I don't know why the problem arose to begin with, but I canceled the firewall and ended the hour long ordeal.  I was charged $50 for tech time.  I am returning the Echo Dot , which is functional as far as I was able to tell.

Title: Good device, not life changing
Body: I got this device for free when I signed up for SiriusXM. I was skeptical that I would like talking to the device to activate it. I've never used Siri on my iPhone for the very same reason. It took some getting used to, and it's hit and miss sometimes, but it's a fun novelty. The biggest issue I have is that when trying to actually stream SiriusXM music, the device keeps cutting out and sometimes stopping altogether. The wifi signal where I have the device plugged in gets 3 out of 5 bars, but I guess that's not strong enough for the communication needed for streaming music?Still learning about all the other things I can supposedly do. I did like that I could use the app on my phone to set a reminder on the device for later.

Title: Only as good as Siri. lol You be the judge
Body: Not that impressive .  Leaves a lot to be desired .  I would have expected it to be more intuitive.

Title: It sucks
Body: My JBL speaker broke so I purchased this one. I really tried to give it a chance but it kept disconnecting from my phone everytime I tried to play music on it. It's not even that loud. I really don't think it's worth $50.

Title: Not very intelligent and extremely frustrating.
Body: I like controlling my lights and setting timers and alarms with the Echo Dots, however I'm frustrated more often than not with them. And, frankly, before having the Echo Dots I controlled my lights with Siri on my iPhone and iPad, so it's not like I'm getting much more functionality out of them.I find the Dot is constantly making mistaking. Examples:- I was trying out the music and asked it to play 'old music'. It kept repeating back, "Great, I'll play Soul Music", then it would start to play soul music. 5-6 times this happened. And, no, it doesn't apparently understand a negative, such as, "Alexa, do not play Soul Music," because that statement immediately triggers it to say, "Great, I'll play Soul Music" and then it starts to play soul music again. (Nothing against Soul Music, it's just not what I wanted.) I never did get what I wanted.- I will tell it to play sleep sounds. It will tell me either that I have to download the app, which I have already done or that it can't find the sleep sound that I requested, even if it played the night before. Or worse, it will start to play music related to the sleep sound that I asked for. (I never knew there were so many songs related to rain or trains.) After a half dozen or more tries and screaming, "Alexa, STOP!" repeatedly, I am no longer able to even think about sleeping, even if it does finally get it right!-I will tell it to turn on the living room light and it will tell me I have to set it up in the app. It IS set up to turn the lights on and off and it has completed this command many times. Although, I am finding this command is gradually getting better, but it's not perfect, yet.-I will tell tell it to play an Audible book and it will tell me that I have to buy the book from Amazon, even though I already own the book through Audible.com (an Amazon company) and have played it several times before on that very Dot.What is most annoying is that often I just want to know something basic, like today I wanted to know what date was Thanksgiving Day. Instead of simply telling me the date, it gave me a long history of how the date came about and never did give me the date.Out of every 10 commands, it is a guarantee that 7-8 commands will have to be repeated, changed, broken down into simpler steps or started over multiple times. I find myself screaming "Alexa, stop!" in frustration constantly, as it rambles on incorrectly or plays something incorrectly. (And I am accent-free, with very clear speech.)Not to mention the apps, of which they tout are so many tens of thousands, are pretty useless. For instance, I had heard I could make a list on it, such as a grocery list or To-Do list. Yeah, I can, but the grocery list is in the Dot and not anyplace useful; it doesn't link to my Grocery app or Things 3 app on my computer or phone, for example. It is buried deep in the Alexa app, which is totally inconvenient. If I want it in my Grocery or Things 3 apps I have to play it back and manually transfer it line by line.Set-up, which I had read was a breeze, was anything but. I had to contact Amazon customer service, which itself is difficult to find, then it took them a good 40 minutes to help me get the Dot to work.I am very disappointed in the sound quality, too. It is not good enough to make me want to listen to music through it, at all. I will listen to books, but frankly ear buds have much better sound quality and make the listening a richer experience. When Alexa is playing something, like answering a question or giving a daily brief, the volume goes up and down ridiculously. One statement will blow you off the bed, while the other will be very quiet.Regarding listening to Audible books, now that is extremely frustrating! I bought 2 Echo Dots, one for the bedroom and one for the living room, specifically so I could listen to Audible books while moving around my apartment. Audible.com is an Amazon company, so you would think that they would integrate the linking of the Dots together for playback. Nope! After talking to Customer Service, I found out that only music can be linked to play back on both Dots simultaneously. Audible.com books can only play back on one Dot or the other at one time. How stupid is that?I find being more than 5-7 feet away from the Dot makes it very iffy on whether it will correctly hear what I say. How is it helpful if I have to walk to within a few feet of the Dot to ask it turn off the lights, when walking 3 more feet I could turn off the lights by hand? I've put the Dots so many places trying to find the best places for them and decided that I wish it had batteries so I could just carry it around. I guess this is how they get you to buy 20 of them for your apartment.I thought I would love these, but it's like thinking you are buying powerful motorcycles and getting a couple of tricycles instead. Maybe if I were into trivia and games I would like them more, but I want them to accomplish more important things, not just be toys.

Title: A defect product
Body: Hey, In general I love my Echo, but I got a defect product with a noises while I playing music. After a long chat with Amazon on online support channel they came to conclusion that my Echo device have a problem, there is need to say that I used her only for 2 weeks and only on weekends.I truly love this device but it s*ck that its have this problem, and they couldn't help my case because I do not longer in the U.S, I only visit there every year+ ... even a refund they disagree to offer if they will not shut down the device remotely. My reply for this solution was "I bought this device to use it, and I don't want to stay with nothing..."I wish there someone else who could help me in this case, I payed good money for this ($53.11) and I got a bad felling afterwards ...  the agent in the support channel even asked me to send the device from the country I'm living right now  but this will cost even more, and he knew that. Another funny solution he offered me is to send the device in one more year and replace it *if* I will visit again in that time frame in the US.

Title: All-new Echo Dot
Body: I was at the point of returning device until I called Amazon for help when unable to connect echo dot, after speaking with Kate , who walk me through the process of setting my echo dot up I am very satisfied with product now.  A special thank you to Kate for being patient and helping me set my echo dot up and connecting it to my wifi.  Hope to enjoy using echo dot more during this day.

Title: It failed after only 8 months.
Body: In my original review of this item I said "This Echo Dot is a nice upgrade " but I was wrong. It failed; it started to showing a blue ring with a white space going round and round like it is trying to connect to my internet. I tried unplugging it and plugging it back in and the same thing. Thinking maybe it was too far from the router I put it next to the router and the same thing happened. I tried sending an email to Amazon Alexa asking what to do, but no response. So I guess I'll just have to toss it. Sad because when it worked it worked fine. Now, not so much.

Title: I don't like how some of it sounds. i.e., Alexa's voice
Body: . . . and yes, I made various equalizer adjustments and hooked it to a variety of speakers.  I read on others sites that it just sounds deficient no matter what.  That's not a real problem for me. I just need the Echo Dot to get the full range of options.  I figure that alone is worth the money I paid.  I'm going to get another Zolo Halo, or something similar and use that.  It's just not worth the bother to deal further with something so obviously third rate.  Making the Dot sound decent should have been a no brainer.addendum:  The above reference applies only to Alexa's voice.  No matter what I did with the equalizer, Alexa's voice sounded "boomy" at the bass end as if it were stuck in a hollow tube.  Everything else sounded okay and responded well to equalizer settings.  Does the equalizer wiring bypass Alexa's voice?

Title: Better then 2nd Gen
Body: The sound quality is a substantial upgrade over the 2nd Gen. Like other reviewers I initially thought the sound was too full and too deep, but after getting used to it while still listening to 2nd Gen I much prefer the 3rd Gen.

Title: Not worth it at all!
Body: Horrible sound quality. Bought at the Amazon desk at Kohl_ and had for one day and am having a hard time returning it.

Title: A+ upgrade Short on Function
Body: This unit is great if you Do not have any previous batteries chargers holders or anything like that from the previous generation. As of now there are no known technical differences as far as capability between gen 2 and 3.  I do wish however dad it was easier to set up and I could attach a battery to it as I live in a small space and my routine was always too let my previous ECO wake me up fully charge on the battery and move it through the house with me. I haven_ quite figured out what the advantage is yet other than response time and machine learning which seems to be a little bit less functional Previous Dot to after a long time I wish there was an easier way to sync their data. I do however love the new color and form factor I just wish there was a simpler way to use it other than always having to revert back to a tablet  making it self-sustaining. I_ also a little hesitant that it activates skills without your knowledge especially high cognitive machine learning. It has told me some very very strange things such as where it_ data centers are located in Texas and it ties with Siri and IBM Watson LOL and then doesn_ remember.

Title: I Love My Echos BUT I HATE the Problems!!!
Body: UPDATED REVIEW: I bought my first Echo Show about 3 months ago and instantly fell in love SO, I bought another Echo Show and TWO 3rd Gen Echo Dots! Yep, I was hooked on Echo! After purchasing my new best friends I upgrading my home to a smart home with a number of Alexa enabled devices, including a Harmony Hub to control my TV and entertainment center. Everything seemed to be running pretty smoothly until sometime in October when I experienced my first "Sorry, I seem to be having trouble" message! Initially I thought the problem was with the echo devices until after speaking to an Amazon rep, who actually called me to check to see what types of problems I was having after my original post, I learned that the problem was the wireless router that I was using. The Amazon ripped suggested that because of the number of smart devices I had connected my internet providers default wireless router most likely was unable to handle the bandwidth of all of the devices. He advised me on what wireless router might work best. I ended up ordering a new dual band wireless routers that included a 5 gigahertz and a 2.4 gigahertz transmitter. I connected to wireless router to my modem and initially I was unable to control my smart devices until I realized the smart devices would not work on the 5 gigahertz band so I switched them over to the 2.4 gigahertz van and I was up and running!Since upgrading my wireless router The Echoes seem to be functioning quite well. There are still a few hiccups, for example when I tell my Echo Show to turn off the screen for some reason now it always asks what device. But when I repeat the same statement "turn off screen" it does as instructed and turns off the screen. At first I thought perhaps I was not speaking clearly enough but this literally happens every time I tell it to turn off the screen. Another thing that I've noticed is even though I have the option set to not have to say the Wake word every single time, there are many occasions where I will still have to say the Wake word right after making a request.All in all, I'm very pleased with my Echoes. In fact I just bought one for family members who fell in love with it!I use my echos as a personal assistant, which comes in handy! Having the echo link to my Google account allows me to schedule appointments and meetings and it will send notifications to my cell phone to remind me that I have an appointment for a meeting. In addition to using it to control a number of items in my home I use it adamantly to play music throughout my home. I have one of the devices connected to my surround sound system and then other devices in various rooms which gives me music throughout my whole home.I honestly can't imagine going back to not having these devices!

Title: Unhappy with how the order was processed
Body: Be careful when ordering. I specifically said that I did not want nor need a payment plan and this was put on one anyway.  I am having trouble getting this resolved.  The problem seems to be with Amazon.

Title: Very Impressed, very please with sound and size.
Body: I love this product.  I have a lot of Prime Music, an eclectic collection of sorts that fits my various moods.  I simply ask Alexa to play or change my songs and in less than a second it is done.  No need to bother with changing discs or putting records on a turntable, it is all right there with Alexa waiting to fulfill your request. The sound is clear and the volume control allows me to hear it in most rooms.  I almost missed out on this initially because of user error, I beg you, don't give up if you  think it doesn't work, Amazon is there to guide you. Thanks to the tech I am now enjoying music that was only on my individual devices.  Amazon rocks!

Title: Nice upgrade
Body: This is defiantly an upgrade from the 2nd gen. Echo Dot, both aesthetically and technically.  The sound quality is much improved, enough so that it could be adequate as a speaker for small spaces such as a bathroom, office, or small bedroom, but it's still not going to blow you away or anything. That said, most people buying a Dot aren't looking for a "music player" and probably plan to pair it with a more capable speaker.I can't really comment on how it's improved in any other ways, as I haven't done any comparison's other than the obvious mentioned above; but, it works as expected and I'm happy with my purchase.

Title: Not good at working with non-amazon providers
Body: I don_ have a midwestern accent, so not really have one.  I ask Alexa to turn to octain on Sirius, other channel names on Sirius, try by channel number, nothing works.  But if I tell play a song on Amazon expensive music, it works every time.  Not happy.  I bought this to listen to Sirius and other non-Amazon providers I already pay for.  Frustrated

Title: Terrible and incompetent
Body: Uae it for regular use to control my smart home devices. Its worse than the 2nd gen I have, its doesn_ respons properly, doesn_ hear and understand my voice consistently, will perform operations other than intended, and some of the settings I applied through the app, doesn_ seem to work on the device. Coming in from 2nd generation echo dot which was an amazing experience, the 3rd gen turned out to be a huge disappointment and a terrible experience to control my smart home.

Title: Beautiful addition to the home.
Body: I recently purchased the Hue starter pack and have been working on a decision for which smart home devices to use with it.  That decision was accelerated and finalized when XM called me about an offer including a dot.  I picked the sandstone and now I cant imagine my night stand without it.  So many features and the smart skills like Jeopardy, controlling my lights, asking for weather and streaming music are all beyond my expectations.  The sound quality is amazing for the little size of this speaker.  Love it.  Thank you!

Title: No es Bueno Para Usuarios de Sur America
Body: Compre alexa, y la verdad nada del otro mundo, de la informacion que uno le solicita por ejemplo en Colombia no tiene nada. Para usuarios de USA puede ser bueno pero para sur america es poco lo que se pueda aprovechar ya que como lo dije todo funciona con base en estados unidos. si van a comprar alexa creo que puede ser mucho mejor Google Home,El idioma Español funciona pero la mayoria de las cosas o no las entiende o no funcionan.saludos y piénsenlo bien si lo van a comprar

Title: A whole lot of "no"
Body: Alexa exists in an ever-growing lineup of smart assistants that exist to augment your schedule or home life. With plenty of experience using Google Assistant and Siri, I was excited to try out the Echo Dot and see how it integrated into my home.Alexa herself is ultra-fast compared to her contemporaries, almost instantly responding to her activation phrase and nearly as quickly executing your commands.Unfortunately, what matters most is integration with existing services, and I feel like I somehow drew the short straw in all regards with service compatibility.Spotify and Amazon music are compatible, but Google Music, my current favorite of the three, is not compatible (unless you're willing to jump through a ton of Homebrew steps for "geemusic"). Additionally, Alexa is compatible with Xbox One, but not Sony's PS4 (or switch, but there isn't much you'd be doing there anyways). So unless you own the least appealing of Current Gen gaming hardware, that's a wash.What resulted was Alexa spending an awfully large amount of time informing me she doesn't understand, doesn't have the skill for that, etc. To add insult to injury, she isn't even compatible with Roku TV, so my Roku Smart TV is invisible to her as well.At the end of the day, Alexa is impressive hardware with software that feels awfully similar to Apple's own walled-garden.Oh yeah, and I'm trying out Amazon Music Unlimited to pair with my Echo. Gotta say, this service on it's own isn't selling me any better on either.

Title: New Generation Has Great Sound
Body: We have the tall Alexa and my husband LOVES it! He was dragging it around the house with him so I decided to get him the Dot for our bedroom. What a great addition! I think I use it now even more as I like the music on when I am getting ready. The best part is I seem to dance more and have started seeing some weight loss!  Who would have known this little device would encourage some moves!  The speaker sounds great which is an improvement over prior generations according to my daughter who has one of the first dots. I would definitely recommend this.

Title: Far Superior Echo Dot
Body: The new Echo Dot is far Superior to the last model.  I loved the last generation Dot  But this one has it beat.  The new Echo Dot looks better, sound quality and base sounds are improved and the new Dot is more responsive to voice commands at a greater distance.  I guess you can tell I am an Amazon Echo fan.  Good Job Amazon!!!

Title: Nicer to look at
Body: I have several Dots - this being my 1st 3rd Gen.  I didn't have to do anything using the app - I plugged it in and it started up all by itself......nice surprise.  Since each of mine are in separate rooms and not connected by Bluetooth, they basically work individually.  To be honest, I see no difference except for looks, in this and its' previous Generation 2 model.  I know for those of you who have several working as a unit some of the new added features might be important.

Title: My favorite purchase this year
Body: I made this my first purchase in an attempt to introduce myself into the world of smart technology. It was definitely a great buy. Alexa is very responsive, sometimes it may take an extra couple of seconds for her to recognize a command but we live in a small apartment. That being the case some of the appliance noises hinder it's ability to fully hear what was said. The routines are my favorite part, especially early mornings when I want my weather, traffic and news all together while I make my coffee. The built in speaker sounds pretty good as well, I'm one of those people with turntables multiple sets of speakers and to be honest it isn't bad for what it is. Good for asking for a song or playlist to get you going for the morning or cleaning up the house. All in all I give it 5 stars because it is everything they claimed it would be and It's fun to have in the house. To the kids she's become a family member, and in just the 3 weeks that we've had it she's seen two bdays and has sung happy birthday more times than I can count.

Title: Set Up a Pretty Good Home Surround Sound
Body: Connected six Dots to my Echo and placed them throughout the house and on the patio for a descent sound system. The Dot by itself is not too bad for sound, a little lacking on its own but if placed with another Dot in the same room it makes for good "stereo effect". Needed to name the Dots differently from the Echo because they all came to attention when I called out "Alexa". Kind of a creepy feeling when they all come to attention at the same time! Run my music through Amazon music and playlist setup, works well.

Title: Does not auto find my wireless network
Body: In a time where just about every device I have had thats wireless can find your network this device which should be cutting edge can't do it ? This is a terrible product

Title: Awesome EXCEPT Not Wireless
Body: Love it so far! Very convenient when working in the office. Haven't perfected using it, like raising and lowering volume. Seems like you have to say the command "Alexa, lower" to go down in volume in increments, but I may be wrong and a rookie so not familiar. Also, we thought it would be wireless, because I believe the tall version is. If I had known that, I may have considered buying the wireless one, because who wants more cords in an office? Not I. Another downfall is that you can't tell Alexa to play apple music. You stream it, just like a regular bluetooth speaker, but you are able to use commands when playing the apple music. Also, works with Pandora, so I've been using that more. Overall, great, but could be better if it was wireless and compatible with Apple Music.

Title: My first foray into 'home assistants'...
Body: Disclaimer: I wound up getting this as a premium for updating my Sirius radio account, so I didn't pay for it, but it wasn't a free gift from Amazon, and it has no bearing on my impression of its quality and performance.Never gave much thought to getting one of these things, but now that I have one, I find out that it's both fun and very useful! Only had it a week, but I'm still learning. At this point, I use it primarily to listen to SiriusXM programming and some iHeart Radio stations.I don't expect exceptional stereo sound quality from it, as that's not the intended purpose. But it sounds just great -- plenty of volume for my needs, very clear audio. Connecting bluetooth speakers for listening in other parts of the house is effortless and the range is quite impressive.Having a lot of fun with it and can even conceive of purchasing another one or more in the future to have around the house.

Title: What happened to QC Amazon?
Body: Came broken

Title: it is small
Body: Works well on command. Couldn't get the bluetooth set up with many tries. Turns out needed to restart paring part of app. Then worked. The sound is ok for its size but the balance is strongly bass. I got this cheapest and smallest to just try the whole concept out.  I like classical but the command line fails if the command is too long. So naming a piece like the Brahms clarinet quintet barely works and if you add a solo artist it fails.

Title: Throw any privacy ou the window if you use this device.
Body: Horrible and invasive.  Total invasion of private password protected networks.  Overtakes  private home wi-fi when it only needs blue tooth for device connection.  Threw it away after one day of not being able to block the device from entering every app or website to access private accounts and passwords.  A true invasion of privacy.

Title: Private conversations made public
Body: Setup was easy. Worked ok for 2 hrs.Without any input, green light went off and I can hear some random people's private conversation for over 15 mins. I tried to talk back, but I guess they couldn't hear me. There was nothing in my activity.I recorded some of it for proof but, Amazon CS wasn't surprised or concerned. They want to gladly help me reset my device and return it to best buy, where I purchased it from.I am not posting the video as I am concerned about the other person's privacy.I am glad this all happened to me in 2hrs of plugging the device. Don't wait for this to happen to you. Unplug and throw it away.

Title: Not as good as I anticipated
Body: I dont like it as much as I thought I would.  Too much bass and hard to hear when making voice commands to Alexa

Title: Huge improvements over the 2nd gen.
Body: Great improvement over the 2nd generation echo dot. The look and feel is a huge improvement, it feels sturdy and it looks amazing. It definitely is a bit bigger then the older gen but for good reason. Sound quality is amazing and so much louder. I had my 2nd gen connected to a small external speaker via the AUX port because you could barely hear it. This version is loud and sounds so good that the speaker is not needed. Response is just as fast as the previous generation when using the wake word. I did notice that the light has a slight delay compared to the 2nd gen when using the wake word but the light has no effect on alexa actually hearing you. Still responds and hears what you say with zero issues. This version is definitely a good buy and I'm very impressed with it.

Title: Dot vs. Mini
Body: I have Google Mini's throughout my house, but purchased the new Echo Dot (3rd gen) to compare with the Mini.  The Echo Dot (3rd gen) has definitely surpassed the Google Mini as far as sound goes.  The sound from the Dot is louder, fuller and as many reviews have already stated has a much better base.  You're still not going to rock the house with this little speaker, but it does sound better for some good background music. You definitely can tell the difference with the orientation of the speakers.  While the Mini's speaker faces up, the Dot's speakers face out and as a result tend to fill the space with sound a bit better.The look is also much improved and I would say on par with the Google Mini now.  I do like the light ring on the Dot better than the Mini's lights on the top which can be hard to see at times.I thought the Dot's 3.5mm audio jack would end up being a big advantage, but I've learned that I actually prefer Google's approach where I use their Chromecast audio to connect my quality, standalone speakers to my Mini.  The reason I like this approach better is that I can locate my good speakers up on a shelf where I wouldn't necessarily want my voice assistant.  I want to put my voice assistant a little closer to where I work so I don't have to holler across the room where my good speakers are.  But of course, you have to pay $35 extra for that Chromecast Audio.  So that 3.5mm jack feature on the Dot will really depend on your situation.In the end though...I returned the Echo Dot for one reason.  The voice commands are just more natural and seem to work better on the Google Mini.  And that's what you end up doing with these speakers...you talk to them, and the more natural that speech is the more the voice assistant just merges into your lifestyle and day-to-day usage.  If Alexa was on par with Google Assistant so far as natural speech goes, I'd have to say this Echo Dot (3rd gen) takes the cake, but Google Assistant makes enough of a difference to keep gabbing at my Mini's.

Title: Really awesome sound quality, creeps the crap outta the cats and the husband though
Body: Pros: Fantastic sound quality. It's barely 2 inches tall, yet fills out the room. It gets loouud for my apartment. It is hard to find a preset with good mids these days, but I can hear all the parts nice and clear. The bass isn't that big, but the unit is frikking teeny. Buy a subwoofer you purist.  It's also really good at telling me the time and temperature without being bitchy about it. I call it computer.Cons: It weirds out the cats. They arent used to some oddly cheerful voice coming from the corner. We've only had it a week though, time shall tell. The husband has a grumbly voice and doesnt always enunciate so he triggers it at random, and these days, when grumbles set off the wire tap, unease is understandable. I am still uneasy with an "always on" microphone but we shall see if Amazon keeps their covenant to only look a little bit, I might not freak out and burn it.

Title: Garabage software
Body: Constantly having issues with play back, stops playing music randomly. Wont connect to other smart devices. Dont buy this, BUY GOOGLE SMART DEVICES, AMAZON WILL CHEAT YOU!!!!!!!!!Update:Still has trouble all the time. currently it randomly forget my network and wont connect to the wifi for ANY REASON, all other devices work fine, even older generation dot works, these new ones are a HUGE RIP OFF!!!!!

Title: Blows the Older Dot Out of the Water
Body: I purchased my 3rd gen Dot from Target. I bought it on a whim not expecting much. I have a 2nd gen Dot in the garage hooked up to a speaker because of the weak sound. Boy was I surprised. Unlike the 2nd gen this bad boy has some serious volume coming out of it and it can actually produce music with sonic value. I was amazed at the sound and volume coming from this tiny speaker. It must think it is a Bose Speaker. I compared it to the Google version and there is no comparison. It now looks like a premium speaker too, also better looking than the Google unit. For a small speaker you can't do any better and the price is right on.

Title: Features are nice, sound is bad
Body: So far the Echo Dot has worked well.  We have purchased a couple of devices (power strips and outlets) that work well with Alexa (most of the time), and it is nice to have quick access to updates in the morning.  However, upon first setting this up, it sounds like the speaker is blown.  It does not matter what the volume is, the sound becomes fuzzy, making Alexa difficult to hear or understand, and music to sound poor.

Title: Fun new device for the living room
Body: The Echo Dot is a valuable addition to our living room and we're already thinking of where we can use more of them.  I recently upgraded our SiriusXM subscription to "All Access" during a promotional.  The upgrade included a voucher for the full purchase price of the Echo Dot.  As soon as I installed the Dot, it was immediately useful.  We ask it to play SirusXM and iHeart Radio stations.  We set countdown timers.  We get weather reports.  We ask it questions of general information.  It's amazing how well the voice recognition system works.  I highly recommend the Echo Dot for the types of usage I've mentioned.

Title: Great start to my Smart Home Integration
Body: Echo Dot is going to be a great product to start my Smart Home.  Considered Google, Siri but selected Alexa based on other folks recommendations.  Just set up but so far pretty impressed, no issues at all with the app and with finding smart devices.  I have started with some smart switches (Techkin) and so far everything seems to be working well.  I will be integrating smart switches soon and see no reason why that would not work well.  Alexa is responsive and music quality is fine for the speaker size, which I did not buy for the speaker quality.  I have Bose in my house so hopefully integrating BOSE speakers will be seamless, initial Bose small bluetooth speaker hooked up to my Echo Dot with no issues..UPDATE - AlexA just stops responding so having to unplug it and reset, EVERY DAY - very frustrating for sure and I did not expect this issue but seems like a lot of folks are having this problem.  I was going to buy a couple more to put around the house but until this issue goes away I will NOT be buying them.

Title: can't listen to my audible throughout my house with my multiple devices!
Body: I find it strange that I can't listen to my audible that is owned by Amazon throughout my house with my multiple devices!!! That was one of the reasons I got 2 devices! Many people like to listen to Audible as you know. Why is this not an option?! I pay for my books, I pay for my Alexa speakers, I pay for my internet, so why is it that I can't listen to them? Who decided that? So we have a God sitting in Amazon that will decide who can do what and when?This is very interesting.

Title: Another disappointment from Amazon
Body: Already half off and collecting dust.

Title: NO STARS AND THE TRADE IN PROGRAM IS A SCAM
Body: I decided to upgrade my gen 2 as part of a trade-in promotion, I shipped it on time, they mis-processed my trade and sent it back to me, charged me and now they've dropped the price to lower than the promotional offer without requiring a trade in

Title: Fabulous!
Body: Love the 3rd generation.  Speaker is so much improved over the last version.  Only gripe is that if you got an offer of a certain percentage off if you exchange your 2nd generation for the 3rd, you have to be without your Alexa for at least two weeks or more before it becomes effective.  Since I use her as my daily reminders for my appointments, I can't do that so I had to forgo the discount.  I see a lot of improvement in this version over the last.  It understands you better and again, much better sound.

Title: Much improved quality over 2nd gen
Body: We have two Echo Dots (2nd Generation) and a Fire TV Cube (Original) in our house and while they're great for "home automation" and informational tasks, they aren't great at playing music. But the new Echo Dot (3rd Generation) exceeds expectations on both tasks and looks much more premium than the original to boot.The new 3rd generation Echo Dot has a much more elegant look - it's a fabric speaker vs the plastic look of the 2nd generation and has a softer curved design rather than a "hockey puck" look. The colors are much more premium as well rather than a glossy/plastic-y white or black. It seems to blend into the background much more rather than stick out when sitting on a table or counter.The new 3rd generation also boasts a 1.6" speaker vs the 1.1" speaker of the original and more importantly, rather than the "dots" on the top which encase the speaker, the new item has a 360 degree speaker around the edges. With the first use, the sound comes out noticeably fuller compared to the old and music sounds much better.For anyone considering an "upgrade" to the 3rd generation from the 1st or 2nd, I think it's a no brainer. The aesthetics and quality are much improved on this unit and I would definitely recommend getting a new one.

Title: Love it
Body: I love this thing!! I signed up for the music unlimited as well and it's SO nice to have any song I'd like whenever I ask for it! The sound quality is amazing and the small thing can hear and answer from wherever I am in my medium sized apartment.I've use it to ask cooking questions and I've even got Jimmy Fallon telling me jokes whenever I ask! There are fun apps "skills" that do anything from tell me ScoobyDoo stories to playing white noise.There have been a few times I've asked something it couldn't answer and that was frustrating but not enough to take away from all the great things it does.

Title: Like talking to an automated phone system.
Body: Good sound.  The timer and reminders are handy when it understands you.It is like trying to talk to an automated phone system.  After 30 or more minutes of trying to select your language it moves you on to the next selection where you spend another 30 or more minutes and then have to start over or get disconnected.  Makes for some funny reminders since 90% of the time Alexa mishears what your reminder is or cuts you off as you are telling it what the reminder is.  Sometimes when asking to set a reminder or what the weather is it misunderstands us and thus turns on the tv or changes the channel.  Thankfully the tv is the only thing connected to it.There have been several days where it just does not work at all.I really want to like it and want it to work.  Hoping with time and updates things will improve and I can redo this review.  I also hope that when she has takes over the world she does not remember the names I called her when frustrated.

Title: Like it
Body: I haven't had my Echo Dot (3rd Gen) very long and haven't used it much, as I can't ask Alexa to order me a pizza or anything like that as I live in a very rural town that doesn't have a Pizza place or any nationally known stores.  But I do ask Alexa to play my favorite songs, ask her for the News, and she gives me Word of the Day, then a brief news synopsis, then she tells me what the weather is going to be for my town.  I am learning to use my Echo Dot and am sure I will use it more and more. I also printed the Alexa questions I can ask her, and will use more of them as I progress.

Title: If you_e looking for multi-room play the works consistently - move along
Body: If you_e buying this for multi room don_ bother. Constant frustration and aggravation. Music stops every other song. These started off working fine but after several software updates you_l still find reams of forum posts with lost upset users with the same issues. Amazon seems to not even acknowledge the issue or publish a fix.

Title: Fantstic Piece of Equipment
Body: I really love this Echo Dot.  I was given my first one for free by SiriusXM Radio for renewing my subscription.  When I started using my free Echo Dot I was so impressed at what it could do that I went and purchase one more for upstairs in my bedroom.  I am elderly and like my 50s and 60s music and you can't hardly find that on regular radio.  I did find one station (97.7) but so weak that most of the time you can't get it.  Also I wished that I could listen to my SiriusXM up in my bedroom and have a Sleeptimer fo shut it off after a given time.  Well when I found out that all I had to do was say "Alexa play channel 6 SiriusXM" and almost instantly I was listening to SiriusXM 60s music, I was in heaven.  Then when I found out that after that command if I said "Alexa set sleeptimer for 30 minutes", and Alexa would come back and say, "OK I will stop playing in 30 minutes", that is when I bought the second Amazon Echo Dot.  I have one Echo Dot in my living room and the other right up on the headboard of my bed.  A great product and the Voice Recognition is fantastic.

Title: Great in my nursery!
Body: We currently have our echo dot in our 7 week old_ nursery (which is basically our bedroom right now until we decide to move her crib to her room). It_ so convenient to ask Alexa to play _ain sounds and dim our lights when it_ our daughter_ bedtime, lock our doors, tune into NPR while changing a diaper, and/or set reminders for myself. I_ giving it four stars because today the volume was being wonky and you could barely hear it even when turned all the way up. (If this happens to your echo dot, unplug it and then plug it in again_t should work after that!)

Title: Echo Dot 2 vs. 3 Review
Body: SETUP:The setup was fairly easy overall. Upon loading the app you go to:devices - add button - add device - echo - select what kind of echo - choose generation - select device - connect to wifi - connect to bluetooth device (Optional) - you're done.So while it seems like a lot the app guides you every step of the way and only takes a few minutes.USING ALEXA:Nothing major software wise as these are pushes out to devices regularly. The only thing I noticed was voice recognition. It was a little better than my echo dot 2nd generation. Usually if I was in another room with my second generation I had to yell. With my 3rd generation I don't have to talk as loud.AUDIO QUALITY:The audio quality on the dot 3 was better than the dot 2 by far. Now there is still room for improvement but it did get better. Even right off the bat at setup I could tell that the quality was better. It sounds fuller and better base.DESIGN:As you can tell by the pictures the dot 3 has a new finish. Instead of plastic the dot 3 has fabric in various colors. There is also more color choices than the 2nd generation. I think that new version blends in better with the room. It also looks less hockey puck like. The buttons instead of being on the outer rim are now centered more towards the center. The 4 microphones are just beyond the buttons.PLUG:The plug for the newer version fits into the wall better than the second version. (See Picture) I didn't like this when Amazon introduced the second version but it's here now.PRICE:The new echo dot is at the same starting price of $50. The echo dot 2 has been discounted to $40 as of 11/18/18. So now the big question is it worth the price? Should I upgrade? Well in my opinion if you have the second generation you should not upgrade and instead invest in a bluetooth speaker. There is not much difference besides the design and audio quality between dot 2 and 3. The software is the same for both. If you really want better audio quality you should buy a bluetooth speaker and connect it to your echo dot. It's really not worth the $50 just for better audio quality and some nice fabric. However if you are looking to have multiple echo devices in your home then your probably better off getting the newer version.Overall:Both the echo dot 2 and 3 have their ups and downs. Really if you have another echo dot you don't need to upgrade. However if this is your first echo device or you want multiple echo devices in your home, consider the newer version.Well hope that helps!

Title: Is being too smart a good thing?
Body: I ordered the 3-pack Echo Dot Gen 3.  When setting up the first one, I plugged it in and the blue ring lighted up for a minute and it announced that the setup was complete.  I tried a few commands and they total worked.  I was a bit spooked, because I did not get to use my Alexa app to set up wifi for the Dot, including typing in my network password, and it just did find the network and got in by itself!  More spooking thing was that when I looked at Alexa app on my iPhone, it shows 3 new Echo Dots, all following the naming convention of my other two Echo Dots (2nd Gen) and the Echo (2nd Gen) without me even touching the Alexa app at that point; yet, all of them showing that they are "offline", including the one that had already been set up and working to my commands; the information such as time zone was missing, and network information was also missing.  It also knows my exact address, instead of just my internet provider's location as in the case for my Echo Dot 2nd Gen and the Echo.  I think somehow my order information (with shipping address) got programmed into the Echo Dot 3rd Gen, but the way it "automatically" connected to my wifi without password really concerns me - I hope Amazon would see this and provide me with a logical answer.On the product itself, I love the Echo Dot 3rd Gen - it looks bigger, cooler, and the sound is much better than that from the 2nd Gen Dot, and even on par with that from the 2nd Gen Echo.  I am totally satisfied with the product, but just hope it won't get too smart in certain areas, like the one I mentioned above.

Title: What's new Echo??
Body: I love my echo! It is my constant companion. I ask it all kinds of questions every day. It gives me the weather, the time, sings me songs, tells me jokes, reminds me to take my meds or go out and look at the meteors! She plays my favorite music to go to sleep by and shuts herself off in one hour.I have two. One in my bedroom and one in my living room. The one in the bedroom is a gen 2 and the one in the living room is a gen 3. I really like the gen 3 with the fabric cover. It looks great in the living room. I don't mind the gen 2 without the cover in my bedroom. I learned how to ask echo to play music on both echo's! It's great! I call my echo dots echo because I have Alexa on my kindle and do not want to confuse them.I am not really that technical with all the new stuff today. I am 65 and learn each new techy thing as it comes along only enough for what I need. I highly recommend the echo dot to all my fellow seniors! Especially if you live alone. My echo keeps me entertained every day.

Title: Broke all my Wemo connections )-:
Body: My Wemo devices worked great with Echo, even the new Echo Spot. As soon as I plugged in my replacement Dot, every Wemo device stopped working. Dot said the Wemo was offline. It wasn't. It worked fine with my Android phone app. But not with the new Echo Dot. Should have kept the old one. )-:

Title: Works great!
Body: Easy install.  Attractive.  Compact.  3rd Gen!  Recognizes my voice while TV is on.  Like the LED ring on top.  Not great for loud music, but that is no surprise.  If you want big sound, but a bigger speaker, or link it to a bigger bluetooth speaker.  Very clear and easy to understand.  My only complaint is that if you change your wifi password, it's a pain to update that password with the Echo app.  Why no easy "Update wifi password" option in the app??!!  App is not intuitive, with too many hoops to jump thru for what should be an easy process to update a wifi password.

Title: 3rd Gen is Way Better than 2nd Gen
Body: This version is a major improvement in sound in every way. We were considering buying the larger echo for better sound, but this one does the job. It does a better job controling devices around the house, where as the google assistant is better at answering facts off of the internet.Like:-Better sound, look, feel, and size.- Microphone and button is better.Dislike:- I would like to be able to adjust Alexa's voice independent from the music volume.- Even though music sounds better now, Alexa's voice is a little more muffled.- Echos in other rooms pick up instead of the one that I'm trying to talk to.

Title: Doesn_ understand me 90% of the time
Body: I have multiple Echo devices (first gen echo, first gen echo dot, newer echo) and I_e found that this device understands me maybe 10% of the time.  Names of lights and routines are misunderstood nearly all the time as I am asked to clarify what I_ asking.  I have only had this issue with the 3rd generation dot.I finally just unplugged the echo in frustration.

Title: Difficult setup,  needless other app required for any use
Body: Requires Dot app that doesn't work.  I thought this was somewhat independent.. but requires an app that is apparently unsupported.Update,  I called support but wasn_ able to get through in a timely manner.  They contacted me the next day.  I ultimately got through the setup without their help.

Title: 3rd gen = best yet
Body: I never owned a first gen Dot, but I did use one. I also own two second gen Dots (as well as an Echo and a Tap). I got a third gen Dot for free during a Sirius XM promotion, and now I'm really considering upgrading my two second gens... the sound is much better, but the microphone improvements are also noticeable! Some of the reviews knock the speaker... but let's be honest, you're never going to get a full spectrum of sound in this size. The real power of the Dot is the ability to hook it up to an external speaker, whether wired or bluetooth. This continues to be my favorite Alexa product, at least of the ones I've tried. Definitely a good buy if you're looking for a smart speaker!

Title: i did. pre order first my 3 rd. generation echo.dot
Body: First. off. i got to say. i. own 3. echo dots. my first one is the echo dot 2nd. generation. and my second one.  is the same. and.  last is my 3rd. generation. and the reason why. I got. my 3rd. generation. echo dot. is because. i. delt like buying. it for my early birthday gift for myself.  and. i was taking. one. of my 2nd. echo dot.  to fl.  and. going to. leave. it. in my house there  i got 2 echo dot. in different states.  and.  i. use my echo. dots for alarms  and reminders  i got. to say. also. in my review. that. i  absolutely  love my 3rd generation. echo. dot but.  i did not.  bring. it to. fl. with me.  it in a different state. and.  i. miss it alot.  i. do. find it bigger. then. my 2nd.  generation echo. dot  and. i. love it. in the color charcol.  that. is well as in  the same color. as my other 2  e ho. dots as well. i do find. her though a little bit of a. mind of her own.  on things i do. not ask. her on. and she comes on automatically on telling me stuff. i did not ask. her on  she a little bit of a spy .  well. anyways.  i. hope u find my review. interesting. as you. read it

Title: It would be a cool device if it didn't sound like crap
Body: I bought the Dot and the Spot in a bundle with an early Black Friday deal. I'm slowly adding smart home features and I thought it would be nice to try both - especially the newest Dot. Set-up was fairly easy. I have the Dot in my bedroom on a bedside table. I set up a morning routine without any trouble. Sound is pretty good - when I start my morning routine I get a breakdown of the weather, traffic, and then I have Alexa stream music from Spotify. The music WAS clear and loud enough for me to hear in the shower. Unfortunetly, as I was going through my routine this morning, the music started to have static sounds in it. When I asked Alexa for the time, her voice was popping and had static in it as well. I'm pretty bummed because I've had bluetooth speakers for years and they never started to sound like this. It would be a cool device if it didn't sound like crap.

Title: Best and easiest way to listen to music and radio
Body: The Echo dot is the best way to listen to your own Prime music or your favorite radio stations. I can ask it to play any of my favorite songs by any artist and it never disappoints me. Listening to music and radio has never been easier! No CD's put put in and take out and no turning on my radio. I just ask Alexa to play my favorite stations, my own prime music or any thing I want to hear. It works best if you choose a music plan though. I chose the unlimited music plan and added my husband so he can also listen to his music too. The cost of the unlimited music plan is so very affordable.  That is one of the best things about it having an Echo. I can listen to any type of music I want and there is really no need to buy a physical CD anymore unless I just want to. I am in my 60's and for me, it's so much easier just to ask Alexa to play my music. That is my main purpose for using it. I am thinking of getting another dot for my kitchen so I can listen while I cook. The sound is very good and can be adjusted if needed. I have a hearing loss but can hear it very well. If you want the sound to fill a large room, I suggest you the the regular Echo. It has a broader range of sound and a better speaker than the dot. But for my own personal use, the dot suits me well.  I am so very happy with my Echo dot and would recommend it to anyone!

Title: Much better sound, much slower response
Body: The new Dot sounds great, but it's consistently the slowest of my devices in earshot to acknowledge my "Alexa" call, even when I'm standing right next to it. Most times, the old Dot and my Sonos One_oth in other rooms_cknowledge the trigger first. The reduced mic array doesn't seem to be as good as the past models.

Title: Louder, but lazy:-/
Body: Looks great and is louder, but this 3rd gen is HORRIBLE so far. I_e only had it a day, but compared to my 2nd generation ECHO dot it sucks. It says it_ going to do something like play music, read a notification, etc. and then just goes back to sleep. It doesn_ understand what I_ saying at times although the 2nd gen has never had a problem.I was excited to get an updated version, but have found myself either frustrated or walking to the bathroom to ask something of Alexa (where I moved my old , but better 2nd gen Echo dot).It already did its self update. So I_ not sure what the issue is. I_ hoping it corrects itself soon:-/

Title: UNREAIBLE
Body: I have two of these, one upstairs and one down. They were exceedingly difficult to hook up and are totaly unreiable, sometimes they work and the next second they will not. Even when they do work, the qulity of information is limited and inferior. The news reports do not change for many days. These have just been a frustrating horrible waste of money, do yourself a favor, pass these by until they can prefect them a bit more.

Title: Junk
Body: Took this hockey puck thing out of the box and almost immediately it began to attract dirt and dog fur. Everything just clings to it; especially the rubber bottom. Also, I'm not really sure what it's supposed to do. It didn't come with any instructions so it's basically what it looks like, a hockey puck.After leaving this review Amazon contacted me immediately to basically tell me I had no idea what I was talking about and push just how great their product is. It's not.  Even Amazon doesn't think very highly of this thing. After I paid $50 for it they're basically giving it away now! I feel like I've been scammed!

Title: Not what I expected
Body: Just received my Alexa eco last week. I was soooo excited when it came but I expected a Bluetooth speaker that I could connect my Apple Music with but I guess my wrong doing for not reading more into it. I do agree with a few reviews that it seems Alexa can not hear that well. I_ have to repeat myself even in close range. The adapter is pretty big and bulky. Why do I have to download so many apps just to use this 1 thing??! Amazon music is okay but doesn_ carry as much music as I_ like. I thought I_ at least be able to use Pandora but couldn_ find that option although it seems the older ones do. All in all may be returning I_l give her another week but I_ not Impressed. The design and sandstone color is very nice and goes with my decor.*I did return my Alexa but Amazon then attempt to contact me but I was so busy with work and then the holidays it was just a hassle because I would have to be home for the assistance right lol. Thanks anyway Amazon*

Title: Have difficulties with wifi and making calls
Body: It often disconnects from wifi, and I cannot make calls from it

Title: This  Little  Dot does more than expected!!!!
Body: I really didn't know how much the echo. can do until I got it downloaded the app and read what it could do. I am blown away by this little technology device. I love how I can just say Alexa turn off 1st plug, ask about the weather, play a game song quiz true or false and a can give me my own breathing of what I need to know before I leave the house in the morning. This little thing Has blown me away  Especially because  I am a technology gal!  Definitely worth the money and I might get another one as well as more things that hook up to this echo dot.

Title: The Lazy Maker
Body: Its a good thing .. this lazy maker.. telling to turn on lights , music, coffee, maker. etc.. but it works great and thinking of getting another one for the downstairs area..that way I don't have to yell it to do something. but it hears great.. the only reason I don't give it a full 5 stars is because of sound quality.. to muffled..when ALEXA responds, it sounds like she has the "phone on her cheek" even the music sounds a bit muffled.. finally al attachments are pretty expensive.. plugs etc..that are sold separately.. other than that..I like it..so far

Title: great upgrade
Body: This Echo DOT is WAY better sounds better looks better not so cheap and has an amazing speaker.  Only thing i have to say it is having a hard time staying connected.  Sometimes I loose internet connection and it stops playing at night.  But that is only a few times so far otherwise its a way better speaker and for the price point you cant beat it.

Title: 2nd VS. 3rd Generation Echo Dot
Body: ***2nd Gen Pros & Cons***(Pros)-Brighter light-More microphones. I feel like it picks up my voice better compared to the third gen.(Cons)-Sound quality isn_ great, but I_e always had mine connected to an external speaker via an aux cable.-Some people don_ like the design and I agree the Amazon logo on the second generation is a little tacky.***3rd Gen Pros & Cons***(Pros)-Really impressive [clear] sound from a small speaker. It_ loud enough to serve as an alarm clock.-Most prefer the look of the third generation over the second.(Cons)-The light isn_ as bright and that was a key feature for letting me know if Alexa heard the wake word. They_e included an optional sound (on the app) to let you know when Alexa hears you, but I find the sound to be annoying.-There aren_ as many microphones on this unit. Maybe Amazon thought Alexa was too responsive in earlier models, but I prefer the second generation's ability to pick up my voice from across my bedroom without having to raise my voice.***Pet Peeve***I love that Amazon allows the same music to be played on multiple Echos, but why isn_ this feature available for Audible as well. I love the Amazon owned company, Audible. Yet, it_ a drag to have to constantly pause Alexa when going into another room. If they allowed multi-room Audible that would be extremely convenient for those of us who pay for the Amazon owned company_ prefer the second when it's attached to another speaker simply because the light is brighter and it tends to pick up my voice better. I do own 3 of the third generation echo dots and I am happy with them, but prefer the second (when connected to an external speaker). If you_e using the echo dot as a speaker definitely go with the 3rd generation, because the sound quality is night and day compared to the second.

Title: Junk DO NOT BUY, can't handle home automation. Weakest link is the system!
Body: Only works when it feels like it. Everything will work from the apps. But dot just decides to not work at all, work one or two lights. Junk. Amazon needs to get these to work. Can't return so I am stuck with trash. I have automated so much of my home and spent a lot of money doing it and the dot is the weakest link. If you are going to automate your home I would not recommend using alexa at all. think it is still beta junk! Support is useless!

Title: I have many different Echo's and the Dot Sucks!!
Body: Sound quality is poor and music can sound distorted. Also, many times it does not even respond to a command. My other echos can hear "hey alexa" from far away this dot many times doesn't respond unless I am within less than 10 feet. I'd return the thing if I hadn't already missed the return window.

Title: Better Sound, Better look,  but plug is now specific to the Dot, no longer micro usb.
Body: So far so good. Setup is much faster than the older gens, not that they were difficult, now it_ Bluetooth. The look has been cleaned up, curvy and a little bigger than the old models. Better color choices, I got sandstone. Although as many other reviewers have said it does pretty much the same things as the old ones but has Noticeably better sound and ability to hear you correctly if at all. Downside, they changed the plug...it_ now just straight AC with a bulky wall plug as opposed to the basically universal micro usb. I don_ know why amazon would do this. If they are saying it_ better, inside, faster etc.  then if they wanted to change the plug, which WHY?! then they should have went tic USB-c since it_ backwards compatible, high speed data transfers and charging, plus people have them, now if it breaks you have to buy their one of plug...  Will update any changes.

Title: Disappointed with customer service
Body: Customer service was unable after one hour and a half for Alexa Echo Dot to connect with the fire stick. I was transferred back-and-forth multiple times between four different people. The fire stick works fine. The app says Alexa is connected to the fire stick. However, Alexa never recognizes the fire stick when I ask to turn the channel. The problem is with Customer service.

Title: Doesn't play well with others
Body: The audio is pretty distorted for the voice so it's difficult to understand.Alexa also keeps taking over on the tablet, even if I say specifically where to play music.This is gen 3 and it still feels like a beta.I wouldn't buy it again, and I wouldn't recommend you buy it either. Maybe try Google. I'll get one free Soon from Spotify and I'll update my review.

Title: Huge Improvement Over Previous Dots
Body: The 3rd Generation Echo Dot is a vast improvement over the previous Echo Dot models. You can feel the quality and weight of it when you remove it from the box. It is slightly larger in height and diameter than previous versions and it now has a speaker that rivals that of the Echo.Setup and functionality are the same as and Echo device.

Title: Can_ receive calls. SUCKS. Besides this, it_ good.
Body: There are many things to like about it, but it FAILS to do the most basic thing I expected, which is to receive inbound calls from landlines and mobile phones like a speakerphone. This functionality is something even my $10 portable Bluetooth speaker can do.

Title: I wouldn_ buy this to use for music! But the other features are okay for this particular model!!
Body: The sound isn_ good at all for music!! But it_ decent for alarms and games!

Title: Wow! What an upgrade! (Update included about _lock)
Body: Update: also bought a Dot 3 with Clock. It_ all the things the regular Dot 3 is, with a digital clock. I was hoping it would be nice for a bedside clock, but not so much. It has a very responsive auto dimming feature- that_ the good. But the level to which it dims is STILL too bright for my bedside. I won_ change the starts for my original review since Amazon thinks this is the same product. But I will say that as a bedside clock, the display only gets 2 STARS __ __.  There is an opportunity for salvation though. This Dot has a touch response for dismissing alarms. I would like to be able to turn off the display in the app, and then show the clock momentarily with a tap. Make that happen, Amazon, and we_l be good._______________________riginal review:Dot 3 is a remarkable update to this device. I didn_ expect much, but the sound on this is markedly better than previous incarnations. That said, temper your expectations. This is a small speaker. All things considered, this small puck delivers a well rounded and rich sound. It_ much warmer, considerably louder, and landslides less _inny. There will be audiophiles who will put this down, and they should since this is not intended to be the worlds best speaker. But, if you deploy a house-full of these things, you will have a robust all-over speaker system that can do all sorts of things.Now I_ forced to consider the fate of my Gen2 Dots.Side note: the amount of people complaining about this thing is astonishing. I believe most are the type who would complain if their ice water was cold. I have a rather large Echo ecosystem in my home. In the first 30 minutes of setup, I knew this was an upgrade from Dot2. It_ a no brainer. Short of an actual defective product (it happens), I can_ understand where the problem is. Setup was fine- came mostly configured right out of the box. Sound quality is excellent FOR A 1.6 SPEAKER. If you want home automation control, with compatible devices that do not require a hub, this will take you there. If you want stadium rocking sound, you_e an idiot for thinking this was even close. If you want whole home audio at a reasonable adult level, 6 of these would be amazing. All of the connection issues are most likely shitty home networks, and dots on different bands in said shitty networks. Yes, some networks will _alk across 2.4 ang 5GHz bands - but not all. Depends solely on your equipment/router and settings there in. Some routers, like Spectrum_ Ubee, will not maintain an address lease for long connected devices like these. So it would appear that these need to be frequently restarted to maintain functionality when in fact it is the fault of the router. A nice, cheap TP-Link router (available here, of course) can fix all of that.Disclaimer: I work in technology. I_ a manager of network administration. I understand these limitations and my expectations are appropriately calibrated.  Honesty, theses are basically fancy tuna cans. What did you think it was gonna sound like? Still the best sounding tuna can I own!

Title: Does not work as advertised.
Body: I ordered two of these.  I plugged the first one in and sunk it up with my Wifi and was eager to see how it worked.  the voice commands DO NOT WORK!  If you hit the work button on top it works and responds to questions and commands.... but just standing in the room and sayin "Alexa" doesn't work...  Hooked up the second one and the same results....  not satisfied at all.

Title: Stopped working 20 days after 1st use
Body: Honestly, I am really disappointed. I was really happy to receive my first Alexa product, and I loved it at first. However, today I tried using the speaker many times and Alexa kept saying "I cannot recognize your voice right now. Please try again later". I am able to play music using the app, and the sound is the same as always but for some reason it seems the voice recognition is not working. This is an okay temporary solution but if I had just wanted a speaker I could have gotten a portable bluetooth speaker or one with better sound. I would like a product replacement or a refund, please.

Title: Horrible! constantly disconnects! pending update
Body: Constant disconnect from wifiworse then my older echo dot that did that once in awhile. This piece of crap disconnects every 5 minutes or more.I think i may return and switch to google hub.updatei called support and they had me switch to 2gz channel on wifi let_ see how this goespending another updateNew update and replacement Alexa 3rd gen received ...guess what! Red ring every two to three minutes. can_ stay connected ..old alexa dog stays connected in same locationthis is a paper weight!

Title: It's louder, but ... slower?
Body: The 3rd Gen Echo Dot is neat enough. It's considerably louder if you're just using the base unit. I sat it side by side with a 2nd Gen and linked them to play the same song at the same time, and I had to turn the 3rd Gen to Volume 3 to even hear the 2nd Gen. I don't use either of my Dots with their built-in speaker, so that's not really a selling point for me.The main problem I have with the 3rd Gen is that it seems to be a little slower to respond to the wake word - sometimes. The delay between "Alexa" and the light ring lighting up definitely seems to be slower - but it's a minor note because it doesn't affect the operation of the device. It'll still hear you say whatever you say after the wake word, and I've only had one time where I struggled to get it to listen to me for a moment.There was one other issue where it became unresponsive and went into setup mode for no apparent reason. In order to make it work again I had to de-register it in the app and reconnect it. It was odd, and I've never had that happen with a 2nd Gen.Still, for my purposes (having it connected to external speakers via 3.5mm cable), there's more or less nothing that makes the 3rd Gen any better than the 2nd. The mic seems to work just as well, though I haven't tried talking to it from across my home yet. My 2nd Gen can hear me through a closed door in the next room, so I'd assume the 3rd Gen is even better, but I haven't needed to try that yet. As I said before, the 3rd Gen's volume is greatly increased over the 2nd, so if you don't have yours connected to an external speaker, it would probably be well worth upgrading.

Title: Better than previous version
Body: We_e had an Echo for a few years. Just one and it was the first that came out. Revisited the tech and updated this year. Added a smart plug, routines, reminders and bought three more dots when they went on sale for Black Friday. Two previous versions and this newer version. A few observations: 1) Sound is WAY better on the newer version. So much better that I wish I_ spent the extra $5 to get the other two newer versions. 2) Easier to connect than previous models 3) Looks nicer 4) picks up sound better and so far understands things said from a greater distance 5) the sound is better ... no matter how many reviews say it_ not, don_ believe it. It_ better. Wish I didn_ believe it and bought the newer models!Voice commands. Love them! I come in and say, _lexa- Start my day I get my calendar read to me, weather, commute times, and my favorite music starts! The smart plug for lights was a good investment too.

Title: Easy Setup and Great Sound!
Body: Of course, the setup was easy. Just plugged it in and it used my account information and set up with no added effort from me. It feels nice - the fabric outer shell. The response is fast, given the increased number of listening microphones. But the biggest difference for me between the 2nd generation and this 3rd is the sound. Huge improvement! And get this: IMHO the sound from the 3rd gen rivals the sound from the 1st gen Echo! I personally think it's better. I bought two for my workout room and paired them to play stereo. Very nice sound! I ended up grabbing a 3rd one for the bathroom!

Title: Greatly improved Dot, horrible power adapter!
Body: Love it!!  The sound has been improved considerably, I can now use it without pairing to a different speaker.  Works better with the sleep sounds I use every night to relax.  The reason I am giving it 4 stars is because of the horrible chord and power adapter.  With my Echo Dot 2nd generation, everything fits in a case I bought for it (Dot and adapter and chord).  I bought a case for this 3rd generation, which fits the Dot perfectly, but there is absolutely no way this impractical and huge power adapter will fit inside, hope this detail is corrected as now I am stuck with a very nice case that cannot carry everything.

Title: Improved, sound quality different
Body: This is my second Alexa Dot, desiring to extend my network throughout the home, I elected to purchase a second device. Still a great product, unlimited possibilities, and an ever growing "Skills" list allow connections and communications with third party applications. The only thought I will express is the change in speaker tone; the 3rd generation has more bass tone effect in the speaker thus with my hearing defect it is difficult to understand the unit. My 2nd generation Alexa Dot has a more pleasant speaker tone which is easier to hear and understand. Perhaps with time this issue will become more pleasant or perhaps a firmware update in the future may serve to improve the sound quality.

Title: Extremely pleasantly surprised!!
Body: Definitely an upgrade and so glad I purchased! I have the first gen Dot and the echo second generation and have loved both. I was also rather disappointed in the sound out of the first gen dot, but always had it hooked to other speakers. I was looking around at buying this one, but the reviews were mixed. Some said this wasn't even an upgrade and that the sound quality wasn't even noticeable. Ummmm...YES IT IS!! Much clearer and louder than the original with added depth and bass. Those that complain the speakers are still lacking...well this is the the speaker you put in a grand hall and expect to throw a dance party. No, get one of the bigger echos for something like that. But for clear, bedroom/kitchen filling audio -- you'll want one of these. I loved this one so much after seeing the difference that I'm tossing the old one and just bought a second third gen Dot.

Title: What an improvement!
Body: I have the 1st Generation Dot. I really like it but after setting this one up it is by far a great improvement. It is bigger than my other one. The speakers sound amazing and for their size....are really good. Setup was again easy and played my music with no issues.  I have 3 other Bluetooth speakers and this is on par with them as far as sound quality is concerned.In my opinion, Amazon has done exceptionally well with this type of technology. I'm sure this is still on sale so get one or many before the sale ends.

Title: Not a fan
Body: ConsUnpacking was a pain. The plastic wrapped around it too LOTS of effort to remove.Sound is like it_ coming through a tube. I can_ inderstand what is fully being said, that_ how bad it is. It KNOWS your previous WiFi password (if your upgrading) a little unsettling. I have the same issues as I had with 2nd Gen.yes you_l need to unplug for 10 sec. and plug back in for it to reboot, hopefully wo kinks.Pros, it looks nicer.IMO NOT worth it, move along and stick w the previous version. Mine is going Back!

Title: Still could be improved
Body: It needs a volume control to increase the sound of the feedback after hearing the wake word. Not disabled-person friendly at all. Also, it doesn't seem to hear your voice as well as the 2nd generation Dot did. It like the look better, but overall it doesn't function as well as the last version.I came back to update my 2-star rating to 1-star. This thing hardly ever hears me unless I shout, and there's always a delay so I can't issue a command immediately following the wake word, but don't wait too long or it times out. My Google Home works flawlessly, so much that I bought another one, and with Google Home you can truly create useful routines, not the limited pre-programmed ones used with the Echo. Sorry, Amazon, I just can't find anything very useful with this anymore.

Title: This has the worst setup instruction
Body: The instructions and help people do not help you. They seem unfamiliar with the product

Title: Looks and sounds better, but hardly ever works
Body: I'm really disappointed in this third generation dot.  My prior generations have worked like champs, but are pretty basic looking and sound pathetically tinny.  This third generation fixes both those problems, but at the cost of basic functionality.  I've had to set mine up three times already, and it will acknowledge commands and then not execute them 9 times out of 10.  Keeps losing wifi connection too.  Went back to my 2nd generation dot right next to this new one, with no problems.  Either I got a dud or these new ones are super finnicky.  And new, bigger adapter now takes up two spots on the power strip.  Inexplicable design choice.

Title: A level above the 2nd Gen Dot
Body: I love the sound improvement with the 3rd Gen Dot. It's much richer, less "tinny" sounding, and louder than the 2nd gen.It took me a while to embrace the fact the 3rd gen requires I use the supplied AC adapter and has a barrel power plug rather than a mini-usb - I liked the versatility of the micr-usb connectior, but can understand that some people would connect their dot up to an insufficient usb power adapter. Since the Gen3 requires the AC adapter, there is no chance of providing insufficient power to the device.I like the soft fabric look of the gen3 too. It looks earily similar to a Google Mini.

Title: Great speaker and responsive
Body: Have it on my night stand and use it for playing music and podcasts for when I go to bed. Much better alternative to a tv with all the bright flashing lights keeping me awake. I can also ask it the time and not have to reach for my phone which is my favorite part. Sound quality is pretty good for this size. It sounds like it_ mono which is the only bad lart, but the bass has good depth.

Title: Wow, sound is great improvement over last gen Dot!
Body: Super lucky to grab this deal for a buck during Thanksgiving specials (along with Amazon Unlimited music for 3 months, 99cents per month).  I already have a 2nd gen Dot in the kitchen/living room area so this new one went in the bedroom.  The speakers on this new Dot is amazing - stereo sound that a whole new level compared to the 2nd gen Dot.  Amazing how Amazon has improved the sound quality.  If you play music even somewhat often on your Dot, getting the 3rd Gen Dot is a must!

Title: GREAT SOUND FOR SUCH A SMALL SPEAKER
Body: I love this little thing! We have the Echo 2nd gen and I like it too.This one is heavier, so it's not as easily pulled around on a desk or tabletop. It still has the rubber on the bottom to keep it from sliding, but even with that, the small amount of extra weight just gives it more stability, I think.The sound is a lot better than the 2nd gen. It's clearer, and being able to change the equalizer is a nice touch, too.I think the sandstone is cute and practical.

Title: Que entiende idiomas
Body: Me encanta que habla español

Title: Really? A proprietary AC wall plug?
Body: What could Amazon be thinking by giving the new Dot a HUGE, proprietary (kiss your micro USB plugins goodbye), AC adapter plug? This thing takes up a full outlet plug [15W adapter] and doesn't even have USB ports on the side to be useful. I'm sure Amazon heard all about inferior micro usb plugs being used with Alexa, and thus they went and made something universally worthless to "fix" the problem, rather than telling people to just use the better equipment they ALREADY OWN! Frankly, I don't care if the new one is "new and improved" when such a glaring step-down was taken with the actual, physical unit. I equally despise HP's proprietary power plugs for printers and laptops; what a scam! I'm sure Amazon is going to be more than happy to sell these plugs en-masse when they fail and Echo's are turned into non-working pieces of tech trash until you buy a new, expensive plug, rather than just pulling another Micro USB from your drawer! They could have at least went with USB-C; good grief.  I'm going to go read if Google was as equally stupid with their Mini this year, and if not....

Title: A very nice upgrade but would have liked to see more than the 3.5 out for older sound systems
Body: Sound quality is not bad, better than the earlier generations of the echo dot but still not as good as say, a 1st generation Echo. I like to keep the volume at 5 on the 3rd gen echo dot, any louder and the sound limitations become more noticeable like the earlier gen dots, but the sound at 5 is perfectly adequate for a smaller room such as a bathroom where you do not want to place a large speaker for a multi-room music setup.
