For the price of $24 though (black friday), the 3rd gen dot is a steal.I would give this 5 stars, but I am deducting a star due to the lack of optical out or even coax.Getting a dot to work with various sound systems that don't have bluetooth has been a chore to say the least, a digital optical out would be nice on future generations for older sound systems that don't have bluetooth or even a special edition dot that has digital out with coax/optical/hdmi.For those with a Logitech Z5500, don't bother with an analog to digital converter. There will be a delay with multi-room music and from what I read, converting may decrease the sound quality. Best option I can see is to use a 3.5 stereo male to 3 aux female and use the included analog cable for the Z5500 to get the dot to play on the Logitech on all speakers. I couldn't find any info anywhere about this so troubleshooted it myself and sharing it here to save others the 2 hours I spent googling and searching various amazon products for a solution.Also, for stereo connections on other systems, such as an older Bose Solo, make sure you get a 3.5 to 2 cable stereo and not a 1 cord coax cord.  The mono cords or 3.5 to coax will not work (I believe because the echo dot outputs to analog and coax is digital).

Title: Just tired of repeating myself
Body: Come on guys. How can these device get such great ratings? I have to repeat things to it over and over again. It can not pick up your voice from across yhe room, let alone when there is any noise in the room. Let alone music. I have the 2nd gen and 3rs gen. Both same thing. Its like OK google in the car. I just wish it had feelings so I could choke the life out of it.

Title: Crazy
Body: I was looking forward to having an Echo again in my apartment. I had the 1st Echo, that big black one. And  I was mad excited about this one. First, maybe I should have placed it next to my Google Mini and not the Home. It was weak in turns of playing music, its like it's missing something. So I'm looking to upgrade to the New Echo that is $109, maybe. I'm only looking to have this control my microwave and ac united, maybe I will keep it due to the low price. Not too sure but I know I'm not to happy with the sound.

Title: Much Better than the 1st and 2nd Gen Dot
Body: The sound of the 3rd Gen is so much better than the 1st and 2nd Gen dot. I was shocked when I tested out the 3rd Gen because it sounded like the full sized echo. It is probably not as good but rather than sounding like a poor quality speaker like the 2nd Gen, it sounded pretty rich. I uploaded a video and if you play it from your phone it is hard to notice the difference but both my wife and I were shocked how much better it was.

Title: Huge improvement in construction and audio
Body: Connects just as easily as the 2nd gen dots and easy add to the app. Physically almost twice as heavy which helps it to feel more solid  previous models.  Last thing....the sound! Can honestly say it as good as google devices. So impressed I_ going to start replacing all the other dots in the house. I tried attaching a video but amazon didn_ like the iPhone video for some reason.

Title: pairing two as stereo only works for requests made over device over like music unlimited.
Body: much better sound then previous version.  very full sound.however pairing to get stereo is a pain.  amazons wanting to box you into buying from amazon music rather then play your own music in stereo kills this device.  would prob be 5 star if it wasnt for silly things like this.  not paying 7.99 a month to actually use these.  if you try to play anything other then streaming services in stereo it will only play in one speaker only.  there is no reason for this other then artificially limiting your device.  so sadly these will go back..  well at least one.

Title: Much better sound than Gen 2!
Body: Love that the sound is so much better than the last Echo Dot. Looks nicer too. Same old Alexa, of course.VERY disappointed that the plug has been changed from USB to proprietary. Not only does this mean that any problems with the cable will require a special buy, but the new plug is too big to fit nicely on a power strip. Since I have several USB ports on my power strip this was especially disappointing because instead of using one of my convenient USB ports I've had to switch to an oversize plug.

Title: Needs equalizer
Body: The sound: It seems like the new generation has more bass, but it's not well-balanced at all, now I'm struggling to hear my podcasts/radio shows.  I don't WANT a bigger one, and I definitely don't want to throw money at a more expensive solution, but ... :(

Title: Compact package and decent sound quality
Body: Nice upgrade to the 2nd generation Echo Dot.  The integrated speaker has good sound quality.  The small size is nice when shelf space is limited.  You also save one outlet and an external speaker, cable and so on.  If I could only hang this from a hook/nail or just through-hole mount to a wall stud with one screw.  Overall another winner from Amazon Echo line.Their Thanksgiving/Cyber Monday deal made buying this a no-brainer.  Oh, and it arrived in 2 days amidst the holiday rush...all around another wow!

Title: Great upgrade!
Body: I received this new echo dot as a promotion for getting sirius xm.  Since I already had a couple of 2nd generation echo dots around the house I just thought that it would be great to have another one for free.  When I got the 3rd gen one and got it set up I realized that this one is much better quality than the 2nd gen ones.  The sound quality is way better than the previous dot and actually sounds comparable to my 1st gen echo.  Also, the sensitivity to voice commands seems better than the previous dot.  I can talk softer and still get a response.

Title: Never knew we needed Alexa until now!
Body: After my family used an Echo Plus for a few days, it quickly became apparent we needed more of these in our house. I waited until the Black Friday sale ($24/Echo Dot) and picked up four of these for our house (and two more for gifts for Christmas). If you buy on the same Amazon account and have saved your Wi-Fi password during the initial Echo Device setup, then these will pair auto-magically and it only takes about 15-30 seconds after plugging them in to get Alexa up and running.

Title: Would have returned, missed window by one day...
Body: Very nice build, great sound for small speaker! Three stars only cause I don't really have any use for it and a few small blocks...First, in the month I've had mine, I've asked what the weather is maybe 10 times and when it decides to work, would turn my Xbox One on/off.Also, cant play my own music through speaker... Huge downside, you can only use things like Amazon music or Spotify or something. I actually like owning my music and don't want to pay for a music service to stream music while also taking internet bandwidth from other things in the house. I don't need to call out specific artist/bands either, just being able to call out play/pause/shuffle would be great for my own music playing.I would have returned mine, but apparently it only has a one month return window and it is literally the day after... Nice if you can find uses I guess.

Title: IMPROVED sound quality/loudness  vs previous generations but still sounds muffled
Body: UPDATE: Nov 28, 2018 - I have discovered that proper placement of the Echo Dot 3rd Gen is crucial to maximize the sound quality. If the echo dot is placed against a wall and/or under a cabinet (I had mine in the kitchen against the wall and under a cabiinet) the sound becomes more muffled and much of the midrange/treble is lost. On the other hand if you have the Echo Dot more in the open, like on a table and not right next to a wall or solid object, the sound will open up more, become less muffled and provides a better overall sonic experience.This is a review of the Echo Dot (3rd Gen) - Smart speaker with Alexa - Charcoal.I have Sonos One speakers, a Sonos Beam and 2-Echo Dot 2nd Generation speakers. I just had to purchase the new 3rd Generation Echo Dot to satisfy my curiosity.Wow, just blown away at the huge difference in sound quality compared to previous Echo Dot Generations. The 3rd Gen Dot has a 1.6" speaker vs the 1.1" speaker in the 2nd Generation Dot and it makes a profound difference in sound quality. The sound is richer, more full and has much more bass. It also plays significantly louder. If you are thinking of getting an Echo Dot, considering these improvements, there is little reason to get a 2nd Generation Echo Dot unless the difference in price is that big of an issue. Or perhaps the lack of a micro USB port will keep you away from the 3rd Generation.I will admit that I am irked that Amazon changed the power from USB powered to having to use the AC adapter that the 3rd Generation now uses. I hate wall warts and now the Echo Dot has one. It's also not nearly as convenient to have to worry about bringing a power adapter with you rather than using any old USB power. But what you give up in that department you more than make up for in sound quality.I like the appearance of the new Dot. It is more refined and has quite a bit more class. Folks with vision issues will also appreciate the fact that the buttons on the top of the Echo Dot have raised features that you can feel with your fingertips to differentiate between the buttons. Kudos to Amazon for that.The Echo Dot 3rd Generation is a big step up in quality over any previous generation of Dot. I would not hesitate to recommend the Echo Dot 3rd Generation if you are late to the party. It sill won't be an audiophiles first choice, but for the low cost this Echo Dot is a winner for the rest of us. In spite of the improved sound, it still has a muffled quality that I notice. So yes, the sound is better than previous Echo Dot generations, but it's still not excellent.You can connect to it via WiFi, or Bluetooth and the 3.5mm Aux Out (no cable included) enables you to easily send the sound to a more robust speaker that allows Aux In or to a legacy home stereo system if you desire.I didn't really need another Echo Dot in my house, but I'm glad I took the chance to check out a 3rd Generation Echo Dot. I'll happily retire one of my older 2nd Generation devices for this one.Thanks to bensound.com for the music used in my demonstration.

Title: Hopefully the Dot 3 is just having growing pains
Body: The good news is the internal speaker is listenable, not bad even considering the size.  Compared to the Dot 2 the speaker is light years ahead.  Aesthetically, the 3 is 10x more appealing than the 2.  It feels substantial, not plastic-y.  Microphone-wise, I am not seeing much difference between the 3_ far field 4 mikes and the 2_ seven mikes...call it even.  The bad news is, at least for me, the Bluetooth connection to external speakers is (was) waaaaayyyyy buggy.  I tried it with a Bose Sound Dock equipped with a Bluetooth 30 pin converter and a regular Bluetooth speaker both of which functioned flawlessly with the Dot 2 right out of the box.  The 3 had a terrible Bluetooth connection.  So much so that I ended up calling Amazon for help.  Annalise was great BTW...we ended up resetting the 3 and that seems to have fixed the issue...but then it made my WiFi smart plug start acting buggy...I fixed that on my lonesome.Once you get past the tin-foil hat aspect of having this thing listening to every word, it_ a freaking cool concept and the 3 elevates the sound game exponentially over the 2.  For $24 on Prime Alexa sale it_ near the price of a stand alone alarm clock radio and is infinitely more useful.  Once the bugs get worked out I think I_l love this thing.  An added bonus is if I say Echo, murder, blood...the cops should be here quicker than a 911 call ;)

Title: Improvements for the go-to personal assistant
Body: This is our first 3rd Gen Echo Dot, our #6 Dot in total, and a couple of full sized models as well.  We've been using these devices for several years in a whole home network and overall really enjoy their 5-star versatility, which this review will not go into. Instead focusing on the 3rd gen Dot's improvements/functionality.Amazon has the initial setup really dialed in.  Unboxed, plugged it in, and it was 100% ready to go in less than 1 minute with me only needing to have the Alexa app on my phone open -- automatically set up Amazon account, WiFi and location information.Appearance-wise, it's a very significant departure (and upgrade) from prior models.  You can instantly visually see it's the latest model and in my opinion the appearance is significantly improved.  It really looks sharp with the cloth surround and slightly bowed out grill which I assume has something to do with the larger speaker in this new model.  The new appearance is elegant and really makes the first two gens look stark by comparison.Voice command response (in our unoffical testing) seems to be slightly snappier despite there being 4 microphones versus the 7 of prior generations.  Not sure if this is due to improved processing or better microphones or maybe both, but it's slightly better in hearing my wife and kids.Speaker sound quality is improved.  Granted that it wouldn't be hard to improve on the sound quality of a prior gen Dot, but none of the Dots, including the latest is a very big device, but for it's size the device it sounds good, and the latest gen definitely hits a greater range (more bass notes).  When we have all of our Dot/Echo devices playing music sync'd throughout the our home, as a whole home system they sound good.Overall the 3rd gen isn't such a groundbreaking upgrade that we'd plan on ordering 6 units right now today to replace our perfectly fine functioning previous gen 1&2 Dots, but moving forward the 3rd gen does significantly set itself apart -- both physically and sound-wise, enough so that I likely wouldn't buy a significantly discounted prior gen and all future orders will be gen 3's.

Title: Dots Just Keep on Getting Better
Body: I am a fan of Alexa. I have or have had just about every Echo device Amazon has manufactured, plus some third party...for my car, Bose 500 Speaker, and the Bose 700 Soundbar. Throughout  this, since the release of the first Dot, there have been Alexa Dots in my life. This is the best yet. Sure the footprint is a little bigger, but I like that. The cloth cover is attractive and has a nice feel. This Dot 3E connected to my household WiFi immediately. The sound is much improved. Overall a better Dot. In fact, after the first, I went back and bought two more. I travel frequently in my work, and one of them will go in my suitcase. These days Dot works well in an hotel room. Highly recommended.

Title: Great Job Amazon!
Body: Glad I waited for Black Friday sales.  I was tempted to purchase one of these 3rd Gen Dots and had to wait and see if a better deal was on the way, and it was.  Two for the price of one!  The sound is amazing and ALMOST EQUAL to the new echo I purchased last year (almost, but no bass on this one).  I would not kid you, the sound is so noticeable fuller and of a higher quality I do not know how they kept the price the same.  The look is so much more _igh end I do not think anyone will feel the need to cover it up with cases, skins, or anything.  Just let this beautiful dot hang out naked on your bedroom night stand and do her thing.  You will be glad you did.

Title: Changed power cord!
Body: Just got the Dot 3rd gen. They changed the power cord from micro USB to a fixed proprietary cord and charger! Why would you do that? Seems like a step back! I would have thought they would switch to USB C.

Title: Real pain to keep awake
Body: Amazon has a long way to go with these devices.  I have 2 2nd generations and 1 3rd.  One of my biggest complaints is keeping it awake and listening.  Even though I have set it in the app to stay awake longer, I have to keep calling it's name to wake it up again because I wasn't finished with it.  Amazon needs to change the programming to give it an option to stay awake until the user tells it to go to sleep

Title: Echo Shrunk
Body: I feel compelled to write a few words about this 3rd Gen Echo Dot. I kid you not, it sounds as good as the full Echo. I don't know how they managed to compact it into this little thing, but it sounds nothing like the 1st or 2nd gen dots. I bought several 3rd gen dots for little more than twenty dollars each during Black Friday and Cyber Monday. THIS will make great gifts (make sure to click 'for gift' checkbox, so Amazon doesn't automatically put your account to the device before shipping.)

Title: Echo Dot is just the coolest product!
Body: This device is so handy!  Some months ago I originally bought a 2nd generation Echo Dot from Amazon (it worked great), but it is has mysteriously gone missing in the meantime, probably got pushed under a sofa accidentally somewhere here in the  house.  So I bought this 3rd generation Dot a couple of weeks ago.  The initial setup was a little clumsy--probably my own fault--but once I completed the setup (calling the device "David's 2nd Echo Dot" in the setup procedure carried out using my cellphone's installed Alexa app), it has performed beautifully.  The sound out of this little guy is superb; the Alexa app includes an equalizer that actually works quite well.  Every day I get music (from Amazon and Pandora), news, reminders, to-do lists, etc., via a simple shout-out to "Alexa".  There are loads of other Alexa "skills" and "routines" I still have to check out.I just received my second 3rd generation Echo Dot today, and its setup went quickly (< 1 minute) and flawlessly without even invoking the cellphone's Alexa app.  It registered itself automatically as "David's 3rd Echo Dot".  Both 3rd generation Echo Dots can run simultaneously, e.g., with two different music sources.  I changed the "Wake Word" on one of the Dots to "Amazon" (the other is the default "Alexa") so that the two devices (and I) don't get confused.I would recommend the Echo Dot without hesitation, and this seller, too.  BTW, I have a third Echo Dot on order from Amazon right now, so each of the three (and the original 2nd generation Echo Dot, too, if it ever resurfaces) will soon be set up in separate parts of the house (my wi-fi router blasts out a good-quality signal around the whole place).So I am now an Echo Dot junkie.  I have no need to get the fancier Echo devices with their visual displays, as all that I ever need in this regard I can get via the cellphone-based Alexa app.

Title: Product was returned along with ALEXIS in the same box AMAZON shipped it to me in.
Body: After seeing 60 Minutes and t/w my work IT dept I decided not to keep this or Alexis. Sent it back and now I realize I should have printed 2 labels but they both came in the same box!  I keep getting notices that I need to return it and I  have.  I can't email AMAZON and can find no where to let them know. Maybe they can respond to this. In all my years with AMAZON this is the first complaint I've had and the 4th time I have ever returned something.  Maybe I'm missing it.  There was nothing wrong with the product that I know of, I didn't even take it out of the box.  Just opened and closed.  I returned Alexis so one would gather I don't need this.

Title: Pretty cool
Body: This is a nifty little device. Setup takes about 10 minutes via the Amazon Alexa app- isn_ too big of a deal. We mostly use it for playing music, checking weather, etc. We don_ have it paired with lights or door locks or any of that kind of stuff that I_ to understand it can control as well. It can tell jokes and answer some funny questions. The only thing I could say could be improved is sometimes there is a solid 3-4 second delay between asking it something and it_ answer. It_ very small, sleek, not obnoxious looking. I have 3 Dots and an Echo in the house to accommodate my needs for different rooms. I have seen some complaints about the Dot_ speaker- I have found no issue with it, if you are just casually listening to music while you cook, or having it read you recipe directions or something, this device is perfectly fine.

Title: It's Great
Body: We're in our 70's but can't let technology march on without us. We wanted to make our house up-to-date. Even if we didn't "Need" it, we wanted it. So much fun. We talk to it all the time. We make reminders, we have other shopping lists named for stores we shop at. We ask for our news station on Radio.com, or our 60's music on Pandora. We drop-in from upstairs to downstairs without having to yell through the house. We attached smart plugs and turn lights on and off in different rooms by voice command; we have timers and our bedroom lights go on and off on schedule. We say "Goodnight" and get a different Goodnight response with our names nightly. My husband bought Nest thermostats from the Electric Company PSEG (they were offering a deal with an energy rebate). We didn't get them yet so I can't comment on how they work.

Title: it's ok, but...........
Body: I like that it's fairly fast but hate that it requires way too much personal info in order to do much of anything other then play music or give you the weather conditions. And talking about music. I #$%^& HATE iHEART radio (or any traditional over the air radio station for that matter). I will not pay for music streaming from any source when I have thousands of songs already that I normally listen to at home and in the car, Thankfully I can find stuff I like on 'TuneIn' but it's a pain to have to specify the exact channel each and every time I want it to play. And even then, some channels you can only get to by  going through the POS mobile phone app. If I ask Echo (the device) to play a certain channel that I was listening to the day before, it says it can't for various reasons. Yet I can turn on wifi on my phone, fire up the app, go though TuneIn and select the channel and it plays fine. If I was playing a certain channel hours before, the day before or days  ago when I last listened to music, I should be able to just say "Echo, play" and it should play the last station I selected. But it doesn't. It defaults to some crappy country station on IHeart and I hate Country music worse then I hate iHeart radio/over-the-air-radio-stations in general. I hate that it can't go over the net and play internet based stations (like DI.FM) that aren't listed in 'TuneIn".It's ok for asking about the weather while you're busy running around in what ever room you are in. Other then that. I haven't used it for much else and refuse to let it do things that require it to have personal info about me and store it on the $%^& cloud.

Title: It sound ALOT better compare to gen 2
Body: It sound ALOT better compare to gen 2 dotI put them side by side and do a few sound test. the sound is more full and not as cracking like gen 2.Still not as good as the full speaker, but hey! for the price and size of this thing I would said is pretty good already.If you care about how much power it runsGen 2 runs about 1.7w idle and 2.0w playing musicGen 3 runs about 1.4w idle and 2.0w playing music

Title: I love these things
Body: I have a dot in many rooms in the house: kitchen - useful for setting timers; family room - useful for light controls, changing Netflix programs; bedroom - great for changing temps on the thermostat, getting morning weather report, turning out the lights, checking the locks; office - great for reminders, news flash, music from Prime.I have an Echo, an Echo Show and Dots.  They all answer to Alexa and sometimes, since I have so many, the wrong one hears me.  A minor annoyance.I also have Insteon door sensors, garage door opener, light switches, outlets for lamps (some are TP Link), Honeywell Thermostat (I have a heat pump and the Nest wasn't right for me), an August front door lock.  All of these work with Alexa and make great gifts.

Title: Capabilities Lost in this Version
Body: My gen one works well.  This gen three doesn_ read NPR news briefs and doesn_ play Pandora.  Keeps saying it has trouble playing.  My Tap and gen one Dot continue to work well in that regard.  All set settings are the same.  Everything else work on it (litecontrols, etc.)

Title: LOVE!!!!!!
Body: The echo dot is awesome! It_ my very first one.. I bought it on Black Friday when it was half the price and what a deal!!!!! I am still getting to know Alexa, but so far my experience has been amazing. The sound is absolutely amazing. I don_ know what some reviewers are talking about. Everything coming out of this cute, little dot sounds great from Alexa_ voice to the music it plays. I love the fact that I can speak to her from across the room without raising my voice. She hears me perfectly every single time. She_ funny too... told me a joke last night lol. Love her so much that I just purchased one for my kitchen! I can_ wait to get it! Don_ hesitate! Buy now while it_ still on sale! You won_ be disappointed!!

Title: Blows previous generations away with sound, but amazon wants to make you sign up for unlimited...
Body: Sound is much better than previous. So glad I upgraded. However, amazon is ruining them. Unless you have amazon unlimited, prime songs are constantly being moved to unlimited and then unavailable to prime members. You may ask for a song and Alexa will play a _tation associated. Or she plays something completely different. Also, I have multiple echos, and the closest one is supposed to respond. That hasn_ been happening lately...the one in the other room may respond instead.

Title: VERY POOR sound quality
Body: I have a 2nd gen Echo Dot, a Google Home Mini and now the 3rd gen Echo Dot.The Alexa functionality is great on both and Amazon has done a wonderful job. I like the overall design of the new version. That is where the positives end.I actually think the sound is better on the 2nd gen Echo Dot. The 3rd gen is much louder but is still lacking in the sound quality. The sound on the 3rd gen is very flat. Listening to music is not enjoyable on the new generation Dot. My Google Home Mini has a much better sound quality and I was hoping the new device would be closer in that aspect.I prefer the Alexa devices over the Google devices for voice commands (even though the Google devices have a better sense of humor). I use my 2nd gen Echo Dot as my daily alarm and have been very happy with it for some time.I am not expecting great sound quality from such a small device. I can not understand why Amazon thought this was acceptable.Amazon -- PLEASE improve the sound quality on the next version.

Title: Badly over-emphasized base
Body: I have lots of 2nd gen Echo Dots and wanted to like the new 3rd gen Echo Dot.  Unfortunately I couldn't get past the change in fidelity to a larger driver that over-emphasizes base frequencies and under-emphasizes the rest (like the taller new Echo).  The only improved thing about it as far as I can tell is that it can get louder and pair with another in a stereo arrangement.  I can compensate by using an equalizer and external amplified speakers (great result that way), but what's the point in paying 3 times for what could've been done right the first time.  (BTW, before you ask, let me add that you can't just ask Alexa to turn down the base -- that turns down *all* base frequencies, not just the over-emphasized boomy ones. )  For regular rooms I prefer the older 2nd gen Echo Dot or Echo to the newer ones.

Title: 3rd Generation...a step up....
Body: I had seven (7) Echo devices (in my home) before purchasing this one (24 bucks was just too good to pass up).  This one was easier to set up (not that the previous generations were hard...).  I have both Gen 1 and Gen 2 Dots but this one is a big improvement because it looks and feels like a better product (pure aesthetics) but in concrete terms it sounds MUCH better than the previous two Dots have sounded.  I bought JBL Flip 4's which I have hard-wired to the others in order to get acceptable sound (while still in a small space).  They have worked out well and sound great (best BlueTooth speakers I've had), but the 3rd generation sounds fully acceptable (with music) on it's own and I'm not sure I would have bought a JBL to go with it had the others been this good.  That, in addition to a more refined "look & feel" make this most popular Echo model a clear winner from my point of view.  Over the almost 3 years that I've had Echos, they have continually expanded in usefulness.  I live alone (am 74) and frankly enjoy having a voice in the house...but she handles music, lights, thermostat, garage door, ordering pizza, reordering Amazon items (previously ordered), etc.  So I get a lot of use out of these units in every room in my house that I frequently occupy.  The total lack of latency problems in music groups is, frankly, quite amazing to me.  Basically, I'm an Apple guy, but the Echo products were first to market and I'm very satisfied with the products and the progress that they've made over these 3 years.  Also, I'm very appreciative of the fact that each new version of Echo does NOT obsolete the previous versions...I have the original Echo "tower"... it's on the nightstand in my bedroom ... it still sounds great and responds to my every (Alexa specific) command.  Don't get me wrong, this is not AI in the purest sense...you really can't hold a conversation with Alexa...but for what she does, I am fully satisfied...and she does a lot...all day long (and into the night).

Title: Doesn't work
Body: It takes 4 minutes to locate the Echo. Then it says to setup wifi manually, even tho my wifi works fine. Then when I select their amazon wifi it says it's connected and the light changes to red or pink and the  app bails out to the start page. It does this over and over and never connects. Nice packing too, Th small Dot box was thrown in a 12x12x12 box with no packing and had a very rough ride. Pitiful.

Title: There is one potential issue
Body: Compared to the old one this thing looks sophisticated....not like a hockey puck.  The sound is so much better than the old one.  In fact I have my old dot on a little shelf you can buy that attaches to your wall outlet.  Its so nice to hear the news or music while shaving/dressing showering. But the older echo sounded pretty crappy even in the bathroom.  This one sounds GREAT.  I mean it wont replace it taller older brother but the sound is commendable.Here is my problem.  The old one had a cord that pugged into the echo on one end and plugged into the plug on the other.  You were thus able to get a real short (3") cord to use when you put the dot on it's little shelf attached to the wall outlet.The new one, in all its glory is very difficult to put on the little shelf.  The wire is part of the plug an cannot be replaced with a shorter cable.  Maybe eventually a shortie plug will be sold but for now I have this great looking echo sitting in front of a bunch up cord...it does not look so great...hope it's safe to have the cord continually bound up too!

Title: AMAZING, GREAT SOUND, LOUD, 3rd Gen Dot, I LOVE EM!!!
Body: I_e seen several reviews saying the sound isn_ much better on the 3rd generation from the 2nd generation, this is one I have to disagree with the other reviewers! My 3rd Gen Dot_ sound is significantly better then my other 2nd gen Dots! My new 3rd Gen fills my large frontroom with music/sound. In fact it can be heard from other adjacencent rooms too! The new Dot is pretty close in the level of sound that my 2nd gen show puts out, which is really quite loud! Honestly from the reviews I read about the 3rd Gen dot I almost didn_ buy them thinking the volume of sound wouldn_ be near loud enough comparing them to the 2nd Gen Dots I already own that are not all that loud. But I_ glad I took the chance and bought 2 of these 3rd Gen Dots, cause they do sound amazing and are more then plenty loud. BTW, that_ coming from a old cabinet maker that_ had his hearing lost significantly from using loud equipment for decades! If I can more then easily hear these, then anyone with normal hearing certain can too! If their not loud, try turning up your volume on your Dot! Personally I can_ say one bad thing about these new 3rd Gen Dots, I_ very impressed! My old 2nd gen Dots are now in our bathroom paired to our new ceiling vents that have Bluetooth speakers. Perfect use of my 2nd gen Dots! No need for extra Bluetooth speakers on my 3rd Gen Dots, plenty of bass for me and you can adjust your bass, etc. on your Alexa app too! Unless you_e wanting ear bleeding sound, you won_ be disappointed with the 3rd Gen Dots!

Title: No Top end. An attempt to create something wonderful.
Body: An attempt to create a small speaker with good sound. Unfortunately if you are into at least a basic decent sound, this product fails. It's just a lot louder than the older generation of Echo Dot's. Quality of sound...nope.The "sound" is an attempt to create a larger sound but, the sound is compressed flat and an awful basic bassey sound. Maybe it's Amazon's attempt at streaming at 32 Kbp/s ? That's what it sounds like....Stereo pairing is a joke along with trying to integrate with the older Echo Dot's. It was painfully difficult to pair or even set up. The delay when using the app to skip an Amazon track is ridiculously slow..to connect with all speakers is bloody awful. You are much better off with Apple's Airplay system even with the outdated Airport Express's.If you want to use this system, please use it in the bathroom when you are having a shower. That's about it.I'm sending it back. Not even worth integrating with Amazon's Eco' Echo system. The older speakers are clearer and are a lot more responsive. Very disappointed.

Title: Must  install FireTV Service provider 'app' within Alexa app to pair with FireTV Stick
Body: Overall the build and quality of the 3rd gen Echo Dot appears to be of solid quality.  It seems that in order to harness much of the functionality of the Echo Dot the Amazon Alexa App must be installed on your phone.  This is the first time I've used the Alexa app (and this is my first Echo Dot).  In the past I've had a high regard for Amazon products and their value but right now I must say that I'm a little underwhelmed by Alexa app and the Dot mostly because the Alexa app doesn't seem to be  too fluid (it lags and is not as responsive as one would expect).  Also as written above, if you want to connect the Dot to the fire tv stick you have to select the FireTV 'app' (for lack of a better term) within the app to do this pairing.  It would have been more logical to  be able to pair the devices under the device settings.  Other than that the Dot seems to what its supposed to do and is quite responsive.Another disappointment is that the Echo Dot cannot be used as a Bluetooth speaker for the TV / Fire TV stick (I was under the impression that it could be used as such but perhaps I should have done more in-depth research on it).

Title: Alexa grew an Adam_ apple.
Body: Very impressed. I got an echo dot gen 1 two years ago and love it. This year I thought I_ ask for an echo plus for the better sound quality and the hub would be cool but not necessary, a plus if you will. Well my gf got me this gen 3 dot based on price and from the second Alexa greeted me while booting up I_e been blown away with the sound. I have a small home and the gen 1 did well giving me enough sound all throughout the house; this one is leaps and bounds better sound quality. The bass and mid tones are great with a bit of eq fiddling. I think the look is a nice improvement but I do like the hard corners of the older model. I am not at all mad I got the echo dot 3 instead of the echo plus I asked for (and it was $85 cheaper).

Title: Much improved sound
Body: I bought a 2nd gen Dot the last time they were on sale for $25. I like it a lot, other than the mediocre speakers, so I leave that one constantly plugged in to an audio input on my sound system.This newer one, though, has WAY better audio. It's good enough to justify itself just as a portable speaker, not even considering the Alexa functionality.As a bonus, I placed this in my garage, far enough away from my wireless router where my phone just barely hangs onto a signal, and the Echo works fine, just a tiny bit delayed on voice commands.TL;DR it's just like the 2nd gen echo, except a little larger, a little better looking, and with good enough speakers to stand on its own.

Title: Alexa is learning!
Body: I was immediately able to play the music I liked and control my lights and ask about my calendar, as I had those things already synced to my Alexa app. It is super duper tiny. It fits in the palm of my hand. It's so cute and discreet! There were some abstract questions I asked Alexa: queries like good ideas to do on a cold day spent indoors. Alexa doesn't know that one, but she is learning. However, I am thrilled to have her help in my home. I even had a friend over and was able to play Trivial Pursuit with them through Alexa. It was a fantastic experience. I can't wait for Alexa to learn more. ^_~

Title: Needs help understanding simple sentences
Body: It doesn't have all the answers,  it's not like asking a computer,  it more like asking Amazon,  Alexa can answer simple questions and follow simple commands but for example I was asking Alexa to find a show called "Channel Zero" on syfy , and she kept telling me there was nothing under the name zero,  I had to look it up manually . And it's not that I'm being lazy but isn't it her job to find things for me? Another big problem is that its super difficult to add echo dots around the house , they just dont seem to want to connect to one another its frustrating to install

Title: Must have for tech savvy family!
Body: Overall great! The sound quality is amazing for such a small speaker. It can hear me say Alexa when I can_ even hear myself. The blue light when it hears you is very noticeable so you can tell if she hears you. I made a few of my own skills and I love how personalizable it is. I where when my husband comes home it tells him what I need help with for the day such as chores. I also made a skill of flash cards and quizzes so I can study for my exams for class. I absolutely love it! We bought a second one for upstairs for our smart lights that came with the bundle.

Title: What is to think about? Everyone needs Dots around the house.
Body: I love this dot! I ordered a pack of 3. I gave my mom one. She is 87 and loves her Dot. Alexa reminds her to take her prescription medication everyday at the same time so she doesn_ forget. I ask for the weather report every morning to start my day. This is a great assistant for everyday reminders and to keep up with what you need to know. Worth every penny. I also have the Echo a Show wrapped up for Christmas for my mom. She is going to love that we can see each other to talk when Im away from home.

Title: Dissapointed
Body: Looks better and sounds better than the 2nd generation dot. Neither of these do I personally care about since I use accessories that have speakers and batteries.Unfortunately this 3rd generation dot is too large to fit my speaker the 2nd dot fits into. And most disappointing is they changed the power plug so NONE of the accessories I have for the 2nd gen dot will work with it.Returning it. I will stick with the 2nd generation dot rather than purchase all new accessories.

Title: Audio is a def improvement.
Body: I have two of the 2nd generation dots.  I upgraded because I read the audio was better. I won_ lie. The 2nd gen was awful Audio. I got a regular echo for music and connected one of them via aux to a speaker. I figured for the holiday price, it wouldn_ hurt to see what the audio improvement really was.I have to say. I wouldn_ say it_ the best audio ever, but it_ got more bass and a better sound. I am impressed. And I_l probably get a second one to pair stereo sound.Def impressed.

Title: Went from 7 mic array to 4
Body: I traded in my echo dot 2 and replaced it with the echo dot 3, because of the raving reviews of the better speaker. Yes, the speaker is instantly noticeable, but do you know what else is noticeable? Alexa having a much tougher time understanding me. I got both the dot 2 and google home mini, and the home mini just say there collect dust, because the dot 2 could understand everything I threw at it, even with a noisy background.My son loves Amazon Math, but now he gets frustrated because Alexa couldn_ able to understand him. Plus, if anyone else is talking in the background Alexa will not understand. We never had any problem with Alexa understanding us on the dot 2. This is a huge downgrade, not an upgrade. I regret trading in my dot 2 very much.

Title: It can't call 911, which makes it worthless.
Body: I called Amazon before ordering. Couldn't get a straight answer. Now it's here, and it can't call 911. That's the only thing I cared about. Anything else it can do is worthless. If I'm not injured, my phone can already do everything this can except the smart home crap, and seriously, people are too lazy to push a button?? This could have been life saving tech and it isn't unless you have a landline or VOIP and yet another gadget to connect. I am so disgusted with this thing!I am looking into the VOIP thing and the connect gadget, but the level of complication, cost, and inconvenience makes this completely unsuitable for many seniors and leaves me wondering why this crippled tech is so popular in the first place. Clearly intended for people who love to talk out loud to inanimate things and get a kick out of telling a robot to play music...

Title: Bad distortion after playing for few minutes
Body: I own 1st generation Echo and Tap and decided to give this a try to use in other rooms.I was able to play from Amazon Music with no issue. However, there was a bad static after a few minutes of playing music. I reset it by unplugging it and plugging in back on and the distortion went away for a few minutes but came back again.Also paired it with my phone via bluetooth and played music from iTunes. Same problem, after few minutes, there was bad distortion.

Title: This thing is whack - 2nd generation wasn't crazy
Body: Everything I play on this device, now plays on all my other devices.  I can't get it to play ONLY on the Dot.  I scared the heck out of my roommate this morning when my alarm went off on the Dot AND on the Show that's in my family room.  I previously had the 2nd gen - I'm going to plug that one back in and return this piece of garbage.  (FYI I've also been on "chat" with the tech department for about 30 minutes... they keep asking me the same things I already answered... they must be AI also and not real humans.... shame on you Amazon)

Title: Ironically, everything except Alexa sounds good.
Body: I'm not going to comment on all the wonderful features of this device. Everything seems to work well, except the sound of Alexa's voice. I have listened to a few voices on news feeds & Jimmy Kimmel jokes & the voices sound OK. Alexa, on the other hand sounds very muffled & chesty. I have treble & mid all the way up & bass all the way down trying to get rid of the tubby/muffled sound of her voice. EQ didn't help. In my opinion, this device should get the voice right first & foremost. I don't expect to play music through it with any fidelity, so it's primary purpose is to talk to me & Amazon got this wrong in their attempt to have it all. Hopefully this can be fixed with their tweaking her voice, or giving us alternative voices that are more intelligible. Disclaimer, I am an audiophile & am used to listening to high quality equipment. My expectations for the Echo Dot's sound quality was low, but I was surprised that the Alexa voice was so bad. I am extremely grateful that they included an audio out though. It's so ironic that Alexa's voice is so poorly implemented. Please give us a new voice or a better EQ. Thanks for that & all the other features. Well worth the money.

Title: Amazon Echo Dot Gen 3 - Setup Unacceptable with Samsun phone
Body: 12/3/2018 UpdateAmazon contacted me to say they reproduced my problem and apologized. Samsung changed the setting names. I still don't like that they required this setting turned off- requiring such on a phone is an imposition. Given that Amazon has generally been good to me, I'm giving them back two stars.I already have an Echo and a Dot. I expected that I would be able to easily setup the Echo 3. Not so- it took at least a half hour to setup. It would not allow setup without Smart Switch enabled on my phone. There is no such setting- it's labeled something else. Furthermore, while I made a good guess at what it was labelled, turning it off did not allow setup to proceed, although the setup procedure was designed to do so. So I spun my wheels for what seemed forever trying to find what Alexa wanted. Finally, the Dot exited setup mode, I had to exit device setup in the app, and it worked. Not cool. Final comment- I don't want that setting turned off.I just bought two Google minis to try. All the reviews say Alexa is better at device control, but the Googles are much better at answering questions, and catching up on device control. Alexa has a real battle in my world.

Title: Buggy and slow.
Body: Seems to be way less responsive that the 2nd gen devices.  The volume setting is either too loud or too low.  There is no in between.  It also repeats itself even when you don_ ask for it.  Unfortunately this will probably go back to amazon.

Title: Wow, nice.
Body: We have 4 echoes in the plastic shells about the house. I love them. This an awesome upgrade from the gen2. Cute as heck and they added Bass...Bump.. for a tiny little thing that she is she stands pretty proud in a room with sound at lower volumes. She lost the "tinny" sound of the plastic cocoon she was tapped in with a rim of outlets around the top to produce sound. The sound now radiates from the sides. If your already a Alexa owner the setup process is as easy as plugging it in. It finds your internet and sets itself up with no need to use the Alexa App. This is a very nice upgrade from the Gen2. I'd buy another one.

Title: Inferior to google home.
Body: I bought an echo dot and google home. I wanted to love the dot but side by side the echo dot wouldn_ play pandora when the google mini did easily. It couldn_ answer any of the questions that the google mini could answer. The only thing going for this is that the speakers are better than the google mini and personally I like the way it looks better. The way it lights up is pretty cool. Don_ even bother though and go straight for the google home mini !

Title: Even Better!
Body: I like my gen 2. 4yr old daughter uses my gen 2 echo dot to control the fire stick in the living room. I use it often for timers, date and time. Due to sound quality I use fire stick and not echo dot gen 2.The reviews I have seen are correct! This new echo dot has great sound. Blows the old one away on quality and volume. Fewer mics isn't a problem, it does even better hearing us. Plus I'm going from 1 to 3, multi-room is nice feature. I don't like my older one now, this one makes that seem like junk.Works the same, but big hardware upgrade, even weighs more.Night and day between new and old gen 2 echo dot!!!

Title: Garbage
Body: 2 stars with thousands reviewing for the Alexa app.  There_ a reason for this.  PURE GARBAGE.Returned to Amazon promptly.

Title: Alexa really Shines
Body: I had to have assistance to setup my WIFI with Alexa but we got it quickly.  The sound aspects with my new Dot are beautiful!  Really resounding and selections of Alexa's abilities are vast.  Easily setup Alarm, listen to my Music list, ask daily the weather, upcoming forecast.  I had wondered if I'd really use an Amazon Device but this Alexa or Amazon Dot is a very pleasant addition to my household.  Even my Cat loves listening to Alexa's voice...and the animal sounds!!

Title: Bad connection on gen 3
Body: I have the echo, echo dot gen 2, and not echo dot gen 3. Gen 3 is by far the worse when it comes to connection and requires constant restart. I originslly placed in in the room next to the router but it constantly had issues. The other device dont. I switched rooms and moved the dot 2farther away and dot3 a few inches from the router and next morning. Im having trouble connecting, other one is fine. Its not the signal strength nor is my apt built with thick walls. My echo 1st gen is furthest away and never disconnects. I recommend going gor older models. You arent missing much upgrading.

Title: Very impressive, But Only 90 Day Warranty
Body: This review is for the 3rd gen Dot. I have several second gen dots.When this first came on I was actually stunned at the bass it put out. The older dots had none. Not as much as my second gen echo of course, but it holds its own.Quite an achievement from such a little GuyThat being said, they don't hold up well, and I have two dying on me now outside the 90 day warranty. Alas customer service says I am out of luck

Title: Best for home automation and IFTTT, bad for everything else
Body: I am a Google Home house. The only reason I got one Echo Dot is because there is more support and customization for home automation via IFTTT and the fact it dropped to $24 for BF. However, I used to be a Alexa user. The thing with Alexa is, you're spending more time setting up skills to make it adapt to YOUR lifestyle. Alexa is a bad conversationalist, can't work off continued conversations and has a harder time understanding foreign accents/childrens voices compared to other voice assistants on the market. Skills and customization (like IFTTT) is Alexa's selling-point, but you have to invest a lot of time in skills to make her second nature to your life. The thing I HATE about Alexa and skills is that you have to talk really long phrases like, "Alexa, open [skill] and play [specific request]" so for example you have to say, "Alexa open SLEEP SOUNDS and play Waterfall" . That is just one example, but you find yourself talking really long commands because skills can't run by themselves. you always have to tell Alexa to open a skill then use the skill, and that gets very very cumbersome when you are supposed to have many skills for your personal customization. Like I said, I ONLY have one in the Living room for IFTTT because the major smart-home-product companies release Alexa commands over Google Home commands. As a personal assistant, she's just too much work. Why I like GH is because it just works straight out of the box, you don't have to spend months to have it customized to your every whim to make it specifically tailored to you. Amazon might not even publish this review but this is my honesty.

Title: Sound issues
Body: The unit looks great and sounds great... SOMETIMES.  Just started using it and once the speaker cut out.  Also about half the time the sound has a buzzz and the voice is "staticky." I am on the phone with Amazon now, and it sounds like this is an issue they are encountering in other units.  They were willing to send me a refurbished replacement initially, and now they are hesitating to do that since they are "afraid" the next unit will have the same problem.  As we continue to speak, I am told they will send me the refurbished unit as long as I understand that there is already an open ticket on this 3rd generation echo dot and the problem may also be found in the new unit.  I really hope they figure out the problem because when this dot plays without the distortion the speaker sounds really great!  I will try to update this when the refurb arrives.  The customer service was quite good.  They really did try to help.  This is a new product and there is always a risk when purchasing a new device that there may be bugs.UPDATE:The unit is working a bit better as of late.  It isn't always distorted. It may not be the manufacturing. Could slight internet interference cause this? Dont know. Will keep testing.

Title: Disappointing
Body: I just received the newest Dot (3) device; I am quite interested in many of its features. But I find it hard to believe that Amazon has not made more progress in the kinds of bluetooth devices which Dot can find and connect to. I have a JBL Flip 2 speaker, TaoTronics Wireless 4.1 Magnetic Earbuds, and B_HM Wireless Bluetooth Headphones with Active Noise Cancelling Headphones Technology. NONE of these apparently will be connected with Dot. The JBL works fine with wired connection, but hardly the point for bluetooth use. You should not advertise the Dot as "able to connect with bluetooth devices" when you are very limited in the kinds of devices able to be connected. Very disappointed given my usual experiences with Amazon products.

Title: Yaasssss get it, totally worth the upgrade
Body: I have 5 of the original Echo Dot's and also a previous generation of the Echo Plus (smart tower) so my house is full of Alexa. I was in love from my very first Dot, but let me tell you this is a whole new world. This new Echo has got fantastic speakers, nearly comparable to my Plus. (Not quite as much base, but for something that is only Speaker no Woofer or Tweeter I'm very impressed)I will have to buy another one for my mother because she is obsessed. I upgraded us to the family plan of Amazon Music as well, and playing music through the house is so much fun, especially with Christmas coming up.Alexa herself also works great for setting timers, morning alarms, and even for starting the day.Most recently I was organizing my spice cabinet and talked to my Kitchen Alexa, I was able to ask"Alexa what is Turmeric used for?" "Alexa what can I substitute for Oregano?" and got fast understandable answers for both. (Siri response? : I'm not sure" )To be fair sometimes Alexa doesn't have a response either, but overwhelmingly I have had a great time and really enjoy this. I will be sure to slowly upgrade all of mine to these new ones.

Title: I'm sorry. I'm having trouble understanding right now.
Body: I love Alexa! However, you would think it/she would work for simple commands (even home network). For example;Why does she have to have an internet connection just to tell me the time?Why does she have to have an internet connection to set an alarm or timer?Why does she have to have an internet connection to page my son or daughter's room since we're all on the same private network???There is a battle of "Smart" devices going on right now and I believe the one that resolves this will be the winner!

Title: Device has drastically declined in use | Got this for $1.06!
Body: Absolutely horrible at responding to commands. Have no idea what happened for it to decline so poorly.Sometimes I find myself yelling just for Alexa to hear me & when it does hear me, it will sometimes ignore the command.They don_ take care of their app well because there was a long period (months) where it stopped saving alarms & timers.________mazon did a random burst of promos over Black Friday where if you bought amazon unlimited music, you would get a free echo dot 3. A week later, I actually got one!So far I_e just added some gag skills (ie. Baby cry, Insult me, etc), set alarms, played music, & learned I can control some of my house lights. Pretty nifty. Doesn_ connect to my home_ hub though, which sucks because it_ a known retailer brand. I can see how handy this would be if I had another set up in my living room & 1 more downstairs. Will look out for deals if I end up liking this a lot.

Title: Amazon managed to improve on the original tenfold.
Body: The new version is beefier and more solid, sounds better, looks better, and responds faster. I didn_ think I could love a Dot as much as I loved the original but here I am, corrected. The first thing I noticed when I took the Echo Dot out of the box was how heavy it was.  The heft of the new Echo Dot makes it feel a lot more premium than the original version.  With competing products like the Apple HomePod, Amazon needed to re-design their cheapest product to look and feel just as nice.  And they succeeded.Set up a simple and it was ready to go within seconds.  The only con I would say about the new version is that it no longer use a USB cord and instead uses an AC adapter. However, that_ nothing when the product is amazing as this is.Oh, and I got it for $25. Literally couldn_ get a better deal.

Title: Horrible speaker
Body: Not impressed.  I have a 2nd gen dot as well.  The speaker on that isnt bad.  This one is plain awful.  I don't know if I just got a bad one or not, but you can't listen to any music on it like I could with the old one.  The static is just insane.  Really really bad.  It also took me over an hour to set up unlike the couple of minutes the old one took.

Title: Family friendly!
Body: Our household is officially hooked. The Echo Dot was the first to join us two weeks ago. Since then, we have added an Echo for our living room and a second Echo Dot underneath the Christmas tree for our boys to keep in their bedroom.This thing has so much to offer. Some of our favorite features are:- The _dd to my shopping/to do list. This is great for those things that cross your mind and you totally forget if you don_ write them down. Having those commands allows us to make a note without having to stop what we are doing.-Unlimited Amazon Music. Totally worth a few extra bucks to be able to stream our music on up to six devices at a time. I can listen to my stuff while working in the kitchen and the kids can listen to theirs upstairs without interrupting one another.- The Drop-In feature. This is great because my husband or I can drop in at home from our cellphones and talk to our kids through the echo when one of us isn_ home. We can also send each other messages through voice command, which is simple enough that our elementary aged kids can do.I could go on and on. Take the plunge, get the product, worth every single penny!

Title: Amazon did an amazing job on the audio
Body: I have the second generation Echo Dot, the second generation Echo, and now this 3rd generation Echo Dot.  I can safely tell you that this little 3rd gen. echo dot is a huge leap over the 2nd gen. one in terms of audio and build quality.  It gets very loud for a little speaker and would be perfect for a large bedroom or even a kitchen.  I use this to set alarms, turn off xmas decorations and lights around the house etc.  Love the product do not hesitate especially if you can get it on sale!  (i purchased this with a smart plug for 30 bucks on amazon because they were running a deal on it)

Title: Impressive sound for the size
Body: I have had the 2nd generation echo dot for about a year now and I really enjoy it. The sound is ok but I really wouldn't use it to listen to music on its own, I just pair it with my TV soundbar. This little 3rd gen has such impressive sound I will probably use it listen to music in my bedroom at least. I like that you can assign different wake words (Alexa, Echo, Amazon, Computer) so that you don't trigger both echo dots at once (since I have a small apartment this is important to me). It's also nice to have a second one so that I can control both of my FireTV sticks with voice commands.

Title: Hopefully they get better
Body: So far I am disappointed with the _pgraded Echo Dot :/ I connected the first one in my room (next to my bed) replacing the 2nd gen so it_ not used as often but I_e noticed it doesn_ pick my voice up as quickly as my old one and it_ slow to respond. I connected the 2nd 3rd gen in our living room right next to the couch just a few days ago and find it_ also frustratingly slow to respond. I have no issues with our 2nd gen and i am regretting not buying the Amazon Echo 2nd gen in favor of 2 3rd gen. The only real positive thing I can say is they are louder and gen2.

Title: Dotty Over It
Body: I got my youngest kid a second generation one. What? He's not an audiophile and still can crank it up too loud. This one is for me. Says it all, right? It's an alarm clock. It's a stereo. It's NPR. It controls the lights. It's Alexa. They sound is good, with great tone, shockingly pleasing bass. Amazon ability to create stereo in a near-Bose fashion is impressive. Of course my main room has a full-size Echo (with a planned subwoofer) but this is a superior tiny music machine. Amazon is practically giving these away to get us hooked - and it works. But I can quit any time I want.

Title: 3rd gen dot is significantly better
Body: This is our third Alexa-enabled device, having started with a 2nd gen dot then picking up a 2nd gen Echo.  We really liked both of those, primarily for music and setting up a daily Flash Briefing, but have also added some basic smart-home accessories.  The full size Echo has much better sound quality than the 2nd gen dot, but this 3rd gen dot has noticeably closed the gap!  The sound is fuller overall, especially on the low end, and voice recognition seems just as good.  In addition, the new design looks much better, despite being slightly larger.

Title: Oh Alexa, why do you torment me?!
Body: Setting up the dot was super easy. Getting it to link to an amazon smart plug super easy. Getting Alexa to respond to the commands to control the smart plug was face-slappingly frustrating. Turns out that speaking to my Alexa in my house was controlling the smart plug in my sister's apartment 150 miles away.....that's got to be an accomplishment. Still haven't been able to figure out how to get her to pause or stop or do anything other than play shows and movies on my Amazon Fire TV stick. I'm sure I'll figure it out eventually, but, for now, she doesn't seem very receptive to commands.

Title: Difficult to set up
Body: Whereas the 2nd gen Dot was easy to set up, 3rd gen was a royal pain.  The online PC app is not worth anything to try to set up.  The Fire HD tablet was useless.  Amazon customer service did not help, even after forwarding to Tech Dept.  It took several attempts with the Alexa app on cell phone to finally get it to work.  There is supposed to be an audio improvement, but it is barely noticeable.

Title: Box came opened and without any protection inside.
Body: Box arrived open and without any kind of filling protection for the product. Since it's a gift for someone else, I won't know until Christmas if it works or not. I will update later and change stars if it works... really disappointed so far...Update (12/01/2018): After some issues on my part (family emergency), managed to talk to Kristina. Since it's not in stock and will be back close to Christmas (and the product is a gift for a relative), decided to give it and if it doesn't work, I can return it without hustle. Giving now 3 stars just because I'm not able to test product yet, but customer service was very helpful so far. Will update and change score once the product is tested after the holidays.Update (12/28/2018): My husband set it up, so far is working well and we have no issues with the product (thumbs up).

Title: Too much bass for voice
Body: I have 3 echo's (dot and large one). When I saw the new 3rd generation at a good price I jumped on it.But, the bigger speaker may be better for music but it is hard to understand Alexa's voice when she responds.I set the bass to the lowest and treble to the highest to no avail. It helped some but still TOO MUCH BASS.This is (of course) my opinion but I am disappointed in the new version.

Title: Smart little speaker with good sound
Body: Love it.  Straight out of the box it blows the functionality of my apple HomePod out of the water.  Why did I spend $350 on a HomePod when Alexa is so smart. Can make calls on my iPhone when HomePod couldn_.  Decent sound.  Certainly the sound doesn_ compete with HomePod but I_ getting the other echo now for that.  This I use in my office and it is perfectly good sound quality to fill a small room. Get this speaker. Only thing I wish is that it used a usb plug but the plug it has works fine.

Title: If you work from home and have conference calls this is a necessity
Body: I cannot believe it, but this is also an IP Phone, and I used it to dial into work conference calls. This was an amazing surprise because it relieves my cell phone and land line from being used for the conference call. So on top of telling Alexa to wake me up with classical music or hip-hop, and getting the news, and playing music, and controlling whatever else is connected,  I can make phone calls to anywhere, and still use my phones for other calls (I multi-task).

Title: Very quick answers
Body: I got my Echo in the mail and it was fairly easy to set up. I do wish the plug didn't look so beefy. The speaker is great and pretty loud and clear. It's also pretty heavy so you don't feel like it'll accidentally get knocked down by anything.One thing I do not enjoy is the fact quite a few features require a subscription. I really want to listen to my Spotify without needing Premium, but that must be Spotify's decision.

Title: Issues with sound quality and atrocious Customer service
Body: I purchased this on black Friday, the deal was too good to pass up! After completing the setup, which was fairly easy, I discovered the sound to be muffled, distorted, and scratchy, almost as if the something was rattling inside or perhaps a bad speaker.After calling Amazon to explain the sound quality issue, they confirmed that they had been receiving complaints of similar problems.I wanted a replacement, but not a refurbished unit. Amazon also sold out of the charcoal grey. This is where the headaches began. First they wanted to hear the problem over the phone.....really? Telephone sound quality isn't in 16 bit stereo sound, but ok, I'll let them listen to it over the phone. I was told they could only send a refurbished unit or I could return it and simply buy a new one. This is a problem because of the black Friday price. I finally got them to agree to a new unit and keep the old dot until they came back in stock. Came back home only to find that Amazon deregisterd the Device!!!! Called again to have it registered explaining my issues about 5 times with various reps.In short, this 3rd generation dot has known sound quality problems and I believe the replacement will be the same. I'm not looking for astonishing sound from a small and inexpensive smart speaker, but the distortion is very bad, my smartphone has clearer sound!!

Title: A great upgrade or additional device!
Body: I've had the gen 2 for a little over two years.  I have loved it and use it many times a day.  It was great in our old, fairly small apartment.  We just bought a new house with 2 floors and a lot more space.  We needed another one for the additional floor.  I don't need one for every room.  I thought it over, and then seeing the sale price of $24, I decided to get the 3 instead of another 2.I am so glad I did!  I replaced the gen 2 in the living room with the gen 3 and moved the gen 2 to the finished basement.  Out of the box, it looks much nicer than the gen 2.  The initial setup of the gen 3 took a couple of tries, but was fairly simple.  I get better sound recognition from greater distances with the gen 3.  For comparison, in the same spot, the gen 2 would have a hard time hearing me from the kitchen sink, in a large open kitchen/living room space. especially if there was other noise, even if I raised my voice.  The gen 3 can hear me not only from the kitchen sink, but from down the hall at a bedroom door, without me raising my voice.The gen 3 speaker is louder and clearer for basic tasks like timers, adding to lists, and the weather.  While the speaker quality is better than the gen 2, I still use it with a Bluetooth speaker for music and when I get her to read my kindle books to me.  This is my personal preference.Over all I like the gen 3 even better than the gen 2, but I wouldn't buy another gen 3 and ditch my 2 all together.  The gen 2 still serves a great purpose downstairs, though she won't get as much use as she once did.  If I decided to add more in highly visible places, I would probably get another gen 3, just for the look.

Title: My life will forever be changed.
Body: I_ in love with echo speakers, I bought 3 of them +the fire cube and the functionality is incredible.  I_e managed to connect all of the speakers, and cube- and had envisioned being in my kitchen, watching something on my iPad and being able to ask Alexa to turn on my sound at and connect to the two from the other room (so I can play music). Boom guys. My dream actually came true. Not only that but I can be in my kitchen and say _lexa, send a message to (name of a friend who also has an echo). YES. CANT MAKE THIS UP. Here I am, constantly finding ways to terrorize my friends (I_e been labeled a FaceTime terrorist) and  YET THIS CHARM has provided me another way! _lexa, send a message to Hope ******** and BOOM. Hope_ Alexa gets the message and she gets to hear my wonderful recording. Some of my favorites are _lexa- make an announcement and BOOM- use this baby to project messages to all the other Alexa babies throughout your home! _lexa, wake me up to amigos @ 7am - BOOM. _lexa connect to my iPad BOOM. _lexa disconnect from my iPad- Alexa connect to my iPhone BOOM.MY LIFE HAS BEEN REVOLUTIONIZED. THANK YOU AMAZON I LOVE THIS COMPANY!!!!!

Title: Sounds and Mic are Better than 2nd gen Echo
Body: First time owning the Amazon Echo dot 3rd gen device, i_ surprised of what it can do for me and my family.  I have amazon music unlimited so i take full advantage use of the service with Echo device.  The sound quality for music is ok, lacking bass and highs but when i connect to my Bluetooth speaker, it is a music power house.  With this set up, i dont need the Echo full size.  Dot is perfect because of the size and it does everything like the big brother full size Echo. I was able to get an addition Echo Dot 2nd gen cheap and it makes me like my Dot 3rd gen even more.  Dot 3 sounds better, louder, and pick up voice commands easier.What do i use this for in a daily basis? Weather, timer, alarm, white noise machine, music, story time for my kids, voice games, control my smart plugs and switches, npr news.

Title: Decent sound, non-standard power connector
Body: I have the second generation Dot, second generation Plus and now the third generation Dot.  As expected the sound on the Gen3 Dot is better than the Gen2 but not as good as the Plus but that doesn't matter to me because I've connected it to a pair of floor standing Snell speakers through a Grace Digital Bluetooth amp. Obviously real speakers will beat a tiny speaker by a country mile.My one complaint is about the power connector. Amazon did something inexcusable with the Gen3 speaker, they used a non-standard round power plug instead of USB as they did on the Gen2 Dot and the Plus. What were they thinking? The no reason to use anything but USB for a low power device such as this.

Title: A lot of fun. Alexa much better than Siri!
Body: Impulse Black Friday purchase and really glad I did. Fun, useful and great sound for what it is. Realized that I'd put off considering this because I hated using Siri on my iPhone. Siri never understood commands very well - I'd keep trying for a while and then just give up. Plus the Siri female american voice setting is just irritating. Alexa's voice recognition is amazing. No trouble communicating. Works effortlessly to request music, turn on the light etc. Maybe it's just a personality thing but Alexa and I get along a lot better :). I really see the potential for smart home,  other skills etc. now.

Title: I love it, Wish I purchased earlier!
Body: My first Echo, so I can't really comment on if better than previous ones.I've been putting off buying one as I figured it would just sit unused. I was so wrong! We found some amazing add-ons, my daughter (14) actually uses it to help her study! I'm sold!!!However, I purchased 2 (my bedroom & Daughters bedroom) our bedrooms are not far away so as she would talk to hers "Alexa.....turn on my music" it would also respond in my room lolQuick fix on the app I downloaded to my cell and changed mine to "Echo" and hers "Alexa"No more issues of both dots responding lol

Title: Love it
Body: I got my son and grandsons the dot last year and was kinda disappointed in the sound of them.  I received MY 3rd generation the other day and I absolutely LOVE it.  Hooked it right up...I have the TAP downstairs and love it because its got an 8 hr charge and can be taken outside or other rooms, but got the DOT for upstairs bedroom and love listneing to distant thunderstorms at nitetime and getting weather and news briefings when I wake up. Just not into radios as I like to listen to what I want to and am loving these Alexa's!! :  This DOT is GREAT.. very happy with sound.

Title: Much improved sound quality
Body: Whoever claims this new echo dot doesn_ sound too different than the original must not have actually compares the two. I ordered this new version because I can never hear my original playing NPR radio while I_ in my shower over the water running. The. Ew version gets easily twice as loud- so loud that at max volume, audio is uncomfortably loud. Besides volume, voices are much more lifelike and not _inny like the original dot. The new dot is twice as loud and twice as clear.

Title: A no brainier purchase
Body: This is the best affordable smart speaker that you can buy right now. The sound quality is great. Music sounds good through the built in speaker and can connect to external speakers through the 3.5 mm audio out Jack for better sound. Voice recognition is great. The Sandstone color is my preference, but the Charcoal and Heather Gray look nice too. Alexa is as helpful as on the second generation, so if you already have a Gen 2 echo Dot and have it connected to a good sound system, there's no reason to upgrade. Overall, it's a total no brainier especially on sale. Black Friday deal $25!! It's already a bargain at $50.

Title: Worse than the first generations
Body: I got a first gen dot the day it came out and have a second gen dot in most rooms of my house.  I am disappointed that Amazon has made this generation worse in what I believe to be an Apple-like attempt to make it harder to let third parties make improvements.The Good:It is louder.  That's it.  The first two generations very seldom had an issue with being loud enough.The Bad:The speaker has more bass.  This may be good for music, but it makes the voice more difficult to hear.The microphone has a much more difficult time hearing me.  I frequently have to repeat myself for it to hear the wake word despite being in the same location we've had a dot since Gen 1.The wall wort now takes up about three spaces in a power strip.  The first two gens fit nicely in one space.The USB cable has been replaced as the source of electricity with some odd circular plug that is permanently attached to the wall wort.  This means that you can't easily switch the length of the cable.  It will be harder for third parties to make things like the two wall mounts I use.  I don't think any manufacturer will be able to make a tight L-shaped corner for this plug like the kind that are so plentiful for USB.  Not having a USB will also make it more difficult to use in the car.  With Amazon coming out with their own car version of Alexa I believe this was done to stop people from using dots in the car and to force them to buy the new device.The device is bigger than either of the prior generations.  While not huge, the increase in size is noticeable and will make it more difficult to mount or make portable.The device is covered with cloth.  Amazon thinks this is a plus.  I guess some consumers might too.  I think it looks like cheap furniture instead of a sleek piece of electronics.

Title: Very Disappointed In The Sound Quality. Muddy, Flat and Muffled
Body: I watched a video before purchasing the 3rd Gen. The reviewer raved about it's greatly improved sound over the 2nd Gen, which I own. Based on that review I bought the 3rd Gen as part of a package deal with a TP-Link HS105 smart switch.After setting it up I immediately noticed how muddy, flat and muffled the sound is. After a couple of days I was desperate to see if there was anything I could do to improve the sound quality. I found out that the user can adjust the bass, mid-range and treble levels. Plus or minus 6dB is the maximum range. I currently have the bass at -6dB, the mid-range at +3dB and the treble at +6dB. These adjustments helped somewhat but there is no getting around the fact that it still sounds muddy. As one reviewer aptly described it, it sounds like someone put a very thick blanket over it.Here's my preference in sound quality in order of preference: #1 Google Home Mini, #2 2nd Gen Echo Dot, #3 3rd Gen Echo Dot.Three stars off for the terrible sound. One star off for the barrel plug to power it.

Title: The entire Echo system has changed for the worst...
Body: I changed my review from 5 stars to 1 star because of a software update that now forces me to specify which light, power strip, and/or other devices I want to turn on/off. All of my rooms, lights, power strips, etc... are in various groups for a reason. Each light, outlet, and other devices have a unique name (IE: The upstairs hallway lights are named UH-Light, UH-Light2, and UH-Light 3, my smart power strip has unique ports like TV, Monitors, etc..).YESTERDAY (9/18/2019) I was able to walk into a room and say "Alexa, turn the light on" (in my home office for example) and it turns the light on, Today (9/19/2019) I'm sitting in my home office and I say "Alexa turn the light off" and I get the response "There are multiple devices that share that name, which one do you want".The master bedroom - Setup with only lights (MBR-light, or something like that so I can identify it later when adding other stuff), the wife used to say "Alexa, turn the light off" because that's what she has always said before going to sleep. Today she can't do that because of Amazon's development team.So I say "Alexa turn the office light off" and it turns the ENTIRE OFFICE GROUP OFF. So now I have to go to the app to turn the light off.I reached out to Amazon customer support who tells me I have to be specific when asking the echo to turn the light off as in "Alexa, turn the office light off/on" and that it has always been this way. When I tried to tell them that yesterday I was able to say "Turn the light off" they said it wasn't possible and I have always had to be specific.I set up groups for a reason, that being I can go into a room, say "Alexa, turn the light on" without having to remember each light bulb name or what I named the room/group. Yes, I know what the group names are, I don't expect everyone in my house to remember the group names.There was a software/firmware update overnight that broke all of my Echo's and Amazon's customer support will not acknowledge it.I will not recommend this device to anyone else until they put it back to the way it was.

Title: Much improved speaker over 2nd gen
Body: This is my third Echo device, with me being an owner of a first-gen Echo (almost since the beginning), an Echo show (added a couple years later), and now two of these 3rd-gen Echo Dots. At some point in there, I also tried the 2nd-gen Dot, but I ended up selling that one because I couldn't stand how weak and tin-y the speaker sounded--I wasn't expecting it to be great for music (you can connect external speakers to both that and this generation), but I was expecting it to still be good for alarms/timers and whatnot.
