Unfortunately, that was not the case for the 2nd gen.Enter the third generation: it's a little bigger, but the speaker is SO much better. It's not quite as good as my full-size Echo for music, but it's impressively good for its size. Unlike the previous generation, it also does produce alarm/timer sounds that sound full and loud, not weak and full of treble only (i.e., if this were my alarm, it would actually wake me up). The power connector also changed to the typical DC "barrel" connector over micro USB, presumably to handle the increased power demand of the new speaker (not a problem for me but may be for you if you're hoping to replace a previous gen you had strategically powered).As of the time of my writing, the Dots have also frequently either been on sale or bundled cheaply as a promo with other items. Even at full price, I don't think this is a bad device, but if you find it on sale and are otherwise on the fence, I'd say to try it! I'm pleasantly surprised (so much that I now own two!).

Title: Sounds significantly better than 2nd generation
Body: We've several 2nd generation Echo devices in our house and I decided to order one of the newer models during Black Friday sale. I am amazed at the difference in sound - it's excellent for such a small device at the sale price or the typical price. I hate reading some reviews were people are critical of the sound. It's as if they think they can spend $25-$50 on a device and get the equivalent sound quality of a multi hundred dollar speaker system - be real. It's  much fuller than 2nd gen and the bass is actually noticeable, but it's not a multi hundred dollar speaker. Also, I don't see many speakers of better quality out there capable of controlling smart plugs, set thermostats, play games and give out the news and weather, as well as read out appointments on a calendar, etc.

Title: Why should I stay with Echo?
Body: We have enjoyed all of our Echo devices- 2 Dots & a Spot. It has been wonderful to be able to play Amazon Music on these devices with out ads.  With the removal of Amazon Music I am considering going with Google Home.  Google works with my Hue Lights and can do everything Alexa does & more.Why should I continue with Echo devices- that doesn't have its own Music and can't answer 2/3 of the questions my "Ok Google" on my phone can? (And it's not eligible for return. )

Title: Amazing Device, you must have one.
Body: I love the all new Echo Dot, it has a place next to my bed and sings to me nightly. I can ask it to set the alarm and it will. You have to be careful with the mic because Alexa can hear you in another room or even on the other side of the house. A few times when I lost internet connection, Alexa told me she was not feeling well. My first clue that there is something wrong with the internet. Sometimes the answers to the questions can be entertaining. I am sad that you cannot use it to turn on a Fire Stick, but with the Alexa app you can turn on the Fire Stick or Echo Dot with your cell phone. Or even send music to it from the App on the phone, subscription to Amazon Music needed. Sometimes Alexa will start speaking for no reason when the TV is on, I always wonder if it is due to a programmed ad. So if your worried that Alexa will record your conversations, rest assured that it will, even when you are in the other room. There is an on/off button for the mic, but it is just as easy to unplug it if you are worried your conversation will be recorded.

Title: An essential device
Body: As a resident in a retirement community I see many of my friends experiencing age related falls.  When I was advised by friends to get an Echo, my first thought was no, I don't need that, but when a very dear friend fell recently and we weren't sure she'd live, I realized just having a life alert hanging around my neck is not enough. If I were to have a stroke and be paralyzed, I'd not be able to press the life alert button. With Echo Dot, I could just call out for Echo to call the number at the front desk for help (Echo does not dial 911).  Aside from that very practical benefit, it sure is fun to ask Alexa to play my favorite music. Right now I am listening to the Mitch Miller songs I first heard as a child. The list is long as to what can be done, but the greatest value is Alexa can help me if I am in danger here in my apartment.

Title: Great but few issues.
Body: This thing is super awesome.  Just what the doctor ordered.  Except the directions are not very clear.  A lot has to be figured out on my own.  And the alexa app is very buggy.  Like the yellow flashing is for notifications and messages.  But how to stop the flashing.  Had to read both notifications and messages.  But app has no notifications section.  Only messages.  And alarm volume is separate in app from regular volume.  And groups do not work.  I had a echo dot in a group.  Then removed it and now when I re add it the group is empty.  It is checked marked but the group still shows empty.  I even deleted that and added a new gruop.  No luck.  Still shows e!my in app.  I even bought a second dot 3 and set it up.  But still not showing in a group.

Title: I prefer it's predecessor hands down. It looks nice but it doesn't sound nice.
Body: Only had it a couple days. Music sounds better than it's predecessor but the Alexa voice is too bassey. Bought it in conjunction with the smart switch for a better price but I think that was a mistake. I say that because whenever I bought this it was $24 plus $5 for a Wi-Fi plug. When I go to return it it says that you cannot return something about a package deal. The other thing is if it's a package deal why don't they ship them together, I got the plug one day and they thought two days later. I would have no problem sending back the plug but when I look at my billing it's supposed to be $24 and $5 and for some reason it turned out to be $19 for the dot and $10 for the plug so I'm going to get raked over the coals when I return it - at least I think so.

Title: My 4th, this one goes permenantly into my vintage stereo system. no more stored music
Body: The Echo system is the greatest source of music for my vintage 1972 McIntosh/JBL  stereo system, restored to original specifications.  Echo provides an unlimited source of full fidelity, clean, music.  It also makes it easy to personalize and mix many selections on digital storage for playing later.  I have found that albums, and tapes are not needed now and are taking up space.  A good multi-band equalizer provides the old "tube" sound I have gotten used to, now without the hiss and scratches.  My other Echo devices provide mathematical help in my shop and another one is my multi-function "alarm clock".  Even though I do not use a "smart" linked system, I find it easy to input information with my home computer.

Title: Beautiful Product!
Body: I love the way this product looks, feels, and functions.Compared to the 2nd generation, the speaker quality clearly outshines it. The volume "10" is sooooo much louder compared to the 2nd generation, and also maintains a clarity of sound that leaves you enjoying it.I bought one of these for each of my family members to make it easier for us to keep in touch and stay organized -- if you are thinking about buying one, then I say go for it!

Title: Sound Quality Much Better than 2nd Generation!!
Body: I had two Echo Dots 2nd Generation and thought they were pretty good. I also have the Echo but put the dots in various rooms. I saw the 3rd Generation at a great price for Black Friday and couldn't resist and ordered 3 of them. Well let me tell you that the sound quality is far superior than the 2nd Generation. It's also much louder if you like that. Huge difference in over sound quality of music. Set up was simple and  the 3rd Generation can respond to my voice from a much father distance than both my Echo and 2 Generation Dots. I'll of course keep the 3rd Generation for myself and gift the two 2nd Generation Dots I have to family member who do not have any Alexa devices.

Title: does nothing right
Body: didn't understand simple commands. I got a lot of I didn't  understand and a lot of MMMMM  it did mange to set an alarm but when i asked her to play beach sounds she stopped talking. The worst part was I asked her for the weather she gave me a report on a town and state i haven't lived in for years! Creepy. I returned it.

Title: Blows the 2nd Gen away!
Body: Amazon literally improved everything, right down to the plug! It sounds so much better than the 2nd Gen did, and even better than the Google home mini. This actually has some low end to the sound. It also looks a lot better, the fabric cover helps it blend into any decor and look much more premium. The plug is also better designed so it more flush with outlet and not sticking out like before. Only downside with the plug is that it can't be powered via USB, since it now uses a proprietary plug. Definitely recommend this over the old one, especially with this being only slightly more expensive at the moment.

Title: this is the way to go
Body: I was using a first generation echo, and was unhappy about the monaural music.  the cost of a 2nd generation echo was equal to two of this product, and still needed a plug in speaker to achieve sterio.  I purchased two of these, paired them, and discarded the echo.  it picked up right where the echo left off with the programming, but added stereo sound.we like to stoke up the fireplace in the middle of the night on a weekend, and play amazon music, with the lights out.  a little hot chocolate, or eggnog completes a memorable evening.  great sound.

Title: Worthless
Body: I received this as a promo on a Ring Doorbell 2 I purchased from a local big box retailer.  Have spent 30 minutes trying to use this as a Bluetooth speaker, and nothing.  I've got 4 other devices in the house that connect to my phone with zero problems, and this piece of shit won't connect.  If I had known this, I would have used it as a stocking stuffer or something but now I'm stuck with it.  Thanks Amazon.

Title: NOT WORTH PURCHASING, BUY THE 2ND GEN INSTEAD
Body: I DO NOT LOVE THE 3RD GEN DOTS.  I LOVE MY AMAZON ECHO DOTS, at least the 2nd Gen Dots.  I have found them to be a wonderful asset.  Easy access to music, audiobooks, to do lists, grocery lists.  They have made my life easier and been helpful to organization.  However I would NEVER AGAIN purchase the 3rd Gen.  I currently have three 2nd Gen.  (Kitchen, Bedroom, Laundry Room)  I was enticed by the "more powerful, clearer speaker".  It was on sale in the fall for the same price as a 2nd Gen.  I decided one more, with a better speaker, would be ok for the kitchen and move the kitchen one to the office.  BIG MISTAKE!!!  I feel I can usually trust Amazon, but this speaker is fuzzy, garbled, not NEARLY as good as the others.  I didn't realize I could return it and didn't try until after the window for return had lapsed.  I am VERY DISAPPOINTED  and want to save anyone else from disappointment.  Buy and Echo Dot, just not 3rd GEN!!!

Title: Do not buy! Very glitchy
Body: Omg I wanted to love this since I have the older version but this new dot is really glitchy. It has constant static issues while playing music. Also it does not pick up your voice commands about 90 percent of the time when you're streaming. You have to literally yell at it to get it to respond. The response time also lags compared to the older dot. I bring my dots with me traveling to other countries so don't really have an option to return this in time so I'm really disappointed. Stuck with a faulty bad product. Amazon, you Southold have better quality control in place.

Title: Bass-Heavy Audio Frequency Characteristics and Limited Adjustability for Voice / Audiobooks
Body: Bought this as an adjunct to the text-to-voice feature on my Amazon Fire / Kindle, which I used all the time to listen to content when I don't have time to sit and read.  I have to say that the audio for this 3rd-generation Dot just isn't good.  It's too resonant in the bass / low midrange, even when those values are minimized using the Alexa app.  That app gives you three frequency ranges for adjustment--bass, midrange, and treble--which should be adequate.  The problem is that the Dot speaker(s) and the shell of the device itself, naturally overemphasize bass and lower midrange.  For my listening (mostly to spoken word, not music), that's not at all good--I need the higher frequencies to come through crisply, and to greatly attentuate the lower frequencies (at which spoken voice sounds muddy, indistinct, and slurred).  I'll send this one back and maybe try again when Amazon has done a better job of configuring the shell to null out the inappropriately enhanced ranges.

Title: Stereo pairing feature incomplete, otherwise a good device
Body: The sound is definitely improved over previous generations, and is downright good at this point.  The SmartThings integration is likewise very good - I can control pretty much everything through Alexa, and the setup was easy and well documented._omputer, turn off the living room and off go the lights, TV and Christmas tree.  Brilliant.The grouping is excellent - whole home audio is here, and it_ great.  (Drawback of stereo feature below also applies here, though.). Just make sure the Dots are in Bluetooth range of each other.I_ disappointed in the stereo pairing though, and this could be a deal breaker for you.  So first, it sounds great, when it works.  Amazon and streaming content sound so much better with stereo pairing.  Synchronization is perfect, and this really adds to the experience.  BUT, it seems you cannot use stereo pairing with a Bluetooth connected audio source.  Do you want to use stereo Echo Dots as your Bluetooth computer speakers?  Nope.  The sound only comes through one Dot, and the Bluetooth connection between dots is severed until you disconnect the Bluetooth audio source. Do you want to stream from a smartphone or tablet via Bluetooth and listen in stereo using 2 Dots?  Not gonna work (in stereo) at the time of writing this review.To me, this oversight/compromise almost makes it a 3 star device.  I am giving it 4 as the whole home audio is quite nice, and Alexa is at the top of digital assistants in my opinion.  But the stereo implementation isn_ compete.One other negative is latency when used as a speaker for Fire TV 4K.  I love my new fire TV 4K. I purchased it in a bundle with the 3rd generation Echo Dot. However, the two barely function together.  The audio latency is well over half a second, so the picture is totally out of sync with the audio.  Big drawback.In summary, use your Echo Dot as a mini smart home assistant. It sounds great, and functions very well as a smart home assistant.  The whole home audio feature is great so far.  _omputer, play Christmas music downstairs and it_ an instant winter wonderland in here.  But I would not recommend attempting to use this as a Bluetooth speaker for a video device due to the latency issues.  Likewise, be aware of the limitations with stereo pairing.

Title: Sound is not as clear as the 2nd Gen Dot
Body: I have several 2nd generation Echo dots and recently received this 3rd generation one. I switched out one of the others for this new one and immediately noticed a different in the sound, and not in a good way. No matter how I adjust the bass or treble, it sounds hollow and much less clear than the earlier generation. I listen to Audible books and music every day and immediately heard the difference with the 3rd Gen dot. This was received "free" as part of a package with another order, so I can't return it for a refund, and I feel like a replacement would do the same, so it will definitely be going out to the shop, where it will be rarely used. Pros: It looks gorgeous and very modern. Cons: Sound is much less clear.

Title: It's basically a sexier looking gen 2 with marginally better sound
Body: I'm just going to get straight to it and give you some important pros and cons. However, if you don't want to read my entire review, when considering all my thoughts on Gen 3 Dot, I still absolutely recommend everyone own one.Pros:- Setup start to finish, out of the box to ready is less than 3 minutes.- Gen 3 looks substantially nicer then Gen 2.- The speaker is improved from Gen 2. With that said, the bass is still laughable. However mids and highs are much improved and push well rather than screeching at high volume.- If you actually explore the vast skills Alexa can do and what Dot excels at, this unit can do a great deal and absolutely be useful from day to day. From updates on Amazon orders, to ordering from Dot, to playing music, or setting an alarm and then having Alexa tell you about your day, this unit can do a great deal and do it well.There are many more pros but nobody wants to read a novel so I chose what's most important.Cons:- When you set this up, if you do it on your phone, you need to exercise caution doing so if you don't want Alexa to have your entire contact list. If you give that permission, your entire list will be in the cloud. Just a heads up.- Alexa can make calls with Gen 3 Dot, and the process is flawless. However, if you actually expect to have a conversation with someone, you had better turn the volume up very near max, or they will not hear you. Also, there is lag between parties on the call and I've verified that a half dozen times.- Alexa still struggles with certain words, phrases, obscure songs, and questions, if you don't word them in specific manners. Given, as you use your Dot, Alexa will adjust to you and get better, but it can be frustrating even for someone like me who's a technology freak.- Alexa often mistakes you when you say to adjust sound down and instead adjusts it up. This fades after you've said the phrase a dozen or so times.As with the pros, I could go on and on, but nobody wants to read a novel so I picked the most important factors to help you make an informed decision.Look, in many ways, for many people, Alexa products, specifically Dot, are used mostly as toys. A lot of people play with them a few weeks or months and gradually give up on them. Why? Usually, because they lack patience working through the kinks in the interface and also because they simply never explore the thousands of skills this can perform.So my question to you is do you consider this a fun toy or do you consider it an exciting technology with a lot to offer? If you consider it a toy, just save a few bucks and buy a used Gen 2 used, for under $20. If you consider it a useful technology and plan to seriously explore its possibilities, I absolutely recommend this as a way to get your feet wet or to add to your Alexa connected devices. Yes, this is still a technology with a long way to go, but it's worth owning and growing with!Cheers!

Title: Affordable way to try home automation, works as a personal assistant
Body: This is my first foray into this type of technology, I got it as a Black Friday special bundle with a sengled smart light kit, so I have no comparison. It has a sleeker domed edge and rounded top which makes it look higher quality out the box than the previous hockey puck style version. It was a straightforward setup along with connecting it to the smart lighting, coming from someone who didn't grow up with technology. It's nice when I come home at night to turn the lights on by voice instead of fumbling across the room to the light switch, as well as remotely control my lights for security reasons, and get my flash briefing while I'm having my morning coffee, and do other simple tasks by voice via skills you can add, you can link various apps to it like Pandora and list.me, make phone calls, schedule, set alarms, use multiple units as a home intercom system, as well as skills templates where you can make your own skill if you're feeling industrious. The speaker is plenty loud for my small space (900sq ft total), but there is some distortion to music at higher volumes, which, for me, is to be expected for something so little (about 4 1/2 to 5 inch across). I keep it In my kitchen, it can hear me from my bedroom down a 15 foot hallway if I have the door open, and not if the door is closed (I'm fine with that as I dont really want a potentially open mic in my bedroom or bathroom). For the cost it was an affordable foray into home automation for me.

Title: Worth the upgrade!
Body: I wasn_ really planning on upgrading from my second generation to this third-generation dot  until I came across the cyber week special bundle with a smart light kit.  The sound, look, & _oot of the new version make this better than the last one.Overall, I was very happy with  my second generation., using it to play music, listen to the news, and hear the occasional joke.  I understood that if I wanted to hear decent sound, I had to connected to my Bluetooth speaker.Enter third-generation dot: As you can hear from the video, music sounds much better, with a bump of bass  without  needing an external Bluetooth speaker. The gray fabric looks very classy with any decor.  Also, the foot is much grippier than the second generation one,  so even though the new version is heftier, it moves less. Overall, highly recommended!

Title: Awesome Little Device for the Mula!
Body: The Amazon Echo is a great little device the money. It has so many different skills and things you can do with it.My favorite being able to set commands as you wish so for example when I say "Alexa, Good Morning", It'll say goodmorning, tell me the weather and raise my living room lights to 50%.There are tons of games you can play with it like jeopardy, Bingo, Ect.It can tell you jokes, but it triggers Jimmy fallon to tell a joke which is neat.The only disappointing thing i thought about it was the sound quality of the speaker. Now i'm not going to make a big deal from it since you can connect it through bluetooth or aux cord to any speaker in the world and it was only $25 when i got it so i wasn't expecting much.But overall the device is very useful to controlling your smart home, other devices with smart plugs, or just having a general conversation with it when you're lonely i have noone to talk to, (insert tear emoji here).

Title: Echo Dot 3rd Gen is a great upgrade over 2nd gen
Body: I am very pleased with my new 3rd Gen Echo Dot.  Everything has been improved on it.  The sound now so good I can use without my external Bluetooth speaker.  Also, design of Dot 3 is very nice, heavier and sturdier hardware wise and look s and feels well-made.  I have 2 Dot 2's currently and the sound improvement was what I was looking for.  But the new design is great and things like setup have been improved greatly.  After you start up the Dot 3 and get the welcome message simply fire up the Alexa app and go into Devices -- Add Device then go thru and simply setup the Dot 3.  No more select this special wifi and setup -- great!

Title: The BEST OF BOTH ALEXA WORLDS!
Body: This is the best speaker PERIOD, I have ever owned! By far the best Alexa I have ever owned, besides my new Fire Cube!  They are both the best devices that you have made in past years and REALLY IMPVED UPON!THANK YOU, and CONGRATULATIONS or making two wonderful devices that will go a long ways and increase your profit line. By far two pieces of electronics I am very happy to have HOME and OWN!Please, keep up the great work Amazon. From a VERY SATISFIED PRIME CUSTOMER!  YOU RETURNED MY FAITH in PRIME MEMBERSHIP!

Title: Alexa thinks she know it all..
Body: I love Alexa..she can answer any questions you can play different games with her and the whole family can join in to n play..you can ask her to play any music example "Alexa play the #1 song in Noway" you can even ask her to play movies read out your favorite book but the only thing is most book,music,movie won't play because you have to be a subscriber for Amazon music Amazon ebooks Amazon movie witch you can get all of it plus free delivery from anything you buy from Amazon and Amazon grocery for only $99 not for a month or three months but for a full year subscriptions... Alexa can Order any food grocery book a ride to places..just download Alexa app she can even controls your light example "Alexa sleep" light will shut off..controls any Bluetooth I'm not Lazy it that at the end of a hard day it feel good to just grab a drink sit down and let alexa do the easy but hard things for me..we argue laugh cry..lol it worth the price .

Title: Very disappointing compared to previous models
Body: I have 2 original echo dots, a first gen Echo and a second gen Echo and this is by far the worst. The microphone pickups are terrible. When I asked Alexa a question to this 3rd gen dot from 8 feet away it does not hear the question, yet the 2nd gen Echo in a bedroom with the door closed can hear me and does answer? This Dot replaced the 1st gen Echo that was placed 20 feet away in the kitchen and had no problem hearing and responding.Did the race to the bottom on costs lead to cheaper inferior microphones? I see there are only four on this one.

Title: Not intuitive
Body: If the device doesn't connect to a wireless router it's useless. I have a previous version of the Echo Dot which connected flawlessly. Wish I could say the same about this one. During set up it tries to connect to a secure network without even asking for the password. The result is that it can not connect. After trying multiple times to connect I contacted Amazone support. They could not get it to connect either. This 3rd gen is going back to Amazon, very disappointing. Any device should ask for a password when connecting to a secure network but this one does not.

Title: Great update over 2nd generation echo Dot!
Body: I have two 2nd generation echo Dots that I love and use daily. I decided to buy the 3rd generation as I got it for a great price on Black Friday on Kohls.comI'm not disappointed!! Love the new speaker. So much better than the second generation.Easy set up with the app just like the 2nd  generation. This is slightly bigger in size than the 2nd generation and uses a different power cord.I wish I had this version in all my rooms!Update: just added a second third generation. Love it over the second gen and since we're moving to a bigger house I need two on each floor. My husband and I use our dots constantly.

Title: The best Dot yet
Body: I've been a fan of the Dot since the first generation, and they really nailed it with this one. I don't know how they did it, but the sound quality from this is incredible for the size. Much better bass, and that's noticeable even if just talking to Alexa: her voice is much easier to hear and understand on this speaker than the prior versions.In addition to the improvements in sound, this speaker looks great, and has a nice round shape and soft fabric sides.Amazon did a great job with the hardware, and the software/AI has always been best in class. What sets Amazon apart from other products in this space is the huge array of third-party devices and services that Alexa can connect to. Having an always around AI isn't very useful if it can't do anything, and nobody's AI can do as much as Alexa.

Title: Great upgrade over the 2nd generation dot
Body: The 2nd generation dot found itself in a bad spot once the google home mini came out. The google mini had superior sound quality, making it a far better option for playing music. This generation solves that problem with gusto. The sound is robust for a speaker of this size, and it can get loud. I have yet to turn the volume up past 50% and it more than fills my living room (your experience may differ based on room size). In addition, the 3rd gen has a great look to it with the soft speaker cover material around the edge.

Title: Not worth having more than one unless u like to spend more money
Body: Nothing like the amazon echo regular this one is stuck on stupid. Asked over 10 simple questions and can not get an answer. Also its not able to play music while another device is streaming music. All this technology and i need to pay for more services. Upgrade to a family plan or so. I already pay enough for prime service plus the cost of a large one and then the dot plus smart light bulbs and now spend more money so 2 devices can stream. What a disappointment

Title: Massive improvement over previous dot. A+
Body: Bought this for my son's bedroom. Opened it, synced it to my echo system and it sounds amazing for the size and price. The Echo 2 sounds better but it's more than twice the price. If you're on a budget for an Echo device, this is for you.Compared to the Echo Dot 2, this new version blows those out of the water. Good bass response, louder, better mids. Doesn't sound like a rotary phone speaker!Amazon has knocked it out of the park with the new Echo. Don't hesitate to buy one. As always, easy to sync and connect to my other Amazon devices and Philips hue system.

Title: Terrible.
Body: Won't connect to WiFi no matter what I do. I've read everything and looked up tutorials, nothing fixed it. I've built my own gaming PC and I have smart gadgets everywhere in my house, so I'm definitely not a novice on the subject, but this just plain out does not work.

Title: Pretty Good
Body: I got the echo dot as a birthday present and so far, ti's pretty good.  The only problem is when I'm asking it to play music, half the time it says it's doesn't understand, but I can use the app to play the song I want, so it's an easy issue to get around.What I don't like is when it suddenly activates itself and suddenly just says, "hmmm, I don't know that.".  Scares the hell out of me!Overall, since I'm still playing with it and getting used to it, I'll give it a four.  There are still some problems, but I don't find them to be a deal breaker.

Title: It_ amazing.
Body: I love love love these echo dots. I got 2 of them for $24 each on the Thanks Giving deals. $24 for what I have? It_ amazing. For me the sound is good enough. And Alexa is so smart. I asked Alexa to do math (can_ believe), convern units, play music, tell weather, news and so on. I can easily add skills and control the lights and plugs. Really want to recommend my friends and family to get them.

Title: Amazing!
Body: I've never been a smart house kind of person untol my husband convinced me to snag an echo dot on black Friday.It's super easy to set up and i use it daily!!I play music while I'm cooking and cleaning. The sound is actually excellent. I also use it to update my calander and set reminders. So handy because as a busy mom i can be forgetful. The reminders also go to my phone if I'm not home.TMy only complaint is that when we tried using it to make a phone call my dad couldn't hear us but that could be call receiver error ;)

Title: It's Fun -- and Helpful.
Body: I have bought a couple of 2nd Gen Echo Dots and really enjoyed them. It was therefore a no-brainer to buy the 3rd Gen given the insignificant price difference between the two.The main difference between the two is the better speaker on the 3rd Gen Dot.  I therefore use this new Dot in a bedroom where it can act as a speaker. My original Dot is synched to a Sonos speaker.Once you start off on a smart home journey you begin to discover the myriad of ways that an Echo Dot can help with household tasks.

Title: The 3rd Gen Dot buzzes when "silent"
Body: Received the Gen 3 Dot today, set it up, and tried it out.  My experience up to this point has been with a Gen 1 Dot have had on my nightstand for years and recently a Gen 2 Dot.  The Gen 3 is the worst of the three, but first a little base-lining.You primarily buy an Echo Dot if you plan on attaching speakers whether wired or wireless.  If you plan to use the device standalone with even an inkling of playing music, then you should go with one of the larger Echos and not the Dots as regardless of the Dot, the sound isn't going to be good.  Dots = external speakers or news, full-size Echos = everything.The worst thing I've found with the Gen 3 that the other two generations didn't have is a buzzing when turned off (not playing anything).  There's a buzzing through the speakers.  Thing is, I also bought a Gen 2 Echo and it does the same thing.  There's a buzzing, even when the volume is low, coming through the speakers regardless of whether the speakers are external or internal.  it's something inherent to the latest devices/hardware.  it's terribly annoying and I can only assume something is wrong with the devices.  As mentioned, neither the Gen 1 or Gen 2 devices have this problem.The buzzing is annoying as heck and the only way to "stop" it is to either play something or turn the volume down low on the external speaker, but then everything is lower.  To stop the buzzing, I turned down my speakers so that what now must play at a Volume 5 on the Gen 3 Dot is equal to what the Gen 1/2 did at Volume 2.  When it comes to the full-size Echo, there's nothing you can do.  It just buzzes even when at a low volume.The other thing I've noticed is that the Gen 1 and Gen 2 were far more sensitive and responsive than the Gen 3 Dot.  I could speak at what I consider a normal volume regardless of what was playing and the Gen 1/2 heard me.  Not so for the Gen 3.  i also have to slow down to let the Gen 3 Alexa catch up to what I'm saying which wasn't a problem with the Gen1/2.I can only assume that there's just something wrong with the device.  I may give it another day or two in the event a patch was released, but at this time, the device seems defective because of the buzzing.

Title: This is the most useless electronic toy I've ever purchased.
Body: There was a lot of hype about the Echo Dot. So I thought I would buy one to try it out.  First of all, it didn't recognize most commands I gave it. Second, it couldn't ever figure out the correct audio device to stream to. Third, the software interface is awful.  If you ask it to play a certain album, the interface didn't show you the list of songs in the album and what was coming up next. Fourth, if I told Alexa to launch a program on my Windows PC, it didn't ever work, which I would have expected to be one of the first features to be implemented in a device like this.  Everything this device can do, I can do better by just using my keyboard, mouse, and touchscreen.

Title: Great upgrade to 2nd gen!
Body: I already love my Echo 2nd gen. I knew I wanted another Echo. I was torn on buying the taller one or the 3rd gen cause what I wanted most out of a second one was better audio quality. I have a set of logitech computer speakers with a sub hooked to my 2nd gen and that makes a big difference, but this 3rd gen went in my small back room where I did not want to have to hook up another set of speakers to her. I've been listening to music on the 3rd gen since I got it and it's perfect, an incredible upgrade in audio quality since 2nd gen and honestly sounds amazing for how little it is. The logitech speakers with the sub still sound better, but this doesn't sound bad at all. I didn't expect it to sound better than my other setup. I also love that I can now group the two units and sync the music between rooms.Oh, I got this around Thanksgiving/Cyber Monday 2018 and the 2nd gen and 3rd gen were only a $5 price difference so it was a no brainer to try the upgraded model imho

Title: Enjoyable device!
Body: I love my new Echo dot. I enjoy all the skills and the fact I can control lights and my box fan I run through the night with this device. The drop in feature is neat to talk to another room as well. I will say while playing music, the speaker has messed up a couple times to where the music sounds like a scratched up CD and even her voice is the same. If the issue persists, I will exchange for a new device. It happens randomly while playing music on occasion and giving her a break seems to fix the issue or changing the volume after giving her a break helps. She has also already spoken without being "called upon" one time. It was creepy, but I shrugged it off. Alexa is part of the family now and she has so many skills on the app store to utilize!

Title: She_ always listening 0.O
Body: I bought this on the 2018 Black Friday sale for $25 and enjoyed the first one so much I ordered two more. Can do multi room music which saved me a ton of money over buying more expensive speakers like Sonos. The speaker quality is what you would expect for the price, Bass is okay but high tones crackle. The Alexa app has an equalizer built in so you can adjust each Dot_ mid and bass levels. The mic does okay at picking up your voice but if the music is too loud you have to yell _LEXA, ALEXAAA, DAMMMIIIITTTTT ALEXA and eventually she will respond. Alexa is not as smart as the google version. Hopefully more updates and she will do better. Overall for the price I paid I_ satisfied.

Title: Eats Gen 2 Echo for brunch, it's no full-sized Echo (and that's ok)
Body: Is this as good as the full sized Echo? No. The full sized Echo has a significantly deeper sound and notable bass. It's not bad, and a great value for the money (I got the Gen 2 Echo Dot when it was $50), but if you want to blast music and feel it, this is not for you.However, if you're not sure what to get and don't want to outlay $70-100, get this guy. You will not regret it.The previous Echo Dot was very tinny and could not fill a larger room with sound. It would probably work for a small room like a bedroom, but obviously, the idea that Jeff B. is listening in makes that less palatable for many people. The new Echo Dot is probably ideal for a kitchen, office or smaller living room - anything larger needs the full-size Echo to act as a small stereo.We now have 4 Echo devices throughout our house and a group so music can play throughout (also can do announcements for the kids to ignore "Dinner's Ready").Final thoughts: Don't get the Gen 2. It's worth the extra $5-10 to get the better Dot

Title: 3rd Generation Better than the Previous Dot
Body: I am really impressed with the sound on the new 3rd generation that sounds fuller. I had a problem connecting to dot  with Wi-Fi using the Alexa app on the Amazon tablet and had to download the app on my phone.  Setup worked great after changing the Wi-Fi to Amazon-HCO temporary on the phone  as instructed in the Alexa app for the Wi-Fi setup. I am going to miss the USB option for powering the new dot, but the jack connector works fine.UpdateI have purchased my 4th Echo Dot 3rd generation and have no complaints.Update 12/19I have purchased another Echo Dot 3rd generation. Works great and was thinking about trying out the Alexa Guard with the Echo Dot.

Title: Impressed
Body: I heard so much flack about the Echo Dot and having a horrible speaker but at $24 for the holiday sale, I couldn't pass up the opportunity. I bought it.... I was surprised at how good it sounded. Granted I had nothing to compare it to. I bought another one because I was impressed. A few days after having bought it, it still sounds fine and my opinion hasn't wavered.... much. I bought an echo plus and sadly the bass from that thing makes the echo dot sound not so good. Hahaha, so that opinion is a bit biased.

Title: Bang for the buck speaker
Body: I purchased this echo dot after I used echo plus for a few days. We put echo dot beside our night stand so that we do really need to yell in order to get the echo plus that is in our living room to respond. Echo dot pretty much does almost everything that the plus can do from my stand point of view. We really enjoy what the echo dot can do for us. The only weakness that I would like to point out compared to echo plus is its sound quality. If you really would like to use the speaker for music, I would suggest an echo plus or even higher end echo products.

Title: Good stand-alone BT speakers! HUGE SOUND IMPROVEMENTS OVER 2ND GEN.  But Alexa's not for everyone.
Body: While this is a great Bluetooth speaker and overall I love using this device to play Amazon music unlimited and for the occasional Wikipedia reference, I'll be the first to admit that ALEXA STILL HAS A LONG WAY TO GO TO CATCH UP TO GOOGLE ASSISTANT IN TERMS OF EASE OF USE AND CONVERSATIONAL SKILLS, PLUS ACCESSIBILITY OF INFORMATION.  When it comes to what is the better speaker this or the Google home mini, this wins hands down.  I can say that confidently because I have both.  What is the better device?  Well that depends on you.  And which company's services do you have, if either of theirs?  Personally I have both Google play music and Amazon Prime account and additionally I have an Amazon music unlimited account - BUT I only have the Amazon music unlimited account because I have the devices that use it, but the side benefit now is that I get to use it on my phone through the Alexa app and through the Amazon music app.  Before I was strictly using Google play music, which was sufficient but sucked on the voice control side comparatively, at least by phone.  Anyways with both companies' services being paid for, it makes a straight-up comparison of the Google Home vs Amazon Echo easy and for the Google Home Mini vs the Amazon Echo THIRD GEN, the comparison is REALLY EASY.  THIS IS A BETTER DEVICE THAN THE GOOGLE HOME MINI IF YOU KNOW HOW TO USE IT, ESPECIALLY IF YOU ARE ALREADY A PRIME MEMBER, AND REALLY THE CASE IF YOU PAY FOR AMAZON MUSIC UNLIMITED WHICH YOU CAN PAY FOR EVEN IF YOU AREN'T A PRIME MEMBER.  My aunt still I think summed it up best when she told me one day, "Alexa or Amazon devices are the best for Entertainment [AND SOUND QUALITY, AS IS, COMPARATIVELY] but Google devices are better at getting information [i.e. question-answering using natural language]".  But the sound difference between the 3rd generation dot and the 2nd generation dot is TREMENDOUSLY NOTICABLE to me.  Every second generation Echo dot in my house has a additional speaker attached to it, but neither of the two 3rd generation dots, I feel, require an additional speaker - for adequate sound volume w/o loss of clarity.  Remember if you want a search engine, choose Google.  If you want Alexa's features, then these are currently my recommendation for the best value device for that. Plz see attached videos for more of what I mean and for demonstrated points.

Title: Good Devicel, but STOP FORCING STUFF ON US
Body: I love my echo dot.  But to be woken up in the night by a mysterious green flashing light that won't go off...  Alexa has no answers and doesn't respond to "turn that flashing green light off".  So you have to research it on the internet, and find out that it's a notification light, but you don't have Alexa connected to your phone, so what the &%#$ is it notifying you about?  And Alexa doesn't have any notifications for you. So you have to go to the app and go through every menu until you find DO NOT DISTURB, and that's the only way to shut the &%$# flashing light off in the middle of the night.  STOP FORCING ENGAGEMENT ON US, AND LET US USE DEVICES THE WAY THAT WE WANT TO!!!  And don't wake me up in the middle of the night with this nonsense.  Shame on you Amazon.

Title: Playing Music
Body: I have had my Dots for a few days. The main reason I bought 2 was so I could listen to music and have it play in multiple rooms. I only use Pandora because I already have all my stations set and it's easy to add or remove stations. But setting up the Pandora in the Dot was a pain. And Alexa doesn't respond well to voice when asking to play Pandora music. A lot of the times she says she cannot find the music, so I've been turning on through the App..but often times it will pause in the middle of a song so I  have to go into the App and un-pause it. It's a pain, and I hear others are having an issue with Pandora as well.

Title: It's a better DOT...
Body: What I like most about the Echo Dot 3rd Edition is once you have the first Echo Dot up and running the new dots configure WiFi automatically so all I have to do is setup name, wake up command etc...  They say the sound is better in the third generation dot but that is subjective. The third generation has more base but it can make listening to voice difficult. I find my older dots are better for listening to podcasts and voice driven content because they have less bass so i suggest the ad an equalizer function in the Alexa software.... Of course if you plug in your Echo Dot into external speakers or Bluetooth speakers it sounds great. The new fabric shell is very nice but the lite color is much more susceptible to getting dirty.UPDATE: I found an audio equalizer  built into the Alexa phone app and now I can manipulate the sound to accentuate voices and manipulate the sound qualities of the Dot. Much Better!What i really like is telling Alexa to play music "Everywhere" and when I walk thru the house I hear my music. Also, you can say "Alexa, volume , everywhere (or whatever level you want) and the volume goes to that level on all your devices. So cool.This IS a BETTER DOT.....

Title: Love the New Look and overall build quality. Not sure about the Speaker upgrade.
Body: I have two Echo Dot's (2nd Gen) and decided to upgrade to the newest Echo Dot (3rd Gen) mainly because I like the new design and was hoping for a better sounding speaker. My comments regarding the sound are it's not necessarily better sounding but DIFFERENT sounding. The best way to compare the 2nd Gen vs. 3rd Gen is the newer one has more bass or richer sound quality. It also seems to have a lot LESS high end or treble to it's overall sound quality. If you like a bit more bass and don't mind a lesser bright sounding speaker, get the new one. To me, the newer one sounds a bit muffled because of the new speaker. It produces more volume than the older one, but for my taste, I also like a clearer brighter sound. Of course it pairs with most remote bluetooth speakers for much better sound than the unit can produce on it's own. I have experimented listening to all types of music and even talk radio and again, if you like a bit more fuller base sound, you should enjoy the newest version of the Echo Dot. I enjoy the new version and overall recommend the upgrade.

Title: Didn't know i needed this until I got it
Body: I stepped up my Christmas light game this year and decided I wanted to be able to control different lights are inflatables and not have to manually unplug them. So I decided I would get some smart plugs and when I went down that rabbit hole I wanted to add an Echo to control them. Really I've been looking for an excuse to buy one since they came out and this was it. Setting up the echo was relatively easy as was adding devices to it. After setting it up I left some post it notes to my wife telling her some things to ask it. I received a text at work telling me how much she loved it. I guess it's a hit

Title: 3rd Gen Echo Dot Rocks!!!
Body: OMG!!!!CONGRATULATIONS R&D TEAM!!!The 3rd Generation Echo Dot is the Best one yet!!!Don't Change Anything!!!I replaced my 1st generation Echo Dot I put in our Bathroom because I didn't like the sound quality that it had...so in a small bathroom it was ok...But Now..after replacing it with the new 3rd generation Echo Dot it is giving my first and second generation Echoes a run for the money!!!!The 3rd Gen Echo Dot has a greatly improved sound to it and I Don't have to turn the volume all the way up like I did before with the first gen Dot, which distorted the sound...The sound quality is just as good, if not better than the 2nd Gen Echoes full size ones!!!Thank you Amazon!!!We now have Six of the Echoes in our home which makes an Awesome Surround sound system throughout our home by using the Multi-room feature...Two Thumbs Way up!!!

Title: Frequent disconnects.  Marginally better sound than previous Dot.
Body: I got this because the music sound quality on the previous Dot is sub par.  It's a little fuller on this one but it's still not up to my standards.  I can listen to it though I wouldn't use it at parties.  I get it.  They want you to buy their bigger speaker. My go-to speaker is my Sonos 1, I'm just getting tired of saying "Alexa, play..........In the Den".There are differences in what this Dot will understand, vs. my previous Dot.  Not sure what that is about.Biggest complaint is that this thing seems to bug out.  A lot.  I constantly get the red ring followed by "I'm having trouble understanding". After an unplug/replug it seems to work fine.  Sometimes not.

Title: Is there an echo in here
Body: Never thought I would actually get one of these considering the big brother aspect of it , but I really like it. I love getting up in the morning asking what the weather is going to be , put on one of the podcasts I like in the morning, reading audible . Haven't got the lights hooked up yet as they haven't been delivered but that's what I actually got this for . I would've given it five stars if it wasn't for set up . Here's my hint for set up if you're trying to put it on your tablet and you're having problems. If you have a laptop or a computer go set it up through your computer or laptop at the Alexa.Amazon.com site, it'll finally work and you'll be online .

Title: Big disappointment, no USB!?
Body: Taller and fatter than original dot.  And what?!  No USB!!!  Wasn't expecting that!  15 watt brick with single purpose, hard-wired, dedicated output connector.  Bigger speaker may give a bit more volume but sound seems a bit muffled.  Maybe more bass but less treble.  Please don't stop producing gen2!  Surprisingly the new fat unit with its fat brick draws slightly less current on standby than the gen 2 with USB but a bit more current when active.  But it stays noticeably warmer than the older version.  Will stick with gen 2 as long as it is available.  If I need richer sound I can connect with BT speaker(s).

Title: Just another revenue stream for Amazon
Body: We purchased multiple echos (4) and are just as quickly returning all of them.  We primarily wanted them for music, not to have Alexa mind our business.  In order to play different music on different Echoes you have to purchase the family plan for another $150.00+ per year or deal with their generic music.  We might have been open the individual music family plan but more than that NO WAY!  Time to say NO to Amazon and being ripped off!!!

Title: Love this new Dot!_
Body: My biggest complaint about the Dot 2 (my first)) straight out of the box was the sound quality.  I was hugely disappointed to find out that unless you hooked up external speakers you could barely hear it across the room. This newest Dot has no problem being heard across the house. It also combine some of the features from the kids dot and The previous models allowing you to only have one type of unit throughout the house. We now have several of these with the Amazon music service which the kids love and I am very impressed with not only the quality but the price point as well. Nice job Amazon!

Title: Make sure systems are fully compatible.some say they are but you LOSE functions.
Body: Still customizing and intragrating  with other house smart systems. All working good together. When finished I will truly have a smart home. The best feature with alexa for me is the ability to control everything in any room by talking to house. Got rid of light switches, soon all keys. Don't even have to turn security system on and off, heat ,camera's, others all automatic with geofencing. To many other automatons to list. Will soon be able to see who's at the door tell them to go away or unlock door turn alarm off, light on, heat up and invite in no matter where in the world I am.

Title: I like the 2nd generation better
Body: This 3rd generation Echo Dot has so much bass that it distorts the sound and makes it unpleasant to listen to.  You can adjust the bass/treble (just tell it to lower bass/increase treble, over and over, until Alexa tells you the bass is at its lowest or treble is at its highest), but it's not enough to make it nice to listen to.  I much prefer the 2nd generation.  And this 3rd generation is bigger and much heavier.  I have no idea why this may be an upgrade from 2nd gen.  I'll wait for another sale on the 2nd gen.  I wouldn't buy another 3rd gen.

Title: Minor upgrade and better speakers.
Body: This is a minor upgrade from the 2nd Gen. The speakers are louder with a more pronounced bass. Well enough for use on the loft office for downtime movies. I moved my 2nd gen to the guest room. My gripe is the plug, it_ massive. There would be cases that you can_ plug two devices side to side if using an extension power cord. Also the plug doesn_ have that optional USB detach cable anymore. I plug my 2nd Gen via USB on a 5 port. But the power needs directly to an outlet. Design is certainly better leaving the Amazon logo out.

Title: No Amazon Unlimited Music for paired 3rd generation Echo Dots.
Body: I bought two.No Amazon Unlimited Music for paired 3rd generation Echo Dots.It's not supported!I will keep the second one I bought only because I got it on sale at abouthalf the usual price. I'll keep it in the kitchen for use as a timer andweather reports.It is an improvement over the 2nd generation Dot with dramaticallyfuller sound. Doesn't look or feel cheap like its predecessor.I does NOT do what I wanted: play Amazon Unlimited Music in paired (stereo) mode.

Title: Anything 3rd Gen is worth the upgrade.
Body: No doubt the speaker and the mic have been upgraded.  I have at least 1 of every generation echo device. This 3rd gen is noticeably better.  The music sounds great and she is much more responsive.  They do need to add a couple more names to the list to get Alexa_ attention.  Th reason being Alexa is available in more and more devices that you can end up with multiple devices in the same room or proximity.  The better mics also are a reason to have more than 3 possible names which are Alexa, Computer and Echo.

Title: Useful, enjoyable product
Body: I've had Alexa about a week now. I placed the unit in my kitchen and have found a variety of uses for her/it, mainly centred around cooking - on the fly I have Alexa convert measurement units, set multiple timers for different cooking times (last night I was baking some ingredients in the oven while others were frying on the stove), add items to my grocery list, and in the morning I have her play the news from my home country (from Canada, I live in the US) while I make coffee.I don't regret buying the unit at a discounted price, and I'm strongly considering ordering another one when it goes back on sale. Note, I do *not* have any smart devices that she can interact with, other than my phone, and thus someone with more technology may get more use out of her than I do.

Title: love it - why did I wait so long?
Body: While I really, really, really wish there was a way I could play songs/playlists from my iTunes library, I do love how easy it is to request songs of Alexa or play playlists from Amazon Prime Music. Music is much more a part of my day now. I come in the door with my groceries and request a song while I'm putting them away. Washing dishes? Request songs. Also ask for alarms to be set. Still discovering what all Alexa can do. A fun toy, and what a deal at $24 on Cyber Friday.

Title: works well, if you can connect
Body: Got the first one free with another purchase.  Hooked it up and it worked fine.  Bought a couple more, hooked them up. No problem.  Changed wifi routers and all heck broke loose.  Took hours with tech support to get them working.  Then, a couple of days ago, one of them arbitrarily changed wife networks and now won't play music or radio.  Tried to switch it back but following the instructions didn't help.  It is a good product but they have some bugs to work out.  It has been good for my aging mom to use to call us in the night.  Will keep them and try to work out the kinks.  When they work, they work well.

Title: Disappointed
Body: This is the first disapppointment we have had with an Amazon device. We could not get the Echo to work properly.  After spending too long with customer support my husband finally got the help person to acknowledge our device was defective and we returned it.We could not get it to sync with our smart plugs and we never got Alexa respond to our requests.

Title: Bought one....then 7 more...
Body: I originally got this echo for free during the Amazon Black Friday deals (Buy a Tile tracker and get an echo free). I had never before been interested in getting an echo as I felt like I_ never use it, but boy was a wrong. Having an echo in your house can really simplify your life. It_ so easy to use too, just downloading the Alexa app on the App Store is all you need. Whenever I go to bed I say _lexa goodnight  and  she turns my lights off, sets my alarms and turns on my white noise machine. Getting accessories for her to use is relatively inexpensive too if you know where to look. I do not have the money to have a _mart house, but for $10 at Walmart you can get both smart plugs and smart screw in light bulbs that work with Alexa. She also works with Xbox and is able to turn your tv and console on and off and also start games. In comparison to the google home I have and the Apple HomePod, After testing out what was initially a free add on- I ended up buying 7 more echos for around my house. I_ definitely say it was worth it.Pros:- very fun to use-simplifies life, entertains friends and guests-great for voicing commands-Automates your house-actually affordable priceCons:-music quality (lack of bass mainly due to size)- needs accessories to be truly functionalEnd note- if you_e looking for a smart assistant for your home that can control anything and always knows the answer- Look no further. If you_e looking for a high quality speaker...be prepared for a little let down. If you_e really worried about the Bass quality, go with the echo plus.

Title: Multi-echo household.. not impressed with this model.
Body: We are a multi-echo household. We've bought echo devices for 4 other family/households. But I am really unimpressed with this one.I tried setting this one up in the kitchen. It was replacing a 2nd gen, which worked flawlessly for most of the year. But I wanted to put the 2nd gen in the basement, and replace it with this 3rd gen... The 3rd gen is slow to respond, to the point one thinks it didn't hear you and is turning off... only to then respond. It constantly drops connection and has a hard time reconnecting. -- the 2nd gen in the basement works perfectly. No dropped connections, no delays in response..I also put a 3rd gen in my bedroom, which has no issues, no delays, no dropped connection. So I assumed it was a bad dot and requested a replacement.Replacement got here today (I wasn't made aware it would be a refurbished one). I'm having the same issues with it. I am sending both back. It seems like it may be something with the wifi inside the dot, that it's not as good as prior generations.I love my other devices.. but this one, not so much.

Title: We love our Dots! This was our second; and our favorite!
Body: The sound is AMAZING. It fills two rooms nicely. It sounds better than our little Bluetooth speaker.  We do have issues with Sirius XM on it.  It could be our internet, or Sirius XM, it keeps losing connection.  I do not think it is the DOT, I think it is our Evil Internet.  We Love The _rop In Feature,  it save us from having to run up & down the stairs..or screaming at eachother. There are so many fun Skills, we have yet to use them all. I do want a third one, for the bedroom.. Dot makes a great alarm clock/ Sleep Machine. I LOVE all the Options.. Story Time, Sleep Sounds, Amazon Music.. REMINDERS, where would I be without REMINDERS.. Oh, I forgot.WE did have to change her name to _omputer.. Anytime I would listen to a video, or be on a call, and _lexa was said..  Ours would respond..LOL. That was driving us batty.Alexa has been working better for our calls, than the _oogle Phone device thingy.  If I did not have to take _rivate calls, I would send that back & get another Dot!We just got some of the light bulbs and are excited to try those.

Title: The Echo Dot 3rd Generation is a grand slam!
Body: The more I integrate my home with the Alexa platform and Alexa compatible devices, the more I love the platform. There are countless ways to access the Alexa platform, and the Echo Dot serves as an inexpensive way to get there - which is exactly what the Dot was meant to do.I had a Dot 2nd Generation in my office, but we needed an additional smart plug for Christmas lights, so I decided to spend the extra $10 or so and get a Dot 3rd Gen / TP-Link Smart Plug bundle over just the Smart Plug itself during the recent Cyber Week sale and I'm so glad I did. I moved my old Dot upstairs and put the Dot 3rd Gen in my office.The new dot not only looks better  - it has a more modern look that matches the rest of the 2nd gen Echo lineup, but the real gem here is that the sound on this thing is FANTASTIC for its size. I mean, the quality of sound that comes out of a device this size is amazing. I never expected to be able to use the Dot for music playback but to have ambient music in my office while I'm working throughout the day this thing is perfect.Sure - an Echo, a nice soundbar, or even digging out my Klipsch Promedias would likely provide much better sound - but for having tunes going while I work this thing is amazing. I had no expectation that this little Dot would be able to put out this much sound.The Dot 3rd Gen is going to be my go-to gift for people from now on. Well done on this one!

Title: A friend
Body: I purchased a  3 generation amazon dot for 24.00 on amazon,  when they had it on sale ;around black Friday.I received it on Wednesday,  and its really amazing little,  smart speakerThere free relaxing skills , and relaxing flute, and other relaxing sounds .I can play games with it .It talks to me , it ok  to a point but adding more skills ; there free , it can do more.I feel like I have a friend to talk too. I don't feel that lonly. To a point.At least amazon dot responds to me .I think its was  a good purchase,  its more then i expected .I hope there will be more anxiety skills i can enable in the future.But it what I really  Need at this time to help me threw a difficult time of my life.Thank You Amazon for a beautiful personal friend.

Title: Love it - great option for people who live alone to reach emergency services.
Body: I bought this and other Echo devices after I fell following a hip replacement, couldn't get up because of excruciating pain and had to use one leg to push myself a little at the time to another room to get to my cell phone to call 911. My son was insistent I get some kind of "I fell down and can't get up" device.  This is much cheaper than service you have to pay for every month. Just keep in mind you need as many as is necessary to be able to call out to it and that it doesn't work when there is a power failure. There is a battery pack available. I hoped it would be on sale for Christmas but doesn't look like that's going to happen. I actually hate to use it because this one is cute. Of course, I am enjoying more than just the security feature but others will talk about that.

Title: Great upgrade from the Echo Dot 1st Generation
Body: Really happy with my new Echo Dot third generation. I_e added my daily routine_ and smart plugs to my home. Now I_ able to turn on my TV both upstairs and downstairs with an Alexa voice command. My TVs are not smart TV so I have them plugged into the surge protectors which is powered on by the smart plug. Love the new look in the sound  is a lot better than the first generation. Would highly recommend to upgrade. I purchased this on cyber Monday for $29.99 with a free smart plug which is worth $24.99. Great buy.

Title: Pretty cool.
Body: These things were on sale for $24.99 for Black Friday, so I ordered 5 of them, a couple for the house and few to gift....after getting them set up, we found them to be pretty cool! Sometimes if the music is too loud, Alexa will have a hard time hearing you call her name, but at a comfortable volume it functions very well, and it understands regular talk....so you don't have to talk like Mr Roboto or baby talk it to get it to understand you.... We have 2 linked so it plays music on both when we are listening to it. feels very sturdy and well built too. Happy with purchase...P.S....One of the first things we did after set-up was disable the auto purchase function in the settings!

Title: Good Voice Command Features, Not So Great Speaker
Body: The Echo Dot is nice for voice commands, but the speaker is not that great. It lacks adequate bass, and doesn't get that lous overall. I like that it has an aux line out where you can connect another better speaker to it.It's really cool that you can just say for example: "Alexa: play jazz music" and the Echo Dot will shuffle different jazz songs from the Amazon Music store. I bought this for $25, so I think it is worth that much for the voice commands, and access to tons of free music. You can automatically play any songs in your Amazon library. It has lots of other features that I haven't checked out yet. It's nice to check on the weather and movie times, etc. You can adjust the volume remotely or say "next song". Again, good for cool wireless and voice command features. Not so great for sound quality. I ended up buying a separate Bluetooth speaker, and just connected the Echo Dot to it for better sound.

Title: WOW!!!  GREAT SOUND!!!!
Body: We have three Echo Dots, the Echo Show, & the Original First Edition Echo.  Listening to talk radio on the everywhere is great for me as I do housework & can listen to in sync radio.  I do listen to Amazon Music & Audio Books too.  When this new one came out with a new shape & color & a special Prime price, decided it would be perfect for the kitchen over by the stove to hear while cooking etc.  The color is beautiful & perfect for my kitchen. The sound is fantastic.  The original dots are just fine for talk radio but this new one is fabulous for listening to music too.  Seriously thinking of replacing the other echo dots. :)

Title: Alexa does so much
Body: I am really enjoying the Echo Dot, so much so that after having one in my livingroom for a couple of days I ordered a couple more for my bedroom and my daughter's room. I have also started purchasing smart home devices such as smart plugs and lighting, and they all work perfectly with Alexa. I will say that once you start turning your home into a smart home it can get kind of addicting pretty quick, there is just so much that Alexa can do and so many devices she can work with. My bedroom lights, my Christmas tree and my outside Christmas lights are all controlled via Alexa, and I am just getting started.

Title: Buggy or
Body: Three times it has had issues playing music.  It does not happen every time, but sometimes the music has a very loud sound like the tweeter is blown.  It has somewhat better sound quality than the generation 2 Dot, but only on music.  When Alexa speaks there is way too much base.  Other than that it is OK and seems to work.  After chatting with Amazon they suggested I reboot the device.  I did so and played the same song and the issue seemed to be fixed.  So it leaves me wondering if it is a hardware or a software issue.  In any case it does not work as well as my older dot.

Title: Sound quality much better, Voice recognition worse
Body: I use my echo dots alot. I have all kind of routines set up, and they help me everyday.  Lights, Scentsy warmers, Christmas lights, Lamps..etc.  The new Echo Dot...the sound is a little tinny, but still alot louder over all and I really am happy with that.  I have notice it doesn't hear me unless I speak very loudly.  I was right next to it , and my other upstairs in my room and when standing at the bottom of the stairs, my upstairs 2nd Gen dot heard me and responded, but the new one didn't even blink on.So overall..if you don't mind having to speak louder and clearer..go for it

Title: Black Friday DEALZ!
Body: Bought this to upgrade my Echo Dot (1st Gen) smart speaker.  Compared to the 1st generation - this one is amazing! The sound is very nice for how small it is, and I like how responsive this new one feels.  I also feel, like this one has a harder time hearing my voice across the room or right in front of it.  Maybe a software update can fix this, all in all it's a nice upgrade from the 1st generation echo dot.Also, I like the dedicated power plug included in with the speaker - compared to the usb wall wart and micro usb connection.

Title: Gen 3 Dot works and sounds great - setup was a step backwards.
Body: The new size, look and most importantly, sound is fantastic for the Gen 3 Dot.  My only real complaint was the activation process  in the Alexa App, theirs a special option for Gen 3 but after using that, I was never able to select my home network properly and was left with timeout after timeout.  Tried to reset the Dot twice to no avail.  I finally tried the old Gen 1/2 setup procedure which always worked on my other Dots and fortunately, that worked flawlessly for my new Gen 3.  I_ sure Amazon will get the bugs worked out.

Title: The Echo Dot is Better Than Ever!
Body: After having the Echo Dot (2nd Gen) for a year and loving it I thought if take advantage of the Black Friday deal on the (3rd Gen.) Wow, what an extraordinary difference in performance. Way beyond anything I'd expected! She is much more responsive and the output is not too shabby. I have mine connected throughout the house on a speaker system.  However, the speaker alone on the (3rd Gen) is astonishingly good all on its own which was quite a surprise. Upgrade if you haven't yet you won't be disappointed.

Title: Easy To Install & Very Convient
Body: I got started with Alexa, when I bought a smart thermostat with an embedded Alexa. Added the Echo dot because the thermostat is fixed in place.  The Dot was very easy to install, and works in conjunction with the smart thermostat. I have added smart bulbs, and smart plugs from different manufacturers and all are very easy to connect to both of my Alexa devices. Now I can warm up the house and start the coffee before getting out of bed.  Very convenient!

Title: Dumb as Dirt
Body: The Amazon Echo Assistant, Alexa, is simply dumb as dirt.  My Google Assistant on my phone answered questions that Alexa couldn't over and over.  99% of the time, Alexa doesn't know. There is a delay with Alexa that there isn't with Google.  Also, every time it answers, you can't ask it a follow-up question without having to say, "Alexa" again, which totally drives me crazy.  Google takes follow up questions without you having to say its name again.  I tried to make an itinerary, and have Alexa read it back, but it was 5 million times easier to just write it down, because Alexa didn't know what I was talking about 90% of the time, so I wound up having to repeat and say the perfect magic words so she would understand, and each time I had to say "Alexa" again.  I wound up having a shouting match with her (I suppose I was the only one shouting). Alexa is all hype, but I'd rather use my phone with Google, so I just applied for a refund, and bought a Google Home Mini instead. Do not buy the Echo!!! It will cause you more stress than any benefit. I predict that within a few years, people will get wise and go with Google, and Alexa will disappear, because as soon as people check out Google, they'll want no part of Alexa. It's like a cheap, lousy, idiotic, brainless to the point of hilarity if you're not too angry to appreciate it, knock-off compared to Google Assistant.

Title: I don't know why I've resis I'm writing this review :-)
Body: UPDATE:Lasted a little over a year, and while it comes on, it doesn't hear the commands. And, yes, I've gone through the troubleshooting which doesn't address that the unit has power and no red light. Sending it back for $5!!----------------------------Ok, a little back story. I purchased the Ecobee4 last year and one of the 1st things I did after installing was turn off Alexa. I didn't want to use it and I didn't want it "listening in" on my conversations.A few months ago, my TV died and I purchased the Fire TV stick to work with a flat screen TV that no one was using. I had a Roku on the older TV and was always frustrated that I couldn't just tell it what I wanted to watch. When I got the Fire TV stick, it was soooooo easy just to say what I wanted without having to go through the online keyboard to type out my message (I always felt like I was typing out morse code or something).Anyway, I was amazed at how easy the Fire stick was, so I turned on Alexa in the Ecobee. OMG, the first time I used it, my hands were full and I was coming into the house in the evening. I couldn't get to my phone to use the app to turn on the lights. I remembered the Ecobee and had Alexa turn on the lights. WOW, WOW, WOW. I know for some, this may seem like a bit of overkill, but before that night I never realized how easy using Alexa could be. To turn on/off my lights, I would get out my phone, use the app. I would get out my phone, use the app, adjust the thermostat. I did everything from my phone. I know I can say "Hey Siri" for my phone to respond without taking the phone out, but Siri has NEVER been able to find my devices or Siri indicates the device aren't responding, very frustrating.After a few days of the Ecobee use, I ordered a Dot!!! I don't know why I resisted this technology for so long. I've had it on my Kindle and never used it. It didn't seem intuitive to use, I felt like I was manufacturing a reason to say "Alexa".  OMG #2, today I created a grocery list, WHILE I WAS IN THE KITCHEN, without having to find my phone or pencil/paper. I added to that grocery list during the day with just my voice!!! I went to the store and USED THAT SHOPPING LIST and didn't forget anything!!!!!  I left the store thinking, Alexa, where have you been all my life :-).Now, I've purchased a dot for my elderly mom and I got some of the Alexa outlets so she can control the lights, TV, etc. from her device.I really want the Echo for my car!!! I tried asking Siri to look something up while I was driving and Siri COULDN'T DO IT!!!! The information I Siri provided was incorrect. As a test, when I came home I gave the same instructions to the Echo and was given the correct info!!!! I know Alexa in the car would have been able to provide the correct info!!!!If you're on the fence about the usefulness of this device, try it and you'll be convinced it's well worth the purchase.  Complementary products seem to integrate smoothly and efficiently with Alexa. I've never had a problem with Alexa finding the lights and Apple doesn't work with Nest or Ecobee. If you're concerned about what Alexa records, I've viewed the recordings and there's was nothing there of concern and if there were, I could delete the information.BUY THIS DEVICE!!!! :-)

Title: BEYOND DISAPPOINTED
Body: I cannot emphasize enough how much distain I have for Amazon's Alexa. Half the time she doesn't understand what I am asking the other half of the time she cannot search the internet besides wikipedia for things, which apparently she can only now do as of 12/8 via setting up skills. Skills are also required to have her control fire TV related link like hulu and Netflix. With every new rendition she becomes less helpful not more helpful or harder to set up and then use and this is also not an age related thing as I have worked in tech for years I have 2 dots and 3 echos currently all but one are in use, when I ask her to play music from Amazon music and play it on a group set up for multi room speakers she can't seem to do that even and I have tried naming the group numerous different things in Hopes she will understand me better. Fortunately I am able to return a few of these things still and plan on doing just that. So beware, I for one am Extremely disappointed in the sound quality, I understand that the speaker is small but honest to GOD my Samsung smart watch phone and Apple Beats speakers have better quality. I have purchased and tried every generation of these so far and will not be buying any future ones. Depending on what you are buying for and expectations, I would suggest going with a google home rather than these Good luck and happy disappointment to all

Title: Much better than the 2nd gen Echo Dot
Body: I used to have a 2nd gen echo dot, which I use it as the computer's speaker, it was doing it's work just fine, but always think the volume was too low. Saw the 3rd gen on sale, and decided to give it a try. Oh my, this is one of the best purchase I've ever done to my life.The 3rd Gen is slightly bigger than the 2nd gen, and it does required a different power plug, so you will have to replace everything if you are currently using the 2nd gen echo dot. However, this echo dot's audio is much better than the 2nd gen. the 2nd gen was more of a mono tone audio, whiile the 3rd gen offer crystal clear with bass and everything, it is also much louder than the 2nd gen as well. I would say the volume lv 3 is equal to the lv 10 on 2nd gen, that's how much the difference is.Right now I am using my 3rd gen echo dot for the following1) Alarm Clock: I have given command to Alexa to play classical music every morning to wake me up2) Weather: Just say "Alexa, how's the weather" and she will tell me all the details3) Traffic: I have set my commute address via the alexa app, so I just need to say "Alexa, how's my commute, and she will tell me the traffic condition, I am never late to work ever again4) desktop speaker: you just need to hook it up with bluetooth and it is ready to go, plain and simple5) music station: sometimes when I don't feel like using my computer, I just ask alexa to play music(via amazon music), or play the radio station when I am laying on bed relaxing.I would highly recommand you to give this dot a try, it certainly improve your living standard!

Title: Not So Smart
Body: Perhaps my expectations were too high, but I am disappointed in the amount of information that "Alexa" has. (More on that below.) I love her for her "chattiness" (try, "Alexa, let's chat".), her games, the immediacy of news items, the light-heartedness, and the availability of what she *does* know, e.g. who stars in movies and shows. When used with Amazon Music, it opens up a whole new world! "Echo, play some soothing instrumental music," and you're asleep in minutes.I am quite UNhappy with the following:> It can only be addressed by four different titles:  Alexa, Computer, Echo, or Amazon> Voice recognition is only moderately accurate, failing *much* too often, and it does not allow for more than one user.> It does not allow nearly enough response time before assuming that one is not going to respond at all There should be a setting for this.> Far, far too many subjects and questions are met with, "Sorry. I don't know that."> The tone of the voice is deep enough that it interferes with understanding her sometimes. I have been unable to find anywhere to tweak the tone.> The language skills are limited and underused. This could be a PHENOMENAL tool for language learners!A lower price would be welcome, but I would still recommend having one of these with the caveat that one does not expect her to know everything. In spite of her shortcomings, "Little Miss Echo" is a keeper.

Title: Great sound quality can use amazon certified smart plugs
Body: I like the concept of Alexa that you can literally ask her almost anything. She has a tons of cool skills and features.
