Something that made me dislike this is that  Alexa recorded me talking on the phone and then replayed my entire conversation this is not safe. That invaded my privacy. I dont Like that when i play music it has a ton of static eitherUpdate received a replacement Alexa sound quality is absolutely amazing.  Amazon told me when I thought Alexa was invading my privacy it was actually her thinking I had an announcement to make. So please disregard the invading privacy! I nolonger hear the static.Volume max is a ten it_ loud enough for me. I usually Keep my volume on a four or five. Sometimes when i ask Alexa something she doesn_ always respond to her name or turn on but overall it_ good!  I do wish Alexa was a little more like google just a tad bit when i say That I_ referring to her intelligence. I did switch Alexa name to Echo because for some reason she would always think i was saying her name when i wasnt. She is connected to a smart plug and it_ amazing i come In and say Echo turn on the lights and she does. Get one i love playing my music on there when I_ cleaning up or when i have guest over. I gave it a 4/5 because it can still use a little improvement but overall nice!

Title: So close to perfect
Body: I bought this so I could shout out the names of tunes to play while working around the house. For the most part, it works great, but you will quickly learn the limitations of Alexa.There will come a time when it won't even come close to recognizing what you are saying. It will play something totally off the wall or something that doesn't even sound remotely what you asked it too! I have gone directly to Amazon Music, played a song from there, asked Alexa to play the last song I played, asked what it was playing, have it recite it back perfectly, ask it to play it again and have it play back something random or claim it can't find it. Alexa just bones the product. Google rarely has this level of misunderstanding!Amazon really needs to polish this. It is frustrating. The thing sounds so nice for its size, but you spend way too much time arguing with Alexa. She is deaf!

Title: Good updates but still needs minor improvements
Body: I really like the Echo's, and the newest version gives a better sound output but I wish they would improve on the sound pickup.  I have had my Echo's on shelves, some facing outward from the wall, some high, some low and I still have not found the perfect spot where alexa will hear me just right unless I am extremely close to her or yelling for her to do some action. (turn off light, switch stations, etc....)*Maybe for future generations they will put in better sound pickup all around her so that she will hear you whether she is laying flat or vertical.*Right now it is trial and error to find the sweet spot in which you can say commands without waking up the whole house :)Overall it is a good product, you just have to get used to her and what she is capable of.

Title: I've grown happier with my purchase over time
Body: It does what it says it does, but I'm not finding it terribly useful yet. I thought it was an intercom thing for the Ring 2 doorbell it was sold with, but that doesn't appear to be the case. If I want to ask questions about the weather, etc., I can ask my tablet PC instead, which is likely to be closer by, but I hope I will eventually find a use for it.Update: Since my original review, I've bought another. The khaki one blends with my decor better than the black one. The Echo Show does what I wanted re: the doorbell, but the Dots have taken over for casual questions or when I want smart lamps on/off. Alexa has also developed more personality. It can be annoying when Alexa misunderstands what I wanted. Overall, though, it has become a useful convenience.

Title: Big improvement
Body: I had the 2nd gen dot, and other of the devices, but the problem with the 2nd gen was it's lack of a real speaker and its plasticy cheap feeling. This new 3rd gen is definitely a vast improvement over the 2nds sound. I can actually hear it when I am taking a shower (as one does sit in my bathroom) or hear it pretty clear from anywhere in my house. Mind you I do have the Echo plus, 2 other dots, and the 1st Gen Show placed in different areas of the house, but the point is instead of having to have music play through all the devices if i want I can just use that one 3rd gen dot. It also has a more premium look and feel vs just the plastic 2nd gen. I have purchased 4 more gen 3s as gifts for family members for Christmas. I highly recommend this product

Title: Brand new defective 3rd Gen echo dot replaced with a refurbished one
Body: I purchased three of these new 3rd Gen echo dots and one of them had no audio right out of the box.  I was able to set it up without the sound and it played fine thru a Bluetooth speaker, just not thru its own.  The other two worked fine.  I tried to make a product exchange online which would always loop me back to the same form which I filled out multiple times, always failing. I then tried online chat support and was required to troubleshoot the "problem" for over an hour even though it was obvious that the other two worked fine and this one did not.  They finally agreed to replace the unit and they sent me a refurbished one.  I paid for a new one, spent an hour trying to get a replacement, and recieved a used refurbished unit.  This is not the Amazon Customer Service I am accustomed to.  Especially on their own product.  Other than that, the sound is only slightly better than the Gen2 model and it has a better look.  The upgrade was certainly not worth the hassle I had to go through.

Title: I got an used device, w/o power cable, not in the official package
Body: I received this item as a replacement from another purchase that arrived defective. Thank you for that. The device seems to be working properly so far.However, I have two complains. First, the product arrived without the power cable. Secondly, it was an used item (refurbished) and I paid for a new one.With respect to the first complain, I will understand that when returning the old Echo Dot, I should do it without the cable. That is what I did, otherwise I would had an incomplete product.About the second, it is  very disappointing and ultimately, lack of respect for your customers. How can I know if the device has all its functionalities working correctly? Can you assure me that the item will have the same expected life as a new one? I'm worried about these issues, besides the fact that I paid for a NEW device, not an used one.

Title: Love having an Echo based smart home !!!!
Body: 11/9/2018So far we love these. I bought 3 echo dots on black friday. 2 came in  sets with sengled smart lightbulbs and 1 came in a set with tp link smart plugs.  We added extra bulbs and plugs to our order. So we basically have a starter smart home now. I love it I suffer from severe migraines. Being able to dim or turn off the lights in a room with my voice is priceless. The plugs are attached to my aquariums lights and now I can control them wirelessly as well or have them set on a timer. I love the music feature as well as the intercom/drop in feature. I am so satisfied so far. Will be ordering an echo auto and more lights, plugs and a compatible thermostat ASAP.

Title: Almost perfect
Body: The AC Adapter is much to large and charging should be accomplished using a micro USB cable and AC adapter preferably the size of a small ubiquitous Apple Cube the Echo Dot charger is almost 3 times larger - there is no sound reason for this.  The reason why having a large AC Adapter is an issue is because it takes up too much space at the electrical outlet  (See image provided) Also, the device must be continually plugged in - thus eliminating the ability for portability - it should be a rechargeable - it's not. Also the design should allow for wall mounting, didn't anyone think of that ?

Title: What a Big "punch" for such a small device.
Body: This is my first experience with an Amazon Alexa device and I read many reviews before purchasing. Many of the reviews have "things to say" regarding the sound quality. This is quite the small device and I don't think it is meant for a large space. I have it on a shelf in my bedroom and the sound is rich, bass is very good, and overall it's "clear as a bell" not "tinny" at all and I tend to be an audio snob. I have already made phone calls , which I like. I can't wait to try all the other features! I am quite impressed. Well worth the price.

Title: Not as great as I was told.
Body: The sound is not nearly as good as my I thought it might be. Also I get quite a few disconnects that makes using the thing a pain in the butt. It's be just sitting getting no use now due to it not working like it should. Everything thing else that's wifi works with no issues in my house. Yet the dot seems to have issues staying connected all the time. Looking into the Google options now. All my friends have recommended the echo line so I figured I'd give it a shot. Must have got a _. Gonna go shop the Google offering and see if the grass is greener on the other side.

Title: Great price and good sound!
Body: The 3rd generation of the dot is the best by far. This sounds so much better than the prior gen dots!If the dot has too little or too much treble, mid-range or base, you can adjust these levels in the Alexa app so it_ more pleasing to your ears If you listen to music.If you want a low priced Amizon Alexa device, this it it. Don_ let the price (I paid $24) fool you. It sounds good for how small it is.

Title: EXCELENTE
Body: Alexa se ha convertido en una excelente herramienta para la administración de todos los dispositivos en casa, a pesar que aún no viene en español con mi nivel inglés y los comandos claros que vienen en las instrucciones he sacado gran provecho. El sonido para su tamaño es realmente bueno con relación a la segunda generación. Me encanta Alexa y todos sus dispositivos.

Title: Read before upgrading
Body: I wanted to try this because it_ suppose to understand you better, and a better speaker would be nice.  Well, it hears a little better, but still misunderstands a lot, for more than I_ expect from the richest man in the world.  The sound is full, but it_ a little too full for the voice coming out of it.  There_ just something we don_ like about it, but we can_ put our finger on it.  We also weren_ happy that the new speaker design can hide the LED ring a little and it kind of makes it look like it_ gained weight.  I like the sleekness of the 2nd gen.  But music does sound better.  I was hoping to replace some key Alexa_ in my house, but in decided to just stick with one.  It_ an upgrade I guess, but not as good as I hoped.  Maybe you_l have a different experience, as I am in a vaulted-ceiling room.  But come on, you know Bezos has vaulted ceilings somewhere.  Imagine being that rich.  Wow.  But I digresss.

Title: An absolutely excellent smart speaker with so many great functions.
Body: Well, I had a very awesome Cyber Monday! Though I only bought one thing, it was definitely a doozy! It is nothing less than Amazon's own smart speaker, connected to one of the best virtual assistants that I have used, Alexa! (I realize now this statement doesn't carry much weight because there's only four major ones, but I will now say that this is the best I've used, due to its ability to do pretty much everything I can think of, and ease of access - I can just talk and it works! (This is also true of Cortana, but Alexa is not dependent on a large, heavy-power-drawing device like a computer running Windows to be usable, so Alexa wins.)Alexa can answer pretty much any question that may come to mind, though there are a few that still haven't occurred to her, but that is fast changing due to crowd-sourced reviews and feedback that are easily provided for every interaction! And that's even before I mentioned the thousands of skills, reminders, timers and routines and all sorts of awesome things that the assistant can do. And all when you say her wake word which just happens to be Alexa (though I am authoring this with a text-to-speech program, I must type the assistant's name to avoid awakening her so many times :) ).The device itself is pretty elegant, as you can see my picture and video. It's grown up quite a bit from the second generation which I have never had, but it is larger and heavier, and has a big old band of cloth around it instead of it being plastic with the Amazon logo. There are four buttons on top: two for adjusting volume, one to perform some kind of action which might actually double for using the wake word; I'm not sure yet, and one to mute the microphones, of which there are four of the far-field variety, which enable the speaker to hear your voice even when it is far away and rather quiet, or when music or other audio is playing through the speaker itself! That's pretty awesome.So many other people have talked about the virtual assistant, Alexa, that I will not waste time here, because I'm mainly here to talk about the speaker itself. And I will close by saying, I'm not really concerned about a proprietary power solution over a USB solution, though I am aware that some inconvenience can exist when one cannot use power adapters one already has. Doesn't affect me, though. And the speaker is actually quite loud, probably potentially the loudest Bluetooth-enabled speaker that I've heard, and sounds wonderful pretty much no matter what is played through it!I most definitely recommend the Amazon Echo Dot third-generation! In your color of choice, though the Sandstone does look very snazzy :-) thank you, Amazon for providing us all a wonderful and affordable entry into the exciting world of virtual assistants and the Alexa infrastructure! I will treasure it forever. And, who knows? I may kit my house out with at least a couple more before holidays are out.(EDIT: As a side note, I just played back the short video I linked above, and Alexa woke up again and gave me several varieties of cheese. She's just that awesome.)

Title: Worth having a few of these in your house
Body: I use mine every day, but I probably wouldn't have bought this without other smart home items. Alexa is neat and has a lot of cool skills, plus you can build your own. I've got my Hues lights connected to it right now, so I can control my lights with voice commands. Right now with IFTTT I also have it setup so that when I leave the lights turn off, and when I come home from work they're on already. I wake up to slowly rising light, and am reminded to get ready for bed by steadily dimming light. When they turn blue I know it's raining and I should go bring my dog inside. When they're bright blue it's snowing, like today! Alexa also plays Twitch audio, Prime music (another subscription, ugh), and can be a regular bluetooth speaker as well. You can usually pick one of these up in a bundle for a steal, I got mine for $1.09 when I tried out Prime Music Unlimited.

Title: Fun, pretty much a part of the family now.
Body: We have 3, 2 3rd gens and one 2nd gen. Like all the reviews say the 3rd ones are way better. I really like that I can play music all over and wake my family up. I like the drop in feature the most. And to make an announcement.Things I don't like are that it doesn't know a lot. And that can get super frustrating really fast. And sometimes it plays music while in a drop in or call. It won't Google search and won't call on Facebook messenger I also can't figure out how to get my phone to Bluetooth to the speakers so I can play music on YouTube.I like to use it to set reminder's to do diaper laundry in 4 days or to set doctor appointment's for my kids my kids like to use it to play games and stuff as well. All in all I'm glad I got them on black Friday and didn't pay full price. They are fun and a definite learning curve.

Title: GREAT LITTLE DEVICE
Body: I have two Echo devices.  This 3rd Generation and it's older Second Generation.  I bought the first one in the Amazon refurbished device section and got it for a deep discount.  After only about two weeks of loving the little Echo, I bought the newer one.  The third generation has great audio quality!  I use my Echo in the kitchen as an alternative to listening to over-the-air radio.  I used my iPhone for radio via TuneIn, but the iPhone's sound quality was brash and unpleasant.  Both the Echo devices are an improvement over both!  I've used Echo for quick news briefs, weather reports and background music.I have two "smart" plugs linked to both Echo devices - one for a bedroom lamp and the other controlling a light in the dining room.  My ancient house now has one toe in the twenty-first century.

Title: For Info only
Body: I thought when buying the Dot(3rd Gen) it would be easy to connect and start using immediately. However, one big problem, that seems to happen all the time, is that the modem needs to be set at 5ghz to 129. I found this info in the internet after trying to set my Dot up but it will not hold the WiFi form more than a few minutes. Since my modem is set to 5.0 ghz, through Spectrum Cable, I cannot acquire the necessary ghz to operate my Dot.If you have any knowledge to help please advise.David Bornhorst

Title: Not as good as 2nd Gen
Body: Microphones are not as good as 2nd Gen. Echo has a much harder time of hearing our commands with this device vs. the older 2nd Gen device. Also, seems to be slower at answering. You can say "Alexa" and it will 2 seconds before the blue ring even lights up, then another couple seconds before she follows through with the command or request. We have our lights controlled by Alexa and the older device could get the lights on and off in less then 2 seconds of making the request. This one really has to think about it before Alexa will do it. Not very happy with the purchase at all. May return and just get another older 2nd Gen one since it seems to work better. It has 6 mics vs. the 4 in the newest model.

Title: Better way to listen to Dot
Body: We have an original Echo device as well as several Dot's.  I have a Dot in my garage and like to listen to music when I am working on a project in the garage.  I am a big fan of the old Big Band sound including Glenn Miller and Benny Goodman.  I was in the garage a few days ago and was listening to Glenn Miller when the dot fell off my work bench and into an empty 5 gallon plastic bucket.  All of a sudden this robust sound I had never heard from a Dot came roaring out.  My garage Dot now hangs from a hook inside a bucket. It has a much better sound than the Echo which is pretty impressive on it's own.  Go drop your Dot in a bucket and enjoy a new and improved sound.  Enjoy!

Title: Miracle Nightstand Device!
Body: This little guy lives on my nightstand. I use the Headspace skill to go to sleep and every morning it wakes me up to NPR and the weather and traffic. I can also vocally add items to my to do list without turning the light on and it keeps the repetitive thoughts from taking over. I feel like I_ living in the future.My 1st gen Echo recently bit the dust but I can say that the audio quality of the Echo is 1000% better. I used the Echo for music but the Dot I only use for convenience. I_e gotten a HomePod that lives in the living room for music, though, and nothing comes close to its audio quality, not even the Bose speakers I had before.

Title: I'm far more comfortable with my Google smart speaker.
Body: I have given both Google and Amazon smart speakers tests for over a year now. I take comfort in the fact that my Google speaker recognizes my voice, and for the most part only my voice. It's very disconcerting that Alexa will activate with anything that even remotely sounds like the name... At least 20, 30 or even 40 times per day it activates (and starts listening) simply because of a phrase on TV. Admittedly, there are lots of Alexa commercials, but it SHOULD be smart enough to know the difference!  I DO NOT LIKE KNOWING THAT A DEVICE IN MY HOME CAN BE TRICKED INTO LISTENING TO, AND RECORDING, CONVERSATIONS IN MY HOUSEHOLD WHEN NOT INSTRUCTED TO.

Title: Good buy but doesn_ meet the hype
Body: I_ not over-the-moon impressed with it, but for basic tasks, it makes it easier than having to take your phone out for every _oogleable inquiry. Setting timers and playing music is also helpful. I haven_ tested all the features yet, but so far, I_ having a hard time seeing how much I_l actually use it, but I_ open to learning more.I think sometimes it is far too difficult for it to pick up my voice. It_ supposed to be able to hear you even in a noisy room, but that hasn_ been the case for me. I swear sometimes it can_ understand me even in silence and I speak to it with clear, nonaccented American  English.

Title: An amazing device that you won't regret owning
Body: I finally decided to take the plunge on a smart device so I decided to go with the echo dot 3rd generation because it was on sale for the holidays. I'm very glad I did because this thing is amazing, I can use it to control my tv, my xbox one and soon an led light strip from merkury. The only issue I have with the device is for some reason when I use it to turn off the xbox then try to turn off my tv it wont work and alexa tells me the TV isn't responding. I'm not sure if it's a problem with my echo dot or my tv. The tv I have is the sony 43xbr800d. Other than that the thing is amazing and I wish I would have gotten one sooner.

Title: Life is easier with the echo
Body: I just love my echo I'm still learning everyday new things from alexa and new ways top use the echo which is thrilling in itself. But life is easier my husband and children also are able to enjoy it. The timer and the adding things to my calendar are my favorite and the drop in on my kids when I'm at work to check on all of them . I love that my husband is reminded of appointments when I'm not around to remind him and everyone can ask what's on the schedule for the day so they know what needs attention in the house internally and externally.

Title: Bigger Speaker More Bass...
Body: I am getting older and my hearing is not as good as it once was.  The Echo three was a replacement for the Echo two and my hearing and first impression say this is a nice overall improvement estheticly but the bass jumped out at me.  It was boomy and at first I did not care for the sound .  After I found out I could adjust treble, bass and midrange through Alexa the sound is a little more tailored.  Not great but much better.  Still the bass throws me off but the overall sound is much improved.  I suspect a younger set of ears will really appreciate what Amazon has done and the kicking bass of the speaker.  I for one want more high end and midrange with a little less boom.

Title: Great Sound
Body: I'm currently a college student in a dorm room and this is a great way to play music in my room! The sound quality is pretty great and it's fairly easy to use, I just connect the Echo to my phone's hotspot. I do wish that the Alexa app was a little easier to use though, and I wish that my Echo would atuomatically connect to my phone's hotspot when I turn it on, because I have to re-pair it with my phone each time I use it, which takes about three minutes each time. Not a huge deal, but I would like it if I didn't have to do that haha. Overall great device.

Title: It_ a hoot. _
Body: When my wife and I discussed getting an Echo Dot, she said _hat do we need that for? I told her I thought it would be fun and a helpful device. Well, we are not disappointed at all. It_ fun and we are using it for shopping lists, playing music on demand, answering questions and telling us jokes and puns, etc. There are many things we have to learn, but it_ easy to use and I am sure we will find more and more things to use it for.

Title: I would_e given it zero stars (UPDATED)
Body: I would have given it zero stars but that option isn_ available. I give ECHO a simple command like turn on (names) light. It says _everal devices are named (names) light, which one do you want? I repeat the exact same name and it turns it on. Why am I repeating myself!!?Also, _CHO, turn off living room light. Response... _cho doesn_ support that.I called customer service and they admittedly stated that it_ learning and evolving and there was NOTHING they could do about ECHO_ performance. The wake word and device names are more than simple but ECHO can not perform them. Customer service agrees that ECHO should understand simple commands and they double checked my naming convention . Simple simple names that should work.Update:Back down to 1 star and that_ being generous. Simple commands are not heard and being yelled across the room. I live in a small, 1,100 sq ft home with 3 echo dots. All the dots are placed in an optimum position for the room. This product isn_ even a good voice activated switch. I tell it,  Echo, turn on Stephens light. It_ reply  There are several devices named Stephens light, which one do you want? It does this over and over and over. At least 20x this morning, switching to different devices. The same reply every time. I_ calling customer service again so they can tell me I need to change the names or what I call the lights to _he Stephens light. THAT DOESN_ WORK EITHER!If you want a product that works sometimes heed this device. If you like things to work as stated, then steer clear of these $30, over glorified voice controlled Echos.Buyers Beware!Junk junk junk! At best.If you_e used another voice enabled device, you will know of ECHO_ shortcomings immediately. Namely, it can_ follow a simple command or even turn on or off a simple tv with their junky firetv stick.Laughable product.I just added a couple stars back because of customer service. I actually got a call back because of the bad review. Customer service was professional and noted the shortcomings to be forwarded to the powers to be. I was given the option to send it all back including the firetv stick or possibly allow him to troubleshoot with me. At the low price paid for the package deal, I figured it would be easier to give him a chance. He discovered a silly way to talk to echo and it appeared to work. Now I say _cho, turn on the (names) light and it appears to work. I know Amazon doesn_ like to hear this, but they have a long way to go to catch up to Apple TVs. But for the price, and if you_e never used the Siri enabled Apple TV. Well this is just another part of the reason I went 2 stars.Another cool thing I noticed is my recently watched episodes were right at the top of the home screen.For the money, I_ not sending it back. I_l just deal with it_ shortcomings.

Title: Poor documentation
Body: I now have 2 dot 3gen and for the most part  I figured out how to use them by trial and errorThe documentation that comes with the device is usless.There is nothing to tell you what app you have to download on a phone and there is no explanation of anything on the app. What are the buttons on the screen? no explanationI fumbled around to fiquire out what did what and I still not completely sureThis is a bust for me but they were presents from my kids for my birthday so that is the only reason im keepimg themI just found out my issue with playing spotify all night is a known issue and they are working on itSorry to say this but if they were not gifts I would return them

Title: I_ buying a second
Body: The first thing I noticed other than the physical was the sound. The sound is louder than the Dot v2. It also has better bass. It has too much bass. Fortunately, the app has an equalizer to adjust the sound. If it weren_ for the muddy low end, I would have given this 6 out of 5 stars. Yes, 6 out of 5 because it would have exceeded my expectations. Oh, one other thing on the sound. I listen to my Dot while falling asleep. The lowest sound level could be a bit lower.I_ glad it still has Bluetooth and a 3.5 mm audio out. I like having options. My Google Home Mini lacks both.  You can use the Bluetooth to stream to other devices. Works nicely with my TV_ sound bar.The Dot v3 is also larger than v2, but not by much. I like that it still has the tactile buttons on the top. The fabric shell is more attractive than the plastic of previous models. The power adapter is larger than the Dot 2_. I_ like to see a smaller adapter, but if you want the sound, you need the power.I have two Dots. I_e replaced the first with this new version. I already picked up a second to replace the other. The reminds me, when I replaced the first Dot, I didn_ have to enter my wireless network password. I guess it talked to the other Dot or the app and figured things out. It was a breeze to replace my previous Dot.

Title: Very helpful and easy to use
Body: We decided to buy 1 echo dot and see how we liked it and the features it offered before buying more. I ordered a second one today. First off, it is very easy to set up and use. After spending a few minutes downloading the app to my phone and setting up the wifi, we were good to go. My 5 and 6 year olds love it! Within a few ml minutes, my 6 year old had Alexa telling knock knock jokes and helping her spell words for her homework. My 5 year old started requesting songs and had a blast switching through our Amazon music playlists. I can now control setting our home alarm, unlocking the front door and changing the thermostat all while still shopping on Amazon by just asking Alexa. Setting a timer for the kids to finish tasks has been helpful too. The second dot is going upstairs, so when it's time to get the kids up for school, I can have Alexa start their wake up playlist. It makes it effortless to play music through the house, which keeps us all moving and on task.

Title: All you need in an Amazon Echo.
Body: I have to admit that I have several Echos.  I purchased the first generation Echo at half price ($99) when it first came out as a Prime exclusive.  I found it to be quite impressive for playing music and several of the other helpful tasks that my family uses it for (News, Math for the kid, homework help, timers, alarms, etc.).  Since then, the device has added so many features that we decided to add them to nearly every room.  I have a 2nd Gen in the kitchen/family room - the 1st Gen was moved to the basement.  I have a Spot next to my bed, and we purchased a dot for my son's room.  Now to the heart of the matter: the 3rd Gen Dot I purchased at the irresistible price of $24.  I wasn't sure what to do with it, so I placed it in the office.  After hearing the sound quality, I was so impressed that I considered switching the Spot out of my room.  This thing is all you need in any room of about 15' x 15'.  Great sound quality and all the features of the full size Echos.  For those who don't know, the Echos can be linked together for whole-home music; they can be used as intercoms between rooms; they can make announcements across the whole system; they can give weather and news reports; they can make phone calls; and they allow you to communicate directly with anyone else who has one anywhere in the world.  If you want to try out the technology, look no further than the 3rd Gen Dot.  Even at the $30 price point, it's a bargain with the sound improvements over the original Dot, which was a bit weak and tinny.

Title: Better
Body: I love my 2nd gen echo dot and use it every day. I decided it was time to get a new one for another part of the house. My decision was between what I already had and loved, or trying the new 3rd gen. I'd read some other reviews that talked about some pros and cons. I haven't done a lot of testing but I can say, after using it for a few days, I love it and would recommend it. Three things I'll mention:1. The sound is much better.2. It's bigger (think 50% larger).3. Alexa doesn't seem to be the same software version, or something. My 2nd gen dot responds better, I feel, than my 3rd gen, to commands. I haven't run into anything that's a deal breaker, but it has been noticeable.So would I recommend this? Yes, of course. Would I recommend it over the 2nd gen? I think so, yes. Now go get one and enjoy it!

Title: Fun, and helpful. Overall I'm loving it. Great for your aging parents
Body: I give nothing 5 stars, nothing is a perfect product, so 4 stars means I totally love it so far. My mother recently got 2 of these, she lives in the tropics and wants to remain there!  After my father passed a couple of years ago she's been there by herself.  I worry about her on many levels.  Even though she'd been around my dots, I must admit I was a bit worried about her acceptance and usage, but by day 5 Alexa was her new bff.  By the 2nd week she didn't know how she lived without Alexa and the smart plugs, and bulbs. Anyhow, I programmed her Alexa  with many reminders and routines.  I can login to her Alexa with the app from here.  Lock her doors, feed the dogs, take her scripts, tell her good night...the list goes on. (Every week I send her a new phrase for Alexa to say to her). My mother having these gives me piece of mind.

Title: Very Nice Update
Body: I picked one of these up for my girlfriend and was pleasantly surprised with it.  I is noticeably smaller than previous Dots and quite heavy for its size (just for its size, it isn't really that heavy).  I expected to have the same issues I have with previous echo products with getting it connected to the network.  I plugged it in and suddenly got a notification on my phone asking if I wanted to connect it to the network.  I said yes and it has work fine.  Very nice update.  I was a bit disappointed that it is no longer a USB power plug but a small round adapter hardwired into the wall plug.  Nothing that takes a star off my rating but something to note.Overall, I like this update from the older one that I have and the speaker sounds really good on its own.

Title: Don't buy if you don't have your own Private Wifi
Body: Not sure if I just didn't read all the details and information, or if it was just never disclosed. But I recently purchased the Echo Dot and was excited to use it. I live on campus in student housing. While attempting to set up my Dot I was informed by tech support (after an hour on the phone redoing everything I had already done alone) that my school's internet was not private enough to protect my information. I'm glad keeping my information private is a concern for Amazon, it's just unfortunate I had purchased this and was so excited to use it just to be told I can't unless I buy my own private internet. Which as a poor college student I don't want to dish out more money on something that's not quite necessary. Again, I'm glad my info and privacy is a top concern, just wishing for future customers for them to know that if they don't have a personal wifi it won't work.

Title: Wants to stay in sleep mode after using it for a bit.
Body: Not real impressed with this so far, it's a little buggy,  it will work for a bit, and then it won't answer back for a while.I've unplugged it, reset it, still the same, when it works, it's great, seems to have it's own mine of when it wants to work lol.That's why the 4 stars, and if the next one is like this one, I'll drop stars down to 1.Been disappointed in it so far, but let's see.I have another one coming in a that is in a package deal, I'll up date when I get it.I hope it works better.Update, after having Alexa for a while, it is the most piece of crap I've bought!It doesn't work half the time, and when it does it's great, but don't waste your time with this, I bought 2 of them, I sure wish I had my money back.Stick with Google.

Title: Nice
Body: I received it yesterday and I was able to connect it very fast. I have Alexa 2nd generation and I was thinking about trading it for the 3rd generation. However, I remembered the " I robot" movie and how replacing the old technology robots with the new ones lead to revolution :). I actually decided to keep both, the new one in the living room as it has a better sound and the old one in the living room. They work great with each other. I only wish that Amazon allows us to customize the name instead of using the existing names (Alexa, Echo, Amazon or computer). I like Alexa name but sometimes it gets confusing if I name both of my dots as Alexa so I kept Alexa for the old one and renamed the new one as echo.

Title: Great Black Friday deal
Body: Never used an Echo or a Dot before.  After receiving it, I bought a Echo to use in another room.  Really simple to set up.  Added several skills including control of my ADT alarm system, all of my Z-wave switches' lights, and various subscription music services I use.  Just added my ceiling fans to the skill set.  If you didn't use it for anything else, for $25 its a great clock (just ask Alexa what time it is) in the middle of the night.  Another product that I didn't need and now I don't want to be without it.  I'm sure I have just scratched the surface on the capabilities of this unit.BTW-the first unit was lost in transit and Amazon was right on it--even though by then it was backordered,  it arrived only a couple of days late----but stuff happens at this time of year.

Title: Big Update from Original Dot
Body: Big boost in Bluetooth performance and sound quality.  Buy 3rd Gen instead of the 2nd Gen.  The improvement far outweighs the small cost difference.If you're like me (bought the original Dot at $89 and was bruised when 6-weeks later the price was slashed in half) it's OK to shake off lingering resentment and buy an "all new" 3rd Gen Dot.  You immediately enjoy the new experience.The Alexa platform is getting smarter.  The mobile app interface is cluttered, but Amazon is constantly improving.  My grandparents (and everyone I know) gets hooked on Alexa in a flash.  Besides a better price point, Alexa beats both Apple and Google hands-down (IMHO) .

Title: Impressed!!
Body: I've been using the 2nd gen for a while. One for the bedroom, one for the kitchen. I liked them, sound quality really wasn't there though. I saw this and thought, ehhhh how much better can it be. Figured I'd order one while it was $29.99. Hooked it up and whoa!!!! Quite a different little machine!! It's much louder than the 2nd gen. The sound easily fills our kitchen and living room. My husband didn't know I ordered it and was surprised when he first heard it. I went ahead and ordered a second while at this price. I had to remove a star only because while playing at high volume, she can't hear my commands, I pretty much need to yell at her.

Title: Microphone could be better
Body: This is my second Echo product. I also have the echo plus which I had first. The sound quality of the music is good enough for me considering it's a small speaker. I tend to use it more than my Bose Bluetooth speaker due to ease just asking Alexa to play music.I give it 3 stars due to the microphone and voice recognition. At times,I have to yell at the dot for Alexa to hear me when I'm sitting less than 30 feet away. I sometimes repeat commands before she responds. I do not have this problem with tbe Echo Plus. Still, this is a pretty cool device. I use it for weather and traffic updates, music, controlling lamps and asking random questions.

Title: Like hands-free Googling, but so much more!
Body: Pros: I say, "Alexa, good morning," and she bids me a good morning, then goes on to tell me something interesting. Sometimes short, but sometimes in depth. If I'm cooking, or just busy, I'll say, "Alexa, add brown surgar to the shopping list. Alexa repeats my request, and adds it to my shopping list, found in my cell phone Alexa app. "Alexa, play Elvis Christmas songs,", and within a couple of seconds is playing Elvis from iTunes. I'm hoping to buy a security camera or two (I'll need to purchase cloud space - pretty inexpensive), but there are dozens of such 1080 ppi cameras available, and 3rd Gen Echo/Alexa can give you your own smart security system. One can use Alexa as a timer, give your favorite sports teams schedules, or simply a quick banana bread recipe. Just ask Alexa! Love it/her! lolCons - Both my Echo Dot and new 4K smart Fire TV are linked to my wi-fi, but I'm having some trouble linking the two together. Same issue with a couple of smart wal plugs, but I've only put about 45 minutes into the process, so I should get it together pretty soon.As long as you have wi-fi access, the 3rd Gen Echo Dot (and Alexa) are an incredible value, and I'm planning on purchasing two more, one for the kitchen, and one for my bedroom, as you can use them as a house intercom system!Mine was from Amazon Prime (Dec. 2018) for $24.00. I'm a 62 year old man, and think these devices rock!!!

Title: Horrible support and horrible voice recognition
Body: I purchased the new Dot to replace a 2nd gen that I was happy with but the sound was sub par. The new Dot v3 has great sound, however the voice recognition is terrible, either not hearing my _lexa command or misunderstanding the command I give it. Keep in mind this Dot is in the same location and setup as the 2nd gen I replaced, but failed to accurately decipher my command at least 2-3 times more often.I initiated the return process since many reviews tout the new version as being superior to the V2, but Amazon refuses to replace the product. I_e jumped through their hoops troubleshooting yet they won_ refund me until I live chat with one of their representatives. This is not a requirement for any other product purchased on Amazon and shouldn_ be for the Echo just because it is owned by them. If I can somehow get Amazon to give me my money back I_l try another one to see if it_ defective or just a poor product, otherwise it_l go in the trash and I_l switch to Google Mini.

Title: 3rd Gen Dot is Fantastic - Nice job Amazon
Body: I was originally going to purchase a CD player, but I realized I could get significantly more functionality for less money with the Dot playing over Bluetooth. I can_ think of any music I was unable to find on Amazon music or my other music services. The Dot is a high quality device that I will use every day in my office. The price is amazing even when not on sale. Once again Amazon surpassed my expectations. I now have a gen 1 Echo, Echo Spot, and Echo Dot. They are all slightly different, but all are great and used daily in my home. I highly recommend all these devices, but the Dot offers the same features with a smaller price tag.

Title: Bass, more bass and no subwoofer.
Body: I like this unit much more that the Gen 2 units, but there are a couple of reasons it doesn't get 5 stars. First and foremost, the amount of bass is overkill and there is no adjustment for it. I love bass, but this is just too much. Second is the fact that gen 2 units can do stereo and add the subwoofer. This one cannot. Still the sound is far superior to just a single gen 2 dot and I will keep it hoping there are revisions in the future.

Title: OMG!  What a useful gadget!
Body: This was my first entry into voice activated house help (previously used only Ok, Google...." for directions in the car.)  I read the reviews and had to order one. After hooking it up in the bedroom, I could see just how useful these can be.  I intended to use it to turn on the radio in the morning and to control a couple lamps in the house but after a couple days, I ordered two more. I live in a three-floor house and hate running up and down the stairs when Alexa could help.  It's like having a very, very polite and helpful maid. This would also be useful for folks who have a hard time getting around their house.

Title: Usability could be better
Body: This is primarily used for music. It does sound better than the 2nd generation but it_ still just OK as far as sound quality is concerned. I have it connected to a Sonos Play One which sounds very good. The bad thing is that you still can_ include Sonos speakers in  groups created in the Alexa app. Another thing is that sometimes  Amazon music will only play one song at a time when I request a station or playlist.

Title: Just ok.
Body: For the price, not too bad, but I get better usability on a day to day basis from other devices of it's kind. This constantly jams up on me when playing music; it will often only play a single song from  my playlists or simply not understand what I am asking. It's a bit of a dumb, smart device and I wish I had gone with something else.The speaker is pretty good though and it is feature rich once you get it dialed down. I use it primarily for music and it  rarely understands my commands, or doesn't hear me at all and when it does, it just stops randomly for no reason that I can discern.

Title: Top notch smart speaker for the money. Way better than the 2nd gen Dot.
Body: Freaking fantastic and it's a bargain at the holiday price. If you got it for the black Friday price, it's a steal. It took a bit of time getting it set up on AT&T Uverse, but once I looked it up, it was pretty easy. The sound quality over the second gen dot isn't even comparable. Way better sound over the 2nd gen Dot. Mic is also way better at recognizing your voice. After giving a demo to my dad, they'll definitely be getting one for Christmas. He was very impressed. I haven't tried any other smart speakers, but I'd have a tough time imagining the competitors in this price range could be any better.

Title: At least try this!  It's as simple as just an Internet connection _
Body: The only reason I'm sharing the next part is so it's understandable just the ease of use this product is!  I've have a small amount of brain damage due to an accident.  This is not only easy to use but WONDERFUL!  I stopped listening to music because I had trouble with setting things up but this puts off a perfect sound.  I live in an apartment so surround sound wouldn't work.  I compared this dot 3rd generation to a small Bose I used to have.  But don't get me wrong I love Bose and naturally gravitate to that product line.  I love it and might get 1 for my sister!  She never treats herself and this is not expensive _

Title: It works okay but still have some ways to go...
Body: Well Alexa is responsive but not all the time. The wisper doesn_ work and if you ask her the time when the volume is high at 2 in the morning she_l wake up the house. Even when follow up question mode is enabled it doesn_ work very well ...... everything else works fine. Installing the Echo Dot was a bit tricky but the Alexa app works better now. I forgot to mention that the light on the unit itself should have an on and off as it_ very disturbing at 3 in the morning if it_ updating and your trying to sleep.

Title: Sound is much better.
Body: I love it.  The sound is much better than 2nd generation echo dot.  Still want to add a speaker for music.  Hooking up dot was easier. I love the quality they put into this with the bigger speakers, and it's heavier, which give it more bass.  I just ordered another one rather than 2nd gen because of the sound improvemt.Bought anotherone.  So easy to install!  The one thing I noticed.  Alexa picks up my voice better with Echo Dot 2nd gen. Bought another one to paird with another echo dot for stero sound.

Title: small but mighty
Body: I have this device  that can just about everything by my bed. Alexa is great for giving information, queing up my song list from either Amazon music, Spotify or Sirius radio. I received this device as a gift for my subscription to Sirius, did not know what to expect but it sure is one of the best unexpected gifts I have ever received.

Title: Junk. Does not work with Alexa streaming in 2 rooms. I disconnected dot & Alexa is fine again.
Body: Nothing but problems trying to play two rooms streaming same music. Dot does not work. Music on main Alexa just stops playing. Always when dot was added. Never before.dot skipped in and out no matter where I put it.  I disconnected dot and my main Alexa works fine again.Dot was faulty from day one. Does not play well with Alexa.I play music 24/7. It stopped working when I added dot. I spent hours on phone with tech support. Nothing worked.

Title: Nifty little gadget!
Body: We love this thing! Easy to set up, and fun to play with. The kids can call grandma and papa on their own, which is nifty. The kids also like being able to pull up the music they want to hear.Seems like it will be useful too.I never knew I wanted one until it came free with my blink camera. The sound quality is also impressive for such a tiny little device! Can't wait to see what else it can do.I already ordered my mom one, and my older son is getting the kid version for Christmas.My only suggestion would be better options for controlling a Roku.

Title: Very Impressive and great quality
Body: I have been an Apple buyer for many years, and never would have considered purchasing anything electronic from Amazon for control of my electronics. I still only use iPhones, iPad, Mac, Apple tv, etc., but I am very impressed with the build quality, the price, the packaging and skills of Alexa. I cannot even get the Siri on my phone to answer me! I have now used products with Alexa in my thermostats and purchased plugs to control other electronic devices such as light in the home. It is very easy to install, and Alexa continues to add skills which makes the product a better value. It even lets you add your Amazon account to purchase products and listen to Amazon music just by talking to it. I am surprised Apple allowed or sat back and let Amazon pass it up significantly with Alexa as in my opinion, Siri doesn't come close, and I am an Apple loyal customer. Also, the sound quality is quite good for such a small little speaker, which is amazing considering everything this does, and the price being as low as it is during the holiday sales.

Title: Awesome little device!!
Body: I'm not a techie by ANY means.  I'm also disabled and only have use of one hand.  Setting up the Echo Dot was super simple until it came to getting the app and registering my unit.  The app would NOT allow me to log into Amazon.  I contacted Amazon and chatted with a CS rep who helped me to do it on their site.  Took a while but after it found and connected to my WiFi I was able to unplug the Dot and move it into another room and she's been chatting away with me ever since.  I have to be careful because I was on the telephone telling my aunt about A L E X A and she started talking to me.  I found I have to spell it if I want to discuss her.  (Humor here!!)  Also if I use talk to chat on my cell.  She wants to know what I want....  I'm having a ball!  I listened to music this morning.  I've gotten the weather, time and back to music.  So far I'm ecstatic.  Let's see if I need to do an update or if this review stands in a week or two!  At this point I would highly recommend her.  The sound from the speaker is fantastic for such a small thing.  I receive the Dot included when I purchased my Ring2 doorbell.  Amazon has it as a package and I got the better end of the deal!!!  Go for it if you are in doubt!

Title: Cheerio, Alexa!
Body: Works as advertised, sound is better than I expected (based on size and price) and with a little research and tinkering, I had a smart home in no time (bulbs, plugs, etc.). However, if I had the extra funds and the Black Friday sale price were a tad lower, I would've bought the Echo Plus due to it's built-in 'smart hub,' meaning I could have used various other smart devices together without having to purchase their hubs as well.Only drawback for me is the voice recognition when asking Alexa to play my Spotify playlists-- to be fair, my playlist names are unconventional and I have discovered that the simpler the name the better. Also-- don't use punctuation and words not germane to the dialect you've chosen in the language settings (Indian accent, UK, etc.). No stars off for renaming playlists, just a lesson learned.On a side note, if you set Alexa to Australian/New Zealand accent and then, in your infinte jest, ask her to 'put another shrimp on the barbie,' she will absolutely let you know how she feels about that hackneyed and clichéd stereotype. Good on ya, Alexa.

Title: The alexa app is garbage, it doesn't do what they claim!
Body: The alexa app is trash. It will not connect to other amazon alexa devices, claims it needs skills added even though the app claims they already are. It has been a constant fight, it has me ready to throw it out the door. If you enjoy going in circles for hours with the Alaxa app not responding and the echo not doing what it claims it does. Give the Echo to people you don't like it will raise their blood pressure! I don't recommend! I had a message from Amazon they called while I was at work wanting to know I left the review I did. Because it does NOT support Firetv devices at all! It will make you mad trying to enable Firetv it does not work. Alexa is ok for other things but I will not spend a lot on anything they claim is enabled since they lie about what the devices do. Customer service has been a joke lately!

Title: Big Improvement in sound quality over older Dot gen 2
Body: I didn't mind the small size and low sound quality of the older Dot gen 2 for the bedroom to set a wakeup alarm or ask what time it is in the middle of the night without needing to turn on a light or even listen to the news with the flash briefing either before bed or upon waking up. I even enjoyed the ambient sleep sounds to help me block out noisy neighbors when falling asleep.So I didn't expect much more from the 3rd generation of the Dot, and I liked the fact it had a 3.5mm audio output so I could connect it to a set of powered speakers if I needed to, however I was pleasantly surprised to hear the increased volume and especially bass in this 3rd gen Dot.I ordered a few of them on Cyber Monday to pair them as stereo pairs in the kitchen and they seem better sounding to me than the original Alexa Echo I had in the kitchen, maybe it's because of the stereo or that one is in one corner of kitchen and the other is in the other side?Regardless I am really enjoying the purchases and since moved my lower sounding Dot gen 2 to the bathroom where loud music isn't needed.I highly recommend the Dot Gen 3's for all over the house.Get them on sale in pairs and you'll find you won't even need to listen to them at half the volume setting.:)

Title: Alexa is my new best friend
Body: This device came with my ring doorbell and at first I though meh I'll probably use it here and there. But let me tell you, once you fall down the rabbit hole it's great. One of my favorite things is syncing it with my Roku remote. That way in the middle of a lazy binge watching session I can just have Alexa press continue for me. The potential for full on laziness is fantastic! I didn't know I could play games with her until the other day and then I spent a good chunk of my Sunday playing the song quiz game. I just ordered some Philips hue bulbs and can't wait to get that setup. I also connected my Spotify account with it and was surprised with the sound quality. We only got one in our bundle with Ring but we already ordered another one for the house. We are slowly but surely becoming a house that filled with robots and I couldn't be happier!

Title: Feel like I'm cheating on ..............
Body: Love this device.  Didn't really want to purchase because I consider myself "living in the Orchard" with all our  Products. The one thing I find annoying about my Siri is that sometimes I have to pick the phone up to continue and when you're cooking or doing something where your hands are tied up - its just inconvenient.  No more - Alexa works seamlessly with my iPhone and I love it!After visiting a friend who was sick and I don't even know how the conversation began, she asked this little dot to do look up something and "Voila" I was hooked.  The sound of music coming from this little thing is amazinggggggggg - I live in a condo and I always wear headphones pretty much or play music through tv.  No more - without additional speaker hook up, this little dot plays like the big boys (of course its not surround) but buy some more dots and there you go.Stop reading this and buy it all ready and to my fellow peeps in the Orchard - go ahead, they'll never know. lol

Title: Better Sound, Small Differences
Body: There are a couple things that I have noticed about this new version. First, you will not be able to use it with some accessories, like certain wall plug holders or any device that depends on the diameter to be like version 2. The diameter is larger and the periphery has the speaker grille which cannot be covered up obviously. Secondly, the audio level, compared to gen 2 is lower. If you have routines that set the audio level or if you use voice commands to set the level, you will need to adjust upward to achieve the same audio level. My routine that sets the level to 2 needed to be increased to level 4 for the same loudness. I believe this applies to the Bluetooth level as well, which the Dot remembers separately. Not a big deal, just different.

Title: Power supply hogs outlet.
Body: I like the new look. I will fit in room decor easier. The sound quality is much better than the earlier model, which is the only reason I will keep this one.The power supply (wall charger), has a larger "foot print" and tends to hog the plug outlet, especially the location of the exit point of the cord, not allowing anything else to be plugged in next to it. Also, the cord is permanently attached to the power supply, not allowing the same flexibility of using the traditional USB plug, for routing the wire. I'm assuming that is because the new model has more power needs than the previous models, and they want to be sure we use only the original power cord.So, I will keep this 3rd generation Dot, but I won't be replacing my 2nd generation dots any time soon.

Title: ALEXA ?  IS THIS FOR YOU ?
Body: A Notch up from the last Generation.  Great concept,Great product. Dose have its pro's and con's. Let's start with the Pro's : The sound quality greatly improved,although it dose have bluetooth that enables you to connect to near by bluetooth speakers, output jack port for direct plug in also.  Very handy for general information, asking date and time, setting alarms and reminders from both the unit itself or your cell phone.  Businesses time of operations,location and phone number, weather,general technical or historical information: spelling,mathematic ,measurement and weight conversions, geographical statistics as some examples. Plays music on demand from play lists ,unit to unit calling or even calls to your contacts or even your phone if lost/missplaced. Smart home integration with some devices and appliances,sometimes with aid of a specialized seperate device.Cons : My biggest issue is the inconsistentency of its listening ability.My opinion: Over all great product and concept . I just hope that software updates continue and hardware updates with newer technology continue as newer models are released.

Title: Love this echo
Body: My family is new to the world of Alexa but so far we are loving this echo!!! I love to just voice command a genre of music and have it play a station while I am in the middle of cooking, if I don't like a song while stiring a pan on the stove top, I just tell Alexa to skip to the next song . I had ordered a smart plug with it so I can control my Christmas tree lights, I just tell Alexa to turn them off and on, no more plugging and unplugging. My daughter loves that if I run to the grocery store she can call me using the Echo Dot, this feature alone is worth the cost for kids to connect with family without tying up their parents phone, for my children the call quality is much better than them fidgeting with a cell phone using speaker phone. Between festive music while cooking or kids having dance parties, we all are enjoying the convenience of Alexa with this Echo Dot. I highly recommend having one in your kitchen or any frequently used room. Next I want to get one for the bathroom, how nice it will be to voice command songs to play or check the weather while in the shower.

Title: Best amazon device ever
Body: I love this device more than most of my other amazon devices.  I am so excited it will work with apple music starting december 17th!!!!  this made my day when i found that out.  I had an echo gen 2 and this way out performs it and is way cheaper!!!!  I love this so much i ordered a second one.  I have sandstone and love how it looks feels and sounds.  Good job amazon.  Update:  I got a new amazon echo dot with clock and love it so much more! $10 more was worth it because I always forget to ask alexa the time or weather.  I put it where I always look and I must say I love it more...more than I could have ever imagine

Title: Love this!
Body: I love this small Alexa speaker.  The sound on it is very clear and crisp.  It fills an average to large size room with a good amount of sound without being turned up to full volume.  I have a previous edition and this new one has improved so much.  I also have the Echo speaker and a couple other Alexa devices, they all sync up and play together nicely with hardly no lag when adding a new room.I got this speaker mainly for use in my daughters room to go with her ipad instead of a pricey bluetooth speaker.  I am really happy I did.  It works great and does enough functions to keep busy.

Title: Best device i have purchased for 30 bucks.
Body: I'm a tech savvy person so i decided to buy a digital assistant and decided to go with Alexa! Glad i did, for 30 dollars you get tons of features and if you have Amazon prime it's even 10x better. Before i made the move on buying one i really didn't really try one, so i went in blind and it was good enough for me to buy 2 of them :) i bought them from bestbuy since if oyu buy 2 you get 10 dollars off.The audio is Loud and clear (remember this is 30 dollars) plays anything I throw at it, I have a slight accent and didn't have to train Alexa she understands everything I say even when I'm half asleep. You can ask Alexa pretty much anything and she will have an answer. People say Google assistant is smarter but to me Alexa with Amazon Prime is the perfect choice.

Title: She_ cool!
Body: She_ pretty cool. We got the dot for free when we purchased the Ring Doorbell 2. She_ in the living room. My kids like asking her things (they are 5 and 7) but sometimes I have to tell them to leave her alone. I typically just listen to the local radio station all day when I_ home by myself (I work from home). I don_ think we_e tapped all her capabilities yet but I especially love that I can connect her to my OurGroceries app and can just ask her to add to it. Best thing ever. She can answer the Ring doorbell too. If it comes for free with whatever your buying, it_ worth it. Heck she_ probably worth the money too. Enjoy!

Title: Alexa at home
Body: I finally decided to get an Echo Dot with its compact size, improved sound quality, and the reduced price during the Black Friday sales. I am still learning about its capabilities and uses but have been using it listen to iHeart radio, and to control my Wemo light switches. So far, it has worked with no problems and sits quietly on my desk most of the time. The voice recognition surprised me when it reacted to a YouTube video that said the word "Alexa." There are many skills that can be added to Alexa through the App.

Title: 2nd Gen is Better
Body: I'm disappointed with this new model. I have three of the second generation dots and they are much better except for sound quality. Sound quality is all that this one does better.The 3rd generation is somehow much slower than the 2nd one. It takes a bit for Alexa to register my voice and my subsequent request. The permanent power cord is a disappointment too. I already miss the USB cord that came with the previous ones. Finally, I've never had so many problems connecting a Bluetooth speaker. It never can work.Overall, I'm very disappointed.

Title: Setup is the devil, Alexa is an angel
Body: I'd honestly give this 5 stars, but the setup process was so infuriating I almost returned it. But after 20 unsuccessful attempts to connect my wifi to Alexa, and 5 unhelpful articles later, the wifi finally connected. I didn't do anything different, didn't change my position from the router. Nothing. It just decided to work that one time. But after all that she works really good. Very helpful with my sengled lights, and I love hearing the weather forecast while getting dressed.

Title: Kids love it!
Body: The whole family loves this device! She's very responsive and has no trouble recognizing words. My kids have used her to tell stories, jokes, and just to answer silly questions. I use her for ordering products and just keeping up with my everyday schedule. Want to know the weather? She can tell you. Want to control your Wi-Fi outlet? She can do that as well. I will buying another since I have a kid that wants to take the Echo to his friends house every time he spends the night.

Title: Very disappointed
Body: Bought this because I needed a new Bluetooth speaker for listening to Spotify, and figured I'd give Alexa a shot because it was on sale for about the same price as a regular Bluetooth speaker, but with extra features. Read that the Dot didn't have the same sound quality as the full-size Echo, but my previous Bluetooth speaker was an itty bitty, cheap, inch-high pocket-size thing, so I figured surely the sound quality would be at least as good as that one was (it had surprisingly crisp, clear sound for such a tiny thing). I was wrong. The music sounds weird and muffled on the Dot, like someone tossed a heavy blanket over the speaker; not even close to decent quality, and trying to adjust the bass/treble didn't improve things. Furthermore, it won't link to my Spotify account, as it apparently requires you to have Spotify *Premium*, which I have no interest in paying for, and this bit of fine print was not mentioned anywhere in the item description when I bought it. So basically, it is completely useless for the entire purpose I bought it for. I initially figured that if I didn't like the Dot, I'd return it and save for the full-size Echo, but as that one presumably won't let me listen to my free Spotify account either, I think I am just going to return it and go with a regular old, non-smart Bluetooth speaker instead -- one that will let me listen to what I want, with decent sound quality and no stipulations. Very disappointing... I was really looking forward to using this. The only reason this doesn't get one star is because I'm sure it does everything else it's supposed to do just fine; I didn't bother to test those features out though, once I realized it wasn't going to perform the primary task that I wanted it to.

Title: Amazing!!!! Quite impressive. It is worth the money!!!
Body: Right out of the box I hooked it up with no problem. I do like the power cable for not being a USB connection. I have a 2nd generation dot that would become unplugged especially useing a power supply.I have been using as before mention for nearly a year. I have noticed how flat the sound is. It would cause you to realize or wonder if the sound is down mixed to one channel. It is more for reading than anything else. Its day is over.From the instance you plug it in Alexa's voice sounds fuller than being spoken though a muffled small speaker. Soon after hooking it up I by chance played instrumental music to balance the sound. The sound is like listening in a restraunt to add an ambiance setting. I also listen to a  kindle booK, her voice was clear than 2nd gen. Otherwise it sounds as a real person is speaking. It's not as someone is speaking from a distance. As stated, I ballaced the sound : base, mid, treb to get it sounding smoothly. I am impressed for a good reason.  It is something that can be used at a party but also doesn't need to be turned up if used in the kitchen. Keep in mind, the environment does effect the sound so adjust to it. The volume can be turned up loud but who wants to. The voice does "hangs on" the louder it gets. The volume does get to the point of being annoying.

Title: Big Improvement
Body: I've owned a 2nd-generation Echo Dot for a couple of years. Although I was pretty happy with it, I felt this one might offer an improvement in audio quality. So I moved the old one to another room, and purchased one of these to replace it. I have to say this 3rd-gen Dot provides a significant improvement in sound quality.  It's a little bigger, and a little heavier, but now there's some ACTUAL bass. It's not really good bass, and it's not really loud bass, or even clear bass -- but dammit, there's bass now where there had been none.  Enough that you can actually follow a musical bass line now. And it can play louder, too. You can also adjust the tone using audio equalizer settings in your phone's Alexa app, which I've done.  Overall, I think this device about splits the sound quality difference between the Gen 2 and the larger Echo (non-Dot). Don't hesitate to buy one of these for streaming music or radio, as long as you don't need too much volume and are not using this as your primary musical listening device.

Title: Great sound
Body: I love the new design.. setup is very easy it connects itself .. works great and it is really smooth on my nightstand perfect match next to my echo show 2 .. when i play music it fills up the room .. and sometimes when the show 2's screen is off i don't even know where the music coming from .. from the dot ? Or from the echo show 2 ?  ..The new echo dot is well made great design ,and looks good in my bedroom .. you won't have trouble to place it .. it looks good in the kitchen in the bathroom ,bedroom ,or livingroom ..

Title: Stick with an Echo
Body: REALLY disappointed in so many ways with this. 1st off, I've setup 2 Echos in my home & it was easy & done automatically for the most part. Tried to set this Dot up using the Alexa app on a brand new Android phone & it forced me to setup in MANUAL mode & on top of that wouldn't complete the process. Tried multiple times doing different things following their steps & it wouldn't work. Finally had to use my laptop & it's Alexa app to set the wifi connection up manually. Should be working correctly out of the box...not create a headache.2nd, the audio is no where near as loud as either Echo device at max volume. Very disappointed on so many fronts. I'm giving the Dot as a gift & hope it doesn't come back to haunt me.

Title: Update from the 2nd Generation
Body: The 3rd generation Dot has some improvements.1) The sound quality is better than my 2nd generation Dot.  I still won't listen to music on it (without an external speaker) but the sound is improved in both frequency response and volume.2) The appearance is more pleasing to me than the stark black puck that is the 2nd generation Dot.The disappointment is that the new Dot requires the provided power supply...I can't just plug in into a USB port for power.  So, yet another "dongle" is added to the mass of wires/plugs/dongles that seem to go with electronics today.I recommend getting the new Dot rather than the old for the advantages above.  And living with the dongle.

Title: New and Improved, but less universal...
Body: So the new Echo Dot has improved sound quality over the 2nd generation dot. The bass is a bit richer, and overall sound is better. The unit is slightly larger, and has a new design. That being said, I'm not at all a fan of the fabric outside; the only thing that accomplishes is making it look more like the Google Home.  Now, the real and true killer of this device, and the reason it's only getting 2 stars, is the lack of USB power. I understand the slightly larger speaker may require power above 5v, though I'm not sure that's the reason.. However, I now need some proprietary cable to power the unit.. I may be returning it, and getting another 2nd generation dot instead.

Title: Highly Recommended
Body: This little guy is my first Echo device, and I love it.ProsThe sound from the speakers is amazing. My music can fill my room easily. On 10% volume, I can hear my music quite well and little to no sound can be heard from outside my door.It is placed about a foot from my bed. This device can hear me quite well, even when I whisper to it at night or in the early morning.It's very portable, however, I don't recommend bringing it everywhere I go, simply because it is not meant to be taken everywhere. If you do want to take it places, for some reason, go ahead?Brought it to my work before. Even with the loud environment, it still heard me and my coworkers well (most of the time.)Has plenty of fun stuff (like Easter eggs and games) and useful tools (like checking weather and alarms).The commands are always quick, unless it has trouble hearing you (which only happened in loud environments.)ConsRequires the "Alexa App" to work. The connection is quite easy, but it's the app itself is the problem. It can be ridiculously slow at times, or even buggy. However, the app is needed to add routines and lists via phone.

Title: Nice sound. Not the smartest
Body: Own a few Google Home Speakers and I feel that Echo 3rd generation speakers sound better than home mini. The home mini was better than the 2nd generation echo though. Ok now the bad part. Echo is not as smart as Home mini when it comes to responding to basic questions like singing some nursery rhymes for my baby. One thing that I don_ like is it doesn_  have a physical stop button like the google mini has; you can just tap on it and it will stop. This one doesn_ have that so if I have to stop it without shouting alexa stop I am out of luck.

Title: Echo Dot 3
Body: I had to get help to connect to wifi as I'm not familiar with how to do things like that but once I had Alexa up and going I've loved it.  My purpose was to see if there were sounds like rain or storms that would help me to sleep but after I was connected to the music, I fell in love with it.  I'm a traditional country fan and was happy with what I was able to listen to.  My young Granddaughter loves more modern songs so we will play games, first she chooses a song, then I do.  I know there's still more to learn with my Echo Dot 3 and I can't wait.

Title: Good sound, easy understanding.
Body: I just recieved this today. Imholding out on the fifth star because I havent gotten to try everything out or use it much. But so far I can comment on the sound and the reaction time of alexa. First of all,this thing is loud at full volume. Which is great. I have no problem understanding the music that is playing or what alexa is saying. And as for alexa, the skills offered are awesome. Ive only tried a couple out but the two that I have tried worked great. My daughter played a guess the animal game and tried to trick alexa by choosing a human and alexa got it. It seems to understand what we say just fine as well. Before I can even finish saying alexa stop it stops. So predictive reaction is phoenominal for that.

Title: A Question of Balance
Body: The most important feature of devices like this is sound quality and here_ where the dot 3 disappoints. The dot 2 had too much treble and while excellent for verbal it was inadequate for music. The dot 3 is the exact opposite - too much bass for verbal but a richer and deeper sound for music. What is needed is an equalizer to achieve the right balance.Update: To its credit, Amazon tech support called me informing me of an equalizer setting in the app. This improved the sound quality!

Title: Small footprint - big sound
Body: I love the echo dots, I have several of them along with a Video Show. Alexa is everywhere in my home. The dots size is great, does not have a large footprint and is very unobtrusive. The only con I found with the latest one, it has a fabric cover.  I had planned on having this one in the kitchen, but traded it out with the one on the night stand. Thinking the fabric will pick up and hold the kitchen odors and or grease, making it difficult to keep clean.

Title: Easy connection to streaming
Body: I debated purchasing because I couldn't decide between echo or dot. I read many reviews and finally decided on the dot. I live in a small condo so the dot is perfect for my bedroom. I'm so happy with the performance of this little hockey puck! It's small but for my purposes perfect. Sound quality is fantastic, I use iheartradio to stream music and I've not had the volume above 5, produces rich, clear tones. I love having music at my command! Have to try this amazing new device with the home plug next. I've been so happy I didn't want to stop long enough to hook the adapter up, lol! Also hooked it up to myaudio pet Bluetooth speakers. Easy peasy, no problems and it sounded even better.

Title: Best Echo dot ever!
Body: This is a very good smart speaker. It has way better sound than the previous version!

Title: Not nearly as good as previous generation. No need to updgrade!
Body: I bought two of these and am super disappointed with them. I have them in the same room with two of the 2nd Generation Echo dots and I am CONSISTENTLY about 1-2 feet away from the new (3rd Gen) version and about 6-8 feet away from the 2nd Gen one and the 2nd Gen is the one to answer my questions. SUPER annoying.After a few weeks of me second guessing ("did that really just happen?" I finally called into the support line and got outsourced to who knows where and the rep was extremely uninterested in helping me figure out what is going on, and sounded annoyed that I was even calling in about the issue. NOT a good experience. Adding insult to injury.  I'll call back tomorrow and see if I can get an English speaking rep and if I can't get some resolution- these are going to get sent back. Bummer. I SO wanted to love these newer versions. They just can't hear you as well as the old ones apparently.

Title: Have issues?  Just send it back!
Body: I tried to to do the right thing.  Our entire home is connected to the Amazon ecosystem and dependent on the Dot as our main hub.  The 3rd gen was failing to respond so I called tech support and after an hour on the phone nothing had changed.  They wanted to start a repair ticket and it will take up to three days for a response.  So now my automated home is on it's knees since I'm unable to use Alexa to control functions.  Now, if tech support determines it's to be replaced, I'll have to wait even longer for a replacement for a device still under warranty!  Next time I will just start a return and have a new one in two days.  Not impressed Amazon, you need to rethink how you handle your adapters of your tech when they have invested time and money into your system.

Title: Life changing. I'm thrilled
Body: I love my Echo Dot 3rd Gen. I didn't know what I was missing until I helped my neighbor set hers up. We ran into a problem interfacing with Pandora until we discovered they moved that from Music to Skills and Games. Once we set Pandora up I was jumping up and down at the possibilities.Alexa now keeps my grocery list for me. I feel like I just gained hours a day and never forget to add something. No more getting up in the middle of the night to make a note, no more stopping what I'm doing to add to the list,...Yikes, this is heaven.I'm totally content with the speaker quality. It's much better than my phone or laptop. I'm going to add more Echo dots after reading other reviews.I bought 2 smart plugs so I can turn an uplight and space heater on independently. So far no problems.  I've only scratched the surface of possibilities.  There is no going back.Oh yeah.  I'm using Amazon Smart Plugs.
