I tried a smart plug from another manufacturer and experienced some problems.

Title: Sounds great
Body: I am really impressed with the 3rd-generation Echo Dot. It sounds MUCH better than the previous models; in fact, it sounds almost as good as a full-size generation 2 Echo, just with less bass. For audio where the bass isn't as important (e.g. classical orchestra, audiobooks, or voice calls), I don't even notice the difference in bass unless I'm thinking about it.Put another way, the 3rd-gen Dot sounds good enough that your average user probably won't feel the need to connect it to an external speaker.The third generation is also much better looking than the second generation, due to the fabric cover. It looks classy just about anywhere you put it.My only major complaint is that the Echo Dot's microphones aren't as good as the full-size Echo. The 2nd-gen Echo has 7 microphone holes and can understand me no matter where I am, how much background noise there is, or how loudly I'm talking. The 3rd-gen Echo Dot, on the other hand, only has more microphone holes, and seems to have trouble hearing me if I'm too far away, not facing it directly, or there is too much background noise (including noise coming from its own speakers).I do think the standard retail price of $50 is a bit of a ripoff, but the sale price of $30 is a good value.

Title: Wow.  Just wow.
Body: I am VERY impressed with this device.  I've got 4 of the 2nd generation Echo Dots, and this new 3rd generation positively blows them away.  This Dot actually puts out some noticeable bass - the 2nd gen had absolutely none.  Instead of sounding like an intercom speaker, this one can be used to enjoy music as well as all the other features.Now, it's not going to replace your larger Echo devices in the sound department, but for putting next to a computer or listening to from the nightstand, this Dot is ideal.  I used to love the versatility of the 2nd gen, and still do, but this one has all of that and enough sound to impress.I purchased the sandstone flavor, and find it to be rather sharp looking, but neutral enough to blend into it's surroundings and not stick out.Bottom line:  This is quite an amazing device and a huge value.  There is absolutely no way to go wrong with one of these.  You get all the features of the full-size Echo in the size of a hearty hockey puck.  Again, I'm amazed with the sound that comes out of this little thing.

Title: Disappointing
Body: I bought it hoping for it to have more functionality than my Google Home Mini.  Instead of just saying "I don't know how to help you with that" like the Google Home Mini,  the Amazon Echo Dot will read long sections of wikipedia pages unrelated to the question asked.  After getting an Amazon delivery, the Echo Dot lit up yellow.  I asked the Echo Dot many questions about how to remove the yellow light.  It was only able to tell me to disable the notification in the app on my phone.  After disabling the notification in the phone app, the yellow light remained.  After searching online and finding nothing, I repeating asked the Echo Dot to remove the yellow light with different wording until "Remove all notifications" worked.  It is unbelievable how precise my words had to be to do this.  Why was it not able to help me do this quicker?  The Echo Dot's text to speech is also no where near as human sounding as with the Google Home Mini.  I would say the Google Home Mini is mildly useful and the Echo Dot is even less useful.

Title: So Glad I Finally Brought Alexa Into The Home
Body: This is my first echo product. We have had 4 Fire TVs/ sticks and love every one of them. I've been on the fence about the Dot and I'm glad I jumped on this one. I got a great deal with the Hue Lights bundle. Set up took less than a minute. I've read many reviews and noticed that many had qualms with sound quality. I have none. For a small device, it puts out a lot of sound. Bass is lacking, but that doesn't matter to me. It's an Echo Dot, not a Bose or JBL system. I can hear it from my living room to my kitchen. Picks up commands well from my husband, 3 year old and myself. Alexa is fun. She does an okay job with the Hue lights with simple commands. I mostly use the hue app unless I ask her to dim, turn on or off, or brighten. Haven't manage to get more than that. Well worth the sale price or the full retail price.

Title: Great for lazy people.
Body: Getting this echo dot set up was sort of my first step toward creating a _mart home environment. I do not yet have the special outlets, light bulbs, and other devices for Alexa to control. So far, i like being able to ask Alex to play SOME (free) music, on command. Alexa can also answer SOME questions. I can tell that it would be handy to be able to control other devices, using this Alexa assistant.

Title: Much better sound and look than previous gen.
Body: I'm very happy with upgrading to the 3rd gen Dot.  I could tell when I opened the package the speaker had been improved by just the weight of the Dot.Improvements --Sound - Definitely the sound quality has been improved.  I really enjoy using my Dot to play music.  The improved speaker has won me over.-Appearance - I personally feel the new look is much more attractive.  The softer curve and the fabric shell make it fit better with a variety of different décor.  The other benefit of the curve is that the notification light can easily be seen now.  Previous gens had the light on the top and you couldn't see it if it was placed high.Overall I give this 5 stars and a big improvement over the previous gen Dots.

Title: It_ like having an invisible personal assistant in the room with you!!
Body: I got the echo dot 3 with a smart plug and plugged my Xmas tree into the plug and I use Alexa to program when my Xmas tree lights turn on and off and I can also just ask Alexa to turn on or off my smart plug. That alone is worth it! Using My echo dot 3 for so many other things. It_ like having an invisible personal assistant in the room with you. Don_ have to teach for pen and paper or my phone and open my notes app anymore!! I just ask Alexa to add to my shopping list or remove an item and it_ done! My husband can even play rock paper scissor with Alexa! And we both love the sleep sounds every night our favorite is city rain! My husband was joking around and asked Alexa _hat do I do about my stomach ache today alexa rattled off a list of things! We looked at each other like wow pretty cool! I_ going to order another smart plug maybe 2 and also get my husband his own echo dot 3 to put in his home office so he_l leave my personal assistant (Alexa) alone. Lol then we_l have one on each end of our house :) definitely definitely would recommend!

Title: Caution
Body: I recently purchased a Roku TV (which I luv BTW) and felt it was a perfect addition. Being on a budget after buying the TV and based on reviews these were perfect. Arrived quickly (thanks Amazon) and hit a little snag. Enter my word of caution. I went to the website and as so many companies provide, I used the chat help. Long story short.... he did not help me at all... what he did was try to confuse me and get me to buy his services for $200. Don_ fall for this ploy. And then he got nasty and hung up on me. So I went on yo fix the issue myself in 5 minutes. Be warned...And I really really enjoy the speakers. Good sound and being so used to Siri I am having a blast with Alexa. And you certainly can_ beat the price

Title: Hopefully not the new normal for the Echo Dots.
Body: This is our second Echo Dot, the first was a 2nd gen.While the sound and music is far better on the 3rd gen, we are not as pleased with it, as we were with the first one.With our first Echo, it was very easy for Alexa to hear command prompts, even from the next room and at regular speaking volume.  After having this new Dot for a couple of weeks, we have found that if we are in the next room, or if there is any ambient noise, Alexa can't hear us at normal levels.  Even yelling sometimes is not picked up and we have to move to the same room to get a response.We're purchasing a third Echo for our bedroom, we're hoping that this Dot is just defective and not the new norm for them.We were very disappointed after enjoying our first one so much.

Title: Great sound and features out of this little puck - great upgrade to the original Dot
Body: So I have the original Echo as well as an Echo dot. Love them both and get a lot of use out of them. The Dot is in my bathroom and I get the news in the morning as well as listen to music while I shower.This new Dot blows the old dot out of the water. The sound quality is night and day - this is much louder and has way more bass. And you can hook it up to other Bluetooth speakers as well, pretty neat.In any case, if you are looking to buy you can pick these up on sale for relatively cheap. Great little thing to have and the sound quality of this small one is really good now.

Title: Much Improved
Body: Very happy with the 3rd gen Dot.  I had previously gotten the 1st gen when it came out and did not like the sound from it at all.  Its improved a lot with the new version, no more 'tinny' sound.  I really like the new design as well, its not just a plastic disc.  The edges are rounded a bit and the side has a cloth like covering which makes it a lot more attractive and gives it a bit of 'grip'.  Got my echo in the kitchen so wanted this for the bedroom,  music is definitely better than previous versions and the microphones were very responsive  even with ambient noises playing.

Title: App is terrible
Body: We cannot get our Echo to connect to the Internet so the device is useless.  When we were unable to get it to work, we had our son-in-law investigate the situation (he is EVER computer savvy and he said that the problem is with the APP - after one hours attempting to connect, no luck).  If Alexa doesn't connect soon, we will be returning her....she serves zero purpose in her present state.

Title: Alexa is My New Friend and Confidant
Body: My insurance company Travelers decided it would be a good thing for their policy holders to have the device so they made a deal with Amazon to provide them. I live in a smart home and have been having more fun communicating with our friendly Echo Dot. Alexa is the call sign that begins a conversation with the high tech device. While I don't know many features at this point it is my understanding that there are over 50,000 commands. Thanks to Travelers for the introduction. Special note:  If you ask for something that might cost an additional fee Alexa asks if you want to learn more about the requested feature.

Title: This Item Is The Best
Body: I love this device!!! We got this device not knowing all of the things it could do. At the time my husband and I just wanted it for the storytime, games, and music features. I love the sound that comes out of the speaker when we play music. I can set a reoccurring bedtime timer and my boys know when they here it that means it is bedtime. Our 3 year old son hates to get up in the morning. Now he can't wait because he knows he gets to ask the echo to play baby shark. This makes starting the day easier for us. We have found that we are laughing and spending more time as a family with this device. It is fun not listening to commercials. Now a days the commercials are so long on the radio that by the time they are done, so is my 3 year old. We are able to shuffle songs that my 3 year old, 10 year old, and we like to hear. Dancing in the house and doing chores with my boys, we can play games and get work done. It has helped my 10 year old with his spelling. We do not use this device all the time, but Alexa is great at activities that don't stop you from spending time with your family. We will be using the Santa tracking Skill this year and we are so excited to see how it will go over with our 3 year old. There is also a skill that you can call Santa and "leave a message" to add to your Christmas list. I don't think we are ready for that one this year, but maybe next year. We have only had the device out for about a week, but we are enjoying it so far.

Title: I want to love it but I_ just frustrated!!
Body: I_ becoming so frustrated with this thing!!!  I bought the Black Friday bundle with this and the new 4K fire stick.  It seems to be flipping impossible to connect the two together so I can control the fire stuck with voice commands through the echo dot- which is the main reason I purchased the dot along with the fire stuck.  I wanted to love the dot as much as I love the fire stick but I_e been tempted the chuck the thing out the window!!  Hopefully that won_ be necessary... but ii

Title: Much improved over previous versions
Body: The overall sound and performance of the new generation echo dots appears to be better and excel over previous versions.  Sometimes it's just an image in your mind but in this case, the changes are apparent and real.  Are they vast and profound enough to warrant replacing all your previous generation echo dots with new ones?  NO!  But the changes are sufficient to warrant paying a little more for the newer generation if you have a choice when you make a purchase.

Title: fun to mess with
Body: couple hours in and we have it hooked up to our JBL flip 4 and just playing music.  It does a good job recognizing your voice over loud music.  I was impressed.  waiting on some smart plugs to be able to yell my lights off at night and on in the morning.  or set routines.  lots to learn.  asking for stories playing jeopardy just fun to mess with. especially for the price.  who cares if Bezos is listening in south park style?

Title: Sound quality is ok, but there are major improvements
Body: Overall I am satisfied with my purchase of the echo dot generation 3. I have the second version of the echo dot and have posted a picture of the 3rd as well as second gens. The 3rd generation picks up your voice a lot better as well as has better sound quality. The sound quality while better is still lacking in bass and treble. It_ not terrible for the price but there are definitely better options if you don_ need Alexa. You can also use the auxiliary cord to plug into another speaker and make that speaker Alexa enabled. This is the major benefit of the dot for me. It makes my older, better sounding, and nicer speakers Alexa enabled! I hope this helped if it did please hit the thumbs up and if you have any questions feel free to ask and I will do my best to answer in a timely manner :).

Title: Alexa....
Body: Ok, First off, I purchased three of these dot's, two for me, and one for my mom. The two dot's I purchased for me, I had to install manually, they wouldn't automatically connect to the wireless network for some reason, but were fine after I manually connected them. My mom's, well, her dot picked up the network but it took me a few times to connect it to the network. After they were connected, it took me a bit of searching to figure out how to connect the smart devices to the dots, but with a little research I was able to hook them up to Kasa with no problem and they work just great. I love Alexa, she is very helpful, I do wish however she was more.. well, like the AI in Eagle eye! Wouldn't that be cool?! But we work with the tools we were given. It would be awesome if you could change her name, and voice, and maybe make her start conversations or offer suggestions. I would recommend this device to anyone and everyone. The only problem I have is not knowing what Alexa sends to Amazon, that is the one thing that is constantly on my mind, and when you ask her, she says "I don't know the answer to that" So there is that one negative against the product. The data mining, and not knowing what data is being shared.

Title: Switching to google home mini
Body: I got 2 dots for the kids rooms, and have Alexa built into my Bose soundbar. the intent was that we all would  be able to listen to different music at the same time if we wanted. Found out that we cannot do that unless we get the most expensive music unlimited package. So i would need to pay for prime and also pay 130ish per year for unlimited music. This product is not intended for families, if your single than your fine.very disappointed with the money making scheme amazon has deployed.

Title: Limited But Useful
Body: I have had Alexa on my firestick and Kindle Fire, I decided to get the Echo Dot because it was on sale and I wanted something that would be interactive and useful without having to use the TV or Tablet all the time. Echo I noticed has limitations. Firstly, the smart speaker on the Echo Dot doesn't play music, you must buy speakers separately.  Secondly, the Echo Dot tends to want to use your phone rather than its own smart speaker for questions as it kept asking me if I wanted to use the device or app, I clicked on the device a few times in the app, then I decided to try the app, it never has asked me to choose since and I haven't been able to find a setting to switch it back. However, for routines, and books, the Echo Dot uses its own speaker unless you have other speakers connected to it or switch the setting to your phone which is easy to locate. I hope in the future that there is more stuff one could add to the routines, the radio selection is highly limited, newsflash is also highly limited, sports news is the same way. But even with such limitations, I find this product useful, and I can see expanding its capabilities in the future which makes the purchase worth it!

Title: Wasn't expecting it
Body: I'm impressed.  Alexa recognizes multiple voices even with background noise.  If found this to be the perfect answer for turning devices on/off.  Way better then opening wink on my phone.  Its also faster.  The wink app can take noticeable time before turning a device on.  Alexa is almost instantaneous for the same device.4 stars because my special needs son can't say "Alexa" correctly enough.  I have no problem understanding that he's saying the word correctly.  There is no way to train for just that command word.  I also don't see a way to set schedules for devices through the Alexa android application.

Title: Makes me feel like a kid on Christmas morning!
Body: The 3rd gen dot is the best value product I have ever purchased.  Period.  I am 64 and the custodial/biological father of two teenage girls.  They got a kick out of seeing how excited I was with this product.  They felt I was entering the techno age!Amazon prime, coupled with the echo dot, is phenomenal.  Amazon unlimited music, Alexa....the list goes on and on.The dot is easy to set up.  Sound volume is greater than I expected.  Microphone sensitivity excellent.And, the speaker output supports headphones....in Stereo!  Buy it NOW!

Title: My first echo
Body: I bought an echo about a week ago for the first time from bestbuy and I have been loving it. I bought another one from amazon because they had a deal at the time where for $35 I got the echo 3rd gen and a LIFX bulb. I'm still new to the smart home thing but so far I've got some plugs for lamps and the christmas tree and this one smart bulb. The kids also love Alexa, I will saying hearing "Alexa, play baby shark" 100 times a day does get old but I enjoy having it. I can also control my DirecTv with it so that's great.

Title: I'm not sold on Alexa - but it was free... so???
Body: I got this with my Ring Doorbell.  I wasn't excited to get it -but it came as a package set.  I have been using it to listen to music on my wifi, and it's kind of nice.  I don't have to get up to tell it to stop or go.  And, I'm able to listen to some of my favorite Christmas tunes by my favorite artists.  I'm not a fan of Alexa listening for you...

Title: I Love Alexa!
Body: I bought this for my birthday. I love Alexa! She is helpful, remembers things and is lots of fun! When we have friends over we play some of the game skills and always end up laughing and having a blast!My echo did randomly disconnect from the internet (I have two, this generation and the second generation) when the other one was fine.. I had to reset and restart it up to get it to work.That's been my only thing so far, otherwise I love it!

Title: Don_ buy it. Major disappointment.
Body: I_ VERY disappointed. It doesn_ work. Constantly freezes  and makes a _kipping noise. Randomly stops playing music. It will randomly light up and do the processing light circle when no one has said anything. I have to unplug it to get it to recognize commands about once every hours. I will be returning it for a refund. Looking into the google one instead. I bought it for connectivity more then the speaker and it is awful. Don_ buy it.

Title: I wanted to order pizza.  Alexa read me the news instead.
Body: 1/9/2018  Edit:  This device is a solid 4 star device, maybe even 5-stars.  Amazon is vague with describing what the echo can do because it can do a bunch of stuff.  I wrote the harsh review below in anger when it couldn't do the one thing I wanted it to do properly, but then after complaining, Amazon reached out to me to offer help in properly setting up my Echo dot and issuing commands.  I still feel that the device is not *quite* as intuitive as they make it out to be.  You can also change the activation word from "Alexa" to "Computer", which makes me feel like I'm in Star Trek. In the end, it's a nice addition to a kitchen, as it can function as an extra cooking timer than can also perform any conversion (1/4 cup = 4 tablespoons), play your second-favorite song when your #1 favorite isn't included with your Amazon Music subscription (computer, play the theme song to 'Quantum Leap'), while also telling you what the wind speed is, and casually look up when Friedrich Nietzsche died for you (August 25, 1900) so you don't have to wonder about it while cooking biscuits.  I think the Echo dot can also give you recipe & meal ideas to cook, but I already have a recipe for biscuits and for other meals I simply asked it to schedule a delivery of Soylent instead.Below is my original review for context.  As I have said, the Echo Dot is a 4/5 star device, would buy again, but it will still make you angry sometimes.I BOUGHT THIS SOLELY TO ORDER PIZZA AND IT DOESN_ WORK PROPERLY.1. Took 45 to set up.  That_ 40 minutes too long.2. Wanted to use Pizza Hut Skill.  When I asked Alexa to _rder a pizza from Pizza Hut.  She replied, _id you mean _mazon Restaurants? I said, _o!  Pizza Hut!!  Alexa: _rder from Domino_ Me: _izza Hut!  Alexa: _ see your current address is (address of family member who lives 2,000 miles away).  At no point did Alexa even mention that she was ordering from Pizza Hut or Domino_ or w/e.  Not to mention, this was another setback because I had to update my address properly, which you can only do from the stupid 2nd-rate Alexa app (3/5 rating for lackluster U/I input).  There were other complications along the way but I was so mad I forgot.3.  After properly setting up my address, the Pizza Hut skill, blah blah blah.  I instruct Alexa to _rder my favorite pizza.  Which is what they advertise you can do.  I went to the trouble of setting up the perfect order online on my Pizza Hut account to make this work.  I find out that you can_ use coupons with Alexa.  So finally, Alexa reads me my order summary - which is $7 more than it should be cause I can_ use a coupon -  Alexa says, _rror:  you will have to input your order online.  _HAT THE *fudge*?!? ARE YOU *fooling* SHIPPING ME?!?Alexa: _ would prefer not to answer that question.I added a star because you can ask Alexa to read you the headlines from The Economist.

Title: It_ a Little Better Than Ok.
Body: My biggest issue with this device is privacy concerns. I guess I_ still skeptical. The other issue is the fact that it had to make an announcement in the middle of the night that it was updating. Seriously????!!  It wakes me up to announce an update!! I called Amazon regarding this and they said I would just have to turn the mic off.. how about just program it to not announce?  The directings seem conflicting. The instructions for different color lights are different depending on where you_e reading about it. For instance.. my messages came over a pulsing white light, not a yellow light.You cannot edit or delete info in the Alexa app.This device isn_ something I can_ live without but it has a couple benefits for me - the music and the free calling.

Title: Great device!
Body: I love the speaker! I have both google and amazon. The differences I notice is that Alexa will ask more specific questions and when you ask or Moreno medical questions it provides very reliable information and sources. Google does not go into as much detail but does seem to be a bit more user friendly. For instance I_l tell Alexa/google to turn off the lights. Alexa will tell me there is more then one light and wants confirmation to which exact bulb I want to turn off. Google will just turn the lights off.  I figured out later that I need to name all my bulbs the same name if I want Alexa to turn them all off. There are other instances where google seems to understand more of what I want and in my opinion seems to be a bit more user friendly however Alexa does have strengths over google such as giving better and more detailed information. The speaker in the google mini seems to sound a bit better but not by too much. Alexa can send messages and can call people through my iPhone. I also like that I have a better selection of music through prime. It_ like a one stop shop. Overall each has its strengths and weaknesses. I have not messed around too much with each device side by side but once I do, I will add some more information. I am just glad that each gets updated and the more they are used the better technology will hopefully progress!

Title: Echo has a hard time with instructions.
Body: My Echo unit was purchased so that I could work in my garage and listen to talk radio. Echo can not find the stations that I want. I do get Holiday or specific music stations, but that is not what I need. There are really only two uses for my echo. First it is very good at telling me the outside temperature / weather and second it is very good at arguing with me. The only real advantage that I have is that working in the garage, if I get hurt I think Alexa can call 911. Yesterday Alexa decided that I would like to hear Rap. Never have I encouraged this. I stopped Alexa and attempted to correct it. The Echo responded with I'm sorry and went back to the Rap. There are times I feel like I am arguing with my children. Twice Echo has been grounded. I have also on occasion informed Alexa that she sucks. This has prompted the response please contact customer services. This relationship is quickly approaching another wife.

Title: Does not connect to Samsung galaxy 8plus or any Samsung device
Body: I dislike the fact that the dot does not connect  using a hotspot from Samsung Galaxy phones and Amazon knows this. I've been on the phone with them for 2 weeks trying to get this going. Still no results. Can't use echo dot with Samsung hotspot. No one at echo can understand why this is happening. Then there's instructions online telling you how to connect it but that's not true. Those instructions dont work. Why is Amazon selling this product knowing it doesn't connect to the Samsung hotspot nor does the regular echo.

Title: Bought two, both defective
Body: I wanted to give these new 3rd gen echo dots a try, hearing so much positive about the upgraded sound quality. However, I bought two on Black Friday, waited 2 weeks for delivery, and both are defective.  One speaker rattles and is distorted even at really low volume, and the other sounds ok until you go over level 4 for volume and then that one rattles and is distorted.  I own three Echo Dot generation 2 and never had a problem, but those are connected direct to separate speakers in each room (which is the best way to go in my opinion).

Title: Super Easy to Start, Skills Linking More Challenging
Body: I'm still figuring out the skills set-up with the Alexa app, but she worked right away once I plugged her in and downloaded the app. We are getting to know each other. I am trying to get her to control Bose speaker, Samsung TV, and IRobot Roomba. I was very impressed by the very high quality of both the Echo Dot itself, the packaging and information sheet.

Title: Excellent voice recognition
Body: Best $30 I've spent on a gadget in years! Liked it so much I bought a second one for my bedroom and a third for my parents as a Christmas gift.I've recently started to slowly add smart devices to my home. So far I have 4 smart plugs controlling my lamps, a Dyson hot/cool air purifier and a Mysa thermostat for my bedroom. Next I'm thinking about adding a security camera or two. These devices can all be controlled by the app(s) remotely or by voice when you're at home. It may sound silly but I especially like the fact that you can change the wake-up name from "Alexa" to "Computer" in the app settings - makes me feel like I'm on the Enterprise!

Title: Product failures are proof life but lousy support is not.
Body: Started getting static after a few songs which got worse the next day, could not understand Alexa at this point. Support said they had a problem with the Echo 3rd gen and would be fixed soon. The next day it was still unusable. This time support said they had not knowledge of a system trouble and to send it back. We got the link for return postage but no reason why the first support woman lied. They said they were not allowed to do an exchange so we sent it back. We then realized to reorder would cost us about 6$ more than the Black Friday price. Chatted with support for about 20 minutes to get them to finally send one at the price we paid for the bad one. Over a week later and nothing in the mail and no link to use to complain since the return is complete. Bad, frustrating, service after a failed product and this is my 3rd try to complain since the last two _rashed just before I tried to send it.

Title: It must have ear plugs in because she doesn't understand me!
Body: Very frustrated with this new model. I say the same things I said with the 2nd gen but get no results. Plus I'm repeatedly told it "doesn't do that" but when I repeat the command phrase it does what it just told me it "doesn't do that"I The speaker is much better but the voice recognition is much MUCH worse! I switched back to my 2nd gen unit and the response is much better. I'm also amazed that Amazon won't publish an honest review of their product simply because it's a bad review. This product has problems and the feedback is letting Amazon know. Is that not why they have reviews in the first place?

Title: Dot 3 does not work with a ring doorbell 2.
Body: I purchased the ring doorbell 2 and choose to receive a dot 3 with it. I assumed the dot would ring when the doorbell did but it does not. I'm not certain why but one would think it would. I ended up buying a ring chime which works but by the time it actually rings chances the person at the front door has already left. One would think that Alexa products work with each other. In addition if I would have bought the ring pro I read it works with the dot 3. There are too many issues to make this a good solution.

Title: Get the 2nd Gen!
Body: Overall, I would say for the price/quality, the 2nd gen echo dot is better. To compare the two echos:Pros:-This one is loud. A lot louder. I turn it down about halfway.-Most music sounds way better. It's better than most generic Bluetooth speakers. It's also louder.- it just looks cooler.Cons:-The sound is muffled. Alexas voice is harder to understand.- It lost the super convenient USB power port.- I noticed that the mic doesn't sound as good. When I drop in or leave messages, it sounds a lot quieter than it does from my second generation.- the light bar is dimmer. This isn't awful, I just like the feedback without having to look directly at the dot. This is probably a pro to most.It really is a small difference and it's not that the 3rd Generation dot is bad, I just think the 2nd generation is better for the price. I use my 3rd gen for music in the bathroom and I use 2nd gen for pretty much everything else.

Title: Our third Echo
Body: Since I purchased our first Echo (Dot 2nd Gen), we have addicted to Alexa for its instant responses like weather forecast and music playing.One thing I had hard times commonly with all Echoes is the registration process. My iPhone 7 never succeeds in registering Echoes over WiFi. So, each time, I had go to http://alexa.amazon.com on my laptop. Of course, if I didn't have a PC with WiFi, I would never be able to perform registration. This is why four stars. I wish Amazon to review this.

Title: Great speaker, Alexa has hard time hearing and answering some questions
Body: Speaker on this dot is great. It's perfect for the apartment I live in, enoo to where I can hear it on the next room but not too loud to annoy neighbors. I was conflicted between choosing the dot or the echo because I am using this mostly for music, but it's working great.Alexa struggles to hear you if the music is too loud, so sometimes you have to raise your voice. The games you can play with Alexa are a lot of fun too. She just doesn't know a lot about how her app works, so sometimes you have to figure it out yourself.She tells me the weather each day and let's me know if there's a good chance of it snowing recently. She can tell me how long my commute to work will take. She plays music automatically from my Spotify once I connected it. She has helped me make grocery lists and logs it in the app so you never lose the list. I haven't discovered everything she does quite yet because I really just got it for music but some of the stuff she can do and knows has been awesome to have!

Title: Loud... sometimes too loud
Body: I had the second gen dot and added this one to my home as well this one is much louder and hears me much better however when music is playing she can_ hear me. I believe it is the positioning of the mic and speakers as even on moderate vol she can_ hear me over music when my face is two to 3 inches from the device and I yell. You have to manually toggle down the vol before telling her the new command which makes using her during cleaning or cooking quite challenging.

Title: Annoying popping sounds every half hour.
Body: I just received this in the mail. I immediately set it up as synced it with my other Alexa and smart devises. I woke up to it making a popping sound approx. every half hour. I did a little research and this seems to be a common problem. The research said the resolution was to unplug it and plug it back in to reset it... I did this and the popping sound continues. It's rather obnoxious. Not even my 1st generation does this.

Title: Fantastic product, I want more.
Body: I wasn't sure exactly what to expect, this being my first smart home device. However, I have to say, I am pleasantly surprised.The setup was very simple. I downloaded & opened the app, plugged in the Echo Dot, and followed the simple instructions on my phone. It connected to my Amazon account and told me about a few things that I could do with Alexa.I originally purchased this because I wanted a speaker that would connect to my music without using my phone as the intermediary. As advertised, it did this very well. However, it can do a lot more as well.I was getting tired of screaming "Hey Siri!" at the top of my lungs hoping that my phone would hear me. Now, I barely say "Alexa" in the room and she is ready for a command.When you have more than one in the house, they connect to each other and you can decide which one plays music, if not all.It looks great. The 2nd generation wasn't very inspiring to me in its design, but this one looks like a fancy speaker.The audio is fantastic. I want sure how it was going to sound since it's so small, but I never go above 5 out of 10 in volume because it gets so loud. The sound quality is also on par with some really good speakers that I've previously used.All in all, I highly recommend. If you are looking to buy a Bluetooth speaker, just buy this! It'll work better than other speakers at its price point.

Title: ALL OF US WERE DISAPPOINTED IN ALEXA'S NEW VOICE BUT AMAZON CAME THRU
Body: After posting the ORIGINAL REVIEW BELOW I actually received a call from Amazon support. That AMAZED me. They pointed out some settings I missed that had been added to the control app on my cell for the device. In particular, I could now adjust the treble & bass. This essentially cured my issue.YAY AMAZON! RENEWED FAITH!=== ORIGINAL REVIEW ===We still have our Echo Dot 2nd Generation tucked in a draw & it looks like she's going to be put back to work. We gave this 3rd generation a fair chance, almost 3 weeks, BUT WE ARE STILL HAVEING A DIFFICULT TIME ADJUSTING TO THE MORE MUFFLED SOUND OF ALEXA. _EVERYONE_ who hears "her" says the very same thing. I am so frustrated at this point I want to kick myself. I usually never buy a new version when released, and I know if it ain't broke, don't try to fix it, but I made an exception in this case because I trusted Amazon not to screw up something so basic as Alexa's voice. I was prepared to live with some initial bugs, BUT TO FIND THIS STRANGER IN THE HOUSE MASQUERADING AS ALEXA WAS SOMETHING I NEVER EXPECTED.Perhaps you will feel differently or your hearing is different. However, it was not just me that felt this way. Literally everyone is saying the say thing. WHY DID THEY DO THAT???

Title: Way better speaker that the original Dot!!
Body: This is my 4th Echo product. I bought the original Echo when it first came out, a 1st Gen Dot,l shortly after that,  recieved a Show as a gift last Christmas, and now got this 3rd Gen Dot with a purchase of a Tile 4 pack. The new speaker sounds soooooo much better. Not quite as good as my Echo but log units better than the original Dot. I wish Amazon would have kept the knob on top to adjust volume but that_ just a small anoyance. I love Alexa and if I wasn_ worried about electronic waste (& my wife leaving me for purchasing too much technology (jk I think she loves me enough to tolerate my technology addiction)) I would replace my current Dot with his new one and my original Echo with the newest and my Show with the newest. The speakers keep getting better and better. Still not HiFi but pretty good. If the Sonos speaker did everything that the Echo does, I would probably even get one of those. Alexa is part of my family now (jk again).

Title: Love Alexa Echo Dot 3rd Gen!
Body: I am able to listen to Prime Music with an additional monthly charge.  I am a regular Prime member.  The speaker quality is very good and better than Home Mini, so I don't need to connect it to another speaker system.  I turned off all notifications because on the second day it pinged and then showed a green light.  Alexa said I did not have any notifications, but the light stayed green.  I tried to unplug it and re-plug it, but the light was still green. I felt someone was listening in on me even though Alexa said there were no drop-ins or phone calls.  The notification function will just have to stay off, which gives me peace of mind.

Title: mote than one
Body: Bought 3 for gifts, set one up, set the other 2 up, decided to keep all 3 for myself, ordered more for gifts, we have a echo close by, my wife has MS, being paralyzed she uses echo to make phone calls and to control lighting, she really enjoys having her favorite music, just ask and echo delivers, had to call Amazon support with a issue, they responded fast and had me on line with no problems in less than two minuets, the intercom and phone feature allows her to always have contact with me or a family member. It frees me up a little, she has control of things, she uses echo to play audio books,news and weather, music,podcast ect.

Title: significant improvement over gen2, and a deal with recent pricing under $30
Body: I've had a gen1 echo dot for about a year and a half now and it has always worked well, but it would also have difficulty understanding commands with background noise and the speaker worked well enough for voice, but was horrible for music.  The v3 echo dot sounds significantly better when playing music.  It still sounds thin and lacks bass response, but that is to be expected for a small speaker.  It seems to provide better microphones even though specs show fewer internal microphones. It also looks better.  In addition to the dots, I have a gen2 echo and fire tv cube with several smart home devices.

Title: Surprisingly intuitive
Body: Sound quality is a little too much bass and muffled. Maybe there's a way to change it but I haven't looked.  I find this very useful just trying random things, like when in cooking saying "Set a timer for 30 minutes" and it just works. I'm having less success with custom commands. If you teach her "Turn off the living room lights" it's all well and good, but she won't have a clue what "Turn the living room lights off" means, so you better have a good memory of what you want her to know. As an aside, Alexa is smart enough to know to be quiet immediately when you swear at her ;)

Title: For the price - it_ a good deal and helpful
Body: The addition of Apple Music is awesome. The routines feature is a great way to for Alexa to perform multiple tasks in a row with one command. The start my day routine is great. Oddly these routines don_ work with the last list. Prioritizing tasks isn_ possible. Alexa doesn_ connect to Apple_ reminders. Skills - like accessing a news source or your bank account - are good but not great. There are many skills but overall the skills feel underwhelming and version 1.0. Voice response is fast and accurate when I used it. The speaker for music isn_ Dolby surround sound but it_ decent. You can_ beat the price which makes the echo a good deal.

Title: addicting and precise
Body: i ended up buying the echo dot 3d gen out of impulse but oh my god this thing is fun to play with! i tell her to play anything and she will. also it has replaced my alarm since its louder and more soothing i love that it has an option to do daily briefing and you can add whatever you want to hear from it through your app on your phone. i also really love this feature that allows you to send a voice message to your echo through the app as well on your phone all you have to say is alexa announce " " and she will send your voice recording to the echo dot. i use it to freak out whoever is at home when im bored and im out and about lol. anyways this device is really helpful you can ask it almost anything and she will have a response for you and theyre frequently adding new commands on top of that. 10/10 would recommend

Title: Muffled
Body: Alexa_ voice is muffled which is super annoying. Sad that I would rather put my old one in my room than this one.  Just like your other upgrades to fire Tv. Whoever you have in design and testing is not doing a good job. You_e creating worse products not improved. Bring back whoever was before the person running your product developments. They are clearly needed.

Title: All-new Echo Dot (3rd Gen)
Body: I have an Echo-plus, 2 Echo Dot 3rd gen and a Echo Dot 2nd gen. All seem to work great. I live in a large house and my Router doesn't reach my garage well so I use an extender to cover that part of the house. It seems to drop out after a few days causing problems But the Echo devices are working just great. I'm new to the "Echo/Smart Home" and am going through a learning phase with all of this stuff. I don't play music through the Echo Dot so I find the 2nd gen works as well for me as the 3rd gens

Title: Can't turn Fire TV Stick 4K on/off, mediocre audio recognition
Body: I got this to turn my LG TV that has a Fire TV Stick 4K on/off, but it can't do that. It seems like Amazon wants to steer people towards the Fire TV Cube.I'm pretty sure they can just update the software so that it can be done, since Google Home Mini and Google Assistant easily turn on/off the same TV.The audio recognition I'm also not so sure about. I can ask my Home Mini to "Play Twerk by City Girls" and it understands. Alexa's history says "Play Fart by City Groove".

Title: Great speaker, few things could be added though
Body: Very cute, practical and excellent response time. The information she gives when asked a question is short but good, it gets to the point of what you asked and cuts out all the extra stuff that isn_ of any importance to your question. Definitely better than Siri and most smart AI assistants, she can hear my voice over other sounds which makes talking to her in a crowded or loud house very useful and overall she meets all my expectations. The only thing I do wish is that you have more control of her over the app, for example instead of asking her to change the volume or going up to her why don_ we intergrate a control panel in the app that lets you adjust volumes to your liking, let_ you change the language she speaks or understands, changes the color of her circle light maybe from blue to pink or red or even cycle through a bunch of colors, have a mute botton on the app so that you don_ have to walk up to her and press the botton. There_ a lot of potential in the app that deserve to go with our smart buddy, it_ wonderful what we can do with our voices but if she had a control panel on the app it would make her better than any other smart speaker out there guaranteed.

Title: The sound compared to the 2nd gen echo is tremendously better!
Body: I had 2 second gen echos which worked ok, but when i hooked one of the third gen_ up and played a song the sound quality is in another world. Its like going from mono to stereo. Since you can now adjust the bass, mids and highs just wow. I ended up getting 3 more to basically setup an all home speaker system which sounds pretty darn good for the money. I have thee of them on outlet holders which makes rhe sound even better and keeps them off tables. Also the look is much better compared to the 2nd gens.

Title: It's Part Of The Family Now
Body: Didn't realize how nicely this little thing would become as part of our daily lives. Got Christmas music playing while making coffee in the morning, I use it to see what time it is so my son doesn't miss the bus as we get ready in the morning, constantly use it for reminders (so I dont burn cookies anymore now, yay!). Also did things like I didn't even know theres a Spongebob game u can "activate" in the skills section that tells u orders and then u gotta listen then pick one of 2 options to tell spongebob what to mak, etc and my 6 yr old loves it. Also got ambitent noise skills and such (birds, rain, fan, etc) which helps me goto sleep. Also bedtime stories to tell my kids at night which is cool cause I've read most of all the books I have already. It does much more to be sure but these are the main things I use em for, best $25 bucks I ever spent! (was on sale at the time). PS Alot of ppl said the dot doesnt have great sound but I say for the size it is, it has a decent speaker in it. I got a 1400sqft ranch home and i can hear it any room of the house with it only being like 50-75% volume.

Title: Echo is great but the Alexa app is buggy!
Body: The item came on time. As usual, flawless transaction from Amazon.I'm enjoying the Echo Dot but irritated that the app is glitchy. The Echo itself works fine but the skills catalog wont load completely so I can only enable skills that randomly pop up on the home page in the app.I have searched online for information and read reviews of the app in play store.. seems like there was an update last week that is causing issues for all users.Allrecipes skill isn't helpful at all. Despite finally figuring out how to enable the skill and installing the app, Alexa can't find any of my saved recipes in my favorites.Pandora works great, as do random questions. Over all, I'm pretty pleased but anxious for bugs in the app to be fixed.

Title: Innovation and quality
Body: Too many good things to say about this Generation 3 Echo Dot.  The speaker is way better.  I got 2 of them for stereo and for moving around the house to control different lights and appliances.  ALEXA  play Purple Haze by Jimi Hendrix.  It starts playing.  Ask ALEXA to play any song.  You are REALLY going to like ALEXA if you are an Amazon member.There are a few hundred more things this device does.  They are a great deal for the sale price going on.

Title: Google Home is so much smarter.
Body: I got this free with a re-up of my SiriusXM subscription. Unfortunately, you can only stream SXM through Alexa devices, and not Google due to an exclusive contract. So this dot sits on my coffee table and plays SiriusXM when I want to listen at home. I use my Google Home for EVERYTHING else. I tried Alexa, but she's not very smart or intuitive. She's great at finding deals on Amazon, or notifying you about Amazon shipments, or reminding you that you haven't bought anything on Amazon in a while, but beyond being a pestering advertisement for Amazon, it's a hunk of junk compared to Google Home. If it weren't free, and I didn't need it for SiriusXM, I'd be returning it for a refund.If you're considering setting up a smart home, go with Google. This is junk.

Title: Echo Dot is great ... just not this version, get the older one
Body: Update 1/4/2019:After using the new Dot for several weeks, I have to lower the rating by yet another star. The sensitivity of the microphones is pathetic. You essentially have to stand right next to it an shout to have it act upon the voice command. It also takes significantly longer to respond, as if the processor that is being used in this V3 is less powerful than the one in V2. Stay away from the third-generation dot!Original Review:It pains me a bit to say this, but the new version (V3) of the Dot is a complete engineering failure. The three areas that have become significantly worse compared to V2 (which we have two of) are microphone sensitivity, sound quality, and power supply.- Microphone SensitivityFrom the very beginning, I had the feeling that voice recognition wasn't as good as with the V2. I had replaced our unit in the kitchen with the V3 thinking that it might eliminate the need to connect to an external speaker most of the time when casually listening to music. I noticed that I had to repeat myself more frequently when asking to add items to my shopping list, for example, or that the Dot misunderstood the items that I wanted to add.This morning, I ran a little test to confirm the problem. I placed the two Dots (V2 and V3) next to each other and asked for the time. The old (V2) Dot responded. I then moved the old Dot farther away in increments of 3 feet. In the end, the new Dot didn't start to respond before the old Dot was at 3x the distance between myself and the new Dot. I guess value engineering didn't work out here with the removal of 3 of the 7 microphones that were in the old Dot.- Sound QualityPeople speak about an improved sound quality. It certainly is louder, but extremely muffled even when adjusting the equalizer to reduce the bass to its minimum and cranking up treble and mids. It's fine for music, but voice responses sound like they come from under water. It's shocking how poor the speaker sounds. The V2 version was tinny, no doubt, and some of the firmware updates caused problems, but at least you could understand what Alexa was saying.- Power SourceThe V2 used a micro-USB plug. I bet you have a handful of those cables and 5V cellphone chargers sitting around in case the supplied cable or charger gives up the ghost. The new version switched to a proprietary barrel mount and hardwired charger. You'd have to get a replacement from Amazon and will always have to carry that particular charger if you take the unit with you on travels.- OverallGo with the V2 version of the Dot and save yourself the aggravation. If you've never had a Dot before, you may not realize how well this can work from a voice recognition and responsiveness point of view. The new Dot is junk.

Title: WHERE HAVE YOU BEEN ALL MY LIFE ALEXA!?
Body: I have been WAYYYY slow to the game when it comes to technology and Alexa. I know people have been using Alexa and other techno savvy things (like Siri- who never understands me). I just got a new apartment by myself and needed a speaker, so I saw the third generation Alexa and was surprised to see it so reasonably priced! Some speakers are WAY more than this! So I purchased Alexa.It has been WONDERFUL. Sometimes I feel a little mean, so I say please to her, but I am constantly bossing her around. Alexa play my Spotify music. Alexa call my mom. Alexa skip this song. etc. I easily switch her from room to room depending on what I am doing (cooking, showering, cleaning etc). She re-connects by herself within a minute after unplugging her. Every now and then I realize that she either stops working or doesn't understand me, but I finally figured out why- when something is on like my microwave, and she is near it (like when I was cooking), she momentarily stopped working. But as soon as the microwave stopped, she continued playing my music. I don't mind that, I get the electromagnetic waves and signals and whatnot. I like her, and she also keeps me company. I am excited to start using her to turn my lights on and off without getting out of bed at night (who else fears the little toe trolls on the floor running from your light switch back to your bed!?) Anyways, would absolutely recommend!BTW: ALSO got one for my grandpa. I think she is GREAT for elderly people, because she can remind him of appointments and dinner dates, and even tell him when something is ready to be taken out of the oven. Especially since his memory is beginning to go just a little, I think this is absolutely great!

Title: This 3rd gen Echo Dot is better for music
Body: Compared to the 2rd gen Echo Dot, playback on this 3rd gen Echo Dot has a fuller sound with more bass.  But voice intelligibility isn't as good as the 2nd gen, IMO.  3rd gen seems optimized for music playback, 2nd gen better for common Alexa voice interaction.  2nd gen uses USB (5V) for power, 3rd gen uses AC power adapter (12V).  The stereo pair configuration is a useful new Alexa option which can work on both 2nd and 3rd gen Echo Dot for music playback.  I had trouble at first configuring them for stereo pair or multiroom sound.  Even though the two 3rd gen Echo Dots were both on the same network, I kept getting Network Connectivity error.  I could check one, but immediately the other would show an exclamation mark on Alexa's app.  The problem was a setting on my Wireless router.  I had "Set AP Enabled" to Off, but I had to change it to On.  On allows client devices on my Wireless network to communicate with each other.  I was then able to create a stereo pair.

Title: Wonderful entry into home automation!
Body: I bought these while they were on sale for $30 and I can tell you that just asking for the weather every day while getting dressed was worth that much. I added a 6-plug smart power-strip, and with that, I have bedtime routines that include turning off lights and turning on the fan.Something awesome and unexpected is how easy it is to listen to Audible. No, it does not yet do Audible on all devices, so doing this multi-room does not work without setting up Bluetooth speakers, BUT, listening to Audible USED to be... Grab phone, turn on BT, find speaker, turn on speaker, pair with BT speaker, open app, find book, play book. NOW it's: "Alexa, open audible." THAT'S IT. She opens it and resumes the last book played. SO MUCH BETTER, especially for sneaking in just a few minutes of play time while doing dishes.Between this and the ECHO, the main difference is how it sounds, and how far away it can hear you.If you are just trying home automation for the first time and don't have much money, it's worth grabbing the Echo Dot on sale if you aren't sure you will like it, BUT, the Echo gets about two volume levels higher than the Echo Dot, has a more resounding sound, and it can hear you from farther away.I suggest that if you think you will like it and you are going to get just ONE device, get the Echo. If you think you will want to cover two different rooms, get at least one Echo and one Echo Dot.You COULD feasibly do all Echo Dots. But, I am really glad that my main device is the Echo.AND - don't forget, you can always try both and return one! Especially if there is a brick-and-mortar store near you (I had no idea there was until I shopped for this, and then I was in there like four times!).

Title: Awesome Sound, Alexa Responsiveness - Not So Much
Body: I had the earlier generation echo dot, and traded it in for the new generation echo dot - its a completely different experience. So here are some of the pros and cons I noticed as compared to previous generation echo dot:Pros:1.Sound quality (alexa sound or music or news) is much, much better and deeper, richer in the new echo dot. The bass is is definitely an upgrade - plus with the larger body, I think it has bigger speakers - so the sound produced is much nicer.2. Form Factor: The fabric exterior casing is definitely a huge plus, as it is more soothing to the eye than the plastic casing for the previous gen echo dot.Cons1. Alexa responsiveness: The new echo dot has 4 ( I think) microphones, as compared to 8 on the previous generation echo dot. I have noticed that Alexa is not as responsive and takes more time to pick up voice commands.2. The blue ring on the top much more jittery when you say alexa (it moves in an awkward manner when you call alexa and the light blue portion of the blue rings adjusts to where you are speaking from). Definitely a more awkward, less responsive Alexa.3. Size: Its way bigger than the previous echo dot, while the fabric casing is a plus, the size, in my opinion, the previous gen echo dot was betterOverall: This echo dot is great - the only thing that is lacking is sufficient microphones so that Alexa responsiveness is as good as the previous gen echo dot

Title: Great gift! A great comfort! Easy 2 set up
Body: Works great! Just a wonderful technological advancement!! So nice to give as a gift to elderly parents as well. If they fall or something happens....Alexa call 'name of son or daughter' and you can get help to them right away. It's fantastic that Alexa is always listening for her name! It cracks me up the people who give it bad reviews because she listens. Lol. That is the whole point of having a talking interactive digital personal assistant...to be there 24/7, to respond to her name, when you need her. But personally, I am very very glad that something is there to help my parents when I can't be. The reminders are also nice for the elderly. Medication reminders or just reminders in general. And for me, I travel a lot and LOVE that I can turn my lights on and off.....from 1,000 miles away....to make it look like I am home. And when I am home....no searching on you tube for songs....Alexa play this 'such and such song' and she plays it!!!!!! And I can even lock my doors and arm my digital Life security system! Adding that skill was incredibly easy and everything was a whole lot easier than I thought it would be to set up!!

Title: Apple Music is BUGGY! Two Versions of Hardware?
Body: Ordered two at the same time to save some money. Both devices arrived and I set the first one up with Apple Music no problem. The second one however will NOT PLAY APPLE MUSIC. Period. "I'm sorry, I'm having trouble playing this". I've tried everything. Hard reset, unlink, re-link, unregister, re-register, no dice. Everything else seems to work OK.My old Gen2 Dot also now plays Apple Music seamlessly.Upon further inspection, it appears that Amazon may be second-sourcing some of these. I noted that the SW version on each speaker is completely different (as in not even in the same number of digits), even after updating both to current version. I'm guessing that the hardware inside these is different too, one can't work with the Apple Music skill, and that it's a luck of the draw which you will get when you order it.I have two more on the way, will be interesting to see if both of them will work with Apple or not.  I'll update this review with my results.**Update #1**I did get Apple Music working on this unit. Looks like Apple Music will not work if your Dots are spread across more than one WiFi network. For example, my home has two WiFi routers, one upstairs and one downstairs. If you want to stream Apple Music to all units, they all must be associated with the same router. This may be an Apple restriction to prevent the sharing of Apple Music with other people. Updated to 4 stars.

Title: Very unsatisfactory
Body: The only thing about these that I can say is acceptable is the voice activation.  The quality of sound is abysmal.  I bought two of them and they both sound horrible.  Very mushy.  Especially the spoken word.  The setup for these is even worse.  The only directions are to plug it in and follow the directions on the Alexa app.  Tried that.  The Alexa app told me absolutely nothing.  Ye *will* wind up needing to call Amazon customer service.  They were very patient with me and stayed on the line till both were set up.  Even then it took a while.There was absolutely nothing intuitive about setting these up.  Without help I would not have been able to get it done.Just based on the difficulties I had with setup and the horrible quality of sound I'm very reluctant to even try the more expensive Dot devices.

Title: Great, but could improve!
Body: Really pleased with my echo. The sound quality on this small dot is great and the smart home features are excellent!One small thing that was disappointing is that the microphones don_ seem to work as well as the standard echo. Maybe it_ my imagination or the location, but we regularly have to repeat ourselves, especially when the TV is on.Also needs updating is the Apple Music integration. Needs to be able to play smart playlists on Apple Music, and to be able to add shuffle to the commands (such as play XYZ playlist, shuffled). Right now you have to ask it to play a playlist, then ask it to shuffle.I would also like to see the light ring at the top be used as a visual way to count down a timer!Fix that and the product would be excellent!

Title: Couldn't love this more!
Body: We received a 2nd gen echo dot from our internet provider for free, so it was a perfect chance to give Alexa a shot. We loved the features on it so much, we ordered a 3rd gen to use in the front of the house. The 3rd gen speakers are so much better than the 2nd get (not anything like a sound system but perfectly adequate for christmas music!) that we ordered another 3rd gen to replace our 2nd gen. This version is also more aesthetically pleasing, as it comes in a softer look and softer colors than the stark black or white of gen 2. It's not a giant brick on your countertop.Not only is it super easy to set up, but it actually understands what you're saying. We're an apple household but Siri just sucks when you're trying to get it to understand you. Alexa never gets it wrong; she even understands my 6 and 4 year old who constantly want to play memory games with it. We couldn't be happier with our purchases and plan on giving these for Christmas as well!

Title: Good music quality compared to echo dot 2
Body: Own 1 echo and 2 echo dots 2nd gen purchase one new one to replace my bedroom one so the other in my garage. I read about one of the differences between echo 2 and 3 was the speaker so had to get it when it is on sale this December with the tplink smart wifi plug. Just rcvd it and installed it today so easy to setup and theMusic speakers is really much better not bose quality but much better than 2. Wouldn_ mind upgrading all my echo dots to 3 but it would be a waste of money. May wait for 4 to upgrade the rest. Overall great buy for $29.99 and super easy to setup with Alexa. Thanks Amazon you have another hit.

Title: Major sound improvement
Body: Bought this to replace my previous Dot I_ had in my bedroom after buying a new 3rd gen one for my kitchen. Playing them together at the same time walking back & forth to each room the sound quality is very noticeably different. The new 3rd gen has a much richer deeper sound to it & the sound is consistent at higher volumes. After hearing the new one, my old one sounded like a toy. Plan to retire it to the garage for music & info on those rare occasions I_ out there working. If you have an old one, take advantage of the sale & upgrade. You won_ regret it. And btw ridiculously easy to set up.

Title: Not too easy to set up
Body: Once I got it set up using my laptop computer, I was quite well pleased.But it seems to be an afterthought and the Mobile App is the best way to set it up.Eventually I cleared enough memory in my phone to download the mobile app, but then the controls disappeared from the laptop and the green light was flashing on the Echo Dot (3rd gen). Tried getting support from the 24 hour support site, but it was never available, which was quite concerning. Tried asking Aleksa why the green light was flashing and there was no specific answer... only several suggestions what it might be, but no instructions how to fix them.Eventually managed to disable 'drop in' using the mobile app and now it's working fine.I am not optimistic about adding more devices, but I will try. I would have given this 5 stars if reasonable instructions were included..

Title: Speaker Problems and Non-Responsive - Gen 3
Body: Gen 3 has problems. I had received a Gen 2 from a neighbor as a birthday gift. Something I didn't know I needed and I love having Alexa answer questions, give me the news, play music, etc. Now, Gen 2 came with problems since it was a gift. Somehow it stopped working because amazon thought it was stolen (although they never came out and told me that) and it took the neighbor to straighten it out. As a long-time customer of amazon, it was the first time I've ever had problems with amazon.Anyway, we enjoyed having the dot that I kept in my bedroom since that's where my home office is located. When I saw the Gen 3 on sale, I decided to purchase one. I moved the Gen 2 to the front room where my husband could enjoy music, ask questions, etc.At first, the Gen 3 was great. Loved everything about it and it worked fine. Then the speaker started to sound muffled. Alexa sounded like she had a lisp (sorry for those reading this who have lisps). Then the news briefing would give the weather, announce the next story and stop. After talking with support, I sent it back and ordered a replacement, which I was assured would not have the speaker problems or lapse in stopping during news briefings. I received the replacement, set it up, and guess what! Although the speaker seemed ok, the news briefings stopped working. Contacted support and was told it needed an update that would take 3-5 hours! OK. Update took place (in the background so I didn't have to do anything). It started working and all was good with the world (well actually we know not all is good with the world, but all was good with the world of Alexa in our bedroom.Guess what started happening again? Yep, Alexa will tell the weather then will stop. I go into the other room to hear my news briefing. This morning it didn't work, I tried again just now and it gave me one story after the news (an update). It's just not right and I would not recommend purchasing Gen 3 until amazon gets these bugs straightened out. Gen 2 never had these problems. I guess an updated product is not necessarily a better product.I said I was not going to call support again, but why should I pay for something that does not work as it should?

Title: Echo...turn on the review of 3rd generation dot
Body: Well i wanted to like it because i figured the new 3rd generation would be better than the previous 2nd generation as far as features and appearance...  I basically hide mine and and ask it stupid questions about weather ,the time, whats 5 x5 when paying bills online or play some music . i will get to that ! ........the real reason i purchased this was to control smart plugs around the house..i think it the best thing since sliced bread... turn on the Christmas tree ...done  its good to wake up smelling hot coffee ..you get it... anyway thats that ..now the musical part of this review is after playing music since i owned this 3rd gen i noticed that the speaker has started getting crackly and the bass has made the device sound like a really loud stereo in a honda civic thats rattling from all the bass shaking it apart..anyway on the alexa app you do have many features to control everything from light to sounds and no matter how i change the bass , treble,or midrange it has started sounding like the civic...im debating weather tk send it back and keep the 2nd generation insted of this one . The dot to me dosent have to have all this upgrading and appearance enhanced look for what its capable of based on the size and it functionality  if you demand higher audio quality and want to keep it on the coffee table like a vase of flowers  than go with the larger models amazon offers. But for the basics of its intent the 2nd generation is fine

Title: Verification Failure!
Body: After Amazon deleted my original post for supposedly cursing- I've cleaned it up a bit- no bad words in the original just didn't like what I said!On Dec. 6 2018 right after opening and trying to set it up-Just received today and out the box. I downloaded the Alexa app, connected Alexa to the power and now I have been waiting for an hour and half for the verification code.... I restarted my phone and have requested the code to be sent 5 different times and I have not received a single one... Its annoying! I figure it would take the most 15 mins to set up but this waiting is ridiculous! One of the most advance company in the world cannot send me an instant code to set up one of their most used devices! Come on Amazon get it together... I'm about to return this if I don't the code in the next 15 mins and that's being generous with the time!Dec. 18. 2018 - though I have a working device the phone verification has no purpose- unless it is so I can call and text people on my phone- if this is the case- It has been 12 days and I have yet to receive a verification code on my phone so I can set this feature.  NO CODE at all after 12 days and I have tried it numerous times- what is the purpose of the phone verification? it does not work for me!I'm giving it 1 star because it has wasted a lot of my time and it has been annoying.  I'm not sure if I have a defective device.  I'm not sure.  I'll be more than happy to return if they pay for the return and get me a new one.  I'm just annoyed that no idea why there's a phone number verification if it has no purpose.

Title: Yes, yes, yes!
Body: AMAZON. I was mad at you for a while because you rejected a nice review of a company who sold me a great product so I vowed never to write another glowing review but I am SO happy at my purchase that I just had to share.I have to admit that I am the kind of person who is overly suspicious of "big brother" listening in but I took a chance while the dots are on sale and boy am I so glad I did. This dot is the best! I now have several scattered throughout my house, and love all the features it has to offer:The first thing I did after installing was ask Aleksa to play some holiday music. BOOM. There it was. In really great quality considering the size of the speakers. Wow. Then I started exploring, finding out all that Alexa has to offer. I asked for the weather, the meaning of life, and whether my husband is still cheating on me (Alexa said "Hmmm, I don't know) so the jury's still out. Next I discovered Alexa's skills. The kids can now ask where Santa is and get a very personalized answer. They love asking Alexa questions, and my daughter even said Alexa you are beautiful to which she responded "and so are you, you are so beautiful" so she is winning over our hearts. With the new "announcement" feature that targets specific devices I told me husband my new favorite hobby is scaring the kids when they think I don't know they're really up playing games when they're supposed to be in bed. And finally, I drift off to sleep using this guided meditation skill I enabled. I have not slept so good in many years. Thank you.There are a few drawbacks- my youngest son is named "Aleksa" which is pronounced slightly differently but still is enough to trigger the echo. But we will be changing the wake-up word via the app which is super helpful. I also notice that with our shoddy internet that of more than 1 person is using Wifi than the speaker cuts off but that is not Alexa's fault. Also, it is a bit creepy what this speaker is "hearing" in our household but to be honest I don't really think anyone would care about our personal life as we are as boring as all get out.Overall, despite my initial qualms this speaker is everything to me, and I can't wait to purchase more. I'm not paid by amazon, nor do I have any financial reasons whatsoever to write such a glowing review but THANK YOU for this great device. You rock Amazon!

Title: Better Speaker, Worse Microphone Than 2nd Gen.
Body: The design as far as aesthetics is concerned is an upgrade from the 2nd gen version we have. However the ability to hear commands seems to be a bit of a downgrade. There is now an equalizer, so the sound can be adjusted to your liking.Alexa's voice now has much more bass. The added bass does enhance music played through the 3rd gen dot. The equalizer option in the app has given me the ability to lower the bass and increase the treble for a clearer voice.What is becoming more evident is that this 3rd gen does not hear us as well as the 2nd gen version - especially when it is playing music or there is some background noise. This newer version is in the same location as the previous 2nd gen dot, however we have found that we have to be just a little louder when giving commands. This is likely due to the newer version only having 4 microphones as opposed to the 7 on the 2nd gen.If the 3rd gen had the same ability to hear as the 2nd gen, then it would be the clear winner. Simply put, the new version has a better speaker, but worse microphone setup.

Title: Much better than generation 2.
Body: It sounds much better than second generation echo dot. Since I don't own any bigger echo device I cannot compare.I have noticed some delay between Alexa word and the LEDs turning on to recognize the commands. The LEDs also turn off for a moment and then on again to tell the response to the command. Something annoying if you are used to previous version where the LEDs keep on all the time until the command is completed and the response received.I tested placing my echo dot 3rd generation into a medium size metallic bowl and got a much better sound. Something like an acoustic box. I recommend testing it.

Title: Nice improvement
Body: I have a few Alexas. This one I use in the living room. It's a big improvement over the previous Dots. The look is much improved in a living room setting. The sound is much better though a bit limited in high range. I don't listen to music on this, I have the bigger ones in different rooms for that. But I suppose you could listen to music in a pinch. A child would be happy with it for music, an adult probably won't. At first I thought the mics were weaker than the second generation. But it has seemed to improve. Not sure if it was an update or what. The size is a bit larger but still leaves plenty of room where it's placed.

Title: This 3rd Gen Dot is awesome!
Body: I have an Echo, Tap, a Dot Gen2 and two Dots Gen3.  The sound on the Gen3 is far superior yo the Gen2; it's louder, deeper and solid for a device the size of a hockey puck.  Sound is more than adequate for bedside.  I purchased the Gen3 on Black Friday with a smart switch  because of the price.  I liked it so much that I bought a second one.  I am now starting to take advantage of using Alexa to control lights and other devices.  The Alexa app keeps getting better.  If you haven't gotten an Alexa device, this would be a great place to start.  You won't be sorry.

Title: Small echo big sound
Body: I have the echo and I travel with it, and use it on a daily despite its large size. Well when I saw this echo dot on sale, I grabbed it. And although it_ just a smaller version of the echo. I like the design. But I did have a issue with some type of static going on, and it wasn_ even loud. I unplugged it and plugged it back up, and that seemed to fix the problem. Overall it_ a cute little speaker for traveling or if you_e like me, listening to music while showering. The sound is decent, bass could be a little more, but it can get pretty loud for its size.

Title: Everyone says she_ cool but not really impressive
Body: She_ cool. She tells me the weather. But my brand new Vizio Smart TV? Nah...skill is enabled but she _an not connect bc the skill isn_ enabled. Same applies for about 3 other devices that say they are enabled under my app, but she has no enabled skill when I ask her to do certain things. For being so _mart, she_ pretty much just Siri.  Nothing special. What_ the point of having so many _kills if they don_ work properly? With everyone telling me how awesome she was and how little is needed to be done to set her up, she_ a great big disappointment.

Title: fun and helpful
Body: though i dont have any smart devices yet, other than my fire stick which i havent tried yet, i do plan on getting some plugs to try out. so far she's (alexa on the echo dot) has been helpful with reminders, calender events, the weather and answering random questions. the sound qality is pretty good for such a tiny unit. i still have a lot to learn since i've only just got them. i do love adding things to my shopping list through her instead of waiting to write it down and then forgetting what i needed. boom its right there on my phone. i'm already planning on getting and echo show for the kitchen so i can see recipes and such. i would recommend this device and plan on getting one for my kids in the future to make it even easier to keep in touch.

Title: Alexa sounds like Southpark's Kenny
Body: The Gen 3 is pretty with its fabric cover and softer shape, and its mic array is noticeably better at recognizing commands from a distance, however Alexa's voice is far LESS INTELIGIBLE. Far from the bright, crisp tone of Gen-1 (we have two), Gen-3 Alexa sounds like she's talking through a pillow. If I hadn't thrown away the box I would take it back to the Amazon kiosk at the mall and exchange it for a Gen-2. Now I understand why their Gen-3 display model "wasn't working."

Title: Useless and NOT Smart
Body: I received 2 of these free with my recent purchases of Amazon Blink cameras.  The blink cameras were actually easier to set up than the echo dot. After spending 2 hours trying to set it up and figure it out, I finally gave up. Both are now sitting in boxes. It's totally useless in my opinion.  It basically is just a voice command station which my phone already does. Everyone talks of what a wonderful speaker it has but I never got it to work with music. Thats the most disappointing part of all. All I heard was "I'm sorry. I dont understand that command." Smart??? My dog is smarter! I wish I could return them and get money back for them but they were free.  Glad I didn't have to pay for them.

Title: Great Functionality and Sound
