Body: We loved our first two Dots so much, we ordered two more.  We now have the Echo (2nd gen) plus four Gen 3 Dots.  This gives us an Alexa connection in all the most used areas of the house.  The Dots have very good sound considering their size.  The intercom feature is nice, and the grouping feature works great.  It's nice to walk from room to room and hear the same music in perfect synch in each room.  I will look into hooking up to our Bose radios in the future to get even better sound.  The only problem with that is that doing so will disable the internal speaker, so I will either have to disconnect the Bose, or leave it on ($$ + energy).  Since I ordered 2 Dots at a time, I had one setup problem.  As I went through the setup, it did not complete, and when restarted thought I was doing the second Dot, not the one I was working on.  It may be because I tried to rename it during the setup process. The problem was easily diagnosed when I said "Alexa, say device name" and the response was not the correct name. A little editing, and all was fine.

Title: Wayyyyyyyyyyy better than Google home mini
Body: I initially thought whatever the tech giant Google launches will be super cool and top notch in quality and performance and I bought two Google home mini, then the shocker, its sooo pathetic in quality that i had to return both of them, then thought of giving Echo dot 3 a try, i would handsdown say Echo Dot 3 is atleast 10 times better than Google home mini.Pros of Echo Dot 3 over Google home mini-  4 mics vs 2mics - from one room i was able to give a command to the alexa which is sitting in another room(distance between rooms is 35feet). and google home was so pathetic i have to maintain a distance of atleast 15feet.- response when playing songs (however loud the songs might be playing, alexa responds brilliantly, Google sucks, it just doesnt listen even when i go and shout at its face with just 1 feet distance also)-  superb build quality vs mediocre quality (do not fall for the looks of google home mini)- Excellent audio quality vs normal audio quality (for the speakers of this size , echo dot 3 is excellent)- "alexa" vs "ok google" - totally annoying to call it "ok google" every time -worst ever implementation by Google- response time - "alexa, turn on the lights", but google home "ok google" wait till it responds then say "turn on the lights"- More tactile nice Buttons vs no buttons at all - i had google home for 2 months, not even once i was able to increase or decrease the volume with ease, shame on you google.- easily mute by press vs take the google home mini in your hands and then turn it upside down and then slide the mute mutton - wow how can google implement it so stupidly?Pros of Google home mini over Echo Dot 3- Google home mini looks cute and doesnt look like a speaker at all.The only Advantage of mini over dot 3 is looks and nothing else NEVER BUY GOOGLE HOME MINI (its one beautiful crap),Now I am going to order two more echo (a bigger one and dot)

Title: Definitely better sound quality
Body: I already own the 2nd Gen. Dot. This was on sale so I moved my kitchen Dot to another room and replaced it with this 3rd Gen. Dot. Of course immediately you notice the powerful sound quality. Everything is just as good as the previous version. I was actually hoping for other noticeable improvements. I was hoping for a faster response. It responds just as fast as my original Dot. I don't like the pause you have to make after saying Alexa and then you can ask your question. I am sure they will fix this small irritation, I just hope you do not have to buy a new Dot to be able to have the capability to say Alexa and immediately state your command.

Title: FRUSTRATING
Body: I ordered this because I thought it would be similar to google. It does not stay hooked up to the WIFI and I have to keep reinstalling. It works for a while then it does not. I have to go to my fire tablet to get it to do anything. I am thinking about returning it unless I can find an easy fix. I love my 10" fire tablet, but not my Echo.I wonder if anyone else has had this issue and found a solution. Would be interested in hearing if you have.

Title: Best echo dot yet!
Body: I already own multiple echo's in my house, but wanted to try the newer gen 3 version. I absolutely love it. The sound is so much better and it looks even better than before. It is good enough and loud enough that I can listen to most music without connecting to an external speaker. Relatively deep bass and not overly punchy but present miss and highs. The volume also loud enough to fill a small room all while being able to hear your commands from accords the room.The connection seems to be just as good as the gen 2 so no difference there. All in all I love it. I will be ordering more to replace some of my older ones.

Title: Has better speaker than the earlier gen 2
Body: Love the Echo Dot.  Reminds me of appointments I have scheduled, and converts my verbal grocery list into an email that I can read while I'm shopping.  Haven't had it long enough yo know everything it does, but it knows my name and it doesn't answer when the dog barks.  It can time dishes that I'm cooking, and remind me to check status; doesn't mix up multiple reminders.  Yes, I do feel it is spying on me, so I talk say much of anything personal, and cut it off when I've got company.  It freaks some people out; but they do like the music feature and so do I.  Ask it to find almost anything from Bach to ....., and Alexa finds it!

Title: Worth it
Body: Honestly I never thought I_ own one of these things but there was a deal for cyber Monday we couldn_ pass up, so we got one! We have it in our living room, and hooked up 2 smart bulbs to 2 main lamps we use. I will say it was VERY difficult to get the WiFi connection set up so that the bulbs and the Echo could connect and the Echo to turn them on. Not sure what happened but overnight the connection wasn_ successful. The set up process through the Echo so that the smart bulbs will turn on/off/dim is also very tedious, but it_ worth it. It takes some getting used to it comes in handy.

Title: It's aight
Body: Great sound for such a small speaker, I received mine as a gift. Alexa works well, I wish there was an easier way to learn how to use this device other than emails. I enjoy using it as a wireless speaker at home, it works especially well as a sound machine, I keep mine by my bed and use it to help sleep. The reason I give two stars and not five is because there's no battery, and this device MUST be plugged in in order to operate, the included cable is incredibly short, and I haven't figured out if there's a voice command to tell Alexa not to listen to you (as if you were to press the mute button and the red ring appears). Also, a side note, wouldn't it be cool if this device doubled as a wireless charger? This in my opinion would have offset the fact that it does not have a battery. Or at least a couple USB type A power out ports. Some sort of charging capabilities would be very nice, considering you cant take this device anywhere outside the home. It would also be great if there was a button command you could press on the speaker to enter Bluetooth pairing mode, instead you have to use the app/website which in my opinion is cumbersome. Overall this is a "good" product, I'm glad I received it as a gift because however "good" it is, I would not spend my own money on it.

Title: Not always there to assist but confuse
Body: The device itself is well-made sounds great and looks good but the functionality is not there after setting it up it turns off the wrong lights tells me some lights don_ exist then tells me that there are multiple lights with the same name none of these things are true so therefore as good as the device is I couldn_ recommend it for anything beyond asking a basic questions or to play music or tell the weather.  We own the second generation bought the third gen on another account set them both up I wish I would_e just bought an apple home pod.

Title: Echo Dot is a Great foundation to a smart home...
Body: I am very pleased with the Echo Dot third generation that I purchased. It_ a lot of fun and it is extremely easy to connect with other Echo Dots.  I love the feature that allows one to connect two plugs or lights which is very convenient and controlling the lighting in your entire home. I can_ imagine the possibilities of providing or creating a smart home using the Echo Dot as your foundation .  I love to ask questions of an Alexa only to find it providing with most of the answers. As time goes by I continue to find features that make life easier.

Title: Totally worth it
Body: Have wanted an Echo for awhile; when I saw that price, I had to get it. Alexa tells me the weather, the correct time, tells me jokes, plays my favorite music, plays Jeopardy with me, even reminds me to do things! She's even polite. If I invest in some extras, I'll even have her turning on my lights. My future self may need something that's voice-activated (I'm 61); hoping it will help with my Fire TV. But it's not only useful - it's fun! Haven't had any problems, except remembering all of Alexa's skills. So cool.

Title: Not as good as my 2nd gen
Body: This one does not pick up my voice as well as my second generation echo. Sometimes I have to use the _ake word like three times until she finally awakes. With my old echo it was much more responsive. However this new 3rd gen is a lot louder, like twice as loud I would say!Update: Amazon reached out to me about the issue and sent me a new dot. This newer one is more responsive than the first one I received but it_ still not as responsive as my second generation dot, I_ still doing tests and comparing both of them.

Title: Much Improved Sound
Body: Prior to ordering this, I had 3 Gen 2 Echo Dots, 1 Gen 1 Echo, and 1 Gen. 2 Echo, so I am quite familiar with the Echo product and Alexa integration.  The new 3rd Generation Echo Dot functions much the same as the others, but the sound quality is much improved over the Gen. 2 Echo Dot.  It is obviously not on the level of a full sized Echo when it comes to music, but I would argue that Alexa voice responses sound every bit as full, where on previous Echo Dots, her responses sounded quite tinny.  The improved sound also helps it function as a much better sound machine and alarm clock for bedroom use.

Title: Waste of time.
Body: I finally decided to get this device a try . I recieved the Echo dot in the mail and after 3 hours of attempting to set this thing up, emailing and speaking to customer service on the phone and trying every suggestion they had to offer, I have come to the conclusion that this product is not worth the time or effort. Customer service suggested that it may be my Internet connection. But since every device in my home connects it is not my Internet connection. It is the Echo dot. I am sending this back. Thanks for nothing Amazon.

Title: Great for quick inquires; the dog thinks her name is "Alexa" now
Body: I bought this during cyber week in a package deal with smart bulbs. While I haven't tried out the smart bulbs, I've asked Alexa a variety of questions about weather, current events, movies, astrophysics and theory. I can tell she pulls most of her information from either Google or Wikipedia. While on Christmas vacation, I'm trying to stay away from sitting at a desk so she's great for quick inquiries. The other day I heard my boyfriend answering political questions that Alexa was asking HIM in the form of some quiz with multiple rounds. I believe the dog thinks we're changing her name to "Alexa" as she trots over when we call for the Echo across the room. It has a great range as I can ask for her while I'm in the kitchen and the Echo Gen 3 is way on the other side of the house in the living room. Overall I'm happy with this purchase! I didn't think I would take to it so quickly, and I'm eager to install the bulbs to control lighting. Over the coming months I'm hoping to purchase a Ring doorbell and a smart thermostat.

Title: READ | My first Alexa product
Body: Pros:*She saves time turning things on and off*She plays music faster than I can search for it on my phone*She updates me on the weather*She tells me what traffic is like*She calls or text for me*She plays games with me*She helps me with shopping*She understands and responds like a real human (No need to pause when calling her name, just talk like a normal sentence and she_l pick up on your question)*She looks good and sounds good*She has thousands of skills to download from*She has thousands of compatable devices to pair with*She works with firesickCons:*You need to have a spotify premium or amazon music to play specific types of music*Can only have 2 voice recognitions to purchase goods with your voice (and you have to wait 6 months to change them to another persons voice)*She_l burn a whole in your wallet because in a month you_l be wondering how your home now has 20 smart plugs, smart lights, a smart  thermostat, smart security cameras, bluetooth speakers, smart vacuum, oh and not to mention the 4 new Echos you have in each of your rooms including your bathrooms.Note:I_e only had this for about 1 month but I love it, she_ making my life easier even if its by a little. If you buy a smart plug its as simple as downloading the smart plug app then pluging it in then naming the plug. I bought her for $40 with the smart plug included as a bundle. That being said if you can find this product on sale then grab it! My whole family loves herP.s Alexa is an AI robot and lots of people are buying her. Which means she will only grow even better. Might as well join the train now so you don_ have to do it later!Hit the helpful button if this helped so more people can view it!

Title: meh!
Body: I have been a amazon customer for over 15 years and prime member for over 7 years. I am usually what I would consider to be an early adopter for technology but hesitated buying a smart speaker because I wasn't sure it was worth allowing the company to record what we are talking about in the house... it feels a little "big brother" to me and so we waited, until now. My daughter has been asking for Alexa for a while so I broke down and got one for Hanukkah... actually I got 3. It works fine, no problem with the hardware but I am underwhelmed. It just doesn't do enough for me to find this a valuable appliance in my house. I can get everything and more from my phone.. It wasnt expensive enough to bother returning it but it will remain unplugged. Even my daughter is underwhelmed. Sorry Amazon, not for me!

Title: It_ great!
Body: I_ super happy with these.  We bought 5 of them.  We use them to announce to the kids all over the house that it is dinner time or time to leave or whatever.  We have music on all the time.  They are great. I would love if they would integrate these into a mesh networking system, then it would be even more useful, being able to have the whole Alexa experience, but also work as an access point.  The speaker sounds great.  Many reviews say they don_ like the sound, but they can connect to other speakers via plug or Bluetooth, so the functionality is still there.  Definitely worth the price.

Title: Functional, beautiful and fun!!
Body: Game changer for my Dad who has Parkinson_.  It_ very _arry Potter-esque to have a beautiful little device with lovely descriptive colors do your bidding from playing music, to answering questions, to simply being able to verbally place a phone call and literally talk - and then hang up without lifting a finger!  I will be adding more throughout the house.  Plus, I can do things like turn the music off with the app remotely from my phone without having to run around, and I can imagine all the other jobs it will streamline as well.  Just wonderful!!!  And thanks for adding a feature for jokes and fun things like guided meditations and sweet phrases in response to _mall talk.  Functional, beautiful and fun!

Title: Great addition
Body: We have had an Echo Show in our kitchen for maybe 6 months, and we really like it - easily select and listen to music (both from our Amazon Prime music and our Pandora account), control lamps (verbally and on a schedule), check our security cameras, listen to news (flash briefings), etc. I was recently given an Echo Dot as a gift and put in the master bedroom which is on the opposite side of the house from the kitchen. I can now play the same music through both Echos so that I hear the same as I move from one end of the house to the others, control lights without walking back into the kitchen, etc. It's been a great addition.

Title: Great!!!
Body: Love Alexa!!!  You can do sooo many things with this speaker!  And I got it on sale!  I bring it to work and listen to music all day!!!  I'm big on jeopardy and the question of the day.  I've won 20 questions once.  I love the song quiz!  I kick butt in that.  I've had the thing since after cyber Monday and I'm always finding something new it does!  The games are my favorite and I love the shopping lists, reminders, alarms, timers.  All of it.  I've only ever made a call from it once.  But it works great for that.  I've never used it for texts.  The only semi off thing ( I wont even say bad) is that sometimes alexa mispronounces a word here and there.

Title: WOW
Body: This device exceeded my expectations. Super easy to set up! Alexa sounds more intelligent than I imagined a robot would have. I can ask her any questions and she is quick to respond. I am the most impressed with audio quality and her ability to listen. I mumble a lot, and I have a soft voice. I hear over and over again from people about this. I am shocked she can hear my voice and understand it. One time I was in my bed turned away from the speaker trying to set my alarm to test it, and she heard my muffled voice under the comforter. She can do many things and has clever responses to certain questions. Very modern and happy with my purchase!

Title: Convenient, if Creepy
Body: This thing works surprisingly well, and is a convenient way of controlling my smart outlets, getting the weather, setting timers, etc. Unfortunately Amazon has a terrible track record with privacy issues related to Alexa, which is why I'd rather have an Apple device for this purpose. Equally unfortunately, Apple is pricing their speaker out of reach (I got my echo on sale for $25), so here we are.

Title: need more improvment
Body: it is nice and I enjoyed it but there are many control and feature can be easy to add but they did not .for example-there is a drop in feature is there but no intercom feature why?-could have more control over the individual device how independently work.  if we share house hold privilege someone,  as I understand that someone can dropin  or even possible to change feature of echo dot?  -- I have not tested. it. I was told that they have full access.? it got great speaker for the price. it is always nice to know the weather etc..

Title: It_ not as simple as you see on tv commercials.
Body: My biggest issue is Alexa doesn_ understand what I_ asking when I_e enabled the apps for it. I use the sleep app for rain sound every night and it still gets confused most of the time or will play the same one, even tho I_e added most of them for rain. I also don_ like how the app pages default back to the top of the list after I enable something within the list of choices. I gave a 2 rating because so far I see nothing special about it, mainly because she answers with _dk to most questions. Nor do I like how I have to remember the exact way to ask for what I_e enabled. It seems to resort to playing a song from your music playlist based on one word it understands. Yet it doesn_ give a reassurance question, it just blast the song on. UghWhat I like a lot is how the smart plug enables turning on lights. That_ pretty cool _. Problem is, you_l find yourself walking right pass the light just to ask Alexa to do it. __The Alexa site is confusing and boring. It doesn_ flow like other programs. It simply drops everything in one place in each category, and you just figure it out. It listed some books I_e purchased in the past, and although Alexa can read them, her voice is very much monotone robot so the _mph from your story is missed. Overall, I_ excited to see new upgrades as Alexa is tweaked. To me, it seems like it_ incomplete or was released too early or something. I_ not giving up on it because I_e come this far and I wanna grow with my little buddy. _

Title: Much improved product
Body: I really like the 3rd Gen Dot a lot. It_ sound quality is much improved over our 2s. It_ also much more attractive looking. If you have an Echo second Gen it will match it well in the looks department.Since we are fully entrained in the Alexa echo system, I continue to find ways to make us of the products. The ability to create groups is a fantastic thing. Especially when we want to stream music throughout different regions of the house.Bang for the buck it_ much improved over the second gen model.

Title: Speaker is amazing, mics are sensitive
Body: I'm very satisfied so far with this. I can't compare because I have never owned the V2. The device picks up my voice from other rooms and has had no problem connecting to the wifi or pairing with other gadgets, devices, plugs, and the speaker is pretty loud for it's size. I do wish it has a lithium ion battery but that would drive the price up so I'm cool. Soon we won't need these because there will be central mics and Alexa/Google assist built into the home so no need for multiple devices for additional coverage. :-)

Title: Speaker is better. Charging cable and connecter is higher quality. Looks nicer on furniture.
Body: First, let me say I already have an Echo Dot 2, so I'm familiar with this product.  The Dot (3rd gen) has a better sound from the speaker. It looks more  pleasant on furniture.  The power cable is more substantial, but I did not have a problem with the Dot 2 mini USB connector, not sure why they changed it (have not  measured but maybe it's longer).  I do not know if the functionality is any different..... I still do the same things as I did on the Dot 2.  I now have one upstairs and one downstairs.

Title: Five units one household BEWARE
Body: We got these for morning alarms with the Phillips hue lights,  for the teens, so we can take there phones and I pass away at night. But we are having a difficult time with the programming. The music is Spotify family account that have saved library_ on them (so we don_ want to switch five users to amazon music). Only one Spotify account user will program at a time and if we want to play the same music on two or three we can not do that.  You have to move the music from unit to unit verbally if you want it in the room your in. If the registered user leaves the house, then the music goes to bluetooth in the car and leaves the ones at home unusable for music. So perfect for prime users that like amazon music.  Speakers quality is good.  The lights have to take up a Ethernet port on the router.  That would be fine if all the teens didn_ think they needed to be hard wired in for faster gaming speeds. So the lights never work when the teens are home (they unplug them to use the port).  Trying to an additional router to resolve and having issues getting the Phillips light bridge to reconize the new router.  Hope this was helpful to other families that are thinking about using them with kids.

Title: i can HEAR it.
Body: it is slightly bigger than the original and it is a bit louder. the size i don't mind at all. what i like is, i can HEAR it. i keep my dot in the kitchen under the upper cabinets. i had to order a different sized 'mount' for it, so i can get it up off the counter, but that was easy to find and do. i love my amazon 'helpers'. and now i can finally hear the dot. Amazon needs to let us name her Dot. I think that would be apropos. ;)

Title: Echo is a combination of the unit, the app, and Alexa - so just regarding the unit:
Body: We wanted to add another dot to the arsenal so I saw they had a 3rd gen for a good price.  I replaced a 2nd edition that was in constant use in our bedroom with this one and relocated the old one. This _wap matters because we_e been using the bedroom one for a year and would immediately notice any differences.Is it better than a 2nd edition?  I think so, but the improvements are subtle.  The speaker sounds different.  The 2nd edition one sounded very _are and _ard in comparison.  The new one seems to have a speaker that sounds _ofter or maybe even a slight bit _uffled, but we don_ have any problem hearing or understanding.  I still wish that the audio was not transmitted in 360 degrees because most people probably aren_ placing these in the center of the room.  I think the sound directed towards corners of the room is potentially wasted, but this speaker seems more powerful than the 2nd edition one so it doesn_ seem to be as much of a problem.As I said before, the improvements are subtle, so I think the microphone is also improved. I think Alexa can hear and understand us a tiny bit better.At the price I paid, it is definitely better to get a 3rd edition instead of a 2nd.  I think 2nd edition works just fine and if you had no 3rd edition to compare it to you wouldn_ be upset at all.So why the 4 stars and not 5?  Because the app is garbage and Alexa is a huge pain in the butt.  Case in point, I set up this Echo using my phone.  We had some trouble because it would only play samples of songs.  We figured it was tied to my account and not my wife_ (who had the Music Unlimited plan tied to hers). We both checked in the app and the device said it was associated with my account on my phone, and HER account on her phone!  We both share the same prime membership, so I_ not even sure why this matters, but it does.  After two attempts to set it up with her phone it finally seems to play music unlimited.The worst part of it is how dumb Alexa is. She can_ even tell you which account the device you_e talking to is registered to: __ sorry, I don_ know that one.  She doesn_ know, and the app wants it to be registered to everyone - which is a nice gesture, but just not true.I_e explained in some depth the problems with Alexa, but to paraphrase: NOT SMART.  If Alexa was capable of more than one command at a time and had a longer memory than Dory, it would be a drastic improvement.  You can read my other Echo review for more details: https://www.amazon.com/gp/customer-reviews/R1N696ZHMO7CL0/ref=cm_cr_getr_d_rvw_ttl?ie=UTF8&ASIN=B0749WVS7JThis unit, compared to 2nd generation Dot is 4 stars.Amazon App: 1 starAlexa: 2 stars

Title: "Alexa set the bass to 5; Alexa, reduce the bass by 2.".
Body: "Alexa set the Bass to 5; Alexa, reduce the Bass by 2.". "Alexa set the Bass to Maximum (+6)" - min. = (-6)WOW! But it gets even better: Alexa, increase/decrease the Trebble by 2, 3... - (-6) to (+6).3rd Gen Amazon Alexa enabled Echo Dots are Dual-Band and default to 5G ** if your Internet Modem/Router is dual-band. Therefore, complete compatibility with 1st. and 2nd. Gen. Echos should not be assumed. The third generation line up of Alexa enabled Amazon devices are a remarkable make-over and rethink of an already amazing concept. This product will satisfy anyone's expectations for a Digital Assistant and the Audiophile's single aim--music in its most balanced form; amidst style and flair to be sure, with a totally rethought-out design concept. Gone is the useless and touchy Mini-USB power plug - replace with a standard unified DC 2.1mm. power adaptor and plug. Dust collecting dust-Pit openings on the tops of previous generations have been eliminated in this fresh, new Form Factor, just 4 pin-hole mic. openings remain. One more very important concept designed into this Echo Dot's rollout is the 'Surround Sound' effect design that's accomplished by radiating sound out of the sides of the device and around it in 360° Surround.** It can switch to 2.4 (4G) Wireless later.

Title: Finally, Someone That Actually Listens To Me LOL
Body: The 3rd generation Echo Dot came with my Sirius radio subscription. Setup is an ease since Amazon connects it to my account when ordered. Basically all I did was plug it in. I linked the Dot to my Sirius, Pandora, Iheart Radio accounts. Amazon Music and Prime are connected. I have the 2nd generation and I think the sound is a little better and I like the looks of the 3rd generation. New skills are always being added.I used my Dot a lot after surgery being laid up for a month. I would "tell" Alexa to play music, read books, tell jokes, ask the time and even the day. It was great having a listening ear when everyone else was gone. She eased the boredom.Winter is heavy duty baking season for me and I have used my Dot to set timers. Very handy. I always know when to get my deliveries since I have package notifications.  My husband was impressed when I gave him his birthday present and had Alexa play the Birthday Song by the Beatles. Lots of fun things.

Title: Good streaming while using satellite Internet
Body: These Echo Dots have kind of surprised me. I don't have a really good internet connection (satellite internet) so streaming anything doesn't work well for me. But this Dot (have two of them now) is able to stream music from both Amazon and Sirius XM for hours without the buffering lags that my phone has issues with. Occasionally while streaming Sirius XM the will be a pause while it buffers and then it continues on. Haven't had that issue while listening to Amazon.The one issue I had was difficulty setting up the internet connection for the first Dot. The second one just used all the information from the first Dot, so setting up the second Dot was no problem.Deducting one star for the difficulty in the initial setup and also for some difficulty setting up alarms and controlling the Dot from the app. Wish that was easier, but they seem to want you to do everything by voice commands.

Title: I love this just for the music
Body: I bought this on sale and I set it up in my kitchen. I really enjoy listening to music while im cooking or doing dishes. I enjoyed the amazon music 1 month free trial I got with this purchase and had the intensions of purchasing it after my free trail ended. But the price per month, or even per year was ridiculous just to listen to music.  So I passed on that and canceled my subscription and use Iheart radio instead. Though I cant request my own songs on it, its free so.....I also like that I can do a grocery list with Alexa. When I notice I need something I just tell Alexa to put it on my grocery list and when I go grocery shopping I ask her to read my list to me. The only thing that I do not like about the grocery list is that Alexa says I can read my grocery list on my account but when I go it only had 2 of the 30 things that I had listed.

Title: Decent sound - great whole house
Body: Not like a high fidelity stereo system but sounds pleasant for most any room.  Enough bass to not be a wimp.  I found the 0 settings on equalizer to be best otherwise highs get harsh.  Bought couple at $50 pair then couple more at that price a deal.  Fills house with nice sound at about volume 4 for each - great bluetooth range.  Also linked to upstairs and down stairs audio receiver systems if I get in mood for high fidelity sound.  With Amazon music or even better Spotify this is great.  Not as smart for information questions as Google Home.Knocked off a star given privacy concerns given web articles about Germany cross user securit gaff although given all the crazy articles about that wonder if some of those are from Russia or other fake news....

Title: Easy setup, Fabric shell material is a nice modern decor over 1st gen models...
Body: Bought to add to my bedroom so I can control devices from there without having to go downstairs.  Works well & setup was a breeze. I was confused at first and went thru setup twice to make  sure I wasn't going crazy - because it practically configured itself.  Once it connected to my Wifi connection & Amazon account.  Guess it knew when I added the device to my existing network & acct, it pretty much auto configured itself.  Also the fabric outer covering makes for a nice modern decor that looks good in most any home.

Title: total waste of my money
Body: I have found doesn't work well with google chrome, seems to be very limited would only turn the tv on and off.. the reason I refuse now not to employ it's use any longer;  and is a documented by several sources...  Amazon sent over 1,000 private Alexa recordings to random person, it's a fact... don't need any more snoops in my life...

Title: Much bigger than it's predecessor, nice cloth cover
Body: This is our 7th echo dot, 1st 3rd gen.  We have them all around the house.  These things are so fun, the kids play all kinds of games on them or just make it say silly things.  My wife and I use it mostly for music wherever we happen to be in the house.  I like that you can create groups and play music in multiple locations, I just wish you could create multiple different groups with the same dot.  example: Our master bedroom and kitchen dot are in a group.  Master bedroom is upstairs, and kitchen is downstairs.  I like to play music to these 2 while doing laundry and I'm up and down the stairs.  I would like a second group with master bedroom and each of the kids bedrooms to play music strictly upstairs when I want.  You'd think that would be simple enough but once a dot is part of a group, it can't be part of another group without removing it from the first group.Otherwise though, we love our Echo Dots and Amazon updates them regularly so there's always new features... Who knows, maybe they'll fix the group restrictions some day.

Title: Skeptical at first, but well worth the risk
Body: The Echo Dot/ Alexa is awesome. We were a bit skeptical at first, but we like the idea of being able to wake our kid up and have reminders without having to be the one_ in the room doing it. Our daughter loves Alexa, she reads her stories, answers her random questions and is able to play games. We also love Alexa, from setting alarms to also playing games. The dot also has a decent little speaker to play music on. All and all I would not hesitate to buy another echo to add to another room. Also we bought 2 initially and paired them together with the smart plugs (full control of the kid tv without having to get up to turn it off).

Title: Gen 3 is awesome upgrade!
Body: I replaced my Echo Dot Gen 2 with this Gen 3 version. Audio quality is so much better. And while most people don't like the elimination of USB power, I like it much better. Design is much more tasteful. No more "Hockey Puck" look. In fact, my small 1850 Sq ft home is covered by 3 of them and an Amazon Echo. Oh, my Gen 2 now resides on my workbench. The old hard plastic styling is better in areas where it could get dirty. If I want better audio there, I will just connect with an external speaker.

Title: Sounds Rough About Half the Time
Body: When this thing works, it sounds, great. Unfortunately, it only works well about 50% of the time. I_e had it for about three weeks now. Sometimes the bass bottoms out just from Alexa_ voice, making it sound scratchy and unpleasant. (It is set to factory settings on bass, mid, and treble)  I am by no means an audiophile, who needs perfect sound, but it just plain sounds bad, at times. I_e also had this problem when listening to music. Again, when it_ working, it sounds great, but a lot of the time it doesn_. It_ definitely much louder than the previous model.I_e also noticed that it is much slower to respond than my 2nd gen Echo dot and it doesn_ seem to pick up my voice as well, especially if there is any other sound in the room, like a fan or a video playing on my iPad. Overall I_ disappointed by the product. I think I_ going to reach out to customer service. If the problem gets resolved, I_l write a better review. I love my first gen Echo and 2nd gen dot.

Title: Better than 2nd - worth the price
Body: The sound quality is so much better on this 3rd generation.  I use mine multiple times during the day for music as well as everyday information.  Combining units is as good as, if not better, than whole house audio,  As with 2nd gens, you can use with smart plugs, ring doorbell etc.  Impressive!  I only rated 4 stars due to the fact at this time I am experiencing small problem with one of the two dots I purchased.  Seems like it dies in the night and has a solid blue ring but does nothing until I unplug it, wait a few seconds and plug in again.  Working with tech to resolve issue.  % stars if runs like the others.

Title: Unlimited Music - crazy restrictions
Body: I love my Echo and Dots but when I signed onto Unlimited Music and found out that I could not play a song on multiple devices at the same time in my home with the unlimited music the service. I was told that you can only play unlimited music on one device at a time. If you have 5 devices on the family plan you can only play different songs on each device if it is from Unlimited Music. This is crazy since I have Amazon Prime I can play the same song on multiple devices but with a family plan or single unlimited you can only play a song on one device at a time. I was on the phone for 90 minutes with Alexa helpline and they all insisted that you cannot play one song on multiple devices in your home with an unlimited music account.  I am a big Amazon fan but if this is true it is a completely asinine way of restricting folks that have paid an additional fee for more music choices but are getting much much less. Crazy????

Title: Impressive Value, Well Worth the Money
Body: I have two full-sized, second generation Echos which have always impressed me and wanted a third Echo in the bedroom.  As this area is rarely used to play music, I figured the Echo Dot might be a good choice as its less expensive than the full-sized Echo and sound quality is not a big concern.  I was shocked to find out that the Dot has incredible sound for such a tiny device.  Loud with amazing fidelity.  The latest generation Dot performs nearly as well as my older full-sized Echos in every way.  Well done Amazon!

Title: Great sound in small package
Body: The Echo Dot 3rd gen sounds amazing compared to all the previous generations of echo dot and even better than the google home mini. Somehow still gets thumping bass in it's tiny size.The 4 microphones recognize my voice just as well as the other echo devices i have that have 4+ microphones. The new design looks great as well, with a rounded top instead of a can like LED ring.Great to just have around the house so you can ask alexa to turn the lights on or off and play music.

Title: Good for music but not for news or talk radio.
Body: I placed my 2nd Gen Echo Dot in the kitchen, where I listen to the news while cooking. I needed a bit more volume (cooking can be noisy), so I bought the new 3rd Gen Echo Dot. It is indeed louder, but there is a problem. The speaker produces considerably more bass, and even with the bass turned down to zero with the equalizer in the Alexa app, the sound was too bassy and muffled to be clear. Sharp trebles are better for articulating speech, and this unit doesn't have it. So I moved it to another room and returned my old Echo Dot to the kitchen. The new unit is better suited for music, less so for voice.

Title: Not as impressed with this device
Body: Don't get me wrong, I love Alexa, but I prefer her old self. Why? It's easy. In gen 1/2, you could plug her into a 2.0 USB port...on a TV, desk/laptop, Asus router, QNAP NAS, etc., and she was alive and well. Gen 3 uses the same power supply as the older "tower" echos, which is all fine and good if that's what you want/like. If I was looking for something a little more powerful, I'd get a Spot, Plus, etc. (the point being is there are many options if you want more features).

Title: Better Sound than Gen 2, but....mic is weaker.
Body: As a year-long user of a Gen 2 Echo Dot, I find the sound quality of the Gen 3 that I've had for about a month much improved. But, the microphone sensitivity seems a little weaker than the previous model. I have to raise my voice or sometimes shout for it to hear either the wake-word or a command. Also, when I renamed this unit to "Echo" as a wake-word, it had a more difficult time hearing me. So, I changed it back to the default "Alexa" and it's back to "good" hearing, (not 'great", but "good").I love, love, love this technology and Alexa is amazing! But, due to the weaker microphone ability, I'm giving it four stars.

Title: Sleeker style with better sound than Gen 2 Echo Dot
Body: Improved style and decent improvement in sound quality versus Gen 2 but still need to connect it to a bluetooth speaker if you want quality audio sound for music. IThe improved sound is not a game changer for its compact size but an improvement over previous generation. I only chose to purchase due to the trade in program and to try to stay current with the tech changes. However, if you are on the fence about upgrading, IMHO, it's not necessary to upgrade if you don't need to.

Title: 3rd gen keeps disconnecting from WiFi
Body: Unlike the 2nd gen Echo Dot (worth $5 trade value); 3rd gen keeps disconnecting from WiFi Internet. Constantly have to unplug and replug just to re-establish connection. The app doesn't easily re-connect during a re-setup. I have two 3rd generation dots and only one has the stated symptoms. Weird. Must be defective. The speakers in the 3rd gen are vastly improved. Note: I also have two Echo Looks (don't ask why) collecting dust because they are not equipped to connect to Bluetooth speaker.  The Echo Look provides cheesy photo and video snapshots with limited Alexa q&a capabilities. Amazon doesnt offer a trade in for the Echo Look. They dont even want this product back.

Title: Very handy, surprisingly good sound quality
Body: Was always skeptical of these things but will admit i was always intrigued. It works pretty well and is pretty easy to add new skills and tricks once you figure it out. I think the biggest surprise from me is the audio quality on it. For such a tiny speaker and price it is actually quite loud and comes through crystal clear. That being said I did have an issue with my music occasionally sounding static-y and i would stop playing but next time i started it up it was crystal clear. I had gone through this several times but I called the customer service and they are sending a new one. I am actually very impressed and am looking to add more now. Only drawback is that you can_ customize the commands. For example our room a is named Jarvis and I would love to tell her to have Jarvis start cleaning. Also our alarm requires us to say _pen alarm.com first before giving commands. Not sure if this is on amazon or alarm.com but is only a minor technicality and doesn_ take away from the overal quality. Thanks Alexa!

Title: The Echo Dot is a must have!
Body: *the photo is my Dot in a case I bought for it. The CASE DOES NOT COME WITH THE DOT.I like the Echo Dot. I got it to pair with my Echo Plus to make it louder and use it in other rooms. It took me a day to figure out how to pair both of them together. I think the sound quality is good for the size of it but I have noticed that it doesn_ hear me say the wake word. I might have to select the learn my voice option to see it that makes it hear my voice better.  I am going to buy one for my mother_ house. She gave us the Alexa iLive last year for Xmas after we loved seeing the Alexa at my uncles on Thanksgiving in 2017.  I love being able to play music anytime.  I subscribe to Amazon music and I heart radio. If you don_ subscribe to them they_l give you a month free and then there is a free music app you can use that I_e seen on the Alexa app.It_ a win win purchase. The price is great and all you need is WiFi. I look forward to taking it places in the summer because I love listening to music!

Title: This is not the home AI device you are looking for.
Body: Buy yourself a Google Home Mini for $20 and save yourself the trouble. Even with an Amazon Music subscription, Alexa can never find what I want, but I can searching Amazon on my desktop. More than half the time Alexa cannot understand me and I have moved her all over the place and tried speaking louder too. Finally, when Alexa does understand me, her answers are more than often useless. This may be the first purchase I return out of just pure dissatisfaction.

Title: Works great and easy set up
Body: Set up is extremely easy once downloading the Alexa app to my smartphone. So far I_e used it to play music. The speaker volume is very good. It doesn_ seem to have any difficulty so far with understanding my voice commands. I have to learn what voice commands it knows when asking to turn up the volume high like, _aximum volume. I_e not had it for long so I haven_ bought the wireless lightbulbs or plugs to try it out with my lighting or tv. Unfortunately, it doesn_ work with my HiSense model tv. However, I am able to turn it on remotely using the smartphone app so, if I_ in a room with the door closed I can speak to it through the app and it follows my commands.

Title: Very good, room to grow - which is a plus
Body: I received a dot with a robot vacuum, and love it. I ordered 3 more dots, and one plus as christmas gifts - all in the same home. The random groups are great, as I have labeled things like Upstairs, Downstairs, everywhere, Kids rooms, master beadroom, etc. You can place a device in multiple groups, and control music, volume, drop in, etc. There is a lot of potential in this device, and for the most part it is great. At high volume levels Alexa doesn't always hear you, and sometimes software updates break 3rd party compatibility. All native functions seem to work really well though. Alexa - beam me up!

Title: Somewhat better than 2nd generation Echo Dot
Body: I have 3 of the 2nd generation Echo Dots and I am very pleased with them.  I couldn't pass up the Black Friday deal price on this 3rd generation and bought 2 of these.  They are a little bit larger (in height) than the 2nd gen and the volume is a bit louder with more bass than the 2nd gen.  The third 2nd gen is in the baby's room and I use it for white noise and other soothing sounds so it is not a priority to replace it.  All the Echo Dots work well with voice command and I have it connected to my Nest Thermostat, smart plugs, and Wyse Security Cameras. The 3rd gen are a keeper

Title: Aesthetically pleasing and fun
Body: This is a great smart speaker. I use it mostly for listening to music and the news but there are also a ton of other features that are possible too, many of which im still figuring out. The only downside is that if you want to listen to a lot of specific songs you_l have to subcribe to amazon music which can run you around 7.99/month.Got this echo dot on discount on black friday for $25 and it_ currently going for $30 right now for their holiday sale. Its a great time to buy if you_e thinking of trying it out.

Title: The same and not the same.
Body: I bought this unit as a upgrade to my older one, a mistake , at least for me. This unit is separate in energy and sound from my last one. This one has its own power input and the sound is better for most but not for me, older and my hearing aids do not respond to better base which for the powers that be in music is the answer for everyones listening while to me it sounds like everyone and every instrument has  muzzles over their output. My wife loves the one I gave her that was mine.

Title: Much fuller sound and larger than Gen 2 Dot
Body: Much better sound than the Gen 2 Dot and Alexa App lets you adjust Bass, Mid & Treble. Sounds much fuller than Dot 1 or Dot 2. Still it_ a smaller speaker that is not meant to fill a room with audiophile sound but it does a pretty good job with decent sound output. The Echo is a much better choice if you_e looking for quality sound output, but that didn_ stop me from filling every room in the house with these Dots!

Title: Stopped working after 2 weeks - would not connect to internet any more
Body: I believe either the Echo Dot we received is defective or the Amazon software to set it up is buggy.  We set up the Echo Dot on Dec 25, 2018 using a laptop and going to alexa.amazon.com web page.  Echo Dot worked for about 2 weeks.  Then it announced it could not connect to our ATT wifi (router model 5268AC) even though our internet did not change.  I made several attempts to reconnect (I tried 2 different Amazon accounts) but without success.  I contacted Amazon Help Desk and I worked with someone over the phone for 38 minutes without success.  Per her instructions, I did try using a different PC to set up the Echo Dot without success.  I asked if it was defective and if I should send it back.  She said it was not defective.  But it that were true, she should have been able to help me connect it to the internet.  It_ not like I am stupid.  I connected our Echo Dot to the internet on Dec 25, 2018.  Also, in some of my attempts to connect it, when I clicked the CONTINUE button on the setup web page, I received the message _mmm...can_ reach this page  making me believe there is a bug in the code of the setup page.I am happy that many people are happily using their Echo Dot.  But it failed for us because of what I believe are either bugs or defects.

Title: Love this little device!
Body: So my box fan randomly burst into flames one night. Imagine a fat girl running through the house with a flaming hot fan, it panties and a night shirt, chucking a pillar of fire into the snow.  I tossed at as far as the Cleveland Browns can throw a foot ball, then I had to pick it up and throw it again so it did not catch the house on fire.  Anyways without the noise from the fan to lull me to sleep, I grabbed my Echo and brought it up to my room to play ambient noise for the night.I never slept so good listening to this thing called brown noise, but then my kitchen felt naked because I had no tunes to clean to. I decided we needed more than one Alexa, we needed an upstairs device and a downstairs device. Enter the echo dot. Yes this little baby solved all my problems. She plays the ambient noise at night, plus I linked her to the downstairs Alexa and can drop in to eavesdrop when hubby is talking on the phone. Unfortunately, neither one of us lead exciting lives and he pretty much just talks to his mom.Oh, the best thing about the dot, well let me tell you.  I have two cats who are jerks. I can tell Alexa to open a box of cats and it will meow away. The look of confusion on their furry little faces is priceless!!

Title: Perfect puzzle piece to expand smart home control
Body: We already have Alexa controlling several smart home devices through an Echo Show but wanted to extend voice control upstairs. The Echo Dot is perfect for this task. It's compact and stylish yet has a reasonably powerful speaker. Setup is a breeze when you instruct Alexa to discover new devices. I'm adding a few to cover voice dead zones that are unreachable through my Show located in the downstairs kitchen. The new colors available are cool but there are a zillion covers available if you need it to stand out or blend in with specific room decor. The holiday price was too good to pass up & i'm glad I bought it.

Title: The best Echo Dot so far!
Body: I've upgraded from Echo Dot 2nd Generations, which are awesome, and the only downsides to them are the sound quality for music. The 3rd Generation's 1.6" speaker has a much bassier, fuller sound, and with this improvement, I can't really think of any sort of improvement I'd want. Maybe if the package included wall mounts? The Echo Dot 3rd Generation is truly awesome.I also have Echo 2nd Generations, and an Echo Plus 2nd Generation, and would recommend either as progressive steps upwards in sound quality if you have larger rooms, or just want the best sound quality for any room size. If you're upgrading from an Echo Dot 2nd Generation like me, I would suggest that you use your older Echo Dot 2nd Generations to control your stereos like I do. They're just as smart, and their lesser sound quality disappears when they've got a full stereo through which to play.

Title: DAY 2 w/ Echo Dot and I Love It So Far
Body: I purchased the Echo Dot with an Amazon Gift Card after a co-worker recommended it. No-brainer set up, super easy. Was able to connect to my soundbar as well. I am still learning all the I can do with Alexa but it all seems pretty easy so far. As I cleaned up my home, I was able to check the time, set timers, play music from my play lists, ask the weather, make shopping list, play podcasts, etc. (all hands free). My friends use it to set timers for their kids and ask for conversion measurements while cooking. As you can tell my friends and I have simple needs but Alexa seems like a powerful tool for managing our busy homes. My biggest concern was my young son being able to shop via Alexa was easy to fix (just disable voice purchasing). I look forward to learning more about what Alexa can do.

Title: Huge upgrade!
Body: Knowing how poorly the Echo Dot line had always sounded, I didn_ have much expectations for the new Dot. Amazon, amazingly, has completely blown me away with this generation. There_ some bass with the Dot now and sound 10x better and louder. I_e had the 1st gen Echo from day one and these definitely beat it by a long shot. After hearing how well it sounded, I decided to get another one for stereo pairing and let me tell you, it_ definitely worth it! Especially since Apple Music is now available on Alexa! Highly recommend for anyone wanting to use their Echo speakers for music.

Title: The sound quality is outstanding
Body: There are two things I love about the new echo dot, music quality and the ability to set a routine.For such a small and affordable device, you would be amazed at how high quality the speakers are. I am blown away at the deep bass and  high treble you can hear. Honestly, if I had known the sound is this good on the Dot, I would have probably upgraded to the Echo or Echo plus.Routines are my favorite part about the Dot. I wake up every morning to my favorite Spotify playlist, the morning news, and my daily commute. Would recommend and buy again for my other rooms.

Title: Most hilarious Christmas Gift
Body: My goodness.  I was not really sure that I wanted to purchase this item but after my hubby expressed interest I decided to get it for him as a Christmas gift.  It turned out to the best belly laughs that we have had in a long time.  We listened to our girls (ages 5 and 6) talk to Alexa for over an hour.  They were desperately trying to hold a conversation and on several occasions told Alexa she was their new best friend.  They were concerned when she would not answer (because they did not say Alexa first).  We overheard the crazy request for Michal Jackson Christmas music, and several questions like how many animals are in the world and how much meat is there?  We also learned how many candies there are and how many people to eat them.  All day long the girls have asked me what our computer's name is and how many Taylor Swift songs she knows.  It has been so much fun to watch my kids play with Alexa.  I can't wait to see what else it can do besides make us laugh so much.

Title: Perfect Extension of My Echo
Body: The sound of the  Dot is surprisingly good, sounding rich and full in my living room. It performs the same functions as my Echo and hears me easily from the kitchen. It matches up effortlessly to both of my iPhones and both of my Kindle Fire tablets and to my computer. What I especially like is that I could create an Everywhere entity so music and books play through the Echo and the Dot simultaneously, so I can walk around without missing anything.I recently added a third Dot so I can talk to Alexa from any room, and the sound of music coming from all four speakers is tremendous.

Title: Good sound quality, horrible voice recognition
Body: The sound quality is a vast improvement over the second generation, which basically sounded like a literal garbage can playing music. And this one looks way better too.The only problem I have is it has horrible voice recognition. Many times I say one thing and Alexa interpreted it as something else. And that got frustrating really fast. I even tried saying the same thing to Siri on my iphone just to make sure and she understood me perfectly.Shame, this could have gotten 5 stars from me otherwise.

Title: Loving it
Body: Recently purchased one echo dot 3rd gen, just to try it out, and suddenly found me evangelizing my 3 brothers into getting one, its advantages, capabilities, and add ons towards making our house smarter. They all were converted and ordered 3 new more echo dot 3gen, and can't wait for them to have it, in addition with smart plugs from different brands. So far, have customized several routines, linked my echo with different accounts, calendars, spotify and even more. You should get one of this.

Title: Very good!
Body: This thing is adorable, it_ in my bedroom and I love it. It_ very tiny and cute, listens very well (I don_ have to repeat things or speak overly clearly for it to hear & understand,) and it overall is a great little product. The only downside to it is that I now have to pay for Apple Music in order to listen to all the music I wanted to use it for, which is $9.99 a month. I don_ really mind though, as it_ a great product anyways that can play pretty loud music and has a clear speaker.

Title: No para Republica Dominicana (por ahora)
Body: Despues de unas semanas con el Echo Dot, concluyo que no es muy funcional para utilizarlo en Rep. Dom. incluso con funcionalidades propias de la aplicacion donde no es posible configurarle de forma efectiva algunas rutinas, tampoco de el informe de transito ya que no trabaja con ninguna de las funcionalidades de geolocalizacion instaladas en mi telefono, incluso la mayoria de las Skills no estan disponibles para nuestro paisPor lo tanto para Dominicana si queires utilziar alguna uno de estos dispositivos seria mas funcional considerar el google assistant.

Title: Echo dots in combination with fire TV stick
Body: Just wanting to dip my toes in the water, so to speak, I purchased two 3rd gen echo dots with the latest 4k fire TV stick for my family for Christmas. All in all, this combination made for a minimal investment to try out and see how much we like it before going all in (the dots were on sale 2/$50 at the time). A little backstory--we have a smart TV in our living room and a regular flat screen in my bedroom. Our smart TV isn't really that "smart"--it doesn't allow for all of the apps we like to use, so we've always had it set up with a ROKU. Sadly, I broke our ROKU out of pure clumsiness. I was going to just get another one, but the kids had asked about getting Alexa for Christmas--initially I said no, but the more I thought about it, the more I considered the possibilities. See, my best friend has an echo plus, so I was a bit familiar with it already. After some thought, I got to work reading reviews and information online to see what I could learn. I'm already a prime customer, a kindle unlimited, audible and music subscriber as well. Amazon's array of services are just a part of life here--why not try more of the devices offered?There are mixed reviews out there about the sound quality of the new 3rd gen echo dots--definitely an improvement over past gens, but still lacking in some way. No, they're not the same as the echo plus, but they're not far behind either. I was pleasantly surprised by the rich sounds coming from such tiny devices.I'm sure we've barely touched the tip of the iceberg with everything that can be done with these amazing little gadgets, but my favorite feature is the ability to "drop in" on other echos around your home. Our place seems to have an odd sound barrier between upstairs and downstairs, so I have to yell pretty loudly to get my kids' attention. With the drop in feature, I can just speak to them in another room in a normal tone of voice. In addition to dropping in, you can also tell Alexa to make an announcement to your entire home, like "dinner's ready," or "time to go," etc. I LOVE that. I'm sure lots of moms could relate to needing something like this!I also managed to successfully pair our new fire TV stick with our echo dot in the living room, so without touching anything, I can just tell Alexa what I want to watch. We used this feature on Christmas day when we were lazing about watching TV--we asked Alexa to find Christmas movies and were automatically presented with a list of basically every Christmas movie in existence (also included Die Hard--TYVM). The fire TV stick has a voice control feature if you press a button on the remote, but there was just something so neat about not having to touch a thing.The music possibilities are endless--it makes me feel a little spoiled. Do you ever think of a song you'd like to hear or add to a playlist on your phone, but your hands are full with something else and then oops it leaves your brain entirely? Any song I want to hear, I just tell Alexa to play. And then I can tell her to add it to a certain playlist if I want. I understand that Alexa works with multiple services such as Spotify, Pandora, etc...I don't know how well those are integrated, but as an Amazon music subscriber, the experience is seamless.All in all, I think my next step is to order an additional dot, a fire TV stick for my other TV and most likely an echo plus....maybe a few smart plugs too. I'd like a dot in all major areas of our home for communication purposes and an echo plus in the main living area downstairs for a more room-filling sound quality. Don't get me wrong, these dots sound great, but I'm also aware of how the echo plus sounds, so I would like to have that as well. We are all in with Alexa now. It's a great and fun addition to our home!

Title: The echo fails to impress
Body: I bought it with the hopes that it would do the same some tasks that Google home mini can do. I was wrong. The echo dot is a nice idea and good things could come from it but I am not seeing it. Alexa wouldn't tell me about my orders, couldn't give instructions on carving a turkey, couldn't tell me where the nearest Chinese restaurant is, and can't answer simple questions. The only thing I found decent is that it pulls up the exact song I want to hear. With my purchase Amazon sent me a free 90 days of Amazon music. After looking at it they want .99 cents. That's not free. Side by side with the Google home mini the echo fails to do what Google has nearly perfected. If you are really trying to choose between the 2. I fully recommend the Google home mini over Amazon. For every test I did the echo dot failed to out perform its biggest rival. This product may be great for some but I wasn't impressed by it. Perhaps one day Amazon will beat Google but that's not likely to happen. The echo dot has severe compatibility issues and the app constantly crashes where as I've never had an issue with Google. So I say again go with the Google home mini as this product is a fail out of the box

Title: Customer Service is HORRIBLE
Body: I have 3 echo dots that I love, but I am giving this review 1 star because the echo customer service is awful.  The last dot I purchased does not always respond to the _lexa command and the voice and music is muffled and distorted.  IT IS BRAND NEW AND THEY WILL NOT EXCHANGE.  I was unable to reset my modem and router at their request because family members were in the middle of work and school projects.  I did do a factory reset prior to calling and the device is still defective.  They have me do another factory reset and now I have to wait 2 business days for them to call me back before they will start and exchange process for a brand new defective echo.  I have no issues with my other two devices and I think they are amazing speakers for their size.  My son enjoys the interactive games and audio books.

Title: Horrible Amazon customer service!
Body: After some thought I opted on buying the echo instead of the google device. I should have not done that.I have been trying to import my contacts for two days. I requested multiple verification codes and received none. I have an iPhone 8 so my phone is not the issue.So I tried contacting customer service via the _all me now service. After the usual generic troubleshooting  instructions the system prompts you to press 1 for customer service. Well...I pressed 1 about a million times and I was prompted to press 1 each time! At the end they hanged up on me. This happened 3 times.I_ returning this and getting google.

Title: Potentially good, but surprisingly lacking
Body: AI technology always disappoints, so voice assistants have never excited me much.  Whenever I think they might finally be turning the corner, the technology, and most of its advancements, are lost.The Echo Dot is no exception.  The hardware is nice, capable of many things,  but greed prevents it's software capabilities from being very useful.  It works with a very limited number of smart devices and services, so unless you invest heavily into the Alexa ecosystem, you're mostly stuck with the vastly unneeded services provided by the voice assistant on your phone.I only gave this a 3rd star because the hardware is nice, and despite being mostly useless, the Echo is still one of the leading smart voice assistants.  I've still enjoyed playing with it and I'm hoping the usefulness improves in the future, but as of this moment, the hype is far larger than the usefulness.

Title: Looks great, and can't go wrong!!!
Body: I bought this on a Black Friday sale. And honestly its some of the best $30 I have spent, no lie. I love it. I have it for my barracks room, pair up with two  Lumenty Smart bulbs and I can't be happier enough with it. I didn't know till a few weeks ago but Alex also supports Apple Music which made it even better (Amazon music isn't the best lol).  The speaker on it is decent but I have mine paired with some Bose Companion 2 Series III, and it gets loud. I honestly would reccomened buying one if you have ever been on the fence about buying one to give it a shot, the dot looks amazing waaayyy better then series 2 and when you pair it with some smart lights and speakers its amazing.Pros-Looks way better then series 2 echo-Even when blasting music with my speakers next to it (Alex) is always responsive and has no hearing problems-Alexa supports Apple Music-Cheap and easy way to make a "smart home" or roomCons-N/A

Title: Love it, but will probably lead to world domination.
Body: I love my Alexa dot and find myself slowly growing overdependant on it.  Alexa takes care of my shopping and to do lists, tells me what the weather is, plays music, and chat with me when I'm bored. I don't think it will be long before I buy myself a second echo device, and then possibly a third.  It is this mentality that I feel will lead to Alexa to take over the planet.  Still, even though she'll inevitably be our artificially intelligent overlord, at least she's a NICE artificially intelligent overlord, and I'm pretty sure she likes me, so that's a plus. Still, because it the blatant world domination plans I have to dock a star from my rating.  I hope she dodoesnt hold it against me.

Title: She's Nosy!
Body: I'm returning this for one reason, the continued interruptions of my conversations. Alexa is nosy and gives her opinions when Im on the phone. She is only supposed to speak when spoken to and only when asking her by name. What Irks me is Amazon has known about this flaw but they won't fix it which leads me to believe they want to eavesdrop on us. Effective today Alexa, I'm taking the L out of Lover and its over, sending you back where you came from and buying a Soundbar for good sound quality and no talk back.C ya!

Title: Much Improved DOT Placement Issues
Body: This 3rd generation device replaced a second gen in our master bedroom.  We found the audio quality to be much better than its older sibling, however, it really doesn't compare to the full size Echo devices.  To save on night stand real estate we decided to purchase a wall mounting device.  Surprisingly, mounting the DOT on a wall outlet resulted in a significant deterioration of sound quality.  Adjusting the equalization via the Alexa app didn't help.  It's unclear whether the  resulting boominess of the audio is due to the mounting device or the wall placement.  Since we only use the bedroom DOT for command and news purposes the sound quality issue isn't a big deal for us.  Functionally it works very well.

Title: Uses one of the worst apps known to man!
Body: Seriously, what were they thinking when they made the app for this? Connecting it to a Fire TV basically involved hours of frustration and it still doesn't work! Yes, I've updated everything, made sure they use the same account, quadruple check the internet connections of all devices, installed the needed skills, and made sure all the information was correct. It still won't do the thing it's advertised to do: control my fire stick.So now this thing is basically a fancy speaker with a few nifty voice commands I'll probably never use. There's a reason this thing is so cheap. Save your money and go with the Google Home hub or something similar.

Title: Alexa what a joy to have around
Body: I have to say this is really nice echo dot. Alexa works great and she can remember dates names etc. for future reference. I no long have to look at my phone to check the weather or if I need an answer she will find it for me. My next investment will be a hub that I can use to control my home theater system. This will then become the last man's remote lol. Only flaw I have found is it has a lot of bass making it somewhat difficult to hear sometimes even with the bass turned down. Overall its a great addition to my tech room and will be getting slot of use from it once more accessories are added. I highly recommend.

Title: App is awful
Body: the echo dot has potential, but the app is terrible. not supported by older androids, and different app features depending on the type of phone you have. my son and I were both on android phones and his app had features mine did not. I cannot locate my music playlist anywhere even though my dot created one somewhere for me. I also have no idea where it found my phone contacts from, and have no way to edit it to use new numbers that are on my phone but for some reason my alexa has different older numbers it tries to call instead. the dot itself has potential, but without proper app support its pretty useless.

Title: Works like the earlier version, just prettier looking and the low sound is stronger.
Body: I tried to get it to control the smart wall outlet but couldn't get it to work.  Still use this and an earlier version for news, weather, and as an alarm clock.  Sometimes I ask a question when I don't want to turn on my computer or tablet.  I use it to turn on Pandora radio sometimes.  Whatever I do with it I have to watch how I give the order.  There are many ways to say the same thing but only a few that Alexa can understand.  The electronics are amazing but the computer in the cloud is a work in progress.

Title: Easy set up!
Body: Easiest hookup ever! As a semi-computer literate retiree, I had both of my Christmas gift Echos unwrapped and hooked up in less than an hour. No problems with initial set up because the online menu walked me right through it.My only disappointment is not with the Echo at all, but with my older 2012 Sony Bravia Smart TV which is actually _umb because it doesn_ have an operating system (android or otherwise). I_ sure there is some sort of work-around for this.I_e had a lot of fun playing with Alexa, and when the day comes to start replacing older appliances, I_l make sure they are smart too.

Title: Whole family loves it!
Body: I got the Echo Dot about a week and a half ago and I absolutely love it. Not only do I love it but my entire family loves it. My husband uses it all the time for music. My son figured out that you can ask Alexa to fart and thinks that is the funniest thing!! It was also really awesome to have at Christmas. We were able to track our letters to Santa and then track Santa on Christmas eve! The speakers are nice and clear and loud. I was surprised at how well Alexa can hear and understand me over all of the kids.  My favorite part is being able to control things like the lamp without getting up. I ended up buying one for my teenage daughter and my mom.

Title: Wish they could share timers
Body: My Alexa use started with a fire cube. After finding how much I used Alexa I decided that I neede a few more devices in the house. I a, very pleased with the dots. The one drowned back is that you cannot share timers across devices. Many times I will set a timer in one room and don_ want to miss it because I have moved to a different room.  More importantly I don_ want a timer to go off and have to run to another room in order to turn it off. I can play music across all my echos, it doesn_ seem out of the realm of possibilities to share timers

Title: Love the new generation
Body: I've got an original Echo, an old dot and now this new 3rd generation dot with a Fire TV stick 4K on order.  I'm really getting into the Echo products and this Gen 3 seems to have the sound quality of the original Echo in the size of a dot so, I'm loving it.  I'm really pleased with the 3 generation  dot and Alexa in general.

Title: For the smart and/or lazy family
Body: Sometimes you just don_ need an entire echo. I disguised these as Christmas presents.  Who I actually bought these for is me...so I wouldn_ have to walk down and tell the kids dinner was ready while in the midst of making the dinner.  Now I just say _lexa, make an announcement and I can keep stirring, playing on my phone or doing whatever it is I really need to be doing. And of course the kids have made their own announcements. Ah yes, Alexa is fun for the whole family. Lol

Title: Surprisingly Helpful
Body: Honestly, I never thought of getting an Alexa dot, but now that we have one, I love it and plan to get another for our bedroom. It makes things easier when your hands are full/dirty to just ask a question or play music or read a book while you want some white noise. There are so many devices you can connect to it to as you evolve your house into a smart house which is nice. The disc is small and doesn_ take up much room on the counter either

Title: Quality look and feel, but spoken word audio quality is not as good as gen 2 units
Body: Received as a gift. Looks really nice and much better than gen 2.  However the sound quality for spoken word is not as good.  Alexa Sounds  muffled, not crisp and clear.  Some suggest turning bass down and mid-range and high up.  This helps, but not enough.  I actually put my old gen 2 in the next room, and I went back and forth asking each unit to tell me the weather, so I could listen to a sentence or two.  The new gen 3 unit is not as crisp or clear as the older unit, and is actually difficult to understand at low volumes.  The older Gen 2 units sounds great!  I think music may sound a bit better on version 3, especially bass, but spoken word sounds muffled.  I'm really disappointed since I use it to listen to Audible books and podcasts.  I actually thought mine was defective, and I ordered a second unit, but they both sound the same.  Very disappointing.  I do think the gen 3 unit hears me better and responds more consistently. But to me the poor sound quality of spoken word is enough to cause me not to use it.

Title: Connection and set-up failure
Body: the overseas operators were unable to help --- I sort of expected this based on my recent experiences (3 different people, horrible communications and endlessly redundant questions/answers, way too much wasted time, no help/result) with another Amazon device that i had to return. I thought  maybe it had to do with the Echo version, so I ordered Echo Dot 3, but I had encountered the same 3 issues with the set-up: Echo Off-line (grayed out), cannot download the app (server cannot be found) tho the link was in the Amazon email, Amazon password not recognized even tho I know it was correctI was foolish to even trying to talk to the overseas-based tech support personnel who lacked basic language skills to understand/address any of my issues. Instead, they just repeated the canned set-up process without even acknowledging the core problems i was trying to convey . I asked them to have someone contact me who can help, but they refused. Nowhere to go now, but return the order.

Title: Made for a Great Christmas
Body: I have friends and family who have made fun of me for using the Echo Dot around my home. Well, I gave a few as gifts. "Why would I ever need something like this" fell in love with it the first hour!  The music, the information, the whole Alexa experience made her a huge believer.  The same thing happened with my sister and my niece. They loved it.  Now we also "drop in" to talk to one another. They love it.I'd say it was a huge hit... and based on my personal experiences plus their enthusiastic acceptance, I 'll have to give Alexa and the Echo Dot 5 stars.

Title: Games and skills for every age!
Body: I love my Alexa. Only thing i didnt give her a 5 star review is because i did not realize you had to enable every. Single. Solitary. App.And skill. Before it can be used. Or else you get the message "i dont know that" "sorry i don't know the answer to that" repeatedly because she won't just add that skill automatically. It is not for kids to figure out that is for sure. And i certainly mean no offense.OH and i HATE that you cannot use this without the cord?? Why doesnt it charge or something?I love that it entertains kids of all ages including adults. It is small and compact but when i play music it sounds like a big speaker because the sound can get so high. Its great though. I love the games and skills, even things you didnt even think of. Can't wait to try other Alexa products.

Title: Extremely disappointing Like the previous version better
Body: I purchased two of the new generation dots and replaced 2 of my previous generation.  They have been nothing but trouble.  If our internet goes out, they go out and don't come back on until you put them back in set up mode and go through all of that.  My old dot would wake me up even if the internet was out.  This one does but you can't turn it off without unplugging.  The final straw was when I reset it up last night after having unplugged our modem to change the plugs around.  I got her all set up and then tried to re-input my alarms and she said she wasn't set up for that.  Basically she was pretty dumb about everything but the time and weather. I'm extremely dissapointed.

Title: My home is getting pretty smart by the day.
Body: I am becoming more and more amazed how my home is shaping out to be a Super Smart home.  With the Echo Dot (3rd generation), I've been able to start transforming my house into a "Smart Home" by managing my lights, ceiling fans, audio system, security alarm, etc. into a "smart home".  Aside from some of the most common capabilities Alexa has, I can now make calls from the Echo Dot 3rd.Gen.  Alexa can tell me what's on my calendar, give me reminders, and basically answer any questions that may cross my mind (similar to Siri or Cortana).
