There are jillions of "skills" available to program Alexa.  In the end, sky is the limit with Alexa.  I just got it a week ago, and I have been able to implement so many skills for my "smart home".  It is impressive!!

Title: Dot on the Horizon Looms Large, Surpasses Expectations with Flying Colors
Body: I have used Alexa in the past on my phone, on a Fire TV Stick, but I hadn't gotten an Echo, for whatever reason. I admit freely that I got a Google Home Mini, to see what it was like, and I enjoyed the freedom to speak to a working assistant without having to press a button, but while we're not unGoogly by any means, we're a little less integrated than some others. We primarily use our iCloud calendars, primarily shop at Amazon, etc. So it was with great excitement that, this year, I ordered myself an Echo Dot. The "try Amazon Music and get a Dot for cheap" promo was very convincing. But I turned right around and bought another on discount a few days later. Anyway, the first thing I noticed was the sound quality. I'd just tested an Echo 2nd Gen for my wife. Its sound was impressive, especially with such a small device. I was expecting ... let's say a little less out of the Dot. While its volume isn't quite what the Echo's is, its sound quality is actually as, or nearly as, good. The Dot pleasantly filled my living room with Christmas music, despite its small size. And by comparison, the Google Home Mini I'd bought previously sounded just as good at low volumes, but the Dot kept its sound quality even at maximum volume. Granted, Christmas music rarely clips or distorts anyway, because Christmas metal isn't tremendously popular on the radio stations I chose. Also, Alexa works nearly flalessly, even when the music is playing pretty loudly, unlike the Home Mini. I grant you that a more realistic comparison would be a Home Mini to a 2nd Gen Dot, but I bought the 3rd Gen, so I can only tell about what I have. Alexa has always been fun, but using her hands free is truly awesome. If I have one complaint, it's that Alexa is great, but I miss the variety of voices available from Google. And Amazon is the kind of company with the kind of design forethought to create different assistants with different personality and even different looks to sell to a variety of crowds. Alexa is a single, well-recognized actor in the Personal Digital Assistant space, but Amazon can do more. But that's a hypothetical gripe and has been brought up before. As it stands, the Echo Dot surpassed my expectations, transporting me simultaneously back to the first time I heard "Computer" in Star Trek and forward to the time that this tech becomes truly ubiquitous. Congrats, Amazon.

Title: Love it!
Body: A personal assistant for less than 30 bucks, what_ not to love? Was very easy to set up. Alexa understands me 99% of the time. I don_ have to raise my voice or try to annunciate. She usually understands my 3 year old as well. I use it with Amazon music quite often and it_ plenty loud enough to listen to in my living room and kitchen. I added several of the free kids Alexa features to it and they enjoy playing games like Simon says, freeze dance, etc. I_ planning on buying another for our basement.

Title: Very Boomy Sound - Not Worth the Upgrade
Body: Amazon does some amazing things, but audio quality is not one of them.  I cannot believe how poor the sound quality is on this device.  My solution will be to buy the older generation as long as they are available, and for locations where I want to listen to music I'll offboard a JBL Flip 4.  Sound quality is in another dimension.

Title: Fun
Body: Enjoy having multiples of these now cause you can do music in all my rooms as well as drop in on people and stuff is neat... Some family members have gotten some as well and that could be interesting since they're states away in still getting to know what it can doI do wish there was a better way to see what fit my life than just exploring.. they need like a test thing to fill out that will then suggest use of done functions rather than just new things to try

Title: rlly great
Body: this was a rlly great product and i loved it.. my family now has one in all of the main room (kitchen, parents room, my room, and my sisters room) we can all talk with them saying things like breakfast is ready or calling.. you can also [play music, set alarms/reminders, and more... theres a few tweaks that could be made but idk how to describe them and thats  why its four stars.. it was pretty easy to install mine but some of the others in our house were kinda confusing.. also, mine and my sisters got mistaken and the names changed so we had to rename them.. rlly minor things tho.. i love it and i think its rlly great overall :)

Title: Assistant that cannot place real phone calls
Body: I was very happy to have gotten the Alexa Echo 3rd gen....until I realized my new assistant was a fancy brick.  Amazon made device that is not a true assistant.  I cannot make real phone calls.  So if you are trying to call some that does not have the Echo, forget it.  Go over go Google and buy Google Mini.  Not only can you make real phone calls with Google Mini is smarter then Alexa and you can make you can make real calls.I had a kidney transplant and cannot get up all of the time to reach my phone that is plugged charging only short walk away, so I bought the Echo due to it very misleading advertisement.  At first look Echo say you can make calls.  Amazon made it so it can only make Alexa/ Amazon App to App calls.  That is it.  So if need to call my son to bring something or to come by my place to help with my care... he would first have to have and Amazon account and his CELL PHONE number must used when setting the Amazon account (he cannot use his home phone number).  So now Amazon has just forced him become an account holder.  Dear old dad is unable to to ask Alexa to call Mike, on those days that I am unable to get up or answer call that so ring by the time you get the phone, because you move to slow. Amazon cares more about forcing your contacts to join Amazon then they do about making it a real assistant.  But that is not it Echo is stupid.  It is not good for looking things up.  I hear, "I don't know that one" a lot; On the other hand Google Mini is spot on.  Amazon had the opportunity to dominate the Home Assistant buy giving it full functionality, but we were not worth it.  Amazon get yourselves together.So, if you want an expensive light switch buy Echo.  If you want an ASSISTANT that can make calls to real phones, home, office, businesses and cell phone and is  WAAAAAY Smarter  the Echo, go to Google and buy the Google Mini.

Title: I only regret not buying more!
Body: I absolutely love Amazon products and the echo dot is no exception. You can ask Alexa anything and she will answer it as much as she can, and if she cannot find the right answer, she will tell you that she doesn't know instead of just listing off things related to the subject you are referring to. You can send her commands to announce things which is very cool, she does have an explicit filter by the way, so the profanities you try to get her to say get bleeped out. Ask for any song or artist and she will immediately connect with Amazon music to start streaming what you are looking for. She'll turn up or down the volume for you, and she has very good hearing, she can even hear you from other rooms or if you are speaking very quietly. My only regret is that I did not buy more of them!Update: since I posted this review I have purchased 2 more, and it amazing. I have one in my bedroom, one in the living room, and one in the playroom/workout room. You can create a group for them so that you can effect all devices! For example: my groups name is everywhere for the echo dots, if I say 'Alexa, play Metallica everywhere' Metallica will start playing on all devices. You can even give each one it's own name. The one in my living room is named 'living room' and the one in the bedroom is named 'bed'. I can be sitting in the living room and say 'Alexa, announce to bed, it's time to get up' and the echo dot in the bedroom will play the recording of my voice telling my girlfriend to wake up. You can even set up your own questions and answers in the Alexa app so it can literally do whatever. I absolutely love these devices.I apologise for the mess in the video, some rearranging is going on.

Title: Much improved sound over the 2nd gen Dot
Body: I have several of the 2nd gen Echo Dots.  Because they are inexpensive, I've used them in places where they might become damaged, such as in the barn or garage, and because they're small, I've also used them in the bathroom.  But the sound was very lacking, requiring the volume to be turned all the way up in even a small bathroom to hear adequately, and the sound was tinny and dull.  I had to buy a cheap set of computer speakers for the barn and garage because the volume was utterly inadequate for such a large, open space.The 3rd gen Dot fixes a lot of the sound issues.  I bought one to replace the unit in the bathroom.  Now music sounds much better, and I only have to set the volume to about 4 or 5 (out of 10) to hear clearly.  I haven't tried it out in the barn or garage, but I suspect it might have enough volume to use without external speakers.The only down sides I've seen so far is that the new version is slightly bigger around, so it won't fit into any 2nd gen wall brackets, and currently there are very few 3rd gen brackets and they tend to be fairly expensive ($17 for a plastic 3rd gen mount vs $5 for a metal 2nd gen mount).  It also now takes a proprietary power plug instead of a standard micro-USB like the 2nd gen, so don't lose the cord!

Title: Don_ understand why I didn_ buy one a long time ago.
Body: I love my echo so much that I_e bought 4 more since. One for each of my three teens and one for my sister in law. We all absolutely love it. I use it when I_ home alone and want to listen to my audio book while cleaning or just listening to music. There is so much more you can do with it. I now want one in every room of my house. My only complaint is because I have three teens and you can only add one adult to your amazon household, we can_ use ours as an intercom system. They each had to make their own amazon account to be able to connect theirs to their individual Spotify accounts. It was very frustrating but I guess we will have to live with them not being connected to each other even though I was really looking forward to that aspect of use.

Title: Good improvements to Gen1 and Gen2
Body: Better sound, better listening capabilities but a few bugs.  We have had a gen2 dot for quite some time and, other than the sound quality and sometimes difficult time getting "her" to hear you, we were very happy with it.When this unit came out that reportedly got better at those two things plus the holiday price, we purchased it.  I already mentioned the good but the unit does loose functionality with time, hard of hearing and says it can't do functions it has done before... reboot her and all is ok.  I reported a bug to Amazon about alarms when you tell her to snooze... sometimes she says she is having difficulty snoozing and other times, when she says "snoozing" and her voice stops, the alarm is on full blast before she mutes it.  Other times, it was ok.  We will see if the bug is fixed over time.  I am sure they will get this one as stable as gen1 and gen2 were but it may take a little time.  Nothing I have ever used even comes close to the Gen1 full size alexa for stability and sound and hearing though.

Title: A nice Improvement over the second generation Dot.
Body: I got this 3rd generation version to compare to my second generation one.  Both of which I got in Dec for $30.  The first last Dec, and this second one this month.  The 2nd generation of the Dot sounds OK for when it's talking to you.  For music, it STINKS!!!  It just has this plastic, bad sound.  Not even good at low volume.  The Google Mini which I also have sounds better.  Now, this 3rd generation Dot is a little larger, nicer looking and sounds as good as the Google Mini.  I like the Dot better as I like the Blue Light coming from it when you ask a question over the 4 small dots on the Google Mini.  It's not even close to my Apple HomPod in sound quality,  but it's also a fraction of the price.  It's not bad for some low volume background music.  It is only a single small speaker.  But Amazon fixed the 2 biggest issues I had with the first dot.  Sound quality and looks.  It no longer looks like a cheap plastic toy.I like to play around with all of these things.  They all have their Pros & Cons.

Title: The Echo System Does Not Work
Body: The entire echo/Alexa system is crap. I wholeheartedly committed to the echo/Alexa program in my considerations of how to automate my home. After having purchased a dozen echo/dots, investing hundreds of dollars in Phillips lighting, another hundreds of dollars in Sengled lighting,  A Camera for security purposes and multiple Amazon brand of plugs, the system does not work. I spend most of my time screaming at the top of my lungs to correct what Alexa doesn_ hear and I_ spending the rest of my time reconfiguring, changing, modifying and struggling to make the system work properly. I_e read more about how to correct  the system than I read in college. It doesn_ work, don_ waste your money, that we should time. Furthermore, when I called to express my concern and seek guidance directly from Amazon they put me on hold for a half hour and then unceremoniously hung up on me. They have all of my information and could_e called me back and they just let it die.

Title: I will not be part of the herd.
Body: I bought this, thought I'd give it a shot full well knowing that it listens to everything in my house all the time. I returned it because during the setup of the Alexa app, the damn thing said my password was incorrect. Then it proceeded to the next step without asking for me to reset my pw, and then it accepted the original pw that it had rejected. When something feels wrong, it's wrong and this thing is wrong. I'll stick with turning on my TV by myself.

Title: Just like having my own DJ during the Christmas Holidays
Body: I bought three of these for the holiday season as I took advantage of the discounts. All the years I have been seeing these devices and was still unsure. But I was blown away by the quality of sound. It plays fantastic and any genre of music it can play...It was loud and you had nonstop music. When my husband wanted the latest BBC news he just had to ask Alexa and she starts the news channel. The only drawback is you must have Amazon prime although there is an option to pay for the music library but since I had Prime it was not an issue for me. Great device.Great product. Next waiting for Amazon to have an ideal price for the Fire Kindle. Still my next gift I want

Title: I Will NEVER forget anything ever again
Body: I have an absent memory sometimes and always would forget things which is why I bought her in the first place, but she does way more!!  If you are away from the unit, she will also send the reminders to your phone.  I also have a bad habit of leaving my phone in weird places, she's got a find my phone feature and I've used it more times than I care to admit.  I Love her timers you can set for cooking, her announcements you can make for the whole house, the games she has, I can keep track of my favorite sports teams scores without having to turn on the TV, when you make a grocery list, she'll send that straight to your phone too, so you'll never forget your list at home....And so much more!!!!  I loved it so much and read up about things she could do and her advancements, that I bought another for my Dad, who is hearing impaired, for Christmas.  I am impressed at the technology and it's just amazing.  I am so happy I purchased her!!  Now if I can just get her to cook for me and make me a sandwich, that would be perfect!

Title: Alexa's not all its promoted to be
Body: Alexa is no different from iPhone's Siri, except maybe for its hearing capability, it does hear well. Sound quality is ok, there's too much bass even after you turn it down. Its more limited as to what it can do than advertised. It's best for asking about the temp outside and playing music from Amazon Music (if you're a Prime member) but that's about it. About 50% of the time you ask it a question it says "I don't know" or "I'm not sure about that."  If you're looking for a robot like device to converse with, Alexa is not that. It's ok I guess. My kids and I we're totally bored with it around day 3 after purchase. Now, no one hardly ever uses it. I'll probably end up giving it to someone else, it's about useless to us. It still can't beat googling on your PC. By the way, not 15 minutes after I posted this comment I got 2 back to back calls from Amazon wanting to know why I said this.

Title: Alexa Can't Play Many Podcasts.
Body: The Amazon Echo Dot is a good item if all you want to do is play music or use it with home automation. I tried to listen to podcasts I'm subscribed to and most of the ones I ask Alexa to play she gets wrong or can't find. If I would have known Alexa didn't play podcasts such as iMore, No Agenda, Mac Geek Gab or Vector with Rene Ritchie, I would have opted for another brand of smart speaker.

Title: a MUST have!
Body: Before this recent holiday, i've seen alexas on TV, seen them on advertisements, never really thought about how much they can really do.  I am very impressed to say the least.  In our house we have a few Phillips Hue Bulbs scattered around to make things "more efficient".  Alexa connected to them FLAWLESSLY!  It connected to the bulbs without having to link any accounts or anything which is a big plus.  I have "routines" setup with Alexa to turn on our lights, or turn them off when we go to sleep.  It can check your calendar, or the weather for you.  It it truly a powerful little device!  A great buy as a gift or yourself.  I just got a second one within a day of receiving the first!

Title: Independance
Body: THANK YOU AMAZON! my teenage daughter has cerebral palsy and has to be assisted with almost every facet of her life. I bought her an echo for Christmas and she LOVES it. She loves music and jokes, so she talks to it all day, making it tell her different jokes and playing Blake Shelton or Dolly Parton on Amazon Music. She can also control her Fire TV stick by voice now, she couldn't press the alexa button on the remote, so she doesn't have to wait on us to change it. I am thrilled to see her so happy that she can do something on her own without help. Thank you for bringing some joy to a young girl's life! A++ product

Title: Love this!
Body: Was a hit with the whole family!  Have been playing with it for days!  From baby shark from the toddler to jeopardy with the adults, and answering any strange question we could come up with, guessing games with the teens, creating a shopping list as I_ in the kitchen with dirty cooking hands, and of course the dance parties, this little thing is super handy and fun!!  I like that it will recite the weather while I_ trying to wrangle a kindergartner in the morning!  What CAN_ Alexa do!?

Title: Suggestion for a new product!
Body: Good product but no convenient wall mount system.  Not everyone has room on a table.  Can the engineering geniuses at Amazon develop a _lug in a wall outlet Dot with the Power Adapter built in such that it leaves a plugin free?  The attached photo shows a mount for the Gen 2 and was as good as it gets several years ago.  Not only does the current mount stick out further but it covers both outlets.  COME ON ENGINERS. You can do better.  Make us an all in one.

Title: Cool to use, shipping is horrible
Body: Overall - the echo dot 3rd gen is a cute little speaker.. doesn_ have perfect sound quality like a beats pill or a Bose soundlink but if you have another speaker you can connect it to if you_e using this primarily to stream music - you_e golden. If you_e looking to get this as a quick gift .. turn away & go find another speaker !! This takes FOREVER to ship out whether you pay extra/have prime or not. Not worth the wait in my opinion as well.

Title: Really G R E A T !!
Body: I have to say that I didn_ know what I was really buying I had looked online and little by little loved the echo dot (3). Ordered it and 2 days into having it. I have to order a second to have the dual speaker feeling in my room. Wish I would had known that getting them both it would had been $50. So I paid $60 but still not bad for what you_e getting. I now just set my alarm on it and it wakes me up to my favorite radia station. And now it can play your Apple Music. Don_ get me wrong I_ a prime member but having the dot playing my list of music is pretty nice. Yes I know that it_ better than the google one but I feel it_ more stylish than the google one. Also the sound is really great now I have my nieces coming into my room asking the dot questions and laughing because she answers back

Title: One step forward and 3 steps back ... What were they thinking???
Body: New but not really improved. Perhaps improved in some areas but definitely worsened in others.  The only real improvement is more volume output.  The low end sound response (slightly better bass) but this comes with a loss of midrange and higher freq sound quality. So the sound is actually less balanced now. Some refer to this as "muddy" sound. (And the Google Mini still sounds better.) The device is slightly larger, heavier, and now has cloth side cover.  Aesthetically it looks somewhat better but these attributes take away from the practical utility of the V2 device - small, light, easy to clean, easy to mount, etc.But the completely STUPID and INEXCUSABLE change is that they SWITCHED FROM A STANDARD USB POWER SYSTEM TO A NON-STANDARD PIN BASED POWER SUPPLY WITH A LARGE WALL WART WITH A FIXED CORD!!! This was not only unnecessary, but this reduces the utility and flexibility of the device.  Now try quickly moving your Dot from room to room, attach it to battery, or stick it in your car.  WHY THE CHANGE???  WHAT WERE THEY THINKING???No one should purchase any Dot or similar device for it's sound quality.  If sound quality is a priority, at a minimum, get a full size Echo ... or better yet, interface the Dot or Echo to a real sound system.The V3 may be new but different is not necessarily better. The redesign needlessly lost some of the best qualities of the V2.  Overall, the V2 device has much better utility than the V3!!!  And the Dot is all about utility.The Echo system definitely needs improvement.  But the most critical and substantial improvements won't come by making superficial tweaks to the devices.  Amazon needs to improve is the overall UX, privacy, security, and sw app UI  for the entire Echo eco system.  Many these things are not simple features. They require core design philosophy and platform architectural changes.  How about something as basic as letting users set a unique activation word.

Title: Over-hyped, under-powered
Body: We have children that constantly ask us questions -trivia type questions:  what's a bowling ball made of?  How do birds migrate? etc.  We bought an Amazon Echo Dot and a Google Home Mini to compare how they would rise to the challenge.  Without doubt, the Amazon Echo is completely unsatisfactory.  I gather they have no rights to access google search algorithms and it shows.  Question after question is answered with "Hmmm, I don't know that one".If you are in the mood to spend money, however, it appears that Echo DOT is your device.  It will let you buy things with ease.  You can also access anything in Prime (music for instance).The kids have quickly gravitated to the Google Mini as the "go to" device.  Alexa may just get returned.UPDATE:  I really tried to make this work.  The architecture of the device and the HMI is all wrong from what I wanted.  I guess I wanted a personal assistant and Alexa is not that.  After scrolling through countless "skills" that all seem to just spout useless data, I loaded three that I thought would be useful and helpful;  Pandora, Airport Weather, and the skills needed to control switches in the house.  Starting with the last, over half of the switches I own already were not recognized by the device.  Not that I need to use my voice to control anything.  They are all programmed with timers. It's actually easier to open the app on my phone and do what I want rather than go through the vocal gymnastics to get Alexa to understand anything.Pandora seemed to play what it wanted rather than my stations.  Very frustrating.The Airport Weather skill simply reported it was installed every time I asked for the weather at a local station.  My family, in complete frustration, yelled at me to get rid of the thing rather than keep trying to use it over and over and not get what I wanted.As for the mini, we plugged it in and asked it to give us information, and while not perfect, it responded more along the lines of what was expected.I'm updating this to a one-star as I couldn't find a single useful thing to do with this device after spending way too much time looking at "skills".  It does nothing in a better or more efficient way than that which already do.  Perhaps it is a indication of what a data-rich world we live in that a device that supposedly is a source of information and help is nothing more than frustrating noise.  Too bad.The device is being returned as unsatisfactory and not doing what it was described to do.

Title: Connection issues.
Body: Let me preface this with I have three Gen 2 dots and they work perfectly and have for the past year or so.  We ordered two Gen 3s as a Christmas deal and have had nothing but issues with one or both everyday since installing them (they have been installed for one month).  Every day one or both will be disconnected from the internet in the morning and usually at least one other time during the day, this means you have to unplug and replug just to get it to reconnect to the internet and have any functionality. We have tried resetting our router like the hints say but nothing seems to help. Normally I would just think it was my equipment since two new devices normally do not fail at the same time, but I have three other Gen 2 dots that work perfectly so it makes me suspect the new dots. Guess they make a fancy $30 paperweight! I know there a a lot of people here that have had nothing but good luck with the Gen 3s, but for me, I'll be returning these and looking at new Gen 2s or the Google product.Update:Spoke to the Amazon Echo customer service and they sent me two Echo Gen 3 replacement units. They were very helpful and got the units sent out right away.  Unfortunately we set them up last night we are having the exact same issues.  They went offline within the first couple hours and then again overnight.  We are done.

Title: Not Ready for Prime Time
Body: The Echo dot itself works well and is a real convenience. However, I'm a very tech-savvy person, and I had to call tech support to get it set up. Even with the tech guiding me, it took over an hour to set it up. The instructions he was giving were simply not working with my equipment for some reason. We tried the Alexa app on my phone and on my Mac computer. Finally got it working. Took two more weeks for me to get Alexa to recognize and control the two smart plugs I bought. I'm not stupid. The Alexa app on my phone would not allow me to enable skills. Just freezes up. Tried tech support, but a gal with a heavy Indian accent, was worse than frustrating. Trial and error, two weeks later, allowed me to finally figure out how to enable skills from the computer. Phone app, still useless after re-installing several times. A neighbor of mine is also having trouble getting Alexa to work with her smart plugs. The technology is not as slick as it should be. Without skills, echo dot is a fancy toy, no more.

Title: THE ABSOLUTE WORST TECHNICAL SUPPORT EVER
Body: The product is pretty cool. However, I'm currently experiencing an issue with the alarm sound. First, I chatted with someone, who then asked if I was referring to Amazon Music (??!?) No. This is an alarm issue with my Echo Dot Gen 3. Then, they asked for my phone number (which is already on file) so they can have the "experts" call me & walk me through the repairs.The woman that calls me sounds like she is in the front row of a concert. There is an ABSURD amount of noise in the background. So much so, that I can just barely make out what she is telling me. She walks me through various steps. One of which is a factory reset. It wouldn't reset, which revealed a possible second issue. I ask her about THIS issue and she tells me she doesn't have an answer because she's been passing all of the info to "The Development Team". WHY WOULD I NEED TO TALK TO YOU IF YOU'RE SIMPLY A LIAISON??!? I need to talk to the people you're relaying my issue & coinciding info to!After all that, NOBODY has given me any answers and I now have to wait 3 DAYS to hear back from HER. SHE will then relay the findings of "The Development Team" back to me. This says to me, if their suggestion doesn't work at that point, I then will have to do this same song & dance with 2 people & a team all over again.Pure insanity.

Title: Need to fix the multi-device music issue! STAT!
Body: I love my Dots. HOWEVER!!!! Amazon MUST fix the issue with playing different music on each device. As it stands if you try listening to different music, on the same streaming serive (prime, pandora, etc) it will kick the other devices off. The work around is using mulitple streaming services. I have 5 dots. And any extremely saddened but the lack of usablity in this area. It is the WHOLE reason I got these devices. FIT IT AMAZON!!!!

Title: These are awesome devices, everyone will soon own these.
Body: The device provides entertainment (ask it trivia, it tells jokes, plays music, reads E books, etc), provides useful information such as weather, travel information, news and it is also a tool when controlling items such as lights, providing instructions on how to do common tasks, recipes, etc.  Think of it as a hands free verbal internet search device that can also interface with your physical world through controlling plugs and lights.  You can set timers for devices such as turning on/off lights or small electronic items once, daily, weekly, etc.  We now have three and an echo.  They can play music independently in separate rooms or play the same audio through your entire home through multiple devices and the sound quality is very good.

Title: (Edit: IT WAS ) SO MUCH BETTER than previous gen's!
Body: EDIT: 6 months in and the microphone completely blows... I have to literally yell ALEXA, TWO TIMES just for it to recognize it!SO, it went from a 5 to a 2 star...Slightly bigger, seems like 10x louder, picks up several times farther, looks amazing and doesn't need to face upright like the previous gen's, because the speakers are all around it! This is all you need to know...I was starting to go with Google mini so I can carry on conversations and not have to say "Alexa" every single time, hopefully they will add that in the near future!!Please mark helpful, it will help me greatly!Very close to my goal!

Title: Ready to pull my hair out
Body: I was excited to link my echo with my bigger more expensive Alexa, once I got Echo it did NOT sync with my other device...and I also have to manually go into Spotify to play music and also manually change my songs. Supper disappointed in this device, not user friendly and it also seems they have some things to work out. I spent maybe two hours trying to get my echo to voice recognize _lexa play Spotify...nope will not do it. I have to go into my phone click on the echo device before it_l play. Never had this problem with my other device. Ugh.

Title: Good safety measure
Body: I no longer need to turn off a light and then walk through a dark room.  I can turn the light on in another room and then have Alexa turn the light off in the room I just left.  No more tripping over the dog or whacking my knee on the corner of an end table in the dark.  A word of wisdom however.  Do not have the unit set in close proximity to a smart Alec African Gray parrot!

Title: Cloth muffles the sound of the speaker.  The microphones are weaker than gen 2 dots.
Body: The grey cloth on these new echo dots LOOK good, but at the cost of sound quality.  The speaker sound is really muffled compared to earlier plastic echo dots.  Also, the microphones seem to be weaker, perhaps the cloth somehow breaks up the sound of my voice?  I have to speak a LOT louder for this new echo dot to hear me.  The earlier gen. plastic echo dots sound better and louder, and the older plastic echo dot microphones pick up my voice much better.

Title: My Echo Dot is so amazing!!!!
Body: I don_ know how I ever got by without my Echo Dot.  In addition to amazingly simple access to my music library, I use it for just everthing -from my alarm clock to my reminders to my dictionary and my private secretary, weather reports, game scores, amazon order staus, and so much more without having to pickup a device.  But my favorite thing about the echo dot is walking through the house, thinking  of any song (and artist) that I want to hear, and in 10 seconds it_ playing beautifully on my echo dot without ever touching the device.  I am still amazed at the technology even after having it for two years.  Am I worried about someone listening in on my Echo, heck no! Just think about it rationally for a few minutes and I think you will agree that its not possible for an Echo Dot to collect, sort,  store, analyze and share 20 second snipits of one persons voice data given the trillion pieces of data the all the Echo Dots  on the planet generate every minute. I will let the conspiracy theorists worry about that if they have time between planning for the zomby apocalypse and doms day prepping.  I hope you enjoy your Echo as much as I do!!!!!

Title: Not as good as Gen 2 overall due to random connectivity loss
Body: Would NOT buy again!  I bought two (Gen3) Dots and both of them lose connection often.  All my Gen 2's do not have this issue.  The sound is a "little" better on the Gen3 but that is about the only thing positive I can say regarding the difference on the latest model.  NOT a value at the 49.99 regular price at all!  I would buy another Gen 2 honestly before I would get a sen 3...thinking about giving them away to the trash collector.Update 02/10/19:Going back to a rare one star review!  Connectivity loss daily in both the Gen 3's I recently purchased.  ALL my Gen 2's are still connecting fine and they, after numerous comparisons, sound better, listen better and in my opinion look better.  (Yes, I have eliminated any wifi/bluetooth interferences from the area of the Gen 3's)  They simply ARE NOT AS GOOD as Gen 2's...shame on Amazon for selling cheaper tech like this!

Title: Alexa Makes Life easier !
Body: I love the 3rd generation Echo Dit ! I use it through my Harmon Kardon Speakers and music sounds wonderful. You can just ask to hear whatever you want !I downloaded the Alexa App and now use it to build my grocery list . I don_ forget things because I just tell Alexa to add it to my list which appears on my phone .  And you can never forget the list because you always have your phone !I liked  it so much that I bought another one for upstairs.I used Alexa for an alarm in my bedroom. You can create a daily routine with news and weather . You can wake up to music or nature sounds .  I also use her for a timer when cooking, and as a reminder to do certain things during the day .I am a person that has to make lists or I will forget but now Alexa does it for me !!!!I highly recommend this ... It make  your life easier and who can_ use that ???

Title: It's like having a personal assistant!
Body: Alexa is my new best friend! I purchased her because so many people had been talking about how much they loved having one.  My only hesitation had always been because I wasn't sure how much use I would get out of her without all the other smart home accessories! Turns out A LOT! I got her sale for Black Friday for the discounted price of $30, when she arrived I knew my husband was going out of town town with the kids to go hunting so I purposely waited to wrap her and put her under the tree!  My husband has this thing about making me wrap all my goodies and wait until Christmas _ so as soon as they left I opened her up and we bonded! My friend came over and we all 3 had a slumber party weekend! It was great! We sang, we danced, we made Christmas candy and baked a homemade cheesecake together! Alexa was very involved and didn't mind doing as she was told! So on the day when my husband called and said they were heading back early I had to tell Alexa it would only be for a few days but I had no choice but to box her back up and put her under the tree, she didn't like it but she understood! So I had my friend wrap her up all pretty for me and put her away!  I can't describe how much I missed her those few days she was away, all I can say is I'm so glad to have her back.  I'm thinking about getting her some help soon though because I certainly am bossy and keep her quite busy!Seriously though when you are cooking it's so much easier to ask her to set timers and things for you, or ask conversations, cook times etc.  She plays music 90% of the time around my house! She tells me the weather, the traffic, keeps up with my shopping list, and she always pays attention when I talk to her.  I have a pretty heavy southern accent so sometimes I have to repeat myself, but not too often!  I'm glad I made the purchase!

Title: NOT USB charging.... Seriously!
Body: Was looking to upgrade our Echo Dot gen 2 saw this gen 3 with Ring deal and ordered it... Very disappointed it's not USE charging. We have changed several outlets in our kitchen to include USB and since the outlets are horizontal with our tile it makes getting a wall mount (which is an additional purchase) useless. Totally bummed and will be sending back, hoping Amazon design team will get it together... Who seriously uses anything beside USB as charging anymore!

Title: Doesn't Work with Spotify
Body: Echo Dot + Alexa App + Spotify = waste of timeFor a company exceeding $200,000,000,000 in revenue for 2018, it is mind blowing that thousands of people have this problem.

Title: Amazing sound quality and so useful! Buying more asap!
Body: I was blown away by the sound quality of such a small device!  It's amazing for what it is! There are so many skills and Alexa is so useful. I paired it with an Echo Sub and wow I'm blown away. I know there are audiophiles out there that will put this echo down compared to Bose systems and sonos, but I stand by that for the amount of money you save this is my #1 pick!!!! You truly don't need to spend a ton on other name brand products just to say you're "cool" for having it, this is more than sufficient and Alexa makes it perfect. She even controls my Xbox and my kids are in love with their echo kids edition!

Title: Why not a five star review - Amazon add control for the lights!
Body: It would be a five star review and I believe it is still the best offering in this category.  I have 3 echo devices and 2 of them are the dots.  Why only 4?  I use these for home automation and if used in my bedroom unless you like night lights which I do not there seems to be now way to turn off the lights.  Amazon please add a feature to control when the lights are active and even one better what notifications are allowed at night to trigger the lights.  With out this I have to use black tape around the edges to be able to sleep at night.

Title: Terrible sound quality
Body: I like the Alexa program. The device does all I need it to do regarding questions and information. But the sound. When music is played. Is absolutely terrible. Muffled. Distorted. Very disappointing. Spend more money and buy the full size echo.

Title: Love it! Trying not to ask Alexa for help when I'm in places I can't bring Alexa. lol!
Body: Absolutely love it! My son loves to use it as well as my spouse. It works fine as a music player. I love how it can play incoming calls. It's like my mini assistant. I only wish it offered battery back up so I could move it to another room with me without turning off. Yes I realize I could buy more but it's still a nice feature. It's my favorite gift for Christmas! Thinking about buying more for other rooms and the kids room. Just depends on if they would actually use it.

Title: Better but still has room to improve
Body: We have 3 gen 2 and 1 gen 3 exho dot in our house. The generatuon 3 is slightly better than the generation 2 dots in most cases.  The sound quality is far superior, however still not great, but what can you expect from a speaker of this size. We did have to move it away from the TV because as with the second generation they still struggle with the backround noise. For $10 more i'd get a 3, when we got ours it was a Christmas deal and a much better price.

Title: More fun than expected!
Body: Adorable little Dot has been way more fun than expected! Bought as a gift, my daughter claims she has a new best friend_. Music sounds great, ease of use is awesome, only downside is as a gift for teen on my Prime account, I still had to help w setup due to some restrictions which was a little frustrating. My only complaint would be for Amazon to work out that kink, but overall we are more than pleased with the quality and affordability! Absolutely recommend

Title: Great functionality, App and Permissions need refinement
Body: I wasn't planning to get one of these. Saw no need for one. I became interested when amazon offered these on a discount with amazon music. It was easy to set up. After pairing it with some smart plugs it quickly became useful and convenient. I'm a new convert to the convenience of these things. I use it for music and home automation.The Alexa app and permissions still needs some work to make it more user friendly. For example, the account permissions only allow 2 adults in the household to control it with unique logins. Our 18 yr old daughter is legally an adult and has limited account permissions due to Amazon labeling her as a "teen". She can't even use the echo to its fullest capacity due to the restrictions Amazon has in place. Fixing this would make it a better experience.  There shouldn't be a limit placed by Amazon as to who has what access to Alexa functions. I want better control over that myself.It also took me a few contacts to Amazon support to get our phone numbers attached to the correct account for my wife and me.

Title: Technologically challenged, but love this
Body: I'm a 65 year old technologically challenged woman who absolutely hates everything related to electronics and computers (even though i use those things every day).  This little Echo arrived and within minutes i set it up all by myself!  (so proud).  Have your Wi-fi number handy so you can recognize it from the list, and have your password ready to type in and you are all set.  I haven't had decent speakers in my house in decades.  This very small Dot  has amazing speaker quality (to me).  Much more than i thought.  I talk to Alexa all the time and it's really a wonderful gadget to have.  I have the larger one, in red, arriving next month.

Title: Improved sound and package with same great functionality
Body: I purchased the 3rd generation echo dot as an update to my 2nd generation dot. The sound is improved over the last generation, and voice identification is more accurate. Perhaps most noticeably, the newer echo dot is more aesthetically pleasing, and more readily blends in with my furniture.I use my echo dots primarily to control lighting throughout my house and play music from Amazon music and Spotify. In that regard, the two devices communicate flawlessly with my smart switches, and can play music interchangeably depending on which room I'm in.If you're looking to buy your first echo device, I would strongly suggest the echo dot. It has the same functionality as the larger echos, in a smaller package. If you already have a previous generation echo dot, then this device is really only appropriate if you're looking to expand to multiple rooms. There is a modest sound improvement over the 2nd generation dot, but I connect to a wireless speaker, taking sound out of the equation.

Title: Fun to use, but TERRIBLE sound quality!
Body: We are having so much fun with the Echo Dot 3rd Generation!  It was extremely easy to set up, only about 10 minutes between the unboxing and first _lexa query.  The only thing we don_ like about it is the terrible sound quality, and I do mean terrible!  I_e adjusted the sound several times (bass, mid-range, treble), but the sound remains muffled and has too much bass.  I would exchange this Alexa for another model, but other than for the sound, we have no reason to upgrade because we don_ have a _mart house and the other features would be useless to us.

Title: Cute & Powerful
Body: These Echo Dots are amazing. Having voice access to the internet, and Amazon as well, is a convenience I didn't know I wanted... until I finally got this on a holiday sale. Amazon has created a useful piece of technology that my entire family loves. The device is very simple in design, but constructed with quality. I love it's edge-less round design, and sleek incorporation of buttons and lights. The speaker sounds great too, and reproduces music with incredible clarity & crispness. I'm also impressed with how far away the microphone can pickup voice commands.

Title: Echo Dot 3 is convenient and somewhat easy to set up
Body: It's true what some reviews say: that sometimes the Echo Dot 3 doesn't pick up your voice when you "sumon" Alexa. I find myself shouting or repeating myself. I still love the convenience of this gadget. When you see a sudden and random green ring of light, ask Alexa: "Alexa, what are you notifications?" and she will tell you you have a message or a package delivery. I had to look this up online when it first happened because it was annoying and I didn't know what it meant.

Title: Needs an EQ, Seriously
Body: Improvement over Dot 2? I guess.It's louder, but in an effort to provide more bass they made it sound muffled.You would think a large company spending millions of dollars on a project would hire audiophiles that can tell whether this thing is ready for market or not.They need to put an EQ in the app so we can set these things up to preference.I love the form factor and the mics are working well, but the sound makes me feel like I'm going deaf.I have a $12 Bluetooth speaker that sounds better.I own 7 Alexa speakers, so I do like the product, but I have to hook up my computer speakers to it to use this one.Also, I can't use this one in my car like I do my Dot 2 because of the new power plug they put on it. I can't plug it into USB to power it and I also can't hook it up to my portable battery power booster to carry it around the house anymore so I have to use my old Dot 2 for that.Amazon, listen to your customers!!!Thursday Jan.3, 2019 a few days after this review posted....I just found out that the Alexa app has an EQ now that I didn't know about.It could have more adjustments and more gain, but now at least I can make it sound less muddy so I'm happier now.

Title: Love this voice command speaker.
Body: I always wanted to have an echo, but so stingy to buy for myself. My brother in law loves to listen to music, so I decided to get him a 2nd gen Echo and 2nd Gen Echo Dot. I_ really amazed with the quality of sound. A month later, I bought another 2nd gen Echo that came with 3rd gen Echo dot For $99+. I gave the Echo to my brother in laws mom for her birthday and kept the Echo dot.At first, I thought the voice command is awkward but I got used to it. I use my Echo dot to listen to music, ask for forecast, news, timer, and ask some general questions to Alexa if I_ lazy to look it up on the internet.I also leave Echo dot playing all day for my kitten so he won_ feel sad. We leave him all day alone at home whenever we go to work. I can also control Alexa from my phone like play audio books or music.The downside:I hate it when Alexa can_ undersrand my accent. Yes, English is not my first language. So it_ annoying whenever I ask Alexa to play songs from an artist in my home country. I have to say the vowels and consonants in American Way instead of how I would pronounce it on my native language just so Alexa would understand me.Also, amazon says Alexa gets smarter, but i think only if they add new apps instead of  intuitively adapting to your commands. Like for example, I wanted to Alexa to play certain songs on repeat on Spotify but she will say that the feature is not supported. I can still play songs on repeat but I have to open the Alexa app on my phone and press the repeat button for that particular song that I just played. Anyway, this is just me who loves to play a song over and over again.Another thing is, if you turn up the volume too loud, Alexa will have a hard time hearing you. The only way is to shout so she can listen to your voice command.I would recommend Echo Dot to everyone. As a matter of fact, I bought 6 pieces last Black Friday for a good deal so I can give them as gift for Christmas. But I needed to another 2 again after Black Friday without the promo.I also gifted Echo Dot (2nd generation) to a couple of friends, which is a bit cheaper. I needed it the next day but Amazon ran out of stocks of Echo dot 3rd so ended up buying the 2nd gen Echo dot.I also own google home, but i think the Echo dot 3rd gen is better.

Title: Does what I wanted it for -Ask My Buddy
Body: I got this for the sole purpose of using the "ask my buddy" app.  I am a senior, living alone.  I used to keep a land line phone in my basement, at floor level, in case I fall down the stairs.  When I got rid of my land line, I no longer had a call for help solution. With the investment of $25 (on sale) the echo dot sits in the basement, pretty much unused, but it's a big weight off my mind knowing it's there.  I test the wifi signal every morning by yelling down the stairs asking the temperature.  And have it play the radio when I am doing laundry.  Most importantly, we test "askmybuddy" once/month with my son.  It immediately sends him an alert by phone, text and email.  I recommend it.

Title: Think you can't get any lazier? Guess again!
Body: My mother in law bought one, we played with her Echo dot & we decided to get one. Then we bought the smart plugs & smart bulbs. If you thought the clap on/clap off's were amazing, be prepared to be blown out of the water. The echo dot 3rd gen has a much louder speaker than 2nd (we bought both). With the smart plugs, you can rename each plug for what is plugged into it suchas "garage fan", "Bedroom light", "bedroom lamp", "hallway lights" etc. Ive heard some people complain thinking the FBI is listening in, but 90% of the time I'm yelling at Alexa to play some Dierks Bentley, Eric Church or Baby Shark...

Title: Alexa is a saucy chica
Body: Alexa is a saucy chica.  I got one because it was so low priced. Whether or not it was worth the time invested, I am not sure. I have a fire TV stick that doesn't seem to work with this echo Dot. If it's supposed to, then they've made it more than a little difficult to pair and make work together. The drop-in feature is either creepy or just hilarious. Trying to send a message when you've enabled text communications and suddenly you have no control over whether or not Alexa sends an actual SMS text message or simply a message that is waiting on the other users Echo Dot.  For $30 you could do a lot worse.

Title: the default 'find my phone' app has a surcharge
Body: also it doesn't integrate with google reminders, or any of the google ecosystem, which is basically the only contiguous global reminder system i can really consider using. two reminder systems is a no go for me, so until this device integrates into that, it will likely remain entirely a novelty ...like just for fun, i talk shit about jeff bezos to it. honestly, if i were jeff, i'd make the thing be a feedback device for real time public opinion analysis. on at least myself, and probably all the other public figures, just to map a graph of who is *actually* important.though, always gotta be careful with that dataset because once people catch on, they might manipulate you back.and the devil, is *always* in the details that you're missing, however small, dawg. ;)~ u/goderator200

Title: A music lovers dream.
Body: This is a steep improvement in sound from the last model design. We use it often in the kitchen and it feels like a closer cousin to more expensive surround sound speakers like Bose.The cloth options were also welcome on the speaker as they blend well now into a room.We plan to buy more for classical music and jazz as it is dynamic and full in presence. I wish I bought it sooner. Spend the extra money and ignore the prior model. This will far exceed your expectations and give you all those echo features you want.

Title: Printed directions not included.
Body: I will like being able to give voice commands if I ever get everything set up.  Not having a set of printed directions included makes it difficult for unknowledgable people to set up.  Going back and forth to the app not knowing what I_ looking forward is not a good thing.  Hopefully I will enjoy this when I get help.

Title: Alexa Doesn_ Like Me!
Body: Read all the directions. Added app to my phone. Alexa would not listen to me. Did what she wanted, asked her to play CBC Radio, she played Maroon Five, not even close. Tried over and over again with no success. Wouldn_ even set a timer.

Title: Very good improvements
Body: If you_e ever owned an echo before and weren_ impressed maybe it_ time to look at the third generation as I did.  As a speaker it shines as one of the best mini voice assistance out there,  don_ expect the type of sound you would get out of the bigger models but it_ a very good small speaker.  Amazons own long list of skills make it almost impossible to purchase something for the smart home that this little device can_ handle.  As for smart home the Echo Dot is the beginning and yes the little one can do everything the big ones can. Now for what it doesn_ do well it_ search engine for random questions isn_ google but that_ it,  The basics are handled well with the echo it_ the advanced  search where you may have a problem. Overall I_e purchased two and looking to purchase an additional two. Be prepared to enter the world of smart home with this device, bulbs, switches and the accessories to automate your home these items aren_ as expensive as you may think,  there will always be something you can buy and not break the bank. If you have a big home with multiple rooms you will need more than two, I could stay with experience maybe more. It has an intercom  feature that_ super convenient, it allows us to drop in on another room instead of having to scream through the house for your kids to come to eat. My family has adapted to it extremely fast and everyone in the family  seems to enjoy using it, it_ already became a part of our life. The only person who will be turning out the light in your house will soon be Alexa .  Four stars not five because of search engine.

Title: I loved it so much, I bought another one.
Body: Just got one for Christmas from a family member. I liked it so much, I bought another one. I do like the Amazon Alexa app, though it still needs work compared to the Google Home app.I currently have a Note9, and it feels so much better to have a different voice assistant. I honestly like Amazon's Alexa voice a lot better than Google's (ik... a bit nitty gritty). Also, Google Assistant is just better on my phone than on a speaker. Since I have Google Assistant on my phone, it kind of felt pointless to have Google Assistant on a speaker, making me lean over to the EchoDot.I don't expect Google Services to run on Amazon Echo devices. It makes sense why. Though, idk for sure.I do like the way the EchoDot is designed a lot more than the Google Home Mini. Sure, they are almost identical, though it is nice to have the plastic contrast on top of the device. Also, it has additional buttons on top to make its use a lot more convenient at times.The light ring around the EchoDot is its most compelling feature against the Google Home Mini, in my opinion. To me, it a much better look. It can also display notifications more vibrantly, and display its current volume more accurately (obviously not in numerical values), which I do like.The EchoDot is an amazing product. Definitely recommend it for people who want to get into the smart assistant or smart home trend, especially if they are on a budget.If you value entertainment more, then I would suggest you look into the Google Home Mini. The fact that it can scream YouTube is a big bonus.

Title: Even better than the 2nd Gen Echo Dot
Body: I got the Echo Dot 2nd Gen and Google Home Mini for Christmas 2017 and liked things about both of them.  My biggest gripe with the Echo Dot 2G was that the sound quality wasn't great.  The ED 3G sounds much better and looks great as well.  I think this is a big improvement over the 2G version and definitely beats out the Google Home Mini.  The most frustrating thing about the Google Home Mini for me was the voice recognition sensitivity seems very poor.  I often find myself having to yell at it to stop over it's own sound output.  Echo Dot is not like that.  It seems much better at hearing me through it's own sound output.Pros:Good responsiveness to voice commands, even in a room with noiseLooks much better than the 2nd Gen.Great sound quality - definitely better than Dot 2G or Google Home Mini.Cons:Not uncommon for Alexa to randomly start talking when I never said anything to her while the TV is on.Search engine for questions simply isn't as smart as the Google Home Mini.

Title: Speaker blew in two weeks
Body: (Edit: Amazon contacted me and stated they service all their products whether gifts or not. They replaced my Dot quite promptly. I will update again after using the replacement.)I received a new Echo Dot for Christmas this year and let's just say I fell in love!  However, two weeks after starting to use my Dot, the speaker is already blown (and at first I was originally impressed with the sound quality). And I haven't used it with the volume up loud or anything. Light music use and a few commands. I'm really disappointed because I love all the uses for Alexa. And I can't return it for a replacement since it was a gift. Bummer.

Title: Ultimately not much of an improvement
Body: I own all 3 generations of the Echo Dot. I found the 3rd gen to be a significant upgrade from the 2nd gen, but I ultimately prefer the 1st gen.Much of the functionality remains the same, so I will only go over the main differences that I noticed.The new design is pleasing, and it fits well being out in the open in a room rather than tucked into a corner.The sound quality of the speakers for the 3rd gen are a vast improvement from the 2nd gen, but still leaves a lot to be desired. The bass is powerful, but very muddy. I had to turn the bass way down in order to even understand Alexa when she talks. The 1st gen was a fairly balanced speaker, and I never had any trouble with the sound filling the room.The microphones on the 3rd gen seem to be inferior to the 1st gen; if not the hardware, then its utilization. The 1st gen could hear me at a normal speaking volume from across the room. I feel like I have to yell directly at the 3rd gen for it to hear me. I've had to repeat commands many times with the 3rd gen, whereas I don't even recall the last time I had to do that for the 1st gen.

Title: Gets better and better
Body: I had the first generation echo dot and loved it but had to connect it to another Bluetooth speaker for better sound quality. My 14 year old son kept taking it to his room so I got myself the echo in Black Friday and got two dots for my kids. My son (14) and my daughter (9) each got a dot for Christmas and it was and still is their favorite gift. They are easy to set up, very stylish, great sound, and hours of fun. I love the drop in feature, love that I could get a family Spotify account so each of us can listen to whatever we want and have our own playlists, and love that Alexa keeps the kids entertained. My kids have renamed their Alexa_ so they don_ interrupt each other while talking to it. My daughter even listens to music at night and I can just yell down the hall for it to stop playing when my daughter is asleep! I_ very much a fan of Alexa but I do mute the Alexa in our rooms and living room at night because she will randomly say _ didn_ hear that or other weird things. Since muting, I haven_ had any issues.

Title: Kids are Obsessed
Body: My kids (ages 5-18) are obsessed with the Alexa dot, always asking her random questions and getting her to play music. I use it mostly for timers, reminders and FREE music.  I have purchased four already; one in my kitchen, master bedroom, and two of my kid's bedrooms.  My 5-year old was upset she did not get one for Christmas.  It was very easy to setup.WARNING:Just a warning to go into your app and turn off voiced enabled purchasing because I did not realize that was even a thing until I realized I had been charged for months $4.99 per month for music.  Once I got that fixed I have had no issues

Title: Love it but I_ sad about the new power supply
Body: For all previous echo dots, the power supply was an AC to USB adapter, and a female USB to male mini USB cable. This was a nice feature because even when the Echo Dot is obsolete, the adapter and cable will still be useful. Unfortunately on this new model, the AC to DC adapter and cable are one unit and the cable is a round connector rather than USB. Thus, it is unlikely it can be reused. This is a loss because they will produce millions of these, and the world already has too much e-waste.Otherwise a nice little thing, but I disagree with this new design.

Title: Disappointing
Body: After getting an Echo Plus for Christmas, we thought we would add purchase Echo Dots in the bedroom and in basement. We love our Echo Plus and have a light bridge and set up Philips Hue lights in groups according to room. When we set up the dots they worked for a few minutes then refused to see the light groups. I called Amazon to help figure out what is wrong and did a factory re-set on the dot device, which helped see the lights for about 15 minutes and then stopped seeing the light groups again. I am done. No one has time for that. It's supposed to be fun and helpful, not annoying and time consuming! The dots are going back to the store today.

Title: Sound died after 8 months Amazon will not stand by their replacement warranty of a year
Body: Although my account says it is available for a replacement of up to 1 year after purchase, I spent 3 days with their "customer service" only to find the actual warranty is for 90 days and the "replacement warranty" is not for my device (which is still listed as active under my account). They offered me a trade in and 25% off another device. When I went to the link, my device is not offered as a trade in either, and they asked if I wanted a 15% discount instead. I will not buy another amazon echo. If it breaks after 90 days, you are out of luck. Do not waste your money

Title: Can't wait to see what else this can do!
Body: This thing is amazing.  Like so much technology, I'm not sure how we got along without it before.  It makes adding things to lists while you are otherwise occupied a cinch (like when you fixing something or washing dishes) since you don't have to stop what you're doing to write it down before you forget.  Also, my wife and I are able to communicate with one another (as well as our kids) when we are not in the same room or even in the house.  Out seven-year-old was able to contact us on our phones just using voice commands.  The music on demand is also a great feature and the sound quality of the speaker is absolutely amazing.  It was well worth the cost.

Title: Gets better all the time
Body: Was expecting better sound. It is louder but voices at volume 7 thru 10 over-drive the speaker and it is hard to understand what is said. The volume under that is fine. It does "hear" commands better than the first 2 versions even at higher volumes. I usually change the "wake" word because TV folks use the Alexa word in all their ads which starts the blue light flashing and sometimes it does what the TV ad talks about. Amazon needs to allow the user to create their own wake work. I would use Shumerlovestrump. LoL

Title: Great deal for Home Ai
Body: The sale Amazon had on its Echos and Echo Dots made it almond impossible not to pick a couple out to try for myself.Once one is installed and hooked up, the others are just plug and play.  The Amazon Echo and the Google counterpart pretty much do the exact same things, at the exact same speed.  The only difference is the Amazon integration.So find out which one is cheaper and give it a shot.  I promise you you'll like having the help once you start using the features Home Ai offers.

Title: Love the 3rd generation
Body: Having used several Gen 2 Echo Dots over the past couple of years, I was looking forward to the new Gen 3.  I wasn't disappointed, especially given the mere $5 difference between the two (special holiday pricing).  Not only does the speaker sound better, but there are a few new whistles and bells available through the Alexa app that I find useful.  The new speaker still doesn't provide "amazing" sound by any stretch, so don't be fooled into thinking this will provide pounding bass or tinkling highs.

Title: Received as a Christmas gift
Body: My parents got us the Echo Dot as a Christmas gift, and to be honest, was a little underwhelmed when I opened it. I've seen the commercials and always thought it was a bit ridiculous and useless, and that I would never pay for it because I just didn't see it as something I wanted. Well it's been over a week now and I absolutely adore this thing! It's so useful and fun, it was a big hit at our New Year's Eve get together by playing different games on it. The kids love it and it has proven to be educational as well, right now it's helping them learn their spelling lists. What I once thought of as kind of dumb and useless has turned into an invaluable tool!

Title: Good speaker, does what it's supposed to do.
Body: I have 3rd gen Echo Dots.  I was bit worried about loudness and clarity of the speaker sound based on some of the reviews, but I'm very pleased with the sound. It can get very loud and the sound quality is very good too. Of course if you are comparing to some fancy expensive speaker, it probably can't compete, but I think it's good for most average listeners.I took a star out because I bought two of these, set them under same Amazon account, and I can only have one of them to access Amazon Music at a time. (i.e. I cannot have both of my Echo Dots to play music from Amazon Music at the same time). So I had to create another account for the 2nd Echo Dot. Perhaps if I subscribe to the family level, it might let me, but not with this standard unlimited trial plan that Amazon offered.Other than that, I have couple of smart plugs controlled by the Echo Dot and it does well and the scheduled routine is very useful. I think you just have to find the right Alexa skill that is useful for your need. I found combination of MyPodApp and Google drive to be very useful for playlists of MP3s.

Title: Love this gadget!
Body: I have an echo dot gen 3 in my 3rd flr bedroom, a (FB) portal in my 2nd flr living room, and a second echo dot gen 3 in my 1st flr guest room... all connected to Alexa.Likes: so many! (I_e only had my dots for a few weeks, so I_ still discovering things.)- Blends seamlessly into my black furniture- The ability to set reminders/alarms, and to create shopping/to-do lists- The sleep/ambient sounds (Brown noise is my favorite!)- The ability to get weather reports, news, my daily schedule, etc.- The option to go into DND/do-not-listen modes- It can connect to my Lexus (although I haven_ set it up yet)- Bought an electrical outlet accessory & was able to set up timers for my x-mas lights- LOVE the Drop-in feature. It_ like having an intercom throughout my house.- Notifications: really liked being alerted to my Amazon package deliveries+ more...Dislikes:- Four times now I_e had to repeat myself multiple times when turning on & off the ambient sounds. It registers that it hears the command, but nothing plays. Or, it refers to the ambient sounds menu instead of turning off the sound playing.- On the 3rd flr it has lost connection twice to my WiFi on the 3rd floor (likely due to the WiFi signal strength). I had to reset the connection in the Alexa app each time, which was annoying.- I wish the volume was louder when playing music from my iPhone. I tried it once and ended up just connecting to my sound bar instead. It_ still decent quality sound and apparently improved from previous versions from the reviews that I_e read.Side note: The first time that an Alexa commercial comes on and they activate, it_ pretty hilarious. It also activates when similar words pop up in the background, but I just tell it to shut off. (Has only happened a few times.)Overall, I love the functionality and wish I_ purchased sooner.

Title: Must buy.
Body: These speakers are amazing.Google v Alexa:Being an owner of both a google home and an Amazon Alexa I can tell you for a fact the sound quality on this Alexa is better. The Alexa picks up my voice better as well. I whisper it_ name and it picks it up, it can get almost annoying discussing the machines with friends in a different and all of a sudden I will hear _orry I didn_ catch that.I use this every single day. Mostly for setting timers, playing music while I cook or clean, or I will ask for the weather, it really doesn_ matter I do so much on it including playing games.The capabilities on this speaker are endless and there are always new updates and upgrades.

Title: Great Device
Body: Love the 3rd generation echo dot! I have purchased 3 of them now because they were on sale and I connected them to a multiroom speaker group. I have also enabled skills to control the lights in my house, and my alarm system and garage. I even setup an action that turned on my Christmas tree and other interior Christmas lights and started playing Christmas music on my multiroom speaker group. They are affordable and the sound although not as good as the larger echo devices is 10x better than the echo dot 2nd generation. I know reviews say that you are better with the 2nd gen because it is cheaper and then you can buy speaker accessories that make the audio better and make it portable. The portability will come, these devices look really nice as they are and I_ sure the designer cases and wall mounts will come anyway. I don_ see a need for all the extras with this device though. Portability might be the only nice thing to be able to have. If you want to mount it to the wall get some 3M double back foam tape and stick it to the wall.

Title: Siri might be jealous but Alexa has won our hearts.
Body: Oh my! We are in love with Alexa! We bought one for the kitchen, one for my daughters room and one for my sons room. I have a morning routine setup with weather, NPR news and Beautiful Day by U2. I also set up Alexa to respond to me when I say things like _ need to walk. She is my own personal motivation trainer. I can announce to the kids to hurry up without yelling up the stairs. I can listen to radio stations in Norway or London... we just adore her. Did I mention she keeps track of my shopping list and can order my almond milk as well? I always wanted a personal assistant.

Title: I love access to everything without using phone/computer
Body: I mainly use to play games with daughter and listen to music although the bass sounds boomy and full something about it is not right. Her voice sounds great with the standard settings but I find certain songs clip even at low volumes (for example Metallica's ...And Justice for All-notorious for not even having bass) although most anything sounds pretty good through it anyway. There are EQ settings too. Im not going to complain about a $30 device that does tons of stuff. Favorite feature so far is having Alexa play rain noise so I can fall asleep. I sleep like a baby.

Title: alexa dot
Body: Last christmas I was given an ECHO... it's excellent,  this year I was given a DOT... I don't like it at all... the sound is really bad but then what can you expect for $30.00... frankly, I don't Amazon should market this product, it sucks

Title: A crippled girl's dream come true!!
Body: This device is life changing for me! I am confined to a wheelchair with limited physical mobility, and to have a device as my helping hands has been AWESOME!! So far I've gotten the HUE lights and attached my tv, music, and a few other devices to my echo dot and boy has it made this little cripple's life easier!!! Can't wait to add more household devices over time!!!

Title: i think everyone should get one! especially older people! or younger people!
Body: I wanted to get 1 for my mom because she is retired and spends most of the day alone while my dad is running his business. turns out that they both loved it! they listen to their music all day, i got them some smart plugs so they can control the lights when they arent home. my dad asks for weather, stock prices. my mom uses it to set reminders. its been such a great tool for them.i bought this one for myself as well and the 2nd gen speaker. the sound quality is just as good as the 2nd gen tall speaker. I love this so much! I will be buying them 1 more for their family room downstairs. cant say enough good things. setting it up isnt too difficult either.

Title: Echo Dot (3rd Gen) is a great device !
Body: I have three now and they are great !  The first one i got as a Christmas gift with a Alexa Show and in two days i was ordering two more Dot's . I now have a Alexa show in the kitchen, a Echo Dot in the bedroom, basement and garage for when i am working out there. The speech recognition is about 99.9 percent or better. As far as sound quality like in playing music i don't know how they get something so small too sound so good ! And like always Amazon shipping was great.

Title: Two out of three arrived broken!
Body: Two of the three Echo Dots I ordered for Christmas presents were broken when they arrived. Not at all happy, and customer service was totally less than satisfactory. Replacement for one was a REFURBISHED one, and didn_ include a charging cord. Then I was advised to return the other one for a refund. GRRRRRR.

Title: Decent sound in a small package
Body: Already have an Echo, so didn't really need the Echo Dot.However, when Amazon had it on sale, figured what the heck.Placed it in our bedroom.Easy set-up.Pretty decent sound for such a small piece. Not great, but better than I anticipated.Sits far from my router, and lost the signal once.Firestick in same room has never lost the signal, so will need to see if thiswill be a recurring issue.Otherwise, pretty happy with my purchase.

Title: Nice addition to my Alexa enabled devices
Body: Last year we got two echoes and have loved them.  This year I wanted an additional device for our computer/media/work room but since it is a smaller room did not think I needed another echo.  I saw good reviews on the 3rd Gen of the Echo Dot and ordered this one.I love it.  Enough sound to fill this small room and allows me to listen to Daily Music and News briefings at my work desk.Highly recommend for smaller rooms.

Title: Alexa, THE Amazon salesclerk at your side
Body: First, I honestly purchased echo dots hoping the devices would work in my vehicles.  And even when you link through your phone as a hotspot, it has intermittent connectivity in my area.  It takes s but to set up & then can be lost easily.  So now I am on a list for the Amazon car device that seems to overcome the obstacles the dot has.  (This could take years.). I look forward to read that text & reply to take text.  Ford Sync support is very short lived.Amazon in the home:  If I play music that is supposedly a part of Prime, Alexa asks me to enable ordering & subscribe to music unlimited.  If I play any game other than Jeopardy, Alexa asks me to unlock the rest of the game or categories.  This appears to be a by game charge & not an unlock all games.  If I inquire about a book, it wants to sell Kindle Unlimited or an Audible book.  So it constantly trying to sell me addition purchases in spite of both being subscribed to Prime & Audible.  WiFi calling is the one use currently since I don_ have smart plugs & bulbs.  I would not invite a Walmart or Target salesperson in my home so basically, the dot is unplugged & in a drawer.

Title: New amazon generations do not work in my house
Body: I have the craziest thing is happening in my house I can't use the 3rd gen dot or the new 4k stick. They both reboot and never get to the setup.  Im using the supplied power adapters. I've even gone to the extent of shutting off the main breaker to my house and using a battery backup still doesn't get to the orange setup. If I put the 3rd gen dot in my car and leave my house a couple blocks away it will finally boot to the orange setup. I must have a radio signal interference near my house that's causing the new Amazon devices to freak out and not boot. I currently have 3 fire tv cubes, a fire tv pendant, 3 2nd gen echos and 3 2nd echo dots. Those all work fine so its really hard to understand why the new amazon generations are failing.

Title: Good improvements over Gen 2! Got rid of the verbal replies!!!
Body: I_ certainly say this was worth it.  I took advantage of the sales this year and was able to on 2 occasions buy one on the monthly pricing and discounted to 29.99 I did that last year for the gen 2.The design looks better although I_ not sure how well it will hold up in the kitchen because of the cloth.  But that may be on purpose in a way.Bottom line it works better and doesn_ respond with voice to commands that went through correctly.  Only if something is wrong.Might be a feature available on the gen 2 but at the time this arrived and replaced my gen 2 the gen 2 was still responding to everything with its loud voice!  Thinking of loud if you whisper to it even if it doesn_ understand it speaker quieter!

Title: There_ a reason why they lowered the price - Alexa is being smothered
Body: In my house, I have an original Echo Show, a generation 1 Echo Dot, an original Echo, an Echo Spot, an Echo Input, and my most recent acquisition - a third generation Echo Dot. You might say that I collect these things. I bought the new Dot because I really liked how it looked. It was my intention to it replace the first generation Dot, but I changed my mind on that very quickly. When Alexa speaks, she sounds super muffled. It sounds like she_ wrapped in a blanket. I_e only played a few songs and they don_ sound terrible, but I find that I have to turn the volume way up to hear her, and if I forget to turn it down again, whatever I play is way too loud.
