My conversations with her have gone like this:Me: Alexa - Set volume to six. Alexa, what is the weather?Alexa: The weather in blah blah is blah blah blah blah. (Loud, but muffled).Me: Alexa, set volume to three. Alexa, play blah blah by the blah blah blahsWithout the first and third step, it_ completely unusable.It is also one of the most deaf of my Echo devices. It_ not as bad as my Show (really hate that thing), but it_ close.I wonder if the muffled sound can be worked out with an update. Music doesn_ sound bad, you_ think that they could make Alexa clear.I am going to put my Dot first generation back and buy a little owl holder for it. This thing is going back.

Title: Kinda cool device.
Body: Arrived on time and well packagedThis device is kinda cool. I love to listen to music when I cook or clean and I don_ like having my phone on speaker, earbuds or pull out the portable speaker. Once you_e setup your device you_l love it. The first one I purchased had issue with pandora so I sent it back. Now I have three and you can make announcements to other rooms that have an echo.  If you have more than one and once you create groups you can play music in an individual room or multiple rooms with the same music. You can command echos from other echo locations within your home. For example if you forgot to turn Alexa off in the kitchen you can send a command from your master room or wherever you have one to turn off Alexa in the kitchen.I_e never been into the whole echo and google assistant but I quickly became I fan of the echo dot and purchased 2 of the dots and 1 of the bigger ones in less than 3 wks.  The Alexa jokes are pretty lame but that doesn_ take away from the rating.

Title: From Echo 1 to 2 to 3rd gen
Body: My Echo Dots are connected via an AUX cable to external speakers. That works very well and couldn't be happier.This 3rd Gen echo is a good upgrade in that it picks up your voice better, but there are some design flaws compared to the 1st and 2nd gen.-The top and sides are curved, so you cannot see the light ring around the Echo clearly. My Echo sits at chest level on top of a piano, so if I'm sitting or standing and I activate the Echo, it's not quite as clear that it has been activated.-The charger is not a common micro USB like previous versions. If the charger breaks, you'll need to purchase a new one. Also, my external speakers have a USB output that can be used for charging but I can no longer use that with the new Echo, I have to power it through the included adapter.

Title: Wishing everything used artificial intelligence now, lol
Body: I bought 3 Dots to use in the kitchen and my 2 daughters rooms. They have become our music speakers, alarm clocks, PA conference system, personal assistant, nagging reminder person(lol), dinner bell, scheduler, personal secretary and I am sure there are more things I have yet to think to ask Alexa to do. I love the _nnouncement  and _rop in features- this makes living in a multi level home so much easier. No more screaming loud enough for my neighbors to hear, just trying to communicate with someone downstairs.I also like being able to use these features from the app on my phone while I am away from home. My girls are constantly on their phones, so even if the phone dies, or it takes a little while to see my text, I have another option for communicating with them. I also love being able to announce that I am almost home and need help with the groceries ;)after I_e done all the shopping, they can do a little heavy lifting too...These Dots can be very addictive;) Shortly after using my Dots, I almost told Alexa to vacuum the floor, but I realized she couldn_ do that... maybe Amazon will create Rosie the Robot soon :)And... Amazon__lease find a way to replace Siri Alexa is a much better assistant!!!

Title: Absolutely LOVE this thing!
Body: My wife and I got 2 for now, and absolutely love it!  One is in my daughter's room where it plays soft music for her to fall asleep to, and the other is in the living room for our use.  We ask for weather updates, and create shopping lists, and even look up information from time to time.  We are still learning how to use it, the verbal commands, the limitations, but we are really enjoying it and are looking into probably getting one more for our room.  One interesting capability is being able to tap into one of the Dots at the house and being able to speak through the Dot to chat with my wife.  You can do this through the app on your phone.

Title: Perfect purchase!
Body: I_ am super excited that I purchased this Alexa! I couldn_ have made a better decision. Me and my family are obsessed with this Alexa. The device is perfect size, we purchased the black with gray charcoal coloring. The Alexa was super super easy to set up took maybe a couple of minutes tops. The speaker is super loud too which is amazing. It_ easy to use of course, you can play music which is good in our household and the best part it tells stories for the kids which I think is super fun for the whole family! All in all this was a perfect purchase!! The shipping was 2 day and fast as well!

Title: Love the new look!
Body: Add a little fabric and a curve to the top and you have the 3rd gen Dot!  it looks great, as I have it sitting on my end table, the sound is a little better, it is good for the everyday things you use your Dot for, skills, smart home, keeping shopping list, and weather updates  but I still prefer to use a Bluetooth speaker system when listening to music.( I like it loud).I took advantage of the trade-in feature on my 2nd generation Dot, it was a smooth transaction and saved me a few dollars, and I didn't need to have another electronic sitting in a closet after only using it for a year!

Title: i like it, but it's bit deaf
Body: she's kinda hard of hearing i have to shout in monotone while annunciating every word crystal clear or she cant understand which is annoying but she's good at finding playlists the games are fun i like asking her questions, i don't have her set up to turn lights off or anything like that it's not the best speaker but supposedly you can hook her up to better speakers, thinking of getting firestick but will she understand the show i want to watch? i like the grey with the black and the blue light it's cute i like using the timer when my hands are full

Title: Not impressed
Body: The speaker volume may be better than the previous version but still sucks. This is my first device like this and I'm really not impressed with it and it's useless without the companion app on a phone or tablet. Maybe this is better as an add-on to other systems but alone, these have very little purpose except to annoy you.

Title: From Gen 2 to Gen 3 - WHAT AN IMPROVEMENT
Body: I loved my Gen 2 Dot. But, the sound was horrible. Spent hundreds of dollars for quality speakers for her to bluetooth to... wish I would have waited for the Gen 3. Speakers are awesome on their own. Gen 2 would make me cringe, but the Gen 3 is fine for me all by itself. Now, I still use my expensive speaker with Gen 3, but only for music and transporting it from room to room. Otherwise, the Gen 3 Alexa Dot is perfect for me to listen to my Audible Books (which is about 95% of what I use her for).

Title: Love it
Body: We are a google home and got this alexa as a gift. It's pretty cool, kids love it because she's more responsive than google...meaning she responds sooner, has an actual answer instead of the usual "I don't understand" blah blah blah comment google responds with. Kids have stopped using our living google and just use alexa for all their commands and music instead. I still love my google though for things alexa can't do regarding non amazon related stuff.

Title: Best sounding of the three generations of Dot
Body: While I'm not in love with the fabric cover, it did seem to be a popular addon for prior generation Dots, so what do I know?Aside from the better mono talking sound in the device itself, it seems to me that the audio output of this new Dot is fuller (EQd differently) and has better low end extension and much smoother highs. AMZ don't publish schematics, but it sounds like a very different op-amp is being used on the output that delivers wider bandwidth and current. The much bigger power supply would back that up.I'll say that Gen2 had the worst capture and hold of wifi. It overheated a lot, too, and lost connection regularly, even 15' from a high-power wifi router. That is solved here. I have only lost audio when my cable modem is resetting, which is unavoidable.Otherwise, it seems to work, even with fewer mics. It works like the Gen2 does for controls and is the perfect companion to AMZ Unlimited Music. I listen to Broadcastify and other radio aggregator sources and find that they often sound better than the actual broadcast signal if there is a broadband feed.I wish that a single interface on my desktop could be used to control everything fully, including programming the excellent Recast and the Alexa devices, like this Dot. You have to go back and forth between a web app and a standalone app to do things, and you cannot program devices from your desktop.Other than that, this is the best of the Dots and seems to be on eternal sale-price at dirt cheap, so it's a bargain!

Title: If Bass Matters, Worth the Extra Cost Over a 2g
Body: The 2g Dot has about a million (sarcasm) microphones across the top whereas the 3g has 4. They both work just as well.Sound quality when listening to music and phone calls , on this one is noticeably better but as I wrote prior the outgoing sound and recognition are virtually the sameIt is notably heavier and taller than the 2g but still isn't heavy and tucks away from view readilyUsing smart home, skills, daily flash briefs, etc is the same across the 2 different Dots and the big brother EchoMy only gripe with the 3g Dot is the lack of sleeves available. I don't want a decal for my Dot. I like the true sleeves of the 2g Dot and Echo for changing things up instead.I got this one as a 3rd Echo device over another 2g because it was on sale for the same as the regular price of the 2g.Any of the Echo devices are fun to own and use and you won't go wrong but the sound quality of the 3g is well worth the price difference to me, even at regular price. It's almost as good as my Echo.

Title: Amazing for the price!
Body: I was really stuck between this and the Google Home Mini, but I am glad I chose to go with the Amazon Echo! First of all Google is a incredibly shady company imo gathering all the data of your personal life. My house is now filled with Echo Dots and what I love about it the most is that the audio quality is outstanding for the size and price. It is very funny how years ago bluetooth speakers of this size would cost more the $50 with mediocre sound quality. While at the time of purchase, the Echo dot is half the price and offers far more features than bluetooth speakers. It is incredible to witness how innovation can drive the price down for consumers. As for Alexa, 'she' is a great home companion since she answers about 85% of what I ask, mind you the other 15% of the questions are more difficult to answer as of today's technology. I really dig the white and the charcoal colors. they are just really cool.

Title: Required for stereo sound, too loud?
Body: Got two so I could set them up as a stereo pair. That works but I later got stereo wireless Bluetooth speakers for a lot cheaper that did the same. Compared to the 2nd generation echo dot, these are possibly 3 times louder. The problem is that level one is still too loud when you want to have discreet background music to fall asleep to. I tried setting the sound level to 0.3, and 0.5 but anything but 0 itself sounded as loud as 1. Being louder so much is probably great for parties but generally, I have to set them at 4 so that Alexa doesn't shout back at me her OK. The solution is not to make them quieter, but to have fractions for setting the sound. Also, it would be nice if, for example, at night you whispered, "Alexa stop playing the music", that it would whisper back OK, instead of shouting it and waking the kids you were trying to put to sleep.

Title: Not Portable-stuck to needing an A/C plugin. Everything else is amazing!
Body: If we had only met sooner!!! Love Alexa and the ease she has brought to our lives. She answers pretty much any question we ask. She tells jokes. The Echo Dot speaker sound quality is great for its small size. Any recipe I ask for Alexa gives it to me, same with calculated measurements and changing liters to quarts, etc.Only downfall that it has, and is why it didn_ get 5 Stars, is this convenient little pod of information is NOT portable and I cannot even attach it to a battery pack because there isn_ one for the 3rd Gen Echo Dot!! This is frustrating when the greater part of my time at home is spent OUTSIDE the house and around the yard. So AMAZON ......get this 3rd Gen a portable battery!! Please :-)

Title: Alexa is great!
Body: Wonderful! We love our Alexa_! I bought two with the Christmas special. You can do so much with her. I have had her read audio books off Hoopla for me, play music, games, tell jokes, read the Bible and it is also fun to just ask her random questions! The only thing I cannot figure out is speaker pairing... I paired both Alexa_ but was considering unpairing and can_ find it.  I did discover that she only plays music on both, but games, audio books, alarms, etc seem to go through the one you start it on. So maybe the pairing is not so bad. I was just afraid of it bothering someone else if I wanted to do my own thing in the other room or is a random alarm went off.

Title: Underwhelming
Body: I thought there would be more with this, there isn't. I like that I can make calls, it sucks I can't receive them unless that other person has an Echo.Second issue is the volume and speakers. You can turn all of it up or all of it down. There are not separate settings for Alexa's voice and Music/media. Music ends up at a good volume, when I stop that, Alexa is too loud or vice versa. Speakers are muffled, seems to be getting worse. She doesn't respond unless I'm within about 5 feet without yelling.It's really not all that useful.

Title: Awesome prodcut for the price
Body: I was pleasantly surprised by just how much this little guy\girl can do. I have never had any issues with this device recognizing my questions its always accurate and knows exactly what I am asking it. The one issue I have with it is unless you are a techy person you may never use it to its full potential because you may never really pick up on just how the "Skills" as Amazon calls them work. Basically you have to download an Alexa app on your phone and then setup the device but from there you have to download skills to really take advantage of this device, an example would be I downloaded a Fios Skill so that I am able to control my cable box with commands such as "Alexa watch AMC on Fios" The problem is setting up the skills for this to work I had to enable the Fios TV skill then I had to choose what cable box this device was going to control, well if you never named your cable boxes by the rooms they are in then you have to figure out the name the cable company gave your cable box. Anyways like I said once you get everything figured out its great. I have it tied to my calendar in Outlook, my cable box, my Fire TV, I use it to play music from Amazon "Apple Music is coming to this device soon" I ask it what my commute to work is like, what's the Weather today. As far as the Sound quality goes, this small device is perfect for a bedroom or office if you want good sound in a bigger room buy the ECHO or ECHO Plus its that simple.

Title: Looks great compared to previous generations!
Body: Quite the unique little dot. It's appearance has greatly improved over previous generations. It's more eye appealing and fits the room a little better. Doesn't look as much as a hockey puck like the past generation did. Nice smooth curves wrapped in a cloth exterior. The speaker quality has improved as well - although it's still nothing to brag about. But it does have an external aux output, so that can be solved with an external speaker setup. It's a pretty cool little device. Definitely worth the buy!

Title: Great improvement on the Dot!
Body: I have all 3 Dot generations, the Spot, and of course the original echo. This (as it should be) is the best sounding Dot yet. It doesn't quite match the rich sound of the echo, but it has very good sound given its size. It is perfect for its design and I can imagine when paired up with a 2nd and sub it would sound like the original Lifestyle Bose system. Great job.

Title: Obsessed!
Body: 2nd 3rd generation echo. Obsessed. You can link all your Alexa_ to play music around the house. You can teach your Echo lots of skills via the app, and you can even customize and make your own skills. Before I owned the Echo I didn_ even really know what it was or if I would use or like it, after 2 months I now have an alexa in all major spots in my house. My son uses it to control his Bluetooth lights as well as turn on and off his tv. Obsessed.

Title: I_ obsessed. I want Alexa in every room!
Body: I love the sound. I got it with one plug for my bedroom lamp. I use it to check the weather when I wake, as an alarm, to listen to nature sounds to fall asleep, I loved it so much I bought one for the kitchen! I replaced my bulky Bose, too. I love that Alexa will pick different _op stations from Amazon music and I can also ask her to play music from Pandora!  (PS. I_ 58 and divorced w no children. This is all for me).

Title: Strongly recommended
Body: I've personally tried many of these type of devices and honestly this has to be the best I've ever tried.These are some of the best aspects of this productVoice Recognition- this product works great in this area it picks up my voice great everytime.(especially since my voice is so very low in octaves that most devices and people cant understand a lot of what I say) so if your like me this will be great for youA.I. or Artificial intelligence- the A.I. that comes with this product known as Alexa is stupendous it works great everytime. It is simple and easy to use and understand. I know everyone will agree with me.Affordability/worth- This device is very affordable especially since it gives on sale all the time. They give you so much in such a little package, there are so many features for you to discover and play with and  can connect to so many different products. If your someone who is just wanting to get Into smart home products I would strongly recommend this to you.Now is this for you? This is probably a question you asked yourself when looking to buy one of these. Well let me ask you a few questions. Are you new to smart home tech? If so than yes. Are you wanting a way to make your life a little bit easier? Than if so yes. Are you wanting to access information faster and easier? If so than yes. If you answered yes to any of those questions than this is for you. It's a great way for someone on a budget to get started.My overall consensus- I give this product a 5/5 because of it's affordability and it's overall quality as a product. I strongly recommend it

Title: Great product but Alexa has a lot to learn!
Body: I was slightly expecting Alexa to favor Siri, when it comes to asking questions and what-not. She does not search the internet generally when asking her a question. She just says "Sorry, I am not sure about that" to most questions. She is helpful for timers, playing music, doing conversions, letting you know the weather, telling you the score on a game, and a little more. I liked Siri because you could ask her silly questions and she would give you silly responses back. We struggle getting her to turn on/off our fire TV (firestick) and starting and stopping a TV (such as asking the command to play How I Met Your Mother on Hulu. She just either opens Hulu or searches the whole firestick for options to play the show. I am excited to try the smart home features that she has though (such as connecting to the smart bulbs or using Nest thermostat). The thing I really enjoy (especially since my hubby is tech savvy) is the Blueprints feature where you can teach her your own tricks!

Title: Not as smart as they make it out to be...
Body: I have Alexa units in my house and, although it was the shiny new object for awhile, I've grown annoyed and disappointed in what it can - and can't - do. One, Alexa is not "home smart".  She may be able to recite facts accurately ("Alexa, what is today's weather forecast" works well) but ask he to turn off the light and she will stumble because you have to tell her exactly WHICH light to turn off.  Alexa isn't smart enough to recognize you are in a specific room and want the light in that room turned off - you must name each "device" attached to Alexa and use that "name" in your commands (ie., "Alexa, turn off the master bedroom lamp" - even when I'm standing in the master bedroom.  This becomes annoying and means ever person in house has to adapt to the machine, instead of the machine adapting to the humans.  Amazon's developers have it all wrong and need to rethink their approach to home automation...

Title: Incompatible power and software ignorance makes the 3rd gen a poor 2nd.
Body: I was so looking forward to this 3rd gen. I was so disappointed. The first and most obvious issue is the power supply. As mentioned in previous reviews the power supply is not compatible with 1st and 2nd gen. I was hoping to just swap out old for new. Not going to happen.Second big issue - for some reason these guys join the club but they don't want to be a member. I can tell gen 1 Alexa turn on the light - no problem. Swap that out for 2nd gen - no problem. 2nd gen turns out the light turns on the light. works every time. 3rd gen is the proverbial dumb and happy. no idea what's going on. Completely Clueless. Cant fund any thing. Maybe there's an issue that I don't know about. But it looks like I will kave to re-educate mr. 3rd gen. Or get a 2nd gen, which is probably a better option.definitely a deal-breaker for me - I gave them away for X-mas ... :-(

Title: Not satisfied
Body: Overall the product works fine, with the following exceptions.  1) which bulbs can I add?  You would think that this would be easy to answer but it isn't.  Sengled makes a number of bulbs that do NOT work with the hub.  It is difficult to determine which bulbs can be added to the system.  2) I can turn on/off lights at sunset/sunrise.  I think that this is mostly an Alexa problem, but really.  Of course I want to be able to turn on lights 15 minutes after sunset or off at 20 minutes before sunrise.  But I cannot.  Amazon doesn't care what I want, but if Sengled told Amazon to fix the problem I suspect that they would listen.  3rd problem. you are better off getting a smart switch that a smart light bulb.  If someone turns of the light switch your smart bulb doesn't work

Title: Appears to be working ok - However, green light stays on a lot ???
Body: This Alexa appears to be in working order.  However, the green light keeps coming on and staying on for long periods of time for no reason and then shuts off after awhile.  When asked what the green light means - it states "You are on a call, or a call is coming in or drop in"  however, none of these is happening when the blinking green lite comes on and stays on???  The dot continues to work just fine with the light blinking however it is really annoying to see.  Anyone have any suggestions???

Title: Greatest $30 you_l ever spend
Body: Where to even begin.... i bought two dots with a smart plug bundle deal going on for Cyber Monday and it_ been the best purchase I_e had since god knows when. I have one dot in my living room connected with a smart plug controlling my lamp and another dot in my bedroom, connected with a smart power strip controlling my heater, electric blanket, lamp, and pretty string lights. I_ able to tell Alexa to turn on/off all of these devices. I can even set routines like turn my heater on, electric blanket on, and lights off with one phrase. Like how cool is that??? Other than that I don_ use too many functions with Alexa other than some voice commands and having her tell the weather/set reminders/play relaxing music for me. There_ still so much more you can do with the dot but even with these few functions I use, I am more than happy with the price I paid. Also the speaker is great for the size of it and it can hear your commands from pretty far away

Title: The helper you didn't know you needed
Body: This compact device sits, patiently awaiting your commands.  First, it is a Bluetooth speaker that sounds pretty good to me despite what some audiophiles say. It expands the sound of your phone or other computer device.  Paired with Amazon Music, it transforms the way you listen to music. It is no longer necessary to put your music on storage media, such as cassettes, CDs, hard drives or memory sticks. When you want to hear a particular song, album or multiple songs from an artist, just tell the Echo Dot through the Alexa software with commands like "Alexa, play Thriller album" or "Alexa, play 20 Flight Rock by Eddie Cochran".  To hear random songs from an artist, say "Alexa, play The Eagles" and the Echo Dot starts playing. Echo will also play a particular genre to match your mood with commands like "Alexa, play smooth jazz" or "Alexa, play sleep music".When combined with a smart device, such as a smart plug, it is easy to do things like turning on a lamp from across the room.The Echo Dot is a great way to explore the benefits of having a smart home.It is also very convenient to use instead of reaching for your phone or laptop computer to retrieve information instead of a search engine, weather app, calculator, conversion or many other things that pop into your mind. It's fun to just say "Alexa, weather", "Alexa, how far is it to Las Vegas", "Alexa, what is the definition of anomaly" or simply "Alexa, define anomaly".I have found that I use my Echo Dot a lot more than I thought I would.

Title: Better Sound - Bad Listener
Body: When I completed the setup (connection to the internet), I played music from Pandora, WOW! what a difference from the generation 2 Echo Dot sound, which I had for well over a year. I was impressed.When it is at volume 5, on some songs/music it cannot hear me say the wake word, "Alexa". I have to literally be inches away from the Gen. 3 Echo Dot to make it respond. At volume 7 or higher, FORGET IT!!! It can't hear me yelling almost kissing the new Dot.Connecting this to an external Bluetooth/wired speaker, it listens and hears the wake word as long as the external speaker is a bit away from the dot, even at high volume (your millage may differ). This defeats the better sounding built in speaker if connected to an external one.Stick with the Gen 2 Echo Dot if you plan to use external speakers. I was going to return it though the price paid (discount + 5 mo payment option) I decided to keep it and not use it at high volume. Maybe I will give it as a gift.Njoy Life...qarawol

Title: Functional and Fun!
Body: My husband and I had promised ourselves that we would not purchase any more gadgets and we kept that self-imposed promise until two weeks ago when I fell victim to the Echo Dot.  My daughter has three in her home and after seeing them in operation I had to make the purchase.  The set up was easy, the functionality was great.  I am amazed at how much information I can now get from Alexa.  I have the Fire TV and  Tablet so I was already a big Alexa fan.  The first day the Echo was set up, Hubby spent the entire day downloading apps and asking questions he thought Alexa would not be able to answer.  The next day, he asked me to order a second Dot for his man cave.  The Smart Plug is a great addition and we plan to eventually control all of our devices with some version of the Echo family.  Great product!

Title: Echo Dot and Firestick incompatible with music playback
Body: I bought this device to play my  personal library of music thru Plex thru firestick but Echo Dot says it can not work with that device.  Amazon advertising claims music playback thru firestick.  Amazon tech support could not mate Echo Dot with Firestick even after an hour of trial and error.  The Echo Dot may be 5 star for many other uses but for my need it is a one.  Fortunately, Firestick remote works well using the command Alexa, ask Plex to play "name of song" on fire TV.  That allows playback of music Amazon does not have in its library.

Title: If you like what Alexa can do for you, these are GREAT!
Body: I got them for about half price in the runup to Christmas - - but my wife's reaction was "MEH!! I've been yelling upstairs that dinner is ready for over 50 years. Why should I change??"And, after a little thought, I realized that my iToys (including the latest Watch) and my SONOS systems can do almost all of what Alexa can do anyway. I particularly like controlling the volume of my SONOS speakers - and skipping obnoxious selections with a twist or tap on my wrist!! I can control my Sous Vide system, thermostats and garage doors from my phone - maybe even by talking to Siri - and there's an Alexa APP for my phone too - - so why do I need Dots??They're going back - not because there's anything "wrong" with them - - but becaue I can't manufacture a "need" for them.

Title: Ok product but not worth an upgrade
Body: The dot sounds and look better than gen 2 BUTAlexa - less responsive. It_ not just the dot, on all echos, Alexa seems to be less responsive and doesn_ understand well. Amazon needs to update thisIt has a buzzing sound, and went through all trouble shooting by customer service but stilll a buzzing sound.Lastly, trying to troubleshoot and then return this dot was a headache. Amazon customer service has become so bad lately. They don_ care and have no accountability. If they don_ like the problem, they will disconnect. I ended up keeping the dot because customer service problems and then they sent me a refurb without a power cord. It was a mess.Worth an upgrade ? NO!!!, if you have a 2nd gen. Keep it. This is not worth an upgrade

Title: Slaying Dragons while cleaning the house , Alexa can do that !
Body: Surprisingly good sound , this is my second dot , this looks better too. Alexa is pretty good at understanding my thick accent lol . Alexa provides entertainment , games, news, audiable, weather, just ask her Alexa what are your RPG skills and you be slaying dragons in no time in interactive stories such as Runescape and the magic door and tons of others. Or if you have kids , Alexa provides you with a story for bedtime and reads it too. Make up a morning or bed routine, like when you say Alexa good night she turns off your tv ( cheap Alexa enabled plugs) and turns on your 20 minutes guided meditation or just ocean or white noise. Ya, I like Alexa! And so far everything was free of charge!

Title: We love Echo
Body: I have the 2nd generation Echo that we use in the living room to turn the living room and family room lights on and off.  When Amazon has the 3rd generation on sale if we buy 2, I purchase the white Echo.  One for our daughter's bedroom and one for the Master bedroom.  My daughter uses it to listen to Amazon music and set the ocean wave sound at night to help her sleep.  I use it to listen to local news and for weather or if I need information and don't necessarily want to grab my phone or power on the computer.  The sound quality is very good for a device not much larger than a hockey puck.

Title: Echo's Newest Raving Fan!
Body: I resisted buying this as I just did not want yet another piece of tech in my home. Now I'm asking myself, 'what took me so long?'I love, love, love this gadget! She hears me from way across the room speaking in a low voice~Yayyyy! I am not a loud person and we live in a quiet house, so that's important to me. I had a free trial of Amazon Music with it, sooo fun!I'm going to order one for the upstairs rooms, too, and that speaks volumes.What are you waiting for?

Title: Great sound quality, and fun device!
Body: I must admit, I was rather skeptical about getting a device with Alexa, but this Echo Dot is awesome! Not only does it look nice and have great sound quality, but it also is a lot of fun. My children enjoy asking it for knock-knock jokes, and other silly questions, and we all enjoy playing the word games Alexa has (especially the escape room game). On top of that, it looks nice too! My wife even uses it to check the weather forecast, and for recipes.

Title: Sound Is Terrible - 2nd Gen Was Better
Body: I'm not sure what criteria people are using when they say the 3rd gen Echo Dot sounds better than the 2nd gen, but I have to disagree. The 2nd gen version may not have the greatest sound, but it's clear and reproduces the highs and midrange quite well. For the lows you wouldn't expect much since it's such a small speaker. Still, it's acceptable. The 3rd gen Echo Dot sounds completely muddy. Speach sounds like the speaker has a sock in their mouth, or a mouth full of food. Music, similarly, is completely lacking in the highs. The midrange is muddy as can be and the lows are not really any better than the 2nd gen Dot. I have two of the 2nd gen dots that I use in small rooms. I have a 3rd gen dot that I tried using on it's own but finally couldn't stand it any longer. I disconnected it until I can get a speaker to hook up to it. I'd even returned one of the 3rd gen Dots, thinking it had to be damaged or something. The replacement sounds exactly like the first - terrible. It's funny to read reviews on some of the tech websites. They all say the same thing, using almost the exact same words, to say that the 3rd gen Dot has much improved sound. It doesn't, and no amount of adjusting the equalization inside the app will do much to help. Maybe there are other things about it that are better. I don't know, I only use it for music, an occasional notification, checking the weather, and similar light duty. If you're going for the 3rd gen Dot for music, you'll want to attach a speaker to it - unless you really can't hear very well anyway.

Title: I love my Echo.
Body: When needing wanting to relax ask Alexa to play gentle soothing Asian usic or sounds of ocean. Love not having to get up or turn on something.I bought Echo because I am disabled & live alone. I have a medic alarm button but it wasnt working & I was fearful.(years ago fell in bathroom. Fortunately my son was here. If he had not been I would have died alone with broken femur)  And so wanted Echo as backup.  I mention that because if you have an elderly person you worry about this would help.So, yes I love Echo/Alexa. Wasnt sure how I"d feel with it but very happy with purchase.

Title: Flawless Design
Body: Number one: Its beautifully designed. It appears flawless in its seams and construction. It is heavy for its size and feels like true quality when you hold it. The bottom is rubberized so it doesnt slide easily. I purchased 3 and it was easy to pair them in multiple ways throughout the house. I wasnt sure if I would get any use out of these but I was intrigued enough to try. I am glad that I purchased these and get a lot of use out of them. It gives the house a next level feel.Also, Dont be an idiot like I was when first installing these. I had a lamp that had an outlet at its base, Dot plugged into lamp, lamp plugged into smart outlet. So when i was telling the dot to turn off the lamp, I was essentially telling the dot to turn itself off. Took me way to long to figure out my mistake.

Title: Good luck setting this up.
Body: Instructions for getting these dot's to pair with Wi Fi are horrible.  You go in circles for hours.  I got one out of three finally to pair and I'm sending the others back.  Frustration level is not worth having these things.  Support was very patient with trying to help me but nothing they said made sense to me since I didn't see what they said I should be seeing on my cell screen.  I have two friends with a similar experience with these devices.

Title: Attractive, low-profile speaker
Body: Functions are plentiful with Echo 3G.  Fuller bass acoustics.  Had to ask Alexa to increase treble.  Full volume is extensive compared to size of speaker.  Houseful of Echo speakers would be sufficient for most people to listen to music and watch videos.  Set-up process took a few minutes.  Seems phone or Kindle has to be held about same height level as the Echo 3G and at least 3 feet away from it during set up so that Bluetooth can find the new device.  Also, takes a moment for the Amazon Internet signal to appear on your wireless device to connect to, so be patient.  Meanwhile, satisfied customer.

Title: The sound on these is damn near as good as the full-sized Echos!
Body: No lie, the sound on these new 3rd Gen Echo Dots is LEAGUES better than the 2nd Gen Dots. If you have to pick, buy these 3rd Gen Dots hands down over the previous models. In fact, it is so much better than the previous, that I find it to be fairly close to as good as the full sized Echo. You won't get the volume with it that you do on the full sized Echos but you will get the clarity for sure. All in all, it's a no brainer. I own one of these and will definitely be buying another in the future.

Title: Getting Echo Dot Connected and Working
Body: Our second Echo Dot arrived today.  I spent an hour trying to get it connected and working.  I failed.  I then asked Amazon for help and a very kind Amazon helper spent another hour trying to get it connected and working.  That also ended in failure.  So, two hours of effort and the new Echo Dot was not connected and not working.  When my wife came home from work she took out her iPhone and she had our new Echo Dot connected and working within 12 minutes.  Whew!  So happy to have a smart Life Partner.

Title: Great item at a great  price
Body: I mostly use it to stream music but there are thousands of other reasons to have one.Update 3/15/19Good deal. Works great as long as Amazon's servers are on line. Only drawback, to me, is it won't use internal speaker when connected to an external one. So I can"t turn my stereo off and still use Alexa without unplugging the external source cable.  Also when connected to a stereo the speech of Alexa is much softer then the music being played so is hard to hear.

Title: Offline issues.
Body: I have 6 echo dots, 5 being gen 2. Never had any problem with any gen 2. The one gen 3 I own goes offline by itself at least once a week. I've considered sending it back. The sound quality between gen 2 and gen 3 is awesome. Gen 3's sound is 10x better but the connection issues have me pumping the brakes one upgrading any of my gen 2.

Title: I can't believe I waited so long to have one of these
Body: This little gadget is amazing!  I'm still learning about the things you can do with this, but so far it's just so much fun and practical.  I have one in my living room and one in my bedroom (2nd Gen).  I did noticed that the microphone capabilities of the 3rd Gen are not as precise as the 2nd Gen.  I think my 2nd Gen picks up the sound of my voice much better and the speakers sound louder.  However, the 3rd Gen speakers sound fills the room more (if that makes sense).  The tasks, reminders, alarms and communication features are awesome.  I don't have a telephone in my house and this device is my new phone.  My son calls my phone when he gets home from school through the Echo and I also call him whenever I want using the drop-in feature.  I also love my night and morning routine and the sleep sounds options... they help me start my day in a good mood and go to sleep relax.  Overall, it's a great investment!!!

Title: So much fun
Body: OK, I haven't figured out half of what this does but we are definitely having fun with it. I say, "Alexa start" and I get a flash briefing I set up. For me it is a Bible verse of the day, the weather forecast, a news briefing, a word of the day (which the kids and I try to use in a sentence), and a briefing from a pod cast that I like. I have changed this and will continue to tweak it, there are hundreds of different things to choose from. My son who has one has a whole different routine it goes through in the morning.I also got one for one of the kids and can say dinner is ready, and they can hear me us stairs, so no more yelling up the stairs or stopping to text. I have always thought it would be great to have an intercom and with the 'drop in' and 'announce' features I do now.We also use it to play trivia, specific songs, and to find out information. I am looking forward to figuring out more of what it can do with different Apps. I think it will have some great uses in homeschooling.Will be getting at least one more.

Title: Read the fine print before you buy
Body: Alexa can play music from your music collection.  Yes, but only if you bought the music from Amazon.  If your digital music collection contains music purchased elsewhere, Alexa won't play it.  Amazon says that's for security reasons.  So the policy is not to force you to buy all your music from Amazon.  (Apple does essentially the same thing with its devices.)Alexa can read your calendar, email and contacts.  Yes, but only if you pay extra to access your mailbox if is on a Microsoft Exchange server, which is the most common mail server in the world.  Amazon says that's because Exchange servers are used by business.  Yes, businesses do use Exchange mail servers.  But lot of private users like me also use mailboxes on Exchange servers.Amazon, like other companies that sell both hardware and services, appears to be moving toward a business model where the hardware it sells will be increasingly limited to exclude commercial activity with any firm that competes with Amazon.

Title: Better than I expected
Body: This was my 1st experience in the modern world of "smart" devices in the home.  I've only had the Dot's (totaling 4 now) about 4-6 weeks so I'm still learning what you can/can't do and have enjoyed them (for the most part).  I do enjoy asking for a particular musical artist or song or genre of music and it retrieving it for me.  I also enjoy being able to integrate the Dot's with a Firestick as I cut the cord when I purchased the Amazon Dot's.  Altogether it has been a very positive experience and no complaints as of yet.  There is still much to learn, much to discover....

Title: Meets all my expectations
Body: Huge improvement from 2nd generation dots. I bought two of these to replace a 1st generation echo we had in a small "sitting room" in our house.I have these two 3rd gen dots in a stereo pair and they sound great for the music and volume we listen to. Usually no higher than 5, and listening to classic rock and Jam Band music. In my opinion this stereo pair sounds better than the single 1st gen echo.Obviously no earth shattering bass, but I feel they are very "full" sounding. I'm considering adding an echo sub at some point, probably will if Amazon ever runs a deal on it.I don't think you can beat the $50 I spent on this setup. Not sure if they would sound as good in a larger room, but definitely working well for my need.I'm thinking of adding at least one to our laundry room. Besides bathrooms, laundry room is only place without an echo. I couldn't justify the cost of a full sized echo in there, and the old dot wasnt worth listening to music on. This 3rd gen just might be the sweet spot to getting music everywhere in our home.

Title: 3rd gen dot
Body: I have 4 2nd gen dots and love them, so I tried the 3rd gen.  sound is superior to the 2nd gen. but I have to reset way too often.  looses wifi connection approx. every other day.  I never lose connection with the 2nd gen.  also I like how I plug the 2nd gen into a cordless usb charger and use outside.  can't due this with the 3rd gen as it uses a different charging system.  but sound is great.  I use this one now in the main room and the 2nd gen has been moved to other various rooms in the home.  based on sound quality only.  sound is about double the volume and rich sounding base.  again this is no Bose, but decent sound for the price.

Title: Fun purchase
Body: These dots are really nice. We use them to play music while exercising or cooking, and to play ocean sounds at night for sleeping. I even bought one for the garage to play music while working on stuff and getting my hands dirty. We also like that you can tap the cancel mic button and turn off the microphone while it's playing music and it will still play music while the mic is turned off. That's a nice feature for us with our trust issues of devices always listening. It's also very nice that it lights up a red light ring around the top and of the mic button as a visual aid / reminder that the mic is turned off.

Title: The future... Today!
Body: Initially I had a heck of a time getting the Android app to find this thing and connect to its built-in Wi-Fi AP to set it up. In fairness, I got sidetracked by something else and I didn't get to trying to set it up until 20 minutes after I plugged it in. I wound up unplugging it and trying again and it seemed to connect that time.Overall I'm pretty happy so far. It's controlling my Kasa smart outlets by voice as well as my aging (but gracefully) Ecobee 2 thermostat.Maybe I'll ask Alexa to order me up some more smart plugs tomorrow.Move over, Jetsons!

Title: I like it
Body: Started small, just recently, with an Echo Dot rather than the bigger model that I guess most folks use as their main unit. It performs well overall, especially for the things I specifically wanted it for (being able to remotely turn lights on and off, as I have an erratic schedule). Sound quality is really quite good for such a small device. I do wish it was possible to get better, more detailed and location-specific weather forecasts (those of us who work outdoors need wind info), and that there was more flexibility in setting up the skills and routines, but overall, I like it a lot.

Title: on my 2nd one - both bad sound
Body: I have returned the 1st one because the sound was muffled and scratchy at times. I now have the 2nd one and the sound goes through the same ups and downs.  I finally turned on only the bass and it removed the scratchy sounds but of course I'm hearing all bass now.  Not sure this is the way speakers should be.  I'm very disappointed in this item but I love my other 4 devices and they are older versions.

Title: Nice Improvement Over the Echo 2
Body: I have several Echo 2's, which I now use to provide input to my sound systems. They work fine in this capacity. I had originally purchased an Echo 2 for the bedroom but was not happy with the quality of the sound and replaced it with the Echo 3. The third generation's sound quality is superior and well worth the $10 difference in price if you want to play music from it. All my granddaughters got Echo 3's for Xmas this year and are quite happy with them. I have no problem communicating with Alexa on it. Works great!

Title: Huge downgrade from the previous version.
Body: Worse speaker, worse microphone, huge delay after saying "Alexa".  Bring back the old version!!!

Title: Love
Body: The speaker on this one is way better than my 2nd generation dot. I use Alexa for everything now. I ask her how the weather is, how my commute is, I have her read me books and play music, she turns on and off my lights and when it_ time to go to sleep, she plays the most wonderful nature sounds for me all night. My only complaint would be that my boyfriend and I have the same prime household membership and we can_ separate our Alexa_ from each other. For example, I get all his calls and we can_ create separate grocery lists.

Title: Fits my minor needs
Body: I bought this solely for multi-room audio streaming. If google had that capability, I would have gone with them in a heartbeat.2 of the 3 I bought are hooked to stereo systems.  I wish there was an option to use an AV cable AND the built-in speaker at the same time for when I don't want to power on the stereo to ask a simple question. Other than that and a white noise machine for the bedroom, I don't use it for much.  Maybe to ask about the time and the weather when I'm in bed.

Title: The Alexa functions work fine.  The speaker function leaves a lot to be desired
Body: I was given a Dot for Christmas and set it up to control several electrical circuits in my son's bedroom.  This function worked like a charm.  I decided to purchase a second for my bedroom.  In addition to the Alexa functions, I wanted to replace my bluetooth speaker.  Why have two toys that perform the same function.  Plus, Alexa can change the volume via voice command.  Alas, as a speaker, the Dot sucks.  There is a lot of static and crackling during playback.  I can playback the same song on my older speaker with no issues.  I'm not expecting concert hall sounds, just something reasonably clear.  The Dot fails.

Title: Finally a clock!
Body: Finally a clock on the echo dot! After upgrading all my 1st generation dots (3 total) because of the better sound quality (huge difference)... They add a clock to the dot! So for Christmas I upgraded them all again! Absolutely love the clock addition, and has been long over due. Just wish I didn't have all these extra dots now. Hopefully they don't come up with another addition that I can't resist. I still have the very original Amazon echo in my kitchen and love it!

Title: Extend your Ech/Alexa enabled home with the latest Generation of the Echo Dot.
Body: You can think of the Echo Dot  like an extension of your overall Echo/Alexa network giving you Automation in any room you set one up in even if that room is out of hearing range for you main Echo Hub. Plus since they can send commands to other Echo/Alexa devices among other things you can turn them into an intercom system for you Echo/Alexa enabled home. Imagine being in the kitchen and you just put dinner on the table. Rather then having to chase everyone down to come to dinner you can just stay in the kitchen or wherever one of you Echo control devices are and call everyone to dinner. Their main improvement in the latest generation (3rd Generation) was the addition of several microphones (making it more responsive) and an improve speaker for better sound playback quality. This means they can also serve as a radio or a news source. It's not high fidelity but given it's size the sound quality is pretty nice. They are also very reasonably priced given all they can do.

Title: Sorry Alexa
Body: UPDATE:WOW, Alexa is great, the speakers are okay, not great. I mean the rest of this stuff right now is just plain silly.I originally gave a 1 star because of this.I thought the Amazon Music Individual plan worked like this,* You can only play on one "Speaker" at a time, grouping does not work with the Individual plan, period.BUT it works like this,* You can only have one "Stream" at a time,  but grouping will work for that one stream on all speakers in that group with the Individual plan.Yeah, I wish Amazon would make this more clear in their drop-down menu (only place I could even find anything, sad). All they need to do is add a few words,Individual Plan: ("add") "Single" Stream tens of millions of songs from any device  "or a group of devices".Pretty simple. Especially since the Family Plan says "Stream on up to 6 devices at once." makes it look like it is the only plan that lets you uses more than one device at the same time.Still only 3 stars because of issues 2 through 10 which still apply (See below before you buy)...ORIGINAL POST:WOW, what a horrible overall experience. Alexa is great, the speakers are okay, but Amazon has just totally blown this for its main capability, playing music. I mean the rest of this stuff right now is just plain silly. I'm returning 2 Dots and an Echo plus because Amazon was so smart they put up roadblocks at every option to try and use these "Smart Speakers" as "Speakers"! Basically, the only way to use these speakers as speakers is using Amazon services. Please keep reading before buying!.1 Multiroom is only available via Amazon Music, there is no other way to listen to all your speakers at once, period!.2 Playing on multiple speakers is an upcharge via Amazon Music..3 Playlist through Amazon Music requires a minimum of 5 clicks per song (think about that)..4 There is no way to use or upload ANY music you already own ( or even a way to compile playlists from that music).5 There is currently no way to import or create playlists externally..6 If you use Bluetooth or AUX for outputting sound from the Echo speaker's the speaker sound is turned off..7 The Dots have no input option, so you can't even just use them as a dump speaker..8 I tried multiple equalizer options and nothing I did made these speakers sound all that great. They basically have no range..9 They don't play in stereo either, they play in mono, one channel on all speakers playing to the same thing..10 This is basically a toy, get a Kid Dot if you want, and maybe in a few years this tech will have arrived, it's not here yet.I could go on but I had the Plus for less than a week and the Dots for less than a day.

Title: Has not improved too much
Body: **Appearance**The new look of the echo dot 3rd generation looks way better than its previous models. It has a more modern look with a nice material finish on the outside so that it looks less like a hockey pick and more of a well-designed device. I love the customization options for it, the designs look well made and smooth, but I wish they would add more there's only 3 when there are so many colors out there! It doesn't seem like you can take off the outside cover on it; so you'd have to buy it from a third party. It's also slightly bigger than its other models but it's not something noticeable.**Setup**It is not powered by a micro USB like the previous model instead it comes with a power adapter that you plug into a wall. This removes a lot of freedom such as plugging it into a computer or using another form of power. Having that accessibility is important because you want to give the customers all the freedom they can. With a micro USB, you don't have to worry about having to plug it away from where exactly you want it. The way it is set up is by the Alexa app. The setup is relatively simple but for me, it took longer than expected as I would be connected to the wifi it was on but it would not give me any further steps. It wasn't a big deal but I thought it was worth mentioning.**Performance**It has great functionality it is useful for hooking up to devices such as smart lights, door locks, etc. It can read notifications off your phone with the voice command, control other devices, listen to music, play games, make phone calls, and a plethora of other stuff. It also has an audio jack for you to connect speakers to if you do not like the built-in speaker. You can get traffic updates, weather information, and you can even connect multiple echo devices. It is very useful for example, if mom is in the kitchen and the food is done, she can announce the food is done via her voice and let an announcement out to inform others. This is very useful for when you're far away in the house making it convenient instead of having you walk you the designated person. It has functionality that you can use. The echo dot also has skills. One example of an of a skill is the find my phone skill. Doing this will let Alexa make a phone call to your phone which can be used if you cannot find your phone.*What I dislike *One thing I very dislike is the fact it doesn't hear me quite often. I'll be 10 yards away and I have to yell for it to hear me which is very annoying. I have to be very close to it to hear me; this is a very big let down for me. Now the music. You can only play off of a radio station or have a subscription to pay to Amazon. However, on the Google home mini, you can play music off of Google Play Music for free. I do not think it should be so difficult for these smart speakers to force us to buy a subscription for such a single task.*You should get a Google home mini instead*The google mini has more customizations, for starters, you can edit the voice from many different choices. You can choose from male and female, and even different accents. On alexa, you cannot change the female voice which limits users by a lot. The Google mini looks better and has mostly the same functionality as the Alexa.This is a good device and is very useful. If you plan to get it I'm sure you'll love it and it'll be very useful, however,  when you look closer into the details, you'll see its competitor can be the better device.

Title: Not Ready For Prime Time
Body: While this is very cool technology, the actual performance of the product is mediocre & at times utterly exasperating.  I have several devices, hooking into stereos in various rooms in the house.  At times it performs perfectly, and at other times it is nearly impossible to get it to play the same radio station that you play every morning [one specific example:  "Alexa, play Vermont Public Radio."  Response (again and again on some mornings): "Playing Maine Public Radio...."]  The words "Vermont" and "Maine" don't even sound similar, so I don't know why it has so much trouble with this.  Sometimes Alexa has no trouble finding my playlists on Amazon Prime, but at other times it cannot find playlists, even when I stand right next to the device, use my best elocution, and ensure that I have the name exactly right by reading it directly from my phone.  In summary, this product was released before it could work as promised.  Amazon has apparently decided that the most lucrative business model for this product was to release it early, without warning consumers that we are all, collectively gullible beta testers.

Title: This is a product that belongs in every home
Body: I was always curious about Alexa; I wanted one, but never wanted to spend the money. Last month I put it on my Christmas list on a whim, and that was one of the best gifts I_e ever asked for. I_e always been an Apple person, but Siri isn_ even in the same generation as Alexa. Alexa is far more advanced than even my millennial mind expected. Imagine making dinner and simply asking for any NPR program, slow relaxing jazz, 70_ Disco, Cher or any other  genre/podcast/artist you could possibly desire and it immediately comes true in a sound quality that is next to none. Alexa does that. She answers questions, responds to compliments, adds to your grocery list, continues the conversation and can teach you a little something about everything.I bought a 2nd Echo just days after receiving the first one. This product isn_ overrated, it_ the standard and you should have one!

Title: Super stellar Sonic hearing ability never fails to amaze
Body: This product is clearly ingenious. It's basically the computer you don't have to type into did that responds instantly and is native in the fact that it will adapt to your style of interaction. It's not without its quirks, but I feel that once I learned better how to use the Alexa app everything will be groovy. The ability for voice recognition above my blasting of whatever music and background noise and the like is probably the most interesting thing to me, although there are so many thousands of things that you can do with this item I'm sure you'll find something less dorky. I also purchased a second generation Echo and the sound quality is only slightly marginally better, I wouldn't say it's louder, just more Bass. Additionally, despite it having more microphones for voice recognition it fails to pick up like the 3rd generation Echo dot does. I'm still trying to learn what all the light rings in flashing mean but I find it entertaining to look at. I'm 100% not concerned about the fact that there's a microphone in my house listening to me all the time, I do not believe that there is malice intent nor even really ability to utilize something such as this in a negative fashion against somebody. Plus the worst thing it could hear is me talking on the phone with my sisters. Hope I helped.

Title: Great speaker, Love the Echo Dot
Body: We love our echo devices. We have a Gen 1 echo and a Gen 3 echo dot. The Echo has better sound and seems to have a slightly faster response time, but the Gen 3 echo dot doesn't come far behind. Great sound, compact and small, and does everything you expect Alexa to do (we mostly listen to music and control the thermometer and use it as an alarm). My 15 month daughter always turns around and looks at the Echo or Echo dot when I say "Alexa..." and she loves it when the blue circle lights up and the music starts playing. The dot is a great price too. Alexa can use some improvement on answering information questions better, but we've noticed she's been getting better.

Title: I love it
Body: I love it and bought another one so I could have one in my kitchen/living room and one upstairs in my bedroom. It's especially awesome for list making but also when I'm cooking or doing dishes in the kitchen it's nice to be able to change shows, volume, etc on the TV without having to go grab the remote. It's also handy to be able to just voice a song request but the speakers aren't the greatest and I've had some difficulty connecting it to a few gadgets - that's the only reason for the 4 star review. Also you can't control volume or on/off power of your TV through Alexa unless you have a smart TV and you're able to connect the two. Just having a firestick won't do the trick

Title: Love my Echo Dot
Body: Everyone we know has an Echo but it wasn't in the budget right now so thought we'd try this little gal. Love her. Alexa is great. I use her to set reminders constantly, as well as timers, adding stuff to my grocery list, and to play music. We have a fairly small house so this size is fine for our downstairs, sound is actually great for small-ish rooms. Its not crazy loud and we dont crank it up, but for semi-loud background music its great. I'm not a super tech person so I cant speak to all the other crazy stuff other reviewers dont like, but for me its great. Like having an assistant, which I desperately needed LOL :)

Title: Alexa - your robotic friend.
Body: Never thought I_ enjoy an Echo but truth be told I do. It_ extremely convenient for quick questions that you need quick and simple answers to. It_ nice to be able to have Alexa perform certain tasks on command like playing certain songs, setting timers, or anything in between. The only flaw of course is that it can be glitchy. It doesn_ always quite hear your voice commands or follows them so you find yourself repeating the same thing to a computer multiple times. I_e had to unplug it too just so it can reboot. It can definitely  be frustrating but it_ worth the price for what you want it for.

Title: Don't Judge By Looks Alone
Body: I have the 2nd gen and 3rd gen echo dots.  I had read MANY reviews that the newer 3rd gen didn't sound any better than the previous 2nd gen.  But then I saw one at Kohls and decided I would check it out in person.  I'm sure glad I did because the sound difference has definitely improved over the 2nd gen dot!  I was very impressed with the sound quality and would have no problem using one in a bedroom application.  Bottom line... if you're on the fence about it... go to Kohls and hear it for yourself before making a decision.

Title: Previous generation worked better.
Body: I own 2 of the previous generation of the Echo Dot and one of this gen. This one seems to have a hard time hearing its wake-up word. Also, the old one had no problem hearing me over the alarm or music that was currently playing and this one can hear if the volume is above 6 and there isn't a pause is audio. I literally have to wait for pause in whatever is playing to catch its attention.The only plus side is that the audio does sound a little better and it looks little more modern than the hockey pucks.

Title: Needs more customization
Body: Should be able to adjust the speaker lever with my voice.Should be able to kill the light show at nightNeed to be able to do more,  and answer more question as the "OK google" function on my phone. Tired of asking Alexa and still having to ask google, I just stopped asking Alexa.And for the size of some of these things, they should start making the rechargeable battery operated version of this.Finally, I don't know why I thought this would be louder.

Title: Not what it seems
Body: Calling this AI? Total bs.Not user friendly. Does not understands or responds consistently. Configuration of smart home devices is a Nightmare. Less nightmare if you buy the suggested brands. Few games and skills are good or work properly. The bluetooh only connects to one speaker at the time. The multy speaker option works whever Alexa feels like. And  I find incredibly stupid that you can not add a skill to a routine.Alexa is a good speaker for the price that says hi to you. Thats all.

Title: Sounds better when it does.
Body: Initially I was going to write a higher review but I have had some issues with the New Dit. Unfortunately at times it sounds Very Fuzzy, like a Buzzing sound. This will be during any random song.  Sometimes the Same song will sound fine. Other times it can just sound horrible and I just yell for Alexa to STOP because I can't stand that sound. Almost seems like the speakers are just messed up half the time. When it works, it sounds Way better than the Echo 2. When it gets fuzzy, it's just awful. Also, I paid $30 New and NOW they're charging $50. THAT Is why I also Can NOT give it more than 3.

Title: Stay away fron the 3rd Generation
Body: Overall, I like the functionality of the device, but Out of the box, my speaker has sporadic static as if the speaker is blown. Sometimes it's clear,  sometimes it's sounds like it's raining in the background with music and Alexas voice. It's a known issue with a 3rd generation dots (google it). I've filed a ticket with technical support and they're giving me the run-around that they'll contact me when they have a solution but refuse to give me a credit or replacement under the warranty until they figure it out. I'm very disappointed because Amazon usually is good with returns with items that they sell from other manufacturers, but when its their own product, they'll guve you the run around and fight you when its an obvious flaw with the unit.

Title: Alexa is fun and a little silly. Great games and music!
Body: I keep her on mute most of the time so she doesn't hear our conversations. The reason I bought her was because my son loves the song 'Baby Shark' and I wanted him to try to tell Alexa to "play baby shark". He tries but he's still working on his language skills being under 2 years old and all.My Husband and I love the game 'Song Quiz'. It's soo fun! My favorite era to play is 2010s. My Husband likes the 90s and 2000s. Overall, we like her. She can give us the weather in our city. My Husband had a hard time getting the weather forecast for a ski resort an hour away. Anyways, we have a great time with her. She's funny and fun. I just wish she could carry on conversation without having to go to the A.I. feedback app or whatever it's called. Love the trivia games she has!

Title: Best Invention Since The MP3
Body: Got one as a gift for my mother.  While waiting for it to arrive, I went and bought one for myself at a local retailer.Best.Decision.Ever.  Nothing like asking Alexa to play your music while your hands are in dish water or having her call Mama while you are making dinner.  Hands free is the way to go.  Weather report, traffic, news, music and even compliments at a whisper.We love her so much that we bought another for the house and I even got one for my desk at work.  She plays all of my music and radio channels that won't pick-up in my building.  When the phone rings, I simply say "Alexa mute" and she stops. "Alexa Resume" and we are back in business.  Lots of easter eggs and fun.  She can answer almost any question and can even fart or bark on command.  Life is complete.

Title: Just right for our needs and more.
Body: The sound for music throughout our house is really good. I purchased three, one for eachlevel of house. The sound is so much better than previous versions I_ so glad I choose not to save $3 per device and go with the old ones. Use mostly for music and life loves it. Started using lists for shopping and try new things all the time. Upstairs one is between kids bedrooms and starting to try as sleep sounds. Also use the drop in feature and use as baby monitor when watching movies in the basement late. Using announcements too when time for dinner or time to leave, beats the heck out of yelling across the house. I_ sure I_l get a few more or may try the Echo Plus for even better sound and move some Echo dots around.

Title: I use it frequently
Body: Admittedly I primarily use these in conjunction with Amazon Music and to tell me the weather/forecast. I'm not really using these to their full extent yet. However, being able to play the music throughout the whole house across multiple devices is a huge plus, especially if we're planning a party or just cleaning the house. Likewise I'm learning to use the Alexa more effectively in calling for the type of music I'd like to listen to. Setting up the devices was easy. Once I got one setup, the others just needed to be plugged in from the box. I should note that I have the Echo Dot Gen 3 and the Echo Gen 2. The Echo Dot Gen 3 seems to carry sound just as good as the bigger Echo for a fraction of the price. If you're going to buy one, buy two.

Title: Echo is for us, Google mini wasn't
Body: We love our echo dot. Great sound and responds to voice commands really well. We use ours in our kitchen and I love using the timer feature. It's easy to set a timer on my stove, but Alexa makes it even more hands-free. Some times my hands and fingers are dirty, so I feel it is a nice bonus to have that ability via a simple voice command. It's our first one so I can't compare it to the 2nd gen ones that I've read about, but I love this one. We bought my Dad a Google mini, because he has used his girlfriends in the past and he's not too tech savvy so I didn't want to throw him off, but I like my Alexa much better. I don't know why, but I just think Alexa responds to my voice much easier and knows exactly what I need. BONUS is the added Amazon prime music. We are prime members and it is much easier to find the music we want to listen to on the echo vs. the Google mini. Google mini only seemed to give "related" music stations to what you are searching for. For instance, Johnny cash. Google only gave us a station that played his music occasionally or more often, songs that they considered similar; while Alexa just gave us Johnny Cash (which is what we wanted). If I want 90's alternative, it gave me 90's alternative. This is our first time using the prime music feature with out prime membership and I don't know why we've waited this long. Now we didn't purchase anything extra with the Google mini, music-wise, so that might make a difference. But with the Alexa we would never have to (along with our prime membership which we already had). I'm not tech savvy in anyway, so if you want to get in detailed specs and such, I can't offer that review! we will be purchasing more!!!

Title: Biggest bang for the buck on the planet!
Body: I purchased this Echo mostly for music but Alexa does so much more!  I LOVE, LOVE, LOVE _er!  There is much I still need to learn but from the first music I asked to be played, which was Mellow Jazz, I was AMAZED by the sound Nd I have BOSE equipment.  I called my man friend immediately to tell him he must buy it ( ECHO DOT Gen 3 ) he did and loves his too. I bought one for my son who is laid up for 3 months with a redo on leg surgery. He is still waiting because evidently this was a very popular Holiday gift but I can_ wait for him to get it. Yesterday I asked for Bird Sounds and you would swear my home was filled with them!  This is the best bang for the buck in the world IMO!  An excellent gift for anyone. You will also get emails so you can try new things to ask Alexa and there are supposedly over 1 thousand!  If she only played music I would be sold! THANK YOU for such a fabulous product.  Every morning I tell ALEXA _ood Morning and she gives me my local weather forecast. What more can I say? GET ONE or TWO or THREE! _

Title: A Tale About My Smart Home
Body: Well, I now have Echoes in every room except the bathroom (that's next). And they have networked throughout the house so I can turn on or off the lights in a particular room without actually being in that room. Since I rely on Amazon for all manner of things especially purchases, it just made sense to choose Echo.  I can order things I frequently purchase as well as previous one-time buys so easily with Alexa. No regrets. The other day, I misplaced my phone, and no matter where I am in the house I can say "Alexa, find my phone." BaBam! Just like that I found it! It's official. My house is now smarter than I.

Title: Nice upgrade
Body: This little thing comes with a lot of sound. Its so loud that I normally have it set to volume 5. My gen 2 I had to have on volume 10 all the time. The only issue I have is that when I use it as alarm for the mornings I set it to volume 10 before bed and it has a hard time hearing me tell it to turn off when the alarm sounds. Any other time ive ised it to play misic I have to yell "Echo" the name for it to hear me. If it could hear me better then it would get a 5 star. Plus the charging cord was changed from the USB to a different set up making it not as veraitile as before if you move it around at all. Other than that its a great upgrade from the gen 2.

Title: Dammed cool! Dammed cool device!
Body: The things this can do is really amazing. The price is great. I bought the outlet control after receiving the Dot and it works flawlessly. It's like the voice command in Star Trek, really cool. For it's size it has pretty decent sound (and I am a picky former sound engineer). Great for a kitchen! I had a little trouble setting it up to my wifi but that was user error. Don't get frustrated if this happens. You can listen to the radio, make calls, hear news, local weather, voice games, I am only beginning to unlock it's full potential. With multiple units they are also able to be used as a household intercom. Neat product. It is linked to your account so in the app I made sure voice purchasing was set to off. YOU WILL NEED WIFI AND FREE ALEXA APP.For the price and capability I highly recommend this or any other of their new "smart speakers".

Title: Alexa works fine. Speaker and sound is garbage.
Body: I bought two of the Echo Dot 3rd Gen and sent both back. I opened one and tried it out. The sound is horrible, even after adjusting through the Alexa app. They just sound like a muffled mess. And these aren_ rechargeable. You_l need to carry the power cord no matter where you take it. I realize this is a small speaker but I have a few other Bluetooth speakers just as small as this and they have great sound range. Amazon needs to go back to the drawing table on this one, as far as decent sound is concerned.

Title: An excellent improvement over the second generation echo dot.
Body: Pros: The sound quality is greatly improved over the first and second generation dots.  Amazon has also refined the microphone system.  The new dot now picks up conversation and understands much better. I used to have problems with room echo with the generation 2.  Great looks, great sound and better microphones make this unit a hit.Cons: There really isn't any.  If Amazon would have included the internal thermometer as they did with the next gen echo plus this unit would have it all.

Title: Surprisingly loud!
Body: I bought this for my toddler's bedroom, so she can control the lamp verbally and I don't have to worry about her getting burned or frying herself with an outlet (the outlets are hidden from her sight and reach though). At bedtime, I turn on the rain sounds for her to fall asleep to, and the speaker does a great job. It's not as good as the full sized Echo, of course, but hey--during the holiday sales this can be had for $25, sometimes even a little cheaper. Not much to complain about there!

Title: Had it for about a month
Body: Overall its ok, I used it during the holidays for music, and also daily news casts.Its just been over a month now, and honestly, I have not used it in the last week to 10 days....It does take time to learn all the possible commands.Would I recommend it, not sure really. Its enjoyable at first but to some degree, its another piece of technology in my life, and really, too much tech in ones life gets annoying.The sound quality is good....

Title: Short warranty....
Body: After 6 months of ownership my Dot started to malfunction. It was playing music randomly, often waking us up in the middle of the night. After spending 20 minutes with tech support I was told it needed to be replaced........... at my cost! My mistake for not reading the fine print, only a 90 day warranty!  I was offered a 15% discount on a new one. Seriously? When they go on sale they are 50% 0ff! I will be selling all my Echo products and changing brands....

Title: Incredible sound quality
Body: I love my dot!!!  It_ everything as advertised and more. I love being able to play games on the dot with myself and my family, but I also love that I can link it up with other dots to play music or communicate back and forth.The only problem I have is this: every so often, it chooses to sound almost tinny. It_ only just slight enough that I notice it. It doesn_ last long but it does happen. I don_ think this is common to all Dots, probably just mine individually (so don_ think they all sound tinny- it actually has incredible sound when it_ working in full function!)I have been recommending this to all my friends. Sounds amazing with all genres of music and very helpful with the alarms and reminders and news reports.

Title: Can_ beat the price for how many things it does. It_ better than Siri on your phone.
Body: I love my echo dot. I got the white and it_ so sleek. Alexia has a personality, it can be fun but also incredibly helpful. I use it also for timers, alarms, weather, the news, music and so on. It also can connect to Bluetooth so if I want to listen to music I just say _lexa connect to Bose speaker and then it plays through the speaker. It_ awesome and can_ beat the price. I also love listening to audio books on it. Pretty neat little gadget!!

Title: The Echo dot is OK for the price, but the Echo is 100X better.
Body: I've been using the Echo dot and the Echo for about 3-weeks now. Everyone talks about the difference in the speakers and sound quality, so I'll leave that out of this review. What I want people to know is that the Echo is much better than the Echo Dot even though the Dot is 1/3 the price. I say this because the Echo Dot has a low-quality microphone. This is probably one of the ways they were able to reduce the price. Consider this:1. Responsiveness: I have the Dot in my room and the Echo in the living room. More often than not, when I say "Alexa" the Echo in the living room will respond while the Dot does nothing. Because of this, I had to change the wake word for my Dot.
