There are also times where I have to repeatedly try to wake my Dot because it just doesn't hear me. On the other hand, the Echo can hear me while I'm in the bathroom with the door closed.2. Understanding: A lot of times I'll clearly (and loudly) tell my Dot to do something, but it thinks I said something else. The Echo sometimes does this too, but the Dot does it much more frequently.I like the Dot overall, but if I could go back in time I would buy another Echo on monthly payments instead. It's just not worth the frustration of having to repeatedly yell at this hockey puck to get it to do something.

Title: Sound clearly better than 2nd generation
Body: I purchased a second generation dot when Amazon put them on sale before Christmas.  I was not sure if I would like it and wanted to go with the least expensive starting point.  I really enjoyed it and bought a 3rd generation for my wife to use.  The functionality of the two is essentially  the same since they are running the same software.  However, the sound quality of the 3rd seems reason enough to purchase the more expensive and newer 3rd generation.  I also like the appearance of the 3rd generation.  The sound quality difference is not bad when Alexa is giving the weather or something like that.  However, we use the 3rd generation to play ocean sounds at night for sleeping and that is noticeably different and better with the 3rd generation.  I have used the app to group some smart plugs and have enjoyed the convenience.  I feel like we will continue to find little uses for the dot that make the morning routine a little easier and it is nice to play a little music while getting ready for work.  Do note that the sound quality is not what I want to listen to music in general but ok to have a song play while getting ready in the morning.  I would not sit down and listen to an album in the evening on it.

Title: 2 Years Later Using Both: Echo is Much Better than Google Home Mini!
Body: I started my smarthome with Google mini because they were, ...well Google (an AI company that will probably do a better job). Almost  2 Years later, I came to find out I was very wrong! While Google_ platform is slowly getting better, I found that Amazon_ Alexa  platform is actually a lot more mature with a wider variety of sensors and smarthome products. Software-wise, Alexa supports way more skills, like way way more. It_ not even close!Using both platforms side by side over the last year or so, I found Google assistant (despite being more accurate with factual answers overall) to be lackluster with _kills and extension/apps. Alexa also does a few things way better. For example the  _rop in feature alone on Alexa turning the echo into an effective in-house  intercom system is  so much better than Google_ one way intercom _roadcast feature.  Google_ system is just frustrating in comparison. In fact I ditched it all together so I can easily have 2-way conversations without having to repeat _ey google broadcast... and then waiting for a reply from the receiver. Alexa intercom system  is especially effective with guests and the elderly (who won_ know how to reply or formulate a broadcast message on Google_ system and just wind up flustered and frustrated with the communication method), etc.Despite running a mostly google smart home system these new echos definitely raise the bar.  They work well with my new Ring Alarm System (much more reasonable pricing both hardware and monthly service fees for 24/7 monitoring. By reasonable I mean over a 50% price difference for arguably a worse product -google being the worse product and charging double!).Hardware: Amazon raised the bar with these. Sound clarity on echo as well as mic sensitivity is  unbelievable when compared to Google_ Home Mini.  It can hear you even from across the room with its speaker playing.

Title: Fails to Connect; Then Loses Network Completely and Needs Complete Re-setup
Body: I got this setup and half the time it takes 3 or 4 tries to connect to the network, even when the unit is virtually on top of the WiFi router. After only a half-dozen uses, it lost any connection to the network and had to be completely set up all over again. Sitting right next to the router & my iPhone, it wouldn't complete the setup process until the second attempt. Disappointed in this product since day 1 and it just got worse every time I tried to use it. Will not buy another Google product!1/14/19 Received a call from a technical person at Amazon Customer Service to try and resolve the problem, which was unexpected. The problem wasn't resolved but I appreciate the effort. Bottom line is that this device probably doesn't have the range to be used outside the house.

Title: for knowledge works well
Body: for controlling alexa app lights and sockets. not so good. in fact bad. works for awhile through alexa ten stops. but works thru the app on your phone. this is an update. a few days after writing this review. believe it or not. amazon contacted me and helped me with my issues. which are no more. the support help. talked to me with great concern. about my problem with my alexa's. they took a lot of time to help me get thru this. and more or less is was my fault. for not knowing to update the alexa app. that these programs work in. once I updated the app. everything started to work with alexa. had to reboot my other two alexa's two the new app. even though they said they were their. new app new reboot. every thing ok. I'm. a happy camper now. with full control of my lights and switch's customer support which called me was so helpful and nice and patient with me. it was an unbelievable experience. I should have called them in the first place. but I jumped the gun. who would have thought that they actually read these review's. so now I upgraded them to five stars. could not ask for better. patient. and understanding service. the girl I had was wonderful. so any problems. give them a call. before you judge here. like I know now.

Title: Amazon, you can do better
Body: Alexa takes over your life like a virus. We just love our new assistant. The kids have lots of fun with it. Our lights turn on and off on command. I just gave it a three for three reasons:1. There is no reason why the kids' model can't be the same price as the standard model. They are just tacking on services I don't want to the colorful case that I want. So the kids got a grown up Dot for Christmas...2. One of the most powerful features of Alexa is the ability to play music. Those speakers are still well below par.3. The microphone is not quite there yet, either.Nice gadget with plenty of room to grow.

Title: Loses its luster after a few days
Body: I feel like this is a novelty device. I had something more in mind but maybe I built it up too much in my head. I originally purchased Alexa and a few Wi-Fi plugs so I could control my Xmas lights with my voice. Which was super cool by the way but once I took my lights and my tree down there wasn_ a whole lot left to do. Now I have 4 WiFi plugs and an Alexa device just sitting there doing nothing. Every once in a while we get a chuckle out of her beat boxing skills (or lack there of) but then the laughter stops and I_ left with what seems to be a paperweight.It does do everything as promised so I can_ knock it for that but I would really like to see a fancier version, one that would display my security cameras when prompted to do so. I realize they make the echo dot but the screen quality was so poor and so small it didn_ do any good so I returned it for this simpler version.

Title: I_ in love! Buy it today-you won_ regret!
Body: I LOVE ALEXA! I_e never used an in home smart device such as this before and boy, was I missing out. My mom got me this for Christmas and highly recommended it, I didn_ understand why until I started using it! She answers all types of questions, tells jokes, the weather, the news (from your choice of news outlets!), and more!I love that my amazon music playlists are quick an easily accessible through Alexa as well.I haven_ used an external speaker as I find the built in speaker fine for me (I_ not an audiophile-just enjoy ambient music or podcasts in the kitchen).Speaking of podcasts, Alexa can pull up your podcasts in seconds-I love that!!!!I haven_ even fully explored all of her functions, but the little that I have has already impressed me! You won_ be disappointed with this and this price is a steal for all that Alexa brings to my home!

Title: Not very helpful
Body: This was a Christmas gift.  I never really wanted one. It sat in the box for a week. When I finally plugged it in, it kept trying to connect to my secure wifi without asking for my password.  It finally asked for my password after trying to make many attempts.  It won't play music unless I paid $$ monthly to play music. My daughters were really disappointed with that. Big $$ scam. They asked it questions it didn't have answers for . Sometimes the Echo wouldn't understand my daughters.  We've had it plugged in now for 2 weeks and we haven't played with it since the first day we plugged in. We will probably unplug it soon. It's just not that fun or useful.

Title: A Moms Bestie
Body: Early morning, I usually get up to prepare the day and Alexa has my back. Reading me the weather, events, inspirational quote, and the playlist I love.While cooking, I ask to her to set timers. No greasy or gross residue. During homework we play _lassical music for study. Kids have 5 min time out timers. I ask relative questions throughout the day.And then of course at night. We may play a little jeopardy on Alexa.People get worried about Alexa _pying on them which I can_ say for. But don_ iPhone listen to everything we say to as well? Not sure if you_e going to think one why not the other?Music - speaker on this model is AMAZING. Better than most Bluetooth speakers I_e owned. If you have Amazon Prime Music. They haven_ missed a song I_e asked Alexa to play yet!

Title: Perfect Assistant
Body: This device is small in size and doesn_ take up too much space. It_ light and easy to move, and it takes minutes to set up. You_l get easy to follow instructions, in the box, along with emails and notifications right on your dot. For me, I_e only had the device for a couple of weeks, but I_e already learned a bunch of great things to ask Alexa for help with; playing music, turning down lights, turning down volume, weather reports, math, setting timers, and even jokes. She_ got tons of Easter eggs, as I found out New Years morning, when I told her _ood morning. She basically _oke up and said, _hat year is it while yawning, lol I totally recommend this for anyone who lives a busy lifestyle, has kids, and can even be used for conference calls.

Title: Getting info correctly the first time
Body: The only down fall I can see for "Alexa" is using the Skills for info. Alexa can answer millions of questions but for some specifics like old radio shows. I have to say Alexa open radio Jack Benny or Open Radio the Whistler,  I can't say Alexa play the whistler.  If I say Alexa play jack Benny it will play songs sung by Jack Benny, If I say Alexa open Jack Benny she will then let me listen to the Jack Benny shows that used to play on the radio.  Alexa has gotten much smarter since I first got the Amazon Echo.  Alexa answers my questons correctly more often the Siri.I now have Alexa turning on a light for me which is great for walking into a dark room.

Title: I_ impressed! I_ not in 4th grade!
Body: I learn more and more things to do with this dot on the daily. Perfect if only used just as a wireless speaker, but why settle for just that?Note: I didn_ write a 600,000 word thesis to receive my Masters Degree in all things Amazon like some reviewers (ahem, you know who you are) Care to know why? Because I_ living my life and not having a melt down over a $30 product that some people think should be as state of the art as studio grade speakers. It_ a DOT.If you want better sound, buy a Tom Jones concert ticket. _oah, woah, pussy cat.....

Title: RESPONDS ON COMMAND TO ANY QUESTION
Body: I absolutely love this device ! Alexa is 10 times more accurate than Siri, when you ask a question she_l give you a direct answer or response, she_l play almost 98% of the songs you tell her to and uses a variety of music resources from pandora to Apple Music to Spotify. Unlike Siri she instantly plays any song on command. My most favorite thing is the smart home voice commands! Turning on lights and appliances through voice command is incredible and I have recommended and bought almost all my family members echos and smart home devices from lights to plugs. I guarantee you will love everything this device will have to offer and it just keeps getting better

Title: Dot-lightful!
Body: This little Dot lives in th MBR. She says, _ood night, sleep tight, sings made up songs, tells stories, and plays Ocean Waves to lull us to sleep. We can ask her the time, to set an alarm or play our favorite NPR station. She shuffled our favorite artists and songs and has replaced our clock radio. We couldn_ be happier. It may be small but it_ exactly the right size for this location.

Title: I like 1st generation better than 3rd generation, here is why
Body: I tested out before I give it out as gifts, but except the volume can be louder, which 1st gen is too quiet, 3rd gen is a pain, here is why:1. the plug is too big, once it was plug on my surge protector, it occupy so much space, I had to unplug two other appliances.2. it's more stupid, 1st gen can understand me better, 3rd gen is slower, and ignore me, or put down funny things in my shopping list.conclusion: good for use it play music, bad for household use.

Title: I received it as a gift
Body: The Echo Dot was a Chistmas gift to me. I would not have bought one because I have no Bluetooth appliances, electrical switches, etc. I do like the Echo Dot as a music source, though--it accesses both Amazon music and Pandora. I've had it only a short time. Gradually I'm learning that it can report the weather more quickly than dialing it up in the cell phone. I like it very much--I'm glad I received one as a gift. I wish it could turn on/off lights--maybe I'll acquire such lamps.

Title: better than version 2 with some caveats
Body: I really like the sound and how much louder version 3 is compared to version 2. However, it is too bass-y out of the box. Go into the settings and adjust the treble all the way up and the lows down 2 and mids should be up 1. this in my opinion gives it much better sound and allows the vocals to come through more precise.Version 2 is better if you want to hang from a wall or get a adapter to hang from the plug. new version is too big and too bulky for the adapters.

Title: Disconnection of other Bluetooth devices....
Body: This takes some time getting use too and works with it. Some of the commands have to phrased in a certain way in order for Alexa to understand. It will come with time, I hope. Also there are certain apps or podcast I have trouble connecting to the Echo Dot. And if I have my bluetooth _N in my iPhone, it will disconnect any other Bluetooth device you may be using. This is annoying because it will keep doing it until you completely shut off the connection from the Echo. Other than that, in time I will get to know the commands and what Alexa understands. That is why I gave it 4 stars. I may come back to update my review once I get the hang of the Echo Dot.

Title: Surprisingly good sound - Now have 3 at my mom's house
Body: I got 2 of these for my mom (she lives alone & loves her 1st generation Dot)So I wanted to add one to her bedroom (as an alarm clock) & one for the family room so she could her her pill reminders & check the weather when she isn't in the kitchen (where her original Dot is).The sound is really great for such a small speaker - way better than the original Dot (which was fine for news & weather) but these new ones sound good playing music - nice improvements Amazon!

Title: The Echo Dot (3rd generation) is AWESOME!
Body: Well we got the echo dot for Christmas and absolutely love it.  It is so helpful with schedules, listening to music, turning on/off lights with our smart plug, and so much more..  My favorite is the "flash briefing" which I've set mine up to hear a verse of the day, a positivity statement, and of course, my news and weather for the day.  We've used meditations, white noise, and so much more.  Love to discover new ways Alexa can assist us where needed or, or learn new things it can do just for fun!

Title: Poor job at recognizing various things
Body: I will ask, "Alexa, play the song that goes..." and say a lyric from a song, and it never gets it right. Not even close. It also does a poor job of answering questions or will tell me irrelevant answers if it actually does come up with an answer. I can ask simple questions such as, "alexa, are CFL or LED bulbs brighter?" And I'm always met with a "hmm, I dont know that one". I wish I didn't spend all this money on putting one in almost each room.

Title: Sound of Music Great, Voice Not So Great
Body: I bought a pair of these for the bedroom to replace a single Echo Dot 2 for stereo sound, and a second pair for my girlfriend.  Listening to music is great, as the speaker quality is very good, and stereo separation is nice.  However, when asking Alexa for the time or weather reports, the voice responses are noticeably harder to hear or understand than with the previous generation.  In addition, the two Dot 3's sometimes get confused as to which one is supposed to respond to questions, and occasionally, one responds, and then the other one responds to the same question after a delay.  It seems as though this technology is not fully developed yet, and hopefully they will be able to offer software fixes for these issues.

Title: What did we do before Alexa?
Body: She works as the perfect intercom between our daughter's casita and our house. Our daughter is disabled and Alexa has opened a whole new world to her.... Alexa, tell me a joke. Alexa ask Hoopla to read Harry Potter. Alexa, let's play trivia. I originally had bought it to use as a bluetooth speaker with my projector and it has become integral to our lives. Alexa, remind me to put the potatoes on at 2 o'clock; Alexa, play instrumental piano. Alexa, put bread on my shopping list.

Title: Excellent device
Body: We have an existing Echo. This one was purchased to put upstairs in our daughters room. She can listen to music in her room or we can sync both the Echo and the new Echo dot to have music playing throughout the house. For such a small device this Echo Dot puts out great sound for a small room. We are very satisfied with this purchase. I would recommend this product to a friend/family member and I would buy again. In fact I am sure we will buy one for our bedroom!!

Title: Echo dot not happening.
Body: I was looking forward to this gadgeT, heard all types of great things about it, family members have one so I wanted it too.  Well, it came a few days ago and that excitement turned to a nightmare.  Man, it was the most stressful thing ever.  What seems so simple watching videos about it did not go in my favor.  Everytime I tried to get hooked up it would say, you're not registered.  Followed all the checklist to remedy this situation but no success.  Tried calling for help, no success.  Literally did all the steps probably more than 10x and then tried it again with whatever changes to see if it would work. Failed.  I'm returning this and bid this good riddance.  This was not the outcome I was hoping for and after reading some negative issues about having echo dot I'm now glad it didn't work.  I've read some really scary stuffs about it.  Get unhooked now, you'll thank me later.  BIG FAIL!

Title: Not impressed.
Body: Two stars_ne for each of the uses I've found for the device in as many months (1. hearing what to expect from my commute without stopping getting ready or being subjected to the rest of the depressing local news, 2. listening to music or podcasts or audiobooks at voice command... though using my phone and Bluetooth speaker was really not that much of a bother). I suppose if you already have a 'smart home,' it may introduce a new level of convenience to your life.As a very curious person who often wonders about all kinds of random things, usually while in the middle of washing dishes or fixing the garbage disposal, I was excited at the prospect of being able to simply voice a question and have an answer without stopping to pick up my phone or computer. But "hey Alexa" is a far cry from "hey Google." Easily 3/4 of the questions I ask "Alexa"_hose answers could be easily found with a quick internet search_licit one of the "I don't know about that" replies.Also, if you're intelligent enough to seek out multiple different sources for your national and world news, don't expect Alexa to help there, either: there's exactly one option.From what I can tell, the Echo Dot is a pretty ingenious way for Amazon to get you to buy all kinds of other compatible devices. Without them, it's pretty useless.

Title: I wish I purchased a Google Home Instead!!!
Body: I had the Amazon Echo for 2 months now, and I can confidentially say, I'm not 100% satisfied.  85% of the time you ask it a question,  it says it doesn't know the answer.  I try to ask the same question in.muiltiple ways and still I don't know.  This is the main reason why I bought it...to ask questions without physically googling them...I have google assistant on my phone it's excellent with answering questions. Another thing, if you have an unusual name, it would pronounce you name wrong and you cant fix it...which annoys the hell out of me!!! Google let's you write your name phonetically.  I wish I got a google home instead!!!!! Since I'm out of my return window, I guess I'll keep it.  But I'll definitely will purchases a google home, and use the echo as a back up.Some Pros1. Music sound pretty good coming out of it.  So you'll love it if you wanted a smart speaker just for this.2.  It can pick up your voice from a pretty large distance.

Title: An improvement on the last one
Body: When I bought the previous Dot, THIS is what I thought it would be. I think Amazon finally got it right. Hey, this is a small, non stereo speaker. Some nice Jazz in the background or for a bedroom or office. Don't kid yourself, this is not a replacement for a larger Echo or other smart speaker or, even better, a basic stereo receiver with a couple of decent bookshelf speakers and, maybe, a sub woofer.I've regulated my old dots to the basement for _uard duty (when I finally get it) and when I am working around the house. They might also eventually be put into stereo mini jack to RCA duty, acting as a way to get streaming music to that receiver with those bookshelf speakers_or the new ones, I have one for a dead spot by the front door (also, Guard duty) and another in the guest bedroom. Fine for basic music and while not as dynamic as the full Echo models, good for some Jazz or classical or vocal background music.

Title: Learn someting new each day!
Body: My Pastors have Alexa products throughout their house and told me I was on a "slippery slope" with a laugh. I'm beginning to think they are right. Just one Dot is not enough. Now I want the outlet adaptors, another for my bedroom, possible one for my office....The learning curve can be frustrating at times. I've been an Apple products user for years and expect a certain level of cooperation from my electronic devices. I've had to look up "how-to" many times with this little gift. But I will say, the more I ask questions the more it adapts to telling me what I need to know. I just tracked my first Amazon order since receiving this Dot and was able to add the ability to know when the order arrives. Since I work from home and sometimes don't know a package has been left, this should be convenient! I'll know more tomorrow!

Title: Works OK, but not exactly what I wanted
Body: I bought this for one purpose, to have music when I go to bed.  I like to go to sleep listening to music and I liked the idea of being able to tell Alexa to turn it off whenever I was done.  It actually does this, but I had to create a playlist from Amazon music for songs that were already on my computer.  A friend told me that I could have the echo play music from my desktop pc, but it turns out that is not true.  Or maybe I don't know how to do it.  My PC does not have bluetooth, so I bought a usb bluetooth adapter, but the connection could not be made for some reason.  Either the Echo did not recognize the adapter or the adapter did not recognize the Echo.  I do use the Echo to answer questions and will probably use it for other things as I discover needs.  Just wish it would play the music I already have.

Title: Love! Way better than 2nd generation!
Body: I had the 2nd generation, but decided to try the 3rd generation. It's so awesome, I ordered another for myself, and 3 more for Christmas gifts! The music output, is sooo much better, and I paired my two in my livingroom, so I have a left and right speaker. I keep my old one, by my bed, for alarms. I had never looked into all the things that an Echo Dot can do...now I use mine all the time! Lists for shopping, groceries, apts, and I haven't listened to so much music, in a very long time! Paired my Amazon music, SeriusXM, Pandora, etc. There are also, so many add on programs, I live alone, so "My Buddy", is available to call Sherriff, hospital, or my kids. If I fall, I just have to tell my Dot which to call, no matter what room I am in. You're going to love it! My kids and grandson sure did!

Title: Very Handy
Body: It's a great help through out our home.  I don't have to scream through out the house to make a statement.  I love the fact that she plays all types of music in that particular room. Her jokes are so dry I love it. The reminders are so helpful. Timers are exactly what I need all the time. I love that I can take her anywhere as long as I have a wifi connections. I just found out that she can remind me to change my toothbrush... OMG. I'm always trying to remember what month it is. Now I don't have to think about it... she'll think for me. My only question - can she work in a bathroom. I want to place in the bathrooms, but I'm not sure if they will withstand the moisture. Great Job Amazon!!!

Title: Alexia Helping with House Lighting
Body: Sound quality and volume level are excellent. Purchased (2) Echo Dot speakers for use with Lutron Caseta wireless electrical wall and lamp switches.  One Echo Dot placed in  family room and other in living room.  Everyone in the house now tells Alexia to turn on  and off these lights. Alexia is asked to turn lights on at a desired percentage of illumination, change the percent or turn the lights off. Lights come on immediately at desired level and not at full level and down to desired level.  The two Echo Dots are our first experience with this product. Besides using the Echo Dots for lighting control we are enjoying all of the information that Alexia can quickly provide, including time, outside temperature, timer, and information on an enormous amount of topics.

Title: Issues
Body: I bought this because I already have a 2nd generation and it works great, however, this 3rd generation says it can call contacts from your phone but mine doesn_ want to contact to my contacts from my iPhone . So it says that you can ask to call mom mine doesn_ because it won_ connect to my contacts, so needless to say I_ not to thrill with it. It also says that the sound is better then the 2nd generation and that_ not true. So if you decided to buy one I would suggest to get the 2nd generation which is cheaper and works just as well.

Title: Making my rooms smarter
Body: Bought three of them for additional rooms and love them!  I had stayed away from them in the past thinking the sound would be bad, but I was so wrong.  Full sound from the little critters.  Hooked one up to my house stereo too... that way I can listen to what ever music I want just by talking to Alexa (need Amazon Music or Apple Music).  But it is making me seriously re-think my large album and cd collection (yes, I guess I'm dating myself here ;).  At the $30 price, there is so much convenience in them you should consider them in all rooms you spend a good amount of time.

Title: Sucks!
Body: Uh hate, doesn_ sink at all wth hot spot, does not pair with iPhone at all via Bluetooth. Can not search internet.  Honestly I don_ get the point of this thing.  It_ decent speaker for laptop that_ about it.  Would definitely go for google home or something instead.  I only got this because it was free with serious xm radio subscription.  Would Not get again.

Title: It_ Alexa!
Body: Great Alexa. Does what every Alexa does. I gave 4 stars b/c the 3rd gen has a new plug and I don_ like that. Gen 2 you can pull out the Alexa cord and use the USB base for something else if needed which is really convenient for my house as I have children who own 100 different toys that charge with a USB charger now and guest come over and will use it to charge their phones etc since it_ in the kitchen. I put the new one in my bathroom instead of my kitchen like planned since the cord is different.

Title: Just what I needed
Body: I have not had a lot of time yet to use my Echo Dot, but so far it is just what I wanted to use in my kitchen to listen tomy audio book on, I have several different "apps" I can do that with, but his is just so easy  doesn't use up time on my phone, and it is right there where I am, I also found out that Alexia will read any book I already have loaded on my Kindle, for free, that is a great feature, and i am sure it will do lots more and I will have fun finding out what all she can do.

Title: Put a Dot on it!
Body: I received this for xmas  I have been playing with it ever since. So far nothing but a good review. Although I have stumped it a couple of times.  However, it does learn and can respond quickly.  Will it replace your partner?  Interesting!  A great tool for handling things you might otherwise forget; like turning out the lights or controlling the temperature of your home.  I can see it also controlling some of your appliances; like the refrigerator or water heater.  I had it place meetings and reminders with recurring schedules.  Will it ever be a must for a home? Yes. Eventually.

Title: Alexa-Good Morning!
Body: Received an Alexa Echo Dot #1 as a gift.  I have to admit, for a device I thought I'd never want or need, it's pretty nifty!  The convenience of saying "Alexa:  Play Music" is on the top of my list of her "talents".  I'm also pretty enamored with the shopping list feature.  Occasional rounds of Jeopardy or 20 Questions are good for entertainment, and quick checks on the weather report and traffic conditions for my work commute come in handy.  There are quite a few "skills" available, but many of them are ridiculous (I don't need Alexa to "meow").  Hopefully, there will be more useful ones added . The app itself could use some cleaning up-I find the list of skills reverts back to the top of the list after opening an entry to get more info.  There does need to be some fine-tuning with Alexa's ability to understand commands and requests, but all in all, I think she's a keeper.Addendum:  I purchased 2 more at a steal of a price, and then my insurance company gifted me one.  I now have 4.  Ridiculous, but I like asking for music with instant results.  I_ also ditching my morning alarm with sketchy reception and replacing with a dot.  Took a while to get that set up to my fave radio station, but all set now.

Title: Who can't have fun with one of these?
Body: What might you use this for? An alarm clock. Multiple timers. Create a shopping list on your phone (Alexa, add chocolate syrup to my list.). A reference (Alexa, when was Mickey Rooney born?). A weather forecaster. A music streamer. A broadcast device for your home (Alexa, make an announcement. Dinner is ready. You'll need a few of these, but they go on sale often!). A calculator (Alexa, what is the square root of 144?). A translator (Alexa, how do you say automobile in Italian?"). Voice control of lights, thermostat, TV with devices from vendors like LIFX, Nest, Harmony. Leave voice messages for family or friends who also have this type of device. Plays environmental sounds. An intercom (Alexa, drop into Kitchen. Provided you also have one in the kitchen...). Alexa will also tell you a joke, carry on a (limited) conversation, and play games. All you need is a smart phone and WiFi. And there's other more sophisticated versions with better sound, or even video. Take the plunge! (Amazon should hire me.)

Title: Easy to set up and a breeze to use
Body: I got this for my wife, first experience with Alexa.  Setting it up was very simple and easy with the accompanying app, Amazon has this process simple enough for anyone to do I believe.The responses and use are quite good, and the whole experience has been pleasantly quick and easy and useful, for the most part.  I do not believe that Alexa is quite as responsive as Google Now in some cases but all-in-all for the majority of time it works about as well as the other smart assistants out there.It looks nice too, blending in well with any decor I think, and isn't very noticeable.The ability to add 'Skills' is interesting though in some cases they are hit and miss when trying to connect to external devices.For the rock bottom price of these piece of electronics it's hard to beat, and it works quite well in general.  My wife loves the games you can play with it, like the music ones.

Title: New abilities Alexa has learned
Body: My echo dot is for personal use only, and Alexa has been very helpful.Some of the new things are "Alexa turn down the bass and turn up the treble and mid range" "Alexa whats the temp outside?" "Alexa text someone and send an emoji smiley face" Alexa play the soundtrack for the movie "Atomic Blonde etc.""  Alexa how are you?"The echo dot has been a fun and interesting addition to my existence and I plan to add a connection to my stereo soon.I like that you can be working on something like a project and you can ask Alexa for detailed instructions on how to perform this task. A computer without a GUI to view but a speaker to hear is an interesting concept. If your in to technology and electronics I recommend buying and Echo product.

Title: Nice step up from 2nd Gen
Body: I've had a couple 2nd Gen Echo Dots for nearly 2 years now and have loved them ever since I got them.  When the 3rd Gen Dots came out and I read the reviews I couldn't wait to get my hands one one.  They're just slightly larger than the 2nd Gen version, but you'll barely notice the difference, and it's totally worth it for the improved speaker quality.  The speaker on this version is much clearer and provides much more base than the previous generation.  It also seems to respond better to my commands than the previous version.  Best of all it integrates seamlessly with the existing 2nd generation units I have setup as a household so I can continue using those in lower traffic areas of the house.  Overall very pleased.

Title: Not what I expected, but great potential
Body: I went into the Amazon Echo experience expecting a lot from this device, rightfully so, I heard a plethora amount of news and reviews about the little guy. I am impressed with the abilities, but also feel that it lacks some very key, yet small, details. Details like simply understanding my voice and not completely butchering what I say at times. I was expecting to be able to simply have a conversation with the Echo Dot and it would have a conversation back with me, but it seems it's not the case exactly. You have to say specific sentence structures in order to do what you want it to do. Although I understand its technology, I had a different idea going in to my experience so I hope you understand where I'm coming from. HOWEVER, just as my title states, there is so much potential with this device, I know in time the Amazon team will make it an exceptional device so I will be holding on to my device until then. =)

Title: Bye felicia
Body: Got it for free because i got the amazon credit card. This thing is creepy. I let it die and threw it in a drawer and plan on selling it to my worst enemy. It_ also kind of useless since you can_ use it as a speaker for music just amazon music which... let_ be honest, we all want spotify. Anywayssss ya one star for this bad girl.

Title: Impressive bang for the buck
Body: Considering everything you get for the price this an extremely high value devise, especially on sale. This 3rd gen Dot is attractive, conveniently sized, and has decent sound. I have my Dots wired into better sounding systems anyways, yet the Dot has surprisingly good sound consideing it_ size. Build quality also seems excellent. I expect my Dots to last a long time. I purchased Dots others too and as far as I know everybody_ pretty happy.  My favorite uses are for radio stations such as NPR with crystal clear reception with no need for antenna and multi-room audio do I can rock the house down.

Title: Easy to set up, fun, and useful.
Body: I wasn't looking to purchase this product but when I saw it was 50% off on Black Friday, I decided to buy it.  It was very easy to set up and begin using.  I quickly learned how to make a shopping list, play music from a local radio station, ask Alexa various questions, and send messages to people I knew that owned an Alexa device.  I even had Alexa telling me jokes.  That was the end of my knowledge of what the Echo Dot could do.About a month after I purchased it, I came across a book called "Amazon Echo Dot" by C. J. Andersen on a free book website I subscribe to.  This book was specifically written for the 3rd Generation Echo Dot.  I am only 20% through the book and now have learned how to connect my Echo Dot to my smart phone calendar, TIVO, and blue tooth.  Alexa now tells me what is on my calendar and can change the channels on my TV just by asking.  I know that I will learn a lot more of its capabilities as I continue to read more.  I am very glad I purchased the 3rd Generation Echo Dot.

Title: Not as intimidating as I thought!
Body: I won this at a family Christmas Party. I wasn_ sure I needed or wanted one. I thought this is a great way to see how it works. When I got it home I set it up. It was very easy and intuitive. I was glad I already had an account. I also have some light switches that are WiFi controlled as well as a speaker. So now I can control lights, music and speaker. If you don_ already have those kinds of things I don_ know whether I_ recommend it. However, we are really having fun asking questions. We get immediate answers. Kind of amazing. You can ask the weather (for anywhere) the time, the date, trivia questions. We were watching a playoff football game and they had a rules expert explaining a ruling. I thought who_ this guy? I asked Alexa and she immediately told us his credentials and I found he was more than qualified to explain the rules. I had never heard of the guy. You can ask for famous people ages. You can simply ask for a timer. Say you_e cooking, you can say set a timer for 30 minutes. In 30 minutes she sets off an alarm. You can say play some music for 10 minutes. You get music for 10 minutes. I_ not saying everyone needs this. But I_ really happy I have one. I_ learning new tricks everyday.

Title: 4th one purchased!
Body: What can I say?  I love the Echo Dot!  I bought two then I bought one for my friend who really liked mine and just a couple of weeks ago, I bought one for my dad who was amazed by it.  I love playing the "Coqui & Crickets" sounds at night as I'm heading to bed.  It reminds me of my time and Puerto Rico and takes me right off to dreamland.  I have to speak quietly to the one in my bedroom as the other one is in the living room and can actually pick up what I say....amazing microphones!

Title: Impossible to set up! App is worthless!
Body: I can see why this was on sale. I_e downloaded the useless Alexa app and it_ a joke. Asinine Alexa keeps telling me my device is connected to the internet, then says it_ not. The app constantly crashes and has the worst ratings in the App Store, and now I see why. It_ frustrated me to the point where I_ ready to throw Alexa against a brick wall. Total garbage!

Title: Upgrade. Now.
Body: Our first Echo Dots were second generation, and performed reliably and well. The sound quality, however, left much to be desired, so we use them these days as inputs to larger sound systems. They work OK for that purpose. The 3rd generation Dot, on the other hand, has significantly better audio: highs and lows are much extended, clarity is impressive. And they seems to easily hit twice the volume to boot. On top of it all, they look much nicer. Well worth upgrading.

Title: Cool. Irritating. Not sure I'm keeping it. (updated 1/21/19)
Body: So the Echo Dot (3rd gen) is a pretty slick device. I've only had my pair for two days, but the learning curve is as easy or steep as you'd like to make it. Setting up routines, while relatively simple, can make you want to scream in some cases. You have no way of setting repeat to particular days. Your only options appear to be a single day, every day, weekdays or weekends. I work Sun - Wed. So to get my device to perform the routine the 4 days I need it to do so, I'm required to make 4 of the same routine and apply the dates needed to each one. Also, you set up your routine in the order you'd like to have it done (in my case - greeting, a particular song, news and then weather), but Alexa does it in her own order. (greeting, news, weather and then song) But the most annoying thing she does (and this may very well be a deal breaker for me) is that she talks over the beginning of every song you request. Those of us old enough to remember when AM radio was the only radio can also remember the DJ's talking over the intro and how frustrating it was -and now, still is.As for the performance - I was very surprised at how well the voice recognition works. Lots of background noise, dog barking etc. and I'd say she's been about 90-95% on getting it correct. And she gets better as you use her. The sound out of these little guys ain't bad. You're not going to throw parties with these speakers, but more than adequate for quiet background sounds or music. I have one in the living room and one in my bedroom paired up and they do reasonably well in my 1,000 sqft, home with wood floors. (no carpet to soak up the sound probably helps a bit) I've ordered another one and a sub to place in the living room. That will be good enough for a party, I believe.All in all I am very pleased with the device itself. Just not too happy with the examples above and a few other things. (navigating the app can be tiresome, but I'm sure this will improve with time and tweaking from Amazon) If anyone reading this review knows how to stop her from talking over songs - I'd really appreciate the tip. And judging by my scouring the web for a fix, so would plenty of other people.I'm moving forward with making the house a smart home with outlets, bulbs etc. But not sure Alexa will see it through to the end. I really do like the thing, but I can't stand DJ's to begin with and now to have this going on - I'm just not sure. That said, if the talking over intros isn't a thing for you - 4.5 stars easy.P.S. - As soon as I got mine up and running, I was immediately reminded of the movie Demon Seed. :)Update: After receiving another Dot, Echo and the Echo Sub - I'm keeping this system. The Sub adds much needed depth and bass. The Echo has been perfect for my bedroom and the 3rd Dot went into the bath. The Multi-Room Music function is awesome and I've learned to just accept her talking over songs considering what I've been able to get Alexa to do in the short time I've had it. Still not a 5, but getting closer. We have a pet iguana (in cold Ohio) and I plan on having Alexa run his lights, heat and humidifier. Alexa is much more reliable than my 16yo daughter when it comes to these things and it allows me to leave the house for extended periods and not worry about the iguana freezing or being burned. I'm installing window AC units in 3 rooms and having Alexa control those and doing away with the central air power hog that is due for replacement. All in all, this system can take over your house for you. Everything from "Alexa, turn off lamps." to controlling the dehumidifier in the basement to who knows what else. I am excited to see just how far I can take my house into the future with this.

Title: Great Sound, Learns your voice, Fun to Have
Body: I normally would not have purchased this, but it was offered for an absurdly low amount of money for getting one of Amazon's Credit cards. I waited until Christmas Day *2018) to open and plug it in, and since have purchased two more!  The sound quality, for me, is fabulous. Once I got it working through the ALEXA APP on my Android phone, went through the short set-up, and started asking it questions (this is the way it learns your voice, BTW), I am EXTREMELY pleased with this device. It is in my kitchen, and I use it every time I'm in there, cooking, washing dishes, putting groceries away, looking up recipes.Sure, you have to add some SKILLS to it, such as games, sounds for alarms/ timers, and other SKILLS / APPS, yet what it can provide in an instant once that is done, is well worth it. Recipes that call for items in metric?  Ask ALEXA for the conversion. If you're waiting for something to cook and have to watch it, play "TWENTY QUESTIONS" or "TRUE OR FALSE."The only slightly amusing issue?  If you have more than one ALEXA operating device in the same area -- they both "hear" you say the "on word" ALEXA and talk at the same time. oops. I *think* there might be a way to change the "on word" (my term for it), so that your devices will know which one you mean. If I'm using my FIRE for recipes, both of the machines activate with the ALEXA word.Highly Recommend, and may buy for friends, if they don't have one.

Title: Disappointed and worried about the security issues
Body: I bought these (several) because they were supposed to work with my Sonos to play Apple Music. I have invested heavily in Sonos, so I_ stuck but I_ increasingly frustrated by the app and difficulty of playing my music.The Echo will play Apple Music on its tiny little speaker but it STILL cannot play it on the connected Sonos. It keeps telling me that service is not supported.And, this part is the worst, when Alexa_ internet brain is offline or slowed down, the error messages make you think you have screwed up. It_ like, you have suddenly forgotten how Alexa works and haven_ said things exactly right. Internet search for _s Alexa down and you find out that it_ not you, it_ her.  This happened right after I bought them I almost burned them in the fireplace.BTW, I bought Apple_ HomePod when it was a hundred dollars on sale this Christmas, and at that price, it is totally worth it. It sounds great, set-up is far easier, Siri will set timers just fine, and control over my Hue lights etc is flawless. It synchronizes music with other HomePods and with the speakers you have plugged into your Apple TVs. (And Amazon has had some astounding privacy and security violations from Ring doorbell to Alexa laughing to recording hours of audio to send to unknown servers.) If you subscribe to AppleMusic the HomePod really the best choice.

Title: Great Voice Recognition & Highly Impressed By Its Sound
Body: I went into this solely for the smart functionality, but ended up blown away by how capable of a speaker this is for music at this footprint. I wouldn't put it above the Anker Premium Speaker, but the convenience of an always on hands free smart speaker with above average sound...great versatility.I already had 2 Insignia smart plugs synced to the Amazon ecosystem via the firestick remote and alexa app, so those played well with the Dot right out the box. Nice to have them hands free now. The functionality that was new to me was the integration with Verizon Fios. I expected the skill to be half baked or sluggish but you can really lose your cable remote and not care. "Alexa, switch to Fox Sports 1 (ESPN, ABC, NBC, etc.)".  "Alexa, pause (resume, fast forward)".  The Dot's voice recognition is very consistent which means all of this so seamless. This is a really great device.

Title: Better than I even expected !
Body: I was able to get a new Echo Dot 3 right before Christmas. It has been even better than I expected ! Setup was very easy and quick. I was also able to pair my Dish Hopper to the Dot. Now I can just say, "Alexa ! Change the channel to ESPN" and it gets there quicker than I could pick up the remote and change the channel ! For someone that has had a stroke and losing the use of my right arm and hand this is really useful for me. I love to play music while I get ready for the day. I usually use an app on my Bluray player which is time consuming just to get the first song played. Now all I have to do is say,"Alexa ! Play Thumbs Up radio " and bam! it's playing that fast ! I can check on the weather before I leave the house in an instant. The sound quality of the Dot 3 amazed me from the moment I first heard it. From the reviews I've read, it's obvious that most people don't understand that some rooms just don't carry sound very well.The unit is kind of heavy for such a small item which I assume is because of the magnet of a much better speaker than previous Dots. I don't know how anyone could complain about the sound quality of the Dot 3 considering how small it is. Some people complain about everything. Just keep that in mind before deciding not to buy this because of a bad review. Ten years ago this item would have cost you thousands. This item is well worth the price.Like anything electrical or mechanical,you have to learn how to use it and then how to best use it for your needs. It really isn't hard. If my wife was using this the first day then I can tell you, it has to be easy.I will be buying more Dots since I have learned that you can place a unit in another room and use as an intercom. Nothing so small and costs so little can do as much as the Echo Dot 3.

Title: Don_ Do It
Body: I use several of the Amazon devices,hey I_ a techie. The 3rd generation dot has a different look although not much, and the new device performs well. If your expecting a major improvement for the 3nd generation dot your not going to find it. We were looking for better sound quality and found it isn_ enough to even notice in the 3rd generation dot. The majority of products used work only with the second generation such as the chargers and other connected devices because the power cable on the dot 3 was changed and certainly not for the better. This of course has no effect on the blu tooth capability_.Amazon can do better than alter the looks and change the power cord so my advise is to stick with your old device or if your a newbie get the dot second generation. You can but these at a very discounted price and most of the accessories are dropping in price as well.As far as the 3rd generation and the hype, don_ do it.

Title: 3Rd Gen is an excellent choice!
Body: My family love the echo dot 3rd gen. Ita very handy with homeschool needs and general things like music & weather etc. Set up isn't as easily done as one might think of you have a 2g and 5g connection you can hook up to. 2g is best but wouldn't work so we had to use 5g. Took a little while even with technician to figure it out. The only other thing I have against it is due to amazon prime alone. You pay for prime but cannot get music unlimited without it being extra so she won't play a lot of songs without it. Also audible is extra as well which stinks cuz that's a handy & fun tool alone for my kids so we use free sites for all the above but overall alexa is a nice addition to our familys needs. The sound for this little thing is amazing.

Title: Pretty rad
Body: I'm well aware that the machines are taking over but if they're gonna listen in anyway, I prefer they do it through my Echo.  I'm an Apple guy.  Like old-school Apple guy.  I was buying those ugly eMacs back in the 90's.  Alexa makes Siri seem like a Speak-N-Spell.  She responds instantly.  You don't have to wait to talk to Alexa like you have to with Siri.  I love it.  For $25, it's a steal.  We have a total of four in the house now so the government can listen to all of our conversations.  Still worth it.  I really like that I can use the drop-in feature to yell at my kids without having to get up.  Really helps with my old age kickin' in.  I can also change my thermostat when my fat body starts sweating in the middle of the night.  Overall a great wiretap.

Title: totally love it
Body: I got this as a Christmas gift. I had been eyeing a lot of amazon smart home products and was lucky enough to receive this wonderful, generous gift. It's been a lot of fun. I'm admittedly a bit creeped out by the warning about how Alexa records everything going on in the background (she certainly has some good blackmail material at this point). I've had a little trouble integrating some skills, and for others it feels impossible to find the app that goes with the skill (apple vs google thing?) but overall i'm so happy with this product. I would definitely recommend it.

Title: Still has trouble hearing me and understanding me.
Body: 3rd Generation still has a great deal of trouble hearing me even in a quiet room. It often misunderstands simple questions. I give it 4 stars because it is still extremely helpful in playing music and answering some questions when it does hear me. I tried using other wake words but it doesn't hear any better then the second generation. It also seems that the AI has not improved at all. It seems like Amazon has abandoned their artificial intelligence as it is not seeking to improve it at all. This can still only answer simple questions. If it hears me.

Title: Very entertaining
Body: Some have spoke of sub quality audio. As with any speaker system if you overdrive them the sound will become distorted.I have several of these devices and find them to be of high quality. I often listen to Amazon and Pandora music and find the audio to be of excellent quality for the size of the speakers. However if you attempt to turn up the volume to hear them in other rooms in your house you are overdriving them and the audio is degraded.Using Alexa with them for controlling smart plugs and things is of great benefit.

Title: Sounds Great and is Easy to Set Up
Body: I've has this for about a month now and am still wowed by the sound that comes out of it.  I love my second gen dot, but this is a very nice upgrade. I only wish it was still powered by a mini USB rather than a propriotary plug and sometimes the trebel sounds like an AM station that is slightly tuned off its frequency when adjusting the equalizer, but overall it is a very nice addition to the Echo family at a very nice price. I just hope someone will come up with a battery base for it to make it portable.

Title: Pretty good to have around
Body: Sound quality is quite good. Plays lots of good music.Pretty responsive to my voice requests, even from next room. Plays good guessing game with my grandkids. Good for news and weather. Cons: poor set up instructions. Tells you to download Alexa app, but not specifically which app. I downloaded wrong app and had to call for further instructions.Also, there is no online list of free music available. Have to find out by trial and error to learn what is  available without monthly fees.

Title: Better Sound Quality Then 2nd Gen, Less Sensitive to Wake Command
Body: Have a 2nd Gen and this 3rd gen. Sound quality is DEFINITELY improved, but anything about volume 7 (which is pretty loud) only distorts sound and doesn't get much louder. I do have some complaints on the far field mics vs the 2nd gen. It doesn't seem to pick up "Alexa" command as easy. Could be my placement location, but I've had issues in 2 separate locations. The redesign does look nice and fits well with home decor. I use this in tandem with multiple Alexa devices and I'm overall pleased with it.

Title: My new Echo Dot
Body: There are so many functions I like about my new Echo-Dot.  First of all, I love music.  Whenever a song comes to me and I start to sing, I'll say," Alexa, play We come to far to end it now, Smokey Robinson" and the song starts to play.  Secondly, Alexa, play Jeopardy, and realized there's a lot that I don't know. But my favorite is Alexa, play relaxing sounds, Thunderstorm, Jungle night, etc.  And when I ask her, the time, weather, recipe, exercise playlist, it's very handy.  And I always say, "Alexa Thank you.  I love Alexa.

Title: Love the Echo dot, but there is on caveat...
Body: Pros:I love my Echos.  I have one in each bedroom to control lights, play music, wake me up, report the weather or news, get notifications on Amazon orders, play games, create calendar events and reminders, set timers, you name it.  These are wonderful little devices.  There is a phone app that goes with it that allows you do do all sorts of neat things like set up routines that do multiple things.  For example, when I say "Alexa, Good Morning," and she turns on the lights, plays the weather, and then turns on my favorite music.Cons:After I bought three Echos, I discovered that if you have multiple Echos playing Prime Music, you can play the same music to all Echos in a group, but you cannot play different music on each device unless you pay for a family subscription to Prime Music or you set up the Echos to play music from other sources (such as Pandora or Spotify).  So if my son and I want to listen to music in our respective room's at the same time, one of us has to use a source other than Prime Music, or we have to pay $10/mo for a family Prime Music subscription.  I was a little irked by this discovery.Wishlist:I wish that Amazon would not require a monthly subscription to enjoy Prime Music on multiple Echo devices simultaneously.I wish there was a separate volume setting for the Alexa's voice verses music.  Sometimes I want the music at a low volume, but then you can barely hear her when she talks.I wish there were a few more options for wake words or even a custom wake word.  When all my Echo's had the default wake word, "Alexa," they would all wake up when I wanted to speak to the one in my room, so I decided to rename my daughter's and son's Echos.  However, there are only four names to choose from.

Title: Simply refuse to stay connected and play music
Body: Amazon won't allow pasting my same comments so rather than repeat my 3 of 4 paragraphs check my review on the Echo 2 (Sub Pair.)Devices continually drop connection to each other and the internet.  I have 9 different speakers and problems with all groups and all speakers at times.  I've reset, I've deleted and recreated groups and I've reset pairs many times.  But after 3 or 4 songs I ALWAYS lose a speaker or a pair or a couple of pairs.The app is also painfully lacking.  A secind rate attempt at best.  I'm very disappointed.I will admit that after my 1st poor review I recueved a call and email from Amazon.  But their only advice was to try the things I'd already done.  Rest devices.  Delete and recreate groups and pairs.  Just doesn't work.And if this was a wifi problem why does my phone Bluetooth connected to either my Bose Mini or HK Onyx 2 play perfectly fine fir hours on end..?

Title: Great for my parents and family! We bought 2 for the home.
Body: Gifted two of these to my parents for Christmas and what a hit! Definitely don't need the bigger one IMO. Bought with Hue lights, an Alexa wall plug, and a universal remote for the TV. Sure it's got some issues here and there like not understanding, hearing the wrong thing, or speaking when not spoken to, but I still give it 4 stars. My main complaint is the app and way you link other apps is not intuitive. There are skills and accounts and alternate apps to download versus what comes with Alexa, etc. It was difficult to set up for me, a tech savvy 24 year old, my parents never could have done it on their own. But now that it's set up they love it! Use it to turn on their lights, turn the volume on the TV up, call family members, make announcements, and play games. We also have a lot of fun messing around from a distance, sending good night messages or changing the color of the lights for a laugh.

Title: Great sound, more depth than gen 2, and more reactive.
Body: I had the gen 2, and upgraded to gen 3 after hearing it play music at a friend_ house.I am very pleased with this device, the sound in a multi-room set up is great, and complements well an Echo Or Echo Show.It is more reactive than the previous version, and the sound has so much more depth than the gen 2, the improvement is very impressing.I also like the new design, it feels more modern, and sits very nicely on our console.We use it every day to control lights, music, ask for weather, news, etc and has not failed once. I find the microphone more accurate than my Echo Show gen 1 sometime.If you are looking for a screenless amazon device, I would definitely go with the Dot. It is cheap and does all the things the Echo does, with a sound close enough to the Echo. If you are looking for a much better sounding device and have the money, I would recommend the Sonos One.

Title: Do NOT reccomend!
Body: Hate it. She just randomly stops playing ALL my music, then tells me she doesn't know what is wrong...I should "check the app" and give feedback She cannot understand half of what I say, I have to yell (I am a quiet voice talker) so I am flinging spit droplets when I try to have her do anything because I am YELLING. She plays games with me and tells me my answers are wrong...then repeats what I said back, as the correct answer. I don't have an overly strong accent, I do not slur my words, I do not speak ghetto or whale...so I do not know what is wrong with it!I ask her to play "Hits One on Serious XM" she says "shuffling songs by Frank Sinatra on Amazon Music"... _ but.. I really didn't know how good Frank Sinatra is, so thanks Alexa!

Title: Funny Story About My Dots!
Body: I love my Dots! I first bought an Amazon Echo and loved it so much that I purchased 2 Dots, a black form my bedroom and a white one for my bathroom. If I_ not asking Alexa to play music, I_ asking her to tell me a joke or the meaning of a word or countless other tasks. One morning driving to work, my routine after a certain stretch of road, I pray to God, giving thanks, asking to get me to work safely and on time, what_ on my mind, etc. This morning as I reached my _rayer zone I started by saying, _lexia. I immediately caught myself and burst out laughing! I always start with _od, thank you for my life ...  Since God has a great sense of humor, I bet there was a little more laughter in heaven that morning.

Title: Alexa is FAR ahead of Siri
Body: We are still learning all that this device can do but already, we are blown away at how far superior Alexa is to Siri on every level!!  We are pretty hard-core Apple device people but Siri doesn't come close to what Alexa can do.This Echo Dot is amazing in it's ability to understand questions, statements, commands, and it's capability to complete fairly complex tasks.  We are going to set up a second one in another part of our house which will allow us to communicate with each other from different rooms and set up chores lists for the kids (Yay!).  Don't know that Alexa will be able to make them complete their chores, but at least they can't say they didn't know what they were supposed to do each day!!

Title: Muffled sound & DEFECTIVE controls when compared to Echo Dot 2nd Generation
Body: Received my new "electronic brillo pad" and despite adjusting the bass, mid-range and treble controls in the Alexa app, I find that the new design emits very muffled audio. Sounds like someone talking through layers of fabric. Whereas I've had up to 5 Echo Dot 2nd Generation speakers in my home for over a year.DEFECTIVE controls. Alex app on smartphone refused to adjust volume. The buttons on dot 3 did adjust volume manually. The equalizer on Alexa app made ZERO difference in sound when I adjusted bass, mid-rabge and treble sliders up or down.BOTTOM LINE: Returning Dot 3 and sticking with Echo Dot 2s.

Title: Alexa remembers a Lot
Body: Alexa isn't just to ask what the weather will be tomorrow. I changed the "Awake" word to mine to "Computer". You can ask it almost anything and it will tell you the answer or tell you something else entirely, like in the video I submitted. There's so much it can do, I'm still finding out new things to ask. It's most certainly worth the price. I bought two and will be buying one more for the living room too.

Title: Amazon echo is perfect for my house
Body: This one was a 2nd echo for my house and I am pretty satisfied with its design and performance. I am highly impressed with its new design and its microphone is much better than previous version.I will highly recommend to others to purchase it.

Title: Best dot ever!
Body: This is a fantastic platform for alexa.  I have 2 full size echo devices and 3 of the 3rd generation dots throughout my house.  I actually think I like the new 3rd generation dots better overall.  They are very small yet produce a great sound.  You can hang them from wall outlets or use a wall outlet shelf to keep them hidden and out of the way.  Overall for the price of these you can put one in every room of your house and link them out to get great sound throughout the house all at once.  I have bought them as gifts and couldnt recomend them more!

Title: 3rd Gen Dot!
Body: For under $30 you can't go wrong with this. It's small and so cool looking (3rd gen especially). How can something this small sound so good. Perhaps some sort of black magic that Amazon employs to make this quality product, I'm unsure. Of course it's much more than a speaker to listen to your favorite music on. Alexa will keep you company all day if you want. Sometimes I set her beside me and just pretend that she's sitting with me, binge watching something on Amazon Prime Movies. She gets me, she really does.  Now I think I have gone to far, have I? I never know. :)

Title: I love my echo dot
Body: What did I ever to without my dot and Alexa???!!!  I tell her goodnight and she turns on my fan, turns off my lamp, and plays my music from Pandora.  Then when I wake up, I tell her good morning and she turns on my lamp. off the fan and music, tells me the weather and my schedule for the day.  I also use her as my alarm clock and timer for cooking.  So many great options!  The speaker is small and sounds decent when playing music.  It always needs to be plugged in, so it is not as mobile as I would like, but I still love it!

Title: Recommend to everyone
Body: I have the echo dot in My kitchen under my counters. I love it! I especially love the wall mount accessory. I make grocery lists, to-do lists, set cooking timers, play games like jeopardy, plays music genres, announce reminders. I love it. I can pull up the info from my echo dot on my phone in my Alexa app (free). I can access the app and share my list. Example: go to the grocery store I can either pull it up on my phone through the app. Or I can text the list to someone who is going to the store for me.

Title: Have 2 in stereo, working great, even for music
Body: As I mentioned, I've got 2 of these paired together, I've got them in my bedroom and primarily use them to play music while I try to get to sleep or clean and they've been working pretty well for that. Don't usually play them loud but I did see what they sounded like at max volume and I was actually impressed. Not perfect but I was definitely expecting worse. It's also nice that they will light up when a package arrives at my door. Plus combined with the Fire Cube it's nice just be able to ask Alexa to turn off the TV and to play music for an hour while I try to sleep from the comfort of my bed.

Title: LOVE IT!
Body: I was pleasantly surprised by just how much this little guy\girl can do. I have never had any issues with this device recognizing my questions its always accurate and knows exactly what I am asking it. The one issue I have with it is unless you are a techy person you may never use it to its full potential because you may never really pick up on just how the "Skills" as Amazon calls them work. Basically you have to download an Alexa app on your phone and then setup the device but from there you have to download skills to really take advantage of this device, an example would be I downloaded a Fios Skill so that I am able to control my cable box with commands such as "Alexa watch AMC on Fios" The problem is setting up the skills for this to work I had to enable the Fios TV skill then I had to choose what cable box this device was going to control, well if you never named your cable boxes by the rooms they are in then you have to figure out the name the cable company gave your cable box. Anyways like I said once you get everything figured out its great. I have it tied to my calendar in Outlook, my cable box, my Fire TV, I use it to play music from Amazon "Apple Music is coming to this device soon" I ask it what my commute to work is like, what's the Weather today. As far as the Sound quality goes, this small device is perfect for a bedroom or office if you want good sound in a bigger room buy the ECHO or ECHO Plus its that simple. Still some issues in being fully implemented but getting better all the time. Besides updates, Alexa learns from how you use it. Do you NEED it? No. But did we need cars instead of horses? Jets over propeller airplanes? This is part of an interesting future. Hop on and enjoy.

Title: Why did I wait so long to try this awesome little dot???
Body: The Echo Dot...not a hugely impressive name for such a neat little item! I had briefly considered the Alexa products off and on, watched the specials come and go but never really thought I would have much use for the device. When it popped up at a discounted price I finally decided to give it a try and see what all the fuss was about. I was actually just looking for a simple Bluetooth speaker for the shower but am so glad I chose this and ordered two.  WHY DID I WAIT SO LONG? This is the neatest device, small in size but very big on what it can do hands-free! I love how all I have to do is say, "Alexa, play music", and she will choose something random or I can request a specific artist or song. I don't have to reach out of the shower to mess with my playlist on my phone or to change the volume or anything else...I just ask Alexa! There are so many different things Alexa can do for you, from organizing your day to setting alarms and calling people on your contact list, to so much more!  My grandson is having a blast with it just asking random questions and was very impressed when she told a knock-knock joke last night! On the other hand, this device could possibly drive you crazy if you have someone that constantly interrupts what is playing to ask her questions or change music. My grandson has ADHD so this became an issue but I'm hopeful it will resolve itself once the new wears off, lol. I am so impressed that I am planning to purchase more units so that we can have them in most rooms.

Title: Side by side I decided to keep the Amazon Echo Plus over the Echo Dot
Body: I liked the Echo Dot, until I received the Echo Plus.  The sound from the Plus was just so much better than the Dot.  If I hadn't received the Plus as a gift, I would have kept the Dot:  It was easy to use, easy to set up and responded as soon as I got it hooked up to my Wi-Fi using the app downloaded from the app store.  But...once I got the Echo Plus the difference in sound quality was pretty obvious, and since both do essentially the same functions, decided to keep the Echo Plus due to the better sound quality.  All in all it was very easy to set up, pretty much worked straight out of the box.  The only thing I wish Amazon would work on is getting rid of the plug which is why I took one star off my rating.  Having to use a plug makes these devices so much less portable.  I wonder why the Echos are still tethered to a power cord, in this day and age of easy Bluetooth availability.  I haven't used the Echo for anything more than asking simple questions and streaming music.  As of yet, I haven't purchased anything, made any shopping lists or used the device for any " higher" functions.  Maybe in the future I'll be saying "Alexa, order me...".  It certainly seems it would be easy enough.

Title: It_ OK I guess, but nothing to write home about!
Body: My daughter bought me an Echo Dot for Christmas along with some special light bulbs and a special outlet to plug it in (if I can remember correctly.). The Echo Dot, I_e already set up with the app but have not used it to its fullest extent as my daughter wants to set up the other items but has been too busy to do so.  The light bulb is one that you can request the echo dot to turn it on or off.I have 2 things I don_ like about the Echo Dot.1). The plug on it is not USB but rather a BIG SQUARE PLUG that overlaps the next outlet on the power strip so I can_ use that outlet for something else.  Why in this day and age would a company like Amazon produce this BIG FAT PLUG?  They have produced all kinds of wonderful products with a USB with a removable plug so the product can be plugged via USB into a multiple USB charger or directly into its own plug.  It appears this product_ clumsy, oversized plug is from the past and it_ ironic that it_ attached to an item of new technology.  If it must have a regular electrical plug, they could streamline the size of it.2) In addition to the Echo Dot, I also own an Amazon Fire Stick that my daughter bought me for my birthday last June (2018).  The assistant wake-up name is Alexa.  Since the Fire Stick and the Echo Dot are used in my bedroom, I went to change the Echo Dot_ wake-up name to _ot but that wasn_ an option.  I had to name it Echo.  It would be nice to be able to use the app to change the wake-up name to almost any name you want.  I can only imagine how this works for people who have 6 or 8 Echo Dots!  Anyway, just a suggestion.  I was very disappointed that this device doesn_ seem to do much - except with added products like the smart light bulb.I generally like Amazon products but I could take or leave the Echo Dot.  I will keep it if my daughter ever gets around to setting up the smart light bulb!

Title: Great product
Body: Gotta love the echo Dot, my daughter gave me one for Christmas and when I saw a second one so cheap decided to buy even tho honestly I probly don_ need two as my house is one floor and not large. But I want to try the white noise at night to see if it would help me sleep. My son gave me some hue light bulbs also and it_ nice to turn the light on before I get into the rooms. Also have tv hooked up to with a smart plug...another gift to turn that on off! Very easy to get the second one synced to the first tho the instructions a little off in that there is no orange light when pairing but it is a lime green. My son hooked the first dot  up for me So found myself waiting and waiting for it to turn orange before I realized it was all ready to use! Alexa doesn_ always get the commands right but 98% of the time. I took advantage of the six month payment too which was nice.

Title: My little Helper
Body: She's more than I expected.  With Alexa I always have the forecast and can set reminders quickly.  Also love that she shuffles my Pandora stations while I'm doing cleaning around the house.  I do find that you have to be clear and precise in how you say your commands, there are often times that I've had to repeat myself because I delayed in saying a command or because i'm in another room i have to yell for her to hear me (especially if the playing music that is very...bombastic?).  I'd like to see her improve her ability to find answers via internet, other than that I find her to be quite delightful.

Title: Great product!
Body: I purchased 2 of these Echo Dots while they were on sale. Installation was a snap. I paired them as a stereo speaker pairs for music playback. I have other Echoes also in stereo pairs throughout the house for casual music listening when playing Amazon Prime or SiriusXM music. They sound good.  The Echoes or the new Echo Dots can't compete with my main stereo sound system but they sound great for the price and a better than the 2nd Gen dots. Plus, I use them to control my Smart Lights and Smart Switches, and Amazon Fire TVs throughout the house! No regrets with purchasing them. So, if you're thinking of buying one or more, don't hesitate.One minor thing with configuring (all types of) Echoes as stereo speaker pairs .. the Amazon app assigns a generic name to the pair. If you have more than two stereo pairs, like I do, it can be a little incovenient trying to figure out which generic named pair is in which room before telling Alexa to play music on the stereo pair that you want it to.  I'm sure that Amazon will eventually enhance the echo stereo setup to allow you to define more meaningful names (such as living room or den).

Title: I was hesitant at first
Body: I was hesitant about having an Alexa at first. And I still don't love the idea of Amazon listening in on my household. But the convenience is pretty awesome. We love using it to play music around the house. The kids just shout "Alexa, play _____", and like magic it comes on. We also use it for our shopping list, which is nice to be able to just again shout out whatever item we've run out of and need to add. And "she" understands us all (even the 3 year old), which is impressive and more than I can say for other electronic assistants (such as Siri). I did have to turn off the feature allowing Alexa to purchase things for us as I am certain my children would have taken advantage of that. So, even with my hesitancy, Alexa has won me over! I'm very impressed.

Title: 3.5mm jack output volume is disturbingly LOW
Body: I would give this five stars. The sound quality through the internal speaker is vastly superior to the old Dot, and almost comparable with a full Echo. Definitely good enough to listen to music through the internal speaker.However, the volume output on the 3.5mm jack is about 50% of the volume that was delivered by previous gen of the Echo Dot.  What's up with that?  I formerly used an older Dot on powered speakers (PreSonus Eris E3.5) and I used to be able to set the volume at 50%. With this new 3rd gen Dot, I have to set the volume to 100% to get the same volume.So, all other things being equal, it would seem this new Dot robs your system (if using 3.5mm) of half its power. That's quite a crime.

Title: Spontaneous kitchen dance parties up by 100% !
Body: We got a Dot for Christmas and we love it. We have automated most of the lights and switches on our first floor. My kids love being able to say "Alexa, play (insert practically any song title here)" and then a 3 minute dance party happens in our kitchen. Not to sound too corny, but it has brought our family a little closer together as a result of the instant fun that happens as a result of having the Dot.  Its great to be able to play music while preparing meals, or really anytime.
