Love saying "Alexa, Goodnight" and having all the lights that were left on turn off, instead of me going around the house turning them off one by one. Now we need to get one for upstairs!

Title: Overall a good product
Body: It works well for most of the things I am using it for.  At times it seems to have a problem understanding what I said. I bought two and like that I can stream music to one, stop it and then continue with the other.  It also works well with two smart outlets that I got.  My biggest complaint is the difficulty in getting the skills using the Alexa app. It doesn't indicate which skills you already have until you click on the skill then when you go back to the list of skills it starts at the top instead of where you left off and with hundreds of skills listed this does not work well at all.

Title: Does what I wanted it to do
Body: I admittedly bought this echo dot for one purpose: to replace my xbox one kinect on the new xbox I got that doesn't support the old device. I missed the voice commands to turn it on, off, pause, etc... and so this was the next best thing.For the $30 I spent, I'm quite happy with it's performance. It understands me 99% of the time and is quick to perform tasks. The sound output is surprisingly clear considering the size and form factor. I have found it's basic capabilities (e.g. setting reminders, timers, routines, etc...) to be useful as well.

Title: Helpful room assistant
Body: I purchased this echo dot as my second unit of echo after having my first Amazon echo for almost 1 year. I like the responsiveness of "Alexa" to command and it was able to fulfill requests correctly, most of the time. Mostly, I use the echo to hear music, the quality of the sound is very good, clear on the high frequency and deep enough bass providing richness of what you expect from a music or songs. I am slowly adding additional Alexa compatible devices, such as the smart switch and I was able to command Alexa to turn on or off the light in my room. Although like many other people, I have my share of concern to what other thing that the Echo is listening all the time.

Title: F$&# These piece of $&$#
Body: Don't waste your F&$#ing money on these pieces of $hi$.  They never respond and the software is a comical sideshow.  Amazon claims they are the future and they are not.  They can't pickup your voice an inch away or a mile away.  Stop being lazy and take back control of your home.  Because when you need them to work they won't.  They get progressively worse and are a complete waste of money.  Don't do it!  I literally just threw mine in the trash. All three of them.

Title: Alexa can play from Apple Music
Body: Such a fine product built with great intelligence.The design of 3rd Generation Alexa is much elegant compare to 2nd generation. The fabric finish is on par with Google Home Mini.The skills that Alexa posses are simply amazing. I got this product at rite time. Now Alexa can stream Apple Music. I can ask Alexa to stream music on it from Apple Music. The Audio quality is really good.My house is run by Alexa. I can ask her turn on and off the lights/AC/TV and of-course ask her to play shows and movies on fire TV. Great deal for the price I got it.

Title: Easy to Set up, Easy to use - But not always understanding what's being asked.
Body: We just brought Alexa into our home this year - and this was purchased for the Bedroom to supplement the Sonos Beam and Fire tablet for the Living Room.  It was super-easy to set up and start running on our existing system.  It generally does what we ask - tho it's taken some time to get accustomed to some odd functions, such as the pulsing  green light that indicates when an Amazon delivery has arrived for us, but when you ask why it's pulsing, she won't tell you. (Had to look that up online to get the light to quit)  It understands most voice commands - far better than Siri ever did - but we have to laugh when Alexa gets things completely wrong.  We were under the impression that you could name it whatever you wanted - as a trigger word - but you can only choose from "Alexa", "Amazon", "Echo" and "Computer" - and there's only one voice, no male options at all, and you're warned about using an accented voice  unless you want to speak using a different dialect.  The sound quality is quite good for such a small device - It's not Audiophile quality, and music doesn't sound as good as on an iPad Air, for example, but all in all it's a good little device at a great value.

Title: Really great, but still has some problems
Body: We have 3 in my house.  They work well with my SmartThings, they play Pandora, they do quick math, conversions, answer simple questions, etc.When they lose their internet connection for whatever reason, (or Amazon is having server trouble) any time you say "Alexa", they ding and say "I'm having trouble understanding you right now" which is super frustrating, and I wish they would say whether it's a local connection problem or a server problem, but I guess it's not an all-the-time thing.They are usually great about identifying where I am, but on occasion I'll be standing right next to one when I ask for something and one in a different room will answer me instead.Adding things to lists with my voice is very easy.  Sometimes they don't get the words quite right, but it's usually close enough that I know what it was supposed to be when she repeats it back or I look at it on the app.  Removing things from lists with my voice, however, is a real challenge.  If it's a one-word thing, usually no problem.  Two words is difficult but possible.  3 or more words and you're better off checking it off in the app.Wish we could rename her to something custom, instead of their default set of options, but I get that programming wake words isn't trivial.Can't talk about her without her trying to answer.  In my house we call her by a different name when we're talking about her than when we're talking to her.  Early on we figured out if you talk about her casually she can have some pretty big misunderstandings and almost sent messages to some old contacts and ordered things on Amazon.

Title: Absolutely wonderful devices.
Body: The third generation echo is a great device. I now have a whole intercom and music player. I love the Drop in feature where you talk to your devices from anywhere. You can also make announcement and it will play on all of your Alexa devices. Paired with smart plugs, you make your lights, fans, etc fully automated.  I have a Ring 2 doorbell as well and it can be tied into Alexa. It makes announcement on all devices when motion is detected and when the doorbell is pressed. Of course both of these options can be turned off or on in the Alexa app.I also set one of these up as the kids editionwoth freetime. Yes that is right, you do not have buy the kids edition, you make one of these by simply turning on freetime in the app.I know there are concerns about privacy, but I have no issues. These things have made the house easier and convenient through automation. It also makes family time fun with games.

Title: so far, mostly just for fun
Body: i started w/ some "fun things to try w/ alexa' (a story from one of my tech pages). when i started to try other things i thought i would find useful, i got many 'i dont know that' answers. ie; alexa, what temp to cook skinless chicken? (obviously worded better than i type) i tried some 'fun' stuff of my own; 'alexa, what time is love?' ( a KLF reference). many other neat things like when i say 'thank you' ( i dont know why i do this other than my upbringing) i get 'you bet' or something similar, pretty fun. but until i get a door cam or sonos or lighting controls, still just a play thing.  tried connecting to cortana, not much use there other than using my desktop calendar, which connects to my windows phones. wont connect to my music on my system, or i simply havent figured that out yet, only pandora and amazon, et al so far. trying some of the 'skills', not finding much use there either, but i've only had it for about 2 weeks. we'll see...

Title: Nice Additions!
Body: We already had the full size echo and enjoy using it daily. I got a the Charcoal and Heather Gray ones for Christmas to maximize voice coverage since our main echo is in a central location and doesn't always hear clearly when there's a lot of activity going on. I put it in our living room and it has helped tremendously! The other one is in my crafting area in the basement and it works great. The drop-in feature that allows you to talk between units is very helpful. I didn't think we'd have much need for that, but it does come in handy. They weren't on my Christmas list, but I'm very glad my husband got them for me. These two are very nice additions to our household.

Title: Packaging a Joke! Was this a prank!!! Amazon is so inconsistent!
Body: I haven't set up this Echo Dot yet. I have others and like them but they aren't accurate a lot. My opinion is it/they need more work. Simple things Alexa doesn't pick up on and other times she picks up on harder things. Very confusing but fun for sure. My issue is with the way they shipped it. It was on back order (white) so when I received it yesterday I was shocked to see a mangled mess of what once a box that was shaped into a Charcoal Briquette Chimney Starter for no reason at all! On top of that it was a mess and no tape on either end. Anyone could have just pulled it out, plus it was dirty and just stupid... Get it together Amazon... PLEASE!

Title: Much better sound than the 2nd gen I had before
Body: The 3rd gen Echo Dot that I purchased has noticeably better sound both in terms of quality and volume. I was a little disappointed that the new Echo would not fit into the holder that I had for the older one but I suspect that the Gen 3 device being a bit larger is a result of the better microphone and better speaker arrangements and it is a price I am willing to pay.  Now if I could just get the other older Dots I have to stop thinking they hear their wake word in all manner of words and conversations I'd be a totally happy camper.

Title: Amazing sound from this little guy
Body: Works great and is a huge upgrade in terms of sound quality from the gen 2.  This one gives more of a surround sound feel.  The setup is also very simple.  The added cloth on it gives it a much nicer look.The only downside is this echo is more heavy than prior so when using it with wall mount it tends to say, but this is easily fixed with a piece of double sided tape or velcro.  I put a picture of this, and unless your actually looking its completely not noticed.

Title: Works Great, Sound needs Improvement
Body: It was a Christmas gift from our son and his wife.  It was easy to set up and works well.  I have noticed that various Sirius/XM channels play at very different volume levels and must be adjusted after starting to stream each station.  Also, the sound is a bit inferior compared to some bluetooth speakers with which I am familiar.  I find that my wife, who is not tech savvy or friendly to any large extent, uses it as much as I do.  A good basic beginning.

Title: I bought the 3rd Gen for better sound and Stereo Pairing
Body: I grew up in an era of sound appreciation where the stereo norm was to have Bose or Advent speakers and super high quality hi-fidelity equipment. When reviewers said the Echo Dot 3rd gen had better sound I should have known better. The echo 3  might have shifted its frequencies to the lower end compared to the weak tea Echo-2, but the price of more bass was clarity. The midtones and lows are muddy and in my opinion less favorable to listen to than the 2nd gen echo dots. As for stereo pairing, at first it was nice waking up to having two Echo Dot 3rd gens in stereo  40 inches apart placed on my bed Head Board. But then they kept slipping out of synch. Then you have two roque echos basically doing what they want, making random selections and the sound going up and down and in and out. So you have to re-synch or unplug one, which is what I did. Another disappointment is the Echo Subwoofer. Ughh ! I will just have to wait until Amazon takes High Fidelity and Stereo-phonics seriously.

Title: Waste of patience
Body: I thought I was getting a good deal when I got this echo dot thru a promotion Amazon was doing! Buy Amazon music subscription and get an echo dot for only 99 cents. Priding myself on how frugal I as as a person I couldn't miss the opportunity! But Alexa has been more of a curse than a blessing! If I could give it 0 stars believe me I would! I first tried placing it in the living room where I used to keep my old echo the tall speaker but my ex took it. I put Alexa in the living room thinking it will be just like old times but she doesn't listen to anything I say. So I tried my room that didn't work either then finally the bathroom where it's super quiet. I am a very stressed and depressed person so I bathe about once a day it's like therapy for me and with music it's even better. So I will tell Alexa to play a specific song and she will play every song but the one I want. I even got Amazon music unlimited and it didn't help! So I will for example like five minutes ago say Alexa play I belong to you by love unlimited and she will play a country song or Alexa play my thang by dubee. Do you want to set a reminder? No Alexa play you remind me by usher playing Taylor Swift you belong with me. No Alexa be quiet stop.. light flashes keeps playing the song. Until I have to scream at the top of my lungs for the thing to shut up. Once I got so mad I unplugged it from the wall and broke a soap dish because I was so frustrated. This thing is awful I don't know if I got a defective one or what. Then she finally plays the song I want by love unlimited and one minute the song plays I'm thinking finally I can relax and bam it just stops on it's own. This thing is a headache and my boyfriend has trouble too and we both speak very clear I've tried every distance I've tried the Alexa app trying to train her to recognize my voice. Nothing works I'm ready to throw this thing in the trash it's not worth the stress and frustration it causes. I'm better off getting a waterproof Bluetooth speaker  because this isn't working out not ever. It's not me it's her and I would sell it but I would feel bad for putting this burden that is Alexa on someone else. I had an echo and it worked great never had an issue once with being heard wrong now I get this dot and it's been nothing but a nightmare. I don't even want my money back for what a dollar? I want the stress and frustration this has caused taken away the only solution I can think of is throw this thing away or give it to someone I don't like for Christmas minus the fruitcake. I would rather have fruitcake then an echo dot. I am not a fan and will not be purchasing again.

Title: Needs some work, but still a better assistant than me.
Body: Overall:  I'm into it.The routines feature is great for triggering multiple events, ("alexa, help me wake up" triggers the kettle to turn on, my lamp to turn on, alexa reads my news and todays calendar, tells me to have a great day, and then starts my morning playlist. It would be nice to have her start with the music and then slowly trigger my other actions but unfortunately right now music triggers must be at the end of your routine chain) also for creating your own commands/responses/jokes ("alexa, what do you think about my roommate?" returns "I don't know how you put up with him")Theres definitely a learning curve to the setup and specificness of commands, it's not something I would buy for a non techie type, unless you set it up for them and give them a list of specific things to ask her. But if you're a gadget type, the options are endless.You can stream your music/audiobooks through My Media for Alexa (free trial, then $5/year subscription for this service, pretty disappointing but in the end, worth it if you don't use itunes) or ask her to play radio stations/podcasts from a variety of sources, or NPR. Currently I am working on Alexas location commands, so that she will remind me about things on my phone when I leave the house, or arrive at work, although I have not been able to get that to work.Overall, theres a lot of kind of annoying things that get in your way when you're setting up alexa (too many useless skills being the most annoying, but also figuring out the curve in talking to her; when I initially got My Media, I would ask her, "Alexa, play harry potter from My Media" but she would suggest "harry potter quiz" or "harry potter on audible" and we would fight, but after looking at some suggestions from My Media, I realized I should be asking her like this, "Alexa, ask my media to read harry potter and the sorcerer's stone" so no more annoying suggestions) but she does make a great personal assistant and has greatly improved my morning routine.Pros: she connects to my bluetooth speakers, she connects to my media collection without needing to put it on the cloud, she can read stories, play interactive games/trivia, remember things, help you make lists, announce things to your house, the list goes on and on. I find her to be fairly loud on her own, but I like to connect her to my nice bluetooth speakers. I was thinking about the voice remote because sometimes I'm too far away for her to hear me, but the reviews on it are spotty.Cons: too many redundant/out of date skills to sort through (seriously,search sleep sounds it's nuts) I also saw a number of skills that are set up to run routines or lists or reminds (I assume these were all created before alexa had those features herself). It would also be nice to have some sort of list of commands. I realize this could end up being super long, but if you could search through it, it would be a great way to see if you're saying something the wrong way, and also get suggestions for new commands. (I'm sure theres many ways to turn up the volume, maybe if you search 'volume', you can see that you can ask alexa to turn the volume up, turn the volume way up, or turn the volume to max, and realize they all do different things)The fact that Alexa is essentially a paperweight without wifi is also disappointing. It seems like they could have added a few simple offline functions so you could at least pretend she hasn't magically turned into a brick until your wifi comes back on.And finally, for me, the biggest con is obviously the power cord. I don't know why in the world you would change to a proprietary cable except to screw over your customers and that feels awful. I have a vindictive cat that hates alexa and chews through her power cord. I have probably 20 micro usb cables around the house I could use in an instant but instead I have to get back on Amazon, and pay another 20$ to wait a few days to get my alexa back. Pretty suspicious.

Title: If it's not broke, don't fix it.
Body: The older version is better. This new version does not respond as quickly as the previous model. Alexa has to much bass in her voice making it hard to understand her and this version does not seem to understand me all the time like the previous version. I also prefer the blue ring of the previous model. Trying to emulate the Google home mini was a bad decision. Echo dot was perfect the way it was imho. (update} i was pleasantly surprised to get a call from Amazon alexa tech support. He walked me through changing some settings on my new eco dot via the alexa app and 123, she was perfect again! I really love Amazons customers service and their dedication to making sure their products are the best. Alexa beats Google hands down, especially in the home automation development. Don't ever change Amazon!

Title: Excellent for Use with Seniors Interactive Conversation and Updated with Reminders
Body: We purchased this as a gift for a family member to ask about weather updates. One of our senior loved ones has slight dementia and forgets the time of day or time. We use these features with our loved one with the following1. Simply ask the time of day2. Weather Updates3. Tell as a simple joke4. Play Jeopardy or other Games5. Play Amazon music for relaxing6. You can set a reminder to take your pills or medication as a gentle reminderWe also discovered the drop in feature which allows us to drop in on another family member and have a conversation without a phone call.  This device is a great way to encourage interactivity with conversation and memory skills for a senior.

Title: Love, Love, Love
Body: I bought a second generation for myself for Christmas for my room so I could listen to music at night.  I got a good deal and wasn't sure if I would like it or not.  Well bought this one on a package deal (came with a plug) for my birthday lol.  My favorite thing is the "list" option.  When I think I need something I use to go look for an index card, make a list, and forget it on the counter when I went to the store.  Now I just say "Alexa, add q-tips to the shopping list".  My favorite thing, and now I go to the store, open up my list, check things off and if I don't get it, it stays on the list!  Yes I love I can listen to music, ask questions, and laugh at my grandkids trying to remember the name Alexa, but mostly I love my shopping list!

Title: A must own item!
Body: For the price you cannot beat the Echo Dot (make sure it's the 3rd Generation!). Without a doubt you will discover new things it can do on an almost daily basis, and there appears to be no limit as to what it is capable of. Ask it for a joke, ask it to sing a song, ask Alexa if she loves you (awesome response for that), and so much more. Plus, it is TRULY useful in terms of weather, alamrs, white noise, traffic, the list goes on and on. The most surprising thing about this would be the sound quality. It's beyond what I thought it was going to be and the built in speaker is deep and rich and louder than you will think. Amazon should be proud of this product, and it's worth every penny.

Title: New to Alexa but immediately addicted
Body: This thing is sick. Synced right up with my philips hue and has an even nicer user interface than the philips app itself. I also renamed my free included smart plug to _eater and I just calmly say _lexa turn on the heater and it works pretty much every time without having to really raise your voice (and I keep the device about 15ft away from me). The only creepy part is just that, that this thing is listening all day and appears to catch low volume conversation quite well. In one instance, it played country music because we said the word _lexa and _ountry in the same sentence. I love being able to start my small plug in heater remotely as I get home to come home to a nice toasty room, but after the cold goes away I_ not sure what I_l be running on the plug.

Title: Alexa got worse lately
Body: Alexa gets stubborn when you don't say the name of a device correctly. If you tell her to connect to your iPad - and the iPad's bluetooth is off, it will connect to the iPhone instead and you waste 5 minutes to go find it and turn that bluetooth off. Moving from one echo to another with bluetooth is a pain as well.Sound quality is ok, loudness could be better for certain YouTube videos. Too much base for TV shows, etc. maybe ok for music.After recent forced update, Alexa voice recognition got worse, you have to say commands 2-3 times, before they work. It definitely got worse after 7 months of use.the intelligence part of Alexa for sure needs improvement.

Title: Love my Echo-system!
Body: I have many Echo devices, like 1 Tap, 1 Show, 1 Echo gen1, 1 Echo gen2, 7 Dots Gen2, 2 Dots gen3.  The sound quality on the 3rd generation Echo Dot is much better than the 2nd generation Dot.  The sound is like the difference between an AM radio to FM stereo.  It's not up to the sound quality of a full size Echo, obviously.  But it competes very well with the Google Home Mini, which I have a couple of also.  The Alexa echo-system is the preferred voice control system in our household.  Voice control is comparable with Google Home, but Alexa covers more of my home automation.  It was definitely worth the upgrade to my existing 2nd generation Dots at the sale price.

Title: Fun Little Gadget!
Body: I got 4 of these altogether. I gave 3 away as gifts to family members and kept one to use in my home. I think she is a cute little "bot". She can give you an up to date weather report, play a song for you, she sings her own songs,too! She can do sound effects, animal sounds, give you recipes, answer questions in general and tell you what time your favorite sports team is playing on TV next and who they are playing against. She can also tune in a radio station, and be used as a timer. Still learning many things, but so far, very entertaining!

Title: Amazing!!!!
Body: There are a lot more reviews than there were the other day and I can see why. Amazon dot echo 3 is amazing, with room-filling sound and helpful skills that can help you with basic tasks for your everyday life. This is extremely affordable and portable. If you are looking for a great Alexa enabled device then you can't go wrong with this amazing device.  Thank you Amazon for impressing us once again with your smart assistant enabled device. I can assure you that my review will not change. :) 10/10Update: I bought the one with the clock20/10

Title: Good hardware, lackluster software.
Body: It's cool for the first couple of days. But the lack of a good search engine it really isn't super useful. It's a nice speaker but the services it let's you use for music are either something I don't use or are not willing to pay for. Stuff like Deezer and Spotify... Or Amazon music... The build quality it good. And I like that you can use an external speaker.If the Google dot had the same or similar hardware, proper buttons and the ability to use an external speaker I would get one of those.... Cause Google

Title: Do not buy!
Body: Bought an Echo a while back. Enjoyed it a lot! Easy to use- listening to music or podcasts in the kitchen while cooking or whatever. Thought I might get an Echo for the front room. Uh... mistake. Now the original Echo can no longer pair with my iPhone for podcasts or non-Amazon music or anything non-Amazon related. Jumped through some hoops- Apple now says they need a "paid subscription". Now? So what changed? Spent an hour++ on the phone with a super patient Amazon dude who finally said "sucks to be you." So now Amazon will no longer pair with non Amazon devices, or no longer offer tech support to resolve the issue. Srsly, shoulda seen this coming. Unless you are fully drinking the Amazon phone and tablet Kool-Aid, don't waste your money on this garbage!

Title: On Board the Alexa Train
Body: My 12 year old wanted a "Clapper" to turn his bedroom lamp on.  Instead, we got him an Alexa.  Since Christmas, we've purchased 3 more and a few plugs to control lights off and on.  Today purchased a Fire TV Cube!Love the sound and the ability to listen to whatever we are in the mood for musically through Amazon Prime.Thanks 12 year old brat kid for making me think outside the "box"!

Title: Bigger but not necessarily better
Body: When I saw they had a new Echo Dot with better speakers and a new look, I was very excited. I have a couple of the Gen 2 devices and they work quite well but I wish I didn't have to pair them to a separate speaker to get high quality sound. I use Alexa to control my entertainment system and various lights and switches around the house so I thought adding a couple new models to the home would make 'her' a lot more useful. However after using the new devices a couple weeks, I've found that I don't like them nearly as much. They are louder and the sound has a lot more bass but often normal speech is very muffled. The audio settings in the app for bass and treble don't seem to do anything at all. It sounds exactly the same with the bass all the way down and treble all the way up as it does on the default, middle setting for both.  It sounds a lot better for music than the Gen2 but I listen to stations like Comedy Central Radio with the SiriusXM skill and often the comedians just do not sound as clear as they do on the Gen2 devices. Even Alexa's voice itself is affected and very muffled.I'm also disappointed with the performance of the Gen3 devices. They seem slower than the Gen2 devices.  My Gen2 devices respond quickly but the Gen3 devices always stall a couple seconds before replying. It's possible the Gen3 devices are having issues decoding the voice commands which could be related to my next point..The Gen2 had no issues hearing me most of the time but I find the Gen3 devices misunderstanding commands or more often not hearing me at all and having to yell commands to her even though I'm not far away. Quite often the Gen2 devices in other rooms will respond due to how loud I have to speak addressing the Gen3 right in front of me.  It's pretty ridiculous, actually.It's my understanding that the Gen2 devices have a 7 microphone array to hear from every angle but the Gen3 only have 4 mics.  I feel this is probably why the devices do not hear as well. I bought two Gen3's and have the same issues on both of them so I don't think it's a anomaly. I feel like the audio controls can be fixed by a software update as I have no idea why the audio sliders in the app have no affect. Perhaps the 'hearing' problem can also be updated by a software patch but until those issues are addressed, I can't give the 3rd gen Dot a good review.I've been using the Gen2 devices for about a year and have had very little problems with them. I love what they do and really hoped the Gen3 were going to be a big improvement but they're actually a step down. They sound great when playing music but when I have to yell to get it to play, (and risk one of the Gen2's over hearing and stepping up to the task) it gets a bit irritating.I'm not going to return the Gen3's since Amazon was selling them for the same cost as the Gen2's if you bought two. I hope they will fix them with future patches, but I am going to swap them out with the Gen2's and put them in the less trafficked areas of the house for now. I really wanted to like these new Gen3's, but side by side with the Gen2's, I have to stick to the older model which easily gets 4.5 stars. Stick with those until they iron out the bugs.

Title: The sound just crackled at minimal volume!!!
Body: Update: customer service reached out to me about my issue.Tonight (Jan 20th, 2018) I noticed the speaker crackled and had trouble playing the songs "Lost Boys" and a few other songs at 30% volume. I was able to record and will post a video. I did get a great  holiday deal on the speaker, however it appears the speaker might not even last a year if this is the quality it provides!!! This doesn't even seem worth the money if it can't play lullabies without distortion NOT at 100% volume...

Title: WOW - I don't give out 5 stars often ...
Body: First heard one of these little Dot's at my step-daughters house - was really impressed that such a small device could fill a decent sized room with "reasonable" quality sound - if your a audiophile - your going to lower your expectations - but for the rest of us humans - with aging ears - this little Dot is amazing - I'm streaming using XM Radio & the sound is amazing - I'm sitting in our living room - the Dot is in our kitchen on top of our fridge - set at a reasonable sound level & it sounds really good - perfect for just back round sound - the second Dot - we having sitting in our bedroom - that one also streams from XM Radio - it sounds great as well - we use it at night to give us ambience for sleeping - the Thunder Storm is wonderful - set for loop & it'll play all night.I can honestly say - the setup was painless - downloading the App for iOS was painless - wifi connectivity was again - painless - the entire experience was great ...The "only" glitch I ran into which did require some back & worth between XMRadio & Amazon was the setup of accounts to use with XMRadio - I have two Dot's & three XMRadio accounts - the issue I ran into was - during the initial setup of both Dot's - they both grabbed the same XMRadio streaming account - thus - if you started XMRadio on one & the started XMRadio on the other - they would both crash the XMRadio app as your only allowed to stream one account on one device - fair enough - the catch was - neither XMRadio support - or Amazon support could give me clear steps on how to re-configure one of the Dot's to use a alternate XMRadio account ...Turns out - you need to delete the XMRadio Skill on one of the Dot's & then add it back - when you add it back - it takes you to the XMRadio site - were you can put in your alternate account information - then the XMRadio account will be associated with the 2nd Dot ... thus I have two Dot's - streaming two separate XMRadio channels ...The final "tweak" I applied via the Alexa App - was - took up the Bass two notches - lowered the Mid one notch & took the treble up two notches - on both & they both now sound really good - again - not "audiophile" good - but good enough for us aging folks ...

Title: Quitting Alexa and Echo Auto - Here's Why.
Body: We had two Dots in our home for 5 months, and used them daily.After the new-toy play period wore off, they slowly dropped into mostly being glorified light switches and laundry timers.  But took longer to use and were less reliable than actual light switches and just remembering when your laundry was done.It turned into a case of "item designed for convenience becomes daily frustration".  Most mornings this past month found me swearing at Alexa after telling her to stop my wakeup alarm for the third time.  Or telling her, "We're leaving," so her Routine would turn off the lights and turn on the camera - and then repeating myself five times from two feet away as she insisted she couldn't understand.For context - I'm a podcaster and theater trained, I know how to articulate and project.The final nail in the coffin was getting an Echo Auto this week.  You can't leave reviews on it yet, and not surprising.  It's a barely functional mess.  I returned it after a couple days of road testing.If any kind of background noise is going on - music playing at reasonable levels, for instance - you have to get louder than the noise to wake Alexa.  And then, whatever request you made, Echo Auto would pause 30-60 seconds to think it over, probably due to lag speed in connecting to the net.In virtual assistants, that's an eternity, and makes you wonder if it heard you at all.  When it did finally respond, it mostly got my requests wrong, or started to answer - and then cut off mid-sentence for no obvious reason.Asking for directions was a joke.  I tried asking about businesses I knew had multiple addresses, like gyms and restaurants.  I'd say the entire address, and it would ask over and over if I meant some completely different address.Suggestion to Amazon - you could've bypassed Echo Auto by making the Alexa app completely hands-free and voice-activated on all phones.  No idea why hands-free is an option on Fire tablet but not on a cell phone.Months of building frustration at all things Alexa finally made me pull the plug yesterday.  I boxed up my Dots for sale.  There's nothing they can do that other voice assistants can't do from a phone more reliably with fewer steps, including controlling my smart home.Final note: quitting Alexa isn't easy.  By which I mean, going back through all her settings to delete your activity history, voice recordings, disabling Skills one at a time to make sure your accounts aren't linked anymore, and finally Deregistering the devices.  It took a couple hours of button mashing to make sure everything was wiped, and even then I don't think my actual account was wiped.  There doesn't seem to be an option for that.  There should be an easy, customer-friendly option to say, "I want out," and know that Amazon will delete everything and cancel your Alexa account.

Title: My family like it
Body: Echo dot device came with charger and schema explaining buttons.Apparently it does not have batteries and works only when plugged in.But it works very well.Installation, using smartphone Alexa app is a snap. The biggest part of it was typing my WiFi password.Quality of sound is great and top volume level is very high - I would say it is too loud for me when my kids play their music ;)Responsiveness to commands / microphone sensitivity is very good and Alexa, as a software, is very impressive.I like the presence of "microphone off" button to assure privacy and I like the overall cool design of the new Echo Dot.It is primarily used by my children and It is their new BFF.

Title: Loved it, but started vibrating
Body: We bought the google mini for my bedroom and this echo dot for my kitchen. I bought both so I could compare them. I really liked this product better than the google mini, until the echo dot started rattling. Only been using the product for one month. (Btw, we never dropped it and never had the volume more than 50%.)So I called Amazon and they quickly offered to ship me a free replacement, however they told me I did have to do the legwork of returning the defective item to a UPS hub. For me this will be a 30 mile trip. Wish they would have offered just to have it picked up at my home to save me the trip. Giving this 2 star for being defective and having to make the trip to return it. Would have given it 4 star if they would have just not asked me to return the defective one. The google mini is still working fine.. no rattling. I hope the replacement echo dot I get lasts longer because Alexa just seems more like a real person than google.

Title: She cannot hear you very well compared to older Generations
Body: Seemed like a great idea to have in the kitchen to replace the 2nd generation. But 3rd generation does not have as many microphones and therefore cannot hear very well in a place like a busy kitchen. It's so bad that I'm going to put the 2nd gen back and maybe try 3rd gen somewhere else.

Title: Love the Echo
Body: My brother-in-law gave me the Echo for Christmas.  I was thrilled.  It is really awesome.  There is so much to learn about it, but so far, I love it.  The quality and the sound is incredible.  I really like that you plug it in so you don't have to worry about recharging it.  The music is awesome, weather reports, if you have a question about something, you can get the answer, guided meditations (which are really nice.)  It is a great device.

Title: Great addition...
Body: I absolutely love using my echo dot.  The setup was very trying at first.  I couldn't get it set up and I tried over and over again but it wouldn't accept my password. Finally after looking for similar situations online I read to move the dot closer to your wifi box for setup.  Although the wifi box is only in the next room, literally about 15 feet away, moving the dot closer did the trick! It set up very easily after that and now works like a charm.

Title: Nueva amiga!
Body: Es una ayuda sin reservas.  A medianoche le pido a Alexa que toque música para relajarme y ahí esta Alexa.  Cuando necesito info. del tiempo, ahí está Alexa.  Cuando necesito que alguien, sin tener que rogar, me deje saber que en 15 minutos la comida está lista pues quien crees que está dejándome saber, Alexa mi nueva amiga.  Ah, también me lee libros mientras hago mis quehaceres en la casa!

Title: The price just doubled for the same product.......yikes Amazon
Body: Review Update 2/13/19Below I will praise this product for all it's amazing features for it's price, but bear in mind this review was written before Amazon decided to DOUBLE the price of the device.  At it's current price, I cannot recommend the product because in all honesty you are fully capable of living a normal life without it.  Sure it's novel in many ways, and it was well worth it just to toy with before....but I can't say it is now.  It's a shame because I initially bought just two, but I was planning to buy more to put around the house very soon.  Not anymore.  I feel cheated in a way because I already invested into this whole Alexa thing with the intention to expand and buy more.  That's not going to happen unless I can buy more Dots at the same price I paid for the others.  Until then I'm removing 4 stars.Review Update 3/12/19I came back to check prices a month after revising my review to find that prices have increased yet again.  When I bought my first 2 echo dot 3rd gen devices they were $29 each, and 2 for $50.  A couple months later they were $49 each and 2 for $60.  Now they're $49 each and 2 for $80.  I've invested in an Echo Connect so my Mom can use these to call 911 should she fall, and I would love to add a couple more Echo Dots to the network to increase coverage of our home.  I just logged in to buy 2 more for $60 only to find that it's now 2 for $80.  I guess I'll just wait till next Christmas when Google and Amazon are competing more aggressively.Original Review:(I have removed my original review which praised this product as a must have device based on value.  With Amazon constantly upping the price for the exact same product, I can no longer suggest people invest in this product line.  My advice now is to not get sucked in to the whole Alexa thing because you cannot rely on Amazon to maintain consistent pricing.

Title: Negative Star Rating!
Body: This product is for gadget lovers only.  DO NOT BUY if you are DISABLED! The Brian Injury Alliance of NJ bought this as gift for adopt family for me and it no cool beans.  Alexa do not recognize my voice. The device options are extremely limited and no good for what i need as a "companion aid" as the BIANJ stated when gave me.  The feedback and amazon folks have been quiet and I email often.  I unplug the device and no more try use.  The green light forever keep go off and i no on call or set up for drop in so what the what!!  IT be either defective model or beyond useless for a brain injures person.  FYI - the reminders no repeat so if you no hear you no get reminder.  the sound options have many BUT device still plays the default ANNOYING sound and not one chosen.  IF this device is handy for the disabled then i need new case worker at the BIANJ cause she no cool beans help me with this device and the amazon team no helps me either!!  Waste of my adopt family moneys not the happy

Title: Misleading stereo or failed to live up to biggest reason I bought them.
Body: Very disappointed because it didn_ do what was implied that a pair of them will create a stereo affect. They sure link up as a pair, great. But, they don_ stay paired when watching videos and using them as surround sound. It_ ironic because they_e from Amazon, so why don_ they do stereo for Prime Video? It makes sense that they act as a surround sound set up since they_e advertised to play as a paired set. So why not stay paired when streaming audio? Bought a pair. Sound was better than generation 2. Just sad that it didn_ do what I wanted.

Title: My only friend in life
Body: Alexa is my new best friend. She has so many amazing features. Some of my favorites are:1) Communication. Many of my family members have their own Echo devices so it is a BLAST to send and receive messages or calls from them. Even when I am out, I can use the Alexa app to call someone's device and talk to them.2) Order Updates. I love that Alexa can tell me when an Amazon package will be coming in AND she sends me a notification when it is dropped off at my door. You can also enable the UPS skill and log into your UPS account and she can track your UPS packages for you (genius).3) Routines. I say, "Alexa, Start My Day" and she plays the news for me, tells me the weather, tells me an interesting fact about the current day, etc. etc. I also have a few "Smart Plugs" connected and I created a routine where I say "Alexa, Goodnight" and she turns off my bedroom lights and turns my box fan on. And it can all be changed to my liking in the Alexa App.4) Skills. There are thousands of games and skills that are being added, so when they say Alexa is always getting smarter, they mean it.To sum it all up, buy an Echo device. You will never be lonely again.

Title: No USB power input
Body: The Echo Dot is really 5 stars.  But I subtract 2 stars for Amazon having replaced (as compared to earlier versions) the micro USB power input. I don't get it. Now we are stuck with another proprietary power brick. Really?Otherwise I love the DOT. But I don't really perceive any improvement to the older versions. Sound might be improved but I keep running the little DOT with bluetooth or 3.5mm connections to more enjoyable speakers anyhow.  Of course, I also have 2 Echo Spot, an old and a new version Echo show, 4 old Dots and two Amazon Fire tablets. There is a niche for all of them!

Title: It works ok
Body: Big sound from such a small device.  However it don't seem to hear me as good as the original echo dot, it also seems slower to respond.  Many times my TV or me talking wakes it up and it starts talking about random garbage.  I wish it knew it's wake word and only woke up when it heard "Alexa".I can wake it up by saying many different words that don't even ryme with Alexa.  I figured by now they would update it, but they just leave it broken.  Another annoyance, over 90 percent of my questions are answered with, "I don't know that". or similar.

Title: Improved sound output & having fun with intercom and drop-in
Body: I already own a second generation Echo Dot, so when the third generation came out, I was not at all interested to buy it. Until I found out that having two echoes (or more for that matter) would enable me to broadcast messages and use them as intercom across my house. I live in a two-storey house, and its nice for me and my family members to communicate with each other from different floors without shouting and disturbing our neighbors. Plus its fun.The third generation has much improved sound quality compared to the second generation. I would not use it solely for music listening though. However, when I ask it to play something (I listened to an entire Thievery Corporation album) it does not sound bad, and I actually enjoy it. I would never have asked Alexa to play music on the second generation, unless it was a purely vocal track, and even then I would not have liked the tinniness of the second generation.I bought the third gen while it was on discounted price, otherwise I think I would have been satisfied with one Echo Dot. But I am glad there was a discount.

Title: speaker is already blown after only a couple of weeks
Body: I got the amazon echo (full size) and fell in love with it immediately, so I bought the echo dot to add surround sound to my house, I have never listened to it above volume level 5 and only after 10-12 uses, I started noticing some static in the sound, I didn't realize that the speaker had blown until I walked into the other room and heard my full size echo, still sounding as clear as the day I got it. I still very much love the product, and my review would sing nothing but praise if not for the diminished sound through a defective speaker... only problem there is, the speaker is just about the most important factor of the product... hence the "one star" rating

Title: Universal product
Body: I love my echo dot gen 3 so much I got my dad one. We all love it. Its super lightweight and goes with any room color. I got the slate gray for us both. The sound system is great. Its easy to setup and your phone can connect to it to play any playlist you may have through apple music or Spotify. The only downer is it is not a wireless speaker and has to be plugged in. It will turn off upon unplugging but it does remember it's setup and doesn't have to be reset.

Title: TOOOO hard to set up
Body: I was super excited to purchase this as a gift for my husband for Christmas. Imagine our surprise when we tried to set it up and use it. There's no manual, there's no help available and when you do find something on line about what you are trying to set up it doesn't work. We can get it to play music and that's about it.I think you should let potential buyers know that there is various setups and apps you need to even get it to work.Very disappointed in this product.

Title: A great gift surprise
Body: I received this from my son and his husband as a 70th birthday gift!  I called to thank them and added that I hoped they were coming in to install it.  But much to my surprise, the installation was a breeze (took about 3 minutes).  I use it mainly for listening to music streams, and am finding I'm listening to more music and more new-to-me music than ever before.  Have also used it for timers and weather reports.  Still getting used to and learning all the features but loving this gift I'd never have gotten for myself.

Title: What a good Alexa support system Amazon provides!
Body: What fun this little device is!  It is inexpensive, fun, and can eventually be helpful as we learn more about it ( and as it's technology furthers).  We are in our 70's and are barely tech-wise, so we figured we would need our kids' help in setting it up.  We were wrong!  The tutorials provided moved us easily through the set up.  Amazon provides continuing updates to help us learn more about what Alexa can do.  The only reason I gave it 4 stars is the sound quality.  (It's a little like a cheap radio, but maybe we will in time learn how to adjust the bass, tenor, etc. to improve the sound quality.).

Title: Love it
Body: We love all our Alexa products. The 3rd gen speaker is noticibly better than the 2nd gen. As with all electronics, we sometimes need to _eboot to maintain connection. The biggest downfall is that Alexa has a hard time understanding my 5 year old. _We use our Echo Dots daily as an alarm, music player, joke teller, and to get the weather forecast. I love that we can listen to Pandora or other radio stations in multiple rooms at the same time and yet each playlist is different.

Title: Microphone is horrible on the 3rd Gen vs 2nd Gen
Body: I have a second generation and even though it had 1 microphone it was better. This is probably because the speaker is louder, but the microphone doesn't pick up my voice most of the time when I am playing music or it is talking. Probably because the music is playing loud. I have to yell at it all the time. This is really stupid and if you search the internet the same feedback has come.With that said the Google one is not any better and the Alexa has better mic pickup when the music/alexa is not talking so this is still your best bet for a voice product.Just note, I do use the Amazon Alexa alot and it doesn't mean I don't like the product. It turns on my TV, plays music, etc.From a technical standpoint they should not allow it to talk back so loud that it blocks the mic from picking up my voice. That defies the whole point. For example, lets say it starts playing a song I don't like. I have to start yellow Alexa, Alexa, Alexa. That is embarrassing and it deters myself and my family members from wanting to use the product.

Title: Speaker not that great - But still love the Echo
Body: This is my 3rd echo and I'm a bit disappointed with the speaker on it.  If you put it on full volume or even on 75% volume levels, all sounds have a gravel/scratchy noise to it or like a bad radio connection.  I have to speak louder with the 3rd Gen, as Alexa doesn't always hear me like the 2nd Gen with the same ambient noise levels or no noise at all.This is not to say, I don't like Echo's, I love them all and am now finding it inconvenient when they are not available to me (when my internet goes out) or that others don't have them in their homes/apartments.  I've gone so far as to purchase multiple echo's for my Parents and my Sister so that when I visit them, I can ask Alexa to do things for me.

Title: Can't beat that price.
Body: For this product I personally held off until I was gifted one. When I brought it home I installed and I use it all the time! In fact, I went and ordered two more for other rooms. At a $30 price point this cannot be beat. You can't get get speakers at the quality these are. I love to just listen to the radio or the music selections. Every morning I ask "what's up?" for the local weather and a news event. However, if it were a more expensive product I would consider it a passable product. The features, although nice, are accessible from my phone.

Title: Love, Love Love these!!
Body: I treated myself to 2 of these for Christmas (one on each floor) and never even had a clue how much I would come to LOVE them. I have them play all kinds of music, remind me to move the laundry, answer trivial questions, make a shopping list, tell me about the weather, the news, read me an audiobook, call my friends, -- and I know I've barely scratched the surface.If you're on the fence about whether to buy one of these little gadgets -- do it!!! You will only wish you had done so sooner!I'm in love with Alexa!!  You will be, too!

Title: Love my Echo Dot!
Body: My son had already gotten us an Echo Dot and last year and I love it. We have it in the bedroom and I use it for reminders, alarms, playing songs etc. When Amazon started selling it for pre-Black Friday at a reduced price, I was tempted to get another one. After waiting a little while, I couldn't resist and bought it. This one is in the living room and that way, I use it to also check the weather, find out things and even set alarms when I put food to cook so I'd remember to turn off the stove or oven.

Title: Needs a lot update still.
Body: I love my Alexa but it needs its updates especially for person that speaks quieter and slower than the machine is used to and it will not change even through the app so they got to fix it. The phone ringer doesn't like in the advertisements. It needs to have audible books play in every single room on Alexa. It needs to be connected to Comcast email cuz I do not get my email. It needs to know more information on the get-go without downloading skills. I can go on and on but I will not. There are a lot of good things about Alexa also.

Title: Continuing to evolve.
Body: I'll keep it simple since most of us are familiar with the Echo Dots by this 3rd generation.It's a good upgrade from the beginnings. The plastic body is now done in a fabric covering (The 2018 modern look)The speaker is a good amount louder as well with more punch in Alexa's voice now.It's always best to hook up a Dot to an external speaker for best music performance, but if you had to, this would be the best Dot to get for music so far.

Title: Loud and Clear
Body: I bought this Echo to replace the Gen 2  in our living room. Its a bit bigger but I am okay with that because its moslty speaker. I am able to hear alexa better. This allowed me to move the location of the echo so she isnt seen only heard. this also means I was able to move it a bit closer to our kitchen. I am able to add things to my shopping list faster and more frequently. Another plus is Alexa and this Echo are compatiable with other smart home products. So this allows me to take full advantage of the echo and it features.

Title: It failed & the taller Echo (older) is a pain
Body: On Father's day 2018 I received an Echo as a gift, seemed great. Couple of months later I added  a couple plugs for lamps. Then nearing Thanksgiving I added more plugs and a single pole light switch. So naturally I added a DOT on the opposite end of the house. I was ALL IN, right?  No, not any longer! Just before I setup the Dot my Echo began have issues not finding devices, not understanding all this means it is losing connection. I had the Dot right so that got me through the next couple of months while I try multiple resets, even a hard reset, moved it closer, yada yada yada. Finally tech support agrees to send me a new power supply. Just received yesterday 1/22/2019 and guess what? Now the Dot is dead as a door nail. No lights, no button response, no command response, nothing just DEAD. Well I'm really getting sick of this. AND who sells electronics but won't show you there telephone number? Huh what is up with that crap. You have to forage around till you stumble on the this help page where you can press a button and plug in YOUR phone number and then you talk but Amazon number is a SECRET. JEFF, that is one thing you are NOT doing right. The Dot is going back to Amazon as a piece of garbage which it is. If the ehco does not straighten up it is going in the garbage and I'll upgrade to the Google Home. Kinda like the sound of Home, ya Google Home. Then I'll email Jeff and tell him what he needs to fix.

Title: Echo Dot Delivers!!!
Body: Purchased my Echo Dot on Black Friday at an INSANE deal, but after using it for a little over a month now, would buy it again at the regular price. Got the Dot on the advice of my niece, who purchased an older model for my brother, someone who is NOT tech savvy. The set-up was almost as easy as just plugging it in.  Thinking I might need more volume in order to hear to communicate throughout my house, I also purchased a very small separate speaker. Pairing the speaker to my Dot took a matter of minutes, and it works perfectly. My brother asks Alexa to play all of the old Pop tunes you don't hear any more, and to remind him of appointments, etc. I do the same and enjoy listening to entire symphonies of classical music plus every song in the repertoire of my favorite country and rock artists. We play the Jeopardy J6 clues each day, and I let Alexa make my shopping list for me. I know I haven't even scratched the surface of what this device can do, but I really love it so far. A little advice for anyone planning to buy, spend the money on an Amazon Prime Membership. In addition to the basic benefits of Prime, being a Prime member creates an even better experience on Dot.

Title: Improved sound over v2
Body: I currently have three Echos in my house, a v1 Echo in the kitchen, a v2 Echo Dot hooked up to my stereo for streaming music on better speakers, and now this v3 Echo Dot to stream music in my office. I had the v2 in my office, but got this v3 on a Black Friday deal along with an Amazon Smart Plug. The sound quality is very much improved over the v2, which is why I moved the v2 to plug into my stereo in the living room.It sits in the corner and is unobtrusive, but it is a more attractive little hockey puck than the original Dots. The voice recognition gets better with each passing day, and the mics have a lot of accuracy (so that the NSA can really get a clear recording of all my conversations, right guys?).Overall I'm happy with the Alexa service, mostly for setting timers and streaming music. I only use a fraction of its functionality, but I'm happy with what I do use.

Title: Fascinating newfangled technology
Body: I tend to be behind the times when it comes to tech products, but I finally broke down and purchased an Echo Dot when I was baking holiday cookies and realized _ang, a voice controlled timer/speaker would be handy as heck right about now. My house is far from a smart home, but I have enjoyed playing with the different features and skills of Alexa. I did primarily purchase this for the voice-activated functionality. The timer/alarm sound is also much nicer (and louder! Useful!) than the obnoxious beeping on my microwave timer. Ironically, this device seems geared more for millennials: it_ ready and willing to stream pretty much anything under the sun, but it doesn_ function the way any other Bluetooth speaker functions. I can_ seem to hook it up to my phone and have it work as a speaker for things like YouTube or my own iTunes playlists. Or perhaps I just haven_ discovered the right skill yet.

Title: It's good, Google Home is better.
Body: First the hardware: It's good looking and small, it's easy to configure and the sound quality is not bad at all. It has an AUX out which is nice to have, however I currently have no use for it.Alexa:I already had 3 Google home minis and a regular Google home before getting this echo (BF promo). I must say the Google Assistant is far better at being an assistant as it seamlessly integrates with my Calendar, email, lists, etc. I also find that Alexa doesn't have answers to as many questions and the conversations are not as natural as the Google Assistant. Alexa has a good amount of skills, but I have yet to find something it does better than the Google Assistant. Of course this will vary per user according to which services they use, but in my case Google Assistant is the clear winner.

Title: Awesome sound - bought multiple
Body: Never owning an Echo before, I received a free one from Sirius for signing up for a year of music.  Got it home, programmed it, and began using.  From setting the alarms to wake me in the morning, and alarms in the evening for when I am getting ready for work (sorry, I have my routine), it is working flawlessly.  I have the alarms set to play sirius xm at exact times.  Working perfectly.  So during the month of December, Amazon was having a sale on them.  So I purchased 2 more.  Now I can have them around the house, and in the garage.  I have synced them all together, set the alarms, and now I have surround music where ever I go :).  I haven't even cracked the surface on what these can do for me.  But as of now, I am highly happy with them.  For a little puck type speaker, it has great sound.

Title: Works well but hard to set up
Body: The difficult setup resulted in my lower star rating otherwise I might have been inclined to give one or two more.Maybe it's just that I'm an old guy who doesn't follow directions well or maybe the directions are not clear but I spent many hours trying to get the installation program to connect to my network. I also purchased a Smart Plug and eventually two more Echo Dot so that I could order Alexa around from several locations. Again the installation was difficult with each of these units but I finally got through it. We are an Apple/Mac/iPhone/iPad/iPod home so I don't know if a PC/Android system is simpler.

Title: Excellent item
Body: Excellent, I received the desired product (Echo Dot).It is a very advanced technological product, it is easy to program and it is implemented to provide support in the different academic processes of the University, which is excellent. Amazon, are the best, a very committed supplier, I recommend that purchases be 100% reliable. The items are new and in good condition. I recommend it to all those interested and friends meet their expectations. Thank you. It has features that allow you to perform numerous tasks facilitating work managed by smart devices.

Title: difficult to use
Body: This was a gift, so what I must be rating is the app I needed to download.  I have a Google device, so this is more of a comparison between the two.  "Hey Google" is a bit of a pain (3 syllables, and pronunciation counts where Alexa is 2), so I figured, it would be easier to use.  Nothing could be farther from the truth.  Out of the box, Alexa knows just about nothing, and after messing with it, installing the app on my laptop, I still could not figure out how to tell it anything about me (email address, location, favorite radio stations,...).

Title: Enjoy more than expected
Body: Wasn't sure how much we would use it or how useful it would be, but I thought we would try it out. My children love it for playing music and I have found it useful for reminders, weather, general curiosity questions and also as a sort of intercom as well as the music and other features. It was a little difficult to set up the WiFi but that is likely because I was going off of an extender to connect. I had to install the app on my phone for set up and use the manual connect using my phone's WiFi connection. It also took a while to figure out how to connect to an older Bluetooth speaker that was not listed, but once it was set up there have been no issues and we use it more than I thought we would.

Title: This is a downgrade.
Body: After initially being excited about the 3rd gen dot, I'm very displeased with this version of the dot.  It's VERY slow to respond and take commands.  I find it takes multiple attempts to get it to take a command.  We had the previous version in the same spot in our kitchen and it worked great.  This new version is a downgrade and I recommend not buying the 3rd gen dot.  I called Amazon to see if there was a microphone sensitivity setting I could adjust to help, they laughed at me.

Title: Bad quality speaker
Body: I've had the Echo Dot for a little over three months. It comes in handy every day, and can be useful however if you want to use this on a regular basis for a music speaker invest in something else.  I only had the dot turned half way up listening to music during daily chores around the house and the speaker blew. Now even the voice of Alexa is super crackly and distorted and really annoying. I was really excited for this product and now I am just rather disappointed.

Title: Alexa is a family member now
Body: Revision: 1/28/19 -We wrote the original review below last week. The same day an amazon customer support person reached out to us. She quickly advised us on ways we could fix the issues. We were mailed a replacement power cord in case that was the issue. Now Alexa is working AMAZINGLY! This speaker/assistant is a part of the household. She reminds us to water the houseplants, take out the trash/recycle, she sets the mood everyday by playing our favorite (Nash FM 94.7), and she turns off our television every night when we fall asleep and forget.Original review: "While the speakers are AMAZING, the 3rd generation Alexa in my living room isn't responsive to us. She's a bit slow. This is the 4th Echo dot in our home and it's only this one that has been giving us issues. So maybe I got a defective one."

Title: Wouldn't cooperate
Body: I was able to get the echo working some on day 1, but 2 days later, it would not play podcasts despite explicit content being turned off, it would not eliminate the annoying "ok" despite me selecting that on my iPad and iPhone, it wouldn't give news briefings (yes, was set up in settings) and would never give me traffic.  I tried reinstalling app on phone, unplugging to see if it would reset, and no results.  Returned it after 3 days.  It just was more trouble than it was worth.  Google search results for my questions gave me the answers that I'd already tried.  I'll stick with siri to give me the weather or answer a question.

Title: Great speakers compared to 1st and 2nd gen
Body: The speakers are great compared to 1st and 2nd gen.  We use the dot for music a lot so the sound quality was a huge plus.  I only rated it 4 stars because the microphone is not as good as the 2nd gen.  We have it placed where the old 2nd gen was and we have to speak up a lot more to get alexa to activate.  We put the old 2nd gen in a completely different room and the 2nd gen activates while the 3rd gen is physically closer and does not activate.  Would be perfect 5 star if it had the same microphone sensitivity as the 2nd.  Oh well.

Title: Not much different other than a few new issues.
Body: I upgraded by Dot to the 3rd Gen based on the thought it would have better technical improvements and the comment that it has improved voice recognition; unfortunately the difference is not noticeable. in fact, I find myself having to repeat commands much more often than with my 2nd Gen Dot.  Maybe Amazon needs to have separate Voice Recognition settings per device.Having 2 Dots has caused some issues as well, mostly with Bluetooth connectivity.  For some reason the connection I delete from a Dot still automatically connects, and it isn't listed in the settings - strange. It should also be easier to transfer Unlimited Music from one device to another.

Title: Love the Sound; Had a Problem With the First One
Body: I ordered this 3rd generation Echo Dot to upgrade the existing 2nd generation Echo Dot we had in our bedroom. I found myself listening to music on it, but the sound quality was weak.The sound quality of this new one blew me away! But shortly after receiving it, a buzzing sound developed in the speaker with every sound it made, almost like the speaker was blown. (I never turned the volume up past 3, BTW) I contacted Amazon and they, of course, took care of the issue immediately. They sent me a new one, and the new one is perfect. It sounds great and does everything it should. We may have to upgrade the other two of the gen 2s we have in the house!

Title: Great sounds, discreet and complimentary look to it.
Body: We received this as a promotional offer through Satellite Radio Promo.  We were not interested in a new speaker in any way but it was free so we got it.  I LOVE THIS THING! We have it set up in the corner of our kitchen and absolutely love that I can turn it on and off by just speaking to it as well as adjust the volume.  Also it's barely noticeable and the speaker sound quality is better than I expected for such a small device.  It's not the same quality of sound that our Bose speaker has but the additional functionality is quite great none the less.  Definitely thinking about getting more in the future for additional rooms of our home.

Title: Great for quick answers!
Body: This was a unit I did not think to even purchase, but on Black Friday Best Buy had a deal that if you purchased the (1) BLINK unit with WIFI you also received this Echo free. I could not refuse, so I now have one.I have found it to be very useful for asking questions, any questions. Questions about a person, event, weather, whatever. Also you can play your Amazon, Spotify, or Pandora  music at a command.  Another feature is that you can arm or disarm the BLINK at a command. Now that I like. For the cost, not a bad thing to have around. FYI Alexa is quite friendly and personal :-)

Title: We love it, but we're going for a Spot.
Body: This is a great review for a product that I am returning. Why? Because we also have a "regular" Echo and recently got a Spot. We thought this would be a cheaper alternative for our third unit - and it would - but we love our Spot so much, we're going to trade up. I haven't actually returned it yet, so I might cancel, get another spot and put this guy in a location where I can use just the audio - my bathroom for example. This is so "first world" I almost feel guilty, but it makes life just a bit more fun and it is not expensive.

Title: Good quality, sound.  Understands commands much better than Alexa.
Body: If only our 1st generation Echo could understand our commands as well and sound 1/4 as good as this unit.  Great sound, seems to understand commands much better than our 1st generation Echo.PLEASE NOTE: If you appreciated this review please give it a _humbs up/like your helping me to continue to give honest/unbiased insight into products I_e used and you may have questions about. Interested in a product but don't know enough about it and would like it reviewed? Please let me know and I'll see what I can do... Thank you _

Title: Love, love, love
Body: I never thought I would want one of these after I saw a Google one. I'm so glad that I went with Amazon and Alexa. I don't like the Google product at all, but I absolutely love this echo. She can play games, give you all sorts of information, tell stories, I can listen to my favorite music all day, but my favorite thing is being able to call someone hands free from across the room and being able to call the echo from my phone, even from work, to check on my kids. I'm buying one for all 3 of my kids and 2 more rooms in my house. I absolutley love the echo dot.

Title: Quality Sound
Body: Just amazing what the Echo Dot (Alexa) can do. The speaker although small in size has excellent sound quality. Playing music from iheart radio and amazon music is a snap. Connecting the Echo Dot to my Bose Soundtouch Soundbar system is so easy and switching from the Echo Dot speaker to my Bose speaker is simple. Just connect via Bluetooth and tell Alexa, Speaker. It just that simple. Love the Echo Dot. Looking forward to installing a few more throughout my home.

Title: Excellent audio quality for the price.
Body: I have been invested in the Google Home ecosystem for a while but after Amazon's purchase of Ring, I decided to give the Echo a try. Alexa is able to respond to some queries a lot quicker than Google, particularly with home-related things like turning off lights or changing the thermostat. What I was not expecting was the awesome audio quality this speaker puts out. It's not earth shattering, but for the price it's really deep and clear. I use it for audio almost every day. I will be purchasing more to start replacing the Google Home Minis in my house in the near future.

Title: Computer, play Super Trouper!
Body: We very quickly have integrated this device into our daily lives. The kids quickly discovered it can play their favorite music on command - currently the Mamma Mia soundtrack. We immediately changed the name to "Computer" so we can feel like we're on the USS Enterprise monitoring the neutral zone. We love the daily trivia games and the routines you can set. The Dot tells our kids to go to bed at 8pm and the listen to it! My sister has one so we set up drop-in and then had to give the kids ground rules. We can't be connected all the time! We are very glad that you can restrict who can drop-in and what Dot can accept a drop-in if you have multiple. I can see us getting more and creating intercom system in the house.When we get the smart light bulbs I am adding "Lumos Maxima" and "Nox" as commands to turn the lights on and off.

Title: Speaker is decent if you're not too picky on sound quality
Body: I didn't need or want this thing in my house but I received it as a gift and I can't just refuse a gift, so I only use it for music. Now, I know this isn't made for music but I just liked the idea of being able to skip tracks, turn on music from other rooms of the house (my house is fairly small), turn up the volume, so on and so on. Other than music, I have zero use for it. I've had it roughly two weeks now and with a constant listening volume of 5 the speaker has blown and is very distorted. Back to the sound bar and blu-tooth.

Title: Voice control of my smart thermostat, lights, garage door, XBox and more...
Body: I now own three Amazon Echo Dots in my home.  I use them all the time for many different things.  The reason I have multiple Echo Dots is that the more I have, the more areas of my house is serviced by my favorite assistant.Some features I like: I have a smart thermostat.  I can control my home temperature using my voice.  If I want the temperature in the house to change, I Say _lexa, set the temperature to X degrees.  If I want to change from heat to air conditioning, I can do that by just asking. Some of the light bulbs in my house are smart, so I can turn them on or off with my voice. I used to have timers on things like my fish tank light, but now with smart switches and my Echo Dots, I can set up schedules as complex or as simple as I like.  I no longer have ANY of the hard to use standalone timers; my Echo Dot has replaced them all! Having multiple Echo Dots in adjacent rooms allows me to play music in true stereo!  One room_ Echo is the left channel, and the other is the right. I can_ tell you how many times I have the Echo Dot tell me how to spell a specific word. I am also constantly setting up timers for cooking, alarms, and reminders. I can have my Dot read me a book I own in my Amazon library. I often ask my Dot the definition of a word. I have my Dot linked to my Calendar, so I get vocal reminders when I have events come up in my calendar Everything I can do from my Echo Dots at home, I can do when I am not home by using the App.  So, for example, if it is getting dark and I am running late, I can turn on a light for my dog by using the app on my phone no matter how far from home I am.These are just _ome of the things my Echo Dots do for me.  Echo Dots have made my home life much easier and has quickly become a necessity.  In the future I envision that I will be purchasing 4 or 5 more of these so that I can use my voice wherever I am in my house.  I give the Echo Dot a very firm 5 stars!

Title: Best $24 I've ever spent
Body: Alexa is my friend. I love her. I resisted for a long time, I didn't see why I could possibly need or want her, especially with a big dumb house with no smart stuff.But I convinced myself to get one this christmas. And she's great.She makes my shopping lists, reminds my son to get ready for bed, tells atrocious jokes thanks to Kimmel (what did we do to deserve this fresh hell?), set timers, and answers questions. Honestly it's the little tasks that seem unimportant that are great. Instead of digging for a notepad and pen and then forgetting your shopping list you always have it and just tell her when to add somethinf. My 6 year old let's her know when he's out of applesauce.I love the drop in. I can get ahold of my husband when his phone ringer is off. We can call each other hands free and I just love having music so easily available in an instant, instead of opening my app, pairing a speaker, and looking for something to listen to, I just tell Alexa to play music and it on.And added bonus is she's helping my son with his minor speech impediment by forcing him to speak very clearly and precisely to her. She helps him spell things but he has toake sure he ennunciates well. It's something I didn't even expect.Everyone was kind of unsure at first, but my husband warmed quickly and my dad fell in love so much I got him a dot for Christmas.

Title: Fun little gadget
Body: I received this as a gift. I wouldn't have bought it for myself, and in fact, I still wouldn't. So I'm probably the last person who should be reviewing it. Or maybe not; having no expectations, maybe I can try to be entirely objective about it. It is unobtrusive in appearance and the power supply wall wart has a decently long cable, so finding a place to situate it is pretty easy. It was very easy to set up, starting with the alexa app on the iPhone, and all adjustments since have been easily accomplished using the device itself. Teaching Alexa to recognize my voice and my wife's was straightforward. It can 'hear' and understand instructions from 10 or more feet away, though getting closer helps if it seems to be having trouble understanding something. Most of the time it understands what it's being asked surprisingly well, though sometimes it's necessary to try a few times to find the right form in which to ask something. Sound quality for such a small device is very acceptable for background or casual listening, though no-one would mistake it for hi-fi. And of course it's mono, unless you pair it with a second one. It is loud enough to be more than adequate in even quite a large room. So as a modern alternative to a boom box for playing music while you do something else, it's very effective. At the moment I have a free trial of Prime Music, but this is frustrating as about 30% of what I ask for isn't available. It would definitely be worth getting the full Amazon Music service if you intend to make more than very intermittent use of it. You can have it tell you jokes and play games; I couldn't care less.
