You can use it to streamline the shopping process on Amazon; that might be convenient but I'm wary of ceding too much control of that to a relatively autonomous device; I think I'd rather spend the extra time checking what I'm ordering and howg than just saying 'Alexa, order x, y or z', but it may well be possible to set it up so it can't cause too much trouble. So it's a nice toy, and I guess I like having it around because I intend to keep it plugged in and may even try Amazon Music. Has it enhanced my life beyond all recognition? Nope. Not even close. Does it appear to have been nicely designed and to be capable of anything between casual entertainment and some quite useful tasks? Yes, certainly. It's a fun little gadget. I guess, despite myself, I'm quite happy to recommend it, at least at the price I didn't pay for it.

Title: Worthwhile Upgrade or Addition
Body: We have a number of Echo devices, from the first-generation full-size Echo in the living room, to the Echo Tap by my desk, to Echo Dots in almost every room, from the bedrooms to the bathrooms where they're called on both to play programming ranging from news to radio stations and to control various home devices. I've even put an Echo Input in my car (which might be replaced with an Echo Auto when those appear). But I needed one for my workroom, and instead of just buying another basic Dot I ordered this 3rd Generation Dot for the kitchen and moved the 1st. Gen Dot which had been there to the workroom.The 3rd Gen. Dot has much more satisfying sound, which my wife particularly appreciates for the lectures and Audible audio books she favors, and when we're ready to do so we can order a second Dot-3, set one as the Left and the other as the Right channel, and have full stereo.Highly recommended whether you're new to the Echo or adding to your armada.

Title: Its ok and saves my remote finger for other tasks
Body: My wife got the "Dot" free with another purchase and was going to give it away as a Christmas gift so I figured I would keep it for myself thereby preventing her from getting in the habit of "re-gifting".  Our house is not "smart" so that option is out; I have friends to tell me jokes so no help there and Alexa does not know how to "Google" so I am basically left with a voice activated bluetooth radio that can give me weather updates and perhaps I can add to my grocery list if I happen to be in the bedroom when I make it.  I know I can put these things all over the house and aggravate the wife by using it as an intercom, but she may turn the tables on me, so in forethought that is not a good use or expense.  Hey,  unlike the wife and kids,it only speaks when spoken to and doesn't eat much so I  give it a 4 star rating.  But do not misinterpret:  I like technology as much as the next techno-geek if it helps me get to the fitness center regularly.  The only real negative to "miss/madam" Alexa is, like Apple products, that she is too proprietary so I cannot operate anything which is not of similar lineage.  I do love my Prime, tho.

Title: Do Not Miss This Great Kitchen product
Body: I was kind of fearful in spending $90 on anything that I was not 100% totally in to.. I read some not so good reviews and found most of them were from folks that did not read instructions.  Such an important thing to do. I also read lots of good reviews.  So I got the 3 qt pot on sale and soooo glad that I did and it is the most useful pot that I own.  I tossed out several pots and pans and an old fashioned pressure cooker...never go back to that one.  the only thing that I wish they added was the clear lid.  That should have been a no brainer..was adding a vege steamer..  oh well one more way they can get your money.  lol  but at least you are getting a good product for it.  It is irreplaceable.....

Title: Okay if you have bland musical tastes
Body: Alexa has some pretty bad taste in music.  Asked for a couple of traditional Irish Tunes (Whiskey in the Jar and The Rocky Road to Dublin) and she played the first one by Metallica, repeatedly.  The 2nd tune by Drop Kick Murphys.  Meh.Also she never heard of jazz bassist George Duvivier.  Couldn't many of the songs or artists I requested.  (While a friend's Google device found them fairly easily.)  I have the Music Unlimited subscription but she has really limited musical choices.  Many of my musical choices are a bit out of the mainstream but I was expecting more.  If I wanted mainstream boring music I would use my radio.

Title: Didn't think I'd like it but now I LOVE it.
Body: First I would like to say I didn't think I would be a person to use this type of device.  I'm 55 years old and change for older folks is slow.  This is my second Echo dot.  I got one for Christmas loved it so bought a third generation one for another room.  I'm disabled and my very favorite thing is being able to turn on and off lights etc. Using smart bulbs and plugs that connect with this device.  The thing I really didn't like was the name but fortunately you can change it to one of 4 choices.  I just changed mine to computer for my dot wake word. Reminds me of Star Trek. Lol

Title: Great deal, 1 PROBLEM
Body: I love this little Amazon Echo.  It's a big sound upgrade from the last version.The one thing I HATE about it is that it only has a female voice option.  Why is it that in the USA (it's different in the UK), anything with an electronic masculine voice is always authoritative and everything with a female voice is helpful?  It's incredibly annoying.  I wish that they just gave us the option to choose like the Google home product (which I got for another room but returned because I like the Echo better overall).

Title: Just a novelty
Body: I haven't studied what all the Echo Dot can do and how to program it.  I use it to listen to my favorite radio station, either directly or through one of 5 bluetooth speakers I have in different parts of the house.  After a couple of weeks I find that it is more work to adjust manually than what it saves with voice commands.  First, bluetooth speakers always come on at full volume (which is very loud and annoying) so I have to go to the speaker and turn down volumes manually.  Second, every time I want to switch bluetooth speakers I need to turn the app on at my phone and go in & out of 5 windows to select a different speaker.  And that's after going to the speaker I want and manually turning it on (I could have old fashioned radios placed around the house and turned them on manually in less time). Third, the Echo Dot does not have a battery so it must be placed against a wall and outlet, rather than in the middle of a room where it would be better able to hear my voice.  Fourth, it doesn't always understand what I'm saying even though I speak quite clearly.  I played a trivia game a few times and it didn't recognize the correct answers quite a few times.I understand that Echo will turn electrical devices (such as lights) on or off with a voice command, but that requires purchase of special outlets for each device and I only have one lamp that I regularly turn off & on when I leave or go to bed, and I walk right by that lamp all the time.The speaker has quite good sound quality, so I'm happy with that when I want to play anything directly from the Echo.

Title: I Love Siri But This Is So Much Better
Body: We didn_ get why people liked Alexa products so much but when this went on sale we gave it a shot and LOVE IT! It does have a hard time hearing us when the TV is on sometimes but the room is large and open to several other spaces and we are upgrading to a full sized Echo, so this will be moving to our bedroom soon which likely won_ have the same problem. Caveats: I_ love better support for kids profiles and controls/restrictions - not being able to have a full profile for kids means we can_ create separate Apple Music accounts to pair for each person so we have to carefully monitor their use and won_ be buying kids versions yet (among other things like creating routines specifically for them). Love that we can share lists between our household (adding to grocery list while I look at what we have is much smoother than Siri!), but hate that since we share an Apple Calendar for family stuff we can_ link it to both profiles or it doubles all the events on Alexa. It_ also frustrating that only one profile gets notifications on our phones or Apple Watches even though we_e both linked ourselves to the app, so we continue to use Siri for most of our timers and reminders. The voice recognition is incredibly smooth most of the time - way smoother than Siri - and much faster to process. Skills are still somewhat clunky sometimes (chore chart isn_ worth the time it takes to log things) but love that they can be customized. It would be nice to be able to pick people to share custom skills with so we don_ have to switch accounts every time we want to use them. Routines could use some more features like not counting an apostrophe or comma as a special character and accommodating longer text responses or other Alexa skills but that will likely come in time. It_ also frustrating not being able to see routines that others in the household have created to ensure that we haven_ used the same trigger words or already set something up (and I want to be able to switch in the app to my kids if we are going to invest in more dots). Overall, we are happy and ready to expand our usage. We look forward to advances in the future as well!

Title: I thought this was a Waste of money until I got a call
Body: I have decided to edit my review for a few reasons, 1 the day after I posted my review I had a very nice and helpful person that works at Amazon call me, after asking a few questions they helped me figure out alot of the things that I was told wasnt available. I couldnt believe it, it made me happy again to be able to do some of the things I purchased the dots for in the first place. But then I got upset again. What if I would have never posted a review? I would still be thinking that they didnt work. How come we dont have someone call or email or atleast text us to see if the dot or other Amazon product is living up to expectations. Shouldn't this be required. But this is a review not a blog. I would suggest that if you have or are going to purchase an Alexa device contact the alexa department with any questions because they are the only ones really trained and can give the correct answer! Like I stated earlier I am happy with my dots now, I still feel a little work has to be done but that is true to any device that is still developing! This starts my original review, You really need to look at all the things that this can do, you really don't even need to waste the money to purchase, just download Alexa on your phone. It doesnt really do much more than that. We purchased them because we seen where it can control your fire TV with the echo dot, well let's just say that isnt 100 percent accurate. Yes it can control SOME things on your fire TV, however these aren't really the main things. You CANNOT control the volume, power, you CANNOT search your prime videos, let me just give a list of what it can do that would be alot less time consuming. So the only things that you can control with the echo dot are Bravo now CBS NBC Hulu and the playstation network that is it! Now granted I'm sure I'm going to get alot of heat for dissing this device. And I am sorry, I know it has taken people alot of time and energy to get where it is today, I just feel that selling it at the price it is, it should really be able to do atleast what the remote Alexa can do. And yes it is my fault for just assuming that one Amazon device can control just like another device I should have read deeper into it. My fault, one that i wont be making again!  Please take my advice and look into what it can do before you buy. Go the cheaper way and just download Alexa on your phone or tablet! The only good thing is I can command whatever music that I would like to listen to because we pay for a subscription to Amazon music. Is anyone else seeing a theme here, it will control paid apps easily, just not the free ones! Just sad that we have to be taken for our money like that, it's not good enough that we pay top dollar for devices but we pay for subscriptions to 3 or 4 different apps.

Title: Just What We Needed
Body: We got an Amazon Echo to help my dad remember to give my mom her medications on time each day (she takes medications 4 different times each day). Dad (88) was struggling to always remember to do that and Mom (89) forgets. They are still living on their own, so the Amazon Echo is another tool that will hopefully help them remain independent a while longer. I've also set up other reminders, including doctor appointments. They aren't using the Echo for anything else, but this use in and of itself makes it invaluable. My husband and I got an Echo at the same time, even though we weren't sure we really needed/wanted one, but have been surprised at how useful it is for a variety of things. We especially like asking Alexa to play whatever style of music we're in the mood for and the music immediately begins to play. It is also synched with my iTunes account and I enjoy streaming my music through the Echo. I have a morning routine set up that helps my day get off to a good start. I know we're just scratching the surface of what it can do, but we're off to a good start!

Title: Smarter than the older dots!
Body: Very good its way more updated than my older Echo 2nd gen tower. My son noticed this NEW dot  plays music that the other Echo doesn't play. Newer dot versions Know about current events and celeberties. (Tower 2nd gen. doesn't)We bought 5 Echos dots updated 1 with $5 off trade in special. They are way smarter than older versions. . But this Echo dot is great! Smart and speaker is good. Worth it to get this one verses older models. I'm happy we bought them. I can drop in on each kid and they can call me when im gone. Set alarms reminders. Tells jokes reminds my kids to do their homework. I'm happy. We got them all over the house.

Title: Recommend highly
Body: In our house, we are Apple product people. When it comes to any tech item there are pros and cons and Apple has a few that can be frustrating and Siri is just that! I believe Siri is there to annoy it_ user at times. I guarantee at least 2 times out of 5, Siri can_ assist me when I ask for aid! Then for Christmas my girls received an Echo dot and they loved it and then I got myself one and Alexa rocks! She doesn_ cause the issues Siri has and that is what I love! Definitely a pro in my book! I definitely recommend this item.

Title: Great product but Amazon needs to improve it!
Body: Great product. The sound is improved. It understands better. and it's a fun toy.HOWEVER, after several years on the market you would think the programmable part would have improved. Most everything I want it to do is a pain in the #$%!.  I am sure Amazon gets tons of requests for improvements but they are not listening or have a microscopic programming group or maybe just myopic... Spend some of the millions you are earning to add some features! Google is going to pass you by if you don't!

Title: Awesome very helpful give it a day or so to get used to I got a little
Body: In love like really, only things I_ change is I_ love a guys voice like, hrmmm Brad Pitt or someone or even Better one of the first James Bond_ :-) also when I ask Alexa to read one of her stories they are about 2 minutes long and good so wish they would be longer.I have audiable so yes I can get some from there. Her jokes and games are awesome too. Again as a single mom who hears enough girl voices I would love a mans voide like brad Pitt pretty please can you fix that _

Title: I have no idea, I plugged it in for a minute
Body: The whole idea creeps me out, I wish I could return this christmas present and get the cash so I could get something useful.  You do realize that it is listening to you, remembering what you are saying.  Your private world is no longer private. I would rethink this whole thing if you are considering getting one... just don't.

Title: Almost perfect
Body: The sound quality and volume are SIGNIFICANTLY different from the 2nd gen. However, once you begin to really pump this up (turn the volume up) the bass comes through so much that the voice of the artist turns down way too much.**ALSO, MY BIGGEST ISSUE SO FAR HAS BEEN THE MICROPHONE ARRAY ON THIS THIRD GEN. I FIND MYSELF CONSTANTLY HAVING TO REPEAT MYSELF TO GET ITS ATTENTION ESPECIALLY IF I HAVE THE TV ON OR MUSIC PLAYING. THE SECOND GEN COULD HEAR ME FINE WHEN THOSE THINGS WERE PLAYING HOWEVER WITH ONLY FOUR MICS, THE THIRD GEN DOESN'T SEEM TO BE HANDLING THIS SO WELL. I HAVE THIS IN MY ROOM WHICH IS A VERY SMALL ROOM SO I THINK THIS IS PRETTY UNEXCUSABLE.**Withthat in mind this is a good pick up if you're coming from the second generation echo.. I hope that Amazon can fix the microphone issues I've been having

Title: New to this...Now with an update.
Body: I just received my two  Echo Dots today, and have them up and running. I already had the Alexa app set up on my phone, and linked to the few smart devices I own, so the Echo set up was pretty easy. They seem to  have a good range for listening, being able to  hear my commands from across the room, and you can give each a different wake-up name so they don't get confused if within range of each other. The sound is perfectly adequate for talk radio, weather, news, etc., but not so good for music -- the speakers are fine for casual listening but I would not use them to replace my sound system. All in all, easy to set up, easy to use, fun to play with, and I'm just getting started!A few months later: I just set up a  Stereo Pair with my two Echo units, and I have to comment on how much improved the sound is! I get a true stereo effect, and they seem to sound better paired than they did as stand-alone speakers. Good move!

Title: Love it. Much better than previous version
Body: This 3rd gen is far superior in sound quality and accuracy of detecting words that the gen 2 device it replaced. The 2nd gen device is banished to the kitchen now!Works flawlessly with all home automation and audio-visual devices in my bedroom and office. The Bluetooth sync to my TV's sound bar is perfect and flawless.Only complaint is that the choice of songs/music that my amazon prime gives me is pretty lame. But that's not this device's fault!!

Title: Bullet proof little hockey puck of joy
Body: My Alexa went swimming in the toilet, into a bag of rice on the sunniest window sill to dry and back in business.  good as new after a submersion.And it isn't hard to change the preferences to shut down the buying stuff verbally function, so it will work with roommates or kids who can't be trusted not to buy too much. love it!1 suggestion for improvement:  a battery so i could take it out in the yard or carry it room to room without losing sound.

Title: I like it!
Body: I bought the echo dot because I wanted to learn how to create Alexa Skills. And I really didn't have much interest in actually using it (at first) but I after messing around with it I changed my mind lol.For its size the audio quality is decent. It's certain not high fidelity but is definitely good enough for listening to music while I'm working. I'm also impressed with how well the microphones work. I tried it where the dot was in a room on the second floor and I was heard correctly while I was on the first floor. It's a distance of about 25 to 30 feet and it's not in a direct line.And then there's the fun stuff... One day while my dog was hanging out with me I said "Alexa bark like a dog." Well, she did! And my dog was intently listening and turning his head from side to side.... Even after a bunch of dog barks (they're somewhat random) he still pays attention to it. And there's a whole bunch of silly things you can say to Alexa. It's fun trying different things just to hear what she says.The way Alexa deciphers the words you say is impressive. I discovered that speaking to Alexa in full sentences isn't always necessary. For example, I can say "Alexa, what's my flash briefing?" or "Alexa, do the flash briefing thingy" or just "Alexa flash brief".  And even "Alexa, flash your briefs" works LOL!

Title: My First Smart Speaker
Body: I don't have anything to compare this to, but I am satisfied with my purchase.  The sound quality and volume is acceptable.  The set-up was easy.  Alexa plays good music for me.  Tells me interesting things in the morning.  Welcomes me home.  And knows the answer to most . . . many . . . er, well . . . some questions.Like many people, I was torn between the Google Home Mini and the Echo Dot.  I chose the dot, frankly for no particular reason.  Maybe because it's supposed to be better at operating stuff around the house (which I don't have yet anyway).  But I have stumped Alexa many times on things where I have immediately followed-up with "Ok, Google" only to have Google know the answer.  For example, "Alexa, who plays Billy on Six Feet Under?"  Alexa was stumped.  Google knew immediately.  Oh, well.  I am sure that as I purchase more and more smart home products, Alexa will come through for me.

Title: Does not work in Trinidad
Body: I purchased 6 of these units for my family. Amazon shipped each separately, costing me $864.00TTD in shipping expenses, that could have been avoided by simply sending them together. Furthermore, the EchoDot does not connect to YouTube, forcing you to purchase Amazon music. It is unable to play our local radio stations as well!!!! I wish I could return ALL of it because I just wasted my money.

Title: Doesn't like auto channel on 5ghz
Body: I've lost connection twice and I've only had it connected for 2 weeks since time of writing this. After week 1 it lost connection on it's own. Had a bear of a time getting it to see and reconnect to 5ghz. Don't recall the steps i took to get it to reconnect but I know it wasn't fun. Today it lost connection due to a router reboot I needed to perform. It would not see 5ghz only my 2.4. My google home mini lost connection too but after unplug/replug it was fine.  The mini is on the 5ghz too. No go with the dot. Tried everything and it would just not see the 5ghz. Did a quick google and someone said to put my 5 ghz on any channel except auto. That did the trick. 2.4 was on auto and the dot had no problem seeing it. Hopefully a firmware update will fix? Maybe it doesn't like my quantum gateway? Who knows. Other than that i like the device. Got it bluetoothed to my home theater system which i like. Don't think the mini can do that but maybe I'm wrong. I'm a prime member and amazon is my music ecosystem. Just trying to let people know about the 5ghz thing. Maybe I got a bad unit but the problem was easy to find on the web.

Title: Better speaker sound but worse microphone
Body: I have the V2 and V3 (this one).  I set this one to "Echo" as the wake word instead of Alexa because the microphones on the V2s pick up my voice from clear across the house!These microphones don't pick up very well at all. You need to be right next to it.  However, they sound really good for music for such a small footprint.I have 3 of these for playing music in various areas of my house.  Placed strategically for Multi-room music (which is easy to set up and sounds great).

Title: I'm still asking myself why I bought this........
Body: I never wanted this thing.  I bought it and in as much as I don't regret buying it, I have questioned myself why I bought it (other than that my nephew and niece have a couple of them)  There is a song trivia function that I think is cool, but the 'daily briefing' sometimes isn't current (not sure if that is an "Alexa" issue )  I do like the timer function. I find that to be useful when i'm cooking or doing multiple things at once. At times,  I have to repeat my question several times before it answers.  It's like she's asleep or something, LOL....

Title: Works as adverstised
Body: Got this one with the purchase of a Ring Doorbell.  It works well and not much to say that hasn't been said many times before.  The only personal observation I would add is that I have 2 Google Home Minis and I've noticed that they are better at random search questions than the Alexa.  I suspect that's simply because of the Google connection but it's not a show stopper.  I was thinking that I had to make a decision on an ecosystem but maybe not.  They seem to co-exist just fine.

Title: Fantastic technology - but one HUGE flaw that makes it worthless
Body: I loved this fantastic piece of home automation/personal assistant technology...for about two days. That_ when we experienced one of our, all too frequent (two - three time daily)Momentary WiFi signal service drops - from our only one choice, D- rated local internet service provider (which caused ALL our Echo devices to drop offline - and these devices do NOTHING without a WIFI signal. Zip! Moments or hours later when the same WiFi signal was restored, NOTHING we tried could get the Echos to simply reacquire that same unchanged WiFi signal. After a 40minute tech support call to Amazon none of our Echo devices was able to reconnect... and Alexa can_ do _- without a WiFi signal. Seriously, an Apollo moon launch seemed easier than getting any one of our Echo devices back to tea quite a simple WiFi signal. After 15 minutes w tech support, we had DELETED every Echo device in our house (and deleted all our playlists, preferences and EVERYTHIG else we spent HOURS setting up. Really! I asked after the tech call went past 20 minutes with no results... Reacquiring a dropped out WiFi SHOULD be one simple voice command or button push (if the WiFi signal /credentials hasn_ changed since it was last connected). After working 45 min w tech support we still had no luck on reconnecting ANY Echo device to our lame WiFi (which can drop in and out several times a day) at which point I asked the Amazon agent  - do we have to go through this entire procedure EVERY TIME our lame WiFi signal drops out for even a second, to which she replied YES - at which point I told the agent to initiate a return for all of our Echo devices and related home automation devices. They were completely worthless to me with this one GLARING flaw. (And I had all the latest 2nd and 3rd gen High end Echo devices. No one thought to fix the huge flaw in three generations of the product line)? Well maybe I_ the only one who has WiFi that comes and goes.I love amazon and regularly place orders over $1000 a month just because it_ SO easy to do and always flawlessly fufilled...except the one MAJOR, MAJOR flaw in the whole, otherwise FANTASTIC Echo series of devices. The entire dropped WiFi signal SHOULD be fixed (provided the WiFi credentials haven_ changed) with a simple ALEXA, Reconnect to WiFi voice command or a one button push...and be back online and in business right away without the need of a 45 minute PLUS tech support call.Echo and Alexa are my favorite home Automation /personal assistant/ direct audio command to buy anything and everything from my beloved Amazon account, but this one flaw RUINED EVERYTHING. Other than that flaw I was fully investing into the whole Amazon Echo lifestyle, but unfortunately if your WiFi drops in and out your hosed and the entire investment in time and resources was for NOTHING!

Title: Awkward, frustrating, time waster
Body: Total garbage. Not the device itself so much as the crappy software. You have to speak in very specific _omputer phrases to get it to work. If this is the future of AI, I_ not that worried. You cannot speak naturally to it at all. Want to arm your security..._lexa, set (name of system) to system mode (whatever). If you just try to say _et the alarm to away....nope. Doesn_ understand. So frustrating. Steve Jobs once said something to the effect that voice recognition is worthless if it has just a one percent failure rate. That is so true. In the time it takes me to figure out how to awkwardly tell Alexa to do something, I could have done it manually five times.Also, I have huge privacy concerns with this thing as do many people. There is a mute button but it just lights up, how do I know it really isn_ still listening to me.Also, the Alexa app is terrible. Probably reminiscent of the Amazon phone. Remember that? No? That is because it sucked and was only sold for a short time.Sorry folks, the future is not quite here yet where you can talk to you computer and get relevant responses like in Star Trek.

Title: What a great smart home device to have.
Body: This is my third Echo dot so far and I love this thing. Its entertaining, it plays music, controls my Firesticks, lights and plays music. There are many other things that make this great, but it would take time to write it all down.I'd say when it comes to smart home devices, this is by far my favorite. They look great on the nightstand or living room side table.My only criticism on the the Echo is the reminder function. Now this may be my lack of knowledge of the Alexa platform, but to that it is a little annoying when you set a reminder message and it continues to repeat that message until you tell it to stop.Other than that one small issue, it is a great device for the household.

Title: speaker quality and style much improved
Body: I received this Echo Dot in one of those "Santa" games at Christmas. Already had an older one downstairs, but this one has an appealing "upholstered look" and a much better speaker. Only problem (not amazon's) was when I went to set it up. Yahoo had so many ad sites above the official site that I accidentally went to a fake site, and it took me a couple minutes to realize I was giving info to the wrong people! Please be careful when you do your setup that you are on the official amazon site for Echo Dot. Otherwise, great product, and I love being able to get news, classical music and quick answers right at my writing desk.

Title: Absolutely useless piece of garbage
Body: This thing is an absolutely useless piece of garbage. It hardly does anything useful and it is the most frustrating device I have ever had to set up. You would think for a multi-hundred billion dollar company they could design even a remotely user friendly app and interface. It is a pain enough to get this over priced paper weight to connect to the WiFi, god forbid you get a new router and have to try to reconnect this hockey puck to the new router. It just keeps telling you to do things in circles and never actually allows you to connect. After I am done writing this review, I am literally going into the garage and smashing this useless piece of $%#& with a hammer and going to Best Buy to purchase a google home device. Avoid like the plague....

Title: DONT LIKE THAT ECO CAN LISTEN TO PRIVATE CONVERSATIONS
Body: WHY DO YOU NEED TO LISTEN IN ON PRIVATE CONVERSATIONS WILL PROBABLY THROW IN TRASH WILL RETHINK ABOUT  BUYING FROM AMAZON AFTER THIS . NOT HAPPY !!!!!!!!!!!! ,first one I owned thought it should work better, some things work great others not so much Do like the eco over all  , Bumped up the star rating because an Amazon rep. called and is trying to help me with problems 2 thumbs up to amazon for the call !!!! Rep helped and got most bugs worked out, BUT STILL NOT VERY HAPPY WITH YOUR PRIVACY VIOLATION!!!!

Title: Echo Dot (3rd gen) Smart speaker with Alexa
Body: I got my first Echo Dot smart speaker for Christmas 2019 and generally I am pretty happy with it. It has good sound and was easy to set up. I mainly use the Echo Dot for music playback, news and free trivia. I had a free trial of Amazon Music Unlimited and was happy with that. Afterwards, I set up a free Spotify Account and I found out the Echo Dot only syncs with a premium Spotify account, I was disappointed with that. I do have some iTunes songs to import and will try my free Pandora and iHeart Radio accounts.The biggest disappointment was the iOS Alexa app for the Echo Dot. I put it on my iPad and I find that the app is slow, buggy, and freezes. It needs some refining and updating. I didn't want to add my contacts for privacy reasons and it keeps prompting me to do that as well as turn on the bluetooth on my iPad.The adjustments on the app for sound quality do not work and it misidentifies my other Amazon devices. There have been no app updates and that is disappointing because it does need a lot of work.If you are buying the Echo Dot for just music and news and other minor things, I would tell you to wait until the software app for the Dot is updated/reworked. The dot itself works good but sometimes spits out strange phrases like "Its too cold to go outside" and "I wouldn't do that".

Title: Ordered 4, 3 worked, one didn't....
Body: So I ordered 4 of the dots, I have the large echo in kitchen. I decided to place one echo in each kids room so I they can listen to music and I love the drop in feature so I can rally my troops for meals without screaming 10x upstairs. So out of 4, one echo dot was not working. The customer service team was excellent in troubleshooting and realizing it was not user error. Here is where it gets weird. The replacement echo dot arrived a few days later. I didn't have time to pull it out of the box and set it up until yesterday. Guess what? Same thing! It wouldn't turn on. The unit was receiving power, the mute button would illuminate when I pressed it, but other than that, I couldn't get it to light up or connect to the internet because it wouldn't turn on at all. AGAIN customer service was AWESOME. I am now waiting for a replacement for my room. BUT I think it sounds like you have a 50% chance of getting a good echo or a bad one. Hope they last!

Title: Perfect Echo companion
Body: We have several Echo Dots all over our home (one in each bedroom, as well as our study, and garage.  Our big Echo is in the living room and the only one we use to play music.I like the convenience of having a Dot in other rooms because we use it to control our Phillips Hue light system and can turn on lights from any room in the house. It also makes it easy to add something to my shopping list if I think of something in a room separate from where I would keep my list.I have the solid black, solid white, and this charcoal grey. I like that you can get different colors to match the decor in each room. As for the sound it really isn't bad, but just not as robust as the larger Echo device.

Title: Don't bother trying to find Voicecast!
Body: I bought the Dot to hook up to my Fire tablet listen to music in two rooms in my house, knowing that Voicecast would allow me to do this. After days of struggle, this is what I found out after an hour online with the tech:"Thanks for being so patient with us, let us check from our end, if that is it.I am really sorry, after consulting leadership and higher authorities we got to know that the Voicecast settings have been deprecated on January 20 2019.Also, I am sorry to let you know that we do not have information on when the feature will be back.I apologize for the inconvenience caused to you."Amazon has specifically made this impossible!

Title: The product is good by itself but needs improvement!
Body: I admit I was disappointed with this Echo before then after posting my experience, amazon reached out by phone and email to try to understand the reason behind the review. After the call, I discovered so many features and capabilities.Such as: ability to create groups for difference "smart" items you want controlled together, the ability to connect via bluetooth to an existing speaker, connect to echo itself by bluetooth, link to fire stick,...After this experience, I highly recommend amazon to streamline the setup process towards minimizing frustration to the user further down the roads. Also, improve microphone and initially set only one source of flash news until the user changes it (e.g., NPR or BBC?)Overall, i recomment this product, looks cool and my friends always get impressed when i say:" Alexa, turn off the lights!".

Title: Poor performance
Body: I have three dots and an Echo. I can stand next to this dot and the older model (2nd gen) that's in the other room will hear, understand and answer but this one won't. It lights up like it hears me but it doesn't seem to be able to recognize what I'm seeing, especially in noisy situations. And it cuts in and out mid-routine. Pretty much the only time I can count on this one working properly is middle of the night when there's no other noise. Of all the Alexa items I have, the original 2nd gen dot works the best: better than the Echo and better than the 3rd gen dot. It's like they're getting prettier but less dependable...

Title: Love Alexa!!!
Body: We received our Echo Dot in a Pirate Santa Gift Exchange over the holidays. It was something we would have never bought for ourselves.  But...after hooking it up and using it, we would highly recommend one!!!  We can play our music from Sirius on it or simply ask Alexa to play music from the 70s and poof!  There it is!  weather reports, news reports and just about any question she can answer!  Our grand daughter loves asking her when Mind Craft was developed because it's the same date as her birthday!  It's also fun to ask her to tell us jokes.  Easy to install and use. We recommend everybody have Alexa join their home!!

Title: A great addition
Body: We already had 2nd Gen Dots. We wanted to expand our coverage and bought these 2 3rd Gen Dots. The older ones were good; these are much better. The audio when we play music through them is really very good - noticeably better than on the 2nd Gen. The microphones seem to be a bit more sensitive, too. Our new Dots can hear and respond to us from all the way across the largest rooms in our house with no errors (well, only a few - but many fewer than the 2nd Gen). Overall, we are quite pleased with these and highly recommend them. Keep on improving, Amazon!

Title: How Will Alexa Fit Into Your Life
Body: I'm glad I bought these. They were easy to set up. I am better organized, entertained, and fascinated by the technology. It can be pricey when you consider your subscription services that can be connected to Alexa. I decided what I would use and the best rate for the service. For example, I stream my music through Amazon Unlimited instead of another popular service for savings. The dots do not take up much space and you can purchase dot hangers that connect to the wall.

Title: Got this as a gift and wasn't sure how much I would use it
Body: I enjoy listening to music from the 40's, 50's, and 60s, plus classical music and the Echo Dot provides me hours of music.  It's so nice not to have to search for a CD and put it in my CD player to listen to music I love.  Plus Amazon has extensive resources for various types of music.  I haven't used it to set a timer yet, but I plan on doing so.  I had it read a story to me and tell me what the weather is like where I am.  Turns out, it was a very thoughtful gift.

Title: Cool gizmo
Body: We have been using this for about 2 months and find it useful. I play music from it while cooking, use it for a cooking timer, ask the weather and other simple questions, love the smart outlet/ light compatibility feature and the drop in feature. I probably don_ use it to the extent you can but overall it has been proven to be useful. Only complaint is sometimes Alexia doesn_ respond and the complexity of naming/ assigning devices to the smart function.

Title: White Elephant
Body: My whole house is filled with Echo devices, although I don't personally have any of the 3rd generation yet. I'm sure I'll upgrade eventually. I wanted to give this a shout out though, as the most popular White Elephant/Yankee Swap gift in both my work and family swaps this year. This was passed around more than the scratch tickets or the snack basket! Everyone likes technology, and this is an approachable introduction to a smart home

Title: impossible to understand intercom messages and other problems
Body: The echo dot 2nd generation worked perfectly as an intercom using the _rop in command . The 3rd generation echo dot has the audio going in and out mid sentence making it impossible to understand the echo as an intercom.  As time went on the 3rd generation speaker did not get any clearer.  Swapping out one 3rd generation for another did not solve the problems with clarity.  The 3rd generation has problems when two people are talking more than the 2nd generation.  Also music playing on either side of the connection will cause problems with message clarity on the 3rd generation echo dot.  The 3rd generation device rather than learning your voice and distinguishing when you talk and subtracting out background noise has the background noise interfere with message clarity.  The 2nd generation echo dot does not have as much background noise, music or both people talking at the same time causing the speaker to garble the message as the 3rd generation.  The 3rd generation relies on training the user to turn down the music, background noise and to wait patiently while the person on the other end talks.  As customers, We expect more from our "artificial intelligent" devices.Service was responsive and polite and made overtures to correct any problems.  However, promised call backs were not made even though they were scheduled.  The service representative did NOT give us a call back number or email to respond or add additional concerns.  When additional concerns were raised on the phone, the service representative listened patiently, but did not give us any solutions or answers.  Hindsight suggests that perhaps the service representative was more concerned with the low rating of the device than correcting the problem?Other problems, the turn in policy on the 1st and 2nd generation echo when upgrading to the 3rd generation must be made at the time of purchase and does not reduced bargain pricing such as the buy one get on free deal that was advertised.  We are still not clear how the turn in your old to get a discount on the new works, even after talking to the service representative.The 3rd generation echo dot appears to be just as dumb as the other echo devices.  This means that the ability to answer questions with answers other than "sorry, i dont understand" or "sorry I cannot help you with that" has not improved.  We have both the echo dots which we use primarily as an intercom device, and the ok google device.  The ok google device does not appear to work as an intercom or an announcement device, but it answers many more questions with actual practical answers from wikipedia and the irs.gov websites.  So other than the intercom and broadcast announcement function, the ok google is the more useful device.Another problem we have encountered is that the echo dot devices often disconnect from the WiFi and require reconnection much more often than the ok google device.  Unfortunately, these "artificial intelligence" digital assistants are not smart enough to reconnect to the WiFi without human help and the use of a phone, tablet or computer based application or program.  The process of reconnection is anything but intuitive and is an avoidable nuisance.  We as customers expect that our digital assistants should be smart enough to reconnect to the WiFi without human intervention.  Artificial Intelligent devices are not very intelligent if they cannot reconnect to the WiFi without human intervention.As a customer, we hope that the software upgrades will address these problems.  As a loyal Amazon customer and supporter of the echo devices and technology, we expect more from our "artificial intelligent" devices.  At the very least the devices should become smarter, more useful, and less of a pain in the ass as time goes on.  So far our experience has been the opposite, the devices seem a bit dumber, less useful and more of a pain in the ass.We purchased a TP-link home mesh system with three channels (the expensive one) because our echo dot version 3 network kept disconnecting.  The description of the mesh network device said it was compatible with the Alexa.  The devices keep disconnecting and now the drop in function between the home office echo dot 3 and the bedroom echo dot 3 no longer functions even though the echo dot 3 (ED3) in the bedroom can drop in on the ED3 in the home office.  Considering the only reason we purchased this system for over $1000 for all equipment was to get a functioning intercom.

Title: Sounds better than gen 2 and fits our decor better
Body: It's an Alexa Dot that does just what the last Dot did, so there's not a lot to say other than the sound has a bit more bass and is "fuller" and nicer sounding than the o4 gen 2 Dots we have around our home.  The more tactile feel of the fabric covering, and the shape of the new gen 3 feels more refined and less "techy" than the last Gen 2 device, though I was able to 3D print wall hangers for a couple of our Gen 2s that allow us to get them off the furniture.  That won't be as practical with the new shape, but then again the new shape looks nicer on our furniture.  At the end of the day,  we are in deep on home automation.  In fact I know carry a Google Home mini with me on monthly business trips to Ireland and the UK - I need an AI to talk to!

Title: Definite improvement over previous version
Body: The new version is a big step up in audio quality from the previous version. Plus, the fabric does make it look nicer. I don't know how much of this is just due to my setup, but I have this echo on a table near me in my living room (< 3ft to my 4 o'clock position -back right- from where I sit) but the Echo Input that's maybe 30 ft away (in my 8 o'clock position -- almost fully 'left') in my kitchen will hear me and respond. I wish timers weren't device-specific! Because when one of them heard me set the timer but another one hears me cancel it when it's going off, it's a little frustrating.

Title: "GURL....! Alexa sounds GOOD!"
Body: Sorry... I was attempting to be funny however that is what both myself and my niece said as we turned her on and played our first song. This little speaker has AMAZING sound quality - a definite upgrade from the first generation Alexa which my sister owns. We picked this up for my niece for her room and set up was a breeze, all the regular bells and whistles are there but the sound quality was not expected for such a little device. I was thinking something similar to the JBL Clip's quality but this NEW Alexa sounds real good. For that you have a great purchase. I have been thinking about picking one up for my room if I can figure out how to sync it to my iPad via bluetooth - if Alexa can do that than count me in as a second buyer!

Title: Wonderful for sight impaired or handicapped people.
Body: I wanted and received an Echo Dot for Christmas, as my vision is very poor and I could no longer set my alarm clock.  Someone in computer class had mentioned they use it for an alarm and talking without their phone.  It is easily set up with an app on your cellphone and can dial anyone listed on your cellphone, just by telling it to call so-and-so.  It is not as knowledgeable as Google or Suri, but gives temperature, time and answers many questions.  There is corresponding equipment you can buy to make it do other things, like change your thermostat and turn lights on or off, etc.  I request  various types of musican artists, and command the volume up, down or off.  This is a God send for sight impaired or handicapped people.  I had to buy a second one, so I could have one on each floor of my house.  I was impressed with the sound quality, for such a small item.  I am not knowledgeable about the larger Alexa's, etc., but assume they would do even more.  I got this on sale for $30.00.  More than worth the money!  I only gave it 4 stars out of 5, because it doesn't know the answer to quite a few questions I ask it.

Title: Works well
Body: This device works well, but I think it's very gimmicky.  It was fun to play twenty questions when you first open it, but now it has lost the fun.  To use the search function is fine, but sometimes alexa misunderstands me no matter how clearly I speak.  I don't have the smart lightbulbs/outlets so those features aren't able to be used.  I hooked the device up to my TV, and she has some difficulty doing what I would like for her to do.  Some features I can't access at all, such as fastforwarding my DVR.  This is a cool toy but I don't see me using it frequently.

Title: Fav thing is lists that are saved!
Body: Love it. After awhile alexa learns the things you ask for and how you ask. Its pretty cool. I mean everyone in the reviews already said what's needed to be said. I do like though that sometimes I will remember to write something down I need from the store so I just tell alexa. Once I'm at the store I just bring my app and the list is there..its been a huge game changer for a working mother like myself.

Title: Perfect for voice controlling your TV or firestick.
Body: Everyone who has one of these has their reason. Here is mine. I am not interested in a smart home. Not interested in turning on lights with my voice. What I wanted it for was my Fire Stick. Together with my Fire Stick, I can basically control my TV. If I say "Alexa fire TV home" it turns my TV on. If I say "Alexa launch Netflix" or "Alexa launch Hulu", the apps will launch. There is a wide range of things the Dot can do with the apps on my Fire Stick. Many apps. I can ask it to play a particular show. if the show is on Netflix it will play on Netflix, if the show is on Hulu it will play on Hulu. It pretty much knows what to do. I can ask it to pause. And then ask it to play. I can ask it to backup or skip minutes. Which is really great when I step out of the living room for the kitchen & realize I should have paused. The Dot can hear me from the other room. I can ask it to skip episodes or go back episodes. When the credits are playing at the end of the episode, I can tell it to skip to go right to the next. I have spent hours without touching my remote. It could also work my Vizio smart TV, but I decided against it, because the 4K Fire Sticks apps movies & shows look phenomenally better than the smart apps. I have also used it to set alarms. "Alexa set an alarm for 45 minutes" while I am cooking or something. It's great. You have access to all the prime music & the Dot Speaker itself is pretty good. I have Amazon unlimited, so I have access to pretty much any music you can imagine. Just ask & she shall play. Good for play music in the background while you're cleaning or something. Every morning I asked what the weather report is & I get a much more detailed report than Google ever did on my phone. If it's going to snow that day I can ask how much snow and she'll tell me. I've actually spent time sitting & asking Alexa questions. She is so knowledgeable, that you could almost have a conversation with her. Lol. If someone's over just for fun I'll ask her to tell a joke & she's set to a Jimmy Fallon joke. So Jimmy Fallon will tell one. It's cool. This thing works a million times better than I thought it would oh, and I thought it would work pretty damn good.

Title: Follow Up Mode Does NOT Work When Connected To Bluetooth Speakers
Body: Overall, this is a bigger and bulkier Echo Dot, but with that, comes louder and better sound, so I am happy with that fact.  That being said, it does not appear that this latest version of Echo Dot offers anything over and above a larger footprint and better sound.I am disappointed that the unit does not allow Follow Up Mode when connected to external speakers, via Bluetooth.  This functionality is one that I've come to enjoy, and it's annoying to lose it when connected to speakers.Overall, I like the product but wish Amazon would get the bugs out of them.  I've had issues with other DOTS as well, such as stereo right/left performance issues, inability to re-connect to bluetooth speakers, horrible performance when "grouping" a few dots together for music, ...to name a few.While music and speaker performance seems to be a problem for me, overall, I do really like the functionalities that they offer above just music!  I use "Reminders" a lot and this functionality makes me very happy.  "Drop-In" mode is another feature that comes in handy, as I have a family member that cannot easily make contact, so this makes that process very easy.  And as well, she can simply tell the Dot to call me, with her voice.  This is a great tool for a disabled person, or other similarly limited person, health-wise.

Title: Alexa is unresponsive and kind of useless
Body: TL;DR; I acknowledge that a lot of my complaints may stem from my own inability to use this device properly. In the same breath, I have not been able to find easy answers to my questions and there does not appear to be a real person to talk to about this thing and the Alexa service. In the end it may be I am simply not willing to put in the effort to configure it properly, however I feel for a device that is supposed to be easy to setup and use, it really falls short of that mark.We bought this primarily for our kids to use. We have a friend who loves theirs and says that they have all kinds of 'Skills' games that they installed and that their kids love to play. It also plays music and audio books and all kinds of stuff! sounded great and at under $50 it seemed like a great deal.We got ours and plugged it in. Package quality was great and it is a nicely built device. We plugged it in and downloaded the Alexa App; and this is where the frustration began.My Wife and I both own a Galaxy s5 and we installed the app on her phone. Adding the Freetime mode and the kids profiles was fairly straight forward and then we attempted to add Skills. The App freezes and becomes 100% unresponsive. You can't even browse the skills. We tried turning the phone off and on again. Uninstalling and re-installing the app. We tried emptying the app cache. We followed a few articles but in the end simply could not get it to work.The kids by this point are starting to play with it and they are asking it questions and that seems to be interesting enough and then they ask it to play music. Well Alexa is only tied to Amazon Music. You need an Alexa app or Skill to use anything else...well that is not helping us. We don't have an Amazon music subscription and we don't have any interest in getting one because we have Pandora and we also have Youtube Premium. So bummer.Finally after searching through the help documents I find out there is also a Browser interface for Alexa. So I pull that up and we Add the NPR One Skill, the Pandora Skill, the Audible Skill and A Game Skill or two. Looks like it is getting better. Then we tried to use them.We tried every 'Phrase' to get any of the skills to work and Alexa just replies "Sorry, I can't do that." to anything other than, "Alexa, Play {song name here}". None of the installed skills will work.So we try turning off 'Free Time' and adjusting the parental controls and just about everything else we can think to do. We go searching for help and can't find a way to get a number for a live person to ask questions too and the documentation is specific but kid of useless because it is not about troubleshooting, it is all about how to do X.I really kind of feel like I purchased a voice enabled bluetooth speaker and that is it. The only thing that is keeping me from asking for my money back is because the Kids do like to listen to music on it and they can control it without my help, so there is that. But from everything it seems to promise, I think it fails in just about every way.

Title: Vast improvement over gen 1 and gen 2...
Body: The Echo Dot Gen 3 is a vast improvement over the older models.  The audio quality is so far above that of the older generations that a comparison can't really be made.  I was amazed by the sound quality that comes out of this little device.  Microphone reception is outstanding, with music playing at 50% volume the Echo Dot Gen 3 had no issues hearing and responding correctly to my voice from across the room.  I didn't feel the need to test the microphone with the volume any higher than 50% as that was plenty loud enough for my liking.  Build quality is great and looks nice.  The device was simply to register and is simple to pair with other devices via Bluetooth or on the same WiFi network.  So far I am really enjoying the Echo Dot Gen 3.

Title: New Echo Dot Has Multi-room Music solution
Body: I bought two 3rd generation echo dots, one for each of two bedrooms, to go with my existing echo which is already linked via Bluetooth to a Bose Wave system. I paired two Bluetooth speakers to the echo dot in one room, and am using the echo dot as the only speaker in the other. I_e been able to add a Bluetooth transmitter via the aux jack on one of the echos and from their paired two speakers in stereo mode. This was/is a bit buggy but generally easy to get working properly. I was also able to create an _verywhere group to command multi room streaming from any room using either echo dot or the echo. It works fairly well, with minor syncing issues between the room. Also, multi room eliminates the blue tooth connection between the echo and the Bose Wave system, and the sound in that room comes directly from the echo. I think the multi room and stereo pairing are great features and will improve over time. I would hope eventually the echo dots could directly pair with a set of stereo speakers without the use of the transmitter All in all, a great procur for the price.

Title: It's cool except it won't do the thing I wanted it for.
Body: I wanted to use it to play music, and was a little disappointed to find out that I cant play my own playlists through the Alexia app for the I-phone. If there is a way to do it it's too confusing for me to figure out. I can understand a little because Amazon wants you to subscribe to a monthly fee so that they will make more money. I can play some free services like I heart radio which does have playlists, but they don't always play the music I like. Actually it would be much easier for me to play  my I phone through  some blue-tooth speakers and be done with it.

Title: Beats the Heck Out of My Shower Radio
Body: I like to listen to sports radio and / or music when I am showering in the morning and the reception in my bathroom was horrible yielding only two or three stations full of static.  I put the Echo Dot in the bathroom and now stream my favorite sports radio station in crisp, crystal clear sound. Also great for listening to music and or asking Alexa to add toothpaste, shaving cream, shampoo etc. to my shopping list when I am running low on supplies. The speaker has great sound quality, the Dot looks nice and it takes up very little room on our bathroom vanity.  A great purchase!

Title: The best gift I never knew I wanted!
Body: I received this as a Chrisymas present and so glad I did! I never thought I would want one, seemed kind of hokey tbh. But I love playing music on it, getting the weather, etc. I can yell out items from the kitchen to add to my  grocery shopping list and my 10 year old son can add things to his wish list so I know what he needs/wants when I'm out. I even picked up some smart plugs and can have Alexa turn the light on or off when my hands are full. It's a huge help when I am coming home from work after dark and I'm juggling my work bag, my laptop, my son's backpack, and the mail. And the to do lists and reminders help me make sure I never miss an important deadline again. Alexa is my new best friend, I'm not sure how I ever managed without her!

Title: Great at capturing voice
Body: This speaker is great at hearing me even when the music is playing. I grabbed this speaker after utilizing alexa on a Sonos One speaker....so unfortunately, I was a bit sad to learn of the audio difference. But that was expected.  My issue is with the 'skills' of Alexa. The skills on the marketplace are very specific or dont seem to have a feature that is very helpful. Perhaps if they were organized in a better way, so that I could find something most useful to me? I haven't found one that I need/use that alexa doesnt do. My other concern. Is her knowledge on some basic questions. I also have google assistant in my house, i use google assistant for knowledge based questions or something I would search online. For example I ask Google what else an actor played in, or the definition of a word and get a great informative answer, and Alexa's answer to 'what is a other word for communication' was communicate... I use Alexa more for communicating with smart things in my house or connecting via bluetooth to my phone, or using the drop in feature with family.

Title: Speakers are SOOOO much better!
Body: We already had a 2nd gen Dot, and were using PC speakers because music played so poorly on it.  The improvement in the still-small 3rd gen Echo Dot speakers is HUGE, and for our use (primarily music) it is sufficient without supplemental speakers.The reason for only 4 stars:  we also have a Google Home mini, and it still is superior to Alexa for random searches for information.  We use this feature less often than music, however, so this is not a show-stopper for us.

Title: Echo Dot 3 is Amazing!
Body: I recently purchased Echo Dot 3 with Alexa, primarily for starting a Smart Home system. I am disabled/handicapped and am confined to my bed most of the time. Since the disease I suffer from is progressive I felt that is time to prepare for worse days ahead. When it arrived, I was amazed at the things it can do. So far I have set up playlists on Amazon Music while I am waiting for my order of Alexa controlled outlets to arrive. As time and money allow, I will be adding more components to the Smart Home system. In the meantime, I have calm, soothing music playing all night long, helping to distract my mind from the physical pain that I suffer from 24 hours a day. That, in itself, is worth having Amazon Dot 3 and Alexa.

Title: Great device for Nursing Home Residents!!!
Body: This small device has brought my dad so much happiness - he lives in a nursing home and wasn_ able to have your typical phone and would lose his cell phone.  He loves music and reading books and so after using a dot at home I bought one for him.He is so much more upbeat now because he is able to call us when he wants and if he needs something.  He listens to music all the time and he can even enjoy a book if he wants since his eyesight is no longer that great.  I can_ say enough great things about this device and technology.  We just wrote up a list of most frequently used commands so my dad would always be able to have them available if he didn_ remember because of his dementia.The echo dot is the absolute best!! I would highly reccomend to anyone for home use .... and most of all... for a nursing home setting.

Title: Occasionally Disturbing Moments
Body: Digital Assistants are getting better and better but still have distinct limits. The Echo Dot 3rd generation is no exception. There is information you might think would be easily accessible but is still met with "Sorry, I don't know that yet ." Part of it is a learning curve for the user in how to frame a question for the best chance of success so don't give up on one try. I won't bore you with all of  the features because they are quite easy to find on the item page, help, and in the Alexa app, but one recently really helped me out. Being a Baby Boomer, I have the occasional senior moment and managed to leave my purse with my cell phone and Fire tablet in a cab. I stopped hacking landline or VOIP a couple years back. The spare key got me inside, but how to call lost and found?Enter the little Echo Dot. I used the calling feature to reach customer service, but had the flash that I I should call my mobile to alert the driver. He turned out to be a jewel and was walking up to my door as my phone rang. It would have been fine but knowing I can make calls without my phone de-stressed me right away.It does a fine job for the price. I got it on sale before Christmas but like other Amazon devices, you can also divide the cost into several interest free payments. I recommend this digital assistant. It worked well even before I used the voice traing.And as for disturbing? One perk of digital assistants is playing with their Easter eggs and asking loopy questions. I did this with first Siri and later other devices. One wild question early on with the Apple program was asking where to hide a body. They.later made less helpful and supposedly less creepy. Naturally I had to give it a try with Alexa. She responded by offering a recipe for slow cooker carnitas.

Title: Great quality and great sound for this third generation Echo.
Body: The main reason I like this third generation Echo dot is that it has a more deep sound than the second generation version.A bonus is that you compare these as a stereo pair. In the Amazon Alexa app you can find an option for adding a stereo pair. Just follow the directions but keep in mind that if you have put them on a guest Network you cannot pair them because guest Networks do not allow each device to see each other. This was a bit of a dilemma for me because I prefer my Echoes to be on a guest Network to protect my main network from hackers but the more I thought about it and realized that I have antivirus software and firewalls and a lengthy wireless router access code I went ahead and took the plunge. I wasn't disappointed. When you play music on Amazon music it will stream stereo with left and right channels and it sounds terrific. Keep in mind that you cannot stream stereo from a Bluetooth device yet because they don't have that capability.

Title: fun
Body: This is a fun little gagit.  My shark vac won't connect to it anymore and my lights go on and off that is connected by the base plugs but the bulbs that I have placed in the lights outside are great and stay on unless I ask alexa to turn them off.  When I forget to turn the garage lights on, I open the alexa app on my cell phone and tell alexa to turn on bulb one.  (YES never in the dark again trying to open the door)  I really like the sound when I ask her to play music.  When I have a question, you guested it, I just ask alexa.  I like that she finds my cell phone.  She turns on my tv and plays a movie if I know the name of it.  I like that I can tell her the name of the person I want to call and she calls them.  This would actually be great for old people that can't move around.  She would keep them company.  She will read stories to you.  So much fun.

Title: Must Have Device! Will Change Your Quality of Life!
Body: Changed my day to day life at home. I was one of the people who though Alexa was stupid or just pointless in general. My friend convinced me to give it a try with my Fire TV and to buy some smart lights to go with it. Man am I glad I listened. Managing lights in my house has never been easier once the echo dot pairs with them, and when I lose the remote to my tv which happens oh so often because my dogs love to use them as chew toys, I can just ask Alexa to load up my show on Hulu no problem whatsoever! Alexa can raise and lower the volume on my tv, raise or dim lights in my house and so much more. I should have gotten one so much sooner. If you are someone like me who thought the echo dot/Alexa is stupid, please just give it a try with some smart devices to go alongside it and I promise you won_ regret it. I can_ imagine ever not having an echo dot in my household now. If using voice isn_ your thing you can also use the Amazon Alexa app to control everything right from your smartphone! So convenient! A must have device! Gen 3 is absolutely stunning to look at as well _!

Title: Good way to help children with routine
Body: Setting up reminders for chores for the kids sure makes it easier around the house and getting stuff done.  From wake up to brushing teeth reminders make life easier for our home.  Alexa makes a great tool for school work too.  Math problems just ask Alexa for help.  We have Alexa set up so that every day Alexa tells us what the top story in History is.I like that the kids can tell Alexa call mom and she does.  Alexa will also make announcements so if I'm out for a stroll but stopped to talk with a neighbor I can announce to the kids that I have been delayed but not to worry.  I can also "drop in" and listen to things going on in other parts of the house.

Title: Love Alexa
Body: Update - Dec 2019We just purchased two dots to use in our winter residence.  The sound is great for such a small unit.  We use Dot as an alarm clock, dictionary, weatherman, stop watch, radio (music), general informatio, etc.  Cannot live without Alexa.  All together we own two Echo and four Dot - they are positioned all around our home.We bought the Dot (3rd gen) for our bedroom and hoped to group it to Echo. But unfortunately, we have learned the two do not group.  We are disappointed with this however we are using Dot as a standalone Alexa.  It is small, has nice sound and is very helpful.  I need glasses to see the alarm clock - with Dot I just ask Alexa for the time!

Title: Love it
Body: Very nice toy. Great for playing music.i bought 2 a echo and a dot. The echo sounds better but the dot sounds good for the dive it is. Would liked it to been a tough louder but it_ good sound for the size and cost.  Just getting started with make my home a smart home but so far I like it a lot.  My son loves to ask Alexia questions. I would recommend it. Very easy to set up and tied my Apple Music to it. Really like being able to make calls with it. So if my son (7) needs to call me or want to call his Grandmaw he just says the name like it is in my phone and it calls. Very cool. Also can call between echo units is nice for when the kids are upstairs. No more yelling.

Title: Looks nice, might not hear me as well as our older version?
Body: I like the look of this newer generation. I am just not sure this one "hears" our commands as well as the old one. It went in the same place as our old one, but this one seems to have just a tiny bit tougher time hearing us on first try and we kind of have to raise our voice. I think the actual speaker quality might be nicer than the older one...well, maybe not even nicer, but it definitely has a different sound. I had them both plugged in in the same place and there's a different sound to the newer version (3rd gen) than the older one (I think we also have a 2nd gen). I don't know if there's anything significantly different and if you have an older version, it should be just fine, so I wouldn't say an upgrade is needed unless you like the way this one looks better than the older one.

Title: SOOOO COOOL!!
Body: Ok...I am a 65  old woman.  Not terribly techy.  Got my 3rd gen Dot today, had it set up in 5 mins.  Now have the newest in my bedroom..the sound is much better...the older dot in bathroom for morning news and music while showering...figured out how to connect 2 downstairs to a group.  I LOVE this system!  ...and, really..the 3rd gen is really nice, much better sound...and if you've got the extra cash..do it.  Just another small lovely convenience...(and I could have gotten it for $7 a month if I had wanted)  WOOOOHOOOOoh...I also have my living room light connected...and can turn it on with my Kindle  (ha! yeah, Im addicted) from work when I leave at 10p

Title: Better!
Body: Update June 15 2016:Still working great. Bought a second one. Sound is significantly better than the previous generation.Original ReviewJust like my other dots, but better! The sound quality is much better. Louder, too. Looks nice. Otherwise it is the same great Alexa experience. Set up was simple, and we have had no issues with it. We bought several gen2 models for $17. We got the 3gen for $29. Its worth the difference! But between a $17 gen2 and a $50 gen3, I'd go with the gen2. Functionally it is identical.

Title: As of FEB 3 2019 the voice commands for navigating FireTV are not ready for prime time
Body: I think the device deserves 3 or 4 stars when considered overall, but in terms of its use as a voice-control for FireTV, it is really almost useless. Echo DOT voice commands with FireTV and related apps are really hit and miss. Sometimes they work, but most of the time they don't.  It seems that the voice command intelligence may be privileging Amazon over other paid apps, listening for the title and ignoring the rest of the command if it is a title that Amazon offers.Alexa,  go to Hulu.  SORRY.Alexa, go to Hulu on FireTV.  OK.  Takes you to Hulu on FireTV. Good.Alexa, watch True Detective.  "Getting True Detective from FireTV"  (Echo exits Hulu and brings you to FireTV page for that TV show ($$$). BAD.Alexa, stream True Detective on Hulu.  "Getting True Detective from FireTV" (you're not taken to Hulu but to FireTV's own page for that title ($$$).Alexa, go to Hulu on FireTV.  OKAlexa, watch Saturday Night Live.  SNL starts playing on Hulu. GOOD.Alexa, exit Saturday Night Live.  "Getting Saturday Night Live from FireTV".  Leaves Hulu, starts playing SNL on FireTV.  BAD.UPDATE as of 2/15/2019Alexa, stream Aeon Flux on FireTV.Alexa:  "Getting AeonFlux from Hulu."But what actually begins to play is a movie called "Shattered" with Pierce Brosnan.

Title: terrible attention from Mexico if you bought at amazon.com USA
Body: Today I am very happy to buy the echo dot at amazon.com, very excited as I arrive I have called amazon USA because I bought it on amazon.com, I asked with my little English that if I could contact someone who speaks in Spanish, very kindly transferred me to amazon mexico and the person who attended me totally refused to help me, I begged him to help me, wanted to know what he was doing, what could be done with ECHO, nothing technical, nothing configuration, just wanted to know functionalities , but the amazon area echo in mexico refused to give me any information, that if he did not speak in English then he would use the chat.I'm going sad with amazon echo support, I do not recommend any Spanish-speaking person to buy the product in the USA because they will close the doors to the telephone support in Spanish when they transfer you to mexico, unless you love the long talks via written chat that is where they recommend giving support if you do not speak English.I will wait for my device echo, very sure the device will work wonderfully, but I give it a star for the bad attitude of the support area of __exico who refused to answer basic questions about the product, I just wanted to know only what I could do with Alexa.the product and the support go united if one of the two fails is as if everything failed.IMPORTANT NOTE: I was then taken care of by a young man in Spanish in amazon USA in the sales area, he was very careful to help me, to try locate someone who speaks Spanish in the area of __cho USA, very sure if they exist but at the moment of my call or they were not or were attending to other users, the good attitude of the amazon youth USA has calmed my spirits, I will remain faithful to amazon USA.

Title: Awesome Product gets even AWESOMER <---- New word but it fits!
Body: Just received my another 3rd Gen Echo Dot today (I have 2 now) along with my 2nd Gen Echo Dots we now have 8. Honestly our house is too small for that many but I really enjoy having the music everywhere fill the house. I'm very pleased with the richness of the sound with the 3rd Gen Echo Dots. I have one Dot linked to my Yamaha stereo with 4 Bose speakers but now that I have the 3rd Gen Echo Dot I use the stereo a lot less often.The heather gray 3rd Gen was purchased for a client of mine who has memory issues from a car accident. Until I met him I thought my echo's were useful to help me remember typical stuff. Upon gaining an understanding of his situation I realized how important this could be for him. We've setup daily reminders, one of which is to remind him to set other reminders and it has helped him to remember crucial things, like to eat (he sometimes forgets for hours that his food is in the microwave). While I realize that there could be issues relying on a device it is very helpful for him.I think the biggest problem with the whole "Alexa" enabled category of products is that a lot of people don't realize all it can do and the great potential for special or particular needs. I hear a lot of people say "oh, isn't that the thing that plays music?". It's a Great Product in a line of Great Products (I have various other Alexa enabled products).So, i highly recommend you give it a try!

Title: What a complete waste of my time
Body: I received this product free as Amazon had some promotional thing going when I ordered my Blink camera.  I have tried in vain to set this thing up numerous times.  I should point out that I'm fairly tech savvy and can program all my other tech type stuff without any issues.  But this thing can't seem to locate my televisions no matter what I do.  I only have so much in patience and I reached it today.  I really don't like the fact that you have to provide so much personal information in setting it up.  I thought I'd give it a try to use it to run the televisions in the house.  But after so many tries I'm fed up.  I am already greatly uncomfortable with the reach that Google has into our lives.  I have embraced technology pretty well but I refuse to rely on the intrusion of this device to do things for me that I am completely capable of doing.  I wanted to return it but it appears that I'm stuck with it and thank goodness I didn't shell out any money on this paper weight.

Title: Potentially good. Needs heavy involvement to be useful.
Body: The setup was simple though we had a couple hiccups connecting to our WiFi at first. Whether we blame Amazon or our provider, I don't know. The premise to call upon Alexa to answer our questions and perform tasks for us is very neat but "she" basically answers from Wikipedia. A good portion of the time, she simply "has no opinion" or "cannot find info related to that".To get the best out of Alexa, it appears you would need to purchase subscriptions that she can contact for you, like music or other entertainment. With time, money, and knowledge, one can probably make Alexa into a virtual assistant to be fawned over. For us regular folk, I feel it is too extravagant a venture.

Title: Speakers are awsome
Body: I not only like the speakers, I love them. they are so easy to use. I love how you tell Alexa what to play and she does. I am a Country Music listener great songs she play for me through the speakers. I also love to listen to Ocean sounds and Nature sounds she play those for me too. You can get her to play almost any type of music you may love to listen to..Still waiting to use the other features she does, like turn your lights on and off. etc  lol lolMy friend call me lazy now, because Alexa play what I ask her to play for me. lol lol

Title: Pleasantly surprised by how useful it has been.
Body: I bought this as an addon gift for my wife / family for Christmas. I thought it was cheap enough to throw into the pile and see what it was capable of doing for the family. My wife has set it up with her audible account, our spotify account, etc. etc. My 7 and 3 year old yell out commands to Alexa to play Kids bop Kids to start their mornings dancing. My 1 year old imitates them, its an oddity that I never thought of being in the household.
