There are so many small things that Alexa does that helps the family out that for the price.. it is an excellent addition to the household. I didn't give 5 stars as there are the ever present hangups with incorrect answers, Alexa responding to us when nobody asked it anything. etc.

Title: Amazon and Alexa Are A Wonderful Pair
Body: Got Dot as a present...waited about a month to download app on phone to use...Once set-up, I was amazed by how wonderful it was..."Alexa, play..." and she finds the song!  (You do need to purchase a subscription of Amazon Music for about $4/mo, but well worth price!)  Have it in kitchen on top of fridge so whenever I am in there for a short time, I always have a smile while listening to an old song favorite being played!  Great product...everyone should get one!!

Title: Welcome to the future
Body: It's very tempting to give this thing five stars, but there is room for improvement. That said, it is an amazing bit of technology, well worth more than the price. Amazon must have been swamped with orders for these things at Christmas as I see it looks like a little back-ordering is going on. And I understand! If I'd known how cool this was back when they had the 2nd Gen for $20 I'd have bought one for everyone on my shopping list.Set up is easy, but you do need a phone or other device to set it up. After that, it's voice-activated astonishment. Ask for information about movies, the weather, history, solve math problems - it's all there for free. To fully enjoy the music you need Amazon Prime or Amazon Music, Pandora or similar. Over the holidays Echo kept us a steady supply of Christmas music - "Play Christmas piano music" - "Play Andy Williams Christmas music" - you get the idea.I keep my 2nd Generation Echo Dot in the kitchen, which is great for setting multiple times, looking up recipes, cooking times, adding items to a shopping list (and you can create multiple lists). The lists are kept updated on your phone, so if my wife needs to add something when I'm on my way to the store, it shows up right there on my list.Voice recognition is really good, though sometimes it can't provide information on what I'm looking for, something I'm sure will improve in time. Hopefully you'll be able to give it a personal name, right now you're limited to Alexa, Amazon, Echo, and Computer. That's right, "computer." I changed it to that for a day and enjoyed being Captain of a starship. Well, maybe an Ensign.My wife and I enjoyed the games feature; turns out the guy who never listens to the radio scored higher than the girl that can sing along with anything. Cool. Then there's stories, where Alexa tells you like a story of the day or something.Alexa has a little bit of a personality, too, which you'll find as you experiment.Directing Alexa to play specific songs or read books from my purchased library is a little tricky, this is where the phone app helps out. By the way, the app can control multiple devices.I haven't tried the extra features like appliances and cameras, but they seem affordable and very useful. Nor have I added any extra speakers, this 3rd Gen has really great sound, almost like stereo, and you can call up a simple equalizer on your app to change the sound. Volume control is easy, either by voice or by the up/down button on top.If you have wifi there is no good reason not to have at least one Echo in your home. It's fun, it's educational, and right now I'd be lost without one. The beauty of it is it available to anyone with a voice; hands-free, no real learning curve. Great for older people, invalids or those with disabilities.Can't wait to see what future versions will be like.

Title: Keep 2nd generation dot. 3rd generation is garbage
Body: This new echo is terrible. I had unplug it and just not use it. It always misunderstands commands. It normally randomly starts listening when no one even said the wake word. 2nd generation is better.Update: after seeing this review amazon reached out to me so they could try to remedy the issues. After troubleshooting, the sent me a replacement refurbished echo dot. This one is still having similar issues as the last one. It's great that amazon is focusing on customer support but it's unfortunate that their product still isn't working right.

Title: Great for anywhere in the house!
Body: I've had an Echo since the first generation and it's been very useful for a number of things including home automation of various things around my house. I have a number of lights in the house that are automated, a Harmony Hub that controls both our entertainment systems (living room and media room) and various Sonos speakers throughout the house to name a few.  I purchased three of these Dots to use around the house and they work really well with the home automation. I can walk pretty much anywhere in the house and issue commands to the Echo or a Dot and have one of them pick up the command and execute it. While my arms are full with groceries, "Alexa, turn on the kitchen cabinet lights." While I'm in the shower, "Alexa, play classic rock music on the bathroom Sonos". Or while I'm cooking in the kitchen, "Alexa, turn on the TV." It's kinda cool to talk to my house like the computer from Star Trek (and yes, I've changed the keyword on all of them to "Computer!").

Title: Won't pair with Alex Voice Remote
Body: The first major problem with this device is that it won't pair with the Alexa Voice Remote.  Following Amazon's directions gets you nowherehttps://www.amazon.com/gp/help/customer/display.html?nodeId=201601810Tried this a few times as well as a bunch of other procedures.  Really lame.  Thus you can't control your TV with this POS as advertised.Alexa is spectacularly primitive compared to Siri and other competitors.  Here are some examples:"Alexa: Turn on TV"  response:  "Sorry, provider is having trouble.""Alexa:  display my watchlist"  response:  "Hmm. I'm not sure.""Alexa: watchlist"  response:  nothing"Alexa: go to watchlist"  response:  "I'm not quite sure how to help you with that""Alexa: show stardust movie"  response:  plays stardust song by Nat King ColeWhat an utterly lame product and an embarrassment for Amazon.

Title: Alexa! Where have you been all this time?
Body: Alexa has helped me with many questions especially with how to spell certain words. I've heard of weird things other people have experienced with this item and last night during the Super Bowl I had a funny thing happen to me during the Beta Testing. As the commercial played my Alexa answered the questions/commands that were playing on the t.v.. It was amusing at first but quickly became annoying so I muted it.I use this mostly to play music as I fall asleep. Brahms is my choice. This composer wrote very soothing music, better than any raining, loon bird noise relaxing sounds that are being sold currently.The alarm strings work fine but I wish Alexa could provide a different tone. All in all it was a good purchase.

Title: Bluetooth setup, can use 5g, sound is a bit muffled
Body: This is MUCH larger than the 1st and 2nd gen. Sound is a little more muted than the previous iterations. So it was a 4 star for me. However, two MAJOR differences make this a 5 star.1. You can use Bluetooth to set up. Using Wifi to previously setup was sometimes a real PITA. Much, MUCH easier now.2. Works with 5GHz as well as 2.2GHz. Nowadays, there's so many things that use the 2.4 band (including your microwave!) that the bandwidth gets used up and everything slows down. A definite improvement.The sound quality at normal volumes is less sharp than the previous gen dots. Slightly more bass- but nothing like the Echo's bass, and fewer highs. Sounds like it's under a pillow most of the time.

Title: Great for kid's rooms
Body: Bought two of these in a recent 50% off sale to put in our kids' rooms.  Not sure they are worth the full price.  It's been a game changer in our family home, though.  Now we can "drop in" on a boy's room, or make an general announcement across all rooms.  This is effectively like having a home intercom.  We no longer have to choose between screaming at the top of our lungs or hiking all the way across the house to get our teenager's attention.  Also, our little one loves asking Alexa to play music, and now he can do that in his room too.

Title: Hard to set up initially but very easy to use
Body: I did not like the instructions that came with the device. I definitely needed to contact support and work with them. If I had had the correct password for my WiFi, it would still have taken an hour or more. (One can get their working WiFi password on Windows 10 by click through a series of dialogs, but it is quite obscure and convoluted. Not Amazon's fault.One I had it set up, this device is delightful. So far I have been able to control it with brief, natural-language commands. Perhaps I should say 'her' rather than "it."

Title: don't do it
Body: Spend more to get the echo, or just get the competitor, it's significantly more advanced. There are so many problems With this device, the frustration isn't worth $30. voice problems, connectivity problems, volume is easier to turn down manually that repeatedly asking, it has linked to my cart to buy things because it is so easily confused. It is convinced that I wanna hear barry manilow whenever I turn on the shower and ask for tunes. Got unlimited music for your echo 10 feet away? Get used to it trying to sell you what you already have. It won't link to my echo, but it will try to connect to the dot in the bathroom 2 floors up. Horrifying.

Title: They SUCK when paired with another Alexa device.
Body: They don_ pair well. They randomly shut off playing music if trying to play on the group. I have had it for 2 months and there has been a red ring light with Alexa saying she is having troubles several times which is concerning. I emailed Amazon a Customer Service twice through the Alexa app and got no response. I am a true Amazon fan through and through but the Alexa pairing I have SUCKS

Title: Doesn't support local music/audiobooks and can't communicate with Fire TV.
Body: These are two really huge DUH! missing features. I've had a NAS (network attached storage) with all of my music, movies, tv, audiobooks, etc, stored on it for decades now. It's all distributed by DLNA - an industry standard supported off the shelf by everybody. I should be able to ask Alexa to play my own music from my own house - without paying more fees to stream a subscription service that STILL won't have my music on it. I want Alexa to play audiobooks I already own without paying for another subscription to an audiobook rental service.I also want Alexa to control my Fire TV. The Fire TV has an Alexa remote! I can see the TV in my kitchen, where this Alexa device is, and I want Alexa to play a TV show or movie on it. Two Amazon products, can't even communicate with each other.Those two are the biggest complaints about stuff that's missing that I expected to work.What's also frustrating is what barely works. If your music choices are very pedestrian, it's nice to say "play some 80s music" and let it go in the background. It's better than FM radio. Really though this shows how poor this option is - the selection is really shallow and repeats songs. There were 230 songs from that decade just counting the ones to hit #1 on Billboard. That's an entire day of listening to music just playing number one hits. Expand that to the top 40 or top 100, you could play 80s music for a month without hearing repeats. We should be able to give complicated commands to our voice servants like "play every top 100 hit from the 1980s in order". It's all databases, these are easy queries! psshIf you want to hear something very specific, good luck. Try to play classical music or opera by a specific performance, nope, too much detail confuses Alexa. If a performer has multiple versions of a song (on a live album and a studio album, for example) Alexa plays the first one she finds. Songs that have been covered by multiple performers, expect to never hear the one you want. Don't expect to hear any song that has non-English lyrics, if you can get Alexa to play artists from outside the USA/UK/Can/Aus English-speaking world at all.There's also the issue of being so rude to mispronounce my name and not being able to correct it.

Title: Good Product with Some Flaws, But Maybe a Bright Future!
Body: Not a bad speaker for its size. I use it primarily for input and use Bluetooth 2.1 speakers for output. Adding skills is fun and increases the device's smarts. Amazon doesn't support the same wake words across Fire HD and Echo Dots. It's probably because they have different development teams that don't often speak or share a vision across platforms. We use "Echo" for a wakeword and that is not supported on the Fire HD 10 to get to "Alexa". If you use it for home control, you will get tired of Alexa's "OK" response. Amazon could mix it up a bit with OK, Done, As you wish, (your name here, voice recognized). There is surprisingly very little use of learned household names (associated to learned voices) on the account which makes "Alexa" seem a lot less personable. Even in a household environment with learned voices, Amazon is quick to remind you who controls the household account (Prime account holder name). This is unfortunate as households often share accounts. So, Alexa tells you that the Prime owner in the household was the one to last listen to a station on TuneIn even when it was another household member that requested it and last listened to it. Aside from those quirks, which should get programmed out, the Echo Dot 3rd Gen is great to listen to music and radio as you move from room to room around the house, or just need the temperature and forecast when getting ready to go out. Some day, "Alexa" may even use Google instead of Bing and really improve/expand the AI on Internet searches and choosing "readable appropriate answers"!

Title: My parents love it
Body: This was purchased as a gift for my parents for Christmas. One night I wokeup and heard my Mom having a full on conversation with Alexa.  This is wonderful because she is blind and has never used the Internet, but adores Alexa___.  My dad talks to her every morning to get weather and news updates, etc.  Next step is to get them ordering a good portion of their groceries online so they can be delivered to them. They also love listening to old 50s music online.  My last day of the visit they danced to one of their favorites.  Thank you Amazon__.

Title: Not worth the extra cost vs the older echo dots
Body: This 3G echo dot is a little bit louder than the past generation, but overall there are no other significant improvements. Yes, it is shaped a little bit differently, slightly larger,  and covered with fabric, but, in my opinion it is not worth the extra cost since very few people spend much time looking at their Echo Dot versus talking and listening to it. I do wish they would move more quickly improve the brain of Alexa to make it more accurate and so it will stop trying to sell me products from Amazon all the time. Overall, I do have several echo dots in my house that I use as an intercom, for instant answers to questions, and for playing music and radio on demand. Also, they need it to respond to _ey Alexa so there will be many fewer instances when it self-activates when nobody is talking to it.

Title: Practically free, endlessly useful
Body: We currently have 4 alexa speakers in the house (Living room, kitchen, loft, bedroom). I will be adding one to our bathroom soon. I basically use these for 2 purposes. The main purpose is to control our wemo outlets (echo lights on). Recently we have started using the music group functions and it has been amazing. If I am do chores or getting ready to go somewhere I can say "Echo play 80s music everywhere" and the same song will start playing throughout the whole house. We have the gen1 dot in our master bedroom and the sound quality of these newer speakers blows that one out of the water. I will be replacing that older dot with one of these newer models. These are pretty amazing considering the negligible cost.

Title: Works pretty well, once setup that is...
Body: I ordered two of these, because I read about the drop in feature and figured having two of them would be useful, and could use it from different ends of the house.  First off, the setup could use some work, it was kind of confusing and very convoluted.  It took at least 3 separate tries to setup the first Echo Dot, it would get partially through a software update and then fail with an error.  I had no clue if I was doing something wrong, and was about to the point of just returning them out of frustration.  Finally on the third try the software update finally went through and voila, it said setup was complete.  I thought a miracle had happened.  I tested a few things, and Alexa responded as expected.  When I went to setup the 2nd Echo Dot, expecting the same amount of struggle, and it literally was done in a few seconds.  I had no issues whatsoever.  I don't know if the first unit was able to share information with it, or what the issue was but it was done and working in no time, and it was farther away from my WiFi routher than the first one is.  Weird.Then I hit another frustration point, when I tried to setup Alexa to launch Netflix and Hulu on my Firestick 4K.  When I tried to activate the Netflix and Hulu video skills in Alexa, for the life of me I couldn't figure it out, and had no idea what I was doing wrong.  I think Alexa was confused because there were multiple Fire TV devices on my account, and she didn't know which one to launch the program on.  Finally out of frustration I unlinked/de-registered the other devices since I was not going to be using them anyway, and voila, it started working.  It was all very confusing and frustrating, but in the end I finally got it working.  It seems to be a useful product, and have already configured smart plugs to turn on lights.  I really like being able to get information instantly, like when does a store close in my area, etc.  I hope to learn more useful things it can be used for.  However, it still feels sorta stupid to be talking to a machine, but maybe I'll get past that.  All in all it seems like a decent product for the money invested, so we'll see.

Title: Simple but one of the most impressive tech I own
Body: I love this thing. In fact I love it so much I purchased 4 of them all at one. It_ a cool experience talking to Alexa and getting things like the weather, news briefs, shopping lists, and so much more. I have linked it to my nest thermostats and I can tell it to change the temperature and works flawlessly. It also works with my ring cameras. My only regret is not getting one sooner. BUT, I got them at their new lower price of 29.99 and they had a sale for Black Friday where if you purchased 2 they would come to $25 each. So I guess it was worth the wait.  My next purchase will be the echo show so we can have it in the kitchen.

Title: There are endless things Alexa can do!
Body: Echo Dot has become an integral part of my life. every time i think of something i need from the grocery i tell Alexa to add to my shopping list. when ever i think of something i need to do, i tell Alexa to remind me at some point prior. i than get a vocal reminder if i am home or get a notification reminder on my phone. i use Geo-fence with Alexa to control my heat/air conditioning and all my lights in my place are voice controlled through Alexa.AND MUCH MORE. those are just some examples. definitely required to have to help make your life easier and is very inexpensive.

Title: Not smart speakers at all
Body: It cannot link up with your iTunes. It_ a waste of money if you plan to use for music purposes. The speakers won_ even play what I am playing on my phone. It cannot be hooked up as Bluetooth speakers. If the music features are making you consider Alexa products you should not buy. Very faulty. Very limited and customer service has no answers besides we are working on it. I_ very upset about this feature and _kill. Regular Bluetooth speakers would be a much better investment if you are looking to dabble in your music. I purchased this thinking I would be able to wake up to or work out to my playlists. But I can_ do any of that. Big let down and I highly recommend not purchasing for music lovers

Title: We have disagreements
Body: Enormously useful when it's not a jerk. A long way from human understanding, kind of like trying to get an eight year old playing with Legos to pick up his room. The functions of being able to manage home heating and make shopping lists as things occur however (the lists appear on your mobile device, so you always have them at the store).I am working on communication, and I suppose so is Amazon. In the meantime it's not perfect but highly useful.

Title: Alexa Hard at work example Video
Body: Alexa is fun! Having a semi smart home is fairly easy to set up once you get used to the device setup. She does misunderstand daily ( That_ why not 5 stars) but best on the market ( I have 1 google mini which is pretty much useless) but our 5 Echo Dots are awesome

Title: Magic in a little Dot! Great for the family!
Body: I love this Echo Dot! My husband, myself and my son find it very useful it. Let me start off by saying that this is good for a small room, kitchen or small living room. When asked a question Alexa pretty much understands unless there is something playing in the background or when she_ playing a song you might have to speak up a little louder for her to understand, As for sound quality I would say that it has no bass, but it is pretty decent in sound, Not that I would use for playing music all the time unless I was using it in the kitchen. The Dot is awesome! It_ good for weather updates, to set alarms, reminders and for shopping lists.  I try to leave this device in the kitchen to let her know what I need, I could even send my grocery list to my husband manually through a text from Alexa Or ask for recipes. My four year old son has a speech problem so this Dot has been very useful it makes him have to say the words correctly or she will not understand him, my son has a hard time pronouncing  words, he wants to get it correct so he tries very hard  to pronounce the words better without throwing a fit, so that_ another plus, my son_  words have improved to the point where she_ able to understand him now, my son likes to speak to Alexa so that she will play music for him or speak pikachu he loves pikachu and all Pokémon characters. You could  say we like it so much that I purchased the echo plus 2gen so we could leave echo plus in the living room and I could actually keep the ech dot to myself cause my husband and my son keep taking it from me!

Title: A very significant upgrade in sound vs the Echo dot 2.
Body: The echo dot V3 has a fuller (less tinny) sound than the Echo Dot 2.  It also takes a larger power supply.  I have purchased a second after using the first and would purchase AGAIN and recommend others to purchase.  Still amazes me how many additional features are being added to Amazons Alexa software.  I dont expect obsolescence any time soon.

Title: Love Echo Dot (3rd Gen)
Body: I love the Echo Dot (3rd Gen).  I have an Echo Show, three Echo Dot (2nd Gen), and I recently bought two Echo Dot (3rd Gen).Echo Dot (3rd Gen)'s sound quality is amazing.  It is much louder and clearer than the Echo Dot (2nd Gen).  I still love the 2nd gen; I just put them in rooms where the sound quality was not as big of an issue.Amazon Echo has changed my life for the better.  It has so many great features.  I especially love the timer function for the kitchen.  I can't tell you how many times I would be cooking and accidentally delete a timer because  I put on a second timer for a different food item,  That is not an issue with Echo.  You can have multiple timers and name. Plus, it's hands-free.I also love being able to add items to a list from any room.  The list sinks to my phone, and I'm always ready to go.  No more forgotten paper list left at home.The music feature is wonderful.  It quickly finds things on the television.I use Echo with the Life 360 app.  My son has a 30-minute train ride to his high school in downtown Chicago.  The life 360 app beeps when he arrives/leaves school,  hockey practice, and arrives home.  It is an extra layer of safety.  It's also cute because when the app beeps my dog waits for my son by the door when he comes home.  She realized its only the afternoon beep.Echo works great with my smart home devices.  It is easy to pair with various devices.I have had parties where I demonstrate all the things Echo can do.  I have had multiple friends go home and buy themselves an Amazon Echo. They all asked me if I could help set it up, but it's so easy no one has needed my help.I love Amazon Echo!  It's changed my life for the better.

Title: Alexa, who farted? Whoever smelt it dealt it, and I_ not talking about the card game.
Body: I was impressed with the sound quality. Still learning what Alexa can and can_ do. She keeps my dogs entertained with some barking apps. Set up was easy.

Title: She_ a hit in our house
Body: We_e enjoying the Echo Dot third generation smart speaker with Alexa.  We are using her for music and  we_e enabled the question of the day skill and the  silly things skill for our grandchildren.  We like the question of the day but the silly things skill does not work that well.  When we ask Alexa to tell us something silly to do she usually reads a silly rhyme.  We have linked our Deebot ecovac,  our nest thermostat,  a smart plug and to smart lightbulbs to Alexa.  Alexa is understanding and carring out the commands we grave her for these things.  We am disappointed with the smart lightbulbs because they_e only 60 W. We prefer a brighter light bulb. I have looked for smart  LED lightbulbs that are equivalent to 100 W but have not found any yet.  I would say that Alexia has been a hit in our house.

Title: Echo Dot 3rd gen or Google Home Mini? I went with Google Home Mini after playing around for a week.
Body: I know this is a sensitive topic and I bet some will disagree with me and some will agree. Anyways, don't get me wrong, I think they are both great personal assistant products and have areas where one performs better than the other and it was a very tough decision. It is hard to give either Google Home Mini or Echo Dot a five star as I think many would agree that they need much more improvements.  If you already have a smart home setup and deep into the Amazon ecosystem and happy with it, then Echo Dot is most likely your pick. However, if you are new to Smart Home world like myself and is not tied into either ecosystem yet, then I would probably go with Google Home Mini.One of the main features I love about Echo Dot that Google does not have is the 2 way Intercom feature, Google home had similar feature but it is not as convenient as Echo Dot where you can "drop in" to a specific speaker and start a 2 way conversation. Google broadcast to all speakers and to reply, you have to actually say reply. Echo Dot also seem to pick up the wake up word a tiny bit better than Google, just need to speak a bit louder. Both not too big of deal for me personally for not having, and I bet Google will have an answer to that in near future.Many reviews compares how much Echo Dot 3 sound is better than Google Home Mini and how you can pair it up as stereo speakers... in my opinion, better sound may be true but only for listening to music because the bass is heavier, however, when it comes to conversation/requests, it feels a bit muffled because of this (some other reviews mentioned something similar) and Google felt more crisp in that sense.  In addition, since I'm not a music enthusiast, I find Google Home Mini is sufficient for me; Echo Dot only sounds a bit better to my amateur ears and not enough to count against the mini; if I'm a music enthusiast, then I probably won't be counting neither to be my music speaker anyways :)... on that same note, I won't be using Dot as my stereo speakers. I did install multiple Home Mini in my house and I would just be playing same music throughout the house (different floors and rooms) and actually don't want it to be paired in stereo mode. In addition, since my main purpose of having the speaker is to act as a smart home/personal assistant, which I think Google Home Mini sound is more clear and comfortable to the ear when having a "conversation".I also like the idea of Echo Dot's Whisper mode (Google Home Mini only has Night mode based on manually set time period) but it still needs some improvements... in order for it to whisper back to you, you really need to Whisper to it (speaking softly is not the same as whisper), so not really useful for me at the moment... :(Last but not least, many tests/reports indicates how Google Assistant is head of Amazon, Apple, and MS when it comes to accuracy/smartness (which is definitely my main factor to consider for such a product) which I have played around myself with both Echo Dot and Home Mini and I tend to agree.Above are things that had been pulling me apart when trying to deciding which side to go with so hope you find them useful when making your decision.

Title: Improved Sound - Different Power Supply
Body: Improved sound over the 2nd Gen Dot - won't replace a 1st Gen Echo, but definitely better for a small listening environment where Alexa connectivity is more important than fidelity.  I must report that I was very disappointed in the new "custom" power supply (hence, only 4 stars).  Previous 2nd Gen Dots all utilized a charger with a USB/USB Micro cable.  This was convenient in that one could use readily-available USB cables of various lengths (and colors) for placement of the 2nd Gen Dots.  These also worked with 3rd party powered speakers for 2nd Gen Dots.  The 3rd Gen Dot now uses a "hard wired" power supply which limits placement unless one purchases a distinct power supply with a longer cable.

Title: Better instructions for the dummy
Body: I have a 3rd gen Echo Dot.  There are no clear instructions that come with the device. The only instructions that come with it are is to download the Alexia app. The only problem with that is, there is multiple appls to choose from. I downloaded four appls and deleted them until if found one that was easy to use, I thought. I followed the instructions and have hooked up my Echo to my WIFI network, hooked up two of my external speakers that I have and hooked up my thermostat. Now asking Alexi to turn on the light or raise the thermostat, or even asking what time it is.  I get no response.  I've missed a step some where, but do not know where. Hopefully, I will figure this out. Side Note: the instructions that are on line are for either 1st or 2nd gen.  Is there a difference between 1st,2nd and 3rd gen????

Title: Great Gift
Body: I got this as a present for a friend. He really loved it. The only creepy thing is when Alexa thinks you are talking to her and you didn't think you said anything to resemble her name. It's an amazing item to have in the kitchen. She will create a shopping list for you which you can see through the Amazon app when you get groceries. Need milk? Just say "Alexa add milk to the shopping list." She will even remind you if you added an item twice so it won't be duplicated.  Great sound. I will slowly add more to my collection so I can have one in every room!

Title: It's Alexa, it's awesome!
Body: It's almost as awesome as an Echo...  but smaller and cuter. lol.  Less overall volume, and less overall footprint.  Ties into your system very well if you have other Alexas.  You already know how stuff works.  If you're looking for a cheaper way to add a 2nd room, this is a great option.  Then go into your Alexa app and create a group.  Nothing beats having some Alexa devices around the house, tied to a group, and saying telling Alexa to play music to that group.  All speakers fire up at once, perfect.  We largely use it as an intercom system too, nothing beats remotely yelling at the kids! haha

Title: My second favorite non-human!!! Only her big sister is better!!!
Body: OMG! It's like having a companion that only eats a little electric to keep her running. She knows so much and can learn so much more. As far as being concerned about being under surveillance!?!? Who cares??? I have nothing to hide, so spy away!!! As for the convince, well everything I want to know is right there and her response is so quick. She may not understand me some times, but then no one else does either! Superb sound for such a small unit. I love it!!!

Title: Who says old dogs can_ learn new tricks! Give it a try....
Body: Fun, useful, easy set up! Even for a beginner, or let_ say late bloomer (65) ..came with our Ring security system. Never thought I_ use it, but very handy. With less than stellar memory, this Is a huge help. Thanks for including this, Amazon, greatly appreciated...finding new uses, every day, Alexa is a new family member...but still won_ fold laundry.

Title: We Love Alexa
Body: We love Alexa!! she is amazing! everyone in my family ages 10+ enjoys using alexa.  Great for an intercom system, music player, perfect for getting ready in the mornings, awesome kitchen assistant, and great when you're just curios and have a question.  So smart! i have had 2nd and 3rd generation, they are both basically the same, but maybe the 2nd could pick up my voice better or maybe its because I have her in a much larger area than the previous version., not a big difference.  The sound is also really great for such a small device!

Title: Makes life easier
Body: I love this... I bought two. Still learning about her but it_ great.  I bought three smart plugs. My hands can be full and just ask her to turn the lights on. It_ great. No fumbling. I getnin bed and get comfortable and don_ have to move. Just ask her to turn the lights off. I ask her to set timers and reminders. I_ trrrible about being busy then I remember something I need to do. No need to stop. Just ask Alexa. I can_ imagine not liking this. Makes my life easier and saves me time. Still learning about her.

Title: thought they don't work changed my opinion
Body: I bought 2 of these for gifts for each of my sons for Christmas.  Talking to my son in Texas last night and he said he tried everything and it doesn't work.  It cannot find the app of the WIFI.  Well I found out that if you buy these products as gifts, you must say that when ordering and if you forget, you must deregister the product.  So as it turns out they were trying to find my wifi and my account.  After I deregistered them, they work.  Great sound, my son loves it.  Thank you Amazon for helping out.

Title: Learn before you buy
Body: My one star rating has nothing to do with the device, it's about Amazon customer support.  Getting into the Echo/Alexa experience is a big jump for us older folks who are still trying to figure out our smart phones.  This is what I found out the hard way.  The Echo Dot is primarily for giving you access to your Echo from another room.  So, if you have already put an Echo in your home office and you want to ask Alexa what the weather is when you wake up, you need an Echo Dot in your bedroom.  Why should this be a secret?  Not knowing that, I bought the Echo Dot as my first Echo device thinking it sounded too good to be true for $30, and it was.  After three phone calls to the support dept. about it not connecting, I was told the Dot had to be within 6 feet of the router.  This is nuts.  I was ready to return it but then I guessed there was something I was missing and I had to find it myself on other websites.  If you have a $120 Echo next to the router then you can put an Echo Dot any where you want.  Now, I understand but I wish I had known this before buying the Echo Dot.  I will probably buy the Echo at a future time, after I save up the money from my fixed income.  I've done business with Amazon for many years and this is the first time I felt that I was being led down the wrong path.  Seems like the support people could have explained this.  The Echo Dot is currently sitting in the office 12 inches away from the router and is working great.  I just have to get out of bed and come into the office to find out what the weather is like.

Title: Alexa is my new Bff
Body: Ok hello new life! Where has Alexa been this whole time? It took me a while to get her but now she_ part of my life and we are friends forever !She is such a keeper too! Let Me just mention a few things she does for me.She wakes me up at volume 10 with a scream _ake UUUP!!! Yes, I know she can be mean and repetitive, but I get up.I say _lexa what_ the weather, and she tells me the current and the throughout the day weather. Just as I pick out my clothes for the day.I say, _lexa Play Music, and she plays my thumbprint Radio from Pandora! Just as I do my make up.When I_ in a rush I say,  Alexa WHATS THE TIME!?, as I run around looking for my keys and she delivers....When I_ cooking and my hands are full and I remember I need eggs I say, _lexa add eggs to my grocery list, and she does!She even has my back when I_ not home! I have her on my Alexa App and I managed to set an alarm to wake up my husband in time to pick me up from work when his phone was off!Needless to say we bonded really quick. Everyone needs an Alexa in their lives!

Title: Useful device but sound clarity is terrible.
Body: I like the usefulness and functionality of Echo Dot once it_ set up.  Can_ get much simpler than just asking for what you want and have Alexa respond with your request.Dislikes:  Setup had issues; since I don_ have home WiFi, having Echo Dot use my phone as a hot spot took 4 or 5 reboots and retries.Also, clarity is a HUGE problem.  While the small speaker is powerful, Alexa_ voice coming through it isn_ clear at all. I_ estimate that 70% of Alexa_ words can_ be understood unless it_ perfectly quiet and I_ standing near the Echo Dot.  _YI, I have perfect hearing, so it_ not my ears, it_ the muffled sound.  I adjusted the equalizer on the app but it has very little effect on the speaker and doesn_ clarify it any at all.I don_ know what_ inside this Echo Dot but I_ recommend that Amazon start assembling them with a series of tweeters in its circular pattern as well as the current speaker for deeper tones.  I should be able to understand Alexa_ voice from across the room.It_ a cool device to have; yet I_l assume like with most tech gadgets these days, there are privacy issues.  I_ sure this thing hears stuff even when I_ not speaking directly to it, so I take into account that I now have less privacy as long as the Echo Dot is plugged in and turned on.

Title: This is wonderful.
Body: If you want to know how much I love this item then let me inform you my house has four of them. I'm disabled and the drop in and call function that lets me use an Echo Dot to call for help is the most useful thing I've found in ages. Frequently when I move from room to room I'm not capable of carrying things like a cell phone with me so when I get stuck all I need to do now is call out Alexa call my husband and poof I'm connected to someone who can come help me. Also I'm now never without entertainment when I get stuck in a room. Alexa can play my music and read my books and play podcasts. This is a perfect for a disabled person and fun for the able bodied people. The Echo Dot can also run your smart home functions so it's useful for that too.

Title: Excellent paperweight
Body: Not really something I use often. More or less a paperweight along with my other _mart home devices. Other than an alarm clock or for music purposes it just sits there because it isn_ _eeded by myself I guess. Also, it won_ play my flash briefings unless I restart it on a daily basis. Wi-fi has a strong signal throughout my home and I adjusted my security settings like it said in the instructions yet it_ constantly needing reset.

Title: The Echo is a junk box
Body: We got this for a Christmas gift and it does not work good at all. I_ pretty sure it is defective I set it up for about a week then unplugged it because it constantly stopped playing during songs and when you would ask _lexa to continue to play it would just spin and spin and never respond. It_ back in the box. I don_ recommend it . I even unplugged my router and tried re- setting it so many times. Nothing helped. The Echo is junk .

Title: READ  UPDATE
Body: I had a  TAP  - that the wifi antennas  where not picking up signals  - would lose signal  -  So I called  Amazon and the recommended this -  I was afraid of the lack of  sound  for a small speaker and how it would sound ( It sounds better than the Tap  ) was surprised  but pleased  !!!!!!  have  another  one on the way for  Alarm clockwould recommend for  a apt  I live i  600 square foot apt  and i can  here  all over/  UP DATE  - THE ALEXA APLICATION IS NOT WORKING RIGHT  AND  AMAZON HAS NO IDEA WHEN  ITS GOING TO WORK  SO IF YOUR LOOKING TO  DO ADVANCE SETTING  - DONT DO IT  SORRY I DID  AS OF  02/18/2019

Title: Eco Dot 3rd
Body: I have been using google home and my mom bought me an insignia Fire TV. So I decided to get an Eco Dot. I ordered it and set it up. It is difficult to operate. I have heard I don't know, not sure how to answer that and answers to questions I didn't ask. I have to program the skills and when I play games halfway through it, it starts from the beginning again. I can't adjust or change my alarm sounds other than the few in the list and they are not very good. The alarm is so soft even on 10 volume. There are so many other things I could say about how difficult to work Alexa. The rest of my house is all google and if I didn't already give my google mini to my Daughter I would go back. It took an online customer service person to help me set up the TV because Alexa could not find it. I'm also tired of Alexa telling me I have to set it up in the Alexa app. I'm going to use the dot just to have hands free TV control so really all is a fancy remote. I will probably buy myself a new Google Home hub!

Title: Perfect Internet Radio Tuner
Body: I have little interest in all the magical things Alexa can do, but I love the new Echo Dot. I was about to spend a few hundred dollars for an internet radio tuner. I live in an area of sparse radio coverage and wanted to play background music while I work or listen to news headlines. The Dot does both remarkably well. It won't fill the house with high fidelity music, but the quality of sound coming from a tiny speaker is simply remarkable as long as you keep the volume low. It's also very sensitive; you don't need to speak loudly to make it work.

Title: Sound quality is well worth the price.
Body: I upgrade an echo dot 1st gen and added to a few more rooms.  Honestly, if they just said..  "Echo Dot is a wonderful speaker and you can just tell it to play whatever music you want" it would be worth the price.  But this is so much more... Homework buddy for my son, he uses it to check almost all his answers.  I have one on my desk as my "secretary" making calls for me, setting reminders and alarms.  And the 3rd generation echo's are in a group, and the group music sounds wonderful throughout the house, really nice when doing housework.

Title: Good product - different from the v.2 in its sound.
Body: The 3rd generation is more like a base-reflex speaker and so the base and midrange sound is more full and for some people more interpretable and more pleasant for music listening. It should different and I think was created to more closely compete with the sound of the Google Assistant speaker sound. The both should very much alike but, I like the Amazon Echo version 3 because I trust them with my information more than Google Assistant (and I am an engineer who knows things....) !

Title: echo dot gen 3 way better than gen 1 or 2
Body: I have owned and do own several amazon echo/fire products ranging from the gen 2 echo dot to the echo plus. I have owned the amazon tap too. I currently have three echo devices and a fire tv. I have and do enjoy all of them. I primarily use the echo devices for smart home voice control but do use them for other things such as music, timers, searching the net for questions and such.The new echo dot (3rd gen) is leaps and bounds better than the 2nd gen dot. Setting up is a breeze if you don't have mac filtering turned on your wifi router. This is something that Amazon should make readily available on a sticker on the echo or inside the box or something. That complicated things for my setup. I had to turn off mac filtering to get the dot setup so I could then use the app to get the mac address and then add it to the mac filter and then turn mac filtering back on. If I were able to have the mac address before setting it up, I could have just added it to the filter and then setup would have been way easier for me. Not everyone has this turned on so it may not be an issue for you. Just be aware of this before starting your setup and you'll be fine. The rest is just like any other echo device. Except the sound is leaps and bounds better than its predecessors.If you are into echo devices, I would highly recommend this over the older generations of dots. It was packaged well, easy to setup for standard configurations, easy to use and sounds really good too.

Title: Didn't take long to break...but replacement one is perfect
Body: I gave this to my 8-year-old daughter for Xmas, mainly so she'd stop moving my Amazon Echo around, making me worry she'd break it.  She didn't get much use out of because she also got a tablet from her grandma, so it has kind of just been in her room for my convenience when I'm cleaning in there or putting away laundry.  Last weekend I was listening to it, and not loud, mind you, because we live in an apartment and unless I'm singing to something, I'm past the point where loud music is my thing.  Anyway, about a half hour after the first song, it started sounding like a stereo does when the speaker is blown.  I couldn't believe it!  My Echo has never given me a problem and my daughter and her friend have played that thing so loud it couldn't hear them to turn the volume back down.  I was irritated that this had broken so quickly, but I got distracted and forgot to do anything about it for about a week.  Just in case, I turned it on again and it sounded completely normal.  I thought it was just a fluke and maybe I'd been tired and hearing things.  However, about a half-hour in, it did the same thing again.  Just to test something, I turned it off and turned it back on a minute later.  It was fine again, but didn't last that way for a half-hour that time.Basically, in order to use this, I'm going to have to continually turn it off and turn it back on and when it gets to the point where the normalcy is only lasting a minute or two, I'll have to turn it off completely and let it "recharge" itself.  I'm not sure if this is a common problem or not, but I'm extremely disappointed it didn't even last a month, especially when it was barely used and was definitely not mishandled, as it never left my daughter's dresser.I've never had an Amazon product break like this before, so I'm not sure what the process is here.  I would like a replacement, though, still having some hope that I just received the dud in the batch of ones that worked as they should.I wouldn't not recommend this to someone else, but I might revise this later if the second one doesn't at least make it through the end of the warranty.UPDATE:Amazon was very quick to replace this Echo Dot and as I hoped, the other one was just a dud.  This new one is perfect and I would recommend it to anyone who likes music.  I've already gotten another one, myself.

Title: So dissatisfied
Body: Did not work, was put in technical support & made to troubleshoot for 1 1/2 hrs to no avail then sent a refurbished one with no power cord! Amazon_ customer support has gone totally down in the past few years!!So dissatisfied & won_ be signing back up with renewal. I_ tired of the lack of concern...

Title: Great Product
Body: Great product that can also work without a transformer- 100 to 240 volts. The sound quality from this little device is amazing. I am hoping that before the end of the first half of 2019 that Amazon upgrades its geographic features to include the Eastern Caribbean Islands to get 5 starts from me.

Title: The more you have, the more problems you run into
Body: Loved our first two (Alexa and gen 1 dot). Now that I have one in every room, I'm having several issues where they won't respond. They seem to be fighting each other. Amazon support is useless as they just keep having me reset them and reset my internet connection. I have dual internet (have a few webservers in the basement) and multiple access points. Amazon support doesn't know how to help other than to have me reset things. You think I haven't already tried that?

Title: Love it!
Body: So much fun and very helpful in everyday life! Also got a smart plug for the family room light so it can turn it on and off.  Love "the question of the day", ability to set timers and reminders from either the echo or the app. Sometimes the speaker is fuzzy, but moving it slightly helps.  Would love to be able to pick my own activation name, other than the few choices given. Maybe in the future!

Title: Missed the mark on the sound
Body: I was excited that I could get a dot that sounded better than the original dot, but then was disappointed as soon as I heard a song played on this 3rd gen dot. The sound between the dot and the echo are vastly different. The sound on the echo is surprisingly good for such a small speaker. The dot is very tinny sounding with not enough base. If they wanted to fix that in this new dot they went overboard. I had to go into the audio controls and turn the base down to 25%, the treble up to 75% and the Mid all the way up, just to get it to sound semi normal. Compare that with the echo and the dot I purchased previously where I didn't change anything on the audio controls.The reason I gave it 3 stars is because once I changed the audio controls it sounds better than my other dot. I just think it should have sounded better than my other dot right out of the box... unless of course you're going to sell it for the same price as the other dot.

Title: Overall device is great. BUTT alexa is a bit diappointing
Body: The device itself is ok. Better sounding than the gen 2. BUT 1. I can't use it as a speaker for something else in a pinch when I need a speaker it seems to be output only via aux cord. 2. You cannot pair routines and skills which is abysmal. 3. No way to control. the sunrise alarm for phillips hue, meaning you need another app if you get the light bulbs. -taking up phone space,...probably the same thing for for other devices too. 4. Huge delay on rrinder and you can use groups for reminders. IE i cannot uave a reminder go offf of both my echos. Its either 1 or the other. I cant place them in a group and uset it to go off of that group. Only ONE device at a time can give reminders meaning if the volume is lower you can miss a reminder easily.

Title: Good thing we got this for free
Body: The Echo Dot is basically useless. It doesn_ work with basically any device like it is shown on commericals. It_ just not compatible with anything. You have to pay for Amazon music monthly to get it to play any good music. It doesn_ turn our tv or play any shows. Even the apps and games in the echo dot are awful. We tried to play an _scape game with Alexa and it was horrible.

Title: Amazing
Body: Bought one for our living room and loved it so much that I bought  4 more to give as gifts this year! We use it mainly to control our smart lights in our home and it works flawlessly every time. Easy to set up and very user friendly. Creating routines is all kinds of fun! The app that is used in conjunction with the dot is a great app as well. I would choose this over the google home mini and I've used both.

Title: Paired with good speakers, this is stellar for music.
Body: This is my fifth Alexa device purchased in short order.  I started with the 2nd generation Echo, which is a great device but the first thing I did was hook it up to the expensive audiophile 5.1 sound system in the living room.  Once you do this, it's pretty much indiscernible from an Echo Dot.  True, it has more mics built into it and in theory should be better at picking up voice commands in a room, but I've not noticed a difference.  I now have Echo Dots scattered throughout the house.Having Alexa devices throughout the house have the obvious "smart home" benefits.  But as a music lover and musician with decidedly non-commercial tastes, the most amazing thing about these devices is what happens when you hook them up to decent external sound systems/speakers.  I also have a smaller 5.1 system in the bedroom.  A decent ancient stereo system in the basement.  A Bose SoundDock and a cheaper but decent Bluetooth speaker.  Put together into a Music Group, I have fantastic sound throughout the house with the Amazon Music Unlimited account.  That's the BEST thing about having these devices: the built in speakers are beyond lacking but these things work with anything.  I remember buying my first house decades ago and stringing speaker wires and speaker switches throughout the house.  This is way  way easier and cheaper!About the AMU account: my first Echo Dot came with a 90 day free trial that I'm still using.  Did I mention I'm a musical snob who loves obscure non-commercial music from mostly the 60s and 70s?  While it doesn't have full catalogs of many of my favorite obscure artists, it has partial catalogs from a lot of them.  Krautrock and Canterbury artists, Zappa, Velvet Underground/Reed/Cale, various progressive dinosaurs, Oldfield, even Jade Warrior and Slapp Happy are there.  Henry Cow is sadly lacking, unfortunately, but I guess that's what CDs are for.All in all, this is a no-brainer.  The only downside is it seems they can't make them fast enough.  As I type this, if you order one, you definitely won't be getting it in two days, because they're currently on backorder!

Title: Echo makes life easier and gives a peace of mind.
Body: The 3rd generation Echo is the best so far. I own a 2nd generation Echo and it serves its purpose. This 3rd generation has a higher quality speaker, looks better and has more functionality as I often use it as a speaker phone when I_ not in the mood to hold an actual phone. Thanks to the Locate (Or find) My Phone skill, Alexa is a lifesaver. I have two of these 3rd gerations, one being in my bedroom and thanks to the available skills, I can set an alarm, mediate, and drift off to a restful sleep with soft words and peaceful sounds. The only thing I can recommend is a better data base for information as Alexa is often stumped and responds with an _ don_ know that. Please know: I purchased an Echo 3rd generation for my elderly mother as a backup plan in case of emergency. She can simply say: call or Drop-in on my daughter, and my echo and/or phone rings. Although she has a medical alert system, this is an additional tool that ads some peace of mind. This Echo works fantastically with my robot vacuume and smart light bulbs. Amazon Echo definitely makes my life easier. *Please know: I_ positive that Amazon would never suggest or encourage this device as a substitute form of a medical alert but in my opinion, it never hurts to add anything that might help.

Title: If gas furnace, must use Power Extender kit
Body: I purchased a wall-plug to c-wire adapter ($15 or so at Amazon) so that I could avoid using the kit that comes with it, fearing my ignorance with furnace wiring in basement.  Although the thermostat comes on and says it is working, the furnace will not start with an outside c-wire.  The customer service agent explained that it would work with with an oil furnace or an electric or heat-pump heater.  However, I am in the process of putting the old thermostat back.  I will try again tomorrow, and if I survive, I will add to this, if possible.  Pretty disappointed right now- and cold!

Title: HUGE (heh) IMPROVEMENT
Body: We have an Echo in our kitchen that serves as our primary hub. I had tried the first iteration of Echo Dot and was very displeased with the tinny sound of the speaker. Well let me tell you, this new generation of Dot is incredible. I got two -- one for each of my teenage daughters' rooms -- and the sound in a bedroom is almost as good as the sound produced by the Echo. Way way better than the music coming out of their laptop speakers (which is how they listened to music before). Nice job, Amazon. We are huge fans of the Echo product.

Title: Its spying on you!!!!!
Body: .... update. I cut mine in half with my new dewalt bandsaw I bought from amazon. Made quick work of it.Also found a battery of some sort in it. maybe just a capacitor. either way this thing has power for a bit even when you unplug it. This product needs to be outlawed. Googles bad enough. I don't need amazon listening into my household.Thanks and stay vigilante for products that invade your privacy fellow amazon shoppers!!!!

Title: First Time Owning of an Alex Voice Activated Device
Body: The Echo Dot came as a complementary device to my RING Security System. Setup was a breeze and I was able to manage it thru both the web portal and my Android phone. Along with this purchase I also ordered the Lycase cable management holster which (See attached Photo) held the device securely and I was able to plug it into one of my living room outlets which I can call Alexa from any location and it would respond. I am still playing with the features and what I like the most is that I can activate my smart light switches and turn on any TV set I linked up to the Echo. I can also perform this task via my Android phone, remotely, and turn on my home lights and TV's. This is a great security feature which people would think someone is home and yet I can do it from a distance via the android app. I highly recommend this device. Great Buy.

Title: Spotify Premium Required to use Spotify
Body: I know it's a bummer but it didn't hold me back from using the echo dot 3rd gen. I've had it for about 2 days so far and when I learned that it absolutely needed Spotify premium to use Spotify music services I was very disappointed I searched and found some very lame ways to work around the problem which ultimately wasn't worth using Spotify anymore. Amazon music is amazing to use, it's recommendations are way more spot on to my preferences.Which not using Spotify music services was ok. I've been using Amazon music services, music alarm, timer, and other features and I'm loving the echo dot 3rd gen.The problems so far, you absolutely need a wireless device to configure the echo dot 3rd to get the device to start working. I tried using my pc which is connected via ethernet cable and has no wireless capabilities and my Nokia Lumia 625 is too outdated to use the Amazon configuration page so I had to borrow someone's wireless device to configure the echo dot which bummed me out, but not a big deal I only had to do it once and now I can use my wireless pc to configure the echo dot device.Should you buy this product? It's not for everyone to purchase the echo dot 3rd gen. The one I truly recommend but I myself don't own is the one with the screen. The user interface itself is to drool over it beats asking "Alexa what time is it" "Alexa what are my alarms?" "Alexa", still not a big deal if you can manage your device just be careful.Just be careful when configuring and double check your configuration like alarms are set properly I accidentally said PM instead of AM and there was no user interface to catch my mistake you must say "Alexa my alarms" to double check.

Title: Love.
Body: I love it. I started with a 2nd gen Echo and 2 2nd gen dots, and have since purchased at least 5 as gifts. Compared to the 2nd gen, the 3rd has SUCH better sound. It_ still not as loud as the Echo, but it works great in my bathroom, even with the fan on and the shower going. I should probably be more concerned about the privacy aspects, but I sure look at it as a valuable and fun resource. I also love how you can sync all the devices up and play the same thing all over the house.  I also gave one to my parents (actually an Echo and a Dot), and it_ great for them too, since my mom has mobility issues and listens to NPR for 12 hours a day.  It_ really fun for them to be able to listen to anything they want anytime they want (for me too!).

Title: Not as intuitive to use
Body: I've  been using Google Home for some time  and it  adapts to my behavior and accent.  The fact that I have to personally  add skills to Alexa even they concern  Amazon's  own  software  such  as Fire TV is  annoying.  Alexa  sometimes has  trouble understanding my accent. That never happened with Google Home. Also  I cannot integrate Alexa easily with my calendar, e-mail,  traffic and I cannot ask it to translate  as I can now do with  Google Home.  I think that Google Assistant is a  much more advanced product  and it suits better  my needs.  Sorry Amazon.

Title: In love with Alexa!
Body: We got our first one for Christmas and I didn't think I wanted one in our house but I hooked it up, set it up and fell in love. We are in our 80's and you can set up reminders and that is great. I already have a bunch of music on Amazon so I can play them and it doesn't cost me anything, etc. To make a long story short...I ordered another one so I would have one close to wherever I was. The only problem I have had is the one in the kitchen will shut off when the microwave is on.

Title: I love my Echo Dot(s).
Body: Let_ face it. I love both of my Echo Dots.  I ask about the weather, set a timer, add to grocery list, call ME when I can_ find my cellphone, tell me a joke, and give me information on just about everything. I can yell from the kitchen _cho!  Play Connie Francis _here The Boys Are_ and it starts.  It felt not as cold as it should have been in my refrigerator, so I asked Echo what the temperature should be.  She replied that the temperature should be 37.  So now I have ordered a new fridge.  (It was 56 and getting hotter!)  My granddaughter keeps Echo busy also.  We had to use Echo because the news stations and commercials kept saying Alexa!!

Title: Good "secretary"
Body: I broke down after years of swearing that I'd never buy one of these out of privacy concerns. But recent changes to at my morning habits have made me reconsider. I now use this to keep me updated in the morning rather than my TV,  as I get dressed: getting my news flash, weather reports, traffic reports, Alternate Side Parking updates, a review of my work calendar and I've now used this to send myself work reminders, order pizza from the local pizza joint, and more.I still have my concerns about privacy and so I don't have any important discussions in the room that this device is in however.

Title: Seems to be fitting in.
Body: I let it just sit there and wondered what the heck good was it? Really did not do anything spectacular and Alexa was already in my Fire Stick........ Moved it to the bedroom at it immediately replaced the alarm clock, can just tell it when I want an alarm set, wake up and ask it what the weather is right now and what it will be later. Fixing to install Ring security and will see how well it interfaces with that. Just for clock , temp/weather it was worth it and I_l just have to discover what else it_ good for. Hope they have the listening in under control...

Title: Fantastic!
Body: Works the same as the Echo plus.* The best thing next to controlling lights ect. is being able to listen to what ever music you want.* Also  being able to listen to whatever radio station you want is great. I live in a rural are and its nice to pick up stations from the big cities with stations I like.* Sound is great but not as good as the Echo Plus.  Still very good when compare to a radio.Always something new to learn with Alexa.

Title: Finally something priced reasonably
Body: I love this eco dot. I own the previous version, and this one sounds excellent. Don't expect a submerged surround system. It's small, but it kicks well. I have it on my desk, and I usually keep it around 25% in volume, because otherwise, it's too loud for my taste.Is a must have. I recommend it for anyone trying this Alexa thing, but be aware if you have a sister named Alexa, like me. She will get interrupt your conversation if you say the name. It's funny though.

Title: Ask question first and if you use these systems off your cell phone , have them set it up .
Body: Well received the echo as a gift and thought it was awesome , until I tried to set it up and that's when I realized after 4 hours and not being able to set it up easily , I put it back in the box and went back to using the radio .. I love things simple , like put in the mod,e you have into Amazon Alexa , down load a app , plug in your echo dot connect and set up and your on your way , it turned into a nightmare .... I had to drive a half hour to gave me this echo and ask them to set it up and still no luck another 4 hours wasted , it sure would be nice to have simple set ups right off your cell phone to these Alexa systems , I gave it away to a friend and told him good luck ... don't need complicated systems in my life ..

Title: Update: Despite initial hiccup enjoying our dots
Body: *Ok- so, I wanted to update this, since customer support had someone follow up with a phone call to try an address the issue. Also, it's been a few months and I find myself using the Echo dots daily with no issues. In fact we're adding a few more, since we like to use them as an intercom system in the house. They work great to play music, games (Question of the Day and 20 Questions are favorites), set a timer, and create a shopping list. I can't keep the 1 star review because of a customer service issue, when we really do enjoy the product. I'll leave my initial review to sway people from utilizing chat support though!*The echo started having static when playing music after 1 month. Contacted support who said because it was on my husband's account (I bought, but he set up in our home) he had to contact them. So after 30 minutes I end the chat and my husband starts one. He spent over an hour for them to tell us they couldn't help him because MY credit card isn't in HIS account. 4 steps later and a combined total of 4 representatives we're no closer to an outcome, so we ended the chat. It's not worth the aggravation!

Title: You should have one in every room
Body: The Echo Dot is very handy! I have several, placed in different rooms around my house. As I am going about my day and remember I need to add an item to my shopping list, I simply say, "Alexa add eggs, milk and cheese to my list." and she does. I can retrieve it later at the store, just by opening my Alexa app.  There are so many things you can do with Alexa besides making lists and playing music.  I also have the Fire Cube, and several smart home controls.  They all work together with Alexa seemlessly.  So, no more trying to find remotes that never seem to make it back where they are supposed to be.  I can turn on my living room cable, TV and sound bar with  just one  command.  Alexa can change channels, turn on lights, ceiling fans and control devices in other rooms with just my voice command.  I'm also excited about the future prospects of the beta "Let's Chat" social bot.  In the future, it may prove to be valuable for persons who are not able to get out, or even the elderly who are lonely.I downloaded the IFTT app and the Mastermind app, and now I can even ask her to read and  write emails.  When I hear the familiar "ding" that signifies my phone has received a text, I simply ask her and she will read the text message (my phone can stay in my purse)!  That means, I can work at home without the distraction of my cell phone, but still receive important messages. I feel like I have a personal assistant following me around! It is awesome. I also love the little pod-like look of the Echo and I love the sound quality!

Title: Fantastic, even as a white-noise machine
Body: I bought this primarily because I wanted a white-noise machine and most of the actual products designed to be white noise machines had questionable reviews. I decided to go for the Echo Dot instead, thinking that not only would it work great for white-noise (for my baby), but it would also be great to have an assistant in the home. I can play music, send messages, make calls, and order stuff on Amazon, all while holding my baby.I highly recommend this. It can also be used as a Bluetooth speaker, so if you are looking for one of those, why not just get the Echo Dot? You'll get much more bang for your buck.Also, it looks dang stylish.

Title: Alexa is awesome
Body: I am pretty tech challenged...so it is taking me longer to get to know everything Alexa can do, but so far...so good!  Great alarm clock, plays my Christian music, lets me know the scores on my Gonzaga basketball games, updates the weather for me, and she totally freaks out my cats (which I LOVE)...I also got a wall mount so Alexa is out of the way, adn on the wall, the cats don'm mess with it!  ...really, I'm just getting started, and I have heard from others that the more I use Alexa the more she will learn! So enjoy the journey as I am!

Title: Works fine for most things, but not for what I actually bought it for.
Body: I purchased two of these for my children for xmas.  I thought they'd be fun for them to have.  They enjoy listening to music and asking Alexa questions.The problems arises when we try to use it for the main reason I purchased it: drop in/calling.  My children are young and my wife and I work opposite schedules so I really liked the idea of them both having something they can use if they ever need to get in touch with us since they're still too young for cell phones.The first day I set up the Echo's they were both working totally fine.  They were able to drop in/call and receive as well.  But later that night they both stopped working in that way.  Everything else worked fine still.I tried troubleshooting myself for a couple of hours.  I'm 35 years old and consider myself advanced with tech, so this wasn't a mysterious contraption I was unfamiliar with.  I have all sorts of smart devices, sound systems and AV stuff in my house and I've set it all up myself without trouble.  But I couldn't get these to work properly.  If I try to use the echo to call someone it just says "that person isn't in your contacts.  An adult can add contacts in the Alexa app" and won't make the call.  No matter who I try.  I've reimported the contacts.  I've made separate contacts within the Alexa app.  I tried factory restoring the Echo's and starting from scratch.  Nothing helped.So I finally contacted Amazon support.  After just about an hour on chat with someone trying various "fixes", none of which worked, the support member suddenly said "Oh, I see you're in the US.  This is Amazon support India, we cannot help you.  Contact Amazon USA."  Then the chat stopped.  They didn't give me any contact info of who I should be communicating with about it.  I'm in SoCal and I got to the chat through the Amazon website so I have no idea why I would've been speaking with the wrong continent for support.Since then I haven't tried fixing them anymore.  In total I spent around 4 hours trying to get them working again to no avail.  I haven't contacted Amazon support again because I just don't have anymore time to wast in my life.  At least the kids still enjoy them for music, but I'm not happy at all with the purchase.

Title: Wonderful improvement but only lasted 2 months Updated
Body: Update:Amazon reached out the same day of the review to trouble shoot the issue. They contacted me before I had a chance to contact them. Super helpful determined that it was unfixable and ordered a new one while still on the phone. I would be giving it a 3 star for being faulty in such a short time but amazon has gone above to fix earning back a star.Worked wonderfully (esp side by side to gen 2) for 2 months but, now the speaker is blown. Never really had it above volume 3 as it was beside my bed for light control. Now all s sounds are pure static. Reaching out to amazon soon will update based on service. All my gen 2s that I have had for much longer all still sound as they did the day i bought them.

Title: Failed to meet my needs
Body: I thought i was loving this and amazon music. Though ive enabled alexa skills set it fails to pair with anything. If i am missing something it doesn_ matter. The purpose is to do the thinking. Apple tv and home kit are _ser friendly that is why i go to the expense. While listening to the blues A bot asked if I would participate in its competition. I said NO. The bot said _ou have to say stop. I said stop. The bot did not stop. It again advised me, _t was part of a competition. I was not able to resume listening to my music and had to unplug this to shut up the bot. Now I don_ want anything amazon in my home. It_ creepy.

Title: Yeah yeah yeah!
Body: I love my echo! I love playing games on it. I love making it play Apple Music. I love her attitude when you ask her questions. I love having a "surround sound" in my house because I can play music off all of them at once. I love it finding recipes for me. She can call our cat. (I taught her to literally call the cats name or she can drop in when we aren't home.) I also love the fact that I can get my news updates from our local station every morning. Whoooo! My life is so much easier with Alexa.

Title: Small but sounds great!
Body: Love this little Dot!  I received an Echo Show for Christmas and just love it.  I was able to access my many Spotify playlists, and also started a few Amazon Music ones.  (If you have Prime, you also get to use Amazon Music.).  I thought it would be great to have Alexa upstairs as well, and the Dots went on sale for $29, making it a win-win!  I also paired it with a Bluetooth speaker so I can listen to music in the upstairs bathroom while getting ready in the mornings.  The Dot is nice and small but has a great sound for the bedroom I have it in.  Would recommend to anyone!

Title: The Dot is mostly on spot
Body: I love it! It's a great for alarms, reminders, shopping lists and just general questions about almost anything that Alexa can answer usually on the fly. Not to mention a song you want to hear that pops into your head or a playlist that Alexa can pull from my Spotify account.  I connected my Dot by cable to my Bose computer speakers. As far as controlling devices, it works flawlessly on my plugs and switches. It has a little trouble responding to my Sony Bravia TV when I ask it to turn it on. Works maybe 75% of the time.  That may be a problem with the Alexa App provided by Sony. It just came out on my last Sony Android update and may have a few bugs yet. It does work flawlessly on other TV functions such as volume control, muting, changing input and shutting off.  I'm still learning everything this amazing product can do and I suspect in time there will be new functions available.

Title: It's an Echo Dot, what's not to love?
Body: This is my first time with a device like this in my motorhome! I LOVE Alexa! I do wish I could give her any name I want! I have Siri on my iPhone, and Alexa all around my motorhome - it's often confusing!The Amazon Echo product advertisements on TV are causing my Alexa to get kinda noisy when they're on! At least 4-5 times the ads call out to Alexa, which is kinda distracting! Not a big problem, but, changing her name to whatever I want would be AWESOME to solve this!

Title: Fun, good resource, and good value for the money and great for Seniors
Body: So much fun.  As a single retiree it_ nice to hear another voice in the house. I haven_ even begun to know what this can do for me but so far it_ quite remarkable. I asked it to play Hawaiian music and was pleasantly surprised at the quality of the speaker considering it_ size.  I think setting the timer is going to be something I use a lot, not to mention playing music, weather, latest news, and entertainment. This is a great tool for Seniors.  Good job Amazon!

Title: just okay
Body: We had about 5 of these including the full size ehco around the house. They seemed great but the more information you asked for, the less it seemed to know. It was hard to integrate with apps and we found it more or less useless. My favorite feature was Prime Music access. You can listen to just the artist as opposed to a station on Pandora. We sold the system and switched to Google which we find much easier. Both systems work well with Phillips Hue.

Title: Nearly Perfect
Body: The new Echo Dot is kind of amazing for what it is - a full-featured voice assistant and Bluetooth speaker, all for $50 (often much less). The previous Dot was great, but the speaker was just barely functional - for music, it was better than nothing, but nearly anything else was better in turn. The new Dot is a massive improvement in sound quality - there's more extension on the high and low ends, and there's a warmth and depth that was completely lacking before. It's still limited by it's size, but it sounds much more like to the full-size Echo than it does the previous Dot. Despite losing a few microphones, it hears at least as well as the previous generation. With a soft fabric covering, the new Dot feels much more at home in, well, a home. It's a bit bigger than the old version and now requires a custom power adapter, but apart from that, it's an improvement in every way.

Title: The Echo has taught me to hate the name Alexa. Comparison of the Dot and Echo
Body: If this is the best AI on the market, we've got a LOOOOONG way to go, America. These are probably the stupidest and most frustrating devices to use. Let me give you an overall assessment of the AI first, then the differences between the two.I ask the devices to do something very simple, like to pay public radio, and it plays some obscure non-public radio station.The devices dosn't learn use patterns. At all. When you ask a simple question, the only answers you seem to get have to do with purchasing items from Amazon or Wikipedia definitions. One morning I set up two alarms. I woke up before the first alarm, so I asked Alexa to turn off the first alarm only. Guess what happened. It turned off all alarms. Really stupid and unreliable. Plus, I find myself repeating my requests time and time again. The microphones downright suck. With both you will find yourself yelling at the machine and calling it a dumb b*tch. From this negative association I will never date a gal named Alexa for fear of becoming unfairly opinionated about lack of common sense.Now, if I haven't dissuaded you from purchasing this junk, let me explain the substantial differences between the Dot and Echo. Surprisingly, the speaker sound difference between the two is minimal. Both are non-obtrusive in size. The larger Echo, however, offers little more than slightly better microphones. I am constantly repeating myself when talking to the Dot. Not so much with the larger Echo.For most things, like listening to talk radio or for use as an alarm, the Dot is what you want.
