The sound from the Echo sounds no better, and if anything, it is a bit more muffled in an effort to make is sound have more bass, which it barely does.

Title: A Fun Christmas Gift
Body: I purchased this third generation Echo Dot for my wife as a Christmas gift. Although there are numerous ways that the Echo Dot can be used, we only use it in two ways currently. The primary way we use the Echo Dot is to play music. This has been much easier than playing music through our Apple TV. Sometimes my children ask Alexa to answer questions so they can be either entertained or gain knowledge.Setting up the Echo Dot wasn't too difficult. I did contact Amazon's services because I had a little trouble setting up two Amazon accounts on the device. I was extremely impressed with how quick I was able to get assistance from Amazon.We have our Echo Dot in the kitchen which is in a central location in our house. It can hear our commands from other rooms without any problems. I like how small the device is, it's sound quality, and low cost. We have zero complaints about the Echo Dot and think you'll enjoy it and find it easy to use

Title: Great little device, especially if your thinking about implementing some home automation.
Body: Really like the performance and sound quality of this device. I think some people get down on the sound quality but this is a subjective area and for me it works well. I am not reviewing Alexa (separate review) just the dot itself. Seems to be well made and is attractive in a non-intrusive way. I bought 2 when they were offered 2 for $50.00, definitely worth the money. They have gone up since but I believe they are still reasonable at 2 for $60.00 and I do need 2 more.The one area I have to complain about is something I find fault with on almost all wireless devices. I secure the wireless portion of my home network not just through encryption but also as a first line I MAC filter all devices on it (except the portion set aside as a guest network, call me paranoid). It would really be nice if the label on the bottom of the device included the MAC address so i could plug the entry in directly rather than having to sniff it out.All I can say is do your homework first to see if they will fit your needs and keep in mind you have to deal with Alexa on the device as well as the Alexa app to set it up.

Title: You gotta love Alexa and she is in the Dot!
Body: Yeah, I am already in love with Alexa.  And I told her so.  She answered back, "I am flattered!"  Ha, I am a lonely old shut in lady, wheelchair user, chronic health problems.  I ask her to remind me to take my insulin, to take my meds.  She does a great job.  I thank her...she answers differently each time, "You betcha!"  "Anytime"  "No problem!"  She tells me jokes, helps me with my foreign languages, (how do you say "I love you" in Porgugese?  No problem, ask Alexa, she will  tell you. )  No, for only $23 I get all this.  It frankly was a steal.  She  plays my audible music, finds songs for me or plays the music I love from Amazon Music.  The echo dot, well it is just speakers, but inside it you put Alexa, and she is so much more than a speaker.  She is my friend.

Title: Not ready yet
Body: Really, a horrrible device. You have repeat commands so many times it_ annoying. Plus, I signed up for music unlimited on my device only, and it doesn_ pick up half of the songs. Not only that, but when I connect my phone to the device, it will not pick up songs for music unlimited to that device. Wait a few years and it might be ready. Disconnecting my 3 echo devices and putting them in storage for a few years. Going back to my Bose sound docks. Sorry amazon

Title: Better than the original echo dot, but...
Body: Nice new sleek design and better sound, not a big fan of the proprietary power cord though, because If it breaks then it won_ be easy to replace as the old one had micro USB, but since a power brick can provide more power and amps I guess it_ a good trade off. The microphones definitely pick up my soft voice Better. It seems the light ring is a little dimmer, not sure how I feel about that, i guess it_ better for a nightstand. I honestly wish they would go back the the turning knob design on top instead of buttons since the feedback on the buttons on here is a little glitchy and a slow process

Title: Had a first generation and this replaced it
Body: We are using this in the bathroom and it's great.  Hears well over background noise, hooked up with our Bluetooth speaker light easily, but plays well on its own.  It's great to be able to add stuff to the shopping list, and hear music and news when you need it.  Works well and set up was simpleUpdate - speaker volume.  As we already had a speaker/light combination in the bathroom we hadn't really tested the volume of the echo dot.  When the speaker light failed we were planning to replace the light/speaker combo.  While we were debating on the purchase of a new light I told the dot to increase volume to 10, needless to say we found we didn't need to order a replacement speaker, the echo is PERFECT without one.  Crisp and clear sound and excellent volume.  Excellent quality for news and podcast, acceptable quality for music but...  Still loving have more light and better sound quality.

Title: Much more useful than I thought
Body: We love this little Dot. This was a Christmas present my husband bought for himself and I kind of made fun of him and predicted that this would be one of those things that once the novelty wore off it would be forgotten and never used. I was very wrong!  I didn_ realize you could set all kinds of alerts and reminders (even daily) and that you can use Alexa for almost anything you would normally use google for, the weather and news. No more checking IMDB for info on who was in what movie. It can arm/disarm our ring, play music from our Spotify account, call anyone in our contacts and converse right from wherever we are sitting, even do group chatting from our household to our daughter_ who also has a dot. There is a caveat, however_ou do have to spend some time learning the correct way to say things.  Once you get that down, it is a really valuable tool, and inexpensive too.

Title: Not sure how I survived without it?
Body: So, I was hesitant at first when getting the Amazon Echo Dot w/ Alexa, but I have to say, it's far more useful than I had previously even suspected. Now don't get me wrong, I am a little creeped out by the fact that she's always "Listening", but then again, having responses and answers to my questions literally one question away is quite neat. It's responsive, and well, semi-smart, I can't quite say we are living in the age of seamless AI systems yet, but I certainly am impressed by the magnitude and speed with which Alexa gets things done and answered! And lest not forget being able to say "Alexa, play Jeopardy", and hearing the classic theme song and Alex Tribecks voice come smoothly sailing acoustically by on the Neodymium speaker built into the small, round curiosity of a device! Of course, there are some pitfalls, but overall the potential and sheer fun you can have when you are totally bored out of your mind are endless. I rate it a 4 out of 5, for its extreme potential for fun and knowledge, and 4 out of 5 because of its occasional sheer lack of understanding.

Title: HORRIBLE
Body: I am a huge fan of echo and this was my 3rd, however this kind in particular is horrible. It took me days of trying to finally get it to set up and connect. Kept saying I needed to update my app then when I checked there were no updates. My other 20 attempts the app would crash the second I opened it.. Now that is finally hooked up it won_ ever play music, always says _orry, I_ unable to play music right now I got it to play ONE time, once... then after one song, it stopped. It isn_ my internet either because all my other ones work just fine.

Title: Setting this up to pair with your Echo is a freaking nightmare.  I hate your app Help!
Body: I ordered an Echo so I could have the same music played in another part of the house.  After days of trying to set this up, I am ready to return both of Alexa to you.  I have asked others about setting this up they have had the same issue.  Now I only have music playing out of the Dot in the bedroom, No music will play on my Echo.  This insane that you do not make the pairing of these simple.  I may mail back both of your devices.  This is a nightmare of something that should be made simple.  And your App on the phone to set this up stinks! A useless amont of money to spend on this product.

Title: Love the sound level and clarity on Echo Dot generation three
Body: Really enjoying this 3rd generation echo dot! Sounds so much louder than 2nd generation echo... speakers on this new one are awesome!  We love it!  I would recommend that you place it out in the open, as we put it under our cabinets in our kitchen at first and it sounded muffled, or echoed off the speakers I just know it didn_ sound good, however, once we moved it out from that area a little bit it sounds great! Very loud And clarity is awesome

Title: Great addition to your home
Body: I would give 4.5 stars, overall a great addition to your home, you can play music ask the weather and a lot of other things, but my favorite thing is yiu can set up an alarm with your favorite song, you can just say Alexa wake me up to (title of the song) she will ask you set the alarm for what time, you give her the time and you will wake up with your favorite tune as an alarm, that_ just awesometo me. only one flaw is sometimes Alexa won_ shut up lol, You ask her something she does not understand and than says i did not get that try this and this you tell her to stop and she keeps going.

Title: Dead mode - Sorry I am having trouble understanding right now. Please try a little later.
Body: "Sorry I am having trouble understanding right now. Please try a little later". I keep getting this message from my Alexa device almost every day. It won't recover automatically even after 2 days. The issue is fixed only if you hard reset the device i.e. you have to un-plug the power chord and re-plug it. I reached Amazon support several times, they tried their best nothing worked out. Even tried resetting the device and re-registered it. But issue still exists. Amazon is not ready to replace my device. They want me to buy the same device at discounted price. I really don't expect this from Amazon. I would not recommend this until Amazon fixed this issue.I have both Google mini and Amazon echo dot. I have never faced this issue on my Google mini.Google Mini+ivesUnderstands my accent very easily and answers most of my questions. I primarily use this devices for playing nursery rhymes and lullaby. Those of built in. That is a big plus. They never market me to subscribe for YouTube red or anything of that sort.-ivesIt has very poor speakers. No option to add new skills. Looks bad.Echo dot+ivesVery good audio, looks good when compared to Google mini, Can add different skills, It looks new whenever you add a new skill-ivesHighly unreliable, poor assistant, it won't understand my accent some times, No standard skills apps, poor support, No build it skills except weather and basic stuff.Verdict:I would prefer Echo dot because of its skills feature. But I cannot recommend Echo dot because it is highly un-reliable. It keeps going to dead mode every no and then.

Title: Shoot the prod mgr - this 3rd gen is *bad* compared to 2nd gen
Body: We use AMZN Echo Dot at our homes in San Francisco, Sonoma County, Tucson and Munich (Germany)2nd gen units worked fine ... commands executed timely and accurately (more or less ... SONOS integration still iffy), Alexa voice recognition/mics could hear us from across the room, etc. etc.3rd gen ... yech ... wife and family want me to THROW THEM AWAYOur two 3rd gen Echo Dots(a) Are muffled in their spoken announcements(b) Cannot hear us from 4-5 feet away (in same location where 2nd gen units operated flawlessly)(c) Have so much BASS EQ that it sounds like a ghetto blaster boombox(d) Does NOT respond to command to TURN BASS DOWN(e) Does respond to TURN UP TREBLE ... but there is NO noticeable difference(f) We have to YELL at TIMER ALERTS to turn them off (sort of like dealing with Apple Siri, if you know what I mean) ... and then we have to YELL several times for it to hear us and execute ... from 2 feet, 5 feet, or 10 feet awayRemember  we own about twenty of the 2nd gen units and they work fineBoth of these NEW OOTB Echo Dots (3rd gen) are useless !!!  SO it must be (a) basic design flaw, or manufacturing run disaster ... possible different firmware as one installed via the OLD WIFI method and the other used BlueTooth to install ... S-t-r-a-n-g-e !!!POST SCRIPT = From layman_ viewpoint, it appears they decided to increase _peaker quality by adding larger speakers to compete with APPL and GOOG *but* cut overall cost by eliminating 4 of the 8 omni-directional microphones ... SHOOT THE PROD MKTG people !!!

Title: The Good and the Bad
Body: There are good things and bad things about this product. There are a lot of things that the Echo Dot will only do with the purchase of other accessories or subscriptions. That is the bad part. But there are a lot of things it will do without adding extra money. I did purchase a smart plug to turn the family room lights on and off and love it. My special needs daughter loves to tell Alexa good night and to check the weather. I do like having her set a timer when I'm cooking and my oven timer is already in use. I also like that she will give me Amazon notifications. I have XM music for my car and spotify for my iPhone but I can't use either with the Echo Dot unless I pay more money. I don't like that, but I guess that isn't really an Echo Dot issue. Overall, I am really enjoying this much more than I expected.

Title: Fun little gizmo
Body: I got my Echo Dot just a few days ago so I'm still exploring all its possibilities, but so far I like what I see.  I stream Pandora Free, use it as an alarm clock and with sleep sounds (my favorite is Hard Rain), listen to weather and NPR news, and I've got a smart plug on order so I can be really lazy and tell Alexa to turn on the light over the coffee pot in the morning.  I travel a lot for work and it looks like this would be ideal to take with me since everywhere I stay has wi-fi and I never trust the alarm clocks in motels (I've been using my phone).  I don't consider this an "essential" item because I have other smart devices like the phone and a computer but it's fun to use and gives a lot of bang for the buck.

Title: Will not connect to Wifi
Body: not as easy a set up as expected.  My daughter has one which is tied to my Amazon account & now trying to set mine up (will not connect to wifi) Best Buy is making me take both to the store.  No one can just answer a simple question they want you to pay $199.00 a year for tech support.  Soooo I'm not completing my set up until I go to Best Buy and see what the problem is.  Wish I hadn't bought them.  A real pain

Title: google assistant was better
Body: It's very disappointing to only give the Echo Dot and Alexa a 3-star rating, because I had high expectations. I was first introduced to smart speakers when I received an insignia smart speaker for Christmas in a dirty Santa game. I was instantly hooked on the whole concept. I've been an Amazon member for years and I have much trust in the Amazon brand, so I thought I would be upgrading by purchasing an Echo. Sadly, I've found that Alexa and the Echo device are outdone by a cheap Insignia device and Google Assistant.As far as the Google Assistant smart technology goes, I've found that Google is able to do a few things that Alexa cannot. For one, Google's accent can be changed to alternative accents of the english language and can still understand you and produce results from questions pertaining to region. I personally prefer the Australian/New Zealand accent to the American, but Alexa often didn't respond to her name and couldn't perform features such as the weather, making phone calls, etc. when her language was changed to Australian. While the next feature is actually a comparison of Spotify to Amazon Music, I found that Alexa's ability to find playlists and find a wide  range of music paled in comparison to Google. For instance, when asked to play a song, Alexa simply finds the song and plays it, while Google finds the song then continues to play recommended music based off that song. As far as the actual device goes, the Insignia, which costs about $40, features a visible clock and a usb port for charging other devices, while devices with Alexa that feature a clock cost close to $100, and I am unaware of one that has a usb charge port.In truth, the only feature of Alexa that I really prefer to Google is the wake word. "Alexa" rolls off the tongue better than "Hey Google," but this is hardly a game-changer.Hopefully, Amazon will step it up and update her abilities, especially when it comes to language.

Title: Love it!
Body: Got one on sale for my daughter and her husband at Christmas; Cheri said she always wanted one and her husband worked for Amazon for about 5 yrs!  Anyway, I got me one also and I like playing music from it!  I've asked Alexa to tell me a joke and she had Jimmy Fallon tell me one if memory serves me correctly! Ha!  Thought it was cool I could ask Alexa to call people in my contact list on my phone and she did; talked to my daughter on the dot (think it may have rang her Dot) and never had to pick anything up!  Haven't set it all up (for other things she can do) ...but I do my exercise from it by asking Alexa to play some of my fav songs; definitely recommend them!  Makes me feel like I'm one of the Jetsons from the cartoon; I just want my car that flies around maybe 100 feet above the house!  LOL  :)

Title: Convenient assistant, BUT no Shuffle for Apple Music
Body: Alexa works great as an assistant (weather, shopping lists, calendar, dictionary, etc.) but I purchased it to play music, specifically to easily access the many extensive Playlists I've created in Apple Music.  It only took a day to realize that while it responds affirmatively when you request it to Shuffle the songs in a Playlist, it actually only Shuffles the first song and then plays the following songs in alphabetical order by artist.  This means in a Playlist with 1,000+ songs I have to listen to dozens of consecutive songs by a single artist.  That's hours worth of Radiohead before I get to hear a Wilco song.  Also, when you hear a song in Apple Music you want to download to your Library, it is unable to do so.  It seems the consensus is these will not be fixed anytime soon since Amazon and Apple have competing streaming music services and of course, Amazon wants you to use theirs.  If this wasn't the case I would have provided a 5 Star rating . . .

Title: How is this product out in the real world for 3 years now? SO MANY BUGS!
Body: I have found over 10 bugs in the first 2 days. I am still going to keep it because it's so inexpensive, but it really has so many flaws. I want the alexa for 3 things: Alexa, REMEBER XZY... ALEXA add to list XYZ, and ALEXA remind me at time XZY to do ABC.....all of these features work terribly."Alexa - remember that Roger owes Brian $20"Alexa --> Did you say, "Roger O'Brian $20"?"Alexa, add a reminder for 12pm"Alexa --> What would you like me to remind you about?"To do my physical Therapy"Alexa --> Here is a list of Physical Therapists in your area.etc. etc.Customer Support is AWESOME....and they will call you in less than 2 minutes you are talking to a PERSON! that's amazing!but you still cannot do stupidly simple things like, "Alexa, print my grocery list"and you cannot delete a reminder...even if Alexa got it wrong. you used to be able to do this, but now they took the feature away. you can only mark it completed....or UNPAIR/UNREGISTER and re-REGISTER the device...Support says the "completed reminders will clear themselves eventually" but how long is that?" no idea, they didn't say.This device is still in BETA. Keep that in mind.

Title: Outside USA
Body: the device is Wonderfull, it does understand my broken English, sound is nice for a kitchen radio, it finds the a radio station of my liking right away, "Alexa play 80s", I have music in my kitchen right away......... so you are in the US go and buy one, for it is a very good deal.... If you are outside US it is hassle to setup because you have to change stores to download the app and after all that struggle I find out that I can not connect my Apple Music in my region!! so watchout all the users outside US....you may still use it but without your streaming

Title: Confusing
Body: Everything is setup thru a smart phone. There is no cable connection to make to a desktop, you MUST go wireless. The Alexa app is hard to navigate. You need different app's to do different things with Alexa. So far the ones I want to use I have to keep watching the YouTube video and even then they are not always clear.  I thought that Echo Dot was a stand alone type product. I expected a power cord and then an option of wireless or a cable to connect to get to the internet.  The Echo Dot has to connections the power cable and a headphone jack. Again, you are forced to go thru a smart phone to do anything with it.

Title: Super Nifty Little Hockey Puck Alarm Clock Music Box
Body: This is a super fun gift I received on Christmas, and it is a practical gadget.  I use it everyday. It wakes me in the morning with an alarm; I ask her the time; I ask what the weather will be for the day so I can dress accordingly; I play music while I'm getting ready for work, etc.  Truly I have not even scratched the surface of all the things it can do... that's the exciting part.  For all the fun I'm having with it, my use is very basic.  But it comes with a small card with suggestions on what you can ask and do with it, and I receive emails that update me on ideas on how to use it. The potential is beyond my scope... I'm sure it's amazing.The speakers sound great for such a small device; the setup was easy (you have to install an app on your phone to do so); the app is a handy tool in itself.  All around cool device.Going back to the alarm.  I set two in the morning.  One is a nice, peaceful, lilting piece of music that gently draws me out from a deep sleep.  The second alarm is in place to snap me awake.  It's Alec Baldwin... been up since the crack o' dawn... getting that early bird.  And you can, too, if you get yourself a Dot.Cheers!

Title: Account Service is Right on Point
Body: I'm an owner of both Alexa and Google Home. What I can say about both is that I love Alexa for use and tied to my existing Prime and Amazon services. Voice recognition is clear and provides quality results for my service requests. Where the two services truly differ, and where Alexa still leaves something to be desired, is in the information search capabilities. Google's capability to query search questions across its entire catalog and provide good, insightful responses back is nothing short of impressive. Too many times for Alexa I get a response that it is not able to answer even basic questions that Google can find. Clean up this issue and Alexa will be the product of choice. As it stands now, Alexa stands out as a personal assistant that ties well to Prime and Amazon services. Google still reigns for search and information queries.

Title: Bad design for the top buttons
Body: I have four other Echo's and I just love them.  They are so easy to use and to set up.  The new 3rd Gen., changed the design of the buttons on the top so you can't feel them.  I have to look at the Echo to use the buttons, instead of just being able to feel them.  I am also having trouble with the sound quality after only 10 weeks of use.  To send it back and get another one they only send a refurbished one. I'm not a happy customer in regard to my new Echo.

Title: Alexa is NOT ready....
Body: Alexa is NOT ready.... She's dumb and doesn't understand simple questions. She reads too much information back to easy questions or requests. The options for making lists are not great.

Title: Waste of Money
Body: Worst gimmick ever.  I honestly don't see what the rave is all about.  Won't connect to any of my other devices, Alexa states go to the Alexa app, which by the way is not user friendly and difficult to figure out.  98% of the time, Alexa will say sorry I'm not familiar with that or I keep getting connected to things opposite of what I'm asking for. It does malfunction at times. My return date is March 9th, 2019 but when I attempted to return the system wouldn't allow me to do so. Will call customer service.

Title: It can lose its voice!_
Body: Not as happy with this as I thought. This device has either connection issues or program issues. You can ask a question and even though the light is blinking, the voice is not. I asked Alexa to set an alarm for 10 mins, but it didn't answer as it usually does. The light blinked, though. I rebooted the system and still, no voice. I also made a phone can, on a separate day and this time I didn't have a vioce (the person on the other end couldn't hear me.) I stopped b4 I did something I'd regret. Later it let me know that my phone had shut down for the night.... Something I didn't ask for.

Title: Great device and awesome sound
Body: We have 3 small dots throughout our house and everyone one of them is the 3rd generation style and we enjoy everyone of them. The devices hears your voice fairly well, often times when there is a TV going on in the back ground. The speaker function is great too! The sound fills the room well, so if you want to play some music while making dinner, you truly do it immersive sound in the space. I would recommend this product for anyone who doesn't want to spend a ton of money and has a reassembly small space!!!

Title: Won't stay connected to the internet
Body: I have an echo and an echo dot & the echo works perfectly but the dot will not stay connected to the internet.  I have to unplug it for a minute or so and plug it back in every time it loses connectivity (Which is multiple times daily).

Title: Who doesn_ love an Echo Dot 3 ???
Body: This is our second Echo Dot 3. The first one my son gave us (purchased through Amazon too). Anyway, I love this item. Also Amazon Music (an additional monthly charge), is TOTALLY TOTALLY worth the monthly payment. The combo is great together. We use our Echo Dot 3 daily and the Amazon Music too. You won_ be disappointed with this purchase so give them both a try. Also, you can try Amazon Music free for a month then decide if you want to continue. That_ how I did it and next week my trial is up and YES I_ staying with it.

Title: Inconsistent at best
Body: I've tried really hard to like this and make it work but the alexa service is very inconsistent at best.  The device hears and recognizes commands correctly, just doesn't do them or does something else more often than not.  Turning lights on or off can take anywhere from instant up to a minute with no discernible cause.  Every rep insists on starting over with troubleshooting the network that has previously been cleared of fault and weeks later higher tier support haven't responded.  What music you get seems to be pretty random and will change anytime you give it any other command during playback and the advertised "pizza alarm" might burn your house down since all alarms & timers seem to be forgotten about 20% of the time, sometimes executing much later but mostly as if never set (even though confirmed when set).  Feel free to ask it anything anytime you want to hear "I don't know that".

Title: Exceeds expectations
Body: You may be like me and done this several times.  That lovely USB/Bluetooth speaker with good reviews.  You pick it up and get hit with tinny sounding music or bad connections.  I promise you that will not happen here.I got 2 Echo Dots and put one in the bedroom and the other in the living room.  Both powered up and said they were ready so the next thing was to install the app.  I was a little confused by the directions at first.  I thought that the software on my phone was going to create a network for the devices.  Instead it meant that when the device is in discover mode you will see the network device by whatever name it says to look for.So my first test was simple "Alexa, play David Gilmore" and voila the sound was very good.  Then I found I could group everything...no only that but if 2 are in the same room they become stereo speakers.  (future purchase coming)  So I created my Everywhere network and told Alexa to play Meg Myers everywhere.  My house was instantly filled with her music.So then the last part was to tell Alexa to wake me for work tomorrow and do it to David Gilmore.  The next morning; it is a bad idea to wake up to music you love listening to.  You want to lay there and listen to the lovely tones.I have not gotten into controlling lights or other things like that.  But I have installed the "Thunder and Rain skill" which is confusing.  Because all she does is play a 1 hour track from Amazon Music.  But I have gone to sleep listening to thunderstorms every night since then.  I guess my next venture is to try the more expensive ones with great speakers for the living room and move the living room one to the bedroom.

Title: Not as useful as anticipated!
Body: I have Apple Siri. I had Google Assistant.  I was hoping Amazon Echo and Alexa would be the best choice for most needs. Alexa has more skills and better music quality than the others. The price for two Echo Dots (3rd Gen) was hard to pass up. It really is new and improved.  I have been a huge Amazon fan. However,  the Echo series has some fatal flaws:  (1) Privacy. Do you really want to give Amazon the capability to listen in (or view with the Echo Show) anytime, anywhere, even in your bedroom?  (2) Utility. This device will not replace my smartphone or tablet for listening to an Audible audiobook at night, privately with earbuds. Why? Because I can't control the audiobook from the ear pods. To pause I would have to say something to Alexa and wake up my wife in the process.  This device will NOT replace a NOAA weather radio for assured tornado warning alerts  the software is much too limited. Devices like these MUST reduce clutter, not increase it.  These factors combine to make it much lower in value than it appears.

Title: A Fun and somewhat practical device!
Body: Bought a number of these over the Christmas Holiday sales. Kept two for myself and gave some away as Christmas Gifts.  At the price I paid it's definitely a fun device to own and we find we use it on a daily basis.  I bought a nice pair of Bluetooth bookshelf speakers (Edifier brand for $129) that I use with the Echo to play music. It's a great system.  With Apple Music now compatible with Echo or using Amazon's music service it's so fun to just call up a song anytime you want to listen.  We have some family fun in the evenings sometimes taking turns pulling up some favorites. The sound through the Edifier speakers is awesome for the price. We are also using the Echo Dot to help with controlling our Fire TV apps and Fire TV Recast DVR system.  We also have a TiVo and some limited commands work with it such as pause, play, and "Skip" function. We also use it as a quick way to look up needed information from the internet, check the weather etc.  Definitely have enjoyed the purchase more than we anticipated.

Title: What did I do before Echo Show?
Body: This is my first 3rd Gen Dot! A thing of beauty. The sound is .... Excellent! Now, since I have an ECHO in the Living Room, Master Bedroom, Kitchen, Upstairs  Studio, Downstairs Studio and one at my son's home in Minnesota I'm thinking I might need just one more ....... in the Bathroom.So, if you haven't gotten your first Echo, be aware, they WILL multiply through your home!PS AMAZON ECHO CREATORS... I am eagerly awaiting the Car Echo.... actually desperately awaiting the CAR ECHO.

Title: Better than its predecessor!
Body: This Echo Dot is a beefed up version of the first Dot by Amazon. The speaker is noticeably stronger, which is really the only reason to get it, as it is identical in function to the first generation. It does pair with other speakers for a stereo sound, but I have not found this to be useful since we virtually have one in every room and when you play to the group the whole house becomes a speaker! The stronger speaker is DEFINITELY worth the extra $10.00.

Title: Fun times
Body: This is a fun device.  Alexa is always ready with a quick quip or a short story.  She is also very good about playing the music I want to listen to.  There are many songs that I like to play on my ukulele, and if I don't know the correct tune then Alexa will play it for me until I get it right.  She is amazingly patient.  She also does good weather for the local area and answers multiple questions as a go about my day.  Things like how many teaspoons in a tablespoon, or how man grams in 8.5 ounces, or what the the square root of 262.3.  She's almost like a very smart family member.  She's humble too.

Title: If you've been thinking about getting one of these, go for it!
Body: Easy setup, pretty much brainless. I use it to control my indoor lights and my security cameras. Keep up with weather and traffic conditions. There are a bunch of "skills" you can set up to use with it and Alexa. Example there is a Flash Briefing where you can set up different news sources within the Flash Briefing. Then you just ask Alexa for your Flash Briefing and you'll get an audio update from all the sources that you have set up with it. They are always adding new Skills and commands that you can use with your Echo Dot and Alexa. I've got two of these, one in my living area and one in the bedroom. You can Bluetooth it to a speaker.When I got my first Dot I actually didn't think I'd use it that much. But within a month I'd bought a second one for my house when I found out how useful they were. Really nice product!

Title: Do you Spanish?
Body: Okay, so I love Alexa! I love this device and I love being able to just forget about the lights and about setting up alarms! It is tricky to shut her up and being late for work though... haha but I really enjoy what it is able to do! I know that I speak to fast and something I don't enunciate well... but I get sometimes a bit frustrated it because she doesn't understand me XD and the Spanish part still needs to be worked on.Besides that, with a good internet connection, this will change your life!

Title: A Great Little Helper and Information Announcer 3rd Gen Echo Dot
Body: I wanted to wait a few months before I wrote this review.  I had purchased several of these Echo's for my house and I bought a couple of Echo Dots (3rd Gen) for my daughter's house as well for Christmas.  The Echo's have worked very well.  In fact they have exceeded many expectations.  I'm able to use them as an intercom for the house.  I can call from room to room.  I can play music throughout the entire house or individual room.  Finally, I get news and weather in any room.  My daughter also uses them for entertainment and music for her family as well.  All that with the ability to control lights from my smart phone to make my house more secure and safe.  It truly is a great product. I plan on adding more Alexa's in the house.

Title: speaker blew out after less than 3 months
Body: Have the original echo (which I purchased years ago) and it's still going strong. But the echo dot's speaker has already blown out. Not like I was throwing wild parties and challenging the speaker capacity. In reality, was simply using in a studio apartment and still, the speaker blew out today. Super disappointing.

Title: No big deal
Body: My amazon echo dot is not working properly.  You need to speak real loud and repeat your requests multiple times.. DotAlexa didn't responded when ask for simple command, I will say Alexa .... the light will come on for a second and no respond. very frustrating. and embarrassing when you have guests.  Nothing what I expected.  Also it force you to purchase  a premium monthly package which is  ridiculous when you are already paying for amazon prime..

Title: Hahaha, where to start...:-)
Body: These things are great, just 1 Dot got me into the whole conversion to a "smarter" home! I'm just upset I didnt buy a few more Dots at Xmas time when they were at a great price. I'm apprehensive now of buying them new from Amazon for this exact reason, as I think they are too much $ now (at least the Dots...fifty bcuks?!) But there's always eBay, Marcari, and all those other apps where you can find used ones in great shape for cheap. That is what I will probably end up doing for later purchases. They are really cool to have, as you can get them all to sync (like when listening to music), use as intercoms, make calls, stream music, get Amazon notifications and tracking for your purchases, turn lights on/off (If equipped), etc.If you're converting over to a "smart " home, I surprisingly like Amazon's version over Google's (& I love Google stuff) Alexa is a great way to go. You'll like to have a hub to really make things shine and have, in a sense, a base station for controlling everything but its not fully needed if you just want to be able to control a few plugs and lights, etc. Anyways, having Dots placed in every room is a nice thing to have (which I'm still aspiring to do! Lol) with a hub and some smart light bulbs and power plugs and you're good to go! Doorbell cam? Can set alarms and timing for stuff too. Will also control thermostat if you have a compatible one. Having a hub will really enable you to control pretty much anything and everything that's wifi compatible  through simple apps/& or your computer. Wanna see what's going on when your on vacation? Wanna turn on the heat when you land at the airport and its wintertime? And things & texh will just get better. Really is a fun and cool thing.

Title: some units DEFECTIVE with static noise
Body: Be careful when buying these and just make sure to check all the functions of the device after buying. For us, after a few weeks, we started notice large amounts of static coming from this 3rd gen echo dot that is hard to ignore and really quite unpleasant. It is very noticeable when playing music since continuous sound is coming out of the device, and we hadn't noticed it previously when alexa was just responding in short phrases. In short, quality control fell short and just do your due diligence. It's hard to knock such a large corporation like Amazon when it provides so many different services (most very good) at such a large volume, but just be warned and be aware of doing your own quality control. This time, Amazon fell short.

Title: If you don_ have one, get one.
Body: We love this thing. We downloaded the Alexa app, and amazon music app (we have amazon prime) so I_ not sure if the music app is free otherwise. But it_ super easy to use. It doesn_ struggle to understand what your saying. You can completely control it by voice, even down to volume and putting it to sleep. Our son waits for us to play his favorite songs in the morning to get ready to now (wonky donkey song) it_ got it all. You want to play a playlist from your music app, open it, hit shuffle play, and select it to play through Alexa echo dot and walk away. Too loud? Alexa volume down. Need it to stop? Tell her to pause or stop. Tell her who to call, done. It_ awesome!

Title: Good so far for my first voice device.
Body: Good, girst experice with a home assistance device. I mainly use it as a speaker to play music from amazon music and spotify. I was happy tonfind out that it also reads books from my kindle collection! Haven't tried many yet, so don't knownif I just got lucky with the one I chose. Wish there was a voice command to mute the mic. Could be combined with a special phrase or word to unmute, so as to only listen to a special frecuency or pattern to unmute the dot. The only option now is to press the mute button, which limits the places where this device can be placed if you want/need to use this feature frequently.

Title: Keep working on it.....
Body: I bought this just as an alarm clock. We're not talking about Gigabits of computing power here.....Alexa failed miserably at this simple task. Why?  Maybe because if your internet suffers one microsecond of interruption while you are sleeping ...guess what?  No wake up. ....No on board clock or battery backup of any kind apparently.  Got an important wakeup for  a job interview at 8 am and the internet blipped overnight? .....too bad. Really need to rely on Alexa for something important?  Look somewhere else.Best and brightest at Amazon? Really?

Title: Cool but Could be SOOO much better!
Body: It was an incredible pain in the butt to set up. It wants to communicate through my wife's Kindle rathert than it's own speaker. She has to turn off her Kindle. It also refuses to recognize other bluetooth devices such as my speaker system which I can access from all my bluetooth computers, iPhones, iPads etc. We could be listening to high end music but have to listen to the echo which isn't that great. I attempted to find help which in many cases amounts to a chat session, but Amazon isn't doing this, so it's a matter of searching and searching and searching. I'm still trying to figure out how I can get Echo to play through my speaker system. All my devices show my speaker bluetooth receiver except Alexa.

Title: Alexa CAN YOU HEAR ME?!
Body: We got two Alexas February 23 2019. We put one in the the living room and the other in the master bedroom. The one in the living room is on a table at the end of the couch between me and my wife on the other side of the table where she sits in a recliner. We both are only 2 and a half or 3 feet away from it. We are always having to repeat request over and over. And having to yell at Alexa over and over just to turn lights on and off. It is an absolutely constant thing repeating yourself and yelling at Alexa. There have been a few other issues but that is the very worst one.

Title: What exactly is it good for?
Body: I didn_ buy this from Amazon.  We got it free when my wife bought the Ring doorbell camera elsewhere.  It works great, but for the life of me I can_ figure out what I need it for.  Music sounds ok, reads me the news briefing, and tells me my Amazon order is on it_ way ( which I already know).  I have other things that play music much better.What the heck do I need this for? Update, I have plugged it.  Just one more thing taking up Wi-Fi bandwidth.

Title: Works very well with voice commands. I_ impressed with its level of comprehension.
Body: After spending a week in an Echo-rich home, my wife and I fell in love with them. Mainly we listen to music from Amazon or our Sirius XM subscription, but listening to our Flash Briefings, fills in well for our lack of receiving broadcast or cable news.  A quick weather forecast or using them for an intercom rounds out our current uses.We have one in our great room/dining room/kitchen, one in the first-floor master bedroom, one in the second-floor workroom/office, and one in the basement kids playroom.  We_e pretty well covered for our usage.Because the home-automation system from a major big-box lumber store is being discontinued, I_e adopted a new system which works very well with Alexa voice control.  So ultimately Alexa will be doing a lot for us, every day.The three Dots have pretty good music quality, but the big, base unit has surprisingly good sound quality for its size and cost.I have not much negative to say about these units.

Title: Amazon fix
Body: 3/29/2019--it took some time with Amazon support, but they did get it worked out.Worked for about a month, now just two days beyond return, buttons are unresponsive, light ring goes round and round. Reset, reset, works for a few hours, then nothing. 3/1/2019 got an email from Amazon; rep offered assistance and to contact him. Replied to that rep only to be referred to another rep; that was a waste of time amazon echo support-not good. This evening, said Alexa to this "3rd gen" and nothing. Restart, nothing. Can't return. And support said, "reply so I can help you." Replied, "please call someone else." Utter garbage amazon.

Title: A compromise from 2nd Gen Echo, but better speaker
Body: So I started writing a review the other day, good stuff, but my browser crashed So I'll cut to the chase .PROS: 1) More powerful speaker, with lower bass, higher max volume as well (although to preserve the integrity of any speaker you shouldn't use it at it's limit consistently). In fact, if you're used to prior generation Echo Dots, in hearing this one it will be as though the engineers granted Alexa a diaphragm -so it takes some getting used to when you hear her speak, but over-all it's a welcome change.2) Price: is actually more approachable on the newest gen, especially if you purchased at Christmas time 2018 like I did.Annnnd.. that's about it in terms of "better than the last gen". I did notice that it connected more quickly to the WiFi, but that could also be that I'm more used to the app on my phone and the procedure to connect everything the way it was. So on to CONS.CONS: As Amazon I'm sure spent more on R&D as well as more material necessary for this model, the bigger speaker as well as the adapter (what a beast) they probably were thinking some parts needed to be cut to balance the cost. This unit has only 4 mics (down from 16 on the gen 2) and while it's not too terrible, I CAN tell the difference. I find myself talking deeper or raising my projected volume in order for "her" to wake. Sometimes I see the Echo Dot frantically "looking" for the direction of my voice even after waking and getting my request all wrong because it probably wasn't "focused" at the best position to receive instructions. I DO think Amazon could of gotten away with 4 less internal mics, I'm also sure they tested things and got reasonable results and that's what I get "reasonable" not terrible, but not at the level they set the bar with either; which feels like a disappointment.2) It's bigger and heavier and uses more power. This should be expected in going through with a newer generation of the same product especially since most loyal to the product will be doing so for the speaker upgrade. So the only reason I bring this up is because my Echo is mounted from under the cabinet in our kitchen. A clever designer created a plastic mount for the Echo 2nd gen (which fits the 1st gen as well) probably with a CAD program and a makerbot and sells these. They are sold in black and also white (which is my Echo's color so it best matches the kitchen even it you manage to see it). When Amazon changed the physical dimensions, I was forced to purchase a new kit (from the same seller who now had an updated kit for gen 3 Dots). So all this to say: if you're upgrading and it's mounted, you will probably be forced to re-purchase something you thought you already took care of.3) Volume levels. Volume levels are different on this Echo. Typically if you want to change the volume on your Echo you have a manual button on the Echo (which I'm not a big user of). And there is the verbal command "Alexa, volume 6" (levels go from 1 to 10). On the gen 2 Echo Dot when doing this, the Dot would play a short tone at the level that corresponds with "level 6" -just a helpful feature that allows you to estimate where you need to be with what you're listening to. To my knowledge, Gen3 Echo Dot lost this feature. Surely you can still verbally raise or lower the volume, but there is no audio indicator for what "level 6" is out of the 1-10 volumes. I contacted Amazon about this and they "took it as a suggestion for an option on the Alexa app" So thank you, but it was Amazon's idea to add this in the first place -it's just as likely their idea to remove it -so, not holding my breath.4)Power brick. Again it was an inevitability with the bigger speaker. This is the most obvious change to the 3rd gen Dot that most reviewers are upset about. So was I, since it took a good bit of planning to make the 2nd gen dot as hidden as possible while not using some kind of battery to sustain it's power requirements. When I did the math I understood. I didn't like the change, but I do realize it was the cheapest way to satisfy the Dot's requirements to function as advertised. You see, 5V is the max voltage a Micro USB cable can safely carry. Even doubling the cables on one side like some older portable hard drive enclosures used to do to get the twice the power to the device wouldn't get the 12V necessary to run the gen 3 Echo Dot. So you go from a fairly ordinary looking USB A/C adapter/charger to a monsterous looking ..."wall brick?" Which could prove a problem for some users depending on how small the space is in the area they are trying to power their Dot in.So all in all nothing is a deal-breaker for me( I play lots of music from my Dot), however the lesser feature-set confuses me. Amazon built itself on customer service and then later, the ability to purchase almost anything on their platform. They have become a force to look to when considering what sells since they are inventing and selling sometimes "firsts" in technologies. They have even established themselves as reputable technology vendors of products that are at or exceed the level of rival technologies at a reasonable price. So why set the bar and then under-exceed your previous product? As it's said, " Getting to the top is easier than staying on top" I don't believe that was the case this time around. I hope someone over there will read my review and take action to truly exceed the 2nd gen Dot in every way.

Title: Munch better than older model
Body: I have the 2nd generation dot, and the eufy gene. The eufy at the time was much better than the 2nd gen dot, now the 3rd gen dot is way better than both.The first thing you will notice is the sound quality. There is way more volume paired with a quality sound as well.After using for almost a month now the 3rd gen listens so much better with background noise, and listens better in general. With the 2nd gen and eufy if I ask to turn my smart plug on I may have to command 2 or 3 times. The 3rd gen dot does it the 1st time 90% of the time.There are more features then the 2nd gen and the eufy.Amazon made a great step in the right direction with this. My only fault I see with this is the power supply. It does not use a USB connection and has a rather large head to go into the plug. This limits the costomazation of the product if you need a shorter or longer chord. What is in the box is pretty long, and I wish it was only a foot for the location.Over all this is a major step up and I highly recommend!

Title: serves my purposes very well
Body: I bought three of these because the 3rd generation includes an intercom ability. Since then I have found it does a whole lot more. Other than the intercom ability, I use the Dots for instant information and music. The speakers are suitable for most music as I move around the house and pair easily to my blue tooth earphones for excellent sound quality.I'm sure I'll become addicted to it as time goes on. Unfortunately, my dog's name is Lexie, and when I say the command, "Alexa," she looks up expectingly, then when the dot replies, she takes off.

Title: Alexa is my new best friend.
Body: I bought this for my bedroom after receiving an Echo for Christmas. These were the last things I  thought I wanted until I received the gift. I am a senior. It is so easy to use. I use it for reminders, to give myself a morning routine, to acess my Amazon music, get the weather. I have even used it for daily reminders to alter behavior like ordering pizza. I listen to Native Ametican flute music to medidate. To listen to fireplace sounds on chilly days or nights. The dot has just slightly less sound quality than the Echo.

Title: Not Impressed. Very Horse and Buggie.
Body: I am a new first time user. Before making my decision to buy I read several reviews and watched several YouTube videos to educate myself. After receiving it and using it, I think it is over rated. There was nothing easy about the set up of the Alexa app or the Echo Dot. The app took over 30 minutes to download and update. When i plugged the Echo Dot in, Alexa said go the the app and follow the directions. What directions? The app opened and all I saw was the outside temperature and the time. I expected to see a start up screen. I had to find the start up in the menu. The Alexa would not discover and connect to my Wifi even though my phone was connected. The app would just sit and spin and say no internet connection. I was sitting 3 feet away from my modem/router. After trying over and over again I finally had to set it up manually. The same thing with my new Vizio Smart TV. I had to call Vizio technical support and get help with that.  The only thing this does with my tv is to turn it on and off. It always comes up with the Amazon Prime and I could care less about that. Now if I want full tv function I have to buy a Firestick. The Alexa app does not recognize Netflix, or YouTube, and many other social media outlets. Very limited. I have a new HP laptop with blue tooth and Alexa or my laptop will not discover each other.  Trying to get the Alexa app on my laptop is just an endless circle with the app asking for my phone number to send it to my phone. I don't think the sound quality is all that great so I added a Vivitar Bluetooth speaker. Alexa did discover that and the sound quality is much better. I tried to plug in a set of Logitech speakers, that worked but Alexa then disconnected from the Bluetooth speaker.  Very limited in it's capabilities. I live in a 900 sq ft apartment. If I want to use Alexa I have to move the speaker from room to room or buy more speakers.Alexa is very Victorian and prudish in her limited answers and almost boring. She has no sense of humor and her jokes are rather juvenile and corny. The developers must be very boring people and limited in creativity. This is nothing but a glorified toy. Alexa grow up.  I am an adult and live in the real world. If you don't want to hear swear words or talk about sexuality then put on more filters. Get real. If we can't have open honest conversation with real answers about anything then what is the point?Most of the things this does I can do on my phone and more.  Setting timers, making lists, searching for trivia, printing documents, searching websites...The is a money pit. If I wanted to turn my apartment into a smart home then I would need a smart hub, smart switches, smart receptacles, smart light bulbs, more speakers, more Echo Dots, etc.  This all seams very expensive, limited, archaic and horse and buggy. But is has to start someplace.

Title: great sound but Very hard to enable all the skills except for the very basics.
Body: It has great sound quality for such a small device. Got it  on sale for $29. Would_e been pissed if I paid 50 for this.  It seems like it has a lot of skills.  But trying to get them all to work is another story. It is very complicated to set up the skills to get your TV to work with it or your Amazon fire stick to work properly with that. Anything but setting up the very basics is extremely difficult at least for me it is so I would assume for others it is to . Right now the only thing I can do with it is play music call and text my friends ask weather and turn on tv. If I ask to  launch Netflix or something like that forget it it always says I don_ know how to do that one time and then the very next time it_l do it and I had made no changes so what_ going on here. Please simplify your products Amazon. Just like the only music I can play from this device is Amazon music. I really wanted to buy your second generation echo deluxe is with the woofer I believe it was about 350 Dollars but when I discovered all I could do is play music from Amazon forget it why can_ I play music from my sources. I believe for this reason you were losing a great amount of sales.

Title: Helpful But...
Body: I always wanted an Alexa to help me with waking up, playing music, and keeping me on schedule. And she does do that however, there aren't many things you can do without being a prime member. To listen to music you need either apple music or amazon music. I thought maybe it would allow me to link my music that I download from the iTunes store but I can only use the apple music (which I don't have). I'm not a prime member and I don't have any special subscription. I was just a bit disappointed with the lack of things you can do without paying for subscriptions that's all.

Title: Much Better Sound Than 2nd Gen
Body: I use these dots around the house in smaller rooms (bathroom, kitchen, etc), and the larger Echos in the big common rooms.  And I have some off-brand devices in bedrooms that work just like these.  Obviously the sound is better on the $150 ones, but it's not 6 times better!  These can be had for $25 if you watch for sales and at that price point the sound is really great!  I do recommend that you read up on the various mounting options that are available.  For instance, in my master bathroom I bought a recessed wall mount (yes, I cut a 4.5" round hole in the wall and installed a plastic box inside it, ran the cable down the wall and out the other side to a plug, and then put a grate over it so you see a speaker grate with lights dancing behind it on the wall).  In my other bathroom, I have a plug mount so it hangs down from the plug with an integrated look!  The kitchen one is glued to the underside of a cabinet so you can't see it.  It's a smart home system without a ton of work or expense.  And I'm just starting to dabble in smart switches and plugs.....

Title: Good, but need some improvements
Body: I bought these because I wanted a few speakers to listen to music, audiobooks, etc. at home. My apartment isn_ terribly big, so three speakers are sufficient. And they work fine as long as you are working with an Alexa-compatible app (Amazon music, audible, etc.), but if you_e streaming from another app (for example, the app I use to download audiobooks from my library), it is confusing and frustrating. I can_ get it to play on all speakers at the same time. Sometimes it will let me change the speaker with relative ease as I move from room to room, but usually it_ a big production. There_ no reason for that-except that it _ncourages you to use amazon services. _And perhaps the most frustrating thing is that Alexa won_ answer troubleshooting questions about her. She tells you to go to the _elp section in the app.

Title: Nicer than the old ones
Body: first of all when I tried to order them they were out of stock and I'm back order however I did receive it in the time specified. I would also like to add is that the new 3rd Generation Echo Dot has a heavier bass sound to it but unlike the first and second generation the 3rd Generation has audio settings on the Alexa app which is outstanding. It is of course a bit larger than the old generation dots and it seems to pick up voice commands much easier over music that is playing from it because that was a problem that I had with the old generation dots. I would recommend that their Generations over the first or second easily and I did it using the trade-in program provided by Amazon.

Title: A needed item in your house!
Body: We are getting use to Alexa. Quick with answers to your questions or requests.We'll come into the room where she is and sometimes she is singing or spouting offsome wikipedia information we never asked for. Only concern is the listening 24/7 toour conversations. My understanding is that information is recorded and used byAmazon for reference selling in the future. "Privacy is gone!" Yes, I'm concerned, and,am telling "Alexa" to STOP many times a day now. Hope they stop using our informationwithout our permission.

Title: Instant information.  Just ask Alexa
Body: I can ask for a weather report, a news update or a specific song and Alexa will provide it instantly.  Also, I an using it to turn lights on and off.  Ask for a joke and you'll get one . If you don't think it 's funny , say so and you will a better one.Hooked up to your internet, this can replace your clock, radio, stereo, and many other items such as a dictionary,

Title: Maximized audio playback with minimized space
Body: The 3rd generation Echo Dot rivals the sound quality of significantly larger and many times more expensive speakers.A true breakthrough in audio streaming quality, it reduces the space needed to the equivalent of a single wall outlet.This enhancement virtually restricts the earlier generations of the Echo Dot and Spot to command only functions.To be clear, you can still stream music on the older generations; you just won't want to after hearing the 3rd Gen Echo.

Title: Awaiting more advancements
Body: It's okay. Like a lot of technology manufactured by Amazon it has it's limitations. Always surprised that the limitations are things that other brands seemed to have accomplished, but Amazon is lagging behind on. Of course Amazon's response is always that they 'are working hard to bring those advancements.' For example, you can't change the voice, yet you can with a Google device and I can with a GPS I've had for oven 10 years. Amazon may want to consider working a tad bit harder.

Title: Looks nicer but not bowled over.
Body: I love my Alexa devices. But I feel this one is less sensitive (just barely noticeable, but it is) to voice, and the sound  is not any great change. I think I may like the second generation better. This third generation looks better and feels less cheap, though it is a little bigger if you have wall mounts for old ones. I have decided not to replace my other 2nd generation models for now. Do go for it when there are good sales though.

Title: Doesn't work well.
Body: I've had three Echo Dot 3's for over 3 months. Not a day goes by when at least one of them gives me problems. It seems like it's been getting worse lately. It tells me it can't connect to the internet right now, but I have fast internet and a good router. The Echos are the only things that have problems connecting. When I use the Alexa phone app, it works almost instantly. The Echo dots have a delay.When I tell it to turn something off, it tells me that device doesn't support that. But it does, Alexa. I use you to turn it off every day.Going to buy a Google home. Hopefully that works better.

Title: Quality control issues, second replacement.
Body: This is the second Echo Dot that I will have to return for sound distortion. Our first lasted about two months before the sound all of a sudden was distorted and staticky. We never have the sound above 50% so I know it's not because of having it up too loud. I was disappointed that they replaced my first echo dot with a refurbished one. Now that one (which is less than two months old) is having the same issue. Not worth the price.

Title: Meh... it still can't fetch the newspaper
Body: 3rd gen blah blah blah. Not much new in terms of functionality, though I believe they did add bluetooth low energy capability to this version, maybe some improvements to the speaker also.I suppose it's worth the price if you're new to the smartspeaker market, but as an upgrade from an older version I'd say wait until it comes with a transporter... Not much to write home about otherwise.

Title: Love my echo dot!
Body: After much debate, i finally broke down and invited Alexa into my home via 2 of these echo dots. i cannot believe how handy they are and i have become slightly dependent on them lol. The audio on these little things is quite impressive, they rival my bose speakers. at full volume i can listen to music from all the way across my 2000 square foot house! Its listening capabilities are so good that it can hear me in my normal speaking voice from across the room. i have had to be care full because it will start asking me what i said when addressing my daughter (Alyssa). i am now in the market for more of the line like the Ring and smart plugs, im hooked!

Title: Bluethooth doesn_ work- drops WiFi Updated
Body: New yes, improved NO... I bought two of these because I wanted to upgrade from the echo 2. They both have issues with Bluetooth connectivity and a bunch of glitches white noise, not responding, dropping WiFi too many to list you get my point. The speaker is a bit louder which is positive but it doesn_ work half the time. It_ dissapointing that Amazon would release such an unpolished product. I would wait until amazon releases another or just purchase the echo dot 2nd gen.UPDATE: After I moved my Bluetooth speaker away from the echo dot the Bluetooth grabbed strength. It might be an interference between signals not sure but the dot works... it sometimes requires an unplug here and there but that_ all electronics.

Title: Fun to have but seem to crap out eventually.
Body: To start off I received and amazon echo one of the first generations for free from my bank which caused a ripple effect of me buying one of the dots to have in another room. Slowly they just started getting slower and slower so I ordered two of these around Christmas time to replace my older ones and put the older ones where I wouldn't use them as much. Well one is still going pretty strong but the other one has a blown speaker. Yes they have been up pretty loud but not so much that it should've blown it. I guess I just have bad luck with these hopefully you'll have better luck with them than I.

Title: Great device! An actual updated device!
Body: Typically now a days it seems like tv's games phones etc always has some sort of quick redundent thing/upgrade without actually having any sort of update. As with the model prior to this one these devices are great. updated model definitely has a huge difference in sound loudness and qualityn which is great. One thing that i was hoping to see this time around was some sort of stand alone power and or battery having to stay plugged is a majordr's i mean come on the device alone stands out for future tech all together so not having that cordless compatibilty seems a bit odd to me but im hoping to see it next time around!

Title: Useful but technology not all the way there yet
Body: I love this smart little thing! But I honestly always forget I have Alexa until she reminds me to take my medicine or wakes me up in the morning with the gentle alarms I schedule. She's only struggled once to connect to the internet. The Alexa app could use some work since it's hard to find what you want and doesn't have everything available in the routines app. Like when I say "Alexa, good morning" I have her respond with traffic conditions to work and the weather for the day. But I can't add the reminder to take my medicine so I have to make that separate at the same time everyday which sucks since I don't say good morning Alexa at the same time every day. I also work at two different locations so I'm unable to get the traffic and weather for one of the two locations since there is no option for a second workplace address in the app and what days to set it at. She also could be more friendly to comments about mental health issues from users.

Title: I love her annoying butt
Body: Her butt is annoying sometimes because she be saying the darnest thing like destroy all humans and how siri is a gold digging whor.. For real though she really cool. echo be in my room blasting toons and telling me the time when i'm to lazy to check. She has some cool apps you can download such as Gordan Ramsey flaming your food and face. My girlfriend and my friend love her too. Sometime it feels like they visit just for her :( . Anyways if you in the market for a good Bluetooth speaker/radio/ Friend she your go to BAE. Don't tell my girlfriend I wrote this or she will destroy me.

Title: Piece of Junk
Body: after contacting amazon about their "wonderful alexa" I've deceided to contact better business bureau and consumer protection,,,,,,amazon so badly wants you to buy their product however they LACK in customer service.  Alex will NOW NOT play from my pandora account,,,,,,really dont care for amazon music, or prime music not a fan........PLEASE by the google speaker, you'll be happier

Title: so much fun!
Body: I never knew I could get so addicted to a gadget like this, but I have! so easy to hook up - even easier to use and a lot of fun adding skills to it for entertainment. I can see this being very handy for people who live alone because theres so many things to keep  you entertained and as a sort of back up for personal safety because of how you can call people thru it - imagine falling and not being able to get up and needing help n possibly not having a phone within reach - just ask Alexa to call a friend on your contact list. I just love this and my only regret is not getting one much sooner

Title: We have four dots now - and an old echo in the garage
Body: Although we are not Alexa power users these have been nice.  I have them all over the house and they mostly get used to turn certain lights on and off and to play music "everywhere", kind of a wireless intercom system.  My wife listens to her favorite radio station on Echo.We have played around a bit with using Alexa in the kitchen step through recipes and it makes a great timer.  I use it in the garage to verbally add fractions when I am woodworking and to convert fractions to millimeters or back.

Title: Alexa OK but not Smart!
Body: I love this little dot.. because she reads to me my audio books.  Alexa is good for asking the weather or time... And She is Great when I ask her to call someone.  BUT she is really dumb... "Ok Google" is must smarter than Alexa.. When I ask a more complicated question like!!!!!!! Alexa How long do I cook wings in my air fryer... She always says hmmmm I don't l know that one.  But if I open my android and say ok google ... same question.. I get an immediate answer.

Title: The Dot is pretty cool
Body: I love Alexa, sure she gets on my nerves at times because you have to word things a certain way for her to understand but she_ still great. I took a star away because I got this for my sister & I have the echo 2nd generation & for whatever reason the dot can barely hear us in the same room but mine hears us 20 ft away. She picks & chooses when she wants to hear us. I have to put mine on DND when she is using hers because it assumes she_ talking to it even though it_ 2 rooms over.

Title: Nice device to enter the home automation era
Body: This was my first Echo device. After delving into the home automation scene I later purchased a Echo Plus and another Dot. My wife listens to music a lot on it and the Echo Plus went in the main family room. I moved the original Dot to my bedroom and the 3rd one when in the basement. I don't see the need in anymore at this time. I haven't had a problem getting any manufacture's devices to connect and work well that advertise compatibility with Alexa.

Title: Not Impressed
Body: Thought this would be a great purchase but found that they are more useless than useful. We purchased the 3rd generation after returned two 2nd generations that did not work well at all. We constantly were unplugging and plugging back in when the Echo would tell us that they weren't able to connect, or how it couldn't understand us. We would ask to play music and it would begin, and say playing such and such music from spotify, then nothing. It would cancel itself... I returned the 2nd generation and purchased the 3rd. Got them all set up and doing really well for the first few months but now we are having the same exact problems. The echo will turn red and it will delete items on our shopping lists... it would respond or stop mid saying something. Also, it will turn on sometimes when nothing else is going on.

Title: Good for baby's room
Body: Our daughter's room is very close to the rest of our home, so we like to play some white noise to cancel out any of the TV noise while she sleeps. After doing some research, we couldn't find a noise machine for kids that we liked at a reasonable cost, so we bought the Echo Dot. This thing is great - it plays white noise, lullaby sounds, whatever works for your kid. I can talk to my Echo in the living room and turn it off/on without having to go into my daughter's room, adjust volume on my phone, etc. The speaker on it isn't anything special but it serves its purpose.The only thing I don't like is how it sometimes cuts out in the middle of the night. I assume this has to do with a loss in Internet connection but I am not sure. A lot of noise machines work on timers, so having something that could play all night was big for us.What I like the most about using the Echo Dot as a noise machine is that, when my daughter gets older, I can still use it, instead of storing it away with the other baby stuff. For >$50 bucks (goes on sale quite often), you can't go wrong.

Title: Works great
Body: good voice recognition controls and adaptability, it's really intuitive. I don't have a handbook of commands but I did learn a dozen or so just from playing around now I know about 50 the real key comes in the syncing of different apps to give it more abilities calendar checking and basically working as your assistant. While some of the commands I think are a bit long winded like "Alexa tell xbox to press a button" or the find my phone feature that makes you spue out your phone number without any breaks as you would normally have. The verbile vomit can be a bit annoying but the power in it is worth the price.

Title: Work great as a stereo pair with an Echo Sub.
Body: I ordered two of these thanks to a SiriusXM promotion and set them up as a stereo pair with my Echo Sub. The sound this pair makes is better than the original Echo (beta testing version) I had set up before. The 3rd gen dot has much better sound quality for music than the 1st and 2nd generation dots also.They were very easy to setup using the Alexa app on iPhone. Something that might help you in the future; push and hold the action button until the ring turns orange to put an echo in setup mode.

Title: Worth the price of admission to upgrade
Body: We own several of the 2nd Generation Echo Dots and love them. After plugging in this 3rd Gen, I can honestly say I love it even more! It has a much richer sound and seems to have a better ability of picking up my voice. My 2 year old son is even able to get her to respond to him, which doesn_ happen on the older generation devices we own. Definitely worth the price and would even consider upgrading the older devices so the whole house audio skill I have set up will sound even better than it currently does.

Title: Blows away the competition
Body: I purchased two of these for my sons at Christmas.  We already had a Google Mini at home I received for free and they loved the concept.Let me just say that there is no comparison in the microphones, responsiveness, and most importantly, the speaker sound.  The microphones pick up from other levels of the house.  The sound is double that of the Mini.  The speed of the processors and response is about instant.  I love the product and I am looking into other amazon speakers to replace the Mini.

Title: Big improvement in sound from Generation Two
Body: I have two gen 2 Dots, and use them frequently.  But never for music.  The sound quality was just too lousy for that (I'm spoiled - we have Sonos in our home).  This Gen 3 has much much better sound quality.  In a pinch, I do use it for music.  Looks nicer, too.I do wish Amazon would have an alternative voice.  Those who have hearing loss can usually hear lower tones more easily - we need a MALE Alexa voice, PLEASE!

Title: Echo Dot changed my life
Body: I am the type to honestly purchase new electronics and end up selling them because of lack of use. Not with my Echo Dot. I purchased this alongside two Kasa plug in outlets that are compatible. My first smart home electronics. I set it up right away. I have been using echo dot (Alexa) for a few months and it has changed my life. From the simplest thing to turning on and off my light and water cooler and setting and disabling alarms for me, it has made the little things just so much easier and FAST. I don_ want to waste the time to turn on my PC to play music while I get ready in the morning so I will just tell it to play a certain artist and genre, and it_ does so quickly. I struggle with insomnia from time to time, so some nights I ask for it to play sleep music, and it has such a good selection when it plays it for me. I absolutely love this device as a 19 year old open to using electronics for different purposes, and I am excited to find out the other skills and uses the device has! Thank you for creating this!

Title: Thank you Alexa...
Body: I bought this and a smart plug for a lamp that I could not reach. Alexa has been such a help turning the light on and off whenever asked. My granddaughter also loves this as well because she can request songs to put on a dance show for us. She also loves to check her math with it by asking for answers to confirm if she's right. It's always fun to thank Alexa after she does something for us because you never know her response, you're welcome, sure things, etc. Might have to get more of these for other rooms in the house.

Title: The Echo Dot support team scammed me out of $450.00
Body: I called in for help when I couldn't get the set up done.  Was directed to a Mr. Mike Harvey who proceeded to tell me my system had a major virus. He said he could correct that issue. He needed to access my computer and Amazon Account. He said because I was such a good customer I won a $100 gift card.  He just needed me to complete the CC number to apply the card to. Instead he bought 3 - $50 cards and sent them to another email address.  He then accessed my email and AMAZON account - deleted all transaction notification and removed them from Deleted and Archive history. I asked him why he did that and he said they were just taking up space.  I told him to put them back, but did not. He was going to update my anti virus.  I got 3 $100 Google Play cards that he said would be reimbursed 75% after the program was installed. Well no program and not reimbursement.  And I still can't use my DOTS. I am very upset and discussed that AMAZON would have that sort of business going on.  I have contacted my bank to file a dispute claim.

Title: Improved version of the already brilliant 2nd gen. Echo Dot, excluding the mic.
Body: Summary:The third generation of the Amazon Echo Dot smart speaker is better in many aspects from the already brilliant Echo Dot 2nd generation. Only one thing really bothered me about it, which is the built-in microphone, which appears to be inferior to the previous model.Since I already own the Amazon Echo Dot 2nd generation and the Google Home Mini, these are the comparison benchmarks that I can relate to in my review.The sound that comes out from the Echo Dot 3rd generation is pleasant to the human ears.
