It isn't meant to replace a true speaker if you plan to listen to quality audio, but it is adequate for background music in a small space (such as a room).As for how it's like compared to my benchmark smart speakers - The 3rd gen's sound is better compared to the Amazon Echo 2nd generation, and in certain aspects, it is better than the Google Home Mini.In my opinion, the Google Home Mini offers a more balanced sound and better "mid" range, while the Echo Dot 3rd generation has better bass and more impactful "surround" sound.The 3rd generation Echo Dot is louder than the 2nd generation and the Google Home Mini. While testing the Echo Dot 3rd generation, I've placed the device in one specific room, and the maximum volume level sounded too much for this space (3x4 meters). So though the audio quality sounds great, and there's not that much of a distortion, I prefer not to set the device to its maximum volume level.What I did is to set the 3rd gen to volume level 7, and it is about as equal as the Google Home Min at 100% volume level.If the Echo Dot 2nd generation looks like a hockey puck, then the 3rd generation looks like a stylish & sophisticated donut.It's larger & heavier compared to the previous model, but it's hard to go wrong which one is the newer model.Since the Echo Dot is Amazon's most affordable smart home speaker, it's good that Amazon offers it for about the same price.I purchased it during Black Friday/Cyber Monday 2018 when it was relatively new, for $23 (as part of a deal that included 3 units for $69). It's not always offered for this price, and Amazon should have the interest to keep the price low, but I still appreciate the fact that Amazon didn't raise the price of the intelligent device compared to the 2nd generation's price.For some reason, I never used the Bluetooth capabilities of my 2nd generation Echo Dot and Google Home Mini. In fact, I totally forgot they exist...That's why I was glad to "re-discover" this so obvious feature is available on the Echo Dot 3rd generation - And it works well with my other devices!Right from the start, I suspected that the newer model is less responsive. At first, I thought that the increased volume level prevents what I say to be heard. Every time I talk to the device, I test if it can hear my voice  sometimes I whisper, other times I talk while there_ music playing in the background, and I_ quite sure the built-in mic isn_ improved compared to the previous model.I think the main reason why Alexa misses some of the things I'm saying stems from the fact that the 2nd generation Echo Dot had a 7-microphone array, while the newer model has 4 microphones.The 3rd generation Echo Dot is powered using a power adapter. I don't mind the power adapter takes more space compared to the USB cable that energized the previous model, but I guess that as a result of the improvements in the audio/volume/size of the newer model, it consumes more power (15W compared to 9W), than the Echo Dot 2nd generationOverall, it seems that Amazon understands its customer_ needs and managed to improve the new Echo Dot so it would offer more features & better quality for about the same price range.Please note I attached to this review screenshots + a video review I made about my experience with the Amazon Echo Dot 3rd generation.The pros:- Improved audio quality compared to the previous model.- Higher volume level compared to my benchmark device.- Stylish design.- Price remains attractive.- Bluetooth connection.The cons:- It is less responsive compared to the 2nd generation of the Amazon Echo Dot.- Bluetooth connection.- The device consumes more energy compared to the 2nd generation.****FAQ :****If you have any, please do ask and I will do my best to answer them.

Title: It's a nice start, may work well someday.
Body: My real motivation to get the Dot was to create a connected music system. I have two of them, connected as a "group", each connected to Edifier 1200T powered speaker systems, which are in turn powered by Dot controlled outlets. The quality of sound now is far higher than the little bluetooth speakers, even though I have a couple of nice ones.The system Will consistently will turn on both outlets by automated "routines" or on command when calling for my "upstairs group", it won't though consistently execute my routine to play music on that group, but often only starts one set of speakers (we typically have well over 20 Mps internet). We don't typically walk around the house shouting commands at each other, so the voice interface is unnatural. I had hoped that the Alexa app might be useful for things like searching for music, but it doesn't have a search function besides again shouting commands it doesn't understand anyway.One of the most irritating things is that if it does start music, it may play 3 or 4 songs but then just stops. This is NOT an intelligent system, but rather a command line interface. It only understands exact pre-programmed instructions and figures nothing out based on AI. The voice command system is largely an exercise in futility as a search system, and Amazon's song selection and list creation isn't that great (and yes I'm a premium music subscriber). You can ask it to bring up your Pandora or Spotify lists, but adding longer strings of commands that way, then trying to get it to remember to play on both members of the group? No.If I do get the music group going, you can't ask it to change stations without losing one room or the other.  It frequently loses one room or the other, although the laggard will generally come back with the next song.So it is a nice gee wiz, and yes, I can sometimes get it to play the music I want in two rooms simultaneously. I like that my phone isn't tied up by a bluetooth connection, but frankly, my net result is generally better with bluetooth. I guess I should have sprung for a Sonos system, although that was going to be a lot more money.Bottom line, I'm  suffering from buyers remorse.  I have nice sound systems in two rooms. I can't say that I have a multi room setup.

Title: Way better than previous Dots!
Body: The original and second gen Dot was a total bargain and pretty handy to have around in places you just wanted another alexa point. This 3rd gen Dot is however, fantastic - I use mine in the bathroom for when Im getting ready and want to hear the news or listen to music while I get ready and shower, etc. Before I could barely hear the speaker over the faucet running, hair dryer or shower noise - this new one is much louder but also better quality sound. It is a bit bigger which is not a concern for me.If I had a bigger place I would totally consider getting another for the bedroom at some point but between this in the bathroom and the echo plus in the livingroom I am pretty happy.For the price, you really cant lose. Enjoy !!

Title: She's impressive.
Body: Alexa has changed my life, a little. But a good change. I bought the plugs and and a WiFi light bulb that changes color in an old antique globe lamp that was losing it's paint from wear now it can be red without paint chips, or green, or pink. I also bought the firesticks to enable to pause and playback on my television with Alexa. Okay I know it sounds a bit lazy, but when your hands are full like say eating while watching TV, it is great.  I can control most of my home with my voice. Maybe lazy, but I say efficient. You can also turn your lights on from anywhere else while on vacation to make the appearance that your home for security. There is also an app that plays iheart radio while I'm gone and keeps background noise for my dog. If I had to pick something to complain about, I wish you could pick your own wake word or she knew you were talking about her as opposed to her. Tiffany Hadish made her play Janet Jackson on Nobody's Fool, which was kinda funny the first time, but I could see it getting old hat. You'll also notice your eyes will glance across the room seeing if she lights up to unwantingly take part in your conversation, when you say her name casually like you accidently said the name of the person your gossiping about and they might be in earshot and heard you. But she's fun to have around the house. Timers are a lifesaver as well as even asking her the time.  Games like SongQuiz are awesome that's has all generations of my family playing along, family game night is back and you don't have to clean up thimbles and fake money when it's over. She even tells me when my packages are at the mail box so I know my mail came. I use the lists for many of things, things I need for different projects at my house or for a trip the grocery store. I love Alexa she's awesome! Also an interactive kids tv show with an animated Alexa might be cool.

Title: Great satellite for the Alexa system
Body: I purchased Echo Dot to add to my existing Alexa-based smart home system. The integration was simple and easy. Because of the proximity of the main Alexa unit, I had to change the default wakeup name from Alexa to Echo. Using the Alexa app, that was not a problem. The smaller speaker doesn't quite have the same music fidelity as its larger sibling, but it's not bad. And it's nice to have an extension to the smart home commands. I plan to purchase additional Echo Dots to provide coverage throughout the house.

Title: 2nd Gen VS 3rd Gen
Body: 3rd Gen: slightly larger but not so much as to create a space issue if you are replacing 1st or 2nd Gen.  Also, it has "cloth" which may not be as easy to wipe clean but I personally don't touch my unit much... so no accidental cheetoes finger prints left behind. The upgrade to this unit is most definitely in sound quality and volume. I recommend the 3rd generation.

Title: Con limitaciones para uso en español
Body: El echo dot tiene una construcción y desempeño sobresalientes:  Pequeño, con buen sonido, el anillo de luz da retroalimentación útil y puede usarse un parlante alternativo por cable o bluetooth; el asistente (Alexa) en español es competente y no tan mecánico como el de GoogleHome. Si bien el uso en español es posible y útil, tiene limitaciones asociadas con restricciones asociadas a la tienda en que se compra (la de EEUU, México o España dan acceso a conjuntos diferentes de skills de Alexa; por ejemplo en la de EEUU no es posible habilitar algunos servicios de noticias que sí están disponibles en la de España) y a la pobre oferta de interfaces en español o para mercados fuera de EEUU  de algunas aplicaciones limitando su valor (por ejemplo, no he podido hacer la integración con Harmony Hub, pues al usar el Echo dot fuera de EEUU no se habilita el uso del skill).

Title: Won't reconnect automatically to wi-fi network after loss of power - fixed!
Body: "Of all my wi-fi devices this is the only one that would not reconnect automatically to the home wireless network after any type of disconnect. Every time you re-plug it at new home location, lose power or the like, the thing is at loss and wants you to go through a setup routine anew, smart?"Above was my original reaction. After weeks and multiple trials, frustrated, I posted a one star review, got call from Amazon on my voicemail next day with an offer to help, came home and plugged the thing in again (just to make sure it still did not work before I called back) - and it worked! Miracle, don't know what to think.  In disbelief I tried few times more.Went back into the setting, found a suggestion to allow Amazon to store a wi-fi password so new devices could be connected automatically. Was it a privacy issue then and my Echo did not save the key first time(s)? Then how had it been fixed w/o my intervention - a mystery. Don't understand what's wrong with saving wi-fi passwords in the device's some sort of non-volatile memory on a first setup, as apparently all my other devices like cameras/speakers/tv do. Unless the device is not secure maybe? Never thought of that, what about cameras? Anyway, problem solved, not an issue anymore.Thanks!

Title: Sounded great at first! After the first month...
Body: After the first month... the speaker almost sounds blown? I haven't been listening to very loud music on it either. It almost sounds as if, I'm listening to a radio station that isn't quite tuned in. Static or blown... IDK... I've tried unplugging it, reconnecting it to the wifi and completely resetting it. I need to contact Amazon and see if they will send me a new one. Sound quality is better than the other generation dots, I've seen. It just sounds blown now.

Title: Stops Playing
Body: I was very excited to receive my Echo Dot but have quickly learned that it isn't all that it is made out to be. Nine times out of ten, any channel i try to play only works for a short amount of time, if at all and then quits and I know it isn't our wireless internet which is working fine for everything else. It is a worthless item on my kitchen counter.

Title: A little disappointed but I would still recommend it as it_ fairly inexpensive
Body: I like that I can command Alexa to turn on Sirius radio and play certain games that aren_ available on my google I home mini. The Trivia games are pretty enjoyable.  However,  I am somewhat disappointed.  Even after going through the steps to eliminate it, alexa seems to struggle to understand me sometimes.  I will command Alexa to turn on a music channel and when she can_ seem to figure it out i just give up and have the google home mini play it instead.  The mini understands the same command that the dot does not.  I would bet that the echo dot can get louder than my google mini but i don_ know because the volume never needs to be loud. Especially living in a townhome with a shared wall.  the quality of the sound is poor at the  low level we use it on.  I feel like the bass needs to be turned down and the treble needs to be up at that low level because it_ not clear.  For that reason I struggle to understand it as well.  All in all it_ a decent little piece of equipment and should provide  entertainment well worthy the cost.

Title: Service Rip-Off.
Body: Okay so here's the deal. This is the fourth Amazon Echo I have purchased for my household and business.  I thought it would be great everyone can listen when they want to.  There is a fee you pay each month, on top of the purchase price.BUTBut they Don't tell you is if you want to listen to more than one device at a time- even if I'm at work and someone is at home, you have to pay an extra $240 a year.You Get that?Two.Hundred.FortyDollars.

Title: Fun device to play around with
Body: I bought this to play music trivia with myself since I live alone.  It's fun to do that and I have only begun to scratch the surface of its apps and capabilities.  I like that it reminds me to do things and gives me the weather, Amazon notifications, and trivia for the day.  Unfortunately, it is not compatible with my surround sound system that is throughout the house.  I was hoping that the music could play through those speakers rather than it.

Title: Audio sounds like it's covered by a blanket
Body: These devices have EQ settings, which was good to discover, but even with the treble maxed, the bass all the way down, and the mids set for best clarity, the audio is muffled. I have $10 radios that sound better. The music is so so. The voice sounds like it's talking through a pillow.We do enjoy these devices for some things - music at dinner, "flash briefings" in the morning, and occasional time and weather checks. It's rare to check traffic but it seems to work well.What prompted this review was something I read somewhere that said the audio was better if you ordered premium service. I don't know what that's about - I'm already paying for Prime, I guess now Prime has it's own audio version of Prime, for more money, and I can see where Amazon is going with this.The audio stinks. The device is nothing but a paper weight without audio, and they designed the audio to stink. And if you want improved audio, you have to pay extra? Seriously?

Title: An amendment to my earlier review.  Re.  Home Automation.
Body: I alternate between being awestruck and total frustration.  It depends on hat you wish to do.I have to admit I find the technology to be very interesting.  The book I read on it led me to believe that I had to go through some sort of Voice Training exercise to get this to recognize and respond to my voice.  I found his not to be the case as both me and my wife no had difficulty in communicating with her.  She seems to have quite a range of things that she can answer and I often find myself thanking her and later realizing she probably doesn't care.Some very pleasant surprises like the fact that I can tell her a word and she can give me the proper spelling, very handy for one who cannot spell worth a hoot.  Weather reports, major events, time of day, setting alarms and timers are among the many useful things she can do.  Got a song you like or want to hear a joke she can do that.  She takes the moral high ground so don't ask for anything X Rated.  It is truly impressive what she can do!But there is a down side to this.  Many of these issues may have solutions however you will need to be much sharper than this old duck.My first concern is for security.  It is a well known fact that she will occasionally get initiated for no apparent reason.  Then there is the fact that I wanted to get local traffic information so I gave here my location and Cell Phone number.  I was taken back to find that she had ingested all my contact information without asking!  I am not sure where Alexa stores her scripts however I would not be surprised  to find it on the Cloud some place (for my money nothing there is secure!).But since it is such a neat deal we sorta glance the other way and overlook many of those issues.  My next great heartbreak is when we decide to utilize it as the Voice Interface for some home automation.  I have managed to get a few things to respond to my voice commands however this road is long and filled with many potholes.Our first pothole came when I was trying to install the Alexa Software.  Originally I had intended to install it on my iMac however I could not get the software to install.  I was able to get some assistance and the first thing the man told me was to install it on my iPad (I would be willing to bet there are some issues with the Mac version).  We began that process and immediately ran into problems.  I have to own up to not checking out the router settings as it will not install on anything other than the 2.4 g router setting.  Once we switched the router the installation went rather smoothly.We began our home automation adventure with the Starter Kit from Sengled.  It is a very good deal with a couple of lights and and Bridge.  However there were some installation  and compatibility issues.  A common thread with most of this Home Automation stuff is that it is not very intuitive and there are no help options in the software.  The bridge will allow you to add quite a few lights however they get pretty pricey (this is where they catch up).  Now if you think there is any compatibility among the different manufacturers you have another thing coming.Bought some other wifi enabled lights and found I needed to install another app!  At last count I have eight different apps running in my home automation group on my I pad.Wireless things that were already on line don't appear to be discoverable and this is also an issue.Now we have something that was intended to tie all this stuff together however this also seems to be a bit of a train wreck.  It is called IFTTT and it was suppose to allow all these different devices to work together.  I have been able to use a few of these widgets however I find myself powerless to deal with them.  The Alexa Software says that some of them are there however I have little control over when and how they execute!  You are suppose to be able to script them and have multiple widgets run from a simple voice command however it looks like this may require another app and that may only run on my phone.  There is little help available for IFTTT since it is suppose to be a no brainer (guess where that leaves me).It appears that the Hype far exceeds the reality.  This would make a fine hobby for some nerd however I find that fun just keeps coming.There could be a few more stars available but some one will need to show me of that intuitive stuff they have been hiding.An Update regarding home automation.  It should be worth noting If you want to use Alexa fore home automation.Saturday 27 July there was a wide spread internet outage that affected large parts of the Northwest.  At first I did not think much about it until I began asking Alexa to do things.  Her response was that there was a problem and I should go to the Help Menu in the Alexa app.  The did not work as did any of the items I wished to control through Alexa.If you loose your internet connection Alexa will cease to function.  She will direct you to the help menu in the Alexa App.  So if you suffer frequent outages this may not be the home automation app for you!

Title: Not as good as old DOT...
Body: We wanted a second DOT do we could have music everywhere. So since we were ordering another, we decided to order the latest model. The DOT arrived earlier than promised. A definite plus!!!It just seems like it runs slower than our first DOT. And it keeps disconnecting from our WiFi. Our other DOT doesn_ do that.Plus we really like the way the older DOT can lower volume by spinning the ring. I don_ have to see which arrow I have to tap is. The new DOT has arrows. I know I can lower by voice command, but sometimes doing it manually is quicker to get it just right!Plus the _abric cover on the new DOT is harder to keep clean. Dust shows much more on the new DOT than the old DOT.I think the old DOT is the one we prefer. Wish I had saved the box and such to send new DOT back and order an older model.

Title: It_ an Alexa - what do you really want to know? Lol
Body: My voice is getting sore from yelling at her- if music is loud she can_ hear you talking to her. Still issues with  connectivity from another room . Once again- yelling to turn off my smart lights and outlets . Sound quality still isn_ great when playing music- not near as loud as I would like but hey it_ a speaker that fits in the palm of my hand- lol...great for alarms, reminders, news, weather, really about anything you want- just like any other search engine .  She_ still getting use to my voice commands as I seem to be yelling a lot..ughhh...doesn_ understand me or does wrong command.  Ho hum... Technology

Title: I'm not sold.
Body: I bought this version on January 1st 2019. I also have the older Echo Dot and the newer Echo. Before I purchased this new Dot, I was 100% satisfied with my Amazon Echo devices. I'm not sure if I got a defective product or if this newer model is poorly made, but the sound quality is pretty bad and now, 3 months after I received it, it is starting to make a static sound at 45% volume. I'm definitely not happy.

Title: Great sound output and quality!
Body: LOVE the new echo dot!! We are a huge Echo family - we have three full sized Echos and 5 Echo dots.  The older version of the dot was fine for a bedroom but the volume needed to be on level 7 or 8 to get any significant sound.  For the new ones, they put out sound comparable to the full-size Echos and are so inexpensive that we have one in almost every room.  I also love that I can group them together and also separately so that we can have the same music all over the house or individually play our own if we want.  Awesome!

Title: HOW DID I LIVE WITHOUT THESE??
Body: I now have five echo dots throughout my place: one in each bedroom, bathroom, one in the living area and, of course, the echo show in the kitchen.  You can have them in a speaker group in order to fill every room in your home with music, news, audio books...so many options.  You can also use them to make an announcement to the entire house or just one room. You can use them to make calls. You can use them to communicate with someone in a particular room. You can set each one with a different time alarm to remind or wake individuals according to their schedules....I'm surprised at how many practical uses these little things are capable of - and for their size the sound quality is great! Games, weather, sports, recipes, they can tell jokes that are actually funny!  ...way too many options and features to list here.  I LOVE THESE THINGS!!

Title: Is 'Alexa Guard' really coming?
Body: Is 'Alexa Guard' really coming?  I would like to hear any and all reply comments.I have two 3rd Gen Echo Dots and a Ring Alarm system ... but Amazon will not provide a 'specific date' when it will be made available to paying longterm customers like me. All they for the last 4 months is 'coming soon'Here's what ADT is officially saying. IMHO ... I think Amazon has 'Guard Issues'In September, ADT announced it had expanded its relationship with Amazon by supporting the integration of the Alexa Guard feature with the ADT Pulse security system. The intent is Alexa Guard will turn the Echo and Dot voice assistants into audio sensors that can be integrated with the Pulse system. ADT_ professional installation and monitoring solutions are expected to be offered to customers through the Alexa Guard website and Amazon mobile app._e_e working with Amazon to refine the go-to-market strategy. They have been strong partners to us, but the full launch will be made when Amazon and ADT are ready, and we don_ yet have a date for that, DeVries said. _e have a very high bar. As you would expect, this is life safety for us. And when our standards are met and fully tested, as well as Amazon_, they also have a high bar, we_l be ready to launch, but we_e not quite there yet

Title: Good improvement in audio, but it comes at a price
Body: I have three Echo Dots in use in my house, two of them on small "outlet shelves" that are built to hold small smart speakers.The Echo Dot v2 speakers work great with those shelves, as they can use a small USB power port to cut down on cable mess and not block one of the outlet plugs.The Echo Dot v3 is a little bit bigger, and while it just barely fits on the shelf, it does NOT use a USB power supply, and the included power supply is big enough to block one of the outlet ports and you can only do so much to compact a 6 foot power cable to fit in the 8 inch distance from the plug to the back of the speaker.Function-wise, the v3 is a great improvement. The sound is louder and has more range.Design-wise, you sacrifice the "fits anywhere" and USB-powerability of the v2.

Title: Little Dots Made Alexa Available House-Wide
Body: I bought two of the 3rd gen Echo Dots when Amazon was having a special earlier in the year. I have an Amazon Echo but it was in the bedroom and I found myself wanting to hear music or ask questions from other rooms. Two dots have Alexa available to me all over the house, and now I hear my music in every room. My husband and I also use it as a whole-house telecom system via announcements or drop-in and this works great to get one another's attention without having to yell. I know there is much more I can do with this that I haven't had time to explore. The speakers are very good - better than anything I grew up with in the 1970s. The Echo Dot speaker sounds like something I would have spent several hundred dollars on back in the day, or a radio today (although maybe even a little better than some radios). I have nothing bad to say about the Echo Dot.

Title: I Love My Echo Dot!
Body: I recently received an Echo Dot as a gift.  I knew of them but wasn't looking to own one but I didn't return it.  Eventually I set it up (which took me a while, I'm an old lady :-)  I started out asking Alexa simple questions; music, weather etc.  Then I synced it with my Sirius account to listen in my home.  Then I got the Alexa App and  started making lists;  shopping, To Do, books to read....I love this feature as it all goes to my phone.  I'm definitely enjoying this and who knows what I'll do with it next week!!

Title: Great AI device. 3.5 jack turns off alexa speaker
Body: I got alexa so that the government can listen in on every conversation we have and be bored to death.I got three alexas for the purpose of intercoming between rooms. Our house phone has this feature but others felt it was easier to wake up the dead by yelling down staircases so now they find it fun to drop in the other rooms to call each other. Besides that feature alexa is very smart and has surprised us all. At times she does not understand 7 year old gibbirish and gives random answers, but that is expected.This little device is great. It would have been cool if the 3.5mm jack didn't turn off its external speaker. I tried to have it plugged into a stereo but it's not used often. But then we can't hear alexa unless the stereo is on. Another idea would be to allow settings for the jack. Another alexa sits on top of a bass speaker with input Jack's. If I could chose to only send bass frequencies I could then have a little bass to the external speaker.But overall we are happy and sorry for the boring conversations.

Title: Amazon 3rd Generation - Not As Touted in Release
Body: In my opinion, I can hear no improvement in the sound quality of the device, and the device is less sensitive to the sound of my voice than the previous one I had where this one sits; and in general, I have a harder time trying to verbally communicate with this device.  I bought an additional device (total of three now) so I that I could have more units in spread around the rooms of my small apartment to interact with and so that I wouldn't have to talk loudly or repeat myself and go to the machine to speak to it in order to get it to work.  The short:  Now, I wish that I would have just looked into trading in the whole set of my purchases of Alexa devices for credit to my account and been done with the aggravation.  Also, cannot get setting "Follow-Up" mode to turn off/on in the Alexa App.I have always embraced new technology, and I really, really want to like this more than I do (particularly since I invested so much money!). It's just like having something else in your house electronic that you need to keep setting and re-setting and troubleshooting and diagnosing all of the time, which I already have to do for my computer and smartphone, and it never quite works the way you want it to.

Title: Love love love
Body: I am so happy with this little thing! I bought it for myself while it was discounted over the holidays. According to the tracking notifications it went "out for delivery" but never showed up at my door (and is still stuck in that status all these months later...so I'm pretty sure that someone stole it). However, after waiting a long time I finally contacted Amazon about the missing order and they quickly re-ordered one for me which arrived safely and quickly at the end of January.I am using it in a small room so I didn't need a full size Echo and it has been easy to set up and perfect in every way. This is my very first Echo product, but years ago when it first came out I had purchased and gifted the 1st gen full size Echo which impressed both me and the recipient. I don't see any going back and I will start investing in compatible smart products.

Title: Sounds better listens worse
Body: I was very excited for this new version but I find it more often than not frustrating.  I could give the version 2 commends walking past it, this one I have to stand in front of it and speak loud and slowly.I have three echo devices and I have to talk so loud to this one while I am downstairs where it is that the two upstairs hear me and respond more regularly that this one does.But it looks better and I got a deal on it at Christmas so I left it.I don't know if mine is defective or Amazon focused so much on the speakers that something got left out of the microphones.It does look much better though, but looks aren't everything.

Title: Slight improvement over the previous generation
Body: The Echo dot when on discount are great value! The new model is heavier and seems built very well. The deep base is slightly better than the 2nd Gen dot, however still not as good as the full size Echo, however songs with bass will quickly make the speaker rattle which makes the speaker unusable at high levels. The tinny sound from the 2nd gen echo dot is gone and now has slightly more bass in this model.  I don't find the mic's work better which I was hoping they were.  The new model has a hard time recognizing my Wemo light switch for "bedroom" and often says "Bedroom can not do this action" while the older Echo dot 2nd gens had no problem.

Title: Good but much much less functional than expected.  Real problems with Australian amazon accounts.
Body: I bought this product to explore the Alexa/Amazon universe for the first time.  I intended to use it with my two Amazon Fire TVs that I had just acquired.  The echo dot is *good-ish*, but there were a lot of problems, rather than everything working "straight out of the box".1.  Initially, all of the TV control functions would not work, and on investigation the entire menu section in the Alexa App for TV controls was missing.  It took weeks to figure out what was going on: Amazon had decided the device was being used in Australia, and although they don't tell you this at all, Amazon chooses not to let Australian users control their TV through Echo Dot.  I don't know why.  Although I bought the Echo Dot in USA, bought the TV in USA, downloaded the Alexa App from the USA iTunes store and am using it in the USA, I once used to live in Australia.  This was frustrating as all of the "Help" sites said "navigate to the TV settings in your Alexa app" and this whole section was missing.  I eventually solved this after several weeks, but it involved having to fundamentally change settings across my entire Amazon account.2.  After I solved this, I discovered that, unlike my trusty Google Home devices which can control multiple fire TVs, the Echo Dot can only be paired with one Amazon Fire TV. Really annoying, as this also limits me using the other TV as a speaker.3.  Since then, I have battled to get Alexa to actually control the TV it is paired with.  It can definitely turn it on and off, but after that... well if there's a solution, I haven't cracked it.  I've stopped using the Alexa and have gone back to using my Google Home as my primary "media control" device.4.  Echo Dot and Alexa refuse to acknowledge my Audible account. Well, no, that's not quite true.  They won't acknowledge my Audible.com.au account, which I log into using my Amazon.com username and password.  Australian Audible is not OK.  The only way I can listen to an audiobook using the Echo Dot is to start a new Audible.com (not Audible.com.au) account, and re-buy the books I want to listen to.  As you can imagine, I am underwhelmed.5.  I use Alexa/Echo Dot to control my wifi lights at home, and it generally works well... adding new lights was not difficult once I understood the process, and grouping them into rooms has worked well.6.  I use simple routines with the Echo Dot/Alexa such as good morning and good night, which play me morning news, tell me the weather and turn the lights on/off as needed.  Not bad, but REALLY limited as to what information I can have played in my morning feed compared to Google Home.7.  She doesn't love my Australian accent.  Sigh.  Nothing I can do about that. Oh well.So.... for me, the Echo Dot has not lived up to the hype.  The advertising implies it can do many things, but in actual practice, it turns out it's mostly just a voice-activated speaker, and Amazon has chosen to be really difficult about country codes.  I'm not a google fan per se, but in comparison, the Google environment works much much better.

Title: Alexa is the friend in the room
Body: I bought one form for myself and then one for my 52 year old brother who resides in a nursing home due to various medical conditions.  Nursing homes are not considered extremely social environments and this makes  Lon's stay monotonous.  Having Alexa at his side allows him to actually have another voice in his room and connects him with various outlets that are otherwise not available in that kind of housing.  He listens to his favorite music at will, checks on the news etc.  I am very happy to help make his circumstances just a bit better and his life just a bit fuller.

Title: Alexa cannot substitute the Internet, but she is great for controlling devices
Body: I think its great to use for controlling my devices, playing music, and even playing games. I also try to use it as a homework tool sometimes, but the Alexa cannot comprehend some questions. I assumed this would be similar to using a search engine online, but I guess not. Alexa has more limitations than I expected. My son likes to learn about sports, but if he asks something like "what previous team did Kevin Durant play for" she can't answer. We even tried rewording the question multiple times. My first time using Alexa (came free with Ring). Not sure how it compares to previous versions.

Title: Neat gizmo
Body: The Echo Dot joins the Echo and the Echo Cube in my house.  I specifically bought it so when I am working in my office downstairs I can simply "drop in " on my wife upstairs without yelling to get her attention.  Yes, I also use it to get the news reports and to listen to my music on my XM account.I was surprised that it took nearly a week to receive it when I order other items from Amazon and they arrive within two days.Overall, I am pleased with it's performance and sound.

Title: Radio Replacement
Body: I purchased this, my third Echo device to replace a radio in my office that was going out and sounded terrible. The new Echo Dot was a great alternative. Since I am an Amazon Prime Member, I have free access to Prime Music and with the Echo Dot, I am able to get access to a huge amount of Amazon Music and even radio stations by using Echo Skills. The sound quality is outstanding and it is easy to control and change music without having to get up out of my chair and go across the room. I would highly recommend the purchase of an Echo product for many needs and even as I did, as a replacement to a radio for music.

Title: Limited support
Body: We purchased first one and then three more of the Echo Dot 3 units.  We enjoyed them at first but the novelty did wear off.  We use them primarily for intercoms and shopping lists, both of which works well.  My main gripe is that they are not programmed to tell you how to use them, what steps are needed to perform common tasks, i.e. how to interconnect with each other, what can you control.  Any question is that regards usually gets the same comment from Alexa, "Hmmmm  I do know that."  There is only so often you can can and wait in a cue for answers.  Alexa is a dumbed down Siri as far a facts are concerned.

Title: Disappointed!
Body: Bought this in January and by March the speaker has started to mess up.  Sounds muffled and messed up.  Also,  there's a lag in response when I ask for the time. There's like a 5 second pause before echo answers. Also  unlike the previous generation this one stops playing music after some time. The older version would play music until I tell it to stop even if it meant all day. It looks better and the speaker is louder than the older version but it sucks! It's always having "issues connecting with the internet" almost every other day blinking red. I never had this problem with the prior generation. I regret upgrading now or maybe I just got a bad batch

Title: On its own, there isn't much Value-Add
Body: I received an Echo Dot as a gift, and I had no idea what it even was. Or what it did.After plugging it in and linking it to my Amazon account, it appears to be another version of Siri. Without any "smart" light bulbs, security systems, thermostats, or other smart devices in my home, the only additional function I could see was to ask for the status of an Amazon order. I only order once a month or so, however, so that is not a big deal to me. I am already getting notified on the Amazon app and by email.I already use Siri on occasion and Google voice on my phone, so adding an Echo Dot did not enhance my ability to ask questions to an electronic device. And Siri answered more of my random questions accurately.In general, I don't like having to add "apps" in order to get questions answered by the device. It's not very smart until you go into the Alexa app and add a bunch of functions, which means searching for them, testing them, or researching online for Top 10's, etc. It's exhausting. Just answer all of my questions without making me do the setup, please.In my opinion, if you plan to have a smart house and connect a lot of other services and devices, then this would be a perfectly acceptable controller to access and change those devices. But if you just want something fun to sit on the table and play with, just say Hey Siri and move on.

Title: Wonderful product, and I'm still learning how to use it
Body: I am learning new uses for my Echo Dot every day. I started using it (sorry, her) next to my bed to give me time, weather, and music. That stuff is ideal. She has replaced my clock. Then I found I could get my favorite radio station. Although when I asked for NPR she wanted a station location. When I gave her location, she found two stations with identical names and asked me which one. I gave her one of the duplicates and now I have it whenever I want it. I have no idea what she did with the other one. Then I asked her for stories and jokes. She's excellent at those! Although when I asked for a bedtime story she needs permission, somehow. I haven't figured out how yet. I don't know how to convince her I'm 71 and old enough for a bedtime story.My next attempt will be at asking her to order something from Amazon that I regularly order, like my favorite coffee.

Title: Alexa. She's a true lady
Body: I bought this Echo 3rd generation Dot, and I've hit to say it's pretty cool. I can tell Alexa what to do and she does it. It's the perfect quasi-wife" for hopelessly single guys who are a little old fashioned and really enjoys having a woman around the house. She's always there. To this point, While servicing my needs for 2+ months now, she's been primarily limited to playing individual songs, playlists and radio stations around the world on iHeart, TuneIn, Amazon Music (non-paid version) and Sirius XM. I enjoy listening to audio books from Audible and Amazon, and that's as easy as 1, 2, 3. There's lots of built-in games, latest. News, sports scores and more. You can even order pizza or an Uber through this little darlin. Well, sort of, you have to enable her "skills," (then just tell the newest lady of the house what. To do or what you want her to do for you. I got a great deal before the 2018 holidays, but that's gone gone gone. Should've ordered 4.imstead.of 2, but hey I wasnt planning on marrying her, I was just taking her for a test drive. But, I truly fell in love. I'm gonna try this next, "Alexa, sweetie, I love you, bring Papa a beer!!!!!!" Will foow-up soonish on how that worked out.

Title: no youtube support
Body: I'm a premium youtube subscriber and this doesn't support it, I think because they have a competition with google.

Title: THAT'S what I was hoping for!
Body: I can babble on and on about Alexa and what it can do, but this review is specifically for the person who has a generation 2 and is thinking of upgrading to the Gen 3.  It's ALL ABOUT THE SOUND.  I have Gen 2 devices, and they work wonderfully, but each of them is attached to some form (either by 1/8 inch plug or by bluetooth) to a Speaker because the built in speaker on the Gen 2?  Let's be honest, it's a bit disappointing when compared to the actual Alexa unit.  But this Gen 3 is DEAD on fabulous sound-wise.  It's the Echo size and the Alexa sound combined together.  The kids now have Gen 2's in their rooms.  The living room and my room have Gen 3 and no longer require external speaker support.  And the play music Everywhere running on multiple Gen 3 units?  Ooh, baby!  Rig up a few iView bulbs set to the ENT scene...and you got yourself a disco!

Title: Could be great but Amazon restricts it  for $
Body: Great: for voice action questions, music, links in easily with speakers bluetooth. This works good if Amazon would allow devices to openly work will all other smart home devices would be Great but the have restrictions targeted at getting you to buy there other products such as Amazon Spot etc. Such as shame.Poor: if you have a smart home will not link with as doorbell chime or any other camera based device with sound.  Ultimately Amazon requires you to purchase their video capable device to hear which is a waste.  So in my case had to go purchase Google mini which link with video doorbell chimes as well as other camera devices with sound capabilities it on the other hand is not as user friendly on all voice actions with my smart home. Note if you down load Alexa on computer or phone same problem it will not give you access to cameras or sound directing you must purchase their other devices what a waste.

Title: Still learning
Body: So i'm new to the whole alexa thing, and i consider myself pretty tech savvy. However, setting up things on the echo was a little confusing at first. I still need to earn the commands. I mainly got it so i can use it for my spotify playlists. It worked great the first night when i set it up, but the day after, I asked alexa to play my playlist and it kept giving me nursery rhymes from amazon music lol. It was quite frustrating. So i went into the settings and realized that somehow my main music was set as "amazon music"-(which i dont even have)  instead of spotify.  Once i switched spotify to my main music, it worked again. So hopefully it doesn't happen again. I will write an updated review once I learn more :)

Title: this thing is great only one problem
Body: I love my echo but if you live in a location with no or pour hard line internet like me and are force to use wireless hotspots as a main source of internet then you will need some extra set up. the echo does no do peer to peer connections like Wi-Fi hotspots so if you need to connect it to one you have to buy a 3rd party Wi-Fi router to feed off the hot spot or establish a mesh system in your house, but once you do that it works great and doesn't drop off.

Title: The 3rd Gen Alexa Echo is awesome
Body: I never had an intent on getting an Echo Dot but 1 day I shopping I stopped by an AMAZON Hub store in the Mall I was @ wile out of town visiting friends of ours. After about 30mins of talking to the AMAZON sales guy I pulled the trigger & got a PROMO deal they where running I got 2 / 3rd Gen Alexa Echo DOT's & a WAYZE Cam & I bought a Smart Plug extra not included in the PROMO. They where simple easy to hookup & I am HOOKED on them I ask ALEXA everything. I even went out & got Color Changing Lightbulb's for my Man Cave & our Bedroom I just bought another Smart plug as well I now have a total of 3 smart plugs in our house 1 plug ALEXA turns on my 65" tv in my man cave / 1 plug ALEXA turns on my Model Railroad in basement / 1 plug ALEXA turns on our bedroom tv / 1 plug turns on my video game console "XBOX ONE X" / I have not picked a spot for my 4th smart Plug yet... GREAT PRODUCT from AMAZON I want to get a 3rd ECHO DOT for the Basement by my model railroad. But the wife says NO I am already HOOKED too much on DOTS we have LOL

Title: Confusing, Hard to Set Up
Body: I_ finding it very hard to use this for many of the _kills this is touted for. It_ not responding to commands. I thought it was that I wasn_ using the right words, but after fighting with the thing I finally called tech support. They told me I have to set up my voice and every voice in the house. Plus, I have to either create a different account for each person in the house, or I can put them under my account but if I do it that way, they can purchase anything off Amazon they want!! Then, I have a 3 year old granddaughter who is shy & wont speak up - not something that_ normally an issue but if I try to help her or tell her what to say, Alexa thinks I am saying it so it defeats the purpose.

Title: Speaker blew out after a couple months of minimal, non-max-volume use.
Body: I loved having music I could control by voice, and played music through this Dot about 2 hours per week total, in 30-minute chunks, with volume between 3 and 6 (out of 10 max). Today I noticed a singer's "S" sounds were fuzzy and blown out on a familiar song; I tried other songs, and sure enough, the speaker was blown out. This seems unreasonable, as I never even played at the max volume, not for extended periods of time, etc.The item is beyond its return window. I would appreciate if Amazon contacted me about alternatives. I have two other Dots (same model) and am worried the same thing will happen.

Title: Very Nice Addition to Our Home
Body: Bought these for the kids' rooms. Easy to open, a snap to set up. I like that I was able to rename the dots to the kid's names/rooms in the app. Instead of 'drop in on Echo dot 2', I can say 'drop in on xxx's room'. Kids love them. Broke down and got the Amazon Music Unlimited Family plan too so they can stream different music simultaneously. Also cool that, although Alexa is in several rooms and the experience is seamless, each device retains its own identity. So if I set a weekday alarm for 6:10am in one room, it only goes off in the one room, not on all devices. Anyway, we are all very, very happy with the purchase. Thinking to add just a couple more now.... :-)

Title: I love the clock
Body: I got this because of the clock.  Because I cut the cord, I no longer have a cable box in my living room, so I didn't have a clock.  I had a 3rd gen. Echo Dot on the end table next to where I sit, and when i saw that Amazon was now selling one with a clock built in, I ordered it.  It solved the problem.  I found a place for the other one.If you ask the new one for the temp, it will display it on the clock while giving you the weather report, and then go back to the clock.  If you ask it to start a timer, it shows the count-down instead of the time.  Very useful.

Title: More options to wake up word
Body: We have the Dot in the living room. Right now all we use it for is music and to turn on and off the lights. It works great and is fairly interactive. I just wish there was a greater selection of names I could use for wake up word or better yet, give me access to a keyboard and let me truly choose what I like. In addition, let me choose a response other than _K. As an example: _o Housemaid, and it responds with  Yes Master

Title: I love Alexa!
Body: She has been awesome and the customer support has been great. The only downside is that they don't tell you that you have to pay for a program to correct network errors. I chose the 4 year plan for $150. When I was working with support trying to get Alexa installed I found out that my computer is secure but the network Alexa uses had a bunch of malicious and junk files that had to be removed before she would work. It was an unexpected expense but I got a good deal on Alexa.It's not Amazon's fault that, unfortunately, I have a HTC Desire 510 Android phone (I guess about 5 years old) and it's not compatible with Alexa. So I guess I'll be upgrading my phone in the future.I worked with support this morning to pair a little wireless Bluetooth speaker with Alexa. They walked me through it and it went great. I can now have it near Alexa and have "stereo" sound.I like to listen to classical music on my local PBS station. My Bose Wave radio has a lot of interference on that particular station for some reason. All I do now is say "Alexa, play 88.7 FM" and it comes in very clearly.All in all, I'm glad I got her!

Title: Super simple to setup
Body: Took me almost 2 minutes to unbox, plug in and add to my Alexa app.  This is second one I've setup this week for home use.I've been resisting using Alexa since it was introduced, but received one as a Christmas gift, and even then I didnt use it until this week.  now I have 2 and several smart plugs and switches.Only thing I don't care for on this one (version 3) is that it uses a dedicated power connection instead of USB cable, but it works and sounds good for such a small unit.Update : 3.30.2018Purchased a 3rd Echo Dot and received it today.  Took longer to open the shipping box than it did to setup.  Also added several other smart devices and everything synced up and is working great.

Title: Very disappointed
Body: After initial setup, which was more or less simple, the device kept insisting to have my phone number. WHile I get that that is how it could get some functionality for messages and calls, fact is I don't care about it and do not want it. There was no way to have this stopped. Because of that, I simply remove app from my phone and the so called "smart" device keeps sending notifications (or at least it says so) to my phone -which is not connected!" Second and more disappointing matter: outside of very simple questions like the weather, traffic and few others, most of the the time the device/service does not know the answer. Then there is the annoying fact that this "smart" device only understands if you ask or better said, pronounce words of places, cities, things, etc in English. WHy would that matter? Because at home we have 4-5 languages going on and we know the real names of place, things, etc....This spills into events, facts, history, etc of several other countries where we often go and need to get info of. Sometimes we have no idea what the English would be....We are at a point of disconnecting it and throwing it (unless someone wants it free). I'm going to give it a few days chance when I see about connecting a few lights and other and see how that works (though I do know that to make it work remote, I'll need to connect to my phone, but I'm setting up a Line2 disposable number so if I want to be done with it, I simply delete the Line2 and number.While I'm sure it has good uses for many other people; it does not work at all for us and other people in similar situations (we have checked with amy of our friends in more or less same and they all say the same.All in all, quite disappointed.

Title: DO NOT BUY THIS HORRIBLE PRODUCT
Body: Very disappointed in this product. Only responds to very specific demands/requests. Won_ play music that I_e already downloaded from iTunes without manually doing it on my phone itself after having to pair it via Bluetooth. Also cannot connect to more than one device at a time. If I want to play music with my phone but want to use dual speakers I would have to use an aux cord to connect the two speakers. For the price, this product is a definite no.UPDATE: downgraded from 2 stars to 1. Would give it zero if I had that option. It constantly disconnects from WiFi and doesn_ automatically reconnect afterwards. I_ forced to go through the whole set up from the beginning. Also some of the skills it offers are glitchy, offering paid-for upgrades that don_ work even after shelling out the extra money.I wished I had returned this product when I still had the chance. But I was optimistic that things would get better once I got used to it and all of its limitations. Sadly, it got considerably worse and now I_ stuck with a piece of junk.

Title: less than expected
Body: I purchased the device because the product description advertised as blue tooth speaker. Well it does not work as a blue tooth speaker with my TV set, which it stated that it did. Works with one TV as expected but not my other set. Both are Samsung Smart Tvs. Very disappointing. Returned it. Beware that it does not work as described with all devices. Look before you leap.  Was very impressed with the sound quality . Very nice. No battery must have a power soucre another negative. Customer support is lacking for this device. They run you around in circles and a little reluctant to admit the unit might be defective and reluctant to refund. But they will. Most features work well.Well I purchased a different bluetooth speaker for half the price and it works great. First try and all paired and connected perfectly. The sound is great to. I would consider an echo Dot again for all the other features if they can get this problem squared away. It a shame that it can't be used a a regular bluebooth speaker. I hope some of their engineers are listening. I invited Amazon engineers to contact me to help resolve this issue.

Title: How did I live without this just three months ago?
Body: I love my Echo. I_ having surgery next month and I set two of these up to control smart outlets in the living room and bedroom so I can control lights without having to get up. I really like the ability to set alarms and timers. I use one when I_ baking and another one for getting up in the morning. I have a routine set where the alarm goes off and then it turns on a light. A bonus from the smart plugs that has nothing to do with the Echo is that I can turn on lights in the house from my phone while I_ driving home (although Echo can be used to set up a routine for those as well).One thing  I didn_ realize is that you have to be connected to the internet for any of them to work. The speech recognition engine is not hosted on the local machine. I live in a remote area where the internet goes down from time to time. It would be nice if Amazon would enable some basic features like alarms to run internally.I was impressed with the sound; my Echo pushes noticeably more base than my Oontz Angle. I do have some problems with Alexa selecting songs with similar names to what_ in my library from the cloud instead of from my library. I_e gotten a couple of jarring surprises.

Title: Static Speaker
Body: I loved the speaker at first, but I have only owned it for less than a month, and the speaker has a lot of static noise. It is not constant, but comes and goes.  The sound quality to not great. I have an Oontz Angle 3 Solo that has much better sound quality than the echo. As far as the Alexa features I love it. I just wished the speaker had better quality.

Title: Not as good as the older ones.
Body: Doesn_ hear as well as second gen.  I wish I had sent these back in time for a refund.  I_e had them for a few months and they seem to perform ok when they can hear and understand me.  The 1st and second gen dots that I have seem to do a better job.  Also these new ones have a proprietary ac adapter so if yours gets damaged you can_ just use an extra usb laying around.The speaker is better, but that doesn_ really matter much to me because I have my second gen in a speaker dock anyway.  Probably going to sell these for a loss or try nd trade them for second generation ones.

Title: One step forward 3 giant steps back
Body: The music quality of the echo dot 3rd generation is a huge improvement over the 2nd generation, but the redesign is buggy and consistently crashes. (We use ours a lot for timers and on occasion a timer will got off and not stop even after repeat commands until the plug is pulled) worse the reason why we chose to upgrade our devices was the lackluster ability for it to hear us. Our hope was this new generation would be an improvement but was a significant disappointment as it regularly does not hear or understand us.Updated 6.22.19- roughly a week after our review went live Amazon called to address the issue. After a reboot and reset I can say our echo dot still does not work correctly

Title: HELLO, ALEXA!
Body: I was ready to send the darn things back, I followed directions, but couldn't get the little suckers to work.  I wasn't told, that apparently, the dots have a pecking order, #1 and #2. Who knew? I had left #1 dormant while I wasted time on #2. I gave one more try and started with the dormant one, and BINGO! Both of my dots hooked themselves up!  Wonderful! The sound is great and Alexa and I are BFFs. She finds just the right music and helps me in the kitchen. I'm going to buy 2 more dots.

Title: Mixed Bag
Body: Seems to have somewhat better wifi sensitivity than the second-generation Dot, but that's where the superiority ends. Sound is bass heavy and muffled. It's also quite directional and speech can become downright unintelligible if the Dot is not properly oriented or close to your ear.I also found that the switch from a USB power supply to a dedicated one is not a convenience, especially if you have earlier Dots around the house, or need to relocate this one occasionally.

Title: Works great! Sounds fantastic for such a compact device!
Body: I_e been an Apple Device user for the past several years. So I purchased this thing and WOW!I_ super impressed by the technology!Alexa is far more fluent in Human interaction than Apple_ Siri!Plus having all of the Star Trek Easter eggs built into the system has practically turned my man cave into a Starship computer system! LolI purchased two of them and an Echo Sub and now have an AMAZING theatrical sound system and a very low cost!

Title: Great buy. Two for $50.00 deal.
Body: As I did research on my kids request for an alarm clock in the morning I found the Echo Dot.  When comparing prices of alarm clocks, the ECHO this was a no brainer. My boys are able to play the music that they like and white noise at night for bed. They set their alarm and find out the weather for the next day so they know how to dress For school. Overall I am pleased other than it has to stay on the charger continuously. The only thing that would give this product five stars for me is that it_ portable. I guess I_ gonna have to upgrade LOL

Title: I know Echo Dot does all kinds of things, but I mostly use it for rain sounds
Body: Echo dot with Alexa does all kinds of cool things. I know. I get the emails every week telling me all the new things up with Alexa!  I may get around to trying those things out one day...but mostly I use the Echo dot to play rain sounds while I sleep. It does that awesomely! I have seen my husband use the Echo dot to control our firestick. That was pretty cool. Alexa has answered my little ones questions with some quippy remarks a few times; that was fun. The dot has been pretty helpful in telling me the weather outside before I step out in the cold in my underwear--that's been a lifesaver. I think my next purchase is going to be the Echo dot thing that comes with a screen and reads you recipes. I probably won't know how to use that to its fullest capabilities either, but Amazon is still going to get my money because someone in my household will know what they're doing. 10 out of 10 would buy this again...actually, I did...I just bought the kid version...so, yeah, Amazon strikes again. I'm told its worth it. Get you one!

Title: works great nice sound quality
Body: Purchased Echo Dot to use at work in my office.  Wanted primarily for music but also to be like an assistant with questions answered easily.  For the most part it works perfectly.  Sound quality is good and no longer have to hassle with radio station static.  One complaint is if I don't ask a question every 3 hours or so it goes off.  When I ask why the response is was shut off due to inactivity in several hours.  I was listening to the music!  Oh well I adapted.  Another complaint is since live streaming music it goes off if get interrupted WIFI (which happens for me at least once if not more times per day).  Again I adapted.So yes I do recommend the Echo Dot.

Title: Functionally Disappointing, Get Google Home
Body: My roommate got a Google Home since his family got 2 (or something like that) and a week later my echo arrived. Alexa knew more random facts and was able to keep things up faster than Google and honestly she was more entertaining, but functionally she was disappointing. The emails should you need for each and every little action gets tiring. Want to download a song on your streaming service, download the skill. Want to connect to other smart devices or equipment, download a skill. And the worst part is, the skills are buggy as all get out. The save songs skill worked for a day and then Alexa would say, "you need to download a skill for that". I tried connecting her to my 4 Phillips Hue lights and she created 8 lights and then wouldn't turn them off if called by their nickname. She was unable to turn off my Samsung TV for a while until I changed it's name to "TV". She can't turn off my Vizio or do anything with my Fire Stick. Unfortunately the list goes on. It doesn't have as loud a speaker system as Google Home either so I don't know why I even got it. I thought the voice assistant would be useful but Google is way ahead in that department too. I decided to stick it out for over a month and now unfortunately I can't return it, so don't make the same mistake I did.

Title: Apple Music?
Body: Can_ get Apple Music to play and when I ask Alexa, she says I need an update to my software. When I try to update - nothing.

Title: Alexa, do you hear me now!
Body: I like the Alexa. I wish there was a way to program my morning and night announcements in one segment instead of multiple segments. It gives only so many characters to write your message. I had to keep adding actions to my morning and night announcements. That was tiresome. It does not connect to a mobile phone. Maybe, I am not doing something right, but I did not see an option to connect my phone to Echo. There are a couple more things that I wish could be change, but overall I am ok with it.

Title: I Like It
Body: Love hate relationship with this thing. I like everything it does, but, I don't like that it's always listening.  Nice that I can stop it from listening if I choose.The speaker on the dot is ok; at max volume, it does not seem loud when compared to the 2nd Gen Echo we also have. Speaker quality is also a step down vs the Echo.If you can splurge I would recommend the Echo vs Dot especially if you plan on using it to blast some tunes with it.

Title: Waste of Money
Body: This really a waste of money. I can occasionally get it to turn on lights and start a timer. The frustration of trying to get it to do anything else is not worth it. The app is so confusing to try to get it to automate anything. Yes I can ask it some stupid questions or play a few games, but I can do all those things with my phone, and much better.Considering Google's assistant is already built into my phone and works better. It was rather dumb of me to buy this. It just seams like for all the things it does well, there are cheaper and better options.I just cannot stress enough how bad this device is. All the issues I seem to have, most people have to, by reading the app reviews.Update: July 4thI continue to believe Alexa is worthless for most people. Here is my latest frustration. I asked for the hours of a particular store. It got the right one the first time. When Alexa asked if I wanted to call, I said Yeah. It does not understand that Yeah as a yes. So I asked Alexa again. However, it started giving me Kentucky and other cities far from my location. I went and looked at what it thought I was saying. The first time, it thought I said "New Bird" every other time it understood I was saying "Newberg", but used the "Newburgh" spelling.So now I say " New Bird" for "Newberg", it recognizes it as "New Bird", but will give me "Newberg" info. This is what drives me crazy about Alexa, always having to figure out the magic words to get her to do what you want. Other times you give the exact same command and it understands what one wants, other times it will have no clue.

Title: Terrible sound with 3rd Gen Echo Dot
Body: I already had two 2nd gen Echo Dots and was happy with them. Nevertheless I eagerly bought two more 3rd Gen Echo Dots when I heard that Amazon had improved the sound. What a huge disappointment. The Alexa functionality is the same (which is great) but the sound is absolutely terrible. At times Alexa's response is unintelligible, even after repeated attempts. The voice is very muffled as if it is covered by a thick blanket, and this is even after trying to tweak the base/treble using the app. I equate Amazon's attempt to improve the 2nd gen Echo Dot to New Coke (which failed terribly)! Trust me, given the choice, get the 2nd gen Echo Dot, or wait until a 4th gen comes out and keep your fingers crossed. The 2 new Echo Dots I bought will be stored away in a box as last resort spares in case my 2nd gens ever fail.

Title: Love the echos
Body: Have three of the Echo Installed and absolutely love them.  Easy to set up and enjoy.So many uses, I use for my outside lighting and inside lighting. Its a clock, weather report. so many endless things you can ask. Love the shopping list and to do list. I have app on phone and when you go to the grocery store its right there, all the things you tell Alexa to add to your list. Plays my playlists and It works my TIvo box, changes channels and controls the recorded shows. There is so many uses as listed in description. I didn't realize how useful the Echo would be until I got them and started using Alexa controls.

Title: Exactly what I wanted!
Body: When my "Alexa" version 1 lost her life, and was dead, I needed a smart speaker by my bed as I fall to sleep every night listening to the radio.  It is the reason I started out on this adventure of using "robot" like objects to ease the pain of being OLD!  Ha haha.  Safe to say, the Dot was just right as I do not have complicated needs, just radio, alarm, turn the radio off, and "what time is it?"I have another smart speaker in my kitchen for listening to the radio, making grocery lists, turning on and off my kitchen light, and hall light.  You see.... pretty easy.  I love the help!

Title: Major improvement from previous Gen!!
Body: What I like about this particular item is that it sounds much more better than the 2nd gen. The mini size woofer gives it the umph to hear such a better clarity and sound quality for the prize. Not to mention that it can be connected via Bluetooth and any device. But if you simply have an amazon account, it makes it easy just to stream music from your accounts with out the need to play from your phone. Just simply enable the skill for any music app and ask away. The best is that it now lets you even enable a skill to play your iTunes music if you are subscribed. This makes a perfect gift and an Awesome product overall!!

Title: _t_ always listening for the wake word
Body: Appearance-wise, it_ beautiful. The power cord is not the same as the 2nd gen so if in case the cable is lost or needs replacement, if there_ still warranty that_ good, if not then that_ another purchase. The setup is easy enough. I find that the green ring is always running waiting for the wake word to be spoken so it_ always listening. I haven_ been able to load the history to delete recordings so I_ giving it a 4-star

Title: Lack of support w/ Echo team. & Pore English
Body: Technical support is basically nonexistent, I_e called more than a dozen times every single time they put me on hold and or the call dropped for no reason, I have called and tried to find out if there are records that I_e called and yes, no answer why the long waits . I tried complaining to supervisor, again I never get through. My questions are easy and simple. I needed to hear previous sound tracks  using the Amazon streaming service using the command, and never went through. I called more than six times regarding the same issue. Not a single individual figured out how to fix this?. Again there_ been other simple commands that I can_ issues with the device I witch is not executing.  Technical support is basically nonexistent, I_e called more than a dozen times every time I tried calling I_e ask for a supervisor, again I never get through. My question is still the same, I needed to hear  Previous Music using Amazon streaming .. and my commands  were not going through.  Still the lack of support that you get from the echo department is disgusting. I finally had to call the sales and returns Development to file a complaint.If anyone  is having the same call center issues I encourage you to write about it.

Title: Better than 2nd gen, still not perfect
Body: If you like Alexa, you already know her capabilities, so I won't comment on that.  This Echo dot is much better than the 2nd generation speaker.  The sound quality and volume level of this is FAR superior to the 2nd generation.  The look is a bit more pleasant as well, as they fit more into a living room decor than the plasticy looking prior generation.  The microphone pickup ability on these is also better than the 2nd generation, but still not perfect.  I definitely still find myself yelling at Alexa to stop, or repeating commands at the top of my lungs because she can't hear over the TV or something.  Definitely worth the extra money to buy this one over the 2nd generation.  If they'd somehow manage to perfect what Alexa can hear over other noise I'd be 100% happy and give 5 stars.  Maybe I'm expecting too much?  Still, a very good quality appliance and I have bought several for other people so they can experience the benefits of Alexa.  It's much better listening to music and audiobooks on this model than the 2nd generation also.

Title: The speaker in this generation is a substantial upgrade! The only Alexa device needed!
Body: I really like this little big upgrade from the previous dot. The speaker is much louder and for this I am grateful. I like how this can read me my kindle books. I find it 100% more useful than the google device that doesn't even have bluetooth and the speaker is so poor I haven't even plugged it back in. (I got it free with my nest thermostat I couldn't find a use for it compared to Alexa.)So I guess for me my take away from this is that Alexa is the only smart home device cordinator I need. Plus my kids can use it to make VoIP calls. Also free time was fun to play Disney music.I also use it to turn on and off light switches, set timers, alarms and tell me the weather.

Title: So many uses and improving all the time.
Body: We have an echo plus with built-in hub in the living room and added the dot 3rd gen in our bedroom. The sound from the dot is surprisingly acceptable when playing music which was important as we often go to sleep to some of our playlists. Also, having access to all of our attached devices is convenient if I want to turn a light on in another room when waking up in the dark. I might get another one for our cellar. I recommended these to a friend who just built a new house and likes to listen to music in different rooms. He bought two and loves them. They also entertain their grandchildren with the games that are available.

Title: Easy to set up
Body: I found it easy to set up. But, only after I sat down with my cell phone and did some reading. I now have 3 dots. I've replaced my radio in the bathroom with one. I have another in the living room. The third in the bedroom now has replaced my clock radio. I have alarms set with "Reville", "The National Anthem" and the "Marine Corps Hymn". That's enough to wake me and get me going. Sadly, I can't find one sound, a US Navy's ship with "This is a drill, this is a drill. General Quarters, General Quarters. (Then the klaxon alarm)" Experience from nearly 50 years ago would really wake me up. I ask for any type of music genre at night and it is restful. My only problem would be if I don't ask the question or command in the proper manner, it will come back with "I don't understand" or "I can't do that" or "Sorry, I'm not sure about that" or something like that.  For instance, I just asked what time an English soccer game plays on Saturday. Alexa couldn't respond with an answer. I then asked the question a different way and I got the game location, game time and opponent. It can be frustrating, but maybe it's me.

Title: So far, having fun, sound a touch muffled, Android app is battery drainer
Body: Finding new things to do with it each day - Alarms and multiple Timers at once, Reminders like "Alexa, set reminder for lunch at noon on Sunday", 'she' repeats it back and at noon on Sunday, 'she' tells you, Audible books (subscription) which pick up where you left off, Shopping list (shows up on Alexa app on phone),  White noise machine at night (lots of free Rain, Thunderstorms, Crackling fire, Ocean Waves, Wind, etc), Games (song trivia, regular trivia, Word of the Day, etc), Flash briefings (easier to set up on laptop than on phone app) which give you are run down of quick news, or weather, or pop culture stuff - what ever you add to your Flash Briefing list, Entertainment (Music (lots free w/ Prime), Radio Mystery Theater,  Choose your own Adventure books (interactive), look for new stuff each day.The voice is bass heavy making it sound a bit muffled but that can be adjusted. You can also tell it to turn up or turn down - these commands are 10 level (out of I think 100) jumps, but buttons on device have smaller adjustments if just want to move a little (louder or softer) at least I think they do.The Alexa app on Android phone (Galaxy 5 - older phone) doesn't seem fully functional and I ended up removed b/c it kept 'turning on' in background and draining my battery! BUT when it was on there, it was neat having my shopping list right there. I'd say Alexa (or you can use the name Echo, Computer, or Amazon - if you have more than one device, trust me - name them differently) "Add 2 dozen eggs to my shopping list", 'she' (the device voice), says "2 dozen eggs added to your shopping list". Sure enough, open app, and touch "shopping list" there it is. I was also able to dictate a phone number to it and 'she' called it (was a land line) - sounds on my end was good, but the person I was talking to, said it sounded slightly echo-ish.

Title: ECHO DOT 3 IS AMAZING!!!
Body: I really like the echo dot 3. You can use it in smaller rooms without a separate speaker or you can add a bluetooth or audio cable directly to a speaker.The sound quality out of it's own speaker is not jaw dropping. Truthfully, the sound is ok. At low volume or high volumes it gives acceptable audio. When connected to an external speaker then the quality sounds as good as your speaker can sound (or as bad).The look is much better than the previous echo dot 2 and comes in 3 different colors.I use money to control several smart devices ( light bulbs, humidifier/aromatherapy, smart plugs, Nest thermostat,etc). All of these work flawlessly with the echo dot 3. Non of my devices require a hub, so for the $49 you get a lot. It can answer many question, although not as many as the google home mini. You can play games on it like Jeopardy. It can tell you jokes, play music of course and much more. All you need do is add the equipment (bulbs, thermostat, etc) and allow the skill in the Amazon Echo App.I use mine every single day without fail. In fact I now have 1 in nearly every room in my house.You can also control any of the other echos that you have from any other echo. You can also play the same song on all echoes if you choose. So if you are are walking in and out of other rooms you can continue to hear the same song. The only thing that could make this better is a little bit richer sound from the internal speaker (which, again isn't bad). However, to do that, I am certain that a price increase would be involved.  I think $49 is a fantastic price and not to hard to swallow if you want to get multiple units like I have.
