Title: Good, with some annoying features
Body: I have a second-generation Dot, and just received this third-generation Dot today. In my very brief experience, here are my impressions.Definitely better sound quality, with noticeable (but not substantial) bass.The cloth exterior looks nice. Glad I ordered the dark gray - I'm not sure how long the light-colored one would stay clean, and it looks like it would be hard to clean it.The power supply uses a brick with a proprietary connector. You can't power this thing with a micro-USB cable anymore, like you could with a second-gen unit. I don't like that. If you lose the brick, you're in for a significant expense.I was in an online meeting for work when the Dot suddenly announced, in a loud voice, that it had received an important update and needed to restart. I had to apologize for the interruption to the other people in the meeting. I REALLY didn't like that.

Title: Not too bad
Body: This is a piece of crap! 80% of the time it can not find the music I am asking it to play. I just spent 20 frequent minutes of my morning asking it to play yoga and meditation music while it was trying to drive me out of my mind playing some horrific frequency music. I would break it if I didn_ have to earn my money so hard. This device is a waste of money and time! If this is the glorious artificial intelligence, we are all in for a huge trouble and mess.UPDATE: I upstared my review because the problem was not with Alexa but with Spotify where it either played the wrong music or simply stopped playing in the middle of the playlist. I cancelled Spotify and switched to Amazon music. So far so good. Alexa still can not understand me so I have to control music through the app on the phone, but at least it plays without interruptions.

Title: Meh
Body: I figured I would try a dot since my phone is listing to me all the time anyway.  I cannot say I am very impressed.  The dot has already stopped doing things like _his day in history and does not have access to many answers.I tried to use it with Rosetta Stone and that didn_ go over very well.  On top of this my smart light bulbs with with google home not Alexa (bummer).After owning this for several month now I use this as a glorified timer.  The interface is just not reliable or precise.  Also, on many occasions it turns on and listens which no activation word said.The tech will be great someday but at the moment it is spotty.

Title: Very aggravating
Body: Alexa, big or small, is nearly useless. She has massive problems finding any useful information. She plays trivia games well, orders things off amazon, and the speakers sound good, thats about the end of what it does well. All of those wonderful apps that make it useful...music, podcast, controlling other devices, etc, etc....all of that costs more money. $2 a month here, $5 a month there, $9 a month for this, $12 a month for that. You want this thing to be useful...it'll end up costing you about a $100 a month.Update:Wow ... beware "Big Brother". If you give Amazon a bad review, they will call you and call you. They will harass you and pressure you into changing your review. They won't actually do anything about the reasons you gave them a bad review, but they will flex their corporate muscle and remind you how big they are.

Title: like
Body: well hmm i said i would never have one of these or any other like listening device in our house and yet here i am reviewing one we got!! i wouldn't of ordered one myself before, this one came as a free add-on with the ring alarm system kit we bought on here and i honestly had no plan on using the echo 3 and was going to give it away but, curiosity got the best of me and well it only took a day to get hooked on this awesome no-hands device after trying it out. not having to stop doing what i am doing to go turn on music and skip songs or not having to remember to later write something down to buy on a list and just ask alexa to order it has been great since i forget to write things on a list later on 75% of the time. I haven't played around with everything this does, not really into all that game play/etc with alexa stuff. The music, shopping list/cart and phone messaging is all i care about really (am looking at them plugs to turn thing on & off with alexa too now) and there are some issues like everytime i say order/buy something, it gets added to cart and am told to go there instead of alexa ordering/checking out even though one click and all is turned on.. also we first set this up on my ipad and needed a phone number to set up a part in app, being new to this, we didn't realize it would become that ipad's phone number for messages/etc.. and installing app on phone afterwards resulted in us not being able to set up communication on it because cell phone number was already being used by ipad -anyhow sure others already described everything about this echo 3. i like it, music sounds great to me on it (although not older music) and i can unplug it anytime i want and it easily reconnects by itself within a minute when i plug it back in. i don't bother with that part anymore since i keep it in kitchen corner but, it is nice to know i can unplug it and not have to redo setup when i decide to get more echo's for other areas of our house.i will say i was suprise at how far/well this echo 3 can hear us, i told alexa to shut off when i was in opposite side of house in living room to see if alexa/echo could hear us there and yup she heard me.. will admit at first that bothered me but, now not so much.

Title: Small Dot, Big Sound
Body: I wrote 3 of the first 1,000 skills for the Amazon Echo when it first came out as part of a developer program. I received a first generation Echo, which has been absolutely fantastic. I wrote a few more skills and got a few more first generation Echo Dots. They were OK for listening to news, etc., but music on them was very tin-sounding.Fast forward to a couple of weeks ago and my wife saw the third-generation Echo Dot at an Amazon pop-up store at the mall. They had a promotion where if you bought two, you got $20 off, so she texted to ask me what color I wanted. I put it on my desk at home and I'm blown away by its sound quality. I'd say the sound quality of it is close to or at par versus the 1st generation Echo.It's a fantastic addition to smaller rooms if you want to listen to the radio, listen to music, or control your home. I'm absolutely delighted with the third-generation Dot. After hearing the sound quality of this device, I'm tempted to get a new Echo, as I'm confident Amazon's made great advancements in sound quality there, too.

Title: DO NOT BUY IF YOU HAVE TEENS!!
Body: This product is ridiculous.  It's all over the web how parents bought this for their teenagers only to find out they can't use them.  Amazon does not allow teen accounts/profiles to access these devices.  That means you would have to use your account to register them giving them full access to buying because the echo thinks it's yours.  It also means no music custumization.  For as advanced as a company as Amazon is, this is a MAJOR shortcoming that needs to be resolved.  It should not be difficult to allow teen accounts to have their own echo with the same limitations as the apps on their phones.

Title: DON NOT WASTE YOUR TIME AND MONEY
Body: Worst purchase I_e ever made. Have a 1 out of 5 stars cuz she works MAYBE 1 out of 5 times. Set my whole house up with Alexa (lights, tv, outlets, etc..) and she hardly ever works. I have GREAT wifi connection and have spent a lot of money to make sure of it because Alexa always tells me my devices are not responding and to check connection. After spending hundreds of dollars on modems and the highest quality WiFi package she continues to do the same. I go to my apps to control from my phone and it works fine but Alexa doesn_ not, proving the problem is with Alexa. Also, if she does not hear you clearly, expect a 5 minute explanation of some movie or book named _ights at full volume at when you are trying to get up for work. Worst part is when she gets started she will not stop, even yelling _lexa at the top of your lungs will not stop her. You just have to wait it out while she wakes up the whole house. DO NOT WASTE YOUR MONEY.

Title: Set up is a pain in the ass, but once set up they are a lot of fun to use.
Body: This was a complete pain in the ass to set up!  Just telling the end user to "go to the alexa app and follow the directions is a really bad joke!  I spent over two hours trying to set this thing up and I was unable to do it following the app directions.  I had to have a friend, who has set up six of these units for his family, set mine up.  Even he had some problems making it connect.  Now that it is set up, I really enjoy using it.I have since, helped set up two units for my sister and a friend.  Before I did, I reviewed online videos on how to set them up and thought I knew what I was doing, but still they were a "pain in the ass" to get set up and connected.  I finally called the Amazon Echo Support phone number and a service guy walked us through the set up and we got the job done.  My advice to someone setting one of these units; down load the alexa app, plug in the Echo device then call the support line at 888-283-1678 and have the service person walk you through the set up process.  This can save you hours of frustration because Amazon techs don't know how to write instruction sheets that human beings can read and use.Besides the set up head aches, the units them selves are a lot of fun to have and easy to use.Amazon needs to put a written instruction sheet in the box that tells the end user:  The account names and passwords you need to have ready, the need to have a credit card on file with Amazon, then a step by step direction on how to set these things up.  I have other friends who are interested in purchasing one of these units, but they have heard how hard they are to set up and are intimidated and are afraid to buy one.Amazon:  Fix the set up problems with proper instructions!!!

Title: Understands a 2 (almost 3) year old
Body: I like the idea of the echo dots.  I wish they were cheaper. I would only give it a 3.5 rating if I could, but I don't think a 3-star rating is justified.  I believe them to be worth the $30 I paid when it was on sale.  But anyway, that isn't the purpose of this review.Watch the video, it's cute. It is my almost 3 year old.  He loves to push the microphone button and ask Alexa what time it is.  The fact that Alexa can actually understand him is pretty cool if you ask me.  I know many adults who don't understand him when asking this question.  Good algorithm. :-)

Title: Sleek design, but awful microphone
Body: I_e had an 2nd generation echo dot for a while, and I_e loved the features and smart home capabilities it brought! I decided to get a 3rd generation dot for my living room, as it would be nice to have a newer model and better speakers in a room that would get a lot of use. Unfortunately, it has not been as solid of a model as I_ hoped for, and I_e found that it_ worse than the 2nd generation model in many regards.First off, the package came dented, which wasn_ a huge deal, though I wonder if that caused some of the problems. The setup process had a solid amount of errors due to already having on echo dot on my account, where it just flat out didn_ work the first day and continued to say it was not fully set up even after finishing it within the app multiple times. Once it was up, I was pretty happy with the speaker, and it can sound pretty good for such a small device.The true problem is the microphone system. It almost never hears anyone, and you have to yell at it to get it to pick you up! Even then, it often mishears us and does something totally different than what we wanted. While it was funny the first time I was screaming _LEXA STOP! over it playing some music, it_ gotten a bit old now (but still kind of funny). We_e tried putting it in different places, but no luck.It_ a shame, because I really like the 2nd gen dot that I have, but this one just can_ compete because it can hardly hear anything. I_ hoping they improve the microphone in the future, but right now, it takes a major toll on the product.

Title: 3-Months in and now here_ my realistic review
Body: What_ not to like about it? (Besides the occasional miscommunication between you and your Alexa usually from mumbling or faulted pronunciation) From as simple yet convenient as a Bluetooth speaker with Apple login for any room, all the way to making calls/play games and trivia/turning on lights/locking doors/ closing blinds/ controlling outlets/ etc. The convenience is all too good to pass up! I bought 2 of the Echo Dots (3rd gen) the first week the 3rd gens were released. One for me and one for my mother. And she absolutely loves it! It_ an everyday used product for sheer convenience with anyone I_e ever known who owns an Alexa device. Definitely worth the purchase in my eyes!With that said, it_ bug fixes don_ come as often as a tech-y kind of person like I would like BUT they hardly run into any problems as far as I can tell from all of the Alexa devices I_e had. Like I said, miscommunication is number one problem as of now which hopefully will be managed someway/somehow. But as of now, just speak clearly haha. I have yet to experience any bad connections with any of my lights, outlets, or other Alexa devices with my Echo personally so I_ assume any review saying there are disconnection errors with external add-on devices would be because of either their poorly constructed third-party device or poor internet connection. Either way, I believe only what I see with my own eyes and what I see and perceive from my experience  so far is a well executed and designed Amazon device.For the great price they run it at, it really is worth the try!

Title: Good but has some issues.
Body: So far so good. I have multiples and enjoy the intercom feature. Only complaint is one of the 4 has an issue where the person on the other end hears an odd noise like feedback but only while they talk. Present from multiple devices contacting the one. Also get occasional devices dropped off the network and have to pull the plug and plug back in to get it to reconnect. I have purchased smart plugs to allow me to power them off and on remotely to remedy this.

Title: Better with multiples.
Body: Love the newer echo dots, we have 3 in our house which is better than one as you can group them and listen to the same song through out the house and we use the drop in feature and we have cloud cams as well that will notify us through the echo dots if there is motion or glass breaking and so forth.At first I didn't like that the changed the plug in part cause the old echos required the same type of plug as a phone, its the same as a phone charger. But I did have issues with the connection being stable sometimes it would fall out and with this new echo dot the plug is secure and I have grown to like it much better.I have grouped my in to Multiple speaker group and now if I am cleaning it will play my music or audio books through out the whole house so if I move rooms I will still continue to be able to listen to my echo dots which makes things much more pleasant..There always updating Alexa with new things to try and privacy seems to have many people canceling or deregistering their echos but you can remove the stored audio on the Alexa and it is just used to help recognize your voice and helps the alexa get smarter, I like this feature as I dont have anything to hide anyways so this does not bother me what so ever.There are deals you can get through your echo by shopping on Amazon.com through the echo which I love a good deal. I once got $100 off a $300 cole hann purse, ecstatic! This was the discount from ordering with my Echo dot !You can also have conversations with your Alexa which is fun!Also it guards your house when your away like if it hears breaking glass or a smoke detector or a carbon monoxide detector go off it will alert your phone, I have pets at home and things like this mean the world to me I am very appreciative of this feature.Will continue to purchase this item and any newer generations as well.

Title: Brought my old Tabletop radio back to life!
Body: I have been trying to figure out how to bring some decent sound into my bedroom and have tried a bunch of wireless smart speakers from Bose and Yamaha.  I was ok with both, but they were very expensive and the sound was no better (I think not as good)  than my very old Cambridge Soundworks CD740 tabletop radio.As an experiment I bought the Echo Dot and plugged it into the Aux of my Soundworks radio.  Perfect!  Sounds great with full Alexa functionality!For those of you looking to up the sound on your Echo ... this is the best and cheapest way to go.Get on Ebay and buy an old Soundworks or Bose tabletop radio and plug a Dot into it.  I'm not exaggerating that the sound on these old puppies is every bit as good or better than ANY (Sonos and Echo Plus included ... even with SUB) smart speaker.  I am now returning my Bose Speaker .... which I really think is very good ....  and buying another Soundworks radio for $50.  Total of about $100 for great sound and Alexa that you could not get new for less than $400-$500.

Title: Excellent Device with minor Flaws of limited Info
Body: I use this product to listen to music, find information omline and have even attempted to find research information online. It works well for music as I am not that interested in loud music but rather, I am interested in music that plays clearly and can be heard as I go from room to room. For this purpose, it works well. As I am a Caribbean Islander, and though I have done the voice recognition feature with Alexa, Alexa still has some issues returning my selections or commands. Also, for research question on definitions of theories, Alexa can_ seem to return any valid answers. Otherwise, I find Alexa to be amazing. I haven_ yet tried Alexa with recipes and nifty information on life-hack sort of questions but I would love to at some point.

Title: Love it - hope it lasts
Body: I have been a fan of Echo Dot since it arrived, have given it as gifts and travel with it. That said, the first two versions have done well when left in place but were unable to keep connecting when I traveled to different locations. This version is slightly larger, definitely heavier, and so far has made it through several trips. I was very disappointed it did not fit into the same carry case as the previous versions, so I had to ditch my cute round pink case and get a clunky black case that fits this version. That said, I use the Dot every day and night (sleep sound machine) and love that it links with my SiriusXM account and Audible.

Title: Sound System Fails after appx 2 months of use
Body: I received the 3rd Gen Echo Dot for Christmas 2018. As of March 2019, I can no longer use it because the sound comes through as basically loud white noise. The music comes out completely muffled. I am very disappointed in this product. I can't figure out how to complain directly to Amazon to possibly get an exchanged, WORKING echo dot. I am a big supporter of Amazon products until now. Not happy.

Title: Just don_ waste your time with a hassle
Body: At first it was a good device worked as it should it had problems at first with connecting to Apple Music and would keep saying ask Alexa if she needs a software update then we would ask and she would say shes up to date after that we just quit using Apple Music.. later on we went on vacation and had Alexa unplugged the whole time when we got back the dot was completely a brick. I tried everything to get it to connect to our WiFi and nothing works I_e factory reset it reset all routers modems tried different phones/tablets/computer and nothing worked along with that we have two WiFi setting from our router a5ghz one and a 2.4ghz one and neither source can pick up the WiFi. Disappointed and upset I have a $50 dot that needs to be scrapped

Title: Problems with the Gen 3
Body: Have 2 Echo Inputs connected to stereo systems, 3 Gen 2 Dots, and just purchased a Gen 3 Dot.  I have all set up as a group, "Everywhere."  We like to play music throughout the house and with everything connected, it has been great moving throughout the house and being able to hear the same thing.  The system runs for 8 hours or more per day.  Bought the Gen 3 DOT and it worked quite well, for a couple weeks.  At first, it would not start playing a song when all the others were playing, but would cut in a few seconds after the song started.  Then, it started just shutting off while the others still played.  Finally, after two or three songs, it would say it was having trouble playing the music and would shut down everything.  Contacted support, and received a replacement today.  Changed out the defective Gen 3 with the new one and all worked well, for a while.  However, the replacement now has started to just shut down after a couple hours.  Both of the new Gen 3 Dots seem to feel warmer to the touch than the older Gen 2s, so don't know if they are overheating after a couple hours or if there is another problem with them.  Thinking seriously about just requesting a refund on the Gen 3 and getting another Gen 2.  I do like the sound better on the newer Gen 3, but if it keeps shutting down, ..............  Will probably use it for a couple more days and see if the problem recurs or if maybe it was just an anomaly.

Title: Here are some audio enhancement tricks...
Body: Love love love Alexa, and she_ bundled up in this nice small puck-sized unit. What could be better?I won_ go through all the reasons to buy an echo, there are plenty of other reviews for that. I_l just say that the setup experience is flawlessly easy, the unit looks good, and the sound is impressive.In order to get improved sound from the echo, you_l need to elevate it off the hard surface that it sits on to increase the bass effectiveness. There are a ton of 3D printable holders to make, some you can simply order, or if you_e lazy, just set it in the box it came in (empty it for best results). You may be impressed as well.

Title: These are great smart speakers for my bedroom
Body: Initially I was skeptic about buying these but when I saw a '2 for $60' deal I went ahead and bought these. These are awesome little speakers. I fitted one in both my bedrooms and believe me they look small but have a great premium sound for little speakers and also gets the work done working as satellite smart speakers for my echo plus. I created a group for all the echo speakers and can play music from anywhere I want and it is great to hear all the speakers playing in sync. Gives a great surround sound feeling if setup correctly. Would have liked it more if it was possible for them to play in sync when connected with Bluetooth. As of now we can only connect them in sync if we are using some streaming service to play music. If used with bluetooth, only one speaker will play music that you have your bluetooth device connected to. I would recommend this to everyone who use echo plus to control their smarthome to have this in each of the rooms that don't have any echo device.

Title: Dessapointed
Body: Dessapointed on everything: 1) looks used eventhough came in "original ' plastic and box seems very used even not look beautiful at all like fading the color.2) Still can't work like bluetooth speaker with my music in the phone without internet.3) I am not impress at all with the sound, my other speaker is so powerful if I compare and cost me only $19.4) Need to have Amazon music and pay for if I want to play songs that I really like at least play only from Pandora any music.

Title: Not responsive over time
Body: Easy to setup but echo takes multiple attempts to turn on the light that is connected to smart adapter (amazon brand or 3rd party brand. I tried both)Even after echo confirms the command by responding _k. Light still isn_ turned on.It takes 2-3 tries. One time it took 5 attempts to finally truly turn on the light.The voice recognization is becoming worse each day. It doesn_ respond to Alexa or Echo. Often we had to raise the voice loudly.It is not next to wall and it has problem hearing even during quiet night time.However, weird thing is that once it hears me the first time, then subsequent commands can be heard and acknowledged even with very low voice volume.Very inconsistent in responding wake command.Echo does not know most of questions asked. For example, can you recommend a national park to visit?Try google home. You will get better answers most of the time.Update:Received a call from Amazon to resolve the device issue. I requested to get a call back at a specific time but never received a call back.The device problem is still there and not getting better. It doesn_ respond often with first call of _lex. Repeating it with same tone, same voice level, and same direction and it responses second or 3rd time. Just not the first.Turning light on is still terrible that it ticks us off sometimes. Alexa says _k after the command and nothing turns on. After 2nd it 3rd time, then the light actually turns on.Reset doesn_ resolve the issue.

Title: Utter disappointment compared to 2nd gen
Body: True the speaker is a bit nicer than the 1st and 2nd gen dot, but the mic sensitivity is much worse compared to their 2nd gen echo dot. I tried saying the same thing at the same volume, and the 2nd get recognized and execute my command properly while the 3rd gen don't even recognize I'm talking to it.Their ambient noise filter is also worse than that of the 2nd gen.I am so disappointed with this gen of echo dot. got it at a discount, but still, I also got my other echo dots at a discount as well.

Title: not playing clear tones  turning off when it wants to
Body: I play music but the tone is not clear  I don't know how to clear  its a very low base tone  why is thatPlease answer as its hard to listen to  not up to parthis dot is not working properly  its shuts off when it wants to  it doesn't play what I instruct  and just is not rightI thought it was me but I just had a friend that knows the product and he says its not working properlywhat can I do Can I have another Dot to replace this one  Its very irritating  I am annoyed  as I am a one person office and want to listen to radio station also  soft music and it continues to shut off or not play  what I ask  pat loffredo

Title: What seems like a whim becomes a necessity
Body: I use this for so many things: to find my phone, to play music, to deliver the news, to check the time and temperature, etc. I could go on and on because there are numerous uses that I have yet to explore. I got 2 of them for my house and I would use it instead of a Life Alert if the need ever comes and I would ask it to call a neighbor in my contact list. It is so useful in so many ways and I use it dozens of times a day.

Title: Good product but sound is muffled
Body: I received my first Echo as a gift from my adult children Christmas 2018. It was the Echo Show. After setting it up to play music, video, and control my home automation using Alexa, I decided to extend coverage to our bedroom with an Echo Dot. After reading a lot of reviews, it became apparent that the 3rd gen. was the way to go, so ordered it on my Prime account and waited for it for over 2 weeks. After receiving it, I found setting it up to be a breeze since it was set for my account when it arrived. After getting it setup on my WiFi, it readily accepted my voice commands and pretty much worked flawlessly. But soon after the initial setup, I noticed the sound seemed muffled... very difficult to understand Alexa, or hear any clarity of music. No problem I thought, I'll adjust the tone controls to fix the issue. After turning the treble all the way up, I could hear little or no difference. I'm still amazed at the low quality of sound I'm hearing. It's as if everything is sharply cutoff at about 3kHz. After reading many reviews about the improved sound quality of the 3rd. gen Dot, I'm starting to wonder if I may have received a defective unit. But if what I'm hearing is normal for this model, I can only wonder how bad the 1st and 2nd get Dots were. Many who might read this may wonder if I was expecting too much from this little $50 device especially after starting with the Echo Show which has excellent audio quality. My answer to them would be no, I'm a realist when it comes to expectations from various devices. I have to honestly say my iPhone has better audio quality than my Echo Dot. Sorry Amazon, I really like the Dot but it (mine) falls short of any average expectation of a device designed to do what it is supposed to do... let me hear it.

Title: Fun & Interesting Gadget
Body: I received Echo Dot as part of a promotion.I would never had ordered one but turns out it actually has some interesting skills like answering questions without asking Google or Siri as well as playing ambient sounds for relaxation.If you have a good quality bluetooth speaker you can pair it with the Echo dot for better sound quality.There is one skill, however, called Alexa Silver that I saw a video about but I have not been able to find it.It would allow me to wake up the echo dot with a variety of names like Alaina, Allegra, Aretha, Alisha, Alfonzo, Aldis, Arashel or Excederin.It's also supposed to have a listening mode that responds "uh huh" while you tell it stories.With this skill it can repeat itself or increase the volume for those of us who may be hearing impaired.I would recommend getting one of these.

Title: It's ok
Body: The darn thing doesn't understand what I'm saying half the time. I have to use the app to find what I'm looking for most of the time. Sound quality is good. I haven't tried ordering anything on it. I'm very disappointed in the Prime Music. For what I pay for Prime, I feel Amazon Music should be included. I'm very disappointed in that respect. Unless you buy your music or pay for Amazon Music, you're going to be limited to only playing a random selection from an artist or group. You aren't going to be able to find one album and chances are you aren't even going to find the one song you want to hear. The latter is the reason for a 3 star rating. In my opinion, paying $9.99 a month for Prime and if I want to find the songs or album I want to hear, I have to pay an additional $8.99 a month for Amazon Music is just a way for Amazon to soak you for more money.

Title: Especially Great for me in Recovery Phase Post-Op Total Knee Replacement
Body: For some years, I had used a network, using the Apple Airport router and multiple pods called _pple Airport Express to play music through multiple sets of speakers throughout the house. They worked well for a while but I did have to reset them a couple of times. When Comcast upgraded their routers, the Apple router seemed redundant and the Airport Express network became more problematic. When Amazon released it_ Echo dot and Google released it_ _ome Mini, I was interested in both as possible replacements for the Airport Express. The decision was pretty easy when I realized the Google Home Mini did not have a mini jack for speakers. I bought our first Echo Dot.The set-up was fairly straight forward and even easier to use than the Airport Express setup had been. We could just ask Alexa to play whatever music we wanted to hear without having to open up a computer and iTunes. During the Christmas season, the price dropped below $30, so I bought two more. Over time, I bought a couple outlets and was able to connect all the lights in the living room so that I could just tell Alexa to _urn on all the lights. This was much easier than turning on the lights individually or putting them on timers as I had done previously.So, at this point, I had music and lights connected which were convenient and fun. Then I added a Nest _mart thermostat. We loved being able to control the thermostat without having to go downstairs to adjust it. I could adjust it from my iPhone or just ask Alexa to turn up the heat or turn it down. Adjusting the temp verbally through Alexa was not without problems at times. You have to be very exact in what you say and how you say it to Alexa. It was really easier just to use the iPhone to make adjustments as I always have that close by.I am a senior on multiple medications for this and that and when my doctor changed the schedule of some of my meds from evening to morning, it was hard for me to get into the new habit of taking them in the morning. I found myself forgetting to take them on some days altogether. This was solved by asking Alexa to remind me to take my meds every morning. If I am home, she verbally tells reminds me to take my meds. If I_ traveling, I get a notification on my iPhone. This has been great.But the real reason I am writing this review at all is to talk about how all of this technology was invaluable after having a total knee replacement this year.After I came home from surgery, I was pretty much upstairs in our home most of the time. I don_ know if it was the pain meds or what, but one minute I was hot and sweaty and the next minute I was cold. Being able to adjust the thermostat whenever needed from my bed was wonderful.I was doing a lot of tossing and turning in bed that first week after surgery and getting up multiple times to use the bathroom during the night. My husband was sleeping in the den as there was no way he could get any sleep with all of my activity. We left the bedroom door open and the door to the den open so that we could hear each other but I realized that I could go onto the Alexa app and use that to _rop in to the den, where he was sleeping like an intercom, rather than shouting. I could do the same _rop in to the living room and to the kitchen.During that first week home after surgery, I woke up and needed to get up to use the bathroom. The walker was next to the bed and bathroom only a few feet away. Usually, I used my left leg, the non-surgical leg, to gently lift my right leg, the surgical leg, off the bed and then gently down to the floor. Once, both feet were on the floor, then, using the walker, I had no problem getting to the bathroom.For some reason, maybe due to sedation of the pain med or just impatience, I moved a bit too quickly to get up. I did not support my right leg with the left foot as I had been doing and when the knee bent because of this, excruciating pain shot through my body and I lurched back, trying to land on the bed but instead of landing on the bed, I landed on a folding table which broke in two pieces, and then a plastic wastebasket that was under the folding table and then finally onto a machine that pumps ice water around the surgical site. Water went all over the floor. I had kept my leg straight and had not fallen directly onto the floor because the table, wastebasket and ice water machine broke my fall but I was stunned and started shouting for my husband in the den. He was sound asleep.I saw my iPhone on the edge of the bed, logged onto the Alexa app and _ropped in to the den and shouted for help. He woke up and came in and found me on the floor and helped me back into bed. I_ not sure what I would have done in that situation without Alexa and that _rop in feature. The next day, I ordered our fourth Echo Dot for the bedroom so if there was ever a problem n the future, I would not even need to find my iPhone.In conclusion, I highly recommend the versatile Echo Dot. I love the reminder features that keep me on track with me meds. I love the ability to just play music on request. I have recently been having Alexa read me the book, _ Handmaid_ Tale. And of course, I LOVE the _rop in feature.

Title: Amazon Customer Service Associate Helped
Body: Updating My Review...Kudos to Amazon!!!! After posting my initial negative review, a customer service representative called and discussed the issues with me.  She offered a full refund and was very nice.  So, Amazon came thru and I'm a happy camper.  I leave the original text so that others won't make a mistake and try to pair this with a Ring doorbell.  Original review text follows:  My fault I bought the thing.  But, it was sold on Amazon in connection with a Ring video doorbell. So, silly me, I thought they might work together.  As in it'd be nice to have Alexa standing by the door so that when somebody came and rang the, I could ask "Who is it?" and conduct a conversation without opening the heavy leaded glass door.  But nooooooooo.  They don't work together.

Title: Not an upgrade
Body: This device and a fire tv don't perform well and seem to show that quality control is has declined.  This device starts but won't play my flash briefing where the older Dot's I have do.  It fails on a variety of commands that work well on the older devices.  I'm invested in Amazon media so may just look for used older generation devices that work.

Title: ALEXA IS FANTASTIC
Body: For half of a century I've been using timers. Timers in the kitchen,bathroom, kids room long ago. I only need one Alexa. I don't have to remember a million (slight exaggeration) things that need to be done at a certain time. Who needs to be called, reminded of doing something I've forgotten, no more notes all around the house....JUST ALEXA, AND SHE NEVER FORGETS!  My husband and I both love her..mainly because we're not telling one another to remind the other to do something! We should have gotten her long ago!

Title: Not quite there yet.
Body: So I've had Alexa in my home for several months now.  While these are great little speakers, I don't think that the Alexa smart controls are ready for public release yet.  The voice control and command recognition just simply does not work well enough.  I am going to keep these little speakers because they are good little speakers for playing music in the whole house.  But I am afraid that I am going to have to switch to a system that has a better long and proven track record when it comes to voice recognition, control, and personal assistant.  Sorry Amazon.  I really hoped that it would have worked better.  I just don't think it's ready.  Not for me.

Title: Tell Alexa "play runescape"...
Body: And be trapped forever. I had to reset this thing because my roommate trolled me and I had to reset it to quit the game. What an easter egg...Pretty cool to be able to use this to turn on lights, get answers to random questions, and know when packages have arrived. But past that, I don't have much use for it...It will randomly turn on. Which is disturbing.It also responds to "Golexo". So it must be going through an identity crisis.

Title: Very compact, Great range, Easy set up!
Body: Excellent quality and sound rang. My house isn't that big, only 1400 square feet, but I'm impressed by its ability to pick up my voice from the kitchen into the living room without any trouble. Fully and easily integrated into my audio/video set up and for the Mooney, a very good investment. I truly believe they will become better and better as time progresses, as most electronics do, but at this stage, it's compact size and ease of set up its a winner for me!

Title: Sound not that gr6
Body: At first I was really enjoying my dot. Our whole fa liked asking it questions and listening to music. I have it in our bathroom because our 3 year old daughter likes listening to nursing rhymes and sin in the bathroom tub. We have the volume about halfway up and the speaker sounds like it's blown out?! We only had it about 4 months. At first I was thinking about getting one for each level of the house. But now that it sounds so crappy....I think I'll stick with my Bose speaker.

Title: Arlo owners beware!
Body: This device has a long way to go. I like the drop in feature, and the smart home features, but the main reason why I bought it was to control my Arlo cameras (Mainly just turning on or off.)  The only way to view a camera is to have some sort of Amazon fire tv or echo show device.  It doesn_ even allow you to view the cameras on your phone using the Alexa App. Regardless if you have fire tv or similar device, It doesn_ turn cameras on/off or arms/disarms camera. If you have a LG TV, you can control the TV except turning it on. Not sure if that_ a Alexa or LG issue, but other brand TVs work. I can live without the TV issue, but Amazon needs to fix the Arlo issue!

Title: Excellent buy. Can't stop at just one!
Body: Absolutely love this. I bought several for my home including a sub, I use it every day. I know some people have a problem with the Amazon echo because they believe that Amazon is listening in and recording what they say, and I don't think this is exactly denied by Amazon either. The seems to make a lot of people nervous, however when you think about it it's not that much different from having your smartphone on you. Your smart phone can listen, and track you with GPS, what difference is it by having an echo in your house? If you want to get away from anyone that can listen, leave all electronics and take a walk in the woods. As far as this Echo goes, it works very very well. Sometimes, I have noticed that I need to word things a little bit differently in order to get the result I want, which seems a little silly, however I have acclimated quite well in order to get it to do what I want. For such a small little thing, it has an amazing speaker in it. It plays really really well, and with the echo subwoofer it is amazing. The only thing I've really noticed about the echo Dot, is that on max volume the speaker doesn't have as great of sound. But considering that max volume is absurdly loud anyways, I usually don't put it that high at all and I never have any issues with sound. I have also noticed that sometimes the echo doesn't want to give commands to other third-party apps such as robot vacuums, there's been a lot of problems with it. But nonetheless this has been an amazing device and I have been very pleased with it so far.

Title: Cheaper than the competitors and works better too!
Body: Our first experience with a smart speaker was a Google Home. It had a nice app and it did some things, but we had to repeat _kay google! 5 times before it even heard us. We repositioned it, we reset it, recalibrated the voice commands, etc and nothing really helped. It was too late to return/exchange it by the time we decided it might be a hardware issue, so into the bathroom it went to be used as a music player.Then comes Alexa. Easier to use and set up, and the physical buttons are easier to use than Google_ (admittedly cool) fabric touch surface. She can hear us calling out her name in the nosiest situations, and I_e gotten so comfortable with using her that I don_ even look for the lights to see if she_ picked up on my voice anymore. I just call out a command and she follows without fault every time!We_e got her hooked up to my Prime account to deliver us notifications and place orders, she_ connected to our thermostat, she can turn on my TV, and we_e got her connected to Smart Outlets to control lights and appliances. I_e almost even forgotten that Siri exists on my phone now!I love out Dot so much that I_e been using them as gifts for practically any occasion. They_e incredibly helpful and I_ excited to expand her abilities and even place a few more Dots around the house.If you_e looking for a smart speaker, I seriously can_ imagine anything better than this. Just try out a Dot! You won_ be disappointed.

Title: Review after 3 months - disappointments
Body: I got the product nov with google home mini to validate what is better ... 95thday my echo dot went dead... I contacted the amazon support... they simply said it_ more than 90 and they can offer a promotional credit of 15%.... and they even closed my report saying it solved .... bad customer service and cheap product.... google home mini is better ... it goes good

Title: Got worst over time
Body: I_e been using this echo dot dice the beginning of December. It had been great originally when I first got it. For some reason nowadays Alexa doesn_ hear me call her or when she does turn on, she will just beep and turn off. I tried an air blaster to clean it and everything but it either doesn_ hear me or just do what I want it to when it does. It has been happening for about a month and it isn_ every time. It was very clear and responsive when I first got it. It still works but it has become a hassle and some what annoying. I expected better from an amazon product.

Title: What you don't know....
Body: I bought this as a Christmas gift and we set it up in the kitchen. It worked for 2 months then stopped working.  We_e tried going to the app as she directs, but nothing has worked. We are owners of the Echo Show, Spot, and black dot too, so we were really bummed when this one was faulty.  Come to find out, the Dots come with really awesome customer service that walk you through the issues.  It's just needed to be reset.  We are back in action......Alexa.

Title: The sound is OK, but nothing like the much better Alexa 2nd generation.
Body: I originally got the Alexa 2nd generation for my main area the living room but soon realized that although the sound was great, I didn't like walking from room to room and not have the music going so I purchased the Dot. It does the trick and it is great when you link it with your Alexa 2 so you tell it to play "whatever EVERYWHERE" or whatever you decide to call the group. It is great that I have the dot in my kitchen, but now I want another for my bedroom as well for the same reason as the kitchen. I don't need one in my bathroom for Pete sake, that would be wasted money in my opinion unless you want music while you have a bath or something! I don't like the sound so much, but it is better than nothing and for the price I can hook up my whole house with the same group and enjoy the same tunes everywhere in the house! Only gave it 4 not 5 stars due to "ok" quality speakers, not great ones. What do you expect for a $50 product though. I heard they went down in price but can't find out where or I would purchase my next Dot there!

Title: Do not download the AP fro the App store.
Body: Followed directions to install.  Tried to download the Alexa AP.  It failed to download.  A phone number is given on the web page to get help, when diAled "THAT NUMBER IS NO LONGER IN SERVICE". NOW THAT IS SPECIAL!  I tried to send a message for on line help and no one is available.  Not a very good start.he next day I tried again, the program still failed to download, so I again called the suggested number.  This started my nightmare.  I spoke to what appeared to be a very helpful "Amazon tech"  she stated that I had a problem with my wifi and that Alexa had detected a problem with my computer.  She assurred me that she could fix it  After 30 minutes of back and forth and taking over my computer she cheerfully declared that she could fix this by removing all the illegal websites that had invaded my computer.  The cost $295.  I spelled a problem and hung up, then deleated what I could from my computer files.  Later on I called Amazon directly and the very nice young lady who assisted my and Alexa was working in 15 minutes.  I am still in the process of learning but so far I am pleased.  So, it is vey important to not down load this app from the app store!

Title: ANNOYING AS TIME GOES On... WHY!??
Body: I don_ understand why this product is so cool at first but then when you try to _et to know it as you use it more in time; the freaking thing becomes dumber and dumber and it is not fair!! I really was looking forward to it actually working, but as usual buying with my luck I_e experienced in purchasing through Amazon (which I don_ know why I keep trying; but I_e been VERY HOPEFUL and the fact that I currently don_ have transportation to get to stores due to unforeseen issues... I_ trying to get things delivered to the house in time for Christmas, birthdays, etc.)Blah blah blah... Yes sad to say, hence the story of my life;The products that are sold Through Amazon hardly ever work right & their DESCRIPTIONS ARE UTTERLY DISGRACEFUL! SO DISSAPOINTING, VERY VERYYYYY MISLEADING & simply NOT COOL....Amazon truly could be a great amazingly overall #1company, but little things like MISLEADING DESCRIPTIONS are basically giving your customers the perception of Amazon having a BAD REPUTATION and believe it or REFUSE to SEE IT, UNFORTUNATELY that_ growing SLOWLY & GETTING STRONGER as NEW Amazon CUSTOMERS BUY & OLD/RETURNING CUSTOMERS take  their chances(LIKE ME) or SPREAD THE BAD EXPERIENCES WITH PEOPLE & as we ALL KNOW,  _ommunication by Word of mouth SPREADS LIKE POISON IVY & is REMEMBERED FOR A LIFETIME. Don_ get me wrong Amazon, I understand it_ not your fault; Although if you just took the time to maybe hire a panel of specialists or troubleshooters or testers, etc. (my apologies as I_ not really sure what the technical word is that I_ looking for) BUT....I KNOW if my idea was PUT INTO ACTION& even put through a trial test, BY SIMPLY doing this for each category that you sell products in, THIS MAY HELP A GREAT DEAL IN SELECTING ONLY the BEST products& RESULT IN actually being a great asset in the advertising & MORE IMPORTANTLY THE DESCRIPTION DETAILS IN each product.... Amazon Co. could really be so much better, more, IMPROVED DRASTICALLY by at least trying To implement this idea into your quality control/Amazon company.I ask, as a Fellow Brainstormer, natural troubleshooter, fixer, problem solver,  extremely hard worker who takes great pride in my work &would never be able to consider ANY task complete or Resolved if it_ done _alf-a$$_R WHEN ido not know the answer or I am not 100% sure I am correct; I have and will never quit until I find the correct solution to the customers problem....Think about it, just for a minute... How many people every day do you think say to themselves, once they receive a product they had purchased and feel just like myself & the zillions of other people do when they discover the description they had read on your Amazon website does not relate to the product they had purchased in anyway what so ever which as a result; LEAVES THEM ABSOLUTELY FURIOUS & Maybe a little DECEIVED or Angry (bc tons of customers TRUST&DEPEND on the fact that they are going to get that gift they bought from Amazon for their little kid, Mom, Dad, etc. and when the Shipment arrives and they only open it to discover THATGIFT _ IS NOTHING LIKE THEY HAD READ ON THE Product Descriptions& Their whole plan on having a nice gift to give is NON EXSISTANT, the persons day is all messed up, stressed, frustrated, which may even AFFECT another persons course of events, day, such as the CUSTOMERS family, friend, relationship, lover, or even WORSE OF EM ALL; the HURT OF A BROKEN PROMISE...I_ SURE ALL OF THIS sounds TOTALLY STUPID OR CORNY EVEN, but I ASSURE YOU ITS TRULY LOTS OF GOOD, HARD WORKING CUSTOMERS REALITY. Please, AT LEAST GIVE MY _ page _mazon Essay_ thought...( I just wish I could get something that I pay for that works the way the description reads) Sincerely disappointed customer...Signed ~ Angela Mellor (aka: JstMee/Mama)

Title: Junk
Body: Nothing but problems with shipping on three of them so I finally get two of them neither one of them work I finally get one to work after a few hours and playing with it and it doesn't even play anything for me from Amazon it keeps going other places very silly I'm going to Google, should have did that right from the very beginning

Title: Great sound and app caveat
Body: Alexa is now playing Abba and I didn't have to pay for a download! The Echo Dot is great. Caveat: identifying the correct app for setup was a supreme challenge. The correct app is subtitled "music" and that immediately told me keep looking for the setup app. In no way would I download a music app. NOT! The app labeled "music" IS the setup app. Setting up the Dot was anything but intuitive. This app needs reworking. Very few setup prompts along the way. It was 95% guesswork so plan on trying this or that link to find the next logical setup step. I finally had to call the HELP desk and she walked me through the whole process. Exceptional help from the HELP Desk. Thank you for that Amazon! I was close to putting it back in the mail today.

Title: Delayed response from Alexa
Body: I love my 2nd generation echo dot, so I purchased a 3rd generation dot for my bedroom.  I definitely like the sound of the speaker on the 3rd generation; however, there is often a several second delay in the response of the 3rd generation.  It is annoying since I don't know if Alexa heard me or not.  I have both of them in a group together and today the 2nd generation would start playing music before the 3rd generation would start playing.  I am not sure how the 3rd generation went downhill in response time over the 2nd generation.  I would have assumed it would have improved.

Title: Glad I didn_ pay for this
Body: I received this freebie through a Siriusxm promotion. I downloaded the Alexa appon my iphone but I cannot get it to pair with my phone.  I_ done getting myself aggravated trying to do it. This will be packed back in the box and stored someplace where I don_ have to see it. It peeves me off because I_ pretty technologically literate.I_ glad I didn_ have to pay for this piece of junk.UPDATE: I did manage to get it paired and set up but not with the horrible instructions sent to me. It took a lot of googling. The sound quality is ok but not as good as my Bose Mini-link speaker. I'm disappointed that this thing isn't wireless (meaning you need to plug it in all the time). It's good enough to set up in my bathroom.

Title: Speaker is not as good as the Echo, but good for smaller room
Body: I have an Amazon Echo and love it.  I got the Echo Dot for the bedroom.  I have tried to connect them for multi room use, but the instructions are hard for me to follow.  Someone more tech-savvy would probably easily understand.  I may have to ask my Grand children for help!  Anyway I was a little disappointed with the sound after the larger Echo, but I had a Bose CD/Radio that I had had for years.  The speakers on it are still excellent, so I connected the Echo Dot to the Bose (with the help of my son) and the sound is awesome.  I love this little dot and may get some help to connect so that I can play the same music in multiple rooms!  However, for now it sounds great!  If you want bigger sound, go for the Echo.

Title: The sound is amazing!
Body: I have several Echo and Alexa devices. I always bought an extra speaker for my dots - until now. This is an astounding little gizmo and I love it. I will be replacing all of them within the next week. Alexa keeps getting better and better. I am very glad I stuck to kindle, fire TV, echo, and Alexa smart stuff. It keeps things standardized and it seems to me that they are the best in the field of 3. I can't WAIT for the Alexa car device to be released!

Title: Sound quality not as good and not as quick to respond as Echo Dot 2
Body: I don't use a lot of the capabilities, but the sound quality is very muffled on the Echo Dot 3 when listening to the spoken word.  Its OK for music, but I purchased a compatible speaker which is far superior.  It connects instantly with Bluetooth so it compensates for the lack of sound quality in the Dot 3.However, one thing that is disappointing is that its not nearly as responsive as the Echo Dot 2. That one hears me from anywhere in the apartment at a normal speaking voice (scary sometimes......) and instantly responds. I have to stand almost in front of the Dot 3, look directly at it and give it directions. I have to speak louder as well to get its attention. Its also slower to respond to commands.  Its like the fabric outside  muffles the sound so its less responsive. I can certainly live with it, I was just expecting an improvement of the 3 over the 2, but that isn't the case.  Amazon, please restore the instant responsiveness capability of the Dot 2 to the Dot 4.

Title: First impression is this could be good.
Body: Speaker quality leaves a bit to be desired. Voice recognition is also mediocre. Ease of use rates high once you get the thing to understand you. Still exploring features and will edit when we have a better idea of how we're doing to use this.Edit: This device keeps attempting to steer my selection of music to Amazon Cloud Music service which it says is set as default. I prefer Spotify and even when there is a spotify selection available, alexa says it can't find it and tries to get me to subscribe to Amazon music. To hell with that and screw Jeff Bezos. Demoted to one star for intrusive decisions it makes on your behalf. Would give it zero if that was possible.

Title: Sweet deal
Body: Love it! And thank you for the free plug offer with it!I already have a spot and needed a hub so I got the dot to help me a little more around the house lol. There_ a portable charger and speaker for the spot but was a bit too much so I went ahead and grabbed this amazon deal c:I_ not sure why anyone says it_ (dot) not loud enough. Maybe it_ just me but I hear it just fine. Great in big rooms. I_ not looking for a sound bar just a nice ranged speaker. Also has a nice bass! The spot however is lower sound quality so this is a great add!Loving my growing smart home <3

Title: GREAT PRODUCT!
Body: Already have the Echo Plus. Bought this for upstairs. Could not believe how good music sounds on both devices. AND I synchronize the music upstairs and dow. It was super easy to install. The only thing I haven't been able to do is to control the turning on and off of the Hue light bulb. It wouldn't respond, but I've been too busy to go back thru the steps needed. Also one must have one's smartphone to do it. I keep forgetting to take it with me. I also don't order anything from Amazon using either Echo. The process is either too confusing or else I'm just too dim to do it successfully.

Title: Static noise  after four months.
Body: I did get the echo dot with the purchase of SiriusXM radio.  It really stinks though that it started to break down just a month after my 90 day warranty expired...  static and Buzzing whenever you play anything on it.  Called and they said the best they can do is offer me $15 off of a new Echo Dot yeah no thanks probably won_ buy it again.  I_l stick apple...

Title: Work unit...
Body: I purchased this unit for my job because...it was on sale. I really liked this 3rd gen because they upgraded the speaker and my music was clear and had depth. I could put this unit on 2 without disrupting anyone around me. Unfortunately, while I've been traveling for work someone has been using it because I came back today and the speaker is blown.  Anything with bass is distorted and tinny sounding.  If I find out who blew my speaker I'm going to make them buy me a new one!!!

Title: Alone, it's more gimmick than tool
Body: So, it's all fine and dandy. It works. But, I'm not willing to give it access to my ordering, because then it can be messed with too easily. I had it connected to my contacts until I thought about how bad an idea that is. The fact is, if I had four of these and a full size Echo along with a FireTV control unit and a bunch of smart plugins/bulbs/etc., then it could be a useful tool. But, by itself, it's just a gimmick. It's nice to hear a joke and be able to play music, but I have other mechanisms for music (have to upgrade my Sirius account to integrate with Alexa, don't listen enough to make Spotify a good deal...). Anyway, as part of a complete system of home components, probably great. As a stand alone item in the living room, kind of annoying to have it flashing at me that I have notifications when I've already received a text message and an email from Amazon telling me my package is being delivered.

Title: So far so good!
Body: I visited an Airbnb a few weeks ago that had an Echo playing meditation music in my room during my stay. I LOVED it.I've never actually been much for listening to music without lyrics, or listening to music while doing activities, but boy did this change my mind. It was a great way to relax and keep my anxiety lower during the day, and to soothe me into a bedtime mood at night. I liked it so much that after a week of arguing with myself, I went ahead and bought my own Echo Dot.I'm still not fully briefed on all it's uses, and I haven't used most of it's features. I'm a little cheesed that I can't access all music everywhere without paying a monthly fee, but in retrospect I'm not surprised they pulled that on users...But when all I have to do is say "Alexa, play meditation music", "Alexa, play classical music", "Alexa, turn off" to get relaxing music without a bright screen or fiddling with a device or charging something or taking up a lot of space (I'm looking at you, boom box/radio), this just makes me so happy! Also, it's a really attractive little device.I'm not sure yet how well it may or may not travel with me, and I still haven't used it for anything else, but at the moment I'm pretty happy!

Title: The easy use of it. I take it with me when 8 travel.
Body: For traveling use. It_ compact and easy. I have it so I can play my car XM satellite radio through it. Love it. I have the Echo Show and 2 Echoes in my home. I use the music on the every group. It_ so cool. I will be happy when you can use different music on each one. That_ the only draw back with Amazon music. My children listen to different music based on their age. I love Country they love other music. So Mom wins at this point. Please Amazon allow different Echos in your home to play different music at the same time.

Title: Considerably Better
Body: We own a fleet of the older dots. I got this one to replace one that seemed to have a hard time staying on my network.No network problems yet!New device seems heavier and better made that the old ones. Speaker quality is much higher.Only downside is the speaker occasionally clicks like it's being overdriven. Haven't been able to decide if it's in the source audio or the speaker itself.

Title: Adds a lot of convenience to this nanny_ life
Body: I really love this product, and it_ made my life as a live-in nanny a lot easier.I have a lot to keep track of in my life, and honestly the feature/skill to be able to play sounds for sleep has made a huge difference. I use it as my alarm, I use the morning start feature and have my calendar linked as well; then at night it_ helped improve my quality of sleep greatly- especially since it doesn_ play continuously.I also love that I can get notifications for my packages like I do on my phone, since I_ not always around it (nor do I feel a small sense of panic if I_ not _ust in case anymore) and the drivers don_ always knock or ring the bell. Being in a large, busy city, not hearing the bell could mean _eceiving my package but easily finding it gone if I_ unaware of it.

Title: Gen 3 is a real Gem
Body: This is my 4th echo added to the house. I_e had the 1st gen in my bedroom for quiet some time and when I found the deal for the echo and smart plug I just had to grab it. Compared to the first echo it_ much better sound improvement. A little smaller then the first generation but sound is way better. We use our echo to tell us the weather outside. Ask it silly questions and of course music so with the upgraded speaker it really makes a huge difference. Set up was a breeze and works just as good as the others. I have it synced up with my smart lights (I have the philips hue, but there_ cheaper choices out now). I_ constantly asking Alexa to turn and off lights. I also use the IFTTT (if this then that app) seriously.. it_ amazing! Alexa trigger bedtime and my bedroom lights turn off. My front door light and kitchen lights turn on at certain times to make it seem as someone is home. Also turns them off at times. I love how well everything works together.

Title: Great job Amazon
Body: Day 1 and I love this more than I thought I would. I think I may even pay the 3.99 a month for the music cause it_ nice to have access to whatever and my baby needs white noise to fall asleep. I plan on buying one for each room. I can take and place calls, ask for reminders and recipes. I can listed to music and play audio books. I can also communicate with other rooms like _ell Isaac in the baby_ room I need help and it will pass along the message. I have never wanted a smart house SO BAD. This was never my dream before I got this product. I was between google and Amazon but 1. Google is evil and 2. Alexa sounds hot.... Anyways, unless you_e an arrogant snob that trolls reviews, I think you would really like this produce for the money.

Title: Regret
Body: I was looking for a full apartment speaker system and these very affordably filled that role. Amazon's prime music doesn't have everything but it does have enough that I managed to build a 16 hour playlist without anything beyond my prime subscription. The ability to sync them together and play the same music throughout my home was the big selling point and I will be adding an additional one or two more before too long.The only reason it did not get the full 5 stars if that the volume control is flaky. Some songs are too loud and others too quiet. The voice commands to change the volume are not granular enough so it goes from one extreme too the other most of the time.*Edited after months of use*There is something to be said for brand new electronics that are only backed by a 30 day warranty and it isn't good. They need to be rebooted frequently or else they will run too slow to be useful at all and 1/3 has already had a power supply fail which of course happened outside of the 30 day joke if a warranty. I'll need to read the fine print better next time certainly won't be buying anything more complicated than cables with Amazon's name on it.

Title: Buyer beware
Body: There are major software  glitches every single day: from repeated volume control reduction to the lowest setting (without command) to music playback suddenly stopping or skipping songs in the middle of them, the subwoofer cutting out and/or one or two random speakers dropping off the _ulti-room playback function. There are so many bugs, I_e had nothing but trouble with this system. I purchased the echo stereo sub combo AND 2 extra echo dots for whole house sound system (that_ 4 speakers and a sub). I don_ know if I_ asking the system to perform functions that are maxing out its capabilities but I am using the system in the manner that amazon advertised it to function, so I expect it to be able to perform as advertised.  I have only owned my system for 4 months and Its been awful. I spent over 350$ and the system works about 50% of the time. I would NOT recommend to anyone.I_ fact, I_ love a refund if possible.

Title: Wonderful Device
Body: This is the only generation I have ever owned so I_ not able to compre it to past generations but this makes such a wonderful little stereo. I use to it listen to my audiable books and music when I_ studying or working. I still have yet to fully figure out how to permanently connect it to two phone devices without it always disconnecting. The skills are also difficult to connect as well. My pandora skill is already activated through the phone app but it still won_ play when I ask Alexa to play pandora. Other than that, it meets all of my expectations.

Title: Good device
Body: I previously had a 2nd generation echo dot that I traded in for this 3rd generation. Set up was easy and picked up all of my settings that I already established with ease. The only issue I have is that the 3rd generation struggles at identifying my voice all the time. Minor glitches here and there but I still like the product and use it daily to run my smart devices.

Title: Over Rated
Body: I do not see what the excitement is about regarding these.  Mine only works about half the time, the speaker started distorting after a couple of months.  All the cool things you see in the commercials, it says it cannot do, and you have to look up instructions online.  Some things never work, like calling people phones or calling echos on a different room.

Title: This item is terrible! Customer service even worse! Will NOT play Pandora!
Body: Amazon could not fix the issue of this 3rd gen echo dot streaming with my Pandora Account. My older models work just fine ( 2nd gen ) but NOPE ~ Amazon has offered zero solutions to get this thing to play my Pandora music and I have spent over FORTY HOURS trying to fix it!! I would give a zero if I could.

Title: Speaker went out in 3 months
Body: I received this item as a promotion from a company so I didn't need to pay for it and I'm glad I didn't. I had this product for approximately 3 months and I really like it. I used a few of it's features but the one I used most was the noise for sleeping.  To be fair, I did use it just about everyday and it worked very well during that time. It did not last long as the speaker on it went out in a very short period of time. I contacted customer support by email to see if there was anything they could offer me in regards to replacing it. The email told me the warranty expired (after 3 months?). It also stated there may be something they can do anyway and I should call their phone service to verify info. I did that and after a short hold time was told the best they could do was a 15% discount on buying a new echo product. To me this device is not too expensive but it wasn't something that I really needed in my life so even with a discount it's not worth replacing especially it if will just go out in 3 months again. For me this is just a little annoying, But if I did integrate this into my life more I would be quite livid.

Title: Worth the upgrade
Body: Hi. Went from 2nd generation to 3rd. Thought I would have to reset everything. It all fell into place right away. No password needed etc. It saw all my routines with no hassles. I did have to re-find my Bluetooth speakers. But that was a breeze. It weighs more than 2nd gen. Listens BETTER. Hence, no yelling at her, repeatedly.I got white but suggest you don't. Fyi. Just a matter of preference!  The speaker in it is an improvement. Less tinny.  Hence the weight. The power cord is longer and the power supply is rated at 15 watts.I got the deal of the century. A 3rd generation and Amazon smart plug for 49 bucks. VERY happy and recommend it . I think it's worth considering. CRAIG _

Title: Static
Body: After 3 months  of use of the speaker started to be staticky and distort the music . It plays well for about an hour now before the static starts. My older generation echo products still work great so I_ very disappointed with this 3 rd generation echo dot.

Title: Great Product, many uses
Body: We are loving this device, make our life so easy! The dot has a great volume, but if is on volume 6 or more Alexa won't hear, so you can get closer, yell or get the mic control. To get up or down the volume you just need to say alexa volume # (the volume goes from 1-10). The skill are great, you can do meditation, exercises, etc. My daughter uses to set timers for her piano practice and to be on time in the mornings. So far so good. Great product Amazon. Customer services is really the best!

Title: A review of the device not Alexa. Microphone sucks... that aside
Body: I'd review Alexa but I feel she is adequate this is purely my feelings about the current gen Echo Dot.I've had this(5 months) and the 2nd generation (1yr and 5months) for sometime now and I can honestly say I'm not overly impressed with the third generation. I had the 2nd gen in my bathroom and the 3rd in my kitchen. Walking through the front door the 2nd gen two rooms away was more likely to pick up my voice than the 3rd gen that was much closer and on top of a counter so it could be unreconstructed. The speaker is about the only thing I really have liked about this Dot as the 2nd gen was definitely really weak. I almost wonder if the mic on my 3rd gen in particular is just damaged. Even freshly unpacked the microphone was weak. It is so poor and the 2nd gen mic so good I had to move the 2nd gen to a back room where wifi is weaker but I can close a door so it won't pick up my voice.As a home assistant it is more important to have a functioning microphone than a speaker. Speakers can be bought and/or added on. Microphones can't.

Title: Stuff you won't read elsewhere
Body: There are hundreds of reviews for this version so I won't just repeat the obvious or gush about how it is the best thing that ever happened to my life. I'm just going to say a couple of things that aren't usually mentioned.One is why I replaced my old original Dot. She was going deaf. I have several Dots but for some reason the one on my kitchen counter was having trouble hearing me, she would either ignore me or keep saying she didn't understand me. I finally figured out that all of the microphones are tiny holes on top of the device and just like an old man's ears they would clog up with dust and kitchen grease and gunk to the point I had to get a divorce - um, from her - and look for a younger model.My new model is more attractive and curvy and sensuous and speaks in a low sultry voice. And that's actually not good. One of the brilliant things about the original design was that Alexa's voice was sharp and shrill and could cut through the commotion of household noise. My new Alexa by comparison sounds muffled, like she has a paper bag over her head. She can hear me fine, better than the old model, but now I can't understand her.Comparing the white color to the first generation there are pros and cons.  First off the new generation is all white with a white cord and white power supply.  The original had a white body but the top, cord and transformer were all black.  I have mixed feeling about that. It does look more contemporary but the mesh side and matte finish on top show dust and fingerprints much more than the older model and already after a few days it is looking a bit dingy.  And as much as I like the new power cord the transformer is substantially larger, it actually prevents me from using the outlets on either side of it on my power strip.One final thing, you would think with all the money and time spent on developing this product they could have figured out how not to make the two jacks on the back identical in size and shape. The original model had a mini USB power port, the new one has a small round connector that looks just like an audio jack. The user shouldn't be forced to think about which one is the power port and which is the external speaker port.

Title: HORRIBLE PRODUCT FROM WORSE COMPANY EVER / WONT LET YOU RETURN CRAP ITEM
Body: DO NOT BUT THIS PRODUCT.  IT IS PRODUCED BY AMAZON.  IT RUNS AS GOOD AS THEY DO, SO YOU CAN'T EXPECT VERY MUCH FROM IT.  JUST ALOT OF FLASHY LIGHTS AND LIMITED ANSWERS.  TRY THE GOOGLE HOME.AMAZON PULLS DOWN REVIEWS THEY DON'T LIKE GETTING 1 STAR.  THEY HAVE PULLED MY REVIEW TWICE.  I WILL KEEP POSTING.

Title: How did I live without Alexa?
Body: I have this Echo Dot in my kitchen and I love Alexa! When I make my morning coffee, I listen to my flash briefing. Before I leave for work, Alexa tells me the weather for the day. When I_ cooking, Alexa can set a timer for me when my hands are dirty. Alexa reminds me every Saturday morning to water my plants. I can create grocery lists with Alexa and the list will be on my phone when I_ at the grocery store. Alexa can play my music from Spotify or play numerous playlists from amazon music. I personally like the cooking with classic soul I think it_ called. You can play games/quizzes with Alexa and she can tell you nerdy or corny jokes, which are funny to me.

Title: 3 Month Warranty - Consider carefully
Body: Update: apparently the speaker sounded blown out because of a software issue that was eventually resolved. Updating star rating to 4 stars for this review to reflect my overall opinion of the device and that this issue was eventually resolved- - - -I bought a 3rd generation echo dot 6 months ago. I woke up this morning to the alarm and the speaker was blown out. The volume has never been higher than 7/10 using the actual speakers on the device. Amazon has a 3 month warranty on the echo dot, so they would not offer me a replacement or fix. The customer service representative offered me a 15% discount on a new echo dot. I would be happy to give the product another chance for without paying more than I already have, but I_ not interested in buying a second echo dot in the hope that one of them will work longer than 6 months. Consider carefully before buying any Amazon branded electronics, Amazon doesn_ appear to trust its devices to work longer than 3 months, why should we?!

Title: Our household gives these 5 stars! We love them.
Body: I think we have 6 of these. 3 bedrooms, Kitchen, Dining Room and gym. My son says he loves he can walk anywhere in the house and use Alexa. We also subscribed to the Family Music Plan so we use that quite often. I can walk into my gym and tell alexa to play my work out music play list and that right there sold me! I used to have to keep an Ipod down there and now don't have to fool with that. I also paired to a big speaker and that makes it very loud...I just wish it would pair to my surround sound in the gym..that would make it even better.

Title: Got it for the exteranl Audio Output
Body: I was thinking about getting the Alexa device that you use your own speakers.  Then I read one of the reviews and the person said that was a waist of money and I should get the dot because it has the external audio output.  I have several amazon echos however this is my first dot.  The 3rd generation has a lot of bang for $40.I hooked this think to my stereo with a male 1/8 to male RCA adapter.  Now I can listen to my amazon music as loud as I want.  Amazon listened to people with that external audio output.  I think that was a wise decision.

Title: So glad I did!
Body: So far, this product far exceeds my expectations.  Alexa is smarter than Siri and it_ fun to play daily trivia questions and having her turn off lights and answer so many questions.  I like that she can control my LG TV - however, she cannot turn it on because it needs the Wi-Fi connection to make it work.  So, don_ blame Alexa or the TV - it_ logic - no Wi-Fi connection - she can_ turn the TV on - once it is on - she does everything the remote can do - excellent purchase and so far very happy with it!

Title: Warranty issues.
Body: I bought a pair of these Echo 3s in January.  One has worked well and I can move it from room to room as needed.  The second has never worked properly.  In trying to replace it , I find Alexa reporting that I have 90 days, the website reporting 60 days, and the sales slip reporting 30 days.  Hmmm.  I guess Amazon does not have confidence in this product.  30, 60, or 90 is a very short warranty period no matter how you look at it.  I am not unhappy with the Echo that works but, since I can't return the defective one, I will check out the Google product and see how it compares.

Title: Love her!
Body: Love her! I wish i would if bought her sooner. She's great compamy! Love asking her the news. She tells me what the weather is beforehand. Then I ask her each night to turn on my bedroom light, when my dog runs in there before me. She can play some piano for my pets while I'm away, ask me trivia questions when I'm bored, oh and I love when her light blinks, notifying me if Amazon shipments delivered. I could go on. =D

Title: Echo Dot
