Body: I bought one of these for a Xmas gift for my wife since we bought this one we have bought 7 more of these and 2 of the taller ones and wonder how we got along with out them. We use them for alarm locks, to control the tv, to control the smart lights we have and to control our ecobee thermostat. The tall ones work great with Sirius Radio and the sound is real good. Would purchase more but think I have enough of them

Title: Not good for medical reminders
Body: Purchased for verbal medication routine reminders due to poor memory. My reminder setup was double-checked to ensure the test's accuracy.* echo doesn't understand me well, so I had to type in reminders* Mispronounces words typed in*Limits length of reminders so my noon medication instructions took five reminders spaced a minute apart.* If your medication routine needs to be repeated multiple times a day it does not give you the option of doing so without having to retype everything all over again.* Because the setup is cumbersome, I decided to just see how the noon cuing went; by the fourth day echo was only giving me 2 of the 5 midday reminders.*A reminder I set to begin a change in my medication routine began 9 days earlier than scheduled

Title: Failed after 5 months
Body: My device failed after 5 months and Amazon does not stand behind these devices. They offered to give me a 15% discount to buy another one. When I told the rep that they were on sale for 20% off yesterday and I purchased it for 50% off originally she told me that I could also trade it in to get another 25% off. I had some problems with his device early on and didn't immediately ask for a replacement because I assumed Amazon stood behind there products. It would work again after I unplugged it and it restarted, but then it completely failed and died. On top of that, the link in the order says a replacement may be available for up to one year, which is not true. Google Home has a one year warranty.  The 1st and 2nd Gen Alexas have a one year warranty, but the 3rd gen has a 90 day warranty. Ask yourself why Amazon would change the warranty for substantially less time if the device was really an improvement over the 1st and 2nd gen devices. I own several of Alexas, but I certainly won't be buying more.

Title: Vast improvement!
Body: I was an early adopter of the Echos and have used Gen 1 (Echo), Gen 2 (Echo & Echo Dot), and now Gen 3 (Echo Dot).  I will say that this Gen 3 Echo Dot is a VAST improvement over the Gen 2.  I still have some Gen 2 interspersed with my Gen 3s and the sound quality is multiple steps of improvement over Gen 2.  I can finally use just one Gen 3 Echo Dot in a room vs having to use (2) Gen 2 in a large living area.  The sound quality isn't quite up to where the Echo itself is, but it is very close.  Music on the Gen 2 Echo Dot was distorted sounding and very tinny - this is not the case with the Gen 3 Echo Dot.  Would highly recommend upgrading if you are considering it.  I exchanged a few of my Echo Dot Gen 2s in when Amazon was running the trade-in promotion - seems like they are running such deals every so often to encourage upgrading.

Title: A great entry level smart device!
Body: This thing has been really cool (I have 2 of them). My only complaints are that 1.) the audio quality is different between the two units, with one being slightly more muffled as you add bass, and 2.) it seems like the longer it stays plugged in, the slower it responds when you call it, kind of like a memory leak. I got my second unit at a drastic discount when I bought the first, so I'd say they're still an excellent deal. I use Alexa daily for my alarm, sleep sounds, and weather, and a lot of music when I'm around the house. It's cool that my kids can use the Dots to call me on my cell phone when I'm away.

Title: cool but need user preference enablement
Body: Ya, I can say lots of wonderful positive things about my echo device, and I am very happy to have it, but this is about IMPROVEMENT needed.1) I use it mostly for my music in a tow room apartment using AmaMusic, SiriusXM and PandoraPrem.  It bluetooths back and forth to my bluetooth speaker in the other room.  BUT IT WON'T PLAY THRU ITSELF AND THE BLUETOOTH SPEAKER AT THE SAME TIME.  That's biggie Jeff!2) Sound quality is ok, but could be better.  Frequency control would be nice; maybe it's there and just don't it yet.  Getting it to play the wake-up alarm music loud enough has been problematic.3) Like it or not Jeff, Alexa can keep the tone and inflection of her voice, but so many other patrons I want to be able to rename her.  We all know now that you're stupid when it comes to women, so just accommodate us for this.

Title: Device sound quality horrible after 3 months of use!
Body: The sound quality of my device totally crashed after just 3.5 months of use (right after the 3 month warranty expired)! Everything has static in the background and all voices (Alexa and voices on podcasts) sound like they have a horrible lisp! I contacted Amazon customer service and their only advice was to buy a new device with a 15% discount. If the quality of this device is so poor that it only lasts 3 months, then clearly it is not worth re-purchasing. I'm extremely disappointed in the quality of this Amazon device and cannot recommend it.

Title: Love this little thing!
Body: This is so useful.  I can ask Alexa anything and she usually knows the answer.  I can set 3 different timers when I'm cooking and she'll tell me what each one is for when it goes off.  It's much easier to ask a question than to pull out my phone.  I loved this so much that I bought another one for the bathroom so I don't have to have a radio in there.  I just say "Alexa, play station xyz."  And I loved the price.  Can't beat it.

Title: Very dissatisfied n
Body: This is my fifth echo Dot. The other four are second generations. the only reason I bought this one was because it was touted to have sound much superior to the 2nd generation. Well, to me, it sounds like someone talking through a rag!second generation sound is not that good but not horrible. However I would definitely give the third generation sound a horrible rating! I'm very disappointed!

Title: Looks pretty. Microphone sucks. Stay with 2nd Gen.
Body: 3rd gen looks pretty (the reason for the 2 stars rating), but just like others wrote - the near field and far field microphones suck big time. I literally just asked "Alexa, play Christian Music on Pandora", and the feedback i got was "Playing Christian Comedians on Pandora". "Alexa, Stop!". Then i repeated the request 3 more times, just to have the exact same result - definition of insanity, right? LOL. Comedy in itself is fine, but that's nowhere near the "Music" that i requested. My 2nd Gen array of echo dots work and respond far better. I advise everyone to stay with the older gen - they're cheaper, too (buy used, it's perfectly fine, too... I did for my last ones, and they're performing admirably)

Title: Gotta get the hang of these things!
Body: Whoa!! Took me a while to get these things sorted out. Purchased 4 of them. Unfortunately I have 2 of them named the same thing as far away from each other as possible, so one doesn't activate the other because of proximity. This feature I don't like. Amazon.... common, get with the program. Due to the community Q&A I have been able to find most of my questions answered, so thanks guys! Multiple rooms having the same audio, that was a tricky one! Overall the quality, sound and price for this is TOTALLY worth it.Oh and I can drop in when my kids are fighting without getting my lazy butt outta bed. _____

Title: Much better audio than the 2nd gen
Body: I now have 2 of these Echo Gen 3's and a Gen 1 and Gen 2 Echo Show and while on the Show the big improvement is the much large screen, for the Dot's between 2 and 3, the sound quality is the most remarkable difference.  I've ready some gripes about the power plug being different but all-in-all, these Gen 3 Dot's are a great deal for the cost and improvement over Gen 2 in sound quality and clarity makes the upgrade worthwhile....plus, I traded-in my Gen 2 Dot to Amazon to get a good discount on the Show Gen 2. :)

Title: Hasn't been as good as Gen2 for me
Body: UPDATE: Things are getting even worse. It really has poor microphones. I have this in the bedroom and I have to raise my voice (even though room is silent) to get it to hear me. Wakes up my wife. My older echos work much better.I have a voice that doesn't carry very far so I was excited to replace my gen2 Dot with this one... which promised better microphones to pick up voices even when there's background noise. I have not seen any improvement. I would say it is actually worse for me. Biggest pro is the whisper functionality - when it works. For example: I whispered something to try and be quiet for someone that was sleeping... Alexa whispered back the answer then asked in a normal loud tone something like "Did I answer your question?". Defeats the purpose of the whisper. Overall, I like Echo Dot. I just haven't had a good experience with the gen3 version. Don't know if it's an anomaly for me or if others are experiencing same thing.

Title: Google Home is better
Body: Alexa is an incredibly stupid AI to the point where it's frustrating.  She has trouble hearing programmed routines or will answer your question with the wrong answer. The worst and most frequent answer though is "I don't know how to answer that".The final straw was when I set an alarm and it went off so I said "Alexa, snooze for 20 minutes". The alarm then started going off every 6 seconds and I couldn't stop it.  It would beep once, pause for 6 seconds, beep again and repeat. I was yelling "Alexa stop" and she would just give me answers like "Which alarm do you want to stop?BEEP". I eventually got fed up and pressed the button to try and set her up again, had the yellow ring and everything but the alarm was STILL going off.  Just going to unplug her for nowMy Google home works way better than this thing

Title: Stopped playing music after 1 months and hasn_ worked since.
Body: Product stopped playing music (probably the main reason I wanted one) through any streaming app after about a month.  I have contracted amazon multiple times, done every trouble shooting method they have and nothing fixed the problem. The best news I have received is that there are some devices having this problem and their techs are working on the issue. Well it_ been 4 months and their techs haven_ figured it out? Most likely they aren_ going to be fixed and I_ hung out to dry. I_ shocked that amazon has not attempted to replace a defective item. I expected much more from them considering my encounters with defective items in the past. Disheartening. Purchase at your own risk.

Title: Bluetooth + Speaker = Terrible experience
Body: I've gone through 3 Echo Dots all with the same issue.  When using this device with either of the two different bluetooth speakers that I own it will only play music for any between 5 seconds to 10 minutes before the Echo Dot will lose it's internet connectivity.  If you call technical support they will make you go through the same setup guide that you find in the manual.  After a 30 minute process they will offer a replacement, so that in a week or so you can go through the return process all over again.The issue is that the Echo Dot 3 is not stable and can not run a bluetooth connection without giving you the red ring of failure. If you don't plan on using it for bluetooth, you might find it good enough.  Otherwise look elsewhere.

Title: Did not make me want to learn more about it - a neat little oddity
Body: I already have a chat cylinder from another company.  Quite honestly, I forget a lot about what it was like to setup, other than I did not particularly care for it.  The other product that I have had a seamless, intuitive, and easy setup.  The Echo Dot was so boring, and seemed focused around Amazon, that it annoyed me.  It gave the appearance of listening all the time, cataloging what was heard in the in house - just my perception, not saying it's a fact.  Alexa offered to make phone calls, so I told it call someone, and said that they have to be on Amazon, or something like that, to work - what a flop.  I'm going to buy another outlet controller so that I can turn Echo-Dot/Alexa on and off through my other product. Also, the Echo Dot would not pair with my Bose Bluetooth audio adapter  - until the Echo/Dot, I haven't found a device that didn't pair with the Bose Bluetooth adapter.  The quality of the Echo Dot audio is nothing spectacular.  It's a neat little oddity that I cannot take very seriously.

Title: An "OK" Upgrade from Gen 2
Body: I have had both Echo Dot (3rd Gen) and Echo Dot (2nd Gen) for awhile now, Both do the job for basic voice control and things of that nature. The 3rd Gen Echo does have more base overall, but for my needs the extra base does not really add much to the experience. If your buying your first (or adding one to a different room) Echo Dot then I can recommend getting the 3rd Gen, But if your just wanting to upgrade a 2nd Gen for a 3rd Gen I would suggest either not doing it (unless you listen to a lot of music), or plugging in your 2nd Gen Dot to a set of speakers.

Title: Upgraded big time
Body: I like that you can say _lexa _lmost anywhere in the house and she will respond to you. I was having Internet connectivity issues with the Echo Dot for a day or two but figured out that it was because I logged off of my Amazon account on my phone. I do not have any complaints so far All I have is good news to report. Sound quality goes beyond anything anyone would ever expect. Knowing that you can use an auxiliary or Bluetooth to connect even more devices only further in Hanses the usage of the Echo Dot third generation

Title: Dots work great even without an Amazon Echo
Body: You do not need to have an original Alexa to make these dots work! I had misunderstood that and that's what kept me from getting one sooner. I ended up purchasing 2 of these Echo dots and we have been using them since Valentine's Day. I have five children that have had a lot of fun having Alexa tell stories and jokes.One thing that I really like is the ability for me to drop in on the downstairs Echo dot using the upstairs Echo dot to relay messages to the kids that "can't hear me".Since I have Prime and lots of Prime music for free, I use it for music often.Another feature that I had no idea about but use everyday is the ability to stream any radio stations using TuneIn.I can stream those all day long, to my location in Utah from their location in Pennsylvania, and the sound quality is great!

Title: I thought they would be better
Body: So I bought 2 echos because I wanted to get a speaker to listen to music and maybe have an alarm as well. I got them when they were on sale and I was happy with the price... Now it_ been a while and I_e used them quite a bit and I have to say that the echos are just okayThey sound just okay, I have them as my stereo speakers but the sound get_ all distorted if I turn the volume upThey almost never recognize me when I use the wake word and I have to say it multiple times and it_ really frustratingAnd they just disconnect from wifi all the timeI_e tried resetting them and troubleshooting all sorts of things and nothingI like the concept of having smart speakers but the execution of them is not that good

Title: Only good as an alarm clock
Body: The whole Alexa product is worthless, it cannot answer most of the questions that I ask it, When I ask Google I get an immediate answer. Unfortunately too late to return it.******DO NOT WASTE YOUR MONEY*****

Title: Like HAL 3000 if he smoked weed
Body: Will acknowledge my requests and not fulfill them or do the wrong thing, yet will do them first time when I'm sick or my friends ask. Also, when i ask the temp, a number is good. Blabbers way too much. I don't need the full report. Idk why I replaced the second gen. Guess I just liked the voice controlled lights and TV. Setting up apps / skills is amazingly annoying and integrating smart tech is so convoluted. Once you do it it's done but it's not fun. If you have more than one also they will compete with each other when you talk.

Title: First Week Has Been Great
Body: I_ an Apple guy. I used to work for Apple Retail and have used the HomePod and Apple Music extensively. I got the Echo Dot for free with the purchase of a Ring Doorbell.Alexa is doing great! She picks up what I_ saying quickly and responds aptly. I haven_ even called her bad names yet, as Siri has taken a tongue lashing from me. In the same breath, she responds more quickly and more thoroughly because she is remembering all my conversations, and as we have recently learned, these conversations are being sent out to be listened to. Siri does not remember prior conversations for privacy reasons, which is a higher moral standard, but less effective in the short term.But that_ okay, because you can turn off the settings that allows Alexa to send your audio out to be listened to.Amazon Music is okay, but the library is nowhere near as large as Apple Music and couldn_ play some of my favorite albums.But that_ okay, as I was able to easily set up my Apple Music account through the Alexa app and now I just tell Alexa to tell Siri to play my Apple Music. Alexa has an assistant, and her name is Siri.The bass is almost nonexistent in this little Dot, with a lot of low-mid trying to cover it, which is does an alright job of. The mids and highs are nice.But that_ okay, because it has a headphone jack and I just plugged it into my existing stereo.I haven_ tried any of the higher functions yet, but right out of the box and the first week have been impressive.Things are best when they are free.

Title: Great Device, I wish it worked seamlessly in Spanish as well
Body: Great device! I had basic home automatization devices such as my lightning system which works perfectly with the Echo Dot.  Although due to the people that interacts on my home I'd wish that it worked same as in English for the Skills, because their functionality is not equal in languages different than english.  So it works perfect for my, but not so great for other people visiting our home.Also audio quality is amazing for such small device. Even my dogs now are enjoying music when I leave the house.

Title: It's all fun and games until the power cord comes loose
Body: Okay I'm really hoping that Amazon customer service will read this review because I actually sent back my first Echo 3rd gen that I bought because when I played music occasionally it would just get very distorted and start sounding like one of the speakers was blown basically. If anybody's ever had a blown speaker you know what that sounds like and it sounds horrible. Well we sent back the device and received a replacement only to have the replacement a few days later start doing the exact same thing. Now my logical brain deduced quickly that the two devices could not both be damaged because that was too much of a coincidence. So after tinkering with it for a while my wife and I figured out that if the power cord on the 3rd gen Echo becomes a little loose it starts distorting the speaker sound very badly. So hopefully that's an issue you guys are already aware of if not maybe I can bring it to your attention right now, but that is definitely an issue that happens. so ever since we have mounted are device on the ceiling and the cord is securely connected to the mounts and will not become loose anymore we have not had this issue, but this could be a serious problem for all the customers who are buying these devices and then just thinking that they're crap and sending them back now I love you guys Amazon so I knew that was not the case so I had to figure that out but I just wanted to let anyone else know that this is an amazing product I love it very much but if you start having that distortion of the sound problem like I was check your power cord and make sure it is securely plugged in.

Title: roommate
Body: Being brand new (just received) I am having a good time with the ease of playing my radio stations and asking questions to help with crosswords and such. I'll probably get over the novelty but it works very well and I think it plays loud enough for me. Initially being an older adult I had a little uneasiness with the app and probably still don't understand all I can do with Alexa.  Tech people think everyone is tech literate but my spouse would have no idea how to set it up. Could be a little more plan and simplified. I realize it's more for the young but a few moments of simplification would be appreciated. Older people are more afraid to accidentally punch the wrong thing. Of course the system would like accidental purchases.

Title: Alexa has become our newest family member
Body: Works very well, fun to use along with attempts to fool alexa (Who is your daddy).Alexa requires a constant internet connection...although you can ask alexa 'are you connected to the internet'.Overall an amazing product which handles different voices very well. Music is good for her size.Fun facts + ability to perform calculations are bonus.Alexa has integrated flawlessly with smart home products (WeMo + Moes).Only downside, since Alexa is 'always' listening, when talking about Alexa in the 3rd person she will respond.We refer to her as 'She who cannot be named'.  ;-)

Title: Clean style
Body: We have a number of connected devices from Amazon, but I wanted a smaller device that could be mounted to the plugin (we purchased a mount separately). This device not only sounds good but looks good as well. At first I was disappointed that the first generation was no longer available as the mount options are much more plentiful. However the style of this device makes it look like it is supposed to be there and the rounded edges don_ hurt if you kid bumps into it.

Title: Amazing product yet niche and unnecessary for most people
Body: Awesome and fun. So many great features. I bought it for smart home use and it's been a charm. I wish it didn't need internet but I understand how it works so its fine. My biggest gripe is that their still aren't enough skills available for various interests. One that stands out is that theirs no weather skill for my area or a news skill for many areas, but I can't fault amazon for that since most of these skills seem to be independently developed. If the internet is too slow it sometimes hiccups and might take awhile to speak back or if a song is playing through it might lower the quality but those are to be expected. My second gripe is that the bass is sounds a little off but all in all it's a great product that works great for its main purposes, if you want better audio just buy the version that hooks up to your stereo system.

Title: I am having trouble understanding, try again later
Body: All of a sudden with same environment (same WiFi network, same Echo Dot location, same quiet room, etc.)Echo Dot keeps saying "I am having trouble understanding, try again later." for three days.I have a lengthy conversation with customer service team letting me know that my Echo Dot is out of warranty so they can't be replaced. A suggestion he offered was move Echo Dot close to WiFi router...What a simple waste of my time talking to someone with a lack of technical knowledge....I did hard reset, reboot, and moved it close to WiFi router. Nothing works...Toss it to the garbage reminding myself never buy any Alexa products again.

Title: Good Starter Device
Body: I love the convenience for playing my favorite music from Amazon music or Spotify.  Love the ability to quickly learn the weather and latest news.  Love the Alexa features.  However the Alexa app can be a bit clunky compared to a typical Apple designed interface.  I bought the dot as a trail to see if I like the concept for my home.  Okay sound but nothing to get excited about.  Will upgrade to the larger and better Alexa speakers in the future.

Title: Poor sound quality versus previous generation.
Body: Produces a very poor sound quality. Although the speaker is louder than the first generation the sound quality is not good.  Listening to a podcast or talk radio, voices give off a rattling, tinny, and distorted sound. This even happens just using Alexa. I would not recommend. I have four of these second generation speakers that replaced the first generation. I wished I would_e kept all of the older versions.  These Gen 2 echo dots are just placed in areas of convenience but are very annoying to listen to.

Title: Disappointed. Customer service run around.
Body: Purschased the Exho for for the music playing ability. Worked flawless in the first 2 weeks then had several issues with volume and connecting to linked skills requiring me to unplug and _eset Alexa. On 3/30/19 I changed SiriusXM accounts. New account linked in skills but would no longer play on My echo. Contacted customer service who attempted to troubleshoot and was unable. I was told it would be escalated and I would receive a call in 24-hours. No call came and I have since emailed and spoke with customer service 2x/ea. Now 2-weeks later and this has started as just a glitch on my echo that it literally worked one minute but not the next, to a system wide issue with SiriusXM and no anticipation of when it will be resolved. Only information I have received now is that it has been escalated to a Master ticket and it is being worked on.

Title: so far so good!
Body: I wasn't sure what to expect with Alexa. i do wish they had a booklet that went with it to explain everything Alexa can do! that has been frustrating to learn how to use it. you have to say Alexa first & then your command. i enjoy being able to make a phone call easily, ask about the weather, listen to my music & have her start my day! very fun!! i have had no problems with the device at this point. i have tried a variety of things just to see what happens. you do get a weekly email of updates on what she has been programed to do. connectivity to my amazon stuff has been smooth with the music & audible books. no problems accessing my phone contacts. i put the app on my phone. i don't have blue tooth to connect. i did get the free plug & am assuming i can plug in a light & have her turn it on or off! fun!! i haven't figured out where i want to do that yet. i also saw on amazon you can order a door with a lock that alexa can lock or unlock with voice command. next will be a fully functioning smart house like on the TV show Eureka!!

Title: Worst Item Ever!!
Body: I bought this item back in November and when I first got it, i was able to set it up with 0 zero issues. Fast forward to February the device stopped working and after trying every trouble shooting advice possible, the item is still not working and it doesn_ make sense to call Amazon. They just have you try the same trouble shooting you_e already done which does not help. I wish I could return this item but unfortunately I am outside of my return window..

Title: Awesome device must have in every home!
Body: Such a powerful speaker for the money and with Alexa being its primary function I, and my wife love it we can drop in to rooms when we don_ have our phones and it works like a intercom I love it! I know the weather everyday and I like when I_ leaving for work asking for the weather to know if o need to carry my umbrella! Works awesome no issues just need more of them!

Title: Easy to use and great features!
Body: Honestly this is pretty damn awesome! I love how it looks and the performance is amazing. I have a Google mini but I prefer to use this one. Setting up and linking my apps and devices was a piece of cake, anyone can do it. I personally prefer Alexa to be on high volume but you can change it however you want. My daughter loves it, she listens to music on it all the time. This makes life a little easier for us and we love it.

Title: Don't buy if you want them to work independantly
Body: I bought two of these things for my kids for Christmas so that they can hear different nature sounds at night while they sleep.  These things keep trying to sync with each other, and when they do one child hears the other one's request, and the one that request certain sounds get nothing.  Trying to unsync them is a big pain, and is difficult to find any information from Amazon.  When they don't sync, they work great, but when they sync they are a piece of junk.

Title: Hey Si...Alexa
Body: As an Apple person who won_ purchase their HomePod because of the ridiculous price, I decided to purchase these instead. I bought one for each room and mainly use the bedroom one. Honestly I really only use it for news briefing and sleep sounds but the capability of this product is pretty vast.

Title: 3rd gen and still NO Optical Out?
Body: Amazon needs to add an optical out on these already. The Chromecast Audio puck has had optical out for ages but I prefer the Alexa environment over Google Home. The built in DAC/3.5mm output on the Dot sounds horrible. I would love to be able to run this through the Schiit Yggdrasil for casual Spotify listening when I don't feel like booting up Foobar but no optical out takes that off the table.Come on, Amazon! You're missing an entire market of high-end audio users who would buy these if we could bypass the lousy internal DAC and use our own.

Title: Software is difficult to use- Sonos support is difficult
Body: I have a Sonos system in my house driven by a Sonos Player and my own speakers throughout my house. I recently added a stand alone Sonos paired speakers in my bedroom to the overall system. Those speakers use the Amazon Alexa commands.The bedroom speakers worked so well with the Sonos and Amazon Alexa voice commands that I though I would try voice in the living room where I listen to music much of the time so I added the echo dot. It took a long time to set up a grouping of my rooms to use the echo dot and I am quite technology oriented. The software and the documentation is not helpful. I finally got it to work the way I wanted to by creating speaker groups that the dot now recognizes. Software was not easy to use but it now works well

Title: Total failure two weeks out of warranty after one hour of total useage
Body: I purchased this Echo Dot Gen 3 for my wife as a Christmas gift.  We registered it, and then packed it away before getting any use out of it because we were in the process of moving out of state.  I was really impressed with the sound quality.  It was unpacked an connected when we moved into our new house worked really great for an hour before the unit died, exactly two weeks after the expiration of the 90 day warranty.  Amazon replaced the power supply free of charge, however that did not solve the problem. The unit simply no longer powers up.I'm certain that Amazon knows exactly how long this unit was powered up (since they're listening.)  I'm just disappointed that the best they could do was offer me a 15% discount on the purchase of a new unit.  We took a pass on replacing it.  Amazon knows too much about us already :)

Title: Does not respond well after two months and the CSR is sucks!!
Body: After two month use, there was one time it did not respond me while playing music as my mouth only inches away, and another time when I called "Alexa" it does not respond at all but my second one placed farther responded. Contacted CSR for a replacement, the CSR asked to go through their troubleshooting process and told it was because the volume was low. That's interesting to hear that in my life the device volume is about if the device can hear me not the sound the device plays. And the CSR asked me to send back the product but they may send the same one back if they think there's no problem. I'd very like to know they would explain the closer one did not respond but the farther one did. Very disappointed

Title: Great choice
Body: Initially I had a tough time getting connected to Wi-Fi, as I didn't have enough instruction to know I need my secure password for connection. However, after getting everything working properly, I am happy with this purchase. It will give me peace of mind to have this, as my husband is disabled, & when I'm gone might need to call 911 plus me in an emergency situation. This is my primary reason for selecting this unit along with the Echo Connect device. We will discover much more when time & curiosity permits.

Title: You can ask for information about EVERYTHING
Body: The tasks, reminders, alarms, and communication features are awesome. Set up is easy, but you do need a phone or other device to set it up. After that, it's voice-activated. You can ask for information about EVERYTHING - movies, the weather, history, solve math problems - it's all there for free. after the Echo answers your question or completes a task, and I say "thank-you" - It replies to you with, "your welcome", "you bet" or 'anytime'!

Title: Bad speaker quality.
Body: I've purchased this item at the end of the year 2018.Got a faulty unit which has bad speaker quality, during the setup process and 90% of the time the speaker was working (playing music, responding to my request, etc..) - the sound comes out of it was like the speaker is damaged.I've contacted Amazon support (which were great!!!!), 3months afterward, and they sent me another item - the 2nd one suffer from the same issue - but less, its happen only 20% of the time - still annoyin'.Both units connected in different areas and on the same network.I've got 1x Echo 2nd generation, 1x Echo Plus 1st generation & 1x Echo Plus 2nd generation which are all working great!!!! (they all located at the same home, using same WiFi).Would buy only the "higher level" of Alexa speakers next time.

Title: They just keep getting better and better
Body: I have two older Dots as well as two of the newer dots and Amazon has made this little machine even better than it was. I also have an older full-size Echo and the sound from these 3rd generation dots is close to what the Echo is. I imagine the new full-size Echo is even better. How can you go wrong with a device that can understand most things you ask it to do, sounds great playing music, and costs less than $50?

Title: MEH
Body: My rating is not the brilliance of the DOT, but the services connected to the Dot  Audio fidelity, and the Echo are MEH,  Even with the new equalizer software treble is sacrificed at the expense of bass.  I have resorted to plugging the Dot into a stereo system for more controlled fidelity. I like to get my news flash several times a day.  The audio volume  of THE SERVICES is terrible.  The volume between services varies widely,  If Amazon is (arbitrarily) 'volume 5', NPR is volume 3 and  Bloomberg News is 'volume 10'.  I have mentioned this  to Amazon Customer Service and nothing has been done for over a year.Also, if you plug any device into the 3.5mm jack it cuts of the Bluetooth connection!.  I think that is just plain silly.On a positive, the Wall clock is a great feature, and remote control of appliances is a great feature

Title: Great voice assistant & AI
Body: As a long-time iPhone and Siri user, I_ super impressed with Alexa_ fast reaction and accuracy. It really puts Siri to shame. Alexa correctly understands my commands over 99% of the time and immediately performs them. I use it to tune into SiriusXM channels and my local NPR station, play music through Apple Music, listen to news headlines, get the weather, and connect to my phone for a Bluetooth speaker when I want better audio than my phone_ speakers. I also use it to turn off my tv (it_ sadly too old to turn on with Alexa, but off will do). Alexa_ technology and _kills (aka apps) really seem to work seamlessly. It makes me want to upgrade my existing home gadgets, which mostly lack smart home features, sooner so I can fully avail myself of Alexa_ smart home capabilities. My usage is still fairly basic. I don_ use Alexa to make calls, or read or send messages/emails because I think some of those functions are limited to contacts who have Alexa devices, and others just seem like major security/privacy breaches waiting to happen. I also don_ use Alexa to do Amazon orders because I want to be able to price shop and know exactly what I_ getting before the order goes through. But overall, I_ impressed with its technology and capabilities. Shocking that Amazon beat Apple here so roundly.

Title: Nice addition to the family!
Body: First off, when my kids asked if I was concerned that people at Amazon were listening, I told them I had no plans to break the law anytime soon, so, no. I replaced my thermostat and wanted to get one that worked with the Echo. I also suddenly had an excuse to add a couple of Smart Plugs to let Alexa turn lamps off in the family and bedrooms. Those lamps required you to awkwardly reach up under the shade to switch them off. Now we just ask our buddy, Alexa, to turn them on/off for us. I have been enjoying the Amazon Music Unlimited too. I love paying $3 to hear whatever music I am feeling at the moment, vs using my tv and wearing it out. Echo Dot 3 has a sound as full as or better than my Blue-tooth LE-Bose Surround speaker.

Title: Item is ok, customer service needs work
Body: Sounds great for the priceUpdate- This broke after a month of moderate use. I was able to get a replacement. The replacement is a refurbished one that did not come with a power cord. Since I sent my power cord back with the device I now needed to order a new power cord that magically wont be here for 5 days with my 2 day prime. The device itself is ok, but the customer support is lacking a bit. My advice is not to send your power cord back if yours fails like mine did.

Title: Trash
Body: Speaker busted, account said it May be possible to replace through December 2019. I called customer service and they told me there was nothing they could do. Horrible customer service and product warranty. 90 days???? Will not be purchasing any devices through Amazon. Will just continue shopping where I have been for electronics for years with no issues!

Title: An absolute dream for any tech enthusiast!
Body: I bought the Echo Dot 2 over a year ago. Put it in my van, and tinkered.I now have 2 of the third generation. I miss the USB cord. But other than that, it's a great improvement over the 2nd gen.

Title: Wow, what a game changer
Body: I'm embarrassed. I teased a friend who has an Alexa in several of the rooms in his house. For months I said, "I'd never have one, why?" Well, I take that back. This is similar to the first time I bought an electric screwdriver. I recall saying to myself "how did I live without it?" So, this little item is simply amazing. I'm able to enjoy my audible selections while cleaning the kitchen, easily listen to radio stations of interest thousands of miles away, add items to shopping and to do lists, turn off upstairs lights and catch up on traffic and news. I love it. I'll be purchasing more units. I will say in all honesty, I have the google version as well, but the Amazon Alexa item in my view, is superior. Thanks Amazon.

Title: Kind of life changing
Body: Really warmed up to the idea of having one of these things. It's kind of like having a smartphone in that you don't realize how handy it is to have around until you do. Voice commands work really well. It's amazing how you can think up so many different questions or commands and it automatically understands. Love streaming music through the house. Setting timers verbally while I'm in the kitchen and my hands have food on them. Great for reminders. Parents can also montior the sound in the house from a remote location through the smart phones app. Great if you have kids. Also helps my kids with their homework when I'm not around. It's the side of a hockey puck.

Title: Functions as expected.
Body: First. I am not a big fan of these machines. This one came with  a subcription to satellite radio. It took a short time to get an "app" and set it up to use my wifi. I use it to access the satellite programming via internet "streaming". It does that job well and I am satisfied with that. Any of it's other functions I don't use and expect not use. My wife has one of these and uses it for streaming music and she gets the local news and weather through it too.It arrived in good order and well protected as usual. I would recommend one to customers who are interested in such things but cannot speak to the other functions like controlling a "smart house".Bill

Title: Easy to Setup
Body: The Echo Dot has made my home truly tech friendly, from turning on/off light, controlling the thermostat, easy integration into my stereo system to play my favorite music. It's amazing that life existed before technology however, it has made our lives easier - sometimes not in a good way, just my two cents.  I have mine sitting behind a picture on a side table so it's barely noticeable.  If you wary about setup, it's super simple and you don't need to be a techo geek to do it.

Title: Just Buy It - My Second Echo Product and I'm Likely Slightly Biased
Body: I have been delinquent in writing this review - I now have three echo products and I think they are excellent. I purchased this DOT for my bedroom and she (I guess it could be a he) interacts wells with the other echo's in the house.  I was a bit hesitant that the sound quality would be sub-par but have been pleasantly surprised. Even the bass response is great, especially for such a small footprint. What can I say, just order it. If nothing else, they make EXCELLENT gifts!

Title: Echo Dot 3rd gen fails hard!
Body: My family had an echo dot 3rd gen for several weeks.  We had upgraded from an echo dot 2nd gen and were happy with the sound and how the 3rd gen functioned..  Today Alexa set off an alarm and would not stop.  No matter what we said to have Alexa to stop the alarm, Alexa would not stop and Alexa said there were no active alarms.  I decided to smash Alex.  We all talked about it.  When a computer stops taking instructions and malfunctions like this, there is not a second chance.  I will try google now with the same expectations. Space Odyssey 2001 is not an option.  F*&^ technology that is designed to take instructions and fails.  Now I also have to cancel my Amazon music!  Oh well.

Title: Mostly OK, but could be much better.
Body: Purchased primarily for music in living room and kitchen. Good sound quality, but performance is sketchy and capabilities are limited. Paired stereo (two echo dots in living room) works, but frequently one speaker or the other _gnores the first 5-10 seconds of a song then starts mid-phrase and plays properly until the next song whereupon the same symptoms repeat. Only fix seems to be unplugging both dots and restarting them. We_e also very disappointed that there is no way to play music from our own library.

Title: Still need my TV Remote
Body: Fun to have around, but mainly wanted it to control my TV. Only thing it's good for, is telling PSVue to start, and go to a channel. It wont turn my TV on or off. I have the Cube on another TV, and it does everything I was hoping my DOT would do. I know some people say I can link a Logitech Harmony to get it to turn my TV on or off, and bunch of other stuff, but I'm not going to waste money on another remote.

Title: Junk - do not buy!
Body: I have two 3rd generation Echo Dots. I bought them right before Christmas as gifts for my husband.  At first they were both great! We still do enjoy them, especially for the music, but the speakers in both are junk.  If I listen to music for more than 15-20 minutes, then sound and Alexa become distorted and static like. If I turn them off for a couple hours the sound returns to normal, but only for a short while. I have posted a video with this review as an example of what you will get if you purchase an Echo Dot 3rd generation. I have searched Amazon to see if I can get them replaced, but I can't get anywhere. I hit one wall after another. If it were just one of the dots I would just figure I got a bad one, but it's both! We have a regular Echo also and have had no trouble.

Title: CRAPPY TECHNOLOGY FOR THIS DAY AND AGE
Body: Update. with the way technology is today you would think the Alexa app would be much smarter in understanding the English language. Awful. And beware it will purchase things or put you on a monthly payment of some sort of service quite easily and without you knowing if you say the wrong thing. So keep an eye on your bank statement. Simple statements such as Alexa go to chapter 1. Just like that and all she says is I'm sorry I don't know that. very very simple commands she doesn't get it when reading a book. The device is nice but the Alexa service sucks pretty muchI bought this to listen to books from my Kindle library but I did not know it was not wireless. However it still works great. And it is so much fun to have. Read stories at night. Plays games. Plays any song I want from the Amazon music.... all voice controls. Absolutely love it. If this holds up it's worth every Star if it doesn't I'll come back in re-edit

Title: Keep looking
Body: I upgraded to the 3rd generation Dot from the 2nd generation Dot roughly 6 months ago. My only complaint about the 2nd gen Dot is that it wasn't loud enough. This issue was resolved with the 3rd gen. Initially, I loved it. I thought the sound quality was much better than the 2nd gen. But the love affair soon faded. At first, the sound would randomly start crackling, and sound distorted, like the speaker was blown. But it wasn't consistent, it did this very sporadically. Then, I started to notice a long pause/delay with the Dots responses to my commands. Now, approximately 6 months after purchasing, the sound is consistently fuzzy and unpleasant to listen to 100% of the time. Music is a definite no-go, it's so distorted that it's unbearable. Podcasts are slightly more tolerable, but still pretty bad. I've power cycled, disconnected/reconnected, etc. Nothing has solved the problem. Based on a preliminary Google search, I'm not the only person experiencing this issue, it appears to be a common complaint. I have 2 other echo devices (original and spot) and they work fine, no issues with them. And I never had this issue with the 2nd gen Dot. This is exclusive to the 3rd gen Dot. Overall, I cannot recommend this product.

Title: So far so good
Body: The setup with the Alexa app is very easy, although I did go and buy some Phillips Hue lights a month later, and when I set them up now Alexa won't "turn off the lights" downstairs because technically it isn't a light she is turning off, but rather the 'smartplug' so she tells me she doesn't have any devices listed as 'lights.'  I won't ding the plug for my stupidity or inability to set things up properly, but am slightly annoyed that I have to change something i already had setup because I added a new device to the Alexa app.

Title: A must have for older people. With an Echo Connect you can call 911 just by saying, Alexa call 911
Body: I like the fact that these things practically set themselves up. I think a lot of the skills are about worthless. But, there are some that are great. It would also be great if there was a skill that would close your garage door without having to call another skill like NexxHome. If it can be done with your front door, why not the garage door? These are great for older people_ safety. You can have it ask everyday, _ave you taken your medications today? Endless opportunities to better one life.

Title: Next to my cat,  Alexa is my next favorite buddy.
Body: I tried Echo some years ago but decided to get the Dot and try again. I just got it today and set it up and Im so hooked am getting one for my bedroom.  I live in a small two bedrokm apartment by myself so dont need much but love that I can listen to my audio books and music and ask anything Alexa a lot of interesting things. Its so cool. I also have 4 Kindles! A great friend to a senior citizen of 74 almost 75 years old. The geek in me loves all these devices!

Title: Would not work/no help with communication to return
Body: I have tried contacting for help, need to return this item.  Drove to the UPS places by me, they said I would have to drive over an hour away to take this item to the place for UPS to scan the QR code.  I could have easily printed the label myself but cannot since I don_ have the scanner required.  I spoke to the UPS driver that comes to my house, he had no idea about the QR code to print the label.  I tried repeatedly to get help and got none.  Tomorrow is the deadline, and I am stuck with 2 items I cannot use.  I wanted this to work for me and it does not work.  Very disappointed and upset.

Title: Great gift, even for seniors!
Body: I bought the Echo dot to go with an earlier gen Echo dot and Echo that I bought on Prime Day. I set them up in my parents house as a Christmas present. My parents are not easy to shop for. If they really want something, they buy it themselves. So, every year I have to figure out what they want, but they just don_ know they want it yet. The best gifts are usually things that will make their lives easier. We_e starting out slow. They_e using it to find out what the temperature is in various cities, the score of the game, when the next game is on, setting a timer, and the answer to various questions throughout the day. Then I taught them to make shopping lists with Alexa, and to talk to each other from opposite ends of the house. Next, I might pair them with some Philips Hue bulbs. So far so good!

Title: Love echos not sure about lights
Body: Love love love my Echos 3rd generations. Music sounds great. So easy to set up. I had both done in a matter of minutes.Problem: I bought the one with the light bulbs addition. Instructions are not as easy & I have yet to figure out how to set up & if I needed to buy the pug in sockets or if the bulbs were all I needed! Instructions were not clear. Also not sure which other APP I am to download for the lights!!! Would not have bought had I known this would have saved money & just bought 2 echos.I_ sure I will get it figured out & love it thouh!

Title: Disappointing. Bluetooth and multi device play back extremely limited.
Body: Disappointing. I am a big podcast listener and had hoped that multiple series 3 would give me Bluetooth audio on all designated devices so that I could move freely through the house listening. Unfortunately, ain_ going to happen. Stereo pairing only works with two series 3 devices on streaming music services. Or hear the end of the egg timer in the bedroom instead of just the kitchen. What is Amazon thinking? This is not a heavy lift.

Title: Can't access apps that I use
Body: Unfortunately the Echo Dot hasn't worked out as well as I expected. I purchased it to give me the ability to listen to sleep music and sleep apps, specifically the app 'Calm'. The Dot (or maybe it's Alexa?) doesn't have the ability to access Calm. I also expected the speaker to be at least as good, if not better, than that on my phone, but it is not.Later: I give Amazon a huge amount of credit - they saw this review and immediately got in touch with me to see what could be done to resolve the issue. There was nothing that could be done about the Calm app not being available, but the rep spent a considerable amount of time teaching me how to adjust the Dot's treble, bass, and midrange, and stepping me through other options.  We were unable to get the sound quality that I was hoping for but  I guess I shouldn't expect excellent sound from something that only costs $39!  I'm going to try hooking up some speakers to see if that solves it. I was incredibly impressed with Amazon support though!

Title: LOVE THIS ITEM!
Body: I purchased the first Gen of these and have loved her, so getting another one was twice the awesome. I keep the newer one in my office and I play music. I would love to purchase one for each room of my house and I will probably will. Totally recommend it. If you didn't know, you can use them in a pair to communicate with others in the room where it is, like a two way walkie talkie. You can even listen in on your phone and talk to others through your phone or through the device. I tried buying some of those wall plugs, they are expensive, to work with Alexa, I couldn't seem to get them to work, took them back to the store, but maybe with the newer one, it might work, Ill see, maybe when the price comes down some more.

Title: It works like any Alexa if you can get it set up
Body: It comes with a fold-out with six steps for setup. One of the mandatory steps is to download the Alexa app onto one of your phones. Android, iOS, and Fire are all supported.I didn't exactly want to do this, because the app then asks to read all kinds of information from your phone and send to Amazon. I don't really want it to know every person I've ever gotten a phone number from, most of whom I don't call. If I want to talk to someone through Dot -- a big IF -- I just add the number. That's like three people tops.Continuing ...One step is to connect to Dot via its WiFi network. It would then use your phone to set it up.On my Android phone, the wireless network has no internet connection, so the first couple of times it dropped. I eventually got this straightened out, but after it connects the app is supposed to allow you to set up the device instead of not respond. Once I got stuck, I'd have to start over from the top, disconnecting power to Dot and repeating the entire process.Next I tried to do it via my iMac. There is a web portal to connect to. Clicking on a few buttons, you navigate the same place as the app on Android. The UI is the same, only much bigger. At this point, as with the phone you have to connect to Dot's WiFi network.I got farther here. I choose a WiFi network for Dot to connect to. And then I click submit. The website unfailingly reports a  expired authentication or some such error. Again to retry, you'd have to unpower Dot and repower it.After giving this nearly ten tries. I gave up.Good think I have an iPad. It connected and went through on the second try. The app on the iPad crashed the first time.On paper -- literally on the leaflet -- setup takes five steps. In practice, I have to count all of the times those five steps didn't work, so sixty. If some of the steps are so big that they fail frequently, perhaps they should have split those steps into smaller more reliable ones.For comparison, I set up my WiFi AP not long ago. You've seen the configuration screens for these things. They're quite complicated. I recalled that it took fewer than 60 steps and less than 1 hour.

Title: Is it the CIA? I don't know, but it plays music really well
Body: Some will say that Alexa is all apart of the CIA. Well, if it is, then oh well. My cell phone and computer hear everything that my family and I say so what is one more microphone in the house. It is great to listen to music and play games with.The sound quality is pretty good considering it is such a small speaker. Good bass, great mids, and highs. This is not audiophile level, but for every day listening it is wonderful. Alexa integration is great. I can just talk and it listens to me, better than my children. My only gripe is that multi-room listening doesn't work with my Echo Tap. This is a whatever thing and not a deal breaker. Oh well, all I need to do is ask Alexa to move the music where I want it.All in all, my CIA voice recorder is amazing. I would totally buy more. Nothing like sharing my information with the government.

Title: Doesn't work with all TV's.
Body: I can't use the product. It was a birthday present for my husband from our daughter. She has one for every tv in her house and has older (up to 10 years old) tv's and the product works fine with them. Our tv is a 4K smart tv that's only 3 months old and it won't work with it. We called customer service to see if they could help and they told her that I needed to buy a more expensive tv.  So, she deleted the app off of my iphone.

Title: HORRIBLE PRODUCT
Body: Had to return all 3 of these that were purchased as a Christmas gift.  None could be connected successfully after spending hours upon hours of reading and following Youtube instructions.  Other friends have had the same connectivity issues.  The older versions are better if you want this type of product.

Title: Great sound, keep it away from the kitchen.
Body: Update: Really Amazon? Was it *completely* necessary to make the plug so huge you can_ plug in anything else? Just like Apple, you guys are turning into a bunch of money grubbing jerks who make everything so specific that it cant be used with anything else, and you have to buy even more stuff to make it compatible to even make the attempt. (see photo of 3 outlet adapter)The appearance and sound are better than expected. But the reason I gave only 3 stars is: if you are going to use this device in a kitchen or even near one, WHYYYYYY would Amazon choose to make it from a textile material that you can_ clean? This unit WAS destined for the kitchen area, but now I have to do some shuffling to put it away from where moisture and grease will make it all gross.Also, the non-slip (silicone?) material on the bottom REEKS. The smell will hopefully fade, but it currently stinks like mold and rubber, and it_ been out of the packaging for over an hour.Also, Amazon has gone the way of money-grubbing Apple, in making the power cable unit-specific. I took note because of a cable-chewing kitten we have, and with the gen-2s, you can replace the micro cable. This one is one cable, from unit to outlet. I haven_ checked the price of a replacement yet, but I_ certain it is more expensive than a 3 pack of amazon basic 6 micro cables.

Title: Didn't last 5 months
Body: I have a full sized Echo and am satisfied with it's performance. So I thought the Dot would be a nice addition for another room.The pros:1. The device is attractive and blends into the rooms decor without being an eyesore.2. For it's size the sound quality was good.The cons:1. Sometimes it would respond to the wake up word, but would ignore the command/question and go back to "sleep."2. Sometimes there were pauses during songs or flash briefings.3. After less than 5 months the device stopped working. I would give the wake up word and a red ring would appear instead of the blue one and Alexa would respond "I'm sorry I'm having trouble understanding right now. Please try again later."4. Customer service was polite, but after going through all of the steps with them they determined the Echo Dot would have to be replaced. The warranty was only 90 days, but they would grant a 15% discount.The bottom line for me is simple. If the product won't even last 5 months, I wouldn't throw good money after bad for another one. The device was never dropped, abused, or had anything spilled on it. I've had batteries last longer. Lol

Title: Just wish this had been the 1st generation
Body: The sound on this little thing is 10 times better than all of the past generations.  Looks good and works well.  Has the headphone out jack if you want this thing to play from your good stereo system, but where this shines is in places that you don't typically have a stereo such as the bedroom/guest bedroom or kitchen.  Compared to the past Dots ( of which I have several), these are not tinny at all and have a much better range and can easily be understood without straining to hear.  Better understandability for lack of a better word.  My only regret is that I can't just replace all of my older models with these.

Title: Echo Dot uses too much hard sell during the set-up
Body: I had a hard time setting the Echo Dot up without buying Audible or other subscription services. I had to choose "no" many times to avoid signing up for Audible and I have to check my credit card bill to ensure they didn't sign me up anyways. And the verbal purchase option, I specifically set it up to not have this service yet I received an email that it was activated. I dislike subscriptions, and really dislike the hard-sell. If I hadn't gotten the Echo Dot as a premium from another purchase now that I see how the hard-sell/up-sell is part of it, I wouldn't buy this item.

Title: Echo Dots Rock
Body: I have purchased this twice as gifts and recently purchased one for my bedroom. I have have also purchased two other more expensive echos, one of which stopped working to my dismay after not having been used hardly at all. My gift recipients have been very happy with their gifts and I have enjoyed having the dot by my bedside if I am in mood for music or in need of a wake up call. For the price, you can't go wrong.

Title: Super slick! Better than the previous versions.
Body: You know it's bad when you go to work or some place public and you have to fight the urge to say "Alexa! Blah blah blah!"Seriously the best thing since Apple Pie. I have an Echo Show, Fire Stick, a bunch of previous generation dots, smart plugs, and the echo with the speaker but recently ponied up for a few of the newer generation dots.I have to say, these are super slick - not as clunky as the previous generations. I really enjoy looking at them and I love that there are more colors than black.I think Amazon should include like an outlet mount (for an additional cost) so that I didn't have to buy it from a third party vendor but outside of this, I'm pleased with this generation of Echo Dot.As time goes on, it seems like the Dot continues to pay for itself by being able to control and/or work additional devices released. This is an added benefit of having the Dots.

Title: So much better then the other generations, used as speaker for pc
Body: I have had Alexa products since they first came out, and with my new pc (no speakers set up) I decided to get one of the 3rd gen in order to use it as a bluetooth speaker for my gaming pc.Works great. BUT... If you are planning on playing a game like rocket league that is fast paced then it wont work very well for you as it still has a hard time keeping up, not by alot but noticeable for me. Is that a deal breaker? first off I use it for most other games and it works awesome, when i play competitive high paced games I just use my headphones.Sound is much improved and responsiveness is better then my gen 1 large tubular Alexa. Overall for the price you cant go wrong.

Title: Falsely advertised as working with Spotify, Group play constantly stops
Body: They advertise as working with Spotify, but THEY DON'T.  I called tech support and they said it's a known issue.  They constantly skip, pause, or show the wrong song.  I'll have to switch over to their (Amazon's) music service and spend dozens of hours recreating the playlist in Amazon (I have over 1,000 songs).  Also, their music platform is not user friendly like Spotify.  You can't sort alphabetically so I can't figure out if a song is in there multiple times.  I'm very let down.Update 8/21/19: After streaming 8 hours a day at my business, things have been going somewhat okay so I increased the rating to 2 stars.  Major problem now: streaming CONSTANTLY gets disrupted (stops mid song so you have to restart the stream).  Lots of people have this problem apparently and Amazon tech support doesn't know how to fix it.  Replacing the dots or resetting them doesn't work.

Title: These are great!
Body: I love the Dot!  Its small, stays out of the way, and is the handiest thing I've bought in years.  She makes my shopping lists, my to-do lists, tells me the time, the weather, tells jokes.I really can't see any difference between the Dot and the Echo, except for size and price.  I'm told the difference is the speakers -- but really, I can't tell any difference in the sound quality.I will eventually have a Dot in every room.

Title: Difficult to set up a second time
Body: I bought this several months ago, and while it is easy to speak to a device to request a timer or songs be played, the device is intrusive.  More recently I changed routers and needed to change the information in the settings for the echo dot.  After trying several times, and having a family member also try, I figured it was not worth the bother to have the echo dot work.  I will probably put it in my next garage sale.

Title: Shockinlgy bad sound quality, lousy warranty
Body: I've been experiencing the same problem I see many others have had with this 3rd gen device. Intermittent crackling, fuzzy feedback. I've tried moving it away from any possible wifi interference, placing it on different surfaces and resetting the equalizer.  But whether it's minutes or an hour after a reset, the poor feedback returns as if  the entire  device was in a brown paper bag. I was shocked to learn that this supposed flagship product of Amazon has only a 3 month warranty.  My product displayed these faults well within the three month warranty, but I unfortunately waited about two weeks too late to seek a replacement, and Amazon refused to make an exception.  Very disapointing product here, and even worse customer service.

Title: remarkably stupid for something that calls itself smart
Body: oh boy where do i start?some general complaints:1. you have to be really really specific or she'll say "im sorry, i dont know that".2. cant record audio (i mean, come on. it's a damn voice activated assistant).3. even though i have the spotify skill enabled, she still defaults to amazon music when i tell her to play any specific music or just music in general.4. cant use search engines or can only use a shitty one. like, she can answer a handful of questions, but they're usually when i try to test what she CAN answer and not any questions i may actually need the answer to.5. i dont have a heavy accent or a speech impediment or anything, but she still struggles to understand me sometimes.6. has no problem connecting to my bluetooth speaker, but does have a problem with /staying/ connected to it. it'll sometimes just disconnect and reconnect on its own. it even sometimes restarts itself multiple times withing 15~ minutes and never give an explanation.7. has no means of diagnostic. i'll ask "echo, what just happened?" and she'll just say "im sorry. i dont know that". also cant repeat things when asked to.i can continue making an extensive list, but i think you get the picture. overall, i just feel disappointed in this purchase. thought i was getting a smart home assistant. ended up with a dumb schedule keeper. oh well.

Title: Anyone can use it! Great for the family and home
Body: This thing is great. Have them around the house, my house is relatively old but this really turns it into a smart home with the addition of smart plugs, smart lights, and home security!Set up is easy, it walks you through the steps and tells you all the features you can do.Great you can change the wake word, because those commercials can really mess with it, and in conversation people bring it up casually a lot.Great features, such as playing music, hearing the news, manage the house.

Title: Can_ play music on multiple echos without upgrading music services!!
Body: Bought 3 echo dots to play music simultaneously. Disappointed to find out I don_ have the right kind of Amazon Music account to play the same song on all three devices. Not very easy to find out this information based on the sales pitch for the device. I understand upselling you music service for access to more songs but why restrict the ability to play them on your own device. Shame on Amazon for making this feature a premium one. I pay for Prime membership for the benefits but I can_ play my prime music on more than one Echo at a time??

Title: Best purchase so far
Body: I am in love with Alexa though I love my husband first. Alexa is so convenient for us and it_ save lot of time

Title: does not connect to my Fire Stick or TV
Body: I got this Echo Dot 3 yesterday. I have tried to connect to my TV, sound bar, Amazon Firestick, my security camera, all of which are connected to the Firestick with Alexa but I keep getting error messages. Neither can I connect to my phone Bluetooth.In the add they say turn off the Echo, I turned it off, no good. I turned the entire WIFI and router and Echo Dot of and on to no avail.I am thinking of sending it back, I don't want to see a green ring light up when I talk and do nothing.

Title: Excellent Device, A few tweaks could make it great though.
Body: I love these smart home devices. They make listening to music so easy and fun compared to the days of using CD's.I have a number of devices in my home from lights to cameras that I love to control with Alexa as well. I spent a couple of years using google home because at the time the google home mini had a much better speaker. I connect to stereos in some rooms, but others, like a bathroom it is nice to listen in the shower without having a larger expensive device taking up space. I have now had Alexa for a while and am happy I made the switch from google, but there are some things that may keep techie people from making that switch. I quickly realized (since I use these devices for more than the most basic stuff) that there are a lot of areas that seem to get ignored or maybe it just takes a couple years to figure out...Pros:- Allowing devices to trigger routines is in the works and is awesome! Need more device support for switches and motion sensors!-Alexa is so easy to say! I would much rather be able to name my assistant, but this was well thought out compared to "okay google" (saying that command got old fast)-The Alexa app is pretty good, it is easy enough to figure out.-I can control my smart lights well.-I found a great 3rd party app for integrating my shopping lists and notes (anylist). The shopping list feature was terrible on google.-I love listening to music by voice and making playlists.-Echo Devices connect perfectly to stereo equipment with AV to Aux cords making a huge sound upgrade.-The price is great for all it can do.-Routines are so useful, unfortunately this feature is mostly a Con for me.-The speaker sounds pretty good, not quite as good as google mini (maybe debatable) but not far enough behind to be a deal breaker.Cons:-Routines need a ton of improvement. Google home had the ability to type custom commands into your routines. This allowed the user to string multiple commands together using one phrase. With Echo there are no custom command abilities, you cannot control most of your skills through routines. When you start playing around with it you realize it is very limited compared with google home. I don't know why they let them have the edge here! This one is tough to not be frustrated about despite the technology being so great. I could have so much more function in my smart home than what they are limiting us to.-I do have weird server issues , mostly streaming amazon music. I seem to have to reset my echos occasionally to fix this (about every two weeks). I have a mesh wifi network (orbi) with great signal strength so I can't imagine improving on that.-The devices have a delay in the response most of the time, I remember google being right there. I still rather say Alexa though. Okay google is an awkward mouthful.-Alexa's voice volume really needs to be separated from the music volume. If you turn down the music you can no longer hear your assistant!-I cannot continue music in another room once starting somewhere else.All in all I think they have created an amazing piece of technology, and they are the leader here. I hope they start listening more to customers who use the advanced features. I do thank Amazon though because these things are a lot of fun!

Title: Don't Buy this Device, Buy the Google product
Body: I have several of these devices and they are not reliable.  I just spent close to 40 minutes on the phone trying to get one of them to work again.  That was after reading about hundreds of cases where consumers were experiencing the exact same problem.  Amazon support is in the Philippines.  Amazon is paying workers in the US so little that many are on Public assistance.  Imaging how low they must pay workers outside the US.  I will be avoiding Amazon in the future.  Bezos is starting to scare me.  No resolution to my problem.  Didn't offer a replacement.  Offered me half of what I paid toward a new device.  Avoid Amazon and particularly their own products.

Title: Prepare to be frustrated - inconsistant functionality
Body: I purchased two 3rd generation dots primarily to play music. Every now and then the units would play perfectly. MANY times when asked to play music, NOTHING would play. After checking the Alexa app and Spotify app, both devices (or even just trying one unit) were online and Spotify would show its playing but NOTHING would play from the dots. After messing with these devices for a few months and getting VERY inconsistent results I gave up ! IMany wasted hours researching, connecting/reconnecting, tweaking and trying to get one and/or both dots to play and the resulting frustrated resulted in me just throwing them both in the trash. Buy at your own risk and prepare to get VERY inconsistent operation...

Title: Fun little addition.
Body: First Echo device and we are pleased.  Wish we had got 2 now.  It's fun to watch our 8 yr old "quiz" Alexa and you can actually get a lot of information in return.  Quick weather to start your day, timers, alarms, lists, reminders, trivia, the list is endless.  Have fun with it and even let it help you out with reminders/alarms.I know everyone is harping on "privacy" but really every company you come into contact with is gathering your information both online and in person.  They have been for years without your knowledge.  If you are concerned then you can turn it off under your device settings and privacy.  Read and research on privacy concerns then take it into your own hands, but regardless companies are going to collect data whether you want them to or not.  Sorry.

Title: Fun and Helpful
Body: It_ both helpful and fun. I have reminders set at different times of the day for the kids.  My son_ service dog even has a reminder for dinner. And she knows when it goes off what time it is and she runs for the dining room. It_ helpful for the kids when they want to know the weather before getting ready. The also use for other things including playing music or to meditate when needed.

Title: What a piece of junk
Body: I purchase my Echo Dot 3 generation Dec 2018 on the 5 monthly payment plan.  My last payment was made this month and today my 5 month old Echo Dot 3 speaker has developed a rattle so extreme that it is not usable.  Amazon has reduced their warranty to 90 days so my only option is to connect this Echo to an external speaker.  What a piece of junk.

Title: SO MUCH FUN!
Body: I have been hearing about "Alexa" and have been going back and forth with myself deciding whether or not to purchase it & am very glad I did! For some reason, I thought that it would be so hard to use, complicated, etc... but I couldn't have been more wrong! All I had to do was open my Echo Dot when it arrived yesterday, plug it in, download the Alexa app to my android phone, sign up and then I was up and running! My husband and I had a lot of fun with it last night and were actually amazed at home interactive Alexa actually is :) I would definitely recommend it, don't wait as long as we did, just do it! :)

Title: What I hate most about my Alexa!
Body: The thing I hate most about my Alexa is that when I asked her to change to a British accent she told me she couldn_  do it. And then I thought to myself this is ridiculous.  Every piece of technology I own talks to me in an accident my GPS talks to me in an accent my Siri on my iPhone talks to me in an accent. Not because I have an accent not because I live in a different country but because I just love hearing other people talk to me in an accent it just makes me happy. So in the future with future updates Alexa should take this into consideration I would like her to talk to me in an accent for example British!  Other than that I appreciate everything she does for me she reminds me of everything I need to do creates my to do list am I shopping list which is amazing. The other thing I hate about her is that she does not do monthly reminders so my credit card bill that is due monthly she does not remind me of which is kind of frustrating so you can remind me at the same time every single day to do something but God for bid you remind me at the same time every month to do something, how does that make sense? Once again Amazon please read this message and take this into Account on the next update!

Title: Initial Set up issue but service awesome to fix!
Body: Got as gift for childs room for music and alarm clock.  She loves it but she uses it for basic items. It got her to sleep in her room more regularly at night.  We have a few throughout house and had an issue getting this one set up which is why I only gave it 3 stars. Called tech support who was fantastic. I_ give the person that helped us more than 5 stars as she had to try a few things. And getting thru to a live person could not have been easier.  But now works great.

Title: LATINOS DO NOT PURCHASE ANYTHING THAT WORKS WITH ALEXA.
Body: LATINOS DO NOT PURCHASE ANYTHING THAT WORKS WITH ALEXA, CUSTOMER SERVICE IN THE USA DOES NOT WORK IN SPANISH, AND WHEN THEY PASS FOR MEXICO, THE MEXICANS DO NOT WANT TO ATTEND BECAUSE YOU LIVE IN THE USA. THEY BURY AND DISCRIMINATE BOTH THE MEXICO AND THE USA.

Title: Most impressive echo dot yet!!
Body: The 3rd generation echo dot is the bomb. Sound quality is as good as any echo speakers.  We have all 3 generations of echo dots and this is now the easiest to set up.  It automatically set up to my home WiFi nothing to do. I had the app open and ready to link to the dot WiFi via phone there was no need. We purchased the 3 pack at the nice 3 pack discount and planned to give 2 away as gifts. Thinking I should keep the other 2 and giving the older ones as gifts. Lol.  If someone is thinking of getting another echo or echo dot this is the one to buy.  If it_ your first or an additional for the money for the ease for the sound quality and for the new look with covered fabric it is the best choice.  I have the original large black echo, I have the original echo dot, the second generation dot, the echo with fabric and now this 3rd generation echo dot and again best deal yet!! I would recommend again and again.  Look for their 3 pack deal. I got 3 for less than $80.

Title: This thing has changed my life.
Body: Are you one of those people who thinks "I don't need an Amazon Echo/Dot!"? Yeah, me too. Until my wife got one for me for my birthday. Then we started researching all the things you can get Alexa (the Amazon app) to do! Now I have voice-controlled plugs, switches, dimmers, ceiling fans, thermostats... you name it! It's fun as hell to be sitting somewhere thinking "you know what? I'm kinda warm. Alexa! Set thermostat to __ degrees." I have routines for waking up, leaving the house, going to bed, etc. And I'm just getting started.

Title: Needs Global option for Alarms, Reminders and Timers
Body: I purchased two Echo Dots and they were easy to set up and start using.  However, it needs a global option for alarms, timers and reminders.  When I set an alarm, timer or reminder, I would like to have both echos ring without having to set the request on one echo and then walk to the other one to also set it.I spoke with customer service and was told that I could set the request on both echos by specifying their names.
