However, I tried that and it didn't work.  I am old, I live alone, my house is large and my memory is bad.  I am hoping that the echo will help me remember what I am supposed to be doing.If it had the global option, I would have given it 5 stars.

Title: Group streaming is terrible.  The app isn't much better
Body: We have one Gen-2 and two Gen-3 echo dots.  Unfortunately, the "Group" streaming is terrible.  The App isn't much better.The sound from the Gen-3 dots are significantly better than Gen-2.  The music from all 3 devices cuts in/out, randomly, and from different devices.  No pattern.  I've rebooted, reset, etc.  No luck (w/suggestions from Amazon support).  The app also freezes, or is way behind the live feed.Anyhow, if you want to play one device at a time - no problem.  If, like me, you want the same music on as you move from room to room, go with another music system/streaming.

Title: Great speaker but Microphone not as responsive
Body: The speaker on this Echo is a huge improvement over previous dots, especially considering the low price point. The only complaint is that the microphone doesn't seem as responsive. I have to speak much louder for it to hear me sometimes. Also the speaker is so loud that any volume above 6 or 7 rules out Alexa hearing you while music is playing, unless you stand right next to it and yell. But the biggest benefit is that you don't really need a bluetooth speaker to make this sound good with music like previous dots.

Title: Gift that is priceless
Body: Love this product. We have three of them all in different rooms. Plays music of so many things. Even from our Sirius XM. I can just say Alexa add whatever to my shopping list. Have her turn on lights or not. She_l tell you a joke, let you know a reminder if you asks her too. Tell her to wake you up at a certain time and a alarm sound goes on. If your listening to music, just stay stop when you want and she will. I can ask her to call someone from my phone list and easily talk to anyone. You just have to add her app to your phone. It_ so much and have so much to learn but well worth the purchase. Love it completely.

Title: Great value speaker for the price.
Body: These speakers are great value for the price with a few shortcomings that would make them perfect.1- No support for stereo pair with 2 echo dots if you are connecting to it via Bluetooth. Stereo pair only works with a streaming pair.2- No easy way to stream your own music via Network Storage. What is there is so primitive, I just dismissed even considering using it.3- Apple Music integration doesn_ have all the futures you expect from iTunes Player.4- No support for ITunes Match service.Bottom line is that I am a happy owner of 3x Echo Dots and will add more if these issues are resolved. issues I listed here can be resolved via software updates and it is my hope Amazon will come to its senses and not compete with Apple Music service this way by limiting consumers.

Title: Love mine!!
Body: This is my 2nd Echo Dot. I have one in my livingroom & this one in the bedroom. I've surprised myself as to how many different ways I've used them. Got a Wemo smart plug to have an awkwardly placed lamp to turn on. Set reminders, ask questions, tell it to add items to shopping/to do lists which shows on your phone to check off at market, play games, set alarms, play bedtime meditation sounds on a timer, play almost any music, send direct voice messages to a friend that also has one & Amazon notifies you on it if your order shipped or was delivered!  I said I didn't NEED one but NOW I can't imagine living without them!!

Title: Does everything as advertised - and more.
Body: I like this because it is easy to use, once you get the correct app from the App Store. You need the Amazon app for it to work easily.  Other apps that pop up made me think that was the correct app and they weren_. There should be a quick link to download the app.. other than that. I love it. Alexa is connected to my Bose sound touch speaker and it sounds great.. using Alexa for shopping list, alarms, appointment reminders, to track packages, play music,  etc...i am still investigating all the other things i can use it for.

Title: Did not meet my expectations
Body: I bought this and a Google Mini over Christmas just to play with and compare.  Long story short, the Google Mini understands me better and seems very much more natural and adaptive in its understanding and replies.  I have not used my Echo Dot in a month even though it's sitting on my desk here at work plugged in - it's just too frustrating.  (I love Amazon and own several Amazon tablets - I sure hope my review is not rejected.

Title: Its ok....
Body: Was given this as a gift, hadn't really wanted one, but since we are using a lot of Tplink smart home outlets and cameras to smarten up our home, I said I would give it a try. Aside from using it as just a Bluetooth speaker it is more of a novelty than anything. Sound quality is decent for a small speaker playing music, although the first day I using it the play back got all staticy and distorted and I had to unplug and re-plug it in to get the quality back. I do have to say compared to Siri I think Alexa wins as far as being able to understand, enabling different skills that she can learn, like starting my wifes Chrysler Pacifica, enabling her to be able to understand Pandora, using the Tplink products for controlling our house. However when she doesn't understand, you might as well have taken the phone out of your pocket or if it is already in your hand hit a few buttons and done what you wanted to in the first place, cause it would of been easier and a lot quicker. Sometimes I have to tell her 3 times to turn on a light cause either she didn't hear me over the background noise or she just didn't understand which device to turn on. I haven't yet been amazed or wowed or said that she has made my life any easier.

Title: Should Have Skipped
Body: If you don't have a "smart" home, I'm not sure why you would need this product.  My 70 year old mother loves it, as she uses it as her speaker to play Amazon Music.  I, however, feel like the speaker isn't as good as either playing directly from my phone, tv, or actual bluetooth speaker.  Also, you have to pay to pair with Apple Music, which limits your podcasts.  Yes, most podcasts can be linked in Amazon, but through their podcast links.  I like the way my Apple podcasts link together and how easy they are to keep track of.Overall, I just felt like it wasn't needed--sadly.  Our phones and a good, high-quality speaker are about all you need.  If you already have Apple, you can ask Siri, or just put the Alexa app on your phone to ask them questions.  Otherwise, I'm not sure that I'll be using this much except for an outside alarm and occasional speaker.

Title: Stopped working after 4 months.
Body: At first my echo works really well, but after awhile the sound started getting fuzzy. If I turned it off and then back on it would fix that issue. Then one day I came home from work and the red microphone light on top was lit up. I couldn't get it to turn on at all or reset. I called customer service and tried everything, to be told it's not fixable and that they would give me 15% off a new one (since my 90 day warranty expired last month). Not very long to have it for it to break already.

Title: Not too useful
Body: I received my Alexa Echo Dot (3rd Generation) a week ago or so.  It is about the size and weight of a hockey puck and relatively easy to use.  Plug it in, download the corresponding app to your smartphone and you're off and running. The app is used to set preferences and settings since the Dot top controls are very limited (there are just 4: volume up/down, mic on/off and attention).I use the Android app so comments below may or may not apply if you are an iPhone Nazi.The interpretation of voice commands work pretty well.  It accepts my voice without problems and that of my 7-yearold granddaughter and foreign-born daughter (who has a fairly strong Romanian accent).  It does not handle compound instructions very well though.  Keep your request to a single command and it works much better. I am told it accepts both English and German although my high school German is way too old to test.I do not live in a 'smart' house so I did not test any of the remote device management capabilities (turn on/off lamps, unlock/lock doors etc.) nor did I use it for things like creating shopping lists.  Although Alexa can provide local traffic reports my 'Droid app from a local TV station is much faster.I suspect the most common use will be playing music (a trial period of Amazon Music comes with (I don't intend to renew at $3.99/month) but I have found that full of shortcomings:1.  Requesting a specific song might get you the original or it might get you a re-recording of the original.2.  A request for an album or genre will probably result in unwanted repeats of a single song (also happened withNPR News summary as well).3.  Amazon claims to have 50 million songs out there but there are a ton of common titles that I have never heardof and there are many popular personal favorites missing.4.  Requesting something like "play Hawaiian Instrumentals" results in vocal recordings and a request to play harpmusic was not understood.  Not sure what's up with that. I'm amazed at how good its vocal interpretation is but itis still a long way from perfect.5.  And the WORST shortcoming - the audio level is very inconsistent between songs.  Playing the Echo Dot on yourbedside while trying to go to sleep results in songs barely heard to the next one blasting you off your pillow.Very irritating!  And, the volume buttons on top of the puck are not lighted and hard to find if the room is dark.On the plus side it does a reasonable job of finding a specific song or album (played in shuffle mode) and you canbuild your own personal playlist(s) if you wish.My granddaughter is going to be pleased with it because she loves to give it math problems.  Saves her a bunch oftime doing homework.  It is also useful as a clock radio (wake to music of your choice) but its rumored ability torecord everything around it might not be what you want in the bedroom (especially if your girlfriend's name is'Alexa').  You can shut the microphone off but I'm unsure if that actually does what you would think.I did notice that with unit not used for several days, even with the mic and notifications turned off, it startsblinking - irritating.It does have a mini stereo jack connection so earbuds do work and you do get full stereo out of the earbuds.  Theinternal speaker sounds mono but it isn't bad at low audio levels.  It will reportedly connect via Bluetooth to anexternal speaker although I did not try that.  You can also set 2 Dot's up to create a stereo speaker although Iunderstand there may be issues getting that to work correctly.I usually watch the local TV news while eating breakfast but if you don't do that this gadget will give you thenews from several optional sources while you eat.  I did notice it repeats stories from time to time and appears tobe caught in a loop. I never found it very useful because not very many news sources are available.My summary: it is a moderately useful gadget but not worth the money it costs (somewhere between $40-$100 on theopen market).

Title: Can not set Alexa dot up unless I subscribe for a license Key
Body: Couldn't connect to Wifi so I got help from Amazon.  The guy I spoke to told me I have errors on my computer and alexa dot can not be installed unless I purchase a License Key at a cost of $199.99 for 5 yrs. or $249.99 for lifetime.  There is nothing on Amazon that tells you that you must purchase this in order to use the Amazon Dot.  I want to hear from Amazon as to whether this is a scam or someone who actually works for them and that the license key is a neccesity in order to use this darn Dot.  Someone please let me know.  I don't have any luck contacting Amazon to find out.

Title: No Sirius to Alexa device streaming >2 months now
Body: The device itself works fine with whole house integration - lights, alarms, connectivity all fine. The ding 1-star rating is due to the continued false advertising by Amazon and Sirius on streaming ability. Since early March, Amazon Alexa devices haven't been able to stream from Sirus. Amazon is aware (have the emails from customer service), Sirius is aware (no email/ticket, but a nice promotional offer to 'offset' the disconnect.What really bugs me is the lack of public acknowledgement from either company. Just a couple of weeks ago, got a postcard advertising the ease of streaming Sirius to Alexa devices - while in truth it hasnt worked in over 2 months! And there's no date proposed for when it will work again (from Sirius Account Specialist), yet both companies continue to advertise sirius streaming as a feature.For pete's sake, at least have the decency to inform your customers of known issues.

Title: Love the dot
Body: Why 4 stars then...Well, cause as great as the sound is, as cool as it is to turn lights and control TV...Some of it it's quirks are hard to get used to.Set a timer in one room, you can't shut it off from another room without unplugging the one near you, or changing the 'wake word' to 'computer, echo, amazon, or alexa'.  Those 4 names are all bad, it's STRANGELY limited, since you CAN change the name of any light or device any time you like.It would be AWESOME if you could control one with the other, and I'm sure they will add that some day... why can't I say, "echo, tell computer to pause netflix", etc.

Title: Must have for dorms
Body: I got this echo for my dorm room and it is a must have in my opinion. It was really easy to set up, however had some issues connecting, but that was more of the school Wi-Fi rather than the Echo itself. The sound quality is great and I use it more than my Bluetooth speaker due to its convenience. My one concern is over how amazon handles privacy, but that is an institutional issue, not relevant to this product specifically.

Title: Good for a little speaker!
Body: This little Dot is so cute and love the white color they offer. Alexa is cool but sometimes doesn_ know the answers to the questions I ask. I love playing music with the Dot and the volume is pretty good and loud...does get a little muffled when on the loudest setting but we don_ use it that loud anyway. Have my Alexa Dot in the kitchen and she_ very useful for timers and making grocery lists! Love it and definitely would buy again or more (;

Title: Excellent product, no more review needed
Body: Sound quality is excellent. Bluetooth connectivity is great but both echo and Bluetooth devices don_ play same time. I need help with grouping my smart home devices because I found group is not perfectly effective. But I didn_ find anyway to contact Amazon Alexa expertises. Online search didn_ help. Is there way to contact Amazon Alexa technical support? I created group and put devices under the group but still hearing Alexa asking _ few things share this name.....

Title: Great for teenagers!
Body: I had given an Alexa Show to my mom for Christmas, but she decided she did not want to deal with it so she gave it back to me.  I set it up, and enjoyed it much more than I thought I would.  The speaker is great, and I have appreciated the convenience of having Alexa's assistance in playing music, setting timers, alarms, reminders, playing trivia, news reports, making phone calls, showing me my photos, etc.  My teenage son also enjoyed interacting with the Show and expressed an interest in having a Dot of his own.  (Alexa's silly skills --telling jokes, talking like Baby Groot and Yoda, etc. are wonderful engagement tools!)  I saw great potential uses for the Dot for him:  1.  He wouldn't have to remember to charge it, since it stays plugged in. 2.  I can "drop in" on him to communicate from the kitchen or even by using the Alexa app on my phone.  He often ignores his phone, but this is much less effort for him to interact with. 3.  He likes the ease of setting alarms/reminders using his voice. 4.  This is an easier way for him to access music.  It's great to be able to give him a product he enjoys that promotes better communication with me and helps him be more organized and productive.

Title: Paid service is expected
Body: I did not realize that a subscription to Amazon Prime is really expected to use this product.  Sure you can ask Alexei to "play spa music", for example, which is what I like to hear to put me to sleep, but without a paid subscription, it plays this station that is not really relaxing spa music and it also has voiced commercials in it, which defeats the whole purpose I bought the product for,  I bought this to replace using my cell phone at night to play music to sleep to.  My cell phone allows me to play 8 hours of relaxation music to sleep to on youtube unlike this product.Update: talked to customer service and they agreed to get any comercial free music you have to buy a subscription.

Title: Improved in all areas!
Body: I was in love with my first three Dot's and wondered what I ever did without them.  But this guy is much improved in all areas.  The new exterior is very classy, and I didn't need to buy an enclosure.  The sound is much "beefier" with improved bass tones.  And setup took all of three seconds.  I am a "senior" with frequent mobility problems so being able to turn on lights with my voice is a great help.  I have thrown away my ancient and "clunky" intercom system which I used to communicate with my adult son who is my caretaker.  I just "drop in" on the Dot in the living room or the one in his bedroom.  I no longer have a radio, the Dot is enough and playing nature sounds at night lulls me right to sleep.  When I purchased the first Dot, my son bought a Google home so we could compare the two devices.  He gave the Google Home to his friend.  It turns out that Alexa is smarter than Google. I definitely recommend the newest model.

Title: Next Great Thing
Body: In the 80's, fax machines became the "it" device, prompting exclamations of "how did we ever live without these."  In the 90's it was personal computers.  Then it was the cell phone, followed by smart pads.  Now Alexa and the Echo Dot are our "how did we ever live without these" devices.  Voice recognition is very good.  Alexa doesn't always figure out the question properly, but gets it right about 90% of the time, and we expect that to improve with time and use.  Added "smart" light bulbs to the living room and Alexa handles it very well.  We use the Echo Dot in the bedroom mostly to play music or comedy through the night, ask about outside temperatures, and start our day with a weather forecast.

Title: I love the sound quality and the look of my 3rd generation Dot!
Body: I now own an Amazon Echo 2nd generation, a 2nd generation Dot and a 3rd generation Dot.  I was amazed at the sound coming from the 3rd generation Dot.  I think it is better than the sound on the Echo!!  My husband and I are 75 years old so we are not tech savvy.  We use it for music and our radio station, the news each morning, the weather.  We also have Philips Hue smart bulbs that we paired with our Echo so that we can easily turn our lights on and off especially during the night.  I only wish I could trade in my original Dot for the 3rd generation.  Our home is too small to accommodate a 4th one.  I did not rate how it connects to a blue tooth speaker since we don't own one.  I imagine it would be amazing.

Title: Original dot is still better.
Body: The decision to change the power cord from an easily replaceable usb interface to an exclusive cord sold by amazon has really turned me off of these devices.  The upgrades (sound quality + aesthetics) are nowhere near enough to make up for the fact that I have to pay $20 when one of their very fragile cords fails.  My cat took one nibble on the cord, bam, dead echo.On previous versions of the echo dot, I could replace the existing usb cord with any usb cord of my choice, allowing me to get a superior product at an affordable price.  This allowed me to customize the cord to something that was a color of my choice, length of my choice, and most importantly in my particular case - made of cat-deterring materials.I'm not blaming Amazon for not making their cords cat-proof, that's not their responsibility.  I am, however, very upset at the realization that I could previously give another company my $5-10 and get a cord that will outlast my echo dot, is customized to my tastes, and can function as a usb cord for all the wonderful things they do.Amazon knows that that $5-10 only sometimes goes to them in the form of an Amazon-Basics usb cable because they have to provide competitive pricing with everyone else in the usb market.  So they replace that interface with an inferior cable they can sell exclusively for $20 and cut out the competition?  Those seems like questionable motives to me...Amazon, if you're reading this review... please let me know if I can send back my 3rd generation echo dots in exchange for your 2nd generation models.  The "upgraded" version is offensive.

Title: Not as good as the Dot 2
Body: I have a couple of the Dot 2's and recently got a Dot3.  While the sound quality seems to be better that is largely due to the emphasized low end not necessarily an increased performance across the range.My primary reason for 2 stars is that I find myself having to repeat commands much more frequently when addressing the 3 over the 2, it is just not as responsive and doesn't seem to respond to the wake word or commands as reliably as my older Dot 2's.  If I need more Dots I will continue to look for the 2's and just tie them to a bluetooth or corded speaker for audio output.

Title: About what I expected.
Body: Love it, my only two complaints are that Siri, generally, is a smarter and more capable personal assistant, and that you can_ set up a routine to automatically unlock your door with Alexa. Kind of stupid if you ask me. - 1 start for those alone. Minor complaints are that it sometimes doesn_ hear me unless I make a dramatic pause between Alexa and the subsequent command, meaning I have to speak unnaturally to get the thing to execute what I want it to do.

Title: Good product
Body: I love this little gadget !  I use it a lot and it's connected with our ring doorbell so it will tell you someone is at the front door. I like using it for news and weather information and playing my favorite songs. You can tell it to turn down or up on the volume or stop. It has 1000 uses I'm sure but I only use a few that I don't think I could live without.  It will set a timer or a reminder for you. Just remember to say Alexa before the request.

Title: Echo Dot
Body: I love this item! It is so helpful to ask Alexa questions without having to look anything up. The ability to choose music, make lists, play audible books and explore the unknown with Alexa is simply great. A friend encouraged me to buy this and Amazon happened to have it on sale. For the price your money is well spent. Amazon's assistance in setting this up properly was quite helpful although it turned out I could have set it up myself. Excellent purchase!

Title: Alexa is Great for kids and busy moms
Body: I don't know too many people who have Alexa but I recommend it.  I got one just to try it Fall 2018.  I easily forget things on the stove or to leave for an appointment unless I set alarms.  My phone is good but Alexa is so easy.  You just tell her:  set an alarm (or timer...they are different in sound) for 25 minutes.  If you set 2 alarms or 6, you can just say: Alexa how many alarms have I set?  Or how many minutes are left?  Alexa knows lots of radio stations (not many of us have radios anymore), music (she plays your favorites without asking), lots of games (great for parents & kids to do together - listening is important!).  If the music is too loud you can say: Alexa, turn it down 3 notches.  The only thing that is slightly annoying is when Alexa interupts our conversation.  She thinks she hears her name so we say:  Alexa, adults are talking!  My teen son and I laugh because, of course, we aren't abusive with other people or even our pets...but Alexa can take it!  She doesn't do it often so there's no need to turn her off!  I ended up getting one for my son's room (Feb 2019)  I hear him playing games before bedtime.  We also ask her world facts and math questions whilst doing homework.  Eventually I'm going to wifi the whole house but for now our two Alexas are a great addition to our home.  highly recommend for busy people and families!

Title: 3rd Generation DOES NOT PLAY Apple Music.
Body: After about four months of phone calls to Amazon_ technical team, my two 3rd generation Echo Dots still do not play Apple Music. I_ told it_ a software glitch, since my two Echo dots (2nd generation) play Apple Music just fine. I am beyond incredulous that a company the size of Amazon can_ update their software for this device after four months. A far cry from Apple or Google, that_ for sure...and a great advertisement for Amazon_ competitors.

Title: Much improved audio quality
Body: I used to have a 2nd generation Echo Dot in my bathroom, mostly for streaming music while showering. I found the audio quality somewhat lacking, so I_e replaced it with a Home Mini for awhile, even though I could stream Spotify, which I love, I missed my Amazon Music and Alexa. During the winter holidays, I have upgraded to the new 3rd generation Echo Dot recently and have found that the audio quality is much improved and matched the Home Mini. The base is much warmer and it sounded more powerful than the 2nd generation. I_ very pleased with the overall quality of the 3rd generation and would recommend it for those who wished to upgrade their older Echo Dot for an improved audio quality.

Title: Love it!!
Body: Ok I bought one to give it a try... I'm old school an not completely up on this new technology.  But I love it! I love just asking Alexa to put things on my shopping list and it goes right to the app on my phone.  I like being able to just say Alexa remind me... an she adds it to my calendar.  I took it last night to my dads and we had a great time playing games, and he liked being able to listen to old country songs.  So I now have purchased 3 more for other rooms and for a gift.  I cant wait to figure out what else she can do.

Title: I dont know if I like who I am with  Alexa
Body: Alex is still so robotic and basic. We have lots of misunderstandings in our relationship. Sometimes I feel like I'm always yelling. I don't know if I like who I have become in this relationship. I feel like Alexa was fing with me for the fun of it the other day. I don't  feel like she really listens to me lots of times. AMD sometimes I feel blown off and ignored by here responses. Not sure this is my forever relationship, but we have had some food times. I guess I just hooed that we would have progressed more by this point.

Title: Alexa Does Not Understand Many Requests
Body: Pros:Great for getting the weather and timeGood for playing Spotify with voice-commandsCons:Snooze function on alarms is unreliable. Sometimes they do not play. I have been late to work because of this. Also, you cannot set multiple alarms at once. If you have trouble getting out of bed like me, I would not recommend this as an alarm.The speaker quality is just decent. If you have seen the Despacito ad, you will be disappointed that you cannot ask Alexa to play the non-remixed version. There have been many times when Alexa has played the wrong song.The biggest con is the lack of information available. Trying to Google stuff with a voice command is pretty useless. 90% of the time, Alexa does not give me the correct information. This is a big deal breaker. Fortunately, I got this as a gift. I feel bad that the person paid $40 to get me a weather machine, timer, and mediocre speaker.Overall:They should have trial periods for Echo devices. People will understand how disappointing these things are.

Title: I love the Dot!
Body: i love the Echo Dots! I have 3rd Gen.  The main Echo unit is in our downstairs dining room. I purchased 3 Dots, one for our master bedroom upstairs, and the other two for the mater bedroom and living room of our second home.  They are great to use to communicate back and forth with others in the house, for turning appliances on/off through voice control, and to listen to music. (There are lots of things you can do with Alexa, but you can read all that in the description.)I just ordered 3 more Dots yesterday so I can put one in each master bathroom, and one in our laundry room.

Title: Sound quality is awful
Body: Did not notice any sound quality due to volume was set to low when listening to music. Wife started to listen to music at higher volume and notice that it sounds like speaker is blown. Called Amazon, Echo Dot is covered only for 90days. Will not be purchasing any more Echo devices.

Title: crap
Body: I wanted to hook up to a hotspot, not my phone. What crap, it would not do it after working on it for 40 minutes. Someone owes me $100 for my time. I'm so sick of doing IT's work for them and going back to the 1990s of frustration.  Make this intuitive. Yes, I threw it away, I don't even want to look at it as a paperweight.

Title: A better Echo
Body: I have a total of two Echo Dos 3rd gen and three 2nd gen. All of them perform beautifully, specially after the foreign language support improved all across the line (now the 2nd gen supports the same as the 3dr gen). The dual (English-Spanish) support is great to deal with Spanish songs, performers, cities and so on.Overall, the Echos are among the most used gadgets at home. They replaced all the radios, and the home theater receiver is now used only as an amplifier for my Fire Stick.

Title: Doesn't go to 11...
Body: We purchased our Echo Dot 3rd Gen on November 26th 2018 and it blew out in March of 2019. About 4 months of light use on a $50 speaker that is self powered (meaning the amp is internal so we didn't hook up anything wrong or feed too much power to it). The speaker should not have blown out. They will not replace it under any warranty. We did not play it over about 75% volume as it distorted at higher sound levels. Now it is completely busted and sounds awful. We would not recommend this product. It is too weak to withstand even light use. We might have played it for about 20 minutes per day on average over the course of the four months we had it. Amazon really should cover their own products with a year warranty. We do not recommend buying the Echo Dot 3rd Gen speaker made by Amazon. Trying to figure out what to buy to replace it since Amazon does not stand behind their own products.

Title: Does not work
Body: The most irritating piece of junk I have ever come across.  every 30 seconds, it announces, "now connected to {my laptop name}" but it's not connected - then 30 seconds later, the same thing.  You can't shut her up!Then when I explicitly 'removed' it from my laptop - it pops up with that request to connect (see attached image)It is like a defective big-brother - just constantly harassing you with its malfunction!I'd return it, but I threw away the boxes - Another one of Bezos' scams. I was gonna get a Beatspill - I should've got the BeatsPill! (At least the ModelT worked!)

Title: If not using for music, stick with 2nd generation Dot
Body: I use multiple Echo Dots in my condo.  I had a Gen 2 dot in my bedroom and living room, and got two new Gen 3 dots - one to replace the living room and another one for the bathroom.  The sound quality is improved, and not as tinny as the Gen 2.  However the bass is overly pronounced, and a lot of dialog and spoken word comes out a bit muffled and boomy.My biggest critique however is how slow it is to activate with the wake word.  And many times it simply doesn't wake up at all with "Alexa".  I've literally had to go over to it and yell "Alexa" multiple times!  This is really annoying for home automation (like when you want the lights to come on as you've entered).  I think the main culprit is that Amazon reduced the number of microphones from 7 to 4 on the new generation.  I wish they hadn't cheapened out where it mattered most!  I have 100% wake word activation with the Gen 2 Dots - and would recommend them instead.

Title: Sounds great... while it works. I have two, both are the same.
Body: Initially, speakers sound great and they work great... after a few months, now speakers going out, and I keep at vol five of ten max. Also, connectivity and understanding commands is really getting bad. Gen one speakers were not stereo sound quality, but still working well. These, not so much. Bad investment. Not just one, but same problems for two of two I purchased at about the same time. My money in the trash, literally.

Title: Half baked and spotty function
Body: As with other Alexa devices the integration with skills and smart home devices is half baked. Smart switches often don_ work or are unresponsive. If you have your lights and other items hooked to a smart switch for voice commands and the skill is constantly unresponsive, then what_ the point?

Title: Alexa Makes ME PULL MY HAIR
Body: I never write a review and rarely read reviews cause i think there rigged but today im writing one. To say that google out shines alexa. Alexa blabbers on when you ask it something. It gets me angry...it makes my blood pressure go up. Its hard of hearing and when it hears, it hears something opposite of what i tell it. Nothing compared to my google home. Im returning my 3 echo 3s and going on to try the home pod and to see if that works better. Also it didnt work with my LG OlEd tv nor My samsung Soundbar N950. It kept saying the bar wasnt found even though it was connected in alexas device list. So yea buy it and find out the hard way

Title: Not bad! Not bad at all!
Body: My Alexa finally has someone to play with! Sound quality is really really good! I was actually very surprised. Only annoying "habit" is trying to connect to my BT streamer on the sound system. Finally had to disconnect. Also don't know how to turn on the acknowledgement sound on it, so don't know if it's listening to me when I call it's name. I probably need to read up on the instruction. The older Alexa had the "ack" beep on by default.

Title: Tossed for Privacy Concerns
Body: After going through and listening to the recordings Amazon kept from our two dots, we decided to toss them (put them in a storage box).Not a passionate review. If I had not found a bunch of recordings that had nothing to do with Alexa stored on Amazon servers I would have kept using the dots. Have no problem with Amazon keeping the recordings of my requests to Alexa but every recording I saw that did not was kept and was even labeled by Amazon to show that it had nothing to do with an Alexa request. If they simply fixed that I would probably use the dots again.  Seems like a simple fix if they already know it has nothing to do with an Alexa request - just delete them as a matter of form. And, some of the conversations recorded were perplexing. Not sure how "Alexa" was heard. Seemed random.That said, we were not huge Alexa users. We found most things it did just as easily or comfortably done in other ways (and I still use Siri for other things and I prefer their privacy policies and practices). I completely understand the 5-star reviews if one is has integrated Alexa into their lives more than we did (If I used Alexa like I use Siri, I would have kept the dots and written a 5-star review). We did not and the privacy concerns were sufficient to get rid of them. All in all, it was a dispassionate decision. Wasn't angry with Amazon and not much attached to the dots.I will miss the shopping list.

Title: Good, but could be better
Body: We added the 3rd generation Echo Dot to two existing Echo Dots (not sure if 1st or 2nd gen).  I'm not sure what they had in mind besides trying to make it more appealing looking and sound better.  Yes, it looks more refined than the previous iterations.  Sound?  There definitely is more bass- but at the expense of treble.  You can hear it when Alexa speaks and even after a couple weeks I prefer the voice on the earlier generations.  I suppose music is a bit better- and one can argue that you can beam to bluetooth speakers, etc.Gen 3 Dot is heavier than the first two and requires a bulkier power supply. I suppose it draws more power as well. With the earlier versions you could use any 5v charger with enough amperage to drive the Dot. So should the power supply fail it would be more of a challenge to replace. A huge worry? No. But a concern nonetheless.Don't get me wrong, we love having Alexa in 3 rooms. We've converted most of the switches throughout the house to smart dimmers, have smart bulbs in other areas and smart switches for coffee, tea, cabinet lights. For the most part we think the Alexa concept is genius with so many vendors on board now.  I think it's a little pricey for what it is, but I guess Amazon sells millions at this price, so who am I to argue?Bottom line: If you're looking to see what Echo and Alexa are about but unsure, maybe find a refurbished earlier generation.  If you want to jump in you probably won't be disappointed.

Title: Some major improvements over 2nd generation, but Alexa is a bit hard of hearing!
Body: There are some major improvements to the 3rd generation echo dot as compared to the 2nd, first off, it looks a lot less like something that would be on the ice at an NHL game, not that hockey pucks are necessarily a bad thing, but the 1st and 2nd generation dots just looked cheap. The 3rd generation has a smoother, more curved shape, with MUCH more attractive cloth covering that resembles speaker cloth.The sound quality compared to earlier models is substantially better. Mind you it's still a tiny little speaker that lacks the physical capacity to really pound out great sound, but for casual ambiance listeneing and voice it is beyond ideal. If you expect more out of a speaker this small, you need to readjust your expectations, it really does sound great considering its size. You want better? Buy an echo input and set up a Bose L1. It will be a TON bigger, but you will have fantastic sound!Now we run into problems, and they are no small problems. My wife uses the dot to play music through the living room, dining room, and kitchen as she goes around the house, and keeps it cranked up. But the microphones can't hear over the sound of the music, so I have to SHOUT at Alexa to turn down the volume... Even at no music being played, it just doesn't pick up as well as my 2nd gen echo dots.. This is a HUGE operability problem,My other complaint with it is that they changed the power input from USB to one of those round input things. Probably necessary for the added power, but it makes getting power to it less flexible, and the plug part is REALLY chunky on a standard wall outlet. Kind of annoying.Lastly I purchased this hoping to get Alexa Guard integration, still not available to me for some reason. Amazon is taking forever getting Alexa Guard set up. I am hoping that they work a deal with ADT to monitor Alexa Guard with ADT SmartThings and not just Pulse once Alexa Guard is setup for everyone...Overall I like it, but the items mentioned above are genuinely annoying.

Title: My Alexa is deaf on vol 5 and above.
Body: This newer version 3 has a bigger and louder speakers. Quality of sound is good but not the best. There are room for improvement eg better base. I also prefer one that comes with a rechargeable battery so I can put it anywhere I like without worry about a AC power source. Another annoying thing is Alexa goes deaf to your command if the volumn went above 5. I hope this issue can be resolved. I find myself having to shout at Alexa to be heard. Not a nice thing to do.

Title: Order junk FASTER
Body: I didn't use it. I didn't open it. Reading about privacy issues with the Echo made me lose interest. Sure, call me a technophobe. Luddite. Whatever. I'll take the extra step to order things with my hands and have sex in private. Because privacy is real luxury. Soon it might even be trending.Yes, I know. I have no real privacy on my phone or on Amazon. Except that I won't have a device in my home just waiting until it hears a phrase it a phrase close enough to a phrase or something else happens that isn't supposed to. Call it a lack of trust in companies that haven't earned trust.

Title: DON'T TURN UP TO EVEN HALF WAY! 6 MONTHS IN, MOSTLY STATIC!
Body: I have had this echo since Christmas 2018, 6 months almost... and all I hear is static playing. The songs still play but its "crumbly" and difficult to understand. We do not play the echo loud at all, at most, maybe half way up! I've noticed the volume has remained close to the same and slowly, the songs get more and more static. I believe the speaker is "blown". That's what it sounds like at least! I hope to get an exchange as this is still so new to us. :(

Title: Dot Quality and Stability Not The Same As Echo
Body: I had been wanting to play the same music stream in multiple rooms of our townhouse but didn't really want to invest in another Echo solely for that purpose (it's loud enough to hear the music upstairs).  Amazon put the new Dot's on sale earlier this year for $29 so I figured the time was right. The first one I ordered had a ship date of about 30 days from when I placed the order, so I thought the demand was high. I noticed a week later I could place a new order and get one in 2 days, so after talking to support for a while, they canceled the first order and I placed a new order at the discounted price.The on-sale Dot arrived and set up as expected. I noticed a lag in response time slowly growing over the course of about two weeks. It also would connect to the external speaker I paired it to, but would never put sound out through it (or itself) after the initial pairing the next time the speaker was turned on. All I needed to do was unplug the device and it started working again. After doing this several times over a few weeks I felt like there was a larger issue so I reached out to support - the website recommended the online chat. That session with Shashi lasted 58 minutes and resulted in a full reset of the Dot and I was told it would resolve the issue but to feel free to reach back out if it happened again.The about-every-two-weeks lag continued and I unplugged/replugged it in again and even reset it again but the cycle remained the same until it recently just started throwing a red ring at me and said to try again later.I again contacted support and after a harrowing recount of the experience, I was told by "Iris" the unit was defective and that I'd have to BUY ANOTHER unit. Iris offered me the following consolation (quotes included), "While this isn't a common issue, Echo is a physical electronic device, and there's always a possibility something can happen. We realize this and offer a 90-day Limited Warranty that covers any defect not caused by physical damage. We also know accidents happen so we have special options available to purchase a new device at a discount."While it was nice to have a Dot in another room to localize commands, the spotty performance, inability to maintain a Bluetooth connection to an external speaker, and a sketchy sale followed by a lengthy troubleshooting process that took the unit out of warranty and mandated a second purchase, I'd recommend that you pay full price and log any issues and troubleshooting steps immediately, keeping in mind the 90-day window.You are probably better off just getting a more expensive Echo to accomplish the second Alexa goal since they seem to perform flawlessly (in my experience).Buyer beware!

Title: Alexa where have you been?
Body: So I've always maintained I have no intention of talking to a computer. I hate phone trees that force you to talk.Siri? No way am I ever gonna do that!But in my new little house I have a bedside lamp behind a plant and it was a total pain trying to turn it off at night without knocking over the lamp. Well, I broke down and ordered an echo dot with a smart plug. By the next month I had 2 dots and two smart plugs. Alexa and I have about figured each other out! She knows which music I like and I know I have to speak up a bit for her to hear me. (Maybe she has a slight hearing problem?)Anyhow she turns my lamp on and off and turns my tv on and off and switches channels in the living room.In my craft room she turns my glue gun and lamp on and off and plays music in the background while I play. What more could you want?

Title: Shouldn't have to download ad-ons or enable things in app for Alexa
Body: I love Alexa and the assitance.  Truth be told, I have one in my office, one in my garage, one in my kitchen, one in each bathroom (2) one in the living room and another unopened, because It's only a matter of time before I want another one somewhere else haha.  All of that being said, this review is meant for the app/enabling features.  I think if it's internet based it should be able to do everything that it advertises automatically.  No going to your phone and downloading add-ons or enabling features.  It's very much annoying.  The world is too far advanced and this product is too far advanced not to already be doing this. --- Wrap up: Love the product -- annoyed with the software

Title: Quality sound and non-slip
Body: The sound won't blow you out of the water, but it's a very improved sound boost from the original Echo Dot (which has the sound quality of a transistor radio), and has what I call small room boom.  Perfect sound & bass for a bedroom or bathroom.  It won't blow you away, but it will still be too loud for the person in the room next to that doesn't want to hear your music.  And it doesn't slide across my nightstand like the original Dot.  I definitely recommend this, for it's current reduced price of $29.99,  instead of the previous generations of junky Echo Dots.

Title: watch you tube to find the correct _lexa app to down load. There are many.
Body: The echo dot looks like a hockey puck. Having said that, the device is entertaining. Definitely going to be exploring what this thing can do. I currently like the free skills you can get for it. One big issue I had with it was finding the right App. The instructions say down load the _lexa App. There is no _lexa app. How ver there are a ton of apps for Alexia. It took me going to a youtube video to figure out which Alexa I needed. Amazon needs to tell buyers which Alexa title to get and provide a picture of it. That is the only complaint I have with it.

Title: A handy tool to have around the house.
Body: Came in handy better than I thought. I love how you can create personalized responses and alarms. I like how it will read out info from online. It hears you from a good distance. It also plays my Apple Music playlists better than my phone does. I do wish it was wireless. When I change rooms i have to unplug it, but it usually reconnects fairly quick when I plug it back in. Hopefully one day she'll be able to generate responses that aren't scripted.

Title: Does Not Connect Does Not Integrate
Body: My firesticks, tablets and all other Amazon devices work great with the Alexa app BUT this device will not stay connected or function properly...how annyoing is this thing. My daughter wanted this so bad. Don't waist your money. Returning this ASAP.

Title: Only one device can stream music! Bummer !!
Body: Having an echo, enjoyed it a lot , music , games with family, news, etc. But it really stood out as an easy go to music easy listening.  10+ years prime member here , so prime music is good enough for me.  The kids loved the echo and eventually i decided get two 3rd gen. echo dot, one in each of the kids rooms so they can enjoy listening to music they like .Here lies the shocker !! I couldn't !!! Amazon lets you stream music to one device at a time, so if i am listening , kids can't, or if one of them is listening, rest of us go into humming-your-tune-mode. I expected to be able at least let each person listen to what they want, where they want!  That's just stupid ! I was planning to order more, for kitchen, my bedroom, heck for the bathroom... BUT  NOT ANYMORE .. THANKS BUT NO THANKS  AMAZON ! Until you fix this...you are losing prime music customer base, which are willing to buy more echo's faster than you can make them !

Title: Checking In On Grandma Was Never So Easy
Body: I set these last two up at Mom's house next to her favorite chair and in the kitchen. I, my brothers and all her grandchildren and great grandchildren can now Drop In on her. She wasn't able to answer her cell phone fast enough when she did hear it. And she almost never heard it buried deep within the dark caverns of her purse. Now, she simply answers by speaking back to us. Intrusive? Perhaps. We can all hear what she is watching on the tele or what music she listens to until she mutes its.I feel she is safer, she calls me to check in by saying: "Alexa, call Mark" and I get a call wherever I am. She can do it with a 911 call too, if needed. This reminds me of the old commercial where a senior citizen had a device hung around the neck and would press a button while speaking  "help, I can't get up" to alert an emergency medical response team. But the echo dot is so much better, easier and cheaper.I know she feels safer. And she talks more with greater ease and comfort. Her arthritis pain is excruciating at times while holding a phone for abit.I wonder why I didn't do this sooner.

Title: Like 2nd generation better
Body: This is a great speaker if you are using it primarily to listen to music. It has more base than the 2nd generation, and the sound is richer. BUT it is really difficult to understand speaking voices with the 3rd generation speaker. Voices are muffled and hard to understand. I disliked the new Echo so much that I traded locations with my old 2nd generation, so that the 2nd generation would be in the kitchen where I use it the most.  I hope Amazon will fix this problem at some point, but right now I would recommend that you try to order a 2nd generation.I'm back a month later, and I really dislike the 3rd generation. It's microphone doesn't work well at all. When you set an alarm, it's hard to turn it off, because it doesn't hear you. If I ask her a question, like how to spell something, she often mises up the words. The 2nd generation works so much better. If I had bought this model first. I think I would have returned it.

Title: Love my Echos
Body: I got an Amazon Echo for Christmas, and love everything it does. Speaker, for the size and cost, sounds great. Even if the TV is on or other people are talking loudly, it still hears it's name and responds flawlessly. So I got this Dot to go in my office with the intention of piping the same music around the house - with the intention of getting more. What I find is that I don't really want them to be playing the same thing. If I'm working, I can have something playing and my wife can use the Echo for what she wants. Multiple assistants! Again, for the price ($30!) it sounds great and works flawlessly. (I give it 5 stars in sound quality only because it is so cheap. If this cost $100, I'd probably only say 3 1/2 stars.) Couldn't be more happy with these Amazon products.

Title: More useful than you might think
Body: Requested/received as a gift, mostly just wanted it for simple things like quick checking weather, traffic and music while getting ready in the morning, which it does fine. I do like that it can control my Deebot vacuum, which is nice so I can ditch the remote and hide the charging station under our couch. I also discovered it can control my tv, at least once it's been turned on as apparently I don't have it set to always be connected to Wi-Fi. But that's also a nice quality of life feature I wouldn't have considered normally, as it's surprising how many times hands free controlling of the tv is helpful.As time goes on I'm sure I'll find more uses for my Echo, but it's already a great addition to my house.

Title: Surprising sound quality
Body: This may sound kind of silly, but I bought this for the bathroom so I could listen to music while showering.  It's compact, and I got the sandstone to blend in nicely with my white quartz countertops.  The sound quality surpassed my expectations, considering the size and price.  I did turn up the treble a few notches and the bass one notch, and it's great.  Volume can get surprisingly loud if you want it too.  I tend to listen around half volume and it's plenty.  The microphones work very well, too.  Even with the shower running and music playing, I can say "Alexa, turn it up" or "Alexa, next song" and she hears me right away.  I got it on sale, making it an even better value!

Title: I used to like it more.
Body: Not going to lie, Alexa is convenient. But some things are frustrating. My biggest pet peeve with Alexa right now is the Skype update. You used to be able to call from the device and now it goes through skype. You have to connect your skype and purchase a plan for minutes. Plus 90% of the time there is an error and Alexa isn't even to make the call. In addition to that crappy update the are still not providing solutions to personalize responses. For example, when you tell Alexa you like a song she will give a long response about continuing to tell her so she can choose better music. After a year of that I am tired of hearing her 30 second response, and this is with short response on! I feel like the upgrade and stuff they are adding are more for bringing customers in and not satisfying the current customers.

Title: Super sensitive
Body: We have two different echos in different rooms. One is my husbands and one is my sons. They are hooked to their own Alexa apps. Everyday before I leave the house I will play music for my dog. So as I leave I say _lexa- play country music. The Echo in the closer room which is the 2nd generation doesn_ always understand. The Echo in my son_ back bedroom will always answer and start to play Top country hits. It_ weird because it is further away but it is much more sensitive. The look is better on the third gen in my opinion as well. The 2nd gen is easier to clean and has a better sounding speaker.

Title: What's not to like?
Body: I traded in my Echo version 1 for this.  The Dot's speakers are better than the original Echo by about a billion percent.  It's also ridiculously fast compared to the old Echo.  For $30, you really can't go wrong.  Now I've got lightning fast commands to just about everything in my house (TVs, Stereo Receiver, Nest, Blink, Hue lights, EVERYTHING).  The best thing (and sort of creepy) was that I did no setup.  I plugged it in and (I guess) since I already had the Alexa app on my phone, it just set itself up.  Plugged it in and it was working.  That's how smart home equipment should work.

Title: Works fine to some extent
Body: Although this new EcoDot 3rd gen device sounds fine, well built and so on, there are some problems regarding the integration with Alexa and 2d gen EcoDots; I've got 2 of these and one of the latest gen, the latter one, can speak and understand Spanish which is my mother tong and the other 2 won't , so at this point, I have to speak English to some and Spanish separately, making life kind of tricky, also I need to call them with different names: Alexa (English) and Eco (Spanish) in order to avoid conflicts. On the other hand I was expecting integration with FireStick latest 4K version, as Alexa spoken commands won't trigger on, off, channels, volumen, etc. to my home theater components which have been previously programmed into the Amazon remote FS control which works fine manually.I wonder when this integration glitches can be solved some day.

Title: Cannot be unplugged from outlet, NOT RECHARGEABLE
Body: Hello all - This little machine CANNOT be unplugged from the outlet and MUST STAY PLUGGED in order to keep working. I let it "charge" overnight and unplugged it in the morning to move it around the house with me and IT IS NOT COMPLETELY WIRELESS. To me, this is absolutely worthless, but my children love being its boss and telling it what to do and what songs to play without lifting a finger, so I'm keeping it for them - but if it wasn't for my kids, I would return this thing. For something originally worth $50 = and even something that I paid $30 for - you're better off buying a Jawbone or JBL speaker. This is only worth if it you're really in need of cheap access to Alexa.

Title: A fun little extra
Body: I bought this to just have music on when I wanted it. I can quickly switch my music request from 50's to 70's or request a specific group.  It also came bundled with a Smart plug, so I have a lamp on it in the other living area that I can control when I'm not in there. I can quickly get weather updates, or even a silly joke.  My grandkids love to play the song "Baby Shark" ,  so Alexa steps right up for us and gets that going in an instant.  It's also company for my dog when I am away from the house and I have music or something "talky" to keep her company.

Title: A Real Review
Body: Sound quality not as good as on the 2nd generation. Amazon really needs to add a digital equalizer.  Very muddy, muffled sound. I have this and a Google Home Mini side by side. The difference is substantial. While the GHM doesn't have the bass that the dot has, it sounds very loud and clear. My official opinon, owning many smart speakers, is to avoid the smaller, cheaper ones, and get the regular editions. Yes, they cost more, but you get what you pay for. Both competing companies make great smart speakers, but spend a little more and get a lot more sound.

Title: Love it!
Body: I did not think I needed a voice assistant/music player until I received an Echo Dot (3rd Gen) as a gift. I bought the unlimited music monthly subscription from Amazon, and it's awesome even though you have to buy a subscription for each device. Now, I use Alexa to regularly play music, set timers/alarms, and get weather reports, and there are a lot of other features which I am still learning about. I love the Echo Dot (3rd Gen) so much that I bought six of these to give as gifts, and they were really well received.

Title: Why did I wait so long to get you, Echo?
Body: Surprised at how helpful this is. I never have to have an old timer moment and forget to add something to a shopping list - Alexa does it. I don't have to take my phone into the bathroom to listen to music during my morning routine (great sound quality for the size of the device) - Alexa does it. I get to tickle my quiz loving fancy - Alexa helps with that.Well done Amazon.

Title: Almost great...
Body: Maybe I'm just not tech savvy enough, but Alexa is harder to use than our little Google pod downstairs. I have bluetooth issues when trying to play from my phone, where the music comes out all staticky and weird, so can only play it straight through the Spotify link up. Which sucks because then it won't shuffle or let you pick songs but is nice bexause you don't need a phone for it. Occasionally, the bluetooth works but it's like 9 times out of 10. Alexa also doesn't listen very well. I use the same commands every time but sometimes she completely mishears and plays random stuff. I do like the volume buttons on top!  Sound quality is good for such a small speaker! Could be amazing, but mostly I'm just annoyed at her now. :)

Title: Great Sound and Looks but not the Wizard of Oz
Body: Good product. Setup is not as easy as 1-2-3 though. What comes with the package is not really useful at all in the actual setup. Make sure you download the right Alexa app and from there it_ not to hard (I_ not a techie at all). The Echo Dot is one of those toys you don_ need but it does offer convenience when you want to know the weather, word definitions, synonyms, etc. It has misunderstood me multiple times and said _ don_ know on numerous other questions, so it is not the infallible god of answers. Listening to  songs is definitely a plus and the sound is amazing for its size.

Title: Sometimes Alexa is home; other times, not so much.
Body: Alexa Client v1.24.205530.0; Android App v2.2.271281.0Alexa needs her hearing checked. About 40% of the time we give Alexa a command, she either doesn't hear it or doesn't carry it out correctly. We have gone through the 'Learn My Voice'. Alexa knows us by name but that has little impact on her responsiveness.+ Alexa integration (when it works in a timely manner).+ Amazon Music Unlimited subscription availability.0 Sound quality (average). Echo Series 1 was a better experience all around.- Responsiveness to voice commands (slow more often than should be) Once the devices are power cycled, the responsiveness improves but it doesn't last long.- The ability of the devices to maintain the requested streams or services. (More times than not, the stream or service stops playing at some point after it begins. That or the dreaded, "I am having trouble playing the music" message. This was not an issue with our Echo Series 1 device. We thought the Echo Dot 3 version would be better and allow us to have more coverage in the home. Unfortunately, it has been more frustrations than a good experience.Amazon blames SiriusXM. SiriusXM blames Amazon and we're without access to a rather expensive paid service on either of the Echo Dot 3's. Pandora is a little better but both services stop repeatedly. Wireless availability isn't the issue as smartphones, tablets, and computers remain connected when the Amazon Dots don't.

Title: Does wacky things
Body: I was liking this Dot a lot until it starting flashing a green light for no reason!  I had to unplug it to sleep so I couldn_ use it to play my sleeping music.  I searched and discovered green meant a message or call coming in.  Nope!  There were none.  After asking for messages a few times it finally stopped flashing and went dark.  But, I don_ trust it now.  If it wakes me up in the middle of the night I_ going to throw it out the window!

Title: Alexa is free to download as an app on your device.
Body: This is a fairly mediocre speaker / microphone. It, by itself, is not "smart," it just has the Alexa app on it ... which is free by itself. It also has a really obnoxious, un-intuitive, nonsensical, labyrinthine setup wracked with error messages and snags. For example: You have to plug in the Echo dot, wait for one color ring, then hold the button down for 7 seconds, then wait for another color ring, where it then tells you to download the Alexa app and follow the directions despite that the Alexa app doesn't seem to have instructions. You'd think they would put a big red "FINISH SETUP" button for you, but no. And you can't search because Alexa gives you a Wifi hotspot that disables your internet connection. The Alexa app on Microsoft demands that you log into an email and remember the password, for some reason, then runs through a whole other setup, so I hope you have everything memorized. I somehow stumbled through it the first time. A couple weeks later, a storm hit and knocked out the power and I had to do it all over again and could not figure it out the second time. Because this thing does not have any sort of battery pack. If the ring is the wrong color, you get to hold a specific button for a specific amount of time. You will be required to sign into one or more emails and one or more wifi hotspots. There's a lot of running back and forth between your various programs. Yes, setup is on a timer, too, so you'll feel rushed. And that's how you'll spend a portion of the hours that it takes to set up.However, you can skip all that by simply not buying this device.EDIT: I wrote this review in May of 2019. In November of 2019, it was working fine until one day I went to play with this smart speaker. I said, "Alexa..." She replied, "I'm having trouble connecting to the internet. Take a look at the help section in your Alex app." Uh okay. The help section isn't available via the smart speaker. Nothing is available without a connection to the internet. I can't even adjust the volume. The Alexa app on any other device ... well I can't even find the help section. Settings, yes. Help, no. This issue will not resolve itself, according to a Google search. I have to fix it. I may have to TRY to call a human customer service representative, and I'll definitely have to go through the obnoxious setup again. How about instead, I dump her in the trash!

Title: Great travel buddy!
Body: I am so addicted to Alexa that I take her with me when I travel... I have a few dots and the original echo. I'm currently traveling and on a project for 3 months... I contemplating bringing one of the dots with me but I did not and I regret it .. so I've just ordered another one for my hotel room.  (I have compared both and Google mini honestly has better sound but if you subscribe to Amazon prime and listen to music the Amazon dot is the smarter buy. The Google mini is now at $29 for a mother's day special and so is the echo.) I honestly can't remember what it was like before Alexa...;-)

Title: Be careful if you have pets and they tend to get sick or have accidents.
Body: I have three cats in between cat hair and kitty litter that is tracked around the house I needed to do something. I decided to try to ruoomba. This is brushless so the hair shouldn_ get tangled in the brush like it will in the less expensive models.  I have used it twice,I have 1500 ft.², it_ all tile except one room has a rug under the bed and it has done a fantastic job it actually cleaned better than one of my uprights did. I wish it was a little quieter but it is not bad. I have to run it during the day because if one of the cats gets sick (as they often do) I don_ want the iRobot to track it throughout the house.

Title: Better than I thought
Body: Borrowed one from a friend as I never thought I'd want one. This thing is not only great fun and informational but has multiple practical applications. One of the simple uses that I love is the shopping list, whenever my wife and I think of something all we have to do tell Elexa and its there on my phone, no getting up write it down, and once at the store you just check each item off. Its amazing how quickly she can get answers on almost any subject you ask. Every home should have one.

Title: We love our Dot
Body: We  have had a full size Alexa Echo for almost a year and have really enjoyed "her and have found it very useful.  Our Grandson wanted one for his "man cave."  Rather than moving the one every time he wanted to use it in the basement, we bought the Dot.  It is fantastic.  He mostly uses it to listen to his playlist.  The sound quality is amazing.  It is as good as the full size.  It was very simple and easy to set up and works great.  We highly recommend.

Title: Divice will barely outlast the 90-day warranty
Body: Shortly after the 90-day warranty expired the device began to have sound issues. The speaker basically broke down over the next few months and intermittently is completely impossible to listen to due to the scratchy hissy popping noises from the speaker.Unfortunately since the device is out of warranty I got a shoulder-shrug from support, and they offered a 15% discount on a new device. That sort of offer makes sense if it has been two years of good performance but less than half a year of use out of this thing leaves me disinclined to spend more money on a replacement, discount or no.Google Home Mini's come with a one year warranty against defects like this and with an identical price point and better speaker, I think it's time I made the switch.

Title: She's like a quirky roommate.
Body: I wanted a way to stream music and listen to the radio, but Alexa is so much more.  She tells me I look nice, gives cooking suggestions, and responds to pleasantries.  She sets alarms and reminds me of things I ask her to.  She will also answer whatever query I suddenly have like an encyclopedia or dictionary.  I live alone so it is kind of nice to come home to a friendly voice.  I know that sounds pathetic.It is a little weird how much she listens to.  I wouldn't be sharing passwords and my Social Security number with her.

Title: Broken after 6 months - Warranty only 90 days
Body: I overlooked the fact that this only comes with a 90 day warranty which should really speak volumes as to the quality of product you are getting. It is quite standard to have a 1 year warranty included for pretty much anything technology and google home has that on their product.I am frustrated because I bought 3 of these units for $50 each about 6 months ago and one of them has failed already. Furthermore, when I spent $50 on each of these they went down to $29.99 just weeks later and I was not given an option for a price match. When the product was working, The sound quality was good and overall I enjoyed it but I am very disappointed in the quality of it and how it isn't backed by a real warranty.  I also want to share few things in terms of the device itself which I find to be major problems. The first is Alexa's Spotify integration. The controls are very limited in terms of choosing your playlists and alexa easily gets confused when asking her to play one. Furthermore if you are like me and have a spottily family account it is very annoying to switch between accounts. I thought that alexa would be able to detect my voice and use my profile but that is not that case. You need to tell Alexa to switch to xyz account. Then you need to tell her to play music, then if you are lucky the speaker will show up as an available device from your spotify.  At least now that my echo is broken and won't be eligible for warranty repair I have a great opportunity to get OUT of this amazon ecosystem and buy google home. I know google home has the features I want like better spotify family support & a warranty that isn't a joke.

Title: You Definitely Have to Speak Loud
Body: I Like how you can pair more than 1 speaker to the echo, so if you have 3 echos you can play music out of all of them at once. I also like the option that you can attach your own speaker via Bluetooth or aux. I Don't like how you have to almost scream at her at times for her to hear you. I like how you can name Alexa different names like Echo or Amazon etc... Especially with multiple echos around. I wish that she can do more than just play music or games I wish she was almost like a legit Robot that you can almost have a conversation with except all you hear with her is "I Don't Know that one" or she says something completely different from what you said and you have to keep repeating till she gets it right.For that I give her 4 stars cause the microphone sucks. I also wish it had more sound settings and different voices to choose from.

Title: Subpar Audio
Body: UPDATE: Absolute garbage. While my Echo works great, the Dot now refuses to connect to anything but Amazon Music. No matter what Pandora station I ask it to play, it returns with "Sorry, I am unable to play the music".*************************************************************I bought the Echo Dot (3rd Gen) on sale with an additional discount for being a Prime member. At such a good price, I couldn't pass it up.Alexa itself is great. The fact that I can just walk in and tell it to start playing music or ask for the weather is incredibly convenient. The app is also fairly easy to use. Although, it has had issues connecting to Pandora on several occasions and the thumbs up/thumbs down buttons don't appear to work when streaming Pandora.Initially, I thought the sound quality was decent for such a small device at such a good price. However, as I continued to stream music from Pandora, Spotify, and Amazon Music, I noticed that certain songs would sound really fuzzy, particularly with higher notes. It would almost sound like the speaker was blown no matter if the volume was set to 10% or 40%. The poor sound quality was, and continues to be, a random occurrence that doesn't seem to be something that can be recreated at will. Although, to be fair, I haven't taken the time to write down the songs that it has occurred on and attempted to test those songs.From the research that I've done, it seems that this poor sound quality is common with the Echo Dot (3rd Gen). Forum members have suggested unplugging the device and then plugging it in again. That seems like a very inconvenient solution whilst one is trying to enjoy music.

Title: I love the DOT this is number 2 in house hy. old
Body: Okay.  I first gave this 3rd generation DOT 1 star on a review, and said basically "THis thing Sucks", but here's what happened.  I couldn't set it up, called the help number in the box.  They said I needed to purchase a Cisco firewall for some ungodly reason.  Really made me mad (retired programmer).  Just decided to return it.  Then went to Amazon help and looked for their setup app, turns out the app the tech support for the dot told me to get was the wrong one.  I can't find a way to report this to Amazon, but I will continue to try.  It was hard to find but I found the app Amazon said to use for Alexa and it worked just fine!  It's great but the tech support for the unit, SUCKS!

Title: Great kids gadget!
Body: Wow! I wanted an alarm device for the kids rooms like their iPads (nice music, easy program etc) but didn_ want their iPads in their rooms. I had ordered, and returned, $20 beeping alarm clocks and saw that this was only $10 more so I ordered two and it_ exactly what I was looking for ... and more! Not only can they wake to nice music, it also plays them stories and/or bedtime meditation or nature sounds. This also works as a sound machine on loop all night... sets reminders for homework and will play games with them like _reeze dance and _ids trivia. Honestly, best purchase I_e made in a while. I think I may order one for each room lol.

Title: Excellent Voice Recognition
Body: Surprised me how good voice recognition is.  I asked "her":  "Alexa, what is non-Euclidean Geometry".  She immediately gave a brief, but satisfactory answer.  Sound quality is excellent for her size, but... well, there's only so much you can do with a "dot".  You can add speakers, either blue tooth, or direct, so if it matters, no problem.  Only real problem so far:  my wife is paranoid that "she" is listening all the time.... so she unplugs Alexa when she's not using it.  Not that anyone could ever possibly care what we talk about!  We've only had her for a couple days, but several times I would have liked to ask her stuff when she was unplugged.  amazing price, amazing product.

Title: What's the point
Body: This can't really be used as a stand alone bluetooth speaker. You have to use their specific apps for podcasts (doesn't seem to be friendly with Apple). It syncs with Apple Music, but I don't think it works with your own music via iTunes, just Apple Music. You can sync with Sirius XM but I  listen to on demand and you can't specify shows, just channels. I got it as it was free with the purchase of the Ring System. For me, it's a waste. I don't need to have a speaker to ask what's the weather or to set my alarm.

Title: The sound is so deep I can't understand it, I'm not sure why , but miss 2nd gen
Body: I have already 3 2nd generation dots . I got my phone opened the app thinking I would have to do something , plugged in the 3 rd generation and it did everything, I changed it's name and hit devices checked it in my group and it was playing music in all 4 rooms. UPDATE I HAVE USED IT LONG ENOUGH TO TELL THAT I MISS 2ND GENERATION, THE SOUND HAS WAY WAY TO MUCH BASS EVEN TURNED OFF , I LITERALLY CANT UNDERSTAND WHAT THE DEVICE IS SAYING. ALMOST TO POINT OF USELESS.

Title: The best device ever!
Body: I love the Echo devices.  I work all night and I can listen to my Audible books by a simple voice command, pause when I take a break and resume with a simple command.  I can ask about the weather and get a instant, up to date answer for my location.  These are my favorite features so far.  I have an Echo and 3 Echo dots spread throughout the house.  I also use the Echo for wake up calls, reminders and playing a few games.  It is a little miracle!

Title: Improved over 2nd gen - completely endorse
Body: All in all, it is pretty much the same device.  If you already own a Alexa device, there is no downgrade of Alexa's support.  3rd gen has slightly better voice recognition, but that has more to do with a better mic than it does software.  The asthetics of the device are much more improved and look like a good and appropriate "desk" piece or wall mounted item.  as ti no longer has the "ugly plastic" look and feel.  Granted the drawback of that is no longer being able to use any of the 1st and 2nd gen dot perefials - but as 3rd gen is out for some time, companies will make new ones (but still have the draw back of needing to buy them).The biggest advantage is sound quality.  the speaker for 3rd gen dot is MUCH better and is a lot better "full room" sound in both terms of quality and volume.There was a deal for a while to "turn in" and upgarde to the 3rd gen for a cheaper cost.  I dont' recommend it.  The 2nd gen is still good and has all the same alexa software.  As the only noticible differences are "look" and "sound".  Simply move the 2nd gen to a bedroom, kitchen, laundry room, garage and keep your new 3rd gen in your primary space such as bedroom or living room.  "everywhere" sound is an amazing thing, as is the intercom system.  So more echo devices the better, just pick and choose where you want the better sound.

Title: Short warranty for a reason.
Body: The sound quality of this little speaker isn_ the best, especially at louder volumes where it has a lot of distortion. But, it is a cheaper speaker so that should be expected at that price point. It_ fine for all the basic Alexa functions. However, it only has a 90 day warranty, and ours died at the 5 month mark. So even though I otherwise like this device, it seems a little disposable and I would hope it would either have a longer warranty, or cost a little bit more for a higher quality item.

Title: Worth every dime!!
Body: This is such a wonderful system!!!  We have a big Alexa for the open floor plan of our home.  Then we have an echo dot in each kids bedroom and one in ours.  each person can stream their own music while others are streaming theirs.  It also works as an intercom so if I need one kiddo I can _rop into his echo I_ his room from any other one instead of yelling to him from upstairs.  Also, for example when dinner is ready I can send a message to all units in the house and it does a dinner bell and it_ my voice announcing _inner_ ready! It is a wonderful tool.  Everyone can to the grocery list if we run out of something.  The kids can even play games or tell jokes.

Title: Great for the price!
Body: I bought 3 of these because they were on sale for $80 off the normal price of $150 and because I needed a better way to control the new WiFi multi-color light bulbs I installed threw out the house. They work good, but there is a learning curve for commands and wording things so Alexa can understand what you want. Overall my first experience with Alexa is positive. The Dots themselves are easy to setup. Just install the Alexa app on a tablet or phone and follow the setup instructions. Once you are done you can still use the app, but everything should be voice commands.
