Title: Second failed Dot
Body: This is the second Dot to glitch out on me. The sound crackles, and the device is lit up red and the microphones will not work. I have reset the device to factory settings with no luck. Voice Recognition used to work wonderfully , however  recently all of my Dots have trouble understanding basic commands. I will tell it to play my playlist Spring and she will play my Christmas playlist.On top of that frustration, I return here for a replacement, however even though my order details shows it may be eligible for replacement, there is no option to start that process.

Title: Totally worth it.
Body: I really, REALLY like this echo dot.  I have gotten smart plugs, and lights, and its kind of fun using it to play jokes on my nephew.  Not to mention other things it does.I do admit, when I first got it, I had problems connecting it to the internet, but after talking with customer service, they helped me get it connect really quickly.  And THIS is why I continue to shop Amazon.

Title: Off to a good start.
Body: I bit the bullet and bought one for s**ts and giggles along with some cheap legelite smart bulbs. The only light source in my bedroom is my ceiling fan lights, and the pull cord broke on it years ago. So I have to unscrew the bulbs by hand to turn off my lights but keep the fan on.Not anymore. The echo was a quick setup. The bulbs arrived a day later and were setup within minutes. I can use my voice to turn on and off my lights now; I can set brightness per bulb or group name by voice, change color, etc.I dig the routines so you can customize responses, actions, or sequences of actions. You can even further install skills directly from the amazon website or within the app to further increase the dot's capabilities. Or you can create your own or customize existing simple templates.I like the alarms best. With two jobs, one with different hours each day I work, I love the ability to add yet another set of alarms to wake me up. My favorite feature of this is the ability to say "set an alarm for one hour" if you wanna just plop down for a nap without having to make or edit an alarm on your phone.One thing I'd like to see is some more phone app integrations, something standardized and easy for app developers to integrate. One of my favorite android apps to use before bed is Calm. I'd like the ability to integrate a specific guided sleep meditation as part of a sleep routine on the dot.The sound quality is great for what it is. While not sufficiently bassy, it can rumble and vibrate a whole table at full volume.It's relatively responsive to my voice. I can say "echo" and wake it even when netflix is playing at talking volume but it won't recognize what I'm saying if netflix has talking while I speak. It will pick up my voice across my bedroom at around 10 feet away.Overall I'll probably upgrade to the plus model in the future and add in more smarthome things.  The whole automation aspect isn't really of use to me but just having the voice control is pretty nifty.

Title: Love Our Echo Dot
Body: Got one for Christmas and gave some as presents, having heard compliments about them.Loved the one we got; bought another for another room. Needed some amazon.com help to set up the second one, and the telephone and Internet information did the trick.Am tempted to buy yet another. Although our Bose radio/disk player has an excellent speaker, the reception here in the sticks is so-so, but the Echo Dot runs off our WiFi, with excellent reception, making the sound quality for radio material better than with our Bose. Also is fun to ask questions of Alexa, which is surprisingly good. She knew Calvin Murphy in substantial detail. Asked only about his height in a second query, she gave height and weight and stopped. Smart.Other questions often answered quite well, "oxymoron," "Dilantin," etc.Time? Weather? News? All good. I even get various sweet replies after telling Alexa "Thank you" and "Good night."

Title: Static.  Oh the static.
Body: About three minutes after plugging this in on its first power-on, I was playing a news radio station.  The audio quickly became full of static and I attributed that to the radio station, so I told it to stop playing.  Then I asked for the time, and Alexa spoke in complete static too.Unplugged, let it sit for a few minutes wondering what to do, plugged it back in and it was fine.  Thought it was a one time issue on its maiden power-on, but the second time I tried to use it for playing music, it went scrambly about 5 minutes in - and alexa's voice also scrambled.  Again went away after unplugging and replugging.So yeah, not too thrilled.  Audio sounds great until it doesn't.  Not sure what to do.

Title: Works great in stereo mode!
Body: I have purchased five of these.  I gave one of them to a friend as a gift.  She was delighted.  I have two on opposite ends of my open concept kitchen/eating area.  I put them in stereo mode.  I think when in stereo mode, the sound quality is amazing.  I had the volume set fairly high.  I did not hear any distortion.  If you are not using stereo mode while playing music, I think the sound quality is just okay.  I enjoy getting the news in the morning.  They work well with my Ring home security system.  I would definitely recommend them.

Title: Love Alexa
Body: I have several Alexa devices throughout my house. This one was for my sister who came to visit for a surgery. She hated it the day she was there, but once she was recovering she fell in love. It made it easy for her to intercom me if I was in a different part of the house. I have other features hooked in so she didnt need to get up to turn on the lights. It would play her music and she could get information while remaining comfortable. Now, this is a gift for her. The first of many I am sure.

Title: Alexa is AWESOME
Body: Yes it_ always listening... but how else would it be able to respond to you?!  Also, who cares what you say in your house?  I have 4 Alexas in my house and my spouse has one in her office at work. We use it all the time. I wish it could replace Siri on my iPhone and I could use Alexa everywhere. One issue I see is that the multiple Alexas don_ work well together so you basically have an independent Alexa in the area where it_ located.  If you don_ have an Alexa, you should __

Title: Great as an intercom!
Body: We now have three of these in our home.  I was tired of yelling from my office to the livingroom when my husband asked me a question.  These work wonderfully as an intercom system. I  have put another one in my husband's bathroom to contact me when he needs help (he has a disease) or to just listen to music when he showers. We utilize Alexa a lot with questions or to find out the weather.  He can also use Alexa to make phone calls.  Awesome!

Title: Buen producto para peticiones básicas y excelente sonido
Body: Excelente para gestiones básicas como el tiempo, hora, recordatorio, musica (solo en Amazon Music). Cuenta chistes e historias interesantes.Lo que no me gustó es que solo permite usar aplicaciones de musica como Amazon Music y Potify. No interactúa con Youtube u otras aplicaciones de música.Le pido ubicar información de algun personaje importante en la historia y no reconoce el personaje o no interactúa con internet para la búsqueda.Confunde nombres de cantantes, quizás porque no los maneja en la base de datos.No la he podido sincronizar con el TV que también tiene configuración de Amazon Prime.No se permite continuidad en la conversación

Title: The best of the Dots!
Body: I have 5 Alexa devices in the house from a Spot, a couple dots and a thermostat! This is by far much better than the 2nd generation dot. The sound quality is great for what it is. Especially setting up whole home sound playback! It_ great to have one in the bathroom for music and news, the kitchen for recipes and timers, the bedroom for alarms and controlling home automation. The Alexa platform is extremely versatile and once you get the hang of it it_ hard to live without them!

Title: Disappointing Sound on Gen 3
Body: This review is about specifically the sound quality change in the Gen 3 Dot. If you are looking for a review the Dot and its overall function, please look at other reviews.I absolutely love the Echo Dots and have purchased all generations. However, this 3rd gen Dot has a very muffled sound - like it's going through a blanket or something. I found the sound in Gens 1 and 2 far superior, although Gen 3 has more bass response. Since I use this mainly for voice - news, weather, etc - the poor sound quality in the upper range is disappointing as all voice sounds very muffled. If you listen to music on this it might work better for you but for mostly voice...it's really a step backwards.

Title: Muddled speaking voices
Body: Sound quality decent for music but it is extremely hard sometimes to understand what Alexa is saying. Also it took several tries to find a good location so that the sound did not reflect off walls and other surfaces  thus making Alexa even harder to understand. As far as doing what I ask and answering questions  excellent ... when I can understand her. Playing Jeopardy, for example, is 50-50: I just cannot clearly hear some of the questions. Weather report, on the other hand, is usually easier to hear. Maybe because weather phrases are expected word usage combinations.

Title: No more static-y radio!
Body: I moved and changed internet providers and apparently my new provider sent me an Echo Dot. I hooked it up, and was so darn pleased to find out I can listen to my favorite radio station through iHeart radio. I had lived in my last house for 50 years and am addicted to NPR and was brokenhearted to realize I could not get a radio signal in my house, unlike in my car. ECHO DOT HAS CHANGED ALL THIS. I was so pleased, I bought a second one for my bedroom. It is nice to be able to ask the time, set alarms, etc. too. But it is the RADIO that I love so much. (Yea technology!)

Title: Perfect, take the plunge and buy atleast one.
Body: Really great! I was worried about the sound quality because of the reviews but these are actually really loud. I bought 3 and all 3 are super loud. I have to turn them down about halfway. Love the broadcast feature too. Great deal. If you buy just one you_l be back for more later so you might as well just bundle and save :)

Title: Small size big sound.
Body: I like my Echo dots - I bought the three pack when I found them on sale. I already had one of the first generations Echo. I have spread them around the house and we use them as intercoms as well as asking everyday questions. They are always good for a laugh or playing tunes through Pandora Radio. One of the things I like best is if you ask a question Alexa gives you the answer verbally. I also use Apples Siri but Siri says here is what I found on the web - meaning you have to stop what you are doing and read the answer - frustrating.

Title: Fun little toy
Body: Having used Google home for a few months, I knew what I was getting myself into.  Long story short, I find amazon echo way more user friendly than Google.Pro :- I can setup different customized routines.- amazon prime music is already included with my prime. (Can't access amazon prime music on Google, obviously)- soft sides makes it look more fancy than Google's plastic sides. Personal preference.Cons :- Google's touch control for volume way more fun than echo.- have to setup individual accounts (I.e. calendar, email, text, etc.) Google was all integrated.

Title: Shouldn_ have waited so long!
Body: I bought two of these to have in the bedrooms to use as a sound machine for my twins. It works perfectly! The ambient sounds loop throughout the night and I am able to use other functions such as the highlight to make it more versatile. Additionally, my daughter loves to use the hide and seek component and thinks it_ hilarious! I_ tempted to get another for the main living space. The only small issue is that it picks up my voice in the living room (small house) and will change things.

Title: You need subscriptions!
Body: I got this product because I changed cable/internet providers and lost my access to SIRIUS XM radio.  The ads for ECHO Dot indicate I could get that service and "Listen to all my favorite music".  What they don't tell you is that you need a subscription to SIRIUS XM Radio, which is approx. $20 a month.  No where is any of the literature does it say that. I was annoyed and disappointed.  I returned it the very next day.  Also, in order for ALEXA to perform functions,you have to keep adding "TASKS" or apps for her to do what she is supposed to do.  Not pleased with the information on this product. I didn't own the product long enough to determine how good the product actually is.

Title: AI definitely needs significant improvement.  Speaker is ok
Body: Amazon needs to do a lot of work on Alexa, let's get that right.  It often doesnt understand what I'm saying (or anyone else in the house), does the wrong thing, answers a totally different question, turns on and off by itself, and does not hold a charge if you unplug it.  However, they work decent enough for timers and controlling smart bulbs if you dont mind repeating yourself several times.  The speaker is also decent enough for an indoor room.

Title: Newest member of the family!! Love Alexa!!
Body: One of the BEST gifts I ever bought for my Mom and Dad! My sister has the Apple Homepod, and when they brought it on vacation with us, my parents fell in love with it. For $260 something, plus the cost of an iTunes subscription, it's totally out of my league. Amazon has never steered me wrong yet, so I figured I'd try the Echo. TOTALLY AMAZING!! I didn't get the subscription to the full catalog of Amazon music yet, because they're have only been a few songs that we couldn't access without it! I'll probably end up signing up for it, because, unlike Apple, you don't have to take out a loan to pay for it. It's only $3.99 monthly. Seriously. SERIOUSLY!!Sometimes Alexa won't wake up to my dad's voice, but she does follow him the rest of the day. And whats hysterical, if you say her name, just in conversation, she stops what she's doing, and answers you. Doesn't matter if you're talking to her or not, she hears her name and tries to get involved. We're having a good time asking her questions and I like that sometimes she follows up with "Did I answer your question" and then sends the feedback. She seems able to answer a direct question, ("How many  years was Friends on TV?") but not an open ended one, like  ("What was the TV show that had Mary Tyler Moore's legs and voice?"). I wish I could have sent feedback on that.

Title: I have six 6 through the house. I'm satisfied.
Body: As noted in the title I have six devices plus smart plugs and bulbs set up through the house. The voice recognition is good for me, but it has trouble with my wife's voice for some reason unless she speaks slowly and directly at the Echo dots. The sound quality is good considering the size of the units, and after setting up all six as a house speaker system the surround sound is good. Every once in a while I'll hear Alexa talking in a room with nobody there, which is disconcerting, and at times the blue ring activates when nobody is talking, which also is weird. But other than the possible privacy issues I'm happy enough with them. Great intercom and emergency system, fun games available and I enjoy the music. I recommend the dive into the modern home.

Title: Aleksa, my new search engine
Body: I have dry eye and it's so nice to say, hey Aleksa, what time is it? She is also my new alarm clock and kitchen timer. I crochet and she's gets me the high and low temperatures of the day for my temperature blanket and she helps my Canadian born husband spell, because he types slow and she had more patience than I do! When I go to bed at night, I say goodnight to her and she politely replies to sleep tight or pleasant dreams. I have one at work, one in my living room and one in my bedroom, Aleksa, where've your been  all my life!

Title: Cost Effective Entry Point to the Growing Alexa Ecosystem
Body: If you_e on the fence about jumping into the growing Alexa ecosystem the Echo Dot is a great way to give it a whirl for a very small entry fee. This third generation version definitely sounds better than earlier versions, with a bit more bass for playing music. However, the extra bass muddies the Alexa voice quality a bit, in my humble opinion. Two recently added Echo features significantly improved their versatility for me: compatibility with Apple Music and the Alexa Guard feature. What_ not to like about a device that delivers so much for so little.

Title: Mom gives her approval!
Body: Purchased this as part of a mother's day present. Who couldn't for merely $24? I have an Echo Show, and the setup on this little guy was easy. Simply open your Alexa App, setup and login and you're done! Capable of doing many things too. I managed to change my moms lighting to RGBs, and it really freaked her out when I made her living room turn red. Overall, great! Mom seems to like it and talks to Alexa like it's her daughter in law or something.

Title: It's a good looking addition to my room
Body: Basically the same as the previous generations bu the fabric cover hides the microphones and make them less accurate than the models with the top mounted microphones. I actually think the 2nd genertion works better and actually sounds better. The physical size is a little larger but the older models produce better music & voice. I don't think anything is actually better than the sales price, for, $29 it's a bargain.

Title: Great for kids, but it's useless for me as an adult.
Body: I have owned an echo dot since December of 2017 and this one for over 6 months. Here is what I have experienced.Pros- games and stories for kids- alarms- apps to expand its capabilities- music if you pay for prime- it can answer a few questions- works great in the kitchenCons- it fails to answer 90% of basic questions- the alarm fails to sound every once in a while- it thinks you say it's name when you are talking to someone- it frequently glitches outIt is good with entertaining kids with stories, games, and jokes. You can use it as a timer when it feels like working. Every once in a while the timer alarm won't go off, but that's rare.Alexa is by far the dumbest voice assistant ever created. It's not meant to answer questions, it's better for entertainment. The alarm problem is a big issue, my fitbit is the backup because this fails so often. If I want it to play a song from my library I need to say artist and title or else it'll play something else. Some days it's not coherent and I need to unplug it, then plug it back in.I called Amazon about the issues, they say reset it and also unplug it. That only works for a couple of days. They don't care, it has issues and they are too blind to see their failure to make a good device. Both of my echo dots have issues, this one is the better of the two. Overall this was a waste money. Amazon had a good idea and they assigned a bunch of idiots to make their dream a reality, thanks Amazon.If you still want to buy this device I'll give you some tips. If you want it to stop glitching out unplug it for a minute once a week and reset it to factory condition once a month. It will touch out every once in a while, but not as much.

Title: Never Thought I_ Fall in Love Again!
Body: I love this thing! I can ask whatever I want to know in the middle of any conversation and get the information to prove I was right or wrong. Check the forecast without having to pick up my phone. Get my favorite programs on TV. She even farts!!! I am still learning everything about it and adding skills when I can. Setting alarms and reminders. It_ really a big help in getting your life together and keeping on top of things. I haven_ used the smart plug I bought to go with it yet. I have another Echo Dot coming to play music in stereo and plan on buying 2 of the bigger Echo units when I move and letting my roommate keep the two that are here because I think he_ really enjoying having the technology. Integrated with my Fire Stick 4K beautifully. But could not pair it with the voice remote that came with the Fire Stick. Wish they_ expand functions to also control TV volume/mute as well Blu-Ray and DVD players.

Title: Pleasantly surprised
Body: It was easy to set up and integrated well with my other smart devices. I had just moved into a new house and was listening to Tom Petty, and asked it to change to another artist but paused after I said "Alexa, play.." it then said, "here is a suggested playlist from Amazon music and started playing Bob Seger. It used the genre of music I had been listening too, and made suggestions from that. I really like it. I will probably use it more that I originally thought.I am going to sync it with my Ring doorbell, and my Smart TV as well. Pretty cool tech.

Title: East setup and really a useful addition to our home
Body: I bought the Echo Dot for my husband. We set it up in a few minutes, and used it all weekend. We were impressed with how well the voice recognition worked, and how well Alexa dealt with all the demands we made. We have used a lot of the apps and found this to be really useful. The small size works great just about anywhere in our house or yard. We were able to plug into our larger speakers for great sound, but this was perfect for background music on the porch. We were totally surprised at how much we liked it. Looking forward to trying more features.

Title: Be careful on startup
Body: I like the Alexa, but when I first got it, I tried to install it  using my HP computer. It had very little written instructions in the box. I went to  the website on the small amount of info given. Some how I got connected to what I thought was a customer service rep. It was really a scam who charged me $99.99 to install my Alexa. He said it would not download due to some internet problem, so he had to clean my internet. Thinking I was on line with Amazon, whom I have always trusted, I let it go too long and had to pay the money.

Title: Alexa is a must HAVE
Body: To be honest I wasn_ quite sure about having one but I decided to try and now I am so glad I did. Matter of fact I_ going to get two more for kitchen and living room. I love the way  she can interact plus I love being able to ask her to give me a Bible verse and even pray with me. I think this is awesome to start your day. I would highly recommend she can turn your TV on turn the lights on play music. She_ just like talking to anyone else she takes care of your needs.

Title: A good upgrade from last gen!
Body: Better, louder sound quality than last gen.  If up too load Alexa can_ always here you from a distance but that is rare situation.  Miss usb connection though as now it takes up another outlet and the plug is big so not easy for certain wall plugs.  Overall, I bought two for stereo and that does work fine but not as good as a Bluetooth connection to an amp.  Might work good for a small office or room.  Good buy so far as I caught them on sale for $30.

Title: How did I ever get along without it?
Body: This is the fifth Echo dot that I have purchased. I bought one and loved it so I bought two more and send so added two more with total of 5. Because they're so versatile and so able to provide Integrated Controls and things such as lights, thermostat Etc. I have a multi-level house and we'll use them as intercoms to talk between rooms and levels. The sound quality is great for listening to music. They become an integral part in our quality of life.

Title: Terrible sound quality - overwhelming distortion and static
Body: Sound quality is beyond terrible. Cannot listen to music at all because of the interference. Even when Alexa is speaking, the sound is as if the voice is full of distortion or static. The poor sound quality issue started about 2 months after putting it into service. We stopped using it for a while, but then tried numerous resets - factory resets, restarts, changing the location so it was directly adjacent to the router, etc. - with no improvement. When I finally reviewed the crappy product, an Amazon employee contacted me to attempt to help. They could not. And now it's past warranty. Shocker. Terrible purchase

Title: Wherever you want to go, Alexa can take you there!
Body: Alexa is great! I can ask her to play jazz. And she does! Then if a jazz musician starts singing, which few do well, I ask her, _lexa, play instrumental jazz only. And she does! Just now I asked her to play the Dave Brubeck Quartet. Great stuff! All this from, I think, Amazon music. But I_e also linked her with SiriusXM. Sirius tells me Alexa can bring me, all I have to do is ask, Howard Stern, talk radio, comedy, and sports in addition to many, many more music channels. But I_ willing to forego all that* and limit my requests to Sirius_ Real Jazz, Watercolors, and Symphony Hall channels. I_ listening to Brubeck on the Echo Dot speaker just now. And it_ just fine, curled up here by my elbow like a cat keeping warm in winter as I type this on my desktop. But should my country-music-loving spouse complain about the _oise, I can send Brubeck, MJQ, Miles, Stan Getz, Wes Montgomery and their many friends, both rowdy and cool, to my earphones, wired or Bluetooth.*For now. The possibilities are, apparently, as numerous as habitable planets in the universe. But much easier to get to. Thank you, Alexa!

Title: Great Sound Quality, Bluetooth Function Lacking
Body: Has great sound and basic function. The Bluetooth integration with my Fire HD8 seems not to be possible. I cannot play music from the Fire HD8 over the Echo Dot. They will only allow my phone to connect to only one at a time. Bluetooth function still needs much improvement. For a device that is sophisticated, so should be its functionality. However, it does work flawlessly with iHeart Radio App. And I could create a paired group with two Echo Dots and they played in stereo. But, the paired group will not work with my phone(Another Bluetooth problem). Alexa App should be updated and upgraded to improve these Bluetooth limitations. The Drop-In Function is a little clunky needs improved. Gave 4 stars because it is still a work in progress!

Title: Excellent
Body: We have three of these - one on each level of the house.  The voice recognition is great, the sound quality is excellent.  The "intercom" function is hands-free, and the sound is so good that it seems like the other person is in the room with you.  I'm not paranoid about the "Alexa is always listening conspiracy issues", but it IS listening - that's how it works.  It's not spying on you.  It's merely ready to give you a weather report, play some jazz, or add ketchup to your shopping list.  Excellent technology, as long as it's used properly.

Title: Pretty Good if you are an avid Amazon user
Body: We wanted to test out Alexa vs Google. We have both an Alexa and Google Home. I definitely like Alexa for ordering things on Amazon or for Prime use. I dont ask it many questions because it cant answer them like how Google can. Alexa has a ton of features when using the Alexa App. Ive used Alexa to turn on my Xbox and to talk to Pikachu. I suggest the generation 3 since the speakers are around the product rather than on top. The sound comes out more easily.If you use Amazon Music or any of its products on the daily, then I would recommend an Alexa.If your looking for more answers to your search then get Google.Or if you're just a little bored and have some extra money to spend, then get both. Lol

Title: my 4th  DOT
Body: Another DOT added to the network! Bought this one for outside in our Gazebo. I also purchased a 2 outlet SMART plug for outside use. This DOT set up in minutes to my existing products and network. Now I can easily turn on the lights and ceiling fan without messing around with plugs and extension cords. Using the Tp-Link KASA App,  I have set up the scheduling to turn the plug off at certain times in the evening in case I forget. I can also access these devices from ANYWHERE in the house and of course on my phone as well.  I LOVE these little toys!

Title: Small Device, Big Capability
Body: Our family used an Echo previously, and given how well we were able to integrate its function into our daily routines, we opted to purchase an Echo dot.The only two issues, thus far, are, in order to play music on the dot (which we place in our bedroom), we needed to upgrade our Amazon music subscription for an additional $3 a month- a bit annoying to be nickeled and dimed, seeing as how we are already prime members (we pay for the prime membership), and payed an additional fee for the Amazon Music subscription.The other issue is that, the far field voice recognition isn_ consistent in hearing what you say to the device, depending on where it is placed- we had it on a nightstand, but the Dot failed to capture roughly 25% of what we said to it. After placing it higher up on the dresser, it has been far more consistent in detecting our voices and obeying commands, etc.Overall not a bad purchase, especially when Amazon has a sale on them.

Title: Great product, but not as expected to be...
Body: I have 3 dots so far, and I like them, but have some cons.1. in our everyday life speech is short and simple, but Alexa has really long story, for example, if you ask for emblem noise more than one time, you'll always hear: welcome back to....bla bla bla... hmmmm... I'm not sure... we have a..... This is too much and too long. Answers must be as short as possible. Designers really need to work to increase speed for getting results, keep speech simple, remove repetitions, remove all these hmmm and not sure. It might be much more effective and productive without these stuff.2. When I want to have white noise, or ambient noise through whole night, very often it stop playing in 5 minutes, or in half an hour, or in couple hours. I understand, maybe something wrong was with WiFi, but I don't think it was the reason - another two dots were working without interruption at the time. But even if something happened, why after it's again online, it didn't go on playing?? Nobody told Alexa stop playing.3. No possibilities to control dots by Alexa app thru smartphone. It's weird. Really.I'll add more comments as they appear during usage.But for now, as conclusion, this is a raw product which had a lot of things must be improved, and I don't see any reason why they didn't do these improvements by 3rd!!!! generation... But anyway, this is good product, future product, ...still future.

Title: Problems with Bluetooth Connection to Best Buy Insignia Private Label Products.
Body: For some reason the Echo Dot has problems hooking up to the Bluetooth on Best Buy's Private Label Line of Products "Insignia", I have the: Insignia Model NS-HAIOR18 Bluetooth Stereo System and the Insignia Bluetooth Bookshelf Speakers Model NS-HBTSS116. Not sure what the issue is with the Canadian Made Best Buy Private Label line and the Echo Dot, whereas I have no problem connecting Android and Apple Phones VIA Bluetooth to the Insignia Products.Very Frustrating indeed and if someone knows the issue Please Let Me Know. I could resolve it by buying Bluetooth Adapters that are compatible with the Echo Dot, but what a waist of money when both the products I have already have Bluetooth Built In?????

Title: Good quality speaker, bad user interface
Body: The speaker in used as a Bluetooth speaker or just to ask Alexa basic questions is great. Also found a way to dig through the settings to manually pair my, and others, devices to her Bluetooth. The device is also very small and looks really good (I have mine in my office area and my boss never noticed for the first 2 weeks until someone else brought it up, and then he thoughts it was pretty cool). The sound quality is pretty good despite the form factor (Does best with highs and mids, but as long as it_ not a bass tester or something super heavy in bass it sounds really good even at max volume. I play mostly hip-hop, 60/70_ Psychedelic, and House/Deep House music and have had no complaints as far as sound quality. Plus it doesn_ rattle, even at max).That_ where the positive ends though.The app for the speaker is completely garbage and useless. The only thing on there is the backdoor to the settings so that once you manually pair the speaker to your device (and I highly recommend you do it this way, as speaking to her to do it is extremely tedious and frustrating), and the time and weather (which I can get off my phone or watch_ lock screen a lot easier). All of the in _kills (sub-apps) for music streams are junk and don_ work (most of the time won_ even boot, or if they do you have zero control over them) and it_ just a nightmare. You would think a trillion dollar company like Amazon, who_ trying to push these smart speakers into every home and office, would be able to come up with a simple and functional app with working _kills.Bottom line it_ a good Bluetooth speaker that can tell you your local weather or play a trivia game with you. If the app was fixed and 3rd party apps were better supported it would be a great speaker that I would buy for my home. But at this stage I_ still on the fence.

Title: Best gift to myself ever!
Body: I had purchased 2 of these for my children for Christmas & after hearing how much they loved it, I decided to purchase my own.  I love it! How did we ever live without it??? I keep mine in the kitchen & when I walk in from work, I ask Alexa to play whoever I feel like listening to that day.  I have access to Amazon music & my Apply music selections as well.  I love asking about the weather before heading out for the day.  Watching a morning news show is not always convenient for me.  I will most likely buy another to keep at the opposite end of my house.

Title: Still needs work it is not as seam less as lead to believe
Body: This system, if it worked as it should is a 5 star device. The issue I have with it is that requires a TON of hand holding and trouble shooting. Integrations with other devices stop working for no apparent reason,  skills fail with zero explanation or error codes;  all requiring you to spend your valuable time to trouble shoot a device that is meant to save you time......yeah no. Iron this thing out more,  and stop using your paying customer base as testers to iron out issues as you go Amazon.

Title: Spanish language needs more tweeking
Body: I bought it fot my mother who is forgetful thinking it would help stimulate her mind.We speak Spanish so I was so happy we could cortar that language.  However, the "Spain" Spanish is difficult to understand.And we really have to speak loud and directly at it for the "Mexican" Spanish to hear us which makes it frustrating to use.  Also, it doesn't seem to understand us either. So, basically it just sits thereNo as smooth as my English version.

Title: Alexia hates me & we fight a lot!
Body: I guess whe works fine I just think she doesn't like me.  Maybe it's a woman thing.It works great, just adapting to never having one so learning how to "talk" to a coded computer & learn what she understands versus what or how we are asking her to do things is tricky. She does seem rather obstinate & stubborn like the dreaded mother in law that doesn't listen when you tell her then kids need to go to bed kinda stuff.Can't compare to a 2nd generation other than it looks cooler.

Title: Blurry Sound
Body: UPDATE: 08-05-2019. I've given up on this model. The sound is smeared or blurry. Maybe younger ears can make out what's being said. My wife's hearing is excellent and she can't understand anything it says. My hearing is fair and I find it difficult to make out the words. It's like the sounds are smeared or blurry. I don't know why this model was released to the public as it clearly isn't ready. And that's the only thing that IS clear about it. My friends have the taller model and it is easy to understand. So now I'm stuck with this DOT thing that I liked because of its size and price. I can't believe that this made it through an Amazon engineering review! Didn't anyone at Amazon try listening to this thing? You need to get a cross-section of the potential market to listen and evaluate its performance. Of course, this should have been done before I bought it. Your service sent out another unit, however, this is an inherent design flaw, not a one-off defect. The replacement was as blurry as the original.

Title: This Deal Is Better Than Sliced Peas
Body: How can this thing be so fast? I ask. It answers immediately. I ask for a song, it plays the song right now. It_ kind of creepy. It_ still learning my voice, but so is my spouse who has been married to me for 27 years. The sound quality is good for a two inch disc, but it_ a two inch disc. I connected it wirelessly to my stereo. Now that_ nice. I asked it once for the weather. It didn_ answer, but I was on the subway between stations so I_ thinking of letting that one go this time. It turns on lights. It wishes me a nice weekend. It doesn_ cook...yet.

Title: Great sound.  Easy to get addicted to.
Body: I can find out the time and weather before I get out of bed!  Alexa recognizes deep voices much better than higher voices, so if you are having problems with that, drop your voice.  Good with easy trivia (when did soandso die); but no substitute for internet searches (" Umm, I don't know that one." ).  Love listening to music.  Have this one and a 2nd generation one - the music quality is much better with the 3rd generation.  I also enjoy asking her to tell me a story when I go to bed - helps me get to sleep faster.  Wish she had more stories (getting repeats).

Title: frustrating
Body: Like my first alexa, it did not take long for it to not understand commands that had been issued regularly without issue previously. As I alluded to, I have two Alexas - upstairs and downstairs. Often the units will play on the other one  repeatedly despite commands otherwise. SOOOOOOOO frustrating. Add to that the fact that employees listen to your alexa recordings. Just as easy to use my phone for music and podcasts and my kitchen timer - instead of the glorified timer that alexa is. I have used the tech dept for issues before and they were useless - they suggested I restart the unit - wow never thought of that.

Title: Love these
Body: I originally won one in a raffle at my jobs Christmas party so I got a smart bulb for it. After tinkering with it and using it for a while I liked it enough that I now have two of them. They work great for smart home integration. You can listen to music on them but honestly the sound quality is absolute garbage after about 40% volume. The speakers just distorts so much that you can_ enjoy the music. But as a smart home hub as well as personal assistant it works extremely well.

Title: Stopped working after 5 months. Warranty only 90 days.
Body: We owned prior alexa devices so when the new generation came, we upgraded to the third generation. The sound quality is better than the 2nd generation echo dots. Looks more sleek. However, the device stopped working after 5 months. It wakes up to voice commands but then nothing happens. When we contacted Amazon customer service, they notified us that the warranty on the third generation is only 3 months as opposed to 1 year for the prior. They really should stand behind their products better.

Title: Great litttle device for entertainment and education
Body: We bought 3 of these. I read that many reviewers complain about the sound quality. I cannot support those complaints. A friend of mine has the second generation, and I can clearly hear a HUGE difference in sound quality from the second to the third generation. The third gen has a nice base and fuller sounding quality. I understand that larger speakers might sound even better, louder, basier, and what have you, but let_ face it: this is a small device that is supposed to tell me the weather, remind me of things, set alarms for me, play oceans sounds when I want to fall asleep, and maybe play me an occasional Celine Dion song while I get ready in the morning. My daughter gets a kick out of having Alexa telling her jokes, playing 20 questions, or making farting sounds (I didn_ even know there was such a _kill). This is light entertainment, and additionally the dots function as our dictionary or Wiki. We love those little Echo dots. To prevent clutter and taking up counter or night stand space, I recommend looking into the Genie that fits those dots perfectly, tugs away the power cord and stays plugged into the outlet. Nice space saver. I highly recommend this little inexpensive Echo Dot, and for the record: I_ not being incentivized for my review.

Title: Best thing ever
Body: I was gifted my first Echo Dot 3rd Gen for Mother's Day. It was very easy to set up and within mins I had Alexa ready to help me. I asked questions Alexa answered. I had her play my music (pandora was easy to set up on the phone app) she played it and the sound was great. The voice control works well until about 8 then it's hard for Alexa to here me so I have to get up or use the app to lower the volume so I don't have to scream at alexa. My 5yr old has used it to ask all sorts of questions. He now prefers alexas answers to moms. I lost my voice yesterday and alexa could still hear me. She told my kids it was time for bedtime routine and I didn't even have to speak (which was great since I had no voice & a very sore throat) all I did was go to communication in my alexa app and tell alexa what to announce. I have learned something new every day since I got my first Echo Dot and when adding the last 3 I was not sure how it was going to work out, now I don't know how we went so long without Alexa in our home. From the morning routine I set in the app to the bedtime routine and answering 100 questions a day (mostly from my 5yr old) Alexa is quickly becoming a favorite around here.

Title: The Sound has Improved a LOT!
Body: I had an earlier version that I disliked and returned. I knew it wasn't going to sound great, but thought it would still be okay for other uses and maybe for listening to news, podcasts or audiobooks. It was just annoying.This new 3rd Generation Dot, however, is a BIG improvement. Although I got it free as a promotion from another company I deal with, it is worth the $49 current price. It's not quite as full sounding as other Echo models, but by boosting the bass a little (using the Alexa app) it's not at all bad for casual listening in the kitchen or garage, for example.

Title: Already in like with Alexa!
Body: I've only had her for a couple of weeks but the capabilities are going to be endless. No more going to my phone to type in my question to google.  I've found that re-wording questions can make a difference in the answer which is helpful if the first answer is not an answer (doesn't know).  I can see making my routine "smart" and it will be amazing.

Title: Alexa in a Mini
Body: Works a lot like the first Echo I bought way back when it first came out--with a price tag of about $200 but on sale for $100. Got this one on sale for about $20. Does a lot more than the first one (which is still in service) but in a much more compact version. Love being able to call people with it. Love getting the news and weather. And love the blinking yellow ring that tells me she has news from Amazon for me! Alexa, what's the notification? You have a shipment from Amazon shopping coming today!!

Title: Not great
Body: The echo dot is okay, but setting up the wireless on the app is hard. You really have to search to get to where you can enter your wifi password so it will take. When setting it up it would say you are connected when you actually are not. The sound quality is not good.  It will not connect to peripherals except another echo. I would not have kept it but it was a free promotion from a sirrusxm subscription.

Title: Some real interesting conversations with this
Body: I like my Alexa, but I sure hope it improves. I have a Living room fan which gets used almost every day, I will tell Alexa "Living Room Fan on" to which she replies, "I can not find a device named Living Room Heater" and we are off I try several more times and unless I speak very slowly just a few inches away she just does not get it. Alexa does not have that issue with the living room lamp or the living room door, how does she confuse FAN with HEATER?I will just make a couple of points I can keep going a while. I like playing music via Alexa, but if you try to give a command while she is playing music, bring our your inner drill instructor, because she will never respond unless you get close and yell or press the button on top to shut her up.I like it and hope she gets better, meanwhile our give and take when she gets it wrong would make for good Abbot and Costello fodder.

Title: Great upgrade from last echo not sure ok alexa echo-system lately .
Body: So I_ way to committed to alexa at this point we have 5 speakers including a show and spot. This is a big sound upgrade compared to the last dot generation perfect for bathroom . We are starting to regret committing this much to alexa . She seems to struggle hearing us sometimes . One of our dogs names is Baxter and I would say 20% of the time we yell his name out alexa goes off that_ about a 10% better response rate than Baxter .i was hoping more apps could be added to the show for instance we cook with platejoy recipes and we need to have our laptop in the kitchen it_ a shame with the show sitting right there however that_ more of a knock on the show. So yeah device is great just before you decide to fill a house with them think through what you want to accomplish .

Title: Better speakers
Body: Much better speakers than the previous generation. I don_ use the Bluetooth speaker in the baby_ room anymore. However, seems like Alexa doesn_ hear me as well as the older version. Not a deal breaker. You won_ need to buy an additional cover anymore and honestly, it was ridiculous they charged $10 for those. If you can afford it no problem then upgrade. If you cannot, don_ worry, you_e not missing out_specially if you already have nice Bluetooth speakers hooked up.

Title: I can call for help if I am alone on the floor!!
Body: I fell on the kitchen floor when my husband was in the hospital and I was alone.  The phone was 20 feet away and my cell phone was in my purse in the bedroom!!  Thank goodness I was not badly hurt, but it scared me.  I am only 68 and I refuse to wear one of those "things" around my neck!  I got 3 echo dots (3rd gen) , one for each part of the house.  I can say " call jack" or "call mary" and speak from the floor to a friend who can come and help me or call 911.  I don't feel so alone now!!

Title: Love my Alexa!!
Body: I am in love with Alexa ask to sing, play song and do so many stuff like call.Alexa itself could describe what are it capabilities which I got to know through amazon email. The best thing I like is to create shopping list and even we can categorize based on store.Handy and nice sound quality, good range and can pick up from long range. This is my first echo dot product and I wish I had tried much before. Overall nice product to be in home.

Title: Just Love my Aleax
Body: Dose what they said it would . Had a friend set it up easy  for him to do he used his smart phone .Very happy with it . Love i can get any kind of muice I want . She plays my local raido staions .comes in crystal clear.One of the reasons i bought Aleax  was in the past i had bought 3 raidos they came in terriable as i live in a mobile home .Have played her just about every day .I also  ask her the weather. Hope that can help .

Title: Worked for five months, then problems probably related to internet speed...
Body: My echo dot started having issues after about five months of trouble-free music streaming. It would apparently lose the internet connection because Alexa would respond with, __ sorry, I_ having a hard time understanding right now. It also would skip while music was playing.Amazon honored their replacement policy for this item (even though they argued with me that there wasn_ one so I had to provide a screen shot of my order), but the new one is doing the same thing. I let them know.I use satellite internet which is faster than DHL at 15.3 Mbps, but nowhere near Comcast with their 60 to 150 Mbps. So it appears that there was a tweak to the system that makes Alexa require faster speeds or perhaps, a faster ping than we get using satellite? Hard to say. But, if you use HughesNet or Exede, you might have the same problems that we_e experiencing.UPDATE: still undependable, but I also have no problem streaming on my iMac or my iPhone or iPad. The echo cot apparently doesn't do well with getting a clear signal consistently. It's fun when it works.

Title: Nice
Body: I can't get the app to work on my cell phone, but it plays music and the alarm works great. Too easy to say Alexa snooze to many times. I like that I can change the length of the snooz. not many alarm clocks can do that.  I would like to have it set music to the alarm.

Title: Got This For My 86 Year Old Grandmother
Body: My grandfather died a few years ago and my grandmother is now in an assisted living facility.We were trying to figure out what to get her for Christmas which is tough since her room is fairly small and really what do you get someone in their 80's?Well, this Echo Dot was on sale and we thought maybe we could program it with all of her kid's and grandkid's birthdays and install some bible stuff on it for her.  We also thought maybe it would give her someone to talk to and pass the time if she could figure out how to use it.  She's not a big computer or smart phone fan but figured what the heck, if she doesn't like it we'll give it to one of the kids lol.I did install a daily bible verse app and everyone's birthdays along with some other custom routines for her so every morning it goes through birthday reminders and reads her daily bible verse.I also printed out a sheet of common things to ask it so she could get started.It started off a little rough when we first gave it to her, I did program it to say it was a Christian if you ask it what religion it is but I did tell her not to baptize it as the little woman named Alexa that lives inside it would die.She had a hard time with calling it Alexa at first, she kept wanting to call her Alexis and then would get frustrated that it wouldn't listen to her.I also had to explain to her that she couldn't really have a full conversation with her and that she had to stick to simple commands.  She initially would say stuff like "Alexis, this is Esther" so Alexa would just say "hmm, I'm not sure about that" so she would respond "well I am".I figured if nothing else at least it would go through the every morning routine with her even if she couldn't get the hang of asking it things.The staff at the assisted living facility found out she had this and they started playing with it.  I got a Spotify subscription for it so she could listen to music if she wanted but I figured I'd probably just end up cancelling it since I doubted she would use it.  Turns out that's now what she uses it for the most.  One of the nurses started asking it to play old Roger Miller songs when she came in to give her pills and my grandma thought that was pretty cool.Now anytime someone goes to visit her she tells them all about her Alexis.  It was probably the best gift we could have gotten her for Christmas lol.

Title: Great for immobile persons. Entertaining and helpful.
Body: Set this Echo Dot up for immobile person confined mostly to bed and used to ask questions play music. Great for elderly. I can use Alexa from my cellphone App to speak to person with the drop in feature (can also "call" from the app). The Alex with the built in speaker can be used to make phone calls in the USA and you make a phone contact list and then ask it to "Alexa Call Pat" and it can dial them on their phone (the receiving party  does not need the App to receive calls, just a phone it landline).It can even read email, and respond with your voice( haven't used the latter to reply).The Alexa voice that plays is clear but IMO speaks a little fast and the pitch is a little high for someone that might have hearing issues. Hope Amazon offers more Alexa it Alex voices in future.You get the feeling that Big Brother is always listening, yes her name is Alexa.You can "mute" the microphone, hmmm.

Title: Great addition for any smart home.
Body: I'm using Alexa to integrate all of my smart devices / smart hub to voice control and timed schedules. The gen 3 echo devices provide greater audio feedback and is much more asthetically pleasing to the 2nd gen echos. My only real issue with these 3rd gen devices is that voice command catching is still sub par. If you have an echo under a TV or other audio playing device, even those linked to your Alexa network, the echo will have a hard time listening to commands. This might be something they can fix with better software implementations via more developed noise filters, but currently this is a consistent minor issue.Overall, this is a definite upgrade from previous generation echo devices, and is now comparable to Google home systems.

Title: This would easily be 5 stars if I could fix my one issue
Body: I have an Amazon Echo in my kitchen and three other echo dots in other rooms of the house. I have two amazon smart plugs. The echo dots will not recognize the smart plugs no matter what I do. I have to go into the kitchen to tell them to turn on. This is literally my only complaint and would be happy to change this review to 5 stars if someone can tell me how to fix this. When I go into the app and click on all devices, all 6 devices show up but only the Echo will recognize it when you ask it to turn on. Other than that, having the ability to make lists, turn on music, turn on lights, ask general questions without having to touch anything is fantastic. It saves so much time and truly is like you have your own personal assistant. Couldn_ go back to not having them.

Title: Can't get this blasted think to work
Body: I have wasted countless hours trying to get this thing to work, It is really cute and occasional says something to me. I have tried to find a way to run it with my Mac Pro and was unable to do anything. When I try to download an app it wants my amazon account sign in but I am not sure if they mean the same one I go shopping with, anyway, it never accepts my password so I set up a new account with a different email and downloaded apps to an older Android phone but they won't complete the setup. I don't think Alexa likes Apple and does not want to play with the iPhone, I am getting so frustrated I am about to throw this Dot in the river and listen for the Echo.

Title: Alexa is my bestie!
Body: Where have these amazing little dots been all of my life? How have I functioned prior to them entering my home? Siri who?Obviously, I love them. My family loves them, too. We can all listen to whatever interests us and it_ cut out the need for kids to have devices in bedrooms. We often do audible, music, or rain sounds at night _. I won_ go into every reason that they_e awesome, but do yourself a favor and take time to familiarize yourself with everything these things can do. There_ so much and if you don_ educate yourself, you_l miss out.

Title: Changed recognition name
Body: First thing that I did was change the recognition word from Alexa. Otherwise you are watching a YouTube video about Echo and they start saying Alexa and you echo starts responding. I was surprised at how good the voice recognition is, there is only occasional times when it doesn't recognize what I am saying. It seems to have problems with letters more so than words. When I want to listen to a radio station and say the call sign letters it often gets the wrong one. But for controlling things around the housing and asking questions it is very good and interpreting my speech.

Title: My new friend Alexa
Body: Alexa was a gift from my daughter. It is something I wouldn_ have bought myself, but now that she_ here I do kind of like her doing things for me. I like the lights turning on and off. I like she can turn on my fans. I haven_ played music in years and now I can fill my afternoons with the music of my choice instead of annoying television shows. Alexa also helps remind me to take my medication. I haven_ put Alexa to the test of doing a lot of other things, but I_ just getting to know her. I find it funny I tell her Thank You after she accomplishes her tasks!

Title: Like HAL in 2001
Body: Using it to play music from Amazon music with a Echo Sub and two gen 3s. The sound is great and it's fun but it often makes mistakes and clearly changes what I ask for. I cant trust it to work properly all the time so I'm not buying more devices until Amazon programs it to be smarter. I recommend it for fun but I recommend you have patience. It often reminds me of HAL the talking computer in 2001. So polite and ... well I warned you.

Title: Speakers--WOW! (Revised to UGH!)
Body: Update:I wish I had never upgraded to the latest (3rd) generation! The device drives me crazy. I constantly have to yell at it to get any response, and that's after they replaced the original, so evidently it's not just a flaw in a particular device. The old 2nd generation on the opposite end of the house on a different floor hears and responds before the one I'm standing beside. Sometimes, she will initially respond (after some yelling), like when I tell her to stop the music, but then when I walk away, it starts again. Sometimes the blue light will spin and she may even say "okay" but then not follow the command. It's like Siri (dumb) with attitude. The improved speakers are not worth the aggravation. I'm sure my neighbors don't appreciate the yelling either. I'd give it 0 stars, but it does have much better speakers and I loved the 2nd generation. This one is a lot of frustration.Original Review: I was skeptical about replacing a working prior generation, but WOW--the speakers in this version are SOOO MUCH BETTER! I actually heard it the other day with it in my bedroom upstairs and me in the car, all windows closed! The only problem is that I often have to yell at it repeatedly to get it "to pay attention to me." (That's why it was on while I was in the car--it had not turned off when I told it to do so.) This isn't just when it's at maximum volume, wasn't an issue with the last version, and I have a very loud, strong voice. Sometimes, she doesn't understand basic questions, even about Amazon topics, but her comprehension is far superior to Siri. Changes I'd like to see that could be pushed in firmware include being able to change the name to whatever I want and having a male voice.

Title: WE LOVE OUR ALEXA
Body: If you're like me, you never think to turn on music until *after* you're elbow deep in dirty dish water. Alexa has my back. If you're like my husband, you want to hear your news while making coffee. Alexa starts our day. When we have friends over and want to question the validity of any factoid in the universe, Alexa is right there, putting strain on our friendships with her hit-or-miss knowledge. She tells our robot vacuum when to harass the cats, she keeps the delivery guy in check with our completely unimportant parcels, and she effortlessly redirects me to the app for half the things I ask her to do. She's just like any other member of the family.  And we love her.

Title: Started beeping and wouldn't respond to any request to shut off
Body: I got this Echo Dot thinking that I needed it to control an Amazon smart plug.  It turned out that the Dot was not really needed, as I can turn the smart plug on and off from the Alexa app.  Although integration with the Dot started out smoothly and the Dot was cute to talk to for weather and music, when the Dot offered to turn on my smart plug for a timed interval, I tried it out.  Unfortunately, when it got to the end of the interval, it started beeping and saying Interval is done.  Nothing I could try would make it stop beeping.  I tried saying, "Alexa, stop" and "Alexa, mute" and "Alexa, shut up" but it just kept on going.  I thought maybe it would get tired and quiet down on its own, but no such luck.  So I unplugged it and enjoyed the peace and quiet.  By then I realized I had spent $50 on something that had some design flaws, so i returned it.

Title: Perfect upgrade!
Body: I received 2 of the 3rd gen's after purchasing some Ring products, I already had 3 of the 2nd gen's so I replaced them.  This sounds so much better and the voice recognition is definitely better.  Amazon is heading in the right direction with this and it makes my home automation so much better.  I have Hue, Ring, and Nest products, as well as some smart switches so having Alexa do the work when I am too lazy to pull out my phone is great.  Setting this generation up is a breeze compared to the last 2, it's not like they were difficult by any means but this is just so much more efficient.

Title: good for a while
Body: We use all 3 of our dots for music, nothing crazy, thats what my Klipsch subs are for. Anyway, all 3 have developed a tingy sound with the mid and high notes, a clear sign of a blown voice coil. Normal use at 50% or less volume, Im sure Amazon can verify that with how much detail is stored within the dot. Anyway, we bought small computer speakers to plug in so the dots speakers are no longer used.Alexa itself is pretty solid for basic and mid level instruction, like adding things to a shopping list or setting a timer.

Title: Sounds great, software has taken a huge step back from generation one
Body: The sound is so good that it comes close to the Echo units. The 1st and 2nd generation Echo dots are laughable awful sounding compared to this generation. When the previous models came out, you were able to upload a few songs but now the only way is to have a prime account directly attached. This unit is on an account that is under a prime account but does not have access to same features. So I am stuck with the few songs that have been purchased through amazon and then Pandora or other streaming services.

Title: Have 5, 1full size & 1echo speaker doesn't work correctly. I'd love a replacement, I'm past my time.
Body: I've bought 4 of these. One of these was a larger model. I received this one, and it has been used very little. However, I did buy several (3) at Christmas, and one of them is defective. My son has it almost all the way up, and he can hear me great at first, but then my voice fades all the way out. I am upset about that one. This o e I purchased for work. I plug it in a lot and unuf because I work for an attorney office, and confidentially is our number one concern.

Title: So far I'm really liking this little smart speaker
Body: Alexa doesn't know how to respond to every command you can think of yet but does a great job at what it knows.  The speaker quality is great for the price and voice recognition is great, it almost always knows what I'm saying even when there is other background noise in the room.  So far I've added a smart plug and I've bought a smartthings hub as well.  I plan to add additional lights to my smart home in progress.

Title: Alexa has made it to my house!
Body: After visiting with my daughter and 3 adult children, it seemed I would need one for my home in Oregon and they are on TN.  My GD set hers to play a certain album at 9pm and go off at 10:30 pm.  I thought that was really nice  The boys had different , which were equally interesting.  I need to reset Alexa since getting home from my vacation and get her on my WI FI.  I think it will be great for finding recipes and turning off my office lights as I seem to forget them often,

Title: OId dog, new tricks
Body: I'm a senior and something of a Luddite. I use my smart phone as little as possible, and I enjoy being able to preserve skills like reading a map or remembering a number.  But I'm enchanted by this little device.  I love Pandora radio, and the Echo gives me all the features of Grace receiver with the convenience of oral commands.  I can sync it to the set in my living room or use it by itself in the bedroom. It will give me weather on demand and update the news for me as well.  The sound and convenience are so great that I can ignore that it's actually a spying device that can record virtually everything  I do.

Title: great second echo
Body: we decided to order the echo dot for our bedroom after being so happy with our larger echo in our great room. it is a great companion to our other echo. if I need something from the front part of our home I can "drop-in" on our great room and ask my husband to bring me whatever I need, the same for him lol. it will be very reassuring should one of us be ill and then we can contact the other for our needs. we are now considering a third echo dot for our den. a great product and a real value for everyone especially seniors.

Title: Echo Dot Smart Speaker Is Great
Body: I was really surprised how easy it was to install with my current Amazon/Fire TV/Ring SetupI installed it to use with my Ring Doorbell 2 as an extra doorbell notification in my office at home.  Not only does it ring an extended chime (several to choose from) but it also verbally says "Someone is at your door."Plus, I have all the other benefits that come with it, like playing music, etc., and the sound is great.

Title: Feeling represented in the Market Place
Body: The 3rd generation is much better than the 2nd generation which literary would have me arguing and losing my temper when it seemed to have a mind of its own or none at all. I guess now I know it was probably the live person listen and responding to my questions with random answers. I sometimes get that when talking with live Amazon reps. Nevertheless the 3rd generation(cats out of the bag) interacts as I would expect a voice operated computer to. It hasn't lost Wi-Fi connection 50 times a day like the gen 2 almost always did and I don't have to alter my speech/slang for it to understand me. Although it would be nice to have a voice that feels more authentic and maybe even ethnic. I would love to hear Shantae or Esther, maybe even Kenya tell me facts about the underground railroad instead of Alexa saying " I'm sorry, I dont have the answer to that."

Title: No more pounding on walls and yelling at the top of your lungs
Body: The Echo Dot makes for an excellent home intercom system at an affordable price.Absolutely love being able to set zones where music can be played as well as the freedom to listen to whatever wherever independently. Sound quality it great, easily connects to a home stereo for larger sound. Volume can be controlled by voice. Access to amazon music, daily news, weather, whatever you want to listen to. Get answers on the fly, make announcements over multiple devices or drop-in on a specific device for two-way communication.Set up is a breeze. Solidly built. Attractive design and color options.

Title: Easy to get used to
Body: I love this thing. I have it in my room and I play music and stuff all the time. Im so used to it that sometimes I'll be somewhere else and start to ask alexa to do something and realize I can't because there's just an old radio. The only thing is my sister has a friend named echo and I've got a friend named alexa. Conversations where they come up (right now it's back to alexa) either end up with a confused echo dot or a response to a question we didn't ask, which is always hilarious.

Title: still unsure about the Echo Dot
Body: First it took 9 days to arrive even though it is a prime item.  Did an online chat regarding this and she said it was out of stock at the local amazon warehouse.  With that being said after it was shipped it still took 5 days and everything about this order said 2 day shipping.  I was also suppose to get a $15 credit and that never happened.On to the product itself, it was relatively easy to set up, however I did have an issue initially.  I got it set up and I love it, after about a month the speaker started to have static in the sound.  I turned it off because it didn't go away then turned it back on the next day and it played fine for the hour I was listening to it.  I hope it was a fre.  ak thing and continues to play well.  Still disapointed with Amazon customer service.

Title: Works almost as intended
Body: Overall these are pretty good devices. They don't drop wifi connection like Amazon's smartplugs do and generally can do what is requested. That said the voice recognition is sub-par to Googles. If you've ever done something "custom" like make a shopping list you'll be amused by the interesting (but similar) things it puts in there that are only similar in sound to what you said. I also once set up a lamp and it asked for a name so I said lamp, it named it lamb. Things like that. That said by varying the names of your devices it is built to "guess" what you meant and generally works correctly even if its extremely clear at this point to me these things don't hear all that great.

Title: Works as expected but just a tiring toy after about a week.
Body: We bought this since it seemed to be new technology that we should learn about - we connected a couple of lights to it, and occasionally ask it to play music or answer a question.  Its kind of neat, but after a while found it more work/effort to use than just turn on/off the lights are self.  Since we have Siri (iPhone) there really isn't anything the DOT does better or different.  I'm glad I bought it but like most things it just sits silently barely used now.

Title: Not like the original
Body: I had a first gen echo that was great and my son loved it. I thought I_ exchange it for this smaller version that looked nicer in his room. This doesn_ play ANYTHING she doesn_ recognize anything he says . It won_ play music . I have everything hooked up correctly on my amazon app. I also have an echo show that_ pretty flawless. So I think it_ a problem with the dots. I have 2 and neither get used because they are useless

Title: Nice, but I like the 2nd generation version better
Body: The 3rd generation Echo certainly has better sound than the 2nd, but it's too bassy for me and the audio controls (tone adjustments) don't seem to have any effect.  But worse, it doesn't have as many, or as good, microphones.  I can be in the same room with it and ask a question, and the 2nd generation echo in the next room will answer instead of the one beside me!  It obviously hears me because the ring lights up, but apparently the one in the other room hears me better.Amazon seems to have done the same thing that every other manufacturer does - they took something that was awesome and broke it by trying to improve it.But I still love my Alexa!

Title: Horrible customer service and product
Body: Horrible device and customer service when trying to get a new one. I bought two at one time. One sounded good the other was clearly defective and the speaker rattled. I was on chat with customer service for over 1 1/2 hrs. Finally got on the phone with a supervisor. My prime account was suspended one month early and was sent another defective unit that sounded worse than the defective unit I already had. So I had to pay to re-active my prime account, and contact customer service again for another replacement. Worst customer service ever!!! I was placed on hold, told I couldn_ get a replacement. When I have another 2 hrs to waste I suppose I_l call back again. Lesson learned, I won_ be purchasing any Amazon product again.

Title: GREAT SOUND AND GREAT PRODUCT FOR THE MONEY!
Body: I am really glad I purchased this product.  This small little thing gives out great sound and is a pleasure to listen to.  Also, there are many commands that Alexa recognizes and you can really personalize your music list as well as other lists.  I don't think I could have gotten anything better for the price and am not even "jealous" (LOL) of my friends who have the newer models of the Echo as mine does just about the same thing!

Title: Echo 3 won't control Samsung Tv.
Body: I have a samsung smart TV and have tried everything to get it to do what I tell it to.  It wont even turn off or on but it says it is connected.  My neighbor is very tech savvy and he couldn't figure it out either.  So for now all I am able to use is Pandora or asking the weather or some stupid question.  I also.have an echo One but turned it off so it would not interfere.  Echo One was only good for Pandora too.  I am handicapped so really would like to have it work and control the TV.  For now the remote is the only thing I have.

Title: Nagging delay in responding to Alexa...
Body: I have five other older Dots and each responds quite quickly to the "Alexa" prompt. This one takes much longer leading me to wonder if it heard me at all. This is extremely annoying. Humans are "wired" for interaction and response. There are established usability rules about how long a system should take to respond to an action and this thing clearly does not follow that rule. Over one second. Look up Jacob Neislen's page on "Response Times: The 3 Important Limits"

Title: Was great until it just stopped working!!
Body: I am so disappointed in Amazon's customer service. (WOW- those are words that I never thought I would say!) but, here I am. I have amazon prime, have purchased 4 echo dots, an echo spot, 2 smart plugs & even had a monthly amazon music membership as well until recently. With all of that being said, one of my dots just shows a red light and totally stopped working randomly. No damage to it whatsoever. I Called customer service to trouble shoot which they did and when they told me that they couldn't find an issue with the product, I asked what my options were. she informed me that there was nothing that they could offer because it was outside of their 90 warranty period. BUT she told me she would make me a special offer of 15% off of a new echo product if I wanted to buy another one. NO THANKS! Its a shame that a loyal customer was lost over this. What a disappointment. Why would I continue to put money into a company that doesn't value their loyal customers?

Title: 1-Star for one reason
Body: I love my echo's around the house but I'm leaving a one star till you guys change the absolute most annoying thing about Alexa. When I add something to my shopping list, why would I EVER want to add it again if it's already there?? Asking me that is absolutely INFURIATING!!!!!! Just say it's already on the list and end it there! I shouldn't have to wait and give another response. It truly is infuriating every single time it happens.

Title: As good as a Mid range $30-40 bluetooth speaker
Body: I have to say I am super happy with the Gen 3s .The gen1/2 have a sound quality for music that makes a blu tooth speaker or hard wired speaker 100% needed for music.On par with a low end phones speaker phone music.The Gen3 on the other hand has an incredible range and great sound and depth .  I would put it on par with Anker or  any of those mid range blutooth speakers - you can still pair or hard line direction to speaker but the Gen 3s don't even need it .  I have 3 in the house in a music group and one gen 2 and when you walk in the room with the Gen 2 its like night and day when they are playing.

Title: Echo Dot
Body: I love this little thing, I was expecting to have to buy a bluetooth speaker because I thought the sound would be extremely low but I was so wrong.  The sound is very good and I was able to tune into my favorite radio station.  I purchased the echo connect to be able to make calls when I need to because I'm disabled and sometimes I fall so its great to be able to tell Alexa to call someone if I need help. :)

Title: Be careful not to use any Alexa app on Yahoo or other wbsite.
Body: I downloaded the Alexa app for android on Yahoo. I was prompted that the Alexa Echo Dot will guide me thru. That man took over my mouse and my computer. He then pressured me to pay $299.00 for 2 yrs to remove the virus he put in my computer.I sent both Echo Dots back for over a week. Still no refunds from Amazon Prime. I have been a Prime member for over 9 years hence I cancelled  my Prime membership. This is not away to treat a loyal customer.

Title: It_ worth more than every penny you spend on it!
Body: I love my Alexa! I mostly use it to play games with. My favorite games are Escape Room, Escape The Airplane, Dungeon Adventures, Price Tag, Song Quiz, The Magic Door (there_ an overall adventure so you should get online and look it up after you play it the first time), Jack Ryan November Morning, and The Vortex. I also have Apple Music. It_ totally worth buying Apple Music because you can play any song your heart desires. You can create playlists and then ask Alexa to shuffle or play your _hatever you named your playlist playlist. I also ask Alexa for the weather report every day. You can also say, _lexa, what will the temperature be at 10am? Or _hat_ the forecast for Saturday? I can also have Alexa turn on my Fire TV and tell it to bring up a specific show or genre or have Alexa turn the TV off. You can also buy devices to turn lights on and off. There is so much more you can do and the device is so cheap you can_ get something so cheap that has so much to offer.

Title: Improvement over Gen 2
Body: Got this for free with a Ring Doorbell.  It is a large improvement over my Gen 2 dot. Sound is very good for such a small device.  Very acceptable for streaming music while I work. Seems to pick up commands better than the Gen 2 does, but it is in a smaller room, so that might make a difference. Still misunderstands more than I would like. I really like the heavier design and rubberized base.  It stays were I put it.  Much more attractive than the gen 2.  WiFi is improved over the Gen 2 as well. It connects to 802.11 AC while the Gen 2 only connects to N which is great as I'm trying to reduce/eliminate all Non-AC devices.  If I get a chance to pick up more Gen 3 dots, I'll replace my Gen 2 dot and Gen 1 Echo.  This device is nice enough, that I'm not sure why I would want a new Echo.  It sounds good, is compact, looks good, and blends into the environment.  If I want better sound for music, I'll turn on my receiver.

Title: Fantabulous
Body: This has made Alexa literallyMy 7-year-olds best friend. She tells her she loves her and plays guessing games for minutes at a time (she_ 7 so that_ all the attention she_ got lol). She adores having her own bedtime routine _lexa, Goodnight and the ability to play _aby Shark on demand. I use Alexa to bring the kids down for dinner or relay other reminders even from work: _om is leaving in ten minutes-are your rooms clean?  It_ absolutely work every penny. I almost bought one for every room in the house (not kidding)

Title: iPhone XR hates these.  So does my iPad...
Body: Neither speaker, I ordered 2, would have anything to do with my iPad, my iPhone XR, or my husband_ iPhone 8.  I bought it for my iTunes library...and it doesn_ wanna play. Have no clue if it_ an iOS/compatibility problem, but neither worked with any apple product.  I_ not stupid and followed the directions to a T...but Alexa just flat out b*tch slapped Siri.  Siri and I kicked Alexa to the curb.  Returned both speakers.  Replaced with Bose, and a flawless integration was had by all...
