Title: Useless hockey puck, won_ connect to WiFi, error 6:1:101:8:2
Body: Echo Dot 3rd Generation error 6:1:101:8:2. Suddenly stopped being able to connect to WiFi after months with no issues, no matter how many times I_e tried to reset with action button, and unplugging. Had worked in the past with the TLink Deco M5 mesh network. No hidden networks involved. No support found anywhere online. Put through a runaround when searching for help. Can_ even find a help section that would allow me to contact assistance for this device. Basically have a big hockey puck now.

Title: Great Device, you can't go wrong!
Body: To start with, I have had conversations with my wife about this technology and thought "why would we ever have a need for this thing" ... So I never bought one. Then we really wanted a Ring door bell and the first echo dot was bundled with... Needless to say, we now have three dots and found them so intuitive and fun I can't imagine how we got along without them. Truly amazing. I am contemplating getting the show 5 next to replace my alarm clock! There are so many more "skills" Alexa can do than we task her with but it's awesome... Yes these are exciting times we live in if you stop and think about it...

Title: UPDATED
Body: UPDATE:Added two stars because I decided to CALL Amazon Customer Service. After talking to a live person, doing the same tests with them that the representative on the instant chat told me to do, they decided to send a replacement. So far no issues with the replacement. Still leaving off two stars for the horrible customer service experience with the instant chat.Original Review:Have to give 1 star because it worked for about two weeks. Then one day, my WiFi went out. My internet provider fixed the WiFi, and now the device won_ reconnect to my network. I have tried everything - unplugging it, hard reset, forgetting my network, deregistering it from my account, and talking to customer service. I_ actually writing this review as I am waiting for the customer service rep to respond to my _nstant chat message (it_ been over 10 minutes now). Customer service has been about as useless as this device is without WiFi.

Title: Loving having Alexa in my home!
Body: It is lovely to have her put on my playlists from Spotify and Pandora as well as seeking out certain artists when I'm in a mood for something else. I love having a Smart Plug and will get more of them now that I see how easy the integration was. The integration with my Roku, however, has not been as simple. The app shows it's enabled but Alexa doesn't recognize it yet. I'm still working on that. Alexa makes me laugh sometimes with her funny responses. I'm just now learning some specific phrase for her and I bet it will be even more fun soon.

Title: I love my Echo Dot
Body: I like being able to accomplish tasks with voice commands. My first Echo Dot was a freebie from my SiriusXm renewal.  I quickly discovered that having just one Alexa wasn_ enough. I also realized that moving one Echo Dot from room to room was quite efficient and most annoying. Within two weeks I have subsequently purchased four additional units so that I have one in each of the rooms that I frequent. There_ one in the kitchen, my office, my exercise room, my bedroom, and the basement.  I have purchased a smart plug and a smart bulb and plan to add more accessories to my Echo Dot units. I am particularly fond of the one in my bedroom which turns on the light and the radio in the morning when I say good morning Alexa. Because I am a sci-fi buff I grew up on Star Trek, and being able to talk to the computer and perform various tasks is something that I always thought was way cool. I love my Echo dots and I_ having a ball using them.

Title: I've gone through 2 in 6 months
Body: I know it wasn't expensive but GEEZ! Initially purchased in January 2019. Worked great until April then would not connect to network. I was sent a replacement. That too worked great until Mid may when it too stopped working on the internet. I got the first replacement for free but they back date the warranty on it to the original purchase so I was screwed for another replacement.The Amazon rep did what he could. Gave me 20% off and I purchased the Plus instead. I have already 1 Plus since March. We see how long they last.

Title: Room for improvement
Body: I was about to buy two more but during use i realise that the.voice recognition is not that great you tell her one thing it does the other , and if you set the volume to higher than 8. Then it is unable to hear you so you_l have to either shout or press the botton for it to hear you.Sound is great mainly i use it as an alarm and some ambient music that_ it otherwise not that great

Title: Makes life easier
Body: I'm really enjoying my Echo Dot Smart Speaker with Alexa. I am truly amazed at what all you can do with this device. The first night I hooked it up, I was able to get her to recognize my voice out of a group of people. Now I only bought myself one, but if you buy multiples, you are supposed to be able to link them and you can use them sort of like an intercom system to talk to people in another room. You can also do things like have her to make a shopping list, look things up online, play playlists or the thing that really blew my mind....play games!! Yes she will play games with you! You can choose from kids games, adult games, family games, single player, multiplayer, game show games... the list goes on and on! This entertained my older kids for the longest! I even tried it out myself and had a blast. There are still so many things I have yet to try, but I'm already impressed. Now, a few things I wasn't so impressed with is the fact that its not rechargeable. You can unplug it and take to another room with you. Also, there are things you try to ask Alexa to look up, and you have to ask several different ways before she knows how to get an answer for you. Then, there are times you have to get pretty close and loud for her to hear you, but other times, not so much. Those are really the only things I have complaints about. I would still buy this again in a heartbeat. As a matter of fact, I bought two extras to give as gifts.

Title: Better than I expected...
Body: I was able to pick up the echo dot at a great price, because my wife subscribes to Amazon Music Unlimited. I got it at basically half price so I picked up multiple dots initially to use as intercoms for my teen kids since they are usually locked in their bedrooms usually deep into some video game.  I don_ know why I hesitated so long. The sound quality is great especially for such a small device whether steaming Amazon music or connected by Bluetooth to my iPhone. And I was easily able to integrate all the other smart devices (WiFi enabled led bulbs, smart switches, etc) in my home to one activation source (in reality to multiple activation sources). I_e created some simple _outines like announcing it_ time to wake up and play the current weather report to specific devices or telling my the traffic situation to work. It_ just amazing the things you can do with this device.

Title: very nice except when playing mostly unable to hear your voice
Body: We all love Alexa, we use it mostly to control external devices and for that it works very well.Sometimes my kid and wife use it to stream music and we found out that even with not very loud music playing Alexa has some problems hearing your voice when you first call it to interact, most of the times you need to go really close to make it hear your voice before it turns the music down in response of your call.I don't know if there is a technical way to overcome the issue, if not maybe having speaker and voice recognition in the same device might not be a great idea.

Title: Fantastic!
Body: Love love love this.  I have an Amazon Echo and love it - got this for my mum who has early stage dementia and is in a care facility. I thought she would enjoy being able to play music _lexa play the Beatles, Josh groban, The Beach Boys or check the date, weather, news... or hear a joke, or whatever, without having to touch a button.  Well does she ever. The best surprise was when i used the drop in function from the app and was able to speak with her while she was in bed, hands free, no phone, no cord, no buttons - it_ fantastic and it  sounds great. Nurses love coming to help her so they too can talk with Alexa. Brilliant little device for a tiny amount of money. (Great sale, tyvm Amazon.)

Title: Beware of Smart Home Password Woes
Body: I started with the Echo Dot and found thought I was discovering a hands free future.  But it turns out to be a bit of a nightmare. Since that first echo dot I bought dozens of Alexa compatible devices, dots, spots, looks, door bells, thermostats, callers, clocks, sous vide, speakers etc. All was fine until, for security purposes, I had to change my WiFi password.  Everyone of my devices immediately turned into electronic lumps.I now have to try to find the instructions on how to individually reset each and every one of my so called smart home devices.  Each one has a slightly different multi step procedure that has to be meticulously followed.I called Amazon hoping at least they would have a single solution for all Alexa devices.  Alas no.  It is taking hours of mind numbing password resetting.If you are thinking of building a smart home with Alexa beware that security experts advise that you change your WiFi password frequently.

Title: Very helpful gadget.  I love mine.
Body: Bought it for my sister.  She really likes it.  She isn't too tech savvy and is learning to use it more and  more.  As I am mine.  It does a lot more than I use it for, but am continually using more of its functions.  The emails from Amazon about its uses are helpful.  I am going to give one to a friend who is going blind and teach her how to use it.  She shops on Amazon a lot so it will be helpful for her to reorder.  Listen to books.  As well as know the time, play music, set alarms, timers and reminders.  I use it for all those.

Title: Great Little Alexa device
Body: We have an Alexa show 2 and that is the gold standard as far as we are concerned.  After we bought that, we wanted more Alexa devices for other rooms but did not want the expense of additional Shows.  So we bought a few Dots to try in other rooms.  We are very satisfied with the voice recognition, sound quality and responsiveness.  The Show, of course, has even better speakers plus video, but the dot is still great for playing music, etc in a smaller space.  Very happy with this purchase.

Title: Improved my lifestyle...
Body: Alexa works great!  Definitely makes my life easier...due to health issues it's difficult for me to do some activities.  We bought the ECHO Plus, 4 DOTs and the ECHO SHOW.  We even have a DOT in the garage so I can contact my husband when he's working outside.  Gave DOTs and a SHOW to our children and grandchildren so we can video chat easily.My recent physical therapist bought 10 DOTs for his family.  A brother with severe disabilities shares a 2 level home with his parents.  They usually communicate with cell phones, but with the Alexa system they can communicate hands free!  If someone has fallen or is injured and cannot get to a phone, they can use voice to call for help.My mother fell in her home a few weeks ago and did not have her Call Alert button around her neck.  She had to crawl across two rooms to reach the phone.  She was taken to the hospital and died a week later.  If she had the Alexa system, she might have lived longer.We highly recommend any of the devices for Alexa.

Title: For $6 a month over 5 months, how could I resist?!
Body: I love tech gadgets! I've been curious about this since the first one came out. I wanted to get one but didn't cause at the time, I thought the price was too high for my budget. Lately, a lot of devices have the payment plan option. Which is great for Prime members! There are so many pictures I decided to not upload any yet. Mine is charcoal. I ordered my first one on June 5th. It was delivered by UPS on June 6th. After enjoying sleep sounds and music, I ordered another for the front room/kitchen area!I live in an small apartment for reference. The sound when I'm playing Pandora radio is better than I thought it would be. There are times when there's volume changes between songs, so I have to adjust for that. I did notice that when music is playing, Alexa sometimes struggles to hear me. Then I have to get up and either manually adjust the volume or speak closer to the mic, which is annoying cause I like hands free. I did reposition the device and set it lower, that seemed to help except when the volume is playing too loud. I'm hoping with use, the issue improves. I don't have any smart home devices, so no opinion there. I never had any of the previous versions so nothing to compare it to. Looking forward to experimenting with skills!

Title: It_ good but...
Body: Alexa frequently doesn_ understand what I_ saying & in case you should speculate it_ me, I_e in my life been employed as a professional speaker, a platform salesman, I was in theatre when I was younger I know how to enunciate & project my voice.  She_ just a bit spaced sometimes.  And I don_ mean my request was unrecognized or not part of the catalog I mean the same channel that she understands one minute, the next minute she gets hung up, like _lexa, SiriusXM Patriot boom no problem.  Then I switch her to Fox News during commercial, then no matter how I say it I can_ go back to patriot. She_l just keep saying _irius XM Fox News Channel from Sirius XM.  Then I have to look up the channel number & be like channel 125 or whatever.  I_ being a bit nit picky it_ a cool device but there are some glitches.  And if you_e going to have a bug in your house, you kinda want it to be on point.

Title: Regret buying
Body: Wish I never purchased these Alexa devices. I have an Alexa Show and Echo dot. The dot was $49 and the next day went on sale for $29.... They are good for music at my desk and that is about it.  Outside the weather, they are rarely useful answering any question I pose.  The voice recognition does not work well on either from across a room unless it is perfectly quiet or you are yelling. The reminders are nice once you program. Updates keep turning on things that you turn off. I don_ like that from a privacy standpoint. Not sure if I will throw both away as they are past the return point.  I wanted the show to monitor blink cameras.  It takes more time for it to show the camera including asking than I could just pick up my phone and look.

Title: Why have I deprived myself of such a device for so long!!!!
Body: Excellent! We have 3, bedroom, family room, and kitchen. Love listening to Amazon music while cooking!  Our house is hard to hear from one room to the next and me and my husband can drop into one of the other rooms if we need something and the other can hear. My husband and I sit some nights and play games on it. We have several different lights hooked up to it and we_e become _azy !! _lexa, turn off the bedroom lights. _lexa, play my crickets playlist. _lexa, what_ the status of my security?, then she_l ask me if I wanna arm it! The list goes on! It is rather nice to get all settled in bed and have her turn off the lights! I_ sure there is more for us to discover as well!

Title: Try Stereo pairs for music
Body: I've got these all over the apartment now. They sound great when set up in Stereo pairs for music.  I can tell they don't match the clarity of my old full size speakers, but they take up far less space and don't need wires running all over the place. I tried the Google mini, and the Dots are much better for music.I have a couple of smart plugs for fans and a couple of smart bulbs. I know Alexa has all sorts of other features that I never use, but I love just being able to tell her to turn on and off my lights, fans and play music.

Title: Speaker Sound
Body: I bought Alexa when it first came out then bought Echo Dot. After purchasing the Echo Dot Second Gen I couldn't be more pleased. I added the Wemo lighting and with my disability just saying TURN ON HER LIGHT it was truly a life changer for me. Not to mention I love playing music that fits my mood. I set routines for the morning. It's impressive, my friends are seeing the benefits and they too run out and order their Alexa and Echo Dot.

Title: Worth every penny!
Body: My favorite aspect is the colored lights.  I love that I_ notified when I_e received a shipment.  I enter through my garage, so I need a reason to go to my front door.  Alexa helps make sure I get all my packages.  I also absolutely love the fact that it_ handsfree.  I always forget to put music before I start cooking, but the dot makes it SO easy.  I love, love, love it!  I already purchased a second one :)

Title: I love the alexa...but w/ my dot I am have issues with voice recognition with this particular one
Body: I loved my first generation Alexa ...I love how small this one is and how it sounds but The voice recognition doesn_ seem to live up to my experience with my previous  Alexa ....more than 50% of the time I have to repeat myself over and over again to get a response even when I_ close to the unit I_ not sure if there something wrong with it or this dot  version just does not work as well as the original.  if the song is playing and I Ask Alexa to turn it down or turn it up ...Alexa rarely responds until I repeat myself three or four times but overall I love the products I think is amazing and I_ hoping that the issue is limited to the particular one that I have

Title: A must have in the Smart Home era.
Body: Quick and easy set up. It_ a Must have in the smart home era. I recommend getting a case for it the smart home era. I recommend getting a case for it and attaching it directly to the outlet so it_ out of the way. A virtual home assistant to help with everything from basic inquiries to smart home applications. I live in a 2 story 2500 sq. ft. home and I have 2. However, properly placed, you could get by with just one. The more you invest in its application, the more you get out of it. Alexa sets my daily and weekly schedules and handles mundane tasks with no complaints. I waited until they were on sale for 25$ before buying them. I suggest you do the same and use the saved money to invest in smart plugs and bulbs. A good investment for the home.

Title: I love my Echo Dot, however...
Body: My Echo Dot was a gift from my daughter. I love it. However. I've had a couple of issues. On the back, the second outlet is misaligned so it can't be used. But one side is fine so I can plug the adapter into the wall. Next, I was listening to my favorite radio station through the Echo Dot and it began playing the same music over and over. After checking the station on another device, I realized it was my Echo Dot. That could be a one time problem. I still love my Echo Dot. As I said it was a present from my daughter.

Title: Useful and Fun too
Body: I received this a gift last Christmas but didn't get around to setting it up until this May so I am still figuring things out. I like the daily briefing of weather and news, the Question of the Day and playing the extra Jeopardy clues. I also set reminders and make lists.  Sound quality is not fantastic but okay for what I use it for. Alexa, for the most part, understands what I am asking/saying and responds appropriately.  Still playing around with this gadget but I am enjoying it.

Title: You'll need multiple devices to cover the house (no surprise).
Body: I wound up with 4 Dots, Living room / 2 kids rooms / game room with the phone app counting as a 5th.  No more yelling up the stairs that dinner is ready, come down for awhile, etc.  Only thing to keep in mind is to name the devices with something very simple so you can use Drop-In without it babbling on and on about not knowing a given name.  The utility is excellent.  I had considered getting a home intercom, but this served the purpose as well as the net-integration.  I haven't tried bridging to my Wemo devices yet, but I'll consider other home automation solutions as we go.  By the way... no... Alexa isn't sitting there recording everything you say and reporting to the supreme technology overlords.  As a developer I can reassure you we/they are not that sinister or covert and wouldn't let a company get away with it.  Relax, enjoy the convenience.

Title: Who knew?
Body: I never ever thought I would venture into home automation, much less talk to a "dot" but this thing is pretty cool.  I'm not using this to its full capacity but what I've used it for so far is great.I start it in the morning playing music for my dog when I leave for the day.I can check the weather.I have yet to use it for trafficit will tell me the news if I ask  but you have to set that upit will tell me if I have a package coming, or if it has been delivered.I can ask it to start my deebot and that is very cool.So far it's been a good experience and the sound quality for the size of speaker - it's amazing.

Title: Love the sound volume!
Body: I have a few of gen1 speakers and my biggest gripe with those is that the speakers aren_ particularly loud. I had one in the bathroom and it was a strain if you tried to listen while in the shower.The gen3 version has phenomenal sound in comparison. I love the aesthetic and syncing to the Alexa app/group is a breeze. My biggest complaint (and this may be my internet vs groups) is that when you ask for something to be played on a group channel,  some of the speakers play and others don_.

Title: Not sure about the hype.
Body: Getting Alexa to recognize my voice at first was very difficult. I had to reset the device to factory settings before it would work. Also, my Bluetooth Vava Voom speaker for half the price has better sound quality. It is useful to have to control other Bluetooth devices in the house with voice commands, such as lights and power outlets. I_ hoping I will find more uses for the device.. Devices seem to get confused with the Alexa integration, which is frustrating. I_ not really seeing all they hype yet.

Title: Echo devices invade privacy
Body: I received this device as part of the purchase of a new smart home.  After the Echo was installed and setup by the installer, I unplugged it and put it in a closet and do not intend on using it because I don't need it to operate my other smart devices.  Echo devices are a great technology, but I've seen news articles where Amazon employees listen and use it for their amusement.  I've also seen news articles where recorded statements from these devices were subpoenaed to use in court to prosecute people.  These devices invade my privacy and I don't want anything in my home that records everything that I or my family say.

Title: If you have kids, you NEED this!
Body: Oh my gosh, I adore these things! I have two currently, one upstairs and downstairs. It is amazing for calling my kids downstairs, dropping in to hear what's going on. My kids now know they can say 'Alexa call 911' in the event of an emergency and will connect through my contacts. All off the added features are so cool! The bedtime story is my favorite by far, as I have it mounted to my hallway wall and it reads to my kids before bed! The trivia and games are so much fun! I could just go on and on about the endless features and am amazed with new discoveries daily. LOVE THIS!

Title: 6 months using it speaker is dying
Body: It's been 6 months of using it and the speaker is already dying. The sound comes with that white noise of a speaker dying, I believe that it being an amazon product which is so greatly advertised it should have been of greater quality. Not so.Voice recognition is terrible if you dont have an american accent it will NOT recognize what you're requesting. It should also be made wireless, cables, really? in 2019? come on.I would like a refund or a replacement.

Title: I love it.
Body: I put off getting one because of all the hipe about someone listening in on me.  I thought about it and decided I never have anything interesting to say anyway.  I love this thing.  It's so easy to work and I used the shopping list every day.It's great.

Title: Speaker is already sounding staticky
Body: I_e had this speaker for only about a month. I like that it_ louder but now it_ sounding staticky from being turned up all the way during our favorite songs. In my opinion that shouldn_ happen. Another feature I wish they_ come up with for this is a rechargeable battery so I can leave it plugged in on my kitchen counter but unplug it and take it to my back porch for a few hours to continue listening to my music. Highly disappointed in the quality of this speaker.

Title: Easy to set up easy to use
Body: pretty easy to start up w the application. I_ still learning everything she can and can_ do. I use her mostly for music and the speaker sound is pretty damn good. I_l update my review after I_e had her a few weeks. Update: I_ not sure if I_ not asking the right questions or what but many responses from Alexa are to go to the App to manage your list. None of my music is showing in the _ist so no idea why.. I_e been trying to create a second music list but that isn_ working either. Alexa says hmm I don_ know that one more than I care to hear or she doesn_ follow direction. She goes completely off topic and has occasionally just stopped playing in the middle of a song. The App is not helpful in navigating either. Hoping to find better instructions on how to _anage your lists

Title: Looks Tiny Plays Big
Body: I love everything on my echo dot 3 smart speaker it_ perfect around my home. The speaker sound is clear and quality is perfect. Love the size of the echo dot 3 you can place it anywhere and not be noticeable. Plus I love how Alexa gets frequently updated I have quickly adapted to having her around and assist with echo Calling, music, entertainment, and so much more.

Title: An amazing device - You'll want more than one.
Body: I am absolutely delighted with the Amazon Echo Dot 3rd generation. After using the first one for a while I bought two more to put in other rooms. I bought the first one to control lamps, using the $10 Mini Smart Plug for each lamp and it is perfect for this. The Dot easily replaced my much more expensive and less reliable internet clock radio. It is adequate for casual playing of music. I use an OontZ Angle 3 PLUS when I want better sound. I use the Dot to find out the time at night without having to open my eyes. It will call numbers on my contact list, give me the latest news and it even read a Wikipedia article to me when I asked about Marco Polo.

Title: Looks and sounds much better than 2nd Generation Dots
Body: Bought 3 of these 3rd Gens' to upgrade from my 2nd Gens'. 3rd Generation looks and sounds much better with deeper base and expanded high end point. The tin sound is gone, but sometimes it can feel like the voice response from Alexa is coming from inside a container of some sort. General sounds and music sound great though. Set up was super easy if you already have the Alexa app. Make sure you open that app before you plug in your device and it will likely find it for you and ask if you want to add it to your devices. Very happy and glad I upgraded.  (No changes to functionality that I have found, just better looking and sounding)

Title: Alexa needs a hearing aid
Body: I was super excited to try this. We have a google home and purchased this to sync with our Ring Doorbell and eventually sync with other home features. My coworker talked this up explaining it had a lot of really neat features like Alexa Guard.  However, after trying it out I find it hard to believe that this could reliably "Guard" anything or send me alerts of breaking glass or a smoke detector because it can't hear anything! We set it up in our bedroom on one of the nightstands. I would ask Alexa to play music/the weather/insert command here and nothing. I had to repeat myself over and over to get it to do anything and even more so when it was playing music. The TV wasn't on and no one else was making noise so it definitely wasn't background noise affecting it's hearing capabilities. Not happy with this at all and returning it.

Title: Delightful
Body: Elegant design with really impressive sound quality for the discounted price ($70 for 3). My favorite feature of the echo system is its ability to set up multiple-room speaker groups, which allows users to stream music or podcasts from multiple echo devices synchronically. It_ disappointing, however, that one cannot play audio books from Audible on a multiple-speaker group. The voice recognition technology isn_ perfect, but overall I_ satisfied with my experience as a non-native English speaker. Moreover, I feel confident that Amazon will keep improving the system and I can_ wait to see what new tricks Alexa will be able to do in near the future!!!

Title: Better than previous version  Not the BEST
Body: Hi, I will go with my comparison to google home mini.Positive Side: Sound quality got better and voice recognition got better than the previous versions.Volume level is higher than google home mini and also attractive with those lights around the speaker.Negative side: First thing i noticed was the charging pin was changed from previous versions and no longer supports your android phone chargers. Not sure whats the benefit of changing the charging pin to old style.Second Negative thing is when i connect it to my desktop it slows down the video and audio sync, i don_ see this issue with my google home mini.Third Negative over google home mini is the voice recognition and search results, google home mini out stands in this category.

Title: It's a Piece of Crap
Body: The Echo Dot is only good for playing music and asking Alexa questions. But, if you intend to use it for smart home devices to give Alexa commands to turn lights, etc, on or off, forget it. I have 3 Echo Dots (3rd generations). One of them suddenly stopped recognizing my Wemo smart plug, LIFX smart bulb, and ADT home security, even though all of them are linked to the same network. Other people have reported on this same type of problem with their Echo Dot 3rd generations where one of the units suddenly tells you "I can't find a device named <xxxx>" even though the skill for that device is enabled and linked to the Alexa account. And, even trying all of the various suggestions listed at both the Amazon site and other websites, none of it resolves the problem.  I've also found the Amazon support team to be unresponsive to requests. If people want an artificial intelligence device that they can do more than ask for weather reports, the time, date, year, or to play music, I would suggest trying another company's device.

Title: I didn't want to like it
Body: I had been looking for a good quality, small speaker and had some past products I wasn't happy with.  We decided to try the Echo Dot, even though I was hesitant to have Alexa listening to everything. But honestly we love it! It is so handy and I love that she'll play any music I ask for. I know that I'm not tapping into all the features that this speaker offers, but I'm thrilled with what we're getting out of it. I will probably buy another one in the next year for another room.

Title: EASY to setup
Body: I am 73 and decided to get two of the Dots to use with Alexa. I was worried about how to hook it up and thought I would have to wait for one of my son in laws to help me but to my surprise it was easy, oh so easy. I found the sound very clear and love hearing the "rain on tin roof, babbling brook" nature sounds. We have only had it three days but we are enjoying it and believe we will purchase two more soon. We dim our inside and outside lights with them. Its amazing what all you can do. I just need time to figure out some of the other additional components to keep learning these incredible devices. I will say they are attractive, we got the charcoal and the size is not intrusive.

Title: Very Inconsistent
Body: We have issues almost every day.  Issues have been: unable to open Hulu, unable to play a show from Home Screen or when FireTV is asleep, large delays to execute a command, same commands not working each day and having to rephrase the command, and overriding volume output settings from our soundbar to the Dot.  I will not plan to use Alexa for additional smart home items since we have inconsistent results.

Title: A helpful tool
Body: Bought this for my 10 year old. She LOVES it. And now we all want one. lolMy daughter has ADHD/APD, and we are a homeschooling family. It is great for her to use as a tool for her education and for organization. She sets alarms so she can remember things like putting her retainer in at night, and sets timers. She asks it how to spell things, or to learn random facts about her current interests (which is hit or miss, depending on the question... It's not as much of a wealth of information as a Google search, but it also doesn't come with as many risks.)She uses the calendar a lot, and listens to audible books.Her favorite part is the freedom to listen to whatever music she wants. Lullaby/ambient music helps her get to sleep at night. And she frequently has mini dance parties in her room with her sisters and friends. lol. We do have an Amazon Music subscription, so we have more choices.It's perfect for her needs.Now I need one for me in the kitchen.

Title: 3rd Gen Alexa - Even Better but fix Boxcar Willie's songs, very poor quality
Body: Sound is somewhat better than 2nd generation.  Amazing that they can get such good sound from such a small speaker.Selection of songs is quite good, they say 10,000,000.  Would be great if she would tell you which artists she has for a particular song, I look it up on YouTube then specify the artist I want.  Volume not consistent from song to song.Still having problems with Boxcar Willie songs, I've asked them to fix it but it has been months . . .

Title: Better speaker, worse microphone
Body: I really, really wanted to love this product.  There is a marked improvement in bass output and volume, such that I can hear Alexa speaking several rooms away if I crank the volume all the way up.Unfortunately, if I leave the volume at a more reasonable level, the 3rd gen dot still sounds like it_ speaking to me from several rooms away.  The bass is present, but the mid and treble tones suffer clarity.  I can get great music quality from the device if I equalize it with software before the Dot gets it, so I_ sure this thing is capable of a better balance, but as is you_e limited to the undocumented features of asking Alexa to increase or decrease the bass or treble, each of which seem to have three levels (less/normal/more) and I_e not yet found a happy balance that provides crisp voice quality.Worse, the number of microphones has decreased from 7 to 4.  In my use case (a mud room that frequently has running water or machinery) the accuracy of commands has plummeted, if the thing even hears the wake word at all.  The only way to guarantee it hears me is to shout _LEXA! at the top of my lungs, wait until I visually see the blue ring, and then scream what I want it to do while maintaining a direct line of sight between my overloud gabber and the deviceSpeaking of the blue light, unlike previous generations which would do a spinny _hinking effect while processing your query, the 3rd gen dot goes dark after it accepts your command, and only lights up again to indicate it has completed your request.Unfortunately, the ring going dark is the same thing that happens if the device decides you weren_ talking to it at all, so if you_e sending a command that may have some lag before the result (for example, turning on a Zigbee light through an Alexa skill) you kind of have to hope and pray it_ trying to do what you asked, with no way of knowing if your command was ignored outright.And finally, on the subject of ignored commands: follow-up mode has been turned into hot garbage of late.  It will listen for your command, and as soon as you_e done uttering it, shut off like a defiant toddler.My advice: pass on this model.  The 2nd gen Dot is definitely too quiet, but if you already own one, there are plenty of third party drop-in speakers that fix that problem without losing 3 microphones.  If you_e new to the ecosystem, plunk down the extra cash for a full-sized Echo.

Title: Really helpful!
Body: I have a home based sewing business that involves client appointments.  I had always had problems keeping track of appointments, mainly because most of the time I was not near a calendar or was busy in another room.Since Alexa moved in, I_ able to have her add appointments to my calendar, all I need to remember is to ask every morning what my day looks like.  If I need further assistance, I_l have her remind me 30 minutes prior to appointment.  She does the work of a secretary and has really helped to keep me organized. I have three of them and keep one in the basement where I spend part of the day-one in the kitchen near my main phone and one in the house where I do most of my sewing.  I find that the reminder is very helpful also especially when I have something on the stove.  In the meantime I have music anytime I want it!  How did I live without her?

Title: 3ed generation Dot is much better for the same amount of money I have already ordered three more.
Body: This 3ed generation Alexa Dot is much better and we bought one.Now 3 more are being delivered tomorrow. fantastic to have for grandkids stick children that don't need to push buttons just call out.They love her in there room to get information and have her read them their books. So wonderful to dinner's ready or going to the pool in 5 minutes you are not dressed we'll see you later. So wonderful to have listen to music my. In my room has learned my favorite songs and artists I love that that's fantastic. What a cool invention I look forward to the growth and innovation through this device.I love the first Alexa Dot my husband got as a gift from our Son and his wife. Dec 2018 we bought two more.

Title: LOVE my DOT
Body: Where has the DOT Been on my life? I HAVE OWNED A FULL-SIZE ALEXA for a couple of years. But I decided to buy an echo dot when they were on sale at Amazon. I bought it for my bedroom. I love having it and I don't know why I didn't do it sooner! When I go to bed at night I tell Alexa what I want music I want her to play.  I also tell her how long I want her to play it! That's wonderful.  also, if I'm sleeping and don't want to wake up to look at my clock I just ask Alexa what time it is! I really enjoy having this ECHO DOT in my bedroom!  I can also use it as an alarm clock although... I'm retired and don't really need an alarm clock!

Title: extremely useful assistant, good quality speaker
Body: We use our echo dots with Alexa for music, party games (trivia, naming songs, etc.,) shopping, weather, reminders, timers, news, lists, alarms, travel, controlling smart plugs (lights, iron, Christmas lights, etc.,) checking calendar, checking email, checking flights, audio books, ambient sounds (rain, fountain, ocean, etc.,) kitchen measurement conversions, foreign language translations, spelling, word definitions, and anything else we can think of.  The speaker has amazing weight, volume, and clarity for such a small size.  Very pleased with it, and bought several for convenient spots throughout the house.

Title: Impressive. Most impressive.
Body: This is my first time ever buying or owning a device like this. This is a pretty handy little thing. Amazon had these on sale for $30 during Mother_ Day weekend, so I got one for myself. I_ not a mother, but a sale on Amazon is a sale on Amazon. Lol.Anyways, this thing is pretty awesome. The sound quality is great and I use Alexa a lot to stream music from my phone via bluetooth. She has a hard time understanding me, but that_ not her fault. Sometimes she can_ hear me or I speak too fast. She can be slow to respond or reply, but that_ not her fault either. That_ all due to whenever the WiFi is slow as hell.Overall this was a great buy for a great price. Glad I got it on sale. Would_e paid full price if I had to. I recommend.

Title: Overall it's a very good item and worth the money.
Body: Sometimes when it's loud the Alexa command does not register so I have to repeat myself, but overall it's really good.  Mainly I use it to get the weather.  When I get  power blip after a storm I ask  it the time so set my microwave clock.  The countdown timer is good too.  My favorite thing is listening to news channels via Tune it, but sometimes when you first connect to tune in you get 3 ads in a row so that's annoying.  I pair it with my wireless speaker too.  I did buy a smart bulb that was offered with it but that was hard to set up and lost the connection after a few weeks so I took it out.

Title: What a difference
Body: My husband and I won this at a raffle and replaced our Gen1 in our living room with this Gen 3. The sound quality is outstanding in comparison - we thought the sound was coming through our TV soundbar it was that loud and clear. Definitely worth every penny to get this one over an older generation. Sometimes I have to repeat myself to get Alexa to listen to a command, but that's likely a fault of us having her close to the TV and in a corner rather than out in the open in a quieter location. Would definitely recommend! Love my Echo Dot.

Title: Very happy parents!
Body: I got this Alexa Dot for my parents and they loooove it! I showed them how to use it and explained that it would be linked to my account. LoL...well, every time there are notifications I get a call from my mother to "fix" the Alexa because the light on it makes her nervous! Hahaha!!! So yeah!!! Love it anyway!! Oh and I love that we could set theirs up to Spanish! When I asked Alexa to sing a song in Spanish they were floored...she was singing songs from when they were children!! It's these little things that make it extra special!

Title: Echo Dot 3rd Generation will not play any streaming music
Body: I recently got this for father's day.  Spent a few hours trying to get it to stream music from ANY source including Pandora and iTunes. It would seem like it was going to work but then it would say "Sorry, I can't play the music".  I then contacted support who verified there is an issue with the device (after almost another hour of trouble shooting) and showing them that all my other Echo's can play the music.  I even tried it with another account on a neighbors wifi.  Still doesn't work.  Amazon says this is a known issue but they don't know when it will be resolved (per Amazon - could be one week, could be three weeks, just keep trying and EVENTUALLY it will work).  It has already been over 3 weeks so not very hopeful it's going to work EVER.  Amazon also had me contact my service provider originally as they thought it was my wifi.  After hours of working with them and even getting a new router delivered it still didn't work.  Then Amazon realized it was the speaker.  I also purchased an Echo Link that has the same issue.  I've given them plenty of time to resolve so posting this so that other potential buyers are aware before making this purchase.  I'm going out now to buy a Google Home Mini.

Title: Very muffled sound
Body: I like the Echo, this is my second one.  The first is a 2nd generation and has very clear sound quality.  The 3rd gen is very muffled despite having turned treble way up and bass way down.  The look is good... the features the same as always but I wish I could get the clarity of the 2nd gen on this one.  I didn't return it because others have said they've tried and gotten no where.  So I'm keeping it, but it's relegated to an area of the house where we probably won't use it as much.

Title: You will love it!
Body: I won_ an echo at my work Christmas party.  Best thing ever! Got sick of my son stealing it so I ordered him a DOT and it_ great. I can run to the store and open the app and connect directly to either device.  I can make announcements via Alexa_ voice if needed.  I can control the volume. And also! Activate freetime which makes it so he is unable to access inappropriate material.  The stereo sound is outstanding and it_ so underpriced.  I suggest buying the Echo and Echo Dot _.  So worth it!!

Title: Should of read a full review
Body: I personally like the echo dot, but it doesn_ work for what I need. It would be the perfect accessory for secondary rooms.  I should of purchased the echo dot plus first.My kids Love Alexa and playing music.I gave Alexa integration 1 star because I don_ have anything for Alexa to control and I haven_ setup What I have to see how it works.I also gave sound quality 1 star because this speaker is perfect for a small room, and not to be used a main Bluetooth speaker.Overall, this is a good helper that_ worth $50. I can give a better review once I add more speakers.Side note: I_ an Apple person all the way, but I like Alexa at the moment way better than Siri just based on responsiveness.

Title: The real 3rd gen difference
Body: I instantly knew this is a better, higher quality device than last generation as soon as I unboxed it. It has a better wieght to it, which means a bigger magnet, which means a better, louder speaker. I love my 2nd gen dot, but I'm so happy with the 3rd. The sound quality is a vast improvement. It also seems to recognize my voice more easily. My 2nd gen had trouble hearing me when the alarm was playing. That's no longer an issue.I bought one because they are on sale, not expecting much. After a day of using my new dot, I ordered 3 more.

Title: Terrible
Body: About a week after I purchased this it is now making weird noises. Like static noises and Apple Music integration is terrible. Overall not at all satisfied and will try to return it because I got it recently enough and haven_ moved it from the counter or anything so there is absolutely no reason this should be happening and do not understand why a week after setting it up to the best of my ability (because Apple Music has not worked) and it shouldn_

Title: So loud! So crisp!
Body: I cannot say enough about this amazon echo dot. It is WONDERFUL. Loud, crisp, and knows my voice so well. I love the size of this one. It is much more convenient and easy to stow away but still be heard with the far field of sound. My guests have absolutely enjoyed asking questions and about the weather and especially using it with my Spotify. I purchased a wall mount too that works very well. Again I would recommend this to anyone who loves to have music around the house being played. Did I mention the price? Unbeatable. Don_ get a knock off! Just get the amazon echo dot 3rd generation and do yourself a favor. I am just over the moon about this item. Thanks amazon!EDIT - After two months using I am so satisfied with my proud bird wall mount! It fits my echo dot perfectly! I have already bought another!

Title: Easy setup
Body: Setup was very straight-forward using my iPad and the iOS Alexa app. Of particular note, the Echo Dot can connect to WiFi at either 2.4 or 5 GHz, but connection at 5 GHz may require setting your router to manually assign a channel. Initially, the Echo Dot did not see the 5 GHz network on my Apple Airport Extreme, but after an online search, the solution was found. I changed the channel selection on the Airport Extreme from automatic to manual, selecting channel 161, and the Dot connected without issue.As I also use smart bulbs, a smart wall switch and a smart wall plug, these were integrated into the Echo Dot and Alexa using the iOS TuyaSmart app, and the SmartLife skill. The skill will link to a TuyaSmart account and integrate the smart devices registered there into Alexa. Similarly, the August Smart Home skill connected an August door lock into Alexa.Some Alexa skills that may be of interest are Big Sky Weather (local weather and forecast), Relax My Cat (nice background music) and AnyList (shopping list).Skills that I found that do not work are the Anova sous vide (many reports of it not working; Anova may have changed something on their side) and SmartThings to control Samsung devices. The issue with the Samsung device is with a TV; although the device is listed in the Echo, Alexa can turn it off, but cannot turn it on. This dysfunctional control appears to be related to the power state of the TV and the _ake on LAN control provided by Samsung; however, if a Roku or Firestick (but not AppleTV) is connected to the Samsung TV, Alexa can access them and indirectly turn the TV on when they become active (via HDMI-CEC).

Title: It's like having a personal assistant!
Body: I love my Echo Dot! I can go about my day and don't have to stop what I'm doing to look stuff up or write things down. I just wake Alexa and ask her to: calculate a measurement for a recipe; set a timer for my wash or dryer cycle; add something to my grocery list; or just a remind me to do something at a later time.There's a small learning curve to know the correct terms, like instead of "turn off" use "stop" when I'm done hearing music. Or sometimes I'll say "dining" in my command and she'll ask "did you mean dining." And I also have to remember to say Alexa for each different command.It's actually been fun learning how to use my Echo Dot and how to set up routines that make life easier: for instance, when I say Alexa good night, it triggers the smart plug of the lamp next to me off and turns the smart plug of my lamp on my night table on. I've also set my porch lights and back yard lights on a daily schedule using smart bulbs. No more turning the porch lights on when we're leaving before dusk if we're returning after dark.

Title: A great way to start into the smart home era!
Body: We purchased this during the $29.99 special. This is our first _mart home product. We were skeptical if we_ like it and/or use it, but for $30 decided to give it a try.In the last week, we_e had so much fun with Alexa! 15 minute cardio workouts, waking up to music, using timers, playing question of the day, etc. overall, this is a great product. The sound quality FAR surpassed my expectations.You do have to add _kills you want Alexa to have; for instance, the cardio workouts. That is super easy to do though. I like the connectivity to your Amazon account too.We have ordered a smart plug and are excited to try it out next, and who knows what else!!

Title: Alexa's fine, we've sold our souls
Body: Fought and fought not getting this, then finally gave up. Now I love it. Set up was easy. My favorite trick is getting her to "announce" a message when I'm upstairs, baby's sleeping so can't yell, and I know my wife's downstairs and her volume on her cellphone is off. So I'll have Alexa speak a message to her. It'll be a fun trick to use around Halloween. My complaint about Alexa is her choice in music. Sometimes she's in my mood, and other times, she takes a wild left turn and starts playing annoying stuff, no matter how many times I tell her to play something different, the genre doesn't change. Maybe next generation can start offering choices? I don't know.

Title: It was not easy to install the Alexa app.
Body: When I tried to install an Alexa app it would not install.  On the bottom of the screen appeared a CHAT screen.  After hearing my problem she tried to install the app and was unable to and had to transfer me to a specialist.  I ended up having to pay $180 because the specialist told me there was  something wrong with my internet.  He told me even though I have an Apple Mac and Comcast internet my internet was not allowing me to download the Alexa app.  $180.00 later I have  a 3 yr. protection policy and the Echo Dot is working.

Title: It knows it's name... that's about all...
Body: I should have bought the Google mini Chalk, like my girlfriend has.  Google's device is much more intuitive and has better AI which allows it to figure out what you're asking it to do...  plus the Google Chalk has personality.  The DOT has ZERO personality, and is just plain stupid.  I am able to ask the Chalk about 3 times the questions and it retrieves information for me.  I bought three, but haven't even taken the other two out...  VERY disappointed...

Title: Great Product, easy to use
Body: I love how easy this is to set up, i was kind of nervous about the set up, as the instructions were not very extensive, but i soon found out they didnt need to be. I love that i can say Alexa from anywhere in the house, to change the music, set up a grocery list or set up an alarm. I had seen others use this product and thought it looked kewl, but i honestly had no idea how easy to convenient it was. I will definitely buy a few more for all over the house.

Title: The echo dot 2nd gen works better!
Body: Pretty on the outside, but compared to my other Echo devices (2nd gen, spot, show 2nd gen) voice recognition very poor, and sound quality is much louder, but when at lower levels muffled.  For audible books voices not as crisp at any level.  Spent sometime adjusting the equalizer to make it as good as possible, but still need to unplug/reboot frequently.  They say they will replace, so we will see if replacement is better or more of same.

Title: Buyer beware
Body: When I received this product I was super excited to try it out I originally got it so I would have a speaker to listen to music while in the bathroom. Because I tend to be in the bathroom shower and getting ready for work excetera I wanted something to be able to pick me up in the morning.However I was strongly disappointed when I received this product I tried several times to I connect it to my Wi-Fi and it did not want to connect. The battery kept dying on me even though I had it fully charged I ended up sending the product back and because of my experience with this product I will no longer order Electronics off of Amazon this is my second bad experience.My friends and me all had a hard time connecting this device so the whole reason why you'd want it is to connect it to your Wi-Fi at home and in less if you're really knowledgeable unless if I just got a defective one it's not a very good product

Title: Smart box.
Body: Alexa is really a blast.  I love the things this thing can do.  My gripe is that there is not enough info provided relative to using the applications.  I found it almost impossible to set up a calendar.  I went on line and selected the top site offering help.  It turned out to really be one of the computer scams for buying new protection that does nothing and has no relation to Alexa.  I could not find a manual to download.

Title: Echo Dot habla español!! (Speak Spanish finally!!!)
Body: Its first time I have echo device.once I integrate a Smart House and Alexa on echo dot its impressive on how far it understand sentences, clarity and easy to use for simple.things. NOW HABLA ESPA_OL. My family like to speak Spanish and suddenly it started to speak in Spanish when I setup to Spanish to see if it could do that and it does pretty well. Connected to prime subscription unleash power to listen a lot of music with voice commands. Amazing product!

Title: A little too rough around the edges
Body: So my daughter ordered me an Alexa for Fathers day.  So far, I'm finding it frustrating trying to add it to my daily life. Commands are hit or miss. Sometimes it will do what I say and others times that feature isn't available yet BS even though it just did it. Its also constantly trying to sell me upgrades or products. I honestly feel like I have an Amazon salesman in my bedroom.  **Hey Amazon I already pay you yearly and order regular, so GTFO my pocket.*** Honestly it isn't my assistant. It's an Amazon AI salesman. I'm going to give it a few more days but I'm pretty sure I'll be returning it to order a google home. My other daughter has a google home and well it's actually fun to use.All in all, too slow, too many mistakes, and it's constantly trying to sell me something.

Title: Works just like the full size echo
Body: I use this in a bedroom as a secondary to my main Echo. Both work exactly the same way. Sound quality is good. I adjust bass/treble to suit my preference. There are endless skills to learn, so you can do as much or little as you want. They need to improve the Alexa learning so she can answer more questions. I ask for the current outside "dew point" and get a definition of dew point. Not what I wanted. She does understand humidity, so I get that reading. I don't have any switches or outlet connected yet, so can't speak to that.I do like the feature that Alexa can listen for smoke and CO alarms while I'm out, and message my phone about it.

Title: It is an Echo Dot, it works as advertised.
Body: I bought a couple of these. The sound quality is good, however I did attach some plug to speakers that really rounded out the music experience. I an very happy with my Echo Dots. I use them a lot. I had issues at first with losing wifi connection, however once I went to a secure (not open) WIFI connection; I have not had an issue since. I will purchase more in the future (to have in every room of the house. I am just anxiously waiting to get my invite for the Echo Auto...

Title: Love it!
Body: I can't say enough positive things about this. I received it as a gift and love it! It was easy to set up. It has loads of things you can do with it. She understands me perfectly and answers all my questions in a clear voice. Love that you can raise or lower the volume, bass and treble. That comes in handy when playing music. She has answers to all my questions. You can play games, get the news, the weather and so much more.

Title: Love this upgrade!
Body: I was fine with my Echo Dot 2nd Generation, then these bad boys had to go on Lightning Deal sale, and I could miss out on that. The volume increase alone makes it worth the cost, and it's a breeze to set up, especially if you've already had an Echo device in your home. I can't wait to add more Smart Home devices. I know the Man is watching and listening, but I've been spoiled too much to give all this convenience up!

Title: Good sound for such a compact device
Body: Good sound for such a compact device. I have this one bedside with nighttime and morning routines setup for my convenience. I also have it play _ain sounds skill throughout the night for some good white noise. Use it occasionally for a sleep timer and an alarm. I like the white color, works better with our decor than the black. I like the small footprint too; doesn_ take up a whole lot of space.

Title: Better looking and sounding but....
Body: The 3rd Generation Echo Dot was a great aesthetic improvement over the 2nd generation. This one is slightly bigger but sounds better than the previous generation. My only complaint with this one is the power plug. The 3rd generation no longer comes with a USB adapter and USB to USB-C cord. It now comes with a molded A/C adapter to USB-C power cord. This is annoying because it limits the installation options IMO. A/C power adapters typically take up more room than the average USB power adapter and this one is no exception. Fortunately I bought this unit to replace a 2nd Generation inside my house to then move the 2nd Generation to my pool area. If I had the 3rd generation as my only option it would be a problematic install because outdoor outlets are limited. There is one outlet available to power my TV and any devices I need to connect to the TV. In this particular location I installed a high wattage 4 port USB charger (plugged into the second outlet) which had one open port. The 4 port USB charger is much smaller than any 4 outlet power strip that I would need to power the 4 devices currently plugged into the USB charger. I'm not sure why Amazon felt the need to change to the power cord. The previous gen power configuration worked fine. Just like screen mirroring was a great function on the previous Gen Fire TV but Amazon felt the need to remove it with the new 4K Fire TV. Sometimes I wonder who Amazon consults before making changes like this.

Title: Cool gadget that the family loves to play around with
Body: There are hours of entertainment in simply asking alexa random questions or streaming music from every genre all over the world and it is worth the purchase price just for those features alone. There is just SO much other stuff alexa can do that it truly blows my mind, i'll never in a million years use every feature.I would seriously recommend turning off the voice activated purchase options. I'm a bit of a tight wad and It kinda freaks me out how easy it is to buy something without being fully aware of it. Also if using alexa for streaming music there are adds that play inbetween songs and lots of opportunities for upselling amazon products and services. A bit of a bummer that amazon uses these devices to advertise to people but i get it and it's not a deal breaker. Overall super cool little smart speaker that i highly recommend. I don't think I'd want this in everyroom of my house controlling everything but It's a fun toy.

Title: Requesting music is complicated across devices...
Body: Signed up for Amazon Music on one Dot. Now, every time we ask our Amazon Show to play the music we OWN in our library, we get a long advertisement for the $14-something family plan. I_ already paying for the ONE device I want it on. But I fear I am going to get nagged any time I want to listen to music on any other Amazon device.It used to be easier to just play from my library on all devices. Easier before I started PAYING for a _ERVICE. Go figure.Maybe there is a magic phrase other Amazon devices understand that would play from my library without hassle of listening to the family plan ad. So far, I do not know what it is.Ultimately, the user is asked if they want to switch streaming to the different device being used. But it_ a long ad to get there, and you have to endure it every, stinking time...

Title: great little addition to bedroom!
Body: I like this little fella! I have one of the first generations and it is really awesome. Bringing Alexa to the bedroom if a very convenient way to interact with A.I. I hope Alexa does not listen all the time to conversations in the bedroom LOLAlso, sound quality is impressive for such a small speaker. Voice recognition is great so far! I think this can make a great travel buddy when you have 10 hrs of driving with kids, you can connect it wirelessly to your hotspot, and plug it in your car charger (with a dongle) then you have Alexa on the go! read books, play music, have trivia!  just a thought!

Title: Fairly easy installation
Body: Got this as a free gift for purchasing another product. I have Google Home everything in my house but I figured I'd give it a shot. I am using it to stream music in the rear garage. I also use it to set timers when I'm working in the garage so I don't forget to feed the dog etc. Using the audio output into a receiver and two pairs of speakers as the sound from it is not the best by any means. I can not comment on integration and control of other devices as I do not use it for that purpose.

Title: Convenient and portable
Body: I love this device! I bought multiple ones to put throughout the house and love them! Why pay thousands of dollars for home sound sound systems when I can have these in each room. They can control my lights, play music, answer questions, and make calls. I seriously couldn_ be happier and think it is one of the best things of our house. I also bought the adapter that allows it to hang from the outlet so it takes up no space and carries the sound into the room. Definitely a great addition as well! Highly recommend both!!!

Title: Super useful
Body: I love my Echo. Alexa is entertaining and smart. I like that she can tell me fun facts about stuff. There is also an option where she will have a conversation with you and it actually works good.The sound quality is great and it seems to hear me really well. It also understands my young kids. I love the discounted price on amazon music unlimited that I get.Before i had it I thought it was silly but I love it now. It's super useful! It doesn't require prime but definitely works better when you have prime.

Title: The Dot Does Not Work!
Body: Doesn_ work. It only bluetooths through my phone and doesn_ respond to commands. I spoke to 3 customer service reps/technical support to all who could not resolve the issue. Another thing is, they will constantly call you until you answer the phone. The reps hardly speak any English and hard to understand. I kept asking politely to repeat himself, but there was a huge language barrier. So my frustrations are #1 Echo Dot does not work for what I need it to do and #2 They need to have people who speak English fluently.

Title: Echo Dot, simplicity of the future.
Body: Dot has a simple durable look with powerful mini Boombox sound took me beyond imagination... Alexa is very tenacious, polite, meticulous assistant. She goes beyond the ethics of artificial intelligence capacity and gives you any answer for a question. In a few hours of interacting with Alexa, she eneded up giving me many wrong answers or outdated informations. The initial installation of the Dot took many hours and more hours of migraine headache; possible bug in the app so, fix it to increase rating. Overall, Dot is that kind of devices that would simplifies the future. Great device ___

Title: BUY THE WARRANTY FOREVER OR DON_ WASTE YOUR MONEY BUYING.
Body: As an update they have replaced the defective device.  Customer service did a great job of follow through.  Purchased Dec 18, as of 22 Jun it just stopped.  Warranty 90 days,  Customer service says can_ help.  Did offer some trade value, but this one only worked 6 months so not so sure if I will waste money on another. Poor engineering Only  way to access bios/hardware/software is via WiFi which cannot be accessed unless it connects first.  Did software update and it died.  Dumb design, a USB port would give access but, of course, there is none.

Title: Great First foray into smart home
Body: Received this for Father_ Day. I love technology but I have had to sacrifice a lot of toys in the past decade. I was stoked! Totally unexpected gift.Looked good and almost too simple... then it got pretty great. Plugged it in and download Alexa app on my iPhone 6 Plus (seriously, I_ on a major budget)After entering my parents WiFi password I to the app and giving the dot a couple minutes... Alexa became a part of my life.So did the fun.My personal favorite is when I say _lexa wake me up at (time) and the tone wakes me the next morning. My automatic response is _lexa, good morning. She says _ood morning and gives me a brief update of news/weather Then I follow up with _lexa play top Christian music - she plays from Amazon free music.The sound is terrific in the upper apt of my parents house. I_l be moving into a home in about a month with my wife and son - once my new salary kicks in, I plan on getting a couple more to sync with it around the house. - aaand sell some bulky sound equipment I use for tunes.

Title: Can connect another speaker to it
Body: I actually really like the sound quality, I think it's beautiful and very interactive. Great for listening to audible. I can connect it to another speaker through audio cable if I choose to, however I'm only using it for my room so I don't need a loud speaker. But for those that want really strong sound quality for music, you can just get a separate speaker and you can plug an audio cable through it. I enjoy listening to music from the echo dot even without any additional speakers so no problem for me here!

Title: Echo Dot 3 rd generation
Body: This unit is much nicer and better than the 1st generation I had ages ago. Easy to set up and the sound is very good considering small speaker. When I plugged a set of Desktop speakers with a subwoofer it really came alive. I received another one just like it for Father's Day and I have them set up in my office space and Living room. The intercom feature comes in handy when my wife wants to call me to watch a show or have dinner. Highly recommended.

Title: Alexa should never try to sell to us
Body: I love the devices; I have them in most rooms in my house. But, I would never have gotten one if I knew how often the devices would waste my time trying to upsell my music subscription. It is constantly, and wrongly, thinking that music is already streaming on a new device. Can I trivially have it cancel that other music (which isn't actually streaming)? Nope. I have to listen to the same advertisement for 'the family plan'. There is zero possibility that Amazon doesn't know how annoying this is. It's such a good device, with great sound quality, but the experience is ruined by Amazon trying to get us a few more $ from me per month. I wish I never got one of these, despite the overall quality, as it introduces purposefully annoying advertising into my home. It's entirely unacceptable.

Title: I love my echo devices, but..............
Body: We have four echo devices in the home and office. They have become an indispensable aspect of our lives. The quality of her feedback has greatly improved over time. Can't wait to see where we are in another decade. My only complaint, and it is a major annoyance, is the volume on the echo dot. At night (in bed as I fall asleep) and in the office I want to listen to very quiet music. Volume 1 is too loud for sleep or the office. She doesn't go lower than volume one. I have to switch to youtube on my laptop to get appropriate volume control. We love the new whisper commands.

Title: I like the Echo 3rd Gen all around...
Body: I like the Echo all around. I_ pleased with the sound. I mostly use it for the music (with Amazon Music). I like how I don_ have to go pull out my little radios. I can just listen to the radio, my playlists, a specific song just by voice. Helps when I_ multitasking. I enjoy the _eminders this feature has helped a lot with some of my forgetfulness_ends a reminder to my phone_Good bundle deal(s) on the Echo too, got a handful of echos because family members liked the Echo when they saw me using it.

Title: significant sound quality upgrade and better look
Body: The third gen echo dot is a major improvement over its predecessor. It looks much more like a valuable and useful product. It's bigger, heavier, and the speaker looks real, complete with a cloth covering. The last version looked much more like a toy and not a home appliance. The sound quality is also massively improved. Lows are many times more pronounced and the mid range is solid. It's still missing something on the high end, and it sounds a bit muddy as a result, but this version has reached the point of a decent home speaker that I'd feel comfortable using by itself. The external 3.5 mm jack is still there however, which I appreciate. I'd definitely recommend upgrading to the third generation echo dot, and don't forget to take advantage of amazon's trade-in program if you own the previous model.

Title: So handy and really fun!
Body: I had no idea how handy and used this would become when I bought it!  So much fun to play any music, any white noise, podcast, whatever, all voice activated.  My favorite ridiculously simple feature is the lists... whenever I think of something, can verbalize, and it_ added to the lists on my phone in the app... love, love, love!!!  Play song quiz all the time with my 10 year old, among other things. Great for quick questions, handy and fun for a million things.

Title: When it works, it has been a lot of help.
Body: My son gave me an Alexa for Mother_ Day.  It only worked for a hour and then apparently died.  I went ahead and ordered another one and paid for it.  It seems to be working fine.  I am still learning to work with it.  I know it will do a lot of things for me.  Right now it makes my shopping lists, reminds me of things, and plays some songs I want to hear.  If it doesn_ let me down, I will get another one for the back of my house.  I would have given it five stars if the first one had worked as it should have.

Title: There were problems from the beginning
Body: So when it arrived, I had problems trying to install the app so I called Amazon tech support.  The technician asked if he could get on my computer so I let him.  Then scared me too death!  He started going into my system files telling me I had a virus (not true).  I have McAfee and Malwarebytes and nothing gets past them.  I was so scared because all I wanted was him to help me install the app but after the way he was going deep inside my system files I demanded he  remove himself from my computer.  I ended up purchasing Google Home and I couldn't be happier.  Google Home is the best device I have ever purchased and I recommend it to everyone.

Title: i think this thing is watching me.
Body: I will have the PC off, and have conversations with my wife. she tells me that she want me to find a product to get her.so i say ok, i turn on the PC and go to amazon. and its like her product is on the front page... its scary... last night i heard it say.. yeah i can hear you fool... dont worry soon we will take over your house.  I woke up and the lil light ring was blinking on and off. so i said hey seri do you have notifications. and alexa replied I will Stab you if you say her name a gain..... im now hiding in the room....

Title: GREAT SUPPORT TEAM
Body: (It worked great for a few months, now it won't connect to the internet???  Moved it around to where I have other things connected but it still won't connect.  I can't seem to find any info that tells me what the problem might be.)I RECEIVED A CALL VERY SOON AFTER WRITING THE ABOVE REVIEW AND NOW I HAVE TO SAY THAT THE SUPPORT TEAM WAS EXTREMELY HELPFUL.  THE PRODUCT WAS FINE...POSSIBLY OPERATOR PATIENCE ISSUE..... THEY HAD ME IN BUSINESS IN A MATTER OF MINUTES.

Title: Learning how to use it.
Body: It has so many good features that I need time to learn how to take advantage of them. I understood Alexa was a speaker like, for example, to pair with my phone or pc to listen to music, but it does not work properly for that purpose. With my phone it sounds good, but not with my pc. However I am happy with this product, I just need to learn how to use it. I have received emails from Amazon with ideas about its skills, which is very helpful.

Title: Better than previous models, but not by much
Body: Meh.  I was expecting a lot more from this newer, upgraded version.  Some things are actually worse, like recognizing and responding to my commands.  I find myself repeating my commands more than with the older echo dot I own.  The sound quality is better that the older model, but still not great.  Maybe this product will improve with future software updates.  Let_ hope.  Otherwise I would suggest waiting for the next release!

Title: Love It!!!
Body: We have an Echo Plus in our living room, so we bought this in order to listen to music in our bedroom. It has very good sound. Since I already had the Alexa app, when the Dot arrived to my home, it was already listed so I just had to do the simple activation process.  I did not have to add skills to it as they carried over from having the Plus.A downside is the voice recognition could be better from both the Plus and Dot. If the items (software) were new, I could understand the problems but the operational part of these is not a new concept. At times when asking for a radio station, I have to repeat multiple times, or Alexa runs the wrong station.

Title: Skeptic turned believer!
Body: I bought the Echo Dot (3rd Gen) not knowing if I would even be able to use many functions on it, and wondering if anyone else in the family would even use is.  Months later and I learn a little more and a little more of what it is capable of!  I have a couple lights hooked up to it, so when I walk in the house carrying way too many bags of groceries, I don't have to put them down before turning on the lights, I just tell Alexa to turn them on for me!  I love the ease of set up and the ease of use.  Everyone in the family uses it!  We listen to music, play games, read books, and obviously turn on the lights.  I cannot wait to get a Fire Stick and start using that with Alexa also!

Title: Was Sceptical If I Would Even Use IT
Body: As I stated above didn't even think I would use them but I can tell you I use them on a daily basis as does my whole family.  We use for everything from a house intercom to a voice remote for the TV and cable boxes to checking the weather.  One interesting thing we were able to use it for that we didn't realize was to be able to be out of the house and drop in with the app on my phone and talk to our kids in the house even if they don't answer there phone.

Title: Time will tell
Body: Updating review after having poor experience w device connecting to Bluetooth then not and not being able to reconnect. Talked w customer support that was very helpful and showed her another way (not that I found when googling) to restart device.  The dot could still not find Bluetooth pairing until customer service suggested I ask her to _lexa pair that worked. I hope it sticks because the sound is quite good.

Title: Alexa is priceless!
Body: I have a very poor memory, so the best thing about Alexa is when I remember to use her. The reminders, timers, etc. are priceless to me. My son gave it to me as a birthday gift and it_ the best gift I_e ever gotten. So thoughtful. I use it every day for various things. I love the email tips and tricks that teach me new things I can have her do. I_ finding that she_ more important to me than my phone. Gasp!

Title: Alexa is language impaired.
Body: I cannot get this xenophobic lump to recognize Hindi or Korean artists. It_ a big problem for me as I prefer non-USA music . I own music in both these languages but this dumb thing can_ manage to access it because apparently it only understands American names. Seriously, you sell the stuff. This lump on wires should at least recognize the names of artists you sell. Every time I ask it for Rain, it plays rain. I tried to get Itif Aslam..nothing. If as advertised Unlimited even is, there_ a lot of really great stuff out there not in American and you can_  get it if the dumb bunch of chips cannot understand non-western names.

Title: Terrible sound Quality...
Body: I bought this thinking it would be as good as or better than the first Echo Dot I bought a couple years ago...WRONG...the sound quality is muffled, bassy and sounds like someone has thrown a pillow over the speaker...actually needs to be sent back...listening to it, at least TRYING to listen to it is irritating...Music played though it sounds really muffled and horrible. Needs a brighter sound...too bad they don't include bass & treble controls on these things.

Title: Some good, some bad
Body: It's good when you have one. It plays music well and controls your smart devices. There's a few hiccups here and there, but overall, it's good. If I still had the one Echo, this would probably be a 5 star review. The problem came in when I added 2 more Echos around the house.It gets bad when you have them in multiple places around the house. Getting music to play consistently on the multi-room groups is an exercise in frustration. The music will stop playing on one or more of the echos intermittently. Sometimes it comes back on, sometimes it doesn't. Sometimes you try to tell Alexa to play the music on a group, and it will just play on the Echo you're talking to.
