There doesn't seem to be any rhyme or reason to this problem. I normally use Amazon Music. I also have the Plex skill installed, which is a total nightmare, but that may not be Amazon's problem, so I won't discount any stars for that. Bottom line, if you're buying this for whole house music, I would look elsewhere. This just isn't a stable platform for that. If you want to turn off lights, go for it.When these things start flying planes, I'm out.

Title: Good Product!  Lacks battery charge.
Body: I like that it's so simple to play my music, ask questions and set alarms, etc. Bluetooth pairing is easy with "some" items. Also, it WORKS with my firestick tv(I contacted Amazon prior to purchasing and was told it did NOT work with Firestick).  Alexa searches for me on Fire and finds what I ask.  Dislikes:  It holds NO battery charge :(  Certain items to pair are difficult to figure out(still have not).  I considered Alexa when I could no longer buy a small cordless speaker I wanted.  When Alexa went on sale, I purchased.  I'm happy with the purchase and would do so again. Not the best speaker around but definately worth the $39.00 I spent!

Title: Grand baby Hannah and Alexa
Body: Love my dots I have one in every room and I also have twoMy 3 grandkids  arrived in town for New Year. The baby, Hannah, is 20 months old. She is quite familiar with the Echo family of speakers. This happen todayMe: Hannah, it_ time to take a nap. Lie on the sofa. Alexa play lullaby musicAlexa: ok lullaby and bed time musicMusic plays softlyHannah: Lexa. STOP!!______

Title: Okay, but not great
Body: This is a fun gadget, but there is still work to do. Sound quality was great the first day or two  at a moderate volume, but after that the speaker sounds like it is blown when trying to listen to music. The voice recognition doesn_ seem as sophisticated as other devices and my husband often gets a __ sorry... I didn_ get that type of response when trying to use the dot. I have enjoyed the drop in feature for an intercom while I am cooking.

Title: Alexa can do it all!
Body: I got an Echo dot as a wedding gift and in one day we liked it so much that we ordered two more for around the house! Alexa makes life so much easier. Need to make a shopping list just tell her what you want when you think of it during the day. Need to set an alarm before you forget just tell her and she will go off when you need it. Need to set a reminder to call the doctor she can do that too.I use Alexa for so many things. She starts my microwave, she turns off the bedroom lights when I need her to, and she plays music for me at night to help me fall asleep. I also use her all day during work to listen to music.The echo dot alone has a lot of features and it is extremely easy to set up you can have it up and running in less than 1 minute. If you want to be able to use it with your phone you do have to download an app. The echo dot 3rd Generation has decent sound quality it doesn't hurt my ears when I listen to music all day and it does have adjustable sound feature such as the bass and the treble.If you really want to maximize the echo dots potential I highly suggest that you get yourself some Alexa compatible light bulbs and Alexa compatible smart plugs. We went all the way and got an Alexa compatible microwave. You will not regret adding the echo dot 3rd Generation to your smart home Arsenal.

Title: SUPER CONVENIENT, easy to use, very capable.
Body: Pretty awesome device, very VERY useful and convenient. Plan to add more smart features to my house now that I see what this is capable of. I use it for my alarm clock because it is very loud, Bluetooth speaker for my fire TV stick, the find my phone feature is awesome. Still haven't figured out how to send and receive messages to other alexa devices but it's well worth the money, the sound quality really surprised me how good it sounds for music as well. Alexa is definitely my little assistant. Would definitely recommend. A tip for anyone who has or is thinking of getting one, make sure to train alexa to your voice an it will recognize you ALOT better. An it is almost completely voice controlled all the way to the volume settings.

Title: Great Little Device, FUN!
Body: We were given this echo dot as a gift. We weren_ sure how often we_ use it actually. But now we ask Alexa things multiple times a day. We ask for weather forecasts, when our favorite sports teams play next, what we should eat for dinner along with recipe ideas etc. The speaker is great on this device so we frequently listen to music. Set up is fairly quick. You download an app and plug the device in. My family also plays trivia games with the device which we love. There_ so much to do and the price is so reasonable. We appreciate the emails that we receive from Amazon telling us all about the amazing things Alexa can do for us. This device is fun and informative. We recommend it highly. Best gift we ever got that the whole family enjoys.

Title: better sound compared to the 2nd gen
Body: i have the 2nd generation and comparing it to this one, i would say the big difference is the sound quality.. the 2nd gen, i have always connected to a speaker to play music on, while i don_ need to with this 3rd gen since it_ speaker already has a really good sound quality like it was connected to a speaker. other than that, most features are practically the same, though i need to mention that this 3rd gen is more aesthetically pleasing for having a tiny house, it just fit in with the interiors without it looking off. overall, i am very satisfied. i love my alexas _

Title: Can't Use It
Body: I've had my Echo for a month now and it's just sitting there b/c Echos won't connect to wireless networks unless you broadcast your SSID.  I spent two hours talking to Amazon "support".  The first hour was me trying having to constantly re-explain the problem b/c the "tech" didn't understand.  The second hour was me waiting while he opened a support ticket.  The next morning Amazon support calls me at 5am with automated calls.  Finally I get an email saying they are aware of the problem and working on it.  Still waiting to use my Echo...

Title: Every old person needs an Echo Dot
Body: Amazing product. I love my Echo Dot. Finally I can set alarms and timers easily. Now I am going to try to use her with a smart plug to see what happens. I am 66 years old and the Echo Dot is a great help in keeping me aware of cooking times, medication doses and appointments. I could use other types of timers and alarms but if I did that I would no longer have _lexa to talk too. Plus she will play almost every piece of music I ask her for. She will even turn her volume up and down if asked. She has a decent price and is always around for me, day or night.  Plus her sloths jokes are pretty funny.

Title: Better sound quality than older models
Body: Have five older models in two houses.  Bought two new ones and integrate well with older models.  Sound quality is richer.  Also use two [Upgraded] Anker Soundcore 2 Portable Bluetooth Speakers with 12W Stereo Sound, Bluetooth 5, Bassup, IPX7 Waterproof, 24-Hour Playtime, Wireless Stereo.  Was easy to set them up for use and even set to stereo to have split left-right sound.Nice improvements - when I ask time at night (whisper) the dot responds in a quieter voice.

Title: Not exactally what I Expected
Body: I purchased 3 units with intent on using one in my home office, one in the family room and one in the mother-in-law house next door.  First let me say, I watched all the videos and read all the instruction for installing the three units.  Note not all answers are available.While the units will give you most information you ask for, it is the "Drop In" feature that I really was interested in. Unfortunately the drop in gets confused.  When asked to drop in on the office from the family room, the MIL unit activates, same thing happens when asked to drop in on the MIL from the office, the family room gets activated.The Amazon Dot would have been a very good solution to the elderly.  This type of wireless assistant to a senior citizen who does not know how to use or possess smart phone technology, could prove very beneficial.  But much improvement in voice recognition for elderly speakers is needed.  My 89 yo MIL doesn't / can't speak loud enough to activate Alexa.Amazon really has missed the boat, when it comes to use of the Echo for senior's.

Title: Every Generation gets stronger, better, faster, ....
Body: With the onslaught of content coming from google, amazon, and other big companies competing in smart home devices; it's hard to choose. For my smart home I chose Amazon as my primary provider. Smart sticks, smart subs/speakers/hubs/cameras/ everything. This device was my first step in making my room smart.If you're looking for a portable speaker/smart device, than I suggest this. It's not a hub, but it's a part of the Echo family.Portable speakers (with wifi), calculator, someone to tell your dad jokes too or test your wisdom or wits.  Alexa is the voice of the Echo family, and like family, we welcome ours with open arms. The dot can be renamed, (I named mine Echo) she's small enough to go unnoticed, and she's got a loud volume that you'll need to yell over her to be heard.Alexa is kind of like the middle man of making your home smart. Of course, you'll need a hub eventually for things like a smart sub. But if you have Alexa enabled lights, or electronics for that matter, you'll be able to speak with her directly to operate those. I.E.: Alexa, turn the lights on, Alexa, make the lights purple, etc.I use my device every day, mostly as a speaker playing music all the time. For individual listening to music, I would recommend volume level 3.5 or 4.  For the house party, 6-8, depending on actual volume of the party. For hang outs with guests and family, I suggest volume 1-2 for a subtle music. Alexa is also able to take multiple commands at once, so you can tell her to change the volume, dim the lights while increasing the bass of your songs simultaneously.Amazon's music library has literally 20,000,000 songs to choose from; and ad free. That's essential to a man who listen's to music every day for hours on end. (Unlike Spotify, with their ads.....)5/5 for sound5/5 for portability5/5 voice recognition5/5 easy installation5/5 smart home device.

Title: Your Smart Home Starts Here
Body: It's already made our lives better. When we get the smart home set up, it will be super nice to use these to just speak commands and program scheduled household "scenes" (read: ambiance) by fiat. But beware using 2 or more in a single area of the home, unless you have at maximum 3 and name them each differently.Main con: you can only name this thing Alexa, Computer, or Echo. It would be way better to name them whatever the hell you want! After all, you paid for it! If you have to raise your voice, you could end up activating the one in the next room, or even all of your household Alexas - unless you name them differently.Be ready to buy more stuff! That's right, going down this road means you are going to build a smart home (smart light switches, outlets or outlet appliance plug connectors, smart lightbulbs alternatively to the outlet plugs/outlets), etc. This is a good thing, but only if you plan to stick around and enjoy all this in your home for some years to come. If you rent an apartment, it might make more sense to do the one Alexa device in the living room, maybe one in the master bedroom, and then use smart lightbulbs and removable smart outlet plugs. That way, when you move, your stuff can just be packed into a box or two and you're unplugged till you reach the new pad.

Title: Smart Speakers Are Great
Body: I'm in full blown consolidate and condense mode insofar as all of the gadgets, doodads and accompanying paraphernalia I've accumulated over the years. My sister gave us a 1st generation echo dot a couple of Christmases ago which we only recently set-up. I was in love.The old lady followed that up with a 2nd generation Hub and it was off to the races. Getting rid of ancient radios and receivers; storing away albums, tapes and discs. The expanses of empty shelf space are just a beautiful sight to behold. Added ultimate music for $3.99 per month and I'm good to go.Still figuring out all of the features but even so I am impressed with the convenience, compactness and the surprising sound quality. I imagine Google's is pretty comparable but either way I'd say go for it.

Title: speaker kinda sucks if your hearing impaired, but has Many Great abilities update below
Body: Love the ability to set timers!! music playing ok nothing special.be sure and set it to NOT record everything and send it to google for analysis.it is set to on as default.UPDATEwe now own 5 dots and 2 echo 5's this dot has a hard time keeping connected to the internetThe one dot isn't up to snuff it keeps  needing a re-install as it can't stay connected to the net. we have to reset it several times a day and it isn't the farthest from the router there are 2 others farther away. might have to send in for repairs. reccomend to a friend 100% as they keep getting better all the time

Title: It sounds very good to me for it's size and cost!
Body: This is our first echo device. My wife and I like it a lot! Music sounds good on it with it sitting in the middle of a small wooden table. Getting the weather on it is nice. We are getting used to asking questions and enjoy some of the games. Setup was real simple and painless. I got one of the smart switches for a hard to reach lamp in a corner, that works good to. I'd like a couple smart bulbs, but have to wait for a deal on them. I'm seriously thinking of getting one for the bedroom.

Title: Good Upgrade
Body: This is a good upgrade when coming from the Gen 1 device. The sound quality has become much more solid and much less tinny. The large Echo units are certainly much better, but these are nice to have around where space is tight. They are also really easy to hide behind lamps. I only docked a star because it took me about six attempts to connect to wifi. That was super annoying because it does not do that quickly to begin with. That sixth attempt connected finally. The device also kept stating that it was "not registered." There are two methods to pair the Echo Dot and get it linked within the Alexa app. If you purchased the device directly from Amazon, make sure you pair it from the list of devices already on your Device list in the app. You new, unconnected one will already be listed there. If you attempt to pair it by just clicking + and adding the device itself, the platform is not smart enough to realize you are pairing it to its existing account. So, it thinks it is someone else trying to connect it, thereby making it think it's "not registered." All set now, just not a 5-star experience (four echos).

Title: Good purchase.....love it...even though it is like a kid...
Body: Yes, Alexa to me is like having a small kid because sometimes I have to yell at it so that it could stop or to listen to me. I think Alexa has flaws like if you ask "Do you work for the CIA?" Alexa does listen but it will shutdown without responding, there are several questions that she does that.I love the idea of having all my smart devices from home on one app, well i still have the other apps, but Alexa app can control all other devices. I like it because I can just instruct it to turn off a light or on, I also like Alexa because I just add items to my shopping list while I am cooking. I do recommend this device....I would love Alexa to partner with Google, that way you can have a superb search engine, currently Alexa uses Bing.

Title: My elderly father is challenged...
Body: I bought echo and echo plus in hopes that my elderly father of 85 could use  it to help him turn off lights and possibly call for help should he need assistance. I have had this product for about a week.  I found it difficult to set up the Echo on my own, however technical assistance was very friendly to use.  Alexa often does not understand my father, and my father who is 'profoundly' hard of hearing cannot understand Alexa very well.  So far, my father can't comprehend how to command Alexa.  Perhaps with a little more time and training he will catch on.  As for my me, age 60, I love having Alexa around to turn off the lights and play some music, and ask her what the weather is today, and other things as I get to know her.  Hope to check back as I become accustomed to you you know how it goes...

Title: Make life better,  buy it!
Body: This is my 2nd Alexa device. What I like about it is the ease of getting it set up. Being  a prime member the device comes to me registered with amazon straight out of the box. The only thing i had to do was connect it to my wifi and have it sync up with my Original  Alexa 1st generation speaker( which still works great after 4 years). The 3rd generation Dot is perfect for my bedroom.  It sits on my dresser taking up next to no space at all. I use it as an alarm, weather center, music, and story teller. Could i live without this device? Yes i sure could, but why would I when this device makes my personal life easier. What i mean is. I dont have to turn on the T.V to get the news  push buttons to set a alarm clock turn on a radio to listen to music that i probably dont like even flip on a light switch or turn on the tv and change the channel.  I can even re-order toilet paper or ramen noodles if i want or need to.

Title: echo dot is a POS
Body: POS, can't get it to work properly with my original echo.....if we have them both on, it floods our network so bad, the WLAN light on our router stays on steady.update 8-8-2019My husband has had 3 calls from customer service shortly after I posted this.  My husband is VERY technically expert especially with networking stuff (as a matter of fact, the first 2 calls he got were from people who did not know ANYWHERE near as much about troubleshooting this problem and he did). The 3rd call he at least spoke with someone that was technically competent.  They worked together for a couple of hours or so and could not come up with a cause or solution.  The person he talked to said they would research it some more and get back to him in 2 weeks but that's now been about 5-6 weeks ago.  Obviously, they have no clue.

Title: Alexa is the best part of my smart home
Body: I can get in bed with the light on and get settled in, and tell Alexa to turn off the lights. I can stumble into the kitchen in the morning and tell Alexa to turn on some lights and set them to 25% brightness. I can tell Alexa to clean whichever room I want vacuumed. I also have multiple things on Alexa controlled plug ins, like scentsy burners, programmed to come on an hour before my spouse gets home and go off three hours later.Alexa does it all with very little error. WAAAAAY Better than even a year ago.

Title: THIS IS BETTER SOUND QUALITY?
Body: I own a total of (3) 2nd Gen Dots and now (2) of the 3rd Gen and I personally cannot stand the sound quality!  I've made so many adjustments trying to make it sound less boomy and muffled to no avail.  I think they tried too hard for such a limited size device.  I can't believe I'm actually saying it, but I prefer the 2nd Gen sound.  I can barely understanding what Alexa is saying 1/2 the time and I find myself asking to repeat and continually adjusting volume and EQ settings.  Music is definitely better, but asking questions or having conversation?  Meh.

Title: Behold the power of listening.
Body: Ok, so honestly the best part about Alexa is I can scream from the other room and she will listen and answer me. My own husband and kids don't even do that. I never have to repeat myself, she's polite, and she always answers back in a polite tone. If it takes owning a speaker to be heard in my household then by God I'm doing it.Added bonus, my husband is convinced she records all of our conversations and hates being around her. I like to randomly move her into whatever room he's in and watch the hilarity unfold. If she really is recording us then whoever is in charge of listening and reviewing said conversations will be thoroughly entertained and will probably seek psychological help for our household with all the talk of poop and farts.

Title: Very multifunctional, worth buying!!
Body: I absolutely love having Alexa in our home! We use her for so much more than music.I rarely watch the news so I rely on her for the weather, she also provides recipes. I use her timer function often to set device timers for my kids and I absolutely love using the music alarm for the mornings. I also use the thunderstorm sounds to help relax and fall asleep at night.I was skeptical at first about buying one, but its definitely one of our better purchases this year!

Title: YOU ARE PROMPT WITH YOUR ORDERS. I APPRECIATE IT.
Body: I am amazed at the technology embedded in this device.  From the first time I activated it, I have been intrigued with all I can do with it. Even though I am in my late 80's, I think I surprised my son when I wanted Alexa to put a "treble" on the voice that was coming over the machine. She told me the range of treble possibilities, and I kept giving commands till it reached the right range for me. It is wonderful.. My son said he would have never thought of that.

Title: Always Love my ECHO
Body: Love the product. I can order or play music anyplace in my house. Love the echo dot. If you have low bandwidth however, be aware the Echo uses up bandwidth and can cause internet interruption if you have several devices on at the same time.. This is not a big deal for those of you who have several routers.  I turn off mine in the kitchen if we are watching TV.  I leave the other one one all the time upstairs in my Childs room.  If I have my Smart tv on, and someone is using the iPad, then we can loose bandwidth and loss of connection. Like I said before if you have unlimited bandwidth you should not have an issue at all.  It was easy to set up, and a cinch to teach her to take requests such as play a iTunes play list when it prefers Amazon music.  I like that I can switch between iTunes and Amazon music.  Alexia knows more every time I use it.... she knows.... everything ..... lol

Title: Alexa, please write a review for me
Body: I already had a 2nd generation Echo Dot, an Echo Auto and the Alexa app on my laptop. When I plugged in the new Echo, it instantly synced and did everything I needed on its own. I honestly can't remember how difficult it was to set up my first Echo, but I know it wasn't a challenge. The third generation of Echo is really much nicer looking than the second generation. The sound quality is dramatically better. It unobtrusively sits in the living room without looking out of place. It responds really quick to commands. I will probably get a few more to add throughout the house and will simply replace my second generation unit. I'm continually adding skills and find life is much simpler with Alexa around. When Alexa is added to my refrigerator, washer and dryer, and many other appliances, and Amazon grocery arrives in my neighborhood, my life will be fulfilled. I can ask Alexa to microwave my popcorn on my Amazon microwave and ask my refrigerator to reorder milk. The day is coming and i will happily embrace living in an Amazon home. I'm still waiting for Amazon cellular service and an Amazon car. (Hint-hint there, Amazon!) Imagine if we could only have one bill a month for EVERYTHING we need! Ok, yeah, I might be dreaming. But with gadgets as awesome as the third generation of Echo Dot, I think Amazon could make it a reality!

Title: Definitely worth the price!! Fun little addition to Alexa.
Body: I've been thinking about ordering an Echo for ages. I've recently purchased a Ring Doorbell and decided to finally pick a couple up so that I could put one on each floor of my house, link them with my Alexa, and have one on each floor therefore beign able to hear my Ring device wherever I am.Anyway, first Amazon is running an amazing deal! I purchased two at $25!!!The sound quality is good. I guess it could be a little louder, but there's a lot of sound coming out of that little cylinder. I can hear my doorbell and it's loud enough for my whole daycare to have a dance party, so what more could you really want?!?!We liked them so much my oldest asked for one for his room. At $25 I didn't hesitate.Probably my favorite feature is the "announce" feature. I can tell Alexa to announce anything and she will repeat my message through all the other devices in the house. No more up and down three flights of stairs to ask someone to take the garbage out!!To sum it up, the Echo is definitely worth the price and has rejuvenated my whole family's interest in the Alexa we've had for 4 or 5 years.

Title: Great sound quality from such a little speaker
Body: I got this with a Amazon blink camera bundle and was impressed at how helpful it can be. I ended up getting a smart plug too so that I can use Alexa to turn on/off a lamp in our living room. It was super convenient and love that I can just issue a command and the light responds within a second!My wife uses this for pandora and the sound quality is quite impressive for such a small speaker.I have noticed sometimes Alexa doesn_ quite catch what you are trying to say, but 9 out 10 times it will get it correct and is very quick and accurate. My kids will use it to ask the weather for the day, or just talk to it... which is where the mute button comes in real handy.It has a mute and volume buttons so that it will mute listening to you and you can of course change the volume on Alexa responses.All in all it is a nice concept have and comes in handy when building a smart home.

Title: Pretty cool
Body: I ordered two, one for my husband and one for myself. My husband uses his for sleep sounds. The other one was set up in the kitchen because i basically live in there between cooking, cleaning, and work. I absolutely love it so far. I really like not having to stop cooking to look up something for my recipes. A little lazy, but really great for my time management. My kids really like it. They've been playing the Lemonade Stand game and the animal exercise game like crazy. It does a decent job understanding us, my 3 year old included. You do have to be extremely specific when you ask a question though. Not a big deal. The drop in is really fun with kids too! We like it so much, we're considering buying the kids version next!But.....my absolute favorite thing about them is that i can make phone calls. We live in a very rural area with basically no cell service so this was a big help!

Title: I should have waited! Could have saved 15$ on all three purchased!
Body: I bought one love it ,just bought two more for my sisters as gifts about two weeks ago 30$ each. I would have saved 10$ if I bought them today bummer. She does have her issues. She can_  do a lot of things I was hoping she could do.Sometimes I have to yell at her. loI,Her learning needs improvement. I also bought a smart plug and a smart light Bulb both which said,Alexa voice compatible.But the light bulb only turns the lights on and off with Alexa So I had to down load three separate apps for full function of the light.color changing, scenes etc...But I still like her. She is still a fairly reliable assistant who never calls in sick! But she does have malfunctions occasionally. If only she could sling. I also enjoy slinging, your first time slinging is always so Special!

Title: Noticeably better than 2nd
Body: I have a whole bunch of Echos throughout the house, and decided to try out the 3rd gen to see what was better. Turns out... a lot!First, it is noticeably larger than the 2nd gen. It's also noticeably heavier. I love the new design, which is a little bit rounder and the LED light ring is better integrated into the edge. Seamless.Sound is also noticeably improved with better bass. There is a larger power brick instead of just a simple USB cable, most likely due to larger power requirements of the internal components.If you're just passing by the 3rd Gen Dot, you probably won't think it's much different... but it truly is. Great job, Amazon. I'm excited to see what you do with the 4th gen after seeing so many great changes from 2nd to 3rd.

Title: We are in absolute LOVE with the Echo Dot!!
Body: I got the 3rd generations in every room now. All because of the sound quality. I love these little echos! I use mine alot for music and the alarm clock. The kids use their for jokes, music, to find out questions about things for school work or just things they are curious about. I love having it because Inised to play music off of my phone so if I got a call or a text of course my music would get interrupted or if my phone died i_ have to put it on the charger in another room. So this is very helpful in that arena. Also we use the drop in feature when we tell the kids to do something, or when we leave the house we drop in on the dog so he can hear our voice and we can hear if he is barking like crazy at random people outside. Its really fancy to us.

Title: Still Figuring it Out
Body: Yet another device that has to be set up using a smartphone.  Be careful downloading the app from the AppStore.  I downloaded two wrong apps before I found the actual Echo Setup app.  Other apps that are designed to make you think they're what you need pop up at the top of the list.  I finally had to delete them from my phone and start over again in order to get the Echo to work.  I still can't figure out how to link it to other Bluetooth speakers - using it is not as intuitive as the ads would have you think.  Still, once I got the basic stuff down, it's fun to use and convenient if you like to listen to lots of different types of music.

Title: A Scam?
Body: I have an echo dot and it works fine. I gave a gift of one and tried to set it up. Impossible! The instructions were bewildering and impossible to follow so we called a chat person who could barely speak English and she informed us we needed something for a firewall? which she could install for $385.00. After an hour of confusing and nonsensical instructions, we gave up.  We were convinced we had been preempted by scam people in Canada. We still cannot get it to connect and will now have to take her computer to an apple store to see what information they obtained from it in our conversation with these people.

Title: Great Tech!
Body: After waiting, I finally purchased my first Echo Dot.  I love it...what nice technology!  At its price I highly recommend it.  I just ordered another and will buy a third shortly.  I purchased 10 smart plugs and it_ a breeze now controlling, fans, heaters, lighting, my sound bar, air purifiers, coffee makers, etc, etc.  I can check the weather add to my shopping list, open the garage door and have Alex wake me whenever the need arises.  And all from my chair without getting up.  I can say _lexa turn on Security from my bed and external flood light respond.  This is great tech!

Title: I Love This Product, Other Than the Sound Going Up and Down
Body: I love this echo dot, but the speaker is sometimes fuzzy (I don't listen to it loudly), and the sound goes up and down, like commercials do on a TV.  It's very annoying, and the voice recognition feature should also be a little more reliable (things like Alexa volume up, Alexa volume down, etc).  I also feel like I'm screaming at it for it to recognize my voice.  It seems to recognize male voices better, perhaps due to the deeper voice? I don't have an accent, so that isn't the issue, I just wish that it worked a bit better.

Title: Good Little Alexa
Body: Small and sleek; easy to disguise behind flowers or small decorations. The sound quality is good, especially for such a small speaker. I am disappointed, however, with the voice recognition. We also have an Alexa Echo and it seems that both of their "hearing" has gone very downhill. Sometimes it'll take us a few times screaming into the actual microphone to get a response. Other than that, it's a handy and inexpensive little tool that I'd recommend for any and every household.

Title: Great Echo Dot!
Body: I love having these echo dots on each of my rooms. They have so many functions for our family. We use them primarily for music, alarms, timers, lists & intercom.  A few things we often ask it about the weather, what time it is, how to spell things, etc. The voice recognition has definitely become better too as the speaker for listening to music. I would definitely recommend. There are a ton more things you can do with this but these are the features we use on a daily basis.

Title: Umm!
Body: I have an Echo in my bedroom and thought it would be nice to have music in the kitchen since I spend so much time there. However, I love my Echo but the Dot just does not have the same sound as the Echo. It does provide music and Alexa integration is okay, but I will be upgrading to another Echo for the kitchen in the near future - probably on Prime Day, and then I'll use the Dot in the Master bathroom for those long soaks in the tub.

Title: LOVE MY ECHO DOT!
Body: This is a wonderful product and much better from the older models.  The speaker is quite loud (but you can connect a bluetooth speaker to the device if you wish it to be louder).  Very easy to set up.  If you do not want Alexa to call random people in your phone, when setting up the device there is a question asking you to give permission to Alexa to access your phone contacts.  Great product!  Highly recommend!

Title: Easy to use, when things work correctly
Body: I've had about a 75% success rate on my voice commands. My song and artist requests are often misinterpreted. Then if anything is playing I'm left shouting twice as loud as the news or music that's on to get it to listen for a command.  My biggest issue has been with the Alexa app, and it's speaker group settings. I bought this Dot to plug into a home stereo receiver, and there is no adjustment for the split-second delay when grouping my Echo speaker and this Dot using the aux out.  The Alexa app is slow and difficult to use for anything really. The sound out of the speaker is average quality and volume for the size, not great. There's no portable option with the 3rd gen now that it requires the AC adapter instead of a USB cable for power.

Title: Always a helpful kitchen helper
Body: We use this in our kitchen.  We play Spotify on it and ask her to set timers, alarms and reminders.  She's a very useful assistant.  We don't have a landline so I use the drop in feature to call and check on my kids when we aren't home.  She doesn't take up a lot of space yet has a decent speaker.  I keep adding them to other rooms in the house.  I was skeptical of the privacy aspect of an Echo but found the app easy to use and the content easy to control so far.

Title: Very cool item, but it & you have a learning curve.
Body: UPDATE:I can't figure out how to make the DOT play music at the same time as using an external plugged in speaker...and or... I can't make it work on its own when its plugged into an external speaker.Original review: I never wanted an item that is listening all the time, BUT... when my iphone & dock for my stereo was dying, this is about as cheap of a replacement as I found.  Best part, you can link a bunch of them together and listen to music all over the house.Challenges are its & your learning curve to make the thing do what you want....  I have only had it a couple of weeks and used it 5-6 times, but so far pretty darned cool.I want a list of the correct phrases to say for things to happen, I will search on line to see if it exists.

Title: Worth it!
Body: I bought this for my condo.  It is a smart home. Attached fast and was working with the smart plugs in seconds. I had to replace my router two weeks later and this attached to it super fast.  Whole house was re-attached within two hours, most of it going to different plugs.  I do not get a chance to set it to my ecobee or K_vo but that is on my bucket list Well worth it!

Title: Improved Speaker
Body: This is our second echo dot.  My husband wanted one in his man cave so he could listen to Amazon Prime music while working out in our basement. The speaker on this new 3rd generation is improved over our 2nd generation dot which is in the kitchen.  One great feature is Drop In. Drop In works as an intercom system between our 2 dots. If I am in the kitchen and my husband is in the basement I can call to him using Drop In.

Title: Buy it!!
Body: It provides hours of entertainment. Alexa is my very best assistant for my home office. She plays back ground music, she searches items, reminds my son to read and get ready for bed, make phone calls, reminds me to get ready for work, plays game with my sone while I_ busy working in my home office, tracks my Amazon shipment.Sound quality is impressive.It_ so much easier and faster then googling.

Title: Great sound for the size
Body: I think other reviews have covered the many pros and cons of this device over others, so I_l just reiterate how this compares to the two others I own. Compared to Borge the second gen dot and to the Spot, the sound quality of this device is much louder and more dynamic. We have been really impressed by it after. Wing used to listening to music on the other two Alexa devices. We had even purchased a Bluetooth speaker to use with the second generation dot, but it is absolutely unnecessary to use with the third generation. The Spot_ audio is fine, but lacks the depth of the 3rd gen Dot.This unit is a bit larger than the previous generations, but it_ worth the extra counter space. It otherwise works just like the others, with no other issues in terms of Alexa integration or voice recognition. That technology is continually evolving, so we are consistently seeing advances in how we can interact with and be better understood by Alexa. Great purchase.

Title: Very Poor quality sound
Body: I much prefer the gen 2 Dot. This one has very muddy and distorted sound It sounds ok playing music, but I don't use it for music, that's what my desktop computer is for. When I ask Alexa something, I can barely understand her. The gen 2 Dot is much better for what I use it for.Suggestion to Amazon: incorporate some kind of EQ.Update:I have never had any problems with Amazon returns, until now. I sent these back a week ago and customer service says it can be another 2 weeks before I get my refund, even though they have the items back.

Title: Best little smart assistant
Body: Received as a gift from mt daughter.  I have been very impressed with the little device so far.  It has very good at detecting and accurately interpreting voice interactions.  The responses have been helpful and relevant to queries. Sound quality has been very good, especially considering its small size.  Music playback is nice and rich, just don't expect to be thumping gas-rich tunes at loud volumes without some distortion. And of course,  if you are a big Amazon user, the Amazon integration is superior.

Title: It_ something you didn_ know you needed
Body: I have only had this for a few weeks, and with the exception of one problem it has worked as expected. I have enjoyed listening to music more frequently and it_ convenient to turn lights off and on. I had one incident when Alexa stopped talking although she was following commands. I unplugged the unit and plugged it back in and it was fine after that. This was a gift and I don_ think I would have purchased it myself but I am finding it useful.

Title: Room to improve
Body: Alexa is very good at picking up what I say most of the time. Sometimes Alexa's answers affected by what I asked earlier. Just like if I say "Alexa, what's 60 degrees in Celsius," it gets me the answer, but if I was asking it something else and then ask the same question as a follow-up question, it didn't know how to answer.I asked Alexa how far is Portland OR from Seattle WA. It doesn't know how to answer that. I think that should be easy.

Title: Doesn_ understand simple commands
Body: You tell Alexa _urn off the lights and she says _ didn_ find a device named lights.  When you say _urn off the lights in the bedroom  she says _here are no devices name lights bedroom.  But if you phrase it differently like _urn on the lights in the bedroom she suddenly realizes I have Hue, and Lutron hubs and does something.  It seems like Alexa should be smart enough to know the room she is assigned to, and without being specific the generic term _ights should automatically refer to the ones in that same assigned room.I also use a Logitech Harmony with hub.  With the media control specifically, the Alexa and Logitech don_ seem to integrate well with _ctivities, so  when you want to do something like _atch Netflix (which is an activity on my Logitech remote that turns on the TV, Xbox, and the audio amplifier), once again Alexa I gets stupid and claims I have no devices that can do that operation.  Instead I must generically say turn on the Xbox (which also turns on the other devices), But doesn_ switch the inputs automatically.In general it just feels like she needs to understand more slang, and metaphorical terms... the current implementation is very frustrating to use because you have to memorize specific phrases and talk like a computer.

Title: Love this device
Body: I bought 3 of these for around the house just to try them out after seeing other echo devices at my daughter's house and how love them. I can without a doubt money well spent. My younger boys love Alexa and talk to her all the time and she not ever let us down. Speaker is good with voice and music. I put 1 in the garage mainly for the gaurd feature but it is able to play music loud enough that you can listen while working on projects. I will get a couple more when they go back on sale maybe prime days .

Title: BAD CUSTOMER SERVICE!!!!!
Body: Amazon has horrible customer service. If you have any problems with your account amazon disconnects all of your Alexa_ and if you have your refrigerator, lights, ring, garage door hooked up to Alexa like I do then nothing works and amazon solution is for you as the customer fix it yourself even though they are the ones that deleted everything from my account. In my case they did this twice to me and sent me emails in French about why they did it. I_ an American and only speak English!!! The amazon employees on the phone are no help either. First thing out of the team leaders mouth was I can_ do anything but send a email. I_e been a prime member since 2004 and this is how they treat their customers!!!

Title: Great little echo
Body: Real nice little echo that is convenient in my living room to control my tv and lights. The sound quality is not as full and loud as my full size echos, but that_ okay because I use my sound system in the living room. A great less expensive than a full size echo option for rooms where you have a sound system already in place. But, don_ be fooled, you can still play quality music from this if you had to, it_ just for a stand alone speaker, the full echo is better...obviously because the dot is like a quarter of the height and speaker size...but quality is great for its size. For voice controls though, and in terms of hearing and understanding Alexa, this is still great...makes an excellent, less expensive extension to my echo ecosystem. Probably will get another dot soon for the kitchen.

Title: Echo Dot Third Generation
Body: I was given a 3rd generation Echo Dot as a gift.  I have a 2nd generation Echo Dot which I own for a couple of years.  To be perfectly honest I like the sound of my old 2nd generation Dot better than the new one.  The new Dot is much prettier looking but the sound is more muffled than the old Dot.  I use them both in different rooms but I prefer the sound of the old Dot.  I gave the 3rd generation Dot 4 stars because of the very nice look of it.

Title: 3 month warranty only on these devices
Body: So we purchased a echo dot gen 3 over the holiday sale, received it in December of 2018. In May of 2019 we heard a slight vibration in the speaker like it was blown. A month later it's rattles like a pop can at volumes over lever 4. Contacted Amazon customer service and the said the device only has a three month warranty and the best they could do was offer a 15% discount on a new device. We enjoy the echo products and have multiple throughout the house, and they are used to control our lights. Just keep in mind the warranty isn't worth _.

Title: Grandma loves it
Body: My 91 year old Grandma saw a commercial with Alexa turning on and off the lights and she didn't understand how it worked.  Her birthday rolled around a couple weeks later and I got her a secondary Alexa (the Echo, she already has the main larger base) plus a few smart LED's for her back sunporch where she likes to sit and watch TV into the evening hours.  We were celebrating her birthday as it got dark and I said, "Hey Grandma, watch this.  Alexa, turn on the Sunporch" and all her lights came on.  She loved it.  She now uses it to listen to her favorite old school music, and when it gets dark, she doesn't even have to get out of her chair to light up the room.Downside: I will now probably have to get her more smart lights to "magically" turn on and off other rooms in the house.

Title: I didn_ know what I was missing and my family loves it too!
Body: I put off bringing anything like this into my home for privacy concerns. I finally decided to get one for my patio to pair with my Bluetooth soundbar for streaming music and to avoid draining the battery on my phone.When I discovered all the usefulness of this device I decided to get an Echo Dot for every room, a kids model for my child, and an Echo Show for the kitchen for a total of 5 Echo devices.It_ been a pleasure to drop in on different rooms to speak with my family if my hands are full. No more shouting between rooms. I also love being able to call my extended family_ and friends Alexa devices. The skills and game are great also. We choose the ones we are most interested in and continue adding more. I hope we can keep up with them. The best ones are the multiplayer games that encourages family time.My child_ echo dot kids filters songs and content with illicit language or subjects. So I_ less concerned about what is playing on that than let_ say YouTube. I can see many future years of enjoyment.I gave it 4 stars because Alexa needs work on understanding enunciation of some words and if the streaming music volume is loud, you have to yell Alexa!!!

Title: This thing is creepy!
Body: This thing is ALWAYS listening, I don't like it. I keep it unplugged until I want to listen to music then I plug it in. When products you talk about in your home privately starts appearing on your home computer as suggestion then it's time to unplug. If you don't mind that then I guess it's not a bad device.

Title: Very useful and easy to use
Body: I love my Alexa. I love the ease of setup and how simple it is to use. I have Multiple Sclerosis and I don_ see well and days I cannot get up and so this device is so helpful to me in many ways. I use it from everything from playing music, to checking the daily forecast, to turning on and off lights. It_ not just a cool thing to have, it_ very useful for people like me who need a bit of help. I_ still new to using it and have not yet discovered it to its fullest potential so hopefully I can give more information as I discover it.

Title: DO NOT BUY, even Spotify does not work
Body: What it can do for me: Spotify, Alexa skills. No Spotify not really work in stereo mode. Nothing works.What it cannot: read Apple News, read Books, Podcast, or play anything I bought from iTunes.And of course you cannot use smart speaker to have the same experience as browsing fb, Ins, and watch movies.Plus the sound is even worse than Sony SRS-XB10 Portable Speaker. I mean I already lowered my expectation.Really disappointed. Done

Title: Problems???
Body: I can't understand it, because this Gen must be based on the previous gen but I the 3rd gen dots seem to be lacking compared to the previous gen. I have 2 of the 3rd gen and they share the same two problems: they frequently lose their internet connection and their voice recognition has problems. This may be due to the fact they are set up in a different house than my others. At one location, I have a mesh router but here I don't. I am also running a femtocell near my router which I do not do at my other location. Whatever the cause, I am not happy with the performance of either of these

Title: Great deal on Amazon Echo Dot
Body: This is a great little gadget, it plays music from my iTunes Library, as well as Apple Music and Amazon Music.  It was a real pain to set up though.  It took two long, involved conversations with Amazon to get this puppy working, though.  Very happy now it is up and working but still cannot access all the music on iTunes, have no idea why.  All in all, a great price for a delivery that was just 2 days from the date of ordering of an exceptional product that works great.

Title: Works well
Body: Overall I have to say that this makes my life way easier.  Generally it's very good at what it does.  However if your getting one for the first time know that you will need to say things exactly as it's programed to interprite.  This is especially true when using voice to activate routines.  The software that runs this device hasn't quight grasped the idea that it should understand synonyms. Not a deal breaker,  just something to know.

Title: Works way better then Siri and Cortina
Body: Its a valid 2nd to Google voice recognition.  Decent speaker.  I took off one star because it keeps saying another computer is accessing my Sirius XM account (literally did it after I immediately changed my Sirius XM password to lock out all other accounts and see if it would still do this).  Its a bug.  Directly going to sirius XM webside does not do the same and neither does roku for same account (I put in new pass for both).

Title: Frustrating
Body: Let's get straight to the cons:- Hard time to pick the signal from the noise. In NYC where sirens go off every 10 mins, Alexa does not seem to respond to requests (might just need a better mic or maybe the algorithm needs more optimization).- Very often the speech rec. does not understand my requests and I have to shout and speak very slowly in order for Alexa to understand.- Wired.

Title: The Short Unhappy Life of My Echo Dot
Body: I only got the Echo Dot because Amazon customer service told me I could not control my second AmazonBasics microwave with my Amazon Tap, which worked fine with my first microwave.  That was incorrect.  All I had to do was change my vocal command from "Alexa, two minutes microwave" to "Alexa, two minutes ON microwave."  Of course, I only found that out AFTER I bought two Echo devices as a result of the conversation with Amazon.Because Amazon had a $99 deal for Echo and Echo Dot together, I pounced.  I didn't realize you needed the same Echo model to use two of them to produce stereo sound.  I have two new Echo devices that cannot produce stereo sound together.  With that realization, both devices lost value.My Amazon Tap -- whose mention the Amazon customer service people found funny for some reason -- has a rechargeable battery and a charging base as well as a micro-USB port in the actual unit.  I use it as a portable device throughout my house and outside.  Really well-designed, portable and flexible.  Both the Echo and Echo dot require a/c power, lowering further the value of both for my purposes.The increase in sound quality between the Echo and the Dot is easily worth the price difference.  I was dumb to get the Dot.In a logical progression of a product that lost utility the longer I owned it, I dropped it, the sound stopped working (the lights responded to my vocal commands and it started the microwave though) and I threw it out.  In venting my frustration with a hammer, I learned the unit is sturdy and I could only put a slight hole in it after about 10 hard whacks on a concrete floor.I feel better now.  All that stress and disappointment only cost me $29.

Title: Echo Dot is a Game Changer
Body: The Amazon Echo Dot is great, right out of the box. It connected effortlessly to my home wifi and now it practically runs the show! My 1940's home is slowly becoming a "smart" home as I add gadgets that work with my Amazon Echo Dot - who says you can't teach an old dog new tricks! Like turning on lamps by asking Alexa to do it and finding the perfect music for just about every occasion - instantly. Sometimes Alexa gets a little annoyed when my family barks commands at "her" - she knows just the right phrase to put everyone in their place. Very quick come-backs - you almost forget you are talking to a computer. Alexa has become part of the family. Don't know how we got along with out her! We even took her along on a recent vacation. My radio isn't very happy and neither is the stereo system. Maybe I'll get a smart plug so that the Echo Dot can bring them up to speed. If you're thinking about dipping your toes into the smart pool, start with the Echo Dot. You will wonder how you have gotten along without it...I know I do.

Title: Built for harrasment, not intelligent at all, poor voice recognition.
Body: Wow, this thing is going to harass you ad infinitum until you go online a few times and figure out the 8 places you have to go to disable the harassment. And even after that you'll get email spam until you find the 5 other places to go to turn off that off as well.I previously had a Google Home Mini, and it never harassed me at all. I bought the Echo because it's advertised as being able to control your Fire TV devices, but it can't. It can only do less than a handful of things with Fire TV. In fact you can't even put the Fire TV to sleep or wake it up to turn on your AV system.And, amazingly, the couple of things it can do with the Fire TV can only be done on one device. Yes, that's right. Amazon has crippled the software so you have to buy a separate Echo device for each Fire TV device.On top of that it's just as unintelligent as the Google Home Mini, and the voice recognition is just as bad. In fact I would have returned it but I'd already given my Home Mini away to a friend.

Title: I bought 8 Echo Dots
Body: I purchased 8 Gen 3 Echo Dots when the price dropped to $19.99/each and kept 6 of them. I gifted the other two. Placed one in every room of our home except the bathrooms, and told my teenagers they could use them as bluetooth speakers. They are worth it for me to use with the drop in feature, when I don't want to walk to the other side of the house to ask my son to come and do dishes in the kitchen. I also use them to drop in on my college daughter, and vice versa. The sound quality is greatly improved over the Gen 2, and makes me feel special when I connect them all together to play music in every room while I'm cleaning the house. It's a dance party with me and the vacuum (which will soon be replaced by an Alexa-enabled iRobot soon, I'm sure). The dots were my intro to Alexa and home automation. Now she runs the light show at our home, controlling everything from our front porch and exterior patio lights, to my daughter's dorm lights so she doesn't have to get down from her bunk bed. My son uses her to impress his friends with all his colored light strips and smart-mouthed responses he can program her to say. My toddler has learned to ask her to play lullabies when he wants music to sleep. My husband hasn't yet warmed up to her, so I'm glad she has a mute button on the one next to our bed. He wasn't even impressed when I showed him that she could turn our TV on and off and change the channels on Dish Network. In the meantime I will continue to plan how I want her to soon control our deadbolts, garage door and clean the floors while I'm sleeping. She's cheaper than a housekeeper. Thanks, Amazon!

Title: This is prefect for my garage
Body: I have the echo show, four 2nd gen dots and bought this thinking I would put this in my bedroom on the nightstand next to the bed. I must say I like the sound and bass of the 2nd gen better for my bedroom. This third gen does have better sound and more bass, but that is the problem. It has too much bass and I found that the thumbing next to the bed made it harder to go to sleep. So I put my 2nd gen back by the bed and use this 3rd gen in the garage. It sounds fantastic there and the added bass and larger volume makes it sound great there,  as where the 2nd gen sounded to small and tinny in the garage. This is prefect for my garage.

Title: Dont buy amazon products till you read this
Body: Purchased 2 echos and phillips hue lights worked grwat about (2 years or so still loved the products and bought a 3rd echo. In feb, amazon updated alexa s/w and it keeps adding multiple lights and in order to use it, I have to open alexa app, delete all the duplicates and then it works fine.  Amazon tells me they wont fix it unless I pay a technician to debug their update! Really, How about this idea, everyone I speak to will hear this B.S.and how the google product works fine for half the price. SORRY BEZOS, you clearly think your customers are idiots that you can rip off and get away with it. Poor business model to break a customers product you sold them and then plan on charging them to fix it.I'm sure this is illegal. At least 100 purchases per year lost plus everyone I tell this to who chooses not to give their money to crooks.Wake up Amazon, you are not too big to fail...

Title: Does exactly what it_ made to do
Body: Does exactly what it_ supposed to phenomenally. I bought two of them to run my smart apartment and they haven_ let me down.Audio quality is pretty decent. Although I have a home theater setup and an Orbi Voice for my music needs, this does a good job when I_ putting something together in the living room and don_ feel like turning on my home theater.Phone calls are a little disappointing. I can barely hear the other person even with it turned all the way up and the person on the other end says it sounds very muffled.Anyways, for the things I need it to do (routines, turning stuff on and off, random questions) it does just great so I_ happy.

Title: It's a good thing to have. I use it every day.
Body: For the most part I have really enjoyed my Echo Dot 3rd generation. I love being able to make myself a playlist using Amazon Music on my phone. Sometimes we don't have a very good Wi-Fi signal and that interferes with Alexa working correctly. The company recommends that the Echo Dot be placed 8 inches from a wall. I wasn't able to do that. I put mine on my end table and cleaned the table off as much as possible. Believe me if you don't keep the table cleared off as much as possible it will block the signal of the Wi-Fi and Alexa won't be able to work.

Title: Just as good as the full-sized option!
Body: I bought this so we can "call" from upstairs to downstairs.... well I put it in the kitchen and it hasn't made its way upstairs!  Great addition to my kitchen and works just as well as the full-sized Alexa in the house.I tell Alexa my grocery list, she makes it and then we both have access to it through the app for shopping.  She sets cooking alarms for me, multiple at a time too (most frequently used command).  Seriously, an Alexa in the kitchen is the best thing ever.Guess I need to by another Dot for upstairs.....

Title: _hall we play a game?
Body: Second-guessing my purchase.  This is more helpful for someone who has a lot of Smart home products. I don_, so I don_ see the value in owning it.  Seems like more of a gimmick.  I don_ care for the level of  intrusiveness into my data - this Machine wants you to link EVERYTHING so that it can spy on your habits, be it tv viewing or shopping.  You are basically welcoming Amazon into your home!!! While loading the dishwasher the other day, I guess the stupid thing hear me loading dishes.  As soon as I logged into Prime, what do I see but an ad for Dishwasher Detergent from Amazon!  That never happens.  Hey, I freely admit my paranoia with this gadget;  the things just plain creeps me out.  I_l probably end up sending it back or giving it to someone else.

Title: List of Changes compared to 2nd gen
Body: The 3rd generation doesn't do anything new in terms of core functionality (2nd gen can do everything 3rd gen can do), but made some enhancements to the overall designGoing to put my original review of 2nd gen Echo Dot at the end, in that review i compared it to the original echo (with speakers) and go through most of the features. Now let's list the changes compared to 3rd gen:1. New lookBigger and weightierFeels more premium. Visually it blends in better with your home decor rather than a hockey puck sitting on the table.No Amazon logo instead has this fabric-like material around it. Very similar to the top of the  Google Home Mini.2. 4 microphonesHas 4 microphones; one around each of the buttons. 2nd gen only had one in the center.Able to hear you better, especially in the morning as you don't have to raise your voice to tell Alexa to turn off the alarm.Has higher pick up range by a few feet. Very similar to mic pickup on Google Home Mini3. Better soundSpeakers on the device is a night-and-day difference compared to the 2nd generation especially when instrumentals are playing. Still not as good as the original echo with speaker built in4. DC powerUses a proprietary DC cable instead of micro-usb, which i'm not in favor of.Can take up outlet plug. May be troublesome if you plan to use it on a power brick/stick5. LEDLED lights has changed. Has a more fluid movement when lights circle around the device.Light is also dimmer, but still visible. Good if you have to use Alexa at night when it's on the nightstand, doesn't strain your eyes.Has a more pink-ish ring instead of a red ring when there's an error.6. Tactile buttons.All buttons are tactile so you can blind feel what you're pressing in the dark. Before, only the action button has raised symbols.Other than that. Everything else functions the same. Still disappointed it doesn't have back up battery power in case you set up an alarm and the power outage occurs. Unless you don't have a good blueooth or wired speaker to pair with your second generation echo, or you can't raise your voice in far distances then the functionality is basically the same and it's not worth the upgrade in my opinion.If you never owned an Amazon Echo device, want another one around the house, or plan to give as a gift then it's worth considering===Original Echo Dot 2nd gen review:Yes, it's a slim down version of the Amazon Echo* without the speaker.*For this review I'm going to refer this item as the 'Dot' and the  'Amazon Echo' as the one with the speakers incorporated in the deviceIt functions exactly the same except the voice for Alexa is not as smooth (probably due to the speakers in Amazon Echo).You CAN play music on the Echo Dot without a speaker plugged in. Compared to the Amazon Echo you won't get the surround sound feature, but it's pretty decent if you're one who focus more on lyrics than instrumentals. There's an optional Aux 3mm plug in and bluetooth compatibility if you find the sound coming from the dot less sufficient and want to use an external speakerThe Echo is very portable. Fits in the palm of your hand. Love how the plug on the Dot is detachable unlike the Amazon Echo so it's easy to tranfer to a new location when you need to.Setup is very easy, just download the Alexa App and following the directions included in the box.Features wise, it's similar to Siri, Ok Google or Cortana: you can ask it questions, make shopping lists, schedule appointments, play music, set alarms, link it to Pandora/Spotify/iheartradio, see traffic updates, sports updates, news briefings, use as smart phone device, voice purchasing off amazon, among other of features. For full list of features or suggestions are present in the app and the e-mail news letter if you sign up for it.Going to go through some of the features now and what you should look out for:-Alarms: If you own multiple echo devices (Dot, Amazon Echo, and/or Amazon Tap), alarms is device specific. Good for if you have one in the master bedroom, the alarm will not go off in the child's room for example. Whatever you voice set the alarm with, it will go off on that device. Also note that the Echo devices are wifi and power dependent. If there's a blackout or if your wifi is down the alarm will not go off-Voice activation: if you own multiple echo devices and they're within the same proximity of each other, best to assign different wake words for each so both won't go off the same time. You have the option for 3 wake words: Amazon, Alexa and Echo.-Voice purchasing: look out for Alexa only deals. There are variety of discounts only offered through Alexa like how the special offers on Amazon Tablet works-Smart Home. By far the best feature in my personal opinion is the smart phone feature. You do need a smart plug or thermostat that's Alexa compatible, but it makes your life much easier by just using your voice to control the temperature, TV, or on/off the lights without having to walk up to the switch or console.Overall very good device to have around you home as it improves on your quality of life, and makes life similar if you own a smart home device. I'd get this over the Amazon Echo if you own your own high quality speakers as it's essentially the same device without the speaker. If you can chip in a little more I'd go for the upgrade as the speakers on the Amazon Echo is really good, if you want to compare it to your own home speakers I'd go check out the display demo that are available at some retail electronic stores.

Title: Bluetooth connectivity is terrible, look elsewhere for a speaker.
Body: Great sound quality once you get into the Alexa app and increase the bass. The microphone picks up me saying the wake word all the way across my home, even in separate rooms. Features and skills are great. The Bluetooth connectivity, however, is dismal. I have owned it for less than 24 hours and have had to reset the Bluetooth connection dozens of times, and it doesn't just drop the connection, it just loses audio and you actually have to disconnect and reconnect to get it back. My $5 Family Dollar speaker is 100 times more stable and has only ever lost the connection once in 4 months. I only bought this because it was on sale and I needed a new Bluetooth speaker and thought that the additional features would be a benefit. I really regret it. Unless Amazon can fix this, you're better off buying something else if you're looking for a Bluetooth speaker. I'm beyond disappointed and I hope Amazon can address this issue, otherwise I'll be returning it. Alexa features are not worth it if the rest of its performance is shoddy and unusable.Update 8/8/19: Amazon replaced the first one and the second one does exactly the same thing. There is still no resolution and every time I call, they try to make me call in the 2 year warranty I purchased on a brand new product that has never worked properly. At least they gave me a partial refund.

Title: Great speaker, not really useful outside of that for us
Body: It seems to be the way of the world that we are going towards more home integration with technology. However some habits are just hard to break and I think that_ why we don_ use this so much. I got it in a deal when I bought my Blink cameras so it wasn_ something I specifically wanted.We haven_ explored much of its features but again, we don_ really feel the desire to do so. Yea you can ask about weather, and news, and for it to tell you a joke, but that_ really it for us. We use it more to play our Amazon Music list than anything which it does quite well. Great sound.It also has a habit of ruining surprises (Amazon gifts that arrive at the door) by telling my wife or son that the such and such item arrived. Definitely have to get to it before they do as far as that is concerned.I_ sure people use these much more than we do but like I said, we_ much rather just use our phone to figure out things ourself. Anything that_ connected to this (lights, thermostats, etc) also have their own apps which don_ mishear my _ommands.I_ only get one if they_e on sale and you_e interested in having an argument with it, lol.

Title: Fooled Me Twice
Body: I bought a pair of these for the home (with plugs). So far I'm not impressed. They're not good for anything other than turning lights on and off. I wanted to set one up in the bedroom to wake me, but the recurring alarm selections are limited to daily, weekly and weekend. That doesn't work for me because I work Tuesdays through Saturdays. I would have to set up 5 weekly alarms. Weak! Another vexing issue is turning off the bedroom light. It works well enough, but I go to bed a bit later than my wife. Telling the device - located on the other side of the room - to turn off the light would wake my wife. So I turn off the light using the Amazon Alexa app on my Google Pixel phone ... which is quite convenient since I have to use the phone to wake me. Pity that one needs so many more gadgets to perform simple voice controlled activities that used to just require the flip of a switch. My home might not be smarter than me, but I know Amazon is for getting me to buy this (for now) nearly useless Gizmo. Shame on you Amazon. Oh wait! I bought an Echo Auto too ... shame on me!

Title: Feeling like Iron Man
Body: Amazing smart speaker. Takes time to learn all of it's capabilities but I mainly got it to set up the sengled light kit in my living room and to play music from Spotify. It was beyond easy to set up the sengled lights and connect them to the Alexa speaker. I work grave shifts so I leave at night and it was always a pain to turn off any lights before I leave as I don't like walking in my house with my work shoes on nor do I want to be walking in the dark. Since I've set the speaker up and with the smart lights, life is so much easier. Can't believe I waited for so long to get one.The sound quality on the speaker isn't the best, but it does connect to Bluetooth speakers very easily and disconnects on command. I have my Alexa speaker right next to my home console speaker/sub woofer and whenever I want to really play some music, I just tell Alexa to connect to the speaker and control the volume from there.Over time, I know this little smart speaker will definitely come in more handy and I will for sure buy more and the newer models as my smart home tech grows.

Title: This is garbage-no where near as good as the first or second gen
Body: Muddy boomy sound heavy on lower mid and upper bass response. No treble whatsover. Worthless to listen to music which I could easily do with my other DOTs... Have tried using the alexa app to alter the sound quality.  The device just has no treble. Also, it no longer takes a standard USB cable. Now it is a proprietary adapter and cable all in one with a small round jack. I guess too many people were trying to use echo dots with a substandard usb power adapter? But now you can't buy the length or color of cable you want. I put this on in a bathroom to play soft jazz during parties, but its ugly black cable stands out stark against white trim. I will keep playing with this for another day or two before I send it back if I can't make it at least as good as my 1st and 2nd gen dots.

Title: Best Echo Dot Yet!
Body: Like millions of others, I love voice assistants and Amazon leads the market with their Echo Dot.  The new third generation is  a cozy device, mine is black with awesome speakers!  Alexa's voice is vibrant as well, all the Alexa Skills I enjoy daily like "Positive Living" and "Big Sky" are rich in sound quality. I also enjoy seeing the "green halo" around the dot letting me know about Alexa notifications,In our house, we also have the Echo Show Device - it's the best also - we love the visual presentations that come with Alexa Skills like "Ask a Question."  Amazon is leading the way for their voice assistants and the developers who create amazing Alexa Skills for us to enjoy!Buy two Echo Dots - keep one in the guest room!

Title: Great product with lots of uses
Body: I had been tracking this product for long and thinking whether it would be of any use to me. One day, Amazon launched a deal price of $25. I just ordered it and was ready to keep it aside or gift it to someone if it was not going to be of much use to me.Pros:1. The first thing i tried was play songs. The sound is crisp and clear. No issues with speech recognition.2. You are in a middle of some task and got a distraction, ask Alexa to remind you in few minutes to continue the task.3. The best thing is calling anyone in your contacts on Alexa by just saying - Alexa call <your contact name>.4. Drop in option is another great feature to talk to people at home from your phone.5. You can always connect your phone through bluetooth and play any songs on Alexa.Cons:1. It is troublesome to play radio stations from Tune in as it expects the exact name (sometimes even the FM frequency), but once you have played, you won't need to repeat the full name next time. But there is an option to play your favorite radio station on your phone and connect it using bluetooth to have alexa sound experience.2. When you set an alarm and want a specific song to be played for alarm, it asks for amazon music subscription.There are more options i am yet to explore. Will keep you posted.

Title: Strong Speaker
Body: I got this to use in the shop, mainly to play music while we worked.Of course, this does what Alexa does. The main difference vs. generation 2 is the sound quality. (I have both.)Our shop is L-shaped and 1500 sq ft. This Echo Dot is located at one end of the ell, yet I have no trouble hearing it at the far end with no machinery running. If I crank up the volume, it is as I like it at the far end (though too loud near it). So, though I don_ need an auxiliary speaker, one would help in that the volume would be more uniform.

Title: This is our 7th Echo device
Body: This did what we hoped- integrated well with our other Echo and smart home devices- better than echo input.  Didn't like echo input and if you are looking at echo input, I'd pay the extra couple bucks and just get the dot version 3.  Input has problems disconnecting from the music groups as well as needing to be re-paired to the speakers that it's HARD WIRED TO every time you turn off the speakers that input is connected to. No problem with EchoDot in the exact same speaker configuration

Title: Alexa now has issues hearing me compared to the old version.
Body: This new version is supposed to have more mics listening to you. There are 4 holes on top of the device for the mics while the old one only had one.  I have two of these devices that replaced 2 of my old ones and I end up having to repeat myself and/or have to say any request louder compared to the older model. Sure the "upgraded" loudness of the sound is welcome but that's about it. if you already have the old version, don't bother getting these.

Title: Worse every day somehow
Body: This is the worst voice control device on the market.  There are songs in my library I LITERALLY cannot play because the voice recognition always plays the 'Live' version and when selecting it on my phone and stream to Alexa the song stops and skips to another album.  This voice control is absolute garbage!!!  Also, you would think something that is touted as AI would be smart enough to choose a song I've played 100s of time before vs a new song and artist that Alexa thought I said....  Why!  If Alexa is uncertain does Alexa not default to a previously played artist or song???

Title: Super useful!
Body: I've been using this gadget for the summer time while the kids are home. I set routines on the Echo to remind the kiddos when to complete certain tasks, or to remind them to eat their lunch, while I'm away at work. I also use it to drop in from work to check on my younger son who doesn't have a cellphone yet. Its been useful! The kids really enjoy playing music on it and asking it random questions.

Title: Does not work with AnyMote.  FOLLOW UP ADDED.
Body: Follow up - I was just contacted by an Amazon tech person , James B., He let me know that it is a problem, possibly with AnyMote not Echo. Also, he let me know that the tech department will be working to get the problem corrected as soon as soon as possible. This is a very welcome and appreciated call.Original - I got this hoping it would be easy for my wife to control the Roku by voice. According to the web and YouTube, AnyMote would be the best choice for making the process easy for her. (She has trouble now using devices.) Even after several attempts, the echo dot, ordered with the Roku Ultra, would not enable the skill. After searching the web, I discovered that others had the same problem.

Title: Be careful what you call it.
Body: I have tried to set this up many times.  Most times it responds to my voice the first time, but not ever again.  I keep on unplugging it to do the setup again and the same thing happens.  I don't think I am doing anything wrong but this is a bear to set up.  After I figured out that is only responds to Alexa and not to Alexis (my nieces name) it works like a charm.  I am very happy with it.

Title: Take it or Leave it
Body: Not sure if I really need this device?It work well for simple things like setting timers or asking for weather or sports stats.  We even played a few interesting games on it.  The voice recognition is fine, the sound quality if fine so long as you are not really wanting it to play music on it.  If you are ok with music coming from a tiny box with no dynamic range, no bass, etc, then you will be fine.  For me, I like a real stereo system.Wrt integration with and control of other devices, so far not overly impressed.  I got the Echo Dot to control my new Denon high end receiver.  It can turn it on an off, but only with a complex set of words referring to the receiver.  And beyond that it is quite limited.  I can't play any particular song over the receiver, only itself....so fairly useless in that regard...or maybe I just haven't worked hard enough to make it work.  But largely, as I am using Apple AirPlay from iphone, it won't integrate with that separate system.I have not yet made the investment in other devices like light control, but have noted my daughter has done that at their house, and use it very little.  It is a lot of investment for little return.  Maybe some day, when I am old and can't move, it can turn off the lights for me.Maybe over time I will find more uses for it.  At this point, it has marginal value for me.  It is an ok value for the a low price.  I would definately not pay much more money for it.  For example, the Apple equivalent, is very costly, might have better sound and integrate a bit better with Apple Music components....but again, at that cost, not for me either.

Title: Not impressed
Body: Either I received a defective gen 3 dot or the new design fails to improve at all upon the Echo dot gen 2.  In either case, my gen 3 echo is so useless I don't even use it.  It's now in a box in my cupboard.  Examples: I had my gen 3 dot next to me in the living room and when I would ask it something, my gen 2 dot in the bedroom would respond and the gen 3 would not even activate.
