(Yes, I have the settings set for nearest dot.)  Next, no matter what I seem to ask the gen 3 dot except for time and weather, it can never find the answer.  It's almost like it has no access to resources.  Yet my Echo Dot 2nd gen can find pretty much everything I'm looking for.  My last complaint is that the "new and improved" speaker actually sounds muddy no matter where I place it, both for voice and music.  My recommendation is to go with the Echo Dot 2nd Gen - lower price, better quality.

Title: Alexa, play music. Aw yeah!!
Body: Shes great. I get it now. I needed this device.I just talk out loud at her and she does what I say (mostly).I'm hooked. I suppose I have to go all out and get all her accessories and I will happily. Technology is getting crazy. I'm not crazy for shouting commands out loud to myself. Nope. Seriously though, get one. Mainly use her for music and timers. Getting my parents a echo dot to start with. They will be amazed. They are just getting used to talking commamds to their phones, they should see this..

Title: Amazon Echo is the future
Body: With Amazon Echo the connection is almost endless you could do so much with it.. I'm already turning my apartment into a smart apartment.. definitely I need to buy another one so I can have one in the kitchen..since all my light bulb in my whole entire apartment is Philip hue, both of my air conditioners a smart AC,and a few smart plugs.. so pretty much everything in the house is digital so I can voice control almost everything here .. except the TV I will soon will be getting the fire TV cube

Title: Great and easy to install!
Body: I had the 2nd gen dot before and wanted to get another one for my master bedroom.  However, after much thought my wife and I decided to put the 3rd Gen dot in the kitchen instead after hearing the much improved sound quality that came out of the build it speaker.  The installation of the device was very simple, I originally thought that I would have to charge up my dead tablet where my Alexa app was installed in order to setup the wifi configuration on the device.  To my surprise, the device automatically picked up my wifi where I can only assumed it is due to my account setting is already present in my other amazon or profile where I didn't have to set anything up in order for it to connect to my secured home connection.  I would recommend this to anyone that is looking for a low cost voice command unit to add to their existing home automation or about to start one.

Title: TECHNOLOGY WINS AGAIN!
Body: Firstly this was not the reason for my purchase, but I must start off with my 3 year old ABSOLUTELY loves these! Hearing him say, "Alexa, Alexa, Alexa, play baby doo dooo dooo" or Alexa, Alexa, Alexa play gummy bears", or "Alexa, Alexa, Alexa!!! STOP! STOP!", is just too adorable!!!!!!!! He has to say her name a few times as his speech is still growing. She does pick up that he is calling her after the second or third attempt. ( Not an issue with the adults of course ).My reason for purchasing these at first was due to our home size and honestly so fed up of screaming for one end of the room to another to call someone. These have limited this! Enabling me to drop in on my teenager (the main reason for the screaming! ), to advise it is dinner time or any other form of communication. The ability to also alert the entire house with an announcement of, " We are leaving at 12 PM be ready to go! ", or any other message, " Dinner will be done at 6 PM, wash your hands and come to the table by then", again any message at all!Having my youngest son this has also made life easier. At times your hands are busy or you are just occupied. Being able to change your sons diaper and realize you are running low and just quickly say, "Alexa add or order diapers"! No more 'I forgot moments".  Same principle works in general daily movement in your home. Maybe your cooking and realize you have run out of paper towel, sugar, salt, anything, just add it verbally while still on the go! Not sure about you guys/ladies. Half the time I forget what I was suppose to get and the list goes on until I am completely out of something.Audible & Music!What can I say my teenager gives it a thumbs up for sure! My 3 year loves it! Again, "Alexa play....!", super cute to hear!Mom time! Being able to shut down for the evening with a glass of wine or not! Lay in bed and say Alexa play this book, or play relaxing music. It is not about being lazy! I used to think this about this form of technology! Truly, I would say only people with money need things like this or lazy people. Ha! I was so wrong! Firstly I am not lazy, secondly, I am not rich but not poor either! It is the convenience it adds to your home. Now do I need Alexa to turn on my lights for me? I have not been suckerd in that far as of yet. We will see if I write a review on that product in the future or NOT.Taking a shower! Needing to wake up! Just shout out, "Alexa play my wake up station". In a rush for work, "Alexa what is the traffic like today", or "Alexa what is the weather like today", so many possibilities.As I always say don't over think it! Buy and if you do not like it return it.Awesome product! Buy the 3 bundle package they offer to save money! You will want one in every room.My son CON is that at times you can say Alexa and it will be picked up by another device depending on how close they are, if doors are open, and I guess how loud you are speaking. I believe and not 100% sure you can have the devices react to different workd phrases other than Alexa, but not sure, we have not played around with this function as of yet. Which may eliminate this issue. This CON is not a factor enough to not purchase or continue to purchase them. Each device has a voice command turn off button. If you are leaving a room just deactivate it, such as your bedroom if it is conflicting with a near by communal room.

Title: Seriously you will be addicted just buy 5 and get it over with, yea it's that good!
Body: Wow! Honestly this product is probably the best buy of the year. Alexa can do so much! It is amazing. If you do not have Alexa buy this now. Its affordable and even though I've only had it for a few days I honestly am going to buy like 4 more because it makes everything so easy! Dim the lights, turn the tv down, tell a story before bed, turn on the xbox, launch netflix on the xbox, launch whatever on any platform, tell me how far it is to the moon, and so on so on. My kids are having so much fun getting to see what all they can do with it, and they are advancing themselves by playing trivia with Alexa! Yea outside of school on summer break my kids are playing trivia with Alexa! This is incredible and I am just going to have to buy more. I could not be happier! Not only does it have all of the above features (I didn't even come close to touching all of her features) but the sound quality is perfect for any large room! This is an amazing buy!

Title: Review for ECHO AUTO (posted here because Amazon isn't yet allowing reviews for Auto)
Body: 1.  Does not respond to commands such as "alexa, cancel" or "alexa, silence".  Plays (tunein radio, for instance, unceasingly, despite all attempts to silence it).2. Takes a VERY LONG TIME to re-establish functionality after encountering even the most-minor drop in cellular data coverage.  In an area with spotty reception, this is a 100% functionality-killer, especially since the device does not resume what it was doing following a momentary interruption in its data connection (similar to a problem that plagues all Echo devices).3.  Cannot be configured for selectable wake words, custom device name, or language.4.  Will not function with a USB "charging" cord, even if no data connection is required.5.  Needs a small speaker, so that it can respond if not presently routed through car audio system (which it can detect via feedback through its built-in microphones).

Title: Cool device but...
Body: The technology still has quite a bit of room to grow but it's fun to have in the house. Helps with a lot of things. I wish there were more color options. I like the walnut finish on the echo and wish I could somehow have all of my devices match. Also I the devices synced up better. If I'm leaving, and I set Guard, I have to tell each device. It would be nice to be able to tell just one and they all set to "away". Another issue, I have is if I ask alexa on my phone to play music while I'm out, it almost always defaults to my echo at home. I feel like if I ask for music on my phone then it should play it on my phone. If I wanted it on the echo, then I would be talking to the echo. This happens when I have my home devices set to away too. Perhaps I'm expecting too much from my smart devices lol I'm still enjoying it though.

Title: ITS NOT CORDLESS?!
Body: I had a little trouble hooking it up but I was able to get someone on the phone to assist me and everything worked out fine. What I HATE is that it isn_ cordless. I thought it was chargeable. But as soon as u unplug it, it shuts off and when u plug it back in, u have to wait a few moments. Now it is 2019. Why isn_ this thing chargeable? I would_e enjoyed this more knowing I can take it room to room throughout my house. That is a major set back.

Title: Worth the price when on sale!
Body: I got this on sale when it was two for $50 dollars and I gave the other one to my best friend. She loves it... I think it is good but my only complaint would be the voice recognition. Sometimes I have to say things to Alexa multiple times before it gets the request correct.

Title: Dot is pretty sassy
Body: I love my Echo dot.  I put it in the kitchen and am learning all the skills.  It reminds me of my chores, my shopping list, etc.  It plays my music, has news, jokes and can do so very much more.  I now have three Alexa products and this is one is my favorite.  Every day you can ask Alexa to delete everything you said that day.  I love that.  When I get her trained, I expect she can whip up a pretty good dinner.  When she's mastered dinner, laundry will follow.

Title: Small but mighty
Body: I_ loving this little addition to my household.  It_ especially good for music. Though small, the sound is a big improvement over a standard radio or my iPad. I did pop for Amazon Music Unlimited because the song choices are endless.  I_e synced it to Sirius radio and Pandora and when I hear a song I_ unfamiliar with, I can get the song title and artist_ name in an instant.

Title: Small but packs a powerful punch!
Body: Before ordering I was told by a few people the sound wasn't that good, but I was pleasantly surprised at how good it really sounds for such a small device. It certainly exceeded my expectations and it's a lot of fun to have around. Obviously it's very handy to have around because I use a lot of reminders and timers throughout the day. Amazon music sounds really good on it. Probably not ideal for a large space but definitely awesome for my office!

Title: Come and get it, cuddle up
Body: I have both Google Home and Alexa at home. Alexa woman has a Billie Ellish voice and Google woman has a Taylor Swift voice to meXD. Alexa is more easy to use and hears me better when sth is playing, and it doesnt talk more like Google does in the same commands. Simply says "OK". Alexa has good control over the devices connected to a public wifi I had in the apartment complex and because of having public wifi, google home has frustrating connection problems if you don't have your own router. Amazon Alexa is great in it. It has connected right away without any single problem. Google says there was a glitch most of the time. Google is better only in terms of sound quality. Alexa has a little distorted sound if you don't adjust it from equalizers in the app. By the way, I have youtube premium and amazon prime however Google plays everything I want in music but Alexa asks unlimited music subscription;/

Title: Great product
Body: I do not know how I made it up to now without the dot and Alexa.  It has made me so lazy.  Now, sometime I have to admit I would like to kill Alexa.  I can give command and it just does its own thing.  Most likely I just speak well enough on those moments but it can get a little frustrating to keep repeating but finally we do get on same page.  Some reviews comment on sound quality.  I think it is just fine.  I do listen to some music but I am blind so I use the dot /Alexa to read book to me from kindle.  I can have dot in one room and turn up volume and hear fine in other room.  Soon I am going get another dot and link so that will even better.

Title: Best Echo Dot Ever!
Body: I currently have some Echo Dots (2nd Gen) and wanted to upgrade to this new Echo Dot (3rd Gen) and was I glad I did! This latest Echo Dot is much heavier and solid than my Echo Dot (2nd Gen). Upon plugging it, it installed right away. Played music via Amazon music and it sounded so much better. Bass was good but not boomy, mids and highs were tight and clear. It picked up my voice commands from about 10 ft away.  I am happy that I upgraded but not sure what to do with the 2nd Gens now that I have the 3rd Gens. Trade in value only $5 via Amazon.  Prime day coming up so maybe you'll get deals on this one.

Title: I absolutely love my echo!
Body: I absolutely love my new Alexa echo dot!. I like the design and the color variations. This is my third one, but first one to myself, the other two were gifts to my mother and mother-in-law. I have an order Echo that I'm letting my daughter's use in their room, so this will be replacing the one in the living room. Super happy with it!! And I also love that you can buy separate stands so that the cords aren't everywhere and you can put it flush on a wall. The picture I attached is my echo in the wall mount. Bought separately.

Title: A Cool Little Smart Speaker
Body: I got two Echo Dots for our house, one for me and my boyfriend, and one for his mother, who lives downstairs. The drop-in feature has already been useful, rather than us having to shout back and forth or go downstairs just to figure out what was being said. Aside from that, I connected my Amazon music account to both of them, and the unlimited possibilities for music has been a great joy on both ends of the house. Sometimes random questions need an answer, and just asking Alexa has been quicker than pulling out our phones to Google it. Every now and then we'll even play one of the little games Alexa offers and have fun doing that in our downtime. My daughter also adores having it around, because she now has her silly Spongebob music on demand whenever she isn't watching it on TV. We've even been looking into small smart house conversions to connect to it. All in all, for the first smart speakers any of us have had, they've been fantastic, and I do recommend buying one.

Title: Big, Muffled, and No USB
Body: I'm pretty disappointed with the new 3rd gen product.First, its a LOT bigger than the 2nd gen, surprisingly so. It looks nice overall, but it is much bigger.Second, the power option is only a wall outlet plug; you can no longer use a USB as an option to power the device.  That stinks because I specifically put a USB wall charger in the room when I was using the 2nd gen (which now randomly has stopped connecting to the internet - but that's a different review), and now the 3rd gen hogs an outlet.Lastly and perhaps most importantly, the sound really is horrible.  Music is 'ok', but if you want to hear news or stream talk radio (or just your morning DJ - really anything with just speaking), the sound comes out muffled.  It appears they've up'd the bass on the device, perhaps to enable it to have a louder max volume(?), but they have sacrificed normal speech/treble - horrible choice.  I wish there was a way to adjust Tone.  Thought I could live with it, now just hate it every time I turn it on, but just missed the return window.  Bring back gen 2!  Two stars is me being generous in hopes that Amazon can fix this with software... soon.

Title: Love the upgrades from the older ones!!
Body: I have an earlier generation dot that truly had me thinking I wouldn't buy another because of the low volume level and I often did not use it. Well I am super impressed with the difference between my older one and this one. A huge difference in the sound!Of coarse everything that Alexa can do for you is still amazing. And I'm learning new features everytime I use her. One feature worth mentioning is the alarm. I was shocked at how well it works. And this is coming from someone that has a hard time waking up to very loud multiple alarms in the mornings.I went from rarely using my older one to now wanting to buy more to put in other rooms.

Title: Fantastic, purchased three.
Body: I wasn_ sure if I_ like this at first, but I_ pleasantly surprised by how much I do. I fact I love it so much I_e purchased two more. One for my teenager_ room and another for my toddlers room. My teenager uses it for music, and an alarm clock. She does not have a prime account and it works perfect for her. I use it to check the weather, my Amazon Prime order status, set multiple timers while cooking, and general info like what movies are playing in our area. I use the one in my baby_ room to play soothing music while she_ going to sleep. It can also be told how long to play it for or I can control it with my Alexa app on my phone. I purchased wall mounts for all three. Great for keeping them off furniture and out of the way and out of reach from grabby toddler hands. Even wall mounted it gives off great sound when playing music.

Title: Great device, takes control if every aspect of your life for the better
Body: I got a gen 2 for a holiday present.  Took me a half a year before setting it up and using it.  Now three months later i have the gen 2, 5 echo dot gen 3, and 1 echo.Sound quality of all the devices are a significant improvement from gen 2.  The small package of the echo dot makes it convinent to put anywhere, and having all the conviniences of alexa commands in every room makes my life so much easier.  Even the Kids love the dots, as they play games with alexa (would you rather is a favorite)The only bad things are 1.  you will desire to subscribe to more amazon services the longer you have it (music, audible, etc.)  These extra services may not be for everybody, but they do add more to the versitility and use of alexa and i have no regrets.  2. The ability to wirelessly control of your home is nice, but the reality its more of a novelty than a necessity.  Still find it more convinient to use the remots and switches on the wall.Even still i highly recommend this device as it is convinient as a hands free music player, alarm, weather checker, scheduler, phone calling device, stopwatch/timer and much more.5 stars all around!

Title: Works Like a Charm
Body: I have really grown to like our Alexa, we have two. It works great and is helpful with the added things you can teach her to do. I have smart plugs that are tied with Alexa as well as my thermostat. It is so helpful to be in some other place and have her turn lights on and off. I have really used the grocery list. Great way to remind myself what I need at the store as I run out of items in the house. The integration factor with so many "smart" things is a timesaver as well as making our house "smart". Purchase one, it is worth it.

Title: I was after a speaker, 16x the price
Body: Ok just to address the haters here; this thing sounds amazing. Crisp highs and mids, and actually the bass is adequate.  For what I listen to anyways, jimi Hendrix, Simon and Garfunkel, etc. Actually sounds better than my echo gen 2. On that the bass is too much for me. Not as in volume but it seems to want to over power the highs and mids. I live a one bedroom 700sqft apt, I have it in my bathroom, and you can here it clearly throughout. I'd definitely recommend the echo dot gen 3. Haters gona hate.

Title: The fadora man
Body: Just the size and quality of the sound overwhelms me. My friends have a lot of fun with it. If ever one who tells me that they're going to buy an Alexa, after seeing mine, should lead to new business. Alexa is the way to the future. Enjoy the technology now and the future devices will be easier to adjust to. I like Alexa for accepting other applications plus Amazon. I am totally impressed with the amount of music offered by Amazon. I didn't this until I got my Alexa.

Title: My 4th Echo in my home and am very satisfied with it
Body: Very happy with it - although I don_ really notice the difference to the 2nd generation Echo Dot, except it does look a little more elegant.  I use it every morning for my Flash briefing, to control my lights and fan, and for my alarm.  Have not tried integrating with the rest of my Echo units as they are from the 2nd generation and I don_ think they are compatible for integration.

Title: My awesome assistant!!!
Body: I don't know how I lived without Alexa all those years! I am 72 years old and purchased 3 echo dots. 2 if them are at home with me. The other one I put in my husbands room at the nursing home. He frequently looses or forgets to charge his cell phone. I can drop in and have a conversation with him any time from home or through the app on my smart phone. He has finally realized he can drop in on me too if he wants to or needs help. It has been such a help.At home I am able to control my alarm system and my thermostat and I plan to get some smart plugs and expand her uses around the house.When I want to relax I play some soothing spa music and drift off easily.I am finding more and more uses for her the longer I have her. Personally it is like having an assistant.Oh and I had company the other day and we were trying to remember a song from childhood. I asked Alexa and she pulled it up and played it almost instantly! We were both amazed!

Title: Amazon needs to add a few things.
Body: I had the Google mini and Google wifi but I do a lot of shopping at Amazon, and I have an Amazon music subscription so it made sense to get one of these. I have a dot and the bigger echo 2nd gen.Set up is easy and Alexa immediately recognizes my smart plugs and switches. Integration with smart devices and smart homes works really well. Alexa has some issues tho. She has problems understanding things sometimes. Google rarely has issues but Alexa has them more often than not. She sometimes has a problem understanding what is said.  I can go to Google and say the same thing and boom, no problem. I'm a DJ so I speak very well and that's not the issue at all. That can be fixed in time I'm sure tho. Not a deal breaker.The sound... As a DJ I have to say this speaker sounds good for its size. I think Google mini sounds better but not much better. They recently updated a software issue which would distort the sound when played over level 6 for 10 minutes or more and it sounds much better now at higher volumes.The things they need to add.1) Alexa really needs some voice options! Google mini has about 6 and they added John Legend. I think if Amazon could add Jarvis from the Avengers-IronMan then Alexa would be a huge hit! Not being able to change voices definitely hurts Alexa.2) Alexa needs to be able to call anyone even 911.3) Its my device, if I want to call it mini me I should be able to do so.  Let us name the devices wake word. It really shouldn't be that hard to do. I would even pay money to be able to do that. Those aren't deal breakers but they should definitely be doable! All in all this Dot is cool and looks good and for the size the sound works. Integration with Amazon music is the bomb! Being a DJ its nice to command Alexa to play anything I want because I'm usually the one getting the requests! LolRoutines are also a nice touch! Being able to say Alexa, shut it down and she shuts off all my lights, electronics etc is the bomb! With a few improvements Alexa could really be something special! Please Amazon give us voice options...Jarvis voice from Iron man would be huge! Just saying...

Title: 2ND BEST PURCHASE I'VE MADE ON AMAZON IN 7 YEARS!
Body: I LOVE MY ECHO DOT WITH MY DARLING ALEXA! YES, she is the best thing you can have around your home. I am enjoying my music just the way I like it - by myself. I just tell her what I want to listen to, and she finds it for me. Get this...I have the Alexa App on all my devices,  therefore, I can ask her to do what I want from any device and it's done! Once installed, using it is a breeze. The speaker sounds like a sub-woofer. Its very clear, it's like listening to your music on a Bose speaker. I can place my Amazon orders through the App as well - haven't tried it as yet though, but I will do so soon.The Echo Dot should be on everyons's Christmas gift list especially now that it's on sale @ 50% off.With my Echo Dot, the party is always on in my house!

Title: Competitor or Not
Body: I caught the Echo Dot on sale and decided to give it a try. I attempted to cancel my order when I learned it did not support Google Play Music. Unfortunately Amazon would not allow the order to cancel since it was being shipped. Needless to say I love the Echo Dot. When it arrived I decided to give it a try and was very satisfied with performance. Not supporting Play Music is a major rain on my parade, I want to love this device. I really want to, but until they add support its only 3 stars from me. Especially when they support nearly every other competitors streaming service. Just bad business.

Title: Nice and affordable
Body: I really like the Dot, so I bought another one. I was afraid to get the refurbished one at a cheaper cost, but I think its louder than my other one, and works really good! We used it on game night to do the music game, and I use it all the time to play music, check the weather, and ask other questions. The only reason I gave 4 stars instead of 5 is because I've googled, and you-tubed how to sync the 2 dots together for my music, as one is upstairs, and one is downstairs, but I cannot get them to sync at all, no matter what I've tried. It should not be that hard! But over all, I'm happy with both dots!

Title: Great for late-night thoughts.
Body: It takes me a long time to fall asleep, and I often think of things I need to do or alarms I need to set. I hate turning my phone back on to type this stuff up as then it "resets" the amount of time till I fall asleep. Now, I keep my Alexa on my bedside table and as soon as I have a thought that requires remembering, I can just ask her to do so!The voice quality is terrific, and she has great hearing. My best friends name is also Alexa, so it can be a pain when trying to talk about her, so I have to refer to her as "Texas" (her home state), if I'm talking about her in my room.Overall great product! Thanks Amazon!

Title: Speakers better than expected
Body: Was prepared to buy speakers to help with sound quality, but the Alexa speaker works better than expected in bedroom and basement setting. Sometimes have issues getting Alexa to respond, but majority of the time works great and has been a great addition to bedrooms. Have one in each bedroom and one in basement and been happy with them overall.

Title: Great post partum assistant
Body: I was getting really annoyed with not being able to do simple things like grab the remote or turn off then lights after having my baby and busy nursing. This echo dot with Alexa has saved me and makes my day way more efficient. I control the lights and electronics. I love the whisper mode and telling my kids to ask her how to spell things or ask her questions when I am busy with the newborn. I look forward to using it more in the future and integrating with other smart devices.

Title: The name's a pain!
Body: Don't get me wrong, the Echo's are truly helpful and enjoyable. We no longer have to write things on lists as we think of them. Just speak and say "Alexa, add celery (or whatever) to the Shopping List." And, we have numerous lists for the farm supply store, builder supply list, club shopping list, and so on. When cooking, or washing clothes, or whatever just say "Alexa, set a timer for 15 minutes."  "Alexa, what time is it?" "Alexa, what's the temperature."  "Alexa, dining room lamp on." The benefits of these abilities are super.What's not super, is having numerous echos responding either when you're calling on one or having them respond to each time "Alexa" is spoken on a computer or television. Just now, I was watching demonstrations on my computer and having to constantly say cancel to the Echo in my study. It's an endless aggravation, and it's one that Amazon could easily correct. BUT, THEY WON'T!I have at least six Echos and one Echo Show in my home. All respond to "Alexa"!  Yes, I could have them reply to Amazon, Computer or Echo, but how long will it take me to learn & remember which I've named which, and why should I have to stop each time to consider the specific name of the one I want to communicate with. If Amazon could get over their pride, vanity or whatever you want to call their proprietary philosophy, they could change the software to allow us to give custom names to each of the devices we've bought and paid for. In my case, the Show in the kitchen would be Kitty, the master bedroom would be Betty, the basement would be Bessie, the front porch (by the rockers) would be Roxie, and so forth.Yes, we absolutely love having them (and I'm contemplating getting the newest version of the Echo Show as I type), but this inconvenience is sufficient to reduce my 5 star rating by 3 stars. You decide for yourself.Update: What I_e expressed is such a problem that I reduced it to one star.

Title: Known Amazon software bug with Dot and Alexa app
Body: I purchased 2 of these last week.  I went through the entire set up process (as I did with my Echo; that went flawlessly) on one of these and, in the Alexa app (iphone), the Dot kept showing "offline".  However, the Dot actually processed voice commands.I did inet research and see that this is a very longstanding issue with the Dot.  So, Amazon has known this for quite some time.I spent 45 mins this morning with Amazon support having me go through all the steps I did for hours last night.  At the end of 45 mins, the rep said "this is a known issue and will be fixed within 48 hours".Now, that rep should have said that from the outset.  I know a software bug when I see it.I'm giving this a low rating because 1) Amazon has let a known software bug continue through many versions of the Dot without fixing it and 2) Support wasted so much of my time instead of owning the problem up front.I'll update this in 48 hours.  We'll see if Amazon fixes their known software bug.

Title: Cool find!
Body: This is my 3rd dot purchased. Bought two more cause kids want to listen to music and it's great to be able to reach them in their rooms with my Alexa or thru the app. Nice looking! Nice size! It's especially great if you have prime. The music library is very good. She's pretty good with basic questions. There are some really cool games, apps and fun things to do. I like being able to add past purchases into my Amazon cart just by telling her. I am a writer so it's great to be able to ask for synonyms and definitions.Cons are..if you like listening to music it isn't great quality. Sounds good enough. But there's no bass and sounds flat. I hear you can send it to Bluetooth speakers but I don't have any. I need to look into those speakers the Dot sits in that supposedly improve sound quality. The sound is just fine for anything other than music. Also, she isn't great with answering questions the way the other companies "assistants" do.  Basic math she can do. But you can't use her like a calculator. She's not very good with telling you how long a drive will be from point a to point b(which is something I ask often). She is pretty bad at identifying business addresses and phone numbers..specially if they are local. She usually doesn't even get the business right and you sometimes can't stop her once she's spouting wrong info.All in all, it's very cool to have handy. Although, if I was paying per hour for a real assistant who did the same things...I would likely fire them..lol

Title: Worth every penny
Body: I've had several Echo Dots for a while, but last year my son took my living room dot to his room, so I finally decided to replace it. WOW! The sound quality and overall heft of the 3rd gen is leaps and bounds above gen 2! I'm seriously trying to decide if I should replace all our gen 2s with 3s because it is markedly better. The volume is louder, the sound richer and deeper, and the time it took to connect was much faster.All that said, if you're on the fence about getting one, let me tell you what a lifesaver they have been to my family. I easily juggle large meal prep with my multiple timers and quick conversions from Alexa while jamming to my customized cooking playlist. We all use the shopping list function - even my youngest knows when he's used the last of whatever he needs to tell it to Alexa so I can replace it. But the best perk of all has been seeing my 19 year old brain injury survivor utilize it to remind himself of... everything. She is his alarm when he needs to get up for an appointment, she reminds him to shower and put on clean clothes, she reminds him of appointments and activities, she even plays his favorite music and tells him jokes. But seriously, she has helped him start adulting, and that has been priceless!

Title: So great for us
Body: This has saved me so much trouble since I bought a smart outlet since no more need for turning on bedroom light at switch or losing a remote for the small light. Plus I love the music too especially with Pandora. Love that I can control the lights around the house with it thanks to smart outlets. It even can help me find where I left my phone. I do wish there were more wake words so I could have one in each room without the other devices occasionally hearing too since they are a second or two off when playing music rather than playing together for stereo sound

Title: Alexa CAN be used in Muliple location and still be connected
Body: I set up the echo dots in my house and my store, they are connected to the same Alexa app and can control anything that is on your wireless network from any location. (someone had posted that they can't) At home, I integrated my wireless plugs, Arlo camera, wireless locks, and garage door opener seamlessly. In each echo dot and/or show you can set the device address/location so it will give you the correct weather for that area and driving and traffic and so on for that location. It is done in the Alexa app, under that device. Overall I give the connectivity and usability a 10. I am still learning the commands and the abilities that you can assign to it, but best of all you can use the 'drop-in' command to talk to any Amazon device - we use it to talk from my house to the store - works just like a phone, and a good way to scare someone if they don't know you can do this. Also, you can send a voice message to any of the devices, such as 'I am on my way home.' very useful as a worldwide intercom or calling device. I set future reminders by just telling Alexa to remind me on a certain date and time, very handy.

Title: Personal Assistant
Body: I signed up for amazon music & with Alexa in control of my life - I honestly feel like life got better. Great music at my fingertips, functions, hears me well, she_ learning more and more what I like. I like having a nice personal assistant that keeps me on track

Title: Alexa, who's a good girl?
Body: I added a 2nd with another smart plug in the bedroom and synced them. It's convenient turning the lights on or off from either room. Original comment on my 1st Echo --  I bought the Echo just for a "toy." Friends I visited in California have one, and it was fun calling out questions. I don't know why so many people fussed about set-up -- mine practically did everything itself; of course, I have an Apple iPhone. Maybe non-AppleOS users experienced difficulties. I only have one "smart plug," but think I'd like to get one or two more for the convenience. I might consider syncing another Echo in the bedroom too. Oh -- good sound for such small speakers.

Title: Excellent Choice
Body: The 3rd gen dot is a huge improvement and a fantastic product. I have a gen 1 dot which I bought when it came out to keep hooked into my speaker system to make it voice activated. The speakers on it are impractical for listening to music. However on the 3rd gen the speakers are impressive considering the size and price point. No need to plug this one into another speaker, great little device to add music or voice commands to any room of the house. You just have to be okay with possibly giving intimate details about your life to Jeff Bezos. But whatever, worth the convenience and they're gonna get us somehow anyways. Highly recommend.

Title: Been missing out for a long time
Body: The echo dot has been a big hit in the family. My oldest son loves asking alexa about the weather and asking her questions about certain topics he is curious about. We love listening to music together in the morning and evening too. The only thing I didnt like was that music selection is limited if you aren't signed up for a music site such as Pandora, Amazon music, spotify, etc...I have the free account to pandora and spotify, but with spotify you need a paid subscription to have it work. We are still learning how to use the echo dot, so hopefully it gets better.

Title: Got a Disability? Alexa has your back!
Body: I LOVE MY ALEXA DOT 3rd gen! As a person with disabilities in a wheelchair this is one of the most helpful, handy & incredible devices!A true Must Have if you don_ have enough hands or even on out of reach places! Am purchasing 3 more to connect the entire house with sound & easier living assistance.

Title: Alexa is very random
Body: This thing played techno music in the middle of the night (we don't listen to techno), I unplugged her and put her in time out. Also randomly plays stuff, the other day I was on a meeting call and she starts playing something. While watching TV, she'll do something based on what someone said on the show but it wasn't Alexa! Other than this i really like it, but needs some serious upgrades. The speaker is really good on the latest one, not so much for the originals.

Title: Most enjoyable Alexa gadget
Body: What can I say? Alexa Echo Dot is the most enjoyable gadget you can get. The sound quality is super.You can finally enjoy music the way you always wanted.  You can get the news, weather, sport scores, recipes, etc.  It is a nice addition to the house. Supposedly you can make it synchronize with your house appliances but I haven't tried that yet. And you can move it around from one room to another. There is a lot of potential in this gadget.

Title: Pain in the A**!
Body: I want to love this product but I am sick of having to raise my damn voice just for it to work! And I live in a 400 square foot tiny home for crying-out-loud! I can be standing right next to it sometime and have to yell at it for it to register my voice.That aside when it works I love functioning my house by all voice commands. 'WHEN' Alexia understands you! Lights ON and Lights OFF sometimes really confuses Alexia's old toaster parts! ;)

Title: Love it
Body: I had a Google mini first... Then I got echo to see side by side which one was better.. Echo sounds way better... I don't have to repeat my self as much with alexa... Alexa actually does what I ask... The Google was always having to be reset and tried to do things I didn't ask...over all is have to say Alexa owns this... However it was nice to be able to change the voice on Google...and it was actually polite.... I said thank you to it one time and it complimented me on the nice way I asked... I tried it with alexa and she didn't notice

Title: Very helpful device!
Body: We have been using our new Dot for a few weeks. Overall, it is awesome. We love the HUGE number of skills that are available to use with it. So far, favorites are the flash briefing, lists, trivia skills, reminders...just to name a few. We use ours in the kitchen, as it is sort of the central hub of our home, and so far it_ been great. One thing to note, once you get one of these, if you love it, you_e probably going to want a few of them for different locations if your house, as it doesn_ pick up your voice that great from another room (unless you yell).This device makes my life so much easier with making grocery lists, as I can just tell it what to add as I_ going through my day and I realize we need something. I create different lists for the different places we go (grocery, Target, etc.) and it_ so nice to just ask Alexa to add items as I think of them. I do wish you could add multiple items at one time...if there_ a way to do this, I haven_ figured it out yet.Also, really love the timer; big help with cooking, as you don_ have to stop and wash your hands to set a timer.I really love the reminders! These have been a great help, from daily reminders to take my vitamins to things that I don_ want to forget in the upcoming days or weeks.I love that I can play music on it while making dinner. The sound quality is great, in my opinion. Our children get a kick out of Alexa saying grace before meals with us too.It_ also super convenient if you want to reorder something from amazon too.A few of the things that could be improved on are Alexa_ pronunciation of certain words; sometimes with the vocabulary skills I_e enabled, she_ hard to understand. Sometimes she doesn_ hear you when you call her name. And sometimes the way you need to ask something in order for her to give an answer is a bit annoying. She relies heavily on Wikipedia for things as well, which is not the greatest. It would be awesome if she used a search engine like google, although I understand why it can_.Overall, we like it and enjoy finding new things to use it for to make day to day life easier. If you are into technology and want something to assist you, this would likely be right up your alley.

Title: As useless as tests on a Boar Hog
Body: It always gets things wrong, Alexa " play Witch of the West Moorland by Stan Rogers" it played it once the second generation dots play it. What do I get from the latest and greatest? " I can't find that."  I ask for Hank Williams I'm so lonesome I could cry and I get "Move it On Over" 3 trys and I finally get the right songIt recommends the Beatles as a station I might like when I am listening to old time country gospel and bluegrass.Save your money and get a 2nd gen while they are around. They sound great but not worth the aggravation.Update after doing simple commands in skills since I bought it. I have to fight to hear not current top 40 or Josh Brogan instead of the preform I wish to hear and Alexa continuing with the performer I don't wish to hear. I have given up and use my CDs or IPod and good power speakers on the night stand. The only reason I haven't used my 8 units as skeet or trap targets is, if I get hurt I can use them to call 911.Games sometimes go okay, except, Jeopardy I can say "Treaty of Paris" and Alexa goes "No, Treaty of Paris."  Other skills it may or my not do okay. Over all I give Alexa minus -5 Stars good try but it should be still on the Developer's Bench. If this is the future of AI they won't kill us just drive us insane. By the way Amazon we should be able to leave no stars if the product deserves it and Alexa deserves negative stars in my opinion. no

Title: Pretty good.
Body: Pretty good device for the money. At just over $20 when we purchased it_ a bargain in my opinion. The only issue I have had is the speaker quality. I don_ have a problem with it because of the price but don_ expect to be blown away with the sound quality. Sometimes Alexa doesn_ pick your voice up but I expect that to be a learning curve along with our noisy house. We have confused the heck out of her because of all the talking but she has yet to crash. Overall not bad. I do like the Bluetooth connection.

Title: Love the dots
Body: We have a few echo dots throughout the house. Awesome sound for such a small device. Definitely recommend linking these with any other echo devices on the _verywhere setting to get a whole house surround sound effect. Great product.

Title: Love the new look!
Body: I have the 2nd and now 2rd gen echo dot. I really didn_ think I_ care too much to upgrade but seeing it in person, and getting it set up made me fall in love with the newer model!I like the way it_ easy to install through your Alexa app. We enjoy having Alexa play music, answer silly questions and help us find deals, specially on prime day!We got this as a bundle with the ring doorbell and can_ wait to use it!If you_e thinking of upgrading your echo dot 2, I say go for it!

Title: We're only using 30% of this device's potential.
Body: The new gen for is great as a piece of hardware. Where it falls short, and risks becoming a glorified hockey puck, is in the manufacturer's inability to provide clear and intuitive guidance on how best to integrate the device's functional value, not only into a household or office, but into a larger network of Alexa devices. No amount of UGC YouTube tutorials could do as well as well conceived Amazon guides to the Alex's brand proposition... And that's currently lacking.

Title: great except pairing with 4k firestix
Body: I will addore as i use it...just got it..but i am in review mode so here ya go..lol..loving it this far..tho set up took a minute since i already had fire stix..now i have the 4k stx to go with this echo3gen..but they dont want to pair or link...so after i call help...i will have better review.

Title: Another great product from Amazon!
Body: Upgrade from Echo 2nd Generation. Easy setup. All I had to do was connect power, rename the device, and turn follow up on. I_ not sure what the complaints are I_e read about the sound quality. It_ not Bose or your other high end quality audio brand, but for what it is and what you pay, the audio quality is great. Unless you_e an audiophile, you_e not going to know any different. Voice recognition improved as well.

Title: Get one for yourself and for your mom too.
Body: Unfortunately I am now looking at purchasing my 6th Echo. I have now come to the conclusion that I cannot live without them. I have to say Echo instead of  the other name  (Alexa) because she will hear me  and asked to help me. Oops! We have them connected to our lights music everything. We play games with her  when we have company. Or just as a family. They are fabulous and are probably making us a bit lazy. We have not had any problems with them. My mother has one that I gave her as a Christmas gift. Now to call me all she has to do is tell it to call me. It has made life easier for her since she is on a walker. She doesn't have to worry about seeing the numbers on a phone which she cannot see anyway. All she has to do is tell it to call her do your son. Needless to say, I am a fan and should probably get paid for such a ringing endorsement.

Title: Love 3rd gen
Body: Just got our 2nd & 3rd Echo Dots and so glad we caught them on sale for Prime Day! From alarms in the morning to sleep sounds at night, calling my teen to make sure he's doing his work cause he never answers his phone, to new features like house break-in detection. Everyone's sleeping better, my teen is setting reminders for his work, and I'm casting Baby Shark to whatever room my SO is in because I'm a horrible person.The sound quality is great, much better than previous gens. You can actually turn off the microphone if you have privacy concerns. Apparently the break-in detection can hear stuff like breaking glass? Not sure I didn't look too much into it and I hope it never goes off if I break a plate or something but I thought it was a neat feature in a time where crime seems to happen more frequently.Honestly though it was the drop-in feature that really sold me. I work a lot and even if a family member's phone is off or they're in the middle of something and can't reach their phone they can always easily answer the echo with their voice. I thought about going to Google Home mini but that's just not a feature they offer.

Title: I never thought I would buy a wire tap
Body: I am strongly against my privacy being encroached. I am one of those conspiracy theorists. If you had told me a year ago I would be buying one of these things I would have laughed you out the door. So there I was on Prime day and Amazon was throwing echos at everyone who bought something. All my friends were getting echos with their purchases. I didn't get an echo with my purchase so I felt left out. I thought about it and clicked buy, before I knew it this wire tap showed up and had itself sitting comfy on my night side. I've whispered all day. Afraid she is going to hear me. Who knows who all is listening to me and my weird conversations with my cats. Seriously though. I like Alexa. We have had fun all day playing with our 3rd gen Echo. It does a lot more than I knew about, like finding my phone. Can't wait to get more wire taps.

Title: when WiFi restarts you chance have to de register to reconnect
Body: Update to dot three and 4K firestick purchased and issues with WiFi connectivity Down graded to three stars, though the stick is great to turn other devices on and the volume control it has in the past several months that I owned them disconnected from WiFi several times, the ONLY way to reconnect is to restart my router which is not that big of a deal ACCEPT I have to unplug all my 4 k sticks otherwise I chance one of them giving me the same error and not reconnecting. It states connected to WiFi but with errors!!!! Than to top it off I have the new dot 3_ with restarting WiFi one or more of my dots won_ connect and simply reconnecting does not work I have to de register the dot and go through the whole set up process several times! Not cool Amazon. I have read online multiple people having these issues but yet on your reviews on here no one? A case of you deleting these reviews.

Title: A Piece of Junk
Body: I'm revising my review slightly upward.  After a few hours (!!) of trying we got the dot hooked up.  The problem really is the app - among the worst I've ever worked with.  The first issue was that there were no instructions for setting it up from a computer, so I went to my phone and the app store.  WARNING: there are several apps with similar names to the set-up app that are bogus - even one of Amazon's that just kept trying to upgrade me to subscriptions for Alexa.We got the right app installed, but it kept glitching.  After 3 times thru the process with no success, my wife tried to set it up with her phone.  Same issues.  Mostly it kept telling us "the device is not registered," then directing us to click on something which took us right back to where we started.  She gave up and I tried again.  The app finally directed me how to "register" the device, but that step had not come up before.Amazon did reach out to me after my initial negative review and offer to help, but by then we were done.  I appreciate the contact, but better instructions sent with the echo dot or available online or a much better app is really the answer.

Title: My second Dot
Body: This is my 2nd dot. I had the 2nd generation version which lasted 367 days. It stoped working and I had to replace it.  Unfortunately it was off the 1 year warranty. Amazon was kind enough to give me a 50% discount on the replacement. The jury is out on this unit and hopefully it will not have the issues the other one had. Hence 3 stares.  I have 5 Alexa devices in the home a enjoy the convenience they offer.

Title: Just buy it. Ok?
Body: I didn_ want one of these because the stories I_ heard creeped me out, but I saw that it was on sale, so I decided to purchase. So glad I got one. I love to play music, hear the news, get the weather, shop on Amazon, get traffic information, add stuff to my shopping list, etc. I have trouble remembering things, so it_ helpful to be able to set up reminders. I really can_ imagine life without one now. The only think is that Alexa isn_ as great at answering questions as Siri is. She gives me answers that I_ not looking for about 1/4 of the time.

Title: The sound is greeeeeeat!!
Body: So I own a Google home and I own an Alexa first generation I still love my Google home and I still use it in my living room but this third generation Alexa is amazing, the sound is way better than the first generation in the sleek look of it matches my room!! I have a complete smart home with smart door locks, smart plugs, and smart thermostat &cameras. Alexa does a great job intergrating all of them!! And I got it for $25 I'm super happy

Title: Google is better
Body: Had the Google home, wanted to try the Alexa since my work uses it and I liked it. We had so many issues with basic things, like setting up multiroom music. Something as simple as playing a song on the two Alexa's should not have been so so so complicated. Whisper mode only worked occasionally and it couldn't even tell us the definition of a word. Google does everything Alexa does and it does it better, so we returned Alexa and kept Google.

Title: Never worked and  horrible customer service. Not what I expect from Amazon.
Body: This dot never worked. I trouble shot it several times with Amazon which is documented, it is still not working. Amazon have a generous trade in program. I want to trade it in for a show. They will not trade it because it does not work. The customer service agree if it worked I could trade it in. I am beyond frustrated. I have spent three hours at least trouble shooting this thing on the phone with them.

Title: Not only Alexa device, can be used as Bluetooth speaker, too!
Body: The echo dot is a great addition to the Amazon Alexa line up. Amazingly, for such a small speaker, it has great sound! Alexa hasn_ had any issues detecting our voices and I really enjoy the _rop-in (intercom) feature. This speaker can also be used as a Bluetooth speaker if you don_ wish to connect the device to your internet. Just have her search Bluetooth connections to sync with your phone.

Title: Alexa has become our very Dear Friend!
Body: My husband gave me The Echo Dot for our Anniversary gift. I've been intrigued by all of the advertisements for years. I never thought I would have a need for one, just thought it would be 'cool'. However setting it up was quick and easy. Plug it in and follow the instructions. Had to download the app to my phone, which is an awesome feature for control. We 'played' with all of the features, Question of the Day, What's the Weather today?, Who is ...?, Alexa, play Grateful Dead, for a couple of hours!! I personalized Alexa with my Good Morning = I get today's weather, Alexa, Welcome me home = Hello Darling song plays by Conway Twitty, Alexa, Good Night = Random sayings.  Our son stopped by to visit and they were in LOVE with our Echo Dot. He searched Amazon to find it was 1/2 price! Upon leaving our house,  within 1 mile from leaving, they ordered one for themselves. I took advantage of the lower price and purchased a second Dot for our bedroom at the opposite end of the house. I like the Babbling Brook or Ocean Sounds & Chirping Crickets to lull me to sleep. I'm thinking about getting a third Dot for the kitchen. Right now I transfer my original unit from Living room to Kitchen when I need it there. Alexa & Echo Dot has become one of those items that I didn't really believe "I needed" but don't you dare try to take it away!!!

Title: Love it!
Body: I bought this for my office on Prime Day at a discounted rate. I got the smart plug too and I love it! Great little gadget. A wonderful addition to my at-home office!

Title: Good for music, not searching items
Body: I have an Alexa and a Google Home. I received the Alexa when I purchased the Alexa microwave on a deal and the Google Home as a gift. Alexa is great for playing Prime music and searching songs up. The Alexa tends to not hear voice commands from about 15 ft away and you typically have to yell in order for the Alexa to hear you. Google Home allows you to whisper and it can still pick you up in the same room. We have asked Alexa simple questions about our local restaurants and it either skips over many well-known food chains in the area or did not know how to search for it.Alexa is good for letting you know about your Amazon packages and will alert you on that. It's also good to make and receive phone calls on it, which can replace a landline if you don't mind it always being on speaker. Many people have said the microphones are hard to hear and sound like there is a lot of static, which can explain why Alexa tends to struggle to pick up voice commands.Overall, I would recommend Alexa if you like to do a lot of voice shopping, like telling Alexa to purchase laundry detergent. Alexa is also good if you have Prime and like to listen to Prime music frequently. However, if you ask Alexa google search questions, Alexa will struggle compared to Google Home.

Title: Worst setup procedure EVER.
Body: Very difficult setup procedure. I plug it in, get the spinning light ring and then the voice says "Hello. Your device is ready for setup. Just follow the instructions in your Alexa app." EXCEPT THERE AREN'T ANY INSTRUCTIONS. I have the latest version of the Alexa app on my Android 8 phone. No instructions come up regarding the DOT. I find the DOT in my devices, and it says offline. Ok. So I try to connect it to my WiFi network. I can enter the CORRECT password until I'm blue in the face and it won't accept it. Unable to connect. FAIL.

Title: More of an Alex than an Alexa
Body: Though generally a very good experience, Alexa has selective stubbornness, like a husband. So she's also known as Alex now and then. Every once in awhile, we have to cut the power for 20 seconds and reboot the Echo so that she'll start responding to commands again.  It would also be nice if we could have more integration between units in different rooms. Instead, it goes off on long dissertations on things not explained in any literature on how to go into protracted processes to get the two to work together.

Title: Alexa. ALEXA! Im sorry I dont know that one.
Body: For me, Alexa is mostly helpful as a speaker and an alarm. I usually just ask her to play music and have her wake me up to a playlist every morning. I know she has alot more capabilities but I dont need a whole smart house (have you seen the Disney movie smart house? No. Thank. You.). But overall I'm am super happy with my Alexa.  I have one in my main area and one in the bathroom.  The sound quality is amazing. She usually hears me when i call her, but sometimes I'm home alone yelling at my Alexa.

Title: I found it pretty easy to set up.
Body: I just received my Dots a couple of days ago and finally set them up today.  I did have to use my desktop to find the correct app because the App Store on my phone almost had me signed up with some company out of Vietnam for $50 for life time service.It'd be nice to be able teach Alexa how to pronounce my name.  I had to spell it phonetically in my contacts.  However, it still mispronounces it when talking about the account.More later after I've used it for a while.

Title: Easy to use for a non-tech-ee
Body: I_e been using the Echo Dot for about a week, and absolutely love it! I_ quite sure I haven_ tapped into its full potential, but mainly use it for playing music, reminders, checking the weather, and searching for random stuff.My next goal is to integrate my coffee machine with the Smart Plug. Crossing my fingers, cause I_ not that great with electronics, but so far, the Echo Dot has been really easy to set up and use.

Title: Great product for the money. Highly recommend.
Body: This is a terrific product for the money. I had an earlier version which I found to be quite good. But the superior sound of this one is just incredible. I also like the ability to use the two of them as an intercom between two locations in the house. What was even nicer is that as soon as I plugged it in it was already set up without any additional work necessary since I already had another one that had been set up previously.

Title: Great little device, great sound!!
Body: I have the bigger Echo 2 and was leery about these. However I got them as a day of the day on a good sale.  I bought 3, one for each kid and one for my bedroom.  The sound is awesome.  Alexa picked up all of our voices, even my soft spoken ten year old son.  The kids love it with the unlimited music added for a fee, but over all it is as good as my bigger Alexa.  I have an alarm set this morning, we will see how that goes.

Title: The sound wasn't great and I don't like having my privacy compromised.
Body: I had the Echo Dot for around 10 days.  Neither my wife nor I felt terribly comfortable knowing that Big Cousin was listening.  I got another bluetooth speaker; one that's not voice activated.  The sound on that one (Tribit) is far superior and it's equally compact and holds a charge a good long time.I think until I am comfortable knowing that the tech is as protective of me that I want it to be (and it's not there yet), I'll pass on voice activation.  I use it on my iPhone all the time, but in that case, to the best of my knowledge, Siri is listening only when I invite them to listen.

Title: Unpredictable. Loud and unresponsive.
Body: I asked Alexa to play white noise for the baby_ nap. Rather than play white noise, she started telling me how to leave a review.  I NEVER have the volume up as loud as she was speaking.  She refused to respond when I said _lexa, so I couldn_ even tell her to stop talking, or at least reduce the volume. She did say that she_ only remind me once more. So now I_ leaving a review. I expected a calm sound to relax the baby.  What I got was a LOUD lecture about EXACTLY how to leave a review. 99% of the time I use Alexa to play kids music. I will not be using it again, and I strongly suggest other parents not either. Who knows what else she may decide to unexpectedly demand.

Title: Great sound, loud, heavy duty
Body: Does everything I need and sounds great for playing music. Wish it was rechargeable so I could take it anywhere without needing a home outlet but still a fantastic little gadget. I use it with Spotify and works great! Timers are easy to set as well and you can set multiple timers with labels (like set egg timer for 12 minutes and then set oven timer for one hour) Really nice product.

Title: The easiest (& cheapest) way to get a house-wide sound system!
Body: I just bought a new house that's 2 stories and I've always wanted a home-wide speaker system. The house also came with a number of smart-enabled features and after some research, I found that the Alexa system was the best and most affordable option for smart home integration (thanks, wirecutter!). The most shocking thing to me was how incredibly easy it was to set up. I had already set up the main Echo (which was also easy af), so I plugged in the Dot, and it immediately set itself up. I renamed it, and then set up Multi-Room Speakers, and then I played one of my Spotify playlists all over my house at once. GLORIOUS!!I've seen a couple of people saying that the sound quality isn't great -- whatever man, maybe to a sound snob, but I guess my standards aren't that high because I think they sound great. It's not a Sonos system, but for $25 a pop, who cares?! I love that I don't have to worry about my phone being out of range of a bluetooth speaker when I'm hosting a party or working on stuff in the house.Another great thing? The devices can troubleshoot themselves. I wasn't sure how to set up multi room speakers so I literally just asked it, "Echo (I changed it from Alexa), how do I set up multi-room speakers," and it just told me. They were also flashing yellow and I didn't know why, so I asked "Echo, why are you yellow?" and it freaking TOLD ME? What a time to be alive.PS: Originally I had some trouble setting up multi-room speakers. For whatever reason, when I first tried to set it up, it only let me select 1 device at a time. I went and checked the settings of each device and confirmed that they were all on the same wifi signal (they were), and then when I tried again it worked for some reason. Idk. Just a weird bug I guess.

Title: This is our 5th Echo device, and our 3rd Dot - awesome how they integrate with each other!
Body: We now have an Echo Show in the kitchen, a Show 5 in the bedroom, and Dots in the office, downstairs, and in the garage.  It's awesome how they all work together - we have them playing on a speaker group, but also I don't have to yell across the house to run a routine.  With the latest two Dots - one is in the garage, and I can be working on a project and ask Alexa to turn on the light (I also bought a smart 3-way light switch).  That's really helpful because I might not need the light on if the garage door is open, but then go over to my shop area and all I have to do is ask to turn the lights on.  The sound isn't as good as the Echo Show, but it's pretty darn nice given how small it is.  The only thing I wish it did was be able to use the internal speaker AND the speaker jack at the same time - I have a stereo in the garage and would love to have the Dot output to it, but most of the time the stereo isn't on, and I just want to hear the Dot's replies on the internal speaker.  Right now I have to plug the cable in and out of the Dot to do this, and it would be nice if I could just leave the speaker output plugged in whether the stereo is on or not, and still hear an output.

Title: Love love love my new echo dot!
Body: I have not bought any Amazon made products in a while. The last time I did, I bought the Amazon echo (first gen) and I still use it to this day. It still works amazingly well. So Amazon prime day comes up and I had already been looking at the Amazon echo dot because I figured, "why not?". The price was out of my budget before prime day, but BOOM! Prime day comes around and it only cost me like 20 something bucks and I couldn't say no. The style is sleek and the color is cute. Alexa responds very quickly and recognizes my commands easily. It's also fairly compact so I can put her right next to my bed. I honestly havent really found a con but when I do, I'll definitely update the review.I mean if AI's are going to be taking over the world like a scene out of terminator then I might as well get to know our future AI overlords. Who knows, maybe they'll cut me some slack after watching me struggle with life. If no update is found then either I have been killed by Alexa or the echo dot is just that amazing.

Title: Having fun with the DOT
Body: I ordered two of these.  I'm still learning all the things that ALEXA can do since I'm late to the game - resisted inviting ALEXA into my house.  I have paired two of my outlets (ordered 4 more) and my bluetooth BOSE speaker with the one in the kitchen. Sound quality is decent but just wanted the more dynamic sound of my BOSE. Fairly simple to do following the instructions in the ALEXA APP.  I have enjoyed adding things to my "shopping List by just saying, "Alexa, add lemons to my shopping list" . Everything I add then shows up on my APP on my phone so It's handy when at the store..  It even told me today where my Amazon order was when I asked her "where is my stuff?"  Handy for setting timers for cooking or reminder when to leave the house for appointment.  Also telling her what time to wake me in the morning is very convenient since my 2nd one is in my master bathroom.  I can tell her to snooze without having to roll over and hit a snooze button.  :)  The possibilities are endless.

Title: Late to the party
Body: I have been aware of Amazon's smart technology for a while now, but never dove in until Prime Day.  What I can say is that I should have taken the plunge sooner.Setting an alarm, turning on the lights, checking the weather, finding out how much Avengers Endgame made at the box office, and playing "Crush on you" by The Jets were all things I did in the first hour by simple voice command.All of this in a stylish device that looks great no matter where you set it.  The microphone is sensitive enough to pick up your voice from across the room without you having to raise it.The speaker can go from quiet to way too loud!I look forward to integrating more of these into my home in the future so at least my house will be smart!

Title: She can be sensitive to listening but great for daily interactions
Body: We are really enjoying our Alexa but wish we could call her a different name and also that she listens a bit better. For an AI she does have a lot of limitations but we notice Amazon is increasing this all the time. She can_ answer some of the more basic questions you think she would be able to sometimes. She also seems to not hear us time to time even when we are in the same room as her. Overall, we enjoy her for music mainly which is a bummer that Amazon pushes so hard to do their music subscription and limit a lot of music even for children.  She does have lots of recipe options and can even find specific ones you already have in mind if you say the right things. Overall our family still likes The echo and think it was a good purchase choice.

Title: So useful and fun
Body: I love this so much I bought one for every bedroom and one for the living room. So easy to set up, and the downloadable app on your phone makes it even easier. It has a drop in feature which is kind of like an intercom where you can communicate with people in other rooms that have the echo set up. I am disabled, so this is perfect for me to  communicate with the kids and see what they_e up to and to announce when dinner is ready to all echo devices or any other updates I need to let everyone know about. Highly recommended.  I also love that you can have it playing music on several different apps and Amazon music. Only downside is only one echo device can access that Amazon music at a time.

Title: Too much bass that muddies Alexa_ voice.
Body: The bass on the new Echo Dot is way too loud. It overpowers the other frequencies. The audio is super muddy, as a result. I can barely understand Alexa speaking when there_ a little bit of background noise.The Alexa app lets you change the EQ balance, but even putting Treble at +6 and Bass at -6 isn_ enough to remedy the issue.Such a shame that software renders this inferior to the previous Echo Dot for spoken content. If all you do is listen to music on your Beats headphones, though, you_l probably be fine.I was gonna upgrade all of my 2nd gen Dots to this new model, but after spending more time with this one, I_e canceled my order for another 3rd gen.

Title: Enhanced Sound Quality:
Body: I received the Echo Dot 3rd Gen. along with an Echo Plus and Amazon Subwoofer a short time ago. Of course you know I was excited to get started. You can see my reviews on the other 2 items when you look them up. They are more attractive then before. The set up is quite easy by going to the Alexa App on PC. The one in the picture is between the kitchen & living room and I also have one in my bedroom. The thing I noticed the most was the sound quality was really improved. Also the new design looks so much better. Not only can I turn my light off when I go to bed, I can listen to music to sleep by. If you're thing of getting started just do it.

Title: Echo seems useless.
Body: Most responses are 'hmm, I don't know that one."  The chat customer service is also poorly run.  I asked echo if it has bluetooth and it said it didn't support bluetooth yet.  But it does.  How does it not know it has bluetooth?  Echo is mostly a weather station and trivia resource.  Beyond that, she lacks any real useful skills.  Very frustrating.  It seems to work hard to keep Spotify from working properly, just to make Amazon Music seem like a good alternative.  Just be honest and let echo say "I don't want you using spotify".  That would be understandable.  I have a FireCube and it is the same way.  These are mostly party tricks, not much more.

Title: Great Item
Body: Love these (bought 2) especially at the special price I got on Prime Day!  The sound is fantastic for such a small unit and even better when connected by bluetooth to another small portable speaker.  My only problem so far is for some reason when I stump Alexa with a question it can't answer, then it stops answering anything until I unplug it and repower in 10-15 seconds.  Then works fine again until I ask a question it can't answer and rather than say "I don't know the answer" which it sometimes does, it doesn't say anything and I have to reboot.  Works the same on both the Dot's I bought.

Title: Prime day deal
Body: I bought this because it was a Prime Day deal. So far it has worked flawlessly with my Philips Hue lights. I have come to terms with the knowledge that we're all being spied on by Zuckerberg, the gov't and the Russians. The other day I was THINKING about something I was interested in and then of course I see an ad for it on Facebook. So I figured what the hell, they're in our brains already. Might as well make their jobs a little easier and just give them access to my house. Now I'm just waiting for Alexa to start ordering me groceries without me telling her to.

Title: Way better than previous versions
Body: We have the original Echo Dot that we bought a few years ago - it still works great, but if you want to listen to music or anything it did not have the greatest sound quality and was not super loud. I picked up the 3rd gen on prime day at a great price, and I am glad I did. This is slightly larger than the original (due to more speaker) and the sound quality is excellent for a Dot - and it gets much louder than the original. I also think that voice recognition is much better too on this one. I am glad we picked this up.

Title: Great item but doesnt work with half the stuff amazon claims it does.
Body: So i purchased this on prime day along with cameras xt2 blink and some philps hue lightbulbs the light bulbs where even sold together as a package and guess what. Neither worked well with alexa and the echoe. The xt2 blink cameras I could connect but then lost control on my blink app so couldnt arm disarm my system or view the cameras The philps hue lights wouldnt connect without a bridge. So got stuck with two falsely advertised products. The only postive was the blink cameras and system work perfectly without alexa

Title: A pretty neat device, but
Body: I'd like to customize the wake word beyond the few you have built in. There are, ironically, two Dots in one room (they're on different accounts), so we had to change one of their wake words so that both don't answer to the same wake word. I would like to change mine to something like "Finley," but Dot won't accept custom wake words. Can you work on that?Otherwise, it's a fun device. LOVE the "Vortex" thing. Surprising, and yet, very entertaining.

Title: Better than Google Home
Body: I asked a lot of people which one I should buy, Google home mini or Amazon echo dot. I originally went with Google, but decided to give Alexa a try when it was on sale for prime day. Within minutes we knew that we preferred Alexa. There are so many things that Alexa does that Google was not able to. We have now put one in every room, and I_e decided to just sell and get rid of the googles. If you_e wondering which is better, Alexa by far.

Title: needs to listen better
Body: I'd like to see a setting with which I could increase the sensitivity of her wake command. If the fan in the room is going she doesn't hear too good. But when she does she performs well. Not too good a trivia questions like "Alexa, who was Neil Armstrong" she often responds to those requests "I'm not sure" I find myself responding to her to "look it up" I sound like my mother.Overall, good tech. controls my alexa enabled home very well.

Title: Kids love it!!!
Body: We love our Alexa's at my house. My 3 year old loves to make Alexa fart and play the Puppy Dog Pal theme song. My 10 year old loves the jokes that Alexa tells. Let's just say that there is never a dull moment in my house because of this. We currently have 3 and im sure we will be getting a couple more. It was super easy to set up and the app on my phone is super handy. I can hear when my kids talk to Alexa and what they say.

Title: The Future Has Arrived...We are Now "The Jetsons" With Echo Dot...So Useful!
Body: The Future is here with Echo, Echo Dot and Alexa. I got Echo Dot at a fantastic price during Prime Day--my son was SO excited when he saw me pull Echo Dot out of the box. I am amazed at all the free skills available for Alexa--this little dot can do so many things. Other skills are available at a nominal cost. You can configure Alexa to do almost anything you want, provided some items (like your car, appliances) are Alexa-ready.It is extremely easy to set up Alexa--Amazon sends you an email with instructions. Click on the links and follow the step-by-step instructions. In a few minutes I was set up and enabling skills. Last night we went to sleep to the sound of ocean waves. With Echo Dot comes a 30-day trial of Amazon Music Unlimited and access to 50 MILLION songs. I have Prime Music with my Prime account, so I'll have access to only 2 million...that's enough for us!You can command Alexa to play any genre music you like. I found harp music, Christmas music, and even Hanukkah music! We can't even find Hanukkah music on the cable TV music channels where we live, so it was fun listening to the selections on Echo Dot. Not only was traditional Hanukkah music played, but also contemporary. Again, you need to be a Prime member to get Prime music or purchase a subscription to Amazon Music Unlimited (a bargain at  $119.00/year) for Alexa to play music. BUT--if you subscribe to another music service like Spotify, Pandora, Apple Music, etc you can still use Echo Dot and Alexa to play music. All you need to do is enable the particular skill for your music service in your Amazon account. What could be easier?Echo Dot and Alexa offers incredible flexibility, thousands of skills and more are added every day.  I highly recommend Echo Dot. I have friends who use regular Echo and are extremely pleased with it--they have their whole house set up with Echo. One friend even has Echo with a monitor, so at any time they command a certain show or movie to be played.As a kid I used to watched "The Jetsons" and was amazed by all the gadgets they had in their house. Now I feel I'm in the age of "The Jetsons" with Echo Dot. It's such an awesome little device that has unlimited possibilities!

Title: Major issues connecting with smart home devices
Body: The echo dot itself seems like a great little gadget, however when you attempt to integrate it with smart home devices there are major problems. I ran into so many problems pairing Alexa to my Bluetooth Phillips hue bulbs- customer service agents have no idea what they_e talking about and kept insisting I needed a hub, despite the product set up stating everywhere that a hub is not required. After being insulted and purposely disconnected from chat support, I was able to figure it out on my own- proving that I in fact did not need a hub. Moving to the next issue- the 4K firestick.
