Alexa recognizes the device and will boot up the tv and play shows when you ask- however once you attempt to power on or off the tv, she suddenly has no idea what device you_e talking about and claims it does not exist. Clearly some issues with echo Alexa connecting to other devices properly. No point in talking to tech support about it either because they obviously don_ know their own products and will just insist you need to buy something else to connect them.

Title: Easy set up!
Body: This came as a freebie with one of my Prime Day purchases and really love it! We were gifted a dot when they first came out years ago, but I never really fooled with the features much and my husband had set it up. With this one, I decided to try setting it up and with the Alexa App on my phone, I was literally up and ready to use it in a minute. Not difficult at all. I was able to easily pair it to one of my bluetooth speakers as well as connect to my phone to take advantage of the 'find my phone' feature. There are TONS of skills you can enable (for free) from the Alexa app and I still haven't found all of them yet. I did try a few games, which were fun to pass the time if you get board.  Definitely recommend!

Title: Better sound - be aware that you can adjust the tone.
Body: Intrigued by the promise of better sound quality, I snagged one of these during a deal-of-the-day special. Although better and louder, it sounded like it's being broadcast from the bottom of a well. I then decided to do some checking, and found that they introduced 3-band equalization (bass, mid, & treble). By default, the settings are all 0,0,0, which explained the sound being flat. This is adjustable -/+6db via voice command or the app. Be sure to update the mobile device app if you have not already. The tone is adjustable from the app or by voice.

Title: There is so many features about Alexa that will blow your mind.Customer service is superb
Body: Any song recorded, Alexa will play for you and store it in 'your favorites section', forever.The music and sound are incredible. So, unaware that you could just unplug the Echo and take into any room in the house.....I bought 2 more units.  Then the UPS man informed me about the audible book feature to Alexa. Wow, Wow,Wow! I can't do justice in trying to explain how wonderful it is to sit back and have a good book read to you. If you fall asleep like I did, just ask Alexa to start chapter 4 again or replay the whole book. How great is that?Got a problem? Ask Alexa to contact Customer Service, and you will receive a call within 2 minutes. No more cd's , records ,or cassette tapes to store. If you have wifi, Alexa can do anything you can imagine.I exercise to 'Super Freak' every morning. How great is that?

Title: Doesn_ work with hue bulbs app on its own.
Body: I bought this on prime day as part of a package with hue lights because I read that_ all I_ need to control them.This Alexa isn_ the fancy one that can act as a bridge for the hue lights. If you plug in the bulbs the Alexa can find them and with your voice you can turn them on and off if you_e home. You cannot use the hue app or see the lights in the Alexa app to control them when you_e away which was why I bought the package. I_ not too lazy to flip a light switch...I don_ need voice controlled lights. Be warned before purchasing you_l need a 40 dollar hue bridge if you want full control of the bulbs.

Title: Change your world
Body: Ohhhh how I love my Echo dot! I currently have two. One in my living room and one in my bedroom. I have my girl Alexa remind me of things all the time. Alexa and I have some rocking dance parties. Alexa even fills me with some incredible factoids. Sometimes when I_ real bored Alexa and I play games. I asked Alexa the other day if she listens to me even when I don_ cue her... And with a stern tone, not average voice, she said no she would never invade my privacy like that. I think I believe her. I mean why would she lie lol

Title: Great looking Echo dot
Body: We already have a 2nd gen that works just fine but once Prime Day deals came along, who can resist buying another at such a great price.  New one looks fancy with the gray cover around the edges compared to the bland 2nd gen black shiny surface. Inside, it all works the same.  i cannot really tell the difference.  My kids though love the "New echo".  It is "so much better" than the old one.  The deal even comes with fire stick.  (we use it with a ton of skills, and all works well via voice control with hue, harmony, wifi plugs, music games, trivia)  Bonus - it comes with proprietary plug so my kids aren't unplugging alexa any more to charge their microUSB devices

Title: Terribly bad compared to my other one
Body: The orinal tiny Echo is so far better than this one but has the one problem this one does not which is speaker quality. This product does not listen right. You have to tell for it to answer you even with no noise in the room. It does not understand speech as well either. It sounds well but they is about it. I am sorry I purchased it. My original Echo gen 1 picks up from the room far away when this does not even tries to listen and I'm right next to it.

Title: Awesome little device
Body: I can't speak to the improvements over the generations as this is the first generation of dots we have bought. We weren't disappointed by our dot though. Decent audio and super helpful in everyday life. I used to burn a lot of food for example. To the irritation of me and my boyfriend lol. No more burnt food because I have Alexa who doesn't forget when my food is gonna be done. You can do so much with Alexa and the dot didn't disappoint

Title: What a great Alexa!
Body: We have a dot in our main living room but I decided to purchase the echo dot for my room to access features like audible, music and news just for me. I am so happy I did! I ask Alexa to start my day and it is the best. She is my alarm now, too. The sync process was super easy and wow the sound is amazing. For the area I use it for if you didn't see it you might think I had a bose playing!! Totally worth every penny and then some. My fav feature is just keeping my skills up with the Question of the Day!!

Title: Easy Setup and it seems to know everything!
Body: I was hesitant to have this device for a number of reasons.  However, I ordered one just the same, received it timely, setup the 3rd Generation Echo Dot and I am enjoying immensely. . so much I ordered another for myself and gifted a friend, enticed my non-technical older sister to have one and now we are all wiser and inclined to be inquisitive and learn its capabilities. There is not one thing that I dislike about it, although I do not use all if its features at this time.Thank you!!!

Title: Overall very good.
Body: No issues with voice recognition even while playing loud music.  Alexa integration is good however so far I've been unable to use it as an additional speaker for my surround sounds which I thought I could. Sound Quality is very good considering how small it is. I have not figured out how to do any of the following so far: let the dogs out, make dinner, clean the house, and when I asked Alexa to make me a sandwich she replied "okay, you are a sandwich" which I thought was very disrespectful.

Title: The 3rd Gen a vast improvement over the 2nd Gen!!
Body: This third Gen is the bomb. I_e had every generation of the echo dot and the regular Alexa and I have to say that this third generation dodge even almost exceeds the regular Alexa. The sound quality is amazing and it has a very sleek design. I bought three of them and I wish I would_e bought more. Amazon great job on this design.  I can_ wait to see what_ on the hopper.The voice recognition is spot on. I put it in front of a desk top fan to introduce noise and there is no issue fully understanding the smallest of command detail.  The second Gen would sometimes not fully understand my voice commands because of the fan in close proximity. The directional microphone_ must_e been adjusted to accommodate human voice versus ambient noise conditions. I almost sound like a fanboy and I am not as I do not own any other Amazon products meaning their Kindles, Smart Products, etc. but these Alexa Dots are amazing.

Title: Great smart home addition
Body: Alexa devices are slowly overtaking the whole entire world! When it first started, it was a simple Alexa speaker now you have Alexa show, spot, dot, and more! It is a great addition with the recent Amazon Prime Day where it came free with the amazon fire stick I bought. The new 3rd generation model with the soft foam speaker surround the actual speaker is so much better than the 1st generation model which was black circular plastic. Music and Alexa speech have great bass and a perfect addition to any room. I find that the volume is clear and Alexa easily follows my commands. Overall it is a great addition to the smart home, now I just have to learn all the voice commands and skills to use it completely!

Title: Amazing... To An Extent :)
Body: My grandma got this for me as a gift and I kind of fell in love with all the Dot could do. I have so many thoughts in my head that it's nice to have Alexa set a reminder, or even an alarm. I play a lot of music and podcasts on here. The only thing I would say I don't love is in the fine print. On TV, you see people requesting a song and it instantly plays. In reality, you will really only get a station built around music similar to the song requested unless you pay for Amazon Music. Although, you can link up your Pandora account to the Dot which is very convenient. I guess my point is, the Echo Dot is truly amazing with all the things it allows you to do, just be aware that it can't do EVERY thing :) The sound quality is very impressive, I must add. There's no need for me to buy another speaker because of the Dot's sound quality, AND you can play your own music from your phone by connecting it via an aux chord to the Dot.

Title: Improved sound at higher volumes, but no longer uses standard micro USB
Body: Much more bass than the previous model, so sound wise it's superior in most situations, but it is harder to understand a very low volumes as the treble doesn't cut through as much, even when maxed out. It's also more attractive and expensive looking than the previous model, but a bit more obtrusive as it's larger.I was disappointed that it no longer used a micro USB port for power, as you're limited to the power adapter and cord length that it comes with.Really not sure which model I like better. I suppose the sound improvement is nice for most, but I don't really use Dots for music, at least not through the built in speaker.

Title: Routines & productivity features limited; speakers buzz from Alexa's own voice at medium volume
Body: Voice recognition is pretty good and Alexa can do a lot of random and interesting things, but after the initial phase of playing around, it's day-to-day usefulness is somewhat limited for real life activities.  The Echo Dot (3rd Gen) speaker also has distortion issues even at medium level playing its own voice.  Also would be great if I could use Alexa as a bluetooth interface for my phone to call or text people just like I can do in my car.  It can apparently only message or call other Alexa devices.  Alexa Routines lack the capability to set timers or reminders as part of a pre-defined routine.  This would be very useful for taking medications or any type of repetitious, timed activities that I'd like to trigger using Alexa.  This limitation is really an Alexa app issue rather than the Echo alone.

Title: Better than my old First Generation Echo
Body: I've have a couple of the old dots, and while they work great, the sound quality drives me up the wall.  I finally bought some inexpensive computer speakers for them.  These sound great.  Perhaps not as good as the 3rd generation Echo, but they sound better than my 1st generation echo. I likely have too many of these in the house, but I have fun with them.  I most likely won't by another, unless one of the 1st generation ones I own breaks, or the speakers do.  But I am very happy with the sound from it.

Title: Love this little gal
Body: I don't have any real 'smart products' to speak of, but this is still fun to play with.  I ask her all kinds of questions and she answers me.  She will meow at my cat for me, which my cat seems disturbed by.  She hasn't failed me at playing descent music.I'll get a few more to extend the range of which I can talk to her, but she does seem to hear me fairly well when I am a couple rooms away (even if I can't hear her reply, I can see her light up though).

Title: So much better than 1st gen!!
Body: The quality of these are much better versus the 1st generation, which is what I originally had. The only thing I don't like about this one, they don't have the same plugs as the originals and other android devices. I liked being able to use stuff I already had if something tore up, and now that's not an option. Sound is much better. Voice recognition is soooo much better. And there seems to be more options/settings for these in the Alexa app.

Title: Only problem is...
Body: I got the Echo Dot up and running and read about skills, so I downloaded some skills and asked Alexa to play a meditation/sleep skill for thunderstorms.  It was very soothing to listen to, but when I asked Alexa to turn off, quit (and several iterations of stop) the thunderstorms/skill, all I got was another sound from the list.  I had to unplug the Echo Dot to get the skill to actually stop.  Not a good thing...

Title: You won_ regret it
Body: Sound quality is so awesome. I got this as a gift for my son.  He_ seven and it_ able to understand him completely when he asks for songs. It_ so easy to use. There is no limit to what this little speaker can do. Call friends, play music, tell the weather, add things to a grocery list. It_ really great. Makes life easier. I_e already bought another since getting the one for my son.

Title: I love technology
Body: It took me about 30 min to figure out and set up, of course with having to reset a password.  things you need to use the echo.  Wifi  , android 5.1 or higher Fire os 3.0 or higher ios 10.0 or higher.  I have an iPhone 7 I think I've updated to 12. 7.  so youll need to download the  Amazon Alexa app. and then everything should be good.  I had no trouble with setup.  For me I love it its great, some basic task you can ask and get quick results, like weather,movies imdb,sports,current news, for instance Alexa when is The Bachelorette on?.  Music is awesome of course you have to have a subscription, its cheap but I have so many, I hated to add another but the convivence of it all is so worth it if you listen to music a lot you can of course create your own playlist all by voice command . I'm defiantly going to get about 2 more if anything for me the music is awesome. I used to spend too much time searching for something to listen to, its so easy to do it by voice command and still do the dishes or what not, right before I sat down to write this review I asked alexa to set a reminder for me to feed my dogs and she just reminded me thank goodness. lol I totally forgot I set a reminder and to feed the dogs, see its pretty cool.  I have the generation 3 my first of this type of device so nothing to compare it to, but I love technology and this is cool.  if you do play music loud Alexa may not hear you across the room you have to get closer like 6 ft. an if you use siri a lot good luck  not getting annoyed at why Alexa wont answer when you've forgotten her name isn't Siri .

Title: Still learning
Body: Ok so I have seen these commercials were people can ask Alexa something and she gives this genius answer that is just as good as me using google but thats not the case here. Yes with some difficulty I was able to connect the firesticks and smart plugs with her and I do plan to get some bulbs as well for stuff thats out of reach. I have a reptile room and being able to tell her when to turn lights, heat, etc off is very helpful.Another thing I really like is the guard option, if she hears glass break or a smoke alarm she will call me or notify me on my phone. This is wonderful because again a huge reptile room with lots of heat and light and that I have teenagers that stay home while I am work. I wake them before I leave but I am always sure they wait till Im gone from the driveaway and go back to sleep. My husband lives 3 minutes away from our house so if we knew smoke alarms were going off he could get there right away.I also have a small dog who is very attached and experiences separation anxiety and Alexa very easily hooked up to a camera (ring) and let me put it where I could see my dog. I can check on him throughout the day and talk to him or even have alexa call his name and he loves it.Finally I was offered a 3 month unlimited amazon music trial. Me, my husband, and 4 teens are loving it. I wish the volume was a bit louder but thats not an issue since I can connect another speaker. I love to be able to just say any song title and she plays it. I can tell her to skip or cancel and she hears my voice over the music. My daughter has a 2nd gen and it just isnt as great as this new third gen. I cleaned my entire house and worked with the animals listening to music the entire time, my husband even enjoyed it enough to leave the tv off and he isnt into music as much as I am. I think I may actually keep the amazon music once the trial is over. Im loving it.

Title: Configure Dot without a second device that also has bluetooth & Alexa app.
Body: There is an important update to this review below...  The new dot looked very cool with the blue led ring. Too bad that as far as it got. The Dot does not have a usb port, and requires you also own fairly new device that can download and install Amazon's Alexa app as well. No way to put DOT on your network without the second Alexa device to talk to it.  I was very disappointed to find my brand new 2019 model Fire tablet w/ Alexa can not help configure a Dot (no bluetooth). Google play store says my smartphone is not compatible with the Alexa app. Microsoft says have to have Windows 10 to install the app on a PC. So the only thing I can do is send the Dot back. Dumb way to design a product line.*Update  As a result of my original 2 star rating, Amazon reached out to me and provided a URL to a webpage with instructions on how to configure the Echo dot, without another Alexa device. It briefly puts your home computer on a network the dot creates. Then you can see the dot to configure it using the PC's browser, including giving dot the wi-fi key to get on your network. When finished you then switch the PC back to your network, and the dot does the same. Amazon should probably include these instructions somewhere easy to find.

Title: Owning is Believing...And I BELIEVE!!!
Body: How did I ever live without Alexa????  I have always owned Apple devices due to its simplicity. However, I have never been happy with Siri.  Alexa is BRILLIANT!!!  Alexa is able to control my Ring doorbell, Roomba, Nest thermostat, Kasa smart switches and camera, etc.  She even knows I named my Roomba _onica (a Friends reference).  Alexa basically consolidated all my apps/devices into one.Ask Alexa to tell you a joke, and she turns the mic over to Jimmy Fallon.  Ask Alexa to start your day, and she can be easily programmed to tell you the weather, what_ on your calendar, traffic to work, news, etc.Ask Alexa to play your favorite radio station...Done!!!  Ask Alexa for a recipe for mango sticky rice and she can tell you the ingredients and send directions to your phone.I have only had Alexa for a week and the capabilities are endless.  This device has been LIFE CHANGING.

Title: Functional and fun!
Body: I just got it today, and I already love it! The setup was very easy to understand and simple to get started! I_ not a techy person necessarily, and I could still figure it out. This gave me confidence in future purchases for some older family members that are afraid they wouldn_ know how to get it set up. For such a small device, the volume is great! I live in a studio apartment, and at its highest volume, the Dot can be heard from all areas. I connected my Spotify to the device and made it my go-to music source. Super easy to do that, and I have yet to stump it on finding a song. I didn_ necessarily _eed this, but now that I have one, I see how handy it is for the house! I would love to buy another one for my bathroom so I can have some shower music!

Title: Fun addition to my home.
Body: Lovin' my new Echo Dot. Haven't even begun to figure out everything it can do, but what I have found so far has been great. I like the easy access to information when I'm not actually at the computer. It has many, many apps for a variety of interactive and fun games. It has also become my alarm clock, weather and flash news report, as well as a way to call my folks when my cell phone died. I highly recommend the Echo Dot for help with reminders, lists, finding new information, and just plain fun. I was truly skeptical about whether or not I'd actually enjoy something like this, but because you can pick and choose how you want to use it and what you specifically like, I'm sold. Even ordered a smart plug to go along with it.

Title: Drop-in a drop-out
Body: We just got our Alexa yesterday, so we_e a bit new. The first thing is that the set up is very easy. Lots of Alexa apps to chose from so I wasn_ sure best one to chose and I don_ have too many smart features so I_ hesitant, at this time, to pay 30$/year for subscription. I_ not impressed with the drop-in. Can_ always hear, sometimes it_ choppy and this is the a feature I REALLY wanted. Also, the cord?? Why no USB port? I feel like the Gen 4 will be fixing these bugs and I_l have to put another ding in my bank account (probably sooner feather than later). I am looking at the google mini home, too. I would love to be able to add groceries to my Walmart App. Perhaps I will buy one and see which I like better. Hmmmm. Decisions decisions.

Title: Do Not Buy
Body: Let me start by saying I purchased an Alexa a year or so ago and I have been very happy with as far as quality, voice recognition, and sound. So on prime day when I saw the echo with a smart plug I was excited to give it a try.First impressions of this little gadget were great I love the sleek look of it and it blends well on my stand. However I_ not at all happy with the rest of it. After messing with it for a while I finally got it to turn my lamp on/off but it was annoying having to say _lexa turn on/off first plug in bedroom every time. Finally got it to where it_ _lexa turn off bedroom light but still it_ a lot to say every time however I could live with that.What I can_ stand is for some reason I feel like I have to scream at it just for it to wake up. I_ literally laying a foot from it and I had to ask 4 different times getting louder each time to get it to turn on. I know it_ not as good as the bigger Alexa but still my other one I can talk in a normal voice from another room and it will pick up on my voice but the echo from a less than a foot away can_ seem to hear me at all. My room is very quiet except for a ceiling fan which I hardly hear at night.Last but not least it has happened 2 times in a week I thought maybe I said something in my sleep and it responded but last night as I was reading it randomly said goodnight. That caught me off guard I spoke nothing before nor did anyone else and for it randomly to do that I was uncomfortable so I unplugged it and had planned on returning.As far as returning it I_ really upset that there only giving me a refund of 14.00 after only having it a week. Granite I paid 26.00 for it which was half price but really not even gonna refund the full amount that is messed up.

Title: Fan of smart homing now
Body: I got used to this thing and now I love it. It's nice to just say "good morning" and get a run down of the day, weather, sports, affirmations etc. I can also tell it goodnight, remind me to do things, and operate a slowly accumulating amount of fun tech (thermostat, door lock, lightbulbs, phone apps etc). I think it's a definitely fun improvement on life. I like the "relax my cat" app, it plays smooth jazz and my cats dig it. Maybe because it relaxes me __ MAN, You can play guided meditations, ocean sounds, cat purrs, your music.... And you just ask with your voice. I get that this has been a thing for a while, I guess it just always intimidated me. It's totally worth learning how to operate, like a new phone.

Title: Alexa is My New Friend
Body: First, I have 8 of these units and use them daily.  I also have the Echo Show and Echo Plus, but those are in another review.  These do everything the reviews say, but I'm using them in a little different way.I'm using them across 3 different networks.  We have 2 homes, with WIFI in both.  We also attend Church, where we also have WIFI.  I have installed the Echo Dot at our Church and at our second home.  Because all Echo Dots are registered with my Amazon account, they all work TOGETHER.  I can be at home #1 and turn on lights at home #2.  I can also be at home and turn on the sound system at Church.Since I also have Alexa on my phone and in my truck, I can turn on things at home #1, #2, or at Church from anywhere in the world.  I find this truly amazing.

Title: Warning!  Works great if Amazon doesn't automatically attach it to someone else's house
Body: The 3rd generation one is soo much better.  The sound quality is amazing for a small thing.I spend over an hour with Alexa team trying to figure out why this one didn't connect to my house, even though it is connected to my house.  The tech person couldn't figure it out, and to this day, a week later, they haven't contacted me back.  Amazon automatically attached it to my secondary house, even though the information listed is the current house I am in.  If it starts asking you for rooms or things that aren't in the house you are in, deactivate it, and activate it again.

Title: Love at first command
Body: I was delighted to discover that Alexa already knew what my favorite music was because she is linked to my Amazon music account. I just wish there were clear instructions on how to adjust the sound balance. I stumbled across it once but couldn't find the balance slides since. If Amazon made it easier to adjust the sound, there would be fewer complaints about sound quality. Still, this was a great deal on Amazon Prime Day. Hope it goes on sale for Cyber Monday in November. Also have Alexa learn your voice so she doesn't turn on everytime the word Alexa comes in the TV or radio.

Title: Would return if I hadn_ got it on major sale. Decent for $22 spent to purchase
Body: If I wouldn_ have purchased this item for over half off I would have been extremely disappointed and would have returned the item. First of all, I spent 2 hours trying to connect the echo dot to my Apple Music account. I ended up having to contact Amazon customer support to resolve the issue. And still I can_ do what I want. I have to use Bluetooth to play my playlist. The echo won_ just do it though WiFi. Now, I still can_ get the Echo to update my location so it tells me weather and other info from another city which is useless to me. The echo dot came with no directions; therefore, I am spending hours trying to figure it out. I look stuff up on the internet to figure out how to do things but there_ not much info on many problems I_ having. I also didn_ know that the echo dot has to be plugged up to a power source at all times to work (my fault for not reading before purchasing). I have also setup my routines on the app, but when I say the commands to Alexa she does not do what I have requested in the app. All around a hassle.

Title: Too much bass
Body: I was so excited to get my 3rd Echo Dot, my first 3rd Gen after buying a few third gens for my aunt and grandmother and seeing the difference, the only this is the sound quality is totally different! It's all bass! I live in an old apartment where it's easy to hear your neighbors and now I constantly have to worry about my volume. I then went in and turned the bass down as low as it could go and turned up the treble... But I can still barely hear song lyrics over the loud bass and constantly worry about being too loud...

Title: I love it!
Body: I bought two of these during Prime day and got 2 smart bulbs as well.  It's a short sample size but early returns are fantastic!  There is so much more to explore that we've barely scratched the surface.  I love that I can turn the lamps on or off verbally.  I love the trivia question of the day.  I love that I can ask Alexa the weather, the score of the game, or to play any song I want.  I'm looking forward to learning more functions and finding new ways to integrate my house into Alexa's world!

Title: Just love it!!
Body: This product is amazing I love the voice recognition, even if  I am really far from it,  Integration of services with the Amazon it's really great I can always ask for my products or quotation on product In real time, Also I love how can work with my TV and power outlets to control my house with my voice.  Sound quality is not the best but the speaker is really small so it's understandable but the functionality it's amazing.

Title: I_ an Alexa convert!
Body: I have been using the Google home device and had no intentions of switching. I had some privacy concerns about Alexa after reading things online that gave me pause.I got a free echo dot as part of a deal I got on prime day. I really didn_ even want it. Thought about selling or giving as a gift. However, my 7 year-old saw it and insisted on opening it. Admittedly curious, I did set it up. We started adding things to my grocery list and asking questions. I was blown away with how much better the voice recognition is (even for my younger son). Alexa understands it. I love the music and the convenience.  It_ now the google device that I_ going to give away. Alexa is such a good product and I_ already addicted in spite of myself.

Title: Works Wonderful!
Body: There is not one thing that i am not happy with at all . The speakers are so clear and play so great . I would have to say that my Bose Wave Radio has nothing on this speaker . Voice recognition is great, you can ask her to set your alarms for things wonderful! and if you have a burning question that you want answered its simple to get your answer often in detail! I cant say enough about this .

Title: Great for music lovers and for busy people!
Body: I love this so much! It_ great for making playlists that you can play from your phone and your car. It_ great for giving you instant weather reports, setting alarms, and reminders. I just got a smart plug to turn on a lamp in a dark corner. It was so easy! I love the dot for making phone calls, including finding my own phone. There are so many more options on the Alexa app that I haven_ used yet!

Title: Fun!
Body: I_ still learning how to work Alexa but she_ fun. I do like the _tart my morning option. I also really like that she stays connected to your phone via Bluetooth which makes it easy if want to listen to music/podcasts from your phone. The sound quality is also good for music. If you want to drive your cats crazy, have her meow at them. I will give an update when needed.

Title: Prime Day Steal of the Day!
Body: My daughter encouraged me to purchase this on Prime Day because of the incredible price.  I reluctantly agreed, sure that I would never use it for much.  It's been in my home for 5 days now & I am finding new things for Alexa every day.  I just wish I had gotten one of these a long time ago.  So easy to play music, make lists, get reminders, and just have fun.

Title: Practical! How did we ever survive without this luxury?
Body: I purchased with intent to use as an intercom for home. Everyone quickly found various uses. I was surprised it needs an app to be downloaded on a phone or tablet to work. I assumed this device could be plugged and Ready to go but first you must download tthe alexa app on a tablet or phone in order to sync to wifi.Pay attention when in app store! Two different amazons popped up in my apps. The wrong one asked for a monthly payment of some sort.This would make for an excellent gift for kids 7 on up or any grown up who likes gadgets of any kind.  I purchased these at a discounted rate for prime members at only 20ish a piece. I intend to purchase 4 more if prices ever reflect similar rates.My daughters enjoyed hearing children stories fully animated with sounds!They also enjoy the soothing music it played at bedtime.I enjoyed being able to use the app to text a message to alexa who announces the message to the entire family. I could have just asked Alexa out loud to make the announcement but this allows for the element of surprise!  I am curious if i can set it up to sing happy Birthday in the morning....The possibilities are endless so this has been a sweet delight! I will be purchasing as Christmas gifts for my nieces and nephews.Lastly it has a handful of unusual features. One is you can look at history on your phone and see every request spoken to Alexa.Another unusual feature on the app is _rop in which gives you the option to listen in which i wouldn't turn that option on.

Title: A helpful device with potential to be even more useful
Body: First, the third-generation Echo Dot itself, as a device: very good. The main disappointment is the sound quality. It's got more base than our second-generation Dot, but tends to sound more muffled.Second, the Alexa app, as used on my fifth-generation Kindle: slow and somewhat clunky, although with patience it finally got our Dots connected to the Internet. (And, no, my Kindle is not overloaded with games and junk files.) A comprehensive set of printed directions  with mention of what needs to be done, what to expect, how to deal with problems that can crop up  would better serve Amazon customers than an oh, so brief and wafer thin package insert.Third, functionality as a communications device: I hope it will become possible to use our Dots as intercoms, not just for "dropping in" to listen to a particular Dot in a particular room, not just to broadcast an announcement to all household Dots that are online. As in "Alexa, intercom to rec room." Alex responds, "Intercom to rec room set." I then say the intercom activation command at my end, which is the room name instead of Alexa, "Rec room, at what time are we going out?"  The person in the rec room responds, "Kitchen, let's leave at 5:45." To end this exchange I say, "Alexa, stop intercom."If there's some way to do this already, I would like to find out how it's done. Maybe, eventually, in a comprehensive user guide that comes in the box.

Title: A Music Lover's Delight!
Body: I bought this wonderful little inexpensive device for my husband as a 20th Anniversary Present. He is 64 and loves music! From June Christy to Jimmy Hendrix! Instead of shuffling through approximately 400 CD's or spending time searching You Tube on his phone...He says Alexa play the Beatles and she responds back to him "Shuffling songs from the Beatles on Amazon Music"! He has a new toy that I don't think he will ever stop loving! She tells him jokes and it is funny! She is one smart cookie! An amazing product! The speaker has volume control which you can request her to turn up or down, or do it yourself manually! The speaker is great quality and can be heard from another room! This was the absolute best gift I have ever given to my husband! Thank you Amazon! Also, you can try Amazon Music for free for 30 days or continue the service for $3.99 a month! Less the $50 bucks a year! How can you go wrong?  It was extremely simple to hook up to wi-fi and to blue tooth speakers!  I would definitely repurchase for gifts!

Title: We liked it so much....
Body: We got the original Echo when it was first introduced and it's still working great and sounds fantastic to this day.  Once you experience having Alexa in your home, you realize that you want her capabilities in other areas.  Our next addition was adding an Echo Dot to the computer room - so great to listen to your favorite genres with a single request.  If two devices are good, three are better.  I purchased a wifi extender just to be able to use this 3rd device in the basement.  Because the area is so much larger and open, I hooked up a bluetooth speaker.  Set up was a breeze and now we can have the Alexa experience throughout our home.  Amazon has truly changed our experiences... it's incredible.  Thanks Amazon!

Title: Great Improvement over 1st Gen
Body: The 3rd gen Dot was much easier to setup than the 1st gen!!!!  I like the sound quality improvements.  The only negative I have about Echo products is that regardless of how many you have, you are only able to control 1 Fire TV device, instead of being able to control multiple devices - should be able to control the Fire TV device with the Echo device in the same room (i.e., Dot and Fire TV in the living room should work together and Dot and Fire TV in the bedroom should work together.  Not sure why Amazon has set it up that only one Fire TV device can be controlled regardless of the number of Echo devices....but that is the way it is.  Would give 5 stars for integration if Amazon would change this.

Title: Does not work with HUE bulbs as advertised. You still need a Phillips Hue Bridge to work with Alexa
Body: I would give 5 stars but I was lied to both by Phillip's and Amazon. Alexa does not interact with HUE bulbs as easily as they make it seem, and that was the whole reason I bought this dumb Alexa thing on prime day; wanted to control my lights. I dont think Phillip's knows about this either. On Phillips' site, they say that when you screw in the bulb, Alexa should auto recognize via bluetooth and discover it.This is not true however. The Alexa needs a skill installed first to use hue bulbs. The problem is that the skill REQUIRES a HUE bridge. But the description for the Alexa v3 and the HUE bulbs both say you dont need the bridge. Under the description of the skill, when finding it in the Alexa app, v3 echo is not listed anywhere as being supported for the skill.So no, it does not seamlessly integrate with HUE bulbs as advertised. And you will need a bridge. I even called tech support from amazon, which was a huge waste of 40min, and they were as stumped as I was.First off the guy tried to walk me through everything I'd done already and wouldn't listen to me about what I had done. I'm a software tester and know how to troubleshoot thanks, I only call tech support when I've exhausted all options elsewhere.EVEN THE TECH SUPPORT DIDNT KNOW ABOUT THE SKILL NOT BEING COMPATIBLE.He was absolutely sure all I needed was the skill, but wouldn't listen to me when I told him what the skill page directly says:"The Phillip's Hue smartphone functionality is only compatible with the Phillip's Hue Bridge V2."Tech supports instructions:"Wait for the Alexa to update since it is fresh out of the box then try again."So I asked:"So when the Alexa updates, the app updates also?"Response:"Well no. Because the app is through the apple/google store."Me:Then why would waiting for the Alexa itself to update, when the skill YOU ARE SAYING I MUST HAVE says it doesn't work without a bridge regardless of version?Response:Sir just please try and let us know.That's when I ended the call. Useless idiots who refuse to listen to the customer. I'll be contacting CS and asking for a refund due to false advertising. I wouldn't have bought this useless thing if I knew it needed another $60 piece of tech to work.

Title: Works amazingly
Body: Love this with the alexa app I have bought multiple of these and currently have six working to cover different rooms in my house long gone are the days where you had to wire your entire house to have music in every room even better is that I can hook these to real stereos or for the kiddos rooms let the sound come through them so my wife doesnt have to yell when the music is to loud also another great perk is that with the drop in app we can listen to the kids or use it to talk to them and ask them to bring laundry or get ready for dinner. To do this they all must be on the same wifi network.

Title: My wife loves this Dot!
Body: I've had first, second and now third generation Dots among other Amazon Echos.  This third generation is a really great improvement over the first and second generation Dots.  I offered my wife any Echo device she wanted but she likes small, simple things and chose the Dot.  She is in love with it, and so am I, though I chose the Echo Show 5 which suits me better.  The sound is louder and better than previous generations, and the style of it really looks great on her nightstand.

Title: Alexa is Great for adding Music to the Room
Body: I mainly got this to play music in my room as we just got one of these as a gift that we have in the front room. I enjoyed listening to the music and randomly saying Alexa play....and the music would come on-so wanted one for my bedroom. I'm enjoying it the only drawback is you keep trying to sell me another subscription for $4.99 a month when i already am paying for Amazon Prime and you kept advertising free music catalog but now it keeps wanting to charge me for more. So that is the main draw back. Haven't really used it for other stuff yet, although husband asks it questions and it answers.Very helpful.

Title: Very disappointed
Body: Was very happy with one of the units that I hooked up at home. The second unit was to be a gift for a friend. When I deregistered the unit to set up to somebody else it would not work. This person is a prime customer also. When I called the helpline I was told I would have to pay for reregistering and for a limited time of 1,3, or 5 years. So the way I understand this I cannot buy certain items under my account if it is going to be a gift. This sounds ridiculous to me. Am I missing something.

Title: Better than a walkie-talkie
Body: We have the dots in 4 rooms in our home now.  I am a "mature" woman who is, as we all are, at risk.  I live in the downstairs part of the house so I have dots in 2 rooms and my family has one upstairs in the kitchen and one in their bedroom.  If I should fall, or am ill, I can just summon Alexa and help is on the way!But when you're talking, just as an aside, you have to either whisper or pantomime her name because she responds so easily.

Title: Easy and Fun
Body: So we needed a new radio for our kitchen. Do you know it is hard to buy a radio now a-days? My husband and I decided to buy an Echo Dot for our replacement. We had help making our decision from a major electronic store worker. We loved the Echo Dot so much, that I have now purchased two more on Amazon. We listen to the radio on it, play games with it, select songs to play, and use the timer and reminder features regularly. My favorite part is adding things to my shopping list and then it is right there on my phone when I am in the store.  We even bought a smart bulb, so we can use the Echo Dot to turn on the lamp and have it change colors. So fun! There are frequent sales, so I wouldn't pay full price.

Title: Small but with good sound quality
Body: we bought it to replace a very old clock radio in our kitchen. It was dying and the static was bad. We are very pleased with Echo Dot. It fits into a corner of our L-shaped counter, taking up very little space.  We do not have it set-up for stereo, which is the sole reason I gave it 4 instead of 5 stars on the sound quality rating; barring that the sound quality meets our needs well.

Title: What can I say?
Body: What can I say?  I love our Alexa!  We babysat our great grand baby a few weeks ago.  I asked Alexa to play nursery songs.  We listened to the "Wiggles", and other songs.  She was very happy.  We have downloaded some bedtime sounds for ourselves, and use the a lot.  Favorite is the distant thunder app.  She wakes me up in the morning, and gives me the news.  Nothing could be better!

Title: Love My Dot
Body: Okay, I should say "Love my Dots", as in I now have 4!  I started out with one, but then got frustrated when there was something I wanted to ask it, but the Dot was out of range.  If there's always one within range, I always have access to it.  I love the grocery list function, and haven't forgotten anything at the grocery store since I got one.  I use the timers all the time when cooking.  I use the "Sleep Sounds" to go to sleep to the sound of a box fan every night as I love to sleep with white noise in the background.  Or the sound of falling rain...  The Dot has replaced my alarm clock.  The Dot syncs with my calendar.  And I love being able to just ask it questions that I would normally have to run and google the answers to on my computer.  I've even got one in my basement...  The second gen definitely has better sound quality than the 1st gen.  Not as good as my Echo Show, but good enough for my musical needs.  Your mileage may vary.  I love being able to turn things on and off just by asking.  And smart plugs are way better than regular timers because when there's a power failure you don't have to reset them.  Smart technology is the wave of the future for a reason.

Title: Good sound
Body: I bought the echo dot along with an Amazon fire stick with an intention of controlling the TV using the echo dot. While that is not completed, I am impressed with the sound from this echo dot (3rd generation).  I have an Amazon echo, which produces excellent sound and this "dot" is quite good.  The "dot" also teams up with my echo so music can be played throughout the house.  Lastly, I intend to take the "dot" with me when I travel.  It's good for general fun, wake-up alarm, music, a timer, news reports and anything that the full size echo can do, but is a small package for convenience.  I'm happy about buying it even though I haven't set it up yet with the fire stick.

Title: Love the Echo Dot!
Body: It's only been a few days but I am already in love with our Echo Dot (so much so I ordered a second one!) I love being able to listen to music with the ability to quickly turn it on and off. One of the best features so far has been the ability to ask Alexa to add things to our shopping list. My mama brain couldn't be more thankful that I don't have to remember to write everything down and remember to bring the list with me but everyone in the family can easily add what we need to the grocery/household list. My husband loves playing the trivia of the day. The sound quality is great (though we do have a smaller home) and its small size is perfect. My only complaint is sometimes she misunderstands what we say but so far its been easily fixed by repeating it.

Title: It_ Fine
Body: Being a music plebeian who never before owned an external speaker, I would likely give this lil guy 5 stars ... if I didn_ also get the full-sized Echo.  The Dot sounds perfectly fine to my untrained ears until I try using the speakers together.  Then every other limitation already addressed in all the other reviews becomes clear.  I_ told I just need to fiddle with the sound settings and, any day now, I_ sure I_l give that a whirl.  Without comparing to the bigger, better, more expensive speakers, it works just fine.  Dot_ tiny, unobtrusive shape means I can tuck it into more places than the tall Echo.  Alexa-wise, it works as expected.  I don_ love the Alexa app, but that_ a different story.  We use the Dots, along with Echo, to play music around the house, as well as control several Smart Plugs.  Overall, a fun purchase for spreading the groove tunes around your space.

Title: ll and works like my tall
Body: My echo DOT is great because I have it in my bedroom where I can listen to Christian music to go to sleep by, and I can use it to contact my wife in the living room on our big Alexa.  We can communicate using these, to talk to each other without shouting.  :-) It has come in to good use in many other practical ways.  I would like to get a couple more as soon as finances permit.  :-) And it does not take a lot of room on my dresser but has great sound.  I did have to use the direction to get it to integrate.  :-) LOL I'm not a big fan of reading directions

Title: IMHO - Better Than the Other Major Voice Controlled Units
Body: I have converted almost all the lights in my home to voice control.  I have both Alexa and the other big named controllers in my home.  True, Alexa still hasn't acquired some of the skills the other unit can currently do, but the other guy can't turn on my TV for me!  Love the Fire Stick...  Setting up and controlling lights with Alexa seems to be a much easier process - and the Echo Dot 3 is a bit more attractive I feel.

Title: Buying another!!
Body: The echo dot has made a big difference! I am ready quicker in the mornings now that I can just ask her for weather, news, music, and my schedule instead of wasting time on my phone trying to find it all. She's fun to have around during family get-togethers because she can play music loudly and they also have fun asking her questions. Even when I have nothing to do when I get home, I can just ask her to play games or play podcasts or play music. Also with Alexa being able to switch languages, all my family can communicate with the dot !!

Title: This is #2 for me and I love to discover the ways to use Alexa
Body: I had to put my first Alexa in the kitchen because I taught my husband to use it to put things on the grocery list.I use the timer and weather feature and answer questions I don't know when I am watching "Who wants to be a millionaire".  The 2nd one is in my work room.  One thing for sure - Alexa helps with my calendar and she is great at spelling. Get one for your parents - they will love it.

Title: Richer Sounding
Body: The new Echo Dot 3rd Gen is heavier in weight and is better looking and has a deeper and more resonate sound. I believe it has more volume than my original Dot. The transformer is also larger, the Dot 3 feels warmer to the touchthan my Gen 1 Echo Dot. The new fabric exterior adds a touch class and gives the new dot that finished look.  In conclusion :Winner Winner Chicken Dinner !!!!

Title: Sound quality is suprisingly poor for an Amazon product
Body: I like the access to information and the integration with our RIng doorbell. But, compared to our Google Home Mini, which sits next to the Echo Dot, the Dot is a Dolt.Very disappointed that Amazon didn't do a better job on the sound quality and controls (which I've maxed out to try to "sharpen" the sound) for a product that's supposed to be "leading edge".Not anywhere near it!

Title: go ahead and buy it!!
Body: This Echo Dot is  probably the best thing I've ever bought from Amazon!  I absolutely LOVE it!  Alexa can do so many things, you will be so pleased.  Every day she wakes me up with a positive message and also with history facts of things that happened in History on that day.  How cool is that??  I have synchronized all my playlist from "everywhere"  and am able to play any song from the whole Amazon Library.  It's awesome, and I will probably buy another one for the bedroom soon.  Alexa teaches me something new every day.  Buy one, you will not regret it!

Title: Handy to Have Around
Body: I really like this Eco Dot. Love it_ sleek, unobtrusive design. For a relatively small machine it packs an incredible, high quality sound when playing music.  I was able to easily link my Apple & Pandora subscriptions in addition to Amazon Prime Music options. Use as a timer, alarm, cooking sous-chef (converts measurements...), shopping lists... Got it for $22 on Prime Day which didn_ suck! Definitely recommend!

Title: I now have 4!
Body: Got one in a special pack with a Ring Doorbell Pro and got hooked. I bought 3 more during Prime Day and have them in various locations. The one for my husband is used in his shed just as a speaker when he plays music or talk shows off his cell phone -- all we had to do was pair it. Got all of them hooked up to Alexa in very little time. The sound quality is more than sufficient for our needs!

Title: Louder than previous versions, but not necessarily better quality
Body: I have had one of the previous generation Echo Dots for the better part of 2 years.  I love them, they make turning on and off smart devices a snap.  I have fans and lights setup so I can just walk into the house and "Alexa, turn on the living room" and poof, lights, fan, etc.But the previous versions of the Echo Dot had rather subdued, yet CLEAR audio.  It wasn't as loud as the new generation and lacked bass almost entirely, but was perfectly clear.  My new 3rd generation Echo Dot has so much bass, even AFTER opening the Alexa app on my phone and turning DOWN the bass and mid-bass in the equalizer settings, that it's kind of annoying.Before, on previous generations of the Dot, Alexa sounded clear, and clean.  Now, her voice tends to vibrate the top of my PC where she's sitting, even with all the bass options turned off and volume at 40 percent.  I've read a number of posts online about other people where they said that their new 3rd Gen dots sounded muffled or too bassy, and I have to agree.  I'd almost like to turn in my 3rd Gen dot for a previous gen, simply because the VOICE sound quality used to be better. Now with all this extra bass, she sounds muddled.  Treble turned up, mid-bass, and bass turned all the way off, and she sounds... weird.Maybe Amazon can fix this in an update?  Give us more than a 3-bar equalizer so I can make more adjustments to sound and maybe then I can fix it.

Title: I_ an Alexa Household!! A must have!!
Body: Amazing sound from this little device!!! Picks up my voice in the proper room (I have 3, one that came free with my Alexa Show 5 (which is amazing, btw) and got 2 more (for less than $50 while on sale because $23 each, why not?? I love the feature that brings up your Ring (and other brand) doorbell on your Show or a FireStick. The echo dot, a light switch that was compatible and a FireTV Stick is what I started out with, and now I can_ live without it in every room! It already comes with tons of capabilities, but if it_ not built in, there_ always an app/add-on for anything you can think of! The intercom feature is also very very handy!! I got that show 5 and had a Show Gen 2, and I can say drop in on living room from my cell or my other show and I have 2 way video/voice chat! Very cool. Also works with Skype and other people_ Shows/Alexa products to drop in on if they give you permission. Sorry for the novel, but this is definitely an Alexa household now. I added the Hue lights from Philips and my stereos and TVs are Alexa compatible.. so I can control almost everything in the house now.. I think it_ a must have because of the endless possibilities! I_ just glad I saved a fortune on setting up the whole house during Prime Days!

Title: Excellent extender for Alexa throughout your home
Body: During a visit to my sister's home, I noticed that she had Echo Dots as well as an Echo in various rooms of her house. I had that thought in mind when I received an email notifying me that the 3rd generation Dots were about to hit the market. I ordered two then, and then another three this past Prime Day. They are an excellent way to provide access to Alexa's services around the house, and to play music in every room. Plug them in, set up a Group, and you're off to the races. Audio quality is adequate, good considering the size of the speaker. Only problem: unlike the Echo, volume control is manual, you have to press buttons on the Dot to change the volume. The Echo can adjust its volume based on your request.

Title: Love it
Body: I bought Echo dot just for fun, but found myself enjoying so much many things that are useful, line the shopping list and drop in to send messages, the call with voice meanwhile I am cooking for example, and playing music all around the house (bought three echo dots).This can be extremely useful for senior adults to communicate with their siblings and being able to live independent and being checked, fir other disabilities it comes to my mind so many ways it can be useful.What is kind of difficult is to configure... but with a little help it is worth the trouble and to learn the _ows by those who don_ know much about apps, or settings.

Title: Worth it
Body: Love this device already. Alexa is pretty accurate and does a Whole bunch of things. The size is perfect, making it easier to fit almost anywhere you desire. The Charcoal color is beautiful as well as the rgb light that changes color depending on the function or command provided. The device is very useful, especially for people like me that has a speaker without wireless/bluetooth connection and therefore Echo Dot can be used as a breach between my speaker and my iPhone. There are always discounts for this kind of products( I bought 2  instead of one for a very good price) . I recommend it

Title: It's a hands- free party
Body: I love my Echo Dot.  It has great sound quality.I wanted it mainly for hands free music control. This was super good for my pool fun so I can play what a I want and shop music while swimming.I can do quite a bit stuff. I'm still learning.  They also send you notifications periodically to tell you other stuff you can do with Alexa.It can be a lil scary that she just listens all the time as I had a random conversation come in on my phone speaker after getting Alexa and the app, but just unplug it or mute it whenever you don't want it on.

Title: Can_ get enough of my Alexia!
Body: This is my second Alexia and is a 3rd generation. I have a second generation in my upstairs and the newer one on the main level level of my home. I think the newer one has better sound, but both are excellent! So easy to just talk to Alexia to get any music I want, set alarms, find answers to questions, leave messages for myself, and ask her to turn off the music after a set time when I figure I_l be asleep. The very first set-up was a bit slow, but when I added on, it took me about 3 minutes and I am no tech whiz by any sense of the word. If my father were alive, he_ have one in every room. He loved technology, but never lived to see all the wonders we have today. If you_e wondering if it_ worth your money to buy one, stop wondering and get out and buy one! Emails come often that provide you with suggestions on new ways to increase your use! Why are you still reading this? Go buy one now!!!!

Title: Awesome little Dot
Body: This little guy works great. I bought a fire TV cube a month or so earlier and I love the Alexa on that. I saw this at 50% off for prime day and I knew I couldn't pass the deal up. I have it in the same room as my cube currently. But it doesn't seem to cause much of a problem. Itll just got through which ever I'm closer to. Once I move out it should be much more useful in separate rooms. The color is great, very sleek and good for blending in. Speakers are pretty good. Not the best, but they definitely do the job.Overall very happy.

Title: Alexa, a convenient little assistant who's always willing to help.
Body: For the longest time I had always seen commercials with Alexa, but I never really understood the hype. Then prime day came along, and I saw Alexa as one of the featured products. Seeing as the price drop for prime day was significant, I put in my order, and received Alexa the same day. I should mention that I got Alexa bundled with a smart plug (highly recommend doing so) Aside from allowing you to blast your music, Alexa also allows you to be ten times more laid back than usual. I have some string lights that I use during the night and having to get up, just to turn them off is not the move, but with Alexa on hand that process is so much easier. With just one quick blurb, I can stay in bed and drift off to sleep. I've only had my Alexa for about a week at this point but if you're looking for a speaker that can help you out a bit, I highly suggest placing an order. To close this review, I'd like to mention that if you do go out and buy an Alexa, she is very responsive to her name. I don't know what kind of microphones they have inside the little hockey puck that is Alexa but, I've said her name under my breath and she somehow still picks it up.

Title: Drop-in feature saved me when locked out!
Body: We have 2 of these in our house. One is located in our master bedroom/bathroom and the other in my son_ room. These are perfect for listening to music, setting timers/alarms, and getting the weather. I locked myself out of the house one morning on an early walk and was able to use the drop-in feature to wake up my son to let me in (I had accidentally left the dot in the master bedroom unplugged and my husband wouldn_ wake-up to his phone ringing). I might have scarred my son as he thought I was in his closet. Ha.

Title: Nice Quality, well made
Body: We LOVE our alexa devices! We now have 4 of them throughout the house. After a "summer cold" I had to spend a week in the guest room to avoid contaminating the rest of the house and there is no TV or radio back there. I ordered the Alexa dot for the back room and can play all of my pandora favorites on it. It is a GREAT device and we appreciate amazon offering this product at a discount during their July sale!

Title: Alexa is a fun device that is useful every day
Body: Okay, Alexa is not perfect but she is amazing. The pros are the small size, the attractive appearance, the ability to use the devices as intercoms between rooms, and in general the fun of finding out all the useful  things you can do with the device. I like Alexa for setting a timer, or two, serving as an alarm clock, giving me all kinds of reminders to do tasks and take my medicine, she does a bang up job making grocery and shopping lists and sending them. to my smartphone, helping us cook by doing all kinds of recipe conversions, acting as a calculator, playing music of the type you like, telling you the weather and forecast, telling you the time, looking up word definitions, it_ really a lot of fun to use.. My husband built a little robot and works on getting them to talk to each other with hilarious results. I keep finding items in my amazon shopping cart Alexa put there because Little Bot told her to. , There was a refrigerator in there yesterday, I  must be careful when I check out! I have enjoyed playing games like Jeopardy with her.. I am sure there are many more things Alexa can  do that I have not hit on yet, but when in doubt if she can do something I give it a try. . A couple things that could be better. Alexa can_ deal with the _ast  if it_ more than a few seconds later.. I can_ ask her to tell me say, what time she reminded me to take my medicine...She can_ do repeated reminders unless they are in a calendar. Sometimes playing a game I cannot understand her voice, and she cannot understand mine. So I might give the correct answer in Jeopardy but it was not heard correctly. Music in the kitchen, like oldies or  rock sounds fine,but when I had her play a sleep story at night, the sound was slightly distorted. I would rather listen to,it from my iPad. Sometimes it gets confusing trying to tell her to stop a timer or add things to the grocery  list. You have to remember the right way to ask.  Sometimes she shuts off really fast, and I think I am talking to her from the next  room, but she_ already off. We have not had our devices long, so I imagine there is a lot more to learn.. We know  she is _pying on us, but generally it is not a concern. We can always just shut her off. I am peeved that every time you play Jeopardy , she tries to sell you hints! No way I know to turn this function off! I feel like I am finally in the 21st century and I am enjoying it.

Title: We absolutely LOVE our Alexa devices, Dots Fill Out Your House so Alexa is Everywhere
Body: We absolutely LOVE our Alexa devices at our house, have 20 in active use, and actually own 26, 3 of them being this Echo Dot (3rd-gen).  There are uses for all the types.  We have most of our lighting standardized on TP-Link smart outlets, smart switches, & smart bulbs.  In rare occasions the bridge between the two has gone down a few times over the years, and then you are forced to remember how much effort it is to walk over and turn everything on and off yourself versus Alexa doing it all for you :) .  Our most convenient use has been the backyard lighting all on smart bulbs to it is just a shout to turn them all on or off because each were on separate light switches in different sides of the house.  The point of Dots is so that they are cheap enough to put one in every room, so Alexa will hear and respond from the closest, wherever you may be in your house.The Echo Dot itself is great.  The 3rd-gen dot is a little bigger than the 2nd gen, is slightly upgraded but functions the same, and fits subtly nearly anywhere.  I have one on an outlet mount in a bathroom, which is nice to get the news, or weather, or anything while you get ready for bed or get up in the morning.  The speaker itself is just fine.  My wife honestly listens to music on it sometimes when it is just more convenient than when she is near a full Echo, and doesn't mind.  It is better than the speaker on my smart phone.  You can pair it with a Bluetooth speaker or headphones, which I find most convenient for my portable dot that I have on top of a portable battery for it.  That's what I use for toting into the garage or backyard to work on stuff.  Inside, I usually have an Echo or Show nearby that I use when I really want great sounding music.FYI: We have 4 Echos (original), 2 Echo Shows (original), 1 Echo Spot , 6 Echo Dots (2nd-gen) + 3 more not in current use displaced by our Echo Shows & Spot, these 3 Echo Dots (3rd-gen), 1 ecobee SmartThermostat with Voice Control (with 9 room sensors) + 1 ecobee4 with Alexa that it replaced, 1 Fire TV with Voice Remote, 1 Echo Auto, 1 Garmin Speak, and 1 smart watch with Alexa as default -- all of which listen and respond as a smart speaker.  I honestly miss it when I'm in the garage or out outside my house when I start to say Alexa to ask something and she's not there :) .  Yes, I even have a dot with a portable battery for such cases.

Title: Got for free so...
Body: This device is ok, I guess.  I thought it was just a speaker to be honest and it was free on a special so no complaints really.  I just don't get the point of it or Alexa really.  I thought I was going to be able to use this as a speaker for my computer (I could not).  It can be used as a speaker only to use Alexa as far as I can tell.  Alexa is ok.  I find it difficult to remember her name but not allowed to rename her.  Also, really 3 syllable name necessary??  When I say "play" she interrupts my sentence and says "here's something I think you like"...geesh Alexa, wait your turn lol, I was trying to tell you what to play!! She does this repeatedly maybe every other time I say "play".  Super confusing is the fact that you can't use it to play Amazon Video sound through...all other kinds of video apps there Netflix, etc. but no Amazon Video????  She can't search Google and give you info like Siri would, she can only search Wikipedia.  She makes random dings and doesn't know why...when I ask her she says she doesn't know.  Aside from setting a reminder, telling me the weather, and playing music apps I can't find much use for...and its not really loud enuf to play music on in my opinion unless you are sitting right near.  Good sound though for sure and was not too difficult to set up with Alexa.Update:  After repeatedly asking Alexa if she could bluetooth pair with my laptop and getting a 3 beat tone in response (no words, no answer, just the same noise over and over), I searched the internet for a while and finally figured out how to do it.  So I originally wrote this device could not be used as a bluetooth speaker but was wrong.  You can pair to any bluetooth device (in theory) and use it as a speaker for that device which is nice because I wanted to play my own music and this allows me to do so.Update 2:  I'm so sick of this device making noises all day long and not being able to tell me what they're about!  It goes on and on for hours with no end so I've given up on it and can no longer keep it plugged in due to the incessant noises it makes for no reason or at least no reason that it can tell me or I can figure out.  Good thing it was free or I'd really be upset!!

Title: Good, but...
Body: This Dot came as a free device from a purchase during Amazon Prime Days and, based on my daughter's Dot, I did not have high hopes for good quality sound. I was happily wrong. The sound is deep and rich and quite loud enough. The device itself, of course, is compact enough to fit pretty much anywhere - I have mine in my bathroom, a space not quite large enough for a full-size Echo - and is unobtrusive.There are two problems, though I think the first one is more related to the smart plug I have more than the Dot itself. It does not like to be paired. Even though my Alexa app shows it is properly connected, over the past couple of weeks, the Dot has disconnected without my doing anything. The second problem is that if I have a Bluetooth device activated anywhere nearby - and that has proven to be a pretty large area - the Dot does not connect to my Alexa Everywhere group.As a result of those two issues, I have docked my Echo Dot (third generation) one star.

Title: Fire hazard!
Body: It is really convenient being able to use the voice control and automation features. Super handy. I was really starting to like having the Alexa around, I had one in my  bedroom and one in the living room.. Except I woke up in the middle of the night with my room full of smoke and the outlet my Alexa was plugged into was on fire. I quickly turned off the breaker and extinguished the fire, but it really scared me considering I would have been leaving for work two hours after and it could of burned down my apartment with my kitten in it. I'm not sure if I can trust any Amazon devices after this. This was way to close of a call. I'd recommend checking your insurance plan for fire coverage and potentially upgrading before installing these in your house. Mine lasted maybe a month or two before bursting into flames during my sleep, but your milage may vary.

Title: Works well...  if you have a new phone
Body: This review applies to my particular situation (Though I doubt it is at all unique) First, the PROS: What it does, it does very well.  Reminders, alarms, random info, conversions, jokes.  It does integrate with Amazon Music Unlimited very well. I have yet to ask for a song or album that it couldn't find. The CONS: I'm annoyed that so much of its abilities and performance are dependant on the Alexa app on your phone. I don't have a new phone so my echo dot is severely limited as to its functionality and abilities.  I did check the availability and compatibility of the Alexa app on my phone prior to purchase. The app installed and gave no indication that it would be mostly non-functional. The app doesn't even have the Alexa voice prompt. My main complaint is that it can't access my contacts or make/ answer phone calls until I buy a new phone.

Title: GREAT FOR A SMALL DEVICE
Body: The sound quality is very good for such a small device, a little bit bigger then a hickey puck, voice quality is fine but for music you should route this through speakers.  We attach ours to our table top Bose to play music.  The voice recognition is good.  Tow issue keep the device from 5 star.  One issue is the device responding sounds or words from the TV and the second is not responding to commands if to speak the command right after saying ALEXA.The set up was very easy, about the same as setting up the Kindle Fire.  If you can connect a device to a WIFI network then you can set up the echo.  We are finding new uses everyday,  Today we used it to translate into Spanish.  Well worth the money.

Title: This little dude is a good sounding Dot! AND IT HAS A CLOCK IN IT TOO!
Body: I have numerous Echos, and have given some as gifts and was waiting for a chance to get one of these new dots. I had read the sound is much better than previous Dot models and I am impressed. This one little dude sounds as good as the full sized original Echo Cylinder... I don't now how they did it, but it actually "hears" better than the second generation Dots as well. Nice little piece to add to my large collection of Echo products and other smart home items. The clock is "Smart" as well... just set alarms by telling it to set a daily alarm or an alarm for tonight, or any specific day and time... it does a great job of making noise enough to wake up a standard adult.

Title: Something wasn't programmed correctly for music playback as the previous, same device.
Body: This one works fine but one big programming issue I've yet to find a resolve. Lightning took out the previous one. This one will not play songs it does recognize (find), only samples.  My spotify will not work with it but it didnt in the other one anyway. BUT the former one, one version older, did play any song in complete.  I've tried all the suggestions.  I'm hoping there is a customer service with a person I will be able to find and fix the issue.It's for a blind man and is his only technology that's very helpful for the caretaker for reminders but he always admired and adored his previous one.I pray this issue will have a solution. There arent many technologies for the non technical blind. Especially cell phones.  You have to SEE where to touch to simply answer one.I can't give a 4 star review until this is resolved.  Makes no sense if the prior one worked fine.

Title: The best ever alarm clock!
Body: I love it!  I use it to wake me up in the morning. I set the alarm in ascending mode.  I wake up refreshed not feeling being attacked by the alarm.It_ the best alarm clock:  Now I don_ have to grope for my phone and squint at it while trying to find the snooze/stop icon (God forbid you press stop when you meant to press snooze!).  Just for this feature alone, I got my money_ worth.It_ a great reminder too. In addition to listening to Alexa_ very soothing voice announcing the reminder, you get a notification on your phone too.Plus all the other great features: listen to prime music, news, traffic, weather, track your orders, etc.

Title: Smart house is no longer dumb........ we love it!
Body: we have a mix of Echo Shows and Echo Dots throughout our house... with over 50 plus devices now integrated into our routine,  we couldn't be happier with the relatively low cost foundation that is Alexa.  We use her for setting alarms, controlling lights, TV's, security systems, doorbells, sprinklers, doors, thermostat, etc.... we love it!  In comparison to 2nd generation Dot's this 3rd generation is a wonderfully designed upgrade.  The expanded speaker is perfect for listening to music or whatever request you have for Alexa.. the lower cost of this device makes it a no question purchase for upgrading or expanding coverage.

Title: Pleasantly surprise on the many uses
Body: Pleasantly surprised on the many uses for it.  Purchased to be my son_ room speaker as he is becoming a teenager and has a phone but not allowed to use at home.  We wanted a speaker that he would be able to listen to his music without the phone. This device did the trick and much more.  Now he sets up his own alarms, tells Alexa to play his favorite music, search for stuff for him (even his phone), and we are finding more every day.  So if you want a device that will facilitate your life, get it.P.S.It even finds clean music, a need for all of us parents.

Title: Echo Plus... Nice product
Body: I have an Echo Plus understands English fine, great product.... caused me to purchase 2 of the hockey puck echo dots 3rd gen ... it doesn_ understand a word of English... $29 door stop. Get the Echo Plus... with the 3rd gen Dot... You will have to repeat nearly every time, speak clearer each time... It will turn off other systems in the house randomly when you call out a command... and not honor the command you gave the Dot... Echo should appologize to any Amazon Loyal customers, give a great deal on deal on their star ship Echo Plus....

Title: Extra Easy Set-up and Better Speaker
Body: This version of the Echo Dot has a couple of improvements over the 2nd generation.  When adding to a group of Echo Dots, the set-up is much easier.  Instead of going into the Alexa app and adding networks and completing multiple steps, all you have to do is plug it in.  The lights flash for a few minutes, and then it is ready.  Wow!  It also has a better speaker than Gen 2.  Gen 3 without an external speaker is not quite as good as Gen 2 with external speakers, but it is close.  Pretty impressive for its size.  It is only slightly larger than the Gen 2.I'm not sure where Motion Detection comes from in the rating list.  It has no motion detection at all.  I didn't expect it to have it, the box doesn't mention it, and both waving my hands near it and shaking it has no effect.  I simply didn't rate it for that feature.

Title: Great Upgrade, Sound Quality is Amazing
Body: Bought this on a Prime Day deal and have been very happy with the purchase.  We have a 2nd Generation Echo and a first Generation Dot (as well as the newest Google Mini) - and the sound quality on this product seems superior to all of them.  Very simple to set up and we love how it integrates with the rest of our Amazon Smart Speakers.  The "Announce" feature, for example, can be a fun and useful tool when you have them scattered throughout a large home.  There are so many uses for this product but one of my favorites is scheduling reminders.  You will get voice alerts at the given day/time, as well as a phone notification from the Alexa App.  The streaming music via Amazon Prime provides a nice selection without needing to upgrade to a music subscription.  Also, great for white noise while going to sleep.  The new generation (we have Heather Gray) is very sleek looking as well  You won't be disappointed with this purchase.

Title: I've got to admit...
Body: I've always been against having stuff like this in the house listening in on your every move - but after buying a Ring Doorbell and this came with it we've had a lot of great laughs with it.  The play music feature is pretty cool, and the sound isn't bad.  It's great for kids so they can ask questions to their heart's content without having unsupervised access to the internet.  I've enjoyed mine so much I bought another for my mom - she'll get a kick out of it I'm sure.

Title: Amazing!
Body: I don't think I've had a chance to use all of the functions, but just having the "drop in" feature is amazing! I love telling Alexa to add things to my shopping list and it shows up on my app on my phone! I bought two and put one in our kitchen and one in our bedroom. My daughter, who is four years old, loves that she ask Alexa to play her favorite songs. All around an amazing product and I highly recommend it to everyone I know!

Title: BIG sound, little package - same great Echo functionality
Body: Bought this little guy for our workout room.  I wanted a discreet and most importantly - SMALL - smart speaker that had the exact same capability as the Echo in our kitchen.
