This little speaker delivers amazingly BIG SOUND for our 20ft x 15ft sized workout room.  Same great flawlessly functioning software as the regular Echo too.  Would definitely buy again.  I just wish there was cordless version.

Title: Not worth money - just by a better Bluetooth speaker and use your phone to control
Body: It is actually kind of fun to set this device up, try different voices and give voice commands to tell you the outside temperature or play Amazon music.  But I was able to do this with just my phone and a bluetooth speaker.I find that the device frequently does not respond to voice commands.  For example, if I command it to set a timer, it does set the timer and the timer does go off but I then cannot get it respond to shut the timer off!!!  I literally have to unplug it and start over.Some documentation says it can send SMS texts but it can't.  It  can only communicate with people who have other Alexa devices.  This is a significant drawback.Save your money - the technology doesn't appear to be ready yet.  Lots of good Bluetooth speakers out there that sound much better than this.  Alexa is kind of like a well-meaning but green intern in this device.

Title: Good product
Body: This is my 7th addition to my ECHO home.  The new design looks great and the sound is far better than the prior models!  with this being an Amazon device, I didn't understand why it took over a week to receive the product, however buying these online at Amazon as an additional device, they come pre-setup, just plug and go, it knows how to connect and is pretty much  ready to go!  Much better than buying in store.

Title: Echo Dot: Alexa
Body: I'm not very tech savvy and this is my very first purchase of this type. I love the sound quality and how I can ask for a song or a genre and the dot will play it. I am still learning all that this type of device can do for me. My apartment is not "smart" so my dot can't do a lot of things. Pricing was great on Prime Day so that's why I purchased the dot.

Title: Jury_ still out on this.....
Body: So far I_ not overly impressed with the Echo system first off its a pain to set up literally worse than the Fire tablet it is limited to do very basic commands I was expecting a more interactive content available. Second it can_ even pronounce my name properly or hear my commands to make a list example errands comes up as Aron_ simple things like that are irritating. Forces you to sign up for Amazon music due to not having some basic classics like Free Allright now in Prime and limited classical music in Prime. I found out the hard way that it does stay constantly on at times and if you set it for drop in don_ be surprised with what you get... being highly sensitive to sound and noise my hearing is superior to most people so it was very annoying to hear the constant hum of the speaker even when not in use. I_ not impressed by the features boring content who needs an app for making you feel good aka damn girl? It is good for daily weather (won_ give you long term forecast) limited news (hate fox had to change it who_ pocket are they in?) little tidbits are ok but I wanted a more intelligent conversation and can_ stand the female only voice either but that_ tolerable. All in all I have unplugged it to shut down the constant hum from the speaker the speaker itself is great very good quality sound and we do enjoy the music very much. Keep working on this Amazon you_l improve hopefully it was worth the price on Prime day.

Title: Pretty darn cool
Body: My wife refuses to let me use this in the main part of our home so the three I purchased have been quarantined to my personal spaces. I spend most of my working day in my shop with my hands dirty and hence the reason for my original purchase. I was constantly having to take my gloves of to change what I was listen to on Sirius XM but not anymore.All of my laptops and phones are Apple and I stopped using Siri long ago because it's basically junk. Anytime you ask her a question she says she doesn't know or just directs you to a webpage. Alexa on the other hand will actually answer you questions which is amazing! We also recently purchased an Emerson smart thermostat which I was easily able to connect and can now control the temp with ease. Alexa is also such better at understanding me when compared with Siri.For me the biggest down side of Alexa is that I don't believe it has the ability to send text messages from my iPhone which is a big bummer.The audio is about a 6/10 so that could be a bit better as well. I still use my Bose portable speaker to listen to music.

Title: I would like to see this device have an internal  battery; so it does not have to be plugged in
Body: I love having the Alexa, and I have the smart plug, but I just learned how to use the plug;  I recommend this to anyone, who likes music,  well like it_ good for alarms, reminders I am grocery shopping list.  Complaint/  it has to be plugged into a power source at all time, to work and that is the only downfall  I thought the smart plug would make it able to work indoors/at home without being plugged in....  but that was not the case. Alexa works amazing but she still struggles with voice recognition a little the only other complaint that I would have, is  the device does not like to connect to a public Wi-Fi?  I take it on trips like to a hotel, for business.  I have to use my hotspot on my Phone or home internet or it does not want to work properly.  Can be frustrating and use a lot of my data on my hotspot. I have unlimited data on my iPhone but not unlimited on my hotspot area I don_ know if there is a way to fix it to where she will work on any type of Internet? I would love for someone to assist me with that

Title: Great sound and so extremely versatile!
Body: This thing is incredibly easy to set up and use. It can do all kinds of things besides play music or books, which sound great BTW .Right now I am listening to the sound of a thunderstorm and rain, my favorite sounds in the world, while typing this. I can also use it to control my microwave oven. If I had the correct bulbs _ and outlet controls I could also use it to turn my lights on and off or even control my thermostat.I would have bought one long ago but just didn_ have the money, but when they went on sale for $22 on prime day it was just too good a deal to pass up. I will be buying two more for the kitchen and living room the next time they go on sale again.

Title: Amazing!
Body: We love our echo dots! We bought one the very first night of Amazon Prime Days. We got it the next day and fell in love, so ordered 2 more. We have one in our kitchen, one in our room, and one in our kids room. We love asking Alexa questions, what the weather will be, adding stuff to our shopping list, playing music. I bet there_ so much we have to learn!One of the reasons we originally got the echo dot, was because i read a review that people use it as a white noise machine for their kids. Which we decided to try out instead of using an app on our phones. The sound is amazing from the echo, and our kids fall asleep faster with the noise coming from the echo.I_ really so glad we bought these! I was really worried i wasn_ going to enjoy them being in our house. Can_ wait until next amazon prime days to see what other Alexa toys we will score!

Title: A step up.
Body: This my third echo device.  I bought myself a second generation Dot and fell in love with Alexa.  The sound is an improvement over the second gen Dot but it still doesn't rival an Echo.  I have slowly been smarting my house and all the Alexa products are a breeze to setup for that purpose.  I can seamlessly walk through my house and yell for Alexa to turn on or off lights, remind me to check the laundry or play my favorite song.  My only complaint is the same one I had with previous generations. PUT A NAIL HOLE ON THE BOTTOM SO IT CAN BE WALL MOUNTED without buy additional equipment.

Title: ALEXA STRIKES AGAIN
Body: Alexa strikes againI had the 2nd generation Alexa for a few years now and didn't think of upgrading. I decided on prime day a few weeks ago to upgrade to this updated 3rd generation.The speaker is better. It has bass and depth that is immediately noticeable. I can hear outside the room it's located in.Alexa can also hear me at further distances.The fabric on outside is a great quality and texture. There's no need for a cover as this matches well with nearby furnishings.If you are considering upgrading its a great move. Go for it. You won't be disappointed

Title: A good assistant, but limited
Body: I bought an Echo Dot and a Google Home Mini at the same time to evaluate which type I should use.  Both were priced identically. After several months of testing, I found that the Google Home Mini handled more of my requests than the Echo Dot.  There were many questions asked of Alexa and she had no answer; the Google Assistant could answer all the questions that Alexa could not.  There was only one question over this time that Google could not answer, but Alexa could.  Also, the Google Home Mini can control all the smart lights I am using; The Echo Dot can also control most of them, but not GE C bulbs.  Also, the Echo Dot is not able to control Chromecast devices connected to television sets.  Based on this evaluation, I decided to buy many additional Google Home minis.

Title: Skip it....
Body: So, I like the idea of this product, but the sound quality is TERRIBLE... there_ too much air noise or something in it, not sure how to describe. It reminds me very much of listening to a cassette tape. There_ no crystal clear sound quality here for sure. I bought a $30 Oontz speaker a few years back that_ by far better. Disappointed I threw away the packaging, or I_ definitely be returning!

Title: Good new or as an upgrade. Exudes quality.
Body: Upgraded from 2nd gen echo puck, much, much better sound quality. Unit is a touch larger but with the fabric cover but much more elegant. Definitely worth the upgrade. I believe the microphones are much better at picking up commands. The biggest upgrade is the sound quality it's not tinny, it's got body and it's much more enjoyable to listen to especially talk radio.

Title: FAULTY broke after 60 days.  DO NOT BUY!  2
Body: Bought this one In May of this year.  Yesterday it just kept spinning the blue light NO LONGER WORKS.  Not even 2 months since purchase.  I have bought a total of 5 echo dots.  The ones from 2017 still going strong.  I bought 3 new generation this year.  Two still working.  Because this one died after only 2 months I will NOT ever buy another ECHO dot. TIME to move to google!  Oh I can't return the faulty one due to 30 day return policy.  Less than 24 hours after the 1st 3rd generation echo dot died another one bit the dust.  I now have only ONE 3rd generation left. DO NOT BUY these they quit after only two months!  No return policy rotten to the core

Title: It_ a Savior
Body: Echo dot is really neat. It was kind of hard setting up the Alexa app to it, but I got it figured out. It was on my end that made it difficult (internet issues). I have two children. Sometimes they can be a little unruly and talk back. I discover that with the Alexa app, there_ this thing on there called _ommunication and if you go on there, your able to type any message in.. no matter where your at and it will relay the message right to the echo dot. You do not even have to be in the house. I use this app with the echo dot for my children. I type their names in and state _e good, _o fighting girls, or some other message as if they are being watched and they stop what ever bad behavior they are doing. My daughters get a kick out of it, because I also use it if they are being good and say thank you for picking that up, or good job for sharing etc.

Title: A little dynamo!
Body: Bought this on Prime Day for only $22 and should have gotten at least two!  I love that I can choose any genre of music and the dot plays it.  The sound quality is quite good.  I love the San Francisco Giants baseball team and Alexa can tell me what time the game is on and play the radio broadcast.  This is huge because I live in the central valley and our radio reception for the game broadcasts is often staticky or weak.  My grandchildren enjoy hearing Alexa's jokes and asking "her" questions.  I don't have any smart lights or other devices yet so I haven't tried that aspect of it.  So far, it is one of my favorite purchases.

Title: It works but software is far from flawless
Body: The Echo Dot "works" great, until you see how well it works with all of the other things on your Wifi that it is supposed to be compatible with. Be prepared to go online to see whether others are having similar problems. Everyone's Wifi setup can be different with different brands and products on their internet of things. As a result, one persons fix may not work for you. At least that has been my experience. I hope they keep updating the Dot's firmware. If the compatibility issues were mostly fixed, I'd give 4 or 5 stars to the Echo Dot.

Title: CRACKED THE CONNECTION ISSUE
Body: I wasn't really interested about any of the Alexa products but on Prime Day when this puppy got slashed from 50 bucks to 25 bucks, I decided to give it a go. I got it thinking it might be the start of something new but like many others was instantly annoyed when I couldn't connect and couldn't find any help online. It took me all night but after going through every single setting on my phone (Android S8), I think I finally cracked the code and boy is it stupid easyyyyyy. I never write reviewes but the pain of not connecting the damn thing is real so I thought I'd share. SO, if you have an Android and can't connect -1. GO TO SETTINGS2. GO TO CONNECTIONS3. GO TO DATA USAGE4. GO TO RESTRICT NETWORKS5. Here you will find that the wifi that is associated with the Echo, for me it's Amazon-TV5, is turned off AKA your phone's default settings doesn't let you connect to the Echo. Turn the sidebar off.6. Proceed with the regular instructions and you should be good to go!I hope this works for you!Aside from this, I'm very much enjoying my new toy! _

Title: Alexa continuously learns
Body: I have the Echo tower installed in my bedroom. It is good there but when I was in another part of the house I would have to go to the bedroom I decided to add an Echo Dot in my living room and love it there as well. Alexa knows my voice and has learned spe ial phrases l used. Instead of using flash briefings I as Alexa "what's up" and I  get all my flash briefings. Sometimes it is like I can almost have a conversation.

Title: I'm not tech savvy, love it!
Body: I was in a wreck 5 years ago and have brain damage. Alexa with the dot is a life changer for me. I programmed my own "routines", which is the echo way of saying when I tell Alexa specific phrases she then responds with a series of things I have preset. This has been helpful with my mornings and getting kids up. Reminding me to start lunch, or complete chores/tasks. I love the music quality. And that with just my voice I can turn down or pause the music.

Title: Alexa makes so many little chores hands-free.
Body: I resisted getting Alexa for so long, but now I wish I hadn_ been so resistant. I love it! She plays my Audible selections for me, which is very nice. She sets reminders and if you purchase smart devices and smart plugs she can control your house for you. I have quickly grown accustomed to having her there and she really adds an additional layer to the usefulness of my digital entertainment and accessories.

Title: Echo Dot Excellence
Body: This is the fourth Echo product I've purchased -- and I can only give a rave review. Alexa works great and has become a big part of my daily routine. I don't know if this will ever be fixed or it is just part of the Echo products, but it in annerving when Alexa starts to talk to you without having been asked... A little creepy, but a small thing in comparison to all the things the Echos are good at doing.

Title: So far so good
Body: We've only had our Alexa devices setup for about two weeks now, so we're definitely still working out the kinks. With that said, this is a review of everything I've noticed of our entire Alexa ecosystem, which includes 2x Echo Dots, 2x Echo Spots, 2x refurbished Echos, and 1x Echo Sub:Pros: Individually, they all work exactly as they should ALMOST all the time (more on that in the cons section). They all look good, and aren't big, ugly hunks of metal and plastic taking up space in your house. They were all incredibly easy to get through initial setup (except the Echo Sub, more below). Music sounds good in all of them, to include the Echo Dots (but it sounds GREAT on the Echos, and fantastic on the Echo/Sub pair).Cons: The voice recognition is almost too good for its own good. We have a fairly open floor plan, with an Echo Spot in the living room and an Echo in the kitchen. Sometimes they both hear a demand, and the wrong device (meaning the one farther away) will respond. I find myself occasionally whispering to an Echo device so its friends don't butt in to the convo.The Echo Sub needed to be reset 3x when I first got it/went to set it up. I had to log in/out of the app a couple times as well before it was recognized and would actually pair to an Echo.Sometimes Alexa tells me she can't complete a request, then my wife (who uses Alexa far less often than I do) will ask the same request and it works...and vice versa. We haven't figured out what we're doing/saying or not doing/not saying for these discrepancies to happen, but hopefully that'll work itself out with time.The most irritating issue I have so far is getting music to play on the "Everywhere" group. Sometimes I say "Alexa play music everywhere" and it just doesn't do it. Sometimes it'll play on only some of the devices, and sometimes it'll only play on the device I was speaking to. Our house is two stories, and we have two kids and a dog, so we spend a ridiculous amount of our time cleaning/walking up and down the stairs. A big part of the reason I bought these was for the music to fill the house while cleaning, and it oftentimes requires me to spend some time arguing with Alexa to get that to happen. It's even gotten to the point where I've had to go into the app and manually select "Everywhere," because the voice command just won't work.Individual components:2x Echo Dots (w/ separately purchased wall mounts): No complaints. They setup just fine, and work perfectly. They're actually bigger than I thought they would be, and look a little clunky mounted to the wall, but overall they don't mess up our aesthetic enough for me to dock them a star or anything. 5/5 would recommend.2x Echo Spots: No complaints again. These were the first two devices we bought, and they worked so well I decided to buy the other devices. My favorite part of these is their ability to pull up security cam footage. My desk is in the basement, so it's nice to say "Alexa show me the driveway" and see who just pulled in, or to say "Alexa show me the front door" when the doorbell rings. I paired these will some web cam covers (also bought on Amazon, of course) so Jeffy and his crew can't record me all day long.2x refurbished Echos (in charcoal): I bought these to play music, and they sound amazing. We'll see how they hold up, given that they're refurbished equipment, but I have my fingers crossed. They also look great, and are not an eye sore like other speakers.1x Echo Sub: The only device that gave me an issue with the setup process. For that, I'd honestly give the Sub 4/5 stars because it really was a pain in the butt getting it properly hooked up. It gave me issues not just connecting to Wifi, but also when pairing with an Echo. Lots of logging in/out of the app, resetting the Sub. Irritating, to say the least. However, with that one star docked, I'd give it a SOLID 4/5 stars. This thing sounds GREAT. I'm a huge music lover, but hip hop/rap is really where my loyalty lies. And I NEED bass when I jam, and this thing delivers bass in spades. Even with the setup issue, I'm planning on buying another for in the basement. If Amazon ever makes a waterproof version, I'll buy one for outside for bbqs/parties too.

Title: Satisfied Overall
Body: I'm just getting used to the whole Alexa thing so it is still a little early in my overall expectations, but generally speaking, I like it. Disappointed in the Dot speaker quality, way too easy to overdrive it. (Note to Amazon: partner with an outfit like Cambridge Soundworks for your audio; Google is outpacing you for the same dollars)Speech recognition learning seems slow but it's getting there. And Alexa is somewhat stilted and precise in getting certain commands to work smoothly. You'll be having to memorize the dialogue for your favorite routines since Alexa isn't very intuitive in learning what you want.I did buy a few smart plugs and I do like being able to turn on/off lights and appliances with ease. If I were a homeowner,  I would definitely do my entire house.Having audio versions of many of the things I typically use my smartphone for I also like, such as medication reminders, upcoming events, birthdays, etc.In fact, I'm thinking of getting a Dot for an elderly friend, I think these could be invaluable in the home of the elderly.The basic "Guard Home" feature is a nice touch, although the addition of a dB-based alarm function would be nice and what I would think reasonably simple to code.In my opinion, a lot to like with a lot of room for improvement. I went in this direction rather than Google out of a certain loyalty to Amazon, I hope they can make the needed improvements.

Title: Bigger not better
Body: Same as previous Generation-Speaker is a LOT more Bass(ie) still trying to get that sorted - no matter how I play it still sounds muffled and bass -Bigger not sure needed to be ....Same flaws the _istening mic either answers to anything regardless of wake word - or you have to scream for it to hear youOn scale of 1-10 on understanding, maybe a 4 i articulate my words I do not us slang rarely contractions still gets it all wrongFind lately I have to repeat my command up to three time before it is actually executed even though Alexa signals it did it ...They are so concerned with either staying ahead of a curve or being the first the the simple single commands are left to rot an ruin  - as a rule for what they charge for the _igher toy - not worth it stick to the least expensive of the group - maybe when they pull themselves together and make the simple commands flawless then and only then should they be considered worth of the prices the command for the upper toy - till then this is nothing but a kids toy that functions Maybe 40% of the time with out glitching on the simple commands - forget the more complex ones

Title: Love using it  can improve voice and Alexa integrations
Body: Using this echo dot is convenient and entertaining. The alexa integration makes life easier  you can play songs easily, know the weather, set reminders, and so much more! It_ not 100% perfect though and sometimes it gets stressful to repeat yourself hence the 4 stars.Tip: Set up everything properly! If Alexa dont understand your first or second request, just be clear and tell her what you want.Cons: I ordered during Prime Day and the shipment was delayed 3x but Amazon support handled my complaints it pretty good.

Title: Nice upgrade!!
Body: We added a couple new Echo dots to our home for Amazon prime day, we're super happy with this upgraded version!! The sound quality is a huge improvement.  Esthetically pleasing to the eye, and works as intended.  The echo dot is such a neat tool to be able to use for little alarms, reminders, and lists.  The question of the day is a huge thing in our household as well, and on/off functions of smart switches and firesticks.  We really enjoy the Dot and like having multiple around the house to make everyday things just a tad easier.  (Black/charcoal has been on backorder for weeks now, we still have yet to receive that one.  Shipping on that has been a tad disappointing, but we know its worth the wait)

Title: Kinda tricky to use !!
Body: Bought this to go with my ring door bell and waiting on that to show up, but in meantime set the echo dot up. Set up is pretty easy and straightforward.  Cant figure out how to pair 2 phones at a time to it. Maybe you cant with this model. But once I was playing my music from my phone, the next day when I opened and played a message from messenger, the sound played thru the echo dot. It seems that all my "media" is now playing thru this device!! The only way I could figure out to to unpair my phone with echo dot. I haven't had the time to go back and see if I can still call thru this since my phone is not paired now. I think a call to customer support will be next !!

Title: Sounds good, dirt cheap (on Prime Day anyway)
Body: Very surprised with the sound quality on this version. I wouldn't rank it as high-quality, however in a small space at low volume it sounds just fine for music. Alexa as a product is available through this device which is obviously it's main selling point and things like white noise and various notifications and access to simple queries have all been very welcomed and enjoyable.If you want to listen to music in a large room or at high volumes I would encourage looking towards the larger Echo products. They would be worth the investment for the sound quality and volume upgrade in my opinion.

Title: Loved it so much I bought more!
Body: My electric company gave me one as a promo.  I loved it so much are order more for the rest of the house.. and since they have lowered the price it was easy!  I listen to Amazon music and the speaker quality is excellent for such a small speaker.  It doesn't take up much room but the sound is good.  The reminders and alarms that are voice activated are so helpful.  Alexa remind me in 10 minutes to take dinner out of the oven.  Alexa wake me up at 6 in the morning..so easy and so helpful. really where are you going to find a quality speaker to listen to radio or music for that price... And have Alexa too.

Title: Cool, but there are flaws.
Body: This Echo is sleek and elegant, however I find that my Gen 2 dot would recognize my voice way easier. I almost have to yell sometimes for this echo to hear me, even if there is no sound in the room. I keep this echo about 10 feet away and it just can_ beat me sometimes??? Also, I bought this echo hoping the sound would be way better for music but honestly it isn_ that much different. Amazon added just a smidge of bass but it really isn_ the greatest. It_ worth the price, just wasn_ what I was expecting.

Title: Works great!!
Body: This is the first echo dot I have gotten. The sound is an improvement over my Echo that I got a couple of years ago. I enjoy it so far. The only problem I had was with the setup. I couldn't get it to set up on my fire tablet with the Alexa app. It couldn't find my echo dot and the page kept saying, "looking for device". I tried to do it manually through the tablet and that didn't work either. In desperation I downloaded the Alexa app to my Iphone. That worked beautifully. It found the dot quickly and the setup was easy after that!

Title: Alexa works great!
Body: The Echo Dot is pretty cool.  I got the white one which looks pretty chic!  Alexa responds well.  Once in a while she doesn't understand what I am asking, but I do have a bit of a Latina accent...lol....Looking online, there are many questions I can ask her.  She keeps my shopping list, adds items and deletes as I ask, she sets a timer, has recipes, sang me happy birthday, and welcomes me home.  It's really pretty, I just wish they wouldn't have run out because I need about three of them.  I also bought the wall mount and currently waiting for it.It arrived super quick!

Title: The perfect supplement to my Echo 2nd generation!
Body: I hesitated before buying the Echo Dot (3rd Generation).  I was very concerned that the sound quality would be too too _inny. Even though the sound is not as as rich as my taller Echo 2nd Generation, it is absolutely fine for what I was looking for.  It_ nice to have the extra speaker in another room of the house. I call it by another name rather than Alexa.  Honestly, the sound is not bad at all; I was actually impressed with it, coming from such a small size! I am very glad I purchased this item!

Title: Eh.
Body: The dot is somewhat useful for reminders when I don't have the quick moment to write down a note or reminder. The alarm sound selection is small and is kind of redundant when you can make a routine for the same purpose.The Alexa app is a total mess, not user-friendly or organized very well. No way to search in-app for what you are looking for, and there is no way to make a routine for select days; only weekends/every day/weekdays.Alexa is also not that "smart." She is not intuitive and I find little point in the speaker. I use it more for a music speaker than anything else.Communication is also broad and not specific to a speaker. If a user calls my account it rings on all family dots instead of a specific dot like I want.

Title: Work fine if I am within ear-shot of either Alexa and without my smart phone.
Body: Alexa understands my voice and what I am saying, than I do hers. I guess that is because I have been busy and therefore neglected to adjust her treble and base, volume only. Music reproduction is fine. Some of my problem may be the fact that I have my own huge personal library of music and sound equipment and mentally compare it to her sound. Thing is, I can't up and take that equipment from room to room where I can the two Alexa's. She's a winner.

Title: This is my sixth Alexa.
Body: I have Alexas all over the house. I like its ability to answer questions, give weather reports, and control lighting. The lighting control is kind of iffy sometimes. I have to reset the hub to make it work properly. I don't know if the problem lies with Alexa or the smart switches. Is Alexa a spy for the Powers That Be? I don't know but as long as she can give me information about almost anything, she's welcome in my house.

Title: Great Companion
Body: I brought this item for my Mom and I also bought one for myself and I simply enjoy it. Its' great to have this thing to ask questions and get answers to. That's why I call it the companion. I just wish it was a physical robot where I can ask her to go get me something at the fridge but I can imagine that will happen eventually.  My Mom is in love with Alexa and the funny thing is that she argues with her...lol! Great product.

Title: So convenient
Body: Searching through the "skills" has shown us that we were missing out on so much functionality! When we started adding more and more skills, we knew that having these in most rooms of the house would be helpful, so we ordered a few of the dots to have in places where we wouldn't need superb sound quality, or wanted a lower profile device. These fit the bill perfectly!

Title: Personal Assistant with home automation
Body: I recently bought 2 on prime day and now wish I would have purchased 2 more. My real purpose was just something to help me keep track of my appointments and it does that OK.. I still have to tell Alexa to add an appointment or add it in my calendar myself, but it does a pretty good job of reminding me.. if I do my part. Some of the things I like, that really didn't interest me before include shopping list maker. I can tell her to add something to my shopping list and she does! So I'm cooking, run out of something- Alexa add butter to my shopping list.  Really works very well. I also like turning on and off my lights with  Alexa.  I did need to add smart plugs to do it, but it was super easy and now I can turn on or off a light with the sound of my voice or the push of a button. Word to the wise-- if your husband turns off the light at the regular switch because he won't remember alexa bedroom light off, it's not going to work for you. I did choose to set up different commands-- bedroom lamp, bedroom light, and just bedroom in hopes that it will make it less painful to remember 1 phrase. If you find something close enough to the phrase, it will still work.  I sometimes said bedroom lamp instead of bedroom light. Now either will work.  Of course you can't have 2 plugs named the same. Alexa is smart, but not a mind reader.  We also have reptiles and I can now program their lights the same way. So I can say Alexa Mortimer day and Alexa knows to switch the routine. I can automate it further to just do it at a certain time, BUT I haven't done that yet.  I also like that I can have my audio book read to me, I can set a sleep timer so it will automatically go off. There are a ton of different apps to try like daily meditation. Really Some very cool features!

Title: I was pretty adament about not buying one... now I am glad I did...
Body: To be honest, I was originally against such a device in the house and not for all those conspiracy theory things. I just don't like things around me that are not tools when I am working. Still, I bought this as a package deal with something else during Amazon Prime Days. It was cheaper than the other thing alone. But I was curious, so before even setting up the other thing, I had plugged in Alexa. Reviews I had seen had me expecting generally low quality sound and issues with voice recognition. So far it has shocked me. I wouldn't use it for a party speaker, but for just background music it has a good amount of bass and a well-rounded sound. So far it has not had issues with voice commands except for things it simply cannot do.In things I do not like I can easily list one I do not think Amazon will easily be able to fix: The limitation of the "Wake Words" that are allowed, Alexa, Echo, Computer, or Amazon. Obviously the third word is out of the question since it is too easy to come up in conversation. The same is true for the second and fourth words, but not so frequent. That leaves Alexa. Oh well. Thankfully, it does not easily respond to television sent commands like has been joked about, so at least it won't start playing music I don't ask for just because I have the TV on.Highly enjoyable despite my reservations.

Title: This Gen 3 is hard of hearing... READ UPDATE AT THE END!
Body: Was excited to get the Gen 3 Echo Dot. Had a Gen 2 and wanted better sound. The Gen 3 delivers more bass and richer sound! However, this Dot seems to be having a hard time understanding us. About half the time, she hears the wake word and I get a blue ring, but as I start talking, she goes black. I literally have to make the room quiet and stand directly in front of it for it to hear me. It is placed exactly as the Gen 2 was, but this Gen 3 seems to be hard of hearing. Disappointed...UPDATE: My bad... I had a Fire tablet located in the same room. It was picking up my commands also and was replying. The volume was turned down on it so I couldn't hear it. I turned off the hands-free Alexa option on it, now my Gen 3 is working like I expected!!!

Title: Can You Hear Me Now??  SMH
Body: This 3rd gen unit looks better and sounds better than the 2nd gen i upgraded from. It's a bit larger and more rounded and has a fuller sound. I really like the new look and sound. BUT.....I feel it is not as good with voice recognition as the gen 2. The gen 2 was much better at hearing and understanding me than this one. It constantly gets commands wrong and sometimes doesn't even respond to the wake word unless i speak loudly. I even exchanged the unit thinking it was defective but the replacement unit was just as poor with voice recognition. Too bad. i would have liked to have given it 5 stars. Amazon... fix or upgrade the microphone on this unit and it will be perfect.

Title: Alexa acted like my wife
Body: When I first set it up, Alexa acted like my wife: she didn't listen. But after a few days I can mumble something across the room and she understands. The sound is not Bose quality but is very very good. The echo dot hooks up to my computer via wifi so it can be many rooms separated no problem. Have hooked up Pandora and Spotify and with Amazon Music I got all I need. I got it as a deal with Ring and I am more than impressed with both.Last night my echo was flashing. I asked, "Alexa, why are you flashing?" "YOU HAVE A NOTIFICATION." "Alexa, what is my notification?" "A PACKAGE HAS BEEN DELIVERED." I looked out front and there was a package by the door. YIKES!!!

Title: this new Dot is a joke
Body: I have an earlier version Dot that works just fine, but this one is a real piece...  voice recognition is good, but EVERY time I pair it with my phone, it says _earching, but doesn_ connect the first time.  when I try again, it connects.  then it works fine for about 10 minutes or so before the audio cuts out.  hitting play (Spotify app) then plays through my iPhone speaker.  if I try to re-pair it, it says I_ already connected, and when I hit play again, it plays through the Dot like it_ supposed to.never had these issues with the older Dot.  unless it gets some kind of firmware/software fix, this thing is garbage.fun fact:  telling Alexa to shut up is pretty effective, which I now know thanks to how frustrating this device is.  at least they got that right.

Title: Didn't quite do what I thought it did.
Body: I purchased this device specifically because I was looking to integrate some smart lights in my house (it'd be nice to turn them on from my phone in the driveway when winter hits), and from the description where it came in a bundle with the two lights it sounded like the Hue lights integrated without -another- device (the Hub). This is apparently not the case.The only real benefits now are the ability to play music through my place by having the echo in my bedroom, and the dot in the kitchen/living room area and adding stuff to my shopping list without having to yell across the place. Sound quality isn't nearly as good as the Echo itself, but decent enough for chores around the house.

Title: It worked first time
Body: I had an old Alexa that I tried to set up in my husband's office last year.  It didn't work.  I returned it and received a small credit.  When I saw the Dot on special, I decided to try it.  I set it up in husband's office.  I read the instructions on how to set it up (the instructions were not too complicated!) and lo and behold it worked!  We are learning how to use the intercom feature.  It is nice to just have Alexa call the office for my husband and I to communicate rather than having to go call up the stairs or, heaven forbid, have to actually walk upstairs!

Title: Much improved sound over the gen 2 dot
Body: This is my second echo dot. I have another gen 2 dot I bought a couple of years ago. I still use the older but I have moved it to the bedroom and use the newer one in the living room as my main one. The improvements in sound quality is like night and day. Having the new one, the old one sounds grainy and low quality. Functionality is more or less the same and I don't notice a difference. The only real differences is the sound quality and the improved appearance.

Title: Like the upgraded look, wish it was still a USB power cable.
Body: I have the 2nd generation and I definitely like the look of this 3rd generation better. So far it's worked pretty well. Glad that it still works essentially the same as 2nd gen. just with some updated looks and buttons. Am a little disappointed that the 3rd gen doesn't go to USB to power adapter like the others, this has its own cable. Since one of the 2nd generation ones that I have, I have plugged into a USB outlet. But realistically it's no big deal. I still really like it.

Title: Too problematic to setup
Body: Amazon must find a way to streamline the setup process. As it is, having to download skilled apps, linking the same to one's account is repetitive cumbersome and a downright nuisance. All the buyers info is already on your servers. Upon purchase, all the relevant software apps required to make it work, must be available out of the box; without recourse to optional licenses. This is a damper on the utility of the product, and is absolutely annoying.

Title: The Echo Dot is amazing
Body: I was very, very excited to see these units work as I purchased two of them on Prime Day, and to my surprised they are amazing. The sound out of these small unit is quite loud for being the size they are and the sound quality is very good, not perfect, but for the size they do themselves justice.  I would recommend them, especially if you get the Amazon Music subscription that I got for one year with one of them.  The Voice Recognition is very good.  Every so often you need to repeat yourself, but overall is is very good.

Title: Echo 2 is my new Office Manager
Body: Alexa is in my kitchen, Echo Dot 1 is in my bedroom, and now Echo Dot 2 is in my office.  They set alarms for me to get ready for a meeting, or leave for a work day.  Or tell me the weather, make my shopping list, remind me to write a check, tell me what_ on the calendar for that day, remind me to buy a birthday card, or just play my favorite music out of two speakers at once.  It_ a easy way to stay up on tasks and still have fun!

Title: Good device but a bit confusing
Body: While the Echo Dot does a good job at most things, I'm not clear on how to connect devices to it.  I have gone into devices on the app and I thought I had done what needs done but it isn't completely clear on how to make this thing work with Fire TV, etc.  Sound is reasonable for a small speaker.  I have noticed that while listening to music it will sometimes stop playing for no apparent reason.

Title: Great way to integrate every room in the house
Body: There was an amazing m deal during amazon days so I decided to grab a couple more for the bedrooms. All my other ones are 2nd gen. After receiving this, I am thinking about upgrading those as well. The voice recognition and sound is so much better with this model. I also like the look. I was absolutely impressed that now when you order them, it gets here fully set up and ready to go. It has been an amazing addition to my kids room since I can _rop in and talk to them if I_ in another room. These are a great for almost any room in the house and makes every thing (lights, tv, etc)  convenient and integrated.

Title: Don't Do It!
Body: It was a huge mistake to even try!  My husband and I thought it would fun to step into the world of having an Alexa device in our home.  That was a huge mistake.  The worst part was when we set our smart TV up to the device.  Mind you, our TV is a very expensive 61" TV that we have had for less than a year.  "Alexa, turn TV on" worked 1 time, just once.  She was not able to turn it off, and now we can no longer turn the TV on at all.  It didn't work with Alexa, not with the handheld controller, and not even with the power switch on the TV.  We now have to turn the power on by unplugging the TV and letting it power back up.  Each time we do that, we have to go though to configuration cycle.  We have disabled the Alexa app for the TV, but that didn't work.  I am frustrated and pi$$ed off!

Title: It's making a big difference
Body: Not to overstate, but, I'm not sure how I was able do without the Dot. I'm a writer, and, I'm always looking things up.In many cases it's pretty easy.I found out today that if you spell a word you're unsure of, Dot will give me the pronunciation.I love how I can play any song or any artist from My Music.  and, you can ask for the name of the song. Of course, to take full advantage of music features it's good to have the Prime music subscription.I can play music libraries such as smooth jazz or rock.Or any radio station, anywhere.Lastly, I use the timer and the weather functions all the time. I run, so knowing the temperature and coming weather is important.Get an Echo. You'll love it. And, wonder how you did without it.

Title: Was hoping for better
Body: When I heard that the sound was much improved I ordered one! I have it in my kitchen and like to listen to music while cooking, eating, etc. and did not want/need to spring for a Bluetooth speaker. At first I was impressed as the sound really was improved. Then I was disappointed to find out that after a few hours of listening the sound degraded horribly. It sounded just like listening to your car radio as you drive too far from the radio station... terrible. I also found that when this happens Alexa no longer responds to your command to stop the static noise emanating from "her" without standing right next to it and yelling at it. I also tried playing music on my older version, the same music at the same time as the new one is going nuts with no issue. After a couple times of this I contacted Alexa help. They were very helpful and attentive, I described my problem, tried a couple things they suggested to no avail so, no problem, they sent me a replacement a refurbished gen 3??? What?! The dang thing just came out how are there refurbs already??? Not. Happy. After I set it up, things were all well and fine for several months when the issue returned! I contacted the help again and all they can tell me to do it to reset the device to factory setting to "see if that resolves the issue" it_ the same problem I had the first time, with the NEW unit, where this did not work then. Outside of this issue, the device works as expected but had I known, I would not have went for the upgrade and bought a Bluetooth speaker (which I ended up doing anyway). Would not recommended it if, like me, you were looking for a sound upgrade.

Title: Wonderful!
Body: These 3rd gen Echo dots are wonderful. These little speakers put out surprisngly big, loud and excellent sound quality. Voice recognition and responsiveness are highly  accurate. Amazon had a 2 pack deal on these and I jumped on it. It was like getting one for free! I paired the two of them as a stereo set and added an Echo Sub. The combination fills my living room, dining room and kitchen with high quality, clear, rich sound. Great for listening to music! Make sure you space out everything correctly. Pairing and set up was super easy. Set up the stereo pair first, then add the Echo Subwoofer for the deep bass low sounds. You will be very pleased.

Title: This Echo is the 4th we'vepurchased for use in our home ... We lovehem all!
Body: I cannot find fault with anything ... A nice small size that tucks away nicely yet it picks up my voice constantly from about up to 25 feet away, the sound is clear and amazingly robust for such a small item.  And once you research/Google what else this Echo dot/Alexia can do, you will find it is not only fun, but really handy to find the estimated time to your office or returning home that wok day, top news items from any of my favorite sources, add to my shopping or to-do lists,\ ... kind of wonder how I did without it.  My kids bought my wife one for her Bd to try and we liked it so much we got these 3 more dots o put in other rooms of our house for convenience.  Love this item!

Title: An incredible upgrade from 2nd Gen version!
Body: Toss your old 1st and 2nd Gen Echo Dots and get the new the 3rd Gen. The latest 3rd Gen version is waaay better! The 3rd Gen Echo Dot  is like a 2019 Ferrari compared to the 2nd Gen Echo Dot which is a like a 1989 Pontiac Fiero.My quadriplegic nephew uses the 2nd Gen Echo Dot to control TV, listen to music, etc and it has been a God send. However, he needed to repeat his commands almost half the time with the 2nd Gen Dot. The new 3rd Gen Echo Dot hears his commands the 1st time about 90% of times. The sound quality on the new version is also way better. The new version has more bass, treble, higher volume and is just a way better device all around to the point where we were upset we didn't upgrade a lot sooner.

Title: Dot and Show do not integrate well with Sonos
Body: This is for both the Echo Dot and Echo Show.  I was given for a birthday, a dot, a show and several sonos speakers, two Ones and two Play 1's . By adding Sonos to the Alexa App, the Play 1's can be controlled, but the Ones with built in Alexa are troublesome.  We have a family member with that name, so we wanted to change everything to "Echo" or "Computer" and the Sonos cannot be changed.  The Alexa on the Sonos also has trouble recognizing the other Echo items.  Not a good integration, and since it is the Alexa that is the basis, we assume Amazon and Sonos are in dispute, and we pay the price since the name change and integration seems to work fine, if the Sonos One is not the closest speaker to the voice issuing the commends.

Title: Rocket Science Not Needed! Simple to use.
Body: I bought this for my wife, she does not really embrace technology. Set it up in our bedroom for her to really use as an alarm. I showed her once and boom, she took off with it and she told me it was not rocket science to use. Exactly what I was looking for her. She loves it and embraces the technology. Good look too, I use the basic black 1st gen, still works great. I will buy a new one to upgrade in the near future. Very satisfied with both our echos.

Title: Unexpectedly much better than Echo dot 2nd generation
Body: I added it to a little "chain" composed of 1 Echo and 2 Echo dots 2nd generation; moved the old echo dot from my bedroom to another room and replaced it with the new one. What a difference! A cuter design, immediately connected to the network, very responsive to the voice even with background noise (such as radio on), and especially better sound: richer, clearer, more bass. Almost (but not quite...) like an Echo. Maybe I should have bought more....

Title: Easy to set up
Body: Works great and does everything I need it to do and more!I don't have a house phone so if I am the only one here and lay my phone down I can easily find it using the dog simply by asking Alexa to find my phone.Turn lights on and off by voice command.Get the news and weather. Set alarms and reminders and p!at music.

Title: Does a lot for a little Dot
Body: This is my second Echo Dot. Extremely easy to set up. I like the looks of the 3rd gen. My other dot is 2nd gen.  I went on line to see what it can do and there are  numerous "skills" that you  can chose . Which leads me to my only complaint. There may be an answer and I don't know. So what frustrates me is in "my skill" I have to scroll through to find them. I would like an easier and faster format. Like alphabetical that I can click on or similar to my phone list.  It has a lot of cool things it can do, but  if it takes too long to find them or I forget what I have then I won't use them and  Dot  does very little but answers an occasional question.

Title: Fun but not as impressed as some
Body: We don't hate it. I wasn't as happy with getting these as my husband was. We use them for verious things around the house. Several voice commands the manual says to use seem to confuse Alexa. We have quite a few bugs to work out. Supposed to connect to our Roku TV doesnt. We are supper upset but a little annoyed because again it should. I wouldn't ever want to pay full price for these

Title: A Big Improvement
Body: The 3rd Generation Echo Dot is a vast improvement over previous iterations. The sound quality has really improved, the fabrics used on the Dot are nice and the button feel is solid and confident.  While the sound quality of the small Dot is not going to impress any audiophile, I use 5 Echo Dots in a group for music throughout the house.  I also have an Echo Dot connected to my stereo system for more critical listening.

Title: Works as expected, can't connect to BT speakers
Body: So, knowing full well that Amazon listens to and records everything said in earshot of these things and keeps said records forever and lets humans listen to the recordings, I bought one of these to put in my wood shop. All it will ever hear is me 'singing' along to music and the sound of lots of saws running. Hooked up to my 70's Pioneer receiver and a pair of speakers from the same era that are big enough to be night stands. It's nice to be able to just yell at the thing to play music, adjust volume, and tell it that I hate or love this song, and it does it without me having to stop what I'm doing to do so. It's honestly kind of amazing how well it can hear me given how loud I am usually blaring music, and it's sitting right on top of the receiver, which is sitting right on top of the speakers.That said, I am disappointed that it doesn't seem to be able to actually pair with other bluetooth devices to play music through. The pamplet it came with seemed to indicate that it could, and the Alexa app (that needs more permissions than you have to give and wants every antenna your phone has enabled to install) also seems to indicate it should be possible, but after querying Alexa, the app, and google, I haven't been able to figure out how to pair my Dot with a pair of BT headphones. I have a pair of worktunes headphones that are hearing protection with BT headphones built into them that I would love to be able to play music from the Dot into, but oh well. Can just use my phone like I had been anyway.

Title: Great Little Gadget
Body: Super happy with this product, and we'll probably buy at least one more for another location in our home. Its primary uses (for us) include: acting as a "phone" so my children can reach me or my husband when we are not at home; acting as an intercom when I'm in one location of the house and need to reach the area where our Alexa is kept without shouting across the house (thanks, Alexa, for enabling my laziness!); playing music. I love that I can add as many voices as we have Alexa apps. Meaning, we've trained Alexa to recognize my voice and my husband's since we both have the app on our phones. Our children, however, do not have devices of any kind, and we can't teach her their voices without them having devices with the Alexa app.

Title: Functions come; functions go
Body: Decent little speaker(s). I use one in the bedroom for audiobooks; compatibility with Audible.com is a major advantage. I use two in the kitchen for stereo. Reliable, easy to connect, easy to program. The problem is that the reason why you bought the dot yesterday may not be available tomorrow. Functions seem to come and go at random. Programmers are able to drop functions with no notice or explanation so you are now the "happy" owner of a device that performs half of what you expected when you bought it. I complained once before and the function returned w/o notice. Five weeks later the function has again disappeared w/o notice. Will any of the functions be reliably available in the future? Buyer beware.

Title: generally a pleasure to use
Body: surprisingly good voice recognition; our grandson demo'd the "are you smarter than a fifth grader" feature of the "dot", which worked very nicely and was fun.  Haven't used it to integrate Alexa controlled devices like lightbulbs for instance, so cannot comment on that feature.  Sound is very warm, almost too bassy, but is overall pretty easily understood.  Volume of sound is surpisingly strong from such a small device.  It has some "heft" to it, being much heavier than one would suspect from just looking at it.  Overall, we like it and it was priced nicely on the Amazon shopping day recently offered.

Title: Easy setup, delivers as advertised, versatile smart device
Body: This is my first echo dot. It delivers as advertised. Setup was easy. Voice recognition is very good. It would have been great if it supported music from Youtube but I guess you can do that with your phone while using it as a bluetooth speaker. Yet to test the full range of services but as far as asking questions, telling jokes and playing music, I am satisfied thus far. I like the ability to control other smart devices and aspects of a smart home. Definitely a useful buy, very versatile device. Also, it does not take up much room and speaker volume is loud enough for a standard room.

Title: Personal assistant
Body: I like being able to ask Alexa for various answers from the comfort of my recliner.  She times my walking and lets me know when to stop.  I encountered one problem.  She was flashing green.  I asked her why and she responded that she did not know.  I asked her what it meant if she was flashing green.  She did not know.  I asked her stop and she did not stop.  Someone told me that it meant that there is a notification.  I asked her to read it to me and then she stopped flashing.  It would be nice to have a booklet to refer to to find out what different colors or flashes mean.

Title: Great little helpful tool
Body: I've had a first-gen Echo/Alexa for a few years now.  Adding in this 3rd gen Echo Dot was great.  Very useful, and more convenient than having to go to the other end of my house if I needed to use my original Alexa for something.  Love the small form factor.  I thought audio quality might suffer due to the size, but teh audio seems as good as the origianl - at least for what I use it for (I don't stream much music through Alexa - usually just kid's music when the grandkids are visiting, and my usage of Alexa primarily just requires voice output for answers or command confirmations).

Title: Buy the 2nd generation. Piece of junk!!
Body: Alexa is less responsive than the 2nd generation. I have to repeat myself several times to get a proper answer. Piece of junk. Keeps making odd noises and won't connect to my smart plugs. While trying to exchange it, Amazon says that they will call, but it doesn't allow me to put my phone number on the form properly. So what good is that process?? I've been trying since July to get it to work for me to no avail. It's defective.

Title: It's helpful in the kitchen!
Body: We got a free Alexa as a promotion for our satellite radio.  I thought it was going to be stupid... but for free I would take it.  Actually,  I am amazed at how fast it answers my questions!!  When cooking, I yell out questions and get the answer right away. "Alexa, how many carbs in a strawberry?". " Alexa, how long do I pan fray a scallop?",  "Alexa, how many carbs in an olive".  Alexa has certainly simplified going KETO!

Title: Great product for anyone really!
Body: I never thought I would use one of these Echo devices, but now have 4 in my home! They are so incredibly convenient with regards to getting weather info, listening to music, and a plethora of other things that can be automated. What really takes Alexa to the next level is when you start integrating smart lights or smart outlets in your home and gaining the ability to turn lights on and off with either your voice or through your phone! Great thing for people who hate getting out of bed to turn the lights of at night haha!

Title: Great product, recommend everyone have one (or two).
Body: Overall this is a great product. It works wonderfully for the purposes I need.I love music so it suits me well to have a song pop into my head and be able to have alexa play it.It is great for me as I am a heavy aleeper so the alarm and morning routine works amazingly.I purchased two and put one in my children's room. It allows us to communicate without having to go back and forth across the house.The announcements feature is amazing because it broadcasts announcements over all connected devices.I have freetime enabled on my children's so they can request kid friendly music, set up routines, play games and even request bedtime stories.We love it and will buy more to put throughout the rest of our home. We are also looking into getting more connected devices that are Alexa compatible.Downfalls: sometimes when thr volume is high while plating music or reading a story, the echo dot has difficulty recognizing or even registering commands. Another thing is that the dot does SOOOO MUCH and I have no idea what it is fully capable of so I feel like I am not using it to its full potential. I wish thete were were more documentation in the box or a complete list of commands and capabilities.

Title: Love this powerful little guy!
Body: Sound quality is really great for a speaker of this size! Totally worth the little extra money for this one over the 2nd generation. I don't think it understands you as good as the Echo however it still does a fantastic job taking commands. We actually got this as a promo deal packaged with something and I didn't think I would have much use for it as we already have an echo in our main living areas. However I put it in our master bedroom and I love it! I now want one for each of my kiddos rooms. Some nights it reads us a bedtime story and I love having the music at my command in my room as well. We have had many bedtime dance parties with our kiddos since putting this up stairs. Woud highly recommend.

Title: A SURPRISING EVENT FOR ME
Body: For some time I was reluctant to have one of Amazon's voice activated devices, mostly because one had to pay almost $25 for a device for the Amazon device to do its job to turn on a light or etc.  When I saw the low price offered by Amazon during the two day Amazon Prime days this year for the Echo Dot device and I found a good price for two circuit control devices, I decided to make the leap.  WOW!!  I am pleasantly surprised and pleased to have the Echo Dot.  I primarily wanted it to play the great SLEEP SOUNDS (Ocean waves) at night, but to be able to turn two lights on or off by voice is better than guessed, Plus I am still learning all the marvelous things ALEXA can do to help or entertain me.  THANKS AMAZON!!!

Title: I love this thing!
Body: So I did get this and two Phillips Hue bulbs for a very low price on Prime Day, so i thought i would give it a shot. I currently have the Dot and both of the bulbs in my bedroom. I will admit it gets some getting used to. I keep turning on my lamps with the switch instead of with the Dot. But with the app i dont have to get up to turn anything on or off. As for Alexa, i dont think i have explored all of the options yet, but i mainly use it to control the lights and to listen to music while folding cloths, it is also handy for the weather for the day. Overall i think it was worth it and i cant wait to see what else it is capable of.

Title: Very useful! No regurts!
Body: If you_e new to these devices and concerned about Alexa_ ability to understand what you_e saying (as I was), don_ be. Alexa_ speech recognition is better and faster than Siri/iPhone. Our family loves these already. Purchased two on a Prime Day deal and immediately wished I had purchased two more. Alexa has great hearing but she has her limits and you will get tired of yelling into the next room. Great sound quality for comparable small speakers. I do not advise buying this primarily for playing music unless you haven_ yet been spoiled by high quality home stereo system. Best use for Alexa, in my opinion, is for controlling lights and announcing in my kids room for him to go to sleep.

Title: Multitude of problems - Zigbee hub does not work over Bluetooth
Body: This is my first ever Echo device and I only had it for a week now. I've always been a google home assistant person but gave this a try for Prime day, with the Philips Hue Bluetooth Color Bulbs combo. The voice recognition works well just as you'd expect from an Echo device.First of all, I had a really bad experience with the on-time delivery of this device. They cancelled my order without my consent and then tried denying me a new device. I had to call them 4 times because every time I got assertive, my call got disconnected magically. Worst customer service experience for me in probably a decade and I cannot believe how low Amazon_ customer service standards have fallen.And then the actual device_ problems. The whole - works with Philips bulbs over Bluetooth- thing, is either a scam or they just released it without testing it properly because of course, prime day sales. The device does not recognize the bulbs. Cannot connect to them. This problem persists with most people who bought the combo that amazon disabled reviews for the bulbs. I have spent north of 4 hours, tinkering with it myself and talking to customer service trying to figure out why. Both customer reps I talked to tried blaming it on my phone, that there is somehow something wrong with my Pixel 2, or the bulbs which is really low for Amazon. Only when I asked them to send that in writing in an email, they backed down from trying to blame it on my end. This is all incredibly shady.They finally figured out that my firmware is not up to date but the device cannot update its firmware. It just does not update it and yes I have tried the whole mute overnight thing and it still will not update. Apparently there is no real way to force it to update. I cannot remember the last time a device gave me so many problems.My advice, to those who are able to read this before this review mysteriously disappears from Amazon, is do not buy it until the general consensus that they fixed most problems. I hate that over the years I became so dependent on Amazon that I cannot really do anything about any of this, but write a bad review. I miss the company that put customer service on top of Jeff Bezos wallet.

Title: They can be very helpful with tasks around the house.
Body: I have these all over the house. I love the ability to play music everywhere. It also tells me when there is motion detected at the front door. I use it to turn lights on and off also. When someone leaves the house or television on and I am in bed I can just ask the Echo to turn everything off. This will come in handy this winter. I haven_ yet used it to re-order products we use often but, I am sure I will soon. The speaker quality is really nice. Much improved over the earlier models.

Title: Worth the upgrade!
Body: Upgraded from a 2nd Gen Dot (Thanks to a great Prime Day trade-in sale). Sound is much louder and more rich in this speaker. The only downside is that it no longer uses micro-USB for power (Google mini still achieves similar performance over USB power). The plug is large and must be installed inverted to avoid blocked the other outlet. Previously, I had USB outlets that allowed me to have two USB devices and two normal 110v plugs.

Title: WOW! Sound Quality Blows Away 2nd Generation!
Body: The 3rd generation dot is all we_e come to expect in this product but with much better _istening due to the extra mics and the audio playback quality is like night vs day vs the 2nd generation dot.Very happy with my purchase and would recommend the Echo Dot to anyone! I_e had my original 2nd generation dot for months and am still learning what all it is capable of.

Title: Objective - Louder Dot - Check - However ...
Body: We decided to upgrade the Echo Dot in our bathroom because I could not hear it well enough, even at full volume, to listen to books or news while showering.The new dot delivers much fuller sound and higher volumes from its little built-in speakers.  Mission Accomplished!  I can now listen to Kindle and Audible books or News Briefings (with variable volumes from one news source to another), even when in the shower.The reason for four instead of five stars is because of two things that could be better:1) The bass is too high, and I do not know how to adjust it.  The lower frequencies overpower the upper and mid-tones. The dominant bass makes listening to books and news a little less pleasant, more difficult.2) When using it to control lighting in the adjacent room, it does not understand us very well in spite of the wide opening between the rooms and no background noise.  To be fair, it could be a quirky acoustic issue with these rooms.  It's usable, but we have to work at getting it to understand us a bit more than we do with our other echo devices.

Title: Not wireless!
Body: Alexa is the coolest AI around. You can ask or do just about anything. My only complaints are volume & portability. Possibly the absolute worst feature of the echo is having to have it plugged in to work. The echo does not have a battery in its design so it doesn_ hold a charge. So it has to stay plugged into the wall to work. I despise that & honestly would not have purchased if I knew that beforehand. This should be wireless! Even the similar forms of Bluetooth speakers are wireless & hold a charge. Come on echo!Also, it doesn_ get very loud when playing music. I have a small bathroom & like to listen when I_ showering. My Old Jam3 speaker plays music almost twice as loud as The echo on both of their max volumes. Like, if I speak at a normal volume I can hear myself over the echo. Not the case with the Jam3 speaker.

Title: More of a Toy
Body: I purchased 3 echo dots with the intention of being able to talk between rooms and maybe a little home automation.  There are  a couple of methods of talking between echo devices, "calling" and "drop in".  Calling requires someone at the other echo to answer the call; drop in does not required any action and is good for eaves-dropping on conversations.  The sound is unintelligible; I wind up shouting down the stairs.  So I cannot use it to communicate, but surely I can use it for home automation.  So I bought two plugs and hooked up two lights.  Sounds great.  But turn on the light always gets me the same response - which light do you mean.  Perhaps I want to turn on the light in the room where I am standing.  You can give the lights two different names, but the names have to fit something alexa can reliably understand like "light one" and "light two".  Which one is "light one" again?  Ok.  Still not a problem, I am an expert programmer I can just write some code and get alexa to do what I want.  Well, not really.  The tools are very limited.  The Alexa programmers have a very narrow view of what Alexa should do and you can't really step outside that very tiny box.  Well they do play music and it sounds better than AM radio so I gave it 3 stars.(update) Someone asked what code I was trying to write.  First I tried to create a 2 echo microphone array to improve the sound quality, but the data I need is not accessible.  The second thing I tried was to use data from my phone to improve home automation, I can get temperature, altitude and location from my phone which then can be used to turn on an air conditioner for example.  Nope, can't do that either.  The last thing I tried was to have two alexas carry on a conversation - this could fool would be thieves into thinking there were people in the house.  Oh, well.  My wife put things into perspective, "What did you expect, Alexa is just a child after all".

Title: A lucky Prime Day purchase
Body: Took advantage of Prime Day and got my new best friend here for $22 bucks! Just having something around I can get the time, weather, sports, and games made it well worth the money. The gag is  I bought it because my bathroom speakers died the day before. I was simply replacing them and now I'm about to purchase the full Echo for the bedroom! I'm hooked.

Title: Not yet ready for primetime
Body: I own two of these products and see them as it best adequate. They are very annoying in that they require you to repeat commands that you have used many times before over and over as they misjudge what you have said. The best feature is the ability 2 control lights and air conditioning by voice command. I subscribe to podcast and streaming Music Services and the speakers are excellent. However I cannot use the demand features of these services only live streams. The integration by  Bluetooth with my phone is especially wonky. it often requires me to reboot my phone in order to connect. There is no easy way to understand the features of these devices so it is a hit-or-miss process setting things to work with them and requires ridiculous amounts of time and effort. Overall if you do not have a pressing need for these devices as I do you may want to wait another generation or two until they are ready for primetime.

Title: Bad Quality
Body: We have a few Echos and an Echo show that are performing well. This one we've only used for a few months after returning from vacation before the speaker "blew". The sound is horribly garbled as if the speaker is defective. Worked with Amazon customer service hoping to get a replacement but after going through the rickets of deleting and re-adding it to our Alexa app was denied a replacement but was offered a discount on a new Echo.

Title: Echo dot
Body: A handy little gadget that provides responses to voice commands, such as specific types of music, alarms, weather, time and other information upon request.  Basic setup needed to get started is easy, but other things are not nearly as intuitive.  For example, if I request music by a specific artist it will search the Amazon music library (up to 2 million songs are free and an advanced library with up to 10 million songs are by subscription) is easy.  However, I haven't figured out how to set up Pandora to play on it.It also connects with Bluetooth devices easily.  For example, I connect it to my Beats Pill (a wireless speaker) so that I can have music on my patio.It has privacy settings that are supposed to maintain your privacy (so no one, including Amazon, can hack in and listen to what is going on in your house.  The fact that it can be accessed by a third party in the first place makes me skeptical about any privacy settings.  So if you've got nothing to hide, privacy shouldn't be too much of a concern.

Title: My Amazon Dot (3rd Generation)
Body: I have had the Amazon Echo (2nd generation) for some time. I have it downstairs in my Family Room. When I ordered the Dot above, I put it upstairs in the Master Bedroom. I now am able to pipe music to both floors of the house by pairing the two Amazon devices. They work great and have excellent speaker quality. I am now able to use both devices much more frequently by having them on each floor of the house.

Title: Awesome!
Body: I bought this on a whim on prime day along with the Firestick. Little did I know how much I would actually love both of them! Alexa is so handy in the mornings when I need to start my routine, letting me know the weather and the latest news. I was extra excited when I realized I could connect my Spotify and play from the playlists that I already have instead of making them on Amazon music too.

Title: Why doesn't she understand when linked?
Body: I bought this to listen to music AND to be able to control my smart plugs for my lamps. I linked my smart plugs to Alexia and I can open the app and turn them on and off, but she can't do it by voice, which was what I wanted. She says there is more than one device with that name which one do I want. WHAT?? There is not more than one device with the same name.. frustrating ...

Title: Good speaker for listening to music and accessing all of Alexa's features
Body: This is the second 3rd Gen Echo Dot I have owned.  I purchased this as part of a package deal when I ordered two Sengled bulbs (color).  It was basically a situation of getting just the Sengled bulbs, or getting the bulbs and the echo for a few bucks (less than ten but I don't remember exactly), so it was a no brainer for me.This little speaker has a much better sound than it's predecessor.  It has deeper and richer tones.  It hits more highs and does better with the lows, but is by no means a replacement for a sub if you're looking for deep bass.  The dot does everything as advertised.  I often use it for checking on the weather and travel before I head out.  I take a train into work and it saves me the effort of whipping out my phone and checking an app.  I have also used this speaker to check on order statuses, which is quite helpful if I don't have ready access to a laptop.I also, of course, use these devices to power on other electronics like my Sengled bulbs, the X-Box Ones (Day One Edition and Scorpio), my smart tv (LG OLED B65).  The latter requires communication via an app on my smart phone, but it makes getting the lights and TV on the right channel easy before I get downstairs in the morning.  It might sound like laziness, but when your rushing to get out the door to work in the morning, it is helpful and has a certain cool factor that I like.  I also really like the drop in and broadcast features.  If you ever wanted a comm system for your house, this makes it easy to communicate across floors.  With our finished basement, we have 4 floors people could be on.  Rather than shouting up and down the stairwells, this is a much more civilized alternative.I can't say these are better than other wireless speakers, say from Google or another manufacturer, as I don't have any of those.  I check comparisons on YouTube, and they stack up well to competitors.  It all really comes down to your preferences and what "buy in" you have with amazon.  For example, if you have a prime account, Amazon Music, etc., getting an Echo makes sense.Long story short, I recommend this speaker.  It's better than the 2nd gen, and it has a ton of features I don't even use that would be fun or useful to some.  I now have 4 dots in my home, two 2nd Generation kid editions, one 3rd Gen in the living room, and one in the bedroom.  I also have a larger 2nd Gen Echo in the kitchen.  I might consider buying another for our kids playroom in the basement.  At that point I would have at least one on every floor in our house.I would have given this device 5 stars, but there is room for improvement in the sound department.  Also, echo can get confused and mistake words at times.  It's a minor gripe though.  It might be my voice, my not speaking clearly enough, or background noise (mostly from my kids) which causes this.

Title: Sounds is louder but muffled, not as clear as Gen 2 Echo Dot's.
Body: I have 3 (2nd Gen) Echo Dot's and I just purchased this Gen 3 Echo Dot (Amazon stopped selling the Gen 2's), it's not that I'm used to the way the Gen 2 sounds, there's clearly a difference between the Gen 2 and Gen3 in voice sound clarity, to be honest the Gen 2 sounds much better, clearer, in the way Alexa's voice sounds in response to questions, to me the Gen 3 sounds muffled, like talking with your hand over your mouth loudly!  I tried adjusting the "Audio Controls",  Bass, Midrange and Treble within the Alexa app but it doesn't really help.  The Gen 2 just outperforms the Gen 3 in voice clarity, period!When listening to music however the Gen 3 outperforms the Gen 2 in music/sound quality but how often do you listen to music through the built in speaker? I use an external bluetooth speaker set for that.  If your purchasing the Gen 3 to play music then you'll be really happy with it, if not, stick with the Gen 2, if you can still find them...

Title: Go ahead and buy, you won't regret it.
Body: Love my Echo dots! We have three throughout the house.  One starts off my day by waking me every morning with a new greeting, the news, and some tunes and they all keep me on track throughout my day. My favorite feature so far is the shopping list. If you only knew the number of times I would think of something we needed when I was in the kitchen or upstairs etc... and when I was at the store I couldn't, for the life of me, remember what it was we needed. Now I just have Echo add it to my shopping list and when I'm at the store I just look at my phone. I wish it worked with Netflix and some other apps on my smart TVs,  and not just the Roku app, but that is probably a licensing issue. I'm definitely going to be getting a couple more along with some of the other peripheral devices.

Title: Super util!!!!
