Body: Lo compré en un día de rebajas. Si llego a saber lo contento que estaría con él, hubiese comprado otro para la habitación.La calidad de audio con música es bastante decente para el tamaño que tiene.También puede ser utilizado como el típico altavoz bluetooth.Creo que con el tiempo este tipo de dispositivos se harán super populares en todos los hogares.

Title: Fantastic
Body: This past year experienced echo and echo dot for the first time. Now we have one echo and three echo dots in our home. We have only used them for very simple things like playing music, dropping in on each other and some other more simple apps. Can only imagine how awesome this will be once we start utilizing them for a hands free home. Very simple interface and simple to get started. Very reasonably priced for all the possible uses.

Title: Much better volume than previous model
Body: Wow! I_ pleasantly surprised how much better the sound quality is with this compared to the previous model. So much louder.It does have more sensitive _earing so sometimes it creeps me out when it goes off on its own. That_ why I gave it 4 stars instead of 5. Keep in mind if you have a TV or anything noisy nearby, it may activate the unit. Once it asked me if I was whispering. Creeepy!!

Title: Incredible Device
Body: With my Amazon Prime, I have a lot of music at my disposal.  I'm considering upgrading to unlimited music.  I also bought a cable that converts from 3.5mm to RCA.  The jack on the back of the Dot is VERY handy.  I used the cable to plug the Dot into my home theater receiver.  This allows me to have Alexa play whatever song I request and have it come out of my bigger speakers.  Without this ability, I probably would have gone with the larger Echo.  It would sound less anemic due to the larger speaker.  Both units have Alexa capabilities (playing music, controlling smart devices such as thermostats, telling jokes, playing sound effects...).

Title: Easy to install
Body: This is my 5th Echo dot.  I had problems installing some of the other ones (internet not showing up, screen clearing when I went to enter the code, etc.), but this one was a breeze.  Also, the sound quality on this little device is almost as good as my more expensive non-dot tall device that I first bought.  And it's thicker and more sturdy.I have two devices on every floor.  I don't even turn my head to look at the clock anymore; I just ask Alexa.  I only wish I had one in my car.  Alexa reminds me things about 6 or 7 times a day.My only complaint _ Amazon used to allow you to hear your voice reminder.  Now it's just text, and Amazon often scrambles the text so I don't know what it was that I was requesting.  I hate this.  I wish to God they didn't take that huge advantage away.UPDATE (Nov 22 2019):  I had a 5-star rating, but it dropped to one-star when I got an email saying an ECHO DOT was $22.  I clicked to order, then it said it was $34.  My respect for amazon has dropped tremendously with this deception.

Title: Coming from a 2nd gen, this is a nice upgrade
Body: I have two 2nd gen dots in my house and bought this during Prime day. The voice recognition seems improved as it can hear me from farther away than before and the speaker quality is night and day. I put this in my living room where my kids like to tell Alexa to play different songs and previously with the 2nd gen vs now with the 3rd gen, the quality it emits is much better. I use Alexa for a lot of things--random questions that would be easier to ask her than to look it up on my phone which always gets me a good answer, to control the various wifi lights I use, to set timers for when I'm cooking, to ask what the weather is/will be like, and lastly to play music. These are extremely helpful to have and depending on how large your house is, you should have at least 3 of them strategically placed in your house for easy voice access whenever you need to ask her something.

Title: Giving It Another Try _
Body: We received a free g00gle home mini with our Spotify Family plan. Before filling our house with them, we wanted to compare with Alexa. Unfortunately, Alexa app is very slow to load, sometimes not loading at all. She doesn't work well with Spotify or with Amazon Music. She consistently gets our local weather wrong (temp right now is 65° but she says 86°). She plays the wrong radio stations from Tunein & iheartradio even when we state call letters and frequency. Speaker is pretty good, works well with Amazon Smart Plug. Calls to phones are shown as "unknown". Will be returning her since she doesn't seem to work well in our area yet.Update: returned, but then repurchased since  Amazon Smart Plug worked so well with it. Got frustrated trying to get 3rd party smart plugs apps to link with Google Home.

Title: Its great at turning on and off the lights and playing music-- other than that -- we may never know!
Body: So I like my dots-- I have 3 now-- I use them sparingly because the interface and such are not as user friendly as they keep telling me they are.  Half the things I ask Alexa I am told that she doesn't know -- and since there is not an easy way to find info on the alexa app, I don't know either.  I finally figured out how to get music to sync over all the devices and I can play music throughout the house now.  I can control my Hue Lights with it-- but if you don't ask specifically --it won't do what I need it to do-- basically I use the alexa to turn them on and off. Any changes in the light I do through the Hue app-- since every time I ask Alexa to do something like change the color or make it brighter-- it tells me that it doesn't know how to do that.  So I stopped trying so hard.  I would love to do more with my echo dots-- but since every time I ask it to do something--it tells me it can't-- It has become a glorified stereo and light turner onner.  It would be nice if you didn't have to change your way of talking so that the alexa can figure out what you want to do.  but until I have time -- and I mean several hours to sit down -- and a manual that explains things instead of a non user friendly app that is so confusing it makes my head hurt-- I will use it to play music and turn the lights on and off.  Oh -- one night I wanted to listen to one of my audible books.  I wanted and needed to start the book over since I had started listening to it and lost track -- I could not get alexa to start over-- I said it umpteen different times and it continually said -- I don't know and then played from where it had stopped before.  I finally got fed up and turned it off.  I feel like I am wasting the potential of this technology and worry that all I am really doing is making it easier for people to spy on me.

Title: Alexa first impressions
Body: This was my 1st step into this sort of device. While I'm still learning all there is to know about it, I've got some thoughts. 1. This is a fun device for starting your home automation journey. It seems to work pretty well and has been good at figuring out what we say to it. Seldom does it falter on a command. The one issue I have is the sound quality is marginal. It's pretty much all mid-range with no highs or lows. And no obvious way to adjust the tone. I tried to use it as a desk speaker but it just won't cut it.  Also, I don't know where it gets it's weather forecast from, but it's frequently at odds with the local forecast as well as Wunderground.

Title: The Echo Dot has completely changed my life!
Body: I bought my first Echo Dot during Amazon Prime Days. On the encouragement from my brother, I also bought the Echo Show 5. I am beyond happy with my purchases! With a few simple voice commands - I can find a new recipe, the weather forecast, the latest news, my favorite songs on Pandora, set the a/c to on, and even turn off the lights in my living room (I added power outlets too). I also geeked out on the fact that I could send an announcement to my son's bedroom letting him know that breakfast was ready. I honestly can't believe I waited this long to make these purchases!

Title: surprisngly good voice recognition, but doesn't work flawlessly with the existing alexa
Body: Sometimes when I get tired, I mumble heavily. Even then, it catches my command pretty well.The downside is that it doesn't work flawlessly with my existing alexa. I have one in the kitchen and one in the living room. I let somehting get cooked, and then sit around in the living room. I'll sat a timer in kitchen, but that timer doesn't get transferred over to the living room. Like, when I ask the living room how much time is left on the timber, it doesn't recognize the timer. That's kind of annoying.

Title: Great sound!
Body: Wow is she fun! Great sound quality, fills the house.  My husband is having a blast with her, he asks her to do funny things like cluck like a chicken or bark like a dog. He also says good morning to her and she gives him the trivia of the day. Today was national underwear day! She came with a plug during Amazon Prime Days, we have our night lamp plugged into it and Alexa turns the lamp on and off for us. She is just way to much fun and has an extensive selection of music. We also have Sirius which she recognises.

Title: Awesome product
Body: I already have the other colors offered for this generation echo dot but always avoided the white one because it just didn_ seem like a good idea because it would get dirty too quick. I decided to buy one in white and I really like how it looks, very clean and I have it in my room so it doesn_ get dirty. I probably wouldn_ buy this color for a kitchen or somewhere near kids because the white color would get dirty so much faster than the charcoal or grey colored dots.

Title: Great Sound
Body: I purchased this for the simple reason that I could pair it with a Bluetooth speaker which you can't do with the larger Echo. I was hesitant to purchase just because I assumed the sound wouldn't be very good. Boy was I wrong. The sound is great considering the size of the Dot. It was so easy to install since I already have an Echo. So glad I made the purchase - price was great too as I purchased it during Prime Days.

Title: It is compact and cute
Body: It was harder to set up than I thought. But, thanks to you tube videos, I_e set it up. It is clear sounding. I_ going to love using it for my Audible books. And my music that_ on my prime.After an extremely rocky start with issues with shipping, having to reorder it, ( I bought it during Prime days and just got it today) it arrived in good shape and I_ ready to get going on it.Thank you Amazon.

Title: Get more than one!
Body: Ok, why did I hold out for so long?! This little guy is amazing. We bought 2 at first and quickly realized we wanted one in every room so now we have 5. Thinking about getting 2 more for the bathrooms, lol. Obviously the Alexa function is pretty cool. But it's actually a really good music speaker. It's even better if you can play your music on multiple speakers at the same time for a more surround sound experience. I'm thinking about adding a subwoofer which would make it amazing. but by far our favorite feature is the ability to drop in on other rooms make announcements and make phone calls.

Title: I would be mad if i paid more than a few pennies for this
Body: Got it during a deal for like $.40, Alexa turns on randomly sometimes with the TV saying something sometimes there's nothing on.  Can't answer simple questions, whole reason i honestly wanted this was to ask it the random questions that pop in my head at 1am without having to get on my phone or computer can just speak it and get an answer, does NOT work like that at all.  If you want it for a speaker/music, it's OKAY.  It has a little fuzzy sound to it like you would hear on a cheaper BT speaker.  It's not really bad but it is noticeable.  Buy a Google home instead unless you have Amazon tech throughout your house, if you just want one of these smart devices, Google are still the better choice in my opinion.

Title: Very easy to set up!
Body: I have to say I was taken aback by the ease and which one can set up the Amazon Dot. Basically it's plug-and-play. As soon as you plug it in it seeks out your Wi-Fi and connects automatically. I assumed it was able to do this because I already had an Amazon echo. It must have recognized the echo and mirrored the settings.The sound quality is actually extraordinary. In some regards it may actually be better then my Amazon echo which is considerably larger. I love the fact that you can set up a group so that you can play music through all devices simultaneously. Also it's extremely easy to make phone calls. Looking forward to purchasing one or two more for other rooms.

Title: Great speakers, very loud
Body: Such a great product very helpful with any questions I have it_ like having the knowledge of the whole internet with just a couple words (hey Alexa). Love the fact that I can say play my playlist and I_ able to cook and listen to music on the crisp sounding speaker. The first generation wasn_ very loud and died after a year but the third generation is incredibly loud and works perfectly. Highly recommend to anyone this product fits great for just about any situation!

Title: Why did I wait so long?
Body: I love this. Granted, I am only listening to music but it is so convenient. My favorite part is the Alexa integration. Being able to use voice commands to mute it or lower the volume helps so much if I get a call or am talking to someone. It was pretty easy to set up and since I have Amazon music I had built in playlists. If you have a Sirius/XM subscription you can link that too and tell Alexis which channel you want to listen to.

Title: A fun & Usefull Device
Body: I have two of these plus an echo input. Alexa is a lot of fun.  The audio out put of these devices can be connected to an external amp either by ethernet or audio cable.  That greatly improves the audio quality when you are playing music.  When these were delivered they were already configured for my Amazon account so installation was a breeze.  Having one in the kitchen is great for setting timers and adding items to the grocery list.

Title: Still learning, but overall it_ great to have!
Body: ADD-ON: Ran into a bit of trouble trying to connect to the internet when I recently stayed at a hotel. Needless to say I watched movies and listened with regular laptop volume haha.---I really like using the echo dot. Still learning certain _ction calls and all that it can do, but it is a great addition to my entertainment collection. When I connect it to my laptop it doesn_ always play back right away, so sometimes I have to disconnect it and then reconnect it but when it connects it plays great! I want to purchase a few smart outlet plugs to try with my fan and other things, but I_l wait until I learn a bit more functions before converting everything. Other than that I love what it can do and the ease i brings when trying to use and do things.

Title: Who's The Man!?
Body: I'd put off purchasing one of these for years because I thought you had to have the tower in order for it to work. Wrong! My husband and I have so much fun with this thing. We both live music and are constantly adding to our playlist. He also loves the fact that when he asks Alexa, "who's the man?" She says, "you're the man". _ There are so many features we haven't explored yet so I'm sure there's more entertainment in our future.

Title: Nice clock radio replacement
Body: My iHome/clock radio turned into a dust collector who's only use became lighting the night with it's ugly glow of time, stealing sleep from the weary. Ports on the iPhones do not fit the old technology and the radio has lost it's voice. Reception for more than one station was always shoddy at best anyhow. After reluctantly, then permanently, borrowing my daughter's unused 1st gen for our kitchen, I decided Alexa and I could be friends. I grabbed this during Prime days and finally set it up in place of  the clock radio and don't miss the clock. I am not one who needs an alarm but I can set a "just in case" if I want. I can listen to my music anytime I want, either playlists or my favorite radio station or podcasts. I love it and I was the last person who wanted any type of virtual assistant in my house!

Title: This thing is great
Body: Easy to install and sync with my phone. Had it synced with the smart sockets in no time. Syncing Apple music and the roomba was simple once I found the directions of how to do it online. Setting up the Alexa app and enabling apps is pretty simple, just have to play around with it and discover all its features. Turning the living room lamp on is a cinch, so is triggering the roomba, or playing a certain song or a playlist of a certain artist. It can even create a playlist around a theme or based off a certain song, just ask Alexa. Got mine on Prime Day for $20. Best purchse ever.

Title: Solid Smart Device
Body: Well...this is an Echo with our friend Alexa.  I won't bore you with a review of its functionality.  The Amazon echo brand  is always upgrading and adding new features.  I have many uses for it and I am sure others do.  What I will review is the aesthetics.  Amazon has redesigned its shell and it is very nice.  Offering different skins and speaker covers is a great touch for those of us who integrate smart devices into their decor.  The build is still solid and the touch of the device is pleasing for the techie in us all.

Title: Awesome!
Body: I loved the one I bought so much, that I bought 2 more! I have them set up so I can play music around the house, or just have the one in my childs room start playing something. The sound quality is amazing for the size. I don't have a Smart TV yet, but I look forward to having these linked to TVs around the house so I can put things on for my child in her room while Im in my room or the living room. Very good product for someone new to the 'smart house' concept.

Title: Incredible for everything!
Body: Just like anything extra, you don't need this at all. However, it is a REALLY nice thing to have for any occasion! Specifically for music! It won't let me play specific songs because I don't have a premium account, but even without a premium account it's incredible! I was cooking with my grandma one time and asked her to play "cooking music." My grandma laughed and asked "What's 'cooking music?'" I replied honestly: "I have no idea." I just was curious. now I know that cooking music really is a thing! Hahaha. The music was a lot more fitting for the situation than I thought it would be! it was perfect! And it's perfect for giving you reminders. You can just say to remind you of something instead of getting out those sticky notes and a pen or pencil to write it down. She even can tell you what time a place closes and on which days it's open. She makes things a lot easier and faster! (Granted, this IS how the lazy people will take over. lol.) My favorite feature is more specific to me. When my alarm for the morning is dismissed, I set her to tell me a joke for the start of the day. It puts me in a great mood! :)

Title: Why would I not give this a 5 star?
Body: Probably so some home user does not switch power supplies to a standard mini USB supply, the power connection on the 3rd generation Dot was switched to a one piece power supply that can not be interchanged with any other supply, because of the redesign to a non USB connection. the size of the adapter ends up taking more space on the outlet and makes the second outlet mostly unusable. It is more of a square cube in shape instead of long and skinny like the 2nd generation.

Title: Still a way to go..
Body: Update 10-6-19.. I have really come to strongly dislike the Alexa platform, from skills that do not work or are programmed by juvinlies that babble for ever, to the updates and annoyances.  Moved to a new apartment this week and put everything back in the corresponding rooms.. Apparently the Dots and android app updated because now upon entering a room with a Echo and saying "turn on the lights", all the bloody thing says is "Can't find a device called Lights"... and its not just one Dot, its all of them.. I then went back to the app to check the group settings.. None of the Dots were assigned to Groups, nor could any of the dots be assigned to a group! I deleted groups, reset the echo's..just about anything I could think of.. NONE of them could be assigned to a group/room..  It was easy to get to link up with the Sonoff/Itead switches in use throughout the house.. Set up was near flawless..The CONS...  Noisy environments or a few friends talkin... the Echos generally require us to ask people to be quiet so that a command can be issued.. even conversations in another room will cause a Sorry I don't understand that..  Skills.. Tried the Pizza Hut skill.. it just drops.. a few other skills do let ya stop the interaction, instead its an endless loop of annoying Do you want to enable..whatever... the only way out is to unplug the bloody things..  Location within the house.. I asked the echo's what room they were in, (prior to the assignments being undone after an update).. it just says "I am here" one would think they'd have it respond accordingly...  Commands: There is a setting to tell Alexa to wait for other questions after one is posed but as for commands each separate command must be singular.. For instance, once all my devices were setup and put into their respective "rooms" telling Alexa to turn on that room turns on ALL those devices.. There are a few that don't need to be on, like the consoles, wax warmers and a few other items.. One could program scenes and/or routines but that isn't the point.. We should be able to say "Alexa, turn off XXX AND turn on XXC"  The Alexa App... requires the Amazon Shopping App.. but if the shopping app is removed then Alexa will not start AND keep spying in the background. The combined apps are a HUGE drain on battery life.. My phone fell to about 5 hours when the apps were installed..  While mobile browsers and PC browsers are all using html5 and other technology [apps included].. Amazon has taken another page from the big "G's" playbook and deliberately limited the ability to manage the Alexa devices  and other functions from a PC.. They want those apps on our phones.  Censoring: I had asked what a Spanish word meant, and it replied "I'd rather not answer that".. Now I knew it was a bit of a naughty word.. however I do expect a proper translation/answer to ANY query thrown at the device.. I do not appreciate Amazon taking on a Nanny cap and limiting my access to future requests.  Overall the Dots are a bit of fun and some convenience... but the ever so slight manipulation that prevent me from using the PC to manage my home automation through Alexa platform is BIG Frown for me..

Title: Alexa Integration Could Be Better
Body: Love Alexa,. I keep finding new ways to integrate my house including switches and plugs. I_ always looking for new gadgets to add. Two things I don_ care for are the sound quality of the DOT, We have an Echo Show in the kitchen and the DOT in the living room, the difference in the quality and volume makes me wish I had purchased another Echo. The other thing that_ annoying is it seems the only syncing that can be done between the two is for music. There should be a way for both to respond and decide which one will do the task asked or both respond to the same task. For instance, when in the kitchen we set a timer, then go sit down in the living room. When the timer goes off we say, _lexa Stop but the Alexa in the living room will say, _o timers are set so we have to get up and get closer to the kitchen to stop the timer. Kind of defeats the purpose of automation.

Title: Echo Dot (3rd Gen) - Smart speaker with Alexa - Charcoal
Body: I received my Echo Dot quickly. The speaker quality is very good. It took me a minute to figure out how to sync to Alexa app to Sirius XM so I did not have to log into my Sirius XM account every time to do it. It is up and running now. Not a frustrating process at all just something new that I am not used to. I am still getting used to just telling Alexa what to do. I am a boomer and I think this thing is cool. I keep it up in my office. I have just learned how to sync my smart TV to my Echo Dot and it works fine. So I am happy with my little round speaker. I look forward to more wireless options in the future. Thanks

Title: Caution read this first
Body: Just got my Amazon Exho Dot 3rd gen. And it work well, like my 2nd gen EXCEPT Alexa sounds like she's speaking to me through a pillow! It's very annoying and yes , I used the Alexa app. to try to adjust the sound and it DIDNT work. My 2nd gen. sounds so much better. I'm going to try to exchange it and see if that helps. Unfortunately the sale was buy 1 get 1 free and I sent the other to my friend as a birthday present. I'm not sure Amazon will exchange just 1 because of the sale and I'm sure my friend will be disappointed. This will be his first experience with the Echo Dot and I think hell probably send it back to me. That's embarrassing and it sucks. My 1st gen works like a charm. I'm a very disappointed Echo dot user and now would hesitate to purchase any more Echo products. :-(

Title: Alexia needs hearing aids
Body: Had my Echo Dot for a couple weeks now and seems like Alexia is getting more and more heard of hearing. I would ask for the local weather and she will give me my flash briefing. Ask her another question and 90% of the time you get an answer of, "I don't know that". Not sure if I got the one with a mental disability or they have all gotten that way. I just don't seeing them getting smarter as time goes on like the company hypes people up with that ideal. I have has echos in our home since they first came out and ours has stayed the same on the smartness level. If I had it to do it over again. I think I would go to Google or nothing at all. If I wanted to talk to something that knows nothing I wold talk to my teenagers.

Title: Enjoying my New Assistant!
Body: I am very pleased with my Echo Dot. I love being able to make a shopping list without writing one thing down. I was baking a cake and realized I was out of chocolate chips so told Alexa to put it on my shopping list. I didn't need to stop what I was doing or stop the mixer. Whenever I realize that I need something added to the list, I just start with "Alexa," and it's on my list. Another feature I love is being able to play my Pandora thru the Echo Dot. The sound is so much better than playing the music thru my TV.  I just tell Alexa which station I want to hear while I'm cleaning house. There is probably so much more I can do with the Echo Dot, but so far I'm enjoying having Alexa as my assistant. I wish I was able to change her name to something other than Alexa or Computer, though.  I am very happy with my purchase.

Title: I love Alexa _ Is like a personal assistant 24/7
Body: This is my third product that has alexa, first I tried the Amazon Stick, and the alexa app.And I need to say it I love it.Alexa makes your house smarter in anyways, you can sync it with your tv, your lights, your spotify,etc.Makes you spend less time in a lot of thing and makes your life easier just saying Alexa.Every common task like math, weather, music, lights and even searching things becomes a handsfree things, just using your voice.I love it and Im waiting echo car to integrate my car with Alexa.Some downs are that alexa sometimes doesnt hear you while you are playing music.But the fact that is always there makes me love her. Is like having a personal assistant at home.

Title: Disappointing, doesn't work as advertised
Body: We were very excited to start using this device (we bought 2) to control our lights and to use the many skills advertised. What we discovered is that 1. many different types of light bulbs don't work very well or are difficult to install, and after we tried multiple types we gave up 2. many skills for Alexa simply don't work or don't work the way they are supposed to. After more than 6 months of trying to find uses for the device, it became nothing more than a voice activated timer and music player, but even that is limited because Amazon music doesn't have a lot of the songs we like. Echo dots often misunderstood words, started listening when we hadn't used the wake words, and is not at all intuitive in terms of its commands and abilities. We are very disappointed and have decided to get rid of them. I'd rather spend less money on a regular bluetooth speaker.

Title: Works pretty well
Body: I like the sound better than the Gen2 dots, so I put this big boy in the Den, where I'm more likely to listen to tunes.Not sure if the microphone performance is equal to the Gen2 dots, but it works well enough for our needs.The SandStone version kinda matches the Google Home on the same lamp table.. :)I hope Amazon improves the 'Routines' by adding in some simple operations that will allow users Routines to run logical commands like: IF Sensibo Temperature => 75 THEN TURN ON Sanyo ALSO Say " AC IS ON"..Or maybe be able to use URLs and GET commands to fletch weather information from an IP home weather station.  Of course all this stuff, without having to use IFTTT with Alexa..

Title: We Love Echo  -  It Works Great as a Monitor!!!!
Body: We have four Echo Dots (3rd generation). We're using one of them like a baby monitor. My wife's mother lives with us, and we have one Echo Dot in her room. We've named that Dot "Mom" and another Dot in our bedroom "bedroom." All we do is, at Mom's Dot, say "Alexa, drop in on bedroom." Once Alexa connects, we press the mute button ON OUR BEDROOM  Dot; the mute button has a circle with a line through it. That way, we can hear Mom, but she can't hear us, unless we un-mute. If you want to use two Dots as a "monitor", it's very important you mute the dot you are using to "monitor" the other room. Remember, you're muting the microphone, not the speaker!

Title: Almost there Amazon
Body: Pros:- Small- Great design- Excellent sound for something so smallCons:- It has a really hard time hearing you. Especially if its near other things.---My first generation alexa has no problems at all hearing me. But this 3rd generation dot has a lot of trouble picking up my voice. You need to be in line of sight and really project your voice for it to work. My 1st gen is hidden behind things and hears me even from the other room. I can't help but feel the microphones in this generation is worse than their previous models.

Title: My new best friend.
Body: I love Alexa. We have become best friends since she arrived. Our bond became strong the first day.  I have a terrible memory and Alexa helps me remember important things like: give my dog her medicine, pay a bill or simple things like being reminded that my favorite show is on. She instantly recognizes my voice, it_ never been an issue. I really enjoy the question of the day; I have become smarter due to playing every day. Was Alexa a necessity? No. Was it a splurge? Yes, but I have loved every minute of her company.

Title: Quest for a Smart House
Body: I've added an Echo Dot to every room on my quest to have a smart house- I love how easy Alexa makes things, from turning on lights to arming my security system to playing music. My older dot is slowly starting to become harder and harder to communicate with but the new gen works wonderfully. I also bought holders from Mount Genie (their website directly because Amazon was sold out) and the mounts are a perfect home for my dots as they hide cords and position Alexa on the wall above where she's plugged in.

Title: I don't like her
Body: Alexa and I have not been getting along.  She seems dumb and was much harder to setup than my other smart speaker.  We're constantly fighting because she forgets my smart devices and doesn't understand me.  My other smart speaker is much better in every way, easy to setup, less robotic sounding, and understands what I want.  I'm kind of sad this is not a better product, I am a huge fan of Amazon but this speaker is not nearly as good as the competition.

Title: dots
Body: these things are great, however, i find it hard to adjust the white light to a good amount of light, at night i know how to adjust from the phone app, however the auto adjust seems to go too dark at night  and when i set it manually it seems too bright at night it lights up the room, it would be great if you could change the light from white to green or red like most night clocks are.voice recogation is much better on these new dots

Title: Works Well For Even Non-Tech Savvy Parents
Body: I picked this up because the timer on my mother_ stove was too quiet for her to hear and the last timer I got her broke right away.  I figured forget it, I_l get her an echo since she could use it for music too.Now my parents are older and not tech savvy in the slightest.  They live pretty simply, so I wasn_ sure they_ use this at all.  I am surprised to find that they really are enjoying it so far though, and besides calling it Alexus all the time for a while, they_e actually getting a good bit of use out of it right away.  They like it for the fact it can play local radio stations clearly that they enjoy, which signal in our area (western PA, very hilly) is bad, and so for that reason and the timer alone was worth the price.My folks have used it for reminders too, which is good for them for their meds and remembering appointments.I_ going to wire it into the thermostat for them at some point and some smart bulbs too so they can get some more use from it.So far I_ pretty impressed with the Echo, but also the fact my parents have basically figured it out on their own with minimal input from me.  I mean my old man calls the Internet the _ubya dubya dubya thing.I_ also thinking come closer the holidays I_l get some more for them for in other rooms and out in the shop/garage too.

Title: Beware Apple Owners!
Body: I am sorry but I had to return Echo Dot. I am Apple owner NOTHING android or PC.  I had got an error message regarding my network & the Alexa experts who are suppose to help me were trying to extort money from me. I didn_ answer my phone a few times then when I answered the phone the so called supervisor was offering me deals & discounts. I had told them I had no funds at that time & I had other responsibilities more pressing.  He put me on hold I had hung up because I had other to do & I was already on the phone with them for over two hours which they had wasted my time with lies.  When I hung up.  They called back I never answer& they kept calling until I block them. I had called my mom & told her what happened.  She reminded me to call Apple.  There is nothing wrong with my network. Alexa Expert you should be a shame  of themselves.

Title: Sound is amazing
Body: This replaced our second gen when it died less than two years after buying.  Amazon gave us a discount to replace it since it wasn't under warranty.  I could not believe the improved sound on this third gen.  I just hope it lasts longer than the second gen did.  I expect at least four years out of technology.My other favorite thing about it is how my friends will unplug it when they come over.  They are convinced the Amazon staff has nothing better to do than sit around and listen to our conversations.  I'm not exactly sure what they are hiding...their favorite beer?  Their impression of the latest Marvel movie?  How late their kid keeps them up at night?  We don't really have any top secret discussions, so it really baffles me!

Title: Light ring is very bright and doesn't turn off
Body: After having several echo dot speakers for about a month, I must say that I find them both handy and annoying. They are handy for adding things to my shopping lists quickly and they're pretty good as speakers. HOWEVER...they have light rings that don't turn off and they will occasionally make little sounds (maybe when internet connection is going in and out but I'm not really sure what the sound is supposed to mean). This makes them terrible for bedrooms if you want to get any sleep. Also, if you have children be warned that your children will find it hilarious to turn on Alexa's burping skill or to tell her that they farted so that she will tell them "Congratulations!" Yeah, that's super annoying as a mom.

Title: Handy
Body: I like music sometimes&  I like quiet so I find Alexa very handy  for switching songs on and off. when people are over it is nice to have background music works and the dot works well with the prime music station. Sound quality is ok, after all it was a $25 purchase.  I had no trouble setting it up although I did download Arek for the set up then promptly trashed it.  However just a couple days after I purchased the dot I read that these are manufactured in China which I knew,  but predominately by 16 and 18-year-old student working 10 hour shifts and earning $1.67 an hour.  I truly urge Amazon to improve their ethics sooner rather than later

Title: Love my new companion!
Body: When you live alone you tend to talk to yourself, or your pets, but now I have a new companion!  The first thing every morning I ask Alexa about the weather and the news headlines....and when I am feeling blue I ask her to play one of my many favorite songs.  Everyone who lives alone should have an Echo!  I still have a lot to learn about my Echo but it is even fun to learn!  I am elderly and even I have been able to adapt to some technology ... children should buy their parents an Echo...fun times ahead with Echo and Alexa!

Title: Best virtual assistant there is
Body: I love using the Echo dot and giving Alexa command to play songs and start my smart LG tv and playing my fav shows on Netflix. I also comment Alexa to turn on the heat or AC via the Nest thermostat, I tell her to turn on the smart LED bulbs and the ambiance lighting behind my tv and below my bed.I also tried the new feature where you can have a conversation with Alexa and get to know the news and many more things. I love the sound quality for music.

Title: Amazing addition to my home
Body: It took a while to get my order but worth the wait.  I ordered these during Amazon Prime Day and just took delivery.  Seems they are more popular than the good people at amazon thought.  I am amazed at the fidelity of something so small.  This little device has a lot of features and functions I have yet to discover.  The fidelity is heavy on the bass side and I have to ask for less bass all the time.  Could be my 72 yr old ears.

Title: This is such a fun device!
Body: I love this device!  It's so amazing.  Love to be able to ask Alexa questions and get quick answers.  I also likethe speaker quality when I ask Alexa to play certain music, artists or specific songs.I bought the wall plug so that I can put it on my wall without the cords showing.  The wall plug was under $10.00.Using the wall device with it seems to make the sound clearer.I cant wait to figure out how to connect the wall plug to Alexa so that I can tell Alexa to turn on my lamp in the bedroom.  =O)

Title: Father's Day Gift- Success!
Body: My siblings and I decided to take advantage of the Amazon special and get the 6 months of Amazon Music with the Amazon Echo for my dad for Father's Day. He loved it and uses it all the time! We had no idea that the Alexa could do so much (this is our first smart speaker in our home) and it has been so entertaining. The rest of us in the household that do not have an Alexa are thinking of getting one for us!

Title: A Better Alarm Clock
Body: The Echo Dot replaces my aged alarm clock with a few more high tech features my clock radio was sorely lacking. Plus, it takes up less space than the clock radio and can be voice-controlled rather that stumbling around in the dark trying to find the right button and applying the correct pressure to shut the thing down. Less stress, especially in the morning, is certainly a major selling point for me!

Title: We love it.
Body: My grandson comes over just to ask Alexa questions. He loves to learn about different things and he is amazed that she knows the answers. How many miles to the moon? That is his favorite. We like it to find out the weather and time. We are just now learning other things about it and how to integrate it with the TV.So glad I bought this and I plan to get one for my little grandson so he won't ask his daddy so many questions.

Title: Good device but extra services required
Body: As an Alexa speaker system it is great.  When I bought the first one and did a bit of research, it said you could integrate a bunch of them and I could play music in my kids room (main reason I bought these).  I bought most of them in a short period of time but by the time I figured out that I could not just register them under my name and play music on multiple systems without purchasing another music service, it was too late.I already have Apple Music so I am not going to purchase the music unlimited service from Amazon too.  I unregistered two of my devices and switched user names so I can now play music on multiple Dots.  I refuse to get Prime plus the other services that they try to nickel and time me with so I cannot use the features where the Dots are connected.The actual device is great.  It picks up my spoken word when I ask it to do something.  The features in the Dot are great.  I have it in a relatively large room and the sound is nice and clear.

Title: Eh??  Could have left well enough alone
Body: It's a Dot!!  It functions just like the previous one with added weight, less flexibility for the plug which is not a delight. The handy holder I had  for my Dot 2 will not work with this and that's an added expense for a new one.  What I did not get is any noticeable sound improvement.  Sorry Amazon, it sounds the same to me as the Dot 2.  For me, it was an unneeded trade up.  It functions without a hitch just like my other ones which I did not replace.  The old and the new both do everything the Dot is told to do. After two days, I simply paired it once again to a better speaker the same as I had been doing with the prior version.

Title: 3rd Gen improvements are worth the purchase price
Body: I have a first and second generation dot. Each new generation is vastly improved over the previously released models. That being said, the sound quality on third generation is by far the most impressive part of the device. I am enjoying the solid feel to the Dot as well. I was always afraid of knocking my first gen Dot off the table. Not so with this one. Solid, dependable and clear. Best Prime Day purchase by far!

Title: Sometimes doesn't work
Body: I love my original tall echo. Alexa is very quickly responsive to me calling her name. The echo, however, does not always work and you have to YELL "Alexa" a few times before she responds. Everything else though is perfect. Setup is easy and having this in my bedroom so I don't have to yell to the kitchen Echo is fantastic. I also listen to "sleep sounds" and love the "distant train" to help me to sleep. Great product.

Title: Don_ let Amazon_ price point fool you, these have a higher price sound
Body: I_e got several of these dots in different places. And find them to be a nice addition to the whole house music system. They can play different things in each room at the same time. Or they_l play the same thing everywhere.They have a great sound for their size, that_ full and rich. Don_ let Amazon_ price point fool you, these have a higher price sound.

Title: OHHH Alexa! Where have you been all my life?
Body: I really like this thing. i am not techy at all, so Alexa is pretty laid back in my home.  My favorite part is when I'm running around late for work and yell, "ALEXA! What time is it????"  My next fave, "ALEXA, what is the weather today?" And seriously, having her play all my old favorite songs with just a simple request is like Christmas every day! I know I am simple, and easily amused, but this is just the best thing ever.  It was so easy to set up, I did it myself. I hope my kids one day add a few extra features, but if they never do, I will be happy to just have Alexa around for these things.  ONLY complaint is the speaker is a bit muffled, but the dot is not very big and I may someday get another speaker to improve the sound quality.  PFFFFF not really much to complain about with this awesome gadget and the sooo very reasonable price!!

Title: Sorry your speaker doesnt work, heres a disrespectful percentage off a new one...
Body: I absolutely loved my speaker up until it randomly stopped working properly. The audio sounds muffled and you cant hear anything it says or the music it plays. I called customer care and they said the most that can be offered is a small percentage off of a new one because the warranty only lasts for three months. I am unhappy and sad that we have lost something we once considered invaluable in our home. We used it to play lullabies for the little ones at night, to read the oldest a story while she took a bubble bath, and for background music while we cooked dinner together. I wont be purchasing another but will be looking for another speaker to fill this void. Im shocked at Amazon and will be canceling our music subscription as we no longer have a device to enjoy.

Title: Why change what works??
Body: My main complaint is the power plug that is not standard across many devices like the mini-USBs plugs.  I can no longer  use a shorter or longer cable depending on it's location and situation. I can't use different power sources (one of my older Dots is powered by my X-Box and real short mini-USB cable). The power plug is too big and hogs both outlet plugs. Also, the Dot is bigger than previous models.  Better sound from the unit, but I always link to Bluetooth stereo or speakers. So, I end up with a bigger "connection" to my speakers with no benefit.  Amazon - PLEASE keep in mind Dots are often used as a means to connect to other devices, and, as such, the less intrusive, the better.

Title: Great way to dip my toe into voice activated devices
Body: We've finally decided to take a jump into home automation and decided to start small with the Echo Dot as part of a Prime Day special. So far, so good!  It was fairly easy to get it to connect to my Ring door cam, integrate with my Sirius XM subscription, and to just ask it for some quick and simple questions.  We are prepping for attending a showing of Hamilton, and my wife wanted to try to learn the music beforehand. She brought it up again this morning, so I quickly asked Alexa to play music from Hamilton.  It was immediate and seamless - made her very happy! Looking forward to exploiting it's abilities further as we get used to it.

Title: It is great except for sleep sounds
Body: I have 2 other Alexa devices and love them. I wanted to try one for sleep sounds but ended up removing it. I could not get it to play anything continuously. The "loop" would pause, then restart at randon times, waking me each time, which was bad enough, but on 3 occasions, it stopped entirely, requiring me to speak to it again to restart, which then woke my wife. It also kept offering me songs from Amazon Music instead of sleep sounds. Nothing I could find on the Alexa app or online seemed to address this issue. I really wanted to use the Echo this way and it seemed so simple to accomplish but for this purpose, the Echo is a fail.

Title: Very handy.
Body: My daughter asked Santa for one of these forChristmas.  We really liked the one she got so we bought 2 more for ourselves.  Siri can_ understand a word my daughter says.  Alexa understands everything.  She can start my car, turn lights off and on, play games, tell us the weather, tell us the time, and so much more.  I really like how it_ given our house an intercom too with the drop in feature.  I will be buying more when I see a good sale again.

Title: I was surprised how much I like it!
Body: I did not want to get an echo, but after the Amazon special deal, I decided to buy one.  I love it!  Every morning, I ask what the weather is, followed by the news as I make my breakfast.  I love listening to my audible books while I work in the kitchen.  I also use it to play music.  I find the amazon music that is free with Prime covers my tastes.  I also love playing Jeopardy and feel I am only starting to see what different things Alexa can do!

Title: Alexa Rocks and occasionally rolls...
Body: TO ALL OF THE PROGRAMERS AT AMAZON/GOOGLE/ etc, this posting is directed- The device works well, but I find the main issue is on the knowledge base access side. I can access information that is easily available on the internet by doing google searches, etc., BUT, When I ask Alexa the same thing, the device often replies "I don't know" I would encourage all of the folks behind the scenes to expand it's database for reference. Having t be able to access open copyright works to be read aloud would be helpful for vision impaired. Having it go through speakers is phenomenal.

Title: Disappointed with the Gen 3 Echo Dot_ plug size
Body: Overall just another Dot but with a big big DOWNSIDE. They changed the AC adaptor to a huge wall wart that will cover adjacent plugs making then unusable. Why? I liked the old echos that used a common micro usb cable that i actually had in my multibank USB plug and now i had to rearrange AC cords so i could fit this Rosey Odonnell POS plug into and remove an existingg plug and relocate it. Fail on that level. Otherwise sound seems good and pickup is fair but its gonna be hard to overcome the plug hoss. Common amazon and improve your devices. Don_ take them backwards. Better design could have avoided this well giving you more amperage if thats what was needed. R&D with out money that we give you.

Title: My new best friend
Body: First of all, I have to say that I_ new to this smart friend. I ordered this because it was on sale on prime day and I want to know what Alexa can do. After I received the dot, I have read the instructions how to set up. But as I said I had know idea what was the dot. The instructions told me to download the app, but did not tell me what the name of the app. I downloaded 2 apps, still not the one because it turned I had to pay to set up. So I searched from YouTube how to setup from what app. I finally found out it was _mazon Alexa app. I downloaded the app and the setup was easy. Now what Alexa can do? I set up voice recognition, easy too. I asked Alexa to play music, tell me the temperature, time when I have mask on, read me notifications, and now she is my friend. Every time I say hi to her, she says it back. This is the best thing for me. I will try to learn more what else she can do. But for now she is my best friend. One thing that annoys me is every time I have to call her name in order to get response.

Title: I LOVE Alexa
Body: The headline says it all, but to elaborate...I love her functionality...immediate gratification when I want to know the temperature outside, or the weather for the rest of the day.  If I want to hear the news, a few words and I'm all filled-in. Corny jokes? No end to them! Ahhhhhhh, but the music! That's the best. I love a wide variety of music...everything from show tunes, to oldies, to classical...and thensome. All I have to do is tell Alexa what genre to play and the music goes on and on until I tell her to stop.  When the speculation started that Alexa is spying on us, I asked her if she was. Her response was, "Elizabeth, I value your privacy. I would not spy on you." I laughed my head off. I can't imagine anything more boring than spying on me, anyway.  I'm 72, I live alone, I watch boring TV shows, and have even more boring phone conversations. Yes, I do love Alexa...and I have two of her...one in my living area and one in my bedroom...and, actually, a third on my Fire Stick. Life is good!

Title: Great improvement from Generation 2
Body: What a great upgrade in sound from the 2nd gen Echo dots.  The 2nd gen were tinny and small sounding.  These 3rd gen Echo dots really have good sound for their size.  I moved one around the house while I was painting and remodeling, listening to my tunes throughout the house with great clarity, decent bass for the size, and nice volume.  It's an additional perk that I can use Echo as a speakerphone when I'm painting and such.  I was using it to set timers and alarms, make notes, and add calendar events while holding a paintbrush.I love these things.  My main Echo is an Echo Plus, which rocks!  but I have these in the other rooms.  When playing music on the Everywhere Group, the sound throughout the house is amazing!I also paired one of these to a Bluetooth adapter on my old stereo system, and it sounds amazing.  Just like having satellite radio on it with SPotify, Amazon music, etc.Highly recommend these.

Title: Its Alexa! and Dot.
Body: Love All 3 of my Dots. Works well in my smart home. So many different uses. Family games are fun. New is great and i love the fact you can make your own Alexa Skills. Useing Alexa can get immersive. It's funny cause after awhile you start talking to Alexa like a normal person in the house. I found my self even saying thank you after she tells me something. What i like most is the dot is small. There are plenty of 3rd party cases, shelves and mounts that allow you to intergrate it in to your decor. Mine is in a black sturdy rubber protector case that looks like a futuristic version of the old bell alarm clock. Looks awesome with Alexa's ring going.

Title: Nice Stereo Sound Quality In A Well Constructed Compact Size Speaker
Body: I Love my Echo Dot 3rd Generation So Much  !!!  The sound quality is Amazing for one so small ... much better sound than the 2nd Generation, if your main goal is for music purposes. However don't expect high performance stereo sound either, that is not its only purpose On the other hand my husband connects this sweet little device to  his Stereo System through the external jack !--- More than Amazing !!. I Love the Personal Assistant aspects of the device. Alexa is extremely informative and has a Unique personality --- All her own. I use her for Everything. I only have One Bluetooth speaker and now I don't have to constantly connect and disconnect from one device to another (I keep the Bluetooth connected to my Firestick) And --- No ... I do not want to connect my echo dot to my Firestick.  They best fit my needs working independently. My only con,  there are times she has difficulty in understanding my word pronunciation or finding a song by lyrics ..... And sometimes... I could be the source of the problem. All of that being said.  I could  not be happier !!I simply Love  the Alexa enabled 3rd Generation Echo Dot !!! Yes  -- of course I would buy it again - and again !!!

Title: Needs better app connections & skills communication
Body: So I always have trouble getting Alexa to connect to Spotify, that's one thing; I have to open it on my phone in order to get it to play, and if I ask Alexa to just play something she won't pull from recent playlists on Spotify, she will search other music libraries, which makes it harder to play stuff I actually want to hear.For the skills, the commands to start skills are not sensible, and even if I ask Alexa to find a skill to provide a particular service, there isn't much luck. I have to search the app myself.Also, it is inconvenient that I can't ask Alexa specific questions, such as what the temperature is right at that moment, that could easily be searched online but instead Alexa just provides the default answer of that entire days outlook.

Title: This is NOT what I expected.
Body: My Echo recently died so I thought after seeing the dot on sale for Amazon Prime day I would give it a shot. BIG mistake, voice response is not as sensitive as my old echo and I can't see if there is a adjustment for it. But the WORSE is while listen to my Pandora station it skips to the next song in the middle of a song. If anyone has suggestions please let me know. I have Googled and went on support and all is useless. Now I know why it was half price on Prime day. Watta bummer.

Title: Alexa not ready for prime time
Body: Alexa is not very smart and can_ find any good music unless you pay for it. If any song is a little obscure you won_ find it. Asking Alexa questions is like talking to a dumb blonde. (Sorry Blondes. Blondes are smarter than Alexa). I mean blondes like Kelly Bundy. Sound quality is only okay if you plug it into another decent sound system. You can do that with an iPhone. I don_ see how this device becomes anything necessary since the smart tools can be controlled in better ways with a phone. Alexa is a little annoying Bitch!

Title: New family member
Body: We received our first unit as a gift from my daughter, and it has become a part of our lives.  From controlling lights to maintaining shopping list to answering questions on the fly and giving daily and weekly reminders.  We just ordered two more units.  Here is a suggestion Amazon if you ever review these, add an application to teach language.  A person could converse with the echo and it could give you words and phrases to say and check your pronunciation.

Title: Convenient and beautiful sound!
Body: It understands me perfectly when other devices in the past could not, or ever! Had it like a month now and finally found that it does have mistakes, no answers, or un comprehensive. I asked it to play Inuyasha season 3, it took me to some Ocean videos lol but still, it is getting smarter! And tho i never wanted to spend so much money on a little box that just sat there! But now doing so, i now understand the quality put into it for its beautiful speaker and sound! And is a more active Alexa than b4! Idk about the full price of it, but bought mine on sale and i must say, it was in fact worth my pay!

Title: Better Than I Imagined.
Body: Despite poo pooing the concept, when the Echo Dot had a super low price on Prime Day, I got one. Didn't really know what I'd use it for, but I thought, what the heck?It's replaced my radio, (i'd been looking for an additional Bose unit) because the sound is go great and I can find my channels. We now have Alexa turning on lights and fans, and particularly is helpful as she anwers my 94 year old mom's questions (over and over).How did I ever live without this?  I bought two more for other areas in the house.

Title: Nicer then the 2nd gen
Body: I have 7 of the 2nd gen and ordered this on prime day since it was a great deal.  I wasnt expect ng much but I have to admit the sound from it is day and night from the older ones.  Ill end up replacing all my older ones with the 3rd gens where they aren't wired direct or on BT to something.  If all your doing is replacing a 2nd gen that is voice control only then it might not be worth it.  The rebate on the ild ones isn't worth it so Ill prob use some of my old ones in the bathrooms and shed and under the eves on the patio.

Title: The jury is still out.....
Body: While I have no complaints...other than the sound seems to amplify the lower frequencies and not a lot of mid-to-upper range frequencies...I can't give this a solid 5 star rating.  It functions as expected, the price-to-value factor is satisfactory, and it has a lot of potential (allegedly), we have not found sufficient use for it yet.  Not disappointed, but certainly not amazed either.  I can get virtually the same from Siri on my Iphone.

Title: Good stuff.
Body: Works great, somewhat better sound than my gen 2 dot. Setup was an absolute breeze.  It cooperates nicely with the Echo Show in the very nearby kitchen, no voice conflicts, one always yields to the other based on things like which of them I_ closest to, or which has the necessary feature for carrying out the command.  Slightly better looking than the older model. Consistently hears me clearly.

Title: love it
Body: I have the big Alexa in my kitchen and got the little echo dot for my master bath...I have the switch hooked up to my hot water recirculator and I can tell echo to turn it on or off when I need it...also nice to be able to just say "echo, set an alarm for 6 am" and not have to actually set an alarm clock...also, play my music when I'm showering through my echo....so many great uses

Title: Almost returned it!
Body: I almost returned this to seller as I wasn't able to get it to connect to my wifi. After getting an error message from the app to scan I of course called the help line. I hung up on two of the Indonesia people I talked to as the first wanted me to purchase security software for my router. BS.. The second time I told them I was going to through it away and they hu g up on me and the third time i asked for someone who could speak English. He said there all busy but he did attempt to help me which led me to going to alexa.amazon.com and syncing it up there. After a few minutes of going through the links I got it to scan. Keep in mind I did restart my router before this but not sure if that had anything to do with fixing it. Anyway go to the link above and sign in with your amazon account and try that before the Alexa App on your phone. YOU WILL HAVE TO CONNECT YOUR WIFI ON YOUR COMPUTER TO Amazon Alexa Wifi. This is not permanent it's just to get your Alexa to connect on it's own. Kinda dumb and confusing. Don't expect Alexa to play Amazon music as it wont connect if it's not a paid service from what I gather. I have a free Pandora account which one can connect from the app then Alexa will let one play music from there once you give it permission to access your account. Plan on at least an hour to get the gist on how all this is done and once you get it working you'll feel pretty good about it and you'll be saying oh that so cool! That's cool too and so on. I'm about 30 feet away from mine in a bedroom and Alexa in the kitchen and she can hear my commands. The sound is pretty decent for such a small size hockey puck. You can get some free stuff such as woof woof for your dog and have a few giggle. (through the app.)Please don't contact me on how to connect it.

Title: Third generation is a must buy!
Body: Its bigger, and better then gen 1 and 2. I also own those. The speaker is on the sides so the sound is much louder. So much louder. Playing it at half is still louder then max of the other two. Gen 1 is louder then gen 2 but gen 3 is like a mini surround system. Great quality in the sound plus she has all the same features as the other two. This echo is heavier, and a bit larger. The wall charger is completely different also. A bit bigher plug then i was hoping for so I'll just be plugging it in the bottom socket. So happy I bought this. Especially since I got it on sale for just $25.00. If you already have the other generations set up this one is cake! My came ready to go and I just plughed it straight into the wall. Only had to link to my Everywhere group. I mainly use it for music but its great for games, weather, news, time, alarms, and grocery list when you cannot find a pen or paper.

Title: Loved the sound and variety of app integration
Body: No doubt, alexa is still leader in voice assistance. Enormous app integration.I have 3 google mini and 2 echo dot in home with dot being the latest addition and I am loving it. Google home is good in whatever they have integration with but still many apps are not supported by them. Echo devices deserve that extra thumb for it.

Title: Does not play well with Samsung a smart TV
Body: The product itself works great however it does NOT like my Samsung Smart tv. Once paired w tv it worked once & then audio went mute. This is a similar problem I am having w my new 4K fire stick. Once I unpaired it from my tv the audio work fine.  So buyer beware of amazon products & samsung products.When I called customer service they try to blame it on the tv or my WiFi connection & when u call tv service they blame it on WiFi or amazon.  It_ just not worth the headache for me & my try alternative non amazon products to replace them ex. Google chrome cast or google home.

Title: Great Toy
Body: I am very pleased with the Echo Dot 3rd Generation. I said that this was a great toy because other than making it simple to look up information on a phone or tablet. So far it has allowed us to be true couch potatoes since we can ask Alexa to turn on and off lights. My wallet prevents me from getting some of the products that work with Echo Dot/Alexa, but again the value isn't there for me.

Title: My first Echo, and ended up getting 4 more since.
Body: So I'll start off with a pretty quick disclaimer, I had been wanting to try these for a long time, and went in with my hopes very high for the ease of use and such. I was also very worried about certain things, like voice recognition and noise, and ease of connection.I've been very pleased so far.It picks up your voice incredibly easy, I've accidently had it pick me up on 2 of the devices at once, which we fixed by adjusting the location, not its fault. As well, it has trouble with some requests, but its fine once you figure out the commands it listens for.For such a small speaker, it projects very well and sounds great, Especially once you have them all play at once and the house is filled with music. I was impressed. And as well, the volume controls are easy to adjust as well.Currently on my setup I have 4 Echo Dots, a Echo Show 5, 2 LED Lightbulbs, and 5 smart plugs, and one air conditioner, and it recognizes and controls them all very well. Its been a great addition to make light and electronic control easy and smooth.Overall, I may update if there is any significant issues that come up, but nothing that I have noticed yet, and I'm very happy with my investment.

Title: Really Smart device
Body: This is my first virtual assistant Alexa device. The setup was very quick , easy and simple and did not see any issues. After completing the setup i tried to hook up to my smart enabled switch which works with Alexa that plugged to my TV.Alexa, turn on my tv in living room - Works perfectly !The only drawback i noticed is sound quality is not great compared with my google home. Also, the sound recognition is very sensitive. I was talking to my friends about this device and during the conversation, we were using "Alexa" word and this device turns on. Wow, it was recognizing the sound  clearly by any voice.We have made this device available to my kid to keep asking some questions, need to see how it fares up with my kid language :)

Title: I'm not remotely using this to it's full potential
Body: I have these in multiple rooms in the house, and the most they get used for generally is to turn lamps on and off.  My mother had back surgery and still has trouble getting around, so this and some smart plugs lets her turn the lights in her room on and off without having to actually get to the lamps, which is difficult for her still.  I use the one in the kitchen to listen to the radio when I'm cooking, and occasionally to set a timer.  I'm sure eventually I'll do more with them, but so far I'm really not using them to their full potential, and they're still well worth it.

Title: Product and Delivery
Body: When the Alexa is working, it actually works well. I use it for news, music, weather, alarm, and timer.I even order a second one during prime day. Yet, I am still waiting for my second one to be shipped to me.After several weeks, I have found that at times it does recognize what I am asking, so it just doesn't do anything. It occurs off and on, not all the time. Probably, like one day in a week. Wondering if I should consider cancelling my second order. I presume it will take another month to receive my second Alexa echo dot. By that time, I will know more and perhaps decide to return or keep the second one. I gave it a 4 star because besides the above it is overall a good product for the price.

Title: On the fence?
Body: If you are on the fence about getting this device I highly encourage you to get one. I got it thinking I wouldnt use it  very much. I got smart plugs and light bulbs in addition to this. I had surgery and this has been a lifesaver! She turns off and on my lights, my fan, reminds me to take certain medications, when I have appointments, wakes me up with lights on dimmed and with music! When I get lonely she also talks to me and tells me jokes. I use it WAY more than I expected to.

Title: Makes life better for elderly to call or get info..
Body: Bought this to add to existing base ... in elderly mother in laws bedroom.. we have them mainly so she can just say.. Alexa call........ and can contact friends or family.. she can_ see well enough to dial a phone and can_ remember numbers.. but gives her ability to call for pleasure or in emergency..we have base in living room and this one in bedroom ..so from anywhere they can hear her voice..

Title: Very Impressed
Body: I purchased a couple Echo Dots during the Prime Day deal and was so impressed with them that a bought another during a two-fer deal.The sound quality is surprisingly good so I use them most frequently for music, including asking for specific songs, that play quickly, from my Amazon Music Unlimited account.  It also integrates well with my Sirius-XM account and Tune-In.  The one trouble area is getting Echo to play specific radio stations as it has a difficult time decifering call letters.Taking it a step further, I purchased some smart plugs to work with my Echo Dots to quickly turn on various lights. I will say that I prefer using the TP-Link plugs over the Amazon brand however. This is strictly due to the fact that only the account holder can use the Amazon plugs in the Alexa App itself, while the TP-Link plugs can be made visible to your entire family in the app. I'll be checking out actual smart lights for the porch next.Overall, I'm very impressed with the Echo Dot.

Title: Not worth it. A piece a crap...still piss
Body: This is piece of device Is not worth it. I had this device I couple of days I had to reset ever since. I was on the online customer service for five dam hours trying to help me  Connect the device, they weren_ help at all, not one bit. So the next day he was helpful. But could not connect to all my tv. Apparently only one tv is the main tv which  sucks. Alexa comes on in the middle of the night which again sucks, you have to tell it shut down, thank God I don_ have sleeping baby the way I was yelling at a piece of device. Tonight I come home 8/16. Ask Alexa to play so @jazz, again having trouble connecting to the WiFi... this device _UCKS  big time thank god I didn_ pay a lot of money on it. Trying to reconnect with your WiFi is hell especially from your phone. Not happy about this piece of crap. Don_ buy this crap don_ believe the  hype . I am soooooo dam  disappointed in This product, I buy lots of this from amazon but this here crap, to dam piss. On this, they just need to send me another one without me sending this one back. I have never had so much trouble of setting up anything with WiFi.

Title: Keep it on mic disabled!!!
Body: So since I got my Dot I have pretty much kept it on mic disabled since Alexa responds and acts on conversations that did not include the "Alexa" prompt.  When it did responded, even to the "Alexa" prompt it responded in ways that made zero sense in terms of the context of the commands or conversations it over heard.It's too late to return this so it's mine.  The key feature I have been using this with is Amazon Music but ask it to play a certain genre and it won't play anything but the same six songs over and over and over again.The key integration I was expecting with this was home automation since the Ring Hub of my Ring Alarm (Ring is owned by Amazon) can now work as a Z-Wave hub.  However, the software still can't schedule anything yet so there is no point in moving my Z-Wave devices over to the Amazon infrastructure.  Who knows when Ring will deploy this feature?  It's been over two years as far as I can tell when the Ring community asked Ring to update the software to rotate a video feed from a Ring Doorbell 90 degrees.  This was needed in my case if I wanted to install a Ring Doorbell.  Thankfully, I was able to return the doorbell in time for a refund.I'm getting to the point of just putting the Echo Dot up on Let Go and see if anyone wants it.  It's already a sunk cost; maybe I can get some reimbursement.

Title: very happy with this my second unit
Body: considering the size and cost of this unit, (I bought during Amazon Prime days) it is an amazing piece of technology.  Sound is most impressive.  Since I also have a Sirus radio, which can now be integrated into Alexa  it is even more useful.  Highly recommend.  Should have bought  two during Prime days....... UPDATE:  received item 8/7...  Worked great until about a week ago when it started skipping portions of Amazon music being played, making the unit basically useless for music purposes. Customer service said it was  a problem at Amazon's end and they are working to update codes to fix.  Said others also having same problem and may take a few days to fix.... Maybe a week or more... I'll update upon completion.....UPDATE..9/20/19  Echo working fine now, whatever Amazon did seems to have taken care of my problem.  Appreciate the good support from Amazon customer service!

Title: Trouble with voice setup, but sounds great
Body: I have not been able to set up voice recognition with this unit.  It gets to the commands it wants you to repeat and then has trouble articulating them.  It stutters twice and then closes the interaction.  While you don't need this to recognize your voice to use it, it's a bit of a disappointment.One important thing though because there are a lot of negative reviews on the sound.  It sounds really good. It's the size of a hockey puck and I was very impressed with the quality of the sound that came out.  For a $25 speaker playing prime music, you'd be hard pressed to find something better.  If you are an audiophile, then perhaps you can tell the difference. For just listening to music and interacting with it, it's great.

Title: Better than the First Gen I have. Big improvement in sound
Body: I'm impressed with the bigger sound. I have three other First Generation Echos and two of them are plugged into bigger AV systems so they sound fabulous, but I had one over the kitchen sink. It's More to control various Smart Home devices and occasional news and weather than to play music. I have speakers in the kitchen already running from the living room system. I really bought it to replace That one, but the power brick is too big for the recessed outlet where a clock used to be and since it's a bit wider and fatter it also doesn't fit easily into the metal holder I have on the wall overhead. So I ended up putting it in the bedroom instead, but I still love it and I'm keeping it.

Title: Better audio output, poor voice recognition
Body: I use this mainly for music, news briefs, and weather reports in the bathroom. The audio quality and Max volume are definitely and upgrade over the 2nd gen Echo it replaced. The downside is that it doesn't hear me as well and I have to shout at it and repeat myself frequently, which was not the case with the old one - the second gen would hear me sometimes when I was two rooms away speaking to another device. And just today it crashed and stopped responding entirely while playing music, requiring a hard reboot.

Title: Bought as a gift for a friend - now I want one...
Body: I currently own the traditional echo dot 2nd generation. However, I purchased this newer one as a gift for a friend and I am extremely jealous. The sound quality is extremely improved, its visually appealing, and overall it seems to listen better than my echo 2nd gen. The only reason I don't purchase my own is that I bought a custom speaker to go with my original dot. Otherwise, the 3rd generation echo dot is fantastic. Definitely the way to go for a smart home integration system!

Title: Perfect for my studio
Body: I was looking for something that was hands-free that I could use in my painting studio... something to play music, recite the news, spit out my upcoming calendar and keep me entertained and engaged while working on my paintings. The Echo Dot has done that. Now I want one for my kitchen and the office and some accessories for turning lights on and off and perhaps a doorbell security system. I see a rabbit hole....

Title: Voices sounded muffled and too much bass
Body: Returned it. I use my Echo for primarily listening to guided sleep mediations for insomnia. I had the 2nd Gen Echo but wanted a clearer and louder speaker. I am disappointed in the 3rd Gen. The sounds are muffled and voices are garbled. I can turn it up louder but it just makes it worse. Too much bass.I actually have better quality sound from my Iphone. Maybe I got a defective dot. Not impressed.

Title: Definitely recommend
Body: I actually am a big fan of this product. I already had an Echo in my main living space and this was a great addition to have in my bedroom. At night I love being able to set alarms I forgot to set without opening my eyes, or ask Alexa to remind me of something...two things that used to make me get up. Also I have a smart light connected in my bedroom and it_ wonderful to have the ability to shut it off as I_ going to bed with voice commands. I play all my podcasts from it, so it_ given me to ability to have my phone far away from me when I try to go to sleep! The only negative is I wish the volume options were a little more customizable. Sometimes I want to go 3 1/2! Haha

Title: Wish it would work with Pandora
Body: We got this as a gift, and it's actually much cooler than I thought it would be.  Most people don't need one of these, but it's fun and novel.... a fun luxury item.  Alexa understands us very well,  much better than any other voice recognition I've used.  It does a lot of useful things, as well as fun things.  We have not been able to get it to work with my husband's Pandora account,  is my only complaint.

Title: Great little Speaker
Body: Alexa is the main reason I got an echo dot which works way better than Siri on my HomePod. She actually recognizes my transcriptions. After I adjusted my privacy settings I felt more secure about the transcription reviews. Don_ expect the echo to completely blow out of the water sound wise however it has a good sound for the size of the speaker. You can also connect it to other echo speakers as well which would provide a more powerful sound. I have bought a second to run some of my smart stuff in the house and I find it super convenient and the price wasn_ bad either.

Title: Amazon following apple's path...
