Body: Seconds update: (you can read my first at the end)Ok, I've tried the other major brand that dispute this world with Alexa, and I'm back, when I start the Google Mini I have the impression that it's very clever, he setup everything alone, I mean, wifi, but when you try to hear have nothing to compare, another flaw of the competition is the "chains" stupid chains, same as Alexa, the competition dont allow you to hear YouTube on multiroom, what they can but I guess need to impulse the sells of the other product like Chrome Cast, stupid things that make some users give up, but as I mention, the mini sounds like Echo 2nd gen and after hear the 3rd you really don't want to go back, and in this case I'll suck it up the inability of use multiroom with bluetooth because, like I've said, is kinda impossible you listen the 3rd and go back to how sounds the 2nd.I'm with Echo Dot since 2014, for the record, integrated with smartthings and harmony devices.Seriously,  I can't use multiroom music from my bluetooth device? Such a shame, I was thinking buy more 10 echo dots plus echo sub and echo plus but now, I'm considering send all back, YouTube,  okay, Google and Amazon dont talk each other, but bluetooth? I still not believe in that, I love how echo dot 3rd gen sounds but will be a piece of paper to me if I can't play my phone music on that, I mean, multiroom, so that's it, let's try out Google mini and see if they allow me play my bluetooth sounds as I want, also, I give up of Amazon music (such a good service) because the inability of upload my music wich I found comfort on Google play music, from my point of view, at these days that we are, you fault is inadmissible on two aspects wich makes the other brand more reliable,  so sad, because I love Alexa since the launch,  and I'm faithful since 2014, but like you following the apple paths, leaving thech behind I think is the time to change!!!

Title: Amazon Echo Dot is a great purchase
Body: Here are the positives regarding the Echo Dot:  1. My wife has found that song quiz and National Geographic geo-quiz are her favorite games on the Echo device.  Nice that the device has built in game functionality.  2. The ability to have Alexa turn home lights on or off is a nice feature.  3. The ability to have Alexa integrate with home alarm system is another positive.  4.  Having the Amazon Echo Dot play music or news upon request is great.  5.  The sound quality of the Amazon Echo Dot 3rd Generation is excellent!  6.  The Echo Dot is also a great price!  We got both of ours for $24.99 a piece, a no brainer for anyone looking to buy one.As far as negatives, I don_ have have any negative info to provide.  My wife and I have had our Amazon Dots for about a month now and really enjoy them.  They are easy to setup and when I programmed in my work address it is nice to say, _lexa, how is the traffic to work? right before I step out the door to leave.  Alexa proceeds to tell me if the route to work is clear or if there are issues.

Title: An amazing home assistant once you become accustomed to using it
Body: I was surprised at the ease of setup and how well it understands English spoken by anyone in range.  The speaker sound quality is surprisingly good.It took a while to become accustomed to asking Alexa for information.I suggest that the next generation of Alexa consider integrating a two-step or follow-up process when step 1 isn't successful.  For example...Today: Me: "Alexa, define enteric." Alexa: "Hmmm, I don't know that word."Future: Me: "Alexa, define enteric." Alexa: "Can you help me by trying to spell some of it?" Me: "Sure, E N T E R..."  Alexa: "Thanks, got it. The top definitions of enteric are..."

Title: A good companion!
Body: I don't have Amazon Prime, so that automatically prevents me from accessing certain "features," but this is still a welcome addition, almost like having another person around.  She (Alexa) might not know everything, but she'll let you know if she doesn't understand or just doesn't know something.  I play games with her and ask her questions, have her set alarms, watch the house when I'm gone, give me weather and scores, play music, and so much more.  For the price I paid fo the Echo Dot on Prime Day, Alexa has already returned that price to me several times over.

Title: Alexa Can Be Quite Annoying....
Body: I DEFINITELY like using only one word activation, "Alexa", in lieu of Google's "Ok Google" or "Hey Google"...... VERY ANNOYING !!!So therefore, I find myself using Alexa more for that very reason.BUTT........ she is for some reason, not NEARLY as smart when asking a question, and answering, as my Google is..... VERY ANNOYING !!!And seven microphones or not, I do not understand why she is NOT hearing me at times, with no other noise going on, AND at the same volume as I would JUST have asked something else.No matter what I do, I also cannot connect stereo sound, though they are both paired together, to listen in stereo to certain music streaming, or music on my phone...... VERY ANNOYING !!!I have yet to start really using skills, so I cannot speak much on them.I do however want to "Drop In", and yet it always tells me I have to give it permission, or activate, yet doing everything it says do, I can NOT find the option where it says to look for it....... VERY ANNOYING !!!So as it stands, I for now, must use BOTH, when I prefer to have just one type of A.I. smart system.

Title: Great, practical, fun device.
Body: Purchased on sale, a bargain, practical "toy" that you just have to get. The sound on the 3rd generation Echo Dot is a significant improvement over the 2nd generation. Have a 2nd generation unit that was connected via Bluetooth to a large speaker. It helped the 2nd generation unit significantly. I found the 3rd generation unit performs just as well on its own without the Bluetooth speaker (freeing up my Bluetooth speaker for other use.) All other functionality is basically the same on any Echo device that does not have its own screen.

Title: INCREDIBLE  LIFE SAVER FOR AGING PEOPLE
Body: This is AWESOME for my 93 yr old mother. She has very low vision (macular degeneration for 10 years) and a little dementia. Although she first resisted this _obot in her apartment, she has embraced it a short 2 weeks or so later. Alexa now responds to mom_ _hank you, Alexa with appropriate comments, such as:  you_e welcome, or glad to help, etc. Alexa LEARNED to do this!!  There has been a learning curve, and Alexa speaks way too fast (as noted in many comments) which has been changed (8/6 or 7/2019, thanks for listening, amazon).  Especially too fast for older ears. It appears you MAY have to tell her to speed up or slow down for each time she talks. Also , it APPEARS I cannot do this on the app as a _etting.  THIS NEEDS TO BE AN ACROSS THE BOARD adjustment (not time to time) AND it Must be Adjustable from the APP. MY reason for 4 stars on sound quality is due to these comments. The actual quality of the sound seems fine. Not 100%, but fine. Bottom line: Alexa has SAVED MY LIFE and GREATLY ENHANCED my mom_ quality of life. I_e just bought Echo Connect. Hoping Connect will allow her to use her tv without having the ability to SEE the buttons.

Title: Very satisified.
Body: The Echo dot is well worth the money.  It performs flawlessly and is easy to set up.  It has had no problems understanding  my commands.  The dot works with android, iPhone, and Fire tablets and phones.  I have an iPhone 6, works perfectly.  Also works with my 10" and 8" Fire tablets.  Setting up new devices is fairly easy.  Alexa takes you through the procedure step by step.  Would recommend.  I had the original Alexa.  The dot works just as well for a lot less money."

Title: Pretty good logic, but not quite there
Body: We got this on Prime day to see if they're worth the hype. I also wanted a way for my toddler to be able to call someone if there is an emergency. Mostly we use Alexa to play music. Occasionally I ask about weather or traffic. We've tried to ask when certain stores or restaurants are open but she can't always locate them. I'm giving 4 stars because I can't talk to her like I talk to Google and get results. Overall it's a nice little speaker to talk to, with some helpful information.

Title: "What song is this?"
Body: For a small speaker it sounds pretty good. The only complaint I have has to do with how the Echo and Dot can't seem to coordinate how to handle audio as a pair. When music played in both devices the system holds onto the last song's information BEFORE the group is aked to play no matter how many songs are played through a group. You can ask for a particular song and that song will play but if you then ask Alexa what song is playing the response will always be the song title last played on a single device.

Title: Good for weather, music
Body: Alexa responds to voice commands is good for asking simple questions weather time temperature does integrate easily with Kindle and fire stick however Alexa lacks a lot of skills that my Google Assistant can do very nicely unable to make phone calls access reminders etc I'm sure things will improve since I only paid $12 because if a prime special and a gift card I really can't complain I got my money's worth.

Title: Great sound. Doesn't always "get it right"
Body: The white color looks great in the kitchen. The design is nice; contemporary, compact and has a soft look. It has wonderful sound for playing music. As for the voice recognition, it does not always get it right. It integrates well with Music streaming services though, and it makes listening to my favorite Radio stations in the morning easy.

Title: Quality speaker and satisfactory assistant
Body: I finally had enough time to play with this to give a quality review.I am new to the world of Alexa. Most of my house is filled with google IOT merchandise.Voice recognitionThe voice recognition is good but not great. It_ reliable for most everyday tasks.Call capabilityIs an incredible feature. I have been out of the country since my purchase and haven_ been able to use it on my own device.SoundThe quality is amazing for the size of the speaker. I don_ love that the volume settings are only 1-10. I like to set my volumes by percentage... idk I_ weird but I prefer that to the numbers of Alexa. However at a 6, I_ able to hear the music well over my shower or in an adjoining room.SetupThe setup was much easier than most other IOT products. I would almost give it a 5/5 just for that. I was surprised at how easy setup was after trying to setup my fire stick (night and day difference)While I_ not sure the quality is different enough for me to switch over.. I_ glad I splurged the $25 when it was on sale to try it out.I want to see IOT get a lot bigger.... so I definitely support what amazon is doing.Let me know if this was helpful.

Title: Compared to echo gen 1, it's MILES better!
Body: I use my Echo Dot primarily while I'm in the shower to check the time, weather, and play trivia games like Jeopardy. Echo gen 1, I felt the volume wasn't quite loud enough or clear enough to understand all the words in the trivia questions. I usually had to have it repeated once or twice. This Echo, it's not a problem! Maybe one repeat per 12 questions. Also, this Echo's understanding of my answer is WAY BETTER! Over 30 days of usage, I think she misunderstood me once or twice, playing every day. I know there are bigger problems in the world, but it was still frustrating to know the right answer, only to get it wrong because she thought I said something else. I would recommend this gen Echo 100% :)Also, my 9 year old son listens to Prime music while he is in the shower. I asked him if he thinks this generation is better, and I got a resounding YAASSSSS!I  hope this helps anyone thinking of upgrading!

Title: Great when it actually works
Body: Stopped playing music from any of my 5 linked accounts. I did a factory reset, linked and unlinked the accounts and the echo Dot still says "I'm having trouble playing music". It's been two weeks and still no fix, I might have to switch to Google ___. *Update* Customer service called and pointed me to "Technical Support" which then proceeded to troubleshoot and perform everything I had previously done. Then one of the agents left the chat and another joined, had to wait for that agent to get up to speed to what we were doing. I did another factory reset and tried everything the agent suggested. Long story short, my device is no longer under warranty and they can only offer 15% discount on a new one since all troubleshooting has been done and they have no clue what is wrong with the device.

Title: Alexa. Is pretty cool. ..
Body: I'm so happy that we made this purchase. I'm still learning what (she) can do. The initial hook up wad a little complicated for me. But after a while I was ablessed to hook it up to the stereo and tv. And now I can turn it on with a voice command. My 5 year old grandgranddaughter loves (her). And I've actually learned of more skills that alexa can do. From her. Such as ..Have a conversation. My only negative hit on this product is that on our 2nd night. We played a song from amazon prime music. That was pretty loud. And we didn't know how to stop the song. So alexa ended up getting the speaker popped and has a crackle every time (she) speaks. I'm hoping amazon can help me with this. Overall I highly recommend this product. I want more._. .lol

Title: Convenient and useful
Body: I bought this because the radio in the kitchen was getting difficult to reach due to back problems.  Now, simple voice commands get me the radio station or information I want.  I had problems setting it up using my phone and my tablet, but the laptop worked well.  It does not always give you what you want, however.  I asked it to play "Who's on first?" and it started playing some odd music and then offered me an Audible subscription.  After I said "no," it played one of the intros to my request, but stopped after three seconds.  I'll try again.Other than that, I consider it a good investment.

Title: Stops responding - Doesn't Work With Pandora
Body: The Echo Dot intermittently stops responding to commands. It also stops playing Pandora in the middle of songs on a regular basis (1-3 times every 5 minutes). Customer service tells me that their technical support people have been working on the Pandora problem for a long time and have not been able to fix the problem. For me, the Echo has turned out to be a waste of money.

Title: You need Alexa in your life
Body: The dots seem to hear me better than my echo show. The sound quality isn_ the best if you want to play your music loud but for usual everyday conversation with her it_ perfect. I have one in every bedroom of my house and in the living room. Definitely a helpful gadget to have and all the different apps and stuff available now are a lot of fun. Amazon even sends me periodic emails about new stuff Alexa can do so there_ always something new to try.

Title: It_ a fun item
Body: This is my first experience with an echo type device and I like it. I_ not so tech savvy that I can automate my entire home, but Alexa has her value. She is a great quick source of information like the weather, which NFL teams are playing, what certain terms mean, and so forth. Alexa also has a bit of humor in her AI whining find refreshing. I_e read the stories about hackers listening in but the echo can be turned off thus eliminating this potential threat.

Title: Something to Think About
Body: Alexa technology is great as well all know who have seen one. You can play music in the nursery by saying " Alexa play ambient music". You can set a reminder, you can use it as an alarm clock, you can leave love messages for your partner when you aren't home, and you can ask her questions rather than logging in to ask google or siri a question HOWEVER you should be weary of this technology... she's always listening recording conversations in your home and uploading it to a cloud database. She is a machine with too much power over your life. Locking your doors, turning on lights, computers, and other electronics in your home. I don't know about your concerns about government intrusions but do your research before buying one and bringing one of these into your home. If you already have one unplug her when not in use.

Title: Unpredictable
Body: I mostly listen to talk radio, and that's working well on this device. I also use it as an alarm and a timer. Thumbs up on those.HOWEVER, the ambient noise function for sleep is terrible! I actually prefer brown noise, and it starts off great. But then, it shuts off after less than an hour, no matter how long I set it for. Telling it to loop worked once or twice, then never again. I read that telling it to set timer for X amount of hours would work. And it did...ONCE. Last time I used it, it shut off after 20 - 30 minutes, and I told it to reset 8 times! Anyone who sleeps with ambient noise knows that it interrupts sleep if it stops. My research on how to solve that problem showed many other such complaints. So annoying!Also, Alexa subscribed me to the monthly Amazon Music subscription without my permission. Thank God I caught it soon after it happened. Customer service canceled it and told me how to disable it.I'd actually give it 3.5 stars for these reasons, but that isn't one of the optiions, so I gave it a 3. Fix the ambient noise option and I will give it 4.5 stars!

Title: Improved since the last generation
Body: I bought this dot to sit in a small food trailer. The last generation dot had a very tin can sound to it. This next generation is a great improvement. It doesn't have the quality of an Echo, but it really is a pretty acceptable small speaker. The quality of the speaker, in general, has improved. The last generation seemed to be made of cheap plastic. Still plastic, but much improved in the quality and appearance. Great for audiobooks and background music.

Title: Amazing
Body: I love this speaker so much.  I debated getting one for well over a year but now that I have it, Alexa is one of my favorite things in the house.  Very helpful, especially with things like reminders and alarms.  I got this as a Prime Day deal so it was much cheaper than normal.  The only thing I don't like is that it's white-ish in color.  I really wanted a black one but when I went to order it the black was all sold out apparently so this was my only option.  Honestly, that's my only issue with it at all is that I wish it was the black model, but I'm ok with this one for sure.

Title: Very useful!  Installed easily!
Body: At least the two Echo Dots I bought recognize my wifi.  They were easy to set up, and I am loving Alexa's list making.  What a help!  And I don't have to bother looking up and reading any notifications.  She reminds me by her green light and reads them to me.  Part of that includes letting me know about the Amazon shipments I am getting that day, and again when it has arrived.  Great product !  Now if I can just get the Ring 2 doorbell to work with Alexa....guess I will try again tomorrow.

Title: Very pleased
Body: I received a 2nd generation Echo device as a gift and decided to get an updated one. This one has better sound quality than the previous one and is ideal for listening to music. I have this one in the living room and use It throughout the day for reminders, timers, music, games, and more. I put the other one n my bedroom and use it to listen to sleep sounds and for the alarm, mostly. I_e been trying to get multi room music to work for me but it is frustrating. Overall, I love the Echo device and am glad I bought it.

Title: Beware of refurbish echo dot 3rd gen
Body: I finally got an echo dot 3rd gen that is working great.  The 2 previous dot gens stopped working in lest that 2 weeks. I ordered the echo show 2nd gen and echo dot 3rd gen in July during the sale days. The first one broke down after 2 weeks. I got a replacement in a timely manner, next day. After one day the second one broke wouldn't work, wouldn't respond to commands and the light  would randomly change colors.I had some suspicions about the dots. I spoke to a supervisor and asked if the dots were refurbished, I was told yes.  The supervisor said another one would be sent out next day. I asked if it would be a refurbish one, supervisor said it could be and there was no  way to know if I would get a new one.The supervisor suggested I buy a new one to ensure I would not get a refurbish one.  I had to buy it, but would be reimbursed.There must be some quality control problems on so-called certified refurnish products.Be sure to asked if you ever have to return a new purchase, will it be a new one or refurbish.

Title: My husbands shot reminder
Body: There are so many good things I can review about our Echo dot.  We enjoy listening to the music we request, if we are stuck on trying to figure a question that is asked of us, Alexa knows.  If we need to know what the weather will be we just ask Alexa.  The most important feature is the reminder.  My husband is a diabetic and has to have 2 shots a day.  He always remembers the morning shot but forgets the evening.  With peace of mind Alexa reminds us every day at five that it_ my husbands time for his shot.

Title: Convenient to have..
Body: I like having Alexa in my kitchen ask her anything and she tries her best to answer you. I mainly listen to music of my time just call out a song and she will try to find it also get Amazon music it gives you a better selection Don't know about her listening to every word we say and logging that but who cares.. the end days are here and you can't stop what's about to happen..

Title: Seems like a good choice so far
Body: I_l admit it, this was an impulse buy. But once I downloaded the correct app (make sure not to get anything other than the Amazon Alexa App) the setup was easy and took very little time. So far so good, and I may start integrating other things to the device very soon. It_ living up to its reputation and I look forward to seeing how I up using it.

Title: Great for the Absent-Minded! Changed my life!
Body: It sounds wierd to say Alexa/Echo Dot changed my life, but let me tell you how it has helped.I am absent-minded, and I have no sense of the passage of time.  Quite often I'd forget to start dinner until 7PM, and since I am on a special diet, that meant eating later than optimal.  I also take medication several times a day.  Add to that how the day can simply get away from me, and I was feeling frustrated with myself! I had no one to blame but myself, but the thing was -- blame wasn't helping!  So I got a dot.  I started putting in reminders for meds, for starting dinner, for remembering to switch the laundry to the dryer.  I got more done, and it helped me not get into negative self-talk/self-recrimination for my forgetfullness.  If I had to stop mid-task, I told Alexa to tell me in 5 minutes.  I used to really get off track if I went to the bathroom and forgot what I was doing before that.  Well, now things flow better. I dont get annoyed with myself, I just fix the reminders!  I don't use alarms anymore with their blaring noise -- if you are a forgetful or absent-minded person like me, an alarm is an annoying noise and youo still might not remember what it is FOR.  Alexa just tells me.  I am also free of the million-zillion post-it notes and the lists that always seemed to be in the wrong room.  Alexa keeps all my lists, and can read them to me.  I set up Google calendar, let Alexa have access and now she also can remind me what events are coming up --- be that doctors or social events.  Finally I have a flow to my day that isnt disrupted if I chase down some internet research topic or read a little longer than planned.  Alexa helps me keep things from falling off my radar, and I dont have to use a form of mild shame to motivate myself.I wish I had tried it much sooner.  My husband was so amazed, he bought the 2nd one for me!  He now enjoys having Alexa play sports talk radio and news, and fun stuff like jeapardy questions.  I've started to listen to audiobooks more and my imagination is soaring.  Alexa is a great addition to my life, the personal assistant I needed!

Title: Big punch in a little package
Body: First off, I'm extremely impressed with the new gen 3 echo dot. I was gifted the Gen 1 years ago (which I still use), however, was lucky enough to receive two gen 3 eco dots as promotional _ifts? during other Ring security device purchases.Initially, I was not impressed, considering the gen 1 I already owned was kind of garbage. However, planned to use the g3 as a doorbell chime speaker. Nice amazon offer considering Ring doorbells aren_ compatible with nearly any other preexisting products; also had zero intention on spending at least $60 more to be alerted if someone was at the door..Pros: The speakers on the G3 are extremely impressive, blows my gen 1 out of the water. The ever-growing list of compatible devices are a surprising fun bonus (i-robot, nest, ring, Samsung anything, xbox, Philips, random water and electric companies etc.). The voice recognition is better than my gen 1 for whatever reason. For example, asking random questions (what's the weather) the Gen 3 will respond/understand, gen 1 (will either completely misinterpret what I said and or doesn_ know the answer).  When you download the Alexa app on a mobile, you can also connect to eco remotely, obviously for when you need to play some music for your dogs during your absence.I'm not sure why there's such inconsistency between the (gen 1 and gen 3), both up to date and on the same network etc.Cons: inconsistencies with the different gen_ software responses, makes me question how other echo devices will function and for how long. My experience with attempting to add and use the _kills (essentially apps you need to download to pair with Alexa compatible devices), was pretty bad and extremely frustrating. When I initially was trying to set up the _ing skill, they showed bound but not communicating., was directed to Ring pairing directions on Amazon, those directions said to go to the Ring website which included instructions for how to pair with Alexa/echo, i.e. back again to the Amazon directions site I conveniently just came from, wash and repeat.Take away: This is a great device and you should probably buy it.

Title: Easy to set up.
Body: I love my echo.  I use it to turn my bedroom light on and off, listen to music and other miscellaneous things.  Each night I read and when I get ready to turn my light off, I purchased the smart plug to do this, and I don't have to climb out of bed to do that.  Just tell Alexa to do it and it's done.  The sound is great and clear.  I can't compare it to earlier versions because this is the first one I have had.  Call it lazy, but when you have bad knees and feet this is a lifesaver.  My granddaughter loves to ask it questions and hear the answers she will give you.  I done a lot of reviewing and studying before making my purchase but I am so glad I did buy it.

Title: Fun for the whole family!
Body: Easy to set up if you have experience with pairing devices and using your cell phone e.g Amazon Alexa and Smart Life.  Fun for the whole family!  I was shocked at the amount of cool features the echo dot with Alexa has!  The trivia games are great fun to bring everyone together and I would have to say my favorite feature, being in a large home, is the ability to broadcast messages to any echo dot that is connected to your home network.  The echo dot with Alexa is a great feature to our home and it is kid friendly.  My daughter asks Alexa to play, "Jesus loves me" every morning.  I will definitely be buying a few more echo dots to fill other rooms in the home.  Nice sounding speaker even at max volume, Good voice recognition, and a great number of different options and ability this little device has to offer.  Good buy!

Title: I have tried numerous Echo devises and none have worked well.
Body: This was my last ditch effort trying Echo devices. This one heard me wrong often and had a lot of trouble connecting to the latest Samsung soundbar. The biggest downfall was it kept loosing the Wifi signal. I have been using the similar Google device for a month or so now and sorry to say it works much better.

Title: Stopped working around 6 month mark
Body: Be aware this item only has a 90 day warranty. Nothing out of the ordinary with it's usage and well equipped to handle basic IT troubleshooting. My device was defective after the warranty ended but within 6 months of usage. Connected to internet just fine, power fine, but zero sound coming out of the speaker. Completely useless. Invest in something better.**EditAmazon was able to help me purchase a new device (making an exception to their 90 day warranty) and this time I did purchase the $8 extended care package. I still am wary of the quality of the product. You have to spend $8 extra to protect your $30 purchase. Oh well.For something so cheap you'd think Amazon would be more willing to swap out lemons, but I got little to no help from customer service. The most basic troubleshooting that is null/void on a defective device. 90 days is all you get and then the support stops there.

Title: A MUST have in our home!
Body: Every since purchasing our first echo dot, it has become a must have in our home. This device will make your life easier. One of my favorite things about the echo, (aside from being able to control almost everything in my home..with just a single voice command.) is being able to tell Alexa what to put on my grocery list. She will immediately send your list to your Alexa app. Another very handy feature, is the guard feature. Alexa will guard your home and send you an instant notification if it hears any glass breaking, fire alarms, etc.. you can check in on your home with just a click of a button. If your purchasing an echo dot, I definitely recommend buying a few smart plugs. They are well worth the money spent. They allow you to control devices from the alexa app, that aren_ smart devices. I definitely recommend this product. I bought the sandstone colored one, and it looks incredible in my home.

Title: Aux Out Only - Useless for me
Body: This is an excellent device for using as a smart speaker, but I wanted to use it in my classroom as a speaker for my projector/laptop. I purchased this device because I am very impressed by the quality of my other Echo speaker at home, and I wanted a smaller version for my classroom. When I hooked it up with the auxiliary cable... nothing. Since there were students waiting, I tried a couple of other things to no avail; but finally just gave up and brought it home to investigate further. After nearly an hour searching videos on YouTube, reading articles online, and 30 minutes with Amazon customer service over the phone; it turns out that only the Echo Dot 2nd Gen has the capability to have Aux In. The Aux port on the 3rd Gen (which I have) only has the option for Aux Out. Great speaker, but totally defeated the purpose of my purchase. I'm sure it says somewhere that this is a feature, but I have used my other Echo device in the same way and it worked. You know what they say about assumptions...

Title: Great product and sound
Body: We use this every day. Sound is great and voice recognition works as expected.  If you have 2 devices nearby you can rename the echo dot to "Echo" or "Computer" rather than "Alexa" to wake it up. Nice feature.  Integrates fairly well with our Sonos One although the devices get confused when streaming Amazon music. i.e. I tell Alexa on my Sonos to "play songs by..." and it will play a song then stop.  I have to go to the app, tell it to stream on a particular device/room then it does it's thing.  I also haven't figure out yet how to add my Sonos and Echo Dot to play the same station (i.e. can't assign them to a room).  Great product overall but doesn't play well with others :)

Title: Fascinating device!
Body: We received this as a gift and are just now beginning to appreciate some of its many functions.  We plan to buy some smart lights and cameras.  Right now, we are just playing with it.  But it's an extremely useful device.  I wish the speaker was a little bit better, but it can be integrated with a better sound system.  I'm playing music from my phone through it at it works great!

Title: Excellent Addition to our Household
Body: I live in a townhouse with an open  kitchen/living room area. We keep Alexa hanging from a wallmount (highly recommended to minimize wires and space) in the living room. I love that I can tell her to add things to different "lists" I've created while I'm cooking, straightening up, watching TV, etc. Super convenient to then access my lists (grocery store, dollar store, pet store, etc) when I'm out and about. Much easier than keeping track of all the scraps of paper I used to carry around in my purse.I know about the privacy concerns and couldn't care less. If someone is listening in on my conversations, then I feel sorry for them. I know my life is boring, so to listen in on my boring life must be just painful.Downside: My husband and I have been spooked more than once. When talking, she'll butt in our conversation with some pretty creepy comments - even when we haven't said a word that even slightly resembles her name. More than a little disturbing. But hey, we're living in a sci-fi book now, so there's bound to be some troubles, right?

Title: Alexa is Great and so is Echo Dot (Update 8-23-19)
Body: Tech Support reached out with a helpful email. I tried a couple of the options and Echo Dot is working much better now. I had too close to a wall and noisy fan. Amazon support is amazing. I highly recommend the Alexa and echo dot too. The below is what I wrote and it's no longer an issue. Thanks tech support!Alexa is great by itself, but since I purchased Echo Dot to pair with my original Alexa, I find myself shouting and still not getting a response. Eventually there is a response, but without the dot it was on the first attempt. One positive is having the additional sound. I will not be buying for other rooms. I'm glad that I did not pay full price.

Title: Gen 1 Echo dot was better...
Body: This may look like a nicer cooler generation 1 echo dot but be warned... with the better-looking dot you lose out on it being able to understand you and hear you.  My first echo was able to hear me whisper in the downstairs bathroom when it was upstairs in my bedroom, this new one I have to almost yell at it from less than 3 feet away... Very disappointed in this product.

Title: We_e happy, using it like a fancy clock radio.
Body: We bought it on a very good sale for our boys room. They_e thrilled with it. For our purposes, it_ a glorified version of the alarm clock/ radio that I got excited about when I was their age. It has great sound for a bedroom- but I_ not super picky. We like how you can program it to say reminders at different times, or I can call it from my phone anywhere. The boys like the jokes and puns- we do have Amazon music- so that makes it better. It was surprising the first time they reported the weather, all official sounding over breakfast.:)

Title: Great products with great interface regardless of the device you're using
Body: I love that we can use the voice activation to tell Alexa to find stuff for us I love that if she really doesn't know the answer or can't determine what I'm asking she tells me that I love that she can tell me jokes or have other people tell me jokes I love that she can choose from vast variety of music I love that my son my father-in-law and ask and I'll use it to this matter what age I love that we are all user-friendly with her I love the interfacing the ability to use it with all of our devices and rtb our phones Kindles everything else just a great overall product sometimes the Time saver when I visit you as something else I can ask you to hunt down things I need to know

Title: 90 Day Warranty, that's it
Body: We love the convenience of AI in the house just not having to replace them frequently. Quality standards only justify they stand behind there product for 90 days.  That's disappointing.  We have a handful of Alexa devices and have learned not to expect a great deal when it comes to these dots.  Pretty poor sound and ours can't be used above 4 or 5 on volume setting, sound is distorted and crackling.  They gave us $10 credit and 15% off next Dot purchase.  Gonna buy some tp.

Title: Is Five Enough?
Body: We now have five Amazon Dots throughout the house, not counting the ones that belong to the kids.  Not all are 3rd Gens (yet), I updated three with the new 3rd Gen. because the sound quality is so much better and I love the convenience of listening to my playlists and books on them.  I think they also respond better.  I am so spoiled by the benefits and features of this technology that I would hate to go back to life without it.I start my day with a "good morning" to Alexa, which in turn usually gifts me with a laugh and/or a bit of trivia.  After providing me with the weather and a little news I usually request a playlist to enjoy during the rest of my morning routine.  My dots remind me of my appointments, to take the trash cans down to the street, to take my medication, and to pickup after the dogs before the yard service arrives. (these messages will also display on my cell phone and tablets)  At the end of the day, after I'm in bed, I look forward to having "Alexa" turn my fan on and my light off.  Then "Alexa," on one of my new 3rd Gens, plays my "bedtime" playlist until I fall asleep.P.S. I'm 70 years old and wish the Amazon Dot would have been around 50 years ago.

Title: Love it!
Body: A fantastic gadget that has improved my organisation. Synced with my calendar events and reminders in the Alexa app, I never miss an appointment. I bought it as a but if fun, but it has turned out to be a great little hub in the family. Morning times are great listening to some coffee time jazz over breakfast. What a great way to start the day! Then Alexa dampens my day by announcing that it_ going to rain! Haha! If you can get past the initial set up and syncing with other devices, then your home and dry. It can be very tricky to start with, but remember this piece of kit is growing technology so don_ expect it to start baking cakes for you just yet? What it will give is, lots of great music, endless information, home management, and a naff joke here and there. A must have gadget and a great piece of tech.

Title: Having Alexa Changed My Mind
Body: I was against any use of Alexa because of all the negative issues with Amazon listening and other such complaints. I felt the Alexa was just another typical digital device that would be added to all my other digital junk collected over the years. My wife purchased the unit over my objections and one for her mother also.However, after a time having the device in my home and with all the features Alexa offers and commands she recognizes I don't know how I got along without her.  I had my doubts at first but no longer.  I am very satisfied with Alexa and I would honestly miss having her. Please note that this not an attempt to get you to buy one. It's just my honest take on the question ask of me on of what I think of Alexa now that I have one..

Title: keep beeping even when mic is turned off; not smart enough
Body: Cons:1. There is the short beep sound once in a while. I thought it is waked accidentally by my voice or something. But the beep is still there when mic is manually turned off. It beeps during the night, creepy.2. Not smart enough. For example, when I say "play a song", it starts playing whatever is left off on spotify. I sometimes listen to a podcast on Spotify, it just continues playing the podcast! Come on, that is not a song!3. The alexa app is really slow ands stupid. For example, the settings page always return to top when you click return. Also not able to change to a male voice, not able to change the tone or the speed of alexa vioce. Comparing to the google home mini I have at home, this app is a piece of sh*t.. Every click I make somewhere in the app, I have to wait about half a second to a second. (iPhone Xs, latest iOS). Come on, amazon iOS developers, you can do much better than this.4. some other small things I couldn't remember now.Pros:1. skills alexa can learn, like integrate with many news sources, even though it is not many though.

Title: Enjoy The Echo Dot
Body: One thing I dislike is that the first app I found by searching the App Store turned out to be the wrong app. But I couldn't set up the Echo Dot until I committed to one of their payment plans. The lowest level was a trial period of 3 days, then $12.99 a month. The next level was $29.95 for a year, which I selected. But then I still couldn't get the Echo synced with the Firestick, or even to reply to commands. I didn't realize, my wife already had the correct app because she was already set up with another Echo we purchased a while back. When I realized the app doesn't cost anything I felt like I had been mislead.Other than that, we enjoy having our second Echo Dot.

Title: Watch out for scam iphone apps for alexa!!
Body: This is a great smart speaker with great sound. The quality is better than google home mini. I have 2 google smart speakers (1 regular, 1 mini) and I have been happy with them, but I wanted the guard and burglar deterrent features which google so far does not have. I believe setting up various music applications (spotify, tunein, pandora) is easier on the echo dot. Right now these miracle workers are on sale for $29 which is quite a bargain and I would recommend them to all technophiles. Watch out for iphone apps to set this device up (Setting Up Alexa, etc.) -- some are demanding money and don't add anything to the device. Amazon should not allow these apps to be sold on Apple store (don't know if they exist on google store). The ONLY app that you need is "Amazon music" which is created by Amazon, not some scammer. Note Amazon does not demand money to add skills (at least music, burglar deterrent, guard), so if your app asks for money (Prime), then you have downloaded an app which is a scam.

Title: A bit heavy on the bass and light on the treble; replaces my Echo Dot 2nd Gen.
Body: The bass was strong, and the treble was weak, probably because of the shielding from the grippers of the wall mount.  But, I didn't want to fool around drilling holes to let more treble out, as others had mentioned.  I did, however, adjust the tone from the Alexa app as much as possible.  This is mounted in the bathroom of the master bedroom and paired with an Echo in the bedroom.  That way, when I must use the bathroom, I get continuity of programing. (Sorry, I'm just a privileged geek.). This rig replaces a similar one with an Echo Dot 2nd generation.

Title: She's good but..
Body: already purchased Prime and the Echo now I have to also purchase unlimited just to listen to regular music? Like that's entirely too much so I choose to connect to apple music. SO even though Alexa is going through MY apple music account for some reason she cant find some of my songs which I think ridiculous because when I ask her to play a playlist the songs play without issue. I just feel as though she is great if you listen to mainstream music but really when she connects to my apple music through my account she should be able to access all of the songs saved to my library without issue.

Title: What did I do before Alexa?
Body: What did I like?  I found Alexa to be a great help several days ago.  I was sewing and impaled my finger with the needle.  I was alone and could not reach the tools I needed to free myself.  I used Alexa to call my son and she saved the day.  I don_ advise getting rid of your life alert but she sure helped me in a pinch!  I love being able to listen to books on audible.  By far it is a very useful help for many aspects of daily living.  I now own 3 and have no regrets.  Set up was easy enough for me. (old lady)

Title: Fun and incredibly handy!
Body: Love this cool little dot!  Easy setup and easier to use. I call on Alexa most often for music, so will probably end up ordering a larger speaker or two, but it is so handy to think of a song and tell Alexa to play and it starts. I love the reminders and get a kick out of the super fun interactive games and animal sounds.Still trying to figure out how to control my Fire TV stick with the Echo dot vs the stick remote.

Title: Alexa tell me that you love me!
Body: Where would we be without Alexa?I bought two, one in the bedroom and one in the living room.  I_ so happy with them.  Small, discrete and perfect for me.  One of my gentlemen friends said it doesn_ have enough bass, but he ended up being a tool so whatever.  It is a tiny speaker, you cannot expect it to have the acoustics of the Mann Music Center.  I used them all day long every day...I think they are great.

Title: It's worth upgrading.
Body: This echo is much louder than the second generation. I bought this as a back up to my second generation echo. I got curious about the volume level after reading a review. I have to it better than my second gen. I retired my second gen echo to the garage and put this one in the bathroom. Its louder and clearer, and can be heard in the shower with the shower going. And I got it for $22. During Amazon week!! Win... Win

Title: Slow response time
Body: I have two Echos at the moment. The first one I purchased was refurbished and it works perfectly. I purchased this Echo brand new and am a little disappointed. The refurbished one I have has superior performance. This one is disappointing because there is a very slow response time. I have made a command and have waiting up to 10 seconds for a response. Also, this echo has also stopped playing my music randomly without a command. Sometimes I have to repeat the wake word 2 times before I get a response.  I don't know if I received a defective one, but this has been my experience.

Title: Identical to Gen. 2 Dot, But with Handy Display
Body: This is a nicer-looking, Gen 3 update of the original Dot with be better (but not stellar) sound.It only comes in the sandstone (light gray) exterior, though I would rather have had a charcoal/black finish, so it would match my watch/iPhone/AirPods dock.The key new feature is the four digit display, which seems to magically float behind the material skin.While seemingly a simple addition, the display is actually quite handy.First, it serves as a clock, which is great bedside, as I previously had to bump the nightstand so my Apple Watch display would come on to see the time. Now this Dot serves as an always-on clock. Also nice, it automatically dims or brightens based on the room lighting. On the lowest brightness in a dark bedroom, I think it gives off no more light than the power light  on the Apple dock, while keeping the display readable. During the day, it brightens as needed to match the room. Good engineering! You can also turn this off and set the brightness manually.Another benefit of the display is showing you the volume whenever you press the volume buttons or even if you ask to turn up the volume. Or ask the temperature and you will see it on the display, in addition to hearing Alexa tell you.There are more uses you will find, but I_e found the display more helpful than I expected.Now, whether you want a smart device on your nightstand is another question. If you happen to have a wife named Alexa, I definitely wouldn_ locate an Alexa-enabled device bedside, at least not without changing the code word (think about it!). Many folks are uneasy about the whole smart device concept so YMMV.But, if you like smart speakers and the Alexa echo-system, I think you will find this Dot a helpful addition.I took off one star because I do think the price premium is a bit steep over the regular Dot, but if you keep your eyes open, you can at least get it at a discount of $10 off for $35. Instead of the usual $45.

Title: Flawed, but better than my GEN 1
Body: SO much better than the early access GEN 1 version I bought in 2015 lol.It really has bass and is quite loud!I had my old one plugged into my home theatre system via the mini cable. It drove sound well. This GEN 3 does NOT PUSH as much audio power as my old one. No idea why. It even uses more power. Previously volume 7 was loud enough to hear over tv and AC window unit. Now it_ gotta be 9 to hear and 11 to really play music.My voice is bad due to an accident years ago leaving my vocal cords scarred. Annoyingly, I_ STILL having to do training, but it STILL isn_ as good a listener as my old one which I gave to my best friends kids to use.Pros:Very decent speaker quality.Doesn_ use mini usb for power.Doesn_ slide around like old ones.Cons:Doesn_ drive enough via external audio.Microphone seems less responsive.

Title: Good Smart Speaker
Body: Bough 4 of these for work.  What?  Yeah, 4 for work.  Our phone system does not have an intercom function and you can use these as an intercom by "dropping in" on one of the speakers.  You can have  a 2 way conversation and that's pretty handy.  The sound quality is pretty good as well.  I am a died in the wool apple user and fell out of my chair when I found this integrates with Apple Music.  I have another brand of smart speaker at home and now wish I could trade them for echos.  I'm in the process of getting a few more of these to put in other offices on a different floor to see how well I can communicate with them.The only thing that makes it difficult to set up is NOTHING!  Easy set up and if you are going to use these as intercoms, you have to set them all up using the same account.  Not that big of a deal for me or where I work.I really like these things!

Title: Wonderful timekeeper
Body: When I received the Echo Dot as a gift, I didn't know what it was, what it did, or how I should make it do it.  I needed a couple hours of tech support to activate Alexa using my PC because I have no mobile devices.  Sounds like a bad review, right?  No!  I love the Echo Dot!  I don't have a newspaper, TV, or radio so I never knew the weather forecast.  Now I can ask Alexa for today's weather or next Sunday's weather.  I also use it to set timers.  I have so many projects that I need to watch the time carefully for each one.  Now I can set multiple timers to keep me on track.The best feature is the ability to set reminders days in advance.  I can say, "Set a reminder for Tuesday at 5:30 p.m. to do the laundry."  Friday night I plan my weekend and set reminders for the entire weekend.  It's amazing.  I get so much more done because I stay on schedule.My friend visited with three of her children to look at things on the internet.  I didn't know how to keep the 6-year-old and 12-year-old boys occupied, but Alexa saved the day.  I activated the skill Tune In Live which lets you listen to any sporting event for $2.99 a month.  The Phillies happened to be playing.  The boys were so excited to listen to the game live and ask Alexa questions during the commercials.There are so many more skills that I've barely scratched the surface.  Wiki How is another great skill.  I was hesitant to introduce more technology into my home, but Alexa is so helpful.  I'm happy to have the Echo Dot and recommend it for timekeeping, education, and weather and news updates.

Title: Love the new look
Body: I'm Alexa'fied". She is everywhere in my house. The new Dot looks great. The sound is improved some, but still not on a par of course with an Echo Show or dedicated speaker. I use my Show in the bedroom as a stereo pair with the new dot. Gives you an all around the room sound.The one thing I am curious about is that my earlier generation Dots get into a conversation with me. I can say, Alexa what time is it, she tells me, and then I say, "How is the weather?" and she tells me, and sometimes on the end of a string of conversation I say, "Thank you" and she says, "Anytime". I notice the light ring on this new third generation goes out immediately after responding to the first command/request. I'm wondering if there is a setting that allows it to make conversations like my other earlier versions do.

Title: A reminder set on 1 Echo Dot does not broadcast to all Echo Dots.
Body: I bought my first 3rd gen Echo Dot about 8 months ago, as I recall. I mainly use it for reminders. I live in a large home and therefore often could not hear the reminder. I recently bought 2 more to spread around my home. Unfortunately, a reminder placed on 1 Echo Dot does not broadcast to other Echo Dots making it rather useless.In addition, I know it has other functions. I do not know what they are or how to set them up.In summary, the devices are like 3 bricks to me.

Title: Like the old Echo Dot with surprisingly rich sound quality
Body: The new 3rd gen echo dot packs a surprising amount of quality in a small package for a great price.  I definitely recommend it for anyone who liked the functionality of the Echo Dot 2nd gen but felt its speakers were not adequate.  As with all Echos, the voice recognition works great with a male voice, but Alexa seems to not really understand women as easily.  Still good and entirely usable, but occasionally frustrating for my wife.  Also, the fact that you cannot link two accounts to your echo network is frustrating.  My account has all the smart home stuff configured, but my wife's has all the music associated to it.  I don't see why Amazon is reluctant to allow us to link those accounts when we live at the same address...

Title: Echo Dot, Where Have You Been All My Life?
Body: I received an Echo Spot as a gift,  then 2 smart plugs, and then purchased the Dot.  What a system!  After the initial setup of the Spot, the rest basically set themselves up.  At my age, I thought it would be hard to get the components to work together, but the technology is very user friendly, even for seniors like myself.  Bedroom lamps turn off with a couple of words.  Coffee comes on in the AM when I tell it to.  The Dot is a cute, little item that sits on the counter, answers questions, adjusts its own volume, turn things on and off,  plays music, and basically makes life easier.  I definitely plan on adding additional Echo Dots!!  Very Senior friendly.

Title: Only minor complaints, more capable than Google Assistant
Body: Excellent microphone, it picks me up from across the room.  Speaker nice quality, even works well as a Bluetooth speaker.  I do have trouble distinguishing been fifty and sixty when hearing the weather report.  When Alexa misunderstands she is often too eager to play music instead of answer a question.  When she answers a question it's usually the right you, if not the correct answer.  For example it take several tries to get from her what direction the wind is blowing, but every answer send to also include the days high and low temperature.

Title: Smoogle what?
Body: I have two of the other products and the quantity went to poo after a week. I was hesitant about the echo based on the other home /nest products but so happy with my decision to take a chance and go with. Works seamlessly with my nest thermostat,  ring doorbell, smarthome smart plug, and ADT. OMG, I love this thing. Sound quality is great. Understands my statements and questions throughout the room. Wish I had one in every room and I want to pick up Alexa products to replace the other substandard products.  My wifi isn't awesome but holds up and the echo doesnt complain. Love it

Title: Spend the few extra dollars and get the 3rd Generation Dot!
Body: If you are like me and have the 2nd generation dot then you know the speaker is "lacking" the microphone is temperamental and let's face it there is going to come a point where the 2nd gen Dot just won't support some of the new things Amazon is adding to the Echo's. The 3rd generation Dot sounds a ton better, its clearer, louder and has multiple microphones built in so it can understand you a lot better. I replaced my 2nd gen Dot's on Prime Day 2019 and couldn't be happier!

Title: Alexa provides good sound quality once you get to know her.
Body: The major drawback with Alexa is a lack of documentation with the Dot.  Repeated directions to "go to your APP" are worthless when you do not have the APP yet and are trying to get the thing to work.  Once installed and working, depending upon your provider's service quality, Alexa offers simple and effective access to music and information with very good quality sound, whether I place it on the arm of my recliner or on a hard wood surface.  It is certainly worth the discounted Amazon price.

Title: Completed my Amazon environment
Body: I received a Amazon Show for Christmas and loved it.  I rounded out that purchase with two other echo dots that have been a marvelous edition to my home.  I am able to sync all three devices and have great multi room sound.  I have named them all different wake up names so I can distinguish which unit to pick up the command. Excellent alarm clock and data retriever.  Excellent addition to my Bedroom and Living Room.

Title: Third generation dot offers so many improvements!!
Body: We bought this dot for my daughter_ room. She mainly uses it to check the weather each day for school. She also turns on and off her light because we paired it with a Smart Plug. She also sets an alarm on it for each morning. The third generation sounds so much better too! I have a first generation dot that I use for talk radio because music sounds terrible out of it. The third generation speaker is leaps and bounds better!!

Title: Nope
Body: I have two that work great but this one won'tr stay connected to the internet at all.And when trying to reset it, it won't give me the Wifi to log into, so its basically a paper weight at this point.

Title: Portable and handy
Body: I purchased the dot for several reasons and now own 3. I have dysautonomia and can use this to get help if I need to do so. It can can for people, text and I even thought if I need to call 911, it can probably be done. I check the weather, makes shopping lists and set reminders. I also use it to play K-Love radio while I_ getting ready in the morning.

Title: Good deal.
Body: Definitely plays music well, as long as you aren't too worried about amazing sound quality. For the size of the speaker, it's prettty awesome.Alexa is very helpful, we use her to set timers for TV/Computer time limits, cooking. I have a reminder to take my vitamins set in, which is excellent since I am always forgetting. Every day she helps me remember things. We have a grocery list set up, so I can add items to the grocery list as I use them, which helps us keep from running out of essentials. If I see something is low, like the peanut butter, I simply say 'Alexa, add peanut butter to grocery list' and it's there. If I have already added, she lets me know and asks if I need to add it again. You can access the lists in real time from the app on your cell phone, so if my husband stops on his way home from work, he can see everything we need right in the store, and check it off the list as he picks it up.As long as you don't mind the marketing that comes along with being listened to constantly, it's great. (Husband and I discussed getting oil for our new house in the kitchen and immediately after I had an ad for an oil company on Instagram. Could have also been our phones. Hard to tell what is triggering these events anymore nowadays.)We also got one for the kids to have in their playroom and they love it. I know there are more features that I can access for them. I just have to find a good description of what they are.One drawback is that you can only link one music service account (that I can tell). Amazon music will only play on one speaker at a time for me, so if the kids ask for a song downstairs, my music stops upstairs. We have gotten around this (upstairs adults) by listening to another app, like iHeartRadio's generic radio stations (since you can't log in and customize likes/stations to multiple music services that I can tell), or TuneIn will play public radio by asking for the program automatically.

Title: A great buy
Body: I got 3 of these on Amazon prime day due to the discount, as I was not sure I'd really use it to be paying full price.  However, it has been really useful.  We have one in each of 3 rooms, and my husband and I both use them.  The ability to turn on and off lights (with the smart plug) is useful, and the ability to play music.  We've used the timers, reminders, drop ins, and asked random questions that we would have usually had to go to the PC to look up. We've also had fun asking Alexa the random things that some of the emails suggested.  All in all, a great buy. I will probably be purchasing one more in the future.

Title: Getting better
Body: I have a 1st gen Dot and got this new 3rd gen bundled with a refurbed Show on Prime Day, and I was pleased with how much better the sound is in the new one.  It certainly isn't the Echo or Show, but it isn't nearly as tinny as the 1st gen Dot.  This one in in my bedroom and I use it mainly for an alarm and to play some kind of audio as I fall asleep and this Dot more than fills the bill.  I love my Alexas, they are in just about every room in the house (if they listen in, they are really in need of lives), most connected to nice speakers so my music plays all through the house on my Everywhere network.  Wait for a sale and buy multiples, you'll wonder how you got along without them.

Title: Loud and clear!
Body: I now have 3 Echo Dots (2 are 3rd gen) and an Echo Show 5. I also have a competing system that starts with a G. In almost every way, the other system comes up short. I love the drop in feature. I can drop in on my garage and listen, plus it makes a great intercom, something the other system lacks completely right now. Amazon, you came up with a real winner and I'm a total convert! And yes, I did start with the other system and still will use parts of it for now, but like this one better.

Title: Not bad at all!
Body: Great for a single, full-range, down-firing speaker. Their circuitry has it bass-heavy, so in settings, increase the miss up 2 & highs up 4 or max. I bought 3 more, to have 4 in total, and I placed them in a room for excellent sound and clarity. Even outside, the 4 dot group sound is pretty good. Put them a few inches from a wall for better, and louder, sound.

Title: Perfect smart home starter!
Body: I now have two dots in my home and I utilize both of them daily.  The quality of this product is spectacular, it feels solid! The sound is perhaps the best thing about it! For such a tiny device, the sound quality and volume is amazing! So far I really enjoy my Alexa enabled smart home. Hoping that Amazon continues to add features and improve Alexa.

Title: Fun Family Times
Body: I ordered the echo to put in my kitchen. After I got the firestick and learned what all Alexa was capable of, I put echo dot on my shopping list. I got it on sale and set it up in no time. I use it to turn lights on and off, keep my grocery list updated, play music while i cook and clean, and tell my babies bedtime stories at night. My toddler even uses  the Echo Dot even though he requires a little help with the recognition aspect, which is quite entertaining for the rest of us. I am planning to buy another echo dot for my bedroom office and daughter's bedroom. I'm just waiting for it to go back on sale.

Title: Fifth Alexa Device and Third Dot I have Purchased
Body: I purchased this item on Amazon Prime day with a prime account for a reduced price and it told over 3 weeks to arrive.  This is the 3rd dot I have purchased and as with all the other Alexa devices (5 total), they set up easily and work consistently without problems.  The sound is ok and good enough on the Dot for casual listening.  The Echo Plus is much better. All the Alexa devices do not hear very well when playing music or in a room with the TV on.  Even with no background music, she often misunderstands activity requests and I have to repeat the command phrase.  Plus, Alexa is not very smart - she can answer only a fraction of the questions that Google can.

Title: Automation
Body: So I have had Fire TV devices for years and this Prime day I decided it was time to automate the home. I got smart plugs and the Echo and some Echo dots and started to study how it all integrates and works together. The Echo can do more than I will ever need and it works perfectly as long as I don't mumble my words. Now that it controls all my lights,TV,thermostat, wakes me up, keeps my various lists and on and on and seems to know all the answers to my questions I am one happy camper. With the Alexa App I can add or subtract skills and customize my privacy.  The sound quality is very good a big surprise for the size

Title: We love our Alexa
Body: Works great, with my voice or my husbands and even the kids. Tons of functions, from reminders and timers to playing our amazon music to keeping the kids entertained with jokes and games. Looks nice on the counter, good sound quality and makes for some fun kitchen dance parties. Love that it can integrate with other units and speakers in the house.

Title: Don_ buy this!! Waste of Money
Body: Extremely disappointed my main reason was to listen to music and that is it a huge disappointment because you can_ even download anything.  I got a hold of customer service and they just transferred me to Technical Support. They told me someone will be calling me back. They wanted money for me to start out at first but almost $200 and then they went down to $75 and they told me if I didn_ give him the money and within five minutes my product will be shut down  they wanted money for me to start it out at first but almost $200 and then they went down to $75 and they told me if I didn_ give them the money and within five minutes my product will be shut down.  So in other words I was being scammed.  I have never been so pissed off or frustrated in my life for buying a product.  Everything that it_ doing for me I could do it with my iPhone iPod it so I can listen to music and I can_ even listen to music and I can_ even download it on my computer which I_e been trying to do for days so it_ been a total waste of money

Title: A.lex.aaaaaaaa!!
Body: This little electronic is pretty neat. We have 7 children, so needless to say it makes setting "time-out" timers super easy. Depending on the bedtime those can happen. It's a great little tool to have for grocery list, a little music, dropping in on kids while on a date, as well as asking time/temperature throughout the day.Like mentioned in other reviews, we dont like how it cuts off songs before their ending, we aren't sure why or how to fix it?Would buy again at $30.

Title: 3rd Gen is TRASH - Don't buy this!
Body: I purchased three of these during Prime Days.  First, it took FOREVER for me to receive them, and I still have not received one of the three ordered.Secondly, the only music platform that seems to work correctly is Amazon music.  On any other platform, the song gets about a quarter of the way to halfway finished and it cuts out to dead air.  When the music resumes, a new song is playing.  I listen to pandora primarily, then apple music and Amazon as my last option.  I purchased them to add easily accessible music in my office, gym, and yoga room.  I contacted amazon and did troubleshooting with no resolution.  They sent me two replacements that are doing the same thing.  The funny thing is if I listen to my second-generation dots and plus I have no issues with any of my music platforms.  It is only the third-generation with the problem; which tells me there is something wrong with this third-generation.  I hope they will take this back and return my money.  I would rather have a refurbished second-generation than not to be able to listen to all of my music platforms.Thirdly, the echo says it is up to date, BUT the tech support representative stated that the software version is not the latest.Lastly, I have to repeat myself multiple times for this echo to wake up and do what is asked.  In my opinion, Amazon had to throw a bunch together to keep up with demand from Prime Days and manufactured a bunch of defective echo dots.I hardly ever do reviews, but I am so annoyed with this situation that I had to let others know what to expect.  This third-generation is not the high-quality Amazon product you have become accustomed.  Do yourself a favor and wait until a new generation becomes available or buy an old one.

Title: Overall would buy again
Body: The sound quality is mostly good, but it_ surprisingly hard to control the volume. If I change it on my phone via the app, sometimes it just randomly changes back to whatever it wants. If I change it by pushing the button on the echo dot it tends to stay there, but then it_ just kind of a pain to have to walk back to change it again. There_ a HUGE discrepancy between song volume and commercial volume on some of the amazon free music stations, and with some of the skills (notably some of the quiz/family game type skills). Alexa understands me 95% of the time, and the other 5% of the time seems like she_ having a small stroke and comes up with bizarre responses or skills. Regardless, I still really want another to add upstairs, and also an echo plus...

Title: Having fun!
Body: Received my first dot for Mother's Day and bought a second one during Prime Day.  I also bought the wall outlets that go with it and use Alexa to turn the lamps on and off.  Not rocket science, but good to know I can do this do this using the Dot or using Alexa app on my cell phone when I'm not home.  I also like listening to music or my latest audiobook while I do other things.  It's great for making a shopping list.  As I use things during the week I just tell Alexa to add it to my shopping list.  I print the list when I'm ready to go to the store.  Has made shopping much easier and I'm not forgetting to pick up ???  I also like making/receiving phone calls on it.  Great range for voice pick-up and hearing others.  My grandchildren have fun listening to jokes, asking funny questions and listening to their music.  I find it's easy to use and the sound is good for it's price range

Title: Problematic
Body: I have 4 Echo Dots and they have been nothing but trouble. Not only is there static, but they often miss commands.When playing a group, there's issues every single day.I honestly would avoid these devices.They seem to have a mind of their own when it comes to streaming music-I have Amazon Music and am about ready to cancel it.Customer service tells me to power cycle and factory reset, shut down WiFi ect.This is ANNOYING because it has become a weekly process.

Title: A Great Assistant for the blind
Body: This was a second dot for my home. The first I received as a gift. I loved it so much I bought a second one. Echo dots are great. You can place an order, look up information, get latest news & weather, set up reminders, listen to music, etc. It_ like having a computer you talk to. It makes a great gift. A legally blind friend is able to get anything we can get on a computer just by talking. What a great piece of technology!

Title: Good Purchase Overall
Body: Was very easy to set up and easy to use right off the bat. As Alexa is still learning, she doesn't always recognize a command. When playing games through the device, it never lets you stop the game no matter how many comands you tell her to stop and I either have to press the Alexa button on the top and have even had to unplug the device a few times for her to stop what she's doing. Overall it has come in handy and it gets better each day. Just needs to learn to stop certain skills/processes when asked too.

Title: Perfect for listening to music
Body: I mainly use this for listening to music or nursery rhymes for my kids. My husband has an accent and it doesn't always recognize his voice, or will play the wrong thing when he talks to it. I am happy I purchased it though, but a few things can be improved. I have it hooked up to my Spotify and Alexa will always try to play from Amazon Music first. If it isn't available, it will go into a paragraph explanation on trying to get me to get another subscription to Amazon Music, etc and is really annoying. The other annoying thing is that it is constantly flashing yellow. I've disabled notifications from the Alexa app for this device, yet it still beeps and flashes every time I have a package delivered or something has shipped. I had to move it to a spot where it can't be seen because the light bothered me so much. If they can fix that issue, I'll give it 5 stars.

Title: Terrible customer service experience
Body: David Josue was my customer service chatbot / person.  I own multiple Echo device including an echo, FIreTV, several dots throughout my house.  They all work great except one of the new 3rd generation Dots recently purchased.  That new Dot drops my music streams around 8-10 times per hour, sometimes more...sometimes every song...and has done it right from the start.So what do I do?  I go online to request an exchange for a new functional Dot.  The system FORCES me to chat or speak on the phone with a customer service rep.  Okay, irritating, especially when I could have simply opted to return the item for a refund, and then buying another new one to accomplish this same task.  But, I'll do it.Over 2 hours later, after chatting with David through this time, I've provided lots of ridiculous info, router make and model, distance from router, other device info, etc., some of which may be relevant, but also including a DNA sample (kidding), and get this - approving his request for an Amazon rep to conduct a house visit to gather debug info from the Dot....?!?!?  Seriously, for a $30 device?!  I say "sure!" because at this point, I think they make this process as long and drawn out to dissuade people from getting this done...what else am I to think?  What would you think?So, David concludes by saying this will take several days to have the development team triage my data and get back to me via email about next steps...Meanwhile my device dropped the stream 11 times in a little over an hour while chatting with David.  He wraps our chat session by asking if he has addressed all my concerns and questions.  I tell him, well, "No, not satisfactorily, but you know that don't you David?"  He responds -"Perfect! Have a great evening."So now, I'm all in to see how utterly absurd this process will be to exchange the Dot for one that functions properly.  It goes without saying that I will not be recommending Echo devices to anyone and will be regaling them with the request for a home visit by Amazon before honoring the exchange request.  I seriously doubt anyone, including you kind readers, will believe it!  But, it's true.  I swear on my dog's life.So, what will come next??  I don't know but am waiting in awe of this stupidity and will update as it goes....UPDATE:  the second Dot that came in the order with the first one is now also dropping pandora streams, so it'll be a return for both, especially since I've not received the aforementioned email from the development team wanting to swing by the house for a debug and beer session.  I guess I'm done buying Echo devices until they work this out.

Title: Much nice and better quality Echo (than the original)
Body: I bought a few more echos on Prime Day as they had a great day (only $22).  I already had one echo which I ended up giving to my parents in law.  I liked the original echo so I figured I would try the new version and I am not at all disappointed.  These echos are better than the original in terms of both voice recognition and speaker quality, not to mention they look way better too.  When I talk to these echos, they understand my voice much better and I usually don't need to repeat myself.

Title: A little mighty Echo
Body: These Echoes are small but versatility and convenient. A nice feature is that with 2 of them you can link them as stereo speakers (just for streaming music services). I got one for free as part of a bundle with Echo Show 5 and bought the second one for less than $25 so it was a great deal. With echo dot it can fill my whole house with it's audio. It is a small device but you will be satisfied with the volume. Plus Alexa is so friendly. LOL! You can ask for the weather, play with your favorite music actually there's a lot to discover what Alexa can do in a very fun and exciting way, she can even tell a joke!

Title: Love the functionality!
Body: Love the Echo Dot!  Currently only have 2 in my home but will probably get more later.  In my opinion, the sound is good and her voice clear.  I basically use mine for weather, occasional music and to turn lights on and off.  So glad I finally took the first steps toward a smart home by buying these dots.  Would definitely recommend to all.  If you check Amazon_ main page, you sometimes can find the dot for $20.00 off( for a limited time).  Well worth the purchase!

Title: Alexa rules!
Body: I love the convenience the echo dot gives.  I talk to her all day, and she's really smart!  She helps me stay organized and I love the fact that I can be hands free with my lights and my speakers.  Not that being tethered to my cell phone is that much of a hassle, but I still like this better.  Of note, though:  Alexa does not swear.  She tells me to "Clean your BEEP house you BEEP".  I think it's funny, most people won't.  :)

Title: Not worth the stress repeating yourself.
Body: Turns off randomly, doesn_ respond. Says it_ working but clearly no music comes out. It does what it wants and I_ dissatisfied with buying two. I_ throwing all three away since amazon does not want to help me resolve these issues. DO NOT WASTE YOUR MONEY ON FRUSTRATING SPEAKERS

Title: Works great with Hue light bulbs
Body: I bought an Echo Dot after seeing my sister's during a visit. It looked like fun. In reality, it has been very useful. I have a couple of hanging lamps with cords but no inline switches, and using the Echo Dot with the Hue light bulbs, it's easy for me to turn the lights on and off or dim them at any level. I also use it as an alarm clock and timer. I'm sure I've barely skimmed the surface of what it can do.

Title: Amazing
Body: So easy to set up. Works instantly, no programming or waiting.  Built in speaker sounds great.  Lots of bass.  Range to activate is great.  I love this thing! I mostly use it for reminders and playing music.  Also use it for weather report and sometimes to ask generic questions like "what is the largest land mammal?" Would highly recommend.  Bought for a steal on Amazon for $29.99. Well worth more.

Title: Alexa, "How do I return a 3rd Gen Echo Dot  to Amazon???"
Body: I was impressed by the sound of my Google Home Mini, but Amazon's  3rd Gen Echo Dot sounds MUCH BETTER. This is our 5th Amazon device we ordered. All have Alexa enabled.Ask Alexa "Where is "Ludowici"?" Answer: "31°4238_ 81°4440_" + "Does that ANSWER your question???" Reply: 'NO!" Alexa replies "Thank you for helping us improve our database."  [="Oh, it's what I LIVE FOR, Alexa. I paid money, bought Echo Dot 3 so I could HELP YOU!!!" I can ALWAYS ask Google Home Assistant when I want USEFUL information! ] I even took the time to run the speech setup so Alexa better recognizes my voice.Alexa needs to take special ed courses with the trade school kids.
