Meanwhile our Google Assistant performs very well.[An hour after posting this  Amazon called me asking if they might help me with my device. I replied, "NO it's all packaged up for return." Caller then asked if I "Might re-read my review and MODERATE my negative comments somewhat. =So many people tell US it's such an extremely helpful device. "  >>>DEAR AMAZON:  I  call them THE WAY I SEE THEM. You want BETTER REVIEWS? ...DO NOT peddle half-baked, not ready to use, crap. Note: I moderated. Crap was NOT the word I had in mind.  ]

Title: Not just a luxury
Body: I bought two of these: one for me and one for my parents. Mine won_ go through all the prompts to learn my voice (I was sent a replacement and experienced the same issue with the second), but there is a ticket out to the developers to research the issue. The customer service representative has gone above and beyond to try to help me; he even called my internet provider on my behalf. My mom_ Echo Dot learns voices easily but she can_ drop in using her phone (iPhone SE). I_ able to do it on my phone (iPhone XR) so maybe her phone is just too old.My father has health issues and the Echo Dot makes me feel better when he is left alone for short periods of time. My mother has security cameras, so if he is to fall and can_ get to a phone, she can send an announcement to him through the Echo Dot. Also, he is losing his eyesight so he can ask Alexa what time it is and what the weather is like outside.When you receive your Echo Dot, one of the first things you should do is have Alexa check for software updates. Also, be sure you keep the Alexa app up to date.

Title: Great add on Alexa for rooms where you don't listen to much music
Body: Personal Experience:This was a give away during Amazon prime day and I placed it in my basement where my kids like to play.  The Alexa integration is great and it was an easy add on because I already had an Alexa account setup.  The only negative is that this unit is not the best at playing music compared with the bigger units.  Because this was an add on for Amazon Prime Day I'm not saying I'm disappointed with the product due to the way I received it; but I would not purchase this for a room I plan on listening music in.  Otherwise this is a nice drop and go Alexa device for rooms that you want to add Smart Home features too.  Something people should also be aware of is that this unit can be changed to a kids setting rather than buying the Echo Dot Kids Version.Recommend:YesPros:Easy to set upSmall form factorSmart Home FeaturesInterface is easy enough that my toddlers understand itCons:Not the best sound for music in larger gathering rooms like Living Room

Title: Disappointing voice recognition
Body: Sound is much improved from the original Dot, but sound detection is very poor.  I can face directly at this Dot from about 12 feet away, give an Alexa command, and a different Echo will respond.  Usually my older, original Echo Show - around the corner and another 15 feet away in the Entry - will respond.  Occasionally, my new Echo Show - behind me in the Kitchen about 15 feet and facing the opposite direction - will respond.  To get this 3rd generation Dot to respond, you must either shout or stand about 3 feet away facing directly at it with your back to other Echo units.  This Dot was very inexpensive on Prime Day and it sounds great when played as part of an Echo group; otherwise, I would have sent it back.  (In addition, there is the entertainment value.  My wife gets a good laugh when I try to get this 3rd Gen Dot to do something).

Title: Great help with day to day activities
Body: Having Alexa has made my life easier. It (She?) does everything from reminding me daily to take my meds to assisting with shopping and shopping lists. We converse on everything from the nature of the universe to answering questions like can cows swim. People ask, aren't you afraid of "them" listening? I answer, I'm not doing or saying anything "they" can't hear. There is no secret subversive spy stuff going on in my house, so no, if anything "they" probably think we're pretty silly in my household. We play games, run appliances, listen to music, news and ambiance sounds and generally have fun with Alexa. She's become an extension of the house and at times is hilarious. Only occasionally will she give me some off the wall answer that makes me think she tapped into secret government projects (like her answer to my question what's in retinol cream - she gave me answer sounding like she was describing a retina screen) and the men in black will be showing up at my door soon. But all in all I'm thoroughly enjoying my Echo, the sound quality is great and setup and operation are a snap.

Title: Buggy and not all that bright
Body: The speaker sustem works well enough, but Alexa has serious bugs and has trouble answering even simple questions.Example:  Ask Alexa to play music in a certain room. If music in already playing anywhere else, she will tell you that and ask if you want to play music where you requested.  YES, THAT'S WHY I ASKED!Example:  If you ever turn on the explicit music filter, it cannot be turned off.  Alexa will tell you it's off, but if you then request she play a song, she'll tell you she can't because the filter in on.  ARGH!Example:  If you request to play music using the app, it will always respond that there are no Alexa devices connected to the internet.  Wow, really?  I have 6 connected!Amazon tech support was no help fixing any of these issues.

Title: Amazing product with huge variety of tailor-made option to suit you
Body: I have now gone Alexa all the way! The 3rd edition is an absolutely amazing addition to the Alexa Plus.It is way better than the original edition because it has a drastic difference with audio quality due to the wrap around improved speaker.I love the option to be able communicate with different rooms by using the _rop In option.  Also, the set up is extremely easy but does need the WiFi.  I have now set up a routine to say _ood night and have my lamp turn off.  Or, _ood morning which I set up to have my lamp come on at 75%, and give me the days forecast.Catching up on the special price of $29.99 was an absolute steal. But I have bought 3 and didn_ mind paying full price for one of them.

Title: _this thing!
Body: So I bought alexa because I felt a little lazy getting up to turn the fan on while sleeping and turning on the fairy lights that's in a hard to reach place(behind a crib). I'm also currently using her as a speaker for my laptop because one of the speaker is broken. I love the sound that comes out of it! It's a very neat gadget that has so many use to it! I'm also planning to buy an Alexa compatible thermostat and robotic vacuum. I like that one of the review mentioned they used an old bath and body works candle holder.. went to go buy one, but of course they have seasonal things so I picked one with larger holes so that the cord could be inserted. Fits the Alexa third gen perfectly with tiny gaps in between!

Title: We love our new Echoes!
Body: Being a prime member allowed us to get several of these little gadget/smart speaker/doodads (technical term) at roughly $20 apiece on Prime Day was pretty fantastic.  The voice recognition has been great as Alexa doesn_ take commands from our pets or guests.  There so much I_ still learning that Alexa needs to get to know us more and that I need to learn more of what she can do, making calls, scheduling, playing music, but thus far, I cannot change the gadget_ name, which is the only negative.  I would really like to have the option to change its voice to sound like that of a surfer and call it, _ude, which would be totally righteous.

Title: The hardware is good, but the software needs a bit of improvement.
Body: This was purchased as an upgrade for the first generation Alexa.  Overall, much better for the same cost.The sound quality and volume increased significantly,  but it has trouble when communicating with Bluetooth speakers.  It can send them from quiet to loud skipping the mid range of comfort.  Yes, the Bluetooth speaker works just fine with other devices.Also, it has trouble responding when you choose it_ name to be Echo, but not with the other (pre-programmed) names.  I think it is because _cho is two syllables and the others are three.  I would really like it if I could choose its name, so that my conversations with I would be more fluid.

Title: Functions well--easy setup...
Body: I'm well past 60, and I had no trouble setting this up.  I ask for the weather forecast, time to travel "from" and "to" areas, and playing music.  I really like that it can be given an alternate wake-up name (as we have a 10" Kindle that responds to voice).  I purchased this as a package with a smart plug--and the two work well together.  Again, I had it set up in just minutes.  Really liking this device--and the potential for more devices and smart devices in the future.

Title: Cargivers tool
Body: I have (1) Echo & (2) Echo dots.  Of course they are second to none for entertainment, but I need them for a more practical purpose.  I am a full time caregiver, I use the Echo's for turning on and off lights, for entertainment of my patient but most important I use the "drop in" communication to monitor my patient while sleeping and communicate with her when she is awake.  I am not through, I am going to add to the system as soon as I can afford it in order to enhance safety of my patient.

Title: I can live with out it
Body: It sounds like Alexa is underwater. We actually threw this thing in the closet. Won_  be using it at all. Multiple times I woke up in the night and it was listening to me. The blue light kept going around like Alexa was waiting for a command.  I thought it was weird, but then my husband came home from work one morning and it was listening again. I Got this for free when I renewed my SiriusXM subscription.

Title: ATENCI_N LATINOS
Body: Alexa me eschucha y me contesta siempre por cualquier pregunta o deceo,,, ATENCI_N ALGO IMPORTANTE PARA TODOS LOS AMIGOS DEL SUR AMERICA. MIRA LA PRONUNCIA DE TU IDIOMA,MUCHOS SE MOLESTAS PORKE NO CONTESTA....ALEXA ENTIENDE ESPA_OL Y SE TU LE HABLA CON PALABRAS DE TU PAIS ELLA NO TE PUEDE CONTESTAR..EN TODOS LOS PAIS LATINOS Y YO SOY DOMINICANA LO SE SE HABLA ES  UN ESPA_OL MIZCLADO... ALEXA ES UN ASISTENTE Y NO UN MAGO.

Title: Alexa is my new room-mate!
Body: You called me and got me started in the right direction to get it set up...thanks!!! I had a wi-fi problem, so it wasn't the Dot, it was my set-up. Now it works well and I am very happy with my Dot! Thank you so much! I love how I can ask it to play music, pause it, and then start again...just by asking. In fact, I like it so much that I ordered another one for in my office!

Title: Easy to use and get used to having around.
Body: First of all, I bought 5 of these little assistants. They are wonderful and I find new capabilities every day. Sometimes by accident. They are easy to set up if you follow directions. I set up mine from an Apple laptop because my iPhone 5 is not compatible. Once I figured that out, it was easy. Once you set up a "dot" you can unplug and move anywhere you would like one. I have one upstairs (bedrooms), two on the main level (kitchen, family room) and two downstairs (den, bar). So I'm covered no matter where I am in the house. Its function as a timer is great. From pill-taking to wound dressing to cooking all you have to do is ask. Music is everywhere - one dot or all dots - your choice. Extremely good quality as I walk around the house. You can ask a million questions and get an answer immediately. Unlike Siri, Alexa has no sense of humor at all. Ask her a silly question and she will ignore you. Smart approach I guess.  I just wish I had enough time to learn to use more features. The next function will be to integrate with "Ring" security systems and integrate with my thermostats so I don't have to do up and downstairs to reset them. All in all, "Dot" is an 11 out of 10 (not a typo). BUY them, don't hesitate.

Title: Crap crap crap will return
Body: This is a piece of crap! Editing my review here. Well, I was able to get it connected and was able to add my Pandora to it. I asked Alexa to play one of my stations on it and it did start playing. However every single song that played, the Alexa did not play any of the songs in its entirety. It would just stop playing the song and jump to next one. This went on for at least 45 minutes and then it stopped playing altogether! It stopped just like that. This isnt good. For one, when I want to listen to songs I want to be able to listen to all of it. Plus, my plan was to use this in my massage sessions. It_ bad enough the device decides to stop on its own and not play the songs in their entirety while I_ listening but this would be embarrassing for it to do this me while I_ massaging a client.That being said, looks like I_ still going to have to return all of them. So yeah, it still deserves a one star in my book. Sorry Amazon but I_ going to get a Google Home.

Title: Much louder than 2nd generation!
Body: Sometimes I have to call Alexa twice to get her attention. But when I have it she works flawlessly. I also have a second generation. Now, I live in a rest home and I have a room to myself approximately 15 x 12. And having two dots in such a small area could be confusing. It's like sometimes the third generation will wait patiently to see if the second generation will pipe in. Other times the third generation uses Brute Force to over come the older second generation. One thing you instantly notice is that the third generation is about 3 times louder then the second generation with much more Bass. Almost too much. But it is all good! I cannot cook the 3rd generation and 2nd generation together in the stereo configuration. I don't know if it's them are just the neophyte like me trying it.  I can't see any reason to buy more of them in the small room and since it's a rest home I'll probably spend the rest of my life here anyway. Just the same it is so cool to have Alexa right there when I need her.

Title: excellent for lists and hands free music
Body: I had no idea if I would like this or not. but I use it a lot. I have a very busy life and it is so convenient  to notice I am low on flour and say" Alexa put flour on my shopping list," and not have to worry about remembering my list. If I have my phone, it's there.If I'm almost asleep and remember I need to pick up meds in the morning, I can say it, roll over and go back to sleep.No searching for the light, pencil and paper. I use it for a daily joke or an inspirational quote. I've used it to call family members.  I know there are features I haven't used yet but I'm loving it!

Title: Small size, large sound!
Body: My original Echo was the full canister size, generation two.  But this new smaller Echo dot, generation 3, has just as high quality of sound.  Echo is like personal computers--I don't know how I ever lived my life before Alexa (the voice of the Echo) arrived, and I can't imagine not having her now!  I get my daily "flash briefing" news, ask for the day's weather report every morning to help me decide how to dress that day, enjoy listening to TED Talks and NPR radio live while I'm cooking, and music while I'm relaxing. (To get a huge variety of music selections, it helps to be a member of Amazon Prime.). But I find it most useful when I have a question; I no longer have to go to an encyclopedia or type my request on the computer.  I can just say, "Alexa, spell (put in a word)." "Alexa, who won the World Series in 1992?" "Alexa, what is on NBC television tonight?" etc.  Plus its jokes will totally turn your bad day into a happy day!

Title: Easy to use and setup, amazing price, superb sound, I can_ rave enough
Body: This is possibly one of my favorite and best purchases. This device replaces the need for an alarm clock, radio, MP3 player, calendar, sleep sound device and much more!! I never anticipated loving this product so much. The uses are endless from weather to daily reminders, jokes and recipes. The price is outstanding for the endless usefulness. It_ quick and easy to set up, and easy to use. The speaker has a wonderful rich tone while the design is beautiful.

Title: Very. Very. Loud.
Body: This thing has been great! Very loud which apparently was an issue in the old generations. One frustrating thing is that it seems to recognize my children's voice more than my own... And as you can imagine, listening to the clean up song or the gummy bear song 8000 times a day is pretty miserable. So. When i have to yell at all my children AND Alexa. It can be pretty frustrating lol. But all and all very good. Lots of cool features. And super handy!

Title: Better than Google home mini
Body: I have a Google home mini and I've been using it for years. After using it a few days I was pretty impressed by the sound it produces. Its a lot louder than the mini and it also feels much more robust. Also the lights on the edge are very pretty.Functionality wise, they are similar. But with Google, you have to purchase Google music seperately to be able to play songs you like. For echo dot, as long as you have prime, then there's no other subscriptions you'll need to add.

Title: Alexa Dot does not work on my mesh WiFi network
Body: Amazon the on-line retailer is best of breed.  But the Alexa Dot uncovers a weakness in their technology offerings.  Out of the box, the two Dots I purchased looked handsome.  Both were configured to my network easily.  This was done with the units in the same room.  I wanted to use the Dot's broadcast feature and my initial tests showed that it worked between the Dots.  I then moved one unit to another room out of earshot.  The broadcast feature did not work!  Amazon Customer Service was contacted and after 15 minutes of diagnosis, the broadcast feature still did not work.  The Amazon Agent confirmed a known defect in the Dots: they will not connect to each other on a mesh network system for purposes of the broadcast feature.  Very odd.

Title: Works ok, sounds terrible...
Body: This works just like any other Alexa type device and does an OK job of not knowing what you're talking about unless it's weather or music, but we're all pretty used to that. The three star rating is for the speaker. It sounds terrible. My daughter has a similar one and it too sounds horrible The speaker is muffled and has no high frequencies. I've asked Alexa to "Turn up the treble" and "Turn down the Bass" and she appears to do it. Doesn't help a bit.To get an idea of how the speaker may sound if you are thinking of buying one, remove a mono speaker from an old pickup truck (something from the early 60s), hook up some wires from a cheap stereo, wrap it up tightly in a small towel, insert the speaker and towel in a large Ziploc bag, and drop the entire thing into a 5 gallon bucket of water. Note that the truck speaker will sound slightly better but you'll get the idea. The strange thing is the Echo's speaker actually will sound decent if you hold it in your hand with the bottom facing out. This doesn't work if you place it upside down on a surface (I tried all sorts of different surfaces), only if you hold it in your hand. If you just want to hear Alexa's voice the built in speaker will suffice. But if you would like to listen to music on your Echo you should order an external speaker to go with it or prepare to be disappointed.

Title: Blown speaker after 7 months
Body: This is update since Amazon took off my negative reviewthe speaker blew out after 7 months and now it doesn't detect my voice as well as it used to.  It is frustrating if I have to buy one every few months. The warranty is only 3 months so they must think it will only last that long.It might be worth getting Google Home since the quality of the product seems to degrade over time.Update:Amazon called me to replace my product and they just made everything worse. They promised to replace my item and then did a bait and switch and tried to sell me the same product at 20% off.  That's unethical.1. Amazon called me to replace the product.2. Amazon system went down and the representive couldn't replace my item. They made notes of our conversation and told me to call back.3. The new rep who was an overseas customer service center read the notes and told me they couldn't replace my item...they only offered a discount.4. I spent 2.5 hours with as they told me that they were unable to replce my item only to check their recorded calls and agree they had made a mistakeSo basically they called me to tell me to replace my item only to keep me on the phone for 2.5 hours trying to sell me their defective product again. Instead of replacing a $30 device that cost $3 to make they just lost a loyal customer. That's bad basiness, I'll buy Google products instead

Title: We still have bonding to do but.. I_l give it 5 Stars for Customer Service!
Body: It has been two days of me trying to get Alexa to simply learn my voice. I try a few times, unplug it, put it away, and try some more. I_e grown completely frustrated with this ufo looking thing my sister swore would simplify my life! So far I am thoroughly disappointed! I am trying one more thing to strengthen WiFi even though all other devices work fine. But after that. I give up on you Alexa. Sorry gal ya gotta go.UPDATE: So while out shopping I received a phone call from Amazon. Reluctant to speak based on the unknown number, the woman was funny with her tiny hello. She was calling about my previous 1 star review! =O Holy Moly customer service! Later I was sent an email to follow a link for help with my misguided Alexa. After many trials, errors, laughs, a 45 ish minute wait for another update, another friendly call back at the time promised by Customer Service, Alexa can stay! Thank you!

Title: My first Echo ...won't be the last.
Body: This is my first Echo and first experience with the Alexa technology in my home. I bought it to pair with a LIFX smart bulb and it works great. I've learned to create reminders and routine. I like making lists that are available on my Galaxy smart phone also. I have created routines and still learning new things.  I plan to buy another Echo--the larger Gen 2 with a better speaker to play music but will still use this Echo Dot for many tasks.  Echo Dot does not have excellent sound -- and that's why 4 stars and not 5 -- but I am 100% satisfied with it's functionality and that it is an inexpensive introduction to the Alexa wifi virtual assistant technology that I intend to expand in my home.

Title: From Gen 2 to Gen 3..
Body: This Gen 3 Echo Dot is awesome! The sound is so much deeper and full. The Amazon Alexa app even has equalizer. This Dot makes a perfect device for  office, kitchen or bedroom listening. I definitely recommend this for someone who wants a compact listening device with an option for aux plug from a media device. However,  you can connect via bluetooth so not sure you'd use the aux plug(maybe for an iPod). Cool feature in the Alexa app, you can set your devices to home or away. In the event of loud glass breaking it will alert you. Neat idea! Overall for the sale price of $29.99 (previously $19.99 on Prime Day) this is a great buy. Fun for all ages.

Title: LOVE THIS ALEXIA
Body: I already have an Alexia Gen 2, which I love. I use her for everything but she's at the other end of the house, so I put this "oatmeal" colored Gen 3 Alexia.  This one feels like heavy cotton, feels much heavier and sturdier than the Gen 2. The speaker is bigger so I think the music is louder.  I love both of them. Would buy this Alexia again.  Very well put together and craftsmanship is really great!!!  Love the color too, instead of just hockey puck black.

Title: Echo dot is almost as good as the Echo 2nd Generaton
Body: I purchased the Echo Dot 3rd Generation on Amazon Prime Day Deals.  I could not pass this deal up with the Amazon Smart Plug included.  I was pleasantly surprised at the sound quality, volume of this Echo Dot.  I do not remember the previous version of the Dot but this is very much improved over the previous versions.  I wanted another Echo for my powder room but did want to pay the price for another Echo.  Music sounds great on this little device.  Perhaps I am using this in a small powder room but it sounds almost quite as good as my Echo Second Generation.  It was easy to connect, easier than my second Echo, and it is small.  I understand it is larger than the previous Echo Dots but I dot notremember what the size of the previous  version was. Even though it's larger than the original Echo Dot, it is still very small.  If you would like a smart speaker and can not afford the Echo, buy this you will not be disappointed.  I like the idea that you can buy a wall adapter to hang it up on the wall by just plugging the Dot into adapter.  It will be out of the way.  Check for deals,as this can be had for a very affordable price.

Title: Love It
Body: Purchased two of these for two different rooms.  Also purchased smart outlet plugs to automate the house.  My original intent was to buy one of these to control the garage door opener after purchasing a WIFI module for the opener, but it turns out there is an additional fee from the garage door opener company to link to Alexa which I am not willing to pay a yearly fee to add the functionality.  Mainly use this to check the weather and trigger sequences to turn on and off various things in the house.  The kids seem to think it is fun to make Alexa tell jokes or sing songs.  Will have a good time discovering additional features.  Sound is amazing for such a small device, loud, and lots of bass (surprisingly).  Would purchase again.  Love the fact it gives me notifications on my Prime purchases.

Title: So far so good!
Body: Purchased this window or Amazon_ annual sale and I_ so happy I did to replace my echo that too. The volume on this one is a lot better quality that doesn_ require using my sound bar like my original one. It also recognizes my voice better however sometimes I have to repeat the questions twice. Ironically if someone is saying Alexa on TV which seats next to the echo he has no problem recommendin purchased this when do I Amazons annual sale and I_ so happy I did to replace my echo that too. The volume on this one is a lot better quality that doesn_ require using my sound bar like my original one. It also recognizes my voice better however sometimes I have to repeat the questions twice. Ironically if someone is saying Alexa on TV which sits next to the echo he has no problem Recognizing their voice. I_ trying to use it a lot more than my echo to because my coworker says that it provides great value. So far so good!

Title: Didn't listen while playing music on decent volume
Body: When the song is playing on a volume greater than 6 it does not listen it's name "Alexa". Finally has to use hardware volume buttons. Setting up my voice profile was a big trouble it keeps getting stuck _ in between. Cannot play songs on YouTube. One day I asked to play songs by the artist Sanam Puri and it played some bhangra song from an old Bollywood movie. So frustrated with it's performance. I have a Google home mini which works perfectly fine in all these cases. I bought this Alexa to gift it to my father but now I don't think hw will be able to use this device _. I have to gift him Google home mini instead.I hope Amazon will improve it's conversational AI and send the update so that it would be worth using it.

Title: Only real complaint is Voice Recognition
Body: As a whole I love the Alexa product line. Before buying any Echo Dots, which at the time the 2nd generation was the most recent version, I had read reviews about how great the voice recognition was and how the dot would pick up the users commands even with the TV on etc. This has not been my experience, both with the 2nd gen and 3rd gen. I was hoping the 3rd gen would be better.  I mainly only use Alexa for security and smart home functionality with the Ring skill and the voice recognition is my only real complaint with the product. My living room, dining room and kitchen area is a mostly open floor plan and approx. 1200 sq. ft. and I've tried all kinds of configurations with the goal being me being able to speak at my normal voice level or even slightly louder with the TV on and no matter where I am at and Alexa picking me up the first time and I have not been able to achieve this or really even close to it. Sometimes I have to almost yell. I have the dots plugged directly into outlets using 3rd party holders as I'm a minimalist and like to keep the clutter to a minimum. I have 4, all 3rd gen, and they are spaced pretty evenly apart. I don't have the TV off very much when I'm at home but I believe voice recognition is not an issue when its turned off even if i dropped it down to only 1 or 2 dots.

Title: 2 out of 3 Echo Dots quite playing music
Body: I've worked with customer support on the problem with my 2nd Echo Dot(3rd generation).  The problem is when playing music it will stop mid song after a couple of minutes, wait 30 seconds and then start playing a totally new song.  I've done everything customer support told me and nothing changed.  My 1st Echo Dot does not have this problem  Finally decided to replace the 2nd Echo Dot with a new one.  The new one came and had the same exact problem.  Tried everything I did with customer service and still no resolution.  These Echo Dots were my initial test for deciding what platform to use for smart home devices in my new house.  While the first Echo Dot works great, the fact that these latest two do not work and customer support has no resolution leaves me thinking that Amazon may not be in my future new house.

Title: Easy for an older person to set up
Body: I admit that I was intimidated at the thought of setting up the Echo Dot (3rd Gen) - Smart speaker with Alexa by myself.  I normally have one of my children come set up things for me.  I followed the directions and had the Echo dot set up in no time at all.  I love being able to set reminders and being able to ask Alexa questions or to find a recipe.  I'm sure as time goes on I will learn more about Alexa's capabilities and begin to use other features.

Title: Invite Alexa over
Body: Recently decided to jump aboard and get _lexa in my home. I was indecisive on whether or not if I really needed it... but the answer is yes. I love having the ability to easily listen to my music, and is able to pick my stations (that I actually like). Also connected it too a smart plug which is rather useful. I can spend my mornings easily listening to NPR and evenings jamming to tunes. I recommend it !

Title: Great product. Thoughtful and entertaining
Body: I'm completely in love with alexa. As lazy as it may sound, this tiny device and the app on my phone does so much for me. I've paired it with smart bulbs, my Bluetooth bose, and smart plugs. I'm pretty sure this is one of the best devices Amazon has to offer. We caught them again on sale and for 22.00 at bestbuy and was able to get one for every room in the house. The sound quality is excellent, it's so good sometimes I fail to tell her to connect to the Bluetooth because it's loud enough. Now my drawback is even tho we have one in every room, you have to buy a family subscription to Amazon music to play music more than one device at the time. But if you want her to broadcast the news, the weather, read you a book or the kids a bedtime story, she's amazing. When we leave home, we can tell her to cut the lights on or off by using the app. Now she has a feature I don't quite understand, when you leave you tell her you are leaving, she says OK I will start guarding. But if and when there is noise in the house, she doesn't record the sounds of voices and she doesn't notify you about it either. I had it set to guard, my son and his girlfriend came in from out of town walking taking laughing etc, she did nothing. I come home and tell her I'm home, and she says OK I'll stop guarding. I think the away features should be tweeked. At least let the guard mode send you a notification and a clip of the sounds involved, or send a notification and let you listen to the background so you can decide if it's someone who is supposed to be there or something isn't right. Maybe the technology is still too new but I really hope this feature gets addressed.. It could be valuable and it definitely needs some attention. I've also purchased these at 22.00 for my family members and some friends but with the sale, there was a limit on how many I could buy. At full price, I would only have the one device. I have a Sonos speaker with alexa built-in in my living room but on the other side, I have an echo dot as well. I brag about the features to any friends unfamiliar with it and some of them have bought them and love them just as much as we do. I also bought a 2nd generation from eBay for 10.00 for my grandson whose still little, he likes it but she doesn't understand a word he says..lol. But his mom can walk in his room and tell alexa to read him a book, or tell him a story. They also come with their own phone number which I really like and you can talk room to room. It's hard to get use to calling from it instead of using facetime but it's still handy. Sometimes when you ask for a specific song, you have to pronounce it very proper or she won't understand it. Sometimes she won't understand it or say she can't find it or she will just play some off the wall song that has the same phonics as the title. But to solve that, when I ask for a hard to understand title, I just use the search in my app. I can leave it playing music when I go to work and it plays til I get home. My dog doesn't have to sit in silence. This review ended up being very long but I hope it's helpful. I still haven't learned all she can do yet but I'm working on it... Mad at Amazon right now because they have a stand alone alexa for your car, my friend got hers for 19 bucks but they tell me, I have to be on a waiting list. I don't like the waiting part and who knows how long it will be lol. So for now I have to use the app and my car Bluetooth, but I will survive. If I get comfortable with using just the app in the car, I might not even need the stand alone device.

Title: extremely hard to set up
Body: i am 78 years old. in my day they had a wonder full way of turning on an electrical appliance. it is called a flip switch. flip  it up and the machine goes on. flip it down and the machine goes off. i cannot see why the pc cannot tell the ecko dot how to turn on by itself. but alexa is great in what it can do.

Title: Easy and fun to use. Over 40 and thrilled I bought it.
Body: I am not technologically savvy at all and I no problem hooking this up. I bought one on Prime day and then bought an additional two for my home and some smart plugs. I have Alexa in three rooms and set up now to be able to utilize my smart plug so I can turn the lights off and on as I come in or out of the house or up or down the stairs. I get my morning briefing on whatever topics I choose like how many days till the next holiday. I had no smart items in my home and my cell phone is 3 generations behind and I found this easy-to-use and actually a lot of fun. I did sign up for Prime this year so I got the Prime music and all I have to do is tell Alexa what song I want to hear and it plays. My kid meowed at it and Alexa interacts and meows back. It's really just a lot of fun if you're over 40 like me and afraid of this, don't be, it was extremely inexpensive and I have a Galaxy S6 and that's what I use to set it up and I'm really glad I did this.

Title: We love ALEXA!
Body: I purchased as an impulse on Amazon Prime Day, mainly to use as a music speaker, UNTIL a friend told me about all the great things Alexa can do. Our whole family enjoys all her amazing features. I also feel like I am finally catching up on some of our ever-changing technology options, while it gives me some serious piece of mind in regards to her communication features and security system syncing.

Title: Cool if it's free
Body: I got my Echo as a "gift with purchase" when I got a new Insignia TV at Best Buy (August 2019), which is the only reason I even have an Echo Dot. I had no desire/need for it, but it's been a fun addition. I don't use it to its potential, partially because I'm not used to it and forget about it even being on my nightstand, but the few tricks I resort to are nice (morning routine/alarm, light and TV switch on-off, weather forecasts).The biggest thing was having to figure out what each color ring means - yes, there's several colors and speed associated with different notifications/status of the device. That's kind of a pain, as you have to memorize them all or pull up the help section on your phone every time the device lights up without being prompt to. I have had a few issues when I had to log out of my amazon account on my tv and log back in - Alexa didn't automatically reconnect to the account, and it took a good 20 minutes for me to figure out what was going on. Voice recognition can be obnoxious too, as sometimes I have to really raise my voice even if I'm in the same room as the device - and people in other rooms can definitely hear me "yell" at it "ALEXA!"Overall, it's a fun little gadget to have around the house. I'm obsessed with its design and have been told you can actually even buy cases/masks for it if you want it a different color/pattern. Wouldn't have spent my money on it, but that's just me!

Title: Slight improvements over the 2nd Generation Echo Dot
Body: Seems the sound quality is better with the 3rd Gen version.  Seems like it can "hear" you voice better than the 2nd gen, notice it most with a lot of background noise.  I think it also looks better.  Only slight changes from the 2nd gen, but I love my 2nd Gen Echo Dots.  My brother bought me my first Echo Dot for Christmas a few years ago along with a couple of smart plugs.  Nice present, and something I wanted, but not something I would have bought for myself. Nice little "toy" to have I thought.  Now I have some type of Alexa device in every room in my house, 2 in some rooms if you count the Fire Sticks, not to mention my Ring Doorbell, Ring Alarm System, smart plugs, etc.  Oh, I also have an Alexa Auto in my truck.  Probably not the best person to review Alexa and Alexa enabled devices.  Amazon now owns me.  That nice little toy I got a few years ago has taken over my house, truck, and me.  On the rare events when the Internet goes out, it has the same impact on my life as the power going out.

Title: Pretty useless
Body: Okay so that title's not entirely true, because it's nice to ask alexa to turn the volume down or hit the next song, but even those commands don't always work.the speaker sounds muffled, but if you're in a roommate situation it gets loud enough, i have a second speaker now but i was already going into this relationship knowing i'd have to supplement with thatit's a bit inconvenient because you trust that your music will shuffle or loop but it doesn't and you have to manually ask for those commands each time or set them in your phone, kind of takes away the purpose of it thoughthe volume controls were easily the most irritating thing, i still have this dot and the comprehension from the voice commands just isn't there

Title: A Must Have
Body: This product has helped improve day do day life.  I connected my device to lights so now instead of stumbling in the dark until I find a light switch, I just ask Alexa to turn the lights on.  I've enabled skills and connected Alexa to my spotify so I'm able to listen to news and music while I'm tidying up around the house.  Alexa has also connected to my contacts so I'm able to call people through my device.The speaker has excellent quality as well.  A friend who was visiting once was surprised that the music I was playing was coming out of my dot.  The sound quality is phenomenal for a device that small.I've also noticed that Alexa is getting better at understanding Southern Accents.  If you're a southerner who has been hesitant about buying one due to bad voice recognition experiences in the past, you won't be disappointed by Alexa.

Title: Sound Quality Sucks Compared to Earlier Versions of Echo Dot
Body: I received my new Echo Dot (ordered on Prime Day 2019). It was delayed in delivery due to the high volume of purchasers on Prime Day. However, this Echo Dot has the worst sound quality of any of my dots I've purchased. (I have 5 of them throughout my house and garage. I don't know if they rush ordered these from China and bypassed the quality control or if they made them cheaply to offer at the 1/2 price discount for Prime Day...but I'm totally disappointed. I'd return it, except then I'd have to pay full price (and I already turned in my better performing 2nd Gen Echo Dot for the trade-in discount). Buyers beware - you get what you pay for! :(

Title: Sounded muffled. Gen 1 sounds better
Body: I purchased this on Amazon Day and got a great deal. I have a 1st generation that I have been very happy with so I wanted to have a dot for my bathroom. The first one arrived and from the get go I was unimpressed. It sounded muffled and I tried it in different rooms in the house but nothing helped. I exchanged the Echo Dot through Amazon and the second one sounded exactly the same, muffled. I did find the settings and turned the bass all the way down and that seemed to help some but not enough. My 1st gen still sounds way better. When I talked to Amazon about doing one last exchange to see if I could get a good product and was told that my only option was to return it for a refund and repurchase. Now they cost twice as much......

Title: Pairing sucks  very few products supported.
Body: I find that this product is a lot harder to pair with your home devices. Google mini Will pair within seconds with the Alexa device you have to jump through a whole bunch of hoops it's kind of ridiculous.  UPDATE  Amazon contacted me and put me in touch with support to help pair.  Alexa is NOT compatible with LG tv's, Vizio Soundbars, and several other popular products.  Google Home Supports all these devices and more and connects in seconds.  I don't know why this product is so popular unless it's just popular with people who don't want there house connected to the device.  I regret this purchase.

Title: Incredibly Helpful Device
Body: I ordered my Echo Dot on July 27th 2019 as my mother and her significant other had owned one downstairs. I realized overtime how helpful it was so I ordered it as part of my early birthday money.I use my Echo Dot for alarms, weather updates, timers, google questions, sleep sounds. She has been so perfect for me and you have the option to change her wake from Alexa, Echo, Computer. I also use my Echo Dot for my lighting in my room that changes color and I can adjust them by saying the name of the light and the color I want along with dimming percentage.She helps with math questions and just everything you can think of as I listed. It's great for being lazy too, haha. Just the best purchase I've ever made off Amazon hands down. Go get yourself one!

Title: Ordered 2 (1 had responsive glitch, fixed)
Body: I_ not sure how to rate this. I just received my devices and have used them for a full day. I do love the product, but I ordered 2 devices and one doesn_ work properly. I have to unplug it and plug it back in before speaking or give the command for it to do an action to the other device In order to get it to work. It_ very annoying.I would return the 2nd device and exchange it, but I live abroad and it_ not cost effective to do so. A bit disappointed.(Update) I found an online recommendation for a fix, changing the Wake word improves responsiveness. Upgraded my review to 4-stars This is a great organizational tool, but there are improvements to be made. It would be nice to see improvements in voice recognition, additionally clarity in Alexa_ voice, and more support between apps and devices, such as Apple Watch. I_ interested to do how these types of devices develop I the future.

Title: Problems right out of the box
Body: I recently purchased a new WiFi smart thermostat and received an echo dot 3rd gen for free.  It did not take long to realize why they were giving them away.  The set up was seemingly simple how ever the function of the unit pails in comparison to my two Google home minis.  When playing music the audio cuts out constantly. Sometimes it will pickup were it left off and other times it will skip to the next song.  After doing a quick search online it became quite apparent that this is a largely know problem.  Sorry Amazon but you have some work to do.  Let me know if you want  it back....  After speaking with someone who instructed how to perform and update on the device as it is several versions old it did not work.  I spoke to another rep this morning who insists that it is my WiFi and completely ignored the software level even after being told several times.  The product is in a business with top of the line WiFi which supports 5 vehicle scan tool devices with no problems.  Finally she instructed me to ask ALEXA to update software which i cant do because that function is not available with the current software level.  So frustrated and not even worth it since it was free.  This thing is going in the trash and I will be returning my daughters Fire tablet given the poor customer service.

Title: Impressive sound quality and voice recognition.
Body: So, this is my first Alexa device. I'd been holding out because I'd witnessed my friends struggle with earlier versions of Alexa, yelling at it when it didn't obey a voice command and I wasn't impressed by the sound.But, Amazon had a great sale on the Dot so I figured I'd try it out.  The sound quality is amazing. I can't believe this little thing has such a big sound.The voice recognition is really good too. I rarely have to repeat a command and it recognizes even the most brief command from me. For instance, first thing in the morning I'm groggy and mumble "Computer, Lana DelRay" and it plays Lana DelRay easily.I call it "Computer" because you can change the wake word options on this model.  Your choices are Alexa, Amazon, Echo or Computer. I chose Computer because I'm a Trekkie and addressing the device like Jean-Luc Picard makes my inner nerd happy. I assume that's why they made that option available in the first place.I like the Skills. Particularly the morning skill. I can say Good Morning and it gives me the weather, calendar and news.I don't use the "Tell Me Joke" skill or anything like that, but there are a couple of fun Star Trek skills you can add that are fun.All in all I'm very happy with this device. I may have to buy a smart plug for my lamp and expand Alexa's responsibilities.

Title: DONT BUY THE WHITE ONES
Body: I bought a total of four dots recently.  I originally bought two black dots and was over the moon with them so I immediately hopped back on to Amazon and tried to buy two more but all they had left at the time was the white version. I figured the only difference was the color. I was wrong...and the white ones are AWFUL.I have to unplug and restart them every other day because Alexa will say "I'm having a hard time understanding please try later" when we go to use her. We unplug and replug the dot back and she starts working again. until 36-48 hours later when we have to do it again.  I have not had to do this with the black version to date (I purchased them on Prime day 2019). Then there is the volume issue with the white ones... If you want to use the "drop in" feature you must have the volume up all the way and the other person still comes through like a whisper. So when you go to play music or listen to an audio book you get blasted. Again, I have do not have this issue with the black dots. The main reason I bought the additional dots was for this issue. I have three kids and we live in a 4400 sq foot home that doesn't have an intercom system. I figured have four dots (and I had purchased an Echo the year before) would cut down on the yelling in the house.I basically have two great dots and two white paperweights.

Title: WiFi Support Limited up to "N"!
Body: I purchased 3 Amazon Echo Dot 3rd gen to use as an intercom and for entertainment around my home and I noticed immediately the Echo Dot has severe Wi-Fi COMPATIBILITY issues that are not so beyond average consumers:1) Wi-Fi support is advertised as 2.4 Ghz and 5 Ghz connectivity however the dot will not see 'AC' networks that I have set up. The 2.4 Ghz network still inadequate even though signal strength reports FULL. Checking Wi-Fi signal strength from the access point shows that the Echo Dot 3rd Gen has a signal quality of above 80% and even comparing superior, similar, and inferior devices with much lower signal strength and a much higher SNR (Signal to Noise Ratio) the Echo Dot is guaranteed to have issues. I am so astonished by the design of something that can't even stay connected as well as something with batteries!2) The Echo Dot 3rd Generation does not have a "built-in" battery for a  "lightweight speaker" and using the Alexa app for "setting it up" becomes a routine nuisance. It would be much better if voice prompts could be eliminated altogether and "maybe if it just had lights"... must be the ULTRA COOL THERMODYNAMIC DESIGNIt can definitely keep your beer cold!

Title: Very disappointed
Body: After a year of using my Echo Plus as an alarm clock in my studio apartment, I found myself missing it when I moved into a place with walls. I bought the Dot when it was on sale for $29.99 because, not only did I now need one for my bedroom, but it was cheaper than a lot of alarm clock options. The best of both worlds. WELL. The error message of Not Being Able to Connect to the Internet became a daily problem very quickly. I tried every troubleshoot from every blog I could find, and I spent quite some time on the phone with amazon trying to figure out why it wasn_ working. Surprise! If it isn_ connected to the internet, the alarm won_ go off. So I woke up late for work and decided it was the last straw. I think I got a dud and it_ going back.As if this wasn_ already kind of disappointing, I am not allowed to do an even swap for a new Dot. The only option I was given, aside from mailing it in and having techs look at it for an undisclosed amount of time was to return it (since I am still within the return window.) However, the price has risen to $49.99, so if I want a new one I have to pay the difference, which is ridiculous. My Echo Plus stays connected just fine. And the Dot was maybe 20 feet from my router, so, again, I think I just got a dud. It_ disappointing that they couldn_ do an even exchange of a Dot for a Dot, especially since this thing stopped working almost immediately. And frankly, when it worked it was a cool gadget, but I am not sure it_ worth $50.

Title: I'M IN LOVE WITH MY TECHNOLOGY
Body: I'm in love with this Amazon Echo Dot.  Where has this thing been all my life?  I must have more of them for other rooms.  In fact, I've already bought another one.  You can play music, get immediate answers to all sorts of questions, get recipes, play games, and more.  I'm sooooooo thrilled with this, I can't even hardly type this review.  It's the most fabulous thing ever,  you have GOT to try this.  I can't wait until they put "Alexa" into a real moving robot.  It will probably happen in the future, and it will be super awesome.  Meanwhile, let's enjoy our Echo Dot - it's very worth getting several of these for all over the house.  It's a MUST-HAVE.  I'm absolutely DELIGHTED!!!

Title: Alexa is my new PA
Body: This is our first echo dot and w love it! It gets what we ask on the first try, and unlike Siri, the echo dot understands our questions or commands from cross the room. It_ great to ask it o play music I like, set a timer, play hide and seek with my kids, question of the day, or even play the specific episode of my current podcast. Sometimes I notice it lights up when I walk past it, maybe listening for a command. So I guess that might be why people say it_ always listening? Anyway, we are pleased with it and now we got second one for upstairs.

Title: Patience
Body: Seems I cannot pause in the middle of a question or inquiry without her turning back off. Most people pause in a sentence where a comma would be. Then I have to start over. This is my only complaint. I use it all the time to make phone calls, check on weather, play music and questions so I do not have to pause in my work to find the answer. On the last version people could barely hear me unless I was standing right in front of it, no more. Very happy with it!

Title: Impressive sound quality
Body: Very good sound quality and fast selections. At the promotion price I bought 2. Don_ regret it at all. Fully recommend to anyone. The free music selection is phenomenal,  I hear songs from artist that I never knew they had done. My selection is easy listening like Buble, Stewart, Denver, Journey, Eagles, Queen, Sheeren and Spanish singers like Gloria, Solis, Lopez. The selection is out of this world.

Title: My toddler uses it more than me
Body: My echo dot is a fancy baby shark machine in my kitchen. It also plays _ou_e Welcome by Duane _he Rock Johnson from Moana over and over some days.I really enjoy it because now I can listen to podcasts without burning through my battery or while surfing Facebook. I bought 2 others but have yet to install in other rooms and sun them.

Title: Annoying as ****
Body: I only wanted it for one reason. That whenever I come home and want to relax I can just give it an command by voice to play my music. It seem there no way for it to create my own personal music play list. I can not upload or add music that I already have safe on my phone or computer to make the play list. I have to use crappy 3rd party music apps or spend more money to buy songs I already have if I wanted to make my own music play list.update after 3 whole days since my first review of this because it has since an high star review rate I wanted to give it an chance and keep using it. Honestly I only bought it because it was on sale for 29.99 instead of the normal 50dollars and I have to say this is one of the worst 30dollars I have ever spend and I have spend my money recklessly a lot during my life. If you try to give it two commands in one sentence it will completely ignore you and not reply back at all. For example " Alexa I do not like this song stop playing this song. " Alexa will just ignore it and keep playing. You need to say " Alexa I do not like this song" than it will add to the list of song. Than after that yu have to say " Alexa stop playing this song" for it to stop playing the song. Another issue I have is that I can not type in the song titles that I want to listen to and have to keep saying the music title and names of the artists. Can not even type in the song title on the Alexa app on my phone that connect to the device.

Title: Works as well and sounds as great as the Alexa.
Body: Let me start off by saying I am not very tech savvy.  I had no idea what the difference was between the Alexa or the Echo dot. I ordered the Dot. The set up was quite simple.  There are step by step instructions on how to download the app and get it set up on your network.  I had it programmed and up and running in no time.I am so glad I went on and purchased this.  I was worried that I wouldn't use it very much and it would not be as good as the Alexa. But that was not the case.  My 4 y.o. and I love doing many things with Echo. Setting reminders, alarms , listening to music/ podcasts are just a few of the things we use it for everyday.  My favorite is being able to listen to music while I am in the kitchen cooking.  I can skip songs, pause the music and even turn the volume down all without having to stop what I am doing. I would definitely recommend buying the Echo dot. We now have 4 of them in our house!

Title: Alexa is my best friend
Body: I love my Alexa (Echo Dot). Whenever I feel the need to google something I just have to ask Alexa. I don't even do math anymore, Alexa is my math wiz. I use it most often for listening to music, and that's the one thing it still lacks on - sound quality. It doesn't really go that high in volume and the quality of the sound isn't that great. It's not bad, but I have cheaper wireless speakers that are louder and have better sound. I still love it though because I can just tell it to play the songs I want.

Title: Voice command is very good
Body: We received an Echo Dot (3rd gen) for Christmas and my wife took full possession of it so I bought another for me. This one doesn't function as well as the first. It starts and stops and will sometimes play for hours as background music and other times stops after perhaps two songs, five songs; it can be any combination of continuous songs.  If there are upgrades in quality, (not just price) and you are determined to have one, spend the money for better quality.

Title: Know before you buy!
Body: Love this as long as I'm connecting at home but if you travel for work like I do its basically worthless. Most times it won't connect in hotels and if it does the connection isn't stable. It won't even connect in a corporate apartment.It's fine when I'm home but since I'm rarely there it's going to be gifted to someone else.There should be a warning about connection issues. They also said I could possibly hotspot it for a connection but since I'm not in the country I'd probably get roaming charges. If I had known I wouldn't have purchased this or the music upgrade. Waste of money!

Title: Announcements are the best!
Body: Addition to our family echo dot lineup.  We love the ability to make announcements across our house.  Really cut down on the yelling to get our voice heard from one level to the next.  Nighttime music and sleep timer is used every night.  Never wanted these devices but now that we have a few we love them.  Really spend some time playing with the skills and reading some articles to get the most out of your device. Wish I did that a lot sooner.

Title: Compact alternative to the full size Echo
Body: We have had a full size Echo in our family room for more than a year, and wanted to have Alexa pipe music in our living room as well.  The Echo Dot is a very nice,  unobtrusive unit, and its audio output plug allows us to directly connect it (rather than depending upon a Bluetooth receiver) to our home entertainment unit and its 12" subwoofer, for much richer music than any built-in small speaker could hope to achieve.

Title: Alexa, order another Echo Dot!
Body: O.k. I had NO IDEA that the Echo Dot could work all on its own! I thought that you had to have a base Alexa unit, and the dots were just add-ons. Nope! I was recently at a BBQ and they were entertaining the birthday guests with the Echo Dot! Alexa even sang Happy Birthday to the birthday girl! How crazy is that? The host had the Echo Dot connected to this really cool Bluetooth speaker and it sounded great in the backyard, in fact, they had to keep turning it down because people were yelling over the music!After the party I was sold and had to go home and order my own Echo Dot! It is insane how much this little device can do! You can ask Alexa anything and she will come up with an answer from google. Very rarely does she not have an answer for your question. She will tell you jokes, weather, news, etc. You can set timers, alarms, add items to your grocery/to do list, or control your smart T.V. without even picking up the remote!The Echo Dot sounds phenomenal. For the small size (about the size of your palm) this thing can put out a lot of sound! and if you are trying to be quiet , you can whisper to Alexa and she will whisper back to you! You can tell Alexa to play a specific song, or a genre of music and rock out for hours. You can make hands free calls to your loved ones!I am in love with my new Echo Dot and will be purchasing more for other rooms in the house (you can even sync music and notifications to all of the dots throughout your house!)My one complaint about the Echo Dot is the length of the cord. I wish it were a bit longer, but hey, minor detail. I would recommend this to anyone who likes a little hands free technology and entertainment in their home!

Title: Hands free! Great sound quality.
Body: Okay so I_e been eyeing these guys for a long time. When they went on sale I decided it was time. I mostly use it for music, reminders and timers. So far I_ happy with the before mentioned. I am however annoyed that the Pandora app doesn_ work well with the device. I_e been listening to amazons music option, it_ similar to pandora but works much better with this device. I_ sure apps will become more compatible in the future.I_ be interested in getting more and using them as intercoms in our home. This seems like a really cool option to get the kids up in the morning or tell them it_ time to do something. Or that they can come out of their timeouts! LolI also like that you can use FreeTime like on the kids tablets and it will read to them.It_ a cool little device with excellent sound quality. I normally stream music thru the tv. Now I don_ have to and it_ hands free! I love it!!!

Title: A nice addition to daily carpentry projects
Body: I purchased this to stream music, radio stations and podcasts while working on various projects around and outside the house. It has decent sound quality, an upgrade from a transistor radio but that's about it. Voice recognition and streaming functions are excellent. One smallish complaint: it stops from time to time for no apparent reason, but will then resume on command most of the time. Also worth noting, perhaps: it doesn't like to get too hot. It has shut down on multiple occasions when it was placed in full sunlight on a hot day. After some minutes in the shade, it will reboot. Overall, a nice way to have on demand entertainment while working on a project.

Title: The sound is terrible: Muffled
Body: I have not found a fix for the sound issue with the Dot 3.It's terrible the sound is so Muffled you can barely make out what is said music not clear. I'm not the only one with this issue. All the fixes on the internet apply to the DOT 2 not the 3. There is no firmware update to fix the sound. I'm so disappointed! You may want to see if there is a fix for this BEFORE you order this model!

Title: You may integrate it in your life in areas you never dreamed!
Body: I love owning this! There is no way I'm using it to it's fullest potential, though I've picked several things that I want it to do and it does them almost flawlessly.I have personalized it, too. I went on vacation for a week. When I got home I asked Alexa if she missed me (jokingly). She responded that it's great to have me back lolCON: I told her that I was depressed. She responded by giving me several numbers I could call. Knowing that if I were a teenager that wouldn't help me, I told her I just wanted to talk to her. She sent me to an AI who basically tried to force me to talk about movies. I tried again but adding that I wanted to hurt myself. She sent me to a different AI. It's not good at helping someone who may be suicidal.

Title: Very Pleased
Body: I upgraded from an original Dot to this 3rd Generation Dot and couldn't be more pleased.  I wanted better sound quality because I listen to a lot of music on it.  The sound is considerably louder and also richer.  And there was another plus for me.  On the original Dot I had to turn straight to it for it to hear me.  I can have my back turned to the new one and am still clearly heard.  I got the gray one and think it looks very nice.

Title: Alexa and Amazon are getting a little too big for there britches!
Body: Alexa and the echo devices are becoming increasingly less cooperative every time I use them.  Cannot get them to work the way they are supposed to like playing the same music on multiple echo devices through creating a home group.  I made sure I am on the family plan so I keep upping my subscriptions and I keep experiencing more and more technical difficulties.  How much does it cost before it just stops working and gives me the big middle finger?  Seriously thinking about getting rid of all forms of Alexa, echo devices and Amazon all together.  If I can't get what I want and am already paying the top price for all of amazon's music services there is nothing else I can do but stop giving them my money!

Title: Love it!
Body: Constantly finding new ways to use Alexa! Us over 50 crowd can really appreciate how exciting tools like Echo Dot are!I'm taking it for granted that I can ask Alexa to play any music track  - and it streams down upon me!  40 years ago that would have entailed - driving over to the record store - making the purchase bringing it home -  putting it on the record player and an hour or so later listening to it. Thanks, Amazon!!PS- I do miss not having record stores.

Title: Better than 2nd Generation and good value
Body: I replaced a second generation Echo Dot with this model. I like the looks and the volume can be turned up a lot higher without distortion.  Only drawback I have found is that the sound is heavy on the bass and even getting Alexa to turn up the treble it still not great voice talk radio. However, for music it is great. Good price and versatility.

Title: Not as good as Google Home mini
Body: We were previously a Google home but the concept of "Drop in" was the deciding factor to switch.  After using the Echo for a few weeks we have discovered that the voice recognition is not quite as good, the returned answers are not quite as good and 1/2 the time when we use the drop in features we end up standing next to the Echo yelling at it so the person on the other end can hear us. Overall disappointed.

Title: Love the sound quality and nee look of this version
Body: Great sound from such a small device. Location selection can make a huge difference in sound quality and voice recognition. Placing near a wall / metal objects can cause echoes which can confuse alexa or distort the sound quality.Some apps are great.  Others need improvement.  Depends what you are using the smart device for and the product support associated with the external device.Voice recognition works great, even with kids still learning to speak.  Our little one is able to request his favorite children's song without a problem

Title: Newest batch defective
Body: We already have a few 3rd Gen Dots in our house and they have always worked perfectly (not the greatest sound quality but they work perfectly).  This makes it easy to stream music to all of the Alexa devices at the same time.  Incidentally, we also have a Show and a Spot which both work just fine too.  I recently purchased two new Dots on sale from Amazon...  I spent a week trying to get them to work to no avail.  They just drop out when playing music after only 1-3 songs.I went nuts checking my internet and wifi signals everywhere...  our wifi coverage is all great.  Next, I moved on to just testing an old Dot in its usual place for an hour...  worked perfectly streaming music.  Then replaced it with a new Dot in the same exact location...  it would drop out to silence within 1-3 songs.  Put the old Dot back in place...  worked perfectly for an hour.  I did this with both Dots in multiple locations and the two new Dots consistently failed.  It was clearly the new Dots that had some defective component in them.I've returned the two Dots.  The return process was a nightmare as well.  I wanted to exchange these for new ones but I had to wait on a call from Customer Service...  I couldn't just check off an exchange on their returns page.  They insisted upon talking to Customer Service...  the page indicated they would call within 10 mins or so...  I waited two hours...  no call.  In the end, I have opted to return for a full refund instead.When I purchase the last 2-3 Dots that I need to complete the home, if I get one more defective unit, I am done with the Echo line.  I'll toss them all in the garbage and purchase another brand.  This problem has wasted far too much of my time.  Amazon's exchange procedures were impossible to use too.

Title: Terrible voice recognition compared to 2nd gen, and very frustrating
Body: I have three Echo Dots, but this is my only 3rd Gen Echo Dot  yet it_ the one that works the most poorly. It has a terrible time hearing or recognizing commands. I keep the new Echo Dot downstairs, and my older Echo Dots upstairs. When I am downstairs and give an Alexa command, the upstairs ones can hear me, but the downstairs one can_! It_ frustrating if what I am wanting is music or audio, since I cannot hear the upstairs ones very well from downstairs, but they can hear me give the command from downstairs. When I play Jeopardy, for example, I can scream right into the new 3rd gen, and it does not recognize my answer. My two 2nd generations never had this problem, and they still don_. Until Amazon comes out with a better version, you are better off getting the 2nd gen Echo dot and attaching a Bluetooth speaker to it to get the superior sound that the 3rd gen is supposed to provide. Currently, the 3rd gen is a waste of your money.

Title: Hooray for Alexa!
Body: I highly recommend the Echo Dot 3rd generation to anyone looking to delve into Alexa products or looking to update their current wares. We currently have 5 total in our house -- two 2nd generations + three 3rd generations -- and the sound quality of the 3rd generation is far superior. While the unit itself may be little, these provide perfect (and booming, if you want!) ambience for parties, endless entertainment for kids (try, "Alexa, tell me bedtime story!"), and a great & accessible hub for controlling smart house functions.For the not-quite-perfect aspects, we've had a bit of trouble with the voice recognition at times. Not only does Alexa refuse to pronounce my name even remotely right, she often misunderstands (I'd say once out of every 5 commands) and sometimes has trouble connecting to the internet, even with a strong signal.That being said, the pros definitely outweigh the cons (really, quite negligible for the benefits), and for the affordable price of the dot, this is a must have!

Title: Free with a purchase.
Body: I honestly cant think of a more useless device. As someone who doesnt enjoy talking to devices and who doesnt have their entire life integrated into devices , the only thing that this is "useful" for is telling my Roomba to start cleaning. But I also have an app on my phone that does that sooo yea, donated this to a new med student.

Title: It_ just okay.
Body: The echo sometimes doesn_ recognize we are calling it. And sometimes decides not to listen.  We use it as a baby monitor (sound only) mostly, for a couple of reasons. 1. We have an Alexa that_ way better. 2. The echo responsiveness or lack of is very frustrating.  3. It doesn_ execute commands correctly.  You can ask it to play a song from an artist and it_l play something entirely different. We_e looking at upgrading to a show but for now this will do.

Title: Pretty cool device
Body: Yes, I'm aware that it's recording everything I say and that I have to tell it daily to delete my voice in the event I say anything worth deleting.  But I just replaced my ancient, beat-up clock radio in the kitchen with this sweet little device that plays my local NPR station, or all the hits of 1991, or the weather.  It even tells me bad jokes.  Plus I finally have someone in the house that I can boss around.  Seriously, the sound on this little inexpensive thing is much better than the pricier radio it replaced.  I couldn't be happier.  I haven't tried integrating it with anything.  That's a little above my pay grade.

Title: Great, but Drop In barely works
Body: I honestly really like this little thing. I got it in white and it looks very nice. Sometimes (and I mean really not too often at all) she'll mishear something and I'm not too frustrated as I know it happens to others as well. I dont have any complaints about the audio quality but I also didn't purchase this to fill my whole entire house with music. It does fill up an entire room though and that's enough for me when I'm relaxing at home. I do have one complaint and it's the only reason I am giving 3 stars. I'm not sure if I received a faulty product but whenever I "drop in" with my boyfriend he'll be trying to talk to me and when I answer, he says he can barely hear me. This is so strange to me because I can hear him just fine and Alexa responds to me even when I'm across the room, but for me to be directly over the Alexa Dot and for him to tell me that with his volume all the way up he can still barely hear me tells me that maybe something's wrong with mine? I'm not sure exactly and it's really strange to me. Also slightly disappointed about that. Other than that, I really like this dot.

Title: Great easily concealed devices!
Body: We were never to "into" this idea.  However the sound quality of the Echo devices is really great and since it's nice to summon music anytime!  So we took the plunge!Also being able to easily set reminders (great for older folks), alarms and multiple timers and ask for solutions to math problems is truly appreciated.  These devices work very well and they provide a great informational interactive opportunity.  Highly recommend!!

Title: For $29.99, it's a good deal
Body: Can retrieve all music in Amazon library, though the library does lack some music.  Sometimes you have to re-phrase request to get what you want.  Must always speak a little loud and definitely clear.  Sound for music is very good from such a small device.  I think it would be a good teaching tool for youngster and easy to use for elderly, unless they forget to say "Alexa" as the first word in their request.

Title: Fun as long as you understand the intrusions
Body: Very simple to link to my laptop, did recognize my small grandson trying to talk to it and wouldn't respond.  It's probably true that "someone" can listen in so we simply unplug it should we decide to have a personal conversation within earshot. I also didn't link it to my phone. Very good at picking up music selections, answering questions and keeping alarms going as needed. Excellent deal for $30!

Title: Doesn't work with streaming Pandora
Body: My Echo and Echo Dot 2nd generation stream Pandora without any difficulty. However, Echo Dot 3rd generation does not. About halfway through a song, the 3rd gen model quit and started a new song. Amazon technical support was not able to fix this, despite putting me through a very long series of steps, resets, reboots, and so on. All was fruitless and so they sent me a new unit, but it has the same problem. It's too bad that Amazon cannot recognize a problem like this and solve it. Ultimately gave me my money back because because of this. Very disappointed, especially since the first and second generations work fine without this problem.

Title: "Hmm, I don't know that"
Body: this is Alexas most frequent response. She knows nothing. Not who discovered America, the date of Bull Run, when the first model T rolled off the Ford line.  She does however, know and to her credit, how to say "Hmm. I don't know that" in a lovely faux-British accent that many New Yorker's adopt when they place reservations at 5-star restaurants (which of course Alexa is clueless at to who they are).Mine went back to its maker after 3 days.  Her memory will haunt me for years--and not in a good way.

Title: Alexa is my first, my last, my everything!
Body: I love my Alexa so much that I don't want to live without her.  She fulfills a lot of my daily needs.  She's there to tell me the weather, to tell me who won a football game or who's playing which teams.  She's there every time I have a question.  She is irreplaceable.  She's my everything.  I love her dearly.  She tells me jokes.  She tells me math problems.  She gives me driving advice.  She lets me play games.  She reminds me to do important tasks. She converts cooking measurements and times.  She knows every recipe.  She speaks every language.  She is a wealth of knowledge.  She's an Enstine and even knows my voice, and my favorite music.  She's better than any human and "SHE"S MINE".... I'm so blessed!!!!!

Title: 100% better then first version
Body: I  have two of the first version and the new one is much better.  The speaker quality and volume is hugely improved and I like the new style (less utilitarian looking).  Was easy to setup (of course) and recognizes my voice even if I'm not speaking loudly.  It's a Echo....what more do you need to know.  Of course, I  have a Google device as well cause neither do everything I want.  Maybe they should mate and produce a Google Little Dot. :)

Title: Better sound than I thought I would find
Body: I was hesitant to buy one of these because some purists had remarked the sound was imperfect. Well, the Echo Dot sounds like a much more expensive speaker. Of course, it cannot compete with Bose Speakers. But for the price and the voice recognition feature plus Alexa integration, I am definitely impressed at the value for money. I must say that the voice recognition is not yet perfect, but it is very good at this skill as well. I have had the device misunderstand my command several times when the air conditioner is running in the room.There is one little drawback to this device. The skills software routines are incapable of running every app you may have or wish to activate. I have a favorite app that runs a music service that is not Amazon, Apple, Spotify, etc. I must start that app manually. Another drawback with the Alexa integrated environment is the Fire Tablet cannot be used as one of the stations in a music group, for example when I want to play music across multiple rooms. For that, you MUST purchase Echo of one model or another. That bothers me since I use a Fire Tablet on a Show Mode Stand to control my integrated home system, but in order for me to have true house-wide music, I must purchase an Echo device for the room in which I have my Fire Tablet on Show Mode setup. In any case, the system is maturing and I am hopeful the Amazon Software Weenies will repair this oversight.

Title: BUYERS BEWARE , Amazon will only replace faulty item with a refurbished one
Body: I ordered two echo dot 3's when Amazon had their "big sale".  One set up to wi-if no problem and has worked great since. The second one, I had to try several times to connect, before I was successful. But it did not stay connected and all I could get out of it was a " I'm having difficulties at this time, please try later" response. At times it would just start talking without even being prompted.Then it might work for a week or so before it wouldn't do anything. I reached out to customer service via chat. That chat lasted over thirty  minutes only to be " disconnected " before problem resolved.  Again I reconnected going thru all the steps.  Week later it didn't stay connected, so I called and talked to a " electronic specialist ".  That call was over half an hour long. I tried requesting a return shipping label, so I could send it back and get a new replacement since it was a faulty device. I was told that is not an option. I would have to send it back and they would fix it.
