I responded that I bought a new item and want a new one as a replacement, not a "FIXED ITEM "  He finally agreed to send out a NEW echo dot and I would have to return the original.  A few days later, I received a "REFURBISHED" echo dot 3.  When I called to speak to a  supervisor, I was told that it is their policy to send refurbished ones if a new one is not in "their stock".  Doesn't matter they have new ones to sell on the website. I told him that I don't except that and it was not what I paid for. And if they are sending out refurbished echos, there must be a huge problem with them. He advised that they test them and to try it out.  So I opened the box.  All that was in the box was the echo dot. No power source .  Again 4th time reaching out to a Tech specialist- supervisor and 45 minutes of phone time. I was told that they only send device out when replacing. And they don't send out any accessories. When was a plug considered an accessory when it is needed to use device.  Again I told him that I bought a new device and it was faulty and I wanted a new device as a replacement.  Not one that has been fixed.  Also I found out that the 90 day warranty did not begin again when the replacement device gets registered. They back date it to the original sell date of first device.  So I only had 40 days left on the warranty.  Also if you go on line , a refurbished echo goes for $29.99, compared to the $ 49.00 , for a new one. Not once did any representative say that I would be refunded the $20.00 difference for the refurbished echo dot. I told him that this is an AMAZON echo dot. It has their name on the product and they should stand behind their name. I also said if I were to buy a tv from a store and took it home and it quit working, they would replace it with a new tv, not a refurbished one. I will never buy another electronic device that AMAZON sells with their name on it. I will tell all my friends and family that they will get screwed if something goes wrong with their product. So buyer beware.  Amazon does not stand behind their products and the consumer whom keeps their  business Alive.

Title: Invasive and uncooperative device.
Body: Ok one I got this free with Sirrus XM. I am not a fan of this device. It_ annoying always answering when no one is speaking to it. It also does not get much right when you do. A little while ago I was speaking and could not get a response because Alexa keeps interrupting me when I_ trying to get a whole command out to use with my sirrus subscription and then when I try again Alexa said calm down. That pissed me off only good for a hockey puck keep this spy garbage out of your home. Phone call from Amazon seconds seconds seconds after writing this review _f you ever want to give our r&d people full access to the voice log they can help you with your issues possibly helpful but invasive. Ah maybe the NHL can help the dot get further. It does look like a puck. The phone call left me wondering if I should just let go of prime music video shopping etc. I_ feeling more Apple in my diet.

Title: Good could be better
Body: I ordered two of these around Black Friday/Christmas this past year. One of these was a gift and the other I use at least once a week. It works well sometimes and has great voice recognition and sound quality. Other times, it doesn_ recognize half the speech and has a static sound when it_ playing music.Side note: quite a bit of music isn_ available on Alexa so that_ also disappointing. Do some research before purchasing. I did but might have made a different decision had I known the limited music library (unless purchases occur through prime) and how Alexa records your conversations while it stays plugged in.

Title: Works as well as the larger model.
Body: The Echo Dot has surprisingly good sound, and works just as well as our larger Echo. We have had it for nearly a year and love having it for our favorite music channels. It comes with an App on your phone and you are able to rate the music you are hearing. If you don_ like a certain song, rate it thumbs down, and you won_ hear it again. After a while you are only hearing great songs on the station you are choosing.

Title: Is Alexa and Dot a tool or a toy?  They are useful so I say a tool.
Body: I purchased a three pack of the Alexa dots. One is destined for my shop. I have a Wi-Fi range extender there so it gives me Alexa communication there. One was a gift to my girlfriend_ grand-daughter and the third will be a gift to another friend. The dot seems to communicate as well as the regular Alexa and makes for easy hands free calling between my house and my girlfriend or her daughter_. They stream music. Tell jokes. Give me weather reports, timer, alarms, trivia, just a fun verbal internet toy or tool?  Gee. That may be a question I need to ask Alexa. I bought her as a toy but she definitely has proven to be a useful tool.

Title: Alexa doesn't Like certain Internet
Body: So when I originally got Alexa, I  got her all set up, but when I had her learn my voice, she glitched out. She wouldn't understand a lot of actions I had said to her that were pretty basic.I had called tech support and we reset my Alexa back to factory settings TWICE and she still did the same glitch, so I received a replacement Alexa.Once I got my replacement I thought for sure the issue would be resolved, but it wasn't. The same thing was happening. I thought maybe it was a system malfunction and maybe it was happening to everyone and people just knew to wait for it to be fixed.But today I had switched my internet provider from Windstream to Spectrum. And suddenly SHE WORKED CORRECTLY! I'm so happy because all the functions I bought her for weren't really working correctly until today.So, If you have internet speeds that are under 30mps you may not get the full alexa experience you were hoping for. I know I will defiantly be getting a second alexa now that I know why she wasn't working originally.She's really helpful for someone with memory problems, especially since she's connected to your phone as well. She also helps with keeping up with our calendar because my fiance refuses to check his phone for his schedule.Overall Alexa has been a great addition. I just wish I would have known what speed of internet is required to make her work.

Title: Baby shark for daysssss
Body: I got this free on a _enew Sirius deal.Didn_ think much of it till we got it home. Construction is surprisingly really well done.My toddlers love it because they can run into the room and ask for baby shark or to check on what their unicorn is doing. Makes me having to pull up baby shark on my phone a think of the past.10/10 hilarious.

Title: Very useful piece of technology, and a lot of fun.
Body: I am really enjoying this new piece of technology and was glad I only paid $ 20.00 for it when it came down in price as well as on a gift card that I build up the value on in another program, which essentially made this Echo Dot free to me.  I have a plug in that I plug into my lamp and have it setup to turn on and shut off by voice or can set a schedule for waking me up in the morning when I go to work. Also works great when I ask Alexa the time or weather or flash briefing or anything else I want to know.  It can also play music from other apps including Amazon Music (which I don't have) but there are other free options other than Amazon Music like TuneIn Radio.  I tried to make a phone call to my cell phone, but it did not work.  I had my phone in front of me when I called me cell phone.  It did not ring the cell phone, but it did leave a message.  To avoid having Alexa calling and leaving messages to your contacts, I just put the Alexa app on my tablet that has no contacts on it.  I am sure I will find more uses for it when I move out of my current living situation.  As I was making this video, Alexa turned on and off my light as I was replaying my video back on my phone.  A very enjoyable toy and newly piece of technology for me and I really love it.  That is why I am giving this a 5 star rating. I am sure you will all enjoy it as much as I do.  If I could add something to this Echo Dot, I would give Echo Dot the ability to upload an alarm sound from my tablet to my Echo Dot for my morning alarm like Star Trek Red Alert, because I am not happy with what few alarms you can use for a morning wake up alarm.

Title: I love Alexa !
Body: So I bought this for my bedroom. I already have two Alex is in my house. So between the other two.  Three we_e just too much.  So I gave this one to my nephew. And I only does he love it the whole entire family loves it.  I_ a huge fan of Alexa. I got one years and years ago when she first came out. Alexa does so many amazing things and she makes life so much easier. From timer to alarm to music shopping list and that_ just the tip of the iceberg

Title: Cool, Useful Device
Body: I love the Echo Dot. The functionality is quite good, it works most of the time, it's small and unobtrusive and, for the price, it's a great purchase. As I add more devices to  my home that can be controlled by the Dot, its value will only grow. My only complaint is that the Sonos Skill (which was the main reason I originally bought the Dot) is lousy and plain doesn't work. I also have some minor privacy concerns, but that's not a big issue for me. Overall, I'm very happy with the Dot.

Title: Incredible technology. Bright future ahead
Body: It has so much it can do, but hard to fully utilize all that power. It may just take time, but already very useful. You can ask it what's the weather for any city and it will answer. I ask it every morning when's sunrise; so I can time my morning walk. I also use it a lot to just add shopping or to do items while I'm getting up in the morning. I just shout out, it listens, no typing. Then at the store I just bring up my list on my phone.

Title: Love my echo
Body: Love my Echo Dot, this one was placed in our bedroom since we already have an echo in our living room. It makes it easy to turn off our living room lights from the bedroom using Alexa. It_ also great because I can play music on this as well as my echo and have music playing in the entire house at the same time. It also comes in handy for when I_ trying to go to bed I can have Alexa set my alarm clock for me. Love my actual products and plan on getting more for my bedrooms

Title: I didn't think I would ever use this...
Body: I got this 3rd gen Echo dot only because it came bundled with a Ring security camera. I didn't think I would ever use this as I'm not a big gadget person... HOWEVER.... I'm finding myself using this everyday. I use it to control the tv, turning lights on and off, listening to music, books (when having trouble sleeping) and even for corny but cute jokes. I wouldn't buy this just to have it but I have to admit it is somewhat convenient to have around. It would be more useful if I decide to add more devices in the future.

Title: Really handy device.
Body: I love the Echo Dot. This device can be so useful for setting reminders and alarms and reminding me to buy things etc. You can also have it play music and tell you things you want to know and the weather etc. It can literally do anything. They even have a microwave with Alexa built in if that tells you anything. You can just be like Alexa heat my food for 1 minute and BOOM! Done.

Title: Kinda weak in the knowledge dept
Body: "Skills" are like apps for this little bezos object. Either I am unclued as how to harness the echo's power or there is little there to harness. Weather reports, traffic update are ok.  I LOATHE asking for a subtle seaside sound machine to play only to loudly pitched an 'up-sell' from the alexa inside.  When trying to rest - I do not want to get into a lengthy ad description of a 'skill' for sale.  At all.  Yuck.The unit itself sounds good enough when playing Spotify.  It has difficulty hearing over some music and will require users to shout - I know - my neighbor routinely barks at her echo unit and sometimes it's  laugh.  Most times not. Echo is best placed out in an open area or it goes deaf altogether.A simple answer I wish I could get:  What network is carrying my NFL team's next game.  Easily accessible info that echo can't report.I wish I could have done a home test side-by-side with the google mini but I ain't got that kind of disposable dough.For now the dot makes it easy to yell out my lights and check to see if it's raining even though I have a window.

Title: In general comment about all Alexia products
Body: I've purchases numerous Alexia devices/models over the years.  Some for personal use and others as gifts.  In short...they are great for knowing the date or time and limited easy requested music listening.  However, in terms of over-all ease of use...they fall far..far..far from being called smart devices.  Most of what you would think you can ask, can't be answered by Alexia.  Over time, this issue gets to be very frustrating and a waist of time & effort.  In fact, it's like trying to have an adult conversation with an toddler.  I think you get my point.  So, if you plan on doing some heavy duty music request(s) or serious educational inquiries....you're probably much better off trying Goggle Home Assist or Apple smart devices.  Al least until Amazon decides that it's time for Alexia to advance beyond the first grade!

Title: Love Alexa
Body: We love Alexa!  I'm sure there are lots of things that we will be able to do with it as time goes on.  I have watched many Youtube's to get ideas.We purchased this one on Amazon's Prime special day as a Christmas gift for our aunt/uncle that are in their 80's.  They get a great kick out of watching us use ours and I know they're going to have lots of fun with it.  My uncle at 88 refuses to learn how to use a computer but is always asking his wife to look things up.  This will let him do his own look ups without her help.One of the fun things that we use ours for is to start our day with the weather forecast and calendar update.  It then plays our local VT radio station for us here in Florida.I wish I had ordered a couple more of these for gifts.  Black Friday!!

Title: Mixed Review
Body: Purchased three and my teenage son loves it uses it for multiple purposes, my teenage daughter sort of uses it and I have one but most of the time to turn on or off my bedroom lights. Not sure because we have three I had to use a slightly alternative way to command the turning off of the lights.  We also had to name each one a different name. Echo only provides four name choices which sucks. The choices are Alexa, echo, Amazon or computer. I ended up with Amazon certainly no one wanted computer. They need more choices or ability to create your own name.

Title: I Love My Alexas
Body: This was my 4th one. Now we have Alexas in multiple rooms and I can get her to help me any time. This new design, with the fancy cover is cool. But I would take Alexa in any format. We use her all the time. She gives us weather, movie/show trivia, spells for us, does addition/subtraction/multiplication when I need it, does conversions. And she plays music as needed. She does so much more. I just need to take time to figure it all out.

Title: What a difference from the older version
Body: We had picked up second generation as soon as they came out. We also have a Google mini and love going between the two to see which one's better. The primary complaint what's the quality of sound where the Google beat hands down. Finally decided to try this new 3rd generation and wow what a difference insound. Thank goodness because we no longer have to use an external Bluetooth speaker to play music through Alexa.

Title: Fun and very useful!
Body: My siblings and I LOVE using the echo dot. We play it_ fun mini games and use it to play music (connected to Apple Music). We have fun asking Alexa numerous questions. I even use it while cooking for quick measurement conversions. I set reminders on it when I need something in the moment but will surely forget. The sound quality is amazing. The only thing that I would suggest would be to work on its voice recognition. I don_ have an accent and my voice isn_ deep. I don_ mumble or shout. Sometimes it doesn_ recognize words that I say and I end up repeating myself twice. But it doesn_ happen a lot, so I still enjoy this!

Title: Stopped working after a few months, spinning blue circle and unresponsive.
Body: I purchased my Echo Dot in Jan 2019. It worked fairly well (I was disappointed that it would not play my Apple iPhone podcasts) until all of the sudden at 6 months it just stopped -  only a continue blue spinning circle but no response.  The instructions said to hold down a button on top until the orange light reappeared. Nothing. And no other options. So a waste. I loved the voice activation but 6 months of being operational? So I was out of warranty by the time I got around to calling tech support but to their credit they did try to help with over over an hour of trying everyone had already tried to reset the darn thing. They sent out a new plug to see if that might help. Still just an endlessly spinning blue circle. So overall I would have to say it was a wasted $50. For very limited use.

Title: Oh it's good GOOD
Body: Firstly, I wish Alexa could do web searches. And not like a Google home but at least basic things. Anyways it has good bass but I wish the volume could be louder. You can't hear it from another room. But you can talk to Alexa from another room. There's alot to do with Alexa it's just finding it. The Alexa app is a problem though. Alot of the times I have to keep reconnecting Alexa. Only thing I say you probably need the app for is the skills. Other than that the app is useless.And I don't know if it's the Alexa itself or the Amazon music app but I can't play music from the music app to my Alexa. I used to be able to but now it won't connect.

Title: Vast array of knowledge and great family fun
Body: My family and I absolutely love these new Echo devices. We have never had an Alexa product before, first time, and we are in love. We are a huge sci-fi Fanatics and when we found out that this little dot has Star Trek commands we were all overwhelmed with joy and laughter!! The games and vast knowledge that she provides for my children has been a huge enjoyment as well.

Title: Meh
Body: This was free through Sirius. I like how it feels, sturdy and eell made. Just not a fan of the idea of this. I don't prefer the microphone due to privacy concerns so will not be using this for anything other than a bluetooth speaker. It really needs to not talk to me everytime I turn it on saying its not wifi connected since it never will be.As a speaker it is very lackluster, very little bass and volume. The good thing is that on the right surface it vibrates through and feels louder. Maybe I'll sell it or give it away.

Title: Way better sound quality than the previous generation dots
Body: I own the Gen 1, Gen 2, and now a Gen 3 Echo Dot. The sound quality of the 3 is vastly better than the previous generations. So much that I want to swap all my dots to Gen 3. Maybe even Gen 4 when Amazon announces new Alexa devices on Sept 25th, 2019.My only gripe is that the Gen 3 seems to lag a bit when you ask for some things. She will wake up immediately with the wake word, but while she is thinking or processing the request, the ring turns off. Specifically when asking for a light to be turned on or off.

Title: This Alexa is either possessed or is modeled after an 85 year old w dementia & hearing problems!
Body: My Alexa constantly seems to rarely hear me correctly, answers the wrong questions, sometimes doesn_ hear me at all when I say her name repeatedly,, shuts off or changes songs for absolutely no reason...  this happens so often I find myself asking Alexa _hat happened (to which she doesn_ know), or, if I_ getting really mad, I_l ask _re you stupid?! (to which she literally shuts herself off lol)... She in fact just told me _ don_ know that One and I_ literally just sitting here not speaking.  I had the very first Alexa and it was great, only thing better about this one is it gets louder. I find myself shouting her name so often my neighbors probably think my lovers name is Alexa, or perhaps the name of my disobedient dog!

Title: The very impressive 3rd gen Echo Dot
Body: I have had and enjoyed an Alexa Echo 2G5 which is stationed in my living room for over a year now, and have thoroughly enjoyed its features and functions. I love the fact that she is always learning and expanding her capabilities to enhance my experience. That is why I did not hesitate to purchase this 3rd gen Echo dot for my bedroom. I use it to control my lights, play music and even set a sleep timer to play nature sounds to help me fall asleep at night. It was very easy to install, being pretty much plug and play, and once connected to my WiFi router, all was up and running smoothly! This Echo dot I feel was a great deal for the surprisingly low cost considering its abilities and I highly recommend it to anyone considering upgrading their tech in their home to make life more entertaining and easier.

Title: The show version is better dont waste your money on this one
Body: The show is obviously a much better choice. This one is glitchy and i think the price tells you why. If your listening to sleep sounds this one will shut off after about  45 minutes and wont stay going all night. The show does this one shuts off you streaming music after an hour on its own. The show doesnt. The thing i dont like most is you have to say things exactly right or she doesnt know ehat your wanting. Example if you want her to stop playing a sound you say alexa stop playing that sound or song. She wont get it you just have to say alexa stop. Its all in the details as to how you tell her sonething.

Title: It's fast, good voice recognition and is most excellent for feeding a stereo system.
Body: Update:  I got a second DOT 3 so I can control the AMAZON Microwave in the kitchen without having to yell at the ECHO in the breakfast room.  It's performing that function like a champ as well as filling in a music/radio gap in the kitchen.I bought the DOT 3 to stream Amazon music to a mini-amp driving shelf speakers using a MP3 cable and it works great for that as well as answering my dumb questions, like "What did I come into this garage for?".I also have a mechanical A/B switch to connect the mini-amp to a Bluetooth receiver to play CDs from my Windows device.My experience with the little DOT 3 will begot a children's version for my 4yo grandson.If he winds up going to Berkley, I'm going to ax for my money back!

Title: Echo Dot is great!
Body: I use the Echo Dot in the bedroom as my alarm, play music and ask general questions.  I first bought the Alexa tower and enjoyed it so much that I ordered the Echo Dot.  If I had known that the sound quality was so good on the Echo Dot, I would not have spent the extra $$ for the tower.  I have detected no difference in the sound quality between the two.  I will be ordered a few more Dots as Christmas gifts.  I really enjoy playing the question of the day and other games.  Excellent product at a very reasonable price.  Highly recommend the Echo Dot 3rd Generation.

Title: Amazing
Body: Started out with Google Home but had too many connection issues so got me one these to try out. All it took was unboxing and holding it to realize how much better the quality was than my Google Home Mini. Alexa is far more capable than Google Assistant, and works so much better. I can literally tell Alexa to start my car. Speaker is better than even the big Google Home speaker and a lot louder. Love the Drop in feature and the ability to arm my home so it listens for breaking glass or smoke alarms.

Title: Love echo products!
Body: I have many amazon devices but this was my first dot, I bought it to use in my bedroom and absolutely love it. Very easy to set up and integrate with my other devices from the Alexa app. The sound quality is great, I_ actually surprised how loud this little guy can get, it fills up my entire second floor when I play music. Exactly what I was looking for to add to my amazon family.

Title: Great Speaker.  More Than 1 = Intercom System.  Use Different Names in Rooms That are Close.
Body: Update:  I ordered yet another one.  I now have a total of 3 Dots in my house.  I have 1 older one in the basement and the 2 newer ones are on the first floor in the kitchen and living room.I did order holders for both new Dots.  The holder helps keep the cord tidy and just mounts the Dots to the wall using the outlet.The sound quality is definitely better with this version, as oppose to my older one.I like the Dots, but sometimes it doesn't always do what I ask.  Also, the newest 1 will sometimes just randomly stop playing music.  I don't know if this is a Dot issue or if there was an interruption in the Wi-Fi.Now that I have more than 1 Dot, I gave them different names (wake word).  I did this by using the Alexa app.  There are 4 different names/wake words that can be used (ie; Alexa, Echo, Amazon, or Computer).  I chose to do different names for the livingroom & kitchen because sometimes when asking 1 specific Dot a question,  the other room's would activate instead.  Different names solved that issue.Overall I'm still pleased with my Dots and will probably pick up 1 or 2 more when they go on sale again.I ordered this 3rd gen Echo Dot and I already had an older  Echo Dot.They both synced up easy with the Alexa app.  I can now use the Dots like intercoms with my kids, using the "drop-in" feature.  I think that's neat, my kids... not so much, haha.This 3rd gen Dot does have a better quality speaker.I don't like that the plug is attached to the power cord on the 3rd gen Dots.  My older Dot had a USB cord that plugged into the plug.  That way you could plug the dot into any USB power supply.Overall I'm happy with my newest Dot.  I plan on eventually buying a couple more to place throughout the house.

Title: Surprisingly good value
Body: I'm in the Apple ecosystem and it was my first time with Alexa and I was really impressed. First off, I'm using it in the UAE and do not have full Alexa support. I had to use 3rd party software to set it up and it was quite a tedious procedure. And without the Alexa app I cannot access all of the functionalities. But despite those inconveniences, I'm impressed with how Alexa understands and responds to commands, as well as the variety of skills including games and quizzes which my family loves. The speaker quality is also surprisingly good for the price - almost as good as my UE wonderboom. All that for less than 50USD. I'm almost tempted to get another one.

Title: Stop spamming me!
Body: Amazon really knows how to screw a good thing up. Older version seems to work fine next generation is just awful. I have to ask it multiple times to do the simplest tasks like play music. It will randomly stop playing music for no reason and when I ask it to stop playing music it will just start playing music randomly a few minutes later. I asked for news it gets me whether I asked for whether it plays music I will ask you the same question five times and it will do four different things. Absolute garbage! Edit: did you know that if you leave a bad review for an Amazon product they start blowing up your phone at work and spamming you with unsolicited calls? Loose my number idiots! You made a crap product stop trying to put that on me! Horrible experience with the Amazon tablet as well. Same thing happened, I try to return it and they just make it so difficult and spam you all week. They act like it's operator error, but it is their products that are deficient.

Title: Disappointed
Body: I was really excited about getting this. Both my daughter have one and they love it. So I bought one for myself and absolutely loved it... problem being... at just after the 90 day warranty it started only working here and there. Ask it to play music and after about 2 to 3 songs it stops RIGHT in the middle of a song. Then you give it a new command and you get nothing. Plug it back in and repeat. I was told it_ out of  warranty and they would give me a $15 dollar off my next one if I choose to purchase another.  Disappointed in mine to say the least. My daughters are both working well... just bad luck for mine? __ 3 stars because my daughter have had good luck with theirs.

Title: I love the new Alexa Dot
Body: I had the first generation Alexa dot, and I liked it very much. I gave it to my granddaughter and she figured out she could call me on it. She doesn't have a phone. She's only 9. But, this new one, I LOVE! I really appreciate the sound quality. I have played all genres of music on it, and the sound is great. Of course, if you are a purest, I'm sure you could find problems with it. But, for me, and just working around the house, I love the way it sounds. I got the Echo Dot and an Amazon Fire stick in a bundle at Target for around $60 with the discounts. I'm really happy with my purchase!

Title: Very good for household use!
Body: I ask Alexa to do quite a few things and this speaker is very helpful. However It would be a major plus if it could be charged and you do not have to leave it plugged in to use it. Also the colors should be differentiated a little further because the rings that show up when something needs attention can be mistaken for another notification. (Lime green and yellow) but instead maybe it should be Yellow and Orange maybe. Other than that I recommend this device for those that don't mind leaving it plugged in to use.

Title: Nice price promo on 3 pack for 60 special.
Body: I got a great deal on a three pack of these so I now have them in every room and I_ very happy to have an Alexa in every room of my house even though the Alexa is supposed to be listening to everything you say I don_ really mind too much and it_ a nice thing to have around when you wanna ask a question a player audio game next song quiz even though song quiz tends to get wrong some of your answers and make you lose when you have a good long winning streak it_ still a fun thing to do sometimes I do enjoy having Alexa and all the different rooms of the house and having it locked the door for you or unlock the door for you are setting a timer and various other things so it_ kind of fun to have and I enjoy the little dots even though the big longer one is louder

Title: Surprisingly disappointing
Body: I bought this to replace an old Alexa Echo. My old one never had a problem hearing me. This one requires me to be right next to it when the music is playing and I want to interrupt. My old one kept better track of the songs I "liked." I have "liked" a song and had it added to my list and then during the same listening session I have "liked" the song again and it does not always tell me that similar feedback has already been saved. And there seems to be only one response when I say I like a song. The old one would say, "Got it", or "That will help me play more of the good stuff." It did not cut off songs before the end of the song was finished playing, bit this one frequently does. And it stops playing altogether sometimes even though I didn't ask it to. And I do not remember hearing, "Hmm, I'm not sure" as much as I do now. I have enjoyed asking for certain kinds of music or particular songs, but I am disappointed at how specific I must be. I asked to play Kasey Musgraves Christmas music and I kept getting holiday classics. When I finally looked up the name of Kasey's Christmas album and asked to hear it, THEN I could hear those songs.

Title: Finally got a smart speaker, and it's pretty cool actually
Body: Held off for as long as we could, but had a Prime Day special on these so got one...  Pretty nice to be able to request music anytime, and generally ask the thing questions.  Decent built-in speaker, but have plugged in to external for better quality.  For the privacy concerned, we do regularly mute it unless we know we're going to be requesting things, but reality is -- we've got no privacy these days, unless you go completely analog and off the grid...

Title: Awesome
Body: I bought two to connect my house with my alarm clock and security system.  Everything integrates ridiculously easy (As soon as I plugged these babies in, they got picked up by my network (Phone) right away.  Just clicked the pop up on my phone and they set up within SECONDS - Understand, I had already set up my main hub (Alarmclock) so the network was put together (That took like 10 min tops) already. Either way, it is fast to add a new device.  They are really well made and look very nice.  They do flash a light when they sense you are in the room, so if you dont want that just tell Alexa, Stop blinking and she will no longer flash the colored ring light. I would buy more if I had more rooms.P.s. They give discounts if you buy more than one at a time (Saved 20$ when I bought two).

Title: Awesome sound!
Body: I have always been "frugal", I dont always pay top price (usually closer to paying the least) and then I am disappointed with the quality (I know, you get what you pay for!) Well let me tell you how surprised I was at the great sound this little thing puts out! I use it mostly for music and LOVE the sound. I know Alexa can help me with so much more but have not "talked" to her much.  If this was only a speaker, I would be so very happy with my purchase and yet there is way more this can do.  I have a Google at home and really like the sound out of the Dot more

Title: Significant improvement over the 2nd generation
Body: The Echo Dot 3rd generation speaker is a significant improvement over the prior generation speaker. The speaker itself is slightly larger than the prior version wrapped in a grey fabric. The sound quality and voice recognition are significantly improved. Music sounds louder, richer and clear. You can pair another Echo Dot for stereo sound although you won't get a Sono's or Bose experience, yet the speakers sounds pretty good for such a compact size. The connection is pretty flawless with the Alexa App.  Overall an improvement over the previous model.

Title: It's Big, Heavy and Its Wood...
Body: They made it use a different power supply, because the 2nd generation was being used everywhere. I don't think its as good at voice recognition, but it sounds little better. Having stereo is nice, there's two 3rd gens in the room now.  There's not a lot more to say, everyone has one of these things. Alexa gets better, sometimes it amazes but most of the time it annoys.  Lower your expectations.

Title: Alexa is now my best friend.
Body: I did a LOT of research on an affordable option for a virtual assistant. This one's biggest review downfall online is sound quality. I don't understand this. The sound quality is great. These reviews were mostly made by men, and for some reason, men thing the louder the better. Makes for a lot of disappointed women, but I digress. The sound quality is great. It's not a Bose stereo system, but that's not what I want in a virtual assistant.I want my virtual assistant to remind my son of his morning routine. Wake up, get in the shower, get out of the shower, get dressed, eat breakfast, grab your lunch, get your backpack, don't forget your homework, don't forget your phone, leave now so you don't miss your bus. And, he does it! Without attitude! I bought myself 45 minutes in my morning, I don't have to argue with my child ruining his self esteem for the day and making me feel guilty all day. We get to have a fun, peaceful morning, and leave for the day still liking each other!It's also great for the five million timers I have to set when cooking so all my is ready at the exact time and served hot.I say, "Good morning, Alexa." And I have it set to play the opening song of The Lion King.She reminds me of my calendar events, doctor's appointments, etc. I have meditation and yoga set for a certain time every morning.I can speak to my son through the device while I am walking around the block. He's 12, not 2.It's great.

Title: Very convenient fun to use
Body: This is pretty great as a mini speaker. I bought it expecting the speaker aspect to only work in my room but if I use it on max volume than I can hear it in the living room of my tiny apartment as well. I like the convenience of being able to get it to work just by saying Alexa. One thing though is that I moved it from my moms house to my apartment in another county but I cannot for the life of me get it to recognize that the location is different. So I have to ask what's the weather like in __ otherwise it'll give me the wheather where I used to live. Also I really wish that it had an internal battery storage so that I could move it between rooms. It doesnt work unless its plugged in and the cord is pretty small. If it could be carried around than I could use in in another location for an hour or two before bringing it back to be plugged in.

Title: Surprisingly not as good as the previous generation echo dot
Body: I don't know what's different about this echo dot but I expected superior voice recognition and function. Instead, I have to speak more loudly and be closer to the unit for it to perceive what I'm saying unlike my previous echo dots (main reason for the four stars instead of five). The sound quality isn't quite as good, but again, not sure how the cloth-like exterior affects the dot. I don't hate it, but it's not better than the previous generation (at least not the one I received) I got it for a good price and it was shipped promptly.

Title: Great sound but doesn_ like corners
Body: This little device sounds great. Two recommendations for improving functionality. The mic isn_ as receptive when device is in a corner. I wish there was a way to adjust input sensitivity to address this. So, you may be yelling to get it_ attention if you_e around the corner from it. Related to this, unlike the Fire TV Cube, there are no audio tones from the device to let you know that it recognized your commands. So, unless you_e looking at it_ LED light effects for a confirmation that it can hear you, you_l have to assume this.

Title: Love this thing
Body: I have had my dot for a couple of weeks and I love it. I had a Google Home Mini that I like but couldn't use with my Apple music. Last week I switched from Apple music to Amazon Music HD and love it 1000 times more. I am falling out of love with Apple, anyway I got the dot so I could play my Amazon music on it and moved my Google mini to my office. I realize the sound is not stereo quality. If I want that I was my Beats headphones. It works though for music in the background while I am working around the house.

Title: Alexa is always ready and willing to help you out.
Body: I_e had  the Dot for a month now and love it. It_ very responsive and learns more about your preferences the more you use it. My reason for trying it was for my 90yr old mom who could just ask to call me wherever I was. Outside, another room, napping etc. Being her only caregiver it gave me a peace otherwise I wouldn_ have. Helping her to turn on/off lights, music and so much more. I_ having so much fun learning more options and I_ not all that tech smart to boot!! Blends well anywhere, if needed can be moved anywhere in your home. Love, love, love it.  Thanks Amazon for this irreplaceable item. Good job ___

Title: Great new look with improved sound quality
Body: I've owned each generation of Echo dot, and while I loved the 1st gen physical volume ring design, I found the 2nd gen too cheaply made to buy more than one. When I got this 3rd gen, I was pleasantly surprised by the new design that's aesthetically pleasing, improves the look of the light ring, and dramatically improves sound quality (though it is bigger). Even just voices (Alexa or audio books) sound noticeably fuller through this speaker, and I bet a lot of folks will enjoy listening to music on it, which was pretty rough on the older gen dots.My only real grip at this point is that the feature that determines which echo device should respond gets it wrong most of the time (so the echo in the next room over responds often). I'm sure it's hard!

Title: Is there an Echo in here?
Body: I purchased one for MBR and one for LR.  New to these type of products. I would like to find one resource that has everything about the Echo's capabilities, rather than get random emails. Also, I'm not so well versed in this type of equipment so I really need it spelled out for me.  Easy to install. Still learning how to use it.  It is satisfactory for my use so far, but I would like to know what capabilities this has so I can use it even more. Getting tired of responses that Alexa can't answer for simple questions. Don't know if it's a setting...

Title: Such a cool idea .  Your going to wonder How did i live without this
Body: One of the best things i have done.. In some time.! I ordered the Alexa Echo for the living room and new Echo has a woofer and a tweeter (sounds Great) but wanted two woofers so i ordered the Dot (Dot only has a woofer)for the Master bedroom  ..My thinking was i will have great music using my wifi.. Well now i wonder how come i didn't have this years ago...Alexa does so much to help me its unreal and once UPS bring it to your door just call Amazon and in a minute your all setup and it so easy and cool.. Alexa is so nice to me and a huge help.. Always says such smart and nice stuff... Got to love it Music Quality with both playing at the same time is outstanding  and Prime has a great and huge amount of music..

Title: Excellent!
Body: This little echo dot is cool. Surprisingly enough, the sound quality is pretty good for a speaker this size. All the reviews that say "it lacks bass", duh, it's got bass but it was never meant to try and compete with other blue tooth speakers designed only for music. If was, the dot would be a lot more than 50.00. I love mine and am going to get a second one.

Title: Stopped Working After Only a Few Months!!
Body: The echo was a nice addition to our Alexa devices in our home. We currently have 3 fire tv cubes with Alexa, and one Echo 3rd generation. We bought this one to pair with our Alexa Clock. It worked for a few months and now is a DUD. Tried resetting it and re-syncing it. It has sound after some resets and then none after others. When it does have volume it is extremely muffled and incoherent. Going to try to return... I do not recommend buying the dot. We have not experienced issues with the other Alexa devices.

Title: One powerful little nugget
Body: I love that this is so weighty and sturdy.  The sound get's nice and loud and clear.  It's the perfect color so it's not hard to find.  The button's are clearly marked which I love.  Blends in with my room's theme perfectly. I just got it yesterday so more to be disclosed.UpdateI loved it so much I bought another for my relative, and she couldn't be happier.  Looking forward to shopping for a nice holster for the walls.  Not just yet, but we'll see what happens.

Title: Better than 1st edition I had
Body: The new Dot is a little more pleasing to the eye and sounds a heck of a lot better as a music speaker, which is all I use it for. It's not the best speaker in the world but as a little desktop speaker, it's great. Love the improved bass and overall sound.

Title: Monthly fees?? What is that all about?
Body: I like this product reasonably well for what I am intending to use it for.  I do not anticipate connecting my entire life to the thing at this point, but music, timer, phone calls are all on the docket.  I don_ know whether or not to be concerned about the _istening ability of this device, but then again I am happy to let anyone listening know what I think on virtually any topic, so do your worst.  The only drawback on the music is that much of what I would like to hear requires joining Apple Music, or whatever they call it, for a monthly fee, and I am not going down that rabbit hole.  As with most of my technology gadgets, I probably won_ live long enough to figure it all out, but so be it.  For the price this puppy delivers good sound and that_ about all one can ask these days.

Title: Quality product.
Body: Liked this so much I bought another for my home office. Voice recognition works very well.Can't believe the sound is so good. The one in our family room you can listen to music through and it sounds pretty clear. My home office is much smaller so I am interested to hear what it sounds like when I am in there.My son was considering the Apple product (we use Apple products for cells, tablets, laptops, earpods, and watches), but I think he is going to give the Echo a dot. Much less expensive and works great.

Title: Love this technology!
Body: My three year old walks up to Alexa and asks it to play Baby Shark and other toddler songs all day.  She just loves that it can also read books to her, and I love the shopping lists, reminders, phone calls I can make, and so many other things we use it for.  My teenage even uses it to catch up on his AP History events and get a more rounded view of the events he is studying.  This week it was the French Revolution, Sedition Act, Marbury v Madison and so on.

Title: These are great little devices with many uses!
Body: This is the tenth echo Dot, Spot and Show I have purchased for the home, friends and family.  It has a long way to go to provide a useful tool for quick research, but Amazon is making it better, and it has so many other uses, it is a great device for the home and office.  I would like to have more control on selection of my own wake word, which is currently limited to Amazon, Echo, Computer or Alexa which presents an issue.  Computer is the worst of the wake words.  I never realized how many times the word computer comes up in normal conversation or is said on TV which causes it to wake up and respond to whatever follows the word computer.  Its annoying and funny when it provides random responses to questions that were not asked, or weirdly interrupts the conversation.  Also requires careful phrasing as it often says it does not know the answer or gives a weird random response repeatedly until the Question is perfectly phrased.

Title: Amazon does it again!
Body: I love my Echo Dot!  I had the larger one before (Amazon Alexa, I believe it's called), but I found that one too be too large for my needs, so I replaced it with this adorable little Echo Dot. I love that it's white--it's so sleek, and really blends in with the decor in the room I have it in. I often play my Spotify music through it, and it's SO LOUD. I didn't expect it to be so loud, but wow!  It's really a great tool to have at home to get information from, keep track of things like grocery lists, and to just simply play music. Love it!

Title: Fantastic Sound, But Stereo Pair Can Get Buggy
Body: 3rd gen Dot is worlds ahead of its predecessors. This one has good enough sound quality that it doesn't need to be connected to an external (better) speaker.Only con is that I have two 3rd Gen Dots stereo connected, and after a few months they don't work quite right as a pair. Unplugging them and reconnecting them as a pair in the Alexa app fixes it. It's a 5 minute nuisance for months of being able to fall asleep to surround sound ocean noises, so I'm not mad at it.

Title: Have multiple in our house
Body: I have one (1) Echo, one (1) Echo Dot 2nd Gen and two (2) Echo Dot 3rd gen. Comparing Echo Dot 2nd and 3rd gen, the sound on the 3rd gen is so much better! This product regularly goes on sale, and for the price, it is an absolute great product. We are happy with the product.

Title: Every home needs one
Body: I have used the dot for 2 months now. I have it in the dot wall mount(sold separately). Alexa is able to hear me and follow commands from the next room. The dot max volume is pretty loud. The sound quality in the dot is decent, however the wall mount does muffle some of the sounds. I can_ imagine life without my Alexa devices, and having the dot in our bathrooms is an easy way to announce to the house when you need toilet paper, or play music in the shower. Or ask Alexa the time so I_ not late to work. Highly feel everyone needs an echo dot.

Title: It's Listening
Body: I changed the name from Alexa to Echo to avoid it chirping up whenever something close to "Alexa" is said. It wouldn't shut up when I was discussing an echocardiogram on the phone. That's a bit alarming to think it listens to conversations but then I checked out the history online and found it listens to WAY more than you think. Like everything. It was fun for awhile playing trivia games but I never connected to every damn thing Amazon wanted me to because of the privacy issue. I finally unplugged it. I use my remote for my tv and the wall switch for my lights.

Title: Overall happy and would buy again.
Body: I bought this after a speaker with Alexa compatibility broke in a power outage. I do like how small this device is because it fits anywhere. I was very impressed with the sound quality too. I do wish that Alexa could learn the correct pronunciation of my name as she called me Stephan instead of Stephene (pronounced Stephanie) but it is ok, I guess it is my nickname. She is still learning as are we. Asking some questions are tricky to get an answer about especially when it comes to cooking. We have asked her about conversions, temps for doneness, and other things where she doesn_ understand what we are asking. I am sure in time we will figure it out. Overall I do love this device as it is great at telling the weather, playing music, and other basic functions and features that I primarily use it for. I am happy with my purchase and would buy another in the future.

Title: Useless
Body: Maybe it's me but nowhere in the description did I see it say that this device REQUIRES wi-fi. At first I was mad that it wouldn't talk to me cause I don't have wi-fi but then I thought I could at least use it as a speaker BUT NO - it won't even connect to your phone via bluetooth you HAVE TO have wi-fi. Sorry but that's some bullsh*t this thing is absolutely useless unless you have a wi-fi connection. Thanks for nothing but thanks for my refund though.

Title: Maybe I have high expectations
Body: I_ not sure if my expectations are high, if I have a bad device, or it_ just how it works. It seems the device is very low. It also has a little delay when I make a command. On the google home device, it_ almost right away when I say hey google. I have to repeat myself multiple Times in order for the Alexa device to hear me. Probably not going to use it for anything else but the doorbell.

Title: Great device with still room to grow
Body: We bought the Alexa device so that we would have a music speaker at out house that is easy to use and will increase the amount of time we listen to music. After having it for a few weeks now, we have listened to much more music as a family than we did before purchasing the Alexa. It is also very easy to use, all we do is speak what song we want the device to play. One of the negative sides is that you need some music service subscriptions to be able to play music and sometimes it does not link well and you need to be tech savvy to figure it out. For example, music from Amazon music is played always super easy and without a problem. However, anytime we try to play music from Spotify, it wouldn_ link to the account unless the app is open on my iPad. This may be a quick fix in settings, but I wasn_ able to figure that out yet. Another issue I came across relates to music in foreign languages. I feel like I have to speak a song name or artist of a foreign language in an American accent for Alexa to understand what I am saying. Foreign language voice recognition can be a great area of growth.

Title: Hope it gets better
Body: Kind of cool but also very annoying. Doesn't work right half the time. If you're power goes out randomly at night, Alexa resets and turns all the lights on. For being so smart this device lacks a lot of simple things, like the ability to sense power surges or listen to clearly spoken words. Yell her to turn off my TV and the device is not working properly, check your power supply. Tell her to turn of my WINDOW and she powers down the TV. AMAZON, y'all sold this? Works to tell the weather, play music, and work the lights in the house (sometimes). Wish I would have bought 1 not 4. I thought they would be better than this. A $50 dollar tablet can tell me the weather and play music plus some. Hopefully Alexa will get better. I'm considering taking mine offline and selling them. Time will tell but lately I've been SUPER DISAPPOINTED with my Alexa.  Especially with the power outage situation. If I were Amazon I'd work at fixing the current bugs in Alexa more so than focusing on making it talk like Samuel Jackson or other stuff.

Title: A step up from 2nd generation
Body: From the appearance to the quality of the speaker this Dot is a step up from previous generations.  Alexa is Alexa, and will be even with Samuel L. Jackson's voice, and she can get pretty confused sometimes.  I like the new finishes for the DOTs, the different fabrics allow you to chose the one that fits the room better than just a shiny black circle.  The speaker is a better quality, music sounds a lot better.  It helps that I only paid $30.00 or so, and I'll probably pick up another one when the price drops again.Recommended.

Title: Love my Echo Dot
Body: If you are on the fence about buying one, do it now!  I bought one for each of my kids rooms - love it.  I can talk to them straight to their room from any location - no longer having to wait for them to pick up their phone!  I can play music in their room to annoy them if they don't wake up in the morning.  They love it too!  They use it to play, tell jokes, play music (which when they play an annoying song over and over, you have the ability to change the music).  Love the dot.

Title: As expected when it works
Body: I replaced an old Dot with this unit. It has had the sound drop out a couple of times. All of a sudden the light looks like it wants to reply, but it is silent. At least a previously set alarm one off. (I think?)Looking around for solutions there seems to be two fixes.1) power on and off2) reset the unit and reconnect it to the app.Option 1 is annoying. Option 2 is unacceptable if I ever had to do it more than once.As this seems to have been a known problem for over a year, why is there no fix?I have no bluetooth devices connected. My wi-fi works fine on a dozen other items.

Title: very good product
Body: this is a great product! Alexa can answer almost any question! you want to listen to music, Alexa can play it, you want to listen to a podcast, Alexa can play it, are you struggling with your math homework, Alexa can help you! there is so much that Alexa can do!!!!! She can give you cooking recipes, tell you what the weather is, tell you what is happening on mars and soooooooooooooooo much more!!! you having trouble going to sleep? well Alexa can even play calming nighttime music! and yet so much mooooooooooore!!!!!!!! it also comes within two days! and talk about the price! this is  definitely 5 stars and i recommend it to EVERYONE ON EARTH!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Title: Was Skeptical at first...but love my Alexa
Body: I was skeptical and wasn't sure I really needed an Alexa, but have enjoyed her. I love that as I am cooking, and run out of an ingredient or realize that I'm low, I can just say "Alexa, add ____ to my shopping list." Then, when I am in the store I can pull up the list and remember what I was running low on. I was terrible about forgetting my hand written list at home. I've used her for a timer or for reminders. I also love that I can announce that I'm on my way home if needed.

Title: Great sound.. difficult to pair
Body: This has great sound.  I use this in my kitchen so I can multi task as well as listen to music while i am cooking and cleaning up.  The sound is great, i have no problem hearing the music from across the room, and the voice commands make it easy to be truly hands free.  Pairing it the first time was a little challenging.. not as intuitive as some of the other blue tooth speakers, but once it was paired, it was well worth the time it took

Title: A Caveat or two awaits you
Body: Be advised hat the more devices you have connectivity to the internet becomes an issue.  I have 4 of these.  When I can stay connected to the internet the Echo Dot is pretty awesome.  Problem right now is that somewhere between the number of smart plugs I have (quite a few, maybe 10) and the number of echo dots (4) I find myself offline, i.e. NOT connected to the internet.  It is ANNOYING to hear the all-to-familiar to me chime, followed by a red halo of light atop Alexa; followed by the also all-to-familiar "I'm having trouble connecting to the internet.  Check the help section of the Alexa app..." at which time by now I'm yelling for it to shut up before I can unplug it in order to reboot it in an effort to reconnect to the net.Go to my i-phone to check my network and the scene i the same.  That being a constantly spinning icon trying desperately and taking forever at it to establish a connection to the internet.  The point here is that as I started to say from the beginning the more devices you have the more internet speed is required.  THAT has been my personal experience.I presently have a download speed of only 20Mb.  If all goes well it will be at 4Mb TOMORROW which can't get hee so enough.  I will update this review as soon as I can in case you or anyone else following along here and have the same issue.  If you only have one Echo Dot and maybe 3Smart Plugs 20 Mb download speed should be sufficient.  Finally, so far what I just explained here is not in the Help Section of the Alexa app WHICH incidentally CANNOT  be accessed if you're not connected to the internet.So if you are for example a brainy type or student focused on something and the room begins to lose its light and in an effort to stay focused say 'Alexa, turn on the light,"  you want the light to come on so you can continue on uninterrupted, right?  Good luck with that.  My patience have worn so completely thin from instead of a light coming on but instead hearing the chime; the message etc; they tear easily now. GONE.So hopefully the faster internet speed will remedy my personal nightmare here.  As for the answers to many of the questions asked in the questions section above I'm a little confused because the main issue I have is connectivity issues.  As for giving Alexa different name if they are within earshot of each other:  every now and then I will say; e.g. "Alexa, turn on the hallway light," and Alexa will answer from the other room the she's having trouble connecting to the internet, while the one in the room in which my request originated will turn on the light.To me a lot of all this is pretty intuitive.  If you are the type to have found, let's say earlier versions of MS Windows to be very intuitive your problems will be fewer and you will likely recognize the cause of problems within software apps for the Echo Dot.  I was a lot happier with this before making my house pretty smart and life more convenient WHICH IT WILL BE ONCE I GET THIS F*ING THING TO STAY ONLINE.Again, if you're getting your first one in addition to maybe 3 smart plugs and you have a mere 20Mb download connection you SHOULD be okay and problem free UNTIL you start adding more devices and you most likely will do eventually, little by little or otherwise.  But for starters, like I just said you should be fine with just 1 Echo Dot 3 smart plugs and I will say a minimum 20Mb internet connection.  Me?  Hopefully 40Mb will be enough.  If not, then I will have to go with the max available in my area WHICH is not a whole lot more than 50Mb best I remember Soooooo...Good luck.  It's a cool product and once you are up and running smoothly think 2001 Space Odyssey almost 20 years late.  Seriously.William F. Nappi

Title: Not as seamless as hoped, but that_ to be expected
Body: Was very eager to get these while they were $25, and I_ honestly very glad I didn_ pay full price for them. Don_ get me wrong they_e nice and they get the job done, but I_ constantly having connection problems that I seem to only be able to resolve by unplugging the dot and plugging it back in.I was very eager to get one for my kitchen for list making and timers, and while the list making is fine, by now I can_ stand the timer. I constantly have to yell her name multiple times because most of the time she can_ hear me over the timer sound, or it gets messed up somehow and the timer cuts our communication off.It_ also pretty lame you can only have one Spotify account connected for the whole house. It would be so much nicer if each dot could have its own accounts. It treats the household as if it_ meant to have 2 adults and little kids, not catering very well to a house full of teens/young adults with their own personal stuff.Overall I don_ regret getting them, just wish they worked more seamlessly and were more catering towards households with more than 2 adults. If you aren_ easily frustrated by technology not always listening and you don_ mind only being allowed one profile for apps then there_ not really a reason not to get them.

Title: The control center to my HOME
Body: I don't know how many good things I can say about my Echo Dot. This was the 5th one I've purchased now. They make great gifts. I have them in every room of my home. It integrates so easily through enabling "skills" with the VeSync, Sengled Home, and Logitech Harmony hub. I use it with routines such as: "Alexa, good morning" --> and it turns on my lamp, under bed lights, and tells me a fact of the day. When I say "Alexa, bedtime"; she shuts off my TV, turns off all the lights, and turns on my white noise machine. I love that it connects to AppleMusic too and my favorite radio stations. Alexa can pickup my voice from pretty far too.

Title: Echo dot 3
Body: Compared to my gen 1 echo dot.  The driver compared to the older one I also have seems a little deeper.  They do handle bass differently though.  The highs seem muffled in comparison, but what can you expect from a single driver.  Voice recognition works as expected.  Originally i was concerned about both echo dots trying to perform the same task when asked.  Both my systems or not close but living room and kitchen or open concept but it appears the two do not compete against each other.  Not sure what tech is involved in  this but they seem to work fine together.  Now if I could get them to play the same thing at the same time for stereo mode that would be nice.  Maybe it exist but I've yet to find it if it does.

Title: Some good some not so good.
Body: The voice recognition is excellent. Alexa_ usefulness is questionable but I_ still in discovery mode. Sound quality is average or less but I_ coming from a background in music and hifi sound. The issue that I find very annoying is that say you ask Alexa to play NPR or classical music on all speakers. Often times on or more of those speakers will play at a greatly reduced volume and telling the speaker to raise the volume or doing so manually will have no result. The only solution seems to be unplugging the speaker to reset it. This happens about every other day. One issue I like but haven_ tested is that the products team up with Ring products to monitor your home.

Title: Great imporovement in speaker quality since 2nd gen.
Body: This generation REALLY improved the speaker quality, now I would definitely recommend it to anyone thinking about getting one. For the price there is really no reason to hesitate. The only real problem I have with these smart devices are the concerns of privacy and security. It is just another point of entry for hackers and a great device for hackers when compromised with it's microphone and generally close proximity to the home owner. Maybe turn the mic off when you aren't using it, which is a great feature.

Title: It's a great buy you can't just have one you'll need one in all rooms
Body: The echo Dot is a great item and a great gift idea. I'd rebuy the item for a friend as a gift. Because the facts about echo dot is it meet all of your needs it's like having a secretary without anyone else being there. The echo dot is on point responsive and you don't have to repeat as long as you speak clearly I was in my living room and I asked it to play iHeartRadio and it responded to me from all the way in the back of the room. It's just a great buy I would buy it again and I love it thank you Amazon.

Title: AHHHMAZING
Body: I absolutely LOVE my Echo Dot 3Gen. I love all the different task it can do, alarm clock, weather, news, music, just to name a few. There are so many other task that I have yet to explore. The size is perfect for my living room/kitchen (connected), I am able to put it on one of my shelves and it blends in to my decor. It's seriously awesome. The sound quality is great, she (I call her she..) can get pretty loud. Now I'm not talking drop the base loud by any means, but can get up there. I love that you are able to ask her turn it down and she does it. The drop in feature is amazing! I love being able to drop in and check on the pup, or when my Dad is over. I don't have a smart home (yet) so I can't say anything about turning on and off lights, locking doors, alarm setting, etc. BUT one of my friends does and I have to say that the whole smart home feature teaming up with Echo is very impressive and gives people a peace of mind. Love it!

Title: Perfect for the shy bladder
Body: I bought this because my guest bathroom sits uncomfortably close to the kitchen table, where we do most of our entertaining. Sometimes, the food we serve can be a bit spicy. Quests and homeowners alike were nervous going to the bathroom, out of fear that a fart would sneak out, or the inevitable _loop of a turd dropping would echo throughout the kitchen.With this fine Alexa device, we can all pee and poo in comfort. While listening to any music of our choice. A great investment!

Title: You will be surprised by engaging this technology
Body: Entry level introduction to the world of smart technology and voice assistant. Easy to use and you will be surprised that it sound pretty decent. With the advancement of Alexa into all things you might as well embrace it. But really, there are lots of things this is good for that you haven_ thought about.I suggested that a friend with elderly parents who were sickly buy this and set it up in their parent_ home. Then he could check in and they could call him without the need for them to find the phone. LIFE CHANGER! He can drop in on them and see how they are doing and they don_ need to get up and find their phone.

Title: Superb Sound Quality, But Still Not Sure the whole purpose of a smart device?
Body: Received a code for this as part of a promo for a popular service that floats over your head beaming music. Never really been hip to a smart device such as this (Siri and any personal assistant if it's in my phones over the years has been reduced to be a marginally used piece of technology gathering dust in the crannies of my phone)Only lasted a few days before the overwhelming urge to just tuck it back into the box came up. Rather then that, it found it's true calling, going to my next door neighbor. His wife recently had a car accident and has been going through surgeries and healing up.Currently it keeps her company and allows her to enjoy music and have some tasks made easier!With luck her new digital friend keeps her company, and I solved the problem of having it languish in my box of electronic gizmos!Maybe i've blown the chance to yank it out in 50 years and take to a hologram rendered version of the antiques roadshow for big bucks, but better to make someone's life easier!Sound was good, setup was easy, app is flawless but it just doesn't fit into my needs like it does for other folks. And that 's okay! May alexa live long and prosper helping a lady get back on her feet!(Bonus: Shortly after being unwrapped, Junior Rangers Nick Wilde Dropped by to see what the fuss was all about. He thought the same thing, great for others but decided against keeping it because you can't find a outlet in the wilderness most of the time!)

Title: It is a great device for mobility and vision-impaired elders. Mama loves her Echo dots
Body: We bought this for our 95 year old mom who is legally blind and has trouble using the phone or dialing. Now she uses Alexa to set timers. She asks Alexa the time because she can't see a regular clock. she also uses it to have Alexa read her books .  we installed these for security because if she falls she can call through Alexa without having to try and reach a phone. Mama loves Alexa and so do we for the Peace of Mind in fact we're going to buy a total of 4 to have Alexa all through her home to provide security and comfort. We are right next door, and if mama needs us, Alexa can help her call us easily from room in the home. I would highly recommend this for anyone who has a vision-impaired elder or mobility-impaired Elder who may be in need have a voice-activated telephone access. We have to get the dialer to go with it but it's so much more than just a pretty voice.

Title: If you have any earlier Dot, just go ahead and upgrade.  This one is worth it.
Body: I love it!  I just ordered a second one to try out the "stereo" feature.  It is so light years ahead in sound quality over the previous generation Dot(s).  I didn't feel the need to connect this to an external speaker at all as it sounds good enough for office or bedroom use as a standalone entertainment unit.  Great voice recognition, easy setup.  I like the way the Dot has evolved, and this one is the first one I would consider usable as a complete standalone unit.  Looks nice, sounds good.  Perfect for a desk or a bedroom.  The only drawback I have is that my cats think this might be a nice thing to scratch due to the cloth covering.  But cats aside, this is a great looking, great performing device.  I can't wait for the next gen.

Title: Should've Stuck with my 2nd Gen
Body: I have had sooooooo many issues with this device. I have to unplug it almost everyday because the alarm continues to go off as some sort of defect. I have returned it and got a new replacement and it does the same thing. It also does not effectively work with looping. I use rain sounds to go to sleep and this device will not loop causing me to wake up in the middle of the night super annoying so I had to just create a rain sounds playlist on my apple music to go to sleep to. I just am consistently having an issue with this device. It'll play music when not prompted causing issues with my music on my phone. I have to give commands several times sometimes. I'm just more annoyed than pleased overall.

Title: The sound quality is terrible compared to the previous model.
Body: I upgraded because the old one had trouble hearing my wife_ commands, as she is very soft spoken.Not only did we not see much of an improvement in it_ listening, but the sound it omits is muffed. It sounds just awful composed compared to the older model. There_ almost no treble. It_ all low range, which from such a tiny speaker is pathetic unto itself.This is a downgrade from the prestigious generation in my option.

Title: I really want to love it!
Body: I really want to love this but for some reason every 2-3 days it drops the wifi and wont reconnect without having to reboot from step 1 like it's new out of the box. I've had it for 10days and I'm on the 3rd need for a reboot which im tired of doing.On the plus side, its amazing on the amount of things it can do. My 6yr old loves talking to Alexa and the voice recognition is on point. I seen complaints about the volume level but im impressed with it.I really want to love it!

Title: Glitches with pandora
Body: This is my first smart speaker product, and I_ only leaving a bad review due to the glitch with pandora. I purchased this solely for music in my spa on my pandora subscription, however it skips and then changes the song mid way through EVERY SONG. Super distracting and annoying and almost rendering it unusable for me. Apparently this is a common issue.

Title: Buy one! You won't regret it!
Body: Wasn't as impressed as I thought I would be when we first got it.  Now she is used a lot and have a couple plus the show.I love getting the weather, setting timers  (great for my 3 y.o timeouts) and best of all My shopping list!!!! I'm the type of person that needs a list of my lists!This is just great to tell her as I go, as I run low on something in the kitchen, I'm telling her to add it to my shopping list!

Title: Hardest gadget to connect; use alexa.amazon.com instead!
Body: Connecting this gadget should not need to be so hard! That is why i'm cutting 2 stars. The app didn't work on my phone (Google Pixel 1); it would hang on the screen "Manually connect to Echo Dot" after connecting to the Amazon-XXX SSID (even with my phone's Mobile data turned off). I finally had to connect using a Chromebook to alexa.amazon.com before I could configure the Echo's wifi! Come on, Amazon! It took me an hour of googling to get this connected. (Thanks to reddit for the solution!)Everything else about it works perfectly once the setup issue is resolved.

Title: Great device for Alexa, not the best to listen to music
Body: I had two Amazon Echo in France and was very satisfied. I just arrived in the USA and found an interesting discount on the Echo Dot so I did buy two of them!The design of this new Dot is awesome! Alexa works as great as on the Echo (very well!), even when there is some noise.However the sound from the Dot is not as good as the Echo, and that's why I'll probably have to buy an Echo for the living room, or even the new Echo Studio because listening to music is one of my main usage of Alexa.I'll keep the Dot for the garage & the kitchen, to run timers or for home automation!

Title: Great for use with a powered speaker
Body: We have these Alexa/Echo devices throughout the house (probably could use 2-3 more) and so far we have really enjoyed them. I always wanted a whole house speaker system and dreaded having to run wires everywhere or spend thousands of dollars on a wireless speaker system. I had an older powered computer speaker system with powered sub-woofer sitting in a corner and figured I could use that with this small Dot system and it works really great. Yes, there are some significant improvements needed in the Alexa/Echo voice response system, however for basic stuff, it works well. Highly recommend.

Title: Great addition for our "addition"
Body: I needed to extend my Echo 2nd generations range since we have recently added a new room to our home, quite a distance from where I keep Echo.  I  got a kick out of  telling Alexa to "Order me a dot", during the last big Amazon sale. It was so fast to do, and fun to actually have her do it for me!My new dot is wonderful.  It takes up a minimum of space and is perfect for our office addition.  I use both mostly for background music, and my new Dot sounds so similar to my larger Echo, that I forget the music is coming from the newer, smaller model.  I am more than pleased with the Dot.

Title: She only recognizes my voice 50% of the time :(
Body: Alexa has a lot of trouble recognizing my voice. She keeps wanting to call me by my husband's name & we sound NOTHING alike. When I ask her to learn my voice, she says she already knows who I am & names him instead of me. The next time I ask "who am I?" she gets it right. We go back & forth..She does a good job of turning lights & gadgets on & off and she plays the music I ask for pretty well. I wish I could ask her to play music for a set amount of time. She doesn't get that yet. Maybe she will improve as more technology is added to her.

Title: What do you mean I need a title?
Body: Honestly I_ very happy with my purchase, I love music so I wanted the echo dot simply to be able to play music. Was told by friends that I should get the echo plus for that but the echo dot had great sound quality for the price even beating some of my friends pricier speakers, the sound volume gets loud but not as high a speaker meant for music only. It_ way easier for me to get the music to play than on a simple speaker because it_ voice command vs selecting on your phone (although you can select from your phone). I can ask it for questions on the go or pause it when my family needs me in a hurry. The Skyrim feature is a hoot, so silly. My only problem is that there_ a weird disconnect between the Alexa app and the amazon music app which confuses it. If you use the voice command to ask it to play music it will play amazon music through the Alexa app. If you want to change the song it_ either voice command or through the Alexa, or an extra prompt through music asking for permission to play over the current song. Also Alexa is extremely forgiving to those with stutters such as myself and quiet voices. It_ a great mic which despite me stuttering or talking quietly, it still delivers exactly what I want. I struggle with Siri and other voice command programs but had no issue with Alexa on the echo dot.

Title: Great intro to the Echo product line
Body: So far, I'm very happy w/my Echo Dot.  The voice recognition is Excellent!  The main reason I got it was for music - linked to my Sirius account & I love it.  The sound quality is good; voice recognition spot on & enjoying the options.  I can see how easy it is to get hooked on using it.  In fact, planning to upgrade my thermostat soon.  I can also see upgrading to add the Echo (better speakers) for the great room & using Dot in other parts of my house.  So far, all Good!

Title: Amazon Echo Dot  - Distorted Sound
Body: I purchased the Echo Dot in March 2019. It worked well for a few weeks then the sound started to degrade. Alexa's voice and any music playing sounded fuzzy and distorted - similar to radio static when a station is not tuned in properly. I tried all the recommended solutions: factory reset of the device, un-registering and re-registering it, resetting my router, downloading the latest software, etc. Nothing worked. At first I thought that maybe the speaker was blown - but sometimes the sound was restored for short periods. I contacted Amazon customer service and they walked me through all of the above mentioned solutions again with no success. The most frustrating part of this adventure is that they notified me that the device was out of warranty. I was expecting them to at least exchange the device for a new functioning one. I expected that it would be warranted for a year minimally. But unfortunately that is not the case, They did offer me a discount on ordering a new device though. TO be fair the Echo Dot is a great little device when it is working. The fact that I received a lemon, combined with a poor warranty policy explains my one-star rating.

Title: Alexa is Good
Body: Vice recognition is very good. Even when other noise is around, once you say "Alexa!" your next command is recognized. I find the sound quality is more than acceptable for me. So far integration of other devices is good although I have only added a couple of smart plugs and integrated Spotify with Alexa. I am contemplating purchase of another Echo for upstairs or in the garage.
