Title: Sounds good. It_ nice looking and it was on sale.
Body: Here_ why I marked it a little less than 5. We bought it to play Spotify. I have amazon music and also and Alexa and 3 dots. We wanted this one specifically for the significant other to use to play Spotify. It says you can but we can_ figure out how no matter how hard we try. So that_ why I didn_ give it 5 stars. Hard to use for anything but Bluetooth and amazon and no we still have no clue how to play Spotify not via Bluetooth so if you do shoot me a message.

Title: How in the world did we live without this??
Body: LOVE this product! Our new stereo, weather forecaster, joke teller, trivia answerer, alarm clock, kitchen timer, kitchen helper, calendar.., how did we get along without one? I just can't even put into words how much we adore it. The speaker is great and I enjoy several hours of music daily.  We are in our late fifties and figured this was something we would never use or want - but after my son bought one for my parents - I was sold!

Title: Great addition to my collection.
Body: The sound and look are updated versus the older versions. They are added very easily to your existing Echo ecosystem and work seamlessly. Control of connected devices works well, although you may need to repeat commands at times.  Using the intercom function is great as I do not need to yell throughout the house to speak with my wife or son, nor do I need to pick up the phone and call either of them.  Their size and look fit well into any decor and they are usually inconspicuous, as most visitors do not initially spot them.

Title: I like it even better than the big boy
Body: I owned the expensive original Echo. Had it 2 or 3 years but it broke. I was leery that the dot wouldn't have good sound quality or be loud enough-wrong! It sounds just like the original at one third the price. Added bonus: it's so small, I can hide it behind a lamp (my wife doesn't like the way any of them look) and it's entirely inconspicuous there, but works great. I keep finding new uses for it all the time - honestly, I wouldn't want to live without one now.

Title: Decent device, awful app
Body: Numerous small issues.When you set a timer, it's local to that device. So if you set a timer in the kitchen for, say, cookies or something, then go to another room, that timer will only go off in the kitchen even if you have an echo dot by your computer.The app is annoying; it needs a "duplicate routine" option for if you need to make multiple similar routines. For example, if you make a routine for "I'm in the den" which turns off all the lights except the ones in the den, and then you want to make an "I'm in the living room," you can't just copy and edit the first one. You have to set it up from scratch, which in my apartment means setting six individual lights to off and one on. Each of those is selected from a menu, then you set options in sub menus, so something that should take less then a minute ends up taking up to ten. Plus if you accidentally hit "back" it drops all progress and starts over. And there's no option to create routines on PC in a browser where it would be more convenient.The echo dot often doesn't understand what I say. Sometimes I have to repeat commands up to three times.Alexa never shuffles playlists when I ask her to play music, which is only a minor annoyance but it's still annoying.There's a ton of potential for this to be awesome in the next generation, but for now it's just okay. The device itself would get another star if the app was better.

Title: Amazon......really???
Body: Called Amazon 4 times within last month for this echo dot and other issues with the 12 devices I've purchased within the last year and roughly 1 month and still have gotten no where!  The dot that just keeps spinning is the replacement Amazon sent me for the defective one I sent back.  Now I've spent hours unplugging, uninstalling, re-installing, deleting groups, re-adding groups etc and still can not get help or devices to do what they were advertised to do!

Title: Sound is not as clear as prior generation
Body: Possibly this is due to their attempt to improve the lower end. Not sure. I do prefer the gen 2 sound over gen 3 Echo Dot. Gen 3 has what I can only describe as a more muffled sound. Other than that, if you like Alexa and need 1 or more extra devices for coverage, the price is usually good on these units. I like having the extra coverage in garage, basement, bathroom, etc. We use larger units in bedroom and kitchen.

Title: This Is Our Second Echo Dot
Body: Loved our first, which is now in the basement with my husband. Felt lonely, so I bought another.  I love listening to music, or audible books when I'm cooking, or knitting/crocheting or sewing.  Unlike radio, there are no ads, no static, and you have more control over what you want to listen to Highly recommend. Most likely will purchase more in the future for other rooms.

Title: Awesome sound
Body: this was purchased as a gift  i have 3 in my house  (one in bedroom, one in kitchen and one in the computer room) and a friend wanted one but was short $$$  and i sent it to her for a belated birthday and early christmas gift she was so happy  :)  i just love my Alexas'  !!this is my 3rd dot  the other two are 2nd generation this one has a MUCH better sound quality  i have the other two on external speakers  one on my computer and the other on an external wired speaker  this 3rd generation doesnt need one  the only thing is  as easy as it was to pair my  Alexa Fire remote with the 2nd generation one in my office ...  this new one is not pairing with my alexa fire remote in my bedroom  i am gonna look around for a stand for it and probably get a decal skin  so many nice ones to pick from

Title: Great quality speaker, easy to use, love listening to music!
Body: I love this! Now if you_e like me and mainly using it for music you have to also pay for the amazon music unlimited monthly which was $3.99. It does have to be hooked up to WiFi and download an app on my smart phone. It took me maybe 5 minutes to set up, voice recognition and all. It has a definitively great quality speaker and the volume adjust well. Highly recommend, purchasing another for gifting. My 7 year old daughter enjoys it too. Alexa recognizes all the Disney songs and plays them when asked!

Title: I think the Echo Dot is a great little product!!!!
Body: This summer we purchased the product Ring.com and with our purchase we received the Google Home device.  I have spent way to much time trying to connect this device to my iPad Air and my I phone with no success.  Once again shopping on Amazon, and saw the Echo Dot on sale for $39.99, and thought well why not.  Received it not even 2 hours ago, and I_ all hooked up to my IPad Air and IPhone.  Echo has played the songsI_e requested, watched a show on my iPad, and asked her the temperature outside. Unbelievable how easy the setup and use.  I personally think this little speaker works great for my needs.

Title: My office assistant
Body: This my office assistant,  reminds me of meetings, important dates and always good for a little history lesson when asked "what happened today in history"Pros.Great sound and great voice recognitionCon.Sometimes just says " I can't play that song right now" when it wasn't asked to.

Title: Amazing sound quality from such a tiny speaker!
Body: This was the first time I have evr used one of these " smart speakers" and I am very impressed on the ability of the unit to recognize voice commands.  I was blown away at the sound quality of this little thing.  Like having a high dollar BOSE Speaker in something the size of half a beer can!  we have one in the Kitchen and my daughter has one in her room.  We use them all the time and have no complaints.

Title: Great Sound and Function.
Body: This is an awesome entry level Alexa device. My son and family love the sound quality to play music from all providers and the games are cool. Being able to turn lights on and off at night also gives my son piece of mind for bathroom trips in the night. The games you can add like true or false and would you rather are great free addons.

Title: I love my Alexa
Body: I had this product before and had to rebuy it. My wife and I were staying with some people and we used our Alexa everyday we were there. We use it to play music while we are getting ready, rain sounds while we are sleeping, or classical music for our dog Olivia when we are away. Anyway, this family we were staying with never used Alexa before. My wife decided to show them the device and their son really fell in love with it, he's one years old, and he is the reason I need another one. These people were so happy to see their son trying to say Alexa and watching him dance to different songs. My wife offered MY ALEXA to those people, and they accepted! I was so sad to leave her behind. Once we left, I would shout Alexa randomly in my own home and no one answered! I finally demanded that we get another one, so here we are. I will miss Alexa 1 dearly, moral of the story don't let babies near your prized possessions.

Title: They still have some work to do with the Echo
Body: Ok I got the echo basically because I wanted to control my Amazon Fire TV.  I attempted to set it up and downloaded the Alexa app to my iphone 6. It seemed to initially be going well until I tried to pair it, and pair it, and pair it! I gave up and contacted tech support. They went thru the same things I did many times, redoing the setup. After several hours without pairing, they had to contact their tech support. Finally after 9pm I get another call from tech support and they asked me to access the app via my Ipad instead of Iphone. Doing this, it paired just find. For some reason my Iphone 6 didnt connect it. Dont know why, dont care, at least we got that far. Then they ran me thru some simple tests...Alexa turn off the tv...lol nope, didnt respond. Alexa turn on the tv, nope. Alexa open Netflix, nope. Alexa whats the weather ? wow , now yes she answered correctly. Anyway, at one point a tech told me I would need a smart plug to make it work..ok got a smart plug and no, didnt work. So, long story short, Im using the Echo for its general uses, not for a Firetv connection. I do like it, but it doesnt do what I originally wanted it for. Still Im 65, and its kind of cool. Im sure the grandkids will know more about it than Ill ever know.

Title: VERY ANNOYING...
Body: Bought this new unit to go in the living room.  I have one already in my computer room.  Took a long time to get he app to recognize and change the "Wake up name"..  Then the fun began..  It started announcing "Good Morning and You've Got Mail" when I signed on to AOL.  It also informed everyone in my living room when I signed out "Good Bye".. Now, today, it started playing any sound made on AOL..  Game background noise, (VERY annoying) and anything I want to listen to on AOL in the computer room is all broadcast to everyone in the living room, LOUDLY.  If this is not bad enough, I have spent hours on several chat sessions with four different people trying to solve this.  The last one, Prabhansh, was chasing me all over.  "Try this..  Try that..." An hour with him and he had NO idea what he was doing.  I guess I have to return this and go on EBay and get a 1st generation that works...  SHAME AMAZON....

Title: Great Sound but ...
Body: I have 2 Echo Dots, one set up in my bedroom and the other in my bathroom. The set up is easy and pretty straightfoward. Sound output is fantastic. There are a few minor issues: 1) Streaming of radio stations or podcasts can easily drop and you need to tell Alexa to restream, 2) no built in back up power (if power goes out, the Dots are useless).  Also, the Alexa app is somewhat not quite intuitive and like most of Amazon interfacing software, its somewhat "clunky" and needs a bit of searching.

Title: set it self up
Body: I got this 3rs generation echo dot yesterday, , I have 3 echo dot 2nd generation so I have experience with the setup . and was already to use the Alexa app to setup this new one but to my surprise I plugged it in and it set it self up on my Wi fi Network, and was all set to go , it found my Hue setup and functioned as it should with the lights, like the sound seems it has a better base sound than my 2nd generation dots, the 3rd gen is a little bigger then the 2nd gen all in all I like it.

Title: Works great!
Body: I_ still learning because I_ an Apple product kinda gal (former MS consultant that caved after young sons school many years ago went 100% Apple) but we are readers and have always have Amazon Prime and products such as kindles fire sticks  and audible so I caved and got 2 echos and 2 smart bulbs and although much more to learn and to put time in to make it truly useful, the fact that I can tell alexa to turn off lights, makes this gal that grew up in the 80s wanting the clap on clap off gadget very _

Title: I love the Amazon Echo Dot!
Body: I'm using this product to control by voice my smart home appliances. I like it a lot. The Echo dot recognized my voice pretty well and works fine. I think it works better than the Google Home Mini. I recently changed my two Google Home Minis for two Amazon Echo Dots. And I love it. The Echo is more pretty and faster than the home mini. And the Echo sound is better too. I think it only have two bad points and it's not so bad. That is the assistant use for general queries. Here is where the home mini shines. The Google Assistant do a better job here. And the other is that Alexa can't learn my voice in Spanish. I need that because in this manner I can separate my personal info from my wife info. But in overall I love much more the Echo even the Alexa app it's better and more organized than the Google Home.

Title: Watch out for Customer Service.
Body: I got an echo for my in laws.  I wanted to set it up so that it would play music which, apparently you have to pay to get anything good.  I didn't want them to pay so I called customer service so that they could help me.  Online the woman said I couldn't do it from their home, I had to be at my computer which seemed odd.  None-the-less, I went home and she said that she would talk me through set up.  She didn't.  She instead took control of my computer through rapid fire pressure tactics and then infiltrated my computer.  Just a heads up, there are some criminals working there to steal data.  She moved all my files to the cloud and I had to wipe out my whole computer to regain any control over my mouse.  I am still trying to regain and privatize  my files again.  They still don't have Amazon music.

Title: Lots of fun and helpful too!
Body: Fun little toy! Most of the time the echo is great until my youngest son learned to say Alexa. Then it was _lexia fart ever 5 min for the longest time. I know that you can change the name and I have cycled through all of them so many times he can say them all.Just a bit of advice a 1-3 year old will learn anything that can annoy you at an accelerated rate. So think long and hard before you show them how to play a song that you like because they will play that song 9 million times a day! My son has almost ruined _ary on wayward son by Kansas for me and it has always been one of my favorite songs!!

Title: Alexa can be your friend too
Body: We_e had our Echos since Christmas, so when we were going away to visit friends and family for a few days, we thought it would be a nice hostess gift. It was just right. We thought our friends would really enjoy the music function, and that was what they used most often while we were there. When we were with relatives they were having fun using Alexa as a search engine to learn about different things. She_ pretty fast in the search department.The bottom line is whether you_e getting an Echo for yourself or as a gift, you just can't go wrong!

Title: Doesn't Work For Me
Body: I was excited about the updated Echo but mine struggles to keep up with the others on the everywhere group and sometimes doesn't start at all.  It randomly answers questions that were not asked and has to be rebooted frequently.  I still have my very first Alexa Echo Device from a couple of years ago and there are no issues so I don't think this device is worth the price for a 9 month use.

Title: I love Alexa! Suck it siri!...
Body: I don't know what I did with my life before Alexa. I use this echo in my bathroom, and it is everything I have ever wanted. I know I am probably not using Alexa to the fullest, but for what I use her for, she's excellent.I just wish the unit listened to more than single commands and didn't require me to say "Alexa" before every command. But other than that, I love it!

Title: Echo Dot
Body: I had one and put it in another family members room for inter-room communications.  Works great.  I added this one to my bedroom for a little late night music, news, and super easy to set alarms without jacking with buttons or dials.  Just tell Alexa what time and it's done.  The alarm is plenty loud and you can customize it online.  I customize my news briefs so when I'm waking up in the morning, I can get the latest in news.  Lastly, I just upgraded the TC in the bedroom to a smart UHD TV with WiFi AND Alexa.  Yep, I can use alexa to change channels, volume, watch youtube, or nextflix, etc. with no remote.  So cool.  Love it!

Title: WOW! Better than expected
Body: I love the Echo Dot (Gen 3)! I've never had anything like this, wasn't sure I'd be able to get used to it, but I downloaded the app to my phone, plug in the Echo, told Alexa to play my fav radio station and WHAM, there it was! Sound quality is GREAT! At 50% volume I could hear it loud and clear throughout my apartment. Super easy to set up, only took me about 3 minutes. Been playing with it all night and I love it! Highly recommend it.

Title: Best personal electronic assistant out there.
Body: I cant imagine life without my Echo Dot. It really has helped get my life into order. When I wake up in the morning "Alexa, start my day" She gives my the current weather forecast. She keep me up to date on the current news, daily facts as well as traffic information. ..what my commute to works looks like. Truly my best buy of 2019!  I have yet to fully utilize all that Alexa is capable of, but I know that when I do, i will not be disappointed.

Title: Three is better than one
Body: I receive an Echo Dot for my birthday from my son and daughter-in-law. My husband loved being able to choose songs (as did my grandchildren who are here every afternoon.) When they kept choosing songs unavailable, my husband signed us up for Amazon Music. That lead to the idea of surround sound by putting one in our living room to sync with our family room. And then one in our master bedroom upstairs was even better. So now we have surround sound and intercom capabilities without cutting into our walls or ceilings. Very happy!

Title: Worth it for the upgrade in sound quality and volume.
Body: I bought this to replace my Gen 1 Dot. Now it isn't the snazzy new one with the time on the front, but it doesn't matter since I have it hidden behind some things anyway. The sound is so much better than Gen 1! And really that is all I wanted. I wish it was white or sandstone as they call it now. Maybe it was my mistake ordering it or maybe the bundle I got was only for charcoal. Either way, just aesthetics. It works great.

Title: Handy
Body: Love this devise! I bought one for my son for xmas last year and have regreted not getting one for myself in the kitchen ever since.  Soooo when they had a deal on it couple weeks ago i scooped one up! Its so handy from something as simple as tell me tje wheather to setting a timmer when baking! Also i easily added the device in my app and i could  set my  devise settings separatly from my sons

Title: Great sound quality and WiFi calling functionality.
Body: Bought this unit as a christmas gift for my parents. They love this device and really enjoy how they can use Alexa to set reminders through the day, check the weather before they leave for work, stream any song they like from Prime Music's large gallery and etc.Another cool feature is that they can call me (to the Alexa ap on my phone) free of charge, without the need for a cellular connection. This is a great feature to have when I'm travelling internationally and want to talk to them. I just have to dial them on the app and I can have a seamless conversation for free.The sound quality on the device is great, as well- the bass is pretty decent for what one would expect from a unit of this size, and if you don't like the sound, you can always connect external speakers to this device over Bluetooth.

Title: It's a great product with lots of useful features
Body: I have 3 3rd Gen Echo Dots in my home.  Master Suite: I use this one for putting me to sleep at night with relaxing music and relaxing sleep sounds, as well as waking me up in the morning.  Alarms are so easy to set and change.  Den: I use this one to control my lamp, as well as my tv and XBOX ONE.  I can turn on the tv, adjust the volume,  and switch the input all using voice commands (my Vizio is Alexa compatible).  I walk into the Den and say "Alexa Gamer Time" and my lamp dims to 50%, the tv comes on and switches to the input that my XBOX is plugged in to, and my XBOX comes on.  Ready to go. I also have Alexa play my Audible Books while I am working.  The third one is in my son's room.  He uses it to listen to Pandora and control his lights.It's a great product.

Title: I use it more than I thought I would.  I have 3 of them.
Body: We live in the basement of our office.  We bought the echo's so it was easier to communicate upstairs and down.  I use them for more than I thought I would.  Mainly lists and reminders, timers and alarms.  Music and podcasts.  My only gripe is that I need instructions on how to tie them together.  If the office echo gives a reminder, I would like it to also say it on the kitchen echo.  I'm in my 50's, so my technical abilities are limited, to say the least.  I would say, write the instructions like you are talking to a kindergartener, but I'm sure that a kindergartener knows more than me about these things!!  Just write the instructions like you're talking to a dinosaur.  LOL

Title: Convenient sound from tiny speaker
Body: This is super convenient.  Walk into a room and ask Alexa to play whatever you're feeling like at the moment, and there it is.  The sound is a little bass heavy, surprising from such a tiny speaker, but that is easily correctable.  For background music, the speaker is fine.  For serious listening, I'd want a better speaker.  Installation was easy.  I have an Amazon prime account and mostly listen to Amazon Music, without commercials and no additional cost.  I also listen to Pandora, which has a few commercials when using the free account.

Title: Never Thought I'd Like Echo and Alexa So Much!
Body: Setting up the Echo Dot was much easier than expected and I never thought I'd like having Alexa as much as I do. Discovering Alexa skills has been great with having children in the house. There are so many skills that the kids love from educational trivia quizzes to music they enjoy. The ability to control our thermostats from anywhere is wonderful and we are growing out smart home little by little. Thanks, Alexa!

Title: I don_ know why I waited so long to get these?
Body: I wish I hadn_ waited so long to get echos for my children_ bedrooms. It has made our lives so much easier. They set all their own alarms. They love listening to music. And they ask Alexa all kinds of fun and interesting questions. My oldest loves to fall asleep to sleep sounds. And my youngest loves learning about the weather.I don_ know if there are echoes with this feature but I think it would be great if they were able to have mood lighting. It would be utilized as a night light.

Title: Alexa is to hard to setup and customer service just keeps hanging up on you.
Body: I spent 5+ hours trying to set this thing up. 1st as Alexa. I ended up giving up. She keep saying I'm learning or other stupid answers. Then I tried talking her a speaker. She did learn my voice. Couldn't figure it out. I purchased to be a speaker and voice appliance for my firestick.  Then I tried to pair with my fire stick didn't work. Very disappointed. I returned to the store. It's not user friendly at all. My friends even tried.  I am great with computers. It was just to hard to setup or just was to dump. I asked it for help and it would say things like defining "help" when I said. Help setting up Alexa with firestick, wtc.. I asked it  to help me connect to the fire stick, setup Alexa, make her a speaker. It didn't understand. the application wasn't helpful AT ALL.  And to thinK I was getting 4 more for my kids at Christmas this was a trial on how it works.  MAJOR FAIL Fail. Not user friendly. To hard. Directions didn't help. Google is so much better AS AN ASSISTANT. It will talk u through setup. Only problem it want connect to Amazon devices. They are not friends with each other. Shame. Customer service want to contact me. That's fine.I TRIED CONTACTING YOU WITH 4 DISCONNECTS. carlahart73@gmail.com. No one else. I HABE A HARD TIME GIVING UP ON DEVICES, BUT THIS WAS A COMPLETE FAIL.  I returned the device today  gave up on customer care.  You just lost a major customer.  Unless your with Amazon r Alexa please don't contract me. If my phone number shows you can call it in case I don't check site. A wouldn't buy item. Love the firestick.

Title: Fun and Useful
Body: Sound quality for this little Dot is pretty awesome.  We've played all kinds of music through SiriusXM and had no problems at all with the sound quality.  Alexa's voice is very clear and there's no problems understanding what she's saying.  So far, I've used it to set alarms, play music, read us stories, ask general questions, turn on lights.  I really wanted to use the "Drop-In," feature connected to another Dot on a second floor (which is on another account) but found out that I have to have a "mobile phone number" which I don't have, so that was very disappointing for me since that was a big reason why I bought it.  The other thing I can't get it to do is remember the "sound" I chose for the Alarm.  It always manages to jump back to the Default sound, which isn't terrible, but isn't my choice, either.  I've yet to figure that simple thing out and the help files aren't much of a help.  Next to these two annoyances, I really like my Echo Dot 3rd Gen and plan on getting some more Smart Plugs to use.

Title: Great little "machine" to own - useful info provider, in addition to music and book reader
Body: I bought this 3rd generation Echo because the sound of my previous version echo is sort of low.This 3rd generation has a much better sound but i often times have to speak in a very loud voice so that the thing will stop what is doing because it does not recognize what i am saying.  It is a little "hard of hearing" this unit i have.However, I love the echo product.  I like to use the echo in the setting that speaks back to you because i like to teach the kids that a please and a thank you is appropriate, always .. and it works to add a little politeness to them, which is great.I use both echo i own for everything - from phone calls to friends, to locate my phone when i misplace it, to recipe and all the other good stuff.  I love it --- just wish my newer echo was not so "hard of hearing" when i try to interrupt when she is not responding correctly to my request.

Title: Plug and Play and I LOVE it:  clock is perfect bedside clock
Body: My 3rd Gen Echo Dot with clock arrived yesterday and I already love it.  I'm in a smallish house and have 1 Echo Spot, numerous smart plugs and the Alexa App already so the Dot was just plug in and all is well.  The only thing I did as far as setup was to schedule "Do Not Disturb".  I bought it primarily for a bedside clock and also so that I did not have to "yell" to the Spot across my house.  The clock is perfect: enough light to see but not so bright as to be disturbing.  Also nice to ask for temperature  BUT, I am on the hunt for an Alexa compatible weather station so I can get temp at my house for alerts for frost/freeze primarily and town temps do not equal my mountain foothill location temps.  Bottom line, I find the Alexa products and smart "things" both useful and fun.

Title: Pretty good, but not great
Body: First, and foremost, understand that Amazon does not believe in this product enough to give it a 1 year warranty like most electronics. You only get 90 days and will need to press the customer service reps to replace this product if it fails you. My speaker blew at around 6 months. I never took it over level 8. My suggestion is to keep it lower than that if you want some longevity out of this item.On the other hand, if you purchase Echo products with a good credit card that extends warranties, like a Costco Citi card, you can run a claim through them.

Title: Might be more technology than a rural area can handle
Body: I have more than a little bit of a chore getting this on-line with a crappy internet connection. The ISP told me I degraded my signal further by adding more devices. GRRRR. Now that I have her on-line my crappy internet is intermittent at best, but early in AM plays great. I have hope if I fire my ISP. I also have to start from scratch if I want to travel with these. Once playing, it has great sound. Alexa has added several items to my shopping list by eavesdropping on conversations -- even something the cat "said". Not happy about that either.

Title: Needs Bluetooth Connection Software Upgrade
Body: I think the Echo Dot needs one software upgrade, to enable it to de-select (and not re-connect) to an external Bluetooth audio output.  I put this as one star less under "Alexa integration," since there was not another option.  It is nice to use an Echo Dot to stream music, for a while, but when I am not doing that, I want to use it normally, adn not have it automatically connect to a Bluetooth sound output source.  Yes, the "blame" can be placed on an output source automatically re-connecting to the Echo Dot, but a quality product and product team will identify this problem and fix it, not pass the buck.

Title: We use these for everything!
Body: Wonderful device.  The voice recognition is better than anything else I_e used and it works great with our Hue lights and Ring doorbell.  Alexa _uard is a great feature.  There are so many great features and the weekly emails with new features and suggestions is a nice touch.I think everyone should own one of these.The dot is the smallest and cheapest and therefore the sound quality isn_ the best for bigger rooms, but they are perfect for bedrooms and smaller rooms.

Title: Great auto brightness
Body: I needed this Echo Dot (3rd Gen) for the visible clock feature for both daytime and nighttime use.  The auto brightness feature works great for the two lighting extremes.  I also have grown to really like the fact the current outside temp displays when you query Alexa about the weather.  We are now officially an 8 Echo household, including the original Echo and the Tap!

Title: works right out of the box
Body: Whats not to love with an Alexa dot?It works exactly as expected, and set up in minutes.I've been using Alexa for a while now, and it senselessly added to my network of devices.We'd been having trouble with a third party speaker, and were really hoping this would resolve that.We were happy to find that it did. It also allows me to announce from my phone, and set up routines that include speaking.Very nice

Title: The CLOCK for the winnnnn.
Body: I_l start by saying that I have owned every version of this Echo dot so far. I also have google home but still prefer the Amazon ecosystem overall. This Echo dot with the clock display was a NO BRAINER for me, I_e been waiting on a clock feature for a couple years now. This newer version is 90% the same as the original Gen 3 echo dot so I won_ rehash that review again. In short. This is the SAME as the original gen 3 but this version adds a clock and a few more tweaks related to the clock and display. Here are some highlights below in a nutshell:-Same as original Gen 3...but with a very useful clock!-Sound is powerful and can be heard across any room. Thanks to the EQ in the Alexa app you can tweak the sound even more.-The LED clock is genius! Shows the weather and has adaptive brightness settings.-In my opinion the clock is worth an extra $10 for the Echo dot-LED time/temperature visible from across the room, even in the daytime.Room For Improvement??-Sorry...I_ still not feeling this power cord. A USB-C connector would have been perfect! I_ even take a micro usb connector compared to the default cord.-Why is the power brick so thick?? My Phone charger has even more power than the Echo power brick at half the size *Head scratch*-The sound is definitely an improvement vs the 2nd Gen echo but it feels just a TAD lower compared to the newest google mini (maybe since the mini has front facing speakers)My Verdict? I give this Echo Dot with LED Clock TWO THUMBS UP! Works great for a bedside clock and I have one in the bathroom now as well for morning news and to tell the time.

Title: Improved over the older dot
Body: I currently have an older generation Alexa dot in each of my children_ room.  My son_ dot had stopped _istening, to the point where I could hold it six inches from my mouth and it wouldn_ hear it.  It would be nice to set the explicit level at each device versus globally.It is bigger than the older dot.  Instead of a usb cable and plug, it is now a regular plug with a barrel connected due to an increase in watts.The time display is nice, especially with how often I find myself asking Alexa what time is it.  I do wish it had a setting to turn completely off at set times (it does an adaptive brightness depending on ambient light).The voice detection is outstanding.  From 10 feet away with music playing it detected _lexa even while playing music louder.The sound has also improved, with much more low end oomph.I did order it to be already attached to my account.  This did not occur.  However, this is the first Alexa out of 6 that I successfully used the iPhone app versus getting out the iPad.I would have preferred a different color.  It is a nice color.

Title: Perfect size Alexa
Body: This speaker is perfect for anyone that wants alexa but wont be playing alot of music through the speaker and still wants it to look good. The sound quality is still good to play music but the full size alexa will perform better in that aspect. Get everything alexa has to offer in a smaller package with the stylish fabric on the newer models. Overall great alexa device!

Title: *Echo Dot - Gen 3* is AWESOME & WORTH EVERY PENNY! MUCH BETTER than 2nd Gen Dot! UPDATED REVIEW!
Body: I initially gave this only 1 Star due to it's appearance and "look." But every other aspect of the "Echo Dot 3rd Gen Alexa Device" I'm reviewing and commenting on right now I would give 4/5 or 5/5 Stars normally.  Before I spoke with an Amazon rep during their phone call to me just minutes ago, I did not due to the quality of the "look" of said received item (Echo Dot).  Even though it didn't "look" right, it worked perfectly.  Now, I have been contacted by Amazon.com via phone # on file (which is even MORE AWESOME because they reached out to me the quickest and in the kindest way possible)!!! So, very quickly after my review, Amazon without hesitation showing their grace and professionalism they offered to make things right.  Therefore, I am now giving this Echo Dot #rd Gen Alexa Device 5/5 Stars all around and an A+ for all those youngsters out there! :p  This Echo Dot works GREAT and responds from far away too!  It hears/responds from great distances (more than I expected) and I LOVE how I just learned about Alexa's "Routines" and how to make Custom "Routines" as well as adding new, unique and impressive "Skills" which are EPIC!Thank you so much "TAMI" (aka the Amazon rep who called ME and took HER time to call ME) for all your help. It's because of you, Tami, and your professionalism towards the Amazon Item & Issue(s) -AND- your kindness, acceptance and non-judgmental positive and uplifting attitude towards my very unique physical and mental status that allows ME to make the time to redo a Review like this one and praise the people who SHOULD be praised!  I hope Tami stays with Amazon a long time and hopefully, seeks more responsibility and they move Tami up in the business. Amazon needs strong women like her in higher positions of power to do right by Amazon's customers.  I'm 99% more loyal today to Amazon as a business, as a whole, than I was this very morning, TBH! Also, thanks directly to Amazon as well for "making it right" with the problem with my Amazon Original Product!  TY ALL AGAIN!!! :D  Look forward to more business together!!! I just bought a CyberPowerPC Gaming Desktop PC and an Asurion 3 year warranty today or late last night or so and now I'm just waiting on that to get delivered and for payment to go thru! ;-) I LOVE AMAZON AND THEIR PRIME DEALS!!! TY!

Title: A great innovation by Amazon but there's a long way to go to....
Body: Well, I am happy that I kept myself up with the newest product I found very useful and practical and these smart speakers are just one of them. Unlike many others, I am using the echo environment in parallel with the Google assistant. The main reason of doing so comes from the compatibility issues and what these devices are programmed to cover. Yes, there are many similarities that you can get from both but if you are really into the smart assistant devices then you realize that the differences are remarkable and I wanted to have everything covered and connected so I am using both (Amazon echo and Google assistant). For obvious reasons, way bigger than what I can even encounter in here, Google is dominating the market when it comes to the speed and ease of use smart assistants and Alexa which is still quite better than Siri, Cortana and Bixby are still way far from Google on the second place. A great example of the differences here is like,when you are talking to an adult person vs you are talking to a kid! So with an adult you can speak freely and expect to get a response most likely than you are talking to a kid. I personally can't blame Amazon for what Google has been dominating solely for years and years ahead of everyone else so if you learned how to speak with this kid (Alexa in here), she is going to get the job done accurately and there's more, as I mentioned on the very beginning. It comes from the area of what one particular device covers and it's that important to get your attention to have the more compatible smart assistant for the tasks or other services you are planning to use. The bottom line here is the third generation of echo dot devices are the best of it's own kind and having them in parallel with Google assistant will do almost everything for what is doable in 2019 technology relm.

Title: Better than Ever
Body: Have an original echo and about 5 echo dots around the house.  Had some of them for years now.  This one is the best of the echo dot ones for then bedroom.  I cleared my nightstand and removed my clock and the old echo dot along with some cables and stuffs.  It looks clean, neat, and classy.  We got 2, 1 for each nightstand.  The room looks darker since the clock light dims based on how bright it is in the room.  They can be linked as a music group and the sound is much better than the 2nd generation echo dots.  It sounds quite nice while both are playing.  The display show not only the time, but if the alarm is on, and the temperature if you ask Alexa for it.  You can select the alarm sound, but that is for all of them.  I traded one of the old echo dots for $5, but got also a 25% on another echo dot with clock for my daughter's room to minimize the clutter there.  You can enable Freetime and block explicit filters so it works out nicely.  Would totally recommend.

Title: Wow, significantly better speaker than 2nd gen
Body: I replaced the 2nd gen echo dot in my daughter's room with this 3rd gen, then took her 2nd gen for my office.  I like the new design, the fabric looks very classy. I was blown away how much nicer, richer, and louder the sound is from the new one. When she puts on an audiobook at night, we ask her to turn the volume down to 2 so we can't hear it all the way down the hall!

Title: Dot with Clock Is Worth The Extra $
Body: We wanted to add a Dot to the bedroom (voice-controlled heat/AC is the best!) and I bought this to replace my alarm clock. Integrated into my Alexa app quickly and easily, and looks nice in the new "sandstone" color. As a bonus, the clock auto-dims according to room light and my wife really like our new, darker room. Alarms and sleep timers can be set by voice which is way easier than scrolling through the time on a clock. Sound is not as good as my Echo but I wouldn't expect that given how small it is. It recognizes voices from across the room and is very responsive. I also added the Alexa smart plug for five dollars extra which made it a great deal.

Title: We just don't use these are we thought we would
Body: Basically we have bought a few egg-times. We just don't use these are they are intended. It's a particularly poor music speaker, the room to room intercom is not good enough and the rest is hype. At least someone in Amazon can listen in to our arguments. Please let me know who you are so that you can confirm that I am right and she is wrong.

Title: Best echo device so far. Clock is a great feature
Body: Excellent new echo device. It_ perfect for a night table and the clock has an automatic dimmer when the light is turned out. Set up was a breeze as I already have the app and several devices in two houses. You just get a notice of a new device and accept and it almost sets up itself. Sound is much improved over the earlier version as well. Even my wife who hates gadgets likes the way it looks and the ability to get the weather for the day before even getting out of bed. Highly recommended.

Title: To put it simply: It lives in my junk drawer
Body: I finally jumped on this Echo Dot bandwagon thanks to Amazon Prime Day. Well, this purchase disappointed. If Alexa even understands your instructions, you might get something going. But the connection is horrible and it's definitely not our network. And like I said, most of the time Alexa can't even decipher what someone is saying. I tried returning this but guess what?...Missed the cutoff. It's been sitting in the junk drawer since.

Title: Echo is working and integrating with our home.
Body: We bought two of these and started with a home security system that also gave us one. Most of the time it works well with integration to our systems. It has difficulty with one smart plug, but none of the other items we own. Works great with our security system. Part of our difficulty is with smart devices that only work with the lower Wi-Fi frequency. The Echo dot does great with 2 or 5 frequency channels of our Wi-Fi.

Title: Weather bug !!
Body: Much better than the first version but there is a bug in the software which I have reported but has not been fixed yet. Ask for weather and Alexa gives it for a location 30 miles away and yes before you ask Alexa is set up correctly as verified by support who replicated the issue. It_ been 4 weeks since I reported this and nothing has been fixed. And if anyone is listening at Amazon I have a case Id.

Title: Loving my Dot 3rd Gen!
Body: I love my little dot! We're still "learning" each other but so far, the AskMyBuddy App made this purchase worth it all!  The monthly payment plan made it possibly - I could not have paid full price up front, so for that, I thank Amazon immensely. I did purchase a wall mount that I am very pleased with - it's truly portable to be used in any room.  Planning on purchasing a second one after this one is paid off.  One for the kitchen, one for the bedroom.  I live in a 915sq ft apt, so having one at both ends makes more sense.PROS:  Great features.  I use the time, temperature/weather/ daily flash news, Amazon music and reminders more than anything else so far.  I bought a smart plug for the bedroom light and that works brilliantly. I've played with skills, but she is way smarter than I am.  That's a hit to the ego frankly, so I've left it alone after being owned so many times.  LOLI love being able to create my own skills.  I've had fun with that! (I had an 8-second  .mp4 video of a new skill, but when I tried to upload the vid to this review,  it said it could not process the  .mp4 file)Having compatible security products adds another layer of awesome for this little dot. So many different uses for so many different items makes this Dot a great addition to the home.CONS:1.  Smart Plugs are overpriced.  I did buy one on a flash sale for $6 - but otherwise, they are $25.  WAY too much.2.  I have a Galaxy S4 phone and the app is not compatible.  Having to use my Galaxy Tab A tablet for the App - but since that is reliant only on Wi-fi, I am limited to those parameters to update the app or create a new skill.3.  Set up was a bear!  I use my desktop PC for EVERYTHING. The PC doesn't have wi-fi.  Having an old phone didn't help either, and setup was impossible over the tablet because it has no carrier.  Had I not had a laptop that I could hard-wire to the router AND that had wi-fi, I could not have set this up.  So beware of that.  If you have out of date tech stuff - and can't afford to update it, it may prove to be difficult.  Borrow a friends laptop that can be hard-wired to the router AND use wifi - you have to go in hardwired then during setup, turn on wifi at the same time.  Once it is set up though - it's a well-greased machine!4.  With it being mounted in the wall mount, the sound range is increased, IMO, but it's bass-y.  I've told it to turn the bass down; it's all the way down now and still sounds too deep.  Perhaps for Alexa, it's all about that bass!  LOL - not a deal breaker, just an observation. To be fair, for a little thing, it packs great sound otherwise.------Overall, this is a fun tool that is also a life saver when you get the AskMyBuddy app.  I paid the extra $3.99 a month to add more contacts, but I'm a senior who lives alone and this app alone, makes it worthwhile for anyone wanting to get their parents that have wi-fi, something fun and useful for any occasion. I highly recommend a wall mount.  I bought the one from "ProudBird" on amazon for $9.99 and it keeps the wires neat and out of the way.  Just remember though, when you unplug it from the wall, the plug stays and the mount goes - be careful when pulling out of the wall to be mindful of that. Nice pairing of two great products though.

Title: Like the latest edition
Body: I picked up my 5th echo device for my dog, I mean spare bedroom.  It also happens to be where my parents dog sleeps when he_ staying with us for a few days. He stinks to high heaven so we keep the window open to air the room out, problem is, he_ a dog, they have excellent hearing. He_l hear a dog bark from miles away it seems and then he_l start barking, at the wee hours of the morning!  My son uses his echo dot nightly to play ocean sounds so I figured I_ give it a try with the dog, put a little white noise on to drown out the outside sounds. I couldn_ be happier to say it worked like a charm, he no longer is bothered by nighttime noises so he doesn_ wake up the neighborhood with his barking. Big dogs come with big barks, lol.

Title: Better than 2nd generation
Body: I've been a happy owner of a 2nd generation Echo and three 2nd generation Echo Dots for a few years now. and I was glad to add the 3rd generation echo dot with clock to my home.  The biggest difference is the new look: it's so much nicer than the  2nd generation Dot and comes in a variety of colors, the speaker quality is so much  better speaker quality than Echo Dot Gen 2. Aside from its larger size and slight convex bulge, the top of the device is nearly identical to that of the 2nd generation Dot: it has four buttons (volume up, volume down, microphone off, and an "action" button) and a multi-colored light ring around the top edge that tells you about the Echo's status. The side of the device has an input for the power cable and a 3.5-mm output jack.The biggest noticeable  improvement is the shape of the power cable, which sits flatter against the wall than the 2nd generation Dot's cable . The set up is easy connect the Dot to your WiFi network and the app leads you through everything.

Title: Loving our virtual assistant
Body: We really enjoy our Echo and the Smart Plug that came along with this bundle. I love being able to play Jeopardy with the device, and it's great for when you're getting ready in the morning and you need to know the weather forecast but don't have time to stop and check your phone. The Smart Plug and Alexa allow us to set an alarm and automatically turn on the bedroom light at a certain time so that we make sure we get up when we need to. It can do so much more, we just haven't had time to fully explore the device's capabilities.My boyfriend is still a bit suspicious of the device, but I'm overall very satisfied with it.

Title: If your house isn't 'smart' what are you doing
Body: I have multiple dots in my house and absolutely love them. Leaving the dogs alone for a while? "Alexa, play Lord of the Rings in the living room". Having a guests over? "Alexa, turn on my party lights". Want a relaxing morning? "Alexa, play sirius xm coffee house radio". Getting organized? "Alexa, make me a to-do list". These things are just great. I have almost all my electronics hooked up to Alexa and it has changed my life. My lamps, tvs, sound systems, security cameras, and even my switches are connected and voice activated or are on timers. You seriously don't know how much you needed these things in your life until you get them.

Title: Good but not great
Body: Id still like to see some improvements on the microphone on this device. I have a full sized echo in another room about 20-25ft away and one in the same room im in less than 8 ft away and when i say the wake word the one in the room away will pickup and the one in the same room will not, even with no obstructions and keeping it away from the wall as recommended by support.The audio quality is much improved from the second generation dot though which is very nice.

Title: My Little Helper
Body: I got the Dot while preparing for my surgery/recovery. I am so glad I did! Alexa is amazing, she was my helper my entertainment and she kept me on track. Her skills are exceptional and very helpful for someone who couldn't get up and walk after surgery. I also got the plug-in wall casing for the Dot - the sound is great and the unit looks good and clean on my wall. I would definitely recommend Alexa Dot and I am going to purchase again to place in other rooms. Very pleased with my purchase.

Title: Fuller Sound!
Body: I_e had 2nd gen Dots for a few years. I love the new cloth design. The old covers were a bit ridiculous. Also a dust magnet.I_ not going to be rough on a product I got for .99¢. A promotion for signing up with Amazon Music Ul. I was ditching another service anyways.The speaker has a fuller and more immersive sound. Keep your expectations realistic. Music is more enjoyable and less tinny.Alexa falls flat. Not the service, but when she interacts. The voice sounds like she_ underwater. Even worse if you have a slight echo. Picture the bathroom. Not a deal-breaker, but still annoying. I_ more sensitive to tones with my blindness. Hopefully a correction for the next generation. Also, Google Mini doesn_ suffer from this. Relatively similar in size.My REAL issue is the AC adapter. Who_ brilliant idea was it to ditch the micro USB? Less intrusive over this monstrosity that plugs in. Not practical for areas like a bathroom. Certainly not dealing with a Johnny I_e design aesthetic. Yeah, I know it_ a $50 product. Aesthetics bring a sense of zen into their respective placement.All said, an overall decent product. Which has a definite fuller sound.

Title: Makes Life Easier
Body: Before purchasing this dot, I had an echo plus. I find that the echo dot is a great addition to my bedroom and allows my day to run more smoothly. I currently use the dot to set multiple alarms for the morning, set a timer for when to give my child her medicine, and answer simple questions while I am getting dressed in the morning ("What is the weather today in _______? What does it feel like outside? etc). While this device isn't revolutionary in what it does (because we have had smartphones for a while), it makes life easier and allows me to do these things handsfree. I run a daycare, so sometimes while I am changing a diaper, I will ask Alexa questions that I would normally need my hands for (Alexa, what time is it?). Overall, a nice addition to the Echo/Alexa lineup.

Title: Bit difficult to connect things but good quality for the price
Body: For the price is great especially I got the Great deal on it. however setting it up is bit pain especially if you don't want to take time reading the instruction.. also I think this was made for native English speaker so if you have an accent or something you might have to repeat yourself couple times. I'm getting used to it though so I might try in different language setting if there is one, but for basic purposes like listening to radio or music was okay. quality of listening is pretty good just setting it up was bit of a pain that's all.

Title: The GREAT HELPER
Body: This is a great product.. No questions about.. It is one of the hallmarks of Amazon.  I enjoy using it and love how my commands are carry out... "No complaining from Alexa ever" LOL.... Doesn't matter what i ask her to do.....For somebody that has live as long as I have, it borders science fiction when I utilize Alexa.  I have not scratch the surface of the things she can do....  It is a paramount buy for the money.PS.  I have 3 great grand lovely girls.  They spend weekends with my wife and me. Like all kids at 8 and lower, bed time is a struggle.  I just discover Alexa bed time stories, and the trip to dreamland has easy up when they listen to them.

Title: Terrible sound quality. It's called a speaker, but it's more like a muffled mess.
Body: I have something like 5 different Alexa devices and this is my least favorite. Why? The sound quality is terrible. It's supposed to be a speaker so I assumed that the sound would be at least as good as a regular Dot. Nope. It sounds muffled and there is no volume level that sounds good. It sounds like it's speaking through a blanket or heavy winter scarf. I do like the look of this one, but the sound "quality" makes it my very least favorite Echo -- by far.

Title: Makes my house so smart
Body: I use alexa for just about everything electric in my house. its easy to install. i had the 2nd gen and the 3rd gen has some upgrades. its a little bigger but the sound quality is very good, especially for music and morning alarms. Alexa has so many features. The only thing i dislike is the power plug. it used to be USB but not anymore. you have to use the given wire. Besides that i love my alexa.

Title: Surprisingly Capable Voice Assistant
Body: This is my families first Alexa hardware product and boy does it produce. She_ quick and surprisingly knowledgeable. She has answers for everything and a great trivia knowledge which is fun. I like that you can change the wake word to four predetermined ones (computer is an option for Star Trek fans). If someone in your family is named Alexa you can still use it without it driving you nuts.It gets loud enough to hear in other rooms and the amount of automation, which Amazon calls _outines, is extensive. I have it a set up to lower the volume to 3 (out of 10) at 9pm and raise it back up to 5 at 9am. This keeps our kids from waking us up and we don_ have to constantly change the volume. There are plenty more options if you have other smart lighting even not in the Ring universe. Ex. It can control my IKEA TR_DFRI smart plugs I use for lighting. All of this without setting it up.It is a little creepy to have it always listening to us and it knows a surprising amount about my other accounts (Pandora worked with my account without setup). My wife and I don_ talk about anything work confidential at home but it may bother others if they work from home. There is a physical mute button on the top of the echo dot but it_ only a software switch and not a hardware one. If that makes a difference to you be ware.Overall, we got ours free with the Ring Alarm system as a promo and the echo dot is a surprisingly good voice assistant and we all use it more often than I figured. Definitely a good buy.

Title: Perhaps one of the devices that we use the most
Body: It integrates beautifully in our home. It is located at my boy's room and from there it controls several devices, it can hear me even from the living room, at 25 feet away and from there it turns on and off the lights at the hallway, for example.We took it to our lounge room for small meetings with friends and it fun to control and fight over which song we will listen next.It learns everyday and skills are getting smarter every week. I'm very please with the product, so please that I bought one for my parent house, with my intention to keep it for me, since I thought they will not use it and get bored about Alexa, quite the opposite they love it and now they are asking me for another one to place it in their second floor.

Title: Superb Sound
Body: This is second one i Baught. At first, I was reluctant to talk to a hockey puck.  Okay so I am old fashioned.  I use smart sockets in some areas in my home.  I have them connected to my phone.  But I found out you could program the Echo Dot to them.  I have gotten used to talking to it.  I now command it to turn on and turn off certain things around my home.  You can command it to guard your home.  You can ask where your orders are.  If you say good morning it will give you information as to what happened on that date years ago.  You can joke with it too.  The things you can do with it are endless.

Title: Some great improvements but not with the microphones.
Body: This is definitely a great improvement over the Echo Dot 2nd Gen in all aspects except the microphones. I use to work for Amazon doing phone tech support for Echos and Kindles so I am disappointed with this. The older Echo Dot had 7 microphones and the new Echo Dot only has 4. They said it should be better but most of the time, my Echo Dot has issues hearing me. I had to by a 3rd party stand just to adjust the angle and have the device work face out toward the room. I never had an issue with my Echo 1st Gen or the Echo Dot 2nd Gen when they were in the same location.

Title: Buyer Beware - $1 Echo Dot sale is too good to be true.
Body: So, get this!  I ordered this Echo Dot on sale for $1 with a subscription to Amazon Music Unlimited.  Good deal, right?  Wrong!  Amazon delivered the wrong item to my house.  This isn't normally a problem because they typically make it right with no problems.  Not this time!  Because it was bought with a subscription, my only option was to purchase a new Echo Dot for full price ($49.99).  They did give me my $1.00 back though.  The pic of what I received is NOT an Echo Dot! LOL!

Title: iffy mic results. Also direct plug in version of EchoDot3 would be more practical.
Body: I find that if I set the volume low, Alexa doesn't respond to commands as well. Amazon always claims that audio volume and mic listening ability are not related - BUT, I agree with some other folk who have reported the same results. I so wish they would offer a direct plug in Echo dot. (Not the tiny new echo plug in they just started to sell) It would be nice to get rid of the messy wires and make echo less conspicuous.

Title: Does what you expect
Body: After the super easy set up, the Echo Dot performs exactly as you expect. The voice recognition is fast, and the sound quality is acceptable. It's much better than a phone speaker so its bluetooth connection is very helpful. The fabric on the outside is fantastic and the overall weight of the Dot is very nice.I would like more customization like a custom wake up word, nickname when talking to me, more alarm sound options, and ability to play youtube audio.Overall this is a great little home device.

Title: Great sound quality, excellent voice-recognition sensitivity
Body: Love the rich, deeper sound. No "tinny" speaker! Excellent range on voice-recognition tasks. Recognizes commands even while streaming music and talk radio. Good weight, stays put on surfaces. Excellent purchase!

Title: LOVE IT!!!!
Body: I_ now hooked on this thing. I use it all the time. She_ my cooking timer, music, lighting controller, back up to my burglar alarm, random information and alarm clock. Also regarding the alarm clock.... yelling Alexa shut the f-up!!! Actually works at 5am to turn off the alarm clock LOL.... you can also say Alexa call (name) and she will make a phone call for you. Handy when your in the middle of cooking or doing dishes. I got another one for my 76 year old mother. Got her life alert and she refused it. Got her Alexa and she_ using it. If my mom falls or gets stuck she can now just yell Alexa call 911 and help will arrive.... got my mom three more echos so she_ covered in the entire house.

Title: Echo, indispensible!
Body: I love everything about this Echo.  We are having fun with the "Announce" feature at bedtime. If you announce "good night" it plays a cute little tune. You can ask things to specific devices like "Ask Bea's Echo to bring me tea" or ask Livingroom Alexa to turn off the flood lights. Mostly I ask for music or details on an actor/actress that I'm currently watching on TV. The Echo is separate and I don't want to bother Alexa (but, sometimes I do.) I set Echo alarms, and tell all of the kids "announce" dinner is ready. This is an underpriced gizmo -- making life a little easier and fun!

Title: I keep having to reset my echo everyday
Body: When it's  working I have I no problem asking it anything and it will answer me, but by the end of the day or the next day, I'll say Alexa and the echo will turn blue on top and I will ask it something like what time is it or what's the weather like today and it won't answer, It just stays quiet. I'll keep asking it about two or three more time and it does the same thing.I end up having to reset it and then it works ok for that day only.It will work if you push the _ction button and ask it what you want but as for as answering you when you ask it something with  your voice it wont answer you..I like it but I don't like having to reset it everyday...Am I the only one having this problem or Maybe you can tell me what I'm doing wrong .

Title: Beyond expectations
Body: I purchased the new Echo Dot with clock to replace my much older and failing bedroom alarm clock. After a week_ worth of use, I can already say with confidence it was worth every penny. The ability to adjust the brightness, set multiple alarms in the matter of seconds (and visually see them appear for confirmation), and Alexa_ whisper function are my favorite features so far beyond a typical Echo Dot. Any reservation I had of switching from an old school alarm clock to the newest technology is gone. It has exceeded my expectations. - 43 year old mom

Title: use in kitchen for timers and music!!
Body: I love echo products... I already have some on my porch and my bedroom. I put this on one in my kitchen and I like it. Granddaughter set it up so I can get it to set alarms like "echo set timer for 20 minutes" or whatever for cooking! It's easier than trying to do it on stovetop with buttons. Also I like to listen to my music while I'm cooking so this is perfect -- I have a radio station that I can ask it to play. It's very easy to use and I love it! I would buy more Echo Alexas if I could.

Title: Just the right size
Body: If you worried about devices listening in on your conversations I would suggest you get over it. Phones, computers, TVs, tablets they all do this. We love this device. We can tell her to play music and turn it up or down or skip a song. She can play specific songs or a shuffle, which we use for the kids like super simple songs. It_ the perfect size, not too expensive. My only complaint is that when you have the music on depending on the volume she may not hear your voice if you try to call her name.

Title: Sound quality much improved.  But still a little too mush bass for speech
Body: I listen to the news on this device.  This replaced my 1st generation Echo in which the speaker "died".  Sound quality improved BUT, in my opinion too much bass.  Also on daily briefing, too much difference in volume between BBS News (volume drops considerably) and Associated Press...Wayyyyy to loud.  This volume difference issue is not device dependent, I've notice for a few years on all of my devices ( have 3 Echo devices).

Title: Horrible
Body: Won't open any app on fire stick. Sometimes it'll search. But if you tell it to open Netflix, it only searches, and didn't even give Netflix in the search results. The boss baby is the first search result for Netflix. I literally got this JUST for the fire stick, and it's extremely pointless for that. If it does manage to give the correct result, it won't actually open it.

Title: Almost perfect
Body: I love the product dont get me wrong, but one feature keeps failing on me once in a while. If you bought the product to be used as a bluetooth speaker for the PC, it does work just not all the time. After a few days the connection on the PC would say connected to Bluetooth. Connection on the Alexa setting would also say connected but there is no sound. Just plug out the power at the echo, wait a few moment and plug it back in. This will reset the device and upon reconnecting the bluetooth after reset it would work. I had to do this twice after a week of using it. Not perfect but yeah does its job.. that is the only complain i have.. Would recommend.

Title: A nice little music streamer
Body: I use the Dot3 connected to a class D amplifier via it's 3.5mm outputs playing through a pair of Overnight Sensation DIY speakers. The Dot3's DAC is surprisingly good and comparable to the Chrome Cast Audio streaming into a $99 Topping DAC. I wish it had a digital output so I could take advantage of an external DAC like I do with the CCA and no doubt the sound would be even better. The Echo Link allows this but it's priced too high for what it does which is probably why it's ratings and popularity are not so great. Based on the $24 I paid for the Dot3 it deserves 5 stars but my first one's output died after a few weeks but Amazon replaced it.

Title: Better than 2nd gen, but has it's flaws
Body: So I've been using echos since the first gen.  This is my first third gen, and I'm not really enjoying some of the changes.  Mainly it doesn't power by USB anymore, but rather uses a pigtail connector and ac adapter that comes with it.  I'm not a fan of being tied to a special power adapter like this.  I like having options for power delivery that the previous generations had.  It's bigger and heavier, the sound quality is improved over the 2nd gen.  I still miss the ring from the first gen.  But bring back USB power.  Use USB c if you have higher power needs now.

Title: So far loving it.
Body: So far loving it. The kiddos are in love with Alexa always asking questions love the home guarding setting so awesome and also the math quiz for kids it_ awesome everything it_ good about Alexa even the price on this echo dot looking forward to get the bigger version of this one. Did I mention that we sleep with the thunderstorm sounds on then she goes to sleep by herself also the do not disturb lights off it_ great thank you amazon. Now the new home activity detection it_ great love it.

Title: Needs to have its own way to connect to the internet.
Body: I bought this for my 90 year old mother. I haven_ got it set up for her yet, as she does not have Wifi. There is an Xfinity guest hotspot, but for some reason, I cannot connect to it.  I_ working on getting her her own internet.  It seems Amazon dropped the ball on this.  There should be a Echo Dot version that can connect on its own, like a cell phone built into it.  This would be a great safety feature, and millions more people would buy it to know their elderly loved ones could call them with their voice only.

Title: Best thing I've bought so far
Body: I've never been into the smart home stuff Cuz I just thought I didn't need it. Well I decided I'd finally try something like this and I gotta say I'm glad I did. I don't have a stereo so I listen to music on this and the sound is actually really nice for a small speaker. The bass isn't the best but thats Cuz I like alot of bass. Through the alexa app u can have alexa do certain things and customize her. She has drop in features where u can talk to whoever is in another room. She can record like if u say hey alexa tell "..." to stop shell record ur voice and tell that person to stop and so on. This is alot better than I thought it'd be. I'm really happy I bought this. Alexa has became part of my everyday life now. I definitely recommend getting one of these if u haven't yet. She does soooooo much that I can't list every thing.

Title: Alexa Worked Fine
Body: I was excited, at my age, and looking forward to having a partial smart home.  I ordered the Echo Dot 3 gen (which I love even now) and two smart plugs to control two lamps...one in the bedroom and one by the front door.  The dot worked perfectly, plug it in and Alexa is "in the house."  The smart plugs would connect to the home network but no matter what we (Amazon Tech and myself) tried, the plugs would not react to the "off/on" commands.  The software would find the smart plug, install the drivers or whatever, but no reaction.  I was disappointed with the smart plugs only.  Please do not let my experience interfere with moving up a notch in the "Smart Universe."  This is probably an isolated incident and a possible something I overlooked in my network.  On top of it all, I lost my patience!  I wanted it to work out of the box.  I returned the entire package with reluctance.  Amazon is a great company for me.  I have never ever had to return anything before.  I personally realize there is no way back from the "Smart Universe."  By the way, the return was flawless.

Title: Echo Upgrade - Better than ever
Body: I have a V1 Echo and even though that one is larger with bigger speakers - this one is almost on par with in it terms of loudness and sound quality.  Its quite a testament in how far they have come with the technology packed into the these small dots.  What is even better about these is that you can pair a couple of these together for big sound that envelops your house.Everything that is good about the V1 Echo is as good with dot instead its small, sleeker, and blends in better with the house decor.  If you are looking to jump into the Alexa landscape this is a great product to start with and eventually grow.

Title: Inaccessible for anyone below a recent (problematic!) iOS update
Body: This is literally a paperweight because I'm not given access to the app and they don't offer the ability to operate via a pc. I have an iPhone 6s which has been GREAT, no issues whatsoever and great battery life.  I am aware that updating to the newer iOS' can cause serious issues or shut down your phone, so I avoid them and my phones been great.  But because the Alexa app only works starting at a certain newer iOS update, I can't even download it to set it up. Thus, I can't even use my dot. _ They should really allow access to everyone...

Title: Echo Dot 3rd generation is the way to go!
Body: We like everything about the Echo Dot 3rd generation actually! Alexa is not hard of hearing she picks up every time we talk to her! It's so nice to be sitting around the house or whatever we may be doing and we say "hey Alexa play Halloween music" as we're carving pumpkins and it works! Or another example I love to use it when I'm cleaning house or game night!! We love it and will be purchasing another I'm sure! Thanks!

Title: Hard to set up but we are FINALLY cool! _
Body: Holy moly was this difficult to set up! I'm not sure if my husband's Bluetooth being turn on his phone while I was setting up that caused issues but it took me far too long to get it figured out. In the end, we got it right. She didn't give me my morning brief when I greeted her this morning but we're still getting to know each other.True story, first thing Alexa did for us was meow like a cat. We'll get along just fine.

Title: Inability to physically shut off alarm...only snooze.
Body: I got this particular echo dot because of the display. I figured that it would completely replace my nightstand alarm clock. While you can tap the top of the unit to snooze the alarm, you can't tap or touch anything on the dot to "shut off" the alarm. I realize I can say "Alexa, shut off the alarm", but I would rather NOT have to do that at 5:30AM while my wife is peacefully sleeping.So, every stinking morning I have to go into the app on my phone to switch the slider to the off position. Now the other problem that this causes is that I have to restart my alarm every night. Not happy about this.

Title: Works better than any other assistant I've used
Body: Alexa is amazing and the integration is so much deeper than any of the other smart assistants I have tried. You can ask Alexa to play games and control your thermostats and lighting etc, without a ton of extra crazy hoops to jump through. Notable difference: Alexa, I want to play Jeopardy leads to a trivia game with the speaker. Another smart speaker will instead play a random song titled Jeopardy...

Title: Perfect inexpensive entry into a 'smart house' monitor!
Body: My first Alexa product... wow. I am soooo impressed!Along with most other people, I am also concerned about eavesdropping. So I have installed it into a spare bedroom that we rarely have conversation in. I'm not sure we ever say anything that would bother me terribly to have someone overhear, but that thought still bothers me enough to keep it out of common areas til I'm more comfortable with it.What I marveled at was how you can ask Alexa to make calls from my contact list. I know some people are worried about sharing that info with Alexa, but take a look at how many apps already have access to your contact list, none of which (other than phone and text) enhance your experience. Alexa makes calls for you while lying in bed!!! This feature made me so happy, I bought one for my mom immediately. She has a rescue alert downstairs, but insists on sleeping upstairs, where rescue alert may not hear her. Now, she can tell Alexa to call me from bed if she needs me!! The peace of mind is priceless.I haven't explored all of Alexa's features, but the ones I like best are the ability to control lights (Alexa lights on, lights off), and the thermostat, while laying in bed. From the guest room, I can turn the ac up simply by telling Alexa to do it, and my husband is none the wiser. HAAAA!!!  The ability to make calls or emergency calls while in bed is wonderful! I can have my cell charging on the table, and make calls from Alexa! The sleep assistance skills which include meditation, sounds (forest, waterfall, rain, thunderstorm - all free). Music on demand... Amazon already has my extensive playlist, so I can have it play a pretty large variety already, plus the Prime Music (and if you have Amazon Music, there's literally no limit to what it can play on demand). Let me expand on the meditation.... this actually does a guided meditation that changes daily to help you calm and relax. It's remarkable, and the perfect ending to a hectic day! I LOVE this!Because it's in a spare bedroom, I haven't spent a lot of time talking to it for it to get fully used to my voice. I have noticed that when I'm slurring my speech from sleepiness, it doesn't always recognize me, and sometimes when it does, I'm surprised because I know I'm groggy and slurring. I imagine that if I had a cold or flu, the problem would get worse, but perhaps that will improve over time as the recognition grows.I am definitely glad I got this, and looking forward to exploring all the new features! At this price, I would recommend it to anyone to try (along with a light switch or plug, so you can get instant light turn on off gratification). What a great intro to a smart house!!

Title: My Favorite Clock in the House
Body: I recently became a cord-cutter.  And while I don't miss cable TV too much, I quickly missed the digital clock in the living room that was on the old cable box.  This Echo Dot with clock is a great replacement for that.My children enjoy asking questions to Alexa and I like listening to SiriusXM channels linked through my online account.I thought I would like the clock's adaptive brightness, but the digits were a bit too dim to read during the day, so now I just use a permanent brightness of 40% and that works great.This is the fifth Alexa device that I've purchased, and I'm just as happy with this one as I am with the others.  Five stars!!!!!

Title: Tiny steps to home integration
Body: Been deciding which company to go with for future smart home integration.  After looking at Google, Apple, and Amazon, decided to go with Amazon Alexa based system.  We already have Ring doorbell and also Ecobee smart thermometer so this seems to be a natural move to go with Echo.  Setup is very straight forward and quick, and everything is very intuitive to use so far.Of course, the deal to get a unit for 1 dollar with 1 month subscription to Amazon Music makes this deal that much sweeter.Loving it!!

Title: Echo Dot Third Generation with Time Display
Body: The light sensor for the time display does not adjust properly to light settings. In the dark it is too subtle, difficult to read. There is no ability to adjust light sensor settings. Other features same as with earlier versions of DOT, except generation 3 is not compatible with all 2nd generation external speakers for which the device needs to be cradled.

Title: Mi familia la llamamos Tia Alexa!
Body: Hemos probado otros dispositivos pero realmente el Echo Dot superó por mucho a los demás. Mi primer ventaja es la calidez de la voz, no tan robotizada sino amable, además entiende muchos mejor y resuelve prontamente. En casa tenemos 2 Echo dot y todos los focos wifi están controlados por voz. Es la mejor recomendación.

Title: Changed our life!!
Body: I want to say my Dad had an accident last November and Alexa made our lives so much better. He was paralyzed and now he has more movement but not much. Alexa and the Alexa plugs made it where he could turn on the TV and lamp. You don_ think about those simple things much but when you can_ even turn on a light when you wake up until someone else does it you could be laying in the dark for 30 minutes if your caregivers are busy. If you want to go to bed but can_ turn off the tv or light you_e at someone else_ mercy. My dad couldn_ use his phone but Alexa made it where he could call people.
