My kids even got to drop in on their Grandpa when they wanted. He was able to hear the news if he wanted and his favorite was listening to music. When all you can do it lay in bed it_ amazing to be able to have those simple freedoms and abilities. I am beyond thankful for Alexa. My dad is at a facility now doing acute physical therapy and they don_ have good WIFI and Alexa. Any connect and it_ so sad to us but for the last year it was his lifeline and once he is well enough to come home (if he ever is) then I_ sure she will be very valuable again. Thanks Amazon for such a user friendly product.

Title: Worth what I paid, which was ninety nine cents with a music subscription.
Body: Didn't know what to expect, but I have it playing music, telling me how cold it is outside, etc. Also controls two plug devices, after a hassle setting them up.  Sometimes, I am surprised what it doesn't "know".  Like how many miles in a degree of latitude. (69}.  I actually got it to answer by asking how many meters from the equator to the North Pole (ten million - defined by the French expeditions along the Prime Meridian}, then asking how many miles in ten million meters, then dividing THAT by 90, the number of degrees of latitude from the equator to the North Pole.  Echo couldn't put all those things together by itself, or didn't know the basic fact.  On the other side, it told me that Barbara Walters is 90, and it doesn't know if she has Alzheimer's. So, it's sort of OK. Good to find out if some public figure is still alive, I guess.

Title: Stopped working after 5 months.
Body: Everything was fine in the beginning, however after 5 months of light use (playing music) it decided not to work.  I ask Alexa to play music.  All is well at first, but then about 4 minutes into the music she stops.  Sometimes I get 45 minutes before it stops working.  It is annoying because it has to start over at new places in the que.  I wouldn't have written the review, however, I couldn't find a way to contact Amazon directly.  Into the trash it goes.

Title: Not smart what so ever
Body: I gave this product 4 stars after purchased I was giddy and excited but soon realized I was mistaken this thing is not smart.. black Friday comes and I ask "Alexa how much is a Google home mini? It says " the echo Dot 3 .... " This happens all the time I can't ask anything about Google products ? I was just trying to buy my mother a Google home mini for Christmas.. so instead I asked Google on my phone how much a echo whatever is and without hesitation it told me an unbias answer.. if I didnt have a fire stick 4k which I love I would throw echo in the trash.. don't believe me ? Go ahead ask your echo "Alexa why does Amazon factories have such high injury rates ? " It won't tell u or it says sorry I don't know that oneI wish Google connected to firestickI honestly doubt Amazon will post this true and unbias review after all I love my Amazon firestick !

Title: An Improvement for Sure!
Body: I wanted another Echo I could put in a guest bathroom. If someone fell in a tub or needed help, they could just have Alexa call me. Of course that is also possible to do that in other parts of the house (we have 5 Echo Alexa products so far and 2 more will complete the process).I also purchased the gizmo that fits this 3rd generation Echo Dot that plugs into the wall socket in the bathroom and it works great. This newer Echo has a more superior quality sound.

Title: Waste of money
Body: Alexa_ nickname is _orthless in our house. Doesn_ enable you to voice select for individual programs. Sometimes just doesn_ work at all when you give it a voice command. It will stop and resume your program fairly reliably. Other than that, can_ say it_ done much to make our viewing easier. The remote that came with our fire stick is the only reliable way to control our set. We don_ care about having some dumb joke told to us or what a sports score is.

Title: Can Amazon just, please, fix it!
Body: Update: I have reduced this to 1 star. I got a phone call that sounded like something was going to happen, but nothing did. I've waited a week. Time to get my money back.I want to give this a good review. I have purchased so many Echo devices for myself and friends and family, I am obviously a fan. I have 7 active and 3 inactive devices in my house right now, plus Kindles everywhere! However, this one has a problem I cannot get resolved. When I drop in to chat with someone the speaker on the Dot fails after 5 minutes. I can no longer hear the other person, but they can hear me. I've explained this to customer service, but they just don't seem to understand what is wrong and have asked me 3 times now to do the same things which do not fix the issue. I have spent at least 3 hours with them and at this point I just don't want it anymore.I'm still waiting for them to call back and, probably, ask me to do the same things again. I'm over it. I don't want to help Amazon fix their stuff for hours. I'm beginning to think I backed the wrong dog in the AI race.I hope I get to update this with an "exceeded expectations" report, but my guess is I'll be lucky to have anyone even meet my expectations: Fix the damn thing!

Title: Fantastic Speaker, Research Shows Microphone Mute Does Work!
Body: I'm someone who *loves* the convenience technology such as this provides, but I must admit to being a bit skeeved out by the potential for abuse that such a device poses. While Amazon may not have any malevolent intent, the fact that a device, if in the wrong hands, can effectively serve as a cold-war era spy's dream bug in your house -- and one that you pay to have no less -- is disconcerting. However, research has shown that Amazon is being honest with respect to the mute button. Teardowns of the device show that when the mute button is applied, there is no voltage going across the microphone chip. This is very comforting, as there are certain times when having an "always listening" device isn't exactly an inviting thing to have in your home.As far as acoustics go, this device is excellent. It's quite impressive how Amazon has been able to pack in such a fantastic and well-rounded speaker into such a relatively inexpensive device. It offers enough bass, mid-range, and high-end clarity to easily be able to enjoy music without wishing there was a better speaker lying around. And for that alone, I'm grateful.

Title: It's called Echo because it comes with a loud squeal echoing on drop in calls
Body: Great little smart device with a woman name Alexa inside a machine. I was watching someone's video in the comments here showing the smart light function demonstration (alexa turn on the light) and even my echo dot sitting at the corner in my room woke up to pick up what that person said in the video and told me "Sorry I didn't find a device name light". The only problem I ran into was drop in call sometimes doesn't work. Some restarting may resolve this bug but I hope it's not repetitive. I ain't not time to unplug my echo dot every time this happens. Sometimes when music is playing at 3/4 volume, Alexa won't hear me unless I yell at the top of my lung for it to wake. Overall it's an impressive small smart device. I can't wait to try out the smart plug and dimmable color bulb. We just need more Alexa controlled smart device like "Alexa, flush the toilet" without having to press down that filthy flush lever or "Alexa, open the window blinds in the kitchen" operating the blinds with a motorized device installed at the main headrail. I can go on but that's just giving free ideas to Amazon. I just love being creative. That's what I do, I drink and I know things.Update 10/31/19: There is a loud high pitch squeal  noise coming out of the echo dot when I drop in call from my Alexa app thru my android phone. Making it unbearable to communicate with someone with they drop in call me. Its horrible! 1 star taken away til they somehow fix this or I will just return it.

Title: Need the app for pc
Body: So sick of having to try to get apps from Microsoft Store.  My win 10 enterprise does not have store and the app CANNOT be installed to get the Alexa app.  How about you make the software available more easily. Have searched over and over to get the 'app' for pc but to no avail. Really discourages me from making any purchase where I have to go to Microsoft Store. Yes, I know I can do it on my phone, BUT I DONT want to. Not everyone in the world is GLUED to their phones

Title: After several months of low volume usage, speaker is horrible
Body: After using this for several months (volume typically around a 5-6), the speaker sounds horrrrrible. The Alexa voice recognition is mediocre, but I like it being connected to my Amazon stuff, so that's fine. The fact that the audio is so horrible it makes me question whether or not I should go all-in on the Echos :/  I only have one of these echos, so I'm not sure if it's the model or just the one I have. Super disappointed.

Title: Its ok
Body: Overall its an somewhat of ok smart assistant. Issues: Integrating it with another amazon speaker is not easy/its pretty bad because it would either not play in sequence with another speaker or even worse is when you would ask for a song to be played on one speaker in kitchen for ex and it would play in a living room while kitchen one will be silent. Dont really know why it does that. Speaker vise its pretty weak but its tiny and packs fee features so expected. Another issue is phone connectivity. It would connect to the phone play music for like 4 mins and just silent itself. No matter what you do it wont play anything until you disconnect the phone ___ Rest of the features its ok. also when it does connect only one speaker will play off the phone which is annoying. Alexa needs to become a little smarter with answers too. Rest of the features its fine.

Title: Use Google home works better.
Body: glad i only paid .99 for it. I worked great for a week, like some of its answers better the the google assistant but it stop doing anything for my wife or my self. reset and tried again still not working? the light just goes around yellew. the app said it online and will play music form casting from amazon music or spotify but no voice recognition. I'll stay with Google home thanks.

Title: Finally, a clock that doesn't light up my room like the sun at night.
Body: Finally, a clock that dims to the perfect brightness at night and brightens perfectly during the day and it comes with everything Alexa has to offer.  I have bought and thrown out so many alarm clocks because none of them can seem to get the bright enough to see during the day but dim enough to actually be able to sleep next to at night setting right.  But finally, with this echo all that is possible.  It is small but the numbers are distinct enough that they can be viewed from a long distance away.  Perfectly dims/brightens with changes in light.  And with Alexa you can set alarms listen to music, control lights, thermostat settings, get the weather, news etc. all from the comfort of your own bed.  Love it, just wish it came in more colors.

Title: Great gadget
Body: Got it for the great amazon music unlimited deal, price is really unbeatable! And I really like the color!Pros:1. Great sizeMy apartment is rather small so I don_ need a big speaker for easy music, the little echo dot is pretty powerful!2. Many skillsAlexa has many skills that can be played around with, like Kungfu panda game with kids is so fun! Also, they have games and news for adults too.3. Tightly integrates with Amazon music limitedIt works very well with the amazon music app, I can just select music on the app and play on echo dot.4. Smart homeIt really helps a lot with the light and heater situation. Quick response as well. I can just have the light on or off on the bed.Cons:1. Bugs/ lagsSometimes it will stop playing music or stop responding, it_ not often and I_ not sure if it_ because of my WiFi.2. Hard to understand sometimesSometimes Alexa doesn_ speak smoothly, like a heavy robot sound, there are some words that I couldn_ understand.And it_ weird that Alexa can_ respond to the same question sometimes.3. Voice controlWhen you_e playing loud music, you pretty much have to yell so that Alexa can hear you.

Title: A Lifesaver for Those with ADD or ADHD
Body: I don_ know how I lived without these. I have one in the bedroom, one in the living room. I have ADD and it helps me remember to take my medicine, to pick up my husband from work, to turn down the oven mid-cooking cycle, etc. I use the timer nonstop. _emind me to switch the laundry in one hour! If I remember I need to call someone but it_ too late to call, I ask it to remind me in the morning to call so and so. I can listen to just about any kind of music with a simple request. I can talk to my phone-less kids by simply dropping into the living room before I get home. It just really, really helps me stay on task. The sound quality isn_ spectacular but it_ decent and if amazing sound is your jam, you can always hook up a speaker or opt for a pricier model.

Title: A great gift!!
Body: After having my Echo Dot for a  while, my lady friend really liked what I could do with "Alexa".As usual, she heard from all the "conspiracy theorist" that the Government is listening in on you (please),but once she got my gift.  She loves it now.  Whether its asking the time, setting an alarm, scores on your favorite team or having a routine (Alexa Good Morning...  You lights cut on, heat turns on, and music plays) ...  its a really neat device.I guess if your a criminal and are no good, then I guess you should worry about "the government listening"... But if your a normal person, buy it.

Title: My NEW Bestfriend!
Body: I love Alexa! She is my new best friend.  She understands every command I give her and I_ from Louisiana (known to have an accent). My daughters love to ask her random questions and play music. The shopping list feature is awesome for busy  Moms. It_ so awesome she can start a list and continually adds to it as you tell her. You can check your list from your phone on the Alexa app! No more getting to the grocery store and realizing you forgot your list and trying to remember everything you need. We decided to purchase a second!

Title: Simply awesome
Body: Overall I think this was super value for money. I haven't used any other smart speaker before but I am very happy with my purchase. Below are some observations :1. Initially it feels a bit weird talking to a speaker but you get used to it in no time.2. The sound quality is pretty good. You get good depth of sound with decent bass.3. Several skills available and you will definitely find some very useful. For example adding stuff to shopping list or setting up a reminder.4. Understands the Indian accent very well. Sometimes I am amazed by how well it picks up stuff.6. Kids love it. An added advantage is that they can take help for homework and talking to alexa also motivates them to talk in English

Title: Great little device for all ages.
Body: What can i say about this product other then i love it!! I love how she recognized my voice and can tell you who I am. The sound on this thinf is amazing!! Sounds like a bif stereo on certain song. My son likes how he can tell her to play his favorite song and she will listen.  I did make sure i turned off voice purchasing on her. Dont want to accidentally have something ordered.

Title: Promotion makes it a steal.
Body: Well, I'm sure like a lot of you recently, I got my echo 3rd Gen from the Amazon music promotion. It's my first smart device that's not my phone or TV. I've only had it a short time (about 2 weeks now?) but I've had lots of fun figuring it what I can do with this thing. I don't use it much now already but I'm glad to have it when I need it. It's mostly for music and the speaker sounds nice enough, but having it at full volume sounds pretty bad. Still, it hits a decent volume before the sound quality deteriorates. I'm not gonna complain though for getting it with the promotion, but had I paid full price, I would definitely mark it down some. I have an off brand portable shower speaker that I paid like 15 bucks for that blows it out of the water in terms of sound quality at high volume (plus being portable is a big bonus for the speaker). That being said, it's not going to leave that speaker, the echo has its place in my room and the speaker goes everywhere else. There's a lot I like personally and it by far outweighs my issues I have with it. The biggest one is more of a preference really, and that's the power supply. I wish it was just a USB cable of some kind, not the kinda bulky brick and old school proprietary connector thing. It feels sturdy, mic range is very good, it compliments other compatible devices nicely, and Alexa said we can get married when humans colonize Mars soon pretty happy with it overall.

Title: The Dot is not perfect but surpasses any mid level or entry level devices.
Body: I wasn't sure at first as Alexa gives me a migraine that being said.Pro'sSound quality is optimal or better not bad at all even better when paired.Easy set up though it may be confusing as you need another device lucky i have a fire table.Voice command can be fun and convenientConnects to other bluetooth devices and or network devices like some tvs through your network.Can contact all your alexa devices at once note if there too close you may get feedback.Con'sSome possible confusion during set up need bluetooth enabled to set up dot on your set up device once set up disable bluetooth on set up device to avoid any possible set up conflicts with other bluetooth devices. once setup is complete you can still add other devices using set up device through the alexa app or by asking alexa  with bluetooth disabled as long as both set up device and dot are using same network.all interactive Network devices must share same network so if you want conference call with other alexa devices using a different network you will not be able to contact outside shared network even if in same house using same internet provider must use same network aka wifi connection to buzz all devices together.

Title: Don't trust it
Body: We were excited to try this out, however, the same day we got it we saw all the reports that real people can listen to what goes on in your house. While the manufacturers say that a random selection of tests is conducted in order to provide accurate voice recognition, who knows what else is going on. This is one step too far for me. I am a boomer throwback I guess. I can't see the need for this unless she is going to clean the house. I can turn my own lights/music off and on.

Title: Wow! This Thing is Amazing!
Body: I don't know why I have hesitated for so long to grab one of these Echo Dots...but I'm glad I did because I was able to take advantage of a special promotion and got one for $.99 cents when I got Amazon Music so right around $9...What a deal! And this thing is way better than I expected it to be. It has amazing sound quality and the volume is way louder than you would expect it to be for something that is just slightly larger than a hockey puck. I was kind of worried about setting it up because I figured it would be difficult, but just like all of the other Amazon products I've purchased, it was a breeze! And voice recognition is incredible! I really like this thing so far...

Title: Good Bass  Inconsistent & Poor Alexa Experience
Body: UPDATE: First Echo Dot was defective and had to be replaced (follow-up mode was erroneously and permanently disabled). The new device works, see notes below _Pro:What I really love about this is the base. The bass in this is better than the Google Home Mini (previous-generation), woohoo.Con:When I tell Alexa to cut off a light, the air conditioner, or a fan, etc., Alexa cuts off multiple items instead of one single item. I don't have this problem through the Alexa app on my phone or on my tablet.

Title: Alexa is listening, and its a good thing.
Body: I cant get my kids to listen but Alexa answers me back every time.  good to play music on or ask a general question.  Whats the weather today?  Cant be alone with Alexa around.Update:  I have three of these and even got one for my elderly mother (she lives in a house in the back) and she can call me anytime she wants if she were to fall.  Its way better than the help Ive fallen unit.  She feels safer and I can drop in and chat with her anytime from anywhere.

Title: Much better sound
Body: I own both a second generation and a third generation Echo Dot and I think the third generation is much better when it comes to reproducing sound. The bass is surprisingly good for such a small speaker.I also find it very convenient having two Dots. My wife had surgery and must sleep in a different room while she heals. It's so convenient her being able to drop in on me if she needs anything during the night.

Title: Typical low-quality Amazon hardware
Body: Short and sweet review:Everything about the Dot is great except the sound quality for music. Sound quality for music is really poor like it was an unimportant afterthought. The sound is muddy, unclear and uncrisp...as though the speaker diaphragm is made of brown paper bag material.This poor sound quality certainly doesn't motivate me to invest in a more expensive version of the Echo.

Title: Never too many Dots
Body: This version of the Dot is so much better than previous versions. It is hard to believe the audio difference in the 3rd ten Dot. We've replaced almost all of our previous Dots with the new version and those that we replaced in main rooms are being used as secondary and just voice control devices in other rooms. My family loves to have these around the house to easily get weather forecasts when getting ready in the morning to being able to have music whenever they want.

Title: Still needs a lot of fine-tuning
Body: Most of the problems are the unit not understanding questions or commands and or answers that are given correctly to trivia related games yet the unit States you submit the wrong answers. Should also be able to submit feedback through the unit without having to go back to the app and process feedback. Search engines are seriously lacking and normally either completely misunderstand the search request or have little or no information available. Keep working on it may be by 2025 you'll have this thing working like Google

Title: Clock adaptive (auto) brightness won't adjust
Body: I have an Echo Dot 2nd generation.  I ordered this because of the new clock feature and better sound (and since it was on sale).  I just returned it for a refund.The sound quality was much improved -- richer and more bass.  The earlier Dot sounded tinny or shrill.  This latest one was much more pleasing.  This isn't to criticize the earlier Dot (since it wasn't designed as a great speaker), but to compliment this latest version.The clock feature is a great new feature.  However, when the brightness is set to Auto (or maybe that's called Adaptive), I couldn't adjust the level of this setting.  I spent over an hour in an online chat w/ Amazon to resolve this.  We did a hardware update, both Android and iOS Alexa application updates.  This setting still wouldn't change through either of the apps or by saying "Alexa, set brightness to 1; set brightness to 10").  The Dot would briefly show "1"" or "10" after sliding the brightness control in the apps or by requesting by voice, but there wasn't any difference in the brightness.I was able to change the brightness when Auto (Adaptive?) was switched off.  So, it could be set to say level "2" or whatever, but then it wouldn't adjust based on the room light.I'd like the brightness to automatically dim in a dark room such as at night; and be brighter during sunlight.  And, it seemed to do so, it's just that it was way too dim for me in all these cases.  I'd like to bump it up, but couldn't despite that seeming to be a feature.  Either Amazon should clarify that this can't be done or fix it.If it wasn't for this apparent flaw, I'd give a 5 star rating.If anyone has this feature working -- suggesting I just had a bad device -- replies would help others.  As for myself, I went back to my 2nd generation Dot and will wait till this is clearly fixed or is a non-issue.  My Dot works fine, so I'm in no rush.

Title: It works great, as advertised
Body: So, there are not any instructions probably because all the new devices are coming up with their own apps and it would be impossible to keep up with them all and give explanations on how they should connect with the Alexa app. I have a new Samsung 42" smart tv. It's smart app is called Smart Things. You are to connect it to their app then have Alexa connect to their app. It doesn't always work. She often looses the connection. I had AT&T and several plugs and some light bulbs couldn't find the internet. My signal is too weak in my house. They said I get a 6ghz signal I could max out my signal at 10 but it wouldn't produce a significant difference. So, I have switched to cable for the internet. Now, the signal can be found kind of. The changing of the network with Alexa is lacking in simplicity. It searches for ever even after I have found the name. It gives the device it's own network name that "isn't connected to the internet", and no explanation as to why that happens and what it's purpose is, so you can't help it along. I got it connected with shear luck. But, this morning I heard my husband tell Alexa to turn on the TV and she did nothing, but responded with OK. This is a learning process. I hope I become an expert soon. I have several other things I would like to make smart. We are starting off small. The plug that works practically seamlessly is Amazon Smart Plug. That review would say, it is too wide!! It takes up 3 plugs on a strip. I tried a set of Teckin Smart Plugs. They couldn't find the internet, I sent them back. I tried Wyze Bulbs, CNET recommended them. They couldn't connect to the internet either. I sent them back. Alexa couldn't find their apps to enable the connection. Whether it was because I couldn't get them connected to the internet, perhaps that was all the trouble. None of this stuff comes with any documentation for troubleshooting. Very frustrating. I am very patient. I can't imaging how I would tolerate any of this if I wasn't willing to play around with stuff for hours. Good Luck, I hope this helps.

Title: Love it
Body: Update: I'm not sure if this thing just had a bad connection or what but it works beautifully now. I have zero issues with it. In fact Ive purchased 2 more for my kids rooms. I can set alarms for them and send announcements to them. As well as use it as an intercom.I love this thing when it works. Unfortunately it only works about 50% of the time. When I initially wake it with a command it works great for about 15-20 minutes. If I'm listening to music, after about 15 minutes it seems to stop responding to commands. It will light up like it's listening but doesn't respond. For instance, if I tell it to pause, ask it to add to shopping list or set a timer it lights up to listen but doesn't follow through or comply with demands.  I've tested wifi strength and connection while it's malfunctioning and wifi is not the issue. Neither is location, as I've tried multiple placements in respect to the router with no improvements. Often it just lights up red and says it's having difficulties understanding me, to try back later. This is with zero background noises. I'm not sure If I recieved a faulty unit. I will contact customer support and revise my review once it is addressed. The sound quality is pretty impressive. It's  not going to blow you away but it fills the room.

Title: Almost there..
Body: Clock is a great addition, and obvious improvement.  The only thing things is... If you use it for an alarm clock you still have to talk to Alexa to turn off the alarm.  You can snooze with the action button, but actually turn it off.  And while the alarm is obviously designed to wake you up, your voice talking to Alexa can be more of a wake up for your bed partner.  An off button option would be an improvement one step more.

Title: Alexa is like a Family member
Body: within 1 day, Alexa felt like a family member. My son and daughter loved it as they don't have to ask permission to play rhymes or songs anymore; They directly talk to alexa :) My wife loved it as she uses it in the morning to play devotional songs and keep checking news/temperature. I loved the alarm feature and things to explore. I would say speaker quality is good. It picks up my voice better than kids. may be we need record as i did mine.Unfortunately someone stole the echo dot from our house 2 days back and we are missing alexa big time. I got it in a great offer and hoping to get the offer back in thanksgiving deal to get Alexa back. We miss you Alexa :( !!!

Title: Smart move for smarter house
Body: Great smart device to add to home. Easy set up and fun to play with. It easily integrates with other smart devices and the Alexa app makes things a breeze. The only qualm is the parental control is not as extensive as I_ like. For example it does have explicit language blocking for songs, but I can_ cherry pick other songs that may not have bad words but still has inappropriate themes dependent on age. Other than that I love it and may get another to add elsewhere in the house (announcements and drop ins are awesome too)

Title: Mom Essential
Body: I bought this on promo and i love it. My poor Alexa has taken on about half of the random questions i get from our four kids per day. How far away is christmas, what is 1 million plus 2 million, who sings this song we are listening to etc. The music and shopping lists are awesome. Being able to remotely access a shopping list is awesome since we were using a whiteboard i had to be home to see. We are only using 3 features so far and i am already in love.

Title: Pretty Happy
Body: Love this little thing. Great audio quality. Easy to set up and control. Only issue I have that is a little annoying is that it will randomly skip my songs on Pandora. It can go for a few songs then just out of no where skip to the next song. I've been turned off the voice listening while playing music. Same thing. Very strange.**Update** After using other music apps on my Echo Alexa hasn't skipped any songs randomly on Pandora. Not sure what caused the error.

Title: Great product can_ complain
Body: Love it I put it in my bathroom was thinking of replacing it with my google home mini In my bedroom but can_ because Alexa isn_ as superior as google The features aren_ there for me Alexa can_ turn on my tv unless it has a fire stick supposedly but google can turn on my tv even without a Chromecast.... even though Alexa hears perfectly unlike google.... don_ get me wrong they are both great products and use them both..... would love if Alexa could cast Netflix without 3rd party app

Title: Fun, convenient and easy to use!
Body: We love our dots around this house. We have the original as well as a 2 and 3. These are such fun little devices. The capabilities really are endless. My kids use them daily to get the weather before getting dressed for the day. The speaker and overall appearance has definitely improved with the newer models. If you haven't used one yet, I would absolutely recommend you give it a try. I can't imagine you wouldn't find at least one feature you love.

Title: Alexa is fun to have.
Body: I have found nothing to dislike.  I'm nearly 80 years old, so technology like this comes through my daughter, who sets it up for me.  But, the directions for setup were clear.  So far, I have used the Echo Dot for playing music mostly, but also for news briefs and timers.  I'm sure that the more I learn about it, the more I'll like it.  I always want to tell her please and thank you, so I guess she seems like a friend to me.

Title: Mehhhhh
Body: It is about a 50/50 % chance of it doing what I ask . it lights up blue reconizing I'm talking to it then does nothing at all it doesn't even say it can't help or any just nothing. other times it will do what I ask. When i play music it have the time will not stop the music and i will have to unplug it from the wall all together . the sound quility is great to bad it is slow and faulty

Title: Easy addition to my Echo Dot family!
Body: I use the alexa.amazon.com application to chat with my Dots instead of a phone app. The setup routine easily recognized a new addition, helpfully labeled it as Dot 2, and I was pretty much up and running. The hardest part was to establish a group to play music with, so that whatever song I requested would play through both Dots. Here again the setup routine helpfully suggested "Everywhere", so now I just append that word to the end of my song request.

Title: Really worth it for the sound quality alone.
Body: This new unit was added for a home office and it was a snap to set up. I'm really impressed with the sound quality! I also purchased the rechargeable battery that can go along with it. Now, I can unplug the power cord and take anywhere I want around the house. When I'm finished, just plug the power cord back in and it charges as it works.

Title: The hype is real
Body: I've wanted an Alexa controlled speaker in my home for a long time. I finally pushed myself to get this Echo 3 because of a big sale amazon was having on them. It shipped in 1 day as most of my prime purchases and boy does it deliver. It has a large charging block head that is a bit tough to squeeze into a normal 3 pronged outlet spot. The audio on the speaker is incredibly loud, and quite when you want it to be. It's very clear. The setup and controls are simple directions to follow using the Alexa app. I've had a fire tv for a long time and eventually I was able to figure out how to connect the fire tv to my new echo. Now I can control it just with my voice! This did require download skills on the Alexa app to my echo, which at first I didn't understand, but the echo answered my question and told me where to find it! Fantastic device. If I ever get a bigger apartment with more rooms then I'll definitely get more for additional rooms.

Title: Works well, nice features, appealing aesthetic,
Body: I received my Echo Dot in the mail and immediately set it up. I had previously purchased an Echo Dot for my parents and also lived with an Echo for a year. I bought this Echo Dot during a deal to see if I'd like it just as much as the Echo.For overall functionality, I say it works quite well. It can't answer all of your questions yet, but Alexa is generally knowledgeable about most topics and has many useful features related to personalizing your experience. I especially like the app that allows you to customize questions for any guests in your home that may need help finding things. I've been able to utilize many other features such as lists, morning routine, playing podcasts, playing music, setting timers/reminders, and others. I am planning on purchasing some smart home equipment in the future, but for now I don't know how well the integration works.As part of the deal to purchase the Echo, I also got an Amazon Music subscription. Unfortunately, the Echo Dot does not have speakers as nice as the Echo does. If you looked up the differences, this is a known discrepancy so I wasn't too upset. The quality honestly isn't bad enough for anyone who isn't purchasing it for music specifically to be bothered by.The other minor annoyance is that the speaker doesn't seem to be 360, as the Echo is, but unidirectional. This isn't a problem for me, currently, as it is set up on a shelf directed towards where I generally am to listen to podcasts, music, and audiobooks. I'm not sure if the microphone is also unidirectional, but I haven't had any problem with Alexa picking up my voice unless I'm in another room around the corner (which is expected).Overall, I'm happy with my purchase of the Echo Dot. If I decide to add another unit, I will be purchasing the Echo for my main living space, as I do prefer the 360 speaker and increased speaker quality. However, for a budget option or those not too finicky when it comes to speaker quality or direction, the Echo Dot is a great option for a smart home device.

Title: This little spot has a lot of personality
Body: Siri, Google, take note: although I love you both in your own way, Alexa is actually FUN! The voice assistant lacks the robotic feel we get used to in other devices.Alexa will occasionally make a joke even when I didn_ specifically ask for one.Once I integrated her into my home, I found that she goes into guard mode whenever I set my security system to arm. It does not matter what device our operating system was used to arm it. The system automatically sets a lighting routine to mimic someone being home. Note if she would just turn on the television.My biggest gripe, and it is a big one. The skills, the basis of what allows you to integrate Alexa with other functionality appears to be poorly written for the most part. The skills store is filled with one and two star ratings and rightfully so. If the software can_ do what it advertises, your stick with funny and cute hardware wishing you could do the things it promises

Title: Awesome gizmo with a huge flaw
Body: This is my first robot. I love the way I can just ask it any question that pops into my head.  Alexa,  what are the bones in the ear. BAM. Also, it is way awesome as far as playing music. Just wake the genie in the hockey puck and about 85 percent of the time Alexia comes through with whatever tunes you desire. Plays all the iTunes you bought, can dial up radio stations, sports, whatever, the thing is beauteous. Back in the day R Crumb had a cartoon about a guy who lived and rode around in his bathtub. I can see this ridiculously affordable device (two six packs) putting me in such a state.  Why think, why move when you have this baby at your side.  Nirvana.Why then do I give this game changer one star? Simple. I got a black one. I like black. What engineer was the genius who decided to make the four simple control buttons on top of Dot 3 , the EXACT  same black color as the Dot casing?!? They are unreadable if they are more than 3 feet from your face!  Are you kidding me? My goal in life is to not have one of the fitness circles on my Apple watch budge. At all. Ever. Every time I need to fiddle with the mic, adjust the sound, reset the app , (which you might have to do if it is unplugged) on this hockey puck in a dimly lit room, I have to get up and get a friggin flashlight to distinguish between the four buttons!! They just blend into the rest of the gizmo. Engineering  crew. You owe me 50 push ups. Doh!

Title: It's a nice Dot. Hard of hearing though
Body: This is my 2nd one. I got an echo almost 2 years ago. Dot is very similar to the echo. Maybe not as good a listener. I have to repeat the wake word sometimes. I use it with Bluetooth connected to a speaker. It loses it's pairing sometimes. The little note that it makes to punctuate when it hears you is so much louder than the other audio I think it will blow out the speaker eventually. These are minor things, just thought I'd mention them.Mostly it is really awesome. I use it for listening to audio books while I cook and clean in the kitchen. I'm spending more time doing those thing, so it's making life better. I was behind on listening to my audio books, I'm catching up now.Just like the other one I use it all the time for timers and alarms. I am absent minded that is my favorite feature.

Title: Not bad, has some uses.
Body: So far i have been enjoying it but like most people it has been giving me some issues. The first is that it wouldnt give me local weather even though but on my app and online it showed my correct location i actually have to remove my location from both places and then put it back in before it finally gave right weather.  Even though if i asked whats my location it would say it right. it also has some trouble understanding commands unless i am right near it. If i say from other side of room play music it seems to get it right about 80% of the time.

Title: Please. Buy. This. Product!
Body: O.M.G.! The Echo Dot Gen 3 is the best!  First, let me start on the voice recognition. It doesn't matter if you're having a huge house party where the music is loud, people talking, etc. The Echo Dot Gen 3 with Alexa integration will in a near instant recognize the call of her name and start listening. It is so good! I cannot even explain how much times I have been grateful for the 4 microphones that can hear my voice, it is HIGHLY convenient.  Next: the sound quality. The sound quality, I can say, is the best so far for a speaker like this. The sound is crystal clear and I can hear every detail coming from those great speakers, I have nothing to say except that you will not have trouble hearing the highs, mids, and lows produced from this speaker and will be satisfied with the sound quality.  Overall, the Echo Dot 3rd Generation from Amazon is by far the best smart speaker out the market out there,  and I would recommend it to anyone and everyone! Again, the smart speaker has amazing mobility for its size, the price is just right, the speakers crispy clear, and the voice recognition and Alexa integration just sets it way further ahead than other smart speakers out there!

Title: Great update
Body: I upgraded one of my 1st gen Dots to the new 3rd gen Dot with Display. It's a great update, the speaker sounds way way better than the 1st gen, to the point you're kind of happy to listen to it. What I didn't expect was how much I like the display and having a clock visible at all times on the dot. I find myself looking at it constantly for time checks, it was well worth the $10 premium in price. All in all I'm very happy with this new Dot and will most likely get a few more to upgrade other units.

Title: Think I got a "Bad One"...
Body: I've had the item for about a week & a half, and quit using it about 3 days ago. The sound on ANYTHING" I request, from weather to music, breaks up within a couple of minutes. No song or sentence is complete anymore (worked fine for 3-4 days when 1st got it). Have jiggled the wire, used different plug-in locations and nothing improved. It's not usable. I'm assuming I must have just gotten a reject, as many reviews indicate no problems. Going to contact Amazon and see if they will replace what can now be defined as a piece of electrical junk.

Title: A big sound upgrade from 2nd gen dot
Body: What stands out the most is the improved audio. The appearance is also upgraded with the cloth surround instead of the plastic. It definitely seems to be a higher quality build. In addition the 3rd gen can be used with the amazon echo sub for added bass and you can pair these and use two together. Even though there are only minor differences (other then sound quality) between the 2nd gen and the 3rd the audio quality has improved so much that it is worth the upgrade. I enjoy using the echo dot and to recommend this 3rd gen over the previous model.

Title: I'm in love!
Body: Why did it take me so long to get on the Echo Dot bandwagon? I had no idea what I was missing out on. I love that I can just talk to "Alexa" and turn on music to what I want to hear no matter what I'm doing. This is great when I'm cooking and my hands are messy and don't want to touch my phone to change the music. It holds a great charge that lasts a long time. And it doesn't take long to recharge. I usually just do it overnight when I'm not using it. It's nice and compact too so it's great for travel. I had no issues setting it up and no issues with voice recognition.

Title: Sleek,  spaceSaving, rich sound and price. My bad for not getting a smartPlug.
Body: Like: full rich bass sound. Sleek and compact. Price. Easy set up connecting and pairing.Dislikes: confusing how it switches back and forth, I have to keep selecting Play On Paired Speakers.My last dislike is on me that i did not buy a smart plug.Overall,  a learning curve.This is actually a necessary practical purposeful purchase for me having adaptations in a modified home...the smart devices are a godsend.Cust service has been great with me

Title: Echo Dot Alexa Could be Better
Body: I really do like my Echo Dot Alexa but it needs some improvement. Mostly I just play music and sometimes the sound is not good and has an echoing or scratchy sound. I have Amazon Music Unlimited (and it sounds so much better in my car than on the Echo Dot)  and when I request a song like Michael Buble's new White Christmas version she always plays his old one with Shania Twain and I want the new one so Alexa is not up to date.

Title: A nice addition to your home!
Body: Alexa is a part of our family :) She is very nice and easy to use. Only issue we have is sometimes she will talk to us when we aren't talking to her which makes my family paranoid that someone's listening and so they unplug her. I got Amazon music and I love it, I can hear any song I want anytime I want with no commercials. They also have stations for everybody's interest. Well worth the money!

Title: If you love quiet don_ buy
Body: I actually HATE Alexa and the Echo Dot but it_ not fair for me to rate it poorly based on my preferences and not on its ability to do what it_ made to do. The speaker aspect of it is actually really great for me. I use it to listen to npr shows podcasts. It_ crisp and clear. Sometimes I use it for music.Why do I hate it so much that I don_ even leave it plugged in unless I_ using it as a speaker? I HATE having to talk to it.  Can_ stand it actually. Which I realize now is the exactly reason most people buy it. To me it ruins my piece and well-being. Introverts should NOT buy it. I had no idea before it arrived just how irritated it would make me to have to keep speaking out loud to it. If I use it through the ap i like it more but still not a fan.If you_e not weird like me, definitely buy.

Title: Useful gizmo
Body: I have never been much for gizmos, but my wife likes them. She wanted one of these after hearing about them, so I eventually gave in and bought one. Set it up with her phone and that was pretty easy.  Now she yabbers with it like its her best friend. Truth be told it is actually kind of handy at times. Asking for the latest weather forecast seems to be it;s primary function at the moment, but I have also found it to be useful for settling disputes over this or that. I am surprised how quickly Alexa responds with an answer as well. Decent price and useful ? Win-win.

Title: Good for the price, needs some work on a couple aspects though
Body: I bought this unit to compare the functionality of Alexa versus Google, of which I already have several devices. So far I've seen that it definitely has better long range hearing, as in it can actually hear you from across the room, and given the LED strip around the edge, it seems to actually be able to figure out a pretty accurate direction on where you're talking to it from. It also understands commands better than Google, though granted it can't do everything. Right now I have it mounted to the wall next to my stereo, and I used to have it hooked up to the stereo by 3.5mm aux port, but due to some issues with that it's just linked to the stereo by Bluetooth now. When connected by 3.5mm, songs will suddenly stop playing through the stereo, but the Alexa app says they're still going, and it seems like the only fix is to skip or restart the song. Bluetooth does not have this problem, however if I had some suggestions for software updates in the future, they'd be this: when the Echo is linked to a stereo either by Bluetooth or aux port, ALL the audio comes through the aux device, even Alexa just answering questions. I'd suggest putting in an option for the Echo to have regular Alexa voice come through its own speakers and music go through the aux device, at least giving the user a choice to choose from. I'd also suggest if that option became available, that the Echo lets Bluetooth linked devices and stereos sleep when inactive, and when given the command to play media, gives the wake command to the device before playing.All in all though, it's been pretty nice, definitely worth the price, and is definitely my choice for playing music.

Title: Reliable little smart speaker
Body: We replaced a google device with this, so that our home is fully Alexa-enabled. The other device also didn_ seem to pick up our voices very well. In contrast, the echo dot hears us even though we put it out-of-sight and under a baby crib.We had some issues with other echo devices. The first generation echo couldn_ make out our words very well, and the new version of the show has some rattling in the speaker. I don_ expect products to be perfect, so we are fine with those quirks. No quirks with this little device, though. It just works.

Title: Some performance issues.
Body: I've had the echo dot for about two weeks thanks to the amazon music + echo dot promotion. It is really an amazing device with very useful features. The reason I don't give it a 5 star rating is because, and I don't know if this is normal or just my device, I had some difficulty connecting with my laptop and wi-fi. Additionally, sometimes the device will become unresponsive at random times. I can't yet identify what it is that triggers this unresponsiveness. When it happens either it auto-restarts and takes a good 10 minutes to start working again or I will manually unplug and plug back again. Other than that I really like the echo dot. Very fun.

Title: Can_ live without it!
Body: This is my third echo dot third generation and now that I have them I couldn_ do without them! They make my life so much easier.  I love the feature that allows the echo to guard your home that way if any strange noises like breaking glass or fire alarms go off it Notifies you immediately and from there you can check in and listen in your home! I can_ wait to see what new features they come out with. I definitely recommend this device!

Title: You'll love it.
Body: Upgraded my second gen dot for this Heather grey third gen.First thing I noticed was the weight, and althought I won't be holding it, I have a young child and 2 cats so the weight is nice to keep it grounded. In addition to the weight the bottom grips nicely.The sound quality for Alexa's voice, as well as for music is incredible on this beefed up hockey puck. The second gen dot is decent, but now that I've heard this one, I'll likely order another third gen to replace my bedrooms echo.The set up was easy, probably because it was linked to my account on Amazon, but if you gift one of these it shouldn't be a challenge for a newbie or someone elderly.We bought this one on a deal for 29.99 USD, and at that price point it's hard to go wrong. Ours is the one without the built in clock (Don't pay extra for a visual clock... Just ask Alexa what time it is.)

Title: Good for visually impaired me!
Body: I'm vision impaired so Alexa is a godsend.  Setting my Dot up took 10 minutes and half of that was reading instructions. Simple, quick,clean Web interface (seriously good human factors engineering here). great build quality, I liked it so much I bought a second one!  Alexa is a big help, with reading my audio books, music, weather, reminders.. this device makes being impaired more livable.  Thanks, Amazon!

Title: My new personal assistant.
Body: I don't know how I managed before this little smart device. I am hooked. I need more in my home. Anything I need, Alexa will assist me with. From reminders to recipes.  Amazon, Alexa is a the gift that keeps giving. Thank you!_ I want to write more about this precious gem. People this is honestly a must have. Do your self a favor and purchase an alexa devise you will have no regrets.

Title: Thought it would be smarter
Body: I love the exercise reminders. I love the 7 minute workout skill. I enjoy being able to play music. But I absolutely hate every podcast player currently available for Alexa. As many podcasts as I like to listen to, the lack of being able to subscribe to them is a deal breaker for me. I can't even find one that lets me fast forward or rewind effectively. I really thought this thing was going to be smarter than it is. My smartphone is still smarter.  This is just a step up from a bluetooth speaker, don't get one if your expectations are high, you'll be disappointed.

Title: SIRI WHO??! lol
Body: I ABSOLUTELY LOOOOOOOOVE MY ECO DOT! Everything from multiple timers, reminders, alarms, even notifications on when my packages arrive! __. This is THE  best thing ever I CANNOT WAIT to get another device.

Title: Multi language feature does not work
Body: The device does pretty much what Siri does, except she has a harder time understanding or doing the right thing.I_ particularly frustrated right now because the multilingual function that just came out does not actually work. After speaking with 2 different Amazon reps 4 times, and doing the same diagnostics over and over again, no one knows how to make the multi language function work.  If the function is not ready for launch, it should not be launched. And if amazon wants to launch something, make sure your techs know about it rather than making me forward the communication to them so they can research and learn about this new feature.I feel embarrassed for amazon.

Title: Great little speaker with stereo pairing and audio out!
Body: Nice lil speaker and for the recent deal where it was about $10 - totally worth it. Especially given the fact that with two, you can pair them in stereo - which is what I_ listening to right now! Bass is a little bit muddy when played at higher volumes but if you were buying these for their sound quality, you_ wouldn_ be going for the Dot. That being said however, these do sound quite decent for their price. Quite a deal better than my Google Home Mini. They also have audio out which I 100% appreciate and praise!

Title: Great Voice Recognition...
Body: I have both this and Google now and in some ways I love this more. The colored lighting is fun and it's definitely more sturdy and pleasing to look at. My only complaint is the difficulty playing any of my playlists either on Amazon or another platform like Spotify. No matter what I say it always plays the wrong list. I have to manually open the app to play it. Then it doesn't play it in it's entirety. Otherwise it's a great little speaker. It picks up voice much better than Google and has better sound quality. I'll be buying more.

Title: Better than 1st Gen by far, but still far from great.
Body: Head and shoulders above 1st Gen unit, but still far from where it needs to be. Still getting ridiculous answers to questions, and home control is far from great. Usable, but not optimal. Ask her to turn on a specific light and she'll tell you it doesn't exist. 30 seconds later ask her to do the same, and she complies with no rhyme or reason. Still much better than Google Home which is having a plethora of problems lately.

Title: If you are struggling on google home assistance and echo devices read my review.
Body: If you are trying to buy a smart voice advisor and struggling on google home assistance and echo devices read my review. I have both echo and google assistant and I have a nest smart controller at home which belongs to google. Guess what?  Echo can control the fan and google assistance can_.  Google don_ even support their own devices? So, if you are decided to buy a google assistance instead of echo. Think again!

Title: Sounds worse than the 2nd gen
Body: If I want better music I would get the full size one. This is a terrible update. Less crisp and really kill the clarity of the speech audio. I wouldn_ buy a dot for music and you really made the audio crappier where I have to make it overly loud to listen to the news briefings and such to get pass the voices now sounding like they are all muffled instead of being crisp and even tinny by those overly critical and wanting everything in a full size echo to be in a dot.

Title: Nice design
Body: I like the design of this new Echo Dot. It has a better quality speaker than the last one for sure, but not quite good enough. I will have to compare it with my Google Home Mini. It doesn't quite seem to pick up my voice if I say it in normal conversation or conversation type volume, which could be a negative or positive. Maybe you were always talking about it and tired of it responding when you weren't specifically asking it a question, then it would be a positive. It could be possible that it is because of the environment that it is in.

Title: Confusing to set up a routine with an alarm
Body: The only issue I have with device, aside from its slightly jacked up price, is that setting up a routine with an alarm is more confusing than it needs to be. You first create an alarm in the app, then you create a routine that is triggered when you dismiss any alarm within a given time period. Not exactly intuitive.Compare that with Google's approach, where you create an alarm and assign a routine directly to that alarm.Other than that, this Echo Dot has a permanent spot on my nightstand.

Title: So far I love it
Body: For the price of 60 dollars, I was not interested at all in spending that much for something that talks to me. With the promotion, I had gotten it for only 99 cents. With that being said, I will continue the review without the bias of cost, until the end.The sound quality and voice recognition is amazing. It literally feels like talking to another person, and playing music is like I bought a decent speaker.Alexa has many features and can cooperate with pretty much every common app. So far I can say this and Alexa will do that.The one thing I don't like is the peace of mind that this thing is constantly listening and you don't know what goes on in it's brain. They say the mute button physically unplugs the microphone but it's not convenient to turn it on/off. The red ring is a pretty nice nightlight.There's a whole lot to talk about but I'd say this is a brief review of what should most concern the average interested consumer. With all that being said, 60 dollars is fair, but it would call it a luxury good.

Title: Integrates easily and beautifully  w other Amazon Echo devices -- inexpensively
Body: There is absolutely nothing to dislike and most everything to like about the new Echo Dot.  Of course the speaker is limited, but look at the price.  For simply answering questions, weather, sports, even reading an audible book, the Dot is excellent.  For quality music, the speaker is limited.  Bottomline:  It took 2 minutes to set up and the Echo Dot plays well with my family of Amazon full size Echo devices, at a superb price point.

Title: Echo dot
Body: A great product that could use some work. I'm not a fan of the drop in feature. Even after contacting Amazon and getting help we still have random people dropping in. When connected to our fire stick tv the sound and the people are off which drives me insane and it's annoying listening through the speaker. I hope as we learn how to use it better I will love it more. I do like that I can play music without having to turn the TV on tho.

Title: Unbelievably useful
Body: At all time, I do not know what to do with a digital assistant at home. This time Amazon offers 8 dollars, then why not. I bought it, brought it to home, set it up, and wowwww... Now I do not need to walk around or use my apple watch to turn on all the lights, but just call "Alexa, lights on" or "Alexa, play classical"... WowwwwI recommend you guys to try it out even if you do not know what to do with it. You gonna find your life is so much better!

Title: Good - but not great.
Body: I love this device for what it can do, but sometimes I cannot get the command right to get it to do what I want to. Sometimes it works and sometimes it does not.  Simple commands are ok, but I am still trying to figure out why it does not work sometimes.  It does not work with Spectrum cable service which was a surprise and sometimes I have trouble with getting my tv to respond.  I do however love listening to Amazon Music or Pandora through it and love being able to set the alarm with a command.  Maybe if I had gotten a more expensive version it would do more.

Title: Get Echo Dot with Clock or Echo Show 5
Body: I got the Echo Dot to try Alexa smart system, & after few days I got boring from using it.So I only use it to listen to Music, & it offers good quality sound (not stereo), its like you put decent speaker under blanket.I gave 2 stars for Voice Recognition, because it didn't get my commands from first time many occasions.Moreover, while watching YouTube on how to deal with it, it recognized Alexa words from that video & started to respond to them.Also I'm using Alexa on my mobile for easier experience due its less voice understanding for my requests.So I would get Echo Dot with clock, cause at least you see the time and temperature when you don't use it.and for little more money, I would get Echo Show 5 for more features and see Amazon Prime Videos.This device will be okay in the garage or bathroom or as secondary Alexa speaker.

Title: Alexa is part of our home now!
Body: Our family uses Alexa for everything! We had the Echo Dot 2nd Gen & just updated to the Echo Dot w/ Clock 3.5 Gen & what a noticeable upgrade with the sound & the visible display showing i.e. Clock, Temp, Timer, etc. We couldn_ be happier with this purchase! The Echo dot will be used for years to come! If you have a Gen 1, 2 or 3 I highly recommend upgrading to the 3.5!

Title: Super awesome promotion..... Although Alwcau
Body: I cant wait to get more acclimated to this Echo Dot!  What an excellent promotion catch!  I do enjoy Alexa's humor, and appreciate the expressiveness.... Quite refreshing in comparison to Google Assistant's boring "Hey, Google.." ... Atleast Alexa has personality _....One thing that continues to bother me with Alexa is the fact that she won't play any of the music that I ask her to play... and worst of all, she tells me that I need to subscribe to Amazon Music Unlimited-- which I do not understand why it's like that, considering that the Music Unlimited acct is set up & synced to  the Alexa app..... I mean, that was how I got the Amazon Music Unlimited & Echo Dot together in a bundle deal so I kind of feel like Alexa should be on the same page, ya feel?  But she be on some other one hahah...

Title: I LOVE IT
Body: I own several of these dots in my home. I love the intercom ability and the streaming music. This one is the BOMB! I had an ugly clock for 40 years that would just never die. I needed to replace it, but never found one that was bright enough or looked pretty. This little gem lights up the time brightly -- and I have bad eyes. It doesn't leave a big footprint either. It's perfect on my nightstand.As for the other capabilities, I haven't jumped into all Alexa can do. I must say she tells the best jokes.But KUDOS for the clock. I wish all of my other ones had it now.

Title: Alexa, a great assistant
Body: I saw this Echo Dot as a promotion and I purchased it right away since I owned some items that can use Alexa to voice control. Very easy to set up. You can ask Alexa almost everything and the one thing I don't like is that sometimes it can't fully understand your question or statement and you have to repeat yourself in a way so she can understand and help find an answer. I also like the hands free feature. When I am busy, I can ask Alexa to pick up or call someone at that moment when I'm doing something important. It is an awesome product to have at your home as an assistant.

Title: beware you might get charged unwanted fees
Body: this echo device turns itself on when your not in the room.......I cancelled my amazon music unlimited because I have amazon prime......but still got charged $16.04 cause she said I was using it.......I told her to cancel it now and soon as I got off the phone the echo which is in another room with nothing on started talking and playing music......this is why I am not getting a refund cause this echo is doing stuff on its on......

Title: Not too sure about Echo
Body: It has a slow response. Picks up background noise easily. I was setting up Alexa to recognize my voice and alexa picked up the noise from the fanNot really enjoying it but I have to say "Alexa" for it to continue or I need to sy "Alexa" twice or three time.Setting up alarms and what to play when the larm sets are easily done.Overall, I have mix feelings about this device.

Title: Perfect for my bedside table
Body: My bedside table alarm clock was dying, emitting a horrible buzzing sound, so rather than buy another dinosaur I bought this new Dot. So far, so good  I can read the time from bed, plus I get all the usual Alexa goodness. It seemed like a ridiculous combination when Amazon announced it but it's actually perfect. Instead of having two things on my bedside table, I need just one.

Title: 3rd Generation Echo Dot is better looking and sounds better with more range.
Body: WOW, how these little hockey pucks have stepped up their game. I have an early Echo Dot that really looks like a hockey puck, and it works great.  This 3rd generation one not only looks nicer but it also has better sound and a wider range (volume) of sound.Connects and works well, like the others in the line.

Title: Leery at first of security concerns, but I'm onboard now
Body: I have serious misgivings about the assistant products offered by Google, Amazon, and particularly Facebook. The usefulness of the Alexa / Echo system and integration with the Ring security system plus security / configuration options alleviate some of those concerns and I find myself enjoying using the Alexa / Echo products.

Title: Super Nice
Body: I got this on sale with the Amazon Music Subscription for 99 cents. Even with the subscription it was like $8 and some change.I just saw a fantastic deal and didn't think about needing Wifi to use it...LOL!So unfortunately I had to cancel the music subscription a few days later. I know I still have it for the rest of the month, but I can't use it.I'm ok with that though, because it still was an amazing deal. So thank you Amazon for an expensive item that I got cheap that will make a super awesome gift this Christmas.We have a someone in mind that we know will get a lot of use out of it.BTW, it's a real cool looking speaker.Lesson...read everything before buying to make sure you can use it. ____

Title: The power of voice
Body: I recently purchased a smart thermostat that came with Alexa integration. Before long, I was thinking of adding an echo dot in the basement where we watch TV/movies.  When I saw a promotion, I jumped on it. This device has moved the convenience of the internet from my fingertips to within earshot. This is not a hi-fi device by any stretch of imagination, but has decent enough sound for me to bring it in the workshop and play music occasionally. One possible negative: I had to experiment with the device location, maybe the microphones are too sensitive. The thermostat with Alexa is located on the main floor, close to the staircase. At first I apparently placed it too close to the stairwell in the basement, without realizing. I would query the thermostat and the dot in the basement would respond. After a moment, Alexa in the thermostat apologized that she was having trouble connecting, etc. On that topic, I do have a wi-fi repeater in the house so I can't speak for the signal coverage the unit gets. I am finding myself using Alexa more and more, for reminders, to-do list, calendar, news brief and sports. I am impressed with the ability to speak from across the room where the dot is, and it responds correctly. The thermostat's microphone is not that sensitive, in comparison.

Title: Not much of a difference over the previous gen
Body: Works as well as any other Alexa device.  I don't really see the improvement over the previous generation though.  It still misunderstands about the same amount of commands as the older ones.  Sound quality of the built in speaker is better than the old ones, but still sucks.  I wish they could include a setting that would play music through the connected speaker (Bluetooth or hardwire) but use the built in for calls and drop ins.  It's not like your external speakers stay powered on 24/7....they get turned on when you need to use them.  It makes the drop in feature mostly useless in my house as most all of my echos are connected to amplified speakers that don't stay powered on all the time.  I'd like to use these as an intercom system, but..._nly big complaint on the g3 is the cloth cover.  Yes, it looks better than the old hard puck design, but it's a huge dust magnate and has to be vacuumed in order to clean.

Title: These devices have totally spoiled me... In a good way
Body: This is a review of the new Amazon Echo Dot (3rd)If something ever happened to these devices, I would be lost. I have one in my catering kitchen to set reminders, timers, and other handy things.This new dot is in my bedroom; replacing my old alarm clock. They wake me up in the morning and locks down the house at night. My next goal is to link them to motion sensors, and have motion and changes in temperature trigger events; however, I am not there yet.Bottom LineThis new 3rd gen dot not only looks good, it is fully functional, and was a breeze to setup. And all at a great price point.What's not to like?

Title: stick to the first/second gen dont upgrade
Body: I upgraded two of my first gen echos for this one. I am so disappointed with it. My first echo worked better than this one. It has a huge lag when you talk to it and freezes up a lot. Sometimes when playing music and you tell it to stop, it won't . you have to go in the app and manually stop it, or unplug it and restart it. When you wake it up with Alexa or echo, you have to wait like 10 seconds for it to turn on and give it a command, then when you do, wait a bit for it to process. meanwhile, I have the 1st echo, which I kept one of them for the bathroom, the first gen echo works way better and faster.. I may be going to google at some point.

Title: A quick and easy set up to get it working right out of the box.
Body: The 3rd gen Echo Dot works well out of the box. Setup was straightforward using the Alexa app for iPhone. Bluetooth connectivity is easy, but I did have some issues connected it to a Win 10 laptop. In fact, I couldn't get my laptop to recognize the Dot. Integration with music services, Spotify, Amazon Music, and internet radio, Tune In, iHeart, etc was easy to set up and it worked well. My disappointment is with the sound quality. For podcasts, talk radio it sounds good but the range for music is more limited than I had hoped, especially with classical music. If sound quality is your biggest concern consider buying a different model.

Title: Few things can be improved but overall a great device for its price
Body: I honestly been having a bit of an issue with the voice recondition. I would call Alex while in the kitchen but she would not turn on and I have my device in my living room which is right next to my kitchen. I also feel like the sound should be improved it_ not that loud at all. I wish it can go a bit louder. But honestly overall I am still satisfied because I use it a lot in my room which I have no issues with the device when in my room being that my room is small. It  works  great in small areas of the home. I love that alexa can do a lot of different things such as set your alarm. Make you a check list tell you the weather and ext.

Title: Made my life easier
Body: I can't even begin to explain how much I love Alexa. So easy and convenient compared to her competition. I love the additional accessories that can be connected to Alexa. She speaks like an actual person instead of like a robot. I can control Alexa from my app from other locations and turn on lights or play music for my dogs while I'm gone. I can add things to my calendar, shopping list, and she gives me a wealth of information. I loved it so much I bought a second one and they are synced.

Title: Perfect little desktop companion
Body: My husband got me the amazon echo dot so that I could use it to listen to music. We_e had it for a bit over a week and I love it. Initially, we had it set up on our wooden desk, but found that the wood dampened the sound quite a bit. Once we put it on top of our printer, we_e had no problems. My son loves listening to his paw patrol theme song and I use it multiple times daily to listen to music while I clean and play with my boys.

Title: Much more accurate & intuitive than anticipated!
Body: Having been used to Google's Mini, it's taken us a bit to adjust to Alexa/Echo Dot, but not long, and we've been incredibly impressed. You can practically have an interactive conversation with it, vs. Google's always felt more 1-off in the commands/interaction. Rated sound at a 4, which is still GOOD for such a small all-inclusive-device, but of course it would be impossible to be a 5, unless I were to simply do so given the circumstances.

Title: Great for communication with chair or bed bound elderly
Body: I am using the echo dot in the room of an elderly relative I care for in my home.  He can use it to call me on the phone.  I can "drop in" to make sure all is OK when I am traveling and he is being attended by home health aides.  He is a bit confused, and with this device there is less chance he'll use it in the wrong way.  When he had a medical alert pendant, he pushed it a few times for non-emergencies, bringing an ambulance to the house uneccessarily. With Alexa, he knows to call me, and if there truly was an emergency he'd know to call 911 (or if he called me, I could do it.)  He can use it to turn a light on and off. This echo dot is working really well for an elderly invalid.

Title: Don't bother to use for music
Body: You would think that Amazon would have perfected the speaker in the DOT by the 3rd generation! I use my full size Echos for music and the DOT strictly to control my Echo clock (very cool product btw) and soon my Amazon combo microwave/air fryer (hopefully) in the kitchen but forget about any type of quality sound. Muffled, bassy and just plain junk for a speaker. Hey Amazon, get together with BOSE and learn a lesson!

Title: Alexa!
Body: I wanted to put another small round assistant in another room, so I decided to compare google to Alexa. I already have Google, and the ability to listen to Sirius on Alexa was the reason I wanted to try the Amazon version.  Can_ say I can tell much different, but I think Google understands what I say better than Alexas. I would, however, say you can_ go wrong with either.

Title: Cant sync more than 2 speakers together and have to be the same speaker....
Body: I would give it a 5, its loud and sounds great. BUT, you cant connect it/pair it with the bigger Amazon echo? Seriously amazon come on. Your amazon speakers have so much potential and were basically revolutionary 6 years back when you released them and now they're already obsolete because you dont want people to be able to connect them wirelessly... if you have the money go with SONOS, better quality than bose and has built in alexa features and you can sync them all together

Title: Much better than previous versions
Body: I have a Harmon Kardon Invoke, with Cortana. As much as I don't love Cortana because she can't be integrated into anything, the audio from the speaker is AMAZING. I didn't think Amazon would be able to match it, and they haven't...but, they are getting closer with this generation. The sound quality from previous versions is very much enhanced.

Title: Not an very good alarm clock
Body: So with the added clock I thought awesome this could be a really cool alarm clock.  What found is that Amazon stuck a clock on there device without really looking at how it would be used.  My desire was for a alarm clock that I could wake to music.  Setting this up is possible but clumsy and quite glitchy.  I am still using it as an alarm clock with the hope it gets better.I have many little dislikes with but will only note the main ones.1) no physical way to turn off the alarm.  This by far was the most challenging to do when I first wake up.  Having to talk while my wife is still sleeping....2)  not being able to pick what music that will play.3)  the interface for setting the alarm needs work.

Title: Alexa will not play the same versions of songs on my Apple/ITunes Playlists
Body: The Echo needs a little work. The sound quality tends to be a little bass heavy. Also, you have to say things to Alexa very precise or your request is not understood (one dimensional). However, those are things I can get used to. What I CANNOT get used to is Alexa not playing the same versions of songs I have on my Apple/ITunes playlist. I cannot tell you how disconcerting it was to have Alexa play my FAV's playlist, and instead of playing Mary J. Blige's Each Tear (solo), this awful male voice joins in for the second chorus.  The male voice sound so odd, I thought Alexa was possessed. I pulled out my MAC to check the version of song I had purchased years ago and it was correct, however, the song Alexa was/is playing is not my version of the song. So disappointed that this thing will not play my music.

Title: Love this dot clock!
Body: This is just what I was looking for and everything I hoped it would be. I wanted to replace the old clock in our bedroom because the LED's were too bright to sleep. Well I saw this little beauty and thought it would be a perfect solution. I love the look of it! I dims at night so you can sleep, but it is still easy to read. It shows you the temperature when you ask, as well as the usual verbal response. It also shows the volume level when you change it. Of course the quality of the sound has improved over the gen 2 dot. Every time I look at it, it seems too good the be true.

Title: Don't ask it to recommend music!
Body: A.I. is not here yet. anyone familiar with programming will see this as IFTTT. I bought this device and a google home mini at the same time. The mini can still hear you at full volume while the dot struggles. The sound quality is better on the dot. I tried letting the dot recommend music. It was a disaster. it kept recommending the same stations over and over again. it was recommending top pop and clean alternative. I Don't want either of these stations. I tried disliking them and it kept recommending them. The only thing that it did that was A.I. like was after I cussed it more than I have anything animate or inanimate it just shutdown. I reset it and decided to use the amazon music app on my phone. I thought it may have been an issue with the app. The app had plenty of good recommendations so it was not the app. If you want something to turn your lights on this is a good device. If you want to explore new music this is not the device. You would think with all the data they have been collecting this thing would function better but it is not there yet.

Title: Bad Unit Do Not Buy One
Body: I purchased this Echo Dot last Black Friday.  It worked at first, but did not work when I changed addresses.  I tried over and over again to get the Amazon wireless link on the install process to work-----but the option does not show up.I am pretty computer savvy and know this unit is dead.  Never dropped it, never abused it, just does not work anymore.I would not recommend buying the White Echo Dot.

Title: I like it
