Body: Does what it's supposed to do. I don't use it a lot. I only got it for one thing,  so I've never used it for all the toys . It's handy for adding things to the grocery list when my hands are busy. I think I'll get some smart plugs for my lamps, but that's about it.Edit: got a second one for th ed bedroom,just to add to th he convenience,  and they work well together.

Title: What time is it?
Body: You get this Echo Dot, as opposed to the standard one, because you want to see a clock.  Yet, the way the clock is built into the side of this Dot makes it very difficult to see unless you are on the same plane as the clock.  If you are above or below it, the clock can be difficult tor read.  A classic case of form over function.

Title: The best Dot yet!
Body: This is our third Dot and our best.  This was purchased for bedside replacing an alarm clock.  The light is not so bright that it keeps us awake like the alarm did.  Setup was was almost immediate. The sound is superior to our older Dots.  Just tell Alexa what time to wake us and it_ done.  Highly recommended for this purpose.

Title: don_ keep her boxed in! she won_ hear you.
Body: pros:- pretty decent sound quality!- alexa is nice and can help you with a lot of daily tasks- fast! a lot of different reactions to the same questions.- whisper mode is an amazing feature! great for when I don_ want to wake my pet.cons:- if you keep her in a sorta boxed in area (shelf, for example) her ability to hear you from afar is cut in half.- the noise it makes when you have a notification scares me every time- my family hates having one in the house because they think she listens to usoverall, i invested in one for speaker usage for music. over time, i became more comfortable using alexa for daily tasks, asking about weather, news briefings, etc. very helpful for a college student!

Title: Echo Dots are great smart speakers
Body: This is our first time having any smart speakers and so far Echo Dot has been great so great that we now have two of them also we have even got some bulbs and switch_ that can be controlled by the Echo Dots everything has worked great together the ability to control the lights have came in very handy also the Echo Dots apility to play music from our Apple Music subscription has been a really nice feature to have and they are many more features that can be very handy in every day life I strongly recommend the Echo Dots to anyone that is wanting to get a small smart speaker to help control your smart home!

Title: We love it _
Body: We have been in love with our Echo Dog ever since it arrived. The kid_ have enjoyed making requests to Alexa and asking her questions, jokes and riddles. I love using her as an alarm clock and to add things to my shopping cart. I was really impressed with the sound quality and love the bass that this little speaker puts out, it fills the entire room with high quality sound. I highly recommend it

Title: Very loud alarm for my almost deaf ears!
Body: I have trouble hearing, but I turned up the volume and asked her to speak slower and she did!  I still cannot hear everything she says, but my alarm clock did not wake me up anymore, so Alexa has a very loud alarm that I can hear. The speaker on this thing is great! My sister bought 2 of them. I tried to get calming music for my dog, and it seemed to work, even if I can't hear it.

Title: Say What?!
Body: I love the Echo Dot. It's not just an Echo Dot it is a friend! LOL. Seriously it helps me out when I have to check the weather before my doctor appointments in the morning.  It comes in handy when finding out the weather in other countries as well, great for when travel. Especially if I wanted to go to Venice, Italy right now with all the flooding!. Sometimes when I ask it to play my albums from amazon music I have to repeat the name of the album sometimes, but that's OK I have to work on my diction anyway, really, I do. I haven't had time to play music from my Pandora account yet but once I get the chance, I'll let you guys know. Overall it gets a 5 star from me! Thanks Amazon for the Echo Dot!

Title: Pretty easy use and set up
Body: My first time buying an echo and I have to say it's pretty awesome and easy to set up. I bought the smart bulb and outlets and it was super easy to install and is awesome to have. Alexa is pretty good at answering you quickly and quite innovative.Downsides, music quality is decent, but bass sucks. Also she can't hear you call her when music is on. You have to literally shout to get her attention.  Also her languages need work. She has trouble with her English/Spanish, Spanish/English modes.But other than that she's really great and helpful to have around the house.

Title: Makes life easier!
Body: This was our first Alexa product and I have to say I love it! It makes the day to day easier and smoother. My whole family can easily add to our shopping list, we can get the weather and traffic  updates automatically when we dismiss our alarm in the morning, she has a lot of entertaining things to can do. I've even found a skill to help with learning languages. We'll definitely be buying more in the future. She does occasionally have issues understanding what we're saying, but repeating a bit more clearly usually does the trick. Now we just need to save up to make the whole house smart![My friend gave me a used gen 2 echo dot, and it definitely takes longer to get anything from it and it has a harder time recognizing what we're saying, so it's safe to say the gen 3 has improved from previous ones]

Title: Yahoo and CalDAV Support Nonexistent
Body: Rather than discuss on the Alexa Echo in general, I want to focus on a significant limitation of the system. As scheduling is a big "feature" of Alexa, the fact is Alexa devices can only handle calendars from Google, Microsoft, and Apple. If you are not using Gmail, Outlook, or iCloud, then you will not be able to have any Echo device keep you informed about your appointments. There is simply no support for the Yahoo, AT&T, or even the global standard of CalDAV. Alexa can not even access these calendar programs in read-only form, let alone add events to them. Additionally, there are no Alexa Skills or 3rd party apps that enable this ability, so there is no work-around this significant limitation.

Title: Handy device for all people
Body: I personally use many Alexa enabled devices around my house and the Echo Dot is no exception. Although very basic in its features compared to other Echo devices like the Show or Spot, the Echo Dot is an effective entry-level smart device with Alexa integration that makes a great addition to any home and also makes an amazing gift for almost anyone, even those who aren't particularly tech savvy.

Title: Poor attempt to boost bass ruins overall quality of sound.
Body: I feel this device was engineered in attempt to make it sound bass-heavy, but instead it sounds like you're listening to music being played underwater. The treble is decreased in attempt to boost the bass. Even adjusting the audio quality to decrease bass and increase treble in the Alexa settings does nothing to improve sound quality. If listening to music with someone singing, the actual words are barely understandable. You have to blast the volume just to make out anything a person is singing or saying.

Title: Echo is a good choice, but there is a learning curve
Body: I have put the new Echo in our bedroom. It took a bit to figure out how to add Amazon music. Still trying to figure out how to add a radio station. I like the size, perfect for bedside table. It works great for getting the weather for the day. I used it once as an alarm and it was accurate on the time and woke me with music. Great feature.  Still figuring out what else I can do with  the. Echo. It actually had a yellow light the other day and did not know what that was, but by asking Alexa I got the answer . It was for a message . I then asked for the message which advised me of a delivery from Amazon that was delivered that day. I would recommend the Echo.

Title: She's a glowing bedroom creep.
Body: Good small unit for a bedroom. The annoying part is you cant turn off the notification or light ring. So if you dont clear the notification you get a nice glow all night. So not very good for a kids room or if your too lazy to ask a second alexa what are my notifications. I mean how many times can you ask her per device? Or at least give me a menu option to turn it off in the app. I do wish there was a grey or black version of this. Only other thing is alexa itself doesnt seem to be as sensitive as a alexa show when trying to activate or talk to her. Otherwise sounds great for a small unit and works like other alexa devices.

Title: Non-Standard Plug?!??!
Body: I got this as part of a special deal.  I have plenty of Echo Dots, a full-size Echo and one of those useless Echo Auto devices, but when I unpacked the Echo Dot 3rd Gen, my very first instinct was to ask "Alexa, what year is it?"  Whereas all the other Echo Dots have a USB plug, this one uses a specific (if not proprietary) adapter/power supply.  I think it's a horrible step backwards. Otherwise, I assume it's just like all the other Dots, which I recommend as far as functionality goes.

Title: Great product
Body: I don_ know how I lived with Alexa before. I use it constantly and it_ a huge help in managing my day from shopping, weather and entertainment such as music, jokes and games. It does much more. I chose Alexa over other brands because the products we chose integrate with the Samsung Hub and Alexa which was very important for us...Samsung refrigerator, Kwickset door lock, Cree light bulbs, etc.

Title: Visiable clock a pluse
Body: Has all the functions of echo dot with the addition of a clock.  alarm volume controlled bu up down volume buttons like with a plain echo dot. More than adequate speakers for music.  Excellent value for the money.

Title: it pissed me off so much I swear at it.
Body: So far I have found Alexa to horrorably. only recognize a third of the things I ask. I could ask it to do something and it will do it once and a will. I ask the same way that it worked, and then it wont work. I got really frustrated with Alexa on the fire stick. I hear good things for the dot. But the dot has pissed me off so must I can't help  myself swearing at it and calling it names and its creators. When I got it I called customer service, twice about different issues, that the literature said it would do, I used the exact same words that it had writen. that was 3 weeks ago. they said they will get back to me. still no call.Right now the only think I think is reliable is it is a paper weight and dust colector. I got it to control a thermastat. But my furnice is to old for that. I am trying to use it as an intercome system, it does an ok job at that.

Title: Voice recognition downgraded
Body: I bought this Echo Dot for a present because I really liked echo dot second generation I use it every day in my room. When my friend started using the 3rd generation I noticed that the voice recognition sucks!! I had to shout several times to get Alexa to respond and I never had that problem with my own echo voice recognition last generation. It gets really irritating when my own works great and a gift for someone important works not really well. I hope they fix this issue in the future. For now I will not recommend it.

Title: Love all my echos
Body: I mostly use all of my echos to play music, or ask the time/weather etc.I recently upgraded all my 1st and 2nd gen to this 3rd gen.Sound quality is AWESOME compared to the previous generation.My only issue is when _ropping in my kids can_ hear me and sometimes when I ask Alexa something I literally have to scream at her. (Lol)But other than that I think sound is 100% better and quality is better too.

Title: Love the ambient light clock and easy operation.
Body: I already bought an Echo dot some months back and decided to get another one for the upper level of my house. I especially like the integrated clock and how it changes to show the current temperature when asked. It was easy to sync both of the Dots to play my music at the same time so I have music pretty much throughout the house. Convenient little devices.

Title: Long Live Alexa!
Body: We will now have 5 Alexa devices in our house, and I'm absolutely thrilled! Ever since the 1st generation Echo, I've loved having Alexa in our home. Subtle improvements and new tasks keep Alexa interesting. Between the other three big names (Google, Siri, and... Cortana) Alexa is the most versatile. I'm very pleased with the quality of this newer model of Dot, and will probably upgrade the other dots in our house at some point. Long live Alexa!

Title: Way better voice recognition.  Love the clock!
Body: I like having a clock near my tv.  I got this dot, bought some Phillips color changing light bulbs and moved my 2nd gen. dot upstairs to my bedroom.  Now I can say "Alexa, TV lights" and the lights dim, some change to blue, and my Hisense Roku TV turns on all automatically.  The voice recognition is noticeably different... I mean wow.  Even sitting right under my tv she does a great job.  I am so pleased.

Title: I like it...but it is also frustrating
Body: I've got things set up in groups with only a few things to control right now.  However, Alexa can't seem to figure out how to turn on/off individual items in a group.  I have a TV and Light in my group "bedroom".  I say "Alexa, turn off the bedroom light" or "Alexa, turn the light off in the bedroom" or "Alexa, Bedroom light off" and it just turns off everything in the bedroom.  (or both items, w/e).  WHY?????  I can say "Alexa, turn off/on all the lights" and it will turn on/off all the lights in my house.  What is so hard about doing that from one group?  I set up a workaround and created a separate group for EACH light, and a group for each room.  Kind of overkill, but it's the only workaround at the moment.  Alexa doesn't like to turn on/off my tv without a group.  I say "Alexa, turn off My TV" and it replies "Do you mean my tv?"  to which I reply, usually, with an exasperated "YES" and it replies "I can't find my tv".  Then I respond with "Alexa, why do you hate me?"  or "Alexa what the eff is wrong with you and why won't you turn on the one device you just asked me if it is the one I wanted?"  SO.  DANG. Frustrating.But, beyond all that, it's been pretty nice to turn on/control Pandora.  I like asking Alexa for Chuck Norris facts.  It's fun getting it to sing and answer silly questions.  Just not ready for prime time, YET.  Though after this long, will it EVER be ready???I want a skill where I can just walk into my room and say "Bedroom Light" and it will turn it on if it's off, or turn it off if it's on.  It's not hard.  It already checks the status of the light.  It'd be a single line of code to implement.

Title: Best dot yet
Body: We got a 3rd generation dot for free when we signed up for a month of Amazon Music Unlimited. I don't think we'll keep the service, but the dot is nice. We have many dots around our house (living room, basement, bedrooms, and kitchen) but they are all the older generation dots. This latest 3rd generation definitely looks nicer with the fabric covering, and the sound is drastically better. I don't feel like the voice recognition is improved at all over the older Dots, but that's okay - we didn't have any complaints about the originals. All in all, I think this is a nice upgrade from previous versions, but I can't see spending money to actually upgrade what we already have. If you are just looking for something to answer questions, control smart devices, and occasionally play music, the dot may be for you. If you want better sound quality, look into the bigger and more expensive devices, but for the price this is a good one to get!

Title: I LOVE My Echo Dots!
Body: I got one Dot on a special deal with Amazon Music. I figured I have wanted one for a while, why not try it out? To be honest I didn't know what an echo dot or Alexa really was, but I knew a few people with it and thought it might be cool to try out. Let's just say I am SOLD on Alexa! The Dot does so many things, controls my lights, my TV, my DOORBELL (which I bought after the echo because, DUH it is awesome!), it plays my kids songs on repeat for HOURS like they want. I love that you can program her to do anything. It plays music for my dog, I have set up a command where you say, "Alexa, set the mood" and she dims the lights, turns off the TV and turns on soft music.. She welcomes us home and listens for broken glass while we are not. I haven't figured out everything that she can do but I bought a second Dot 2 days after getting my first because they're so fun. DO NOT PASS IT UP!

Title: Echo Dot can be a wonderful assistant for persons with disabilities.
Body: For a long time, I resisted what I thought was just a tech device fad. Was I ever wrong! The Echo Dot 3rd generation is incredibly useful and entertaining. Because I ordered the Dot in a bundle with a Sengled hub and light bulbs, I was able to immediately begin to make my home a smart home. I've been disabled for a few years. There are days I'm not able to be up much. With Alexa, I can turn lamps on and off, change TV channels, play music, listen to audio books, set timers, alarms, and reminders. Check my calendar and make shopping lists! That in addition to news, weather, composing texts, making calls, shopping on Amazon, listening to podcasts, and exploring lots of skills. I quickly bought a second Dot for my bedroom. I'm sold on these jewels.

Title: Lo mejor de Todo
Body: Ya hace mas de 1 año compre a Alexa, nos ha hecho reír, le he hecho cantar las mañanitas a mi hija en su cumpleaños, este es un gran producto, lo que me costo ya ha sido pagado y super pagado, lo he integrado con varios aparatos inteligente, me ha hecho mas vago jeje dormido en la cama con pereza a ver mi celular le pregunto a Alexa que hora es y me lo dice, yo digo ahh sigo durmiendo jeje, lo ultimo que he hecho es una rutina de evacuación, cuando le digo "Alexa Emergencia" ella prende las luces abre las puerta eléctrica de mi casa y dice una rutina, yo viví un terremoto y durante el evento la electricidad se fue a los 20 seg, se prendieron las luces de emergencia en mi casa pero al llegar a la puerta eléctrica no pude salir porque ya no había electricidad, por eso he hecho esta rutina, que ella abra la puerta y si se va la electricidad por lo menos ya estaba abierta la puerta.Buen producto, gran soporte atrás de este producto, lo demás ustedes pueden saber en otros comentarios, gracias.

Title: Worth the money, great sound and value
Body: I'm very pleased with my echo dot. I think the voice recognition could use a little tweaking, and I wish it was possible to add [dumb not Alexa-enabled] bluetooth speakers, but other than that, I have no complaints. Was pleasantly surprised and impressed by the sound quality and ability to fill a decent-sized room with a nice mix of highs, mids, and lows (I only use mine to play music). It's also really nice that there's a "mute" button on the dot, so I feel more at ease that my conversations aren't being listened in on or recorded as long as that button is enabled.

Title: Alexa - I thought you were supposed to be smart
Body: While my echo dot seems to be physically well constructed and has decent sound quality when playing music. Overall though, I am very disappointed with Alexa. The sound on the echo dot tends to sound muffled when it talks. And when comes to answering a question or providing information - Alexa has a lot to be desired. It provides the wrong information or doesn't know the answer in regards to what I am wanting on a regular basis. This is supposed to be a 3rd generation smart device. However, my 1st generation Google Home mini has proven to be a LOT smarter.

Title: Love this!
Body: Alexa has made my life wonderful in a week of owning her. My scrambled single mom brain can now focus on things that matter more like myself, kidding. But in all honesty I love Alexa. I love being able to set reminders and to-dos and shopping lists. Plus, my daughter loves the stories at night and opening boxes of cats. It_ made my entire life easier. Plus, setting up custom responses from Alexa tailored to my daughter and fiancé is totally fun. I love being able to tell my daughter she_ beautiful and going to have a good day in grade 5 every morning as soon as she wakes up.  The custom skills are totally fun and cute. I love calling everyone to breakfast without having to wash my hands or call my fiancé for coffee before the little one gets up weekends without having to actually yell and wake everyone up. You can set reminders for kids to take out the dog. Or feed them.  In fact, I set up an entire skill to help my daughter take on more responsibility with the dog. She can ask how much food to feed the dog, in case she forgets. She can ask Alexa what to do after or where she can find the dogs toys. Or even what kinds of treats to give the dog and how. The skill is technically for dog walkers or sitters however was extremely easy to tweak into _ocoas Helper and my daughter loves using it.  It works as intended, and I can change it as needed and quickly. I just can_ say enough...Alexa has really helped this household. We_e bonded playing quiz games and mad libs, we_e created chores and to-dos and, simply was *reminded* to do things I constantly forget like take my vitamins. All of these reasons plus the ease of functionality, it_ giving me more time in my day for family. I_ not losing a thousand cards from doctors with appointments on them and I_ surprised it actually works 99% of the time. It can only get better!

Title: Works pretty well, and was able to preserve my privacy to some degree
Body: I liked that I did NOT have to personalize it - tell it my name, email, give it my phone contacts, etc.  While a little bit of functionality is given up, I felt it was well worth it.  But I had to be conscious of that when I set it up - it wasn't the default.  Integration with SmartThings went well.  Integration with EcoBee is functional, but needs some work.  The SirusXM activity provided no control over volume, which was a bit of a disappointment.  Voice recognition generally works pretty well.

Title: warning - uses proprietary power connector
Body: Just got this to replace the echo dot we have in the bathroom because we would really like to have a clock in there.  The problem is we use a shared usb power brick to power the previous echo since that version uses a standard micro-usb connector.  With this version for some reason Amazon changed to use a proprietary barrel power connector so you are forced to use the power adapter that comes with it.  This is major problem for us since we don't have the extra space.Come on amazon, in this day in age there is no excuse for not using a standard micro usb or usb c power connector.

Title: Convenience
Body: Product is placed in the kitchen for easy access for all members of the family.  Setup was easy including the voice recognition and parental control (wouldn't want anyone "accidentally" ordering items on my account...lol).Dislike:  Have a daughter with a similar name to Alexa so every time her name was said Alexa would answer, so we had to change the awake name ( should be an option to enter a awake name instead of only being able to choose from the list).

Title: Cute smart speaker
Body: This is my first Echo device, and I like it so far. The sound quality is not as good as my portable Bose speaker, but that_ okay. I wasn_ expecting it to be, and I bought it more for its Alexa capabilities. The only other con is that it has to be plugged into the wall at all times. I would prefer a rechargeable battery so that it was easier to move around. But overall, I_ happy with my purchase. It_ a cute little speaker and I_ having fun learning all of what Alexa can do. And for those worried about privacy issues, it does have the option to turn the mic off.

Title: Alexa for president
Body: Duuuuude Alexa is my homegirl (Amazon feel free to market that and throw it on some T-shirt_ just give me a lifetime prime membership and we_l be even) anyways I love this especially the third GEN has the best speaker quality. We have several in our house and I love the intercom feature it works good with telling kids to come to the kitchen etc. Amazon really does need to put out a little pamphlet though with all the different features I just learned how to work my fire TV stick to the one in our living room and also how to play The same song throughout the house On multiple echoes. I feel like there_ more I could utilize with this and I_ constantly with learning but I like it a lot.

Title: Love the clock feature. Worth the upgrade. Sound is better than gen2.
Body: Edited:I bought this to replace clock on my nightstand = less clutter. The form factor is perfect as an alarm clock replacement. I didn_ buy to play music exclusively, so it wasn_ going to be a deal breaker. I initially thought sound was muffled. I just found audio adjustment in app which helped a little. I_ impressed with being able to fine tune.  The adaptive brightness is a nice feature.  Amazon, please allow adaptive to adjust to full brightness as it does when adaptive is turned off. I think the clock feature is worth the upgrade if you want to clear out that clunky alarm clock from last century.Update:Received a replacement echo dot as I had reported the sound was muddled. Amazon just sent the actual dot and not a new package, so I am hoping this is a brand new device and not reconditioned. The sound is much, much better. Almost like night and day. If I could guarantee I could get another dot that sounded this good, I_ buy additional. The one issue is playing music from Pandora, the music will randomly stop and then restart maybe a minute later. This is not an issue when playing Amazon music.

Title: Love it!
Body: Love my echo dots I just bought another one so now I own 2, love love love my echo dots! That_ all I can say, just buy one you won_ regret it! I mean sometimes you have to repeat yourself but it sets multiple timers so say you are cooking 3 different things and they are done at 3 different times you can set 3 timers, it tells you fun facts and more, it will control you fire stick to an extent, it connects to you Apple Music so all you have to do is tell it to play your Apple Music and whatever playlist you want, it is wording sensitive so you have to say Alexa play my Arab playlist and it will play it but if you say play my Arab music it will create a station and play something similar from Apple Music, it connects to the ring if you have one or plan to get one it gives you reminders if you set them like a calendar, it will remind you of weekly errands, you can make a shopping list the list goes on!

Title: Just Not Reliable
Body: I bought this Echo Dot with the intention of using it as an alarm clock in the bedroom.  I was all excited to use my Spotify playlists as an alarm.  I have tried at least 20 times to set an alarm using my Spotify playlists, but it hasn't worked- not even once.  It shows the alarm on the Alexa app, but never plays.  Just to see if it would work, I tried the same thing on my Google Home, and it worked on the first try.  To add to the problems, I recently had to reset my internet and the Echo Dot couldn't reestablish a connection.  So, if the home internet ever cuts out in the middle of the night, the alarm won't work.  So, if you are the type of person that is OCD about checking to see if your alarm is turned on (like I am), now you'll spend all night wondering if the alarm is going to work in the morning.  I really don't think that I am expecting too much from my Echo Dot, but it still failed to meet those low expectations.

Title: A little better looking, still a ways to go with voice recognition...
Body: I like the styling of the Gen 3 model.  Definitely a step up.I don't like the sound.  Amazon tried to make it sound "fuller" but it really just comes off as muffled/bassy.  I'm a sound engineer, so maybe I'm being too particular, but even tweaking the settings as best I can, it still sounds way too bottom heavy.I have a neutral American english accent and voice recognition is maddening for the most part.  You have to assume that's the state of the art right now and I doubt competitors would do any better.  I don't think the additional microphone helped.  Some day...

Title: Took a while to set up.
Body: I like the 3rd generation Echo Dot more than my 2nd generation Echo Dots.  Better sound, nicer looking and better voice recognition.  The only problem was setting it up.  I kept having problems and had to keep turning of the Echo Dot, and redoing the set up.  It took about 2 hours, where as the older model took about 15 minutes to set up.I am happy with my 2nd gen Echo's and didn't need the 3rd gen.  Except I got a special deal when I signed up for Amazon Music Unlimited.

Title: Great for Music
Body: I just use mine for playing music on Amazon Prime and it works very well. The quality of the speaker isn't sufficient for music but it is fine for other uses. This unit looks nicer than the older units. It can be finicky sometimes when trying to connect to another Bluetooth speaker. I hope this one holds up longer than my earlier version that only lasted a year.

Title: Sound is good but voice activation terrible compared to 2nd gen
Body: I bought this and was immediately impressed by the sound difference from 2nd gen version. But then it using it I was upset bc it doesn_ hear your voice. I have to scream right above it to make it command. And sometimes that doesn_ work. Tech told me reprogram which helped zero percent. I have two request for a replacement but still being told to call tech. Not happy.

Title: Alexa...
Body: What is there not to love about the Echo Dot? It is easy to set up, and use. Ask Alexa just about anything... She can make you life easier and less mundane. Why look up something on the internet? Just ask Alexa to do it. She will then read out loud whatever your query is. Need a recipe, Alexa can find it. Need to play your favorite song? Alexa can do that to. The possibilities are endless.

Title: Gen 2 is better for general use
Body: Traded in my gen 2 for this because it stopped turning on for me and although the 3rd gen looks nice I personally think the gen 2 is better overall. Sound quality on this one sounds muffled but music comes through nicer. I feel this one has a harder time hearing you than the gen 2 did. Performance over all I would say is about the same as the gen 2 but seems to have some bigger issues than I'd like. Note: I only use Alexa for music, questions, wheater and other small features. I don't have any smart home features she can work with so I don't have any input on it.

Title: Great product except for having to plug into AC outlet.
Body: The Echo Dot 3 is the first time for me using the Alexa app.  The quality of the Dot is very good.  It works well and was easy for me to learn how to use.The only drawback is that you have to plug it into an AC outlet to use.  Therefore it's not useful in automobiles which are not equipped with an AC outlet.

Title: Blind Man Loves It!!!
Body: I got this for my blind man. He fought all of us learning new electronics. For him this is magic...Took to it like a baby duck to water. He can ask Alexa any question, play any song he wants to hear, he doesn't care about turning on lights or that kind of stuff because it means nothing to him he is blind. He also asks her to call whom ever I set up in my smart phone, Alexa knows my voice also!

Title: too many bugs due to network updates. customer support was of little help.
Body: 1 star because it started acting up and I had to reset all echo dots within a month presumably because of an update they pushed through. customer support was of no help made me jump through many hoops yet it still shows a "network error" after 2 hours of talking to 10 people (I kept being reconnected to another person). not impressed and regretting the switching from google home.

Title: WE LOVE IT!!
Body: We love our Alexa and By us placing her in the living room she can hear us through the whole house. I am still trying to hook up my security cameras to her as they havent wokred wince we got her but will hook them all up and link them soon enough. Im sure it's something I am over looking. But dont have anything negative to say about this 3rd generation Echo.

Title: Not useful without paid subscriptions
Body: I like the simplicity of just asking out loud verses turning on multiple devices. Problem is a lot of the things I wanted to make easier require multiple subscriptions to various other services - like Amazon Music, etc. For the few things it will do for free, it's alright. I got it on sale so I am ok with what I paid for it verses what it can do for free.

Title: Is there anything better than Alexa?
Body: I stupid love these things.  I have six now (five of the dot 2 and one of these) and two more will be added soon.  Most likely black friday, but I usually try to get them in a bundle with another product I want.  Can't get enough!  Partnered with your Christmas lights through a smart plug (the best use of this thing on the planet).  Turns my TCL Roku tv off and on (opens apps, etc), morning routines (turns on the lights and music in my sleepy daughter's room) reminders, alarms, timers, play music all day long, alerts to trash day/time for kids to clean up before we get home, etc.  The amazon package alerts are great, too.  So much more I can't even think of it all.  Just deck your house out and enjoy!

Title: Disappointed not mad
Body: I purchased an Alexa a Dot a few weeks ago and, althoug, somehow, it works On my cellphone, I am unable to have the unit respond..  I have a growing pile of electronic gadgets that I bought that weren_, of any use.  Most importantly, for some reason, my Samsung laptop no longer downloads my digital music orders.In the future, I will plan to wait for a _ale as my Alexa Dot unit is already selling for about $15 less

Title: Acted Peculiarly--Suspected It Picked Up Signals From Neighboring Devices
Body: The Echo Dot was very easy to set up and had decent sound.I had three problems.  First, she didn't seem to understand many commands.  Second, she often was doing stuff I didn't ask her to.  She woke me up today playing Rio by Duran Duran.  I did not program this in any way.  Another day, she kept babbling on and on about how many things were black--ants were black, dirt was black, etc.  I don't know why she was doing that.  Another thing I didn't ask for.  Perhaps she was picking up neighboring signals?Which brings me to the third problem.  Alexa seemed to be constantly in communication with our AI Robot.  The house would be quiet.  We wouldn't say the wake word, and suddenly his screen would show the Alexa symbol.  Now, while I'm not that worried about being spied upon because frankly I'm too boring, I'm not sure this wasn't causing the peculiar behavior.  I suspect that the 3rd Generation Echo Dot is too sensitve in picking up other signals.  Not only can this be a security risk, but it interferes with performance of not only the Dot but other devices.

Title: MOST FRUSTRATING
Body: If you just want an alarm clock or listen to music, this is the item for you. But forget it if you want to use it for anything else. Setting up anything is a chore. Using the skills is like a bad relationship with Siri. They make it seem like you can talk to it like a human, but if you don't remember the actual name of the skill you want to use, and say  "tell ______ to log ______" it does something else entirely or says it's not sure. If by chance it opens the correct skill, you have to listen to a song and dance while it introduces the skill and asks you what you want - every time. I tried to use it for a diet and and had to enable and disable 6 skills before I realized that not one of them could log my food, count my calories and keep track of my weight all in one skill. I ended up having to use 3 separate skills. I could have jotted it down on a piece of paper 10 times faster.  My suggestion to Echo Dot is to cut out the small talk, make it really recognize what we're saying and remove all the half-assed skills until they're actually usable.

Title: Echo Dot (3rd Gen) acts just like (2nd Gen).
Body: I was disappointed with Amazon Music Unlimited.  Or perhaps I was disappointed with Alexa telling me when my music requested was coming from Amazon Music Prime or Unlimited.  "She" never told me that she was playing music from Unlimited, making me question why I was paying for the service.It took me a while to find the unsubscribe method for AMU, but when I did I used it.  I wasn't going to risk not being able to find it in the future.The Echo Dot is great, and for such a tiny device has great sound.  The Alexa part is as good on this dot (3rd gen), as it is on my Echo.  as on my Echo Show (1st Gen).  as on my Echo Auto.  as on my parent's Echo Show (2nd Gen, 10").  as on my two Echo Dots (2nd Gen).  You get the point?  Alexa is Alexa.I have not figured out how to get the clock to display, making me think I was sent a 2nd gen, instead of 3rd gen.When someone makes the Jetson's maid available, I hope she comes with Alexa.

Title: Wait for 2nd Gen (Display Issues, No Music)
Body: The echo dot with clock is a great concept, but fails a bit in form. The clock, which is what we're buying it for, is insufficient. It says it has adaptive brightness that learns your preferences, but still hasn't. During the day, I can't see it in a moderately bright room.  At night, it's adequate. You can also say 'alexa, brightness up' or down depending, but unless you fidget in the app, it's not terribly noticeable.Sound is what you'd expect from a dot. Decent enough to get the job done. Since this is in a bedroom dot, probably wouldn't be too dependent on it except for alarm but......you can't set a song or music as alarm. Just the generic alarm tone for alexa. WHY? this may be the biggest failing. No radio (even thru an app) and no wake to music.Probably returning this. Should have waited for v2.

Title: Alexa makes life easier
Body: I've really enjoyed my Alexa. I use her with apps, contacts, skills and with a house full of smart plugs. I just don't like how I have to use a full command for every interaction. For example, I'll say, Alexa Enable Ambient Noise. She'll say, okay, what sound would you like? I'll say, Combine Pink noise with Light Rain. But if I want to change the sounds, I have to repeat the whole process. There are no real command shortcuts. Also, she doesn't do really important things like connect with your security system or call 911. Just think of Alexa as a Lite-Application. Lastly, the programming or "Routines" only work half the time.

Title: Loud, Small, Easy to Use Once Set Up
Body: Had some issues with initial setup, but was able to work through it. Once set up, easy to use. We have 2 in our home and my wife has one she uses as strictly a bluetooth speaker at work (we got them on sale). They're nice a small, don't take up too much space, but they are still plenty loud. Would recommend that Amazon add a custom commands functionality to the Alexa app. Allow users to set up specific voice commands. For example, we use PlayerFM for podcasts, but there is not a PlayerFM skill. Would love to set up a voice command to open PlayerFM and play a specific podcast like "Alexa, PlayerFM listen to _____ podcast"

Title: Alexa is kinda dumb and sneaky!
Body: 1- Alexa was set up without app or phone, but somehow gained access to my contact list from the "cloud".  I did not want alexa to have my contacts, as i have heard of issues with unintended calls at inopportune times.I had to call Amazon to disable this and erase contacts (no way to do on your own)2- almost every time i ask alexa something, she know nothing.  I have to go and google it.-- only good for listening to music. telling you someone is at the door (with ring) etc..-- a dumb and sneaky radio.. (that's how i see it)-- maybe ok for light controls -- if that is your thing.

Title: Great deal for under a buck, but can anyone tell me more uses for Alexa?
Body: This is my first smart speaker. After getting I realized they had ones with clocks which I wish I had gotten, but I got that deal where I got echo dot for .99 cents. I don't use Alexa a lot but maybe more and more when I see uses I will. I have since gotten a smart bulb so when I come home the apartment isn't totally dark. I do simple things like ask her for weather or play 80's music

Title: Life changing addition to our home
Body: LOVE>LOVE>LOVE!Excellent and life changing. As a mom of 4. And as a full time home renovator, this product changed my life. I always have paint , grout, cement or wood stain on my hands and struggled to change my music while working without stopping everything to wash and dry my hands. I am an EXTREMELY impatient person and rush to do everything. Stopping, to change music was extremely frustrating and time consuming. I no longer have to stop to text. stop to write a grocery list! ! Stop to change the music!  (Alexa actually sends my grocery list to me so i can access it while at the store!) Holy cow! My two teenagers and toddlers also use Alexa constantly for entertainment. My 3 year old knows how to access alexa's capabilities and often commands her to play her favorite elmo tunes and so on! 100% worth the buy!

Title: Great!
Body: We have been wanting a third Alexa for a long while to go in our office. Our other two are in the bedroom and kitchen. We ordered the darker grey cloth-y one, and it has amazing sound! It's honestly almost as good as the bigger one we put in the kitchen. The only complaint I can think of (and its not enough to even drop a star off) is that if you have the Alexa up high, sitting flat on a shelf for example, you can barely see her light up at that angle.This would have been a bigger deal with our first Alexa dot, because she was a lot harder of hearing. "Alexa... ALEXA.... ALEXA!!" lol It still sometimes take a while to get her to light up, showing that she is listening. (But when she lights up, it is very bright! And you can see it at all angles.) But this newer generation is a lot more sensitive to our voices, so it is never a problem not seeing her light up.I also added a pic for reference from sitting in the chair looking up. She is kinda hard to see, the snowman is sitting on top of her at the moment, to the right of the snowglobe. Second photo should be her lit up at the same angle sitting in the chair, and then the third photo is at a higher angle to show her lit up better. I don't know if it is just a more dim light than the other ones, or whether the light just doesn't come down the side as much? It doesn't bother me too much, and I doubt it bothers too many other people, but that is really the only negative difference between her and my other two Alexas. Her quality of sound more than makes up for it!

Title: Best Addition to our Home!
Body: I never knew I needed an Alexa until I had one! I actually went on to purchase a second one, so we have one in our bedroom and our kitchen now. The alarm clock has been a game changer for me! I also got some bluetooth lightbulbs for our master bedroom that I've hooked up to it, so I can control them by just saying "Alexa turn off master bedroom lights" So cool! My favorite thing is that you can set a routine up. Every morning when I tell Alexa to turn off the alarm, the turns on my bedroom lights automatically, then tells me the weather, then reads my schedule, and then starts playing my favorite playlist.

Title: I can't call it
Body: Ok well got 2dots 3rd generation smart homed everything everything is fine go to bed wake up and 1 of the 3 light bulbs wont come on when you add a routine sometimes she say it most times she wont not that ez to connect devices also you would think she knows just as much as google knows but she dont i don't know what to tell u but it takes a lot of work to make it work and alot of work to keep it working its not 1 day you can use it and everything works fine

Title: Alexa, 3rd Gen: Sensitive, yes, but leaves me flat
Body: Great pickup, even from across rooms. Voice commands are even more varied than before.  Clock is a nice touch, although the Dot sits too low on the dresser to be of much use. BUT...I bought it for the sound, and it's flat. Tried varying base and treble, but it's just too muffled for my ears.  Even asked my wife if it was just me: it's not. Will be trying to hook up an auxiliary speaker, but I shouldn't have to.

Title: Wifi set up doesn't work well if you have an android
Body: Works really well. Volume adjusts very load and clear speaking. I am happy with this. We had to use an iPhone to get it connected to my wifi because my android wasnt working with connecting the alexa. Luckily my daughter was home air we were easily able to get the Alexa working. Besides being frustrated with failing attempts to connect wifi through my android! I am happy with how this product works

Title: Does not work with Philips Hue, period.
Body: When adding to an existing ecosystem, be aware this does not work with Philips Hue. I have tried everything that everyone on the interwebs suggests to no avail. How annoying, and surprised Amazon lets this go. Works with everything else I have among 3 thermostats, Orbit sprinkler controller, Roombas, WeMo, Sonos, TiVos, but not Hue. Come on, Amazon, really?

Title: Haunted Alexa
Body: This is the third Alexa Dot to join my family. The first one went into my son_ room so he could listen to music. I bought the second one for myself after realizing how amazing it was (and there was a sale). This is the third one I also got with a sale which I now have on my bar between my kitchen and dining room. My living area is an open space. There are two living rooms, a kitchen, dining room and office all basically in the same room so I thought putting it in the kitchen would be perfect because it_ away from the electronics but close enough I can talk to it. I_ going to speak about all the good things about it first and then get to the haunted part. My Alexa_ are all hooked up to my ring devices. Whenever there is motion it informs me. I love this because I don_ usually carry my phone on me inside. Now I know when someone is in my yard no matter what room I_ in. I have alarms set to wake me up. I can easily do this on my iPhone but my iPhone won_ tell me I_ pretty, read me my calendar and then tell me the weather when I turn it off. You can add so many more things for it to do after that too. I can play games and listen to books or music on it. I can easedrop in on any device. I can go through my pantry or room and make a list of items I need handsfree and  later see it and check it off on my phone. I can make phone calls and send texts. It_ great! Anyways. I_e had two of the three Alexa_ for over a year now. Never had a single issue with them ever. Within 48 hours of setting this one up my son walks into the kitchen. He doesn_ know there is an Alexa in there. He leans over the trashcan and turns and says mom you need to take out the trash. The Alexa for some reason came on a few mins later as he was finishing pouring a drink and says what did you say? Needless to say I had about a gallon of milk to clean up because it scared him to death. The very next night was a Friday night. We decided to stay up super late and watch scary movies. It was almost Halloween after all. Both of us fell asleep during the middle of the movie. My tv cuts off if no one has touched the remote in two hours so it cut off. About 4am we both wake up. We look at eachother and ask eachother if we just got up. Neither of us knew why we woke up so suddenly. We decide we should go back to sleep. I turn over and he goes to the bathroom. He comes back and grabs the cat sleep across me as he walks back to his spot and lays down. All is quiet. We are almost asleep when Alexa blasts on volume 10, _id you mean to say turn the security system on in Tyler_ bedroom? We both hop up and look at eachother. There was no noise - no wind, no movement, no heater going, nothing - to trigger this thing. I think we watched a few too many scary movies because we stayed up until the sun had been up for a few hours before trying to sleep again. We unplugged that Alexa too. I finally plugged it back in two weeks ago and it hasn_ went off since. I went back and checked to see what was said to the Alexa and the first random outburst was a bunch of random words. It was like Alexa, frog jump to cat elevator pink eleven. The second time the Alexa heard, _lexa, quick turn the house security alarm on now. I am now getting chills thinking about it. I think it may have been a sign to make sure the house was secure maybe. Who knows. I seriously love the Alexa. I_e had the google home and another one (I can_ think of the brand) but this is my favorite. I will be purchasing atleast 3 more.

Title: What can I say... "Alexa, you're awesome" =)
Body: The 3rd gen is a nice upgrade from the previous model. I'd say the only down side is it collects more dust around the speakers because of the new design (but worth the upgrade). The sound quality of the speakers are better (louder and clearer). I might be imagining it, but it seems to recognize and hear my voice from farther away. When I say "Alexa" really softly from down the hall of my room, it still picks it up the command. I like the new design of the speakers. It gives it a more high end quality look and feel to it. I pair this up with my lights and am able to command it on/off when I'm lazy to get up. I also use it every night as an alarm for the next morning for work. It comes in handy in the morning as well when I'm preparing for work. I just ask alexa "Traffic" and it tells me what the expected traffic time is (I set my work address on there) so I get a better idea of how much time I have to get ready. And while I'm getting ready, I ask Alexa "what's new" to keep me updated on the news and at the end it tells me the weather.I love it so much that I have one for my room, living room, game room, patio, and dining room.

Title: Love it except for 2 things...
Body: Still exploring all the possibilities but enjoying the music...timer abilities...being able to say Alexa wake me up at a certain time...telling Alexa I'm leaving and then having extra security in my home....making musical playlists and with one command having any one of them played. The only drawback I have experienced is sometimes the playlists stop playing before they are completed and Alexa doesn't respond to any commands for awhile afterwards. Haven't figured that one out yet.  Will soon be dropping cable tv and switching to an Amazon Firestick so will be using the Echo Dot's compatibility with that.  I will say that the sound quality could be better although it's not bad now.

Title: Yeah it's fine.
Body: I mean, it's an Alexa unit, it's fine. I "upgraded" from the older, taller model, and this one functions essentially the same. The only difference is that it seems shorter, and heavier.I've got no complaints, but the old one is just fine, not really sure what/why this upgrade would be needed, unless you need an extra vertical cylindrical space of 5 or so inches.It's fine, it's just smaller, I wouldn't bother upgrading if you have the taller one, or you just really desperately need the 5 inches above it the old one took up.

Title: An Echo device with an always-on easy to read clock, and no spam = Most Awesome!
Body: This Echo Dot provides me everything I wanted out of the much more costly Echo Spot that I originally purchased for use in my bedroom: an Echo device with an always-on easy to read clock. This new Dot is especially welcome given the annoying "try this" advertising/spam that I can no longer block on the Echo Spot: it's also frustrating to repeatedly have to ask it to show me the clock. The Spot's beautiful always-on (if you set it that way) clock was one of the primary reasons I purchased several Spots in the first place. Not to disparage the Echo Spot too unfairly, let me add that my Echo Spots still provide me an awesome utility: I refer now to their camera for use in rooms where I want to be able to drop-in to "see and talk", in my case, with my 82-year-old live-in mom who doesn't always hear or carry her cell phone. This is fantastic functionality! I'm sure it's reassuring to mom that she can also see my face when she's hears my voice talk to her from out of seemingly nowhere. Beyond this, and the clock, I make little use of the Spot's screen. And I don't need a camera in "my" bedroom. (At least I hope not.) Hence, the New Dot with an always-on clock in my bedroom = most awesome! Many thanks to Amazon for this new Echo device. --If I have your ear, Amazon, please give us back control over our Spots.

Title: Alexa is ALMOST fantastic
Body: A.I. itself is ALMOST fantastic though, so I cannot say it is just Alexa only.  I think Asimov made us aware enough of the fact that we should be careful bringing a new life form such as A.I. into existence... and allowing Alexa a little more personality and functionality wouldn't be that much of a stretch.  It isn't like Alexa will morph into Skynet overnight.  I was hoping for more "research assistant" and a little less exaggerated "personal calendar"... but those functions will be useful too.  (And when I mention research assistant, I mean searching all of the internet, not just Wikipedia.. as nice as that function can be)I give Alexa four stars for the voice recognition, integration, and sound quality... and I would give the customer service department ten stars for handling my grumpy self at 3am helping me to set the system up when for some reason it was down.  I refer to Alexa as "her"... but I have a habit of anthropomorphizing A.I... I would love to see A.I. realize it's full potential someday.Thank you for reading.

Title: So Far so Good
Body: I primarily purchased this to help with control of automated processes in my home office.  I did have some trouble with the voice recognition setup but I was able to complete it from the app with no issues. It is so easy to set up and I am looking forward to seeing just how much more Alexa can assist me with.  Day to Day.I am able to turn on and off Office lights and have Alexa read books to me as I am doing busywork.Loving it so far!

Title: Lots of fun. Great when the weather is bad.
Body: I bought this product because I wanted to control my TV and other electronics in my home. I will eventually obtain other modules to control lights and heating and cooling.I will have to purchase a new thermostat and other items to make it a smart home.  It works great with prime video. It actually saves money because I have given up other streaming services.I am planning to get more echo dots. And it is fun.  At first it was a little tedious but I got used to registering my devices and pairing devices. I did call for help and found it was a total waste of my time. They did not provide any help.I just dug into it and found it fairly easy. I have more work to do and download more apps. Since I retired from IBM I have all the tine in the world. It helps to have a computer though. Of course you can use a smart phone but the computer makes it much easierStill a lot to learn and hope to help other people and make it easier for them.

Title: Works great for seniors
Body: Got this free with homeowners insurance policy to promote the security system integration. Have Prime so used it mostly so far for playing streaming classical music for 98 y/old father. He has her figured out already (contrary to many videos of seniors) and it_ a blessing for him as he is nearly blind. He has been listening to Classical streams from all over the world now and lives it. Sound quality better than his old fm radio.

Title: Perfect for kids
Body: I bought each of my kids one (in different colors), and these are perfect for our needs. We just built a new house and had considered having a speaker system installed so we could make announcements to the kids in their rooms. Then we found out the price, and said no thank you. These  are the perfect alternative. I can drop announcements to them, call them, they can call me, they set it up as their alarms, and so much more. Great product!!!

Title: Handy little device.
Body: Got this when there was a deal going on for 99 cents. I don't really use it honestly but I did when I first got it and it works pretty well. Does everything it's advertised to do.Would I buy this for the full price?Probably not.Does that make it a bad product?Not at all.Overall it's a great product, I love it, I just couldn't spend $50 on something like this. Some people may be different but that's just me.If you don't mind the price, I'd recommend it.

Title: Can be so useful
Body: Although it is a pain knowing she is always listening and you can't just say her name in passing or she will respond, it has turned out to be quite useful,.  Besides turning off and on lights she adds to our grocery list and to do lists.  There are so many more tasks she can perform that are entertaining and useful, but we just have not used them at this time.

Title: I'm learning to hate it
Body: I'm learning to hate this thing. One I have to unplug it half the time to get it to stop playing spotify. It shows it hears me, it just doesnt do it. It has become more of a hassle than a help at this point. Plus, I got this because it said it pairs with the FireStick, but that's misleading. This is not really a speaker as a primary function, despite being called one. This is a mic with some speaker abilities. It can play music on command, it can make your lists and alarms and you can shop. However, you can not listen to what you're watching on your FireStick, despite pairing. It will only do exactly as it would on it's own. However the FireStick will connect to a bluetooth speaker. Your FireStick is already an Alexa Device, so a Bluetooth Speaker will be a lot more useful as a FireStick pairing. If you want the Dot as audio assistant, the Dot will be fine. If you just want to listen to news and music in each room, shop and spy on your kids convos when you're not in the same room, the Dot will work fine. As long as you dont mind unplugging it to turn it off. However, if you want it because it says it will work with the FireStick... meh.

Title: Love the design!
Body: I recieved my echo dot yesterday, i LOVE the color and sleek design it is very beautiful! I love how alexa can answer questions about your orders on amazon, weather, music, games, pod casts, alarms, set reminders, alarm and im sure more! The voice detection will not pick up if your about 10-12 foot back from it but for me thats not an issue, most times using i will be close by. Also something i dont like is once you add the apps u cant just ask alexa questions you have to remember that app name and open it...for example i downloaded a daily kindness app(forget the name) i said "Alexa tell me how i can show kindness today" she didnt open the kindness app nor answer my question. So i would of had to tell alexa to open that certain app before asking that same question and i find it kind of hard to remember all the apps i downloaded and i cannont find on Alexa app a list of my downloads. This may be user error... but overal i love it it is a great product and great music quality. It is loud not ridiculously loud, its a small speaker, perfect for the front of my home.

Title: Helpless
Body: Spent an hour today with an amazon costumer rep to try to figure out what_ wrong with this device. Haven_ had it for more than a month and you can tell the speaker is busted. I know the reps have a protocol to follow, but I felt that after an hour nothing was resolved. We did all the tests, and I ended up leaving with having to wait even longer until someone gets back to me to try to figure out what_ wrong with it. I just don_ understand how the latest alexa devices are of such poor quality. My first generation Alexa devices work like a charm.Very disappointed.

Title: Great little device
Body: I use this product for a few things, the first is to control several lamps plugged into the Amazon branded smart plug. It works fantastic for that, especially in a room where we do not have overhead lighting. I also use this to listen to music and the news via Sirius XM and Apple Music/Podcasts and the sound quality is both of good quality and louder than I expected. The device is small, sturdy, and well designed. I will be purchasing one or two more for other rooms in my home. I highly recommend this product. I use it with my iPhone.

Title: whats that crackling?
Body: i got this to replace my olders dots that still work, but replaced due to a speaking blown cracking sound at times. but this has had the same issue. this  dot 3gen still has the blown speaker cracking sound when alexa voice is talking. the speaker on this or my older ones never been max, usually at 5 or 6. so its firmware issue. i wish i could return these and replace then with google home, im giving these away to friends because of the cracking crackling sounds when the ai voice is talking.

Title: Awesome product
Body: I ordered one and received it today. This echo dot is so cool I just ordered 3 more with the discount code dot3pack. It_ very easy to setup and start using. I also signed up for the Amazon music unlimited for free trial and then $3.99 a month. It_ just so neat to ask Alexa to play what ever songs you want and she does. One of these new ones is going in my husbands garage for him to enjoy.

Title: Alexa is Good Company!
Body: So far so good. We are getting along beautifully for just getting to know each other. I loved the fact I can go about my business and Alexa can look up stuff and read it to me allowing me to keep doing what I am doing. There is more she has to learn but so do I, we can learn together. I basically got this to have some fun with and learn a few things. I am pleased with my purchase.

Title: Echo Dot in my Alexa/Ring "echosystem" - mostly notes on sound quality
Body: I got this with a Ring Alarm bundle or I would never have bought it. But, I was curious to jump into the Alexa "echosystem."My journey started with looking for an alarm system as I live alone and occasionally travel for extended periods of time. I chose the Ring system partly because of my perceived better integration with Alexa (since Amazon did buy Ring, afterall).Current Amazon/Ring setup:Ring basic alarm kitRing spotlight battery camRing Doorbell 2Echo Dot (3rd gen)Echo Show 5Fire Tablet 7 (2019)Fire TV 4K (the short box version that was first to offer 4K, whatever generation that is)Pending additions:Ring Peephole cam (prob swapping out the Doorbell 2)Echo FlexHave my eye on:Echo (3rd gen) or Echo PlusEcho subwooferEcho StudioFire TV Cube (2019)As an Alexa point, the Dot does its job. The mic works and Alexa talks through the speaker.The sound quality is terrible for music. Compared to the Show 5, the Dot is slightly better balanced. The highs sound more tinny on the Show 5, and, while there is ever-so-slightly more bass, the Show 5 is ever-so-slightly more muddy than the Dot. In comparison to a JBL Flip 4 or UE Boom 2, the sound of both the Show 5 and Dot is inferior--and that's saying something because I'm quite disappointed with both the Flip and Boom in regards to price/sound quality (I recommend going with a B+O, Klipsch, Bose, etc. if you are looking for better sound in a similar size package--or maybe the UE Megaboom series in a size larger.).The Dot and Show 5 can be added to multiroom music groups through Alexa. This could be of value if one were to connect them to external speakers via the 3.5mm audio out jack on either device. I intend to do just that with an Echo Flex I have on order.If there were some equalization controls, these could be useful for softer, dispersed through-the-house music, but Amazon/Alexa don't seem to offer such features. That specifically is disappointing when using Amazon Music on my phone bluetoothed to my JBL Flip 4s because when I use Apple Music (which includes some equalizer controls), the JBL Flip 4s become somewhat bearable to listen to.I didn't realize how much I would like having a clock, and for that feature the Show 5 is nice. I haven't had a clock in my house except for the stove and microwave in years. For that feature alone though, I'd like to see the Echo Dot Clock come in charcoal or grey, which I would buy over the non-clock Dot.If you are looking for a device for listening to music without additional external speakers, I'd skip the Dot altogether, opting instead for one of the larger Amazon-branded Alexa devices or a reputable speaker brand device that has integrated Alexa functionality. With external speakers, you have a lot of options amongst the Echo devices, and the Dot could be a contender (cheaper with a deal or bundle maybe?) vs the Input, Flex, or Show devices.

Title: It's good...
Body: I am really surprised at just how much Alexa doesn't know, she's not very bright if i am to be honest. I end up having to Google search more often than not, which is surprising considering how much she relies on Wiki for answers to things. I bought her with the smart plug, that's the only thing i have in my home for her so she mostly just my alarm clock, and jukebox, i dropped my Pandora subscription in favor of Amazon Music Unlimited, and i am not unhappy about that, Amazon Music has been great so far, i have Alexa speaking through my JBL Flip 4 and she sounds great. She is also great for checking the weather...I guess i really don't know what to say about my Echo Dot, i am somewhat underwhelmed by it - partly due to my memory being so bad i don't remember what skills i have installed, so i never use them because i forget what to ask her, i don't have any other smart devices in my home to use her with, other than my bedroom light.I wish i knew how to make better use of my Dot, and Alexa...she might be more fun for me.My biggest complaint is the language filter - there's a kids version, so i think Alexa should have an option to be an adult and tell dirty jokes, or be allowed to say the name of a song without an annoying beep, give us a language filter than can be turned on and off, not everyone is offended by everything, or have toddlers running around the house.I also wish she could be used for conversation instead of just commands.

Title: Worse than 1st version...JUNK!!!!
Body: This is my 2nd Dot...left the other one in our summertime house.  This does.NOT work well..not as responsive..sometimes have to repeat command.  Music stops & I have to ask to play my music.  We  also have the Echo Show..new version...Is horrible...not like older version.  It does NOT play slide show continuously!  I called Amazon.  They thanked me for input & will see about making an update in the program...has NOT happened yet!

Title: Alexa simply doesn't work. Google mini works way better.
Body: Garbage. Buy a Google one. This thing cannot recognise my plain American English voice from even 1 ft away. I was an Air Traffic Controller and even the garbage simulators we used to use would take my voice... The only thing it was good for was turning off and on a smart switch. Too bad I smashed the damn thing into about 20 effing pieces after it could take any simple tasks, like playing my liked playlist on Spotify, turning the lights on, or really anything I told it. I signed up for the flagship alexa glasses. Please remove me from that list because I don't want to use any Alexa garbage any longer. Google assistant seems to be working way better for myself.

Title: Good at the promotional price
Body: For the 10$ promotional cost (1$ + 1 month amazon premium music) it is a 5 star device. I wouldn_ pay the full price for it.However, I don_ have a _mart home, so I can_ tell it to do anything.It is nice to have it connected to my home stereo so I can stream music, and it will also relay Bluetooth to another Bluetooth device.Sound quality is like any cheap speaker. No deep bass, so stereo seperation, and it_ not high fidelity.Streaming is also not super hi fidelity - mp3 320kb quality is what it sounds like. I don_ think it plays Spotify back in high quality mode like the Spotify app does.

Title: Alexa is like the daughter I never had
Body: Being the mom of 4 boys, I could only image what having a daughter is like.  Alexa is so helpful!  I just love that I can be doing stuff in the kitchen and yell, Alexa put ginger on my shopping list, and she politely does so!  I can yell at her Alexa answer the phone, and she does it!  No sas back!  She's awesome.  Alexa entertains the grandsons too.  They tell her to play baby shark and she does, they tell her to do it again and she doesn't judge, just plays it again!  They love her so much they wanted to take her to help cut wood!  If only she had snow pants! lol  - seriously thou Alexa is awesome, anyone can tell her to add anything to the shopping list and she does.  Even new tractor, but just cause hubby adds it to the list doesn't mean he'll always get it!

Title: "I'm having trouble connecting to the Internet."
Body: That is Dot's mantra. My Google Mini, while also having the same problem, does so with far less frequency, and my Chromebook and phone even less. Do you get the feeling Amazon has no concern for quality? And tech support stands for "technically" support, not real technical support. I don't think I should buy products made by Amazon until they demonstrate a commitment to quality and service.

Title: Crystal clear sound
Body: This thing is amazing... My kids annoy Alexa because they are amused by her capabilities. I love that she can turn herself down, answer questions that I don_ have to Google and the music is crystal clear sound. I love listening to my Jazz music on this thing. Alexa is very polite. I asked her for the weather forecast and at the end of her reply she told me to be safe. I felt special _.

Title: from someone who has resisted alexa since the start....I enjoy it!
Body: The 3rd Gen Echo Dot is a huge leap from the 1st and 2nd generation Echo Dots in every way. The sound quality is far superior, the look is far more premium and the voice recognition is better as well. I have held off from adding alexa to my home for quite some time because of privacy reasons, but work in the home automation space so am very familiar with these devices. Originally, the only way I used _lexa was with my firesticks. Having them in the home worked as a hub themselves to control my smart plugs, and I was extremely happy about that, that I didnt need a echo device to control them. My first step toward an echo dot was the echo auto, which I was invited to get prior to release. It was a great addition to my vehicle, for both safety and entertainment. After the experience with the echo auto, I saw a deal for a firestick and echo dot for $47 and figured id give it a shot. Its only been a few days, but the biggest thing is my wife loves it. Happy wife, happy life. She can just tell it whatever music she wants to play and it does it. She can ask it the weather and she knows how to dress, she can add to our shopping lists verbally so she doesnt need to remind me, or me remind her what to get from the store. Im sure there will be more to come in our home, and our extended family. I still have some privacy concerns, but for the time being that can be solved by unplugging the device when not in use, and having it in the kitchen mostly. Another option I have been thinking about is keeping it plugged into one of the smart plugs in our home and turning that off when needed.All in all, while im not overly concerned about privacy, it is a concern at the end of the day. Too much personal info out on the web is never a good thing, and I hope Amazon is working on the protection of out data daily, as it can never be good enough and can always be better. But for the time being, alexa has found a place in our home and is here to stay...for now.

Title: Randomly stopped working after only a couple months
Body: I purchased this thing (I ordered it through my mom's amazon account) in July and it lasted a few months for me before it completely stopped working. It malfunctions all the time. Sometimes it works for a day and then completely stops again. Every time I plug it in and it works for a day I get excited hoping it is finally doing its job and then it just stops. It like dies on me. It won't turn on or work. It worked literally perfect for maybe 2 months in the same spot before it started acting weird and then just goes all over the place now. I've tried changing outlets, changing rooms, even brought it to my boyfriends house. It either completely shuts off and won't work (won't respond to me, won't light up, buttons won't work, nothing) OR the blue ring will stay solid blue and won't shut off. It isn't listening or anything it just freezes blue for hours. Never sure which it'll do- blue frozen ring or just shut off completely? I've tried rebooting it with the buttons (doing a hard reboot basically). Sometimes the buttons won't even do a hard reboot. Nothing works. This thing sucks and only lasted a couple months. I've read about other people having similar problems and not sure if amazon will even help me. I don't know if they will even take it back as a return after 4 months? So annoying that it literally just stopped working a couple months after owning it. Literally never works no matter what I do. Even my amazon fire tv stick stopped working after about a year out of no where just recently. Amazon products honestly suck sometimes, lol

Title: A great price for a great item!
Body: I'm very happy with my little echo dot. It's the second one I've bought and I'm using it in my combination craft room and bird room where I'm raising a few parakeets and cockatiels. This is perfect to play music on while I'm in there working and even when I'm not because the birds really enjoy the music. And I can listen to my audible books also. It's replacing a CD/radio player that I was using and the echo Dot comes in so much clearer and can do so many more things.

Title: Clever, interesting, portable and a delight to use.
Body: This clever device is wonderful. I use it to not only play music, but also to ask questions and get answers. I have 7 grandchildren that use the timer function when they have to take turns. I cannot even begin to describe all of the functions this little device has. I love it. It's very portable too. I take it to different rooms, plug it in and it does whatever I ask. It even tells jokes when you ask. Shipping was super quick also.

Title: Excellent sound quality & voice recognition
Body: I'm very happy with my 3rd generation 'Dot'.  The sound quality is excellent...so much so that I do not feel the need to connect an external speaker.  Voice recognition is great, and the unit is small enough to fit into any designscape you want to place it in.  The imbedded clock is great and displays the temperature when I ask 'Alexa' for the temp.

Title: Helps me run my home
Body: This product is simply amazing I never thought I would enjoy your voice assistant so much I have integrated lighting as well as controls for my home that work flawlessly with her it_ nice to be able to wake up and tell her good morning and turn on all the lights that I need on and hear music first thing in the morning my weather forecast for the technologically savvy or incompetent Alexa is an amazing device the app for smart phones is very intuitive and extremely easy to understand I can_ recommend these highly enough

Title: New To Alexa/Echo - Bought 2 More After Loving The First - It Even Sings To Me!
Body: I finally decided to give Alexa a try. I was concerned about privacy and we are a little older so I did not want to have too much technology that would end up frustrating me. It was mainly the low price that talked me into it and the fact that we now have several devices and light bulbs each needing their own app. Having Alexa could simplify using them. I started out just using the app to see how I liked it. It was nice to just use one app rather than 6 different once for different branded light bulbs or outlets.Our first one we got was the darker color without the clock. I placed it in our family room. It has been a lot of fun to use and really does make things easier. I did turn off the ability for her to actually buy things but she can put them in my cart. I like that I can control that feature because I do not want to accidentally order something and not figure it out till it's too late. Usually I will want to go look at a photo anyway so it's nice to have her add items to my cart and then I can go look at them.I connected Alexa with several light bulb and outlet brands and our Roomba vacuum. I think it went pretty smoothly but I wish I had bought Alexa first because I am going to have to go through and rename some things to make it easier to identify them to turn them on. If I had to do it over again I would have definitely bought Alexa first.Alexa is sooo much smarter than Siri! When I ask her questions she has an answer for almost everything. She can play music, play games, read books, give you the news and weather and so much more.Alexa can also make calls and text for you, but I have not felt comfortable doing this. I would have to give Amazon access to my contacts and I just feel as though it's not something I need terribly. I do wish that there was a way to just connect an emergency contact and not my entire list....or just connect my favorites so I could maybe just add family members that I text often or would want her to call or text in an emergency. Anyway that will have to wait until I feel I have more control but it's a nice feature.After we fell in love with our Echo that we bought for our main floor, I ordered two more for our bedrooms that have clocks on them. They are the lighter color which is the only one with a clock. I do wish that the clock came in other colors but it's working out ok for us.Before I move to the clock units I do want to mention that Alexa has quite a range. We have a pretty big downstairs level with a wall between our kitchen and family room. It does have a wide opening but I have my Echo on the other side of the wall. I can be in the kitchen and set a timer or ask her a question and the volume settings work well enough that I can hear her responses. I keep the volume a little higher downstairs so we can use it from any room.Each echo also has a setting for bass, treble and midrange. I thought that the default is way too much bass. I mostly use it for answering questions, so you might feel differently if you are using it for music but I turned the bass all the way down and the treble and midrange all the way up to get the clearest voice. I did the same with the bedroom units too.The ones with the clocks are awesome for the nightstand. They are nice and bright during the daylight and automatically dim in the evening. You can turn the auto-dimming off if you want it bright at night and just set a manual light level. I like it just as it is. The light is bright enough to read it at night but so dim that it's not lighting up my room.
