I actually use Alexa during the night to ask her the time because then I do not have to put my glasses on.This would be such a great unit for those who are visually impaired. I have low vision but it's corrected with glasses but there are times when I really like not having to search for my reading glasses. I have used it to read me a book or play music or any number of things.Alexa can also play a number of games with you. I enjoy 20 questions. They also have Jeopardy and a bunch of other games suited for a variety of ages.Bottom line is that the Echo Dot with or without the clock is not only a fun toy but a useful tool. I think in years to come this sort of thing will be in everyone's home.Thanks for reading my reviewBecky Brooks

Title: About the STEREO Audio Jack on the Back
Body: It has been difficult to find any mention of this elsewhere, so I wanted to make this information CLEARLY available to all Echo Dot users.The 3.5mm audio jack on the back of the Echo Dot is a STEREO connection, not mono as many an Amazon Rep I've talked to has suggested!!If you like to hear your music in Stereo on your own sound system, then this is great to know,as you can simply ask, and Alexa will play a song, as long as you are subscribed to Amazon Music.However, there is one little catch. lets say you want to listen to your TV, and switch to another input on your HiFi system.  Alexa can still hear you, but you hear your TV, and can't hear the response from your Echo Dot.So obviously, you can't be plugging and un-plugging your stereo cable all the time.Perhaps someday Amazon will rig the DOT so that ONLY music is channeled to the Stereo output when a cable is plugged on.At least for now YOU know the rest of the story!  Good day!!

Title: $22 bucks and now I have to replace all of my dots!
Body: I ordered this because it was $22 if I ordered through Alexa. What a big difference from my older dots. Once I linked them all together and played some music throughout the house you could really tell how much better this 3rd generation dot is. I saw another $22  special for the tan colored one so I ordered that one for my mom before I had linked all of mine and now I can't get another unless I pay the higher price because it's one per customer Ugh! I'm going to wait until Black Friday to see if there is another special that I can opt into. If not I'll wait for the X-mas specials to buy as many as I need to replace the others.  On a basic Echo review note....it's really nice to not have to even move to change t.v. channels and turn lights on and off although I see the need for more exercise if we not getting off the couch anymore.

Title: mediocre smart assistant
Body: Ordered this in January 2019, Alexa voice assistant was great in the beginning.  But now that the novelty has faded, all the the shortcomings are quite obvious.  (1) the mic is crap as it doesn't pick anything up if there is even a little bit of background noise.  Still iffy when it is absolutely quiet. Have to stand next to the device for it to pick up your voice unless you are screaming at it.  I have 2 devices, both have the same issue. (2) the sound quality is quite underwhelming, need to plug into another speaker to hear decent sound. (3) Alexa is always mishearing the commands.  Don't get me wrong, when it works, it works great. Controlling smart devices at home is awesome, but when Alexa can't even hear what you said its annoyingly inconvenient.  Its faster for me to flip the switch.

Title: Sleep Sounds will not play all night
Body: I am having the same problem with my Echo Dot with clock that I bought SPECIFICALLY for ambient sleep sounds. I have tried asking Alexa to loop the sound and she says _ will remember this setting. I have tried setting a sleep timer and the same problem. It will play for a short while and turn off, every single night . I am so disappointed. Amazon says that is the developer problem, however I have tried multiple skills the same thing happens with all of them. If Amazon is choosing developers that are not sufficiently supplying the product, then they need to step in, not shift the blame. Buying this was a total waste of money since this was the sole reason I bought the Echo dot for the bedroom. I wish I had just bought a sound machine instead and am hoping Amazon gets this fixed soon.

Title: Not 100% on board...yet
Body: I haven't quite figured out what to do with my new Echo Dot. I didn't care for Amazon Music and it's recurring monthly fee and thought I could just play music from my phone. Wrong! Alexa told me no, she is not a 'speaker'. Well then... I also thought I could have some (limited) control over my smart tv, which sits 2 feet away, again, nope. I bought two 'smart' outlet plugs, so I CAN control two lamps with this. Wow... it's a learning curve, so unless you enjoy asking Alexa random questions or weather reports, joke of the day... all I use it for besides turning on/off two lamps? A clock! Hey Alexa, what time is it? Is the most used feature... damn.

Title: A perfect addition to our Alexa family!
Body: I LOVE all Amazons' Smart products.  My husband and I live in a small 2-floor loft, just under 800 sq. ft.  We have a total of 5 Alexa products....1 Alexa, 3 Echos and I Echo show.  We also have 2 fire sticks - 1 in each TV and smart bulbs and or plugs scattered throughout.  We use a Fire tablet as "command central".  So we are totally integrated and I LOVE IT.  The number of units we have is very excessive for are size home (we started with 2 devices, one on each floor and have since added one in the bathroom and in the living room merely for convenience.  These products are changing the way we run our home (appointments, reminders, lists, recipes, phone calls, music, games, news...).  The suite of products helps my husband and I communicate by leaving reminders for one another or adding to each other's lists. Our new echo dot is a welcome addition to are Alexa family.

Title: I arrived at the future when Alexa appeared.
Body: This was first foray into this kind of technology and I absolutely loved it. The choice of what you can ask for or what Alexa can do. A few comments, though. I would like to have Alexa wait for a "Thank you" and not gotten will reprimand you for poor manners. Also, I find "Alexa" a hard name to remember. More than once I've had to rummage through the bedside table to pull the Amazon features card to look up her name so I could say, "Alexa please end alarm!" I do realize there are other names available, just haven't gotten to it yet. The sound is improved by linking two together, adjusting bass higher on one of them. Other than these small things. It's great. You can usually find a combo deal if you look and Black Friday seems to be the best time to find lower prices.

Title: Sound, sound, sound...
Body: While the look is so much better than it_ earlier versions, it_ ability to hear has definitely taken a step back. The sound is muffled when speaking to another device. In fact when dropping in to another room, others can barely hear you use you are standing over Alexa. But it_ music speaker is very good. So not necessarily the best ever made but definitely has a few good improvements.

Title: Just buy it
Body: This is the third dot I_e purchased - second one for my home - and it exceeded my expectations in form, fit and function. Set up is now effortless. The design maintains its small footprint yet greatly enhanced audio quality over previous model. As for Alexa ... she_ still herself via this device or other.  Recommendation: if you can use one, or additional echo dots, just buy it .. or them.

Title: Not as good as the google home mini
Body: Got this dot through a promotion on amazon when signing up for a month of amazon music subscription. After using for 2 months, I can say that it is not as good as my google home mini. The google home could carry a continuous conversation, while for the dot I have to keep saying "Alexa" to talk with it. Also the google home gives more detailed answer for my question than the dot. The only plus for this dot is the design, which is more clean and futuristic. Also it notifies me whenever my amazon packages are delivered.

Title: So-so overall. Can't use as a dumb speaker-- require Alexa. Dumb.
Body: It works, but why can't I just use it as a dumb speaker? Why should I give Amazon all the info just to get it to play music?Sometimes, I just want to play music from my phone, but I must register an account and must register the echo with Amazon. That's dumb.Speaker quality is pretty good. All the Alexa features are pretty okay too. So-so overall.

Title: Excellent Device. Integrated easily into my smart home.
Body: I picked up the Echo Dot due to Amazon running a promo where you got the device for .99 cents with a subscription to Music Unlimited. Even with the cost putting the Echo Dot at a little over $9, it was the cheapest I had seen one drop.Part of my reasoning for getting the Echo Dot was also due to my Ecobee 4 already having Alexa integration. The Echo Dot allowed me to place it in another room and still control my devices(like the Ecobee 4).The sound is good, but not amazing. This is to be expected for the size of the speaker, however, it does sound better than expected.voice interaction has been extremely accurate. I have not had any problems with controlling my thermostat, lights, or any other smart devices I have around the house.I would definitely recommend one if you get it on a sale and you prefer the amazon ecosystem in your household. If you are already using Google,  I would stick with a home mini or other such device for better interaction in that ecosystem.

Title: A nice addition to the Echo Dot (3rd gen)
Body: Seems simple enough - but the clock face is a perfect add-on.Is it worth paying more than the regular gen 3.  Well.... not if you don't need it.But in the bedroom, it's nice to have to simple glance and see the time (vs picking up your phone).  Eliminates the need to clutter your table with an additional clock.Easy to see from a distance and seems to dim appropriately at night.I've not tried the timer feature - but I believe it does that too in case you've got it in a kitchen and want a quick timer to be able to see.So yes - worth it if the idea of a clock/timer is something you think you'd use.I'm also moving up from the Gen 2 set of Dots and the sound seems much better.For that matter - before this thing came out - I bought the 5-inch Echo show.  Which....I do like... but the sound from that unit is very muffled in my opinion.  It's been disappointing in that respect.  I consider the sound from the 3rd generation dot to be superior to the Echo Show 5 inch.Overall - a nice purchase.  As I write this - everything is at holiday pricing, so a better deal if you buy now.

Title: The clock added to Dot makes it almost perfect!!
Body: I love Alexa. I love the Dot for the bedroom. Since discarding my old clock radio in favor of Alexa, I was missing the clock on my nightstand- that I could easily visualize and not have to ask Alexa _lexa, what time is it? This fits the bill quite nicely. The sound is great. I am having some issues with Alexa _etting what I_ saying. I am used to,the occasion misunderstanding of what light I want on....but I play Question of the Day every night before going to sleep and I_ frustrated that Alexa is often saying _ didn_ get that or worse yet- I say the  correct answer and Alexa tells me I_ incorrect when I_e given the right answer!!! That_ why I did not give it 5 stars.....

Title: What the Dot Should Always Have Been.
Body: What are the most common question asked to Alexa? I bet it's "what's the time." I like having that little clock there. I also like being able to see the current temperature as it is displayed, and having visual timers. And setting an alarm clock by just talking at Alexa? Heck yeah.So, only down tick I think is the auto dimming feature. It dims down far too low for me to even see at night. I wish I could set threshold values rather than have Alexa use whatever 'model' it currently uses.I bough Google Home Mini's as gifts for others in the past, but this is the first voice assistant I purchased for myself.

Title: Alexa hit me one more time.
Body: Omg I am in love with my echo dot. I saw one of my friends with one and I knew I had to have one. I was truly amazed at all the things it could do. I opened up my dot and I was acting worse than a kids on Christmas day. I set up my dot and I been playing with it all day. I love all the things I can do with the dot including using my satellite radio. I'm over excited with my new toy. I recommend this with everyone that has a firestick. It's worth it.

Title: sound quality Could be better!
Body: sound is terrible on the dot, my echo has much better sound. not just the loudness but i'm talking EQ wise the dot is over powered by bass and almost seems muffled at times. in my opinion if the pirce was  lowered this product would be worth it, other wise just go with the big brother echo or a if you want small device get a google home mini, i also have that and the speaker is way better.....not as loud but way better on the EQ side.

Title: Echo Dot 3 Set-Up Problems
Body: Using an Android Samsung Galaxy 7 Prime I could not set-up an Echo Dot 3 with the Amazon App after previously setting up both an Echo Dot 3 and Smart Plug a few minutes prior. I called Amazon support and they could not fix the problem so advised they would send out a different unit and to return the old unit. I promptly receive the new Echo Dot 3 and had the same problem. I then downloaded the Amazon app to my iPhone and it worked - Set-up complete. I then tried it on the other Echo Dot 3 and after two tries using the app on the iPhone set-up was complete.I will keep the unit and "not return" it to Amazon. I have not seen another medium to advise Amazon of this other than this.I just thought it was strange that the app work better on the iPhone versus the Android Samsung phone. Still having a problem downloading Contacts to the Echo device so I can make voice calls by name.Bottom line is that I like the product but did not like the problems with the set-up process and difficulty in downloading Contacts so I can use the Echo as a speakerphone. The app also froze several times forcing be to reboot the phone and this was common on my IOS and Android phones. For these reasons and all the time spent working on fixes and researching the How-To for the device, I can only give this product three stars. This is suppose to make life easier, not take hours to set-up. Still working on some issue like Contacts.

Title: Love the sound quality and hardware but AI and Amazon Music is awful w.r.t. competitors
Body: I am using 1st Gen Google mini and 3rd Gen Echo dot. No doubt, Echo dot's hardware and sound is far better and usually offer better pricing options with frequent deal prices than Google home mini.However, AI lags way behind. Answers are not as good as Google search and hence not as good as Google home mini. Its not able to make as funny conversations as Google.Coming to Amazon Music - man oh man, it sucks! Even the paid version sucks big time w.r.t. Google home's free music - for Indian content specifically. It feels like the music selection has been picked by really old people, Its so awful I wouldn't even use it for free and did not use my 1 month free trial more than 4-5 times.

Title: 2nd gen worked better
Body: The 3rd gen has a bigger sound, which you may like if you listen to music.  But I don_ use my dots for listening and don_ really like the boomy voice this has.  But that doesn_ affect my review score.The reason I give it 3 stars is because it doesn_ seem to hear or understand me as well as the 2nd gen does.  I bought this one because it came as part of a deal with Phillips bulbs.  Since it looks nicer than the 2nd gen, I put it in my living room and moved the old one into the garage.  Now, after a few shouting matches, it has been put in the garage and the old one is back inside, working as well as it always has.It burns me when an _pgrade is worse than what it replaces.

Title: We used to be friends. Then Al went her own way...
Body: She worked well at first but then slowly became stubborn and ornery. I would be saying to a friend"oh, I need to order prints" and Alexa would play Prince. Pretty funny Alexa. Then she stopped listening altogether, unless I asked about a blue button then she would go into a spcheel about blue buttons.We had to break up then. I can't share my home with someone who only cares about blue buttons.

Title: Absolutely amazingly terrific!
Body: I have always wanted to try an Alexa smart device.  Now I finally have. You should have given me more time to be with the device before requesting feedback on how I am feeling about my purchase.  Because, I love it! _ It was extremely easy to set up. Basically take it out of the box. Plug it in and start a conversation with Alexa. The only downside is you should have offered a version with good quality wireless Bluetooth speakers.  It would enhance the sound quality.  When I ask Alexa to play my playlist from Amazon Music, I would enjoy it more.  You should also think about allowing the Echo Dot to act as a karaoke device. Offer a Bluetooth microphone to kareoke with the Echo.  The Eco Dot is a great purchase for anyone or any family. Alexa really sends it over the top! Ask her anything. You will be delighted, inspired, educated, and challenged by hee replies. I love playing daily trivia. Thank you for my purchase. Sincerely Tony Sullivan

Title: It's really impressive for the size
Body: I had pretty low expectations for the dot, but I was impressed at how well it sounds sounds for its size. Don't get me wrong, it's nothing like a decent set of bookshelf speakers. But, it fills up our kitchen fairly nicely and does have some bass presence.  If you can get one on sale, it's really a nice temporary sound solution, and of course, you'll use it with Alexa to ask it questions while you're cooking a new recipe, or just want to look something up.

Title: Works well but sound quality is low.
Body: I got this mainly to listen to Amazon music in my kitchen. Setup was easy and it works well for things like news headlines, weather, timers/alarms, even controlling my hue smartlights. The sound quality is not great, just ok. I suggest placing it in a corner under a cupboard to get better sound. At 60% volume or higher it becomes very distorted and sounds like crap. One good thing is you can link it to another Bluetooth speaker so you don't need to use the built in speaker. Overall it works well for what it is.

Title: Entertaining Echo...
Body: I love my Echo and with the app on my phone, I can scare people in my family.My husband was in the kitchen getting a drink, well my inner kid could not resist pulling up the app and turning on some, Polka music, he loves his metal music.He come flying in my office asking me what I did, and the answer will always remain the same, nothing.Just for this reason alone, I have to give this nifty gadget 10 stars, just for the laughs alone!

Title: Love It
Body: We've had an Echo Dot for a year or two now. I'd won it in a contest & when I'd first gotten it, I had no idea what to do with it. Lol. Fast forward to today & we love our Echo Dot. We use it to check the weather, set reminders, play games, etc. So, when I saw this on a promotion, I decided to get it as a Christmas gift. I'm considering buying another one as a Christmas gift, too.

Title: Connectivity issues
Body: I seem to have lots of connectivity issues.Also, the volume is constantly changing and then unable to be turned up or down.Voice recognition is good, and I like many of the features.If you don't subscribe to the unlimited music the echo dot isnt vey helpful for music (really hit or miss).

Title: Pretty simple to play Pandora
Body: I basically bought the Echo Dot because I wanted to be able to play music throughout the house while I'm cleaning and working on various things. Being able to play music in just room, or group them together and play throughout the house is really nice. When my wife and I are washing dishes, we can just play music in the kitchen. But if we're cleaning the whole house, we can tell Alexa to play Pandora "downstairs", which right now combines two speakers.Right now I don't really care about having Alexa and all her "skills". It's mostly just for music. It is nice to be able to mute the sound quickly when a commercial comes on, or change the volume with a simple command. I may start using more commands in the future as I add technology to the house.I didn't really have any trouble signing up for the app, and I have now connected three different Echo Dots, linked my Pandora account, and renamed and grouped the different speakers. It's been pretty simple so far.The sound quality is pretty good. I'm a fan of bass, and speakers like this rarely have enough for my tastes. I may have to upgrade to one of the fancier ones later to add some bass.

Title: Not worth the hype!
Body: I was so excited to get the 3rd generation but soon became disappointed. You have to constantly ask Alexa whatever question or task you have her do at least 3-4 times before she will respond. It's so annoying! It is also muffled and have the time you cant understand her even with the volume up. She cuts off before you can finish your question and when you ask her to turn off the lights she's short with it. Meaning while your still talking she she okay and cuts off but doesn't complete the task. I have the generation 2 in my guest bedroom and I love it! No issues here. So I just go in my guest room and ask Alexa to do things or questions. 3rd generation is not worth the hype or money. Too many issues and bugs needing to be fixed and the white one is not pretty. Looks old and stands out in an unfashionable way. Keep your money or get the second generation!

Title: Extremely Happy
Body: I bought the Echo Dot to replace a radio/Alarm clock that NEVER had the correct time and the sound was horrible!! I LOVE the Echo Dot..I like being able to tell it what Im wanting to hear and the clock (the real reason I bought it) is perfect!!! BUT like everything its not 100% perfect not often but sometimes I have a hard time getting it to turn on..But its usually my fault because Im not the best communicator even with a gadget! All that said Im buying another for my son for Christmas!!!!!

Title: Amazing once set up properly
Body: Pros: Once set up and paired with the devices you want it paired with this thing is amazing, worth every penny but if you can get it for half price even better.Cons: I am a techie and I had problems setting this up. You have to pair it to your phone first and then set up everything through your phone, wifi, external speakers, apps you want it to control, your library, contacts, etc.. This is not as easy as just having Alexia on your phone, or Siri, or Google assistant.  Once you go through the rather painful process it is an amazing device.

Title: Very Satisfied Customer
Body: I have been a dedicated Google man since the beginning, and I was very reluctant to purchase the Echo Dots or anything Alexa because I just thought it was too main streem, and I was fine with the Google products I had. However, when I found the deal of three for $60 I couldn't pass it up. When I opened the box and attempted to set up the first one, I ran into a little trouble with the app locating the echo so I requested that a technical support specialist call me. I spoke with a technician who quickly showed me how to work around it, and i was able to set up all three units in less than 10 minutes. I'm so glad I have chosen these items, and look forward to purchasing more Echo units in the future.

Title: USER FRIENDLY
Body: The Echo Dot was very easy to hook up. I live by myself so now I have someone to talk to. The capabilities are endless.

Title: Sound quality is garbage.
Body: Echo Dot 3rd gen:  Great response to what I_ asking, however, the sound quality is not there. My normal speaker is a Bose mini (1st gen) and this is nowhere near the quality of that. We have a 2nd gen Echo at the office and I feel like they really downgraded here. When you sacrifice quality to lower the price and get more sales, all you really have is a cheap pile of garbage that eventually no one will want.

Title: Buyer beware
Body: I got the echo dot and an amazon smart plug for free from Verizon, I shouldn_ have clicked on that link to get it, it was a mistake... I never knew that I would really enjoy having Alexa in my house. I ended up buying 2 more echo dots and 6 smart plugs and a 4K fire tv. As a prime member I have access to music and videos by amazon, I_ also a Apple Music and the echo dot intergrates it flawlessly. I have Netflix, Hulu and Disney plus and I hope that they integrate these services flawlessly. I did not expect to buy all these Alexa powered products from a _ree promotion. Well played amazon... well played.

Title: Great gift
Body: My house is small. But I have one in my bedroom, in my office & kitchen. The first one was a gift. I thought it was silly. Obviously I've changed my mind. Alexia plays relaxing rain sounds as I fall asleep & through till I wake up. That's after I learned about loop mode. I love asking her to fill out my shopping list by store.Often I think of something I want to do in the middle of the night & forget by morning. Now I ask Alexia to put it on my to do list.When reading & I don't know a word's meaning or how to spell or pronounce it. I ask Alexia.She is great whether you want information, a song, a joke or story. These are only the beginning of her talents.I have recommended the echo dot to my friends & relatives. Many have purchased one & love it as much as I do.

Title: Alexa sucks at searching.
Body: Overall I like it pretty well, It's in my bedroom so I'm the main users but my daughters use it to set appointment reminders and make lists. It has some interesting little skills you can download, I like trivia and random facts and it's good for that. reminders, notes,etc are okIf you're expecting google like voice search you'll be sadly disappointed, Alexa isn't good at searching, at all. It also doesn't work with my smart TV. (a three year old Samsung)If Alexa could be used as a voice search engine I'd most likely give it 5 stars. For right around 25 bucks though it;s handy for basic questions, weather, and of course music.

Title: Simple and elegant smart home solution
Body: UPDATE:So it would seem that echo dot is less user friendly than my initial impression.- If you are 5ft+ away from it, or if there is any other sounds in the room, or if there is any obstacle between you and the dot, it starts to not hear you or misidentify your command even when you already raised your voice. The further away you are the worse this gets.- I cannot get it to stop blinking yellow notification. I've read multiple sites on how people turn off notification for tip of day, mail, etc. but it still blinks and gives me that tip of day crap. It should've be a very simple configuration and it should work the way I want it, not having me looking up sites after sites for configuration for a simple option maybe just because amazon wants to showcase their featureBecause my sole purpose of getting it is just to give me accurate voice command capability of lights/electronics around the house and not give me unsolicited information. I'll say it around 2.5 star for me at this time.----------------------------------Overall setup is very simple for someone who is somewhat familiar with technologies and can follow instructions.The dot is smaller than I remembered but has surprisingly good sound quality for such small device. It is very nice looking imo and can recognize my command very well. It does sometimes have trouble picking up my voice about 10+ ft away in my fairly opened living room/kitchen/dining room area, I'll have to test this further as it was quite noisy in the room at the time.I also have non-amazon brand smart switches setup and the Alexa app was able to pick it up. I was very impressed because it asked me which room the light switch was at and setup the light switch all by itself without any manual intervention on my part.I got the three-dot deal and one of the box seem to have been opened previously because the seal sticker on the box has been teared off, however the inner plastic wrapping seems intact. As the dot seem to be functioning flawlessly and it seems too big a hassle to return it, I am just going to keep it but just throwing this out there for whoever might care - check your factory seal.I am actually in the process of recommending a smart home system to an elderly relative who would prefer foreign language voice command. I think this might be a feature where amazon falls short of but otherwise I am perfectly happy with this system.

Title: A lot of fun
Body: I worry about if i'm listened to by outside companies wit this so I unplug it when i don't want to be spied on.  Great for weather and news in the morning.  OH and guard the house when i'm gone...  The drop in feather is nice also.  I talk to my cat when I'm outta town.  LOL

Title: Fantastic!
Body: My mom got me the Echo Dot for my birthday this year and I swear I used it every day whether its music, audio books, a timer or a general question. She ALWAYS recognizes my voice and the responses are exceptionally quick. I also got a Google Home Mini through Spotify last month and I can honestly say that I use my Dot far more than my Mini. The sound quality and response time is distinctly better. I can here the little Dot all throughout my house through the built in speaker on the Dot (to be 100% honest. it sounds better than my boyfriends $300 Sony Sound bar). It is a marvelous little thing and I am in love with it!

Title: I can't believe it took me so long to buy this!
Body: Oh boy, is this ever fun!  I ordered 2 on Black Friday (just yesterday) and they were delivered today. How's that for in a blink? I took the first dot upstairs, plugged it in, downloaded the app and in no time at all, it was up and running. I asked my dot what time it was, the weather, and then said, "Alexa, call ________" and boom, their phone started ringing right through my little dot, they answered and said the sound was great -- was great on my end, too.  I LOVE this.  Obviously there's a ton it will do and after I hook up the other one in the kitchen, I'll be set up and rarin' to go.  By the way, I'm 72 and if I can do this, it's a cinch you can.  It's terrific!  Alexa is playing the Blues station for me now.  Omg, I'm in heaven.

Title: Does your New Echo Dot sound Muffled???? Here is the solution!
Body: Very easy to setup. Worked in a matter of seconds. However totally disappointed with the sound quality. Very MUFFLED to the point of not understanding some of the words. I had purchased the three pack so I tried a second one thinking maybe the first one is defective. Nope, they both sounded horribly muffled.I went looking through the reviews online and found the same complaint. However, one lady posted about speaking with Tech Service and found the answer. Here it is:Equalizer controls are available.1. In the Alexa App, tap on the Devices icon at the bottom-right2.Tap on Echo & Alexa at the top-left corner3. Down below, tap on your Echo Dot4. Under "Audio", tap on "Auto Settings"5. Then tap on the Equalizer -- here you can adjust the Bass / Mid / TrebleTurning the bass way down and boosting the midrange helps a lot. Saving those settings seems to be a problem with my app. There is no way to save the setting and they keep reverting back to the original setting. But at least there is a way!!!

Title: What an upgrade!
Body: This is my second echo dot. I have had a 2nd gen for the last 2 years in my bedroom and have enjoyed using it daily to listen to music, let alarms and so on. I decided to get a 2nd echo dot and boy am I glad I did! The sound compared to the 2nd gen has GREATLY improved. It has a lot more base and more crisp and clean. It is definitely louder than the 2nd gen as well! Set up was easy. I love I can listen to music throughout my house. Only issue I've seen so far has been when using amazon music, there is a delay in both speakers playing at the beginning of a song.I'm super impressed with the upgrade and thinking about getting another dot or echo for my kitchen and placing the 2nd gen in my bathroom. Keep up the great work Alexa!

Title: Terrible product and no customer support.
Body: I bought this and it was a great price BUT they charged me for the smart socket plug. When I got it it said it was FREE with the dot. Checking the listing now and its gone like it was never there. They charged me a whole extra $10.49 for it. Even when I was checking out it, it didn't say ANY of this and said it was free even when I checked out. Terrible. Shoulda got google home instead.UPDATE: Not even a month in and she breaks on me. She doesnt respond to her name. If she does is cause I have to yell it, then she doesn't answer. Or takes way to long to answer sometimes having me to ask her multiple times. Her audio always cut out. She always has a red ring. I wish I could give this 0 stars. Amazon hasn't even submitted this review cause I'm sure they don't want to look bad.

Title: It_ 1984.
Body: Look...Amazon, Google, Apple and Microsoft are most certainly the devil and they are going to contribute to Skynet taking over the world...the Matrix...1984...Anyhow...at least I can save myself from standing up to turn off my lights or turn on my fan using my voice...because my 200 square foot apartment is just so damn big.All cynicism aside...it_ convenient.

Title: Best value of all echos
Body: This echo dot 3rd gen is really easy to use and has excellent voice recognition. I own a echo 1st gen, a echo dot second gen, and 3 of these echo dot 3rd gens. This model by far has the best voice recognition, looks, and value out of all of those. The echo dot has almost all of the same functions as the regular echo which costs three times as much. There are many smart home devices that support Alexa such as Phillips Hue, Ring Alarm, Ecobee thermostat, and smart switches and plugs. This echo dot also has does well on playing music and answering your average questions like _hat_ the weather today and _ho won the game last day. I personally love the echo dot and think this one is much better than the second generation and is much more intuitive. I would 100% recommend this to a friend

Title: Works very well..
Body: Install was okay.. wifi connection had lots of hiccups but eventually connected.Strong voice recognition and understands most requests.Very good and loud sound quality for its size.Lots of Alexa functionality and tons of apps.Lots of smart home integration potential if u have the enabled devices (thermostat, lights, plugs).Alexa guard function.No "call emergency" function.Good price when on sale.

Title: Fun
Body: We purchased this for my son for Christmas, but the entire family Is having fun with it.  It has great sound quality.  We have been using it as a novelty item, but when connected to other "smart" household items it can be used for so much more.  We just are not at that point yet, so for now, the kids are asking Alexa to tell them a joke, answer a question or play them a song.  Would buy it again.

Title: I can't believe I ever lived without Alexa!
Body: LOVE LOVE LOVE THIS!!! So fun to talk to Alexa first thing in the morning and when I come home from work!  She tells me the weather forecast, a fun fact for that day when I say good morning, plays music that I have asked for! Some days I have no one to talk to in the house and I turned to Alexa!! I have purchased these as gifts for many of my family and friends! Highly recommend this product!!

Title: Its my fault ..And yet the regional restrictions make this into junk
Body: Now first of all I am SURE the regional restrictions on Alexa integration are stated somewhere in the product information and, had I identified that, then I would not have purchased these 2 Echo dots. They are beautiful and nearly useless. I live in the Caribbean and there are regional restrictions in effect which limit Alexa integration for APPLE MUSIC, subscriptions for AMAZON MUSIC, CONTACT LIST access integration outside of the continental US and Canada.Except for my Audible Library, this thing can't link to ANY major services I already have where I live. I won't bother with the hassle of returning them.

Title: Bad sound quality as a speaker, yet it_ not bad as a smart speaker.
Body: I bought this just as a speaker for my desktop, but its sound quality really disappointed me. The bass is fine, but voice is not clear and you can barely hear any details from either music or games.But after one-day use, I found it_ pretty good as a smart speaker by itself.A quick reminder to those who just wanna use this as a Bluetooth speaker while playing games with a wireless controller like me, the sound has a noticeable delay even after I plug my Asus Bluetooth adapter to usb 3.0 port (no sound at all if using usb 2.0 port), I believe there_ nothing to do with the speaker but the adapter, but i guess most people use usb Bluetooth adapter instead of pcie adapter like i do.

Title: Small but great dot to my Amazon environment
Body: So I have a Fire HD8 for my primary tablet and Fire TV in my bedroom. I have been using both devices with great satisfaction. Although I am always happy with my Fire TV as a center of my entertainment, I barely use Alexa function with the TV. Same for the Fire HD too. I know how Alexa works as a personal virtual assistant, but never really care until I bought Echo dot. Echo dot is a compact version of the original Amazon Echo but with full function on it. I found it very convenient to make voice commands on an Echo Dot through an Alexa personal assistant to answer questions, play music, play the news, and many other tasks. By using Echo cot, I can consolidate my use of Amazon devices after registering my  Fire TV and Fire HD to Alexa app. I'm still learning how to make full use of Echo dot, but Echo dot is certainly a great small device connecting the dots of my usages of Amazon devices.

Title: Had WIFI setup issues  -- but was able to resolve.
Body: It took a bit of doing, but I finally got it connected to my WIFI. During setup program I was asked for the "WIFI Password" -- I did not have it. After doing some searching, I found help from Windows and was able to find the "Security Pass Code" associated with my Router/Modem and finish the Echo Dot setup. I am new to this technology so still I am learning what it can do.

Title: Saving me money from day 1
Body: I have placed the echo dots all over my home. I paired them with rhe switches and bulbs. My electric bill used to run about 4 to 500 a month. At times it was six. I have seen a drastic drop from the moment I started using these smart devices. Month one dropped to 200 and by month 4 it has consistantly been less than 100. This month it was 84. The only thing that has changed in this 4 bedroom tripple wide mobil home is Alexa now runs the show. My son thought this was a stupid investmwnt but now he is buying them. Do your self a favor and let Alexa take over at home and put your money back in your pocket.The sound is amazing. I feel no need to purchase extra speakers. I love using the group feature and running around cleaning with my music.The drop in is amazing. When my grandaughter is here and playing in her room I just drop in and listen as she plays and if she wants to talk while going to sleep we can.Home watch, one of the features is watch my home. Whwn I leave I say Alexa I am going to work and she says I will watch the house. If there is so much as a broom falling over in the house she alerts me and the video scrwen kicks in.Mannaging my mail. I shop on line for everything. With alexa my packages no longer get left on the porch. They just give her a code and she unlocks the front door and they can set the packages just inside. Shes watching them on camera to make sure they go no farther and then she locks the door when they leave.The hot water heater. Alexa turns the hot water heater on 1 hour before I come home from work. That is at 4 pm she turns it off at 8. That means I am only running that costly water heater 4 hours a day and saving the other 20 hrs of bill. Why pay for it when noone is home.The heater in my room. I love cuddling uo in the chilly air and going to sleep however whwn i wake up I want warmth. She turns rhe heat on one hour before i wake up on my room heater and I get dressed in cozy warmth.I never write a review this long but honestly tuere is a ton more I could say. The grocery shopping. I tell her and she adds it to my list and say purchase and then i pull up at walmart pickup and they put it in the car....reminders...I never forget my meds anymore. I just love my echo dots.

Title: Why Aren't There Many Ways to Ask the Same Question to Obtain a Request.
Body: Were the programmers on substances dreaming this up? I ask to a piece of music on my Amazon Music account and she gives me three radio choices, I ask her to play a playlist and she starts playing music not on that playlist. I just now had to tell her to stop three times, the last I had to shout. There is pretty much only one way to do anything and we are required to learn each different way for our desired result. This is a failed product. The website leaves you half way through the process sometimes, and the links often appear to go to the wrong place.

Title: A fun way to connect your entire home.
Body: This is my second Alexa device. I have a larger Echo and now this Dot.This is an exquisite electronic device. Being able to listen to the same song through amazon music throughout the whole house is a miracle. There is NO MUSIC LAG.Secondly I can have each device paired to my smart bulbs for their corresponding rooms. It_ awesome! Grouping is made easy with the app.I can send love message via Alexa to whichever room my boyfriend is in. These are a fun investment for your home. The best part is you don_ need a subscription, most devices want some sort of money for their service, Amazon values that you paid for an Alexa and doesn_ milk you.

Title: Won't go without one now.
Body: I have used Echo devices since the original was released, and i have come tlo view Alexa as an indispensable part of my routine. The 3rd gen Echo Dot puts out amazing sound that is comparable to my $200 Bluetooth speaker. My teenagers couldnt function without Alexa so they each have a Dot in thir rooms and even in the bathroom. We use the intercom feature all the time (we used to call each other from the next room) and it's a huge convenience if you need toilet paper and didn't take your phone in there. I am adding several to an elderly friend's house because she likes the idea of being able to call for help but doesn't want to wear one of those buttons. The Dots are unobtrusive but they deliver all the oomph you could need.

Title: Wow!  Truly wish I hadn't waited so long to get one.
Body: Received this today and have already ordered another and a smart plug to use it even more throughout my house.  Super easy to set up and use.  The sound quality and volume are great, as is the range of where the device can "hear" me.  My only regret is that I waited so long to get one.Many of my friends have them, and even earlier gens, and are happy with them also.  I really cannot recommend this device enough.  I've linked it to my laptop, Fire TV, smartphone, and am amazed at its capabilities.  Everything is very easy and intuitive.  No interface issues at all.If you're on the fence, like i used to be; jump in - the water's fine.

Title: VERY INTRUSIVE AND DOES NOT WORK HALF THE TIME !!!!
Body: I have a very difficult time with getting this contraption to respond!  Sometimes it highlights blue for no reason and it makes me wonder if it's randomly and indiscriminately recording my conversations!  Doesn't work have the time...constantly saying "sorry I'm having a hard time understanding right now"!  The worst part is when it tries to sell you something!

Title: Clock feature is great!
Body: Love the clock display! I had an echo dot in my room and lost it to one of the kids' room.  Ordered this as I dont like a bright clock on my nightstand, but also dont enjoy clicking on something to see the time.  This dot is perfect! Suble, but clear time display and all the dot features I love.

Title: Not what I thought
Body: I was expecting it to have the clock display, I guess this was the wrong one and the set up was a bit confusing, and not at all what I was expecting it to be. I tried to order the one I actually wanted and unfortunately it is sold out until January.

Title: My first smart speaker
Body: I was on the fence about a smart speaker, well i ordered this one and i am quite surprised on sound quality and over all performance. It does hav an adjustable EQ  in the app, got the 5$ wifi bulb amazon kinda bundles with it and it works great. Paired no problems and integrated flawlessly. Only complaint is now i have get used to this  smart home  thing as i slowly integrate more. I have 2 more dots ordered already. If your on the fence, i say order it, i cant speak on it for you if you are upgrading a gen 2 or 1 but my first impressions are great.

Title: For the price, very cool
Body: Overall awesome product. For low price you are getting a good speaker, !standalone! gadget, after a very simple setup using your phone, it works via wifi  with your amazon prime , if you will choose unlimited, then listen all songs your want, just talk to Alexa :) Yes , Alexa is pretty good at it but this is how you control your gadget. Can even tell to lover the volume or stop the music.Must to say- standalone means it's no speaker, it's a streaming device with wifi. How to use  that- search the "net". I have tons of bluetooth or wifi speakers, but this is not just a speaker. I am writing this because I was looking to improve  my "prime" and this is the improvement, thank you, Amazon. Alarm clock too,  just does not show the time. There is another model, which shows.By the way, just asked Alexa, "tell me the time"- told just as well. Local.

Title: It was great, at first > SPEAKER GROUPS DON'T WORK, NEITHER DOES SIRIUSXM
Body: I've been wanting whole-home surround sound for years now and researched so many different wired systems and was super excited when these devices came out, it seemed to be the answer to my audio problem.  I quickly purchased 2 Echo Dot (3rd gen), 2 Echo Inputs, and 2 Plugs...hooked them up, created my speaker group and it worked great for like the first month or so.  I synced my SiriusXM acct and was stoked to finally listen to my Xmas music throughout my house, upstairs, downstairs and basement.  Then the issues started...one device would play, the others wouldn't...then they would all play together and then stop.  I connected, reconnected did all the troubleshooting things you're supposed to do.  I googled for answers and found the same syncing issues with using SiriusXM, but I had issues with Amazon music too!  These are THE MOST FRUSTRATING DEVICES ever!!  If they worked liked they're supposed to, it would be awesome, but alas...they don't!  Sometimes they play together, but most times the don't.  I can play one device at a time, but if I try playing Amazon music on another device, it won't allow it without a family account or something.  If the dumb speaker groups would actually play, this wouldn't be an issue.  I've researched forever and you'll find lots of reviews with these same syncing issues, you'd think Amazon would address it instead of just having them on sale all the time....arrrggg.  PLEASE FIX THE SYNCING ISSUES AMAZON!!!

Title: Created good ambiance
Body: Purchased five echo dots to upgrade from 2nd gen for better sound.  Sound is way better on the 3rd gen.  I don_ need power speakers because my home is open floor plan with wood floors and blinds with 10ft ceilings.  Therefore sound bounces around pretty good.  If you have carpet or curtains you may not obtain the same effect.I wanted the ambiance of soft music following you as you walk through the home with no dead spots or fading of sound as you move from room to room without the cost of installing a high-end wall system.  The echo dot seems to work as I need them.  It has enough bass to pick the lows and the highs are good enough where it doesn_ crackle.  I only have them at less than half volume and they fill the house, if you place them right.Had issue installing the new ones using my s10 note.  Called tech support, which as a great help, ended up having to hard reset them and run setup through the app on my IPad instead.  Then I as able to see the new ones when I attempted to create a music group.After setup I kept getting an  sorry something went wrong when playing amazon music message when using the group with Alexa voice.  So I used Amazon Music app, connected to the group and it worked.  I disconnected from the group and tried Alexa voice command and it worked. Go figure!Remember, this isn_ Bose, klipsch, or Sonos but if you place them right and used more than one or two you can create a pretty good surround sound  effect at a fraction of the cost.

Title: Resistance is futile. We've been assimilated.
Body: Our son bought us one Echo Dot after I was beset with some health issues, with the thought that he could "drop in" on us to see how we're doing, especially if he can't get in touch with us by phone. (We haven't figured out how to let him do that yet).However, after several bouts of pneumonia resulting in multiple hospitalizations, we purchased three more Echo Dots. We now have one each for the bedrooms, the office, and the kitchen. Because my lungs don't work any longer, I use the Dots to speak to my husband in another room, with the door shut, with him wearing headphones. This is the perfect solution to our communication issues.Alexa still has occasional difficulty hearing and responding to me, but so does everyone. She's getting better. And, I know we haven't begun to plumb the system's uses and skills. We pretty much move step by step as a specific need arises.Buying three Echo Does all at once was a bit of a leap of faith, and a big chunk of change for us, but it's well-worth the investment.

Title: Awesome Device!!
Body: When I initially purchased this, I was prepared for bad sound quality and for it to not be that loud, due to reading reviews. Well... The sound is much much much greater than I expected. It gets so loud that I havent felt the need to turn it all the way up. This little speaker is amazing. Alexa does everything I need her to do and much more! And she understands my kids. (Sidenote: Not ready for the day the kids realize she could possibly give them homework answers... lol!) This is my 3rd Amazon device that I personally own and use, aside from my 3 childrens Fire tablets. I am a new Amazon tech geek and I cannot wait to order more Amazon devices, especially after having this Dot. It arrived a day earlier which was also a pleasant surprise! I've not had it for 12 hours and I am already in love with it! If you're considering buying this, it will not disappoint!! Highly recommend!

Title: Love It and Highly Recommend!
Body: I was a little worried after reading mixed reviews on this. But I focused on the five star ones and bought this Echo Dot. I have the Echo Plus second gen and I love it so I was a little nervous about getting the Dot. I actually bought four! My mom has an old 80's boombox on her kitchen counter so I wanted to get something smaller to replace it. I opened the Dot I bought for my third floor and set it up today. I can't believe how good it sounds!! One thing that puzzles me about the reviews is how people talk about using the volume buttons on the top. I just say, "Alexa, volume 4, Or Alexa volume 7". The sound is great up to volume 8. After that the quality is not as good as the Plus. Still good, but the base isn't as good as the Plus. That being said, the volume is loud and clear and I don't think I'd use 10 anyhow. I can't wait to give my mom this cute little Dot to replace her dinosaur boombox! Great buy, great sound! I HIGHLY recommend it! I'll update with pictures after Christmas.

Title: Eh...May Return
Body: I've had this for 2wks, now. It worked like a dream fresh out of the box. However, it seems like the longer I have it the more problems I have. The voice recognition is hit or miss.  If I wanted to be ignored every other time when I called it's name, I'd talk to my kids. At first I thought it may be a noise issue. (Too much stuff going on in the background.) Unfortunately, it will do the same thing when it's dead silent. Other occasions, it will recognize that I've said "Echo" but will not complete the demand.  For example, I'll say "Echo," it lights up and it lights up. I say "Set alarm for 0430" almost immediately after and it's a coin toss as to if it will actually do anything.  It also tends to sporadically stop playing Amazon Music. I haven't had any problems with that when playing the local stations. I've checked the connection when it acts up and WiFi seems to be 100%, so I don't believe any of this is simply a connection issue.  I'm not sure if this is a regular thing, but it also tends to "ding" randomly.  Like it's reconnecting or something, but there wasn't anything wrong with the connection that I've seen.

Title: Good Product.
Body: I'm a fan of Dot, and of course, Alexa. I get the news, I can listen to my personal music playlists, and I can even get a corny joke from Alexa! This is my second Dot, which is now in my bedroom. The first one is still working hard in my computer room.  There are several inherent, but not serious concerns--the one is that Alexa only responds when its name is called--if you are making a change to a setting, this gets tedious (I usually reset any delicate settings via my computer). If you are entertaining someone whose name is "Alex" sometimes Alexa responds! I wish there was a male voice option for Alexa.

Title: Music sync and guard circling ring will not work
Body: 1)delivered a day early, incredible2)sound quality outstanding3)would not connect with my selected echo, no music share4)Amazon service excellent, chat,email telephone all reachable5)i the light ring that circles when on Guard mode, does not function6)Amazon offered to replace, I am not going there, too much time wasting in copious attempts to correct.

Title: Teriffic
Body: This hooked up with my other Echo products without any trouble...love these items....my Mother is 91 and I have them all over the house so if she needs me all she has to do is say Call my Daughter, or cell, of Son-in-law....and she calls.  I also have them programed so I don't have to walk all the way back to her room if I am in the kitchen for her to come in there...just added one in my husbands ManCave.....I love it.

Title: Love the whole house function of Alexa!
Body: We have a regular Amazon Echo and one Dot.  Took advantage of Black Friday and CyberMonday to get two more Dots.  Really only got one for the kitchen to listen to NPR and one for the Master Bedroom for music and alarm.  Discovered we could link all devices for music everywhere in the house!  In fact, you can link up to 6 devices in one group for multi-room music!  Great sound, easy to link, easy to use!  Also, discovered we can have DIFFERENT music in each room!  The sound is wonderful!

Title: Speaker still not very good
Body: I got the Echo Dot 3rd Generation as part of an Amazon Music promotion to upgrade my Echo Dot 2nd Generation. I assumed that the size upgrade included a much better speaker as it looks a lot like a Google Home Mini which as a very good speaker and microphone. This Echo Dot sure is louder than the previous generations but it doesn't sound anywhere near as good as a Google Home Mini, it sounds very tinny when listening to music. The microphone also doesn't pick up very well at all. I have to say the same thing usually twice before it even recognizes me talking. Other than that though it is pretty good. I like how it looks.

Title: Unbelievable step up from second generation, integration with TV is poor.
Body: My wife hates Google. She hates Google speakers, she hates Android phones, and she mildly tolerates my Chromecast. So after buying a fire 4K stick, I decided to upgrade the echo Dot next to it in hopes of going full Alexa.With Google, I can say "ok Google, play mad men on Netflix" and it is smart enough to start playing the show on my Chromecast. I was hoping that I could get a similar setup with my fire stick and echo Dot. Unfortunately, the voice commands don't seem to work at all for that purpose.Of course, that is not all that the speaker is for. The sound quality blew me away, no joke. We had the second generation sitting around, and the sound on that is painfully hollow. It is truly and completely awful. Fortunately, it came with a 3.5 mm out port, which I can combine with a soundbar to make a halfway decent speaker.This one doesn't need a sound bar. In fact, it sounds almost as good as my first generation echo, which I have been very happy with.As for voice recognition, it seems to be a touch behind the echo. It also oddly decides to stop playing music in the middle of the night (my toddler sleeps to lullabies) which the big echo never does. I think we will end up putting the old big echo in the baby's room, using these echo dots throughout the rest of the house, and sticking the old crappy second generation dots in the bathroom or a closet or something.

Title: Our best Dot to date
Body: We have 3 of the previous generation Echo Dots and really like them.  We do not listen to music through our other Dots. We have one hooked up to a Bose Wave Radio for my wife, and I have one hooked to a Yamaha amp in man cave.  This Dot is in a guest room and I have had Alexa play an album for me at bed time.  The sound is fine for being used like a clock radio.  When guests stay with us they will be able to ask Alexa to set an alarm for the morning and they will be able to listen to music at night as well.  We are very pleased with the Echo devices.  We have an Echo Show arriving shortly that was included with our recently purchased Ring Door Bell Pro.  I am looking forward to seeing how that works, literally.

Title: Great device!
Body: Okay so I'm debating between 4-5 stars but will go with 5 because the price is fantastic even as a speaker alone!!! Alexa is a lot of fun and more so then siri or bixbi and the speaker is great. I think it's a little better then my Anker Blutooth speaker I paid more money for so yes I'd say it's definitely worth it. It fills our living room with music.  I can ask alexa to play Christmas music and she will.. I previously was using spotiify through my phone and bluetooth which was more time consumung and made my phone slower and often there was connection issues with the spotify app. I was so tired of it and practically stopped listening to music.. Alexa interacts with me, answers questions and is all around so great to have. I have not used "home" features yet but you can also connect her to your compatible TV and Roku and she will change the volume, etc. Very neat!!! You can also play trivia with alexa but she is very limited and if you want more decks of trivia you have to pay for it which is a con for me.  Another good feature is she will also add items to your amazon cart and or you can choose to "buy it now" or repurchase items and will also look up items for you if asked.. So why am I debating between 4-5 stars? Well sometimes Alexa  doesn't know everything I need to know.. She can play news if asked or the weather and other simple commands and she does it better then bixby which is far behind however she often does not understand certain questions or only gives part of the answer. I can ask how to rebuild an engine for example (for fun ;) and she will give a simpliefied example but hey what can you expect. When she doesn't understand, you can rephrase and she usually understands. She also makes jokes if asked and can truly interact with you which is VERY neat. Bixby can do some interacting too but is definitely more limited making Alexa much much better although I think Alexa has room to improve her skills and knowledge.. That being said for the price of Alexa she is definitely worth it. The speaker plays music loud and clear and she will turn up and down the volume if asked. The only slight muffled sound that I read mentioned in reviews is Alexa's voice seems slightly muffled but I guess it depends where the device is set up.. Anyway the initial set up.litterally took minutes.. You need to download the Alexa app and go from there to connect your device via wifi but she was up and running in minutes!! Super easy set up even for someone not tech savy. I will definitely be getting another one for the Living room as I've been carrying the device room to room as it plugs in the wall and is inconvenient to carry room to room. I do enjoy Alexa more then I expected to at this point and would recommend!

Title: Good Device.  Must Use Precise Command Language.
Body: We have the Google Home devices and the Alexa Dot devices.  Google has better voice recognition.  Alexa can be a bit difficult.  You need to use more precise word in with Alexa.  For example, Google Home you can say "Reduce volume 25%" and it understands.  Alexa you must say "Set volume to..." A number between 1 and 10.  Nothing else works.  So it can be a bit frustrating.  The connection to Amazon Music is really nice.  Much better than Google option which has much less flexibility to play specic albums or artisrlts or playlists.  Both work equally well controlling remote devises.  Again, Alexa. Voice commands must be more specific than Google.

Title: Wow! Fantastic!
Body: I've only had this Echo Dot for a few days but so far Fantastic! For its size very impressive sound. Setting up the unit was very easy. Download the Alexa App to your smartphone and follow the instructions. I'm not a real techie sort of person. I did find it easy to setup....  I'm still learning about it's capabilities. I have been using it for its reference library capabilities. Have done music streaming with it. The sound is very acceptable. It might be better soundwise adding a remote speaker but I'm very happy the way it is. I don't own a large home but running the volume at 5 fills the room with music. Maximum volume is 10.  I'm not sorry I bought it..

Title: Small setup snafu
Body: I own 2 other Alexa Dots, but when this one went on a Flash Sale, I decided to get it for my craft room. Had some issues with setup. I reached out to chat support and they very patiently held my hand and walked me through several steps before instructing me on how to hard reboot my device. (It wasn't broadcasting its wifi network.) The hard reboot forced it to update its software. It actually auto set up (because I had other devices on set up on my network.) It was a bit frustrating that it didn't come out of the box and just work, but I really appreciated the Chat Tech Support getting it up and running with me!

Title: Great Upgrade to the Little Dot
Body: We have a bunch of Alexas in the house and at the office, but I wanted to get this one for my Dad, as I knew he would love having it in the bedroom.  The clock is easy to read, but not too bright at night and the sound is perfect for one room where you want to listen to music, news or stories.  (Tip: It will show you the temperature where the clock is when you ask about the weather or temp) It won't rock out as hard as the big ones but has a good sound quality and big enough to easily fill the whole room.  He loves it and turned out to be a perfect birthday gift.

Title: Missing item
Body: I have already one of this devices, works very good, having on mind this , I decided to get one to be use in my office , me and the staff were very exciting expecting to play it and listening music , however , the delivery staff did drop it by the wrong building and to the wrong person, mean that we get disappointed since we had a little party this evening and we were expecting to play music from this equipment, calling Amazon Customer service we got the best respond from a sweet lady who offer all the help and even replaced the item which will  arrive on Friday , my concern is about the delivery system, why in the wrong building if the number is very clear , why someone takes a package for someone who not even is known and the driver just give without proper verification, that is why amazon suffering from so many stolen item , deliveries should have more control about who they handing items.

Title: She's cute.
Body: Alexa's cute. Assistant not much use to me so far but I'm still exploring. Sound is decent enough as long as I don't listen to real Rock for background. For Clapton, Ac/DC, jazz or country I will need that aux port. Sleep sounds could be useful if  the loop function would function.Aha. Other user found out sleep timer is a workaround. That indicates Alexa needs basic conditional loop programming. If then, else. While Wend. Just tell Alexa mainframe her loops are busted. VI intelligence should find bugs in microseconds.

Title: AWESOME CLOCK
Body: I love this.  I bought two of these to supplement my echo 2 dots around the house. However, I am thinking of replacing the older ones, as these are so much better.  The sound quality is great, it listens much better, and the clock is a much added bonus.  I love talking to my Alexa, but some times I want to know the time and not awake the entire household doing it.  The clock face is very minimal and does not interfere with sleep in any way. In fact you can turn down the lighting if you feel it is to bright.

Title: Great alarm clock and so much more!
Body: This was my first smart speaker and I love it!  It makes an excellent alarm clock but I also use it daily for music and to play relaxing white noise at night when I go to bed, "Alexa play rain storm".  The Alexa AI is so useful, I just tell it to stop playing in 45 minutes and off to sleep I go.  The sound quality is so so, but honestly is amazing for the size of the device.  I still find myself using it to play music because of the convenience even though I have higher fidelity devices in the same room.

Title: Just do it
Body: I had my WiFi stuff set up through an app on my phone and it was just a pain in the butt.  These came up on sale during the Black Friday deals and I grabbed two of them in bundles with other accessories.  I never really thought about doing the whole smart home thing, but the more stuff I get connected, the neater it is.  We've had some fun with Alexa too... she's always there with a joke or a story, and if we ask her to bark it confuses our dogs.  lol

Title: I didn't know I needed Alexa until I got this
Body: I had been reluctant about getting a smart speaker for a few years and I broke down and got the Dot being that it was on sale. I am not disappointed whatsoever. I got the smart plug bundle and I love it. I also went out and purchased some smart bulbs to play around with as well. It's a fun device and I'm glad I purchased it. I will definitely purchase more Alexa integrated devices in the future to make my life easier.

Title: Stopped Working after a few months. DO NOT BUY.
Body: Does anyone know it only have 3 MONTHS WARRANTY!?!!!!!!I purchased this device for my wife a number of months ago and now it no longer works. I tried contacting customer support and they just advised me to buy another one. The customer support person told me that they would offer me 15% off if I decided to purchase another one but would not help me at all in exchanging or replacing the device. DO NOT BUY!

Title: Nice upgrade from the original.
Body: Bought two of these, one to replace my original echo and one for my buddy. Sound quality is good, and the integration features keep getting better. I really like the guard mode, but who knows how effective it is. I hope I never have to test it!Mainly, I bought it because I wanted the Bluetooth transmitter, that way I could stream to my stereo receiver.

Title: Terrible Bedside Alarm Clock
Body: The problems with using this device (Echo Dot with Clock) as a bedside alarm clock are:1. If the power (or WiFi / internet access) goes out, the alarm does not go off.  The device does not have an integrated battery backup (like cheap dedicated alarm clocks... or a phone...).  You could buy a small UPS power strip to overcome this, though.2. Even at the lowest 1% adaptive brightness setting, the clock way too bright... about twice as bright as our old-school Sony alarm clock3. When the alarm goes off, the top ring lights up at full BLINDING brightness (not dim-able or disable-able).  And, if you have the escalating sound option turned on, the lights still light up right away, about 10 seconds before any audible-level sound can be heard, defeating the purpose of the escalating sound option.4. Turning off the alarm requires speech.  You can tap the top of the device to "snooze", but there is no physical way to turn off the alarm without speaking to it.  Some instructions online say that you can press the "wake button", but pressing the "wake button" and not also saying "stop alarm" only snoozes the alarm.

Title: Echo Dot is great, one gripe with Alexa.
Body: It's my first experience with a smart device like this. I did my research on an Alexa vs. Google and decided to support Amazon over Google as that seems to be the big difference between the two (that and I like calling out to Alexa instead of a search engine 'google'... it just seems more personable). Anyways I'm relatively satisfied but have a gripe with it - it won't let you say "Turn on the lights at 6 am". You have to create a routine that can go off daily or on certain days of the week to have it turn on and off lights at certain times, but I would love to see the ability to turn on (a) the lights/devices just tomorrow at a certain time and am surprised it doesn't have what to me would be a basic function. There are forums with others wanting this feature as well so I know I'm not the only one, and after chatting with an Amazon representative I know for certain they haven't created this feature yet.My morning routine varies so the night before I would love to be able to tell it to do something at a specific time (for instance if I decided to have my bedside lamps turn on before or after my morning alarm, or not have to set my alarm but have the lights wake me up instead; i.e. in the evening I could say "Alexa, turn on my lamps at 6 am tomorrow"). I don't want it to be a daily routine, more like an alarm function but for my lights/devices, and if Alexa responded with "Would you like me to turn them on every morning at that time" to make it into a routine automatically I wouldn't complain although I would probably respond with 'No, just do it for tomorrow morning' as I would change the time it would go off almost every evening based on my work schedule the following day and when I would like to get up.Please add this feature Amazon! It would simplify my life if you could and make Alexa more fun to use giving me more control of the environment around me.Also could you please add the ability to have more than one triggering condition to a custom routine?

Title: I love Alexa
Body: I have 2 Alexa dots, Alexa input, 3 firesticks, 5 smart plugs and 2 smart bulbs. All these devices operate smoothly together. The dots are easily understandable, easy to use and easy to give commands. I can control my entire home simply by asking for what I need. "Turn on bedroom light" "turn off the heater" not to mention best of all I can turn off the lights and tv, heater anything from another room...or even another city using my phone via the Alexa app. I can make an announcement to everybody such as "time for bed kids!" Then proceed to dim my smart lights in to night lights. Using the Alexa app I can turn things off and on without voice also. I'm not done buying them yet. My next mission; the bathroom. I'm in love! Highly recommended. If your trying to decide why you should buy one...just trust me...buy it! It's worth every cent.

Title: Nice upgrade
Body: Let me just start off this review buy addressing those who sound quality is everything to them.  No, you do not get an echo dot as a stand-alone music player.  The echo dot has always had subpar sound quality and the third generation is no different.  With that being said, the sound is great when coupled with my other echo devices while playing music on all speakers.  I got this dot with Clock to replace my 2nd gen dot and alarm clock on my dresser. The LED isn't very bright, but I can see it well in the middle of the night.  It also displays the current temperature when you ask for the weather.  I love the alarm snooze tap feature.  It's weird, but Alexa has a tad more bass in her voice on this new device.  They had a trade-in special when I purchased mine and I can say that I'm extremely happy with my purchase.

Title: Spoken output sounds incredibly muffled, not clear at all :-/
Body: Spoken output by Alexa sounds incredibly muffled and not clear at all :-/I have two 3rd gen echo dots and the sound quality definitely is muffled. I've reduced bass and increased treble, but the sound is very bass'y/low, as if someone's speaking from under a pillow. It's ok for music, but any spoken sounds (what's the temperature, play news, etc) doesn't come out clear. Voices lack clarity, and sound thick :-/Very disappointed. I'm hoping there will be a software fix, and if not, perhaps a recall/exchange for those units.It's foremost a speaker, and as such it is poor for voice output. I expect(ed) better from Amazon - esp since this is the 3rd generation of this product.

Title: Echo Dot is fun
Body: Love this little gadget. We all enjoy asking Alexa random questions. I also like how you can personalize your own questions and answers. Another neat feature is the chore lists. Alexa will keep a score of who finishes their chores and give a point for each chore completed. This is good if you like to keep track of chores. We also control our Fire TV through Alexa. This is nice for when we can_ find the remote which happens more than I care to admit. I got the echo dot free during a promotion last Christmas and ended up ordering another one because we liked it that much. We plan to integrate other smart devices that can be controlled through Alexa into our home in the future.

Title: This device is a great addition to my home...
Body: The bass resonance of Alexa's voice does vibrate the device from time to time so I have hooked it into my house speaker system.  Many of the other functions I've used it for contain far less bass so it can be used as a standalone device.  Response time is excellent and I'm still exploring new skills.  After ordering the adapter I have successfully integrated with my Insteon smarthome setup.  Basically this means I can control lights, the thermostat, etc.  I've even been able to pair it with my "driveway alert" system so it lets me know when someone has pulled in my driveway or walked up my front door path.  Useful to know when the mailman has arrived.

Title: So disappointed, guys. I can_ believe this device has all these great reviews.
Body: We have several second generation echo dots and we really enjoy them. We use them all the time, so much so that I wanted Alexa in every room. When I saw the Black Friday deals for the third generation echo dot, I snatched up four of them. I was super excited because of the great reviews and that these were supposed to have better sound quality than the second generation echo dot. Boy am I disappointed. The sound quality is really horrible. Alexa sounds like she_ trying to talk to you while being smothered by a pillow. It_ that bad. All four sound this way, so I know that I didn_ just get a bad one. They_e all bad. Music sounds a little better and the news update sounds a little better than Alexa, but everything still sounds a bit muffled. It_ how Alexa sounds that is the absolute worst. Very disappointing because we talk to her all the time. Fix this, Amazon!

Title: Works well and is convenient
Body: I already had bigger Echo, so this was an add on. It was a snap to set up and it will work with the other unit (s) for playing music in the entire house. Alexa seems to understand verbal command requests, but sometimes it takes several times before she knows exactly what you want. So at 1st if she doesn't get it, experiment with commands in a different way until she get it. Having Alexa is a lot better than having to get up a change a CD or turn on a radio or the TV for news if your working on something. I have her sitting on the edge of the bar which is convenient when you're entertaining. Play cocktail music, coffee shop music on Amazon Music, etc.

Title: Amazing Sound!
Body: Usually when I hear that a product has a new "generation" or is "new and improved" it falls short of expectations.  Yet this 3rd Gen is truly better than 2nd Gen.  The sound is bold and rich, whereas my 2nd Gen sounded a bit "tin"y. I sometimes needed to repeat myself with 2nd Gen, and with 3rd, Alexa gets what I'm asking the first time.  Really happy with my new gear!

Title: Horrible app!!  Not intuitive.
Body: I'm only a few days in, but this thing is SO counter intuitive.  I'm so disappointed I went here instead of Google.  Just 1 degree north of ZERO instructions come with this.  And is you ask Alexa how to do things, it either says I don't know or refers to the very horrible app.  And I mean the app is absolutely HORRIBLE.  You would think it wouldn't be.  But it sure is.  I'm in $57 for 2 Dots, so if Amazon doesn't figure this out, I'll drop them in the garbage and give Google a try.  For all of my friends and family, I suggested they try Google first.

Title: Must have for you home!
Body: I am astounded by this tiny thing. I LOVE it!! I can_ believe I waited so long to get one! I was so so hesitant about this, thinking _hat_ the point, I can do all that stuff on my phone anyway but omg this is so nice to have! It was super simple to set up, took me about 5 min once I figured out what our WiFi password was. I_e had it set up for about 20 minutes and I_ head over heels for this thing. Never looking back! Can_ wait to set the second one up, upstairs!

Title: Welcome to the family Alexa!
Body: I love my Alexa. We have so much fun talking to her. Asking questions and just playing silly games. I mostly use it in the kitchen. It makes a great timer, looks up recipes and send them to my phone, and plays my favorite songs while preparing meals. My youngest son gets a kick out of her and loves to listen to Spider Man songs on her. My oldest son wants one of his own. Lol. My only knock is sometimes I have a little trouble with the voice commands when asking to hear playlist. I would also like away for it to respond only to specific voices. That might be asking a lot but makes a lot of sense when your three year old tells her to stop playing your music in the middle of a song. Great addition to my home otherwise.

Title: Easily Hear You & Set Up is Very Easy!
Body: Purchased 3 of these because of the deals they had. Works flawlessly. Very sensitive! Can hear me from quite far. Speakers is actually fantastic.
