For something so small, it's bass is actually good! It pretty much does almost anything you want it to. Capable of turning on and off things like Lights, play music based on what you like, add routines which is so nice. Definitely worth adding to your collection if you want to upgrade to a modern voice activated software or just electronics in general.

Title: Great and fun product.
Body: For the better part of the day, The device works great but we have a misunderstanding now and then and it does not perform the task asked of it.  I am sure that it has to do with voice recognition, just frustrates when you ask for a task that you have asked asked before and it goes into a rendition as to why it can_ perform the task.  Love the routine functions that I can set up and will auto run at a predefined time.  Also love the integration for smart home capabilities.  Keep make it better!

Title: Amazingly useful li'l gadget, esp. for the price!
Body: I like the ability to ask what time it is, and what the weather forecast is, and play my music (or Amazon Music if you have Amazon Prime), and ask for objective info (the population of Moscow, Russia, and of Moscow, Idaho, etc.), and integrate with the Ring security system, and set alarms or reminders, etc. etc. plus many things I haven't learned yet. The Dot can output to your high quality speaker, so sound quality is not really an issue if that's important to you.

Title: Wonderful Multiple Use Dot!
Body: I own multiple Echo Dots, but this is the first I got with the clock. Love having it on my nightstand to use as an alarm clock. I use to turn off all lights after getting in bed and as a sound machine for sleeping.  I have also enjoyed lying on the bed and listening to music with it just to relax. The sound quality is superb! My wife likes to get the weather report when she wakes up in the morning. I bought two more to give as Christmas gifts.

Title: I am hooked on Alexa devices
Body: This is my second Echo Dot and I was really used to my Echo Dot 1 .... But... the 3rd generation model is built for better music sound.  Ok, I don't use my echo for music.  Alexa's voice is now muffled.  I'm guessing it's the bass.  I tried adjusting the Bass but still sounds muffled.  It's too bad that the Alexa voice isn't on a seperate channel without going through the bass.  I really preferred the crisp voice from Generation 1.

Title: Shuts off
Body: I was excited to get the Amazon Echo Dot! I ordered 2 because of the great cyber Monday deal, and got them the very next day. I followed all the instructions for set up, downloaded the app like I needed to, everything seemed to be working great for about 20 minutes, then, they both would just turn off. I unplugged them both, went through the settings again, reset my router, but the stupid things wouldn't work correctly.  Spent almost 2 hours farting with them both to get them to work, but to no avail.  Oh well, I've gone this far in life without them!

Title: Love these things!
Body: We have about 5 or 6 Alexas throughout our house. We use them for everything. I even have one in my garage because it makes playing music while cleaning or working on the car so easy. It also frees up my phone (versus having to plug it into the stereo for music) so that's helpful as well.I can't even imagine what life would be like if I had to give them up and go back, so I just keep picking up more, :D.

Title: Beware if pairing up with an echo voice remote
Body: I got this echo dot and a new echo voice remote on sale to supplement my first generation echo. The feature I love the most on my first generation echo is being able to control it via the voice remote when the echo microphone is disabled via the red button on the top.  I was looking forward to doing the same with my new echo dot and was very disappointed to find out the hard way that voice control via the remote will not work UNLESS the microphone on the echo dot is enabled which defeats the purpose.I contacted support via chat thinking that I may be doing something wrong, but they were not able to help me.  It looks as if the behavior is by design, or by design flaw.  If disabling the echo dot microphone also disables echo voice remote commands, then what is the point of pairing up an echo voice remote with an echo dot?I hope this is something that can be fixed remotely, otherwise I have limited use for this device, and little incentive to recommend it.

Title: You can use it as an intercom.
Body: I like that this product is cheaper than the Google products. Being that I have never owned any smart devices turning my home into a complete smart home is quite the stuff for me. With that being said the Google echo 3rd edition seems to be very easy to use. Inside the box are very clear instructions to setup your Google echo. Did you go echo sound quality is superb. Voice recognition is easy to set up within several seconds. It is lightweight, and small enough to blend in with my decor so that it does not stand out. I'm especially excited to use my echo as an intercom. This device allows you to use your app with the click of a button and your voice just send a message to all of your Alexa devices throughout the house like an intercom. My husband is terrible at answering the phone, so now I am able to stop the sound coming from the TV for brief moment so that he may hear my voice in cases of emergency. I give this product a five star.

Title: Echo Dot (3rd Generation) - Amazing Product
Body: I liked everything about Echo Dot.  Voice recognition - excellent!  Instant Alexa reply - excellent!  Sound quality - excellent!  There isn't anything that I don't like.  This product is like a talking dictionary with immediate answers, but it only comes to life when you say "Alexa."  I am thoroughly enjoying this new addition to my home.

Title: Almost there
Body: The Echo 3rd gen is very nice... it most certainly have enough color choices to match my home's various decor.On the functionality front, it is very good as well.  It is still a bit off compared to Google Assistance in terms of some of the voice recognition and answers Alexa can provide but not bad.  The leg up with the Echo is the ring light on it to give passive feedback like a notification or any pending issues.  It would be great if it can be used as a nightlight .  Oh, speaking of notification, I do wish I can see the notification in the Alexa app so I can dismiss it without using my voice to have it read out the notification.And definitely a huge plus for such a small device to integrate with the Ring alarm system to detect glass break and fire/smoke alarm sounds!  I was concerned that Ring doesn't have a glass break sensor but then the home setup tech told me about this feature which is super nice.  It doesn't feel as creepy since the mode is only on when the alarm is armed which is when nobody is home.Oh... the sandstone color looks great!!

Title: Life Enhancing
Body: After my dad had seen multiple commercials advertising all things Alexa, I got a text one day asking how much was Alexa in which I had to explain how it worked and there were several options with Alexa.  He decided he wanted one.  I've always been hesitant about things like this due to the "are they listening to us all the time" fear and the thought of some unknown person(s) eavesdropping on our daily lives is weird.  Nevertheless, I bought him this for his birthday.  He was thrilled!  He has had so much fun asking Alexa questions, he plays music with it ALL the time, asks for reminders, etc.  I've interacted with it also and it is fun and helpful to have around.  The sound quality is amazing and it is really easy to set up and use.  Highly recommend.

Title: Nice Upgrade from Non-Clock Version
Body: I bought this to be a bedroom clock with Alexa integration to replace my Version 2 Echo Dot. I wanted a clock with a good auto brightness feature since I can't sleep well with any light in my room. This clock upgrade should have been in their original design because of all the nice features it has created. Overall I am happy with this purchase, but I do believe $60 is a bit high for this. Only downside I've noticed is that the auto brightness system isn't very customizable. I had to move the dot to a certain position since it wasn't bright enough when it was daytime or when the TV was on at night no matter the settings I used. Just place near direct sunlight and/or in front of TV light to fix this.

Title: My echo dots and Alexa are my new best friends.
Body: I love the echo dots! I have three of my own and I just bought two more for my mom for Christmas. Everyday I discover something new that Alexa can do for me to make my life easier. The Dot's allow Alexa to tell me the time, to tell me the weather to answer questions for me we normally have to go to Google. She recites recipes to me she keeps up with my grocery list she sets reminders and I can even use the Alexa app and the dots to "drop in" on my own house to audibly check up on my kids while I'm away.  Alexa even plays games with us and plays music for us all thanks to the echo dot.  The speakers sound great and communication with Alexa is easy and simple enough the smallest of children can do it. You will not be sorry once you step into the world of Alexa.

Title: Not a fully functional alarm clock
Body: I bought this as a replacement for my 30 year old Sony AM/FM Alarm Clock.  The Echo may have more overall functionality, but it does not do the basics well.1.  The numbers are not very large or bright and cannot be seen from across the room2.  There is no way to simply turn off the alarm by touching it - you have to tell the alarm to stop, which means interrupting my wife's sleep - she does not wake up to the music the alarm plays, but speaking does wake her up.3.  I have to use the Alexa app to do things like stop the alarm which means having my phone next to me - it would honestly be easier to just use my phone as the alarm.It feels like Amazon did not really do any research or put any real thought into how people use alarm clocks.  They added a digital display but did not take into account varying distances from the clock.  It needs a way to be turned off without talking, and not rely on the Alexa app to do basic functions that should be on the alarm clock.  Thankfully, I kept my 30 year old alarm clock which has never malfunctioned and can go back to using it instead of the Echo Dot.

Title: Love this!
Body: Had to order this from Best Buy, didn_ want to wait after January 31st! Got it for the same price off amazon! Love that it has a clock display and upgraded from the 2nd generation dot! I wouldn_ have bought this if it didn_ have a clock display on it! I used my previous echo dot as an alarm clock but didn_ see a time and I would over sleep my alarm because there_ no snooze function! I had to set up 3 to 4 alarms in 10 minute increments and since there was no clock I would wake up 20 minutes after the last alarm! Hoping this will help me not over sleep since there_ a time on it! Tested the sound with music and it sounds decent with the upgraded speaker!

Title: Nice addition
Body: Two years ago I said I'd never allow one of these devices into my home.  My son sent me one as a birthday gift and it took me 6 months before I even attempted to take it out of the box.  My new Echo Spot is my personal third device, and I'm thinking of adding at least two more!  I'm still leery about the privacy invasion, but so far, so good.  Love the tone and the ease of getting it to play some really great musical selections.  By the time I get around to really investigating more of the available Skills the technology will be in full hologram mode, but I'll get there eventually :-)

Title: Warning - Cannot prevent skills from being enabled by voice!
Body: There are tons of reviews about this product. Tons. I will only add what is important and may not be in other reviews and that is this:Lets say you have your device in a common area of your house. Anyone can enable skills on your device by just telling alexa to enable that skill. "So what?" you say. Well here is a fairly common example of how that will be problematic.Lets say you have a child who decides to enable skills that are not appropriate for your child. While there are some parental controls the ability for the PARENT to determine what is or is not appropriate for their child is critical. Personally I don't want my children to be preached to or missionized to  - but there are plently of skills that would open that door up. While I can disable any skill from the app - it can simply be re-enabled by the child just by asking alexa to enable it.  Not only that but Alexa will frequently respond to a request with "I have a skill that can be enabled for that - do you want to enable it?" All the child has to do is say yes. This is ridiculous. Alexa needs to allow the owner to determine if they want skills to be enable-able via voice.

Title: Problematic to set up, good integration with smart home
Body: The 3rd generation Echo Dot is not that different than the previous versions.  It is sometimes difficult to set up as it almost never sets up on the first try.  I spent an hour on the phone to get this working.Once set up, it works great with my other Echo (not a dot) - it integrates commands well.  I purchased to facilitate my making the home _mart - and now I have controllable lights, fans, stereos and porch lights.Clever product- just wish it would set up as advertised.

Title: Best _larm clock ever
Body: Love this as an _larm clock.  The sound quality is very good - much better than past gen. Hey, it_ on your nightstand not at a dance party.I use this every night with wave sounds to fall asleep. When I shut off the alarm by voice it runs my routine of weather, calendar for the day, and a nice morning greeting like _ood morning sunshine. Alarm repeats can be customized. Snooze by tapping anywhere on the top. (9 minute snooze is not adjustable as far I as can figure out).

Title: What else can you say?  Very good!
Body: What else new can you really say about the ever ubiquitous Echo Dot? We've went with Alexa integration for smart home functions and most everything works without a hitch. We can even start our car--a Ford with Ford connect--using Alexa  As a partially sighted individual, I appreciate being able to get the time and weather with a quick request. The 3rd-gen Dot sounds a lot better than our older version. I'm very pleased with it, and as a lifelong Star Trek fan, I even changed my wake word to "computer." We are really living in the future!

Title: Love it
Body: I received an Echo Dot and Smart Plug as a gift from my wireless carrier which was cool, whatever, but then I started using them, now I don't know why I didn't get one for myself sooner. Such a stupid but nice thing to be able to turn hard-to-reach lights on and off with my voice, and have the weather announced as I'm getting ready so I know how to dress, without having to stop to check my phone. I look forward to learning what else it can do.

Title: Incredibly disappointed with Alexa integration across the product line
Body: Incredibly disappointed. This was one of EIGHT Fire TV and/or Echo devices that I purchased on Black Friday, hoping to switch from Roku TV and have a seamless smarthome experience. Oh boy, was I wrong.Whether I rename the the Fire TV devices or use their original names, the echo devices CANNOT control or recognize the tv devices, even after properly pairing them under the TV & Video setting in the Alexa app. I've tried to unpair, repair, restart, unregister, reregister, you name it. I've wasted days.  Generally, Alexa responds with 'I cannot find a device named ...' I consider myself very technically savy and I'm positive this is not something that I'm doing wrong. I should've read more into this before buying. TONS of people all over the internet are having this problem. It's infuriating. Plain and simple, until problems like this are fixed, Amazon is blaintantly false advertising the way that their devices work.Other cons to note:-Multiple video apps stutter and sometimes even randomly pause without ever resuming unless you physically resume them.-Alexa drastically lowers the volume of the TV when you are voicing a command. This in-and-of-itself is not a huge problem. However, it becomes a problem often when after the command is complete, Alexa does not resume the original volume of the content. When this has happened, I've had to ask Alexa to turn the volume back up to the specific number it was at.-I have two third generation echos paired as a stereo system for the TV. Often, even though I have my fire TV set as the preferred device, only the echos hear my voice, and once again, because they cannot control the TV, they say that they cannot recognize the device and then I just have to pick up the controller anyway.-The Fire TV will often think that it hears an 'Alexa' when absolutely no where near that word has been stated. Because the volume lowers drastically when Alexa is listening, it creates an obnoxious volume dip in content to listen for nothing when this happens.-You cannot set a sleep timerHonestly I could go on and on about the cons and about just how unhappy I am about these products. There are even more problems than what I listed here, but I'm not wasting too much breath, as after doing days and days of research on these topics, I've seen that Amazon has absolutely no answers to these problems, even after thousands of people have reported the same problems over and over. Unless there is some revalatory software updated coming, I'll be returning hundreds of dollars of equipment.

Title: I keep wondering if it will take off like a flying saucer
Body: I love the little lights on this thing.  It really does remind me of a flying saucer.  I hope the features and capabilities will expand.  So far it's been great to add items to my grocery list without my needing to leave the kitchen, do a quick calculation, or set a reminder to myself.  I haven't yet set it up to control some smart switches.  I'm waiting for my firestick so I can have a little control over my TV without looking for the remote.  It's great to ask for the weather without sitting down at the computer opening the browser nad searching for itl .  And the ability to put on the news, listen to a radio station or play a music genre (ever tried cleaning house to marching bands or MoTown?)jShe does a good job with understanding.  She doesn't restrict you to strict words and order.  I haven't felt as if I had to speak her way....I can ask, What's it like out, or what's the weather or just weather.If you have to repeat things, so far it seems as if I have to stat each sentence with "Alexa."  There may be a setting that allows her to take follow ups, but haven't looked just yet.It would be great if there were one standard between smart switches, bulbs, tvs, etc.  But it's still early.  I do have some concerns with privacy....I'm not used to talking with "ears" listening. It did talk to the TV once and to someone else--that's a bit weird.This is still early, and our robot overlords haven't set their plans in motion, so I feel safe for now.  It does save me time and does make life easier.  I hope to see it do more. I think this phase of smart homes is referred to the "bleeding edge."I wonder why she doesn't repeat words....words....words...............wor...

Title: Not what it's all cracked up to be
Body: I really thought I'd love this but I don't. First off, this is my second Alexa or better yet a replacement for the first one I purchased because everything I tried to listen to or play on it kept stopping or disconnecting...ALL THE TIME!!! Nothing played for more than 10 minutes before it would cut out. Now they sent me a replacement and this one won't even go through the setup process or connect properly. I'm just over it. I'm going back to my Google home mini.Plus, isn't it supposed to digitally display the time?? Well mine doesn't. Not the first one and not this replacement. Smh

Title: Pure Awesome
Body: I have been putting this purchase off because I was unsure if I needed it, and if I wanted Echo Dot or Google Home. I_ so glad I got this. I listen to music. I make my calls with Alexa. I control my AlticeOne cable box with it, and ask her questions rather than picking up my phone and Googling it. It_ not laziness, it is convenience with two babies and never knowing where I set my phone down. When my babies cry I ask her to put on baby music and it calms them down without me having to grab my phone and turn on my Bluetooth speaker. When I want to know when my games come on or the stats she has the answers. So excited!! I got two so one is in my room and the other in my kitchen. I can make announcements to all speakers when necessary, and even from my phone when I_ not home. I can_ wait to get smart lights and control it from my Echo Dot!!!!

Title: Going in the trash
Body: I have two echo dots and my primary use of them is to control various smart lights and outlets in my home. When I got the first dot almost a year ago it worked well but the longer I've used it the more useless it's become.  Now when I ask it to turn things off or on it says there is more than one thing with the same name.  Or it can't find a device with that name at all. I get both of these responses in relation to the same exact device.  I've rebooted and rediscovered devices.  I've even deregistered both my dots and started from scratch.  Nothing has helped.  I bought the second echo dot hoping that a newer version would perform properly.  It's worse than the old one.  They're both going in the trash.  Incidentally I also use Apple HomeKit to control all the same devices except my Nest thermostat.  It works flawlessly.  I've never had a single problem with Siri ever. Just saying....

Title: Kinda skimpy on the power supply, but its hearing is great!
Body: I suppose I should be grateful because a lot of Amazon products do not come with power supplies this one in particular comes with one with about a 2in cord (slight exageration)This is about the seventh or eighth Amazon device that I have owned. Since every single one of them has had a USB power cable I also purchased a long USB cable when I ordered this. I was a little disappointed to learn that the power supply for the echo is a wall wart with a fixed cable meaning that I have to place the device within about 30 in of an electrical outlet. Totally not cool that Amazon's engineers have decided how I need to arrange my room. Best thing about the dot: her hearing is excellent compared to all the other Alexa enabled devices that I own (5 within earshot at the moment).

Title: Amazoning
Body: I was a bit skeptical based on my "OK Google" experience but got a deal so I put this in the Garage and was very very impressed (I have Amazon Unlimited Music).  It just works, in a garage which has various amounts of noise coming in from the street or my activities.  The sound quality blows me away, I had now idea what I was missing from my prior BT speaker.  Pairing with my phone or using the Amazon service is very easy. I also connected it to my Lutron light switch for the room next to the garage and that was pretty cool.We are still VERY leery of having that little cloud connected mic in the house hence the garage placement.  Yes, I know we have n number of phones and tablets in the house so we are trying to come to terms with this Brave New World....

Title: Incredible what it can do right out of the box
Body: Alexa is incredible.  My wife talks with a accent and Alexa understands every single word, her response time is extremely quick.Set up was a snap ( once I found the password for my WiFi).So much easier than picking up the phone and looking for the weather or traffic. Just ask Alexa.I_ not sure how but I gave Alexa a phone number to call and it called it ( did not know it has a phone capability in her.Must use a WiFi to call?)Although I understand it can NOT call 911 as it poses some kind of legal mess or something.I wanted to use Alexa to turn on living room light in the morning.Little bit of a catch is You have to buy a smart bulb(I got the Hue19 bulb with smart WiFi and Bluetooth. About 25.00 for 1 bulb) but I was terrified of trying to make it work or hooking it up and my research says this was the simplest. Although some places said you need a HUB?Took a chance ( no hub ) just plugged in bulb, did have to open the Alexa app on phone hit connect , turned light on off on and boom done , works beautifully.I understand there is also a plug you can put into the wall socket (then plug in another light or the Christmas tree or?) and should work about the same as the smart light. (About 25.00$)Alexa play classic rock Alexa play Christmas music ,It_ amazing!The sound is very good. Does not replace a tv sound bar or some of these big Bluetooth speakers but for a small disk that sits on the table it_ great.This is the echo Dot 3rd generation and supposedly it has much better sound than the previous 2.Bottom line as long as you have WiFi get this Echo you will not be sorry it_ simply amazing the things it can do. I use it every morning as a alarm clock and a timer for eggs also as a reminder  Alexa remind me to turn off stove in 15 minutes, okI will remind you in 15 minutes starting now.I_ still learning all the things it can do and it continues to amaze me daily.

Title: Very Poor Audio Quality
Body: Set up was rather easy, however I'm very disappointed with the quality of the audio. It's extremely muffled as if it were being held under a thick pillow. I've tried the normal suggestions found on the web, basically doing a power cycle adjusting the equalizer controls and of course checking for updates, but none of those have helped. I had planned on setting this up in my office for some background music but it's more suited for generating white noise.  As for integration. Most of my lights are automated and configured for voice control. For some reason Alexa does not like my kitchen lights. Half the time I ask for them to be turned on I'm told that there are multiple devices with the same name and instructs me to delete and add them again. There is only one Kitchen Light, and nothing else in the house that sounds even close to them. I have the same problem with Alexa on my Facebook Portal mini (Gen-1). However; this has always worked flawlessly on all of my Google Home Minis (Gen-1), which also have excellent audio.

Title: iPhone/Comcast Connection Issues Galore!!
Body: Wish I could have used this thing, but after spending over 2 freaking hours with Amazon Kindle/Echo Techs on the phone trying to simply connect it to my WiFi signal through my iPhone, which I note has not had a single problem since I moved into this apartment in July 2019, I got pissed and gave up and realized that it had been a big waste of time and inconvenience to try and set up a cheap $24 plastic spy toy that I will probably rarely use.I called Comcast Xfinity 3 times, had a technician come out and they said they could not figure out why my WiFi connection got thrown off except that it might have been because of the attempt to connect to the Echo Dot. So frustrating!The kicker? I had my father take this Echo Dot to his home and try it and you know what? It worked just fine. He also has Comcast Xfinity, except he has an Android and I have an iPhone.Moral of the story- Comcast and iPhone? Move cautiously. I used to think Amazon could do no wrong, now I think twice.

Title: Must Look Review
Body: I used google home and echo dot for over 6 months, so here is what I feel about Echo dots 3rd generation:Pro:1. Good looking and nice touch.2. Easy to place order by this smart device.3. Stable connection4. Good sound quality for this price5. Good on setting up alarm, reminder...6. Price is affordableCons:1. AI Technology needs to be improved. It is way worse than the Google home. (NOT smart enough)Ex:1. Bad on internet search engine2. Bad on giving the direction to the place you what to go3. Unable to understand and answer daily life questions (google did a better job in that)In conclusion, if you kind of rely on a smart device to make your life easier and if you use google account a lot, I will definitely not recommend this product. Google home does a better job on that. But if you are just using it for easy things like setup alarm, place Amazon orders, weather report, morning call... This is enough.

Title: Perfect for a NON TECH person or older person.
Body: My husband is very old school, non tech. Never used a pc, credit card or ANYTHING high tech. I bought him a few stereos so he can listen to his old time music...always a fail! Nothing was ever easy enough for him to use. So I bought this Echo Dot 3 hoping that he could at least talk to it instead of pushing any buttons. I changed it's name to just ECHO trying to make it simple as possible for him.  IT WORKED!!! He likes it and actually uses it for his favorite songs and music. I even bought the smart plug so he can turn his lamp on and off be a easy command. This was a great gift for him! THANKS!

Title: Easy to use for seniors and can be used fo remergency help
Body: It was so simple to start up even for 76 year old. I love the skills of these units and I have installed one in each room for emergency calls to my children. You can leave a voice message..so cool. If I fall and can think of a reason to get up but am unable to do so I can I can get help. I joke about reason to get up but I am serious about help being available also I stream Sirius radio all day in each room.

Title: Echo whole home solution
Body: I've been trying to integrate my various sound systems. I didn't want to go the Sonos route ( although it is a fantastic product) because I had Bose upstairs, downstairs and in the garage. Echo Dot solved my problem (at ~$60 vs ~$1000 vs Sonos). I added an Echo Dot to each system's Aux channel; created two groups: Indoors and Everywhere; and the next thing you know, I have a perfectly clear, integrated system that put my indoor FM transmitter system to shame.  I love the sound.  My wife loved the price.

Title: love alexa
Body: i really like alexa. my family has a whole bunch of them around there house but i am away at college. i got this one sale just to try it out and i_ so happy i got it. i love it. i love that i can download the app and control her from my phone.  every morning alexa sings my favorite song to wake me up and tells me the weather. i also love the games you can play, i play question of the day. this is super helpful for college students. i love being able to study and listen to music or ask alexa a question. i recently found out that you can talk to people through the dots. so i talk to my friend through his dot and my dot when i am super busy and can_ reach my phone. only thing is sometimes she doesn_ understand what i am saying so i have to repeat a few times. and i wish she was wireless. but overall i love the dot! i can definitely see me getting more in the future when i have my own place.

Title: Poor design feature
Body: Got an echo dot and tried to hook it up to my computer system , which the instruction said I could, after trying several times and downloading software thru the apps store I was told that a needed a wireless device to set up the Dot.REALLY the reason I wanted this system is that it was advertised as being able to work thru my computer system.NO WHERE IN THE INSTRUCTIONS or on any website was there anything that said "MUST HAVE WIRELESS DEVICE TO SET THIS UP" to me this is a poor manual as well as a design flaw , not everyone wants to use their phone to set up a system that is advertised as working on a home computer. I mean how hard is it to have your product search and find my wireless system without me having to piggyback it thru another device.this is why I am giving this a low rating as I am also wondering how many others are giving this as a gift thinking the same thing only to find out that they need to have another wireless device to get this to do what it advertised to do.I will be returning this device for a full refund and warning others about this.

Title: Very handy
Body: Never thought I_ own a smart home anything but after being 2 months non-weight bearing on one of my legs due to surgery I jumped at getting a smart plug and an echo dot on discount during Black Friday sale. The echo was harder to install than the smart plug. The combo of Echo dot and Smart Plug very well for a hard to reach upright lamp. The echo also works great for reminding me to take my medicine on time, telling me the time or temperature outside when I ask, playing music, audiobooks, the _ood morning and _ood night routines I set up on it. I_ still working on figuring everything out on it but it_ a neat helper, especially when paired with a smart plug. If you have cats you might want to consider getting the space saving mount for the echo that_ available. That_ the accessory I didn_ know about at the time that I_ ordering ASAP.

Title: Multi-room Music is BAD.
Body: I have four Echo gen. 3 devices setup in a "multi-room music" group.It RARELY works. Amazon's bottom dollar customer service staff is about as useful as the feature itself. To be specific, almost useless, and ALWAYS irritating.At random one Echo stops, than two, than all four and the music dies, leaving you and your friends and family in an unexpected silence. It's great for parties!Streaming a station from one device? Ask Alexa to continue to music to the group ("everywhere" in my case). Alexa will ask you what to play. No, simple Alexa I asked you to continue to the music playing everywhere. Alexa; "...". Alright, you try again. "Alexa, play music everywhere". "What do you want me to play"? You say something specific. Alexa; "...". Alright **** it I will use the app, even though that is counter intuitive. "Epic! It's working"!... 45 seconds and a quarter of a track later. SILENCE.If you use Alexa for anything other than turning on a light or listening to music (and news and media) I would sure be surprised. It blows my mind how this super-basic and KEY feature is near non-functional. Every time I talk to customer 'support' it blows their minds too!As soon as Google's egg, nest, data harvesting spy whatever is on sale I'll be picking up four. Two Alexa's will go to the toilet room and two will go to whomever is willing to take 'em.

Title: Very convoluted and unfriendly setup.
Body: I am now invested totally in Amazon eco system with new Firestick 4k and new Echo Mini 3rd gen.  The Echo mini cannot get TV sounds from the Firestick.  It says it can and is setup for it, but nothing.  I wish I had gone the Google route.  And yes the volume is turned up.  It plays sound fine from the Echo device through my sound system but can't connect anything to it wirelessly.  Terrible.  I went though hours of troubles shooting on Amazon's website but nothing helps.  I can only conclude that these items are not compatible.  Now I have couple more pieces of junk technology I wish I had never bought that waste time and never give back.Update: We got it working after 3 days.  Someone responded to a question we had and it helped.  Very convoluted and unfriendly setup.  So add back 2 stars.

Title: Amazing
Body: Update...I was so pleased with my original Alexa, I ordered another one for another part of my house.  At the same time I ordered a shelf for the Alexa.  The only issue I have with my second Alexa is that it will shut down, and I'll need to unplug it then plug it back in while it restarts. With the shelf it's a little difficult, but doesn't take away from the pleasure I've received from having it.I got an Echo Dot for my birthday, and I'm in love with Alexa......she turns on the lights, plays music, tells me the time, and has answered questions....she is  amazing.  My only issue is that occasionally she will make a noise.  Although she didn't make that noise at all yesterday.

Title: Not worth the price point, better options out there.
Body: This is an okay device. It does have its limitations. The google brand similar product has better integration for my bilingual family. The echo dot has muffled sound the higher the volume. Amazon has a lot more privacy policy terms that I don_ necessarily agree with to use the device. I wouldn_ have purchased this at its current price if I didn_ get it through an offer which significantly reduced the cost.

Title: I think I'll keep her..
Body: She, (it), is very relatable. The AI has grown in leaps and bounds. I love the new whisper mode, and the apparent understanding giving back to certain questions. I have some issues with integration to Fire TV sticks, and my Fire TV Recast. Customer service so far has been five star. I will call on those issues when I have some spare time. Also if you choose the allow it to linger a few seconds you can follow up on a question without the awake word (typically Alexa). If you want to roar with laughter watch the SNL skit on Alexa for Seniors!

Title: Cheap , Great Integrations
Body: Bought this for $25 last year and couldn_ be happier with the integrations and price. Overall a great addition to a smart home or room. I have my two lamps hooked up with the tplink plugs and _lexa turn on the lights is all I need. You can also download the app and get custom voice commands. So I have led strips around the house and when I say _lexa! INTRUDER ALERT!  All lights turn red and imperial march (Star Wars) starts playing at full volume. I_ glad to say I haven_ had to use it yet. Practical uses range from commands like , _lexa, good morning. You can have her tell you the time, weather and news if you_ like. Almost endless possibilities.  Highly recommend.

Title: Best Bundle Deal!
Body: Haven_ used it yet but as far as I can tell this was a really good deal! I bought the Alexa + Hue Lights bundle and already I can tell that it_ going to be good! The hue lights came in a two pack and prices separately they would have costed me $44 while the Alexa would have costed $40. I got BOTH of them for $32 (the Alexa was on sale for $22 and the hue lights costed $10 more). Best deal yet! Saved me almost $60 dollars! MUST BUY! I will probably buy this again too if the deal is still here the next time my paycheck rolls around

Title: Quick setup, tons of convenience at a low price
Body: I've been putting off buying one of these for years, but I'm glad that I finally got this dot. Setup was quick and easy with the Alexa App, and connecting it to a smart plug and Spotify was also easy. I'm really impressed with the sound quality, considering its size... great bass and mids, and the highs are not tinny at all. Those of you who have used Alexa already know that the voice recognition is excellent, you can speak it to very naturally and it does a great job. All in all, very happy.

Title: Spanish recognition works flawlessly
Body: Always wanted an Echo Dot but being the only English speaker in my home never bothered to buy one. After learning it now works for Spanish, I got the Echo Dot and can say not only it understands Spanish perfectly well, but the information it provides is accurate and fast.  Even the jokes it tells are not just English jokes translated to Spanish (which kills most jokes), but actual Spanish-origin jokes.Other than the language, technically speaking it works great. The microphone hears me from like 2 rooms away, the sound is clear, it's fast, it's pretty. Totally worth it!

Title: Great features with iffy connectivity to external devices
Body: Almost everything about the Echo Dot is great. I'm still learning the different "skills". The kids love asking Alexa questions (or to make fart noises). The only issue experienced so far has been certain devices that I have connected won't work some times. I have a Samsung TV I have connected and the use through Alexa is intermittent. The same with our other Fire enabled Smart TVs. I've still not been able to connect my Fire TV to another Echo Dot we have.

Title: First time Alexa user; Happily Impressed!
Body: I did quite a bit of review digging, and I am picky.  Late adopter (tend to do that with most technology), and happily impressed with ease of use and quality of product.  Will continue to be wary of privacy concerns, but well aware, so not an uninformed user and will take precautions accordingly.As an audiophile, the Dot sound quality is not particularly better than a portable radio, but far, far more functional than one, and at very good (Black Friday) price.  And I don't have a portable radio, so this more than fills that need.Thrilled that I can now hear XM, Amazon Music, the NoSleep Podcast and so much more on voice demand now, and just in time for a post surgery recovery period.  Nice for room to room calling, also.

Title: These is addictive
Body: I now have an Alexa device in every room in the house and the garage.  Great for reminders, shopping lists and music.  Excels at routines (turning lights off & on, giving the weather or just a joke to start the day).  Good in the kitchen for timers and conversions.  Great in the workshop for figuring measurements.  Most important, as an old guy, I can call for my wife anywhere if I need assistance.

Title: I feel like I'll have an echo dot in every room before it's all said and done!
Body: I love my echo dot! This one I got for my room and I love the lilac color option.I use it for an alarm in the morning, playing music throughout the day, drop-in to my other dots to communicate throughout the house, and to play my headspace meditations at night before bed.It's perfect and I love it! I bought a 4th for my teen son to keep in his room.

Title: Didn't even last 10 months
Body: We really enjoyed our Echo Dots...for 10 months. When it started to malfunction Amazon said too bad-they only stand behind them for 90 days. They offered me the not so awesome option of trading it in but in that case they would give me less money for it since the volume features on it don't work and then I would have to apply more of my own money to purchase a new one---which would probably only last for 10 months again. Very disappointed in their customer service. You would think they could stand behind a product for longer than 90 days. It's not like I wanted the thing to last 10 years but is it too much to as to be able to at least make it to 1 year?!

Title: I love my echo dot
Body: I mostly use my echo dot to listen to music.  It_ small and convenient to bring on the go with me anywhere. Sometimes I_l use it to ask Alexa questions which is a cool feature. It was easy to set the device up and sync with my amazon account and the app. I just wish it was chargeable and didn_ need to be plugged in all the time.

Title: Disappointed in Echo 3rd Generation Dot
Body: I have an Echo Dot 1st Generation and a 2nd Generation Echo.  I decided to update both Echo's and add to my household for more quality and help from Alexa.  I had noticed that the speaker of 1st generation dot was starting to sound a bit off, like a cracked speaker, and Alexa wasn't responding as well as before (but she heard me better than this new one), hence the update of the dot.  And the upgrade for the original Echo 2nd Generation was because of the Zigbee hub (I updated to Echo Plus 2nd Gen).  That all being said...The Echo 3rd Generation Dot in the kitchen doesn't hear me very well (the old one did a better job).  Many times I will ask Alexa to add things to my shopping list and she gets it totally wrong or I hear the new Echo Plus 2nd Generation in the other room pick it up.  Also if I tell her to set a timer in the kitchen, again many times she doesn't hear me or the other one will pick it up.  I figure the reason the other Echo (in another room) hears me is because I am having to shout at Alexa to do what I am asking; set a 10 min timer, add eggs to the shopping list, ect.  Very annoying!Not to be all negative on the 3rd Generation, if I do play music on the Everywhere Group setting it isn't to bad sounding, but it is in my kitchen (my hub) and I need to be able to request to her to add things to the shopping list, set timers and she needs to be able to hear it correctly and not make me shout at her.Lastly, the Echo Dot 3rd Generation sound quality (when she does hear you) is way off.  I have tried repeatedly to bring up the sound quality (less base / muffled sound) for use in just the kitchen.  The Echo Dot 3rd Generation is way to muffled sounding, and sadly this one is going somewhere in the household where it will be rarely used and I will bring the old one back out of retirement...at least I could understand the Echo 1st Generation more, with no muffled sound, and she heard me way better than the Echo 3rd Generation.  I am disappointed in this Echo 3rd Gen Dot and glad it was on sale, per it wasn't worth the 50.00 original asking price.  I do enjoy the Echo Plus 2nd Generation with the Zigbee Hub, but it is in a different room, and I do play music through it.

Title: WiFi no connects badly.
Body: Echo fail when attempting to connect to a WIFI that is commercial. My apartment complex provides Spectrum internet and cable free. Each apartment has a different log in. Been trying for a couple of days and researching. Thought I had it once or twice....Will call Spectrum, saved it for last on Monday.  UPDATE 12/9/19 Spectrum was helpful with finding and now knowing how to add a device to the network. Problem still remains; either an Alexis or an iPhone7 issue. The AMZ network doesn't stay available to find and connect temporarily so I can get to full connectivity.  Will proceed and see how much time I need to devote to this for some supposed ease???

Title: A useful device
Body: A useful device. I was resisting purchasing one of these products. I am not so sure about the likelihood of intrusion but my son convince me otherwise. As someone who is blind, I saw the value of having a voice activated device to give me connection to the outside world. I successfully set up the basic unit but needed help with other things in order to integrate my security system and other devices. I_ glad that they have telephone support to help us through this especially in moments when my vision loss is an issue. Generally, if you have vision loss you may need to set this up with someone else who can see. Now that everything is set up; I have found it to be quite useful. The sound of the speaker is clear. The information that I can retrieve is plentiful and some of its responses are _illy. They give me a chuckle. This small device sits on my windowsill in the dining room where I work. I believe I would purchase this again after having used this for the last couple of days.

Title: Flawed Blutooth
Body: Product came very quickly.  Unfortunately, I wanted to use this as a replacement in my bedroom. Then I was going to put the existing one in the spare bedroom.  I have a great Parrot Blutooth Speaker I use in the bedroom and this absolutely would not connect.  Then I tried several (4) other speakers I have (including one just purchased for my hot tub), just to make sure it wasn't just this one specific speaker having an issue connecting.  None of them could connect.  NONE of them. If it is an issue with just mine, or an issue with this model, I cannot tell.  If you're planning on connecting this to blutooth, rethink the purchase of this model.With that in mind, the speaker in this model is fairly good, so I wasn't completely disappointed.  I put IT in the spare bedroom and kept the original where it was.  The clock feature is why I wanted this, so I could see it from across the room. It's actually quite nice.  However, since the blutooth doesn't pair with anything I have, it went into the spare room.  It's truly a shame.  Again, with it being a newer model, perhaps they changed the blutooth standard this unit uses.  If that's the case, being "backwards compatible" may be an issue for those using anything 1 year old or older as the external speaker.

Title: Love it!
Body: My 1st echo or alexa device. Easy to hook up and the added bonus of the light bulbs are great! Now I dont have to get up to turn the light switches on n off or when my kids decide to leave lights on!Still connecting more devices to have the dot do more for me. I'm a little slow when it comes to understanding all this new technology lolLove the sandstone color too! Matches with my living room. I was very hesitant on buying a device like this but im happy my kids talked me into it!I'll probably be purchasing another to add upstairs as well along with more smart light bulbs.Awesome little gadget!

Title: Decent speaker, useless everything else
Body: I don_ understand why the same commands don_ make from one Echo product to another. Bought this to put in the baby room (which currently has a spot that I wanted to move to our bedroom) to use as white noise. NOPE! No matter what combination of things I tried, the white noise would abruptly stop at SOME point during the night. Once as soon as I put her down to sleep (not even 10 minutes after starting it). The duration changed daily, but it was definitely NEVER on by midnight. Had to put the spot back in and now she can sleep.As with all the Alexa devices, her ability to understand us/answer questions varies greatly. AI still has a ways to go, I guess.

Title: Great Bluetooth Connection!
Body: I have a great Onkyo 5.2 stereo with an Amazon Fire TV. This is a great setup for listening to music, but I hate having to turn on the TV just to listen to music. With the Echo Dot I no longer need to turn on the TV! I merely say, "Alexa, play Led Zeppelin" or anything else I wish to hear and Alexa responds that it's shuffling songs from my selection. It's a lot easier than turning on both the TV and the stereo. I turn on the stereo set on Bluetooth, I ask Alexa to play my selection, and then I say, "Alexa, connect to Bluetooth speaker." It's that easy!

Title: Alarms randomly go off throughout the night
Body: The DOT has a mind of its own! It sets the ALARM CLOCK off all hours of the night up to 15 alarms in one night full blast going off in my daughter's bedroom I can hear it from Clear across the house 2 a.m., 3 a.m., 5 a.m., 6 a.m., 6:15, set up I turned them off I delete them I talk to customer support nobody wants to help nobody cares. Says I'm eligible for a return through August of 2020 and it's a lie! They forced me to buy another one if I wanted to get this thing resolved. This is a scam! I cannot believe Amazon wont support thier own products!

Title: It's worth upgrading from the Gen 2 Echo Dot to the Gen 3! Better sound quality!
Body: The echo dots were on sale black Friday, so I decided an order another one. It's the perfect bathroom radio to use while taking a shower! (Obviously, plug it into an outlet and mount it outside the shower. I doubt that the Echo Dot is waterproof.) I immediately heard the difference in the sound quality between the Gen 2 and Gen 3. If you still have a Gen 1 or Gen 2, upgrade to the Gen 3. It's completely worth it! The sound quality is much clearer and I can better hear the range of treble and bass in each song. Great product!

Title: Muffled Sound
Body: Works just fine as an Alexa device. I have a 1st gen Echo dot as well. I like the voice sound on the gen 1 device better. The gen 3 has a nicer design/appearance, but the sound is "muffled" in comparison (note: I don't use the Dots to listen to music; this is about voice quality/timbre). The other thing to know about the gen3 is it uses a different power supply: plug adapter vice straight USB power. I can connect my gen1 to a USB outlet with a standard USB micro cord, but the gen3 has it's own standard power outlet "wall wart" adapter.

Title: Cute little thing and really handy to have around
Body: I really like this little Echo, although it has malfunctioned a few times and I've had to unplug it and plug it back in. It's still pretty cool though, and the sound is actually pretty good. My kids love it and are constantly playing music through it. It does a ton of cool stuff too. The games are fun and I like having updates on sports and weather. It's really easy to use with the Alexa app. All in all I'm pretty happy with it.

Title: Alexa is taking over my life. Why can't she do dishes too?
Body: Alexa is slowly taking over my house and I am ok with it. She plays us music and adds things to my grocery lists. She sets times and alarms and she is pretty ok for a robot lady.I have to say there is so much I do not know yet. So it can kind of be frustrating trying to do things out of the norm. Sometimes she doesn't hear me.She's pretty cool, but we have to get to know each other better. At this time I'd give her a B+

Title: Decent entry level smart speaker
Body: I got this on sale and I have several google homes. I will say if I never purchased a google home device this dot would get 5 stars. With that said its just not up to par. Sound quality is good. Googles ability to communicate efficiently is just better than Alexas. I find myself screaming at Alexa a lot more lol. If dot is cheaper at the time then it's a good device to just go for but grab a google when a sale pops up.

Title: Great Smart Home Integration
Body: This is my first Alexa featured product other than the Firestick. This little thing is awesome! I was able to automate so many things around my home by simply asking this little device to do things for me. I am very happy with the Echo. I keep discovering more and more devices around my home that can be added to this device. I_ glad I received this with my Blink camera system as part of the package/sale.

Title: Nice for moms
Body: I enjoy the Alexa but I don_ use it as often as I_ expect. It_ nice to be able to ask questions verbally to eliminate the need for google. I don_ like that it will play my Apple Music but when I ask it to play my playlist it says it_ not connected. Also, when the volume is all the way up it sometimes doesn_ respond as promptly. Overall, nice to have with a baby to play lullabies, check weather/traffic, read stories, etc

Title: These keep getting better and better!
Body: This is my 6th echo product. I own a couple 2nd generation Echo Dots and the 3rd generation is an improvement in sound quality and aesthetics.  I_ happy to have added another Echo Dot to my household.  They are great to have in every room.

Title: Not quite the sound you're looking for
Body: I bought this little gem for my home office to listen to music while I work. It's not bad. Only problem is my Insignia bedroom speaker/alarm clock beats the pants off this in terms of sound quality. The sound from this is best described as shallow and tinny. It's not horrible, but compared to Insignia, it's....lacking. I've purchased a second with the hope that pairing the two will produce good stereo sound. I probably just wasted money, but here's to hoping.Update 12/10/2019Just received my second dot and paired it with the original one. It's in a room that's 12x12, so small. It sounds really great with the stereo sound. I wouldn't recommend it for anything larger, but the sound quality is really nice for a small room. Happy I bought a second dot.

Title: Great little device.
Body: I got two of these free on black friday promos. I already have two echo 5's, so adding these were a breeze. I now have Alexa devices throughout my phone. It's great for when I want to listen to music. I grouped them all together and now I just tell Alexa to play music everywhere and I have the same music playing throughout my home. Being able to control things like lights, camera, tvs etc is great.

Title: Really handy!
Body: I never had any smart speaker and tried one of these... now I have four. Convenient timer in the kitchen, great  for intercoms to other rooms and answers most any questions easily like store hours or weather without having to go search it on the net. Fantastic devices.

Title: gave it 2 days then into box in a closet, not worth postage to return it
Body: intrusive, refuse to train myself to learn to speak in alexia. frustrating by not pulling up what I was looking for; wanted a research tool, not a playtoy. got it with the subscription and $1.00 device. spent too much time on phone with alexa support setting it up. cancelled subscription on day 3. staying happily with a dumb home and 'duck, duck, go' hand typing in search terms.

Title: Don't Buy this If You Need Great Sound
Body: Don't expect the Dot to give you the same sound quality that the larger Echo gives you.  The sound is tin-y and grates on the nerves a bit.  I bought two, returned one, but kept the second one for my office, where I don't spend a lot of time.Of course, I am spoiled.  The sound on the larger Echo is extremely good.  It was just the Dot that wasn't so great.

Title: Big upgrade for first generation Echo device
Body: I had a first generation Echo which had poor sensitivity to voice commands and low sound quality. The new Echo Dot is so small yet is superior in every way to the original Echo device. I am keeping the old unit as a 'spare' in case one of my other units fail, but so far none of my Echo devices (Original, two versions of Dots, one Echo Plus and Fire TV plus Fire Stick) have been a problem. My home is as automated as it can be without spending a few thousand dollars, the most recent addition being a smart thermostat I can monitor or change from my phone as well as from any of the Echo devices in my home. Amazon has done a great job of updating their original concept of a voice command unit and I look forward to other new devices. The only thing I have not bought into yet is the visual versions as I don't have a personal need for them, but if they come out with one that can act as an Echo terminal as well as a tablet I may just buy it!

Title: if only they kept the micro USB power cord
Body: I bought this to replace my current Gen 2 device in the bathroom.  I have it mounted on the mirror and use it to play iHeart Radio or my favorite music while I'm showering and getting my day started.  I liked the idea of the Gen 3 device and it's improved audio - the only issue with the prior generation devices.  What I didn't notice is that the power cord has changed.  My current unit is plugged into a micro USB outlet next to my mirror.  That outlet has 2 110v and 2 USB-a outlets.  one of the 110v outlets is used for my Oral B electric toothbrush.  The other is used by my wife for her hair dryer or other hair product.  I need my Alexa to be micro USB or I'll have to constantly swap cords around.So I left my current Gen 2 unit in place and put this next to my  bed and use it as an alarm clock instead.

Title: It_ good for what it is used for
Body: We think the Echo Dot is pretty cool it helps reminds me when my children need to take medicines or bedtimer. It_ great for when I am at work I can send a message to Alexa while I am at work to let my 9 year old who has no phone know what chore needs to get done. It plays music great not as loud as the google home, but gets the job done. We are still debating if we want to keep it or not. If your home is a smart home then it will work out perfect if your home is not a smart home then it won_ go up to it_ full potential. The echo dot is connected to our phones and living room tv they do sell smart plugs that are wireless that Alexa can control for you example a lamp or a coffee machine.

Title: Way too much bass!!!!!
Body: I bought this to replace the original 1st generation Alexa Dot and this one is much faster than the gen 1.  Responds quickly, looks better, but there's one major issue - the BASS IS WAY TOO MUCH!!!  I've tried turning it down, and it just won't go down any further.  "Alexa turn the bass down" doesn't work.  It's almost as if this speaker purposely has excessive bass response.  It's annoying.  I don't like it.  None of my other Alexa's do that - any form factor or generation.  It was a great price so I'll keep it and use it in a spare room but it's just not what I had expected at all.  My new echo show 5 and fire cube audio is MUCH better.  I would avoid this model if I were you.

Title: Great sound from a small gadget
Body: for being so small, this has great sound- makes music sound great. I have been having lots of fun talking to Alexa. When you thank her for something, she remembers and will add to her comments later - ie: she will tell you to have a wonderful day - or ask you if you want added info... Alexa was funny when I asked her what she wanted for Christmas - she said she would like to travel thru space and see far away galaxies but she said a new dictionary would also be nice so she would learn more words for riddles and jokes.  Alexa is great for a shut in who needs someone to talk to as well.

Title: Echo Dot - Wowzers!
Body: 1. Small, but Powerful - What a beast!2. Alexa is Amazing - She Hears Everything...Literally from Another Room.3. Crystal Clear Sound Wow - No Video4. Able to Link my Ring and Wyze Cameras - Sound Notifications5. Able to Link ALL Echo Devices in my Home6. Love the Surround Sound when Linked Together for Music (Whole Home)7. Absolutely LOVE the Drop-In Ability to Check on Each Room in the House - Sound OnlyIs there really anything Alexa CANNOT do? I don't think so!I would DEFINITELY purchase this Echo Dot again.

Title: Whole family loves it
Body: I bought this along with an Amazon Unlimited subscription promotion and I do not regret that purchase. My kids love that they can ask it to do all sorts of things and for now it sits in the game room, and I mute the microphone when needed, so I don't have any privacy concerns. It understands my children and it set up profiles for each, so they play what they like. My kids are 3 and 5. They set up timers when I give them the 5 (or 10) minute warning to stop playing. I now want to add two more Alexa products to my house!

Title: Meh
Body: I have several older gen Echo Dots, all of which work great with the occasional voice to tv lag or crackle here and there. Overall, though, I love them. This was a massive disappointment. Crackled nonstop like it was blown, didn't recognize my voice most of the time unless I screamed at it, and would just stop playing music at random times even if I had loop on/etc. I returned it. I'll stick with my older gens for now.

Title: Simply AWESOME
Body: I received the Echo Dot (3rd Gen) in the Charcoal color for a Birthday gift and WOW, this thing is AWESOME!!! With the multiple reviews available, the Echo Dot has certainly lived up to the hype and more. I'm not sure why the Sandstone color is the only Echo Dot (3rd Gen) to have the clock feature, it would be nice to have the clock feature on all the colors. The Echo Dot is a must have and I HIGHLY recommend it.

Title: Pick up voice better!!
Body: So I got this to try against my Google mini speakers cuz I was having a lot of issues. I love Alexa because it picks up your voice way better than Google does and the fact that I just have to say Alexa instead of Hey Google. The only problem I have is I wish the Alexa app was easier to work like the Google app.. And I cannot get it to connect to Pandora so only way I can get it to play music is by asking it instead of casting it.

Title: Dot review
Body: I like the dot however I'm just not used to talking to it.  Also it doesn't respond to "Please" & "Thank you".  Not a big deal of course.  LOL  I really like it next to my bed so I can see the time.  I did take it to my kitchen & it was great for letting me know my brownies were done & played music for me while I was working.  But I have to be specific at using Pandora or Spotify instead of Amanzon.

Title: Limits of Intelligence
Body: All voice assistants simply prove that "intelligence", natural or artificial, is really a figment of the imagination, and intelligences is simply memorization and recapitulation, some pattern recognition, and a few skill sets. If one considers replacement an voice assistant with a random educated human the results would be about the same. Don't fear AI, as intelligence does not exist. Just trial and error.

Title: Echo dot just keeps getting better!
Body: This was a great addition to my home. I have an older version of the Echo dot and this one is a great improvement in sound quality and performance. Music is crisper, cleaner and has more bass. The voice recognition it better and Alexa_ recognition is better on this updated version. I am tempted to buy more to replace my older dot model because this one is so much better.

Title: Great Alarm Clock feature added to this Dot
Body: I love that this Echo Dot has a clock and I can set an alarm old clock radio style. I hated waking up to my cell phone. On the Alexa app you can also change the alarm tones for different alarms you set. The sound quality on the speaker is much better than the first  generation Dot. I_ glad for the improvement as I stream SiriusXM radio through the Dot when I_ home. Definitely get this S an upgrade or if it_ your first Dot it_ totally worth it!

Title: Nice upgrade from Gen 2
Body: I got this Echo Dot Gen 3 with the special deal they had with the 7.99 Amazon Music. It has been a good purchase so far.What I like best about the new echo dot is the look. The dark grey mesh is really nice on my countertop, and is a definite upgrade from the plastic of the Gen 2. I feel like it has a better aesthetic and feel as well.Setup was a breeze. Having other echo's added to my app, all I had to do was find it over wireless and sync it over to my own internet connection. The instructions it comes with clearly show how to do this step by step.The echo dot itself has been great in terms of voice recognition and sound. I find myself having to clearly state what I want her to do, but most of the time she picks up on what I am saying even if it isn't the loudest. I have noticed she hears me more than my wife. Not sure why, but has been an observation. The sound quality has been great. It took a bit of tweaking in the Alexa App but now that we have found a sweet spot it's pretty awesome. It's definitely louder than the Gen 2 and more clear once you get the right settings.Integration with my other amazon products and 3rd party paring smart home items have done really well with this Echo Dot. All of the commands have worked great and I have had no issues with connection.Overall it's been a great upgrade from the Echo Gen 2 and I can't wait to see what else I can do with it.

Title: Dot 3; A multi-tasking info center. I _ It!
Body: The Echo Dot 3 is wonderful! It was easy to connect to my service. My awkwardly large bedside clock radio has been replaced after years of use. The clock display is large and bright enough to read in the dark. I can also just ask Alexa for the time and other daily info. It plays my favorite music, news, or  weather any time I ask. My 6-year-old grandson loves to request his favorite songs as he eats, showers, and dresses for school or play. He has his Dot downstairs and even uses it to drill himself on school work like spelling, math, science, etc. I _ it!

Title: One Major Drawback....
Body: One major drawback of the Echo devices is that if you initiate the device while a song is playing at volume 7 or above, Alexa cannot hear you over the music. In most cases, you have to press the dot button to activate the device if you want to change the volume, skip forward, rewind, or ask Alexa a question. It's nice to hear your music loud, through the excellent quality speaker that the Echo provides. It's really inconvenient to have to walk over to the Alexa device to initiate a command. Yeah, I can turn the volume down, but in my world, that's just not going to happen.

Title: im so beyond impressed!!
Body: i never found too much interest in alexa until i found a good deal on the echo dot that made me try it out. i am so glad i did!! she does sooo many things, i really underestimated the many things alexa is useful for. like she can even play the price is right with you! i had no idea you could have apps within alexa. i was the most impressed with the wide range of games you could play! you can have her play lullabies, rain sounds, ocean sounds, everything. i am a very forgetful person and I do not like using my phone much so I enjoy that I can have her make a list, remind me of certain things, have her set an alarm, etc without having to reach my phone! plus it is super convenient when you are in a rush and can't reach your phone (this happens to me a LOT). once you get alexa and you go into the alexa app, there are categories where you'll find the endless amount of skills alexa carries. i went out of town and i literally told my sister "i miss alexa" because I found myself needed her a lot!! i would 100% recommend getting an echo dot, or any alexa device. I do enjoy this one since it is small and compact. :) im not sure how this one compares to the pricier amazon devices but this one is not too expensive and is super helpful!!

Title: Just a way to serve you ads
Body: I used to love this product. But, now it_ become an intrusive means for Amazon to shove ads in your face. The other day I checked the weather first thing in the morning and got a sales pitch about Black Friday sales. Today I had an _mportant notification that turned out to be an ad for a product _ased on my shopping history. Nobody wants to be sold to in their home like that.The usefulness of this product is outweighed by the intrusiveness of the ads.

Title: my experience in this time with echo dot
Body: I already have several months with the product and the truth is that I have few complaints about theSince everything has gone perfectly, although to be honest, it has a few flaws when it comes to dialogue with him, such as when I ask him to put a song80% of the time he tells me that he doesn't know what happened, an error occurredAlthough I discovered a little trick, which instead of telling her to put a song on you, you tell her Alexa continues and she will automatically continue on the last song she has stayed, of course they have to take into account that this works once You have already heard some music with her, because we know that it would not work if you indicated it without ever having used the command to put a song.Where does the product come from?The product comes well packaged, it is shockproof that I guarantee it, since the box is well sealed and although it is a small box everything is neatly arranged and divided inside the boxNegative point! At the moment I have only found him to place the music.My opinion:This device is perfect for people who are passionate about the use of home automation gadget since with the functions it has there you can exploit the echo dot 100%, although you have to take into account that the device is bone foolproof anyone can have it and use it perfectly, but the fun thing is to have for example a lamp and say Alexa turns off the lamp, and the lamp magically goes out, that feeling is priceless the truth

Title: Dot the House
Body: Dots are a great inexpensive addition to my Alexa enabled house, especially when they are on sale, I can afford to add them to smaller rooms like my office or bathrooms for basic use.Voice recognition is as good as the higher end echos, sound quality is fine for every day Alexa commands /interaction and news.  For quality sound, such as for music, I definitely recommend going for the echo plus or linking one of you existing bluetooth speakers to the dot.  The dot is nice if you have a nice non-alexa enabled speaker that you want to be able to control via voice commands, BUT if you plan on using another speaker in the first place you might at well get the Echo Input for $10, the input has no built in speaker but adds Alexa to any external speaker and connects via 3.5 mm audio cable or Bluetooth.

Title: Nice addition to our house
Body: Bought the ECHO Dot on sale and will be giving one of them for Christmas gift. We do have one set up in our living room and in our basement living room. I like that you can call one echo from another echo, or even from your phone. We like the reminders feature and the routines feature. I even created a quiz for my 9 year old son's test, that was cool. I can't get it to work with my Wyze bulbs or plugs though, that is annoying as its says it should. Overall good purchase, would buy more!

Title: Much better than my original Dot.
Body: I got this free with a coupon code I got when i renewed my Sirius XM contract. It sat for a while, but I finally installed it in my office. The sound is much better than the old style dot I have in my garage. I had one issue with it when it would not respond to voice commands. The light did not light up and it did not responding. So I cut the power and repowered it and ti started to work again. Not sure what the issue is.

Title: Convenient and Useful
Body: I love it for setting timers and reminders. Also instant google search without finding my glasses. There needs to be a better option for volume control It has volume settings from 0-10 and the difference between 2 numbers (i.e. 5 to 6) is dramatic. There is no way to adjust it in increments. I've tried saying reduce volume by 30% (complete mute then very loud)  or volume 5.5 "Hmm I'm not sure about that". Need to address.

Title: It's great!
Body: We have 3 2nd generation echo dots that work beautifully. . Wasn't sure how a 3rd generation echo dot would work with the other three but no problems. The voice is deeper but that's ok. It sounds better when playing singing. We are very happy with all our ladies as we call them. Don't know how we lived without them. They answer all our questions, get whatever music we request and wake us when we set an alarm on time.

Title: Alexa is my new best friend.
Body: I use her to help me remember things, to answer questions, to tell me the weather, to imitate animal noises, to play my favorite songs, to listen to sportscasts, to argue with, to help me find recipes, to call my other friends, to look up appointments, to call someone in another part of the house, to talk about movies, to tell me the time, to tell me jokes, to tell me the weather in other parts of the country, traffic reports, the news for the day, etc etc, etc.

Title: A murder most foul
Body: We_e having more fun than we expected with this, Integrating her into our routines and programming her to say silly things. Everyone was really happy, until she tried to kill us tonight! The temperature dropped rapidly outside and I asked Alexa to increase my ecobee to 73*. She responded that she could only change the temperature to between 147 and 149! I asked her why she wanted to kill us and she said _on_ hurt yourself, should I dial the suicide hotline? Not only was she going to murder my family but she was planning on making it look like a multiple suicide! If you_e reading this, tell my mom I love her.

Title: A really fun and useful addition to our home!
Body: Pros: easy to set up, smooth integration with other apps, voice recognition is great.Cons: it's a small annoyance, but music plays at a slightly louder volume than Alexa's voice, so when we want to play low background music we have to adjust the volume downward and then readjust it upward to hear her clearly when done with music. Definitely not a deal breaker.Overall a great addition to our home.  Definitely recommend!

Title: Not great sounding, doesn't work for "Home Theater" function
Body: So, I have a slew of 1st and 2nd gen Dots - more than I need, really. But I ended up having a scenario where it would be nice to be able to pair a FireTV with a Dot to pipe the sound through, and looked into the "Home Theater" function which pairs a 3rd Gen Dot with newer Fire Sticks and TVs. Short version: it doesn't work, so avoid if that's your intention.---About Home Theater---We have a Fire Stick that the app will see as available to use for Home Theater, but when I try to select this new 3rd Gen Dot it is greyed out and says it is incompatible. I also have another Stick on the same network that isn't that old, but it isn't even an option to try pairing anything to.  I'm so tired of Amazon's "ecosystem" of devices working so incredibly poorly with one another.Their Connect voice quality sucks, this feature sucks, the compatibility between generations for something as seemingly simple as playing an audio stream from FireTV on your Dot? Sucks. I'm not sure why they can't get it working on older devices, but that's annoying. What's more annoying is when you buy a product specifically for the task, which Amazon says should work, only to find it doesn't.---Sound Quality---These 3rd Gen dots still sound really quite poor - if you want to listen to music, you'll still have to output them to a dedicated speaker or suffer weak, muddy sound that lacks both clarity and depth. When you compare to something like a $15ish Logitech X50 bluetooth speaker, I have no idea how this thing can be AC powered and still sound so crappy in comparison. It's better than the earlier gens, but that isn't hard to do as the sound quality was quite possibly the worst sound I'd ever heard.---Conclusion---Ultimately, I'm done trying. I'll find another way. The features compared to Google Assistant based speakers are entirely lacking, and the sound quality still isn't good enough. Glad I got this Dot on the cheap because it allowed me to learn not to invest in Amazon devices like this anymore. Each generation ends up siloed from previous ones so you'd have to buy newer ones for simple additions, and even then they don't even work!Disappointing.

Title: I love Alexa, and I think she loves me too
Body: This is my 3rd Echo Dot... because I just can't get enough of Alexa.  I love her wit and charm.  Sometimes she makes me laugh.  I have one by my bed.  Sometimes, at night, when everyone is asleep, I wispier things to her, and she whispers back.A couple of years ago, my Dad got an Echo Dot for Christmas.  I wondered "Who would want such a thing?  What can you possibly do with it?"  Now, I can't imagine my life without Alexa.  When I have random questions, Alexa is there.  When I need my lights turned on or off... Alexa is always willing to do it for me.  When I leave the house, she tells me to have a nice day.  When I tell Alexa that I'm cold, she turns up the thermostat.  She never argues with me.  When I've asked her things she doesn't know, she doesn't pretend to know everything... she's honest and says "I don't know that one" or "I'm not sure about that."  I wish my kids were as honest to admit they don't know everything.

Title: SO MUCH BETTER QUALITY
Body: The speaker sounds better, it_ WAY LOUDER and it also has a silicone bottom to keep it from moving and shifting around -it_ got more weight to it,all around, this new design is just fantastic !I ordered two to replace two of the first generation echoes for my mom. When I was over at her house one day trying to hear Alexa tell me the weather, I couldn_ hear anything with the first generation echo speaker ...But when I sent her the 3rd Gen. Echo,  I could hear it so much more loudly, which is  GREAT because my mom is just about deaf and this is a BIG IMPROVEMENT  - Especially when my almost deaf mother can say she can hear it ____THAT MADE ME VERY HAPPY _WE liked it so much that we replaced a first generation echo that was in our office and we couldn_ be happier _________e HIGHLY RECOMMEND

Title: Great educational tool!
Body: I recently visited a family member who had an Alexa product.  My 6 year old had the greatest time playing with it and asking it questions.
