During the Black Friday sale, I saw a great deal on the Echo Dot and decided it was time to get one for her.  I wasn't sure how it would work since it was a different model without the screen that my family member had.  However, I decided that we would give it a try since it was a lot cheaper.  I was so pleasantly surprised.  The echo dot is such a great educational tool.  I homeschool my daughter and am always looking for exciting ways to teach her and let her learn.  There are so many great skills that the Echo Dot/Alexa has.  I highly recommend it for anyone who likes to limit screentime but sees the value in the internet and electronic tools.  I have been able to let her use it to learn about animals, geography, practice her math facts, exercise (yes, exercise), and listen to books and music.  That is just in the time since I got it yesterday.  We are in love with the Echo Dot.

Title: Be careful
Body: I get extremely frustrated when I ask for simple information if I should look it up myself on Wikipedia. More often than not she will tell me "I'm not sure about that"It's extremely frustrating.She does connect with my Serious/XM acct. but I just don't think that's enough.The other night, we asked what movie won the Oscar in 1969 and she was unable to answer. Along with many more questions.We tried linking her to our WiFi tv which she didn't recognize, the same with our Bose headphones teven our cell phones.Unless you're willing to give up you're entire life to a little circular thing and have no privacy (you always have to be careful that her light isn't on) I wouldn't mindget this product. It looks great on TV but do you really want an object controlling your life like this?,

Title: Impressive Echo Dot
Body: This is my third Echo Dot, and it's the only one with the LED clock and weather feature. I thought it would be a great addition to my existing Echo Dot family, and I'm very pleased with it.One of its key features, that's probably accessible on my other Echo Dot's, is that, Alexa and I recite "The Lord's Prayer," each night before I go to bed. I'm so impressed by this Echo Dot that I plan on purchasing another one, sometime soon.I've always appreciated the sound quality, and various additions that Alexa can provide; including her jokes. However, the LED clock and weather display is a great feature to utilize on Echo Dot's, in my opinion.

Title: Consumerism at your service.
Body: Bought this device with the intention of using it as a white noise machine and speaker in my newborn_ nursery. Let me say, the last thing you want to deal with while attempting to calm a screaming baby is a klunky AI that has no concept of simplicity. The audio options are severely limited by the level of subscriptions you pay for and even then, you never are certain of what you_e going to get when you ask for _alming lullabies.  Key words and command seem to be prioritized to trigger advertisements or plugs for premium skills and services. The reality of the full line of Alexa devices is to annoy you with the limitations of free services and in doing so, subconsciously influence and motivate you to pay to unlock the full potential of the device.

Title: Guessing at music was work
Body: Trying to figure what music to request  and then waiting to find out what Alexa would respond with became tedious.  It is much easier to grab an album and play it.  Also, there are times when Alexa goes into hiding.  For example, I'll ask for the temperature before I leave the house.  Alexa will flash some lights and not respond.  I'll repeat the request a few more times at difference speeds and tones, the same thing happens.  So, I'll grab my Samsung tablet, hit the weather app which responds immediately.That said, when it works properly it does some things worthwhile.  My conclusion is that robotics is a field with an impressive future and we are at the 1st of a hundred steps.  So, I will stay tuned and keep my tablet handy.

Title: Nice compliment to Echo, but check subscription to paid services
Body: The unit does what it says and the sound quality is very good (not exceptional), with enough volume to hear in the unit in the shower.  The call/intercom feature is cool.  My only negative 'surprise' was that I can't leverage the 2 million songs, and other paid features, on the dot without upgrading to multi-unit/family subscription.  I was my bad for not investigating...but I really didn't 'read' the 1-unit original agreement since I upgraded my original echo via 'voice'.  Not sure if the $4/month is really worth it just yet.  You can listen to things like radio stations (which i can on my....radio) and other features such as iheart radio that I can't get on my regular radio, so that is a plus.

Title: Have an issue with all the bass
Body: This is going to sound weird, but...I wasn't as happy with this newer generation version as I was with my older Dot! I think it's because when I listen to music on this Dot, I think it sounds muddy and too bassy. I like the vocals, and it seems it makes the vocals way too bassy I contacted Amazon about this. The Echos didn't have equalizer capabilities.  I believe now they have a program that addresses this, but....its another extra COST!  No, thank you! If you like a lot of bass as you listen to your music, you will probably like this newer Dot.

Title: Love my Dot
Body: I was pretty skeptical that a device this small could produce a decent sound, but I was pleasantly surprised. The Dot actually sounds really good out of the box. I was impressed, but I still used the Aux out to connect it to my Bose Acoustic Radio, and now it's AMAZING!!Setup could have been a little easier but it wasn't too bad. The Dot had a hard time with my 5G network. I finally just connected it to the 2.4 and it worked well.I like to voice recognition. It's kinda funny but when I say the wake-up word the Dot looks at me like a short, blue eyed Cylon. Very entertaining.I am very, very happy with this purchase and highly recommend it.

Title: Just buy the damn thing. You won't regret it
Body: Cons: Can't change the voice; has a dirty word filter that I can't find a way to deactivate; an option exists to change the wake word (Alexa by default), but it can only be changed to a very short list of very unappealing words.Pros: Great for asking weird, random things when you're bored. Busy schedule? No worries! Alexa will keep track of all your appointments and events, give you reminders, and serve as your alarm clock. She'll tell you the time when asked, tell you about the weather and what you can expect for the week.She plays me my favorite songs, tells me bedtime stories, or just plays some pleasant sleep sounds. She can crack the occasional joke, and even passes gas from time to time.Having multiple echo dot devices, or other Alexa compatible speakers in your home can make communicating with individuals, or everyone at once throughout your home as easy speaking to a little speaker on the counter.She's very handy for hands-free movie selection on my firestick. Yay!And can even be used to control various lights, some appliances, and even control the temperature in my home.She never allows the NSA agent listening to interrupt my life, as I'm sure sometimes he is dying to chime in with how disgusting some recipes I've requested from Alexa sounds, or to complain of the stupid questions I ask, such as: Alexa, how many milliseconds until Christmas? What is the average size of a man's....well, you know.

Title: New large proprietary plug interferes with some outlets
Body: Comparing to gen 1 dot: better sound quality, better weight (doesn't get yanked off if you bump cord), looks have drastically improved. Where it falls short is the new proprietary cord. Gen 1 used a simple micro usb cable. This version has a cord attached to a relatively large power converter, meaning I cant use it where I want to because it interferes with other cords. (I have an outlet with 2 standard plugs and 2 usb plugs, and the large plug on this dot covers the usb sections)

Title: Better Than Google Home
Body: I am a convert from Google Home. Alexa is so much more pleasant and the deals Amazon officers on devices is great. Echo is connected to my TV with Logitech Harmony Hub, my lights with Samsung SmartThings, and can even turn my Christmas tree off and on. The speaker sounds pretty good despite the size and my husband can use his Spotify, and I can use my Amazon Music to stream. We even ordered Chipoltle by just asking Alexa! Give it a try for the price!

Title: Alexa is what's been missing in my home.
Body: I have ubiquitous Alexa throughout my home. Kids use it in the morning to prep for the weather. Wife uses it throughout the day for to-do lists, shopping lists, and reminders. My job is to set up all the cool routines and enable all the IoT Smart Home ideas I can think of. These Echo's are amazing, brilliant, and practically free at this point! Alexa is another member of the family, and I catch myself saying please to her.more.often than I should.

Title: I'm a convert.
Body: I generally resist new tech, but we've been wanting to get something for my mother-in-law, who is a recent widow. We wanted her to be able to call us without needing her phone or the expense of the "well-known" helper. The 3 for 1 deal was irresistible. Now she has one in each of her rooms, and we have 1 to reach her directly. She was worried Alexa wouldn't be able to understand her accent, but so far, so good, and she says she loves it. Sound quality is excellent (tho I'll be honest, I'm easy to please).

Title: Great source for music
Body: I purchased this item to use as a music source in my bedroom.  I love having the ability to play music while I am working around in the room, in the mornings when I am getting ready for work, and in the evenings when I am relaxing.  I realize there are a lot of features I have not utilized yet and look forward to using it in a more sophisticated way.  I have not watched TV since I got the Echo.  I recommend it for relaxation

Title: So cool
Body: I never had something like this and this version works great. Easily recognizes requests. Although not the smartest. I get a lot of, "I don't know that one". But really like it otherwise. Sound quality is superb long as you don't turn the volume to high. I have the bass and treble at factory settings and it sound good.Much smaller than I expected. Nicely blends into the surroundings.

Title: Seems glitchy
Body: Overall enjoying our new Echo Dot, but it seems to have some random glitches. Things like music is playing and I request ALEXA ADD TO specific PLAYLIST, and it responds no music appears to be playing (not exact response but something similar)  Other times I request something be added to a playlist and response is it can't locate the playlist.Responses are immediate, so I don't think it is caused by our sometimes sketchy internet.

Title: Works perfectly with smart plug.
Body: We have 2 dogs and needed an easier way to disarm the garage door (cut off electric) Iam using the dot and Amazons smart plug to control my garage door. Dot connected quickly to my router and the plug to the dot. Via blue tooth. Now, I just tell alexa to _urn off or on the garage door as needed. The phrase can be changed to anything. Turn on the light, coffee pot etc.

Title: Alexa is my new best friend
Body: I got this as a bundle with a smart bulb as a Christmas present for myself.  It_ been a joy listening to podcasts and music on it, as well as getting the lights turn on just by saying the magical phrase.  I_ still learning all of the bells & whistles but I_ really impressed.  The set up was easy and the sound quality is great!

Title: Great tool for in the bedroom or anywhere in your home
Body: I debated whether to buy this. Now that it_ installed into my bedroom, I_ very pleased. Now I have an alarm clock in my bedroom and the ability to play music when I get out of bed in the morning. If I wake up in the middle of the night I can ask Alexa what time it is. Pretty cool! Privacy you_e concerned about? She has an off button!

Title: I love it! I wish I had gotten an Echo sooner.
Body: I took advantage of Amazon_ Black Friday pricing and being able to split up payments to order one along with some gifts for those on my list. I figured for such a low initial amount, I_ try it_tarting with one. After setting it up and streaming my favorite music, getting the weather, news and being able to get an answer to most of the dumb questions my family can make up, ordered four more. I_e set them up through the house to use as an intercom, and got one to give to friends. Like a cell phone I don_ know how we lived before having the Echo Dot and wish I had ordered them sooner. I really love it! I have a smart plug coming to see how it interacts with Alexa and play around with it before getting more. I really like that it can be used to make calls_hich helps out since we don_ have a landline phone at the house. The units can be paired with Bluetooth speakers and your cell phone can be connected to play music. I haven_ hooked one via the 3.5mm jack to a sound system but may later on for a party or something. It_ handy as an alarm clock and timer too. I like that you can set reminders. Just don_ say the word _uy around it, stuff will get added to your Amazon shopping cart. Thanks to my mom and brother and I nearly wound with a metal shed and have been trying to train them on how to interact with it. It struggles a little with an Appalachian accent and a deaf parent who has a hard time pronouncing words, we_e working on getting it used to it. It_ definitely worth it and buy several if you get one. Amazon has a deal that ends later this December where you can get one for $0.99 if you subscribe to the Unlimited Music_ffectively knocking $15 off the current price (24.99 as of this review). Now is the time to get one!

Title: Great Speaker
Body: I bought this while Amazon was having a deal, subscribe to Amazon Music get and Amazon Echo Dot for $1. Golly! What a deal, so I bite and make the purchase, with absolutely every intention of cancelling the music subscription after the first month. I already had a Google Home mini and had been a faithful Pandora subscriber for the past 3 years. Once I got the speaker set up physically and on my phone, I realized a few things about the speaker. It was much louder then my other speaker. I don't have to ask the speaker over and over again hoping she heard me this time. Overall its a great speaker and I love the music app. I'm so glad I decided to buy this and switch my speaker and my music subscription. It honestly makes sense since I've been shopping on Amazon for the past 5 years, why not have a speaker already connected to my most used and favorite shopping website. Ever if I missed the chance to purchase this speaker for essentially $9, I would still pay full price for it now,

Title: Simply amazing and easy to use!
Body: Oh my gosh these little gadgets are great! Since my Mom bought me my first Alexa it_ opened up a whole lot of possibilities for integration for whole home management. I have some smart plugs that I use with it. Alexa has made my holiday decorating more awesome because now all my interior lighting can be managed with voice commands. The skills make it even more fun because I can program her to turn on my Christmas lights by saying _erry Christmas. That will be so fun for the kids! I also really enjoy the _uard feature. I didn_ know how much of a peace of mind it would be until I started using it. To me, _uard makes it totally worth the price all by itself. I love the Alexa so much that I bought three more as gifts for Christmas this year!

Title: Great for Memory Care Residents
Body: Fantastic purchase! I am a huge Echo fan and have a show and two spots in my home. This was purchased for my mom_ birthday gift (she resides in a nursing home due to memory, mobility and other issues). She loves her _ew friend and has been asking her tons of questions (ie when the Berlin Wall was built, what the weather forecast is, how old Barry Manilow is etc). She is also enjoying the drop in feature when I drop in on her. Great tool to help those with memory issues get answers to questions. Since the device is on my account I can check the activity and see all the things she has been asking Alexa!

Title: Need some assistance I guess
Body: Love this thing. I only gave _er 3 stars because she_ linked to my husband_ Spotify and I_e done everything it says to switch to mine, even did a factory reset, but it hasn_ worked. My husband listens to music at work. Everytime I try to listen to a song through it, it turns THAT song on, on HIS phone and cuts off his music. When he changes the song back, it goes back to HIS song through Alexa. Not really a good thing when you_e at home with 3 kiddos and trying to goof around, then Eminem pops up cursing out MGK. They thought it was funny though and I enjoyed changing my husbands song to Swagger Jagger by Cheryl.

Title: Bummed
Body: I was really excited to get my Alexa.  I use her everyday and she doesn_ respond immediately at times. I sometimes have to say her name numerous times even if I am standing right next to her. She also periodically shuts off. I have tried trouble shooting and resetting. I am at the point of just throwing her out. So bummed! Maybe I should have bought the newer model.

Title: Works fabulous
Body: Bought this as a gift for my daughter because she absolutely loves music and I wanted something that could sing Christmas songs and read us stories as we snuggle up on the couch together. Really love it! My son also enjoys it too! He asks Alexa all kinds of questions and I do believe I_l be ordering one for him for his birthday so he can have his own

Title: Love Alexa!
Body: Living alone,  Alexa is a nice way to wake up and say "Good Morning Alexa" - she then rattles for about a minute about a fact of the day and even adds some humor to it.  When I come home - I say "Alexa I'm home" - she then welcomes me home.  And of course, there's always those silly questions you can ask her at anytime.  I don't have electronics to hook her to like turning on lights - TV or other things but still a fun addition to my home to keep me entertained.  For the money -- I highly suggest you get one of these for anyone who lives alone - it's just fun since after all - my two cats don't talk but Alexa does !!  FUN ~

Title: Seems to have hearing problems, often!
Body: Quite a lot of features and usually works well, but it seems to have a lot of hearing problems quite often. Unplugging and plugging back in seems to help, but I don't feel I should have to do this as often as I do. I really like that it can guard your home when you leave; I just wish it was sensitive to more than just smoke detectors and breaking glass. I have come home and forgot to tell Alexa I was home, thus my devices are still "guarding" my home and actively listening. Apparently, any other noises do not set off any alarms with the device.

Title: Nice but ...
Body: Bought one almost a year ago, and for some unknown reason it stopped connecting to my WiFi.  After countless calls and multiple chats with Amazon to try to get it to work, they finally gave up and credited me the replacement cost (but not what I paid).  Kudos to Amazon for finally doing the right thing.  Very disappointed that it "died"--electronics like this should not really die. Fortunately it was still in the one-year warranty.  Would have been really pissed if it died a month later.

Title: Great sound quality
Body: I purchased an Echo some months back and wanted an Echo Dot for my camper in the summer. Setup pretty much does itself and the sound quality is almost as good as the full sized Echo. The only think I would like to see different is for me to be able to customize the name of the device and be able to rename it to a name I could choose and not just one of the four names the Alexa app has available. My great grandson's name is Alex so I had to change the name as it was hearing people every time they called Alex. Keep up the good work Amazon.

Title: More than marvelous!!!
Body: I look myself as a child with this toy. It is good to ply with it although it is very useful. I bought an special bulb for my lamp no too expensive and every night when I am goingo to prepare to sleep I say Alexa turn on the light and I finish my preparation to sleep I say Alexa until tomorrow then she repeats a Bible thought I have configured previously and play for 2 hours instrumental music that I also configurated. It is wonderful because she does many things more.

Title: I'm impressed.
Body: I bought a few Alexa enabled devices this past Black Friday and I'm hooked. I get my weather and news report while I brush my teeth. My lights are activated by my voice. I can turn on/off the Christmas tree and coffee pot, and listen to a podcast or music with my echo smart speaker. One surprise I didn't know it was capable of was guarding my home by listening for smoke detectors or glass breaking while I'm away. Yeah I'm a fan of these little smart things.

Title: Love how easy it is to use.
Body: I bought this as an experiment, to see if I would enjoy streaming music in the dining room, and I love it.  It picks up my voice much further away than I thought it would.  Five minutes to set up and start using, paired with Alexa app on my phone.  I'm thinking of getting another one for my bedroom to use when I have lots of music filing to do in there.  The sound is kind of small, but clear.  I purchased a sound bar designed for pcs and I'm using that to fill the large room and little better.

Title: Voice recognition not as good as 2nd gen
Body: Seems like 3rd gen has issues picking up voice as sometimes I end up having to yell _lexa several times for it to hear me, regardless of volume level. Don_ have that issue with 2nd gen. Good sound quality though and still use it everyday.

Title: It spies on you
Body: It listen when you don_ want it too and send info to amazon.  I got this free when I bought something else on amazon. Never wanted it and plan on giving it away or destroying it.  I_ be surprised if amazon let this review go through.

Title: Love my Alexa
Body: I love my Alexa! Easily set it up myself (67 year old woman, average tech-savy). The shopping list is awesome, love the music she plays (great selection of Beatles and Rolling Stones songs), love the temperature and weather, love her setting a timer for the kitchen, etc. The only thing I haven't figured out is the calendar integration with my iPhone, but I will. Definitely recommend.

Title: Dont buy without a warranty
Body: Do not buy this product without a warranty. I bought one 4 months ago and today it randomly stopped working. I hardly ever used it, but today in the middle of a song it just stopped working. Tried all the troubleshooting methods, nothing worked, call Amazon to replace it they said my limited warranty expired in October, and offered a measly 15% despite the website saying I could return it by June 2020. I never have problems with any of my orders but I am very unpleased with this, I purchased 3 dots this week for gifts, but I will be sending all 3 back

Title: It took minutes to set up.
Body: After trying out my step mother Echo Dot (3rd Gen), it turned a septic into a believer and I just had to have one of my own. I just love it. It took minutes to set up. I have already brought some for friends.The only thing you need to know as a windows 10 user there is know app for the Echo. In order to set it up you need to go to alexa.amazon.com. Any additional set up will need to be done there also.

Title: One Alexa to rule them all... well 2, I own 2
Body: I have both the 2nd and 3rd generation now, and the speakers on this one are way more intense. I do reccomend you doing the voice recognition to help her learn. The technology has come a long way and yes, there are moments when you just wanna throw her across the room, but remember... each day it learns more and she remembers. She knows almost everything and when the technology come back to take over the world, Pinky, she will remember you. Other than that it's a great fun product to have and easy to use and I love turning my house (lights, tv, fan, lamps, coffee maker etc.) on and off with her. Enjoy! __

Title: Sometimes, in the Everywhere mode, two different songs are played
Body: It seems that the Echo's do not integrate well.  The way I am using my four Echo's is as a single speaker system, with only one Echo serving as the host to receive commands.  In this setup, there are times that the songs being played are different between the 'host Echo' and the other three--with the host playing one song and the other three together playing a different song.  Another problem is that the 'system' seems to act as if it has been playing a station even when it is commanded to be off---not that anyone hears it but it seems to continue to stream---and then when the host receives a command to play a particular station it just continues playing the station that was previously playing---picking up in the middle of a song.  You've still got 'bugs' that need to be worked out.

Title: They work good for smart home, tvs, lights and music
Body: We use it to control a lot of things in our house, play music in the gym, kitchen, nursery, bathroomControls smart plugs connected to Christmas tree and Christmas lightsLights, tvs, oven,You can use it as intercom and drop in on other rooms or listen in on babyAny questions I have I can look up or contact support

Title: Big fan of Alexa
Body: We don_ even use all the features Alexa is capable of but Alexa replaced all our alarm clocks and is a great resource for basic questions. We have one in kitchen and bedrooms, I like asking Alexa cooking questions when I have my hands full. Also great for communicating with family upstairs without having to scream across the house

Title: Terrific Companion for my Mom
Body: She loves the ability to ask for music, check the weather, request a joke, set a time while cooking, confirm the time on the West Coast, etc. etc. It really is a terrific always available, smart companion. And it doesn't take up a lot of space, and the speaker sounds terrific. Overall very happy and would recommend.

Title: Wonderful device for $25 but has some annoyances
Body: Overall I enjoy using the echo dot as a temporary toy. We've spent hours goofing around with it, listening to music, asking it silly questions, setting reminders etc. There are some glaring items of improvement for me though.1. STOP PLAYING LIVE MUSIC. If I want live music I would deliberately request it. On 25% of the songs I've wanted to play, Alexa starts playing a live version or a cover version of a song, and with the live versions I can't find a way to tell her to play the studio version of the songs. I almost never want to hear live music from a stream so please change that. I've had to tell Alexa STOP way too many times because she starts playing a live version of a song and I just don't want to hear it.2. This device needs a power off button. Not a mute button, not a "don't disturb" function, an actual turn off button. When I don't want to use Alexa, I don't want it on and it's a pain plugging and unplugging it over and over again. If I mute the device, then this glowing red ring lights up and burns electricity. To those people who don't care about your privacy and trust Amazon completely, I don't need to hear about just leaving it on and unmuted because Alexa won't "activate" unless you use the wake up word, I don't care. I want the device off and without power. I know the development teams have gone through the rounds and have chosen to not include one. I'm asking them to reconsider.3. The sales pitches. If we're prime members, can we get a function to turn off "ads"? Every time I request a song, Alexa needs to tell me it's playing from Amazon music. This is unnecessary and annoying. Also because I don't have Amazon music, every time I play a song that's not part of the included 2 million song catalog, Alexa goes into the same spiel about how I can sign up for Amazon music and the free trial. I got it the first 30 times Alexa, the answer is still no, stop repeating it.It's a cute toy to play around with, but this device clearly presents itself as a way for Amazon to constantly pitch its products and services to you, and they've made it to where turning it off is a chore. I'm sure more functionality and features are on the way, hopefully Amazon decides to consider some of my above proposals. A lot more people would jump on board and use the devices more often if they did.

Title: Oh my gosh! For such a small little girl, Alexa has a big presence!
Body: I have three Amazon Alexa products not including the Echo Auto (which really needs to be improved) and I love every one of my little Alexa girls. I am a dog sitter and I had a puppy tangle with my original Alexa in my living room and the puppy one. This time I got the 3rd generation Dot and I'm so glad I did. The setup was easier than the originals and the voice recognition and quality is so much better than my original Dots. I love this little sucker! I got the dark gray and it is absolutely invisible on a dark gray etagere in my living room which is what I wanted. It has such a low profile but a large chunk of electronics inside that work beautifully.  You know what's weird? for only 3 days I didn't have a working Alexa downstairs in my house. And for three days I missed asking all those questions during the day. it kind of makes me laugh when I think about it, because I didn't realize how much I used it until it wasn't there. From the temperature outside to what time a store down the street closed to how old somebody is that I saw on television. Yep. This is my addiction and I'm proud of it!

Title: Affordable and creating routines and linking skills makes for an enjoyable hobby.
Body: I have recently been introduced to the Echo system and, although there is a learning curve, I enjoy adding skills and routines to the Echo. I now have five in my household due the the affordable prices offered during Black Friday. The Dot is well built and sufficiently heavy not to be easily knocked off a nightstand or desk. As others have noticed, the sound quality is not that of the larger Echos, but I find it perfectly adequate for listening to radio and music while working in my home office. After experimenting with the 3rd generation Dot I added the upgraded model that has a clock face, as well as the smaller Show 5, which has a display. The only negative comments I would make are that Alexa does not always understand my commands. But I have alleviated some of that by giving smart home devices simple, short names. I am also impressed with the connectivity to the Apple world allowed via the Alexa app for iOS. Highly recommended.

Title: NIghtmare
Body: Like so many things, it's great when it works.  But with the Alexa products  when there's a problem - it's a nightmare.  I just spent 1 1/2 hours getting into my Alexa App because I took my dot with me when I went to my son's house for two weeks.  OMG.  Only 1 1/2 lines of the authentication characters showed.  How can you enter characters you can't see?  After that it was a good twenty minutes navigating how to get a phone call from the Alexa people - and then another 20 trying to navigate the prompts without getting cut off.  Third time was a charm, I finally got a person!  This person eventually checked with her supervisor and was eventually able to connect me with someone in the right department.  The new person was very nice and hung in there with me and in only about another half hour my dot was finally connected.  The good news is that it finally worked and the woman was very professional.  The really bad news is that it shouldn't be anywhere near this difficult!  I'm done buying echo products.

Title: A Great Improvement
Body: The sound is a great improvement over the version 2.I am not someone who is particularly picky about sound quality and was quite satisfied with the sound quality of the Dot 2. I have one Echo and sevaral Dots - one in every room. When the Dot 3 price dropped to $22 i thought i'd try it just to see the difference.  And what a difference it is. The sound is a notable improvement - louder, purer, more mellow.Besides being radio, clock, alarm, weather thermometer, and information source, Alexa controls a living room light, porch light, grow lamps for indoor plants, and home thermostat. Alexa has become an indispensible part of my life.

Title: Works as intended, mostly
Body: Nice sleek design that leaves a small footprint  Adding the easy install wall mountvallowas you to put it in a convent location. Some small issue with voice commands like stop, which has to often be repeated twice but overall a very good item. Have been to set up multiple routines with ease. Runs my smart lights and iRobot and easily finds my favorite rasio stations or music apps. However, integration with the echo connect has been a nightmae. Disconnects mid call for no apparent reason, hence the 4stars. Don_ know if this is a dot issue or a connect issue.

Title: Excellent Buy
Body: love it... So many positive things to say about this product for anyone looking for assistance in the home... Alexa does so many things. This is a great item for elderly,disabled and the entire family! So much you can do with this!!! I would give 10 stars if i could. Alexa  does it all... monitors our home when we go out, turns on and off the lights, tv and outlets, tells the weather, she has skills that help nearly everyday living... plus fun skills for kids and all ages.... I highly recommend this product for anyone looking to simplify their daily routine.

Title: Vastly better sound
Body: This is a nice upgrade over gen 2. The sound is significantly better this time around. I mean, not a subtle difference. The gen 3 really seems to project sound while the gen 2 was struggling to be heard.Same Alexa problems (she isn't great with questions). Also still finicky about interrupted connections. I have to pull the plug then plug it back in occasionally when my DSL is being unreliable.It's a bit bigger than gen 2 as well, so I doubt any accessories from gen 2 would work with this revision

Title: Way better sound than the 1st & 2nd generations.
Body: I was amazed at how much better the sound is in this device compared to the 1st & 2nd generation Dot. It's night and day difference. When you get it up to a very high volume, you can tell where it could stand to improve, such as in the full Echo. That's to be expected. Though at low to medium volume, you'll be very happy with it. Sounds good. Knowing this, I'd probably turn away from a full $99 Echo next time and go with this. I now plan to upgrade from the 1st & 2nd gen Dots in my house with this new one.

Title: Dimmer
Body: I absolutely love the new Echo Dot with the alarm clock. The only thing I don_ and it_ minor, is the dimmer capability on the display. I wish there was a way that you could set it for evening to be one level and day time another level. The only option is for it to auto self adjust and I would like to be able to set it for day and night separately and leave it at those two settings. Other than that it is great! Sound quality, accuracy, features, pairing other items with it all are great.

Title: Good sound and fun for family
Body: I have been using my echo dot for the last two weeks and it is great!! Sound quality is way better than I would expect from this tiny device.. voice recognition is good but needs improvement. It is sometimes having hard time understanding comments when there is bakcground noise.. and not sure if it is specific to my wifi/location of echo dot but I had multiple times that it lost connection and reconnected.. it is frustrating but can live with it.. all members of my family loves to interact with Alexa and it is quite fun.. definitely recommending to everyone..

Title: The Echo Dot is really fun to work with
Body: I never really wanted one of these but for .99 my oldest son talked me into getting it and I love it.  I ordered 2 days ago and recieved it today. The packaging was great. Easy setup on my pc and I have been playing with it all day. I don't have much right now to connect her too but she still answers all my questions and plays what music I want her to play from Amazon Music and my iHeart Radio. She even told my 2 year old grandson a cute little story after asking him what is name was, his favorite color and favorite animal. She also can read your books to you which is awesome. I plan on getting light bulbs and other devices to use with her but for now I am really satisfied with what I purchased.

Title: One of the best purchases I_e made in awhile.
Body: Have enjoyed having the Alexa dot in our living room, my mom liked it so much that she got one for her bedroom. I was thinking of getting one for my bedroom but it didn_ make sense with the type of alarm I had since it also played music. As soon as I saw this one I snapped it up! I love it! One of the best things about it is how the time adjusts to the lighting of the room, the way it dims when the lights are off make for a very nice sleeping environment.

Title: It_ useful when prodded and you finally work out the integration bugs.
Body: Swore I_ never get anything that would sit there and listen to me but I did Lol. I still have my concerns but I live alone so it_ not hearing much. It_ got superior sound quality compared to the google speaker but I have issues with finding stuff. I usually have to ask it 5 different ways before I get the answer I already know the answer to. I_ just testing it to see if I should give it to my 22 year old...or maybe I_l keep it haha. Hooking it up to Spotify took forever.

Title: Simple Setup, the experience is an 8.5/10
Body: Surprisingly good sound quality! One dot won_ wow you, but if you buy them and put the around your house, the volume is adequate with surprising clarity with the bass. It_ not THUMPING but is clear at casual listening levels.My biggest issue is the inability to use more than one Spotify account with the Alexa system at home.Using the household profiles doesn_ switch Spotify profiles for some reason. Alexa will switch profiles but still play from the same Spotify account.The only workaround I_e found so that my wife and I are not kicking each other off the same account is to download my main playlists and use Spotify offline while I_ not home and she has full range to stream while at home.We have the family plan and Alexa WILL NOT change spotify profiles, or at least not YET. I_ sure an update will fix that shortly.

Title: Awesome little speaker with Alexa!
Body: A friend has the big Echo and we were playing with it.  When I saw this deal for under $9 bucks I had to get it.  The sound is really good for such a small speaker!  Asking Alexa to play songs, albums, what the temperature or weather is can be fun!  You just ask Alexa to play your favorite songs,  artists, a genre of music, even remixes! Have her tell you a joke even!  I was a bit skeptical at first, but the sound is very good and it's fun!

Title: It was time to leave the past behind.
Body: I decided it was time to join the 21st century and get rid of my 20 year old clock radio when I woke up in a panic the morning Day Light Savings ended thinking I was late after looking at my clock radio.  Having the Echo Dot is great.  It has all the functionality of Alexa and I still have the time display so I know what time it is if I wake up in the middle of the night.  One of the main reasons I kept my clock radio for so long.  Being able to wake to Jeremy Clarkson and the guys from The Grand Tour yelling at me is just the icing on the cake.  Money well spent!!!

Title: Would definitely buy again!
Body: This does everything! Great little gizmo! Very helpful and is getting smarter by the day. Recognizes my voice with ease. Would only change two things: I have another one of these that I gave to my mom, she_ in a different part of the house in her bedroom and her Echo doesn_ recognize her voice, instead it calls her by my name and 2nd, the drop in function is by far my favorite, because of wonderful safety uses, but the mic volume is too low. When Mom and I use this feature, it is not always the easiest to hear the other person.

Title: Creating a smart house, one Alexa at a time.
Body: I love all the Alexa compatible devices that I own. I work from home and don't have anyone to talk to, so she is my main companion during the day until hubby gets home. Sounds silly, I know. But the dot is a great addition to the house; we set it up in the kitchen. It's great for listening to music while making breakfast, learning about traffic before my hubby leaves for work, and a variety of other things that I find useful on almost a daily basis.

Title: Great stereo sound, linked
Body: I bought 2 of these so I have stereo sound in the living room and the master bedroom. I didn_ link the other one but I like having it in the back bedroom for when I use the air dyne.  Such a nice addition for anyone who loves music or has a smart home. I don_ use this for my cams but if I wanted to, I could with another alexa accessory.  Nice app once you play with it and customizable it.

Title: Makes my life easier
Body: I am always finding new ways to have fun with my Echo's! This week I discovered that I can use them as an intercom system - even from my phone when I am at work to "talk" to family members who are in the living room, or my guy upstairs in the bedroom! You just tell your alexa app which Dot you want to communicate with and it makes it so easy!!! Love love love my Echo Dots!

Title: Easy to setup and use.
Body: Easy to connect to your home wifi. I wish I could add rename each and use them as 2 way intercom type. I know you can use commands lime announce and it will to all my 4 dots. Other than that playing music is ok because there are other devices with small architecture that have much nicer much more powerful output. I do like the Bluetooth integration but is limited.

Title: I "thought" i wouldnt like it...
Body: First off My echo dot vocier recognition is amazingthe call feature really loud and clear... doesn't hang up on accident or anythingAlexa doesn't randomly speak without being spoken none of that weird "talking to it self stuff"Wonderful purchase use it with my Christmas lights and house lights and morning coffee!!! I like it a lot frfr and you will to

Title: The device that just keeps getting better and better with each revision
Body: Okay so first off I'd like to say that I had a gen 1 echo for a few years now and it finally burnt out and I missed it so I purchased this gen 3 thinking it was going to be the same quality as the echo one, I was completely wrong the weight of this device is a lot more than the old echo device the size of it is a little bit bigger in diameter and has a much much better speaker in it. I was amazed at the quality of the audio that came out of that little device almost comprable to Bose integration is exactly the same as the Gen 1 and Gen 2 it's very easy as long as you follow the directions the power cord I noticed is alot beefier for this one I would say it's almost double the size of the old one. How this differs is this is an actual circular power plug that being said you cannot hook this up to any USB device to power it like you could with the gen ones this does have a small quarter inch headphone jack to allow you to put speakers externally to it. I did notice this is much louder than the old generation 1 echoes and much clearer. And with Amazon offering them for around $25 I'm just going to say you're a fool if you don't purchase one they even make set up very easy if you choose to have them add it to your existing account. That being said all you have to do is connected to Wi-Fi and you're done. I would recommend purchasing the smart lights and smart outlets to use with this that's how I found the most use out of this device and I've been using this for years you can literally connect almost any smart device to the echo so that it can be voice controlled. I currently use this for lights in my house as well as outlets plus I have it control outdoor Christmas lights on a timer which is also hooked up to music through prime music that being said there is just an amazing amount of uses for this product and it seems like they just keep getting better and better and better. Because they invented this voice control I guess you could say I would stick with them over Google or any of the other companies that may provide these devices I have never been a huge Amazon fan but they have actually done something fantastic with these devices. I think at least every home should have at least one of them. And if privacy is your main concern don't worry laws are in place that prevent the company from snooping in on your private data.Amazon really doesn't want a billion dollar class action lawsuit on them so they take this seriously. I purchased one for my wife and will probably be purchasing a few more to send to my kids so they can enjoy the device as I have enjoyed it

Title: Sound Quality
Body: I'm of an age where my hearing is going.... Sigh....  I have a couple of Echo Dots, a 2 and a 3. Because of hearing loss, I much prefer the '2' over the 3.  I need no bass, and high treble, and '2' fits the bill here.With the 3, right out of the box, it is so 'bassy' I just hear an annoying low frequency rumble, which is almost impossible to understand.  I spent many hours looking for tone controls to set bass low and treble high but the '3' doesn't seem to have this capabilty.  I did find a comment somewhere that others are experiencing this, and that both bass and treble can be adjusted by asking alexa to 'set bass to minimum' and 'set treble to maximum' (IIRC these were the commands) but the sound quality for me is still way to blurry and fuzzy.  I would have returned it except it is fine for other members of the family (and grandkids).So, my recco is that if you're experiencing age-related hearing loss, think twice before you buy one...

Title: my news brief "is not available" after 2 minutes...
Body: I've accumulated numerous Echo devices ever since I was given the opportunity to purchase the 1st generation Echo at the pre-production price of $99 a few years back.  Always impressed and always satisfied until I purchased the 3rd generation Echo Dot with Clock and added it to my home network.  In spite of all of my other Echoes continuing to work just perfectly, this particular 'Dot with Clock' will provide my new brief but after ~2 minutes the news story (in progress) simply stops and I am informed that "---- is not available at this time".  Not sure if this is a conspiracy or if it is a glitch in the software for this Dot... Either way, it is disappointing, and none of the online solutions are helpful as I've deleted, re-added, reset and renewed the Dot and all of my news subscriptions.  It's a nice clock and it does play music (I'm a Prime member) stations, but I have always looked forward to my news brief each morning and this has definitely been a disappointment.

Title: OK, but glad I bought it at a discount
Body: The Echo Dot is OK, but just OK. I bought it to use as a speaker for my Kindle Fire. Setup was more of a hassle than I expected. Setup isn't particularly complex, but some steps took multiple tries. Also, the Echo seems to lose its connection to the Fire after periods of inactivity. This isn't a big deal. I just unplug the Echo Dot and it re-connects when I plug it back in. The biggest problem I had is that my alarm, which is on the Fire, didn't play through the Dot. There's an alarm on the Dot, but I prefer the native clock on the Fire.Update: The poor quality of the Alexa app leads me to reduce my review to two stars. It's just awful. It's likely I'll return the Echo due to the poor quality of the app.The notification lights are also an issue at night. There may be a way to turn them off, but I don't really want to invest the time to figure it out. By the way, I realize that what I'm seeing as problems are actually features for most users. But, four stars seems fair, given the flaky setup and periodic loss of connection.

Title: Great sound
Body: We had a first gen echo and recently upgraded to a fire box so we figured we didnt need one upstairs anymore.I was missing my upstairs echo so I took advantage of the .99 promo for this one. I'm extremely glad I did- The sound on this one is phenomenal. My reasoning for this one is the alexa integration. So I'm using my downstairs Alexa to communicate with upstairs. Planning on getting one for each of the other rooms too, for like an intercom thing, so I dont have to yell for the kids anymore. Music is clear and crisp on it. I haven't used it for anything other than asking the time, weather, playing music, or talking to my other Alexa. But for now it's working perfect for what I need it for.

Title: DON'T BUY IT IF YOU VALUE YOUR SANITY
Body: This product is the worst.  It simply does not work.  I have to leave a review because it has absolutely driven me mad trying to link it, trying to get it to play my Apple music, trying to get it to do the simplest things that its own instruction book tells you it should do.  So tired of Alexa telling me I don't know how to do that when it is as simple request as to turn on the newly purchased Smart TV that came with the very Echo Dot, all of which was paired multiple times.  Then, there's the Apple music pairing issue where on some days it works and on others not so much.  Prepare yourself pls.  You will go crazy trying to pair it and to figure out why in the Alexa app it shows everything as paired but there is Alexa telling you that you still have to pair it.  Over and over again you will lose sanity trying to get it to simply play a song right in front of you.  No way to override the madness and to shove the damn song down Alexa's throat so she will spit it back out at you to inevitably play the one song right there on the app.  And then there is the issue of telling Alexa to play an album only to have her play one song from the album instead of the entire thing an what seems to be a concerted effort to only play Amazon music.My advice whether this Echo Dot was free or $100 or $20 - don't do it.  Don't buy it.  Save your sanity.  Save your precious time that will be invested in fixing all the problems that will arise and suck you in so you can get this DUMB PIECE OF EQUIPMENT to work correctly.Horrible piece of crap doesn't really do it justice.  If it was free to me, I'd take a hammer to it.  That, truly, would give me joy right after Alexa tells me she doesn't know how to do something she's done a million times over.  THE HAMMER AND A QUICK BURIAL WITH THE BROOM AND A TRASH CAN.  That only would bring peace to this generation of Echo Dot.

Title: Bigger.
Body: This is huge in comparison to the echo dot first generation dots. I'm glad I have several smaller ones for the bathrooms, they are better for wall hanging. But this is nice too, I got it for my sewing room. I have six dots already, this is my 7th and only third generation. I have four large towers, which I love. We use them all over our house and all my children's homes have several as well. The only bad point I will mention is that they only allow you to access prime music on four. All my others are Spotify connected on subscription without ads.The sound isn't as good as the towers, but this is simply a matter of price point. For twenty two bucks it is quite appropo.

Title: Echo dot 3rd generation makes previous one look like it communicated with smoke signals!
Body: I love my echo dot second generation so it wasn't easy to to decide to upgrade to the 3rd, untill it arrived ! I am in love with it. First it is bilingual! So it really understands my Spanglish! The speakers r awesome can really loud. It looks so beautiful I don't get tire of looking at it. I chosed the deal with the mini plug and used it with a power surge and plug all the living room lamps to it. I can just ask Alexa to turn lights off from bed and the living room goes black. I will get a couple of plugs more and soon kitchen appliances will b smart by default and the bedroom after. If only I can teach Alexa how to cook I will marry her.

Title: Disappointing!
Body: After reading the glowing description, we thought the newer Dots would work a whole lot better. True, the music sounds somewhat less like a transistor radio, but now, the audio quality is muffled and muddy, even after adjusting the tone controls.The voice recognition remains abominably poor, as does the responsiveness of the device, itself. Should I really have to bellow in my moderate sized kitchen to get a response? No, I don't think so. We'd hoped the "improved" mics would perform better, but no dice.I suggest you save your money, folks. Who knows? Genuine improvements might be down the road.

Title: Great addition to any room.
Body: My daughter is in love with this and to be honest I'm not used to talking to a machine. But children don't have this issue, since life is always a 1st experience with no fear. But as an adult I must say I really do like it. But i only have one con and maybe this is a sony issue. i can turn on my tv no problem but it dont do apps and i don';t know if it can learn how to do it for me but. If i focus on just the unit its self. Its clear it works and it can read a book instead of watching tv we just listen to music, books, and jokes. So to me Alexa is the new turn knob radio that was used in the early 60's. It brings the family in one room and no screen time.

Title: Great gadget for your home!
Body: I love the look and quality of this newer Echo Dot. The speaker on it has improved so much that I rarely connect to my stereo system speakers using Bluetooth anymore, like I did with my first Echo Dot. The only issue I have is that it doesn't seem to be as responsive as my first Echo Dot. Sometimes I feel like I have to shout to be heard, whereas my first Echo Dot seemed to hear me when I whispered. But I still love it and recommend it to all my friends. We have 3 Dots, and one of our favorite features is that you can use them like an intercom system. No more shouting upstairs to the kid!

Title: Sound quality is fine, but Alexa sure is dumb
Body: TL:DR - This is a perfectly fine bluetooth speaker and well worth what I paid for it (99 cents with an Unlimited Music subscription of 7.99 which you can immediately cancel if you wish) but don't expect voice command functionality to impress.To be frank, I didn't buy this device to listen to the weather, control the lights in my house, or operate a home security system.  My phone can tell me the weather, and light switches and manual locks have worked fine so far.  I got this because I like listening to music or videos while I cook, clean, and work on the computer at my table.  So basically I'm in it for a bluetooth speaker.  And I have to say, it's kind of neat to have a bluetooth speaker that accepts voice commands.  The problem is in how it responds to those voice commands.Me: "Alexa, set the volume to fifty percent."Alexa: "Sorry, you can only set the volume between zero and ten."Me: "Alexa, what is fifty percent of ten?"Alexa: "Fifty percent of ten is five."This is the problem I've had with every voice assistant I've encountered so far.  You can't speak to them in everyday language using simple concepts that a computer should be able to understand.  Alexa should be smart enough to know that fifty percent is the same as five out of ten.  If you can't give the device simple, direct commands and have those commands be understood, then why have voice control?As far as a speaker goes, this is about what you would expect from a bluetooth speaker of this size.  You're not going to get clear and sparkling highs, but the overall sound is strong and there's the perfect amount of bass response if like me you enjoy music but also live in close quarters and aren't trying to disturb the neighbors.5 stars for Voice recognition - It knows what I'm saying.2 stars for Alexa integration - The device understands my words, but it doesn't know what they mean or act on them.4 stars for Sound quality - I hoped for a bit more clarity, but this is perfectly adequate for a speaker of this size and cost.

Title: Improved sound / setup issue
Body: Bought this 3rd Gen Dot because of the special price, already have 4 2nd gen dots. At first, could not get it to link up, even with tech help. A replacement was delivered the next day. It wouldn,t link up using my A50 Samsung, had my daughter try with her iPhone. It still would not register. She then Bluetooth linked the Dot to her phone before putting the Dot into setup mode. This worked. Liked the improved sound and price so I had her setup the first one and keep it too. Very good tech service even if they couldn't solve the problem.

Title: Great Product
Body: This is my third Dot and it works great for controlling lights, etc.  I also like the new feature for glass breakage and smoke/ CO monitoring and alerts - a really useful feature.  The sound quality is very good for the Dot itself... for one of my Dots I've connected the output to my existing  home stereo system and the sound quality is AMAZING and thanks to a Kasa switch I can now turn my amp on/off with voice commands and use the Dot to control what is playing and the volume level.

Title: I am sold!!!
Body: I bought one and a Kasa smart plug as an experiment when they were on sale. Installation wasn't difficult and I was so impressed when Alexa turned on my livingroom lights, played Christmas music and added items to my shopping list.  I bought a second one to put in my bedroom so that Alexa can call my daughter if I need her (I'm a healthy 81 year old, but need support system). Now, no matter where I am in the house, Alexa can hear me and help to keep me safe.

Title: Great for home automation. Wish it was easier to group multiple speakers as default.
Body: I really liked having these echo dots around the house. Voice recognition works well for me, but spotty with my wife. Sound quality isn_ too bad at lower volumes. I wish I could have multiple speakers grouped together for playing music without having to say the group. If I_ downstairs and I ask it to play music, why can_ all of the speakers in that area automatically play rather than having to define a group and tell it to play on said group. Usually, by the time I get to saying which speaker group I want them to play on, Alexa has already started playing the song on the default speaker in that area.

Title: Alexa is my BFF
Body: OMG, Alexa is my new best friend. I bought one for my bedroom and one for my living room, and I couldn't be happier. I'm a total scatterbrain, so it's amazing that I can just ask Alexa to add an item to my To Do or Shopping List the second I think of it (before I forget again). It syncs with the Alexa app, so I can just pull up my lists on my phone while I'm out. You can also play some games, set alarms, listen to music, use it as a white noise machine... the list goes on and on. Now I just need one for my car, and I'll be all set!

Title: Amazing, Love It
Body: I absolutely love it just got it in today, I got it sooner then it said. It said that it would be back in stock on December 16th got notified yesterday the 13th that was shipped and was gonna get it Sunday the 15th but nope instead got it Saturday the 14th. The sound is so much better then the echo dot 1st edition! I love the color, now they need to get it in color blue, yes they have blue for kids edition ones but need it in blue for all. You wont be disappointed. I'm happy with my purchase.

Title: Great having but can't set up stereo
Body: I was given a Echo 5 Show as a gift.  I love it and went out and purchased another Echo 5 Show.  Thinking that everything echo is compatible, I went and purchased two more echo dots (3rd generation) to put in other rooms.  Things worked ok but when I purchased 3 more echo dots for the purpose of giving me stereo in all the rooms I began to have problems.  I have been unable to get stereo to work with the combination of a Echo Show and a Dot in the same room.  Tried a number of things without success.  Even just added a Dot to the room and made them both into a group but then the vol controls still work independently on each unit.  When I called Amazon support (who are really outstanding) they told me that I could only set up stereo if I was using the same units.  For example, I could use 2 dots and set it up or 2 Echo Shows but not a Show and a Dot.  I wish I had known this before I went out and purchased 3 more dots.

Title: Lasted less than 6 months (DON'T WASTE YOUR MONEY)
Body: I have a first generation echo dot and it works great.  Bought this one and have had lots of issues.  Its been 6 months and Amazon will not replace it or repair it.REALLY AMAZON!I can't believe it.  I am so disappointed in this device, but more so with Amazon.

Title: i love the echo, but it isn't flawless
Body: I love the echo it is nice to have the hands-free support. The only things that bother me about using it is that it isn't always consistent. I have a routine set up to turn on a light at 6:25 AM every day and some days it goes through the routine and other days it doesn't, and I have no idea why. And sometimes it doesn't recognize my voice so I have to kind of yell at it. But overall I am very happy with it, I've bought two and keep considering buying more for the other rooms of my house.

Title: Useful
Body: Pretty useful. Occasionally doesn't hear/process my voice the first time, but overall pretty good. I like being able to turn the lights on/off from my bed. Easily get the weather while getting ready in the morning. Can look up stuff, even shop if you dont need to see a picture of what you're buying. Also if you change the wake word to computer, you feel like a star trek character.

Title: For a BUCK! Nice addition to my desk.
Body: How can one pass up one of these for $0.99 (plus one month of Amazon Music Unlimited for $7.99)? Took all of 2 minutes to setup. Took another 2 minutes to connect my Sony TV skill. Not expecting much use, but it does my phone calls, weather, alarm, and some music (though the sound is not the best but it is only a 1.6" speaker). Not bad for a large PUCK on my desk.

Title: This Item Just Did Not Work For Me  But I Am Willing Check Out the Echo Show 5
Body: The product had amazing sound but would not play more then a few songs and shut off.  I have an Echo Dot 2 and they would not connect.  I can ask my echo dot 2 to play the rolling stones and it will literally play for days.  I would ask the echo dot 3 and it was a crap shoot.  I have the echo dots to play  music 24 hours a day.  I have 2 little dogs and I have found if I play music all the time they are more calm as the outside noises of apartment living are kept at a minimum.  The echo dot would not perform in that manner.  I tried to connect the two of them and it looked good on the ipad but they never connected to play the same music thru out the apt.  I would come home and the echo 3 would be off and I would have a panicked dog.  Not cool.  Amazon Sent me a new echo dot 3 and it lasted for maybe 2 months... the speakers sounded blown.  Amazon sent me a return label...  Since I love my echo dot 2 I have ordered an echo show 5 and I am praying I love it!!  I have had more good luck with amazon products then bad so I am willing to continue using their products.  They did refund me for the echo dot 3!  Thank You Amazon for standing behind your products!!

Title: It does just what it says it will and quite well, but...
Body: If you have a smart phone, pretty much like just about everyone does.. and you have a bluetooth speaker, like a lot of people do, then you don't need this taking up more space in your home.  I just put mine in the trash  due to this reason..no need for it.. OH, and if you work in the same room as this thing, and you make long calls for work, this will think you are asking for something and start talking to you in the background. Not cool when you are on a business call.  I also didn't like that it was yet another device that is probably monitoring every word I say.so, just use your smart phone and a blue tooth speaker that probably has better sound anyway..I got mine for "free" during a Sirius XM promo when the price was $50. Then they were giving them away for $22 at Christmas.. yah, that tells you all you need to know. Save your money

Title: Not impressed
Body: Got a 3rd gen as a gift and simply not impressed. This is my first Alexa product other than fire tv remote. So far not impressed for the 4hrs I_e spent trying to integrate my home WiFi outlets, thermostat, fire tv ect I literally could have go gotten up off the chair for the rest of my life to turn these items on off up down ect and have 3hrs of my life back. Linking fire tv is a joke, still can_ turn fire tv on or off, can_ view amazon photos on tv, can_ turn amazon music on fire tv vs defaulting to playin on the echo. If I have a tv with stereo why would I want to play music on this tiny speaker? Everything non amazon works flawless and was relatively easy to set up and use anything related to amazon is a nightmare and does not work properly via echo/Alexa. It_ almost funny how everything else linked up and set up fine yet everything amazon sucks and won_ link up right or work 100%.

Title: Alexa's Voice Sounds Muffled in Gen 3 Version. Sounded Great in Gen 2.
Body: At first I was impressed with the audio output. Music quality was quite an improvement over gen 2. Then "she spoke"! Hard to believe this product would be released into the marketplace without addressing this issue. Voice output reminds me of someone talking with a pillow over their face (slight exaggeration). A fellow customer suggested using a bluetooth speaker which makes this device at least tolerable for the time being. With this supplemental accessory that I shouldn't have had to purchase, I can understand her answers to questions like "What time is it?" but when setting up timers or reminders the volume level drops to "1" making even the BT speaker "fix" unacceptable. Please address this with a firmware upgrade or whatever it takes or I will have to continue to convince anyone that asks that they should probably NOT get one.

Title: Makes things easy and faster
Body: So far, I enjoy having an Alexa. I_l admit I_ lazy when it comes to connecting my phone to Bluetooth and finding something to play so this is just one of the things Alexa does for me. There_ a few things I wish she would do though. For example, I created a new playlist using Alexa and it was a little hard for her to understand a few of my requests on it. Like changing the name of my playlist, removing a song from my playlist, or going back to a previous song. I mostly use it for setting timers/reminders, or playing music right now but I haven_ even had it for more than a week so I_l learn more about it as I go. Happy I bought. Even more happy I bought it during cyber week because I wouldn_ have paid its original cost for it.

Title: Helpful, fun and simple to use.
Body: Alexa is my first stand alone virtual assistant. I_e had Siri on my phone but never really utilized it, so I can_ make any comparisons with other units, but I am loving the extra help and the ease of just asking for it. From _hat_ the temperature outside? To _all my (misplaced) phone? Or _all my sons phone To _lay (whatever) song?, she is right there and ready to help. Every request is hand free and can be done while multitasking. It really is helpful and fun. And fear not if you_e not a _echy type, it_ so simple to use. I got a great Cyber Monday deal so I thought I_ give it a try.  Very  happy I did.

Title: Alright at a discount
Body: This is the second smart-home speaker I've got, and it's far less intelligent than the Google Home. The ability to play my Audible and other such things has been enough of a difference to be worth keeping it, but I know from experience with other smart speakers that it's possible to recognize more than this. There are times I've asked it a question only to get an answer either tangentially related, or even unrelated entirely. There was time I asked it a question and got the answer "No, that's not true," which since I asked it to define a word, I'm still not sure about. It also tried to answer by giving the capital of Guam. Once again, not what we asked.It has, however, informed me that birds are real animals and are classified as birds, so that much is worth it.Sound quality is really good, too, best of anything I've seen or had in my home.

Title: I love my echo but it doesn't always recognize me or understand me
Body: I like my echo dot a lot. I am frequently asking it questions and having it set alarms and make lists for me. I like that it will also send reminders to your phone incase you aren't home and therefore cant hear it reminding you. My issue with it is that it sometimes won't recognize me, won't understand what I'm saying, or will just simply not respond even though it was listening. I have it set up as instructed in the open without anything around it so I don't know why it often glitches. Overall I'm pretty happy with it and find myself missing it when I'm not home and need random questions answered.

Title: Couldn't live without my echo dots now that I have them!
Body: I'm so amazed by my echo dot 3rd gen. I've own TONS of speakers and the sounds quality of this blows all of them away! I love how much I can truly customize and program my echo dots to suite my lifestyle and preferences. Alexa had made my very busy life incredibly easier. She sets times and reminders for me, disarms and arms my security system, turns on/off my TVs, turns on/off my lights and fans and does everything I ask. I really do not know how I survived without alexa. I now own 5 echo dot 3rd gens and an echo show 5 along with a kindle fire 7. Thank you amazon for bringing alexa into my life!

Title: My smart home is starting to look good
Body: I bought 2 of these here on Amazon and another on Woot! I use them in strategic places around the house, and I love how easy it is to control everything around my house. I have a video doorbell and smart thermostats that I integrated with Alexa to easily control everything around the house. I'll get more smart stuff later on to integrate them.This made my life easier and efficient in many levels with the calendar management and the notes too.Also, my niece loves playing with Alexa and listening to music. Thanks to FreeTime settings, I control what she can access and for how long. That is an amazing feature for a family with kids.Totally recommend it if you want to make a smart home work like charm.

Title: My new girl friend
Body: The Echo Dot is a great product. It is small enough to be located just about anywhere and is very unobtrusive. It has a very good sound quality for its size and responds without hesitation. Setup is simple with the directions furnished and my Galaxy S8 recognized the Bluetooth connection flawlessly. My only complaint would be "Alexa's" sensitivity. She tends to respond anytime the name Alexa is spoke on my television. She doesn't argue or talk back and answers all my questions and request without getting upset. I wish I could say the same for my wife. LOL.

Title: Damn I love these things
Body: I use these guys for everything. I have 6, 4 inside, 1 out in the shop, and 1 on the patio.  I run plugs and lights with them and the individual devices made by other companies may have quirky setups, once they are set up Alexa runs them just fine.  weather, info, music, intercom, alarms, Simply Safe Security with cameras (so a show is next), SHOPPING LISTS, to-do lists, all the skills, and out in the shop I can ask "Alexa, what is the molecular weight of acetone?" and get the answer faster than i can look it up.I love these things, they are so helpful, but don't make the mistake of buying the Echo Auto on the wave of joy you get from the Echo dots, you will be let down.

Title: Great Device!
Body: I am new to the Alexa functionality, and I love it. I like that you can add skills or play games. I like that I don't have to search for a working pen or piece of paper that my 2 year old hasn't drawn on. I can simply say _lexa, add toilet paper to my shopping list and then its all stored in my app and easily accessible. I can send reminders to my husband while I am at work. I was sent my first one as a gift earlier this month and I have already ordered a second one for the kitchen. I deducted one star for sound quality. I like to listen to music while cooking and cleaning. Maybe its the type of music, but the bass sounds terrible sometimes. Other than this small issue, this is a great device. Its already made my life a little simpler in the two weeks Ive owned it.

Title: Request Sounds too loud
Body: The Dot has good sound quality, but it_ too loud on certain features. The sole reason for buying it was to have a more reliable alarm for the work-week and one that wouldn_ also wake up other people in the house who are still sleeping. The actual alarm sound can be set to any volume which is nice, but the start and end request sounds that ding when Alexa recognizes an incoming request or completes a request are WAY too loud. They sound through the whole house waking everyone else up, even when Alexa is on whisper mode. When the alarm is going off and you tell Alexa to turn alarm off, even if you have the alarm volume turned down low, the two request _ings are on the highest volume. The echo speakers are really nice, but that means it_ the most jarring noise to hear first thing in the morning. Like a killer robot screeching directly in your ear. Those request sounds are so much louder than the regular request sounds, and only really loud on a timer or alarm, which is the opposite of what is needed on a 5am alarm. I also wish Alexa could play more than just apple radio, cause I_ like to listen to my playlists. When I ask to hear an apple playlist Alexa says there isn_ one created. Other than those two things I_e enjoyed it, I just wish it could be used it for the reason I purchased it.

Title: Big bang for your buck!
Body: Very happy so far. Alexa sometimes will command things on and say they are on but they arent. Rarely but it does happen. The most annoying thing that amazing NEEDS to fix is if you're watching tv and give no commands for let's say about 20mns. When you ask again to turn the tv volume up or down alexa diverts back to her own speakers volume adjustment. ,(1,-10) you then have to say adjust TV volume. Yes 1st would problems I know but it's still annoying. Your tv should be the default volume option at all times. Overall setup is very simple. As soon as you add a new smart device...alexa gets smarter so now I dont even have set it up in the alexa app. As soon as you add the device in its companies app alexa announces she found it and knows the name and everything. This was very impressive. I believe for the money this is an amazing device. I turned my entire appartment into a "smart" apartment for around 180 bucks. Now the 2 big ticket items I have left, nest thermostat and smart door lock. These are quite pricey but everything else alexa can control is pretty cheap from bulbs to light strips to smart outlets to tvs even to my samsung robot vacuum! You can set reminders times shopping lists even routines! For example every morning alexa wakes me up to my favorite song and also turns some of the lights on in the house csn even slowly dim them as you wake up to gradually get briter. It's pretty cool stuff. The speaker on it is VERY clear and quite impressive from a disk the size of your palm. Overall and especially if you have a sound system in your house its totally worth it. No need to buy the bigger echos with bigger speakers if you have a sound system in your house font waste the money and go right for this echo dot3!

Title: It does everything it claims it does and I haven_ had any issues so far.
Body: I have two Echo Dot 3rd gen._. One for my room and kitchen. It_ very useful with setting up reminders and timers when I_ cooking or  when my kids need some time out. I used to waste so much time grabbing my phone to set a timer but now I just tell Alexa to set it for me. Love love love it! The sound quality is great and the volume goes up very high. Oh and I LOVE how I can ask Alexa if I have anything scheduled for the day since I have missed some doctors appointments because I forget but as soon as I say, _lexa good morning she responds with anything you set it to. I have her tell me if I have anything schedules, the weather, and the traffic from home to work. If you thought Siri was great, well Alexa is by far the best, and I love my Apple devices. Thanks amazon. Echo Dot is great!

Title: Great Dot, But Lost in Wifi!
Body: I love the new Echo DOT design and the ability to link other bluetooth speakers. I successfully linked my new Dot to a higher quality speaker in my Sonos clock/radio.Today, when Alexa requests were made, the Dot reported network connection issues, though other household Echo Dots remained connected to the same Wifi. I gave up connected that device in frustration -- for now. I still love the Dot and nosey Alexa, but these connection issues are annoying.

Title: Get ready for a headache
Body: I've now had two defective devices. Amazon makes you chat with support and then tries to make you pay for a replacement for your defective device. The device can't hear you half the time or can't do what you say unless it's directly an Amazon service. The speakers don't play music half of the time or it fades in and out. All you get after hours of chatting with support is an offer of a 15% discount and "this device is out of warranty". Unacceptable.

Title: Awesome product just wish she was cordless
Body: So she works well, sounds great! You can connect her to your phone by downloading the app to find out what other features she may have. My favorites is "unleash the Spartan" and "ask baby groot". She is also so small but has a great quality sound that i can clearly hear from the living room and even into the kitchen. There's a mute button, volume buttons but you can also tell alexa to turn up by 5 or down by 5 but that's just an example, you adjust your volume however you please. You've also got an on and off button. I have found so far that you have to leave her plugged up which is a bit of a downer when you want to take her into different parts of the house with out having to plug in but I'm sure within time Amazon will fix that in the future or maybe they already have and I'm just behind on the times.. Either way this is still a great product and before i forget she also has an aux plug in so you can still use her as you would a normal speaker. _

Title: Perfect first smart home device!
Body: Echo Dot is the first smart home device I've purchased and can say that I'm absolutely in love, it's the perfect first smart home device. I purchased the Dot with the Smart plug as a gift for my fiance but ended up giving it to her early so we could use the smart plug for our Christmas tree. Most items in our homes these days have toggle switches in convenient locations, but seasonal decorations are one of the few things that do not. For that reason, the Dot and smart plug are perfect.
