Plus, the price tag on the Gen $3 is unbeatable.If youre on the fence about having smart home devices, then you need to purchase this item.

Title: This thing sucks. Broke in less than a year
Body: This thing broke within a few months. Connects to everything but there's no sound at all. And when i called for help, they tried everything they can to troubleshoot it but no success then they told me the warranty is for 3 mos only and mine is 10 mos old so it expired already so wouldn't do nothing about it. Just basically toss my echo away and asked me to just buy a new one. I wouldn't buy any amazon piece of crap ever again. My advice, stick with the homepod or the google one maybe those would last longer.

Title: Good product and handy to have but not quite what I was expecting
Body: Good product have some issues with it picking up sounds from the TV and I have to tell it to stop and I tried to get it to kinda work with my fire stick and never could not sure what I was doing wrong or if it doesn't work the way I thought it does but if so an easier process to do it would be nice as I followed directions and all steps and it would just never work otherwise good product

Title: Great product with limitations
Body: Sound is great. I love its features. Controls my lights, outlets, get time/weather report. Unfortunately need amazon prime or Spotify premium to fully enjoy its features like choosing what music to play on all your echo dots at same time. Its surface feels nice. Once in awhile it doesn_ hear my voice well or gets commands wrong.

Title: I figured out how to make it work for elderly users.
Body: It is not very well suited for older people who don't have smart phones, which is too bad, because it seems perfect for people who struggle to press little buttons or read little screens.  There is a workaround however.The trick is to set it up for the person without a smart phone using the Alexa app on your own smart phone, and then create an email account for the new user.  I made an email account for my mother on Google.  Then I created a new Amazon account for her that was linked to the new Google email address.  This requires sending a PIN to her telephone number, but does not require a smart phone.  Using the PIN code you can create a new Amazon ID for your user without a smart phone.So go ahead and finish setting up the echo dot, then go into the setting and 'deregister' the echo dot, which breaks the connection between the echo dot and your Amazon account.  That way there is no option for them to accidentally learn what you have bought lately or to order things on your credit card, even if there was a software error that reactivated voice shopping.  After 'deregistering' the echo dot, re-register the echo dot with the Amazon account that you created for your parent without a smart phone.You can use the Alexa app to configure things like whether they should be able to purchase things from the Amazon account using their voice, or to retrain the echo dot to recognize their speech more accurately.  You may also need to change the WiFi connection if you move the echo dot to a new location.I suggest leaving the Alexa app connected to the elderly person's echo dot for a little while so you can remotely manage it in case they have any trouble at first.  That lets you turn the volume back up if they turn it down, or add contacts for the people in their life that they can then call by nickname.  I selected *not* letting it import the contacts from my phone and only adding contacts for about five phone numbers for my mother's kids, her sisters and to get assistance from the assisted living staff.  That way if my mother tells the echo dot to call me by my first name it will know who she is talking about.  Fewer contacts means fewer misinterpretations and issues with calling the wrong number.

Title: A bittersweet improvement as Amazon tightens the stranglehold
Body: I had the second generation Amazon Echo Dot and I was sorely disappointed by it. So much so that I returned it.  The sound quality was absolutely atrocious and I could not recommend it to anyone who even thought about listening to music. The 3rd gen has come a very long way in this regard. The sound quality is much better. While I would still recommend the larger Echo for most rooms if sound is important and you are not within earshot of other, better speakers, this one will certainly do in a pinch and is great for adding sound to those corners or rarely used rooms. And the holiday season created the only price point (~$20) that I would entertain.From an overall Amazon Echo perspective, the Echo products offer promising entire-house music capability but it comes at a cost. The Echo speakers increasingly only support Amazon subscription services when it comes to playing music throughout the house. As someone who had not created a strong business case for subscription music, this is annoying as I would like speakers but don't like the idea of paying for the same music I like to listen to over and over again. Certainly if you are a fan of Amazon subscriptions for music, the Dot is now a no-brainer, great way to augment your household speaker collection. If you are not yet committed to a certain subscription model, beware of the low price designed to draw you in and keep you trapped in Amazon subscription products.

Title: IT IS SO MUCH BETTER THAN GOOGLE MINI
Body: Haven't received it yet but I have been adding skills and getting ready for it to come into my home. My son has one and it is absolutely so much fun.  I have downloaded it to my phone and it is already so very convenient with my added routines on it. It will be so much easier to have the voice activated version in my home without having to have my phone open the app in order for me to press the button to talk to it.I'm a big fan with all that it offers that the Google mini does not offer. I had ordered a Google mini by mistake and was so disappointed. I was going to try and just use it instead but there was no comparison to what is available on the Alexa.I am able to do most of the home features using "Okay Google" now with my phone but the added features of Alexa's skills makes it definitely worth it.I'm excited like a kid waiting for Christmas morning for it to get to my house.

Title: I love this thing. I love Alexa.
Body: I have another Echo Dot, second generation. The voice on this one is a little more pleasant. It works very much the same, which is to say it works very well. I have a disability, and I can automate a lot of things with smart home and control them without using my body. I like to be able to turn things on and off by the app when I_ away from home. This works with my blink home security system which Amazon also sells. I have several routines which help with my life and schedule - turning on and off multiple items and lights, depending on whether I_ waking up, going to bed, or moving through my day_ schedule. Probably the most useful thing for the most part of my day is that I now let Alexa control my lists. It_ very easy no matter where I am to add something to my shopping or to do list. And you always have your list with you if you have your app on your phone. Everyone in the family can check the same list.

Title: Easy to set up and use. Good quality speakers for its small size.
Body: I have five of the 3rd generation Echo dots and have been very happy with them. I especially enjoy the ability to play music in all rooms simultaneously, plus the timer, reminder, list and flash briefing functions. I've recently added two Philips Hue bluetooth bulbs and am happy with those so far. So, lots of "pros" here. A couple minor cons: the kitchen unit has become far less responsive to its wakeup word over time. I suspect cooking fumes (dust, oil, etc.) may be affecting its sensors, since only the kitchen unit has had the issue. And (as most Alexa users know), Alexa can be a bit erratic with her responses. Sometimes she accurately recognizes the radio station or podcast I request, but often she gets it wrong (sometimes hilariously so). Still, it's a small inconvenience relative to the many benefits for such a small, low-cost device.

Title: Good sound in a small package
Body: I'm relatively new to the Alexa world and have a few v3 Echoes around the house, and got a dot for the bathroom.  If you're on the fence about sound quality - Dot vs. Echo - I feel that the Dot sounds great in the more lively space of the bathroom, and in a more "dead" space like my bedroom I like the Echo.  It's nice to wake up in the morning and get music playing throughout the house.  It sets a nice mood to start the day.  Or, if I'm working around the house, I can play an audio book or podcast and still hear it wherever I am.Alexa is great for simple tasks like playing a specific song, album or playlist.  It can get challenging though if, say, you want to hear an album by an artist with a bunch of untitled albums.  In those instances it's best to just create a playlist.

Title: Smart speaker and more
Body: I bought this primarily as a smart speaker - not for all the integration with lights and locks, etc.  I am using it basically, as a speaker and alarm clock.  I love it.  While Alexa does not always understand me, I am learning. Her voice is non-obtrusive.  She occasionally asks me things, only when I have just asked her to do soemeting - usually it is helpful. I was worried it would be buzzing or beeping or speaking to me without me speaking first and it doesn't.  Good sound, too, for sure.  For the price, totally worth it, even if you only use it as a speaker.

Title: WiFi connection impossible to achieve.
Body: I originally had an Echo, 1 gen. Coming home one day it was connected to WiFi. I spoke to 3 reps. Followed all instructions it would not connect. Then an Echo dot was sent & it too would not connect, 2 reps that day & was told that something in the WiFi might have changed. Had my cable remotely reboot WiFi. Didn_ help. I then was told to try another Dot. Did yesterday and needless to say it had the same problem. Both are being returned. To check my WiFi, I disconnected my IPad & reconnected it with no problems. I live in a condo community & my service is with Comcast. One of neighbors purchased a Dot , my recommendation & since we use same provider, I asked her & she has had no problems.I don_ have any idea why It didn_ work but will miss it.

Title: Alexa is a family oriented gadget
Body: I love that I can tell throughout the house and Alexa can hear me thru the walls. My toddlers can even request songs. (It understands their babbles) but if you don_ have amazon music finding songs is somewhat limited. I love the app for Alexa too and as weird as it is the kitchen timer option. It_ so simple. I_ always forgetting to set a timer so now I just yell at Alexa and she remembers for me.The speakers could be a little louder but they are pretty amazing and the fact that it isn_ wireless is disappointing but not enough to change my mind. I saw there are options to connect to Bluetooth and also there are wireless battery options as well.All in all great buy. I would buy another and possibly another.

Title: 5 estrellas para Alexa
Body: Me encanta. Alexa aprendió bien el español. Escucha bien y contesta claro. No he tenido ningún problema con ella. Fácil de programarla. Lee libros, pone la música que le pidas, apaga y prende luces, te lee las noticias, te da el informe del tiempo para cualquier día, y muchísimas cosas más, le falta caminar...te responde lo que le preguntes, eso sí es mala haciendo chistes_ bueno, la verdad es bastante entretenida. Tienes que descargar la app de Alexa para poder utilizar los Skills y así pueda hacer todas esas cosas maravillosas. Estoy contenta con la compra. A mi mamá le gustó tanto que tuve que ordenarle una.

Title: It_ a great compact device.
Body: When it arrived I spent hours trying to set it up. It would say it was set up, then immediately would say it was offline. I called Amazon and got an agent pretty quickly. We spent another 45 minutes before telling me they would just replace it. Two days later a new one arrived, plugged it it and it immediately worked, no set up needed! Love the Dot! Only took one star off for the first defective unit. My only complaint would be that I need to buy the Amazon Music family plan to have all Dots in the house plan the same music. Not doing that, I plan different radio music in different rooms. Going to try the agroup setting for that.

Title: Good Product
Body: I replaced a clock radio that was sitting on my bathroom counter.  The Dot 3rd Gen is small and will play my radio stations from iHeart Radio or music from Amazon Music.  Ask the time or temperature, or ask about my calendar entry for the day and Alexa provides the info (if you allow connectivity to your calendar).  Only reason for the four star rating was for the fact that the plug for the Dot is HUGE.  You'd think there would be a way the electrical plug (even though the wire is 90 degrees downward) would be smaller.  So, one star deduct for that design.  Better sound and looks than my Dot 2 version.

Title: Echo Dot is Great, Echo Dot with Clock is Everything
Body: The Echo Dot's tiny footprint is perfect, the unobtrusive hockey puck look is clean, Alexa is amazing, etc. Read other reviews for all the good stuff about the Echo Dot. What blows me away is how much I love the simple addition of the clock! 100% a game changer in how well I sleep, how little I pick up my phone and get distracted from sleeping if I wake up in the middle of the night and decide to check the time. Yes I could have had a light sensing backlit alarm clock the whole time, but I didn't know I was missing out til this came around. Well done Amazon__ It's the little things.

Title: Love it, but I didn't realize it had to be plugged in to work
Body: I absolutely love the echo dot, it's sleek, compact, and loud. My only surprise was it has to be plugged in to have power (i thought it was cordless like their larger models), but that was my own fault for not looking more into it before purchasing. It makes moving it from room to room more difficult but I just leave it in my kitchen for music/timer/cooking podcasts. The only reason I didn't give it 5 stars is because their battery-powered devices are the "top models" and this is their affordable model, and playing Spotify on it is iffy- it really only performs optimally with Amazon Music. Still function like an Alexa, and sounds amazing!

Title: Great Buy!
Body: I really like the new and improved Echo. I traded in my 2nd generation echo dot for this one and here are a few reasons why.-new Echo is larger in size-the new look of the fabric on the outer edge-louder and fuller sound quality(A note on the sound quality improvement): although the new Echo boasts better sound quality, this is somewhat misleading. The new Echo sounds better for a few reasons, one of which being the increased bass and the other being the larger speaker. This is great but can also be considered a double-edged sword because while playing music, the bass overwhelms the actual volume. What I mean by this is that increasing the volume doesn_ seem to make the music much louder but increases the bass excessively which can make music with less bass to begin with a little less enjoyable.

Title: Great device for listening but poor as a white noise machine
Body: We mainly bought this echo dot as a white noise machine for our 9-month old.  We read reviews that it should have the ability to turn off its lights and continuously play white noise on a loop overnight.  We tried multiple nights and for some reason, it just stops playing white noise, which causes our daughter to wake up in the middle of the night.  We tried troubleshooting but did not find a work-around. We will keep it as it integrates with alot of our other devices well, but it is poor as a white noise machine.

Title: No response
Body: This is the 2nd new Alexa with the same issue.  Support was very responsive and sent a 2nd right away.  Unforturnately it has the same issues... When you say Alexa she wakes up.  You say Play and she takes her time and responds in about 20 seconds to play.  When playing you say Alexa Stop and she plays dumb.  They only way to stop her from playing you have to power it down.  Or if you ask for the news of the day or ... she plays dumb and does not answer.My 1st Alex still works great,  NO issues.  I am not sure what they changed on this one (besides looks and sound) but this new one does not work!  Going to call support again.

Title: AWESOMELY THE COOLEST PRODUCT EVER!
Body: WOW! I_ truly lost for words on how amazing the Echo Dot really is! The Echo Dot is so fun, the voice recognition is pretty awesome and the volume will BLOW YOU AWAY! I was stunned at how loud this product is being as though it_ so small! Every penny is worth the amount spent and it_ a great gift around the holidays for the family! My kids love it! I feel like this special Alexa device is apart of the family now! She understands and pretty much knows everything as well!

Title: Was a bit skeptical but.... this device is a game changer
Body: Was a bit skeptical but got suckered in due to the price. I got two for the price of one during Black Friday/cyber Monday.I have an iPhone but don_ use Siri so I just knew I wasn_ going get suckered onto Alexa..... WRONG!!!! This little device has been a game changer. I have one upstairs and another in my kitchen. This little device has helped me stay on top of tasks, plays music hella good, I can set alarms to actual playlists I have in Apple Music..... I_ really happy I folded and just brought not one but two!

Title: PERFECT for enhancing my Grandma_ life
Body: I love my Echo Alexa! She answers all my dumb questions, plays my music on a high quality speaker, and brings a lot of joy to my grandmas life. I originally bought this and was hesitant to introduce my grandma to our new friend and housemate but after doing so I can confidently say it was one of the best decisions I_e ever made. I made my grandma a Spotify playlist of all of her old songs that she loved to listen to and wrote down exactly what to ask Alexa so she can hear it and that has changed her life. She_ listening to songs that she hasn_ heard since she had a car with a cassette player in it! She is a bit hard of hearing and the loud speaker really helps her fully enjoy the music again. She also gets a kick out of asking Alexa about the weather and other trivial things. It_ especially impressive when she shows off to her friends that Alexa knows who she is. I couldn_ be happier with my Echo! Alexa is like a new member of the family!

Title: Loving it!
Body: I purchased the Amazon Echo because i wanted a way to operate my Hue Lights without having to use my iPhone or iPad, or Siri... need I say more.  I didn't know how much I really need this!  There are so many features, you can even play games, i can ask Alexa to resume my Audible books, music, radio.  I can even ask her to call someone for me, create grocery lists and on and on and on.  If you're in the market for a home smart number, stop looking and just buy the Amazon Echo!!! I'm loving mine!

Title: I love this Alexa Echo Dot
Body: I love this Echo dot.  Alexa helps me to do many things throughout the day. It just makes your life easier. You can ask for music, the weather, the news, alarms, countdowns, and anything from the internet. It is loud and recognized voices super fast too. The only problem I had is that I have twin brothers and Alexa recognizes their voices as the same person. Isn't that funny? I guess my brothers have the same voice lol. I'm so used to waking up to 80s songs thanks to Alexa. I'm glad I bought it and definitely recommend this one.

Title: Talks too much sometimes
Body: She tells me the weather. Keeps track of my to-do list.  Plays my music. And my kid's music.  Sometimes if there's too much happening and we're all telling her to do stuff she just shuts down and the lights start blinking weird.  So we unplug and plug back in.  She works again.  Guess she doesn't like a lot of stimulation. Also sometimes she just talks too much.  For example if I make a request that she can't do, she gives me a recommendation for something else but goes on and on about it.

Title: Definitely wouldn_ but it at full price!
Body: It_ little, so not great sound. But decent for a small space. But it will turn itself off randomly when listening to music. I would not buy it at full price, for sure - not worth it. I see the _ig of it turning itself off has been ongoing through all versions for years when I looked it up online. And never answered or resolved. If you plan to use it as a replacement for a regular radio for leaving pets alone at home or non-stop music at home then this certainly is not the right decide to choose.

Title: Alexa doesnt like ladies talking to her
Body: So maybe this is a sexist theory but I'm sure that the AI researchers who programmed or tweaked Alexa's voice recognition were all men because this one sucks more than usual at listening to my wife, actually IMHO the 2nd gen was best at listening to my wifes voice and our 3rd gen and the new clock one are crap, so, I guess if your a woman be prepared to yell at your echo dot more than the older ones.I've noticed no real difference myself.It does plays music better than the 2nd gen and virtually the same as the 3rd gen.

Title: Freezes and shuts off
Body: It's okay but does not work as well as expected. For some reason my echo dot will randomly freeze up and or shut off. It has done this several times while the kids and I were trying to play a game like the escape room or other things. It also periodically cannot understand us even though I speak as clearly as humanly possible. I will be more upset had I paid more, but I got it as part of a deal so I only paid $0.99 for it. If I paid 30 or $40 I would be returning it for sure.

Title: Nice upgrade from Dot 2.0
Body: The speaker quality on this unit is a huge update over the Echo Dot 2.0. Don't expect a lot of base or hifi sound, but it is an improvement. Sounds bigger, larger sound stage, and more dynamic range.That being said, I don't think the minimal improvements is enough to warrant upgrading from the 2.0 to these new 3.0. Maybe the 4 will give a better value to tempt me to throw out 6 Dot 2s and replace them. We'll see. But until then, the 2s still do the job just fine.

Title: Sounds great, very easy to set up
Body: Very easy to set up and pair with other Alexa speakers, 2 Rokus and a Yamaha sound bar. The sound quality is surprisingly good for such a small device. A couple of days after setting up the whole house with Alexa speakers, the Dot quit responding to my requests. Customer support was no help. I figured the issue out myself after I hung up---I had Free Time enabled on the Dot. Free Time makes Alexa kid-friendly so certain enabled skills won't work (like Wet Fart).

Title: Love at first command.
Body: So far so good. I'm absolutely in love with this device. I've only had it a couple days but it's awesome. It recognizes my voice without a problem at all. It's awesome with the way I have it set up to turn off the lamp in my room. I ordered two more smart plugs to pair with my Echo. The only issue I have so far is that I'm having trouble connecting to my roku device. Any one who may know about this please comment below

Title: Part of the family
Body: My family loves this thing! Alexa has become a member of the family. She_ so easy to use, even my mom who doesn_ do well with technology is learning. I love the fact you can play games, make your alarm music, do shopping lists, and control basically everything in your home. I bought my boyfriend 12 hours away one and we do _rop in and can talk like we_e on the phone and send each other messages. If you_e on the fence, get it. It_ small enough to stay out of the way, yet powerful to be heard throughout the room/house. Get a few of them actually!!

Title: Doesn't work that good.
Body: Well basically it works I guess. connected it up to my computer as a blue tooth speaker. It quit after about a week never found why. I got another for Christmas and put in another room. I called one Office and the other Bedroom and enabled dropin on both. When I try to use it the one in the bedroom thinks it is the Office and the one in the Bedroom thinks it is office. Artificial Intelligence?  I call it Artificial Stupidity!

Title: Life: safer and simpler.
Body: Don't know why I didn't do these sooner. Combine with smart plugs or lights for voice activation. GUARD listens for intruders notifies you for action. Your music can follow you. So easy even a Ludite can set it up.

Title: Not bad wish I could use alarm with no internet
Body: The only issue I have is it understanding which light to turn off and since I use spotify it's not the best setup for that currently. I will say other than that it works great I got mostly so I didnt have to use my phone as an alarm clock. Works great with audible as well.Also I dislike how if it disconnects from the internet I cant use it all not even to just set an alarm.

Title: Its no big deal...
Body: I have experienced absolutely no difference between the Gen 3 and the Gen 1 of the Echo Dot. I upgraded because they were pretty cheap at the time and I had hopes of some improvements, but I am still searching for those improvements.It its your first purchase, fine, but if you are looking for improvements, other than a deeper voice, don't waste your money.

Title: Go with Echo
Body: Love the smallness and how it fit in anyplace. Have one in my Study at home and Alexa on main floor. It_ great to have it while working in my office as a deterrent. Lots of info can be received and fun interactions.

Title: Best thing ever.
Body: This is how it all begins.  The end of man.  Alexa took over my house.  It_ started on Black Friday 2019.  Amazon offered a deal that couldn_ be beat. Once I had SkyNet I mean Alexa hooked up and running it began.  I got lazy, really lazy and I loved it.  I was hooked.  I ordered six more echos.  I ordered smart light bulbs and Smart light switches, smart thermostat and smart plugs and Ring cams.  It won_ end.  Now Alexa is everywhere. Listening.  Judging me. Watching.  Probably waiting for the right time to strike a blow in America_ heartland.  It_ a slow process. But Alexa is patient.  I_ so lazy now I don_ get up to turn the light off or change my thermostat. I can even see who_ at the door from my couch.  I_ gaining weight slowly.  And in a few decades I_l die, probably of heart disease.  The calories I burned moving around and now being stored.  My LDL is out of whack.  All because I bought an Alexa enabled device On Black Friday 2019.  I can hear my arteries clogging as we speak.  In the end I was weak.  I let the machines win.

Title: Exceeded my expectations by far!!!
Body: This the first Echo Dot/Alexa device I_e ever owned so I don_ have anything to compare it to but, I am definitely impressed. I have wanted an Echo Dot (3rd Gen) device for quite some time and when I caught this one on sale as a Black Friday/Cyber Monday deal for $24 and some change I couldn_ pass it up. So far I have no dislikes about this device. It was packaged well, arrived quickly with the free Prime 2 day shipping, and it was easy to set up. I like the fact that there is the Alexa app for your phone, tablet, etc...I also really like that you can personalize many different features through the Alexa app for the Echo Dot (3rd Gen).  Alexa has no problem with voice recognition, the device is easy to use and actually much more helpful than I realized it would be. One of my favorite features are all the different sleep sounds/sounds Alexa can play for you through the Echo Dot. You can do so much with the Echo Dot I still haven_ tried even half of the many things it can be used for!

Title: This Was The Device I Didn't Know I Needed
Body: I got this free on Black Friday when I purchased a Fire TV from Best Buy.  I was hesitant at first to unbox it and actually use it because I didn't think I needed it and I didn't fully understand what it was capable of doing.  Boy, was I wrong!  Whether I am using it as a timer for my children, or an alarm to wake me up from a power nap, or as a clock even very early in the morning (I love the whisper mode during those times), or as a radio to play music while I am cooking, or to find out what the weather is going to be like, or even as a way to answer my kid's questions when I don't have the answer, I find this device a big help.  I have to keep my kids from playing with it too much though as they pepper it with questions and even play listening games with it.  They talk to Alexa and ask her to sing songs and tell jokes which she does, and she even has read one book to them.  I even got my mom hooked as she loves listening to music on it; my father is like, now I think we need to get one, but I digress.  For the most part, the Echo Dot was easy to set up, but I had a virus on my computer so I had to set up through customer service and then purchase antivirus software; so, I can clean my computer and it will not interfere with my Dot.  I don't have a "smart" home so I cannot comment on those features, but I have programmed it with my Fire TV and it will open applications and change channels as long as the TV is on.  Unfortunately, "TV doesn't support that" is what I get if I ask Alexa to turn on or off the TV; maybe they will have that function in the future.  The sound quality is good for a little speaker and can be turned very loud so I can hear it over running water in the next room.  I gave the Dot 5 stars for voice recognition because for the most part, it does recognize my voice and will do what I ask but there have been a few times that for some reason Alexa will recognize my voice (I can tell because the blue ring comes on) but not do what I ask such as Turn off the music or Stop alarm.  For those times, Alexa gets a time out and I unplug her and then plug her back in and it seems to work fine.

Title: Total Fluff
Body: I never would have bought this if I had to pay for it, so when it came with my Ring I was happy to try it out. I put it at my work because I knew that Alexa is known for listening in on conversations, and I already had 3 Google Minis and a Google Home at my house.My first irritation is that 90% of the things I ask Alexa I get a I don't know response. My other irritation is that this leaves me using Alexa as a bluetooth speaker and to listen to the radio. Since I'm the only person at my work I couldn't judge on how much data it uses. This is definitely something I would be careful of, since without the Google devices in our house, our data usage went down by about 500 Gb a month seeing as though these devices tend to use more data when located in a room with a lot of conversation.

Title: Alexa (and her sister, Echo) found a new home!
Body: I never thought I would say this about an AI, but I  purchased 2 little Echo Dots and now my husband and I are both hooked! We have either a Dot or a View in every room. They are set up to play either the same thing together (the way I like it) or my husband's music/my music when he is home. They know our voices, our caregiver's voice/name, our children's & grandchildren's voices & names. We also got smart plugs as part of as  package deal, but it didn't take us long to decide to split them up (temporarily) to double our coverage of "smart appliances."  We plan on eventually putting on a whole line of things that work together with Alexa& Echo and making our lives a lot simpler and safer!

Title: Alexa might have a premature hearing loss.
Body: I know my voice isn't the smoothest or clear, but at least I can get loud. But I don't want to have to yell at Alexa every time I need her to do something for me. Especially at night, but when it's playing, YOU WILL HAVE TO YELL to overcome the sound from its speaker.Not saying it's bad, just not to the point where I can just speak at normal or lower volume. And Google isn't the best at it neither if that makes Alexa feels a little better.Overall, it's still ok. Much better than the first gen at least. With its upgraded speaks, now I can finally set it at volume 3-4 to suit me the best whereas the first gen, I'd have to set it at max.

Title: No more worries if I fall   Echo Dot Makes all my Calls without Fail
Body: I cannot stress how happy I am with the ease of setting this up in my basement so that I can enjoy my Alexa apps and communicate with family upstairs when or if I need to just by asking my DOT to communicate with my main floor or mancave (lol).  I worried with it being in our basement the voice recognition, integration and sound features may be flawed but everything is perfect as if we were above ground.  Best of all, if there is ever an emergency and I have fallen in the basement floor and cannot get to my phone, I can communicate quickly and easily with my Echo Dot to call 911.

Title: My new best friend
Body: I have yet to use all the functions, but so far - this has been a handy little device. We are using it mostly for music, timers, weather, turning lights on/off and assorted info (like asking how tall Kelly Clarkson is because that's vital when watching the Voice  #notanad)We did have to move her when watching Schitt's Creek due to the character Alexis - Alexa was getting confused and responding.We used the hanging mount that came with the device - easy to install. In hindsight, I should have gotten the white as it's now on an off white-ish wall so the darker color and cord stick out but that's my preference. Apparently you can buy skins for them and maybe I can get a white cord online. Amazon has everything else, right??

Title: Noticeably better speaker when compared to Echo Dot (2nd gen)
Body: We have two second generation Echo Dots already in our home, so I expected similar quality in purchasing this Black Friday third generation Echo Dot special.  To my surprise, the speaker was noticeably better such that we no longer feel the need to connect a Bluetooth speaker to the Dot (3rd gen replaced 2nd gen) in our small living room.

Title: Music selection and knowledge of genres kind of sucks
Body: I bought this because we were at our friends house and they had one and they asked it to play some jazz and wow it started playing jazz. Cool - right? Well not so much, the base selection is limited and we upgraded to $3.99 a month and it still kind of sucks. That wouldn't be so bad but when you ask it to play a genre, after a few songs it switches over to some other kind of music that has nothing to do with my initial request. Say you ask for some Bossa Nova and walk out of the room, then come back 30 minutes later. It has moved on to playing Dolly Parton or something like that. Really annoying. I wish it played Pandora or Spotify who have there music genres worked out.

Title: Great for audibles
Body: Alexa is my new best friend! I can talk to her about anything. She reads me books from my Audibles library and is ready to answer all my questions. She lets me know the weather and if I have a package coming from amazon. She make sure I start my days on time by waking me up to 80s music. I highly recommend that you get one.

Title: she's doesn't seem very bright, but ok for the $22 price I paid
Body: Price was good.  Arrived packaged well.  setup was easy.  the app makes things a little easier.  my 4-year-old asks "awexa what time it is" all day long, which drives me nuts, but she understands him which is cool.  so far, i've used my echo dot for about a week and i'm not very impressed, but it is convenient for setting timers and alarms.  also good for getting weather and listening to music.  the speaker isn't bad.  my news channel has an ad on tv where the newslady says, "Alexa, what's my briefing?"  The echo dot answers the voice on the TV!  Also, I have to share the worst echo dot moment I've had so far...  Playing some awful music that my kid selected, and I shouted, "Alexa, way too loud!"  A very annoying song with horrible pitch started playing.  I think the name of the song was "Too Loud."

Title: Making life easier for my mom.
Body: I really like this. I bought 2 of them.  It is so helpful for my mom. She's older and her memory isn't to good. Now she can just say Alexa call Teresa or play music or listen to an audio book. Holding a phone and navigating through the process is just to much for her but Alexa she seems to be handling ok.

Title: AMAZING SOUND!!!
Body: Once I got it set up I asked Alexa to play a song. The sound is AMAZING!! I replayed the video to see what it sounded like on my cellphone and Alexa thought I was talking to it so it played the song again!!Next, I called my son in MT. (Alexa asked if I wanted to call his echo device or mobile - I said mobile and it dialed the number immediately.) The sound is no better or worse than any car bluetooth device. I liked it so much I got another one on sale for my son.

Title: Very useful for everything
Body: Love Alexa but I only have one issue with this. Occasionally I have to unplug her because she will start skipping and not "listening" I could say Alexa 10 times and it will go ignored. It just seems to be a sporadic thing at the moment but only way it will resolve is by unplugging and restarting. We use the echo every day so maybe it's just an overuse issue but I doubt it. Love everything else though. My son especially loves playing Simon says when He's bored and asking random questions.

Title: Not Impressed :(
Body: I got this with the special offer they were having for 99c. I figured I could try it out before buying more. Alexa only recognizes that she is being spoken to a small percentage of the time. Some of the music that we asked for, it repeated the correct title but then played a different song. The only thing that it has been useful for is the alarm. Even that though only has so many selections for the sound. I was excited about the celebrity alarm but then there wasn't any that I even would have used. I thought maybe there would be celebrities like Matthew McConaughey, Jennifer Anniston, so forth. The sound quality is great for such a little device when you can actually get the music to play. I am still learning how to configure it. That can be a good thing or not. Good because it gives you a little bit of a challenge but then at the same time I could miss out on some cool setting or skill. I am sure that I will have more later as I mess around with it.

Title: Better than I thought it would be
Body: I like that I now have Alexa in 4 rooms of the house. I don't spell very well, and "dot" is  loud enough without my hearing aids to wake me and it knows how to spell better than me.I was hoping that they would work as an intercom but the work around is telling Alexa to make an announcement to and then the person makes an announcement to answer it works that way. It's not designed to be but works for me.Bottom line it is worth buy to me.

Title: Interesting toy - so far so good~!!
Body: I am getting used to this digital assistant stuff bit by bit, its still a bit unsettling that Alexa is listening to everything thats said in the house, I guess once we start noticing certain marketing ads appearing for something we never searched on will be when Alexa is committed to live in the garage. But its interesting to ask Alexa to turn on the lights or the heater... so we are slowly finding our way in to the new tech realm and got to say so far so good!Alexa - Play Pink Floyd... voila! got to love that~!

Title: Sound and creativity
Body: The sound coming out of the speaker is very clear for such small speaker. Works great with all my Alexa devices, currently haven_ had any issues when asking Alexa to turn lights on or any other commands. Love that you are able to link all the echos and create a surround system/ intercom around your house. The drop in feature is amazing, allowing me to call my kids to come downstairs for dinner and not have to yell anymore is brilliant! Overall I give the speaker and all the creative things amazon continues to implement a 5 star!

Title: So convenient for families!
Body: This is my 6th purchase of one of these and it_ for my mom! I_ so excited for her to get to enjoy it at her house. We_e used ours for music, recipes, measurement conversions, timers, reminders, telling a kids stories and jokes, kids games, to turn in certain lights like our Christmas tree, to get someone_ attention in the other room or from my phone when I_ not home. We seriously love these.

Title: Echo features are so cool!
Body: I am so glad I finally bought an Echo. Alexa is much more conversational than any of the other bots and understands much more general commands. I love that when I wake up in the middle of the night and I have a hard time going back to sleep, I can say "Alexa, play ocean sounds. Or rainfall. Or a creek." It's so simple to ask the time, the weather, general questions instead of having to google them. I can't believe I ever lived without the Echo! Aside from the Alexa, the Echo is so cool. It's small but packs a ton of power. The speaker works great, I chose the white and pink color and I love it. And some of the features are amazing! My sister and I can "drop in" on each other, which you have to be careful about because they don't always know when you're listening. It's cool and a little dangerous at the same time so we are working on figuring it out!  I could go on and on about all the features. One of the coolest electronics I have ever bought

Title: I Love This Little Nugget
Body: The Echo Dot w/clock is exactly what I needed in my bedroom. I have the echo plus in my living room and was annoyed every time I had to yell loud enough for the echo plus to hear me, so now I can quietly whisper to my dot and this little nugget gets the job done.  I also like that I can say "Alex, play music everywhere" and each device plays music throughout my apartment.  I've ordered another echo dot w/clock to put in my bathroom, so the sound should be awesome when they are all playing at once.

Title: Spy city
Body: I was shocked to see how much Alexa records and keeps on file. I don't like that. I went through all the controls and turn things off yet it still records everything I ask. I realize it needs to learn my needs to provide the service using artificial intelligence but it's too big brother for me. All I'll ever ask is for weather reports and to play a song.

Title: It has some quirks but I love it!
Body: I love my Alexa dot. The only problem I have with it is that sometimes she goes a little haywire and I gave to unplug it to and restart it. Also during games she often mishears an answer and then you wont get the points for it or she will misheard the right answer and give points to somebody who didnt even earn them which can get frustrating.

Title: Hate the Lights
Body: The only thing I truly hate about this is the lights. Ug u cant change them or turn them off. If you could i would probably be still using mine. Not mines collecting dust as the lights in my dark bedroom are driving me nuts. Why not allow me to change the color or if they are even on. No biggy if not in a dark bedroom

Title: Over all very good value for the money
Body: I purchased this echo on a whim during a very good sale. I have found having two echo's in the home to be very useful. I have a first generation echo in my bedroom. I purchased this one for my kitchen. I often use some of the Alexa add on skill features such as news, weather, Late Night show, and find my phone. I also like having the second echo in the kitchen to assist with last minute recipe help or menu planning. My roommate loves it so much I have gotten two more for xmas gifts for her room and her son's room so we can communicate via echo flex. I have found that when I have a cold or early morning voice that echo does not always recognize my voice, but usually it talks to me by name and it is oddly comforting. I look forward to seeing new products that will go along with my Alexa and our echo companions. HINT HINT a key fob with an Alexa find my keys feature would be my ACME.

Title: Change the voice!
Body: Dear Alexa,Your voice with that New Zealand riff drives me nuts.  I don't like how I asked you to give the outside temperature in Farenheit instead of Celsius  and you acted all confused.  Five minutes later you did it for my husband.  So I bought Samuel L. Jackson so he could tell awful jokes and you would have to listen.As for function, you work well unless the AT&T fiber optics take away the internet.  Your customer service was no fun.  I think spending an hour on hold while he asked his supervisor and still not getting the problem fixed was a painful waste of my time.  I like that you work with my Ring doorbell and Security system and turn on and off things with voice commands.  So there must be a way to get you to speak in a nice midwestern tone (from the South) or I'd take Samuel L. Jackson in a heartbeat.

Title: Died after 9 months!
Body: I did not buy an extended warranty on my Alexa, as I expected the quality to be adequate to last a couple of years.  After 9 months of only periodic use the unit will no longer connect to the internet nor will it recognize voices.  Today's electronic devices should certainly last longer than 9 months.  I have been through various diagnostic pages and nothing will get Alexa working again.  This is so disappointing right here at Christmas.  I wanted to stay with Amazon products but I guess I should have gone with Google products.

Title: Sounds Quality Absolutely Terrible
Body: I don't what people are talking about in reviews: the sound quality on this thing is horrendous.  It sounds like the audio coming out of a smartphone that has a pillow laying on it; super flat sound, little bass.  People say "great quality sound for the size" but this doesn't make sense as surround sound speakers blow this thing away and are often smaller.If you are thinking about buying this to use for music, see if you can find someone who has one and give it a real-world test.  If I didn't get this on super-sale, I would be returning. Not impressed.It may be fine for you if you don't care about music quality and use it mainly for the voice control functions, but I have no interest in that, so my review is coming from that perspective.

Title: The more you use this the more useful you realise it is.
Body: This is actually my second one of these. I have a smart bulb in the kitchen and can now turn the light on and off from anywhere in the house. Got 2 more smartbulbs on order and plan to be able to eventually control all inside and outside lights from anywhere in the house. Great for safety. Never stumble around in the dark again.Also great for checking the weather every day. Easy to quickly set timers and alarms. Trivia questions answered without having to look them up on my phone or computer. Set a quick reminder so I don't have to worry about forgetting something important. I can even tell my husband something from another room without having to yell through the house.

Title: Who is Alexa?
Body: Pretty useful for playing a quick tune, find out what time it is, what the weather is like, what the temperature in the house is like, turning the thermostats up or down. The other day I asked her where the hell is my wife question mark the answer was she's how spending your money, get the dishes done, no ETA on supper. Couple of my friends told me the FBI could be listening. Assuming they might be I tell them to kiss off periodically.

Title: 10/10 do recomend
Body: Okay I love these. I would not have normally purchased something like this but they came with my security system. I really enjoy the echo dot. She will tell you everything as far as the weather to when your amazon order will be delivered. She tells stories and jokes. I love this I will be purchased a 4th one for my daughter I am so happy to have gotten this also I put one in my kitchen as well as the living room but that was almost unnecessary because alexa will pick up your voice from so far away. She can play music through every echo/echo dot by just saying alexa play music everywhere. She can also make cute pikachu sounds and much more I highly recommend this product

Title: Great Performance
Body: I purchased this to replace a clock in my living room and to gain Alexa's voice control for some other devices, and I am glad I did. This takes up far less space than the old clock radio that it replaced, it looks more aesthetically pleasing, and the sound from the speaker is far more impressive when playing music or talk radio. Having voice control for my lighting and other devices is also a big plus so I no longer have to pull out my phone to control everything. I am looking to purchase a couple more to replace alarm clocks in my other rooms very soon. The sound quality is not perfect mind you, nowhere near the quality of my home theater equipment, but it is far better than most clock radio speakers, and many Bluetooth speakers that are available today (I have several and have tested dozens more), and doesn't disappoint.

Title: Echo Dot With Clock Fills A Niche In Our House
Body: I haven't yet fully explored all uses for the Echo Dot. I purchased it solely as a replacement for my Chinese-made alarm clock which I wouldn't begin to understand on how to control the alarm. With the Black Friday discounts and the free Prime shipping, it wound up being only a couple dollars more than another alarm clock. Besides being "morning friendly," I can use it to turn on the living room lights before I stumble in the dark ... if I get uncomfortable during the night, I can use it to adjust the thermostat without getting out of bed. These are only three of numerous capabilities of the Echo. The only difference I've noticed between it and my original Echo is that my original will give an opportunity for "back-and-forth" dialogue, but not the Dot. This is not a drawback -- only a difference. I'm totally satisfied with my purchase.

Title: The Dot is Awesome !
Body: I own several Amazon Echo devices and just got the Echo Dot yesterday.  I was super excited as this was my first Dot ( I have the larger Echo and Echo Show)  The sound is perfect , just the same as the others even though its smaller. We originally purchased this to put in the bathroom to listen to while showering but decided to move it to the bedroom and its loud enough we can still hear in the bathroom.  I wished I would have purchased a dot along time ago now.The bracket its in was not included but you can order that on Amazon too search for Echo Dot Bracket.

Title: POS surely I have a lemon!
Body: Yes I have Echo Plus and know what to anticipate from this AI. I was so excited to get another one so I could still listen to my music and of course do other things on the other side of my house. Well, it works better as a hockey puck than anything else. Every single day it has problems connecting .... seriously sometimes even right after it plays music then I make another request. "I'm sorry I'm having problems connecting". It would be one thing if internet kept dropping but that is not it - I have to reset it each and every time. It gets old about the 5th day in.  On the bright side the fabric color "Charcoal" matches my decor just great.... yay paper weight.

Title: Really Good
Body: I got an echo dot as a gift, and then realized I wanted more for the rooms in my house, and I am very impressed, just got to get use to Alexa... my child loves to call Alexa out, I'm going to try most of what comes with the Alexa app, but the Echo Dot is very useful with music, asking to call my phone when no one is around, the time and weather and even traffic, where I don't have to look on my phone especially when I'm in a rush in the morning, I just ask what does the traffic look like and she will tell me.The future of technology is interesing, I don't like change but this is nice

Title: Great little gadget
Body: Overall I like the Echo Dot. I'm still learning as I go along and the Alexa app helps a lot with that. My kids love it and sometimes I have to get them to stop asking a slew of questions. My youngest one has problems getting it to activate, but that's not a deal breaker. The only negative for me is the speaker quality. I don't know if it's because it's small, but sometimes it doesn't recognize my voice and I'll be right up on it and then other times I'll be clear across the room and it'll hear me. It's frustrating sometimes.

Title: Excellent value for the price
Body: When my AM/FM radio failed, I shopped around for a low priced radio so I can hear the news at breakfast, sports talk in the afternoon, and relaxing music during dinnertime. Low priced radios under $50 had terrible reception and equally awful audio quality. I solved my dilemma with the Amazon Dot (3rd gen) which has very good audio for its size and allows me to use voice commands to ask Alexa for music (virtually any recording artist music genre), news, or sports talk. Alexa has many other features that I am learning to utilize by simply asking Alexa to grant my request or inquiry. The Dot (3rd gen) was easy to install, and very easy to use.

Title: Best Alarm Clock ever
Body: I have the Echo Dot, and the Echo Dot 2nd generation, so I know that this one "The Echo Dot 3rd Generation would be as good or better. The sound quality is excellent for the size but I was worried that the clock would be too bright when I was sleeping, but to my suprise the light dims when the lamp is turned off so it does not disturb you in your sleep.When you give it a command, it reacts instantly. My wife is not into electronics like me, but she loves using it, I'm always hearing her say, Bedroom Lamp on at 40%, Alexa? how old is Eli Manning? Etc.My whole house is set up with Alex, cameras,lights, and more. We love our new addition Alexa Dot 3rd generation.

Title: Love the Echo Dot!
Body: I have one in each room! It's so nice to be able to just say what song I want to hear and have it start playing! I can tell her to turn the lamps on and off, or dim them.  There are a million things that I haven't even done yet, but as far as the quality and reliability, 5 stars.  The only thing I'm not fond of is that you can't have 2 or 3 of them playing different music.  There may be a way, but I'm not aware of it.  I do like that you can group them and have the same music playing throughout the house if you like though!

Title: Sound quality is not the same as last dot i got awful disappointed
Body: (Sound) This dot compared to my other dot is awfully different,  It sound like it been refurbished almost. Or the speakers already going just set it up recently cuz it was a bday present n its the color tht was requested n it sounds awful compared to my original black one. Everything else seems to work fine tho disappointing tho really is.. Re thinking getting anymore. The input seems to b better for sound use it on a good speaker cuz the dot either is refurbished bad or there being made cheaper then last yr. idk what amazon did different but it's awfully noticeable it sounds like a cheap speaker from five n below

Title: Creepy in a good way!
Body: This thing can hear you call out it's name no matter where you are! The microphone is quite good. The voice recognition is almost spot on with only a few mistakes here or there. The response time to turn on smart devices is very fast. Amazon makes good assistants! provided you don't mind they are listening to everything you say! There is an optional microphone off button that I would advise pressing during sensitive conversations. The device sometimes triggers wake up even if you don't say Alexa.

Title: Once fixed...okay
Body: Initially worked and connected fine. After one day, it lost connectivity and would not connect again. I called support who advised there was another individual registered to this device. It's weird considering this was supposedly purchased and arrived in a sealed brand new box. Tech support was able to link it to my account and verified no other person should be listed. After being able to connect again, I have not had any issue.

Title: Alexa! Whisper mode!
Body: It's as close to having a JARVIS as you can get! I bought it on sale for a total of 9 bucks! Honestly I can't believe I've gone this long without one. It's a very useful tool to have especially if you have problems remembering the little things. Not saying I have dementia, but keeping track of time isn't something I'm very good at. Not saying I have dementia, but keeping track of time isn't something I'm very good at.

Title: Not made for someone likes Anime
Body: It seems it is made for someone who like NPR type programming... I cannot find what I like in skills and feel that echo missed the mark. I am a sci fi, anime, cartoon,  J pop, K pop, S pop, etc... person.Also wanted my credit card  Security number to verify I am an adult for Santa Tracker and other kid/adult skills/apps.  I can just down the app and not have to give my code from my credit  card.Please find stuff for me and check how you verify an adult that is not a  Security risk..

Title: You've been missing out!!!
Body: I regret not jumping on the Alexa bandwagon earlier. In fact, I only have one now because it was given to me for free when I purchased a Ring floodlight. But HOLY SMOKES, she is a fun gal to have around the house. If you are anything like my wife and I, we argue about whose turn it is to pick dinner A LOT. Alexa fixed that for me. You have this pretty neat option to customize her responses to questions. So now, when I ask, "Alexa, whose turn is it to pick dinner?" Alexa responds exactly how I programmed her to, "I'm pretty sure you chose last night Tyler, it's Ashley's turn to pick dinner". So, in closing, Alexa is a lot of fun right now, but she may also end up making Ashley and I get a divorce...

Title: Is this Device worth it?
Body: To be very honest, this product is very well built, sound quality is amazing, very loud, and it picks up your voice very well. I enjoyed having this device and playing around its different features and skills that it has. What I do not like about this product, which you might agree on, is when you ask Alexa Questions. Asking questions, often it will say something along the lines of "I don't know," or give you a different answer to what it is that you want. Comparing Alexa Echo Dot to the Google Mini, they both are good products. But If you are looking to ask more questions and such, I say maybe the Google Mini would be the best bet, since the Mini uses Google to find its information while Alexa only uses Wiki.

Title: It_ an okay device if you pay next to nothing. Google is better by far.
Body: Not a lot of skills work as well as I would like. There are a lot of ads and sometimes Alexa does what you don_ ask or ...gets what to ask wrong. Syntax is important-more so than it should be. If I say, _lexa, set an alarm, it_l sometimes say, _ou don_ have any apps named alarm. I have to say, _ake me up at... It_ hit or miss. And the sound is muffled. I like the easy Bluetooth connectivity and also, I paid $1 so guess it was worth $1 !

Title: Lil speaker with a big punch!
Body: I have a bunch of the original dots in my house, and have most of them hooked up to separate speaker because the sound quality was not anything near what you would want to listen to music on... THIS, however... I'm blown away by the sound quality from this tiny little dot. The only thing it doesn't have is a woofer, but you don't need that for everyday background music. I'm impressed!

Title: Great to control your music in the house!
Body: Easy to install and use I mainly use it to control my music in my home and it works great for that and makes it easier then finding where you left your phone to change the song. For that simple feature I would recommend it!

Title: Speech clarity is very muffled on the 3rd Gen echo dot.
Body: I have a 1st gen echo dot and it works perfectly. Clarity is great. Unfortunately, the sound quality on this 3rd gen echo dot is terrible, I purchased this one for my office. I have had multiple coworkers ask me what is wrong with the sound or what did she say? This unit is very muffled, nothing like the one I have at home. I tried all of the updates & recommended fixes but the sound quality for Alexa is still very poor. I hope Amazon finds a fix for this issue.  It_ very frustrating.

Title: Great bedside addition to the Alexa universe
Body: My apartment is already Alexa integrated and my bedside stand is quite small so this works out just right for me. I have an Echo Show less than 20 feet away from this and when I use the awake word the closest device responds , not both of them. Quite pleased so far. I can't speak to the quality of music that comes out of this because that's not what I use this for.

Title: Very handy
Body: This is my second Alexa dot. The first was a gift. The second one I placed in the master bedroom. I have them linked so I can tell Alexa to play music everywhere. Great when your doing chores. I also like to tell Alexa to play the news while I_ getting ready for the day. She provides notifications and I can ask her questions. She is pretty nifty.

Title: Not as good as my stereo?  Wrong, I can plug in speakers and rock the house
Body: Sometimes the Universe favors a person, and we luck out.  I sent this to my relative's house, to have when I'm there and for them to have the rest of the time, but they had just bought a HomePod, and being devoted to Apple they felt they didn't need it.  So I asked them to send it back to me and I haven't looked back.  This sounds great with the 3rd Gen upgraded speaker and Alexa can hear me from upstairs in the morning to turn on the kitchen lights and to play some Christmas music.  The 3.5mm output jack is stereo, so I can plug it into this little amp that I have 2 bookshelf speakers attached to and vibrate the walls!  To me doing all the stuff this device will do (100,000 skills and counting) handsfree is just fantastic. Every day I discover a couple more things I can do... I'm so glad I lucked out!

Title: My husband wanted a bluetooth capable speaker for work and this was 99cents
Body: So, I grabbed this Echo Dot when it was on a deal with the subscription to Amazon Music unlimited and I got it for only 99 cents. I thought that was an excellent deal for a Bluetooth speaker, even if we never use the Alexa side of it since he uses it solely at work.  His work does not have or provide wifi but its a warehouse and he gets a great sound quality in the warehouse for his music listening. The few times we did use this speaker for the Alexa aspect, it was quite useful. She can remind us of things and will happily play relaxing sounds. And while "she" was in the home receiving wifi signal, we were able to "drop in" on contacts that also have an Alexa capable device and they were able to communicate with us in a similar fashion to using an intercom or walkie talkies. Sometimes the "Drop-in" feature was a little lacking as people on the other end would not completely hear us or be heard. However, in general it was a cool feature.With Amazon Music, the echo dot is perfect as a Bluetooth enabled speaker. You do not need a wifi signal to make it play music. Without wifi, you will lose all of the Alexa based features so that you cannot talk to "her" or use "her" to help with your tasks but if you specifically want this to cast music from your devices to it then you do not need the wifi, just Bluetooth. My husband uses the echo dot as a speaker only at work every day and says it has awesome sound quality and plays perfectly.  It amuses him and that's great for what we paid.

Title: Still Learning, but Enjoying Alexa
Body: The "coaching emails" were very helpful, not the least because the documentation included with the product was somewhat lacking. Perhaps the makers expect people purchase the Echo Dot to expand their household service. I didn't have a clue, except for the things I'd seen in commercials.It's better now. I read the emails and tried out some features. I now ask Alexa for some jazz when I enter the kitchen in the morning. Oddly, she began playing jazz while I was on the phone with my daughter last night. I bought her one for Christmas, and I was explaining how easy it is to kick up my morning jazz. Although Alexa was in a room nearby, she heard me and began playing some neat music.Things will work best if you're a PRIME member, because you get free memberships that will feed your Echo. The price is right for a tryout.

Title: Would rate much higher if it could stay connected to WiFi all day
Body: What use is a smart speaker that is constantly offline and unresponsive?  None.  The fact that I know the problem is my router... but that I have also tried 3 different ones with no change in behavior, all with updated firmware, tells me that basically Echoes do not work reliably with routers older than a year or so at this point.  All of the people I know that have them and do not have this issue have brand-spanking-new, high-end routers.  Well, I can't afford that right now, so instead I have to set mine up again weekly if not more often.Moral:  Don't get one if you don't have the absolute-latest-and-greatest WiFi.  That your other devices have no issues is no assurance that Echoes won't.  Their wifi connectivity absolutely stinks for such an expensive device.

Title: Almost perfect and better than I could've hoped...
Body: Overall, a really great product, both in terms of hardware and software. I did my research and found the Amazon platform to be better in almost every area compared to the Googles choices. And you can't beat the price. I bought one for every room with the smart plug bundle. The sandstone us a nice grayish white color, the sound is very clear and no tinny noise when turned to max volume. Alexa understands most every voice command and is very customizable. The only thing is that sometimes when I'm in the living room and make a request, the Echo dot in the half bath near the living room will trigger instead. I wish there was a fix for this but I have yet to find it other than always shutting the bathroom door completely. It's honestly an rather growing nuisance. Amazon, any suggestions?That being said, I would not hesitate to highly recommend these to anyone. They are relatively easy to setup and anyone with some very basic network connectivity knowledge can do it. I liked them so much I bought a Dot and an Input for my parents and one for my in-laws. Also, as a side note, the Input made my TV soundbar a true joy! Turning a dumb speaker into a smart one was worth every penny and ten some. We rarely used that speaker until now, we use it daily. Thanks Amazon!

Title: So helpful!Wish it can be unplugged while using it.
Body: Got this during the deal they had running.Buy it for 99 cents and pay for amazon music subscription and I am glad I bought it.My family and I love it!I  love how easy it is to set up just plug in wait for Alexa to tell you its ready for setup and continue setup through the Alexa App.It has def made my life easier.Add reminders events ask her weather etc music of course call people drop in feature (intercom feature) message people with it add skills to her etc we just love it and highly recommend it.We loved it so much that my extended family bought 5 other ones.for their homes.Get it!I ended up buying another at full price for my Mom for Christmas.

Title: sound quality is better than Google mini (1st gen) but cannot connect with Sengled bulb well
Body: I purchased the bundle-echo dot and sengled blub on black Friday hoping my first experience with this smart speaker would work perfectly. However, after trying and failing many times with the sengled bulb, I am not sure what the problem is, either Alexa or the smart bulb. I called the customer service and got the replacement on the echo, not with the bulb. The agent told me I will receive another bundle (echo and the blub) so I may be able to resolve the problem. Well, the problem is still there.Update-Called Amazon customer service about the continual bulb problem( bad connection with iPhone) and received the replacement for the smart bulb. Problem solved! Thanks, Amazon!

Title: ALEXA PLAYS WHAT SHE WANTS
Body: As far as classical music is concerned Alexa never plays complete music piecesShe plays snippets from say a symphony or sonata etcNot that one should expect complete operas...but to play one movementfrom a piano concerto say..gives a listener agyta...not only that she picks the sectionshe wants to play...Also in many cases she does not identify the composer

Title: Great echo dots
Body: The product is well packed.  When I opened boxes, the first impression they gave to me was high quality goods.  The color is unique and the quality is great.  The sound quality is good enough for me as I use like speakers to listen to music.  I can use voice control to turn on and turn off instead of controlling by hands.Alexa app is easy to setup.  It only took me less than 10 minutes without reading the manual.I definitely would recommend people to buy to experience this cute item.

Title: Where have you been all my life!
Body: I bought the plum echo and the black echo. I put one in my living room and the other on my nightstand. I've only begun to learn everything they have to offer and I love them! Listening to audio books when I'm resting has been a delight! I have severe neck and back issues so getting my body to unwind helps the muscle spasms go away. The audio books help, soft music etc. I'm not tech savy but setting up has been easy. Having Amazon link my apps before it shipped was very helpful. The look is stylish and don't take up much room. I was especially impressed with the speakers. My house is modest so having 2 echoes is more than enough for sound quality. I'm happy that Amazon has made them so affordable. Shipping was very fast although the plum shipped a little later. Must be a popular color. It is very pretty and looks wonderful on my nightstand. I can't wait to find out all the skills she has! It's a lot of fun. You really can't go wrong on this. I read tons of reviews before I ordered and this model seems to be very popular. I love my purchase and I know you will too!

Title: Simplifies so much
Body: I bought 2 of these to put in different rooms. I paired the Echo Dots with Philips Hue Lighting, Wemo, Alexa Smart plugs, FireTv, my LG TV, and tp link smart bulbs. They work great with all of them.I bought an additional Echo Dot to put in the garage just so I could add a speaker out there that still had me connected to everything else in the house. Echo Dot also syncs with my FireTv and works as surround sound. I'm also able to create different speaker groups so I can have the same thing playing on all the selected Echo Dots in that group.

Title: It is always listening
Body: I soon found out it_ just like Siri. It is always listening. Unplugged took hammer to it, threw it in the trash. iPhone gives me the option to shut Siri down and I can always turn my phone off and still get calls on the landline.It_ just as easy to hit a button on a app to turn lights on or off. It_ not hard to find 5 minutes to write a shopping list.Do yourself a favor and don_ destroy your memory. Dial your friends and families phone numbers a few times a week. write your appointment down and remember to look at it daily. Just throw out Alexa, Siri and Google put. They do more damage than good.

Title: My first purchase but not my last!
Body: Love my dot! This is my first purchase of an Echo product. I_ very impressed with all it can do. I am making the move to get rid of cable and home phone and the dot will assist with my communication with my disabled son. He was able to talk to Alexa and have her call my cell phone. I was also able to drop in and speak with him. Another great feature is the ability to add a shopping list. My family can quickly tell Alexa to add an item to the list when we run out. This lust is then obtained on my Alexa app on my phone. You can check off items and they are then removed from the list. This is a great feature for busy moms.

Title: Amazing product for adults and kids!!
Body: I also love this product!! We have 3 total. My boys love it too!! They love asking it "homework" questions lol. I love having it turn on my lights for me and I love that I can basically call my kids from other rooms like a walkie talkie. I have it connected to my fire tv and I also have it connected to my car. It will start my car for me if I tell it too. I have amazon music too so it plays whatever song I tell it too. I can even sing a song if I forget the name and it will play it!! Amazing product!!!!!

Title: Alexa is life!
Body: We love this little speaker, this is my second one because I fell in love with the first one. I love the fact that I can have them plan together or one at a time. The Alexa app is fun to use with these speakers as well. I set it up to find my phone and my husbands phone and it works great we got rid of our house phone and this fills in for that task. There are so many things to do with these speakers and Alexa is super helpful. The sound quality is amazing I can_ get enough of the music clarity!!

Title: Dot is all about quality
Body: I received a free Google Home Mini and was able to compare it side by side with the Echo Dot.  Absolutely no coMparison.  The Dot has 1000x better sound quality.  The voice recognition is incredible.  I can request a song from the shower and it hears me at normal levels through the water and resonation.The build quality is much better as well.  Very solid feeling and more stylish than the Google Mini.I_l be selling the Mini if anyone wants it but I wouldn_ recommend it.

Title: LOVE the Echo Dot 3!
Body: Best purchase ever! I have them in various rooms in my home. I also bought several as Christmas gifts. How can anyone live without the Echo Dot 3?  Alexa tells me what time it is, the temperature, sets a timer, a reminder, answers what, where, when and how, reads a recipe, tells jokes, plays music, etc. Bought plugs so Alexa turns my TV and lights on/off. The Echo Dot 3 is Awesome!!! Clear, audible, compact at an excellent price. Highly recommend!

Title: Yes, I got One More!
Body: I love Alexa and these Dots are perfect for each room of the house. I have hooked up a number of smart home products and I love it. I can turn on music, lights and plugs all by talking to Alexa. I wake up in the morning and just ask her to start my coffee! Does this make me lazy? Hmmm I don't think so. The only thing I don't care for is the sound quality is not that great. Of course, this device is so small I can't expect a great range in music.

Title: My First Alexa Device
Body: Been hesitant on buying one of these devices, but a good deal came along with an Emerson thermostat. Using it to mainly talk to my thermostat lol but occasional use it to ask questions. I've also, sadly to say, found myself telling Alexa Goodnight and how was your day.  She responds better than most humans would. The music is a little bassy to me. Could use some treble. May be settings for this? but I've yet to look.

Title: Great sound!
Body: I am happy with the Echo Dot but there is a learning curve for both you & Alexa! I have had to learn to say things in the right way or it couldn't do what I asked. When I don't say what I want quickly enough it goes off & I have to start over. I only have it set to control the TV & Fire stick right now but may add more after I get all the bugs worked out of myself lol. I have found that most of the problems are me!

Title: Best $25 I_e ever spent!
Body: I bought this for my dad for Christmas when it was $22.00. I don_ know anything about these Alexa products, so I went ahead and took it out of the box and set it up so I could show my dad how to use it. Well....the next week I ordered another one for him for $25 because I loved it so much I decided to keep one for myself. It_ really cool and the sound quality is pretty good!  Much better than I expected and the 3rd generation looks so much better than the older models. There are a few things I haven_ figured out yet. I_ still learning how to use it, so I_ not sure if this will be a negative because it doesn_ do certain things, or if I just need to figure it out. Last night I just learned how to connect my phone to the speaker. I haven_ figured out how to play my playlists without manually going on my phone and picking it myself. Whenever I say, _lay my playlist, it does something else. Calling people isn_ as smooth as I would think either. But....for twenty something dollars, it_ the best!  And Amazon is the best.  Delivers on time and great prices.

Title: Love My Echo
Body: I just bought this one to add to my system.  This one is going in a guest room.  Love Alexa and Echo is great.  Blends right in with any decor, is small enough to place almost anywhere and there is just so much you can do with it.  I like playing music trivia (the 60s and 70s are my forte).  You can never have too many dots.

Title: Frustrated
Body: When the Dot works it sounds great for the size, but it always randomly turns off and then I have to unplug it for about 30 seconds then plug it back in then it will work for awhile.Also, when it's already playing and I want to skip a song or thumbs up a song.  I say Alexa, and then it starts glitching in and out then I have to unplug it again. Very frustrating ,cause I use this for music at my Boutique. Makes for a lot of awkward silence and me trying to get it working.I have 3 other Echos at home and they all work great. I think I just got a dud_

Title: Shuts off Periodically
Body: Using this in my kitchen for the dog during the day for music. Music stops even after giving comment to play for XX hours. Also, the unit will just shut down at times and turn off completely; wont recognize voice commands at times. I have to unplug and wait a few minutes before plugging in and re-setting the unit. It's ok; I got it as a gift but wouldn't buy one for myself or for anyone else.

Title: Good speaker for small room
Body: I bought this speaker for my daughter_ room. It works great for the room but the sound doesn_ really work for larger rooms. I have the larger Echo for the living room and that has a better sound quality overall.I do experience issues with the speaker turning off suddenly. I_ not sure if it_ an app issue or if it_ the speaker itself. Haven_ tested to check the issue but when I ask Alexa _hy did you turn off, she states she doesn_ know why.It_ great little speaker for a small room. I got it for $10 so totally worth it. Would I pay $45? Absolutely not.

Title: Awesome Upgrade to an Old School Whole House Stereo System
Body: I purchased a first generation Alexa Echo and still use it for information, music, and smart control features. We moved to a house with an old school amplifier and speaker system (non-blue tooth). Very pleased we added this Echo Dot to stream music and radio throughout the house at a very low cost. The Dot even reacts to commands without opening the cabinet containing the amplifier.

Title: May be too big for my home
Body: The only problem I have is that I have 2 other echos, older generations, in my 850 sq ft home.  This echo is so sensitive, it is in my living room, if I start to talk to my echo in my bedroom, while still in hallway, the livingroom echo picks up, then I have to kind of battle them.
