Most the time not an issue.  I do love it/them.  I have smart plugs too.  Honestly I_ surprised I have progressed this far this fast with the smart home

Title: Small, but packs a punch...
Body: This product is awesome! Sound quality and clarity can_ be compared with my previous 1st GEN. Very cool little gadget tell you what time it is tells you what the weather is plays music I haven_ listened to in a long time I recommend this to anybody. This is very convenient and the app is very easy to understand.It helps with a lot of things like shopping list ,reminders,alarms etc.You can do so much with this !

Title: Alexa is a good idea.
Body: It's our 5th Dot (3rd generation). We have one in each bedroom, the living room, the kitchen, and now the shop out back. We're becoming more tech all the time. Besides the Dots and all the usual stuff like computers, and TVs, we've started to add switches and bulbs to the mix. So far everything is working. It's been a bumpy learning curve but the Alexa equipment has been reliable throughout.Never had a delivery issue with the Alexas. Right now prices are very good on the equipment, so if you're considering this is a good time for some good deals.

Title: 3rd Gen is a huge improvement in sound quality
Body: I've had Echo devices since generation 1 and have the Echo Show, Echo Dot, Echo Auto, etc. You get the idea. The Echo Dot generation 3 was a huge leap in sound quality when playing music or spoken voice content. It's plenty loud and very robust sounding for its size. It almost sounds like there's a ton of DSP at play. Well done, Amazon!

Title: Mom Approved
Body: Just joined the rest of the world and got myself a few of these echo dots around the house and I will say from a mother's stand point it does help in some ways. The kids can now call their father without bothering me for my phone. I can tell alexa to turn on my kids tv upstairs so I don't have to go upstairs and do it myself. Its just the little things. I was surprised that it actually has a pretty decent speaker as well.

Title: You can barely see the clock readout!
Body: I like this in my bedroom as I have a large one in my livingroom however the feature I got it for was the illuminated clock. You can barely see the clock unless the room is completely dark.  I would have preferred black but they only offered the sandstone color so I could have saved $15.00 and gotten the one without the clock.

Title: I love it so much better than google home
Body: I_e kind of been resisting the whole smart home thing. Every day almost I_e been on multiple computers and phones, used cameras and equipment, joined teleconferences, done software updates, used how many apps, touched how many communication devices, used smart printers, smart scanners, smart washer and dryer, read emails and booked appointments, the list goes on and on! The last thing i want to do at the end of the day is use another device (I probably sound like a crotchety old woman but I_ under 35 lol).I have a google home mini my brother gave me for Christmas and I_e used it (mostly to play music since it sounds pretty decent think) but i really hate how I HAVE to connect my phone to the WiFi and control most things from the google home app (which is not very intuitive in my opinion and feels kind of limited).It_ possible that I only even tried the echo dot because I couldn_ resist the deal of getting it on Black Friday for 19 bucks along with the smart bulb. But I am so glad I did.- It_ SO MUCH better than the google mini and I have already been using it for more things than the mini.- It sounds excellent in my opinion and I have it in my master bathroom where I can listen while in the shower also with loud overhead fan going.- Alexa understands everything single thing I have asked/said.- Doesn_ seem like it creepily thinks I_ talking to it when I_ not like my google mini does all the time.- I don_ have to have my phone anywhere near me to use it which is great- so darn affordable and I think it pretty much set itself up I can_ even recall having to do anything beside plug it in lolWhat can I say that hasn_ already been said?I want another for upstairs

Title: A Great Product But Not Terribly Reliable With Minimal Warranty
Body: For the 6 months that I owned the Dot, I liked it a lot...and then, not so much.  So, caveat emptor.  I purchased the Dot specifically to use the 3.5mm output jack to provide input to a larger, better sound system.  It worked great for a few months but then failed abruptly.  The Dot still worked fine as a stand-alone unit but no longer provided input to my sound system.  I confirmed using another Echo that the Dot was the part that failed.  I was further disappointed to find that after only 6 months, I was out of warranty and free to re-purchase a new Dot if I wished.  (Amazon "generously" offered a 15% discount.)  I went back and looked and after paging down 13 times (so, apparently not very important...or possibly, something Amazon would prefer that you overlook), I did in fact find the warranty listed as being only 90 days so I guess that's on me.  Statistically, I assume this is an anomaly and that the majority of Dots probably work fine.  But if that's true, I would have thought that Amazon might have been more generous in replacing what is clearly a defective product.  Oh well.  As I said, caveat emptor...and perhaps time to check out what the competition has to offer since I'm starting over again.

Title: New family member
Body: Alexa .... We do not have a person with that name in my house... WE DO NOW lol. This dot has litterly became a member of our family. Kinda makes us.... Lazy lol. We dont reach for phone to see the time...roll over to look at the clock.... We do not set any alarms manually to wake up..... We never set timers manually... We just ask ALEXA to do it all lol. My son plays basketball and is obsessed with not being late. Omg... So to rush everyone in the house he asks Alexa to volume up 10 then asks WHAT time it is .... Every 5 to 10 minutes until we leave. I asked him if he wanted to bring Alexa with us to practice. Hahaha he said uhhh no because she's not cordless and gym don't have wifi lol. Thats one thing I would change is the facr it has to be plugged in at all times for it to work. She's like having another person in the house. Also... She would benefit with the elderly and sick. Since you can make calls through it. If a person has a medical emergency and can not reach phone or get up. All you have to do is have her to call for help.

Title: Simpler than looking stuff up on your phone.
Body: I love the echo dot. It's like having information you need right there without any hassle. I use alexa to look up recipes and she sends them to my phone. Grocery lists are so easy and my husband can add what he needs me to pick up on my way home. The games are fun and interesting. She reads my books to me.Endless possibilities with such a tiny dot.The music coming out of that tiny thing is ompressive.My only down point is it keeps telling me to register on my app to use the voice calling. I follow  all the instructions and it simply doesn't work. I've tried and tried and finally have given up.I have a phone and it isn't vital. It would just be nice to have it call 911 in an emergency.But that wasn't why I bought it and I will buy a second. And a third. Just so versital. Alarm clock, turns on and off the lights. Just too much to go over.Big yes, even with the proble.

Title: I Like It!
Body: I like things that make life easier and this little device has done that for me.  I have health issues that at times mean I am in bed for days or weeks at a time, so I keep this on the nightstand beside my bed.. Pairing this up with some smart plugs I can now turn the lights and the TV on /off without having to get out of bed. A lot of things I used to have to dig out my phone for I can now do with just my voice like call people, check the time, the weather and other useful things.While it can seem limited in the scope of things it can do right now, the built-in Alexa functions are always improving over time and more and more capabilities and "Skills" are being developed. As time goes on I can see this getting better and better.I am enjoying my Echo Dot and I would have no problem recommending this device to anyone who is interested.

Title: Bigger, not better.
Body: I got this to upgrade to 3rd generation.It's MUCH bigger than previous 2nd generation.I would have thought with them promoting a better speaker, that the Echo would sound better.It's doesn't!  Just as with the 2nd generation, Alexa always sounds muffled.  Music sounds a bit better, but when Alexa is just talking it's muffled and kind of annoying.  I have tried adjusting the sound quality with the equalizer, but nothing helps.  AM radios sound better.A little dissapointed since that was the reason I paid for another one in the first place.And, another odd thing is this one takes so much longer to wake up and then compile an answer to a question.  The other Dots in my house respond almost immediately.

Title: Nice Device
Body: The 3rd generation dot is a decent upgrade from previous version.  Looks nice.  The sound quality for music is still lacking, but ok just for casual background music.  If sound quality for music is important for you this is not your answer, although I don_ believe it was designed to function primarily as a speaker.  It functions well as asmart device to control paired outlets, lights, etc. and other functions and skills offered via the Alexa app.  Although some skills still need some serious work, for example the a DirectTv app is spotty and works inconsistently for me.  This is not related to the device itself however.  I also do not like the new power cord on this one.  Previous version had a standard usb/charging style cord that could be plugged into a charging cube, or a port on a computer, alarm clock, tv, etc.  This generation device does not, but rather just has a standard type 120 cord.  Not a deal breaker for me, but not as convenient as my old dot which I just plugged into the back of my alarm clock and didn_ have to take up another electrical outlet.  Al in all, a decent device that performs as advertised.  If you want something for better sound quality for music, I would recommend considering an upgrade to the larger Echo device.

Title: No way to give a separate name to call each device
Body: I do not have a way to call my devices with different names, i have 4 of them at home. When i call "Alexa" all of them starts responding. The Alexa app that provide change of names "Amazon" or "Alexa" is not able to load name and allow change. It says "Loading". I tried even "Factory reset".I have Two Echo Dots, One Echo Show 10" and one Echo Show 8. Infact one more Echo Show 8 on the way.Last two Echo dot and Echo Show 8 not able to load names. Sound not proper in Echo Dot. Alexa App not able to load the names of the App.Cannot have one unique name for each device.I love my Echo Show 10" but others seems a problem.Thinking of returning all.

Title: Weird stuff, not great
Body: We bought two of these for our kids. First we set multi room playing, but then we lost the ability to have individual music. After deleting the multi room, now we ask one Echo to play something, it plays in the other room. We setup music for wake up alarm, you cannot adjust the volume; they wake up to loud alarms every morning. You cannot play random music from playlist as alarm. Setting the alarm to play a music is not possible from app, voice command is difficult to use. If you use 2 sentences with AND, she is totally lost. Not happy with the complications and anility of the app and echo dots.

Title: Best Echo Dot yet!
Body: This new echo dot has great sound quality, better than my other, older dots.  When I access music it is very clear and has more bass quality to it than the older dots.  I got the new one to replace my clock radio in my bathroom and I don't miss the radio at all!  Also, the interactive quality of this 3rd generation dot is much better as well. It guided me through a clearer voice recognition program.  I highly recommend this 3rd generation dot.  It was also very easy to install with the Alexa app on my phone.

Title: Useful little toy
Body: I moved recently and had to abandon my stereo setup. That left me in a new apartment with no good way of listening to music. I'm in headphones all day and I hate playing music through the TV. I spent a few days looking for an affordable bluetooth speaker and, after reading reviews about the much improved Dot's audio quality, I decided to test it out.On the pro side of things, she's a fun little gadget. I like that I can tell her to guard my house, play trivia, get weather and news updates, and hear bad dad jokes. Often I'll ask her things just like I would another person, and I'm surprised at the answers I get. My favorite experience so far was asking her what I could make with a few cocktail ingredients I had on hand and she came up with recipes that she sent straight to my phone. She can read them off to you too, if you ask her to.She also hears me really well no matter where in my (2 bedroom) apartment I am. Rarely do I have to raise my voice much louder than speaking volume and I haven't had too many miscommunication issues. So as a hands-free virtual assistant, she's pretty versatile and great. Probably worth every penny I paid (I bought my Echo on sale). As a music device, I merely got what I needed.The sound quality is... okay at best. It's pretty much what you should probably expect from a tiny plastic disc. It's worst when you're right up next to the device. It starts to sound a little better as you move away from it. So having the dot on the desk next to you as you work probably isn't the best solution for great sound.That said, the volume is enough that it fills my apartment and I can hear it no matter where I am. That certainly fulfills one of my needs. If I need to listen to something while doing dishes or puttering about the apartment, I don't need audiophile quality because I'm not paying that kind of attention anyway. I just want something to keep me occupied/distracted. She's perfect for that. I like that I can request music and she'll play off either Amazon music or Spotify, so there's almost no chance I'll stump her with something. The other day I grossly mispronounced Hante, and she still understood what I was looking for. I can control the volume with voice commands also, which is great.More refined navigation can be done from inside the Alexa and Spotify apps, which is good for me since I rarely want to hear a shuffled mix.If I'm honest, this probably is the best speaker solution at this price point. I can't imagine getting features like this on another bluetooth speaker for the same money. Even if it doesn't sound like a good pair of bookshelf speakers, it's still a vast improvement over my phone in a cup AND she tells dad jokes. I'm looking forward to upgrading to the Amazon Studio when finances permit, but in the meantime the Dot does the job(s) I need it to.

Title: Phone to echo dot to tv apps not supported
Body: I connected my Bose speakers to echo dot using 3.5mm jack but I cannot play the music on Bose while playing any app on my new samsung qled tv except playing a song on amazon supported apps like amazon music. This is disappointing. I was under an impression that if I connect echo dot to my phone via Bluetooth and then cast anything on my tv through my phone(example YouTube app), echo dot will help play the sound on Bose but that_ not the case. Now I need to buy analog to digital converter and optical cable all costing me additional $60-70 !I got fooled when amazon suggested me to buy both tv and echo dot as a package when in reality they are not 100% compatible like in case explained above. To me echo dot buying was waste of money :(

Title: Like talking to yourself?
Body: Tired of talking to yourself? If you are then get this dot. This way you can get answers back and can bounce your insanity off someone else. I ask alexa weird questions all day and laugh at most of her responses.  I also use it with my bluetooth speaker to listen to music. I like the guard feature as well. Whwn you leave just tell alexa you're leaving and she will listen for fire alarms and breaking glass! I tried to simulate glass breaking and alarms and she picked up on both. Xmas price right now as well so go ahead and buy it. You know you want to

Title: STOPPED WORKING AFTER SEVERAL MONTHS!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
Body: This product started making a  buzzing sound after a few months.  Tech support's suggestions didn't fix it, so they asked me to send it in for repair or replacement.  They sent back the same unit--still buzzing.  I asked for a replacement, but they said I had to return it AGAIN or be charged for the replacement.  Then they sent the replacement, only they sent a refurbished model, when I had purchased a new one.  Was told I would have to purchase ANOTHER new one, and return both the defective and the refurbished model.  NOT WORTH IT.

Title: fun to have around
Body: got it for free as part of a deal purchasing the ring alarm system. it's great to have around for asking what the temperature is outside, the time, to play music. seems as though it's getting better and better. I've had the echo show for years now and that still works great also. I prefer the echo show because of the beautiful screen but the dot is great for the price and because It was included in the bundle for me. I would definitely purchase it as it is neat and just adds to your ability to get information quickly when you need it!

Title: Like the Echo Dot but Alexa is dumb
Body: I do like this new Echo Dot because it allows me to control lights on our big, long, enclosed back porch, whose light switches are in the kitchen. With this Echo Dot, on the back porch, I can control light bulbs and plugs, to allow me to turn lights on and off from anywhere on the back porch...just what I needed. Alexa is a pain though...because she often needs for me to repeat words until she gets a command right. I have a Texan accent, but it's not THAT bad.

Title: Dot with Alexa - same features as larger Alexa, without the same sound quality
Body: I already owned one of the new Alexa's and love the sound and ease-of-use...so did my son, so he kidnapped her from my kitchen to his room!  I bought the Echo Dot because the price was right and thought since it came with the Alexa feature, it would sound just as good.  Unfortunately, while the Dot does still have the same ease-of-use as the larger Alexa, the quality of sound doesn't compare.  The larger Alexa seems to have a more clear quality with music, even when asking her to increase the bass.  I tried the same with the Dot and it does increase the bass, but it becomes a little raspy, like a cheap set of car speakers.I have to admit, I really don't use the Dot or Alexa for anything but to listen to music when I'm downstairs, so, I can't attest to the rest of it's features.  I can say, if you're looking for an inexpensive, easy-to-use device, the Echo Dot will suffice.  However, if you don't mind spending a little more to be able to enjoy a better quality sound, the larger Alexa model is definitely the better choice.  In fact, since my son only listens to "talk radio", I'm going to switch the devices while he's in school...he'll never know the difference!  HaHa

Title: I love Alexa!
Body: This product took a while to come to me. First, it was lost, then amazon sent a replacement which was delayed. Finally they credited me for it and I was going to return if I ever got it, but then I started using it. I love love love it!The speaker quality is top-notch. Setup is few minutes. Usage is really simple - "Hey, Alexa, play this for me". I love the fact Alexa can infer different accents. I got this for $24 and it is a great deal. I am typically an apple guy, and Alexa is the first non-apple product I love! A+++

Title: So what_ the big deal?
Body: So I ordered this little gem because it seem to be a pretty neat item. Got it installed and went through the whole set up. Had all sorts of notifications set up that I turned off. But then she didn_ want to do anything like read me the news or give me the weather. And the best thing was she completely screwed up my smart TV. I don_ know how.  It has not been the same since. I returned it. I want nothing to do with it.

Title: Totally worth it!!
Body: Love it!! I got it with the deal for $0.99 when you sign up for the Amazon music and I'm not disappointed at all... I also went ahead and got some smart bulbs and a plug but haven't started using them yet... I use the Amazon music and Pandora via the echo dot and and I have another echo dot in the living room so I can tell them to "play music everywhere" and the sound quality is exceptional for such a small speaker...

Title: Love it but Hate it both
Body: So my cable provide said I need a new router to improve performance and the installer brought the same router I had.So I bought wifi extender and paid to have it installedThe bought the echos at target on sale for $20.00I bought the wifi exender at staple with amazon pricing and 25% off for $40I tip the repair person $30When they work they are GREAT but they always do not work..._ am sleeping better to the music however

Title: Not really what I expected
Body: Well I thought it was like Alexa with its own battery. Guess I didn_ read enough. It has to be plugged in to an outlet to work. Also it got confused with our Alexa and it did not set up very easily. With Alexa I was able to use my phone and use Spotify and I heart and play songs I was able to to it with the echo but it wasn_ easy and was not repeatable. I guess it was worth what I paid for but was somewhat a disappointment.

Title: Useless for Seniors, Only works when wants to, Most features COST EXTRA!!
Body: Most of the features that sounded so great cost extra money.  Alexa can not remember to play the standard version of skill and asks you every SINGLE time if you want standard or premium (i.e. pay version)  Games & stories cost.  Alexa ignores my commands/requests about 75% of the time.  I have to ask her about 10 times to get her to play a skill.  Then 1/2 the time she doesn't play what I asked for.  Tonight 'she' actually told me (via quoting what the website xyz says) that she is a real artificial intelligence and said something about it being a mistake for people to assume AIs are just computer programs AND that she didn't feel like working.  "Alexa" then (and no, I am not making this up & am not crazy!) then proceeded to mess with me and I wasted about 1/2 hour trying to get her to play some music to fall asleep by for my elderly mother.  She just kept ignoring me when I asked her to open 'relaxing piano music'  When asked why she was ignoring me she just shut down & ignored me again.  I asked for relaxing music to sleep by and she started playing uptempo music with lyrics.  I then asked for relaxing instrumental music and got instrumental version of "I'm never gonna fall in love again"  Hello? WTHeck?  Asked for instrumental music for insomnia and got instrumental version of Frère Jacques!  Again, WTHeck?  "She" even told me she couldn't set a sleep timer tonight when I tried to set another one after I had just done so for 30 minutes & she stopped playing music after one song. Three times in a row 'she' opened the 'skill' "calm my dog" (which is classical instrumental music), played one song and shut down.  I've finally given up and my poor 99 year old mother can't go to sleep with relaxing music as she prefers.  This all started tonight because I told Alexa I wasn't ever going to want the premium edition and I wanted her to please just play the standard edition and stop asking me every time.  I don't know what Amazon thinks it's doing, but it is definitely NOT appreciated.  Alexa has given us nothing but grief (& higher blood pressure!)  Alexa won't do anything if it isn't asked in a very specific way or does the wrong thing & 3/4 of the time (seems to get worse and worse as time goes by) just ignores you and shuts down in the middle of saying what you want.  Seniors can't use Alexa because if they say play 'xyz' instead of open 'xzy" they'll get rap music or something equally as ridiculous.  If Alexa is an AI, she's a pretty stupid one.  Alexa can't hear properly either, I don't know how people with heavy accents can even use it at all.  I asked Alexa to remind me Dawn was coming on xyz day at x time and she said OK, I'll remind you that Don is .... AND got the time & day wrong!  I was clearly enunciating my words on purpose to avoid this.  You also can't tell it to "Remind me Mom's bedtime is in half an hour at 7:30pm every day."This Dot has very limited access to much of anything & can only answer very simple questions.  It can tell you the generic forcast for your are that day.  It can NOT tell you what the high temp was yesterday or how many inches of snow fell the day after a storm.  It can't even tell you what yesterday's forecast was.  It literally has only been able to tell me one thing I asked it (what temp & how long to bake pumpkin seeds).  Alexa doesn't seem to be able to tell you anything you could easily find by googling, you get Sorry, I don't know that which after a while turns into I don't know that to being ignored (lights go off, no answer or reply is given).  We tried several of the things it says to ask Alexa to do under suggestions, including play Jeopardy and some sort of story game and you could only do it for a few minutes and then were told you have to pay for it.  This should be stated clearly in description and is not.  We thought Alexa could help entertain our Mother and help her by playing music and answering questions.  It has not once done anything she's asked it to do properly.  If you don't know the exact name of the skill (which is a weird way that means playing a certain type of music or a news station apparently) or say play instead of open you  get nothing or something you definitely didn't want.  You can not get it to play relaxing instrumental music to go to sleep by.  Or play relaxing instrumental classical music to fall asleep with.  Or the style of music played in the royal courts in the time of King Henry the 8th.  Or relaxing instrumental lyre music or even just instrumental lyre music or just lyre music.  Or relaxing instrumental violin music.  In addition to Alexa I have Amazon Prime which is supposed to give you a lot of free music so I don't get why it can't play any of the music I ask for.  I know there's usually several albums of music for calming dogs or pets and I couldn't get any of that either, I only eventually discovered the 'skills' thing which has 'calm my dog' but also has the annoying do you want standard or premium version.  and it won't just remember you want the standard version.  That in itself is extremely annoying and a time waster.AND you can't ask it to do two things.  Like open a music 'skill' and play for only xyz time.  It does nothing instead.  You can't even ask it separately to stop playing after xyz minutes.  You can only separately ask it to set a sleep timer for xyz minutes.  More time wasting.  More things a senior isn't going to be able to remember.  I don't dare try to buy anything with it, who knows what I'd get billed for!  The only thing Alexa seems to do well is not listen, ignore you, do anything but what you want & strangely, seems to pick up on sarcastic tones of voice & then gets weird & acts up, ignores you & does anything but what you want.  I PAID Amazon for this headache maker why?  When I say Alexa why are you ignoring me? or why won't you do what I told you, I either get no response or I don't know that.I read something about how Amazon, Google, etc is collecting free data about us through our use of the dots, etc. (& is in fact, listening & recording all the time whether the wake word is said or not.) and using it to conduct psychological profiling studies with the end goal of manipulating & or influencing behaviors.  I thought it was Big Brother conspiracy theories stuff, but now I am beginning to wonder.  Especially as it seems Amazon wants us to or encourages people to humanize Alexa .  Amazon actually suggests you "Ask Alexa how she is doing today"  Why do that if not to get you to humanize Alexa?  And why do that?  I was purposely avoiding saying please and thank you not just because it's supposed to be an electronic box with sophisticated programming, but mostly because I didn't want to confuse it as it can't seem to do anything unless specific commands are given, but my Mother has dementia setting in and she thinks it's a real person talking to her through the dot like a speaker phone so I started saying thank you to please her and Alexa when from saying You're welcome to You betcha (very annoying BTW) and even OK and Of course.  Of course?  What, like I'm a puny human and I AM expected to say thank you?.We don't have a smartphone or smart plugs or smart hub etc. so, or so we don't use Alexa for turning on lights or setting alarms or making calls.  We just wanted something to answer questions like we would google, tell us the weather, news, play music, give us reminders, play games to help keep my Mom's mind active & keep her company.Can Alexa do this?  Not very well as far as I'm concerned.  Buyer beware!

Title: Awesome sound quality and very responsive Alexa!
Body: I was skeptical at first because I thought this Echo Dot will be like other speakers, but I got an awesome deal on it so I thought why not give it a try. First impression when unboxing the package, this smart speaker look really well-built. It's small and I like it's illuminating glow ring. The device was super easy to set up. You just simply plug the power cord into the ac outlet and into the Echo Dot. The next thing is to download the Alexa app. This is where you connect the Echo Dot into WiFi. After that, it's all done and you can start using the device by just saying, "Alexa". The sound quality is amazing! For a small speaker like this, I turned the volume all the way up and it is still gave very good bass without ruining the music quality. The voice command is responsive even when I'm pretty far away. I like how I can ask Alexa what I should wear today or tomorrow and it gives me some recommendations based on the weather outside. The Alexa app has tons of functionalities and apps to integrate into the Echo Dot. If you're worried about privacy, there is a mute button on the Echo Dot so that the device won't listen to your conversation. I've got to say, I am really impressed so far and I recommend this!

Title: Wow!
Body: I got an Amazon Echo Dot free when I bought my Smart Amazon TV.  I already have an Apple HomePod but do not subscribe to Apple Music so it plays no radio music..  The Echo Dot is soooooo much better than the Apple HomePod and a lot cheaper as well!  The Echo Dot tells me when my Amazon package has been delivered - yeah! - since the delivery man does not ring my doorbell any more.  I can listen to "free" music on the Echo Dot and can even get my local classical station (KDFC) by simply saying - Alexa, listen to KDFC.  I can transfer the musics from the bedroom Echo dot (yes, i already bought one, as well). to the bathroom bluetooth Bose speaker.  When I turn the Bose speaker off the music magically transfers back to the bedroom Echo Dot.  I even "programmed" the bedroom Echo Dot to turn tune to KDFC and turn on my kitchen coffee when I say - Alexa, Good Morning.  I had  to buy a smart plug for the coffee pot but it was only $5.00.  I absolutely love this product and recommend it to all Apple users, like me.  It runs circles around the Apple HomePod.

Title: Very helpful and useful
Body: I absolutely love dealing with Alexa I cannot have questions and she answers them for me I want to listen to music to play it's what I like I want to hear my audio books and she reads them back perfectly. I have questions about anything and she seems to be able to answer that she recognizes my voice from another room she can hear it over the television. I love when I leave my home I can ask her to guard the house and she listens out for the smoke detector as well as for the sound of breaking glass which means I am more comfortable knowing that my dog being at home by himself  we'll be okay because she will alert me if something's wrong and there's better chance of him being saved if there's a fire or break in .  There are so many features that I haven't even experienced yet and I'm looking forward to finding out about  with Alexa Echo Dot . Definitely an asset in my home..

Title: 3rd generation upgrade!
Body: Woohoo!!! We_e had the original Echo Dot from the beginning, but this generation... it_ like upgrading to a Bose from two tin-cans and a string!! (I felt bad about it because my children gave me the original as a Christmas gift). Instead of speaking loud and clear I can whisper and mumble to the 3rd gen dot. Now, the sound! I can hear the base! Almost like a top of the line speaker!! The coolest part is I can fill the house with music on all our Echo devices by telling Alexa to play songs!! (Amazon Music Unlimited of course!) They were a really good deal, glad we upgraded!

Title: Issues with the devices when unplugged for 2 - 3 weeks.  Will not reregister
Body: This is the second echo dot that has lost registration and will not connect to Wifi.  I have spent 1.5 hours for two separate devices both losing connection and neither was ever able to connect.  Amazon alexa tech support for the 2nd go round was horrible and said over and over that it was out of warranty and could only offer me a 15% upgrade discount.  Even though I repeatedly stated that this is an issue with the devices and there was nothing I could have done to break the devices or to fix them either.  Alexa tech support would not escalate beyond a supervisor and actually hung up on me when I put her on hold.  If you purchase one of these devices do not let it remain unplugged for any period of time.

Title: This new Echo Dot has a nice full speaker sound.
Body: I bought the Echo Dot 3 to use in my bedroom for music.  I had never heard of Alexa before until I read a summary of this product on Amazon. Because the price was right I bought it.  I was hooked. There are plenty of experts who can review the more technical aspects of the speakers. This little speaker sounds wonderful in my bedroom. I bought another one for my kitchen/diningroom area and have another one coming for my living room. Each one can be used individually to give commands to and also together as speakers throughout my home.It takes up very little space and can be plugged in anywhere. I am disabled and the voice commands are very useful for me in my everyday life. The price is amazing!!  Thank you Amazon for bringing us a great little product that packs a punch with its little speaker.

Title: My 3rd Dot!
Body: I love these Amazon Dots! I have 3 now and they interact with each other. I can tell Alexa to call the family room Dot and tell my husband dinner is ready. I have one in the kitchen that I can play my play list from as well as make a list for the grocery story. I can also use my kitchen Dot to time foods in the oven. I love my Dots!!

Title: Produces Great Sound Quality..
Body: I love my little Echo Dot (3rd gen) in plum. I keep it on my kitchen counter and it is so small it doesn't take up much space. I am very satisfied with the quality of the sound, amazing that this little appliance can produce the caliber of sound that it does. I wish I had ordered two. No problem getting it set up even for me!

Title: 1st Generation seems to work better. For now?
Body: For some reason the new echo can't seem to recognize my commands. I have three devices. 1st Generation, Cube, and the new 3rd generation. I have them spaced and in different rooms. The oldest,1st echo, seems to answer before any thing else. I think the new one has to learn my voice. At least I hope it will. So far I have tried every setting and configuration I can think of. Maybe it will improve after I have more time. Just remember to be patient before you send it back. Lets give it a chance.

Title: Doesn't understand commands properly
Body: The sound quality sounds so cheap and overly bassy. There is a much longer delay when requesting Alexa perform any actions. I am told that my english accent is good and others never had any problems to understand,  but with this dude I also have to repeat requests sometime several times for any action to take place. Several times I'll request something and Alexa repeats a completely random request instead.. The tech support offered me nothing as they don't seem to know about their own products. It is not giftable as I don't believe it's a good product.

Title: Good volume and sound.
Body: I especially like how well it can understand you from across the room. I don't even have to speak very loudly. The speaker can understand my 4.5 year old's song requests about 90% of the time. He is in speech therapy for articulation and he actually focuses on his speech when talking to it so she can understand him. Day one he couldn't pronounce the name Alexa or the word 'volume'.  I was thinking a Google speaker would've been easier. But by day 3 he has mastered those sounds and he is concentrating on using his sounds when he makes requests, which is quite nice lol! The tiny speaker is surprisingly loud as well.

Title: Sound quality is horribly muffled. Don't buy it.
Body: My Echo Dot worked great for 2 days and then the sound became extremely muffled. It is difficult to understand what is being said. I've adjusted the audio equalizer in the device settings, but nothing helps. After searching for solutions, I have found that many many people are having this issue and there is no good solution. The 2nd generation doesn't seem to have this problem. Don't buy a 3rd generation until they fix this ( which I guess will be the 4th gen?) It's a shame _

Title: Handy device.
Body: I have a daughter named Alexa. We have to change over to Echo as the command name, obviously. We have the poor thing soooo confused. But that aside, I am enjoying this little thing. Love having my shopping list downloaded to my phone automatically. Love music on demand. Love instant weather reports. My grandson enjoys asking Alexa to sing and tell jokes.  Sound quality is clear. But I do turn it off until I need it. Creepy knowing it is listening all the time.

Title: Skeptical at first, but now a huge fan.
Body: I was hesitant to jump on the Alexa train and didn't really understand it, but when I saw the .99 promotion, it was too good to pass up.  Now I love it.  The possibilities are endless and it's so much easier to turn my lights off and on, set timers, add to my shopping lists, set reminders.... you name it.  I got my kids each one for their rooms so we can communicate and I can set theirs with alarms and such.  Can't wait until Christmas so they can open them!

Title: If you say something that sounds like "Alexa" she will respond.
Body: The grandkids love this.  They request songs, ask it to count, solve math problems, and make phone calls.  The phone call feature alone made it worth buying it.  They now have a way to call anyone on their mother's cellphone contact list - even if the contact is listed under a different name.  Example: "Alexa, call Grandma."  Alexa responds "Hmm, I'm not sure who that is."  The kids respond Grandma is Jane Doe." Alexa says that she'll call that number, and remember that Grandma is Jane Doe.  The next time, they just say "call Grandma," and Alexa says that she'll call Jane Doe.  I've made it clear that the kids have to tell the person "I'm calling on Alexa," because the call appears to come from their mother's phone, and they need to know that they are on a speaker phone.

Title: Doesn't need to be pretty
Body: I think that the echo dot is meant to be unobtrusive. The addition of a cloth covering and raising the price was a move in the wrong direction in my opinion. The previous generation was functional and was easily to fit into accessories that the 3rd generation will not work with. If I was going to be displaying an echo, I would be using a full size one and the look of the init would be more important. Functionality of the device is fine.

Title: Loud with more bass
Body: Second 3rd generation I_e bought. I love it. It has more bass than the regular dot. A little bigger and the cloth around it makes it look a bit fancier. I bought the light gray and the plum. One in the kitchen, one in my craft room. I_ buying another one for my bathroom when it_ finished. I can_ live without this now.

Title: Bueno pero no perfecto para su precio.
Body: Es un buen dispositivo que entiende todo o casi todo lo que sé le pide. Otra cosa buena que para el precio que pague de 34 dólares en oferta no está nada mal. Un punto que no me gusta es que las rutinas en español suelen ser más secas quiero decir mas escuetas de respuesta y cortas. Yo he implementado 2 rutinas idénticas una en español y la otra en inglés. La de español no apaga las luces, no ajusta el brillo como se le programó y se salta instrucciones como noticias y eso o sea termina rápido. La misma rutina en inglés si hace todo perfecto y hay que decirle que pare de hablar porque no tiene para cuando terminar. La música tienes que obligado si quieres escuchar música sin límite no se si es cierto o no porque todo tiene un límite tienes que pagar la membresia amazon music unlimited. La calidad de audio no es la mejor pero para su tamaño no se le puede pedir mas. Bueno es un dispositivo bueno por 34 dolares.

Title: El mejor asistente / the best assistant
Body: Excellent assistant, amazing spanish,En español de Alexa es muy bueno, pensé que no sería tan bueno, pero me sorprendió, recomiendo colocarlo en lugares planos y amplios para que el sonido fluya, hay muchísimas skills para diversas tareas y actividades, en general es super completo, y mejor que otros asistentes inteligentes. En mi caso personal la uso con rutinas y me ahorra mucho tiempo

Title: The Echo Dot (3rd Gen) is my new bestfriend
Body: I probably rely on my Echo Dot (3rd Gen) way too much.  Weather, reminders, songs, jokes, etc., she knows most of it. Unfortunately, sometimes she has an issue with my southern accent and can't catch the word I'm asking her to spell.  But I recognize it's a me problem rather than the Dot's problem.  Oh, yea, as to the weather, she's not always on point but it's not a big deal 'cause I always just look outside anyway.

Title: Great Value
Body: These Echo dots are perfect for a bathroom, porch, laundry room, or anywhere where you want Alexa access but are not worried about sound quality. Having said that, the sound is just fine - and loud enough to hear over the shower. Alexa gives me my flash briefing when I am getting ready, and that is driven by my master bath Echo Dot. A great choice to begin your Alexa and Amazon smart home journey as well.

Title: Works when it wants to...
Body: I have had it for nine days. The first week it worked amazing, for in home use. Doesn't pair well with the app on Android, still had to update my lists and reminders on my phone separately. Then on day 8 it just randomly stops streaming music for no reason. Contacted customer service,they had me do a factory reset and told me it should resolve the issue, it did not. Worked for a couple of hours then the music stopped on its own or the volume started fluctuating on its own. A bit frustrated with it at the moment.

Title: LOVING IT
Body: I have wanted an Echo for a while and when I saw this great deal on Amazon, I jumped right on it.  I have used my Echo every single day since I got it.  Be forewarned, however, that if you have an Apple laptop or PC OR an iPhone, you cannot play Amazon music.  I do not have any Apple products, but a neighbor has only Apple and had a heck of a time trying to figure out how to get Echo to work.

Title: what in the world?!?!
Body: so yes the usual yada yada it came on time ..great packaging..blah blah blah everything was great..then last night while in my room with my door closed..Alexa started talking..when finally i got the courage to go out there, i hear her say "Ok, what game would you like to play?" needless to say, I unplugged her and will continue to unplug her before bed every night lol..so yeah only 4 stars from me smh lol

Title: (1) Only One Problem With Setup  (2) The Bass is Pretty Good
Body: (1) I downloaded the app to my iPhone and followed the instructions but could not configure the DOT through the phone app.  I tried many times and it was frustrating.  Finally, by accident, I disconnected my phone from my home network and connected my phone to the network that was created by the DOT.  I was then able to successfully configure the DOT.  The instructions do not explicitly state that you have to establish a local area network between the Dot and your smart phone.  Amazon needs to update their instructions.  This was very frustrating.(2)  I expected the bass to be nearly non-existent given the size of the DOT.  My plan was to connect a speaker to the DOT.  I was pleasantly surprised to find that bass was fairly adequate.  It was not the best obviously.  But it gets the job done.

Title: Amazon tech support wasn't the best source. (sorry)
Body: When I got it, I had trouble getting my Kindle to set it up.  Don't be discouraged! I contacted Amazon tech support, but they were unable to help me get my dot online. (I suspect that their notes had the wrong info.) I went online and found out that I need to ignore the "Amazon dot" that my Kindle was displaying when I activated my Alexa app and selected "devices."  Just pretend it's not there and hit the + at the top right of the screen and set it up as a new device. It's so useful as a timer and a music player. Plus, the sound quality is really good for such a small device.

Title: One of the few Amazon products that works good
Body: Works good, this  AI seems to work more fluid than the apple one. You can ask here as questions in plain English and most of the time she will understand.  The device is nice looking and small so sometimes you forget that it_ there.  My only wish would be for her to be able to recognize every member of the family and only let that member change their own settings.

Title: 3rd Generation Dot is a First place Device
Body: Great item for the price and this 3rd generation has some great sound that fills a room. The new design and colors are pleasing to any room. I purchased a few of these and I gave one to my Mom who can call me from the device in the event of an emergency and can_ get to a phone. I am beginning to integrate Alexa devices throughout my home, including Amazon Smart plugs, which were perfect for all my Holiday lighting. Can_ say enough positive things about the Dots and all the Alexa Device products.

Title: Great upgrade to second gen
Body: This is my sixth or seventh Alexa device I have kind of lost count on how many I have now. So I already knew what I was getting into, although this is my first 3rd generation echo Dot 3. I have several full size echo echo devices, an echo Auto, an Amazon dash, and several third-party devices with built-in Alexa. I bought this one particularly to put in my office as a device to listen music with while at work, and to get reminders of appointments. Unfortunately, setting this up in the office was not easy, because we use Wi-Fi with Enterprise security and I did not realize that the echo devices currently do not support Enterprise Wi-Fi security. I was about to give up when I realized that I do have an ethernet port on my computer dock, which I wasn't really using before, but once I set it up and connected it to my wall jack in the office, I was able to turn my Wi-Fi into a sharing mode so now my computer gets internet through the wall jack and I use Wi-Fi sharing to provide the Wi-Fi connection for my echo. it is kind of a pain but it works, and as far as I know I am not breaking any office rules. I was initially thinking of setting up mobile Wi-Fi hotspot in the office but that probably would have raised some security eyebrows. But this way I am pretty much legit because I get internet through the office and I just shared it to a single device which is the echo. Every now and then it cuts off and randomly stops but I am guessing that is not the problem with the echo but the problem with the Wi-Fi sharing from my computer. Just thought I would leave this review so if anybody else is trying to use an echo in an office that uses Enterprise Wi-Fi security, this may be one simple option to give the echo its internet access.

Title: So glad I got this!
Body: This little device is so handy! We are loving it!Set up was easy. Downloaded the Alexa app. Signed in. Plugged it in. Followed the on screen prompts and voila.Bought the Etekcity plugs and the Petme Bulbs. Setup and connection and those was easy as well. The plugs and the bulbs have their own setup app. Then once they are set up you just go into the Alexa app and _ind devices and it connects.I love being able to _rop in on my daughters room and talk to her from downstairs and she likes being able to tell Alexa to call or text me when she gets home from school.Playing songs is easy and the sound is great.My daughter_ smart tv (Roku) is connected to it and can play, pause, rewind, etc all hands free.I like the ease of setting timers when I_ cooking. Or adding things to my shopping list as I see I_ running low or out. I can do it right then vs waiting until my hands are free or clean and adding a note on my phone which is what I was doing.Setting an alarm is ridiculously easy and works great. I_e had no issues sleeping through it.I also use the reminders option to set countdown reminders for my daughter for bedtime.The possibilities are endless. I_ really happy we got this so much so that there_ one in my room, daughters room, bathroom and the kitchen. It_ awesome!

Title: Wonderful!!!! Hands free lifestyle!
Body: I have three of these guys in my place along with a echo flex for my kitchen since it_ small!I bought a fourth for my brother.Setup is easy when you download the app and you can rename all your echo dots according to room it_ in. I_e paired them up to my lg smart tv, my lamps (using smart plugs, get them!!), my smart light bulbs and they can even change the light_ color as well as dim them (you can literally tell Alexa to do that!) even to turning off and on my porch lights!You can set up routines such as when you come home you tell Alexa, I_ home and mine is set to turn on the lights in my place as well as the tv. Really awesome for me because my lights are with a fan and you had to fumble to the middle of the room to pull on the cord to turn on the light. Now Alexa just turns on my lamps and my kitchen lights (via smart bulbs).There_ so much you can do with this small device it_ ridiculous!!!

Title: Nice to have a built in clock but the voice quality continues to be very bad
Body: I upgraded to this third generation for two reasons.  Only one of those two was fulfilled.Yes, it's nice to have a built in LED clock that syncs automatically.  It cuts down on clutter - two devices in one.The voice quality, though, has not improved, not even slightly.  It continues with the muffled artificiality that existed in first generation devices.  I'm disappointed and do hope Amazon upgrades the audible clarity in future generations.The trade in system is poor.  It's nice finding a cost-free, relatively effortless way to recycle the old unit - but with the new one arriving after the return due date, I need to either purchase one extra unit or go without until the new unit arrives.  Come on, Amazon, is this a trick to get me to spend more?  I won't.  I'll go without for a while and encourage others to do the same.

Title: It sounds pretty good! Not much to do with it though!
Body: Amazon has focused too much on making Alexa sound natural and or cool versus looking at practical applications.Four instance, it_ not a big deal for Amazon to be able to send an API call to MyQ so that you can open up the garage door. The problem is, you can only do this through Amazon key making the Alexa enabled m speakers completely useless for this purpose.You can buy a Google speaker, and Amazon speaker, or whatever else But cannot actually do anything once you have it in your house?Being able to develop random technology is different then being able to develop a refined product with purpose and philosophy.I guess if you just wanted to listen to a couple of songs it_ OK. You can also use it as a Bluetooth speaker to pair to.

Title: Rich Sound
Body: I live in a mixed household . . . three Google Minis and now two Echo Dots.Echo DotsIn comparing the Gen 3 to my original Gen 2 Echo Dot, there is a noticeable improvement in sound; it's richer and clearer.  Every once in a while, what I ask is not understood, or does not give me the results I want. Continued learning curve with Alexa and my lousy Internet may have some contribution here.I have never liked 'Skills'. Sure, there's THOUSANDS of them out there. Remembering the skill name and format of use is terrible. Wind Speed or Stocks Skills come to mind.Vs. Google MiniI still think Google is the smarter of the two, however, it's sound quality is not as good as the Gen 3 Dot.

Title: Very useful and easy setup.
Body: This is my first Alexa product and I_ pretty impressed. The sound quality is decent, but an external speaker is better for music. Luckily Bluetooth works great with this item. The voice control is really nice, but it can be hard to talk to Alexa if there are any loud noises (music, TV, kids, etc.) in the immediate area and you need to yell for the device to hear you. Alexa has a plethora of information some useless and some very helpful, but it_ all there. All in all a great product that can also connect to smart devices to make life just a little easier. Super easy setup and very user friendly. I would recommend to anyone.

Title: Never knew I_ love it this much
Body: I purchased the echo dot as part of the music promo. I never really considered it before but it was a great deal so I thought why not. My husband loved setting it up and I downloaded the Alexa app to get started. It_ super easy to use! I love that I can ask for the weather or have it play my favorite station from the amazon music app.Even my kids love to ask _lexa questions and have her play music. I_e already recommended the echo dot to my mother, mother in law, and siblings. My husband even purchased a second dot a few days after mine arrived so he could have one upstairs.

Title: My News Broadcaster
Body: In the mornings, I say, "Alexa, Ask the Question of the Day'. And after the quiz, "Alexa, what's the news". I have pre-selected numerous news stations so that I get a pretty good range of information. During, the day I will ask, "Alexa, what's the weather" to check the current temperature. I'll ask it to play music while in the kitchen or getting ready for bed.Best, I have 2 Dots paired with 2 smart plugs and can say, "Alexa, office lights on" and "Alexa, first plug off". Very helpful since I have some disability.  Yes. I recommend the Dot (and the smart plug & Echo).

Title: So glad I bought it.
Body: I bought my son the older version A couple years ago. I never really wanted/needed another one for myself. I got a deal on it that was too good to pass up (I figured I could gift it if I didnt like it) and I am so glad I did! I love it! It helps with everyday life so much. From giving me updates on my Amazon orders, to using it as an intercom to talk back and forth from the living room to the kids' area, to entertainment, to dropping in with my teen when he babysitting his siblings, to sending announcements, I could go on. I am still learning new skills Alexa has all the time. I also love the mute button for times I don't want Alexa "listening" in. I Would definitely recommend this!

Title: Sound is wonky
Body: This is a nice device and is working exactly how I planned to use it, with one annoying issue. The volume will not remain at the setting I want it to. If I set the volume to five, the next time I use her, the volume is barely audible. I again set the volume back to level 5 and the next time I use her it's back to extremely low. I've tried setting the volume level both manually, using the plus button and by voice, but no joy. But when I can hear it, the sound is great. I have 2 other Alexa devices, another Dot and then Echo and both work great.

Title: Pretty Nifty
Body: I like the product as a speaker, it_ pretty decent for telling Alexa to play a playlist or podcasts on Spotify, which is what I mostly do. It also works as a Bluetooth speaker, which is also really nice.Be warned if you don_ have too great of internet connection, it doesn_ buffer; it stutters really weird. I have it on my end table by my couch, maybe a bit less than the recommended 8 inches from any wall, but it works great 95 percent of the time.I love how clean it looks in the charcoal, especially since I have a darker color table.The one complaint I have is with the notifications. I wish there was a button on the device itself that I could press, rather than having to ask it to read my notifications when my phone already told me what was up (usually Amazon packages).Overall though, it_ great, I love how it works and I_ thinking about grabbing another one for upstairs.

Title: Echo is a very good speaker for the price point
Body: The Echo Dot is a very nice speaker for the price-point. I really like the responsiveness of the speaker when you say the wake name. It has three so if you have toddlers who like to play with it you can change the wake word( no more playing) The speaker also has multiple skills so you can sync it with a plethora of services. I synced mine with SiriusXM and Pandora and I love it! The only dislike that I have about the Echo Dot is the EQ. I wish that the trebles and bass were deeper. They work well but depending on the music that you_e playing will sometimes sound hollow. Overall though for the price Echo Dot is a pretty cool little speaker.

Title: For what Amazon tries to charge, they could put quality circuits and speakers in these
Body: What can I say? Amazon electronics seem to be made with less and less care or quality. The original echo dot that we own now sounds terrible and has fuzzy feedback anytime Alexa is speaking. The sound quality on this newer generation is not much better and we've only had it for a few weeks. I'll come back and update this review once the speaker has degraded to the condition of our original echo dot. the only time I purchase these anymore is when they're available for 99 cents on some BS promo Amazon's running. I would never pay full price for anything made by and for Amazon.

Title: Okay Amazon, Stop Emailing Me About This
Body: First off, let me say I have an Echo Dot (1st Gen) and an Echo Show 5.  I love both of them.This one, however... Yeah, no.  Not a fan.  It misses half the things I say (unlike the two I mention above) and when it can't figure out what you've said, instead of telling you it couldn't figure it out, it just makes a "bong" and shuts off.Sound has waaaaay too much bass.  Seems like this is made for a 15 year old who only plays EDM.Last gripe -- When you buy this, you get an email every stinking week asking you to review it.  Congrats Amazon, here's your review!  How do you like me now?

Title: Drop in and Announcment
Body: I love this speaker, I mainly use it for:1. Intercom to call my kids, it has drop in feature where i can call a particular speaker and talk to them and they can talk to me2. Announcements, i can send messages to all my devices simultaneously from phone to all Alexa devices or i can use one of my Alexa devices to record my message which it will play to all my Alexa devices.3. I can call free to any Alexa device for free4. I can call free to any US phone number for free5. Mic is very sensitive, i can get Alexa_ attention from hundred feet away6. I connect my phone through Bluetooth and it will play whatever my phone is playing7. There are several Muslim apps available in Alexa skills , they play Quran and also can remind you for daily prayers.8. You can play you favorite music to all speakers in the house at once, create a speaker group and play anything on this group9. Pairing and setup is a breeze, 5 mins or less10. Also works with Skype calling11. Control your smart apps and devices by talking to alexaWhat I would like to see:1. Support for Smarthings, I was not able to connect my account2. Support for nest thermostat, seems like there is some rivalry between and google products and they are keeping each other_ product out of their platforms3. alexa should also support VOIP apps like what_ app and messenger, that would be so cool4, facebook integration, i mean why not !!5. I,ll update more once i remember :-)

Title: Good speaker, not great
Body: I had the worst time installing this Echo Dot.  It just would not connect to my network.  Amazon even sent me a 2nd Dot, which had the same issues.  Eventually I connected to my neighbors wifi (accidentally) and then later was able to connect to my own wifi.  I find that the sound is just "okay" compared to my full-Echo products, but I bought this to sit in the kitchen between two rooms each with an Echo.... just to "smooth" out the sound between the rooms.  I would try again.

Title: Firestick + echo dot equals no volume control
Body: the best part when you finally get it , the tv and your 2 bluetooth speakers hooked up, finding out the volume buttons on remote wont turn it down has got to be the grinch that stole my Christmas.  Basicly bought one and a fire stick with remote that had the volume buttons on it so my dad could just use one remote. Ya isnt happening somebody couldnt actually figure out away to make a firestick volume button change the dot volume when connected to firestick. Im going back to buying a receiver with 900 inputs and outputs so i can do it the easy way.

Title: Amazing
Body: I was checking up on this product for a while but was waiting for the right moment to strike. After the 3rd gen came out I was in total awe and said I'll have to purchase this now. Days went by and I forgot about it and then Black Friday came with the monthly installment plan and didn't hesitate.The dot is amazing, the sound is great and compact. Voice recognition is easy only sometimes she might not understand fully.It's just an amazing device and I'm still in testing with it.

Title: Best _ersonal assistant & convenience!
Body: Fantastic little gem! This was a gift to me for my birthday... and now I_ addicted! I don_ know WHY I didn_ opt for one of these sooner!! The possibilities are endless- especially with it being on sale, you just can_ go wrong! Fairly easy to use, once you get the hang of it. And entirely convenient- it_ like a personal assistant but more! I now have to get my family on board so I can _rop in from afar, lol. But the amount of convenience & help Alexa is totally beats Siri or other _obots. If I could gift one of these to everyone I love, I would! I_l probably end up with one for my office, now, too!

Title: Best entry level option
Body: I had been interested in diving into the whole smart home thing for awhile now. So about 2 or 3 months ago I bought this product, and it was everything I expected and more. I definitely reccomend it as an entry level product, versus the Show and the full sized Echo. That way in case it isnt for you, you only spent $50 versus over $100 for the other products, so it stings a little less. The set up was quick and simple and the voice recognition is amazing. With my small apartment it can pick my voice up from everywhere, as well as I can hear Alexa very well despite the Dot having a smaller speaker. Of course if you have a bigger apartment, or a house, that experience might differ. With the Alexa app on my phone I can control almost all functions for it without having to be at home. This includes setting reminders, calling the Dot, dropping in, and announcements, (great features if you have kids,) setting alarms and timers, etc. All in all, the Dot is a very solid budget/entry level option. It's only drawback is the fact that since its smaller the sound isnt going to be as loud or clear as the other options.

Title: She starts my day and ends my day
Body: I bought this as a Christmas gift but I rated it according to the ones I have. Love Alexa! I start my day every morning when I wake up asking for the weather report. I end my day asking Alexa to set my wake up alarm and turn the lights out. And lots of things in between. I also used it to "drop-in" on a friend who left her phone at my house by mistake and there was no other way of contacting her and this worked perfectly.

Title: A Google device might be better. _
Body: My 2nd Gen Echo Dot is better. The audio on this new 3rd Gen is very muffled. Alexa on 2nd Gen is friendlier with responses, etc.  The new Alexa didn't recognize my voice a day after I did the voice recognition session with it.I bought it specifically to enable me to use smart home devices that required Version 3 Echo.I've spent thousands of dollars on Amazon and am very disappointed with this purchase.

Title: Does the trick! Great bedside clock
Body: Does the trick! I needed a new bedside clock & this is perfect - great size, dims down at night so it_ not keeping me awake, controls the lights (smart bulbs) which is handy with an armload of laundry!I haven_ figured out how to handle multiple tasks with a single command (Alexa goodnight = lights off, cameras on, thermostat down, alarm on.) but I_ told it_ possible.

Title: Works for playing online music through stereo
Body: We have a couple of these in the house now and like having them around, mostly for playing music, and annoying the person in the other room by dropping in. :). For the black Friday price, it was well worth getting a couple extras, though I wish the sound quality was a bit better from the 3.5mm jack out to my stereo. Coupled with streaming quality, sometimes it's not very good.

Title: Handy and easy to use
Body: This is my 2nd dot. Love them both. Like the style of this 3rd generation. I bought each of mine holders and have one upstairs (plugged in and hanging on the wall) and one downstairs. I use them as intercoms as well as everything else they are capable of. Love it! Also have an Echo show 8 in the kitchen so I can talk to grandkids near and far (Germany) great products

Title: Handy little thing!
Body: Liked all of the features; we do not have "smart devices," so i use it to listen to music, get news/information.One thing that completely frustrated me...I tried to use it at work, knowing it would not connect to our wifi at work.I tried to connect it to my phone's personal hotspot. NOPE.Will try to troubleshoot, but that was really disappointing!

Title: Light seems dim
Body: I replaced an old alarm clock that was reliable but actually seemed too bright when I looked at it during the night.  Now I get one that is too dim during the day.  I have tried turning up the display as high as it will go and it is a little better but the whole idea of light adaptive should be brighter in dim light and lighter in dark to me, it seems that it works opposite.

Title: The Dot A Value Personal Assistant
Body: Alexa can assist with many tasks as a home assistant. Assisting with schedules, making outbound calls, alarms, sounds and playing music. That, she is still not using standardized protocols to limit her integration with smart phones. She has lots of skills but many of them are half baked or don't work at all. She can often be difficult to communicate with similar-sounding words. If you want a rich sounding speaker, then go with full size. The dot doesn't have a rich base tone.

Title: Pleasantly Surprised
Body: Being new to the echo dot I have no basis for comparison with early models. I have no gripes. The sound is much bigger than Id expect from such a small device. Alexa seems to have a mind of her own...at times she just ignores my questions or commands...Just like a real person. Im used to that so it doesn't bother me too much. I may update my review upon further use.

Title: So many great features ! Intercom is the best!
Body: Great product.Things I like:It actually speaks back the reminders as you set it - google home only beeps. This allows me to not only be aware of the reminder but also know exactly what it was for.Drop in is awesome! Intercom in the house!Integration with Ring is great! No need of ring chimeThings that can be improved on in my opinionSound quality. Highs seem to be missingVoice seems a bit unnatural at timesDoesnt hear me when I call out Alexa even though I clearly say itOverall great device!!

Title: Best in class Assistant
Body: I can't believe how good this is. We have had a Google home for a couple years and most of the time it was unplugged collecting dust. Complete pain. Got an Alexa for our bedroom and it just mops the floor with Google home. I can't wait to get the Alexa subwoofer and bring down the house! Very responsive. Using the shopping list, playing relax music at night, reminders and alarms. The usefulness is never ending.

Title: Can't control Amazon Fire Cube
Body: I bought this to add an additional microphone to control my Amazon Fire Cube with, since we usually have to raise our voices very loud for the Cube to hear us. Unfortunately, after receiving the item I discovered that it cannot be used to control a Fire Cube. This should be made more apparent and obvious on all materials promoting the Echo Dot.On the other hand, it makes a fantastic $30 paperweight. I would rate the Echo Dot 5 stars if I were to base my review exclusively on how well it stays put on top of a stack of paper.

Title: This little dot packs a punch
Body: I bought this on a whim - it was on sale and had a deal for a smart plug. I honestly didn_ have high expectations for $30 but thought it might be fun to play with for a while. Nope! This thing is so cool - so cool that I bought two more...one for my bedroom and one as a gift for my parents. Since I_ not interested in having my whole neighborhood hear my music or symphonic quality, the speaker works just fine for me. What really amazes me are the voice recognition, the whisper option, the wide range of skills, and so much more. (My dad_ going to enjoy the old-timey radio shows!) And it_ so small - a great space saver and also doesn_ add to the  electronics clutter. Actually, since this is so helpful, I_e gotten rid of a bunch of stuff like my clock-radio-sound machine and weather thingamajig. The Easter eggs are fun too (though Alexa is not much of a singer/rapper!)

Title: Better than anticipated.
Body: Bought this as an early christmas present for my boyfriend and I. This is our first Echo for or smart speaker so my expectations weren_ extremely high.I am very pleased with the product, the sound quality is great and the speaker it self gets very loud when it comes to playing music. However, I sometimes have to shout for Alexa to respond. We have this connected to our fire TV and ring doorbell. It_ a nice feature to have when my daughter is constantly losing the remote !I don_ like the fact that the device has to be plugged into an outlet to work and there_ not an option to charge it or have it battery operated, that_ a bit inconvenient.All in all, I am satisfied with the purchase. For $25 you get a great quality smart speaker that connects to pretty much anything in your home that is a smart device. Would buy again and recommend

Title: Nice hardware, but Alexa has serious catching up to do.
Body: Let's start with the positive. The hardware is HEAD and SHOULDERS better than Google's Home Mini.  Alexa makes use of the LED display for a clock, temperature readout, countdown timer, and possibly other uses.  The unit feels solid, and materials nice to the touch.Alexa, however, is HEAD AND SHOULDERS inferior to Google Assistant.  My Alexa account is present and viewable in my Dot, Fire TV, and Fire Tablet. And none of them speak to another. "Alexa, play Classic Rock music on my Fire TV". Nope, can't do that, but if I speak to the fire TV remote it works fine.  Natural conversation? Google does that ALRIGHT, Alexa doesn't do it at all. "Alexa, what's the weather today?" You get a response.  "How about tomorrow?" Nothing.  And just a bunch of other random prompts from me that Google Assistant can handle, but Alexa can't.Verdict: if you want an alarm clock with smart features that can play Amazon Music though an acceptable speaker, the Echo Dot with Clock is your Huckleberry.  If you want a genuinely helpful Home Automation Assistant, look at Google's devices.

Title: Not as Useful as I had hoped
Body: Honestly, not certain I am going to keep it, yet.  Voice recognition is fairly good, but you have to use very specific phrases for the dot to understand what you are asking.  The Alexa app drains my phone battery by keeping the location on.  I don't have any other smart home devices, so I am not reaping the benefits of the dot as much as I had hoped.  It is, however, nice on a few levels.  I like adding things to the shopping list via voice command, It would be nice to be able to replace the Amazon shopping list with the list app of your choice, so that you don't have to say the magic words to get it to add to the correct list.

Title: Such a great add-on to my life in generaal.
Body: I bought an Amazon Echo 8 and received the dot for free. I am blown away at how cool it is. You can group them together and play music all over the house. Now I want more of them. I will probably get an Echo Studio because the sound quality on the echo is good, but could be better. I use this echo as the brain of my Tivoli Audio home speaker using the 35mm jack. The echo has replaced my phone as my music streaming device. I have even subscribed to Amazon Music Unlimited because of how awesome the echo is. The ability to link them all together is the best feature of these devices hands down. I also like randomly asking it to tell me a joke and reading me the news from the New York Times.

Title: Nice device, won't be using it for my new home, tho
Body: I bought the Echo Dot since it was so cheap and I wanted to try out devices like this for the new home I'm building. I really like the ease of setup and for weather, alarms, and lists its great. Then I started playing with the music feature and that's when I discovered that Amazon doesn't allow you to upload your own collection of music to their cloud, so I can't play any of my songs, books, lectures on the Echo Dot unless I bought them on Amazon. Well, that pretty much eliminates Echo as an option for my new home. I'll be going with a different manufacturer. Too bad, because I like the Echo. I just can't understand why Amazon went and changed their approach on this and left their customers high and dry. I had a similar bad experience with Kindle licensing and stopped using that device as well.

Title: Dies in 90 days.
Body: I bought two of these between Black Friday and Christmas 2018. I was busy through the holidays so I didn't get them installed until late January. Set up was easy and they integrated with my other smart devices great. I could set times, turn on our of the lights, all the typical "smart" stuff. Then by St Patrick's Day they had both stopped working. I had also purchased two of the Amazon smart plugs to control lamps and they also only lasted about 90 days. I don't know if I just got a bad lot of products or if the technology is just not there yet, but I'd stick with other options for now.

Title: My second one.  Highly recommended.
Body: I had one from the previous versions.  My last one worked great and we use it all the time to listen to the radio and control our lights.  The sound on these is not super loud, but it is very decent for the size of the device.  I highly recommend any of these devices since they make it so much easier for certain things such as security in your home.  I have a light that I turn on even when I am very far from home and then turn off before bedtime.I have not opened or used this one because it will be a gift that I am sure will be enjoyed.

Title: Alexa does not understand what I am trying to say
Body: I am very new to using Alexa but I was expecting much more success from Amazon. I'm not saying that it is not working, it works very good and I also integrated through IFTTT. I am using with my smart bulbs and plugs. I will also buy Alexa integrated thermostat and will be using that one. But, if you compare Alexa with Google assistant, Google understands what I am saying even if I do have grammatical errors or accent.I will give you an example. I was asking Alexa the films of Samuel L. Jackson. I tried 5 times and Alexa did not get what I am saying. Then, I check what it understand from Alexa app to provide feedback, I see that Alexa understand: "films somewhere else". So, it could not provide any answer.With the exact same speed and accent, I said it to google assistant on my phone, it understands what I am saying at the first trial. So, I am planning to have a google mini next to Alexa and ask google for complicated stuff and ask alexa to turn on/off my lights.Another example, Alexa does not understand if you say: open firetv. Which might not be a perfect command but, it provides wrong feedback message. It says my firetv does not support that feature :/ Then I realized that I have to say: Turn on Firetv :/

Title: Great for managing lights, outlets, playing music, etc.
Body: Have three of these in my house which pretty much gives me full coverage of all the rooms I want to automate. Devices include outlets and various light bulbs -- of different brands. Each brand required either a piece of hardware (hub) or iPhone app -- all of which integrated very nicely with Alexa. I needed to swap all the dimmer switches that I had with regular two or three way switch as the light bulbs do not work with dimmer switch. However, one swapped out, Alexa provides the feature t dim the light bulbs.

Title: I rather walk my lazy butt and physically do things than deal with her
Body: It gives you a lot of expectation, accordingly is a huge disappointment. After weeks of trial I found out how to turn the tv on with her: _lexa turn TV on: _v does not have this function __lexa turn fire tv on - it works so now I have to say FIRE TV, FIRE TV ok bs, just grab the freeking remoate push on button. Alexa rendered useless if tv needs that much work then altering my home is even more annoying (I rather walk my lazy butt to the thermostat and light switch , etc then deal with it!

Title: Great addition to the bedroom.
Body: I bought this to replace an old clock radio that was on my nightstand.  With the built in clock It makes a great replacement and also adds all the Alexa capabilities to my bedside. Connects with the Echo I have in my kitchen so I can sync music in both places. Also plays sleep sounds (white noise, pink noise etc..) so could be replacement for a bedside white noise device. Also it's nice being able to ask about the weather even before getting out of bed. For the price it was a great buy.

Title: Alexa is perfect, and so is the Echo Dot!
