Body: The Echo Dot 3rd gen is a great smart speaker. I have it in my room, and also have a smart plug to go with it. I just ask Alexa to turn off my lights, and she does! The speaker quality is really good for this small of a speaker, and works great in my room to project the sound around it. Alexa recognizes my voice 95% of the time, the 5% being when I don_ whisper loud enough in whisper mode(you whisper to her and she whispers back, it_ great for at night!).  99% of radio stations have a way to stream them, and I haven_ found a single platform not supported on the Echo(I_e used stations that stream with iHeartRadio, Radio.com, TuneIn). You can play music from many platforms, like Spotify and Amazon Music. I recommend it, it_ a nice little gizmo that makes life easier. If you_e not sure which Echo version to buy, I_ say the Echo Dot is the best combo of function and price, but if you need a better speaker you can get the regular Echo or Echo Plus. If you want a screen then get the Echo Show or Spot. But for most people, the Dot is plenty good for them and you can easily find it on sale for $25 or so. Great job Amazon and you_e earned my business again!

Title: Fun device and sound is great for a small inexpensive device
Body: The physical device is a great size for keeping on our nightstand.  The microphone picks up our voices from across the room and even through the closed door!  The kids have a blast with Alexa.  Even though the voice recognition is officially tuned to adult voices, it is amazing how well it understands even our youngest with a speech impediment.  They enjoy compiling and playing music playlists, as well as the children games skills and jokes, etc.

Title: Why wouldn't you?
Body: If you are planning to make your house completely smart house, to me it makes no sense why you wouldn't want an echo. The sound quality is amazing for such a tiny device. I like the fact that there so many thing you can pair with and echo. I bought a couple security devices and led lights and even a doorbell. I must say I think I have a weird obsession with futuristic smart devices but so helpful. Living the goooooodddd life.

Title: Alexa doesn't understand
Body: Alexa often misunderstands or plain doesn't do what you ask her. We had a Google home before the echo and it was much better (we changed to echo bc we have Android phones and the Google home and our phones would compete/get confused about which we were addressing). I repeat myself two to three times with Alexa and then just end up giving up and doing the task myself. Also in case you're wondering, we don't have accents or anything that would make it difficult to understand the commands.

Title: Try it, you will love it_
Body: The device has unlimited potential; however, one must research to determine its capabilities. One day I read I could send an audio message to all devices to inform the family diner is ready. When I ask the device to send the Audi message the next day, it can_ tell me how to do it. So sometimes the device will explain how to do tasks yet other times you need to research how to do things.  I guess the best thing to do is keep notes on how to do things that are not frequently done. Overall, I am happy with the purchase as I can play several devices simultaneously throughout the house.

Title: You don't need anything more expensive than this
Body: I love how easy it was to connect  -  like 2 minutes, all done.  She knows every question with a real answer I could come up with.  I haven't integrated this with my other appliances yet.  That will take a little bit of $$ for each appliance, or lights, whatever electric switch you have.  I move it beside my bed at night and ask for music to go to sleep to...I'm gone by 3rd piece.  I got this for 24.99.  It's all the Alexa I need.

Title: Wish I had help it don't work like it says
Body: Well I liked somebody else's and that's why it was given to me as a gift cuz I wanted one. then I've had nothing but trouble with it I say Alexis and the blue light comes on but she says nothing back I say Alexis say hello she says nothing and I get tired of trying to get her to answer me I don't know what's wrong so as far as I can tell if my friend didn't have it hooked up to her phone or if she did I never noticed cuz she would just talk to it and it would come on but this one seems to have to be connected to my computer or my phone I didn't think it had two I thought it had to be hooked up to Wi-Fi once it was hooked up to Wi-Fi through your phone or computer that it didn't need to be operated through that device and never seen my friend do that so anyway I don't know this review is not a very good one I'm sorry I wish I could have done better with what I seen you and now what I have are two different things

Title: Some work better than others.
Body: I got two during Black Friday. One was $12! Cheaper than the other. Ok. Fine. But the one I got that was cheaper has far less issues. The first one I got, the black one, constantly cuts out, beeps and stops playing music. The other one does not do that. Thinking I should return it because it cannot be updated or settings adjusted enough to not make it the most annoying thing ever.

Title: Great for casual use
Body: We bought this dot to use in our kitchen. More for background music, and it has been perfect so far. In fact, my husband also used it to sync our outdoor Christmas lights and all we had to do was say "alexa, turn on outdoor plug" and they would all turn on! So nice not having to go outside. The speaker is not necessarily high quality, for those looking for a great music sound system but it does the job.

Title: Very good
Body: Much better than the first one  speakers has a heavy bass and very loud luv them got one for my niece Christmas gift and check to see if it work .. well .. end up buying one for myself . As a flight crew I would take the one I have at home but now with the new one I don_ need to take it and also no need to take my wireless speakers on my trip because this new one is so good with the sound

Title: A Nice Improvement
Body: The newer third gen has a much better audio quality over second gen Dots. The cloth cover looks nice as well.  I_ an Apple device user but find myself migrating away from Siri toward Alexa because Alexa just works better in regard to voice recognition. Remembering how to activate my various skills is tedious. I do like that I can pair my phone to the DOT via Bluetooth.

Title: Near perfect voice recognition, surprising number of uses
Body: Intercom. Control TV. Easy-Access Dictionary, Thesaurus, Encyclopedia, Calculator, Clock, Outdoor Thermometer, Weather Forcaster, Verbal Internet, Grocery List, To-Do List, Notes, etc, all without lifting a finger! I find new uses every day, and there are numerous I have not tried yet! I will probably buy one for the kitchen and one for the second bedroom also.

Title: Majorly Disappointing
Body: Surprisingly poor sound quality considering it_ the 3rd generation of the product. Not a critical flaw for music playing because that goes through Sonos speakers via WiFi in my set up.  When music is playing you need to scream at the Dot to control the volume or pause it. I never had that issue with my 1st gen Echo this replaces. Not sure what_ up with that. Only thing in favor of this product is price, but only because of Black Friday special.

Title: Turn any Ordinary Speakers into Bluetooth Smart Speakers!
Body: I like this because not only does it make any speaker a smart speaker, it also acts as a Bluetooth receiver. So I was able to make my home theater speakers Bluetooth! All I have to say is _lexa connect to my phone and bam, now I can stream music from my phone. That_ a huge pro and one of the main reasons I bought this thing. Highly recommended!

Title: Way better than google
Body: We had google mini_ and had a really hard time with connecting them and keeping them connected to all our smart bulbs. With Alexa the sound is much clearer and the connection was so easy!!! To hook up our whole house took less than 5 minutes!!!!! The drop in feature is amazing! So when I want to check I_ on my kids I can very easily!!

Title: Echo Dot faster, cleaner appearance, less power, and a great buy.
Body: We replaced our tall echo series one with this 3rd gen Echo Dot and here are the pros I have noticed and one minor difference in my use case:Pro -1.  Faster. Boots and responds to voice commands more promptly than the series 1 devices across the family.2.  Better appearance. Lights and cloth material appear nicer to me.  Color in this case = Sandstone.3.  Smaller size makes it less noticeable and clears vertical are to the large size echo devices.4.  Newer mounting accessories and options to mount based on smaller size.5. Can be paired together for stereo like audio in a room and also Alexa subwoofer.6.  Less power used. Uses a 15W power supply versus 18W on the series 1 large echo.7.  Less expensive retail price.I_ sure there are more and above are simply what I noticed in first days of use.Only difference I have noticed:The sound quality of the echo dot is surprisingly good as other reviewers have shared. The minor difference is that the echo dot does not have as much lower frequency response (bass) as the larger echo devices.  This can be solved by audio out cable to audio system, pair with the Alexa subwoofer or other.

Title: Good intro to Smart Home
Body: Alexa voice control is a little difficult at first. You have to be fairly precise in what you are requesting Alexa to do. After you get used to that it works pretty well. The integration side of Alexa is the reason I rated it a four. I have had a hard time with Smart lights (Phillips) and my Kindle. The Kindle tends to be slow and not responsive at times. The Hue Bridge works pretty well.Sound Quality is mediocre at best. If you just want background, it is satisfactory. Above that, get a stereo or receiver. Can't speak for the Echo.Because my wife is ill, I bought it to use the intercom feature. Still have not gotten it to work. As I understand it, you have to tell Alexa the echo you want to talk to and then wait for the connection and the other person to answer before you can talk. So it is not just push a button and talk like they make it sound. Not good in an emergency or immediate need situation.Overall, not a bad product, but has a long way to go for really being useful in a Smart Home.

Title: Does its basic job
Body: It's not bad to set up, but some of the more sophisticated uses takes some digging and playing around to figure out. It has lost its connection for some unknown reason on occasion, which is annoying but not a game-ender. It has spontaneously started playing music, triggered by some unknown force. We are surprised at some of the simple requests or questions that it cannot handle or learn. I do worry about how much of unintended conversation or data is being collected and stored in that great concrete bunker in the sky (or Ashburn, as the case may be). Some uses require changes in the volume, up or down, from the current setting. It is a useful novelty...but duplicates the capabilities already present in most smart phones, only with a slightly larger speaker and mic.

Title: So much fun!
Body: Now I have to say this Echo thing is just too much fun. I received an echo as a gift and thought it was an interesting novelty. However when I asked Alexa about a Tolstoy quote and immediately got the answer I was looking for I was a little hooked. Then I started utilizing the echo for weather reports, reminders, tidbits of information during conversation, music, and a whole host of other little fun things this little thing does. I now own three in three rooms and if I want to play music throughout the house I just ask one to play what I'm looking for over everywhere and I have music throughout the house. My next purchase will be an upgraded speaker and I have been buying these like crazy for family members for Christmas.One thing to be aware of. Watch proximity to television as there are commercials on all the time for this Echo product and I find my Echo Dot will respond.

Title: Never imagined I would use one of these
Body: We are not folks to have the latest gadgets. Received this as a promotional item. Knowing now what it is like, would I buy one? Yes!  It is so easy to walk into the kitchen and request whatever style of music you feel like at the moment.  You can request particular songs, or just categories.  I like background music filling the house.  It is nice.  That is mostly what we use it for.  Has a lot of other features.  We try to stay off our phones at home, so it is nice to just ask what the overnight low temperature will be, because online you can get distracted by so many other things and realize an hour later that you still don_ know what the temperature is.  I also like that you can press a button to mute it from listening.

Title: Use Two For Stereo!
Body: After previously owning the first version of the Echo Dot, I bought two of these with the express intention of pairing them together to play music in stereo.  I also assumed the sound quality might be better than the original.  In a nutshell, pairing was a breeze so now music is played in stereo which is very cool.  As for sound quality, yes, it is better than the original Dot but as you should expect, it_ not amazing rather, it is what it is... tiny speakers housed in plastic.  Considering I purchased these on sale (less than half price), I am very satisfied!

Title: Great improved Sound and Interaction
Body: I like the little update from the 2nd gen, I have three Dot's and use them to turn on and off lights and a fanand also enjoy them playing music through out my house, in each room or the whole house at the same timeI use them every day for looking up things or help in spelling, I could go on and on so lets just say there a lot of fun.  Drifter

Title: Works great recognizing southern accent.
Body: I love this little echo dot. I have been hesitant to purchase one for the longest time due to the fact that Siri has such a hard time with my accent, as well as my google home, so I have little faith in Alexa, but she has no problem at all. I purchased it when there was a sale, if you purchased a month of amazon music ($7.99) you got the echo dot for .99, so it was practically stealing and at least worth a shot. There are tons of featured, it works well with our fire sticks on the tvs and the sound quality is very nice and I really enjoy it. Great product.

Title: Alexa, where have you been all my life?
Body: I have 3 Echo Dots around my house and I have them connected so when I play music, my home fills with song. And I finally got rid of my digital alarm to see what time it is when I wake up during the night because I can quickly ask Alexa. I have my home set up to use Alexa to turn lights on and off, as well as my waterfall. Need a reminder while cooking? Alexa has you covered there too. Each week I_ finding something new to use my Dot for. If you_e on the fence, just do it! I was so happy with my first one, I got two more.

Title: At this point I don_ know
Body: I recently purchased 2 Gen 3 I_ not going elaborate because the list is so long it_ ridiculous. Sum up things is that Alexa is stupid I tell her something she says the opposite not all the time but if I_ lucky  she will actually be paying attention when I ask her something. She goes crazy randomly for no apparent reason all the time she acts like she_ her own person because she starts to answer her own questions and then randomly just spits out phrases and words and also she sometimes just starts to say how r u when I_ in the bathroom or somewhere and it_ just me here no body else like she having a conversation. I factory reset her 3 times to see if it would help it made her worse. I thought she supposed to get smarter not dumber now  I want to throw her out the window. I have the fire tv box which is awesome does not do anything like this echo 3rd gen does at all and 15 percent out of the time she works with my fire tv box but almost always she doesn_ seem to do what you guys have which I_e read all many times the instructions, so I unplug her if I want to watch my amazon prime shows  or movies, when I_ streaming music she sometimes tells me to change the song on my iPhone instead of Alexa skipping to the next song when I ask her to, she randomly just stops in the middle of things when I ask her something like she fell asleep. What because I_ to boring I really am shocked on how this echo is bad and did not hit my consumer high point. Sad day for amazon echo product. One more thing is she will pulsate the green light which means a call or a drop in but when you ask here to answer or decline she says there is no call. Did some digging online and could not find anything about it and she still flashes the green light so I have her unplugged because is somebody listening on the other end?? It_ really scary knowing that when this green ring just shows up randomly, what else are you supposed to think about it.

Title: Better sound quality vs the original Dot
Body: Decided to get this because of the current sales promotion. Better quality sound, bugger and more of a modern look. 3 stars was because Amazon had a better promotion a couple of days after I bought them and tried to get a price adjustment. The sales rep copied and paste their policy on promotional pricing which made me upset. I ask if I should just return them and buying again and she said "yes if that is what I wanted to do". That response just upset me even more while typing so I just deducted 1 more star... >:|

Title: Love this thing!
Body: I got the Dot on a whim when it went on sale, not really knowing what it does. The set up is super easy and I immediately paired it to my smart thermostat and had it playing music. I have had it for a few weeks now and added a smart plug so it can turn off my lamp, which is great! I got the plug on sale but the regular price is ridiculously pricey so I_l wait to add more when they are low. I know it can do a lot more but the process for acquiring new skills is confusing to me so I will leave it at music, lamp, and heat for now.

Title: Super fun, smart, and informative interaction.
Body: What a fun way to experience AI interaction. Plating games, asking questions, music, trivia.  It hooked up pretty easy, but it got a little tricky doing things like 'family account' so it would recognize different phones.  Amazing stuff, really.  I wonder what advances we'll see in the NEXT 10 years?!  Anyway, it's definitely worth the $25.  But if you are a music junkie, you might want to get one of the higher priced echos that have the better speaker.  But for a small unit, it is pretty impressive.

Title: like is so far...
Body: like the features, setup was difficult for some of my devices (August Door lock, Bose speaker)...  but all switches and outlets (5), thermostat, tankless water heater.  Unfortunately all I can do is turn on/off Bose.  It doesn't support volume or changing channels, but I believe that is due to the particular speaker I have....  Worth getting if you already have other devices to use it with...  I don't sit around and ask Alexa questions much so that doesn't really matter to me....

Title: This was my first Echo
Body: As someone who has a Google Home in every room of the house (minus the bathroom) I decided I should give Echo a try. This deal was too good to pass up and I was not disappointed.While Alexa won't be replacing Google, (I have way too many songs on Google Music to switch) I am satisfied with the performance and my niece actually prefers the Echo for her music needs (I think she just likes Alexa's voice as well as calling her Alexa more than Google).

Title: What's not to like?
Body: Set up was as challenging as plugging it in.  Sound quality is great.  Voice response top notch.  Foot print is small and it is very unobtrusive.  Also have a Google Home device.  Struggling at the moment as to which I like better but as of this review am leaning toward the Echo.  On minor item I very much like is the ability to change the wake word.  Instead of always having to say "Hey Google" I now just say "Computer" on/off, volume etc.  Reminds me of my youth and Star Trek.

Title: Love it!
Body: I never wanted an Alexa anything. I didnt see the reason to have it, until I got a free Echo dot and a smart plug from my cell phone company. I'm hooked! I never realized many tasks this dot could help with! I love getting a run down every morning of the weather, important events, reminders and tasks, all hands free. I love that I can tell my pets "hi" while I'm at work, or put on the tv or a pet station for them if I'm going to be home late.

Title: Amazing Device That Can be Most Helpful
Body: Excellent source of information.  Very handy for use as a timer.  Quick and easy alarm clock.  Music to listen to instantly.  Once you go through the setup procedure and have the dot working properly, don't make the mistake of unplugging it to move it to a different location.  I did that with one of the four that I have and it led to problems in having to go though the setup procedure again and the second time was much more difficult.

Title: Big fan
Body: This is our 5 dot, to go with our 2 first gen echos, echo Auto and echo call.  This last one was for my home office and for a small area the sound is great.  We use the echos a lot in my home for sending announcements like letting everyone know dinner is ready.  Obviously I am a fan of the echo products and honestly the dot is one of the best, each generation the sound has incremental improvements, I honestly think the sound from the 3rd generation dot is as good as the 1st generation full sized echo perhaps even a little better.

Title: All the Echo devices that I own work very well
Body: I have several Echo devices including the Fire Stick. All are easy to configure and work very well. When you get the new device, read the brief instructions completely before you start. Write down your WIFI uname and password and write down your Amazon password. Have your Amazon app loaded on your smartphone. Now start the configuration. It's easy, even the non technical person can get through the instruction.

Title: Third one
Body: Have not determined exactly where each one should be placed because as the only one in the house I can't seem to decide whick room is the best for me.  The only sure place is in the bedroom for slumber music.  Now if Echos could just maintain the same sound level for the music.  Some you can barely hear and some will wake you up.  The next upgrade should be constant sound level.

Title: Fun to use
Body: I am really enjoying the Echo dot with Amazon music.  It will play music from any year & most any song.  We found a few that Alexa does not know.  She comes on occasionally by herself.  We have not figured out what triggers her.  Sound is pretty good only occasionally is it muffled.  Temps in 50s & 60s are hard to distinguish sometimes.  Overall Alexa is fun to have around.

Title: Versatile helper
Body: We're very impressed with how easy it is to set up & use the Echo Dot. We take it with us when traveling to our vacation home and find that it just keeps working with us after changing the router connection and zip code. Also, surprised to find that it works with our video security system. I am sure that we will connect it to more of our home devices in the future.

Title: Tradition means Christian Christmas music first and secular familiars 2nd
Body: This may be Amazon Prime problem  But  Alexa doesn_ listen to me closely  maybe I have to pay more money  But  when I ask for Christmas Traditional Music with or without vocals or with orchestra music only she is lost  Look at Sirius Xm Traditional Christmas music  it is all back in 40 50 60 and early 70ties  it has Ray Coneff singers and Boston pops orchastra Nat King Cole  Percy Faith Perry Como as well as Bing Crosby Frank Sinatra and many other bands and instrumental music  Even the vocals on Alexa don_ carry the good old traditional songs I remember  sorry I_ over 72 and just want to hold on to my youth memories  thanks for asking

Title: Alexa vs Google Home: Depends What Features You Want
Body: Ordered my 1st Alexa Device after I was already using Google Home.  I have to say. Alexa is less prone to false search results and provides more comprehensive local radio station support.  Originally bought Google Home to listen to local AM Rl1080 Talk Radio.  However support was dropped, thus losing the key feature that drove me to select Google Home in the 1st place.

Title: Works great with Philips Hue.
Body: I've integrated it with my Philips hue lighting system and it works great. Additionally, I've tied it to my Sirius XM subscription so I can just tell it to play my favorite stations and boom....there it is. Love it. Constantly finding new things to do with Alexa. I have a google home system also, and I seem to be able to do more with Alexa over the google home.

Title: Takes Time
Body: Pairing the echo with my phone should_e been simple, but turned into a bit of an event. The volume was pretty soft , also, even though I increased it on my phone. Sometimes the device doesn_ recognize a task when it_ already performed it in the past. I_ guessing there_ user issues, to an extent, so being patient and continuing to explore.

Title: The most useful part of the smart home for most
Body: The key things most people want to know: 1. Yes, the speaker built in is good enough to use to play music and will get loud enough for regular use. If you are having a large party and want more than background music and really want to crank it up, this wont work, but to listen to music while cooking or doing something else, even if you like it a little loud, it is fine.2. Yes, you can connect a speaker to it over either bluetooth or aux cableHaving had an Echo Dot for about a year and now having 3 I think they are great. They are most useful to listen to music. If you have prime, it is awesome...'Alexa play country music' will get you a nice mix of country music. In the kitchen it is great for setting timers...'Alexa set a timer for 45 minutes'. It also integrates nicely into the whole smart home but be careful. It took me a while to figure out that smart home devices also use zwave and zigbee to communicate (as compared to bluetooth or wifi), so if your smart devices use zwave or zigbee, you also need a hub. I have a Samsung Smarthings hub and it integrates nicely into my smart home, which is only semi-smart. We have about 6-8 smart switches, 5 smart outlets, smart front door, 3 echo dots, 2 echo buttons (these suck) and 2 Samsung buttons (buy these instead for buttons).

Title: Indispensable for dementia or Alzheimer_
Body: Bought for my mom. She lives in an assistant living facility.  She wanted a CD player to play classical music while she oil paints.My mom has moderate dementia which means she forgets to go to her exercise class, meditation class, jewelry making class etc. I set it to remind her 10-15 min before her classes/activities begin so she gets there on time.Alexa /dot has been the perfect companion for my mom in so many ways especially with dementia. Recently, the dot has become even more indispensable. Mom fell and broke her arm in two places therefore, making it a project to get up off couch and answer phone before it stops ringing. I can just say _lexa, drop in on mom_ dot and mom gets a little sound notification and mom and I can just talk to each other hands free and without her having to get up from couch, chair or bed. Mom absolutely loves loves her echo dot. She plays music, asks Alexa about the weather , time, jokes,news and so on. I love the dot for all the joy it seems to bring her , but mostly how much it_ improved my mothers quality of life and how much it_ helped me to help her.If you have a loved with Alzheimer_, dementia or any handicap involving not being mobile ... You need this in yours or your loved ones life!

Title: There have been two periods of my life;
Body: One was pre-Alexa and the other was Post-Alexa. I bought this one for my kitchen so I could use timers and also start up my Amazon Alexa enabled Microwave (also a great product). I play games in the skills section while cooking or washing dishes. While making coffee and breakfast I get the news and weather. The Dot hides on a shelf and isn't seen which is fun. If I get in the mood to hear a song while eating breakfast well Alexa is there to play it for me. The sound quality is great for such a small speaker. I even bought one for my girlfriend and she loves it. The fact that you can tell Alexa to add things to your shopping list is great and why it should be in every kitchen. Amazon you have changed my life. I added in Alexa enabled light bulbs and even turning the lights on and off (including the stove light) is all done by voice and hands free. From my bed or the living room I just tell Alexa to turn off the lights in the kitchen if I forget to do it when in the kitchen. Buy one for every room you will use it in every room and it has a purpose in each room. What you get out of the Dot far surpasses what you pay. It is a bargain.

Title: Awful Experience, Unusable
Body: Brought this for my parents and it has serious issues that make this unusable.Pros:Sound quality is greatLooks niceHas a clock on the frontCons:Setup is not easy, if you are a technical person it still takes a minute to get it connected. It could be a little bit easier.Doesn't allow adding additional voice recognition. For example, it recognizes my voice mother's voice but not my dad's voice. It says to add additional voice download the app to a 2nd phone. That only works if you have a smart phone, my dad has a flip phone and barely knows how to use it. They need to have a household voice recognition option, that actually recognizes an individual's voice.The voice recognition will do any female voice but not a male voice and vice versa, not a true voice recognition.It doesn't allow you to play your customized playlist on Amazon Music, it plays what it wants.The internet consantly disconnects my mom's phone from the internet now, whereas before it did not.When it finally connects it plays a song for 10-15 seconds and then shuts off. That defeats the purpose of what I brought it for.

Title: ok but...
Body: It's ok but the thing I noticed different from also having the 2nd gen, is that it takes longer to respond to you and sometimes it don't at all, so that's why I only give it 3 stars. I like the look of gen 3 better but I actually prefer the gen 2 over this one because of it's quick response and it can hear you better from far off. I almost thought about just returning the 2 new dots that I have but since they no longer have gen 2 available, I'll just hang onto them. Thought about trading in the older dot for new when I was buying the new dots, now I'm glad I didn't!( I'm not for sure if the 3rd gen echo dot is worst or it's my hotspot, being that I just found out that I'm maxed out on my hotspot. I have the new google nest mini and google nest hub now also and I'm having the same problems with it not working as well sometimes, no response at times.  It could be that this dot works just fine if you are using it with a good internet setup. So I really can't say for sure it's not as good, this has just been what I'm experiencing with this dot.)

Title: So impressive for the size
Body: I_ blown away by this hockey puck. We_e a solid Apple household primarily for privacy concerns. I got this for free with a promotion and I can_ believe how much nicer and easier to use Alexa is compared to Siri on my HomePod. Alexa is personable and warm. My wife hates Siri and won_ use her for anything. Within a few days she_ warmed up to Alexa.All that being said, I absolutely don_ trust amazon with 24/7 audio recording in my house. I do like that you can disable the mic with a single button press, so that_ nice. If we start talking anything serious like finances, I cut the mic on the dot.I am very impressed with the sound quality. It_ not as good as my HomePod, but it_ miles ahead of my iPhone and and good enough for normal use. For Apple Music, the HomePod is king simply because the dot can_ compare due to its size. I may actually buy some more echo devices with better sound (echo plus perhaps) since we can get Apple Music easily on the echo.

Title: Impressed
Body: My house has been an Apple house, with just about everything we have that is automated hooked into Siri. That works out okay for basic stuff like turning on light. But there hasn't be a lot of development in that area and there's not a lot of apps that would be useful to me that work with it. It also poses a problem when you have more than one person with Apple devices in the household. My husband's HomePod drove me nuts, taking over my "Hey, Siri" meant for my iPad or iPhone when I was trying to get something done for me. So I decided to try out this Echo Dot to see if it would help sort out some of the confusion - and it does!I don't have a lot of music attached to my Amazon, but Alexa has access to some free selections and radio stations that aren't too bad. And the Echo Dot has a great sound to it for being so small. Alexa also seems to be a little smarter and a lot more entertaining with the trivia games you can play with it, plus some of the other skills it has. I haven't had it for too long, but I am really enjoying it.

Title: Doesn't play well with Pandora or Spotify.
Body: Got an Echo Dot for each of my kiddos for Christmas, primarily so they could listen to music in their bedrooms. I was under the impression the devices would pair with Pandora and/or Spotify--and it seems they do, sometimes, for some people, but so far not for us. Each time I ask Alexa to play a song in Pandora or Spotify, she tells me I need to link my account and enable the skill. I've done this, multiple times now. The Alexa app shows that I've linked/enabled both services, but it still doesn't work. Annoying.

Title: Very disappointed
Body: Both my mother and my sister have an Amazon Alexa. I'm not sure if mine is broken but for some reason it has trouble recognizing my voice when I call her name. It does not always understand what I'm saying to it, it might think I'm telling it something completely different. Her voice comes out slightly muffled which makes it hard to understand. But the worst part is that occasionally she just seems to freeze when I asked her command and I'll try to ask it again but it will not go through and then she just seems to shut off all the way. I then have to unplug it and plug it back in for it to work. I'm very disappointed I have a feeling mine might be defective because my sister and mother do not have this experience. I don't really have the time to return it and go through that process so I am just very disappointed right now.

Title: Works great, but needs a little tweaking.
Body: Alexa has a wide array of available integration devices on the market that allow you to make an easy transition intonation smart home. I use Alexa with a smart TV, smart plugs, and smart switches. The device easily controls all of your peripherals in your home. The only thing I have issue with, after you set a routine or phrase, it must be said exactly to the word or the device doesn't recognize it.  If you have the volume set to anything above 8, it is difficult to interrupt music or actions that are happening. I'm satisfied with everything that I've programmed the echo to do. It just needs a little tweaking to be perfect.

Title: nice!
Body: I got this as an add on to another purchase (which I haven't received yet)  Wasn't really looking to get another one as I have 2 echo dot second gen's and a echo 2nd Gen already.  They work good.  I will say that the echo dot 2nd gen's don't sound good enough to me so i added a sound amplifier to both of those and they sound better now then the full size second gen echo i have!  anyway, I will say this, the dot 3 out of the box sounds much better than the 2's!  I won't need an amplifier for this thing.  So, since it was free...it's going into my workshop so i can listen to music out there!  Win Win!

Title: AMAZING life saver!! This device is awesome and can do so many things! Worth every single penny!
Body: My children ask me SOOOO many questions all day and evening. It's a lot with juggling full time mom, full time work, raising minions. The kids ask Alexa things now and it's SUPER helpful to me. This device can do so many things. I've shown my friends, family, informed co-workers whom donate currently own one of what these amazing devices can do. Music, recipes, setting alarms, setting alarms to wake up to music, Christmas music, asking dumb questions, etc. You name it, this thing probably does it. It's truly a life saver and it's very much worth every penny. I wish I had purchased one sooner!!

Title: Not good for multiple users on same account
Body: I have two children with dots, my wife and I each have a dot and we have a plus at a vacation home.  App only allows two accounts (Prime).  Teens and children can not have separate Echo accounts.  So all the devices connected to my account are limited.  For instance, only one device can play a different Spotify tune at a time.  So if I am playing a song and they want a different song, mine will turn off.  I can't use guard (the security system) on just the Echo at my vacation home.  I spent over three house with tech support and the only answer was to set up my kids with their own Prime account (that I have to pay monthly and they would lose access to our audible account).  I guess it works well if you want them all to do the same thing.  It also messed up audio button on my iPhone, for which tech had no idea how to fix.

Title: for the money
Body: it is the shiz. do NOT think that it does stuff on its own, you will still need to buy into the alexis eco system, but it the starting point and get one for every major room so you dont have to shout. I got three for a relatively small house and it has saved me tons of money. I combine it with the smartlife eco system (plugs, lights and such) and it has been amazing. Look, for the price (i believe like 30 bucks) this device has been a steal and a life changer. BUT AGAIN, DO NOT THINK IT IS A STANDALONE DEVICE, YOU HAVE TO BUY LOTS OF "SMART" STUFF.

Title: Pretty cook
Body: I got a bunch of dots for Xmas and initially I was disappointed. Sometimes it would respond great. Other times it couldn_ understand me. A few trouble calls with amazon and nothing was working. Finally started paying attention to what was happening when she wasn_ responding and it wasn_ Alexa_ fault at all. My internet provider really sucks. Made them repair the cable/internet line and now my upload speeds are what I pay for and Alexa works great. Alexa can_ respond to commands that don_ get uploaded.Now she and I are very happy together. My family uses drop in so no more screaming across the house when the kids needs to do their chores. I just drop in and say _ooper scoop.I still don_ know all the things she can do but am looking forward to learning them

Title: Easy to set up and easy to use.
Body: This is my first Alexa product, and it_ fun!  I was able to set it up, and have it playing music in 5 minutes (maybe 4 minutes, lol).  In the four hours that i_e been using Dot she_ recognized every command, and performed flawlessly.  Time will tell whether or not she_l perform as well as my initial interactions, but as a semi tech-savvy person my estimation is that I_l have more of these little babies, and will eventually upgrade to paired speakers and other Alexa products.

Title: Stupid
Body: Love all the echo loving reviews.  The truth is, its a dumb box.  If that works for you, great.  Just not there, and to imply its better than that, is a lie.  Its okay.  I find myself repeating myself a lot.  Plus, I'm already sick of, "can you repeat that", "I don't understand that".  Yes, I repeat and I do the exact same way, and magic...it works.  NOT THERE.  When it works cool.  FYI, only use this for music and, some timers.  The main problem does seem to be music request.

Title: Best Smart Device I Ever Had
Body: I had bought these for others who loved them but I didn't get one for myself until now and I don't know why I waited so long. I have several smart items and the Echo Dot with Alexa has made it easy to get them all connected and working together in one place. Plus the Dot is great for setting timers & reminders and providing a wealth of information quickly and concisely. And I can also do all of this from my Samsung cell phone. As you can tell, I highly recommend the Echo Dot.

Title: Works as I hoped it would
Body: I bought this to put in the living room so we no longer have to yell into the kitchen to communicate with Alexa. We've also started using it, in combination with other Alexa speakers and the Echo Input, to play music all over the house. There is no lag with the Alexa "music everywhere" option, which solved the problem I was having trying to use bluetooth to broadcast music everywhere.. The Echo Dot sound quality is quite good for such a small speaker, and perfect in combination with our other speakers.

Title: Alexa echo dot 3rd grneration
Body: I like that with a simple small device you can automate your entire house. You just have to buy the compatible extra devices for that to make the connections between what you want to make to work. But the Alex itself has already many functions, says weather, reminders, calendar, news, music, etc. I bought for my husband and at the beginning he didn_ seem to like but now he_ enjoying  a lot! You need to have Wi Fi for all the devices work with the Alexa.

Title: A great device which needs improvement
Body: I have 4 of these devices around my home.  Some are more sensitive to sound than others, you must be connected to the internet to use things like sleep sounds, and there's still no search capability.  That being said, I love this device for its convenience, capabilities, and potential.  I do recommend one of these for people who are blind, it was instrumental in assisting my former boss in many different things.  As far as the whole "its always listening" thing, we don't say anything at home that would interest anyone at all.  Why would they care if I'm making truffles for Christmas, or what music I listen to?  If you make an effort to stay away from trouble, trouble doesn't find you.

Title: Works awesome, big help to me, good company
Body: I love everything about this.  I'm elderly and alexa is good and useful companion.  She is clear and easy to understand  She answers all my questions and always sets the alarm perfectly.  i don't know what else to say, I love it and it is well worth the money.  I would recommend it to anyone of any age.  I got the easy set up from Amazon, all I did was take it out of the box and plug it in, that's all!  I didnt even have to set the time, she did everything.  Hats off to Amazon for an awesome and useful tech product.  Thank you Amazon!

Title: What time is it
Body: I have enjoyed the echo dot so much. I wake up during the night and just have to ask "Alexa what  time is it" and she tells me.  I dont have to look for my phone to see the time.. I just ask.It was my great grand daughter's birthday..I said "Alexa sing happy birthday to (name)" she sang it to her and she even got dogs to bark Happy Birthday song to her... My great granddaughter was so happy.. she is 3 and now she wants me to ask Alexa to sing all the time.. ________ if Alexa doesnt know the answer she will tell you she doesn't know the answer..

Title: Works great for music, but spoken word is too bass heavy
Body: I have a bunch of 2nd gen echo dots. While this 3rd gen does have overall better sound for music, I believe it_ at the expense of everything else that_ not music. It seems a bit bass heavy, which for the spoken word isn_ that good. So when Alexa responds to you, it doesn_ sound as clear as can be. I believe the 2 gen echos do a better job at non-music sounds, which is what I mostly use Alexa for.If you don_ listen to music on your Alexa device, the 2nd generation echo dots are a bit clearer and cheaper.

Title: Not happy!
Body: Alexa keeps turning off. I say Alexa play holiday music, she plays a couple of songs then turns off. Another instance was we were listening to music and there were weird sounds then she stopped playing.  She wouldn_ turn back on with awake words so I had to unplug it a few times. Another time we were listening to music and the music started to get louder and softer by itself. Not impressed, got it for free thank goodness.

Title: What more needs to be said.
Body: It's and echo dot and performs as it should. My biggest surprise was how much my wife liked it. She is one who doesn't really like high tech much, but she loves having the ability to command music on demand. It's connected to her portable bluetooth speaker so she can carry it throughout the house. I also purchased two Wyze smart plugs so now she can control her xmas lights by voice as well. Happy wife, happy life. Thanks Alexa.

Title: It comes in pink!!!!!_
Body: Yes yes and YES!!! Amazon has done it again! I purchased in pink for my daughter who is 11. It is a Christmas gift and I cant wait for her to open it. I mainly bought it so she can set timers when doing her reading assignments, listen to music with our Amazon music subscription,  ask whatever homework questions she might have and so on. This thing is AMAZING! Can't wait till she opens it!

Title: Can add to shopping list in seconds.
Body: I can add things to my shopping list at anytime and anywhere.  I also ask what the weather is like before I get out of bed every morning and I can get the scores for ball games that I missed.I also can add things to my To-Do list at anytime before it slips my mind.Have Alexa paired with my phone and have an alarm clock, calendar, information source at my fingertips all the time.Alexa is my girl Friday, Saturday, Sunday, Monday, Tuesday..........

Title: Wouldn't work as stereo or group
Body: I purchased 3 dots with the intention of having coordinated music in multiple rooms with one command. I have been able to frustratingly unable to group them for that purpose. It appears to be simple using the app, but when I select one dot, the other becomes unavailable in the list at that instant.  Same network. Unable to make that work, I tried setting up two dots in one room for stereo. Same frustration. Any help would be appreciated.

Title: Size of unit
Body: I bought this Echo Dot to place in another room in our house.  We already have a full size Echo we use in my office.  I like the small size of the Dot.  The sound quality is good, though not as good as the full size Echo.  Voice recognition is good.  The only problem I have had is WiFi signal being weak at times rendering the Dot to being a paper weight.  That only occurred when we first purchased the device.

Title: WORKS GREAT
Body: I THOUGHT THE DOTS WERE LARGER IN DIAMETER BUT FOR WHAT IT IS IT LOOKS AND SOUNDS VERY GOOD. I ACTUALLY LIKE THE DESIGN AND THE PETITE SIZE IT IS. NO ISSUES WITH IT AT ALL. IF YOU DONT HAVE ONE OU SHOULD REALLY TRY IT. I USE TO USE YOU TUBE FOR RELAXING MUSIC TO HELP ME FALL TO SLEEP BUT NOW THE VIDEOS STOP PLAYING AFTER ABOUT 20 MIN SO I GOT THIS AND BY VOICE YOU CAN INSTRUCT ALEXA TO PLAY AS MANY HOURS AS YOU WANT. AND AN AWESOME ALARM CLOCK AS WELL.

Title: I was a complete skeptic, paranoid, non believer...
Body: When I first got it, She wouldn't do anything, you do have to use the app and go in and build her "personality". For the first couple of days I thought I was going to return it. Then I sat down with Alexa and the app and spent about 30 minutes going through all the functions and options.I am 47 years old, was diagnosed with a morbid case of diabetes when I was 45 and have been horrible about taking my insulin and checking my blood sugar on a consistent time line, which is crucial. So, I set reminders in Alexa to tell me "its time to test your BG", It is time for your short acting insulin (3 times a day) and at 11pm she reminds me to take my long acting insulin and Lisinipro for the evening.  Because of Alexa reminding me, I have gotten my A1C down from 9 to 6.5. That is an invaluable feature for me.Then, one day, I had a song in my head and just said, "Alexa, play "Like a stone" by Chris Cornell. And bam, she plays it. I do have the Amazon music subscription which I think you need in order for this to work but I have not been able to think of a song or artist that she cant find and play within seconds. My Chocolate lab "Copper" loves the song "Baby Shark" so I set a "routine" and all I have to say is "Alexa, what does Copper like?" and she jams Baby Shark for him while he bucks around the living room having a blast.I have been playing Trivia battle every single day. She makes lists for me so I don't forget things I need for work. She sets reminders for me so I don't forget appointments and other important things. You can say "Alexa, set a reminder on March 15th that my brothers birthday is tomorrow, or a week from now, or, whatever you need.I learn something new that she does every day and went from one of those paranoid skeptics to a total believer. In fact, I got a second one for the living room and have them linked. She will read E-books to me while I work. I am a history buff and I can say, Alexa, tell me about Abraham Lincoln, and she will go on and on with just about any historical question or figure. She does math, she tells me what my weather is like currently and what it is going to be like through out the day.Honestly, I love this device, I have a white one and a black one, one is called Alexa and one is called Lexi (so you can drop in from room to room with music or conversation) Just the improvement in my health with the reminders she gives me has been a life saver, not to mention I don't forget things anymore because when I think of it, Ill set a reminder and Alexa and Lexi take care of it.I know a lot of people think "oh, that thing records everything you say all day and it is an invasion of privacy" well, that is incorrect because you can turn it off (red ring) and really so what if she listens to what me and my wife talk about... IF she is, all she hears is what we are thinking about eating for dinner, what's on Netflix or Amazon Prime video and us playing with our dog.I cant recommend this device enough, when I leave the house, I say "Alexa, we are leaving" and she has particular parameters that she listens for (breaking glass, doors getting smashed in) when we get home I say, Alexa, we are home and she says "Okay, I will stop guarding the house for now.Get one and try it, you wont be sorry.

Title: Works well, I was able to "lose" my clock.
Body: Between several chargers (for phone, tablets, watch, etc.) and the items that go on the chargers, I also had a clock and a dot (2nd gen) on my nightstand. I figured getting this dot would allow me to get rid of my clock. I am a little worried about an alarm not going off if we lose internet, but truly we almost never use alarms and when we do, we usually wake up just prior to the alarm going off anyway. So I have only used the alarm once, and turned it off prior to it even going off anyway. So I also don't really know how well the snooze option works, but assume it would be fine. The brightness of the display is nice, very visible during the day but at night (bright and dark times, not really night or day) it lowers it's brightness nicely and is not too bright. So, so far it is working well as far as the clock part goes. As far as comparing the gen 3 versus the older gen 2, I would say first off, I am not audiophile, far from it, but compared to the gen 2 dot (not echo) the gen 3 seems to offer not only louder volumes, but also clearer and crispier audio, not that I would only buy it for that, but some might. The only thing I wished for, was that it came in more than one color, I would have preferred black, like just about everything else on my nightstand, the color is not bad, it just sticks out more because everything else is darker on my nightstand. Maybe the clock part wouldn't work as well with a darker color, not sure, but on that note, the clock is very easy to read from across the room, so no problems there.

Title: Decent, great for the price...
Body: So I finally broke down and entered the world of _mart speakers. Got tired of the wiring mess with my 5.1 system. Having to try to integrate a surround system with a Firetv Stick. Have 3 different remotes to run all and have the wife keep up and use it all confidently.I purchased 3 of these and an echo sub. I tied two with the echo sub and a 4K Firetv Stick. _heater.Setup was actually pretty easy. Had it all up and going in about 15 minutes once the speakers had updated to the latest firmware.Sound wasn_ too bad......but it was not what I needed for my main TV watching area. The sub helped tremendously but the system sounded well, just not what I wanted. I also purchased two echo 3rd gen speakers and WOW! Much better. (Reviewed under those speakers).I did however, order 3 more of the dots as well (6 total). I installed one in our master bathroom, master bedroom, garage and 40_50 building. For listening to music in the background they work pretty well. Setup is a breeze. I have 3 different _roups.As far as sound, I will say they aren_ terrible. Much better than a couple of other blue tooth speakers I have. Obviously the small size limits the bass, but they will fill an area for listening. There is no comparison to the echo 3rd gen or echo plus but common sense should tell anyone that.They_e great for certain situations and places. For the price (on sale at $19-$22 ea.) they_e pretty good. Not sur if I_l buy more of these or just wait for the echo 3rd gen_ to go back on sale and buy those.Still......NOT BAD little speakers!

Title: Good interface with Alexa ....
Body: I luv these echo dots. I have one at the house and I luv it so much, I got another one for the weekend house.  It's a bit tricky to configure the wifi smart plugs to turn on the light with the same name (ie kitchen light) at different locations.  However, this is an "Alexa" issue and not the echo dotdevice sincee it has the geo-location capability.The echo dot devices themselves work well.  I placed the device in the dinning room since it is central to all the spaces in a small house.  I can give Alexa commands from anywhere in the house with this setup.I used the echo dots to turn on the lights in different rooms, the night light in the bathroom, or the LEDs on the Christmas tree.  I also tell Alexa to set the temperature on the wifi enabled thermostats to turn on/off the heat.I don't have any electronics or clocks in the bedroom, I just ask Alexa for the time when I woke up in the middle of the night.  Some people may find this creepy since Alexa is constantly listening for commands.  I am OK with her.One command I use a lot is the timer.  I cook and do tons of task at the same time so I use Alexa to remind me of things.  I also ask Alexa to play Christmas music since the speaker in the echo dot is pretty good.The echo dot device is a good interface with Alexa to do things in a "smart" house.  The microphone and speaker are good quality.  The low profile and small size make it less  intrusive although Alexa is constantly listening.I always inform my guests of the device when I have visitors.  If the guests are uncomfortable with Alexa constantly listening, I simply unplug the device.  The "constantly listen" creepy factor can easily solved by legislation.For those Alexa haters, don't get these wonderful echo dot devices.  You can continue to gather firewoods to burn in your cave to keep warm at night, or you can tell Alexa to set the temperature to 75 degree in your comfortable house.  Your choice!

Title: Pretty much useless going to try echo plus
Body: I bought a 55' amazon fire TV and an amazon echo dot for my wife who is paralyzed it simply doesn't work 50% of the time sometime's it will turn the volume up but not down sometimes it will turn the volume down but not up most of the time alexa just says fire TV dosn't support that but it dose because it works sometimes alexa won't turn the TV on or off at all Most of the time alexa won't switch the TV inputs for some reason a lot of the time I'll give alexa a TV comand and she'll turn on my Xbox iv gone through the alexa app were it lists what you said to alexa and what she did in response and you pick if alexa responded correctly alexa is supposed to learn from this but she doesn't and the alexa app rarely lists the commands she got right so basically Alexa has been pretty much worthless except for setting alarms, timers & turning my Xbox on & off which I have on a shelf out of reach it should be noted that a Amazon echo dot cost about $25 where a Amazon echo plus with built in hub cost $150 a big difference in price and probably a big difference in quality so I'm going to bite the bullet and try the echo plus I wouldn't bother normally but like I said my wife is paralyzed and if Alexa worked as advertised it would change her life a lot O and don't bother trying to make phone calls with Alexa she'll make the call but you can't hear the other person talking and the receiver only hears bits & pieces

Title: Not sure what I'm reviewing here
Body: I mean, 5 stars on the Dot.  Let's say 2 stars for Alexa and the software.  I bought this primarily as an alarm clock to replace my 10yr old Motorola droid :)  Alexa OS alarms give you 3 recurring options and 3 options only.  Every Day, Weekdays, Weekends.  So if you have a flexible sleep schedule you're screwed.  You can say "Alexa cancel today's alarm" and that works, but if you aren't 100% sure if you maybe canceled a different day there is no way to tell.  If you ask "Alexa, when is my next alarm" the answer will always be "You have a weekday alarm set for 5:15am"  I plan on complaining about that officially but who knows if they'll care or implement it.  Using the phone app to check on your alarm gives you no more information than Alexa herself did.  If you don't currently use Alexa at all, keep in mind she's dumb as a pile of bricks.  Google is a lot smarter and I'll assume Siri is too.All that said, I like the clock just fine and have no plan to return it.  I like being able to ask her what time it is, when my cat is in his usual spot on my bed...with his butt between me and her.

Title: My new alarm clock!
Body: I had been using the Echo Spot (now discontinued?) as an alarm clock for a little less than a year when the screen begin flickering on me. Luckily, Amazon gave me the option to exchange for a new Alexa device and I chose this Echo Dot w/ Clock as my replacement. I've been using it for couple of weeks now and notice a big different in the audio quality of the Dot over the older generation's Spot. The sound is much clearer. Responds to command with no issues. Some people complaint that the clock face is a bit too bright and is non-adjustable. I do wish it were adjustable but luckily I don't find it disturbing my sleep at all --- it's not too bright, but would definitely be "bright" for sensitive sleepers.Edit: Right after I posted my review, I went into my Alexa app and found out that I can actually adjust the brightness of the clock display. I had it on adaptive setting; no wonder I didn_ find it bother me at night! This makes this device even better!

Title: Amazing to have with Alexa. Even worth the money just as a bluetooth speaker honestly.
Body: This thing is awesome. If you can get past the idea of something listening at all times (I'll admit it is an odd thing) this is so cool to have for so cheap.Very rarely has it ever misunderstood us or not known what to do. Any music/channel available on Amazon Music can just be asked to play and it will. Pandora account channels can also be played from. The sound quality is better than literally ANY bluetooth speaker you can get for this cheap (yes it is also a bluetooth speaker).Alexa is pretty sweet to have in your house. The Dot will have a yellow ring on it for notifications so when you notice you just say "Alexa play notifications" and they can be anything from Amazon Shopping stuff to you or any friend setting up a notification for you. When I need to remember something I just say something like "Alexa remind me to bring in the garbage cans in 30 minutes" and it will beep, say it, and show a notification on your phone.People in the house, or even away from the house, can call in to the dot, or dots in other rooms can act like an intercom to other dots.I also did some smart home automation. It came with the outlet, and I added a DC switch, water main valve servo, and flood sensor. My water main will shutoff if there is a flood, and I can just tell Alexa to turn the Christmas tree on/off. There are skills for Alexa that listen for break-ins and also ones that make it seem like you are home with sounds, talking, and turning things off/on randomly.If you want the smart home features make sure that whatever service the device you get uses has an Alexa Skill to link it up. If something says it needs a hub and doesnt mention direct Alexa connection DO NOT get that if you dont have that hub. I have a few things and just to give an example they use Kasa, eWeLink, and Smart Home which Alexa can link to those accounts and control them. What this means is you will have accounts for each of those apps and Alexa will go through the internet to control those with their accounts. (That is my understanding, so no control with no internet).I took a star off of Alexa Integration, because even though my devices show in the device list, they do not show in the create routine menu (place to make a series of things happen). I worked around this so far since the smart home apps usually have their own routine makers. This could be a deal breaker if you get the wrong devices as Alexa would be the only common account to try and utilize the devices in series, but it can't. (Maybe I just dont know how to fix it, but it isnt hurting me for now). Another workaround would be IFTTT (If This Then That) is a service (somewhat complicated to figure out) that allows linking various accounts and making routines. This is somewhat hit or miss though as companies need to pay for support and some may only check device statuses like once every 30min to save money.

Title: Not another useless gimmick
Body: Many times these devices come along and you really don't see anything really useful for it but when you are a severely disabled American Veteran as I am and if just walking around in your own home can be hazardous to your health, by setting up wifi sockets and wifi outlets which manage lights throughout your home then you can see how devices such as this is quite literally lifesaving. Many times I will get in bed while leaving the bathroom or hallway light on but by putting these wifi devices in these areas I can then ask Alexa to turn them on and off, also depending on which wifi light socket you get, you are able to set the brightness on a regular normal light bulb. When I get up in the morning I have Alexa to turn on the bathroom light, the living room lights and my smart tv, I can even use Alexa to set the volume on the television which is great considering how the volumes are different from each HDMI port. This is especially helpful if you lose your remote or don't feel like walking to get it if you had placed away from yourself. Depending on the wifi device you get to set it up can be easy to tricky. I would strongly advise anyone who is having problems setting up their wifi devices to go to YouTube and search for a similar device if not the same one.

Title: Love Alexa, but...a couple of things
Body: In general, Alexa (echo dot) seems to be working well, and I love the music.  It's not loud enough to carry throughout the house (not a problem) but is great in the room where you are. I requested a couple of pieces which would force me to buy Amazon Music at some $$ per month as they weren't available in the basic library, I was disappointed by that.  But the worst thing is that halfway through Messiah yesterday, the music started to stutter and Alexa hung up and was unresponsive.  I unplugged her, and plugged her back in, and everything was fine except I didn't get to hear the rest of Messiah.  The great thing was I discovered I could play the local NPR radio station.  So I haven't yet tested the "drop in" feature which is one of the reasons I bought multiple echo dots, hopefully it will work.  In general, I love the echo dot.

Title: Awesome little voice recognition speaker. Great for playing music, checking the news and weather etc
Body: I recently gave my echo dot 2nd gen to my daughter and she uses it to listen to music and play games in her room, I was going to buy another 2nd gen one to keep in my kitchen but I started reading the reviews on this one and decided to take a chance on this one instead. I made the purchase and just opened it for Christmas. Ever since I took it out of the box everything has been a breeze. Setup was so easy because it automatically synced with my account making it to where I didn_ have to use the app or anything. In fact, I like it sooo much I just ordered a second one for my bedroom!! Sometimes she has a hard time hearing me and recognizing what i say but I  Love Amazon products and devices and have never had an issue with anything.

Title: Largely an entertaining device.
Body: I got this as an experiment.  I have been using the google equivalent and wanted to compare. They are very similar in a lot of ways. I found that there are more entertainment options on this device. What do I mean by entertainment? Games you can play, a celebrity voice, integration with Audible, and the like. I particularly enjoyed the Starfinder game which is a choose your own adventure style audio RPG.It controls the same sort of smart devices as the Google version. The build quality is really nice and the audio coming out of it is loud and clear. Where it falls behind is in voice recognition. I had to repeat myself a few times while using the device. I didn't have to repeat a whole lot, but enough that I noticed the difference. I will also say the level of information available from google is just greater so doing search was better there.All of that said, I think the Echo Dot is a good device and I would be comfortable with giving it to friends and family.  It is useful and fun.

Title: A lot of sound from a little package!
Body: This was given to me by Travelers Insurance Company to test an Agent Messenger Skill. Set up was confusing but that could have been brought on by me because I really didn't want to attach it to my personal Amazon account. I proceeded anyway having to download the App on my phone and visit the Amazon website. Once connected to our office Wi-Fi, the sound is incredible coming from such a small device. I'm not a big fan of being so connected and it attached to my personal Amazon account. Besides, who knows who's listening with these devices. Everything can be hacked these days! I really only use it to listen to a local radio station, so I'm not sure how much longer I'll keep it connected.

Title: Good for music, muffled speech hard to discern
Body: We liked our first generation Echo Dot, so when the newest one went on sale for $22 for Christmas we purchased one to get a "new and improved" model. Alexa's voice on the new one is best described as muffled, sometime to the point of being unintelligible. My wife is not at all happy with this. We never had this problem with our old one. Attempting to adjust the EQ in the Alexa app had no affect on this muffled speech problem and seemed to only change EQ parameters for playing music. By the way,  music does sound better on the 3rd generation DOT. Still, for a newer model that should be an improvement, Amazon took one step forward (music) and two steps back (voice) on the new Dot.

Title: Buy now!
Body: I love it so much I bought another one! It recognizes my voice from other rooms.  It's nice to be able to ask the time/weather/etc when I'm busy.The unit is small and unobtrusive. The sandstone one blends in nicely with any decor.  The sound is great; has some nice bass.  (We have a small Bose and the sound is as good if not better.)  The dots are set up to play music individually, or collectively.I'm saving my pennies to get some smart plugs to further integrate our home to the dot's  program.  We have one plug already; it turns the light off/on when we ask.Can't wait to learn more about it!

Title: Speaker improvement
Body: The speaker in this 3rd gen Echo Dot seems better than in my 2nd gen Echo dot which is a good thing because it often loses bluetooth connection with my Bose Soundlink Color Speaker.  Almost never a problem with my 2nd gen Dot.  The Bose announces it is connected but the Dot says it is having trouble connecting (even now) and on the app it is searching constantly.  So if I don't want to hear my expensive Amazon music through  my Bose speaker, then it is okay.  We have several Echos, Towers and Dots, and smart plugs throughout the house so I am not new to this game.  For the sale price I paid, it is just okay.

Title: Interesting "upgrade", but not 'better'
Body: In my opinion, the new 'dot' falls short on two fronts: 1) the original dot used USB type power adapter and cables. This allowed you to use longer or shorter cables and USB power hubs to great advantage. Now, it's a wall wat with a long cord and a barrel connection. A step back I think. Not great. And, 2) The audio was supposed to be improved... but it is more muffled and overall just not as solid.  It gets batter the louder you set the volume, but that is 't always the right effect. even with the audio controls built-in, the setting s are weak.  The Gen 2 is a better all-around unit.

Title: Small and powerful speaker!
Body: Great sound! Very easy set up and great music selection! Ask Alexa anything too. There_ a mute button for privacy also convenient to get the weather .. The only thing I was not crazy about is They tend to repeat the songs especially while I was using it during the Christmas season and also if I put on smooth jazz they play the same music over and over... wish Alexa had more of a selection of old fashion Christmas songs... I pay a monthly fee I think $4.95 a month for unlimited music it is well worth it however there are ways around this by downloading the app so I_ told.. will try it

Title: Love the Quality
Body: We've had a Dot forever but decided to upgrade to one with a clock.  I love this little Dot.  The sound quality is so improved and the Alexa App includes sound adjustments of the bass, treble, etc.  The light on the clock can be adjusted and there is a feature which allows the light to adjust automatically according to the ambient light.  When we ask for the current temperature, it is shown on the dial.  When our alarm goes off, we can either tell Alexa to snooze or stop or we can tap the top of the Dot.  This is a great unit.  We love it!

Title: Instructions would be nice.
Body: Even though I can build databases, I could not figure out how to set up this device without research! Once plugged in the unit says its ready for Set Up, but doesn't tell me how. The little folder of 'instructions' is not much better. I'm told to download the Alexa app, with no instructions of how to do that. I would have thought I'd be downloading the app onto the Echo device, but not so.  It seriously wouldn't have been so hard to tell us in the instructions to download the app onto a phone!  Many others have had the same trouble, as evidenced in the Q&A section of the product page.

Title: Very nice "hands-free" assistant and entertainment center
Body: Having seen Alexa in action in my daughter's kitchen, I was happy when this one arrived.  Thanks to pretty good set-up instructions, and very good technical support from Amazon's Alexa Support Center, I have been able to start enjoying Q&A about all kinds of "searches," as well as connections to our Smart Thermostat, and most recently, the blu-tooth enabled speaker (Oontz Angle 3) I bought, which significantly improved the sound quality.  Among other pleasures, Alexa integrates my Skype subscription, so that I can use voice-recognition to call anyone in my Skype contact list without lifting a finger, and take advantage of the Echo's (and Oontz's) speaker-phone capabilities.

Title: Worth every penny
Body: I held off on Alexa for a long time but finally decided to get one when Amazon was hosting their 99 cent deal with Amazon Music. I was really missing out on this thing. I use it for a lot already.I have it connected to turn my Xbox on, my office lights, control my smart outlets, etc. Feels great to come home sit in my chair to relax and ask Alexa to turn my stuff on, browse for my show, play it, dim the lights, etc.Best yet the speaker on this Echo is actually really good for music. It's not going to be as good as the bigger Alexa devices, but it's still superb. The volume goes very high.I'd recommend this in a heartbeat.

Title: Love this little device, why didn't I buy it sooner
Body: OK, I've been keeping my eye on this device but felt I didn't really need it.  But we wanted to listen to a couple of radio channels (including our local public radio station) that live stream in places we didn't have a radio.  AND, I love Audible books and wanted to listen to them before I fell asleep.  So when the 3rd gen and pre-Xmas specials came out I bought them.Very easy to set up, very nice sound and I've found more to uses it for.  I'm still searching for some nice relaxing apps to add to it.  One wave sounds were too noisy and had a notable click when it repeated in about 1 minute.  Ugh! Not relaxing.  I'm still considering whether to pair it with my new smart TV.  And, whether to take it with me on vacation.

Title: Great device, terrible Amazon streaming policies
Body: We love the speaker, but you cannot stream music from the same source on two different devices. So, with my 3 Alexa devices, I can only stream one song at a time from Amazon music (that pay extra for!). The only way around is is to set up SEPARATE music accounts for each device. Not worth it. I hope Amazon changes this because I know of a few  people who are switching to Google Home because of this. I have family members ghat received these for Christmas and they_e going to be frustrated when the first fights breakout between the kids and what music they stream.

Title: Privacy concern. Will not recommend
Body: Sounds IS GREAT... but the device not so. And I stopped using it, because found that it does not protect enough privacy. The app navigation is not transparent enough, and the default features enabled are tricky... unless you search for them, which you must know what you're looking for, this is privacy concerns. It will be great that on set up, it goes with the user on all the privacy features si that user is aware of what it allows. I found the current strategy to be misleading.Will not recommend .

Title: A handy companion
Body: The speaker has a pretty good sound quality until a certain volume to where it sounds like it could blow out. The voice recognition seems to work for the most part, but it will occasionally misinterpret some commands. I can_ tell you how many times I tried turning off my lights with a voice command only for it to turn my TV off instead. Which leads me to the next point, the integration. I was actually pretty surprised how hands-off a lot of the integration was save for providing some account access to Alexa via phone app, but from there I_e been able to do a lot. It has me excited about expanding the smart network at home and the different interactions the devices can have. The major downside to this is that it could start confusing certain commands with a different device and who knows what kind of awkward results can stem from there. What_ clear is that this technology is making great strides in making life more manageable and although it_ not perfect, it certainly works.

Title: The echo network works very well in our home
Body: We have an echo dot in each major room of our home.  This serves as a very effective intercom system plus all of Allexa's information services are available throughout the house.  We also have an Echo Connect device linked to our phone system so that we can place voice activated calls from any room in the house.  This could be very helpful if someone falls or has an emergency.  Unlike medic alert necklaces and wrist monitors this does not require that you ware something.  It works with just anyone's voice.

Title: All of Alexa in a tiny little package.
Body: We bought 3 echo dots during their 3 pack sale recently. While they may not have all the bells and whistles of their larger counterparts, you could definitely just have echo dots around your house and be comfortable and confident your getting a good Alexa experience. Our kids love to play games with her, and ask her questions, and jokes. We like to tell her good morning and get our fun fact for the day, then have her start reading us the news, it_ become a morning routine. It took a minute to realize I could attach more than 1 music application to her and call them out by name and she would differentiate between which I wanted her to play. She will even play a specific playlist on my Apple Music if I call out it_ name followed by _n Apple Music. Same with SiriusXM, call out the radio station. She does kind of struggle with my 5 yr olds voice, but my 5 yr old has an issue with articulation and any AI is going to struggle with that. I was initially going to put the stars down to 4 under voice recognition for that purpose but thought not to, because it_ not a design flaw, more a simple quirk in my small child that she needs to grow out of. I did want to write it in my review for those that might want to get something like this for an older family member that may have a medical issue and couldn_ articulate well because of a stroke or other reasons. Alexa seems to be adapting to her slowly, but she will probably grow out of this stage before Alexa adapts to her.

Title: Looks Great, Sounds muffled
Body: I purchased the Echo 3rd generation and upon connecting , I foiled the sound to be extremely bass heavy or muffled.  I contacted Amazon who duplicated my issue on their end with the same results. The equalizer in the Dot does not make much of a change except for raising the volume.  Amazon sent me a replacement Echo 3rd Gen unit but it had the same issues.Granted the new Echo is a lot more attractive than the original. The clock is an added plus. The ability to ask the new dot certain questions and have them performed is quite interesting. It will reset the EQ , adjust the EQ settings, set the brightness level and sound level just by using your voice.  Amazon explained it might be fixed in a future upgrade.All in all I_ ok with the unit.  Good luck

Title: Cool
Body: That was my kids favorite Christmas present. They don_ leave Alexa alone. Alexa doesn_ hace the best voice recognition and often understands completely wrong. I have things added on my. Art that they didn_ even ask ir said and I_ supervising. My teen is in love with this but she has trouble sometimes with Alexa understanding.Uf.
