And useful but also tricky to do settings.It has a good sound for tiny body but I could do way better. But for 25bucks is prefect.

Title: Echo Dot is AWESOME!!
Body: I love my Echo Dot!! I use it mostly for listening to music, but I like it so much that I bought 2 more !!  It sounds great! It_ easy to use and connect as long as you download the app. My kids do other things with it like jokes and games it_ really impressive what this little thing is capable of! It even seems to have learned the speech patterns of my youngest who is autistic and has speech issues! Alexa understands most of what he says now!

Title: I found tech support tobe very helpful and will take all the time needed to solve a problem.
Body: Setup is fairly easy, but since I'm pretty tech-unsavvy, it took two calls to tech support to finish the process.  That's an operator error issue that someone with more knowledge would not have.  The sound quality is excellent, I think rivaling more expensive sound systems.  I have connected two Smart Plugs to control living room lights.  I will add a second Dot in the basement so I can play my 60s mix there while my wife plays her Country songs upstairs.

Title: Secure?
Body: Hello all. I have and still hear and read horror stories about how voice prints and ongoing conversations are kept on servers and / or in the cloud. Still, I was given this product as a gift and find it really fun and easy to use and integrate with the small number of 'smart' devices I have at home. How secure it is? I have no idea and so far, have experienced no negative or 'scary' incidents described in the media. Lots of personalization to go and experiments to do with respect to functions or 'skills' as they call them.

Title: Some issues with it.
Body: When I bought this I spent hours trying to set it up. Finally gave up after it would not work. I then called Amazon and they spent a lot of time with me trying to get it to work. Finally they found the problem. The box was never open however the serial number is on bottom of box. Some registered this item and then returned it back to the store. So they had to un register it so I can get my name on in place, then I was able to proceed.  Another thing is if you like Elvis on xm, it will play channel  19 for a while then throw you in to another station.

Title: never thought Alexa and I would be friends
Body: I never thought I'd like this but I figure Google's looking in on me anyway no matter what I do. I like the fact that I can get radio stations in my house on a.m. that I can't get on other devices. Yes I can get them on my computer but I don't want to sit in my office. Also I'm starting to use the shopping list more frequently. It's really helpful instead of looking for scratch paper all the time. Great Christmas present from me to me

Title: So Disappointed
Body: I had not expected much from the maligned Flex and a lot from the Dot. I received the Flex first and was happily surprised, but very disappointed when I got the Dot. I have to almost holler for it to hear me and it sounds as if it responds with ALL bass, so you can't understand it. It may be great if you are getting it to add to your music sound system. I am going to contact Amazon and see if I got a defective one.

Title: AALEXA IS LIKE TALKING TO A PERSON, FANTASTIC AND INCREDIBLE
Body: I always heard about Alexa, and I was curious to see how it worked.  I ordered mine recently and I was so surprised on how Alexa sounds and recognized my voice.  It took me a while to install it, but it_ not that difficult.  I am glad I bought my Alexa, she even wake me up with music _ _ .  She sings for me and is always so cheerful.  I know I still have a lot to learn on how to use it.  I love _ Alexa_______

Title: Super nice for office_
Body: I bought this for the bed room but decided to use it in the office. It_ paired with my echo and is a perfect desk speaker with clock. Takes up minimal space. The clock dims with changes in light.  I am sure Alexa will be a great assistant when I go back to work next year _ I did buy another dot for the bed room. Both dots with the echo are a super little whole home stereo system with intercom!

Title: Terrific product, with some bumps in the road.
Body: Echo Dot is an unbelievable value at the price, and the simple instructions in the box got "Alexa" up and running in no time. After that, getting integrated with music-on-demand (and following up on Alexa's best offer for Amazon Music) became a chore. I imagine younger, more technically astute customers would have known that one has to use either paid unlimited Amazon Music music or paid Spotify (vs. the free versions). But, that being said, asking Alexa about the problem yielded nothing, and technical support told me my router might be bad (not the case). After searching online cleared things up, Alexa's original Amazon Music price offer for one device was hard to recover--and required a call to obtain--since other (higher) subscription prices run simultaneously. While Echo Dot is a terrific product, it could provide a little more basic support, along with more consistent pricing information about the music service.

Title: Amazing
Body: Omg I just love it, and so does everyone else in my house including my 3 year old niece who is constantly telling Alexa to play baby shark lol. I will be buying more for other rooms in the house. On some reviews I seen the speaker wasn_ loud enough I don_ see how it isn_. The sound is perfect. I have her in my kitchen and she can hear me all the way in my Livingroom and I can hear just fine

Title: Impressed.
Body: I have the google home mini already and had no intentions of buying anything alexa related until this was gifted to us through sirius radio subscription service. I have since decided to do away with my google home and replace it with everthing amazon alexa related. I love it. The voice recognition is superb in comparison with the Home and Alexas capabilities far exceed what I was even aware any A.I. in the home could do. Impressed and certainly happy with this little device.

Title: Love it!
Body: I_ very impressed with the dot. I have one of the _ther  brand as well and much prefer this one. Clear sound. Good voice recognition. Only complaint is all the _lerts it has for me. It gives me Lots of recommendations on how to use it. But I can see how some people would find it more helpful than annoying. Very small complaint. Overall a great purchase!

Title: has times when it keeps searching for voice
Body: Sound is good, good interaction.  I have already had to reboot it several times by unplugging it and resetting it.  At one point it wouldn't stop searching for my voice and the light ring kept going on and off. A simple power reboot didn't work and I left it unplugged for over 24 hours before it would work properly. I'm not sure if I am going to keep it.

Title: Decent, mild problems.
Body: I switched this one over to recognize _cho. I didn_ want to be triggering my other dot. I found that it does not recognize Echo as well as Alexa. I would have to ask Two or three times before it finally did what I asked. I switched it back to Alexa and it_ working better but I swear my gen 2 echo dot is way better and far more consistent.

Title: Nice little echo
Body: I like the clock feature.  It helps declutter the nightstand.  The clock light dims when you turn out the lights so you don't have a bright light blaring at you.  The sound is better than on the 2nd generation dot.  If you want real good sound you will need to connect it to better speaker.  It does all the features of all the echoes

Title: The Good and the Bad
Body: I purchase this Dot (and 2 more) for my kids room so they could each listen to their own music, this is where the Bad comes in.  They are not able to listen to different music on our Amazon Prime Music account, only one device can in  control or the Music on Amazon Music. Unless I want to create them all separate Amazon accounts, which then I will need to manage and then invite them to the Amazon Unlimited Family Plan, which as you can guess cost an extra $149 a year.  Kind of a rip off if you ask me.Now that being said, here are some good things...They can each listen to different iHeart radio stations and/or Spottify account.I can now sync them all together and play the SAME song through out the house pretty easily.The sound out of just a little device is great for the size.I purchased them on a Black Friday deal and they came with smart plugs.So, Amazon, time to give back and allow people to stream different music from our Prime Music accounts  on different Amazon devices (dots, echos, shows) without gouging us for more money.Other than that, I like them.

Title: Great Product !!!!!
Body: You had my expectations about echo dot and Alexa, so far they were all overcome.A robust and excellent quality manufacturing equipment, to be one of the basic equipment its sound quality when playing music in a room or dining room of regular space is heard excellent, and if we add the equalization function available in the app you can achieve Interesting improvements in the quality of audio reproduction.Pro:-. The interactions, speech recognition and the text to speech engine are incredible.-. The generation of routines integrated with Skill, helps to reduce several functions or interactions in a simple command.-. Excellent Audio Quality-. Integrations with Online Music Services.-. Accesible price.-. Simple integration with electronic equipment.Cons:-. The maintenance or development of skill is very poor.-. Many available Skill do not work properly.-. The skills available or to be developed must support at least two languages _(English / Spanish).-. It does not support some way of working offline, in case of connection failure to the internet.-. It does not yet have integration with messaging systems like WhatsApp, Telegram, etc.-. It does not yet have integrations with VOIP systems other than Skype.

Title: Better options may be available for you
Body: As a speaker it_ better than the old ones. But if your using this only to give voice commands may I suggest the new (cheaper) echo flex? This little thing plugs right in the outlet, and has no bulkyness to it, no cables and adaptors etc.If you are planning to use this as a (secondary) speaker, than sure its better than the flex, but terrible compared to bigger Echo_. I think with the arrival of the flex this actually became almost redundant in the Line up.If you are planning to connect this to your stereo with a 3.5mm jack, than yes that will work. And if your on a budget then it_ the best option for you.  But if you have more to spend then may I suggest you buy the Alexa Link, together with the flex? It has a much better DAC (Digital Audio Converter) and also the option to go out optically to a high end DAC. The big plus of the Link: you can switch between your tv audio, Alexa, and another output (I connected the google audio to it with an optical cable) all without ever having to switch channels on your amp. Love that feature. Really great advantage.

Title: 8yo has SO much fun with this, definitely recommend.  Very easy to set up.
Body: I really wasn't sure about this purchase, I didn't know much about these Alexa things and my 8yo had never even mentioned one for Christmas.  But I'm so very glad I bought it!  She has an absolute blast with this Echo Dot and it was definitely the hit of Christmas day after all the presents got opened.  I really thought there would be more to setting this up but it's very easy!  All you need is Wi-Fi, of course.  I downloaded the Alexa app and within minutes it was all set up.  My daughter figured out in minutes that it will actually play fart sounds, lol, go figure.  She kept saying this thing will do everything.  We even played kids trivia and it asks you how many players then goes around asking you all questions.  I can't believe this thing was only $25!!Edit:. I didn't know what the Smart Plug was for so I ordered it as well, then later learned it's so you can plug a light or something into it so you can tell Alexa to turn it off or on.  So, you definitely don't need it, unless you want that option.

Title: Awesome device
Body: This amazed me honestly. First I will say that had this not been on sale for a dollar (plus a month of amazon music) I wouldn_ have bought it. Once I got the Echo out of the box, it was set up in minutes. I have mine in the living room beside my Xbox One. I found the skill on Alexa_ app to be able to control the Xbox, which is super useful. I can play music to make the room more lively which is always nice. The sound quality is very good considering it_ such a small package. I don_ keep the volume up normally past 8 as it loses clarity, but it_ not a deal breaker. One cool feature I found out was that you can connect to external sound systems with a line-out connection which I will be doing soon. I will probably never use amazon music as I have Apple Music, but this is able to link to Apple Music. All in all I_ say this is more than well worth the price and especially with it being on sale. If it broke today I_ jump on amazon and have it replaced immediately.

Title: Life savior
Body: A characteristic treat of an autistic child mom is that we become a "broken record". We have to repeat the same routine time and tie again. Day after day. Only for the reminders option, Alexa is worth her price. Period.I don't really have many skills on her, I basically use her to control lights/smart plugs, music and our routine reminders.My main complaints about Alexa is that I would like her to be more "understanding". Sometimes you or the kid asks her something and you keep getting the "I don't have an answer for that" or "I don't understand" kind of answer and is a little bit annoying.Plus, I would like an option of English & Spanish (Spain) combo language, not Latin. Latin Spanish Alexa sure won't understand some commands. No offense intended but Latin & Spain has very different accents and vocabulary.

Title: Not always reliable with smart home and hub links
Body: It is not uncommon to have to repeat commands that require action with the smart home links such as outlets and light bulbs even though Alexa repeats back the command exactly as given but no action actually takes place.  Example: "Echo, turn on lights."  Alexa responds back with the same command content, but the lights do not come on.  I repeat the command again, and the lights come on.  Similar experience with the Harmony Hub commands that control my TV and Theater sound system.  I know my network is working with huge bandwidth (Gbit), but I cannot speak to how these device links work over the WIFI.  If they are actually communicating over the local network with each other, there would not be any excuse for this type of activity or lack thereof.  I can't speak to how the various devices (Harmony Hub, MajicHome, and KASA) communicate with the Echo Dot.

Title: Very good
Body: We do enjoy using our new Echo but her voice is very loud, we can turn up and down, but if you play music it not so loud, even when you say "alexa turn it up" or "alexa volumn 5" it sounds a bit muffled. We wanted to rename it but it didn't give us a choice other than; Alexa, Echo, Computer,.. but thats ok. And it does guard the house though we forget to tell it to most times. I am glad I bought it, it helps to keep my daughter on time with meds and teeth and school and all sorts of things, i can get weather anytime. I did notice though when i ask for it to play a certain musician it plays the same list every time.. and i have to ask her to skip music, when i told it i don't like a song it still plays it. But still a very good product!

Title: Wow!
Body: I can't believe Amazon was having a Facebook promotion for this item and guess what, I took up the offer.  The first thing I want to say is Alexa was so easy to set up.  You do have to download the Alexa app to run it but it's worth it.  I have set up an automatic weather update for every morning since I'm not a TV person.  It scares me some mornings because I forget it's set.  But I have not had any issues with it besides the voice recognition.  Sometimes, Alexa picks up the TV voices and says the most random things.  It also picks up other voices in the home that are not linked to it.  I'm guess Amazon is working on that but I do like it and would recommend it.  I will be ordering another one very soon.

Title: Sadly Disappointed with the Display
Body: This is my fourth Echo device, third Dot. I enjoy having Echos, using them, and find them really useful. But with the Echo Dot with clock, I feel like I was sold a bill of goods. I saw advertised that you could display time or temperature. I want to be able to have the temperature always displaying. The only time the temperature shows up, is when Alexa is telling me the weather, then it goes back to the clock. I have not found a way to display temperature as the default setting.On the plus side, the sound is a huge improvement over the second generation Dot. It is incredible how much better the sound is, but the size is only slightly larger.The engineers did a great job on that.

Title: huge learning curve. and needed family music plan
Body: we got 3 echo dots and 1 echo show for Christmas. huge learning curve. it took us two days to figure out how to let the kids listen to music in their rooms (make sure you turn on your explicit filter, parents). i had to make the kids scripts that told them "(alexa, computer, echo, amazon), play (song/artist/genre) from (amazon, tune in, i heart radio, spotify) on (specify name of echo dot in their room", because you can't play amazon on more than one echo at the same time, and we loooove music. so before you start your free trial, decide which trial you want, because you can only get one (family or unlimited). only with the family plan ($14.99/ month or $149/year) can you plan amazon on more than one echo at a time. today we ended up switching over to paying for a month of family, and will likely purchase an annual after that.

Title: Best small speaker ever!
Body: My parents have an Echo Dot 2nd generation and were not very happy with it's low volume and audio quality but I decided to order the Echo Dot 3rd generation due to the great bundles deal with Amazon Music Unlimited and I have to say I was so impressed I had to bring it to their house so they could see how amazing the new generation is! The audio quality is far superior to anything else this small and the volume is magnificent. I'd easily pay the retail price to get another so they can enjoy mine.

Title: Not bad
Body: Elexa answers question but if they are umm risky in anyway she just says something like . I don_ know that one. Anytime you ask to play music they will play free music but it_ not the exact song your always looking for but it is the artist. It always mentions to pay the $3.99 per month for Amazon music. Then you can play any song you like. At night time the light around it is always flashing which I do not like. It_ in my room and I have been unplugging it at night time but then I_ not able to see what it_ like for Alexa to wake me up to music. I bought two of them at $24.99 so for the price it_ a good buy. We_l see how it goes. I thought it_ be more fun but it_ ok.

Title: Convenient, simple set-up, good sound
Body: I_e resisted this long, but finally got first Amazon Echo Dot with Black Friday deals.  I_ only using a fraction of what it can do so far, but have found it to be so convenient, I bought 3 more for Kitchen, Living Room and Bathroom (1st one went in bedroom).  Love just being able to ask them to play whatever music I like or ask simple questions I would have grabbed the iPad to look up before.  Easy to set up and sync with bulbs and Amazon outlet to really make life more convenient.  Sound quality is better on larger model, but this is more than adequate, and great when multiple Dots synced to play as group and fill the house with music.  Wish I bought sooner.

Title: I'm a fan
Body: My husband has wanted this for a long time. I've been so against it . Now that it's here and I've read up on its features I love it! We now also have the Ring security camera.  That came with a Dot as well. Now we use it as a intercom. No more screaming around the house. I have a disability and now I feel more secure knowing I have Alexa should I need help .The downside is that everything runs through your homes wifi. If that goes down, nothing worksAlso, my 3 yr old granddaughter learned to say "Alexa play baby shark."Bottom line is, now I'm a fan and plan on adding more devices.

Title: Works well...but plug in, no USB. Liked Gen 2 better!
Body: Honestly I don't use my Echo to listen to music. I have some Yamaha's for that.  This "new" dot need 15w and a PLUG.  It doesn't sue USB so I can't plug it in where my others dots are (ie USb distribution at computer desk, USB charger on the coffee table, USB at Craft desk). I'd rather have more Mics and less speaker,...and USB powered.  I mostly use thew Echo to turn lights on and off, and control my environment.  I have a weird muscle disease, and occasionally have difficulty moving....and even paralysis.  Voice is the last to go...so I do LOVE the DOTS,  (7 of them).  Just my personal preference.  (FYI: Ask My Buddy...works)

Title: Alexa becomes almost a member of the family
Body: Alexa is always willing to provide outside temperature and time, both locally and other locations of interest.  She also serves as an excellent alarm clock and timer.  And, with appropriate smart plugs, will turn lights on or off when requested.  She also answers most question as a verbal encyclopedia as well as providing a vast library of music (with pretty good audible).  They can become so handy that you may find yourself with more than one in various locations around your home.  We now have five, and the dots are almost as good as the more expensive models.

Title: Good for what it is. You will want to upgrade right away.
Body: The sound quality is terrible compared to my other speakers. I have a cheap Philip's speaker and a cheap logitech that sound better than this thing.It works ok with Apple music, you need Amazon music for it to work properly.The Alexa feature is awesome though. We check the weather and news on it almost every day on it but, dont buy this to stream your music. I feel like music sounds very flat. My 20 dollar logitech x100 puck speaker blows it out of the water and it is 4 years old.Voice recognition is great on it.

Title: Love the dots.
Body: I now own 7 of these. I use them for whole house music and running smart devices (about 45 devices, including switches, locks sensors, thermostats). They are not Bose or Sonos quality, but they are a fraction of the cost. The software is still a little glitchy but it gets better as time passes. Definitely not a home entertainment system but if you want to play the same music in all your rooms and you have a bit of patience, this works for a fraction of the cost of the systems claiming to do the same. Not to mention, it has a lot of other cool features.

Title: Not what I was hoping for.
Body: I was hoping to replace my JBL flip travel speaker with this, but it doesn_ sound nearly as good.its only marginally better sounding that the version 2. The high end is muffled and indistinct.  it_ not much smaller than the jbl. Maybe it_ even larger with the dedicated power wart.  There_ no internal battery even though it_ heavy. I hate the nonstandard power connector and outsized wall wart. To top it off, there_ not even an aux in. I_l keep it and use it. But I can_ use it as my travel speaker. It was a real disappointment.

Title: If You Want To Play Music, This Is Fine
Body: But if you expect Alexa to do other things, disappointment awaits.  First, the voice is so muffled I can varely understand it in a quiet room.  Second, it will turn your lamps plugged into a wall socket on and off, but won't dim or brighten them.  You're stuck with whatever bulbs you've got in there.  Third, its weather reports are spotty and may or may not be accurate.  (It told me it was sunny this morning while rain came from a completely overcast sky.I think it has a way to go before it's truly useful.

Title: My favorite new gadget
Body: I love this echo dot.  Got it on sale for $24.99 and I've been telling everyone who doesn't have one to consider purchasing.  I bought smart plugs to pair with it to control my night stand lamp.  Works like a charm!  Can control the light when I'm not at home even with Alexa app.  Voice recognition is accurate, speaker quality is really good for such a small unit.  Love the alarm, routine and reminder set features.  User friendly and totally customizable.  Get one if you don't have one.  You'll love it!!!

Title: Great to replace that old alarm on the side table...
Body: I have multiple units in my home and as far as the quality I like this one best out my littles. I have a screen one in my kitchen and the sound is about the same .. I believe it's an echo show 5 I'm comparing this with on sound. This is the only one I got the voice recognition to work on. Its super easy to set up and I love the look also. This one went in my bedroom and has become a friend lmao news.. alarms.. music.. reminders.. shopping all from my bed with my eyes closed ..  she replaced so many other items.  The sound machine, radio & clock all free space now that my echo is here. Love it

Title: Amazing sound quality, sleek and easy to use!
Body: After what seemed like years of deliberating over purchasing an Alexa we decided to take the dive on Black Friday. The Echo and Dots we have throughout the house work far beyond our expectations. As music lovers, and parents with full hands-our favorite feature is being able to control and connect music throughout our home with just our voices. The sound quality and bass is much better than our expensive speakers, they_e sleek and incredibly easy to set up. Overall we are very impressed and happy with our purchase!

Title: Can_ trust it in my home!
Body: Suddenly, without warning and without setting up for anything but a single TV it turned itself on and blared (not exaggerating) very loud music. It did the same thing with various announcements I didn_ ask for... weather reports and utter nonsense! All of this happened when the unit was off and the light red. I ask it NOT to do such things but it wouldn_ listen. Finally I realized I couldn_ trust it... and that_ when I toss 25 bucks in the trash... tried to sell it but folks seemed to know having untrustworthy ears wasn_ wise.

Title: Great sound out of a small package
Body: This small echo dot with time display is great. We own an older echo dot but the sound of the new one blows it away. I couldn't believe how good the sound is out of such a small unit. Installation was a breeze...didn't have to set up anything having two other units in the house. I just opened my Alexa app and looked at it..didn't have to press any buttons. The Alexa app recognized the new unit and that was that. My son loves the alarm wake up features, particularly the Grand Tour guys.

Title: Alexa....fart!
Body: I used to think Google had the upper hand on their voice activated devices after using a family members then our older dot. However, Amazon is on point with this new dot. Can hear me from across our house and sometimes even in other rooms. And my 4 year old boy loves the fact that Alexa will fart on command(bet a lot of you didn't know that?!?!)and she will also give you the definition of flatulence after a few times, which was enlightening. Anyways, the voice recognition is great, features are great and the clock/timer on outside is awesome. Great buy!

Title: Good device, but buyer beware
Body: As someone who has owned an Echo for some time now, i can say that it is the most useful device you can have, it can make your life more convenient with its rich features that are available.But keep in mind, the echo dot and many more smart home devices essentially record and gather information about you ALL THE TIME. There is no turning off these functions as well, there should be no presumption of privacy. This might strike some as dramatic, but i have read the EULA, yes i did that, and it is a bleak future my friends. A future where we plug ourselves willingly into the machine. I am not naive, i know that privacy and security is an illusion....whelp.......yeah, its cool and all, and works really well with other smart home devices.

Title: Not as easy to use as I had hoped
Body: You really need to have a customer support phone number people can call for these things. So far, I've only bought three smart plug outlets to use it with, and I've had an enormous difficulty trying to schedule lights connected to the outlets to go off and on. and moving into a new home in January, and would love some more information on the type of devices I can buy for the home to work with these, such as dimmer switches, etc. It's fun to play with, and I really need to pair it with some Bluetooth speakers to make better use of the music choices that are available.

Title: Love it and have 7 total !!
Body: I was shocked that such a small speaker could be so loud. It_ just like having a small boom box. The skill you can add to it are fun for sure. If you add the unlimited music, then the music will play continuously or if you dont then it_l just a few songs and stop and then you_l have to restart it. All of mine get hung up from time to time and to reset it, you just unplug it. If you talk to it to fast and don_ wait a few seconds between commands, it_l get hung up and you_l have to unplug. The drop in feature is amazing ! I can listen or sou, however you want to call it _, to what_ going on in my house without having to actually call the house. You can also use the intercom feature to talk to someone on the other side of the house if you have another echo or use your phone to to call/drop in , to use as an intercom, instead of yelling and hoping someone hears you. I_e been able to sync my lights and plugs thru the app as well with no issue. I liked the first 2 so much that I went and bought 5 more. Can_ wait to add more smart stuff to smarten yo my home !!

Title: Not so impressed with 3rd gen
Body: still not knocking my socks off as three echoes the two other second gen but notice of the can work together when is Amazon going to get it together if I put a reminder on one it should be on all of them if I put an event on one it should go across all of them I should be able to be in my bedroom and talked to the echo in my living room and tell what to turn off its timer stuff like that still leaves a lot lacking in the echo

Title: Socks have been blown off!
Body: I bought a 1st gen Alexa, but didnt care for it and sold it. So this 3rd GEN Dot was very intriguing due to the fact you can set alarms, events, reminders and so forth. I love that Alexa tells you to enjoy your day or evening plus all the things you can ask her! It's great not having to grab my cell for the weather nor to adjust my Nest thermostat! Alexa can even play audio news headlines! I will never ever sell this one!

Title: She can set a timer go off as well.
Body: I love it! Only thing is if you ask her to okay a certain song. She can_ unless you have and account with amazon prime or amazon music. I mean u can listen to music for free. You just can_ choose a song. She also plays the radio stations which is awesome too. And she guards your home while gone if she hears broken glass it smoke alarm she will alert you on your phone app so say yes to notifications on amazon Alexa app.

Title: Works well, but WIFI settings are a complete mess
Body: Device works well and does what you want it to do, but configuring WIFI is a complete disaster and took me several hours.  All amazon devices get creative on WIFI settings, and my Echo Dot only wanted to connect to 5g networks from the access point farthest away from it (and through multiple concrete walls (which 5G signals dont travel through.  So i ended up having to make a new SSID that is only broadcast on my 2G network from the closest access point.  Then i had to add the Echo's MAC address to a blocked list for my main SSID (because even after connecting the Echo to the new SSID, it would default itself back to the main SSID - and there was no way to make only the echo device forget the main network.  This then got my connection up over 200 mb (vs Alexa's preferred network at 5mb).  After all that, i made sure to make the new SSID isolated from the rest of my network because who know why it wants to be on the other one so badly

Title: Glad we got it.
Body: I got this in a deal (pay for Amazon music for a month, get the dot for 99¢) and I'm so happy we did. Would I have bought it at the normal price? Nope. But for 99¢ when I already use Amazon music, it's worth it. My kids love it and we love sending "announcements" to Alexa from each of our phones. It helps because you can announce that your home from the store and have your kids come out to help unload. Lol

Title: Occasionally frustrating but incredibly convenient.
Body: Sound quality was surprisingly excellent, and the Alexa system is very convenient- especially for music and setting up alarms/notes. The voice recognition can get awfully annoying and the system has to sometimes be unplugged and plugged back in simply because it gets overwhelmed. It also can fail to hear you even if you're yelling (yet somehow hears me when I'm quiet in bed in the morning, eh..). So. it can be frustrating but honestly, the productivity it has helped me gain was soook worth it. However, I believe the price should stay the sale price ($25) instead of $50..

Title: LOVE THESE!! _
Body: I_e bought 5 of these, 3 for me and 2 for my brother. I have one in living room, kitchen and bedroom. They are great and I was amazed at the sound quality. I leave one in for my dog while I_ at work...it plays for like four hours I believe. I play sleep music at night for relaxation and it is wonderful! I have an alarm on my phone, but I also have Alexa wake me up just in case LOL.

Title: Beyond Frustrating
Body: Don_ buy a product from a company that is literally technology inept. Alexa doesn_ recognize commands or tries to up sell you into one of 10 services they offer all for additional fees, plays on other Alexa devices at random and if you are looking for kids FreeTime unlimited you better have a fire tablet or you will be paying full non-prime price vs the advertised $2.99 price for one kid. When you contact customer service they will then blame Apple when they are the one making the connection to Apple from their site. Hours on the phone with customer service, that at one time was top notch, now is miserable to deal with and no resolutions. Don_ waste your time buy a smart speaker from a company that builds great technology.

Title: Never knew I needed this
Body: We received an Echo Dot for free, with the purchase of a Fire TV, and that is the only reason we have one. We most likely would not have even considered buying one, because we didn't know anything about them, and don't like to spend money unnecessarily.  Having had one for about a month, we are now considering purchasing two others. It's nice to have a hands-free way to check time, or listen to music while doing dishes and have the ability to change the music (although it is frustrating that Alexa can only play Spotify playlists with the voice-control. I know I can play my playlists and specific songs via paired devices, it's just a little tedious sometimes.) Overall, I am pretty pleased with the Echo Dot.

Title: Must have!
Body: I bought this for myself and I loved having the news read to me every morning and the temperature the weekly forecast etc. I also liked asking Alexa to play random songs when I was just thinking of them. I ended up taking this into my six month olds room when her sound machine died and I have been asking Alexa to play White Noise for her naps and bedtime end it has stayed in her room ever since we love this item!

Title: Get one for every room in your house!
Body: If you_e sophisticated enough to read this review, I_ sure you_e familiar with _lexa and how these products work. If you_e not, When they go on sale, buy one for every room in your house. I don_ use mine to the full potential but I do play music or Audible throughout the house and use it to control lights and such. It reads my daily calendar in the morning when prompted and greets me with music and a light when I get home late. It_ probably better than your spouse.

Title: I dig these little speakers
Body: This is our 2nd one and I really haven_ been able to use it that much yet. I was disappointed that it was going to take 2 months and be $10 more for the echo with the clock. So we just went with this one. Our 1st one has a couple of glitches and I don_ know if this one does but from time to time music only plays one song at a time. I figured out if you unplug it and plug it back in, it seemed to fix.

Title: This is my first "Alexa" product
Body: Frankly, I am not asking much of it, but what I ask it to do, it does well. I only tell it to play NPR in the morning, the sound quality is great for that. It makes for a very easy to set alarm clock. I also use it to turn off the bedroom light after I have gone to bed.As I said, I am not asking much of it, but what I do ask it to do, it does well.

Title: Useful Fun Flexible and Flawed
Body: I purchased an Echo Dot for myself on Cyber Monday and received another one as an Xmas gift. I set them up at opposite ends of my house and created a multi-room user group for them. This gives me the flexibility to play each Dot separately or simultaneously depending on my activities and location. I use the Dots for news and weather updates and, of course, to play music from classical to classic rock. Last night I used my bedroom Dot to play sleep sounds and found the "fan" sound most helpful. Sometime during the night the Dot stopped playing the sleep sounds; I didn't notice because at that point I was indeed asleep.The sound quality of the Dot's speakers is surprisingly good although far short of audiophile quality. I use my old Harmon-Kardon Soundsticks with my living room Dot and have ordered an OontZ Angle 3 Ultra : Portable Bluetooth Speaker for my bedroom Dot.Despite my overall satisfaction with the Echo Dots I've experienced a few frustrations with music: 1) My Music list, composed of CDs I purchased on Amazon, contains only a fraction of the music I actually purchased since 1998; 2) My Music is not "folded into" Amazon Prime Music. If I want to play songs from My Music, I have to specify " play such-and-such on My Music" to Alexa; 3) If I request a song not available in Amazon Prime Music (I do not have Amazon Music Unlimited and have no intention of getting it; Prime is expensive enough), Alexa tries to upsell you to Amazon Music Unlimited every time and there's no apparent way to stop that or even interrupt Alexa during the upsell attempt; 4) When I try to play a song or artist on my FREE Spotify, Alexa plays a Spotify "station" based on that song or artist. For example, if I tell Alexa to play "Hotel California" by the Eagles on Spotify," Alexa plays a Hotel California station on Spotify that may or may not eventually play "Hotel California" or other songs by the Eagles. If I tell Alexa to play the Eagles on Spotify, Alexa plays an Eagles station on Spotify that may eventually play a song or two by the Eagles but will mostly play songs by other artists from the same general time period.Overall, the Echo Dot is lots of fun, can be useful depending on your preferences, and is great for music listening despite the flaws I listed.

Title: Trouble synching Dot with Ring Security System
Body: Let me first say that my Ring Security system is AWESOME!  I purchased the 14-pc kit plus several additional components from Amazon totaling roughly $420.00 because I have a very large house.  Installed the system and got it online perfectly without a hitch through the Ring App.  The progress suddenly came to a grinding halt when I downloaded the Amazon Alexa app that supposedly works to tie the Echo Dot to the Ring Account.  It does not.  In the Amazon Alexa App, you select 'menu, skills & games, magnifying glass, enter ring, then Enable to Use.'  This series of entries navigates you to the Ring Login screen where you enter your Ring account login information.  Upon hitting enter to log in, the screen just pops back to a blank login screen where you just keep re-entering the login information without success.  I was on the phone with Amazon tech support from 1030 a.m. to 1:37pm (no lie!!)  but they could not resolve the problem.  They transferred me back and forth asking me the same stupid troubleshooting questions over and over and over and over and over and over and over and over again. I finally gave up.  Planning to box up this Echo Dot and call it a day.  Hope this saves you some headache.  Ring Security is great, but the Echo Dot clearly does not work with it.  12/31/2019 - Update:  My Alexa / Ring login problem is now fixed!  One of the many CSRs I had spoken with previously suggested opening a ticket with the Amazon developers to see if they could get the two accounts to link.  Problem is solved and my Echo Dot is now working perfectly.

Title: Problems, problems, and more appear
Body: I've had more problems in a week with a Dot than in 2 years with Google Home. I bought one for myself and one for a friend. She keeps having to unplug/replug the Dot so that drop-in doesn't give me the message "XXX is not available." I had to restart mine to be able to make phone calls. The only reason I don't give it a single star is that the aux jack allows me to connect and stream music to me audio system, but even then Amazon limited the jack to miniplug rather than both that and TOSLINK. So far it's a stinker, and it's already on to 3rd gen.Each time I stream from an iPhone after a lull, Echo announces, _ow playing from iPhone. This can happen many times a day. It is idiotic and unnecessary. (Amazon support confirms that it works this way.)Many times when I say _ey, Google, the Echo wakes up and listens. This is an unacceptable privacy intrusion, and cause to question Amazon_ motives.Now when I ask what song is playing it responds by telling me it_ a great kitchen companion, blah, blah. Junk ads.Update: Right now, it is stuck in perpetually playing podcasts. I told it to play one, which it did, but now it keeps playing past episodes of the same podcast. It ignores my instructions to stop. Even if I use the phone app, it then plays two podcasts at once rather than ending the first. I_l have to unplug the device. This is one buggy product.

Title: Perfect for people trying to improve quality of their lives
Body: I am not paid to write reviews or anything. And if you check my account I don't write that many reviews. But this device has made my life easier. First, I love that I can set one alarm once, and I have to tell alexa to turn it off which helps me get out of bed because it wakes me up more than swiping the alarm off on my phone. I've been trying to wake up early and right away everyday. With my phone I always put it back down and went back to sleep. But with Alexa I must speak.2) I love that you can do it all literally even when your not near the device. Make shopping lists, grocery lists, schedules, etc. You don't have to remember any of it or write it down. Just say Alexa show me shopping list or schedule, etc. Alexa tells you what's on there. If you are not near your device you can access all of this on the app on your phone.3) I don't have any smart devices connected with it so I won't comment on how that works.4) You can have alexa start and end your day the way you want and on a happy note, by playing sounds, reading news ,etc. It works really well and helps get my day going.5) You can play music on there and its really loud and good quality which is surprising. I have been looking for a good speaker to play loud and good quality music. Bose is too expensive, beats suck, and I even bought a big one for $400, and its loud but the quality sucks. But this little speaker is loud and has good quality. For the price is sounds like a small Bose one.6) It feels sturdy and strong, not cheap and looks very nice on a desk. It will help you get your life together. Give it a try, and you won't be disappointed.

Title: Lame alternate names; Echo, Computer or Amazon. Should have more options.
Body: Amazing little doober! Lots of accessories to purchase to be able to do a lot though. The sound quality is GREAT! It can hear me from the other room. The ONLY annoying thing I_e found is that you can_ choose a summon name for your Dot device you can only pick, _lexa, Amazon, Echo or Computer and we have two dots (my daughters in her room and mine and my husbands in the kitchen). I_e got a small house, so when I_ in the kitchen and I say, _lexa play The Beatles and my daughters in her room playing the Hamilton Soundtrack, it cuts her music off and The Beatles start to play on both devices.So we had to rename ours and the available names SUCK! I feel ridiculous saying _cho do this or _omputer do this.... I can_ use Amazon because we say that too much in our home and it would constantly think we were talking to it and I can_ use Alexa because my daughters is called Alexa.There you have it.

Title: Enjoying this gadget overall
Body: I swore I'd never get one of these, but I am enjoying it. I mainly use it to listen to music.The search function isn't so great. I understand Google Assistant is much better, since Google is the search king. I tried to find the hours for the credit union in my hometown, but Alexa kept giving me the hours for credit unions near where I currently live. I kept asking repeatedly for the info I needed, and she did actually give me the hours one time but I didn't hear them correctly. I tried to get her to repeat them, and never succeeded.I wish the yellow notification light would never come on. I don't care about the stupid messages or notifications, and the unwanted light is so irritating. Alexa also lit up in the middle of the night with the green and blue light for no apparent reason. Fortunately it went off quickly.

Title: improved sound quality over previous generations, POOR integration with 3rd party music services
Body: I'm not sure if this is Pandora's fault, or Amazon's fault, but integration with Pandora is very poor. We mainly use this as a smart music device that also tells time and weather. Everything worked well when we had Amazon's unlimited echo streaming plan, and it normally picked the correct music, but canceled when we got a newer echo (this one) and someone in our household signed up for Pandora with family sharing. Since then, the experience has been mostly poor. Alexa rarely matches against the correct music (that I know exists on Pandora), and quite often plays offensive music, which is not good when it's mostly for my kids. For example, if you ask Alexa to play the Frozen II soundtrack (for the kids), it plays some random trash. Worse, I asked Alexa to play "Do You Want To Build A Snowman" for my daughter, and it keeps trying to play "Do You Want To Build A Snow Dick".  This last part likely isn't AMZ's fault, but Pandora doesn't have a cast to Alexa option anymore, so there's no way to get at the music that you actually want it to play without using the Echo as a bluetooth speaker... less than ideal... Alexa should just work regardless of service.I'm a big music fan, so I have hundreds of my albums uploaded to Google Music (Amazon's music locker service is long gone)... but unfortunately those are not available on my echo, because Amazon doesn't allow Google Music on their devices. Maybe they will add this one day, as they did with YouTube TV on the Fire devices.

Title: You need this.
Body: OK. I was a total "Why would I ever need an Alexa in my d*mn home?" Kinda person. But let me tell you! I love this girl. All of a sudden I have a lot of sh*t to ask. Like, "Alexa, what's the weather today?" "Alexa, what was the most famous soeech ever given?" I'm even ordering her to do tasks like, "Alexa, set my alarm to Elton John music at 7am tomorrow " or "Alexa, remind me to get dinner ready at 5pm on Sunday." Or "Alexa, bark like a dog." (The last one is to rile up my dumb dog who can't tell where it's coming from.) My kids are in on it to! They're all like, "Alexa, who was the first person on the moon?" And "Alexa, play the Frozen 2 Soundtrack (for the 100th time today." And "Alexa, make farting noises."She does it all. No questions asked.I can't wait to get a home where I can hook her up to all the lights and other things. It's gonna be great! I'm gonna purposefully walk outta the bathroom and sit on my sofa and say, "Alexa, turn off the bathroom light." And guess what that chick gonna do? That's right. That lights gonna be off.

Title: Still not ready for Prime Time.
Body: I have multiple echo dots. I love the functionality when they work. I control lights, timers, garage doors, and thermostat; however, they have a hard time hearing my wife and me. Old ones worked better for hearing commands.Many times, the closest one doesn't hear me, but the other room echo will respond. That's horrible. Even simple commands she gets wrong, when she finally does respond to me. I have a scenario called "activate" which turns on my cpap, light, and charger. Half the time when I say "activate", she gives me today's date.Amazon, please fix this issue. Make us heard. You are listening all the time, just answer me instead of responding randomly to my TV.

Title: Doesn_ pair well, don_ buy it!
Body: I bought two for my 87 year old mother for each part of the house. She has trouble with lamps, the remote, won_ use a life alert. I thought this to be a perfect solution. My mistake. I_ very technically savvy but this was a nightmare. Sitting next to it, Alexa can_ hear her. Spent almost 2 hours on the phone with support because it would not pick up the fire tv, they were useless. The only thing this is good for is turning the lamps off and on, I could have gone with another cheaper option just to do that. Waste of money, don_ buy it. Customer support was horrible and they gave no clue about their own products.

Title: Use The Link Account Option When Purchasing This......
Body: ......it will make the set up a breeze.  In the older generations of Dots, it had issues for me when setting them up.  This new generation with the linking to one's account option at purchase, takes away the potential nightmares of getting your network to recognize it.  All I had to do was plug it in, go into the Alexa app, making sure Bluetooth was on in my tablet, confirm the light ring was orange on top of the Dot and I was done connecting to it.  In the app I selected it and modified the settings to my likes.  Nice and easy.  Having existing Echo devices on my network made this a slam dunk.

Title: Vocal trouble
Body: Ok.  I was singing her praises, until she stopped playing my favorite artist, Kem.  So I figured there was another artist by the name of Kim.  So I spelled Lem out and she got it.  I had to do this several times and she would play my music.  I figured it was somehow stored that this is my preferred artist.  Fast forward to a power surge and now she only plays Kim.  Even when I say, _lexa, play K-E-M she plays Capital Jazz Lounge from Tune In.  Does that sound like Kem?  So I just play his CD on my CD player when I want to hear him, getting up to switch to the next CD.

Title: Great design
Body: We love the quality and appearance of this echo dot. The design is nice and fits well in our decor. The voice recognition is great, have no issues and is alexa integrated. The sound quality is superb. We have several dots in our home, one for each room in fact. Yes, even our bathrooms. We have our whole house set up with alexa to even turn our lights on and off. Overall, this product is a great buy, great quality and we highly recommend this product and we are looking forward to seeing what else comes out.

Title: The teenager loved it...
Body: It works just as you would expect, and it's quite entertaining when you ask it random questions.  The ONLY reason I gave it 4 stars is because you must have an adult/parent Amazon account to set it up.  Since we gave this as a gift to our "honorary" daughter (who's 13-1/2), and her mom doesn't have an Amazon account, we had to add her to our Amazon account.  While I understand the reasoning for this limitation, a buyer should be aware that this could cause a problem. However, I still HIGHLY RECOMMEND it.

Title: Love the clock & upgraded speaker
Body: I pre-ordered this Echo Dot (3rd gen) because of the clock feature. I have earlier generation Echo Dots in various places. It was totally worth upgrading not only for the clock but for the amazing sound. There is an extremely noticeable difference in the sound quality, especially music, between the Dot (2nd gen) and the Dot (3rd generation).I hope that all future generations will include clocks. It's definitely a space saver that makes having a clock radio unnecessary.

Title: Another addition to our Echo family
Body: I purchased this dot when it was on sale for $22. I mainly purchased it for my computer room. When I am in the computer room and the wife is in the kitchen, I cannot hear her talk to me (I have hearing problems). Now if she needs to talk to me, we can talk between the Echo devices like an intercom. That is just one benefit of the MANY that the Echo family has to offer. Set timers, weather, time of day, jokes, recipes, the list is endless on what these devices can do for you.

Title: Good but Mobile HotSpot doesn_ work...
Body: First Alexa product I_e bought.  It_ a pretty cool little thing.  My biggest problem is that I am unable to connect to my mobile hotspot.  I_e looked up many ways and the Alexa app does not have the same steps that I see in the instruction videos or amazon echo instructions!  Doesn_ make sense to me to have old instructions and newer app and it is very confusing.  The app does not have the wi-if update...you have to hit _hange and then hit your device then back to your phone settings to look for the Amazon wi-if connection and it isn_ there but if you skip tapping on your  device then  the Amazon wi-if connection shows up and then you go back to the app and you have no choice but to hit your device and it shows wi-if connections but you can not scroll down to the _se my hotspot then enter your hotspot information.  If anyone can help with the newest Alexa app please respond.  Otherwise for what I wanted to use this echo dot for I like it.

Title: My girl loves this- good transition into more responsibility with tech
Body: We gave it to her for Christmas. She can call us when we_e out or at the grocery store if she needs us, and she loves talking to it, listening to music, using music for an alarm. It makes her feel so grown up. We won_ give her a phone yet, so this a good way for her to call just a few people if she wants and it has great parental controls. Nice transition into some more responsibility with technology that can be used as leverage and a chance for her to prove herself.

Title: Lovvvvve My Dot
Body: I am in love with this Dot.  I was sick and tired of the old clock radio sitting on my night stand.  When I saw this Dot on Amazon with digital clock I KNEW it would be perfect!  I LOVE this little thing.  Love telling her to turn on and off my bedroom light, to tell me the weather, to wake me in the morning to specific music. The digital clock even dims and brightens with the light in the room!!  One of the best things I've bought myself this year!

Title: Alexa fulfills you_e request!
Body: Great device! Setting the device up is easy once you have internet. Great voice recognition, you can ask to do something from a certain distance and she completes your task. The app can help you navigate Alexa if you_e not sure, but I was able to learn to by just requesting or telling Alexa to do something. Alexa informs you off promotes and trials you can try. If Alexa  can_ play or give if formation you requested she will tell you this! Also sometimes sassy with answers lol! Plays your music, connects you with some of your other accounts like Spotify, gives you information you need if available, and gives you game options for family gatherings. Only issue was when asked to set an alarm, she set it but it never went off the few times I_e tried. Overall, a great device to have in your home!

Title: I am my own personality
Body: I love this little round ball of free personality with a mind of her own named Alexa. She is a blast to talk to and my grandkids can't wait to visit so they can aggravate her. She will answer any question you ask as long as she knows the answer to it. She will play any music you wan't to hear for you. You can get music subscriptions if you wan't them so you can stream all your favorite music singers. It's just a great thing to have next to the Apple Phone.

Title: Life changing little device
Body: I'm not up-to-date with this technology going on right now, so I'm not sure if the following is relevant.  I use the aux with my phone or pad to listen to music (with ads).  I read the weather and news on the same devices consuming precious minutes of my life messing with them.  BUT now, I just speak and I get answers when I'm doing whatever it is.  I can make calls when my phone is dead, check the weather play music with no ads.  This device has given me a piece of my life back.

Title: Love but won't connect to public Xfinity WIFI
Body: Love these but wanted to use this at work-- not on my employer WIFI but on my Xfinity WIFI. Even though I use my own credentials for Xfinity "public" WIFI, it will not connect to the Echo due to settings on the "public" WIFI. Booooo. so, to listen to music on it, i use it as a speaker connected to my phone which is on Xfinity and only ask Alexa questions as necessary, as she is connected to my employer WIFI. Hope I didn't confuse anyone ha

Title: Cool but not great sound.
Body: Kinda cool to get messages, make calls, listen to music, etc. but the downfall comes in the sound quality. Granted, I realize that it isn't a very big speaker and it also allows you to output to a different speaker system but as far the unit itself, sounds like any cheap Bluetooth speaker. Nothing special.You can adjust bass, treble, and mid-tone levels in the app to tailor it a bit but doesn't improve the filtered sound quality.

Title: Nice added features. Too bad she_ hard of hearing
Body: Way better speaker than gen1 and the clock is a nice touch. Sadly, Alexa can_ pick up voice commands if the speaker is playing at any volume above 4. Also can_ hear commands when the shower is running, even in a bathroom so small it only fits a 24 vanity. The google home Gen 1 was far superior in terms of voice pickup and recognition. Can_ have it all I guess...and the plug is SO BULKY! Wish is were just a small USB like the old echo dot.

Title: Alexas has to have the "Skill" to operate stuff
Body: I don't like that there has to be a skill for Alexa to be able to integrate with things. Not everything that is Bluetooth or Wireless can be routed with it, which makes it only usable with newer TVs and electronics. Also, once you install the skill, you then have to use the voice part of Alexa to customize or set up the skill. Hopefully there will be more things the Echo Dot can do later on, once it becomes more common.

Title: Great item for the $30 price I paid.
Body: If you are looking for a cost efficient Echo device then the Echo Dot 3rd generation is a good choice. I have had all 3 dot series, 1st gen Echo, Tap, and Show 1st gen. and I am pleased to say this speaker is the best of all the "Dot" series. The $30 price I paid was on point, although $50 is a bit too pricey for this device. I love the pinky plum shade and appreciate Amazon making a feminine shade in this device.

Title: A Nice addition to current capability
Body: I have had an echo since the original introduction and don't use it a great deal, but still wanted something in my basement workshop and one of these has proved to be ideal.  I can use it with blue tooth or to stream music and news while I'm working.....has proven to be very nice.  Also purchased one for a Christmas gift for grand children.....and they loved it....better then anything else the received.

Title: Awesome!
Body: Just got it today and..so far so good.Set up took about a minute, if that, and it does everything it's advertised to do.I wouldn't want to blast my music on it...the sound isn't nearly as good as many other Bluetooth speakers but for conversing with Alexa, people in other rooms, or listening to an audio book..it's great.I would highly recommend. Especially at this $25 price!

Title: Perfect addition to my bedside table - Function and Fashion!
Body: The dot in sandstone blends into my room beautifully.  The time display is a great addition. Setting a morning alarm verbally is the best - even my husband can do it (Haha)!  I already have Amazon prime and previously set up an Alexa Show so the set up for the Dot was super easy. Be sure to use the Alexa app on your phone to best customize and utilize all the features the Dot offers.

Title: Way more than I expected
Body: I had just set it up but had not tried it when a friend called......I was across the room with my back turned when I began to tell him about my new toy... I said , in a very low voice that all I had to say was _lexa, play my music.... and, amazing, I heard my music play!I can_ imagine what I thought about it, but I was impressed at how well the Echo heard my voice and responded!  Fantastic!

Title: Kids love it!
Body: I ordered these fir my kids for Christmas. They've enjoyed playing music on them non stop since. They use it synced with my phone to call friends and family. They've already talked through the dots to each other. I look forward to using our kitchen echo show to communicate with their dots in their bedrooms. Alexa has quickly become a useful tool in our home... and we've barely scratched the surface of it's many uses.

Title: Convenient
Body: I have 5 Alexas at my house, one at work and have given them as gifts.  I like the announcement and drop in features.  I travel a lot so I like that I can use the app on my phone to send my family a message to any device.  I love the reminders and alarms bc my kids hit the snooze button on the phone several times but when I set the alarm to talk it wakes them up.  Love all the integratedfeatures!!

Title: A Good Alarm Clock Replacement
Body: Very impressed with this little gizmo. I typically mute the microphone and I thought the clock light and red ring would be too vibrant for a bed_ nightstand. But check this out: when the lights go out in the room, the lights dim on the Echo Dot!I also activated the Alexa whisper skill and, all-in-all, it_ a pleasant replacement for my old alarm clock.

Title: Good speaker, but poor tech and usability
Body: Got this one on an offer. The sound output is good. The voice recognition is better than Siri but there is no comparison with google. Alexa needs a lot of improvement. Disappointed with no rechargeability and power-cord.Pros:1) Nice sound2) Good quality speaker2) Better voice recognitionCons:1) Not rechargeable. Needs power supply all the time to work.2) Power cord is not the generally used micro-USB type. So, need to carry it all the times.3) Only Amazon streaming (music, video, etc) access that has limited options.4) Voice recognition still needs to compete with Google.

Title: Awesome... But Frustrating
Body: This is an awesome product for people who like to ask questions and get answers. It's even great for those that like to ask for a song and get to hear it right away (if she understands what you asked for).Where it begins to take a turn for the worst is when you start trying to play games using it's "skills". There have been many times where I am right in the middle of a game and it decides that it's time to crash and end the game. I have contacted customer support and there were very responsive and great to deal with, but my problem still exists. I was told to uninstall the Alexa app and re-download it after restarting my phone and it should work just fine. This was NOT the case. While the dot has experienced slightly fewer crashes, it is still happening and I don't know how to remedy the problem.

Title: A very useful device!
Body: This device was a good device to add to our kids room.  It is really cute.  I like that I was able to set parental control to assure my kids werent able to purchase items on my account or ask indecent questions that Alexa would answer.  My kids adore this device.  Now, they can ask Alexa how to spell specific words, math questions, read books, and much more.  Be sure to download the Alexa app on your phone to help with integration process.This device has so much you can do with it.  Unfortunately, I had to learn via trial and error as there is no manual that comes with the device.  There are many skills you can sort through on the app that could be very beneficial.  It is time consuming to adjust to your likings but Im sure it will be well worth it.For us, the parents, we absolutely love the'Drop in portion' where you can use as an intercom to notify others in other areas of the house _.  This skill scared my teenager so bad one morning she thought Jesus was calling her name in her sleep.  Lol.  The only catch is that they too can drop in on your device.  So use wisely.It was so sweet that I was able to create a skill that allowed my daughter to ask Alexa how many days were until xmas.  Also, the notification and calendar events from my email were also helpful.What concerns me is when we have to sometimes call Alexa's name loudly to ask a question. Sometimes she doesnt recognize voices (rememeber to set via the app or device).The speaker/ sound quality is great.  You also can group them together to play the same music across all the devices simultaneously; very nice.I highly recommend but just be patient when setting them up.

Title: Great addition to the house.
Body: This is a real nice addition to our home. We have 5 dots. One in ever bedroom and 1 on each floor. We have integrated our lights with smart bulbs and or smart switches.  The bulbs turn on and change color on comand. They are also set up to timers. Our aquarium lights are hooked up on a timer too. Alexa also controls out Next thermostat and ring door bell. The dot itself was very easy to set up. The lightbulbs and light switches and plugs all have to be added one at a time. Each individual product has its own set up instructions. We have had some issues getting the lightbulbs linked up. Also our WiFi was not strong enough throughout the whole house so we did have to get a WiFi extender for upstairs. All in all the dot is a real nice device with great sound. She also plays relaxing sounds and music.

Title: Almost Perfect. Needs One Software-Based Fix
Body: Sound quality is surprisingly good, especially when two dots are linked when used for true two-channel stereo. The appearance is significantly improved over the first generation dot. I have only one major criticism:1. After a few weeks of faultless operation, all five echos (1 show, 4 dots) start having problems with voice recognition and syncing which is resolved by power cycling all of them. It would be wonderful if Amazon would just set up a routine that restarts all the devices in your house. Allow users pick the time their dots reboot using the Alexa app. Problem solved.

Title: Amazing difference between older models, not usb powered
Body: This Echo Dot is a beast compared to the previous versions! Normally I keep them all at via level 10, this one I have to keep around by level five or six otherwise my wife will complain it_ too loud. I love it because I don_ have to turn my stereo on to listen to my music. Installation took a matter of minutes if that and sound quality to me is excellent. Wish they had the ability to be plugged in via USB like the other ones rather than having a plug because a lot of the places we use ours we have converted over to USB along with the upper and lower 110V plugs.

Title: Can't imagine life without it!
Body: I just love the echo dot! The only problem I have, is that I am often unable to make out some of the words Alexa says. Now, in all fairness, I do wear hearing aids. With them in, or without, there are still words I can't quite understand.I use it a lot for listening to music, which I canunderstand. I can't say the sound quality needs a bit of help for certain, because it could be my ears. We have 3 echo dots in the house, and others often can't make out a word or two either. I don't know if it's because the dot is so short, or what? All in all, I am well pleased.I lost my hubby in March, to Alzheimer's. I feel alone a lot, but Alexa has helped immensely! She's entertaining, plays tons of games, and she's just fun to talk too. Of course, I love the music!The games are endless, and I'm STILL stuck in the jail cell, in the game, "Escape the Room!" I fear I'll never get out! Lol!She's amazing, and sets my alarms, reminders, you name it, she probably does it! I'm still learning, and new skills are never-ending! I'm even learning to speak Italian!I just can't say enough about the echo dot. If you don't have one, you have no idea what you're missing! She even sings. I'm amazed daily as I learn new things the echo dot can do.If you own other compatible devices, ie. lightbulbs, and a whole host of other products, you'll really love the convenience of echo dot. So much power in a dot...! I really enjoy getting weather reports, football scores, making "to do" lists, reminders, etc. There's nothing I don't like. You can turn off the microphone while on phone calls, or during a conversation. (Seems some people are afraid of being recorded.) I highly recommend this amazing echo dot. The sky's the limit! She tells jokes that are often so ridiculous, you can't help but laugh. She's a ray of light with her antics daily. A must have!

Title: A MUST FOR YOUR HOME
Body: Love this product. I connected to my Honeywell thermostat and it works great. Now I just tell Alexa to set my AC to my desire temperature. I also connected it to my audio books and she reads for me my books. I connected my Wemo smart plug and turn my lights on and off in an instant. And last but not least, I connected my Deebot vacuum robot and tell Alexa to start it or return it to base. I also ask her for weather, set my alarms, my appointments and remainders. I have my Ring doorbell and cameras connected to Alexa. I even pray with Alexa my rosary!  Welcome home, Alexa!

Title: We love it.
Body: We enjoy using this product for listening to music all around the house.  It has lots of functionality that we haven't used yet.  It's great for entertaining us in the kitchen while cooking meals.  We like using it as a cooking timer because we can set and stop the timer just by talking to it.  We don't have to stop what we are doing and go touch it as we do for other kitchen timers.  It was also fun for our guests when we were entertaining at Christmas.  Everyone could ask for the songs they liked.

Title: Much better than the previous version
Body: I had a previous version of the Dot, but this is so much better. The sound is much louder and has a greater depth to it. The earlier version used to work for "drop ins", but it got to the point where I couldn't hear the person at the other end. This one works great as an intercom.The only negative, and it's not worth reducing it by a star, is that it seems to be a little slower to respond. I'm retired, so that little extra time doesn't bother me.

Title: Sleeker, more substantial, better sound than Gen 1 Echo Dot
Body: We've owned a 1st Gen  Echo Dot now for +4 years and still use it. When the new Dot became available we thought we would move the original to another room and use the 3rd Gen Dot in our main living area.It has better sound and better build quality with the textured outer fabric. As always, the same fast responsive assistance from Alexa whenever we need her for many services and functions. And don't forget to ask her to tell a joke now and then.

Title: Simply wonderful!
Body: i got a great deal on this, 24.99, 5.00 a month for five months through Prime.  I had never bought a device like this before and was upset I did not buy the charger for 9.99 more.  Was I ecstatic when I received my Dot and she had a charger.  Dot is linked and synced to my other devices and amazon music, the sound is awesome!  If she cannot find a song she will pull up other songs by the artist.  I truly am amazed that this little beauty was so cheap!

Title: Nice integration
Body: I am impressed with my recently acquired Amazon Echo Dots. Previously, I had used Google Chromecast Audio devices to stream to multiple Vintage systems in different rooms, thereby achieving whole house (like SONOS) audio. The sound quality and functionality of the Echo Dots seem to be better than that of the Chromecasts. And, the overall integration of being able to tell Alexa where and what to play, in addition to powering on a system, makes it very nice. Also, I am really impressed how this is all integrated directly into Spotify Premium, which can also be directed from the desktop or multiply devices. So, this is my current streaming to Vintage solutions. I am currently streaming from an Echo Dot directly into a pair of Dynaco Mark III mono blocks and the sound is fantastic. IMHO, at currently $25, these things are awesome. I am still learning of all the capabilities and have purchased and Echo Show along with several LED bulbs and modules. I also have this integrated with the Ring Doorbell Camera.

Title: Great device for a great price!!
Body: We bought these when they were $22 a piece - we have 3 all together. I think these are great all around the house for different purposes. We use ours mainly for music, news, timers, maps. We have 2 at home and one for the office. I use the office one for music and podcasts. Apple podcasts just paired with Alexa which is great for me. There is some cons to it as I can't stream all the podcasts I like to listen to. I would love to just pick the podcasts I want and broadcast it to Alexa but sometimes that doesn't work - I have to go to the show and then swipe through each episode on my phone. I could say which episode I want to Alexa but she doesn't always pick it up so the Alexa app is usually easier. Overall, we love them! We also paired them with our ring so we use it as a doorbell notification for our home. I think these devices are a great start if you want to start turning your home into a "smart home". There's many other features like morning and night routines that can be set off by things you say to Alexa, they could also do white noise. For $22, you can't go wrong!

Title: Great life-improvement device, average small speaker sound quality.
Body: I got this as part of the .99 deal. For that price it's an incredible offer.  Alexa still isn't perfect, but it's a lot better over time.  I use this one primarily as an alarm clock and ambient noise generator in our room. I've gotten way better sleep with it and the alarm gets loud which is nice.  We can control the smart thermostat without having to get out of bed, and I also paired it with our other echo to have multi room music, and that is fantastic.  I paired it to a Bose speaker in our room for better quality.  On its own the unit sounds similar to a computer speaker, not terrible but audiophiles will need a nicer external speaker.

Title: Get it. Just get it now
Body: A friend got this for me as a gift.  I never thought I'd even want it, but here I am now integrating my home to this thing ."Alexa, turn on the tv. Play (insert whatever show my roku, hulu, Netflix has). Alexa, set an alarm for 9am. Alexa what's the weather"I swear, if alexa could have a hologram image of my choosing, I'd basically be living with Joy from Blade Runner. I love this thing.

Title: Alexa is courteous during holidays.
Body: So far I like it. You just have to get used to speaking clearly for it which from my thinking normal. I liked that I could ask it for delivery updates on products during Xmas and it wouldn't say what it was just in case someone you didn't want to know asked or was around when you asked that question. Alexa did say too that as being the reason why.  So far it's been cool having it around.  The speakers though sound muffled. I get why the extra connection to another speaker would be added at a feature to the dot. It feels well made. Doesn't feel cheap.  At the moment I have no real complaint. I haven't had it long though so as time goes by if I find anything to add, I will.

Title: Easy set up, but no clear instructions of features
Body: Although it is easy to set up out of the box.  There are no clear instructions on all the features that the Echo can do.  You have to search the internet to find it out.  A link to a tutorial would be helpful.  Also the pulsating light should be able to be turned off.  Although not on all the time, when it is on in a dark bedroom, the pulsating colorful light can keep a person awake.

Title: Good speakers
Body: I love listening to music throughout my house so I have several dots set up in different rooms. They are easy to set and pretty easy to synch together. My biggest complaint is that I can_ play my iTunes music library and have it play on all the speakers at the same time. Maybe it_ just me and I haven_ figured it out but it works if I_ using amazon music. But being that I have an iPhone and iPod for many years all my music is in iTunes. I activated the itunes skill for Alexa and still doesn_ seem to be working right.

Title: Excellent upgrade from the 2nd generation Dots!
Body: We initially ordered this so my oldest daughter could give my younger daughter the 2nd gen and my oldest could have the 3rd for Christmas. There have been many arguments in our home over who gets to use the 2nd gen Dot. So we thought it would be fun to let our youngest have her own to listen to the songs from Frozen on repeat, over and over, till her heart is content. The 3rd gen was so awesome that my husband purchased one from his account (without my knowledge) for our room. So now we have a dot in each bedroom.I'll just jump right in on this fabulous device...The sound!! Wow! The sound on the 3rd gen Dot is spectacular! I cannot believe how amazing the sound quality is on such a little device.  It is as if I have it synced to a bluetooth speaker, but I do not. (The video that I posted is the sound from about 5 ft away from the device.) Loud, crisp, clear sound with a hint of bass. A huge improvement to the sound on the 2nd generation Dot.The 3rd gen easily syncs/pairs with the other devices in the home. These range from 3 diffetent Samsung phones (via the Alexa app), a Fire TV stick, 3 Fire tablets, another 3rd gen Dot, as well as the 2nd gen Dot. It also paired up to 2 separate bluetooth speakers with ease. My 10 year old synced her Dot with one of the speakers on her own, via the Alexa app, with zero help. So pairing this device with other devices in your home proved to be a very easy task.
