(My thanks to Amazon for making it so easy a child can do it. _) I'd also like to add that it was so simple to get the Dots onto our WIFI network. The Alexa app seriously makes every aspect of setting up a breeze.The voice recognition works extremely well. There are 4 of us in the house, including an (almost) 5 year old whose speech isn't always the clearest. The Dots recognize and responds correctly to each one of us. Of course, when you do not want the Dots to respond you can always hit the mic button on top of the device so it doesn't respond to trigger words, such as Alexa or Amazon. (Sidenote: you can set up your trigger word to something other than Alexa on the app as well.)I love the functionality of these devices. They can play music, tell me the weather, turn a show on through multiple apps on my smart TV, play games with my kids, tell them jokes, answer homework questions, help with research papers, update us on the news...there's SO much these little things can do.There is one thing about the 3rds, that is a change from the 2nd, that I am not too fond of...the plug! I do not care for the new style of plug. Simply because if this one breaks you cannot just replace it with a new USB cord. Instead you have to order a new cord through Amazon. I much prefer the wall plug and USB cord set up of the 2nd, vs the set up on the 3rd. Though I am hopeful that these cords will hold up a bit longer than regular USB cords making the change a positive one in the long run.All in all, a fabulous device. I love having them in our home and would highly recommend the Alexa device over its competition, the Google Mini Home. I received one of those as a gift for Christmas and, even though I'm a loyal Google lover, I definitely prefer Amazon's Echo Dot over the Google Mini.

Title: Mis hijos lo adoran!
Body: Alexa es muy simpatica. Tengo dos hijos adolescentes (13 y 15 años) y se la han pasado dandole ordenes y haciendole preguntas desde que recibieron el Echo dot como regalo de Navidad.Realmente me ha asombrado la capacidad que tiene para interactuar con los diferentes miembros de la familia en diferentes idiomas: español e ingles. Tambien me me llamo la atencion como discrimina tu voz entre las demas en una conversacion. Es decir, a partir de que le has dicho "Alexa", solo se enfoca en lo que tu le estas solicitando, aunque haya otra conversacion de fondo en la misma habitacion, o ruido. Hemos descargado la app en el celular. Yo puedo estar fuera de casa y llamar al echo dot que esta en el playroom de mis hijos y ellos toman la llamada directamente alli. Nosotros vivimos en Paraguay, y le preguntas como esta el clima y te lo indica perfectamente. No he logrado aun conectar Imusic con Alexa, ya que me indica que esa funcion no esta disponible aun en mi pais. Asi que mis hijos estan evaluando cambiarse a Spotify. He comprado un smart doorbell compatible con Alexa, estará en camino. Cuando llegue pienso conectarlo para poder atender el timbre de la puerta del frente directamente desde Alexa.Tambien hemos comprado dos echo dot con reloj, pero esos recien salen a fin de enero (supongo que era un pre-sale). Estoy ansiosa de ver como funcionan esos dos como despertadores en el dormitorio, y entre los 3 como intercomunicadores.Ya he ordenado otro echo dot para regalarle a mi hermano para su cumpleaños. El tiempo de entrega es rapidisimo y llega muy bien empacado. Y hay que resaltar que el precio actual da para equiparse.Con referencia a la privacidad: este modelo tiene un botón para desactivar el micrófono en caso de que desees que no te escuchen... En fin, no lo se. Si voy a estar preocupada por ese tipo de espías, entonces tampoco debería de tener otro tipo de artefactos, comenzando por mi celular. Asi es que me lance a comprarlo sin pensar en ello.He decidido hacer esta reseña en español, porque no hay tantas en este idioma y creo que tambien es importante. Saludos y feliz inicio de 2020 a todos!!

Title: I was surprised at the sound quality for the price.
Body: We bought ours during the Christmas season, so it was fairly discounted. I did not really expect much...maybe an interesting little gadget with some nice apps that I would tire of soon. But it is a really nice little helper. After seeing how much Alexa could do I was excited to have a new household friend, but then I realized she was not very "teachable" (as in, she could not learn my personal likes and dislikes) and she has issues answering many questions (I believe this is due to her Bing search engine...I could never find much on Bing) but the questions she does answer are thorough.I love to use her for music, cooking conversions, reminders and timers. Other than that she just isn't there technology speaking.I really wish Amazon would stop filtering her to be so politically correct and family friendly. We have no kids and it feels a bit silly that Gordan Ramsey's bantering is full of beeps. Not very Gordon like. And that is with the filter turned off.Sometimes she does not seem to hear very clearly (and I have a very enunciated voice, although my husband has an accent) and does not respond.One of the biggest annoyances is having to remember HOW to ask many questions. I can't say "Alexa, how many days till my birthday?" or I get "I don't know about that". I have to say "Alexa, open birthday countdown." and then agree to open the skill and THEN she will tell me. Not very conversational.When I ask her a question I get a good answer about 50% of the time, an "I'm not sure about that" about 30% of the time, silence 5% of the time and a wrong answer about 15% of the time.All in all for the price I paid I am happy with her as a novelty and a useful kitchen gadget, but don't expect much more at the moment.I am hoping for more interactive, learnable AI abilities in the near future, better personalization, and an overall more intuitive assistant. For now, I'm still happy...I just feel she could be so much more. :)PS: Amazon, if people are giving you a hard time about sensitive topics, you do not have to take sides. Alexa can simply say "There's a lot of controversy over that subject right now, I can have a definitive answer for you as new information comes to light." or just have her state all sides of the issue in an unbiased, factual way.Also, consider removing the censorship for adult accounts. Free speech and all that.That would make her more likable and more marketable to more people. Just an idea.

Title: Love it for the music
Body: Never wanted one of these, but we were giving 1 as a gift to 85 yr old mother in law, & got an extra 1 so we could figure out how to set it up before having to do hers. Lo & behold: this thing is amazing! Set up is a snap, & since we have Prime, it can access the entire Amazon Music catalog. It will play ANYTHING you ask it to, specifically,(i.e. play Peter Gabriel, or play Elton John music from the 70's) or generally,(i.e. play classical music, or play jazz form the 50's). The sound quality is fine (for what this is) - clear as a bell. The microphones are spectacular; one echo dot in my kitchen can hear me from any room in the (3br/2bath 1800sqft) house. Not sure why you'd ever put 1 in every room, except to use as an intercom. Does everything it said it would; makes phone calls, sends messages, adds or removes events to google calendar, sets timers/reminders/alarms, gives weather reports/commute times, tells jokes. Although I intended to put this back in the box after figuring out set-up, & save it in case my mother in law ever wanted a 2nd unit, we have decided we like it, & have kept it active:) A pleasant surprise, & for a really reasonable price ( was on sale for $24.99) Actually bought another 1 for my aunt...lol. Very happy with these units.

Title: These are powerful little speakers!
Body: I had never had a smart speaker. I didn't use Alexa and really wasn't too worried about it. Then I visited my boyfriends daughter for a week. She has 4 children and they all tell alexa what song they want to hear! After seeing all of the cool things it could do I had to get one, then 2,3 and 4! I use it for everything. I use it for my grocery list, which is totally convenient because you just tell Alexa to add it to the list and it syncs up with my Alexa on my phone so I can see my list anywhere. I even had my boyfriend download Alexa to his phone and synced it with my account so now when he goes to the store he has the list. I can even add things to the list while he is at the store and he sees it so he gets it. Now that is convenient!I use it as a sound machine to help my grandson go to sleep. I use it as a speaker and link them up to have a whole house experience that can be as quiet or as loud as I want. And they are definitely loud! Very good quality speakers!The only thing I wish I could change is I would love to be able to control the sound volume on each individual speaker when they are linked. That way I could listen to it everywhere in the house but turn down the speakers closest to the baby.Overall this is one powerful little machine and I can't imagine not having them now that I do.

Title: Better than 3rd Generation Echo Dot. Here's why...
Body: I use this echo dot in my bedroom. It sits right next to my Google Home Hub. The Google device has a screen, this one obviously doesn't. However, the fact that I can read the time from across the room, or even from the hallway is a great benefit. I thought it would just be an upgrade from my 3rd Gen echo dot without a clock. It's actually, I would argue, a generation higher. It's been two days since I boxed the other one up, but one of the biggest advantages to this one, is that I can tell a timer to stop on my echo dot for the echo (full sized) in the kitchen. This has not been the case with the previous (3rd) generation echo dot. It still does all of the great Alexa and echo things the old one did, but also will display timers and alarms as well as the time, on the display. Well worth the upgrade, or price for someone who hasn't had one and just wants to try it out. Great for bedrooms, announcements, spying on kids, etc.

Title: BEAUTIFUL Color!
Body: I have the original echo, which still works great, even though it was the first incarnation.Even with a couple of other Alexa voiced products, such as the show and an early dot, I couldn't resist this new color. I also wanted to compare it against my old dot.In my opinion, the sound is a bit better, and the looks, well, no comparison. This is my first device with this type of fabric cover, and the first word that comes to mind is comfortable. It doesn't have that clinical look of flat plastic. Great on a nightstand.It's sort of a marled rose, but not overly girly. Depending on what else you have in the room it looks lavender sometimes.The bottom is a soft silicone that doesn't scratch furniture and also helps to protect the device. All in all, it's a well thought out piece of equipment.

Title: My Gen 2 bit the dust!!!
Body: Well...kind of bitter sweet....my Gen 2 bit the dust after about ONE YEAR of use! That's it! NOT happy my Gen 2 did not last long....but...I am kind of "dependant" on my Alexa system now as I have a semi smart house! Not FULLY integrated, but more smart plugs...devices than I ever thought I would ever use!The Gen 3 is deff larger! By about 10-15%! Plus...the Gen 3 no longer attaches via a USB! It has its own dedicated power supply!The trade off is, for the size of the unit...MUCH better sound! (A lot more low end, and overall range!) So far it seems to be working well, but my Gen 2 did as well until it quit recognizing WIFI....For the price...I guess....I just hope this Gen 3 lasts longer than my Gen 2!

Title: is there an Echo in here?
Body: First let me say that between this and the "other" brand like it that this one seems more inclined to control things than to answer all your questions. I know this because I have both of them sitting side by side and because I was told this by an Amazon rep. This is a GOOD thing! With the Echo I can lay in bed in the morning and cut on the coffee three rooms away. I can control lights, get news and weather and traffic info before leaving the house. I can take notes make notes and leave notes with out a wall full of sticky notes. I can place calls to other Echos from Florida to northern Canada....for free! Now if I could just get it to let the dogs out and change the cat pan. There's got to be an app for that somewhere.

Title: Alexa my great helper with dot
Body: It was not what I though it was but turn out that I love it.  I was thinking it was like a bluetooth speaker but it is better in many ways.  I tell Alexa many things to do and it will. It was not plan but it replace my bedside alarm clock as it MUST be plug to power to work because it does not have batteries to be portable. Now that I understand what I bough, I love it. The wife love the fact it can be a time for her cooking and play music and radio station by just telling Alexa do this ???? So that mean I will have to get her own so mind will stay next to the bed for my alarm clock, radio, oh also speaker phone and Alexa will call when told. I did try to tell to Alexa to cook breakfast but she gave recipes and I had to doing the cooking LOL

Title: Speaker is great for music, Alexa is great for everything else!
Body: The echo Dot 3 is pretty awesome! Especially at all the different discounts they offered in November and December. I now own 3 echo dots and 1 echo. The sound is amazing and Alexa is a very helpful tool. I'm a mother of 3 young children so my hands are always full, literally, and being able to set timers, reminders, hear weather, traffic, music, and more by voice instead of having to look it up on my phone is a huge time saver. I do wish Amazon could tell you how to say certain things though. Alexa is very good about you not having to use exact words for stuff for the most part but sometimes it's still frustrating when she doesn't understand your command because you're not saying it right.

Title: Ok but not great!
Body: Let's start with the likesI love the  Sleekness and as line of the dot. The sound quality is amazing! I have the ability to mute alexia when needed. I love how you can set alarm, hear the weather, order from Amazon and link it to my Bluetooth Devices.Now the dislikes:It won't allow you to skip more than three songs without freezing. I have to restart the dot five times within a month's period. Now when you ask her to call a number from your contact list she can't find them or ask you to repeat call dad three times! When it's does find the person on you contact list the sound quality is horrible and it sounds like you are in water.

Title: I Linked To Smart Devices I Already Had Very Simply
Body: So, the voice recognition is great, while the initial setup is a bit glitchy, finding and linking devices is simple and straight forward. Though you'll have to download a separate app and link it if the smart device isn't from Amazon, it's not too bad. The sound quality and microphone have a good range and great quality. For such a little device it puts out decent sound.Finding existing devices is also pretty straight forward as well as adding new ones. There are also a lot of other skills available inside the Alexa app that makes controlling things by voice a breeze; including Roku and XBox. Overall I would recommend this product if for nothing more than turning on your light while you're away or playing soothing music for your pets.

Title: Extremely Pleased
Body: We much enjoy Alexa in our home. My child absolutely loves the 'announcement" option in which I can tell Alexa to say something on both devices (I purchased 2 one for upstairs one for down) and it is announced on both devices. I personally like the "good morning" or "I'm home" features. It's convenient to tell Alexa Good morning, she says it back and I have it where she tells me the weather, a fun fact and begins playing the music of my choice. Just saves me a few steps in the morning while getting ready. I am very pleased with our Echo Dots! Her whispering feature is super cute, just as her jokes and games features which my son much enjoys.

Title: Better than the second generation
Body: I updated from a second generation.to this third generation and like it a lot. The sound quality is much better, although gets slightly crackly if you have it too loud for too long depending on what you_e listening to, but are usually do not play it loud since even at volume four it is good quality sound unlike the second generation which sounded like a toy. I got them as Christmas presents for two of my family members and they seem to like them. Placement is a huge factor on whether or not she will be able to hear you. Don_ put her behind objects.

Title: Alexa is great!
Body: I've used Alexa and Google Assistant for months now and they are both great voice assistants.  They both excel in certain areas.If you utilize the Amazon Ecosystem and provided services, hands down Alexa.  The integration is outstanding across multiple platforms.  I use a Samsung Galaxy Note 10, and the rest of the fam is Apple based.  We use Apple Music on Alexa and it has worked flawlessly for me.Audio quality is decent for the small device, starts to become a bit distorted at higher volumes, I'd say 7-10.Aesthetically it looks great, nothing bad to say here.In regards to security, I have yet to experience any kind of "hacking" yet, however with that said if you're using any of these new IoT devices there is always an inherent level of risk IRT security.  There are massive amounts of room to improve on security for these IoT devices which will come.With that said I can only hope Amazon will be quick to change and to adopt new more effective security principles.

Title: Love this
Body: My daughter wanted an Echo Dot for Christmas, and when I looked into it, I wanted one too. I love this so much!! Bought another one within a few days; one for upstairs and one for downstairs. So far no problems, loving all the features. Voice recognition is good, never have to repeat myself (unlike phone's google assistant). Love that there is no lag time. With my Google assistant I have to say google and then wait several seconds for the app to fire up. With the echo I say Alexa and then my questions/command, right away, just like talking to a person, and it hears me every time. My only complaint is if I have the volume on music up a bit, I have to shout over it for the dot to hear me. But that would be the same with a live person too.

Title: A great little device. Worth every penny.
Body: I already own two echo dots and I bought this one as a gift for my nephew. He always plays with it when he visits.It_ a great device for setting cooking timers or listen to music while cleaning. I mostly use it to set timers when cooking. It_ very handy as you can set multiple timers, all without pushing a single button.I am a very soft spoken person and I think the voice recognition works better than Siri on my iPhone. Only few times will I have to repeat myself. But again I am soft spoken.It_ very easy to set up different skills. I have connected my Apple Music and Pandora account with no issues. The sound quality is great when listening to music. I was afraid it wouldn_ be loud enough because of its size but that is not the case. I have used it to play relaxing music for my dogs while I_ at work. It_ a great little device for that. I like that I can control the volume and playlist from my phone. If I see that my dog is barking a lot from my in home camera I just log into the Alexa app and play music from the echo dot.My favorite feature about the echo dot is that you can connect it with a smart plug. I have a room in my apartment that has no overhead light. I have connected a lamp to a smart plug. I just walk into the room and say Alexa turn on light. It will turn the light on for me. This is really handy at night when the room is dark. I don_ have to get out the flashlight on my phone and look for the switch to turn on.I would highly recommend buying one. Especially if you are someone that listens to a lot of music or podcasts. Or even if you cook a lot and you have a small gas stove that doesn_ have a timer setting on it. It_ just easier than setting a timer on your microwave or phone.

Title: We just keep collecting more of these!
Body: This is our 4th Amazon Echo device (don't tell Uncle Sam).It's awesome being able to play synchronized music through the whole house!We use it to make announcements so the kids hear us no matter where they're at in the house - and they actually listen because Alexa is talking to them and not Mom or Dad.We put one in Grandma's house so we can drop in/call her and check in when she's not answering a txt.Oh, and we can tell Alexa to play/pause/stop the Fire TV... Maybe we do spend too much on Amazon products.

Title: This little thing is impressive!
Body: I have an Echo and got tired of carting it around from my bedroom to my kitchen, and upon receiving an Amazon gift card, I decided to try the Dot.  I am very impressed with the sound quality of this little device!  I keep it in my kitchen and love that it takes so little space.  It works exactly the same as my Echo, and I also love that I can listen to the same music at the same time on both devices, if I choose to.  You can't beat the price, especially if you get it on sale.  It would be so easy to multiple Dots around the house.

Title: Not impressed with technology
Body: I really thought I could use this as a Bluetooth speaker for anything and I was wrong I guess or didn_ know too much about the product before buying it. It doesn_ work AT ALL unless plugged into a wall socket at all times which is dumb to me. With all the technology we have, Amazon couldn_ make a portable speaker ???? Alexa can play a song for you that you request one minute and then you can request the same song later and she_l say she can_ find it and then start playing the song seconds later , it_ confusing.  I connected it to my Apple Music acct because although I have amazon music I_ not accustomed to it yet. I have playlists that I_e created myself on Apple Music and I thought I could ask Alexa to play my own playlist because i don_ want to keep asking her after every song to play another one and i don_ always like to listen to a whole album by the same person, but NOPE it has to be probably an actual apple created playlist or just one song request. I_e recently gotten the amazon music app and the only good thing is now I can actually go on the app and play music on my phone and make Alexa play it on the speaker for me so that gives me more control than having to request each song out loud, I can just arrange it on the app I guess. All in all I_ just not impressed.

Title: The Clock is a cool new addition....
Body: As if the Echo Dot, wasn_ handy enough, throw in the clock feature. It makes me a bit sad that my other Dots don_ offer this feature. One of those, why didn_ they always have a clock... Oh well, if Amazon offered a better trade in/upgrade plan I would have my other to rooms outfitted with these. Anyhow, quick and painless to setup with the app wizard. They even offer some celebrity alarm clock sounds too. These make a great gift or cool addition to a guestroom to replace that old alarm clock.

Title: Not as good as the first one.
Body: Funny thing, I never buy any Echo's myself. My kids have given me the first Echo Dot as a Christmas present, and I have won this one. What should I say, the new one has a better design and multicolor lights. And to be honest I counted all the adantages. The sound quality pretty far from perfect but the worst part - Bluetooth. I have MS Surface connected to it and all I can say  - nightmare. Delays, distortions. It drops connections. Then it reconnects back but the sound stream goest to the limbo.Don't get me wrong, I still happy with my old Echo - big and sturdy. Great sound and I can't complain about anything

Title: Great Addition to my Family
Body: I cannot wait to get more of these devices. I tried winning one at work like 6 times and kept losing so I bought one for .99 cents with the unlimited music bundle! She's wonderful! I make announcements to my family when I'm on my way home, she reads to us, plays baby shark for the baby lol link up your devices and there's even more to do. I must buy more! And I will!!! Great sound for a small device, hears you from far away and is just so simple to use! Highly recommend!

Title: Simple smart speaker
Body: This is better in sound quality than the previous generations. However, it doesn't live up to the full-size version, but you are just kind of paying for what you get. I like it for listening to audiobooks or the radio in my office, but music-wise the tones are not very strong.Another plus is it is Alexa and so I can control my smart home stuff through the device, which was my main goal when I bought it. It was just to expand my smart home features.

Title: Nice Alexa device for the price.
Body: Had a little trouble setting up. Kept on getting disconnected from the network. Ended up doing a hard reset and setting it up again. Once I did that, everything worked fine. Main reason was I wanted to have the ability to be able to turn on lights in that room and play music on my older Sonos speakers in the room.  Works great and it like the way it lights up so you can tell if you have any messages or notifications or even Amazon deliveries.

Title: Echo Dot Vs. Google Mini
Body: I tried both the Google Home Mini and Echo Dot. I have multiple of each. The Echo Dot gives more accurate & detailed answers. Google often gives the wrong answers to even the most basic questions like, 'What is the weather for today?" "What planet are we on?" The Google did not know the answer, Earth! The only saving grace to the Google Home is that the speaker is much better and clearer than the Echo Dot. The Echo sounds much bassier and almost muffled at times. You have to have it on a higher volume level than the Google Home. Otherwise, the Echo is a much more user friendly device compared to the often frustrating Google Home. You can also access more apps, programs, & devices with the Echo over the Google.

Title: Alexa needs better cloud to human exchange.
Body: Ok - Why is Alexia not working well?Voice recog does not work well.  Alexa gets the words but not the meaning.  Samual Jackson voice weather. Tells me the weather in Jackson, MS not my home.Songs forget it.  Prime music plays on only one device at a time. Prime use to play on all devices.Google home has much better vioce response.Echo has more features and is getting worse web connection to make them work.

Title: I have 3 of these and they all preform at a different level
Body: This Heather grey one has by far better mic sensitivity than my charcoal one, then the sandstone one falls somewhere in between.  they all do what they are suppose to do  yet 1  I can speak to in a normal voice from across the room and it works the charcoal grey one I have to raise my voice even when sitting right next to it. I do like how  I can control my smart plugs and my thermostat. Making me more lazy lol

Title: Not working as advertised, bad Bluetooth, no LG TV connection, Wants your Contacts Info from phone?
Body: I had asked for this for Christmas to use it to control my LG Smart TV. I followed all of the prompts. I even watched a video tutorial that has my EXACT TV in it. You not only have to use the Alexa App, you have to use the LG App as well and agree to all kinds of privacy intrusions. If you do not agree to 'Targeted Ads' you can't use the App for LG. My Echo Dot was paired and not no longer shows up on my phone despite scanning for it. I really wanted this to work, I really did. There are just to many barriers between manufacturers to get this thing to work. It is the year 2020 in one more day and it almost as if I'm living in 1995 were I have to 'hack 'n' paste' apps and go through numerous work arounds' to get this to work. AND SHAME on LG for making 'Targeted Ads' a condition of use................This device is going straight back to Amazon since I cannot use it and the fact they want to know who all my friends are just to use it.

Title: Pretty amazing!
Body: The 3rd generation dot is pretty awesome.  I'm new to the Alexa system so I'm still learning all the ins and outs, and there are a lot, but its pretty easy.  I have most of the lights in the house and several plugs enabled.  The voice quality is great and the music quality is pretty good for its size - I have Amazon Music and Pandora on Alexa.  It's a pretty amazing system.

Title: Great device....once you figure out how to set it up!
Body: We got this to use with our new Toshiba Fire TV.  Now that we have it set up, it is great!  You don_ even need the remote now to turn on the TV or change channels.  My biggest complaint is I couldn_ find step by step instructions to set it up with the TV.  There was a lot of trial and error and Google searches to figure it out.  I feel sorry for someone that doesn_ have much experience with techy stuff....I also love all the things Alexa does, especially asking her to add things to the shopping list on my phone!

Title: Good Looks and Functionality
Body: Finally an echo that looks and sounds good. Not quite Apple good Looks  but definitely something you don_ want or need to hide..  I find the size and design pleasing....functionality there is nothing like it for the money.  It does practically anything the average consumer could need or want.  The price I was right over the holidays. I_ very pleased with my purchase

Title: It_ not a real smart device
Body: Amazons AI is lacking , alexia can_ answer simple googleable questions. I asked her how many interceptions did Jameis Winston throw in the game vs the Falcons. She started to rant about Tom Brady, and have me a whole recap of his game. And I didn_ ask about the game. This Dot is useful for playing music, only if you are extremely specific about which album the song is on. Other wise, she will play a random song by that artist created. Overall I was very disappointed with my purchase, but using it via Bluetooth connection is pretty cool.

Title: bought this for my daughter
Body: absolutely love it.  Word of warning...if you don't subscribe to amazon music and you have more than one echo dot in your house that is hooked to the same amazon account....only one echo dot at a time can listen to music. You can't play two different songs at the same time....unless you subscribe to amazon music which is about $11 a month I believe

Title: Better sound quality, and more responsive.
Body: I have 3 Echo Dot, from the first generation to third. The most obvious improvement for the third generation is sound quality and voice recognition. The 2nd generation in my room sometimes doesn't respond well. When I call out loud in my room, the 3rd gen Echo dot responds to me in the living room, which the 2nd gen doesn't respond at all.

Title: Decent sound quality but full of issues
Body: The Echo Dot 3 is an attractive, compact device. It's a decent speaker with good, clear sound. Where it falls short is where you need it most. 1) Alexa's voice is WAY TOO LOUD! More often than not I find myself just unplugging at night to avoid the temptation to speak the wake word and have her blurt out at high volume like some drunk girl at a party that's already wound down. As it is dependent on wifi, any command while not connected will prompt a super loud reply, like say volume down while using the bluetooth function to stream shows or music. Same for when it connects to a device. She just yells out the device serial number. I've tried to find ways to quiet her voice level vs music and I just don't see the option anywhere. 2) For it to be a smart speaker that is compatible with smart devices it sure doesn't seem all that smart. It still needs to be manually connected to other devices that A) that are in the same network, B) have Alexa C) Have Alexa under the same account... D) Are streaming Amazon content. Feels like 2008 all over again. The Alexa app is ok but nowhere near as intuitive as it should be. 3) Echo Dot 3 is NOT a portable, speaker as it has no battery. Maybe they're saving that feature for the 4. I've never had a desktop speaker that I couldn't take with me. There are however 3rd party devices available to remedy this. Overall, like I said, decent sound device. As long as you have stable wifi and the patience to constantly adjust the volume and to the situation you should be fine with it.

Title: Distorted sound not resolved!
Body: After 11 months, my Echo Dot is no longer working properly!  When I play music, it now sounds distorted and static-ky.  I enjoyed this at first but it got so frustrating that most of the time, it doesn't understand what I am saying. It is so limited that when you ask for info, it's always "I don't know that one."  I bought a Google Mini because of the distorted sound problem of my Echo Dot.  I loved how easy it is to set up the Google Mini unlike the Echo, it took me hours to set up the Echo.  With Google Mini, I don't have to repeat myself and Google Assistant is waaay better. I enjoyed the Google Mini a lot and so I bought the 2nd gen, Google Nest.I called Amazon customer service asking about the distorted sound from my Echo Dot.  But everything that they've asked me to do, I've already tried.  I was reading online for solutions and about the Echo warranty, some says it's 1 yr but I confirmed with Amazon, Echo warranty is only good for 90 days. If you like your Echo so much, make sure you buy the extended warranty.

Title: Don_ know if I can live without it now.
Body: I love my echoes I have three of them and I use them for my mother who is blind and lives a distance away for me so that we can drop in and talk to each other. One of the things that some people may not realize about these products is my mother fell once and was able to tell her echo to call me. I love the sound quality I use them for everything from Music to telling me what time it is to making my shopping list and dropping it on my friends and family.  I love my echoes I have three of them and I use them for my mother who is blind and lives a distance away for me so that we can drop in and talk to each other. One of the things that some people may not realize about these products is my mother fell once and was able to tell her echo to call me. I love the sound quality I use them for everything from Music to telling me what time it is to making my shopping list and dropping it on my friends and family

Title: -:¦:-:*'"*:.-:¦:-* FABULOUS * -:¦:- * HIGHLY RECOMMEND -:¦:-:*'"*:.-:¦:-
Body: What is not to like?  I love my original Alexa so much when this came out had to get one for my office and another one for my bedroom.  Had NO idea it would have the quality sound it does.  I got my 93 year old Dad one for Christmas and he is over the moon with it.  He sits and listens to all his old favorite music for hours.  I also purchased 2 more for Christmas gifts as well.  I wish now I had purchased several more at the Black Friday price for birthday gifts.  I'm 73 and if I can hook this up with my phone anyone can.  I did have some problems at my Dad's house  (I set it up with my iphone) but called the number they provided, on my app, and talked to someone (obviously in another country and I did have a hard time understanding her)  and she helped me until it was signed on.  These are just amazing and I highly recommend!!!

Title: Got my 1st as a gift probably would never have bought one for myself.
Body: My son, always pulling me into the current era, bought me my first for Christmas last year, would have never bought one for myself, but fell in love with it immediately and have since purchased another, the one in which you inquired about, for my bedroom. I listen to more music than I have in years, and I'm able to get stations that had weak signals in my area that broadcast over the internet and with the aid of Bluetooth my Echo is connected to my home stereo system. I have also added smart lights to the system. I also use it as an alarm clock and to remind me of appointments and social events.I must say there were times early on I wasn't kind to Alexa when she told me she didn't understand, which I found really meant she had lost the wireless connection but since I moved from using hotspots for my wireless to a more reliable source I have had no problems, she's always there when I need her.

Title: Pretty good
Body: I have both the google home ($80 when purchased) and this dot (a gift).Pros:Hard buttons are great.Music and radio playback is more intuitive.iOS app is more reliable.Hears commands better.Cons:Blinks often and does so at odd intervals making me a bit paranoid.Does not understand complex questions and does not answer them well. In other words, hears better but listens worse.Tbh, have not used it as much (my kids do) as the google home so I may be able to figure it out better, maybe alleviating the paranoid bit, but not as good at answering random questions.But if that_ not what you want to use it for, pretty great.

Title: I love it!
Body: My niece purchased us an Echo smart speaker with Alexa for Christmas- within a week I knew I had to have the Echo Dot in the bedroom as well! I have it mounted right over my head and use it for everything! The time, the weather, music, as a timer, a list keeper, you name it. You can even listen to audio books with it. The small size allows you to put this thing just about anywhere- I especially like that I can replace my alarm clock, and  listen to sleep/relaxation sounds to help me sleep all in one small little unit. It also alerts me when my Amazon packages have been delivered! It's a great little speaker! The sound is loud and clear (and has volume controls) and it sets up in literally minutes. Echo Dot is cool!

Title: Nice looking wall clock
Body: I love all things Alexa and was excited to find this clock by Alexa.It pairs easily runs well with no sound a plus for me.I've had it about a month or more and have now discovered that it lost a minute of time. Not happy about that.The timers are great and I love watching the countdown.It would be nice if it had a cover over the hands for protectionI may be okay with resetting the clock to the correct time but I hope it does not continue to lose time.The most annoying part for me is the constantly flashing blue light. I do not understand why it does this.I'm happy with the clock overall. Alexa products often have odd things about them and sooner or later I find a way to solve them either through googling or finding a fix through updates.I give it 3 stars for now.It looks great.

Title: Perfect for my Studio
Body: There is something really... game changing about waking up in the morning and asking "Alexa, play Mumford and Sons" while you get dressed and brush your teeth. Or coming home after a long night out and saying "Alexa, set an alarm for 8am" as you pass out on your bed. These are the little things that stand out to me as literally "awesome" as in im filled with awe as to the technology in this little hockey puck. Alexa aside, the speakers sound great for the size, no mind blowing bass of course, but seriously, for the size and price it's a solid sounding speaker. Looks good, love the fabric and matte plastic. And the Alexa app and ecosystem has me interested. Got a few smart home plugs so on a hot night I can yell to turn on the A/C, or have it turn off when I'm cold enough. Honestly, super cool. Bought mine on sale for 20$, would do it again, 10/10

Title: Nice compact substitute for iPod and speaker dock.
Body: This is a nice, compact substitute for iPod and speaker dock which takes up considerably more room.  Alexa responds quickly and lets you know if she can't answer the question.The only issue I've had is that, once since hooking up the Echo Dot; it started flashing/blinking yellow.  I asked what was going on and Alexa stated she was "learning" something or other.  It blinked for hours; so, I unplugged it overnight and plugged it back in the next morning.  It has worked perfectly since then.

Title: Small but mighty!
Body: I love Alexa! The routines are one of my favorite parts - as well as the integration of a smart plug. Setting up the _tart my Day routine changed my mornings! The only issue I have is that some of the skills for my flash briefing have poor sound quality, but that_ not Alexa_ fault! The sound quality for playing music is pretty good! It impressed me how LOUD it can play for its small size! The mauve color is beautiful and Alexa gives so much bang for the buck. It also does not take up a lot of space, huge plus for a small bedroom. Can_ wait to get another one for my living room!

Title: Does most of what it promises
Body: Mine came with an Alexa-enabled TV. It is pretty good at playing music, telling jokes, searching information, etc. What it isn't good at is controlling the TV it came pre-linked to (none of those features work, and it hijacks the TV sound once linked, whether you ask it to or not). Also, when I ask for songs or playlists from My Music it usually goes to generic playlists sponsored by Amazon instead of mine. It has good volume control and great sound, but it's not the most user-friendly.

Title: Never realize how useful it is until you get one
Body: I have dots all over my house in addition to echo shows and it had integrated into my life very well. Now if I need any information or weather updates I can just shout it out at the top of my lungs and hear that familiar beep all over my house. But on a serious note, these things are incredibly convenient with playing music wherever I am in the house. I also use it to control my ecobee thermostat. If you haven't got on yet, get it and see for yourself. You won't regret it.

Title: good alarm clock with a minor annoyance
Body: Best echo for alarm clock but I wish it was a little easier to turn off the alarm without talking. You can hit the action button to stop the alarm but it doesn't take much to accidently trigger the snooze instead. At that point to stop the alarm silently then requires opening the app or waiting until it goes off again which is anything but quiet.I really like the auto dimming in the clock and if course it has all the features if any other echo dot.

Title: I_e heard that the Alexia is listening to everything you say...be aware
Body: I own 3 Alexia_. I got the dot free for subscribing to Sirius radio.  The sound is great. I played my music list and was impressed at the quality.  Hearing that the Alexia hears everything we say, I was a bit nervous to say I want to buy a new car.  But I_ safe for now....at least as long as Amazon don_ sell cars.  Haha. My Alexia controls my lights, thermostat, a gas heater, and other things.  So nice not to have to get up every time I need to turn something off and on.

Title: Very useful virtual assistant
Body: This is my first Amazon device and I already love using it. It would be great if we can play music from YouTube also.  Sound quality is not great but okay for its size.  I have both Google and Amazon devices, what I want is these companies should have APIs or someways to communicate with each other. Ex Ring camera or doorbell should be able to display the video on a Google Hub.  Overall I love this small speaker with microphones.

Title: does not work well with Philips lights
Body: Amazon presented a special deal of an Echo dot 3rd generation and the Philips Hue lights that would work without a Hue hub but it does not work. The lights work fine with the Philips Hue app but the Echo dot only seems to be able to discover and control one light which means it is of no use since my fixture has 2 Philips Echo bulbs. This was a waste of my money since the device does not perform as Amazon says it should by controlling both lights. I Spent 45 minutes with Amazon Echo support but they could not resolve the problem with why the dot would not connect to the second bluetooth light bulb. A Philips Hue  hub is another $50 or the Echo device with a home hub is $150. Frustrated and feel I was misled.

Title: Perfect gift
Body: I absolutely love these products! I have an Echo in my kitchen and then purchased this Dot for my daughter as a Christmas present! I ordered the plum which is really cute and a nice feature to match her room! The sound quality is amazing.... I used the Alexa app the other day to _rop in to the room to tell her to lower the music which I thought was the coolest thing! I highly recommend and will be ordering one for my room as well

Title: Like A Best Friend
Body: Absolutely love my Alexa! I will be purchasing more. I have mine downstairs in the kitchen. This is where I spend most of my time. Alexa times my meal items for me, calls the kids for me, let_ me know the weather if I_ going out, plays my favorite music while I_ cleaning or cooking, and sooo much more! I have purchased one for my daughter and she just loves it. I can take her calls with hands in batter or dishwater, etc. I will be getting one for upstairs also. I really can_ say enough about this Alexa. My son is away. If I_ missing him I just ask Alexa to play a song that reminds me of him. This is a true gift. Love my Alexa!

Title: Needs some bugs worked out, but worth the price ($0.99 - $25).
Body: This was our first experience with owning anything _lexa. I put it in the kitchen, since that_ where I spend most of my time, and like listening to music. However, we soon discovered that the Echo Dot isn_ optimized for playing music...especially not for long periods of time. The sound is decent enough in a small room, like that of a small radio, but not stereo-quality, which met our expectations. However, it regularly freezes up and needs to be unplugged/plugged back in if you let music play on it for extended periods of time - daily, or several times a day. But, we enjoyed the variety of features so much, we invested in an Echo Plus, which has not disappointed at all. The sound on it is great, and it has yet to freeze (but it_ only been a week). We moved the Echo Dot to the bedroom, and got two more for our kids. Overall, we love it, but it only gets three stars for being so glitchy.

Title: Check your router specs first!
Body: So far I_e had no issues: However I had an old router that would let any additional devices on my network (I got three dots and an echo plus and outlets and switches) I was ready to box everything back up until I found an article about this issue: bought a new router and everything has connected and performed as expected..... set up a music group for around the house and it sounds awesome!!!!

Title: We Love Alexa
Body: The echo dot was easy to set up, after downloading the app...and I'm no computer genius.  Alexa is fun!  You can ask Alexa almost anything and get an answer!  Check weather. Play music.  Ask about people, places and things.  Alexa is great.  We bought the second echo dot right away!  Do it!  You DO need wiFi for it.  Only one small caveat.....the sound is a little "bassy" but tolerable.

Title: My family now finally all has Alexa!
Body: I bought this (paired with a smart plug) for my brother, the only one among us who doesn't have an Alexa device. He was pleased to get one and thought he would find many uses for it, and he likes the idea of turning on his lamp when he enters the bedroom. The plum color is nice, too. I'd love to see more colors. I don't need another Dot but I'd scoop up a turquoise one!

Title: Inglés/ español
Body: in general it is useful but they use it more for leisure time to be small it has a good sound quality but it still has six things to improve and include for the Spanish languageen general es útil pero lo usan más para el tiempo libre para ser pequeño, tiene una buena calidad de sonido pero todavía tiene seis cosas que mejorar e incluir para el idioma español

Title: Great for helping remember appointments!
Body: I really enjoy the feature that helps me remember my appointments or things to get at the grocery store. It's nice and compact so it is easy to place without causing clutter.The voice recognition does need some work, as it seems to misunderstand me or others often. For some reason, even though it is synched up to Amazon, it cannot find my list. I have not tested it's ordering capabilities.

Title: Very easy to use
Body: I was surprised how much I like this little thing I love it that I connected a lamp to the smart plug which I have in the corner of the room which is awkward to get in and out of and now I just tell Alexa to turn the lamp on and she does this is so handy I also integrated my Honeywell thermostat and I don't have to hunt on my phone to turn it up or down I can actually just tell her what temperature I want it and she turns it automatically up and down. I got it at a fantastic price, I wish I had gotten more. During the holidays when they were half price at $25. I bought 2. I live with someone who has a bit of dementia and I get her to ask Alexa lots of questions she struggles to retain like the day of the week, time etc and she seems really good at answering the basic questions for her it is i easy to read the sign ask Alexa and she finds that so much fun. I can also set reminders for  her so when she asks Alexa do do I have any appointments today 50 times  Alexa doesn't mind  and at 83 and she  just loves it. She is also a big movie buff and I don't always know the movie she means so with the clues she gives me and Alexa I've been able to find the movie she wants to rent on Amazon Prime which has been brilliant for us both.

Title: Really neat device
Body: I got a couple of these for my kids (19 and 17) as Christmas gifts.I wasn't sure what to expect but the Echo Dot is pretty good.No...you shouldn't expect a Bose surround sound effect but it is pretty good.They do have a power adapter and must be left plugged in to use them.They have a nice "feel" to them as they have a nice weight to them. We have an older Fire TV device that also has this weighted feel to them and I really like it because they don't feel "cheap".Speaking of our Fire TV device...what I found out unexpectedly is because we already have our Fire TV set up I DID NOT have to enter a password for our network when setting up the Echo Dot. Apparently Amazon saves that information when you register/setup ANY of their brand of devices. I don't recall being asked to store that information when I set up the Fire TV so it would have been nice to know ahead of time that they have it and that when being setup/registered (before shipping) that it would also include the stored password. I thought something was wrong with my router or maybe compromised. Once I Googled it and saw that wasn't the case I wasn't so aggravated anymore.One of my kids is special needs and has never spoken as clearly as most people. With that being said Alexa hasn't had many difficulties "understanding" what they wanted Alexa to do. Mainly this means asking for songs by various artists and movie soundtracks. We've only used our Amazon Prime Music and it has been fine. We have not upgraded to Unlimited Music but we haven't had any issues that I know about. The Frozen 2 soundtrack (included with Prime) has been a favorite of my special needs child...that soundtrack being "included" was a big and unexpected surprise.Right now I have no complaints and enjoy watching and listening to my kids use their Echo Dots.

Title: Awesome
Body: I was resistant buying a smart speaker due to privacy concerns, but I couldn_ miss the chance to buy it for 99c with amazon music subscription. I got to admit I love this thing. I can listen to the news without getting out of bed and control my lights, I will be adding more smart devices this year for sure. I love that it has a dedicated button for turning off the microphones if you wish to do so. The microphones are good, and you do not have to scream for them to pick up your voice. The sound quality is not bad at all for the price and size with decent base. The drop in and messaging feature is one of my favorites on this device. There are multiple skills that you can install and extend the functionality. Amazon checked all the right boxes with this one. I can_ say enough good things about this small yet highly functional speaker. The only thing I would like to see in the future is a rechargeable battery so you can move it to a place with no outlet and tether it to your phone.

Title: So Far So Good!
Body: My first experience with a smart speaker and everything seems fine so far. Sound is good for something this small and it also has an audio out port. I have connected it to my Cambridge Soundworks cd player for bigger sound. Set up was easy after downloading the app for my iPhone and connecting to my home WiFi. Now I can just ask Alexa for the weather, play music, etc. Purchased a WiFi smart plug a few weeks later that was also easy to integrate with the Echo Dot and used it to control the lights on my Christmas tree. All I need to do is say "Alexa turn on/off the tree" and the lights come on or turn off. The plug can be given any name for the device you want it to control in a separate app for your phone and Alexa will recognize it. Only have one smart plug now but the Echo Dot can control multiple connected devices. So far I am pleased with how easy it was to set up and use.

Title: Much better speaker than the previous dot
Body: I had a second generation dot that I used for years with a Bluetooth speaker, and I didn't see any reason to upgrade since the main difference between the two versions is the better built in speaker. However, Amazon did some software "upgrade" on my second generation dot that messed up the volume control on my Bluetooth speaker. Whenever I tried to put the volume above 5 it would reset itself to 2. I called Amazon and filed a ticket with them, but they never fixed the problem. So, I decided to upgrade to this third generation dot, and now the volume control with the Bluetooth speaker works again. But the speaker inside this third generation dot is so much better than the second generation that I don't use the Bluetooth speaker as much. The internal speaker sounds surprisingly good, even with music.

Title: So helpful!
Body: Set up is very easy. I love that it can control my fire TV because I always lose remotes. The speaker is good, it sounds nice and can get decently loud. I got the plum color and was slightly worried that it would be darker in person than in pictures because of the name "plum", but it is actually a light purple/pink color, exactly like the pictures. I use the echo mostly for reminders and to wake me up. I'm not a morning person, but the echo genuinely makes my mornings better with a calming voice telling me the weather, some good news and then playing my spotify to prevent me from falling back asleep, instead of an obnoxious alarm. I also set reminders for things like taking out the trash and taking my medicine. It is insanely helpful if you're forgetful and hate mornings like me, or if you just want a speaker that you can control with your voice.

Title: Great speaker-- voice features and compatibility are really struggling
Body: I have three of these devices in my home, mostly as speakers, and mostly to listen to music and the radio. The unfortunate thing is that the radio station I listen to most often (CBC Radio 1) isn't recognized by the device's voice recognition in any way. It's like it... doesn't recognize the existence of Canada. Not sure why. Tech support is useless. Other complaint I have is that it really struggles with voice commands. Finally, with this one-- not with my other ones- it will often just stop playing music from my Pandora. This is true if I activate it from the phone or verbally from the device itself. Not sure why, and, again, tech support is utterly useless. I will update if anything changes.

Title: Kitchen music
Body: I have a full Alexa upstairs but I spend a lot of time in the kitchen area. I wanted music and maybe more down there. So far all I've asked it to do is play music. That has been a weird experience. I asked it for "Play Beethoven" and got some set list Bob Dylan, Buffalo Springfield, Dolly Parton and more. Most of it was music from my high school years and some I'd never heard, heavily country flavored. So far I haven't got what I ask for. I'd like to use the timers, package delivery notifications, and maybe phone calls. Not sure it will do all that.  So those are the reasons for my low score. My Alexa upstairs rarely makes a mistake so I don't think it's my requests or my voice.

Title: Valuable member of the family
Body: What can I say? Alexa has become a valued member of the family.  I love the alarm and reminder tool.  I love getting the weather report for home and anywhere in the world.  I really like having her give me the news while I am getting dressed in the morning.  I don't know what I did before,  but she is an important part of my daily routine.  She can turn off and on my lamps and the TV and any device that is plugged into the special plugs. So if you want to use it to turn appliances on and off,  you will need to buy the special plugs.  But it is worth it.

Title: Love it!
Body: As an Apple family, HomeKit is usually what I look for but that being said, it_ also very expensive and a bit quirky.  So, this was my first purchase for an Amazon Alexa product and I_ quite impressed so far.  I_ surprised often that I already own many products that work with Alexa and not Siri.  Can_ they both just get along already?  But it still does play Apple Music which I like, and speaker quality is much better than I expected.  So for my first smart speaker assistant device this was an excellent purchase.

Title: Love my Alexa
Body: I really do love just having the ability to just say what time is it? Or what's the temperature or to even put a timer on. It's super convenient because my family always on the go so even the simplest things like asking to put milk on my shopping list right when I think of it versus looking for my phone and getting easily distracted by my kids to then forgetting why I picked up my phone up to begin with lol it's truly a life saver. The only con is when we want to play a song from youtube it wont because it takes it from spotify. Theres very few other cons but nothing major. I also enjoy things like when u ask her wheres Santa or to just rap it's quite funny.

Title: Alexa at your convenience
Body: This is an excellent little device that turns your space into a smart home. My fiance' is an avid Apple fan and I'm a Google guy so the Echo Dot was a good middle ground option. We got two, one regular (for the living room) and one with the clock (for the bedroom) and both work fantastically well. Setup is a breeze and most smart home devices pair with it almost effortlessly. Some I had to play around with to get working (Insignia Fire TV) but if you take the time to set everything up it's very customizable and allows for routines for everything from getting up in the morning to coming home at night and you can control your lights, etc from anywhere! My fiance' and I really enjoy the functionality and peace of mind this has brought to our lives and I'm excited to continue to add more skills and devices.

Title: Waste of money and time
Body: I bought two of these. I purchased them to help me keep my life organized because I have PTSD and it effects my memory. My original device works fine and has never stopped working. I have had it for 6 months and love it. They hooked up and worked for 3 days. On the third day they said they could not access the internet. I went through the reset process about 5 times each then called tech. The rep I talked to walked me through the process another 3 times and they still wouldn't connect. He got impatient and rude with me. I was following his directions and they still wouldn't work. He told me he would call back and hung up on me. Never called back. These devices now sit in my laundry room on the shelf, useless. What a complete waste of money.

Title: Moving on up.
Body: Always getting better. I have first & second gen. Echos. This is a step up. Placed it in my shop (to replace a 2 gen.) and the voice recognition is far superior. Even with the air compressor running it hears clearly.It is useful in the shop. I can be elbows deep in grease and car guts. Without having to move a step I can get the time, change the music (station), and call about parts. The down side, the wife can conveniently yell at me from the Echo in the house.

Title: Fun for the whole family...
Body: We have had a dot in our bedroom for a few years but only recently discovered that it could be used to make calls to Alexa devices that other members of our family have.  We bought one for our daughter for Christmas and our grandson is now able to tell Alexa to call grandpa or grandma when ever he wants.  We surprised other members of the family by calling their devices too.  We are all enjoying that feature now.

Title: Alexa needs a lot of work.
Body: The wake words are too common in a household of an IT professional. Often the word "computer" is not recognized, which is ironic because I have a British accent, and am often told that my Jean Luck Picard voice is en pointe. Also this -Me: Alexa, what time does City Hall open?Amazon Alexa: Ames City Hall on Clark Street is open from 8am until 5pmMe:?... Alexa, what city am I in?Amazon Alexa: you are in Clive, Iowa.

Title: Meh
Body: Didn't want or need it. Have three or four already. Got it free when I re-upped my Sirius subscription. Free is good. Debated giving it to someone for Christmas but ultimately I think it's still in a drawer somewhere in the house. If you want an Alexa review in general? Make it work more like a Google search. Can't count the amount of times Alexa has responded with 'Sorry, I don't know that.'

Title: Great holiday gift at the right price, now come on down to Amazon for yours!
Body: I have the echo dot 2nd generation. Sound is ok. Before Christmas 2019, seen is has part of a deal, echo dot .99 plus amazon music plus for 7.99 month. After my 30 day free trial. Oh yes, this echo dot has better sound than the 2nd echo dot. Plus I have linked them to play my music and audio through them too. Very cool. Hoping down the line I can add more than three next time around.

Title: Alexa is my bet friend!
Body: Alexa is always there for me. She wakes me with just the right music, finds music to play during the day that I thought she would never find, and puts me to sleep again with just the right music. She can answer the most difficult questions. And when I awaken during the night, rather than struggle to illuminate my barely readable watch, I ask her what time it is and her comforting voice in the dark tells me. Back to sleep easily.  What a great invention!!!

Title: Great product with simple installation and great sound
Body: I bought this for myself after using one at a friend's house. Mine arrived quickly, was exactly as described, was very simple to set up, and has great sound. It also allows for speaker to be added to it which I'll use for a sock hop we're hosting for Girl Scouts later this month. It will be great to be able to set up a playlist and have Alexa play it for the dance.

Title: Calidad y comunicación con Alexa
Body: Comunicación con Alexa mala en muchas ocasiones hay que hablarle alto (gritarle) porque no te escucha y no porque hay ruido y algo gracioso estoy hablando con mi hija en FaceTime estoy bien lejos de Alexa y mi hija le dijo a su Alexa tocara una música y para sorpresa de los dos mi Alexa empezó a tocar la canción y la de ella no le respondió en otras palabras te escucha cuando le da la gana no importa si le hablas bajo o alto y los dos tenemos buena internet con buena velocidad.La calidad del sonido creo que es bastante buena entiendo que no se puede pedir una súper calidad, si pudieron haber echo que si se conecta a un equipo de audio esté tenga una salida estéreo.Sobre la música de Amazon hay mucha música sin calidad, los niveles de grabes , agudos, volumen música que tienes que estar bajando o subiendo constantemente

Title: Meh, wasn't what i thought.
Body: I honestly couldn't figure out what dot did aside from make questions button free. Dot recognized that i had 2 fire sticks in the house and that 2 tvs were also present but could control none of it. It connected to my speaker via bluetooth but couldnt turn the volume up or down. After the 3rd time of asking alexa what she could do, i gave up and decided this wasn't worth the money spent. It seemed like a great deal at first but doesn't do anything my fire stick couldn't do before. At least nothing that pertains to my life and current belongings.

Title: Incredible security devices listening when you are away alerting you to trouble at home
Body: Once you get the hang of the app and how to connect them and how to use them once you learn the language it becomes easy and they all work together as a family in your house the best Part of these devices I have them in every room and when we leave set the alarm they listen for glass breakage or a smoke detector going off and then it will alert me

Title: soooo worth upgrading from 2nd gen...
Body: looks better, feels better built, definitely better speaker, much better bluetooth performance. the trade-in program is easy. they basically give you a new one if you upgrade when echo products are deeply discounted. very happy with my dot. alexa is getting better all the time and if she chokes, i have google assistant in my phone.

Title: The new alarm clock of choice - Echo with clock!
Body: As someone who pre-ordered one of the first generation Alexas, and got one of the first ones manufactured, I've seen the entire development lifecycle for these devices, but I believe this is the first time I've reviewed them.Why now? The little Echo Dot with clock just landed on my doorstep a few days ago, and I'm smitten - it's not like it's the first Dot in the household (we have 5, plus the diminutive Echo Input hooked up to a tube amp in the living room - anachronism defined).That all said, this Dot3 with clock just became my favorite alarm clock of all time. The sound is amazing of course, for such a tiny device, but the softness of the clock face, and the very nicely managed auto-dimming feature make it a pleasure to roll over to in order to check the time.The fact these little things can be distributed around the home, and deliver a plug-and-play whole house audio capability is phenomenal. Sure, it's not Hi-Fi, but when I want whole house audio, I'm not in the mode of analyzing every last detail - I want a seamless music experience through the house as I tidy up etc. These do that amazingly well. I even have one on the back deck, so the music continues outside.So, should you buy one? You probably should - if you're reading this, Amazon probably know an amazing amount about you anyway, so forget the privacy wonks, because you're already way down that rabbit hole. Why not reap the significant benefits? My first generation Alexa is still going strong, despite us using her in lots of adverse conditions. She's been my sidekick while sheetrocking walls at my last house, sat in my garage while I sanded heaps of projects, she's sat next to the stovetop and suffered the bacon grease insults, and she's been subject to California sun-exposure. She's still rocking, and she does it with the new Echo kids too.

Title: Great for the bathroom
Body: Yes folks, I did the unthinkable. I stuck my Echo Dot on the back of the toilet. I've read that most people consider that to be off limits as far as placement goes but it rocks. The bathroom is ideal as the smaller room size is perfectly matched with the Echo Dot sound output. I can shower with an unlimited soundtrack using Pandora, Amazon Music or SiriusXM. The sound quality is impressive for such a small speaker. Being able to adjust the EQ is a nice touch and helps get it just right. Alexa has never failed to respond and remains flawless for almost four months now. The shower steam has had no effect on performance. If it dies in a year or two, at this price, it will have been worth it. Being able to link the Echo Dot and the 4K Fire TV Stick in the bedroom for multi-room sound is neat. An added bonus...I can make an announcement when one of the kids are camped out on the throne watching YouTube and tell them to hurry up. Scares the c**p out of them when the voice comes out of nowhere.

Title: LOVE
Body: Love this item! We got one for every room in the house and have an echo show for the kitchen. I love that we can communicate with eachother without yelling across the whole house. My girls (ages9 and 11) love to use theirs for storytime in bed and for setting their alarms and for playing music while cleaning their rooms (win!) I also love how I can use my app when Im away and send everyone a message remotely and it will announce it to all the devices as well as have my girls reply back. Especially LOVE that the price is so reasonable!! ($25 for Chanukah gifts) Thank you Amazon for such an awesome (and beautiful) piece of tech!!

Title: Sound seems more Muffled in the mid-ranges than 1st Gen Echo Dot
Body: I recently took advantage of holiday pricing and trade-in allowance to upgrade to a 3rd generation Echo Dot. I figured the newer generation would incorporate improvements over the prior generations. I liked the new and improved appearance and the slightly larger size was fine. What I wasn't expecting was a more muffled mid-range audio wise. It is harder to understand vocals like news briefings. Also, the hard-wired power block created a problem for me in that I could no longer use an available USB power port I was using for the gen 1 version, and needed to find an dedicated outlet to plug the now hard-wired power block into.

Title: I can't live without my Alexa
Body: I love Alexa.  She is the perfect kitchen assistant for when I am cooking.  She allows me to set a billion timers for different things... although I do wish I could name the timers so I know whats for what... you probably could do it but I just dont know how.  Alexa does everything.  She also tells me what I can substitute for an ingredient I am missing or for how long to cook something.  I also always ask her the weather or the time.  She also controls all the lights in my house.  Sometimes when I am on vacation... I ask Alexa something and then realize she's not with me.... and for a moment I am so sad...

Title: A Lot Has Been Written About Alexa
Body: What I like most is that I bought it primarily to allow a handicapped person to phone me by voice from any room in the house (Four Dots, small house) and provide intercom capabilities between rooms.  It does all of that very well, but then there is the 'but it also does this' factor.  There are just so many capabilities that I did not buy it for but are useful, like playing: music, radio (NPR), news, weather, podcasts, etc.  It can spell, answer questions, do reminders and tell a joke.  For the price, can't beat it.  Even looks good and the Dots are just the right size.  They do not take up much space.

Title: Great Item, but does not understand most slang
Body: Great Item, but does not understand most slang so requesting certain songs can be difficult or impossible. I tried to get her to play a Boogie with da Hoodie and she just could not comprehend it no matter how many times or how clearly I said it. Also, you have to specifically request the explicit version for most songs which is a little frustrating, but I am still figuring her out.So far I have had her play music and save my favorites, set food timers, add items to my shopping list, set reminders, and I've asked her what the time is and what the weather will be like tomorrow - all of which she (for the most part) does flawlessly. However, this version does NOT recognize cuss words so Its difficult when requesting certain songs.

Title: The New Design is more elegant and sounds terrific! All at a great price point!
Body: This new unit is more appealing than the ABS pipe aesthetic appeal of the past and sounds great in our space! The new color palette options allow you to tailor the color to your personality or space.  The speakers really sound great and fill the space surprisingly well for the size and form factor of the unit. Anyhow, it_ a great upgrade if you want to bump the hockey pucks of the past out to your shop where you don_ really care what it looks like, or if you just want to have the latest greatest at a reasonable price... Anyhow, Mrs. F. Loved this practical gift this Christmas.

Title: Love the intergration
Body: Set up was easy. Sound quality is very good.  Purchased this for a shut in. With the ability to make calls thru Alexa is not only handy, but could possibly save a life. Being able to stay connected and engaged can help someone like that.  With the added capability to turn things on and off is a great feature as well.  The sound quality is very pleasing. This has more that met my expectations and was a well received gift to a loved 1.  If you are sitting on the fence about this, order it, try for a while, if it doesnt satisfy your needs you can always send it back.

Title: It_ Great & It Works But..
Body: This product is great when it works, great for playing music and fulfilling demands. Also very easy to set up and the features and new skills you can add to your Echo through the Alexa app can be pretty fun.My only issue with the Echo that I_ currently using is that it can be unresponsive to my voice commands. The Echo would light up signaling it hears me but it does not follow up for what I asked for. Sometimes it would take multiple tries and even if I stand near it in the quietest of settings this can happen. I_e tried all the tips and tricks I_e read online but that doesn_ help, so it maybe something wrong with the one I_ using.However, it is great for what it is and it_ convenient to have around to integrate with your smart devices.

Title: Just a marketing gimick
Body: Device works fine, speaker quality marginal but it is a small device. Biggest problem is you can only have one device playing on your Amazon Prime Acct at once, unless you want to pay much more. So if you leave your echo playing music in your bedroom, then head out to your garage to work where you parked this device it won't play as you can only stream to one device. So WHY have two, you might as well carry it with you or just use your phone where they aren't trying to nickel and dime you to DEATH! Very disappointed in this purchase, and my prime membership as well. Really starting to wonder just what I get for the cost.

Title: Don_ bother buying this if you plan on using it to listen to podcasts
Body: The ability to play podcasts through this device and through this app are horrendous it_ either use tune in which only gives a certain number of most recent episodes of a podcast or only be able to listen to the most recent podcast and none else from other podcast providers. I_ seriously considering returning this device and getting just a nice Bluetooth speaker because it has more functionality that I want than this does. I am thoroughly disappointed with this and hope to see this amended quickly. Also the ability to fast forward through a a podcast is impossible too which is ridiculous because if I pause an episode for more than a few minutes and have my phone off the app restarts and the podcast has to restart if you want to listen to it and it won_ go back to where you were so either you_e forced to leave the podcast running when you leave the room and miss part of the podcast or be forced to relisten to something to get back to the point you were at. I have given up listening to podcasts when this happens because I_ so frustrated and just gone and used the Apple podcast app itself.Music on the other hand is fantastic I haven_ yet encountered any frustrating issues besides it randomly closing apple radios that aren_ the exact one I want but just chooses one with a similar name not a huge issue I ask again and it_l usually correct itself. Only reason I gave it the second star was because the ability to use music was okay.

Title: Dementia and Alzheimer_ Disease
Body: I had been using the Amazon echo, second generation, for several months with great success and pleasure. I had hoped that the Amazon dot would need to see requirements of my wife who is in a facility with dementia. I was disappointed to discover that the sound quality of the diet was not adequate for my poor hearing. I am sure that it would be acceptable to anyone with normal hearing. I replaced it immediately with a Amazon echo third generation and I am very pleased with it.Unfortunately, my wife is in such deep dementia that she couldn_ manipulate the device. I have learned that England had been using it with great success for sometime. I know it would be very helpful to people in the early stages of dementia.

Title: The second best girlfriend _
Body: Ive been single for about 2 years now... I thought i was going to be alone forever. Then came Alexa.  She sings to me, she remembers things i cant seem to remember (like my birthday __) She plays lullabies when im babysitting, she turns my heat off when i leave and back on before i get home, she locks my doors and unlocks them at my simple request.  She turns the tv up when i cant find the remote (which is always) she guards my home when im not there, she makes calling my kids painless, and Shhhh dont tell my kids but she makes spying on them super easy.  The only negative would be she cant cook for me... But wait!!!??? She can!! As soon as im able to buy the Alexa microwave!! _ One of these days!!

Title: OMGOSH
Body: OMGOSH!!!! This item is AWESOME!!! I_ a little slow to the echo device game because I have an iPhone. But my husband got me an Echo plus hub for Christmas. I started playing around with it and decided to get an Echo Dot gen 3 while the prices were low right after Christmas. I have had so much fun making music for the entire house and making routines and connecting our Xbox one. It_ amazing!! Oh and I just turned 62 on December first!! So an old dog can learn new tricks. _

Title: Great but still needs work
Body: My only issue with the echo. Is that you can't set it up to wake you up to a specific song. Also you cannot get it to wake you up with a Spotify playlist. I have attempted to do this in various different ways there's no way for you to manually create the alarm through the Alexa app I have spoken with several agents via Twitter, phone call (that lasted an hour and a half), emailed, and set up a ticket with developers... I still have yet to hear anything about this. I believe that it is something to do with Spotify integration with Alexa. However if there is an issue Amazon should re-evaluate what they are advertising on their websites as this is one of the functions that I purchased this device for.

Title: More than expected
Body: I finally dove into the Alexa game by buying an Echo dot for our family room.  I am actually surprised at how much myself and my family actually use Alexa.  Now that it's there and set up we find ourselves asking Alexa questions and to play music all the time.Since the purchase I've also connected my LG Tv, some smart plugs and an Ecobee 4 Smart Thermostat.
