The ability to set up routines is pretty neat; Alexa can turn on the TV, lights, and crank up the heat on one simple command.I'm still learning all the possibilities, but I see myself buying additional smart devices and more Alexa devices in the future.

Title: Performs very well, but needs many more improvements to be the perfect device!
Body: The integration at times can be very cumbersome with some simple equipment like Wis lightbulbs, the fact that you cannot use the full benefits of Apple music are annoying. If you have the device near a TV, even with the volume at a moderate level, at times you have to mute the TV just so the device can understand your voice. Alexa is also not as smart as Google, and cannot answer many complex questions that a Google Home Mini can, but Alexa once integrated works very well. The whisper mode needs to be more consistent, as when you whisper _hank you after whispering a command, she will say YOU BET! Aloud causing people to wake up in the middle of the night. The display is wonderful, and displaying the temperature when you ask for it is a neat feature. The display is a very functional feature that should_e been apart the game of this device from day one. Despite my complaints, I am happy with this device, and the strengths it excels at.

Title: Helping elderly parents stay safer
Body: The installation of the echo dot was effortless.  It has integrated with all my other alexa products and I have had no issues.  The sound quality isn't as good as the Alexa but that's not what I purchased it for.  I have it in my elderly parents bedroom so that they can turn the lights on in their room and in any room before they get to that room.  We use it for reminders for their medications and appointments.  They can use it to make phone calls.  It's helped them stay safer and kept some of their independence.

Title: LOVE MY ECHO DOT!
Body: I LOVE all my echo devices. I started with a Dot & went on to purchase an Echo Show 5 & an Echo Show 8. My Dots will help me know if there_ someone at my door (Paired with my Ring doorbell, give me the weather report & turn lights on & off. It will take my different shopping lists & it will read my Audible books. I_ still discovering everything they will do but I_ HOOKED. The Dot (or Show) will rewind, increase or decrease the volume with me just saying to do so. It will also dim or brighten lights. I love the convenience!!!

Title: Alexa Setup
Body: Make sure you have you internet security codes available they will be required for set up. that and you will be asked several minor questions as to what Alexa can access for you. Once set up, just really takes a few min. it works great.You don't need to have Prime to access Alexa.  You can use other services, Pandora, Spotify etc.  Instead of pulling out the phone and having to Google, now its just ask Alexa!

Title: Cool Idea!
Body: I like the idea and concept of Alexa. Don't really have anything to compare it to because I don't use Apple products, so that is why I gave it 4 stars. Also, not sure about the security of my home network with this device. I think it is Blue Tooth enabled. With that regards, I wish it was similar to setting up a home router. Where I could change settings with a browser. This way I could change passwords when I need to. Anyway, having fun with it.

Title: Better than previous model.
Body: I received this as an add on freebie with purchase at a retailer.  It has a much better speaker than my previous version and would recommend the dot.  Very convenient to have in my kitchen to listen to news, weather, music, set timer, etc. at a  low price point. Alexa and I don't communicate well as I may speak too fast but I am learning to speak Alexa and then pause before making a request.

Title: Echo Dot
Body: Works pretty well - more useful than I thought it would be.  Excellent integration with equipment we already own - Vizio TV, Dish Hopper 3, Logitech Harmony remote hub, Firestick 4K TV, etc.  Reminders, calendar management, and lists are very well integrated.  Great device at an unbelievable value price!  I'm looking forward to integrating light/power control in the near future.

Title: fun, fun, fun
Body: Easy to set up and use.  My wife loves it.  Why did we wait so long to get one?  I highly recommend the rechargeable battery pack for it so you can take it from room to room rather than being locked to one room or having to buy additional Echo's.  Connects to a bluetooth speakers easily, which makes a ton of difference with music.  If you have Prime, you should have one of these.

Title: I love Alexa Echo products
Body: We love having Echo products to help run out home.  For the most part the responses are very quick, and Alexa is very intuitive.We sometimes have trouble getting the Dot to hear us when it's noisy. We also sometimes have trouble getting the wording just right to complete an action.  But overall I'd say that the Echo system is easy to use, and very useful in our home.

Title: Learning Curve
Body: I am enjoying all of the great things available to me with Alexa and the Echo Dot 3rd Gen.  I wish there was better instructions available that are more directed to older non-millenials.  It is also somewhat discouraging that many of my current electronics and appliances will not integrate, even if they are only a few years old.  Otherwise, this is really amazing and fun.  Also, Alexa is so easy to understand and the sound from the speaker is crystal clear.

Title: How?
Body: The product is outstanding.... but there is no users' manual... no explanation for apparent error indications. The thing noted as being a web-based users' manual offers no troubleshooting at all. The app is great at setting up, but turns useless on support. Still, the product is absolutely awesome... and kind of frightening, so I haven't given it my contact list yet.

Title: Glad I got it
Body: I hadn't really considered getting one of these until a holiday special that was too good to pass up. It is fun to tell Alexa what I want to listen to and she plays it. She answers all sorts of questions and plays games. I got the Fire Stick as well and they work great together. I'm getting g so used to using it, I'd love other parts of live to be so easy to ask as and direct to make life easier.

Title: Great device
Body: Love this device I love that I can drop in and listen in the room the kids are in the other day i ran to the store left the kids home and I was able to drop in from my phone to ask them if i needed milk and they were able to check for me and I did all that over the echo dot. I an also reach my husband if he is in the basement without having to find a phone and text him or call him I just ask Alexa. I want one for every room of the house now

Title: Sound is an issue
Body: The Alexa 3rd Gen Echo Dot is great in all aspects EXCEPT the sound.  I've tried adjusting it, but it consistently sounds like Alexa is in the bottom of a giant barrel or trash can....it's very muffled.  I love the newest feature of the clock, and the set up took about 1 minute, total, super easy.  This is my 5th Alexa device (not including my smart plug-ins), and I think that the 1st gen dot sounds better than this one.  I'm debating on whether I should send it back or not.

Title: Love My Dot
Body: My daughter received a dot as a gift and raved about it and encouraged me to get one. I held off, saying that I didn't need one. That I would just use my phone. But with the good prices at Christmas time, I bought 2, not one. One for my bedroom, room for the living room and I fell in love. I love the one in the bedroom because when I can ask Alexa what time it is rather than having to hunt a clock in the middle of the night. I also like being able to ask the outdoor temperature before getting out of bed. The sound quality is great so it works as a great speaker for my Amazon music. I also like that I can play the same music simultaneously on both speakers I own.  I especially like playing white noise while I am reading in the living room and my 71 year old husband is in the other room listening to TV with the volume up!  I like my dot so much that I bought 2 more to add as extra speakers in the house. I also bought 2 wall mounts so I have 2 dots that stay put and 2 that I can easily move around if needed.

Title: A Smart Speaker for everyone to enjoy!
Body: A well made,  high quality smart speaker. Don_ let its small size fool you, it_ sound quality is excellent! The Alexa software keeps getting better and better and Alexa_ voice has a friendly soothing quality that I find enjoyable. Amazon engineers worked hard to improve the Echo Dot and it shows. Even the light ring is enjoyable to watch do it_ thing. A marvelous piece of technology. Older folks that have an internet connection and a smartphone or tablet but don_ like using computers might enjoy an Echo Dot around the house for alarms, reminders or  just asking general knowledge questions with your voice could be very handy for Senior Citizens. This product is for people of ALL ages! Get one and try it!

Title: Love my Echo Dot!
Body: I love my Echo dot!!! Works way better than my Google Home for my uses. We have like 5-6 total in the house. Sometimes she thinks you're talking to her and you're not but it's not that bad. If you like bass and turn it all the way up it has a distorted sound but overall pretty good and can get loud. Amazon Key doesn't integrate to let me close my garage door with it but hopefully that will be fixed in an update soon. These are some of my favorite things about it:-Whisper Mode, if in bed you can whisper and ask for weather or time or whatever and she whispers back-Song Quiz game is fun and we play it a lot especially when my parents come over-Of course asking to order stuff or what the time/temp is etc-Controlling smart home stuff like the Christmas tree lights or the room lights, brightness, color, etc-Ring integration to notify of doorbell with an actual voice notification-Dropping in or Announcing/Broadcasting a message to othersIn the end I absolutely LOVE these and wished everyone had them lol. I do get mine when they go on sale for $25, I think the regular price is TOO much!

Title: upgraded speaker from the gen 2
Body: i got the 3rd gen dot for my garage so when im out there working the wife wont have to come out to get ahold of me she can just drop in or make an announcement. i also love the fact that i can just connect the dot to my stereo in the garage so the radio now has bluetooth capibility and i dont have to worry about notbeing able to hear the dot due to the music volume. the speaker itself seems like an improvement over the gen 2 even though we lost half of the mics. i am not a fan of the change of the plug as i have multiple usb ports on my powerstrip in the garage  but the larger powerblock takes up a spot and a half on my powerstrip thus i lost 2 spots on my strip in the end.  over all it seems like a better speaker and easily paired to my other dots and communicates flawlessly.

Title: She's becoming human
Body: When we had just one echo life was great. Now that we have 4 they work like crap. When we send an announcement they all announce at different times so it's this awful echo throughout the house. And we can ask one Alexa to play something and she'll do it just fine, but when we ask a different Alexa to play the same thing she won't. It's so frustrating. She also randomly stops playing a playlist after a couple songs. And I can ask her to play something and she'll tell me she's going to and then nothing plays. It's like she's picking up the habits of my children and has selective hearing and ignores what she doesn't want to do.

Title: Great device but not being able to download the Alexa app means you're screwed!!
Body: I was given an Alexa while in the US and was able to download the Alexa app onto my US phone, which made Alexa work perfectly. On arriving home (in a foreign country) I found the Alexa app is not available for download where I live. Luckily, I'm able to use my US phone over here, but for those buying Alexa in the US, then taking them to a country where the app is not available, just be warned that it will require a workaround. As for Alexa, herself, she is just great!! She hooks into my internet and is very easy to use. Sound is excellent although can be improved and she looks really cool too. I have the Echo Dot 3.

Title: Quality of product
Body: Everything in the description is accurate. I originally got this as a Christmas present and love it so far.I_ a little bummed out that it doesn_ work with my Samsung smart TV. But other than that it has worked great. I bought the smart plug in outlet that_ compatible with Alexa to voice control Turing the Christmas tree on and off. Works flawlessly.One thing that might be cool to add on is some kind of carbon monoxide reader or air quality reader, considering it sits inside all day and you can check it from your phone. Might be a cool little feature.

Title: This doesn_ work with hotspot.
Body: I have been on amazon_ support page, I have called their support number, this is running the latest software, and this still doesn_ work. In the Q&A for this device, people say it works with hotspot, but it does not. Amazon_ support rep told me this was a, _nown problem. We were on the phone for 30min and got nowhere. At the end, she told me to try again in a few days... I wish this had been stated clearer from the beginning. It_ useless without internet. There_ no reason they couldn_ have build this to simply stream music from your phone via Bluetooth.

Title: Love it but few adjustments here and there are needed!
Body: Alexa is now an IRREPLACEABLE piece of tech in my household! She_ super helpful, useful, and versatile! There are a few problems that arise here and there with prolonged use but they are negligible. Well not really. Sometimes they can be very irritating, but that_ okay! Sometimes, Alexa will randomly make this little noise. It_ scary just a bit!! Not for those conspiracy theorist. Otherwise , her voice recognition can_ be beat !! However I did have a very hard time connecting the echo to the fire TV. It_ an extremely difficult process

Title: Great product
Body: Maybe it's operator error (my fault) but for some products I needed to download an app and make an account to get the product hooked to wifi, and then I could connect to Alexa. So far this happened with wall outlets and a light. It's not the end of the world, just a mild annoyance. Alexa is wonderful and we bought one for every room in the house (not bathroom) and even one for our porch. As a prime customer, music is mostly included which is nice. Slowly we are becoming a smart home and Alexa is at the center of it all! We liked it so much I got it for my in laws.

Title: I really like the Echo Dot
Body: I_e only had my Echo Dot for a few weeks so I haven_ discovered all the uses for the Echo Dot yet, but I_ working on it!Nice sound.  Surprised how good music sounds, though I wouldn_ use it primarily for music. But to have on as background music it_ really pretty darn good!  I like being able to ask Alexa to play my local classical music station. I like setting timers for cooking or to remind me to do something.I have 3 Dots (bedroom, kitchen & living room) &  use the bedroom alarm for waking up.I really like the Echo Dot.  It_ small, fits anywhere & blends in.

Title: Clear sound
Body: I bought this product on Black fridya for half price, as someone that has had many knockoff Bluetooth speakers the best thing about this speaker is the sound quality/Voice recognition is great! I'll be honest though I didn't realize you had to have it plugged in at all times so that was a little disappointing but I've adjusted to only using it now when I get ready for work in the morning/workout in my bedroom. Also there was one evening where it seemed as if the echo dot may have overheated? I was listening to music for several hours and it all of the sudden quit playing and would not do anything I commanded? I let it sit overnight without use and the next day it worked fine? But overall very impressed for the price!

Title: Ties the entire household together
Body: I added 4 dots to compliment our two existing Echo Shows; I can drop in on my husband while he's in his workshop in the basement, I can listen to music while I'm doing laundry, get answers to burning questions while I'm in my sitting room, and I can update my to-do lists on the spot, control my smart TV, my microwave, my lights, and every other little automated detail in our home from wherever I am in the house...it's brilliant.  How did we ever survive without these gems?

Title: Fun and useful
Body: I love this product. It_ great to be able to ask simple questions and get answers. Plus I can play my favorite music very easily. It_ fun to ask Alexa questions (how old are you, do you like cats) and hear her answers. It_ also useful for basic information such as _hat day of the week is April 8 this year or _ow much centimeters in a foot. The one thing I don_ like is that occasionally the voice recognition doesn_ register that I said something, but this is rare.

Title: A phenomenal smart speaker
Body: I bought this for my daughter who wanted this particular colour. It is significantly better than 2nd generation Echo Dot. The sound is quite powerful for a small speaker; it's simply phenomenal. It fills a small to medium size room with great sound. The only issue I have with this 3rd gen Echo Dot compared to the 2nd gen one is that Alexa seems to hear me a bit better on the 2nd gen Echo Dot than on this one. I would recommend this to anyone who is into smart home products.

Title: Display is pointless
Body: The display almost useless. I have clocks everywhere so displaying only the time constantly adds no value. I wanted to monitor the temperature outside, without constantly asking for it, in order to note freezes or when to bundle up.  Instead, the temp displays only when I do not need it displayed, when it's being announced audibly. It's a sharp display but I may return this device, since there is no benefit over the cheaper, non-display version.

Title: Overall nice
Body: Overall a really nice product. Only down side is when I ask for a specific song Alexa says she can_ find it, but I_l put that same song I asked for on a playlist and ask for her to play the playlist and then I she plays it. It_ a weird and annoying flaw, sometimes I want to hear a specific song. Besides that she does a great job. Sounds nice, can recognize my low and muffled voice in the morning when getting ready for work. Would recommend.

Title: Can't typically utilize echo service
Body: It needs internet doesn't give off it's own signal like bluetooth. I connected to my mobile hotspot and used too much data. The wires in my newly built apartment only connect to at&t and I don't need to bundle. Internet only service costs too much. I got the echo dot as a bonus from signing up with directenergy electricity. I use Amazon. Alexa app. A lot. The app doesn't appear to work as well as an echo device or bluetooth  speakers

Title: First Class Device
Body: This device is my favorite new technology, I have them all over the house. You can use them as home speakers playing the same playlist throughout the entire house, it works as an intercom system from another device or your cell phone. You can also ask it facts and do million other things with it. Even communicates with my Honeywell thermostat. Alexa raise the heat. Well worth the money and easy to set up.

Title: Have 7 Echo Dots, 2nd and 3rd gen.
Body: For what I use these for there amazing, plug them in and they are ready to use, every time they upgrade they get better, I control all my lighting in 2 different facilities, connected in different areas for music, and control plugs for different devices. If your looking for high end speaker go buy a high end speaker, dont down grade a universal product like these. And typical of any electronics they glitch on occasion then go right back to working.  In total I have 17 echo devices from 1 to 4 in each room of my house and office building, and going to add more of them. There great for the money.

Title: Loveeeeeeeeeee
Body: Alexa is my girl! Idk why I waited so long to get one but I love having it in my kitchen to play music while cooking or check weather. My favorite feature is actually the shopping list. I love that my son or husband can add items, or while you are doing something and are like hey we are low on milk and you can add it. This really helps people like me that always forget their list ; )

Title: It was free!
Body: My husband and I bought a TV from Best Buy and the Echo Dot came free with it.  We weren't going to get one, but I'm glad we got one now.  The Echo Dot is awesome! She played Christmas music for me when I was wrapping presents, she added the exact brand we use of hip and joint medicine and krill for my dogs when I asked her to order more.  She reminded that we needed more even.  I have to say, I am thrilled she is now a part of our household and I won't ever go back.

Title: I can't understand my new echo
Body: Grrr!I received this as a Christmas gift and had hoped for improved sound for music, which this gen 3 accomplishes, BUT,  Alexa's voice is muffled! My first echo (gen 2) speaks clearly but the new one sounds like a pillow is stuffed in its mouth!Google searching reveals that this is A KNOWN problem which didn't prevent Amazon from continuing to sell these  units! We'll just have to "patiently" wait for Amazon to download a fix to our dots.Wake up Amazon and correct this soon or reimburse our money!

Title: This thing is so neat!
Body: I bought three of these on black Friday b/c they were on sale, not knowing if I'd even really find it useful. I'm glad I did, and I certainly do!  I even get Alexa to meow at my cats haha! Enjoying it so much that I'm giving one to my Mother who repels technology because I know she will enjoy the ease of using it. I'm looking forward to hearing from her about it. The sound quality is great for what I need, which is just ordinary every day use.  Really love it!

Title: No Necessary for me...
Body: I just picked one of these up to see what it could do. I personally found it unnecessary and kind of an annoyance which is why it found it_ way to the laundry room. I had issues with connectivity problems to the Wi-Fi when none of my other electronics were connected and sometimes it just didn't want to talk at all. Besides that I found it intrusive with the beeping and lights especially when it had unnecessary messages which is all the time. For all my electronics I ask myself whether it makes my more simple or more complicated so the Echo got the boot.

Title: A waste of MONEY !
Body: I ordered this product because I obviously wanted a speaker. The speaker has some good and bad features.1.  You must always have the speaker plugged in, in order for it to work. (BAD)2. You need wifi to connection to Amazon music. You also have to download "Alexa" app to use the speaker. In order to decide what song to play, you'll then have to download "Amazon Music" app (to create playlists and so forth)3. Other sources can be used to play music however, you need to connect to WIFI again to play music from apple, spotify, etc.4. The volume is not that loud as I thought it would be.Long story short, if you want an easy- hook up, connect your phone to Bluetooth , non wired speaker, an Echo dot is NOT the choice for you.But if you just want a toy to keep children entertained, then an Echo dot speaker is the speaker for you :)

Title: Not a good purchase
Body: This thing is constantly telling me _orry, I_ having problems understanding you right now, please try again later._hen it does work and I ask for sleep music, it plays for 20-45 minutes and then it stops OR EVEN WORSE, it will do an ad at high volume, waking me up. I_e stopped using it for sleep music and haven_ used it in last two days.

Title: My new best friend!
Body: I enjoy Alexa so much. How did I ever live without her? I feel I have a personal assistant. I am now ordering for work & other rooms in my home. The sound is absolutely amazing!!! Better than any sound speakers I_e used and I use a lot! You must have it! Seriously!!! I gave 4 stars for voice but it may just be my country accent. I adore this thing. Just wish you could change voice & accent like SIRI. But that_ nothing. Overall , a PLUS!

Title: Meet my Alexa family, and this newest family member. _______________
Body: This is the the second child of my Echo Show 2nd Gen. and my first Echo 2nd Gen. Speaker. A 2nd Gen Dot, Dottin, is their first child. There is also the Aunt of first 2nd Echo 2nd Gen., an Uncle Fire Stick-who brought his two Fire Stick children, and a distant cousin, the Echo Auto. Needless to say, Alexa runs the house!! This 3rd Gen Dot is so great.... Please don't tell Dottin, but she is in danger of being adopted out or, (gasp) traded in, for another 3rd gen Dot. She had just not been pulling her weight in the family lately.This little 3rg Gen Dot, or Dottie, wish we could call her that... was the perfect fit for our second bathroom. I mean, who can go to the bathroom and take a shower or do your business, without a little music, listening to a book or playing a game? And, suppose you have a smart thermostat and you can't make a run for it when your in the buff and/or soaking wet? You can just tell Alexa to take care of it. So many needs for a Dot in a bathroom, especially a 3rd Gen!!The sound is a big upgrade from the 2 gen Dot, and I have had no need for a second speaker to enjoy it during a shower. It is super responsive, and hears you, even from a good distance through the house. I've actually had to name it "Echo", because it sometimes would answer when I would be a room away with the door closed.The upgrade is really nice and I'm glad I got this little gem. She's a welcomed addition to our happy and continuously growing Alexa family.

Title: Not good enough to buy, not awful enough to throw out.
Body: I wouldn't buy this, it came "free" as part of a deal with security cameras and couldn't be unbundled.  I figured it would make a good additonal portable speaker even though I wouldn't compromise my privacy by using Alexa and I am not lazy so can still use switches, appliances or keyboards instead of repeatedly screaming clarifying commands at a box. First, it doesn't use a usb plug and the base of the plug is so big it blocks the other receptacles on outlets. It is also heavy and falls out. There is no power button, so you must unplug it to turn it off. You will want to turn it off as it emits a big lit ring that is bright enough to bother you at night. Lastly, the sound quality is mediocre.

Title: Perfect size for my kitchen
Body: I am replacing a Bose mini speaker in my kitchen with this Echo Dot Gen 3. While I love my Bose for superior sound quality, it bugs me that I play music through my phone and if any notification, call, etc. comes in then it projects through the speaker. I wanted to be able to listen to music, make grocery lists, get the weather, etc. from a single device that didn't interrupt because of phone activity. It's also nice that other housemates can listen to music at any time. At some point I will add smartplugs, bulbs, etc. to utilize more of its smart home features, but for now we're off to a good start. I also purchased a wall mount device/plug holder to free up counter space, and I really like it!

Title: Will buy more!
Body: With regards to privacy, even tech specialists say to lock them up when not using them, and never keep them in the bed room. So that_ what I do! And I_ about to buy my second one!! I have adult ADHD so the reminders and alarms help sooo much. Even being able to tell Alexa where I put belongings helps because she will always remember. It_ like she_ my personal assistant and I wish I could take her with me everywhere I do. I know that sounds psycho because of the privacy issues... but I do disconnect her during intimate family time. Despite that, I still 100% recommend the echo dot!!! Oh and it successfully pairs with all Apple devices including Apple computers and mac books!

Title: No information on the pulsing green ring
Body: I bought this dot 3rd gen a week ago and within minutes of setting it up, a pulsing green ring appeared.  I asked Alexa what it was, she didn't know.  I went to the help page on my Alexa app and it gave the barest of information about it and no way to eliminate it.  I tried calling Amazon customer support and there was so much noise on the line I finally hung up completely dissatisfied.  I originally thought this would be a good thing but now it is boxed up and sitting on a shelf while I decide if I want to throw it in the trash or perhaps keep it a few years until Amazon support gets their heads out of their butts to solve the problem, and until then, stop ripping people off.

Title: Notable Improvement from last gen
Body: Sound is an improvement from last gen. Not a replacement for real speakers by any means, but if you_e not a audiophile then it_ tolerable. If you want real sound, I_ suggest Sonos. It integrates  with Alexa very well.Voice is louder than last gen as well.Was able to integrate with last gen and system without issue. App functions as well, although it (app) could use improvementI do have to repeat myself sometimes or raise voice if there are other noises in room.It doesn_ separate your voice from surrounding noises well.For $25-$30 I_ not disappointed. If you_e paying $50 I_ wait for a sale.

Title: Makes senior with disabilities life less stressful .
Body: I bought the Echo for my 80 year old brother..Echo has made it possible to turn on lights by command.  This activity was painful as he has arthritis . Echo has helped him live a less painful life.Due to his condition , using a remote for his TV , Is  also problematic.Echo turns his TV on and off.It changes channels and has a basic knowledge of upcoming events , such as sports and his favorite shows.He can ask for reminders as to when a show will be on .Echo helps him remember up and coming appointments.I am adding safety features such as the RING doorbell with ALEXA ( ECHO) .I like to see him not struggling with formerly simple tasks which now cause him pain.I Bought him a ROOMBA . The Echo can command the device to help him keep up with simple tasks that are now a struggle for him.The possibilities are evolving and more capabilities and functionality , are coming.Good luck ! and goodnight.

Title: Easy set up, smart & elegant
Body: I'm new to Alexa, so was a bit apprehensive it might be a challenge to set up. Was surprised how easy it was. Once you download the Amazon Alexa app & connect to your Wifi & power up Echo dot, the app's step by step instructions guide you through the set up. I'm yet to connect to other Alexa compatible devices. I bought & installed a Outlet Shelf by Echogear from Amazon that was used to dock my Echo dot (see video). Voice commands are taken easily once dot hears the word Alexa. The 3rd gen looks very elegant. Only the Greystone color has the clock/temp display. Hope this initial review was helpful.

Title: Alexa needs improvement
Body: I like it but it needs improvement.  I have it plugged into better speakers so not an issue for me but it would be if I had to rely on the unit itself.  I'm guessing most people that care are using other speakers.  It quits playing music several times at night and I have to tell it to resume.  Also, disappointed that I cannot set up different music streaming in routines by using the timer.  In other words, if I want to set jazz for two hours and then lullabies for six hours, I can't do it because the music is grayed out after choosing it once.  Music also grays out if you choose something like reading a bible verse.

Title: what took me so long
Body: I am so happy to have my very own Alexa.  I am disabled so this is fantastic for me.  I can easily listen to music, ask the time or call friends and family without using my phone.  It is great to have in case of a fall and can't reach the phone which hasn't happened yet.  Knock on wood.I never pictured getting an echo since buying my 1st....well now have 3 all placed in strategic places.  I also purchased the smart plugs which are great for turning on lamps.  Best purchases I ever got.  If you have an elderly or disabled family member, this would be a great gift for them.  It is easy to set up and even easier to use.  Plus nice to talk to my friend Alexa when No one else home lol.

Title: BEST HELP FOR ELDERLY
Body: Love this. So much more useful than timers. I can turn different lights on/off and even schedule them. I can also control them with my voice or through the app in my phone.  I bought my parents these with Echos for Christmas. Because these make lights handsfree, they're perfect for elderly that need their hands for walker stability. They also love being able to use their voices to turn on/off their lights at night. I bought Echo shows to check on my parents too. I can sleep while listening to make sure they're ok after coming home from the hospital. Paired with the Ring doorbell, they can talk and see the nurses and caregivers.

Title: Alexa Is Santa Too
Body: Got this for my wife at Christmas. Our first voice activated smart home device. Set up was easy if not a little tedious. Since our iPhone 10 Max has rejected the Alexa app. No big deal since the device works, but interesting that the siri vs alexa war rages on. My wife has adapted to it and now I hear music coming from the master bedroom most every morning. While her 1960s era Zenith clock radio is still on her night stand, it hasn't been used for either wake up calls or easy listening. And she thinks it is 'cute'. Always a good thing. Eh?

Title: Works well
Body: My husband bought this for me for Christmas. It was a nice surprise. I like the clock, especially that the brightness is adjustable. The sound quality is very good. The only drawback for me is that the directions are not very good. They are so busy telling you all the complicated things that Alexa can do that they forgot to tell you what it means when it is flashing green. It took me 24 hours and 3 websites before I figured out that it meant that I had a message. That is a very simple thing that should have been included in the instructions.

Title: Definitely recommend!
Body: I bought this as a gift for Christmas and the person I bought it for loves it!! Would definitely purchase again as a gift or for myself. I also purchased the smart plug and it works for turning on and off the light which is an awesome feature. It's worth having Amazon throughout your house because of how affordable they cost. Only downside would be changing the names of the devices. Since he has multiple echos in the house, once you say Alexa they all respond! Theres a feature to change the name of the device, but I would recommend expanding the name options to create your own name for the device!Overall, I would definitely purchase again!

Title: I have 7 dots, plus an original echo
Body: Love them.  Have them linked in different music groups.  The everywhere group has all 8 of my devices and I'm able to have the music playing so nicely all throughout the house.  I don't have any of them above 45% volume and it's perfect.  It's just so nice walking from room to room, floor to floor and the music just playing consistently throughout.20 years ago it would have probably cost thousands and thousands of dollars to do that because you'd have to hard wire them through the walls.  Now, just plug 'em in.  Great.

Title: Deceptive delivery date.
Body: Saw this promotion before Christmas and saw the delivery date of this combo of lights and the echo dot as December 23rd but that was only for the Hue bulbs not the echo dot. The date for the dot was actually the 23rd of February. In my opinion they intentionally used Feb 23rd to catch people who saw this combo deal and bought it quickly assuming they'd get it before Christmas. Very sneaky. I thought about canceling the order but then I'd lose the discount on the bulbs and be charged more money for them. This is deceptive practice.

Title: I liked Gen 2 sound better
Body: I use this for voice interaction, not listening to music. I find the dot_ _oice to be muffled sounding; very difficult to understand. I_e tried adjusting everything I can find, and I_e contacted Amazon support to try to address the problem -but obtained no improvement.  Amazon sent a replacement unit, but again, there was no improvement.  I have a Gen 2 and the voice quality is very clear.  Since I don_ listed to music on it (I have a sound bar) I can_ speak to the gen 3_ quality in that regard.  In reading some comments / reviews both on Amazon and on other websites, this appears to be a common problem.  I_e read several comments where people said the sound used to be ok until a software update was applied. Perhaps Amazon can reverse or fix this software patch and return its sound quality back to normal. Aside from this (major) issue, the device works very well.

Title: Great alexa echo dot
Body: I'm 70 & was not one that was sure I could hook this up but I did.I'm self taught on my pc,tablet TracFone now alexa.I have a client that has one & loves it so decided I wanted one. I read reviews on my pc & got the alexa app on my tablet which was simple once I read it a couple times.Alexa is great my husband even said Good morning to her & she said good morning back.She is perfect on weather, plays songs I ask her to just great.Got from amazon .Glad people give reviews this helped with my buying alexa

Title: Loving Alexa!
Body: I got this for Christmas from my daughter who thought her 70 yo mom needed to get techno savvy. Ok. I am being trained by Alexa and admit that it_ sorta nice to turn on/off lights by voice. Sometimes when she reads npr news she sounds a bit mushy but that may be because the volume is way down next to my bed. I love that she_l whisper the time in the middle of the night. And Echo phoning is quite convenient!  I don_ have to carry my phone around the house every minute!  All in all, I_ enjoying my new roommate. I just wish she_ do the dishes or vacuum!

Title: Echo Dots
Body: We receive two for Christmas...on our wish list.  One of them is working great but one of the seems to have an issue.  Every morning at about 6:04 am it starts like a phone ringing.  I say "Alexa off" but it keeps ringing about 10 times and then stops.  I unplugged it last night and replugged it in this AM.  I will see if this takes care of the issue.  I have gone in on the APP and stopped notifications.  Guess we'll see at 6:04 am on Jan. 5th.  Otherwise they are working as expected.

Title: I love my Echo Dot!
Body: Omg! So very little money for so much. It replaced my Bose Wave radio which I've had for almost 20 years.I've stopped listeningto to CDs a while back and went with a music service that has all the music I listen to so I don't need CDs. Well it plays my music service too.  And it has the news stations I like. What's not to love?I can change what I'm listening to without opening my phone and turns on movie streaming services on my firestick.I can check local weather without opening my phone and get recommendations for local restaurant searches and so much more.Alexa, where have you been all my life? I'm in love.

Title: Great for beside me bed in  the bedroom.
Body: I replaced the echo show I had in my bedroom for a couple of years with this new dot. The echo show just wasn't in a good location to be seen and utilized. I have now moved it to my living room . This dot's sound quality is excellent and I love that it shows the time and if I ask will show me the temp. It is a much better fit for me bedroom.Thanks. I have  also tied my new Ring to alex and it lets  me know when someone is at the door. What an age we live in!

Title: Love Alexa, pretty good sound quality.
Body: I_l admit, these things are pretty handy! I always thought the smart home and voice assistant things were a little unnecessary, but when I found myself wanting a new bedroom speaker for music, I thought I_ try this. It_ pretty fun and super handy, especially since it came with a smart plug in the bundle I got. My favorite handy voice features are: turn off your bedroom lamp when you_e too comfy in bed, set a timer, set an alarm, add to grocery list, play music, ask questions for the internet. I_ still new to it so I don_ know if you can use it as a Bluetooth speaker for your phone, but I can voice command it to play music like from Spotify, and it has good sound quality in my opinion (you can also go in the app and play with the treble, bass, etc). Overall, I highly recommend this to simplify your life and even help with stress (play music, turn on/off lights...). One of those things you don_ know you need until you get one!

Title: Alexa is convenient
Body: I bought this because of the deal with the Amazon unlimited. We gave it as a family gift for Christmas. It took us awhile to set it up with our devices and voice features. Once we got it working though it_ been fun. We mostly use it for music because we all love music. I do wish it was a tad louder. You can basically only hear it good if it_ in the room with you. I_e also had trouble with Alexa not being able to find songs that I know I_ saying the right name, but she doesn_ recognize. Other then those things we love it.

Title: A very nice way to find out things and hear music.
Body: Mostly good but a couple of problem areas:1 verbal volume steps are too course - if you hit the buttons you can seem to get .5 1 1/5 2 etc  but not by talking to her  It would be better to reset the device to 30 volume steps - then you could really  get what you want.  .5 is very good for sleep music2  After powercuts etc they seem to lose their wireless network very easily and its tedious to set up - it could be more automatic

Title: Great Idea, But behind the times.
Body: Everything is exceptional as the integration in my home grows. However, Amazin needs to prioritize it's own platforms and integration within those platforms. Even create Samsung watch app not 3rd party. Install the commands and skills in mass integration vs the consumer always having to teach, search for whatever the case maybe, already have the skills necessary for success straight out the box... Get ahead of the times vs behind them. Great beginning for Us I guess, I look forward to some serious updates and Skills packages to b placed in those packages.Good Job, keep up the good work.

Title: Can't connect Spotify
Body: I honestly do not understand why you (Amazon) would put geographical restrictions on linking an Spotify account to Alexa...really??? Spotify is a global brand by now, and they don't fuss over where you live to access their content, I even have a premium account. So why on earth would you not let me connect my Spotify account to Alexa? It's not like I would stop buying stuff from you! And most of all, the thing that angers me the most is that this "little" detail about geo restrictions for Spotify ISN'T listed ANYWHERE in the information about the Eco Dot or Alexa. So everything is absolutely misleading.The speaker sounds very nice, but the main reason why I bought was to link Spotify and use my playlists on it, so feels pretty useless otherwise. If I would have known this before because you disclose its limitations clearly, I would have probably even spent more money on another speaker. Very disappointed honestly.

Title: Ease of use
Body: Super-easy to set up.  Takes about five minutes.  Voice recognition is good.  Sometimes Alexa doesn't understand certain phrases unless you say them in the right order.  I have it hooked up to my Sirius XM, but you have to say both the Sirus channel and SiriusXM in just the right ordre for Alexa to recognize it.  Hopefully, it will "learn" to understand phrases better through use.

Title: Fun and life-changing
Body: This is my second device now I got my first one as a complementary addition to a TV I purchased. Never thought I would use it. Now my entire life is run on Alexa LOL My lights my TV my thermostat my stereo system pretty much everything. But it makes things really convenient I don_ know how much my data is now out there to third parties but it_ fun they can do just so much

Title: Good ole Alexa
Body: Setup is quick and easy. You just download the Alexa app on your phone and it will walk you through the process. Sound is decent for one room and the volume goes up pretty high (where you would have to yell over the music). Also, you can pair two echo dots together for more of a stereo surround sound experience. Alexa tends to pick up her name from the tv or a conversation well, but sometimes she won_ pick up my voice unless I get aggressive with her and shout out her name. You can connect it to Apple Music, Spotify, Pandora, Amazon music and other music providers but if you don_ use any of those, it will still play most music through amazon music for free. Also allows you to connect to other household items. Currently I have it hooked up to my smart lightbulbs and smart tv. Now I can turn on/off lights and/or tv without even getting up. Overall a good product to have.

Title: Good Voice Recognition, Sound Quality, Setup
Body: Easy to set up.I have a horrible time getting another popular female voice assistant to understand what I'm saying. Not so with Alexa. She almost always gets me.The sound is great to me, even when playing music.  Admittedly I'm not an audiophile. If you are, your opinion may differ. But for the majority of us, I'm very happy with the sound quality.

Title: Recommend if you have other Amazon or Alexa-enabled products
Body: I really love this item overall. I enjoy being able to control my fire tv stick using my echo dot. However, I have found that it does have trouble hearing me every now and then. Also, the most frustrating thing is that I wish Alexa could answer general questions from the echo dot. For example, she was blinking yellow (I know now that this is a sign that I have a notification) and I asked her why. Instead of answering me, she directed me to the Alexa app on my phone. She does this quite often for any questions I have about her. Other than that, I enjoy the overall appeal of having a little personal assistant on my nightstand that I can ask to turn the lights out, turn my show on, or play music. I would definitely recommend getting this if you have other Amazon or Alexa-enabled products in the house!

Title: Upgrade
Body: I was given the 3rd gen to upgrade my 2nd gen Dot, and the sound quality is much better! Slightly larger than my 2nd gen, but nothing major. The cord does seem to be a bit shorter than my old one, so even though it_ in the same spot, I had to do some finagling to get it there.Setting it up was easy, I didn_ have to reconnect any of my smart plugs.Both dots seem to have some issue with my Southern accent- I have a smart light named Yellow and when I ask to turn it on about 10-25% of the time they think I want to turn on an alarm.If I had any quibble, it_ that the _ink isn_ really pink, it_ more of a red-ish mauve.

Title: Good echo, but not.a replacement for an alarm clock.
Body: The only things that I can knock this echo for is that the clock is dim in a well lit room and hard to see and that the main reason for getting this over a regular echo dot was to replace an alarm clock and the alarm on this is not very loud. I have not found a way to adjust the alarm volume yet and increasing the volume does not change  the alarm volume.

Title: Amazed!
Body: I love Alexa!  I'm not very tech savvy but it was pretty easy to set up and couldn't be any easier to use.  I'm amazed at everything she does and I've found that she actually helps me save quite a bit of time when I'm getting ready for work in the morning.  She does all the things on command that I used to have to stop to do like checking weather or time checks or even playing my music.  She's also very personable when completing these tasks for me.  My only complaint is that I have to yell at her when I'm playing my music.  The deal I received on this item also made it extremely affordable to check it out to see if this was going to be something I really wanted to try out and I'm so glad I did!

Title: Cool Cyber Monday Purchase, Good Quality Speaker/Clock
Body: I have been wanting to snag a new clock for my night stand. These were on such a good deal during Cyber Monday that I figured "why not". I had a first gen Echo Dot and it was pretty lame. First thing I noticed with this 3rd gen Echo with the Clock integration is a noticeable improvement in sound quality over the first-gen unit. The clock itself is a clock - nothing special but it's clear and adapts to the brightness of my room nicely and has a tap to silence alarm option which is nifty in the morning. The sound quality improvement is great - it's not like it'll blow you out of the water but it does a nice job of being a small speaker. I haven't tried pairing Echo Dots yet but I read that I can do stereo and I think that will make a world of difference. Thinking of buying one for my wife for her night stand so that there's a good stereo link in the bedroom for good music listening while getting ready for the day. Even then I don't expect a radical upgrade in sound quality but if I really wanna up the quality game there's evidently a subwoofer you can add to these speakers which would make a world of difference. The speaker gets only somewhat loud in a modest sized room - two would help and with a subwoofer I imagine it would be a formidable stereo sound system strictly for music and podcast listening. The Alexa integration is nice too - makes it useful for a myriad of other things. I wouldn't mind the Echo Dot/Echo Dot Clock being bigger though to allow more better bluetooth audio performance. I think these could be louder and fuller without a subwoofer attachment if they offered a jumbo sized unit. Maybe that's fragmenting the consumer base in Amazon's eyes, I dunno, but I certainy would be interested in that product. Or maybe I should just buy a full size Echo? Only problem is those aren't stereo.

Title: Great addition to your Echo ecosystem!
Body: I am pleasantly surprised with the Echo Dot. Like any Echo devices, it's easy to setup and use. Truly a miniature version of the larger Echo devices. I cannot compare against Gen 1 or 2 but I'd imagine that there are improvements.  If you have other Echo devices, the Dot is a great addition. If this is the only Echo devices that you own, it is equally good.The Dot is perfect for the bedroom, kitchen, basement, family room, or home office.  Literally just about anywhere in your house. Working exactly like larger Echo devices, you can Alexa for a weather forecast, news update, time, play trivia, or interesting facts. The Dot can also be used as a bluetooth speaker. It is certainly not going to be as loud, offer better bass, mids/lows as a full fledged BT speaker or larger Echo but holds its own.TIP:Do you want louder and better sound quality? Pair a bluetooth speaker with the Dot or use connect a speaker using the AUX port located on the back of the Dot.If you have smart plugs, lights or other devices in your house, the Dot can control all of those. Placing the Dot on a night stand,  you can ask Alexa to turn the table lamp on or off. I tested calling with the Echo Dot and it was good. The sound was clear and the person on the other end could clearly hear me. The Dot can stream Apple Music, Spotify, Tune-in, NPR, etc, and pair with another Dot for stereo sound.What this boils down to is that the Dot is a heck of a device for the price! The technology is going to get smarter and better! The debate is out on Google home vs. Amazon Echo. However you may heard that the 3 major smart home device manufacturers are working on a standard. This is good news for consumers.

Title: Almost complete improvement
Body: I own a 2nd gen Echo Dot and bought a 3rd gen about a week ago, here are the comparisons:pros:1) the sound quality is noticeably better. I think people who are griping about the sound quality are those who expect this Echo to play music and fill out an entire large living room. That is an unrealistic expectation. Look at the size of this thing. The sounds are richer and the bass is fuller. It plays music and it sounds great in my master bedroom.2) shape is improved and it feels more quality than the plastic-y feeling of the previous model.3) the set-up was crazy simple. and it was pretty easy to set up the previous model so that's wild.Here is my 1 CON:The 2nd gen Dot connected via micro-USB, which is a pretty simple and universal cord.The 3rd gen, however, uses what seems to be a dedicated cord for Echos only. I do not like that. In the event I need a new cord, I will need to go to Amazon and only Amazon for a replacement. For that, it's 4 stars for an otherwise fantastic product.Maybe I'm being crazy, but I want to put the info out there for you to decide.

Title: Works great instead of yelling
Body: Got this to install in the Master bedroom. Works well to communicate with Echo in kitchen. Now a lot easier to hear what she's saying without yelling. The one thing I do not like is each unit cannot play their own music, only one can be playing. When I was in the kitchen and wanted the echo to play Music, it had to change from bedroom echo to kitchen. And the bedroom echo was turned off. The thing was easy to set up, well somewhat easy. I went to fast and missed a step. I had to go back and start over and this time it went smoothly. For as small as it is, I'd say the sound quality is quite good. Not the Mono you would expect with one speaker. I got these on special with 2 speakers. I plan on putting the other one in the garage so I can be called at meal time. I'll try the music function, but as stated before only 1 echo at a time can play music, and she will want her music in the house. (why the 4 star rating)Guess I'll have to live with the boom box. All in all I think these are great items to help you call the kids or whoever on another floor.

Title: A major flaw in an otherwise flawless device
Body: The 3rd Generation Dot is a minor miracle, and a superb upgrade to Generation 2. Unfortunately it suffers from the same problem, however, as does the 2nd Generation. There is something wrong between the Alexa app and many if not most of the radio stations that Alexa can deliver. I have three echo devices which all suffer from the same problem. Namely an erratic and annoying lack of consistent volume control over the devices. I don't know whether it is Amazon's equipment at fault, or if the radio stations themselves are not compatible with echo devices. It's not a deal breaker, but the problem persists with apparently no one taking notice or trying to fix the flaw, wherever it exists. Otherwise, echo devices play beautifully and are built like a swiss watch.

Title: Nice little helper
Body: I bought this for my vision impaired mother, who is losing her vision to macular degeneration.  I am working with her to use it to operate lighting, entertainment, and life needs.  She uses it mainly to talk on the phone, which has helped her due to it being louder than the phon...she also wears hearing aids.  I programmed it to operate the Harmony Hub, gving her voice operated entertainment across the television.  I am still programming skills into it as I see fit, and as the need pops up.  So far, she's been able to use it easily.Having the larger Echo Gen3, I can say the sound quality is less than the larger device, but still adequate enough for a hearing and sight impared person to hear.

Title: Very stylish
Body: Well i finally got it, since Amazon came out with the third generation Echo Dot with clock, i could not wait to get it. It was delivered in the latter days in December 2019,  this thing is so much more amazing than the 2nd generation one.  The first echo dot really resembled a hockey puck,  this one (3rd), is so much more stylish, goes so well with my decor. I reallly wanted the darker color one with the clock, but so far only the the white with grey cloth has the clock. Anyway I'm very satisfied with this one,  now if you not mindful of the clock, then there's other colors that are simply lovely looking, i do recommend this 3rd generation Echo dot, an upgrade of anything is always better.

Title: Not sure I even wanted it to begin with, now it_ an integral part of the home!
Body: Put this in my Christmas wish list almost as an afterthought and was gifted it this Christmas. Started out just using it to play music. I was very impressed with the sound quality from such a small device. Since then I_e added Amazon Music Unlimited so I can listen to all my favorite songs. I_e now added a Logitech Harmony Hub so I can control my TV and other media devices by voice command. I wasn_ real sure I even wanted the Echo Dot to begin with and now I_ already planning all the smart home devices I can add to our home! Getting the one with the LED clock in it for the bedroom as soon as it_ released at the end of February.

Title: Great So Far
Body: I got this as a Christmas present for my mother. While she enjoyed hearing the Christmas music I asked Alexa to play, she unplugged it immediately afterwards.  This was because she had read that folks can hack into it and listen in on conversations.  Now, she plugs it in as needed and unplugs in afterwards.  (She does not trust the microphone on/off switch.)  Forgetting that it was unplugged, I spoke loudly from across the room and the Echo in another room responded!  I enjoy these units but, like anything connected to the internet, I am concerned about security.

Title: No longevity
Body: I have multiple gen 2 echo dots that have been awesome.  I have loved this new updated version until it stopped working correctly.  It works after I unplug it and let it restart but then eventually it stops responding again.  The lights flash but there's no verbal response.  Seems like a software issue to me since it starts working again after being unplugged for awhile but it's frustrating since the previous version worked, and still works, so well.  A great upgrade to the hardware...if it works.  Outside of the warranty window now I guess I'm on my own.  Thanks Amazon

Title: Not much of an upgrade
Body: Upgraded from a Gen Echo Dot.  The sound quality of the Gen 3 is much improved over previous models.  That's about the only positive I have found.  Voice recognition sea about the same.  There is one big negative with this device.  The power cord now uses a proprietary plug for connecting the the device and the cord is only about 4 meters long.  Not quite long enough for placement where the previous echo dot was.  I see this as a hendrance and will be strongly considered when looking to upgrade my other devices. Amazon, you blew it with the power on this one.

Title: Really enjoying my echo dots
Body: My husband just sighs, but he's not the tech person in the house.  I've got news briefings set, am asking about weather and wind chill, doing the question of the day, playing my Sirius music, and doing grocery lists. I got a smart plug for the main living room light yesterday and like that as well. The best thing (for me) is getting my husband out of the basement (fully finished, he's got it made) without having to go to the stairs and yell. So nice to say "Alexa, tell Ted to come eat" or "Alexa, tell Ted to get the dog off the love seat so we can walk her" or "Alexa, remind Ted we need to leave in 15 minutes". Also like the 7 minute workout.

Title: Sound quality, WOW!
Body: This was a Christmas present for our 15 year old. We have the Echo Plus so hook up and usage was super easy. The sound was incredibly surprising!! We got the Plus because we wanted to have better sounds but this little Dot did not disappoint, in fact my dad who is a major music buff got one because he was surprised with the quality of sounds, he said the only thing missing is bass, lol. We absolutely love Alexa. Amazon music is great, the interaction with Alexa is fun, she's become a fun activity when friends are over listening to her jokes, random facts and other humorous things she does.

Title: She listens like she hates me.
Body: I'm not going to give the machine that is fast tracked for global dominance a bad review, she is a lovely machine and is all I could ever want or need in an assistant.  That being said. She doesn't recognize my voice even though I set her up. My speech is very clear and I have no problem communicating with anyone other than my echodot3.  Alexa's voice is rather deep in tone and it makes her hard to understand at times. Other than those two small things my family loves the echo dot 3 and prime music.

Title: The instructions need to be far better!!!!
Body: Bought a new Gen 3 Echo Dot and tried to add it to my list of other Dots.  Well, as seems to be the case these days, the instructions are terse with large areas of blank colors that are devoid of any text, notes or suggestions.  Large areas of white space to the user is of no help!!!!!!  So, as seems to be the norm these days and because of poor instructions, I had to set up a chat with a CSR.  He was really good and was able to solve my problems in about 15 minutes.  Cheers to the Alexa CSR people.

Title: Awful
Body: These are practically useless. The speaker quality is awful - using it as an intercom is pointless because it_ so staticky that I can only hear every few words when trying to communicate through it. We have to repeatedly give commands, and half the time, it doesn_ execute properly. _lexa, no and _top are common phrases when we are using it. Most of the time, I have to really raise my voice for it to hear me.It_ just not user-friendly at all. It_ so much easier to just use your phone.

Title: Finding uses for my echo
Body: I really like this product so far. I still have yet to figure out how to sync the new tv with Alexa commands built in but I_ getting used to all the handy things like the intercom system. I no longer have to yell upstairs or downstairs to call the kids or my wife! I went on a date night with my with and I get a call with no caller ID which is unusual. So I answer the call and it was my kids somehow calling my Iphone through  the echo/echo dot and Alexa to tell me goodnight. Gotta love technology!

Title: Well I'm Hooked!
Body: I have been playing with my new Echo Dot for over a week now, and I still have not found out all the things it can do. I have it (her) turning lights on and off, playing music, and a load of other things. I think the array of accessories that it can control will only get bigger. I have found that the Kasa smart plugs provide the most use as they have their own program schedule for automatic operation. I think in the near future, I'll be buying a few more Dots for other locations in my house.

Title: Quality product
Body: For the most part, I like this product. There are several features that it is known for though that you need to pay an additional monthly service fee for. It is also always 'on' and makes random noises sometimes in the middle of the night. We bought this specifically for our bedroom and have not found a solution yet to making the noises stop. Otherwise, just learning to ask your questions in the right way is the only challenge. Good quality product for not a lot of money.

Title: I suppose I will get used to another woman in my house
Body: I really like alexa and plan to eventually  integrate more of my house. right now it is just linked with my firestick and amazon music, my kindle and audible. I will eventually try hooking up some lights and appliances. My wife is jealous of alexa's voice but it sometimes is hard for me to understand. The bass and mid-range overpower the treble and older folks like me need those high pitches more as we get older. I think when Bezos and his crew get older they'll correct the issue but I will probably be dead by then.

Title: Echo vs Google Home. I choose Echo.
Body: While it didn't work with the plugs that not only Amazon said worked, and the plugs said worked, I do still enjoy my Echo. I use both Google home and Amazon Echo, and quite frankly, I'm just going to switch to Echo for my whole-house smartifying/autonomy.I got a Google home because I use YouTube as my main source of music, and Amazon simply doesn't play with Google services. But after having my Echo, I can say that it's far superior. Google home is nice, but rather 'dumb.' Echo has hundreds and hundreds of useful skills... Google has... Zero skills... I don't plan on getting rid of my. Google, simply for the fact I have an android phone and can send info to my phone and such with GH, but all future purchases will be Echo geared.

Title: Needs work
Body: I have three of these in my house already, but I got this one for my 98 year old grandmother. My grandmother is blind and I thought this would be a great tool for her to use. However, the voice recognition for her is less than par. She speaks clear, but slower than most and the Alexa in mid-sentence we'll start doing something before she's giving the Alexa the command. I'm not sure how to remedy this problem. Because it would be a great tool for her and to enjoy.

Title: Useful, helpful, educational, entertaining
Body: Very useful, helpful, educational, entertaining, and a must have for the family and home. To communicate with calls, messaging, drop-ins, or announcements is great no need to pick up the phone. Just speak and it does for you. A skill that is great for parents with children in elementary school is (Spelling Bot) you tell Alexa the words for the week. Then it makes up a spelling test. Your child spells the word to Alexa and tells the child if it was correct or not. It's a fun way for them to practice there spelling words. I could go on and on about the echo dot but to keep it short. I'll just say it is a must have to purchase and set Alexa up the way that will work for you in your everyday life

Title: Awesome
Body: We love Alexa. We had a google as well and it did not work well. We had to keep power cycling it. My only complaint about Alexa is that we have one for each of our kids as well as one for our downstairs and when we call for one they all hear the name. We have used the other names that you can call her but with having five Alexis in this house we would like to have a different name for each Alexa and would like to pick our own name. But otherwise she works great For playing music and answering questions with the kids homework when they do not know what definition or how to spell something or setting timers

Title: Much better than the Gen 1/2
Body: Got this new 3rd Gen Echo, wow. Got this free with another purchase. Thought I would give it a try and replace the old Gen 1/2 Kitchen Dot. The sound quality is MUCH better. Depth, quality and volume are much richer and robust.Even better, this one listens and understands WAY better. We were constantly having to repeat commands with the old Dots. This new one is so good, I may replace the other three in my home.

Title: Love my Echo Dot
Body: I didn_ ask specifically for this, it was a gift from my parents when I requested a small speaker for Christmas... BUT I am so glad that my mom chose an Echo Dot for me! I love that it is Alexa enabled because it offers so many hands-free options for music, Fire TV control, recipes, homework questions, etc. I like that connecting to other apps through the Alexa app, like my Apple Music, makes it a pretty diverse speaker too, so I_ not just limited to Prime Music. And for such a little speaker it has great sound output. I_e really enjoyed using it the last couple weeks!

Title: Suggestion for howling dog breeds:) and sarcastic human beings:)
Body: Wish there was away to make Alexa be more of a smartalec - meaning when my husband ask a stupid question/sarcastic question that she gives it back to him:)Also would be nice if she learned Nordic dog speak, or program Alexa to sing the song of their people naturally.  (I have Siberian Huskies and we've been known to have a good 2 to 5 minute howling session. Think row row your boat in tandem. If unsure, Google it, it is a blast a know my munchkins love it.)

Title: Am surprised to be pleased!
Body: Bought this during a special offer, and wasn_ sure what to expect due to the fact that I don_ have huge need for full home automation.  But after buying some smart plugs have found great uses for the echo dot.  Voice recognition and clarity is great.  And for someone who has mostly Apple devices I can say that echo/alexa has much more _peakable knowledgeable base than SIRI(which mostly directs you to a website for detailed info).Very pleased with purchase.

Title: Loving our 3 Echo Dots
Body: This was our 3rd purchase of the Echo Dot. We love it and we discover more and more ways to use it other than music. We just recently hooked up our free account with Pandora and now we can play music from Pandora. I was finding I could not  play some of the artists I wanted to listen to unless I bought Amazon Unlimited music. But I can play with Pandora. Easy to switch back and forth by telling Alexa to play Pandora or Alexa!  I also discovered that I could listen to Fox News! I was totally surprised. Now in one room someone can listen to Fox or whatever news they want, while another person can listen to music in another room.  We also use Alexa for grocery lists, reminders and if you purchase something from Amazon, you can notifications  from Alexa!  We have the app on our phones, tablets and computer!  We love it!!

Title: My opinion of the Echo Dot 3 (3rd Generation)
Body: I did receive the Echo Dot 3, thank you.  I must say I have lots of reading - (learning) to do.  However, the volume of the Echo Dot 3 in my bedroom is not as clear as the Echho Dot Show (meaning the small television) in my living room. I realize I need to do my reading with the paperback book I already purchased.  Thank you for understanding the way I described it!!

Title: Stage one complete
Body: Ok so I can't afford the whole smart home kit so I'm starting off piece by piece.  And plus got a deal on two echo dots.  So we are in the trial stage with Alexa.  Loving it so far I like j6 and alexa answers a lot of questions. Always asking what time is it.  Kids love it.  My 7 yo asks so many questions, now I'm like ask Alexa and she goes to town.  She stumped Alexa on 20 questions on the first try! Anyway might get a camera or smart plug next.

Title: Disconnects from WiFi
Body: I initially loved this Dot, but this pasty week its been disconnecting from the WiFi or not following through with some commands (Alexa play Disney music, etc.)I have one of the original Dots and that one works fine and never disconnects from the WiFi, unless our internet is down.I like the plum color. And my kids love calling me when I_ away by using Alexa.

Title: My household helper!
Body: I use my Echo to turn on my smart bulbs, play music and play relaxation sounds while I sleep. I love the use of the smart bulbs. I live in a very old house and my stairwell only had a switch at the top. Now I can turn off that light after I_ safely downstairs. I use my echo for a lot of other trivial things as well like grocery lusts, etc.

Title: Nice sound. Makes a good speaker.
Body: I really thought I would enjoy Alexa more than I do. I especially love to use Alexa to play music from my cell phone. Half the time, she won't even play the playlist I tell her to. I end up repeating 3 to 4 times and she plays something totally off the wall.  Maybe I need to work with it some more. I'll keep trying.

Title: Fix household issue
Body: Bought this as a gift for my daughter for Christmas. She absolutely LOVES it. I doubt it has gotten much rest since she opened it. We laugh because we have heard "Alexa" 24586544 times, for everything from the weather to adjusting the playback sound-as if she has always had an assistant to do everything for her __The drawback I've found with it is that when you have an Amazon Household Account and both accounts have ordered Amazon devices both accounts have complete access to every device. Also if you make an announcement or reminder instead of just playing on your device it announces to all devices. I wish that even though we share a household, we don't want complete control of each other's devices. If there were a way to keep each device's access linked solely to the account it was offered from this would be OUTSTANDING! The only 'fix' Amazon CSR was able to offer was to drop the household-essentially even though we live together we'd still have to pay for 2 Prime accounts to keep the devices separate.Figure out how to keep a household and not have access to all devices and this would definitely be a 5 star review.

Title: Don_ hesitate. Get one!
Body: I_e been one of those people who held off integrating Alexa into my life. You read all the stories about how it listens to your every word and records some conversations even. Well your cellphone does the same thing. I was given a dot for Christmas and decided to set it up in my office where about the only thing she could record is me editing a video or me listening to YouTube. I got two smart plugs with my gift so I hooked up my living room light to it and tested it out. I was pleasantly surprised how easy it was. Well then things spiraled and I needed to be able to control everything with Alexa. She turns on my tv and plays whatever I tell her to. This has been a huge help with having a newborn. While I_ feeding, changing or burping I can tell Alexa to set timers or pull up my favorite tv show. Next up is a ring doorbell. Alexa can listen to me farting and yelling at the dogs all she wants as long as she keeps making my life easy.

Title: Amazing little speaker! and a new little assistant.
Body: What I like about this device is:1) I can make calls over it2) I can listen to music over it (wish it did google music but  I knew it didn't and okay with that)3) I can set timers, great in the kitchen4) I can set up routines to wake me up, turn on the lights after a short wait, and then play a song or two.5) I can lay in bed and say "Computer Next song"  or "Compter Play some soft jazz"  (I changed it so it answers to Computer. and the other one in the house is Alexia!The sound quality is pretty good for the size, sometimes I have to get closer if the music is too loud to turn it down.All in all I think this was a good purchase, I just wish they would have google play music available as a skill.You can pair the speaker up to play as a blue tooth speaker for your phone too.It controls lights, just be sure to get the right Bluetooth enabled bulbs.

Title: Wouldn't want to live without!
Body: I'm a gadget person who avoided trying this out because I didn't think I would use it enough or that it would be anything more than a speaker or be more painful to setup & operate than its worth.  Boy was I wrong!! I use it every day now & would hate having to go without it. Love being able to just ask for music, info on different subjects, add items to different lists, get news headlines, read my email, call people all hands free while doing something else. A multitasker's dream gadget!Highlights: * Easy setup for routines, skills etc through the Alexa App.* Easily links with other media app accounts.* Performs quickly & immediately things that would take allot more time for me to do like making a list, item inquiry, info look up, set alarms, even play music etc* Sound quality for music is better than expected. Speech could have more clarity though.* Price point is greatCons: Haven't found one yet.This gadget is so handy and easy to use that I'm getting my 78yr old hates gadgets Mother one because I know she will be as surprised & happy with it as I am.  Not to mention the safety feature for her to call for help with only her voice if needed, is a definite plus.

Title: It_ good for the money.
Body: I listen to music in the shower with this doohickey.  It_ held up very well.  I can get my morning news brief in the morning and listen to my morning mix while I get ready.  The sound is very improved from the dot 2.  I was running that with an anchor sound core 2.  This is comparable, but not quite as good.  Good enough that I retired the Bluetooth speaker to travel trips though.  This is a cleaner setup.  The audio is by no means good though, but if you_e okay with a cheap Bluetooth speaker, this is on par.  It_ enough for a bathroom.  If the room gets any bigger, you should get one of the larger speakers if you listen to music on it.  I did one of the 8 shows in the kitchen for recipes and music and the audio is night and day.

Title: It'a Echo
Body: I have had the Alexa 3rd gen echo, at first I didn't use it much and then got the dot for my upstairs and I find i'm using both now and bought a 3rd. So now I have them in the locations I want and during the warmer months have one to use outside. It does make life simpler with basically everything you want using Alexa . I listen to my tunes while tending to my many fish tanks, place and order hands free if I need something, get my local weather and more. Use the sleep sounds at night and fine I fall a sleep faster and stay a sleep longer. Can drop in on various people and more. I like having them around, but I still mute the mic, besides that I enjoy having them.

Title: It was better than I expected.
Body: This was a second Amazon Echo for me. This time I purchased the Dot for my office at a great Black Friday Sale. The sound is amazing. The downfall for me was I thought like my Echo I could move it around the house not being plugged in but you can't, it just turns off. Also I thought I would be able to play separate music while my husband was exercising in another room playing music with the Echo. It wouldn't let me saying for $15.00 a month I can play separate music or link same music that my husband was listening to. So that was very disappointing. Now I just can't do it the same time he is using it.

Title: Works great with Apple Music subscription.
Body: I was surprised at how easily it interfaced to my Apple Music account. I actually use it as a bridge between my Apple Music stream and my stereo and it sounds and works great.  I don_ use the built in speaker so I can_ comment on how that sounds.The speech recognition works pretty well.  It sometimes misunderstands and plays random music but most of the time it gets it right.  I love that I could change the name it responds to from Alexa to computer, and give her a great British accent. Brings a bit of Star Trek to the living room.  I wish I could name it Hal with a deep sultry voice.  Many next year.

Title: Amazing device, packed full of functionality.
Body: The functionality of this device is pretty amazing.  The attention to detail and customization when setting up the blueprints is really amazing.  I currently have them throughout the place and I can_ express enough how much I really do enjoy them.  Tons of features that are helpful and well thought out. Guest blueprints, chores, babysitter feature and even workout sessions fully customizable.  Setting up the play music every where feature was very easy and comes in handy when you have those clean the house days.  No matter what room you walk into it_ nice to hear the same song or audible book you were just listening to in the previous room.  It truly is a wonderful product.
