I am very happy with this purchase.

Title: What a great device!
Body: I love my Echo Dot! Alexa is my new friend. LOL I'm enjoying finding out all it can do. Its a ton of fun asking Alexa questions. I downloaded the Alexa app to my iPad & it went off without a hitch. Installing the Alexa app to my desktop computer was a bit more fiddly. Mainly due to my fiddling with settings a long time ago. Got Alexa working just great now. I bought one of your smart plugs so I'm having even more fun! LOL For what you get with Alexa, the price is fantastic! If you don't mind I have to go, Alexa is playing Mozart. LOL

Title: horrible voice
Body: I couldn't understand a word alexa was saying. I can't believe you haven't figured out I sent it back less than a week after I got it. I even tried calling customer service and the had me listen to music and it was okay but the regular voice I couldn't understand at all. My son has the same problem with his but he turns his on high volume and is okay with it even though he can't possibly be happy. Go back to the drawing board on this thing and give it options for different voices. So I hated mine to be honest so back it went.

Title: Who needs a girlfriend when you have alexa
Body: Should be 1 star because she wont marry me until mars is colonized..... but i'll overlook that.Connects fine considering i have sattelite internet i didn't think it would work.It's good for entertianing kids  my friends kid loves the are you smarter than a 5th grader app and the animal workout app.I had no idea there were so many apps for this thing.I also have it turning on lights and adjusting my temp. It can turn on my dish dvr (but not the tv so that's kind of pointless).....>

Title: Great device and work well! I just wish I could turn it off!
Body: I hope this helps someone who is concerned about the same issue I am and that is echo not have the ability to be turned off. I appreciate the option to mute the mic, but do not like eat red light on all night, especially in a very dark room like the bedroom when sleeping. Also, unplugging it each night as a turn-off option is not very functional, especially if you plan to use it for alarms to early morning activities. So here is my creative solution, so feel free to use it. I plugged my echo into a wifi smart plug that I have setup on timer to turn-off at my bedtime and turn-on before I arise in the morning. That way, I can start the day with giving Alexa commands and not feel as though she is listening to everything that I do throughout the night. :-) This appears to be the best solution for me right now until Amazon comes up with an option to turn the device on and off. If anyone else has any ideas, I would love to hear them. Keep in mind this is more about privacy during quite hours than anything else, so keep that in mind if you decide to comment. Thanks!

Title: Echo dot did not listen as well as the Echo Input we have.
Body: I gave this Echo Dot to my wife as a Christmas present. I also gave my 12 year old an Echo Input to connect to his pre-existing speaker. The Input hears us from 2 or 3 rooms away and sometimes with doors closed (that may be a bad thing for some people, but we use the mute button if we don't want it to listen in). The Dot only hears us in the same room, and when the music is on, we have to yell a few times for it to respond. The Input hears us perfectly even when the music is on max volume. Maybe there's a problem with the Dot unit we received and it may not be a product-wide issue, but I am returning this. I'm not sure that my wife will get another Echo device. If she does she said it would be an Echo Input.

Title: Pretty Awesome! Just a small bug.
Body: Alexa is so fun to mess with, her sarcastic remarks and jokes are funny! For it to be a small speaker, she sure does project, very well. I really like the multi-room music function, where you can play the same song on multiple Alexas in the household, it makes chores more fun. Small problem though, sometimes the music will just stop, or if we're in the middle of a game with her, sometimes she'll just turn off. We don't ever have connection issues, so I'm not sure what else it could be. If that was fixed, it would be a full 5 stars. We haven't encountered any huge problems with her. In the future, a wireless charching dock would be cool, in case if have to take her to another room temporarily. :)

Title: PERFECT!!
Body: It was nice addition to the home, difficulty setting up with my daughter doing the same in another room but once I was set up it was great. I am currently having difficulty getting Alexa to do anything other than play my alarms and music I never asked for when the alarms go off and that's been for  2 days & 7 alarms now, I will look more into it while at work today and hopefully would have rectified the situation before 4AM tomorrow because if not Alexa will be thrown out of the window.

Title: Fun unexpected gift!
Body: My kids absolutely love the Echo!  We got two for Christmas and we have been having a lot of fun. Listening to music is easy and will pull from Amazon Music or Apple Music depending on what we ask for.  The sound quality is excellent. We have requested the time, weather, jokes, information, phone numbers, and to make lists. Alexa tells pretty good jokes and my kids laugh like crazy and then repeat them to everyone.  We are still finding new things that we can do. Fun and convenient. I would definitely recommend this.

Title: Cute and functional device!
Body: My son bought the Echo Dot for me for Christmas - its cute. Easy to set up and easy to use. I ask about the weather, I ask it to play Gospel, Jazz, Christmas Music, and Meditation music. No problems with Echo getting to those genres. However, the playlist? hmmmm not really crazy about it but it works for my needs. It plays the game Akinator ----- LOL!! My son told me about it so I downloaded the app and played a few times -hilarious how this device knows what I'm thinking. Pretty fun!

Title: Has it_ flaws but worth the purchase.
Body: The product is worth the money when it works. So far, I_ constantly pairing it to the internet. The speaker cannot handle any song with base in it. Scheduling lights on or off works half the time. I enjoy having a MP3 player on call and voice commands suck as Alexa, turn on tv. I think they should continue to improve and eventually the product will get there. I_e bought two for two rooms in the last two weeks, even with the aggravation, it_ a good product. I give it a B overall, with room for improvement.

Title: I call "her" Echo.
Body: My dog's name is Lexi.  I call my Echo Dot, "Echo" to avoid "waking" "her" whenever I talk to my dog.  I wake in the mornings and tell Echo, Good Morning.  She always responds pleasantly and tells me something positive to start my day.  Throughout the day, I ask her to set timers and reminders (which she does).  She plays music for me.  She tells me jokes.  I even tell her good night and she sends me off to bed with a pleasant remark.  I received her as a Christmas gift.  I'm very happy with my new Echo Dot.

Title: We want to change the female voice to a male voice
Body: I wish I could change that stupid female robot voice to a male robot as we can do on Google assistant . I don't care about having a " star" to talk to me and spacially don't care to have to pay extra for it, I think nowadays we should be able to change the voice of our assistant freely. That what I love with Google's assistant we can change the voice to our likes. I was on the market for other Alexa gadgets but I'm going to pass on it for now.

Title: Unbelievable little speaker
Body: You can't imagine how loud is this speaker even when the volume is 60% the people from outside my apartment can hear the sound, add to tha the quality of the sound and the base are so great and Alexa response make it even better.I would recommend it, you can use Bluetooth or Wi-Fi to play songs, unfortunately it needs the wire attached all the time but still the features of the device cover everything and will make you 100% satisfied.

Title: Good device for the price.
Body: The sound quality is not as great for a speaker but the voice recognition is good. Alexa seems to misunderstand some prompts but I am hopeful this will work out the more interaction that occurs. The user friendliness of the device would not be ideal for everyone, I.e. people who aren_ comfortable/tech-savvy (if you will). For example setting it up with the app and other dots in the home would present a challenge and/or frustration for some users thus resulting in not being able to utilize some of the more awesome features of this device. The features are very user friendly once the initial setup (which even for a technically somewhat savvy person took several tries and hours to get correct).

Title: A nice home feature at a very reasonable price
Body: We rated the Echo Dot as a 4-star item only because we have not yet fully explored its possibilities enough to be able to give it a 5-star rating knowledgeably.  However, for a very modest price, we have found the Dot to be a useful, though not essential item, to have in our home.  "She" answers questions for us about the weather conditions in our vacation home in Northern New England readily, provides updates on current local weather conditions and road conditions and, of most interest during the past Christmas season, she played seasonal music for us readily upon request.  In fact, we liked the latter feature so well that we signed up for a free 30-day music trial with Amazon Music and will likely continue this feature for the modest monthly cost ($3.99/mo.).  We are amazed at how quickly the Dot can find and play countless numbers of tunes for us and readily provide background music in our home when we entertain or just want to hear certain music ourselves.  We don't "need" the Echo Dot, but at the price we very much enjoy having it!

Title: I love this device
Body: This is my 1st time having a device like this.  In the past month, I have now purchased 3 of them for me and 2 as gifts.  I have one on each floor and I just tell Alexa to play a certain station or ask other things.  I mostly use it for listening to my Penguins Hockey games, so much easier than using my phone and phone speaker all the time to listen to the games, helps to save my phone's battery also.

Title: Easy
Body: Walk into room and tell Alexa what to play walk out and say off, that_ it. Going from a Bose sound dock there is no more playing around connecting phone and selecting what to play or adjusting volume, no more. Voice recognition is spot on and easy to use. Only downfall would be this beautiful little speaker will never produce the same sound as the Bose its ok the features out way this shortcoming.

Title: Does not live up to expectations
Body: She does not understand a lot of  commands and does not have answers to as many questionsas I thought she would. When told to play a song I don't like that she only plays that one song and then stops. I would like her to continue playing music of the same genre. Also I pay for YouTube music and I am upset that Alexa does not sync with YouTube. Now I have to pay for Amazon music in addition to my amazon prime and YouTube. The echo dot is definitely not as great as I was expecting

Title: easy to set up, use, and helpful
Body: Bought a bunch of these as presents this year (hint wait for black friday/cyber Monday deals!) everyone liked them.  Had to help set up a few myself, but really easy. Gave it 4 stars as you have to download a bunch of 'skills' before you can ask certain questions, like border line ups (my mom always wants to know!).  So if buying for someone not super tech savvy, help them set up and  send a list of skills they might like.

Title: Accurate, Our Lives Have Changed
Body: So I got this as a gift over the holidays. This is not a product I would have ever thought of purchasing myself, however, now that we own one, our lives will never be the same without one. They should have Alexa's EVERYWHERE. The simplicity of a voice comand and the echo dot accuratly responding and or playing the correct song as well as creating playlist all by voice is awesome. I have also paired my Pandora account so it will also play my playlist off of there. For the price, you're getting a better sounding product that an expensive pill shaped speaker.

Title: Lots of Fun and Help!
Body: We_e enjoying the music especially, getting the weather and the family gets a kick out of asking Alexa jokes. We_l try  different things as we get the time. We have two Echo Dots and got them both going, we thought, but need to figure out why the one in hubby_ workshop here at the house isn_ working. Probably some little, simple glitch.  We_e happy to have Alexa here with us! _

Title: Love how we have so many devices connected, how you can play games w/Alexa or for info/music etc
Body: Everything is good, we have 2 of these Alexa echo dot units then an Amazon show 8 and also an Amazon Alexa Echo the tall one so we have them in different areas of the house and all connected so we can talk to each other thru them and have each one do different things at the same time. We originally had/have a Google home so we do like the different types of things both do but as of right now the Alexas are great to use all through the house (we even have one of the dots in the bathroom so we can listen to music or other options while in the shower and can even drop in while someone is in there so it's got great features all together and we've only scratched the surface of what this all can do! Very neat to have this "set", I love all the cool features on the Amazon Show 8 which can be set up to do things on the Dots and Echo!

Title: My little friend
Body: This little thing is awesome. I love this gave it to my hubsand as christmas gift.  He loves it too.  Every morning he get updates on news and weather. Set alarms to wake him up for work.  Plays songs on request including indian music thst is awesome. I cant sleep without the deep sleep music. Me and my hubsand love alexa. I am suprised with the volume frequency its is great for a small device.

Title: THIS DEVICE IS HELPFUL! BUT AT WHAT COST?!
Body: Quite honestly at first and still at times I find it quite creepy. The rate that AI has taken off lately. After the first week or so of having this product I've had fun integrating it into my life. I've found it quite useful for things such as turning out smart bulbs or even using it to change the channel on my roku.The fact that you could use this for such things as games, telling the time or temperature, setting schedule or timers and even therapy. This device can essentially do everything a zombie drone human attached to their phones could do. But even better, cheaper and at times more helpful.If the future turns into that Will Smith movie I-Robot, I won't be entirely too shocked. This device is helpful now. But imagine what it will be in a decade from now.

Title: Better sound than the previous generations.
Body: Unit seems to have more bass in the output, and the program equalizer does not remove enough bass for some folks. Wife has a hearing deficit in certain tonal ranges that made hearing the unit hard for her, Switched the unit to a different location partially solved the problem. Would purchase again, sounds great to me, but they are larger that the previous generations.

Title: Its very useful
Body: I received the Echo Dot as a white elephant Christmas exchange. I'm very happy with it. However, it does take some getting used to. It does not always know how to respond and I have to figure out exactly what to say in order for certain things to happen. She has also just stopped in mid stream sometimes when performing certain tasks. I do recommend it because I find it useful. It connects with You Version Bible and reads the plans and also Audible.

Title: Great for my office!
Body: As a therapist who does hypnosis and meditation with my patients, Echo Dot is a welcome part of my practice. We use Amazon music Family Plan to play exactly what we need, when we need it. We now have 3 in our office. I purchased the holder for it that plugs in the wall and wire is out of the way.Fabulous. We also have 3 Echo Dots at home.

Title: Get it if you want it, I_ not impressed
Body: The AI goes on and off every now and then. (Makes me paranoid, lol)I purchased the echo as a combo with the nest thermostat. _ I think I need a hub so that I can change the settings via speech.Anyway, I personally don_ need AI unless it_ a fully functioning robot. Echo and Google home has just been AI paper weights.

Title: Great sounding and that_ about it
Body: Unplugged it after a week.  Only plays songs like the song I request, not the requested song.  It seems many have this problem.  Was disappointed cause it does sound great.  Makes a great paperweight though.  I have the first version dot and for some reason everything i tried to switch my membership to new dot didnt work.

Title: Replaced my old alarm clock
Body: When my original bedside alarm died after 30 years, I bought one from a reputable name.  However, controls were difficult and not intuitive and the dial brightness, even on low, could wake me up from a sound sleep.  Some nights I_ turn it over on its face to rid myself of the annoyingly bright bluish green light, which defeated the purpose of a bedside clock.  So when Amazon released a version of the Echo with an embedded clock, I decided to make a change.  It took the place of a Gen 1 Echo Dot.  It provides all the features I want in a bedside alarm clock except a spare USB port to recharge my phone while I sleep.Anyone that has used Alexa to set alarm times knows its a pretty simple command, including naming multiple alarms.  Countdown timers appear on the face to temporarily replace the clock dial, which replaces the often repeated phrase _lexa, how much time left.  A phrase I_ glad to left go of.  The clock face automatically brightens with increased ambient light and then dims again when the lights go out. Since I need Alexa to run smart home routines as I prepare for bed anyway, it has been a perfect solution.  The only criticism is that it doesn_ come in alternate colors such as grey or black.Bruce

Title: Works as advertised and intended
Body: The Echo Dot is a shorter more compact version of the original Alexa.  It integrated into my home network with no difficulty or problems.  I already have two tall Alexa devices and since this Dot was within voice distance of one of the other Alexaes I just had to change the default name from Echo to another name.  I use this Echo Dot in the garage so that I can stream radio from the internet while I am out there.  It works as intended, but since I have it sitting flat with the base against the wall, I find that I have to be relatively close (within five feet) for it to understand my voice directions.  I'm not sure if this is caused because of the way I have it situated or because the sound receptors are now basically facing up and down rather than left and right, or that the Dot was designed this way.  Whatever the reason it does work and does what I purchased it to do.

Title: I just Love it!
Body: Love it! I got two from two different people ,for Christmas. I can_ tell you how much I love it! I will certainly buy more Alexa enabled devices. The echo dot does so many things! It Turns things on and off, acts as a Bluetooth  speaker, It sets alarms,reminders and timers . I think babysitter mode is amazing!Oh the schedules that it keeps, the music it plays, the stories it reads!What can_ it do? I spend a lot time playing with it, to see its features. There are sooo many cool features. It makes phone calls I love the night and morning mode feature... Ugh to much good stuff to talk about.Set up was easy, took about 5 mins .It_ very compact it_ about the Circumference of a coaster.The speaker is surprisingly loudBuy it, play around with it, you_l be amazed how much this little speaker can do.

Title: Great quality and price !
Body: We traveled to a vacation home where there is no wi-fi.  I forgot my alexa devices .  I think I have all of them Except for the dot. I realized how much I depend on Alexa for kitchen timers, shopping list, sleep music etc.  Even my husband tells alexa to add something to the shopping list and there it is on my phone !  No need for pen and paper. I didn_ want to use a lot of cellular data from our phone hotspots so I purchased this instead of a spot or a show.  I was not expecting the quality to be as good as all the other devices .  I was pleasantly surprised at the sound quality for what we use it for. Price was great as well .  If you use an alexa device you will grow dependent on it once you get used  to it.  When paired with the alexa app it_ amazing what you can do.  Just love it.

Title: I would like to think i'm fairly intelligent, but sometimes, IT JUST AIN'T SO..........LOL
Body: Had a 2nd gen all good. Got a great deal on 3rd gen dot with 2 smart lights. One bulb arrived damaged, no big deal, AMAZON gladly sent me 2 new bulbs (and told me to keep the one that was working) everything was just plug and play could not have been easier. somehow i lost wifi to my computer could not get ALEXA to reconnect spoke with cust serv and they couldn't be more patient with me., but i really didn't want ALEXA to run through my phone. so they offered to replace her. I finally broke don and downloaded the android app had everything back up and running in miniutes and it actually makes everything so much easier. anyway THANKS GUYS YOUR ALL VERY GOOD AT WHAT YOU DO. maybe i'm getting old and stubborn. ALL IN ALL 3RD GEN IS DEFINATELY A BIG JUMP FOWARD I LOVE IT

Title: Amazing Speaker
Body: You can't beat the bang for the buck with the speaker! Alexa has paired with pretty much everything in my house, so I control everything from this tiny little box. It has a lot of sound for music, but my favorite part is how it connects with my FireStick. I sit in bed at night, warm under the covers, and yell at Alexa to play my favorite shows! She never complains about being my personal remote. When my phone rings, I yell at her to pause, then replay when I come back in. It's amazing. I don't think I've used my remote in weeks.The only reason it isn't getting 5 stars is because Alexa does get confused a bit. For example, she can't recognize certain TV show names when they have punctuation in them. So that's when I have to manually use my remote control which feels almost archaic at this point! Overall A- quality!!

Title: Pretty Cool Tech
Body: I realize that by phrasing the headline the way I did, it might lead one to believe that I've just emerged from under my rock.  But this is not entirely true.  Our family had resisted making a purchase of this type of "smart" device for several years for various reasons, but this past Christmas I went whole hog and bought two for our home.  While we don't have anything "home" related interfaced with Alexa, it's just super cool to be able to request a song or the weather forecast, and BAM!, there it is.As far as sound quality goes, I will say that it's lacking behind the Anker bluetooth speaker I have, which is probably close in size.  But considering that my Anker is just a speaker, I guess that makes sense.

Title: First smart item I have owned
Body: I guess I expected more from this item after I heard someone interact with their Google mini.  The echo doesn't always answer.  You have to know how to interact with it to get it to work as Alexa doesn't always respond if you don't use the right words.  Sometimes there is a tinny noise when she speaks.  Initially when I started using it, you could make phone calls with it and I was told that my voice was very clear and that has ended.  I like that we receive emails suggesting trying different options to interact.  (However, now it seems all the options are the same suggestions.)  Other than that, I like playing games on it.  I like that she can be used as a reminder and alarm.  I especially like that she will read me my kindle books.  Audible was awesome when I trialed it.  I may get it again but they charge too much for the service and I would like that option to be useful in my car as well.

Title: Neat Little Device
Body: I haven't been using it as much as I anticipated; maybe 3 or 4 times a week.I Mean - - - - - - - - how many times can you ask it what time it is; whats the weather; tell me a joke; or play music?!?I'm sure it will grow on me eventually; but there are times when the blue/green ring is spinningand I didn't even say the magic word "Alexa".These devices are taking random sound samples from your room; for what ever reason, and I'm not really liking it.I use the mute button on top of the DOT at least one a day because I'm not actually sure if it is building some kind of virtual speech data base on me..

Title: What an Experience.
Body: I tell you, I wasn't sure how Echo Dot would fair. But I'm very impressed. More so, Alexa. And its capabilities. The Dots volume when compared to Google Home. But of course, that's really not a fair comparison, hah.- It's pretty much on par with the Google Home Mini. I do think the Dot has a bit more "umph" than the Home Mini.The microphones are really good. Better than both the Google Home and Home Mini. And the design is much more appealing to look at than the Home Mini. Something satisfying to see the now iconic Alexa blue ring in action as it's responding to you.Overall really happy with the Echo Dot. I wanted to give it a try, being a G. Home user. The Skill features are great! Expanding the horizons of the capabilities. Something Google lacks for its smart home speakers/devices. Not to mention Alexa in general, is more efficient and more polished comparably speaking. - in regards to the app. A very easygoing experience. And just makes sense.Happy with the product!

Title: I recommend this product to everybody
Body: Still learning what this echo dot can do but I_ having trouble connecting it to my 4K firestick, I_ hoping once I get further along with this product I can enjoy it more  and give a better update. But I can tell you that I am thoroughly enjoying figuring everything out  And I love the music quality very much. I also got a smart plug and I highly recommend that to go along with this echo dot . I actually ordered the newest echo dot that displays the time on it but  it will not be here until March 2 at the earliest so when I get that one I will be giving this to my mother and teaching her how to get involved in the 21st-century  LOL!I do highly recommend this though and I think you will enjoy it.Will update my  review at a later date. As I stated above I am having difficulty getting this connected to my fire stick which is causing some issues as well as not getting it connected to my cell phone.  I just  need to set aside time to talk to suport and get my issues resolved. Because this is ( so far) the only disappointing issues I_ having .

Title: Convenience is Declining
Body: I have owned multiple Echos for about 3 years now. They have been so convenient and amazingly helpful, up until about 4-5ish months ago. I'm not sure if there was a software update or what, but suddenly she became very uncooperative, especially with Fire TV. We used to say "Alexa, play The Office" and she would reply with "Here's The Office from Netflix". Now if we try to say that to her, she says "I'm sorry, I don't know that". Then we thought we needed to say "Alexa, play The Office on Fire TV", then she would reply with "Getting The Office on Fire TV" and she would pull up a listing on Fire TV with options to play. So then we would have to scroll to Netflix and hit the play button. But before doing that, we have to select the profile on Netflix that we want it to play on. We have slowly figured out that you have to say "Alexa, turn on The Office on Netflix" and she will play. But she will not do this for HULU or Disney+. Now, to make matters even worse: while watching a show on Netflix/HULU/Disney+, we used to simply say "Alexa, pause" and she would pause the show. Now, she gives the same reply of "I don't know that" or "Hmmm I'm not sure". Why? W h y ? W H Y ? ? ? We have figured out that we have to say "Alexa, pause Netflix" or "Alexa, fastforward Netflix 1 minute" Want to skip an episode? FORGET IT SHE DOESN'T KNOW THAT. Want to skip intro? FORGET IT SHE DOESN'T KNOW THAT. This defeats the purpose of having the Fire TV integration. It should be as simple as saying "pause" or "turn on The Office" or "fastforward 10 seconds" We should be able to say "Alexa, play The Office" and she should select the most convenient way to play The Office (either from AI knowledge or from recognizing our habits) and then just play it. Like she used to. This is the worst version of Alexa there has been. I have had nothing negative to say about the Echo up until this update. It is actually more frustrating to have an Echo now than it is to not have it. Because I can't just simply give commands anymore and her think on her own and know what to do. I have to think about how she needs me to say things and try different ways of saying things and break it down to very specific instructions and it is no longer a convenience; it is an inconvenience.

Title: Love it!
Body: My wife bought me this for Christmas. It's great, the speaker is so much better than past versions. In fact, we have a smart speaker hooked up to another echo in our bathroom, and when I play music on both at the same time, the sound that comes from this little dot is so much better than the bigger speaker.I love the clock. It's a little small (I'm nearsighted) and I have to squint to read it at night, but it's great otherwise. Dims when I turn off the light - nice touch Amazon!They might be spying on me, but I love the Echos we have!

Title: This is the best Echo Dot! Love it.
Body: I bought this new Echo Dot with the digital clock on it to replace my generation one echo dot  basically because of the clock on it. That was by far the best move by Amazon and the sound quality is very good.  When asking Alexa the temperature outside, she also displays the temperature  and when you ask here to turn  the volume to a number, that shows too. I noticed there_ been some comments on how to make the display brighter. You have to go into your Alexa app and go to your device and you can set the brightness through that feature in the display feature. Now that I have a clock on this Echo Dot, I use it for an alarm now. Also takes up little space on the nightstand and looks great. I_ very pleased with this product.

Title: 2 Dots gets Stereo but poor sound quality
Body: Echo 1st generation  up and died displaying the blue ring of death. Black Friday sale had $22 Dots so I bought 2 in order to get stereo sound.  PLUS = I was able to mount Dots on opposite sides of room to get stereo sound. MINUS = the sound quality is poor, muffled. Only one Dot responds, they aren_ sync_ together for basic commands. Stereo has to be set up in the app and I have difficulties getting music in stereo using voice command, I need to go into the app and select it. There should be a default preference setting but I haven_ discovered it yet.

Title: Make sure your WiFi signal is strong
Body: I use my speaker mainly to play music. I don_ really receive calls or anything so I don_ need it for much besides music, weather, notifications. It_ nice to be able to check the weather while I_ getting ready for work. The music aspect is fine - if your wifi isn_ the best, you_l definitely notice a lot of buffering in your music like I have. Most of the time it_ great but if too many people in my house are using the WiFi, you can hear my speaker struggle :( Also! I_ the only person on my account, the only one connected to my speaker, but while I was about 40 miles away at work, my sister sent me a video of Alexa playing my music. I_e made sure to disconnect her when I_ not home but that_ just odd.

Title: Almost a great product!
Body: It's very convenient and works fantastic. It's able to answer nearly anything when asked. Whispering sounds creepy but I did get a laugh out of it.My problem is that Amazon took away the option to completely disable the listening feature on its latest (3rd gen) devices. With my Amazon Tap, I set it up so that I press a physical button to communicate with the device.However, it DOES have a physical button to mute the microphone.Another issue is that I will have to purchase more (I've purchased two so far) Dots for music around the house and garage. I intended to use my Tap as the main device and use the Dots as satellites.  Amazon apparently won't allow it.  I'm unable to pair the Tap with the Dots. I'm sure a simple OTA software update would fix this feature

Title: Easy to setup and getting smarter
Body: I don't have much to add concerning the Echo devices.  We have several. But, Alexa is getting better.  Used to be, if you started a timer with one echo, you had to remember which one it was in order to stop it prematurely or quiet the alarm.  Now all the echoes know about the timer and the timer can be dealt with at any of our echoes.  I actually got this one for my office at work and it was easy to set it up for our work Wifi.  The 3rd gen echo dot has much better audio quality than the 2nd gen dot, though not as good as the full size echo.

Title: Not better than the Google home mini
Body: So the google home mini beats the echo dot in my opinion by a long shot. This is good only to integrate with Amazon's website but with google home mini you have everything alexa has but add the search engine capabilities and syncs with google calendar, reminders and alarms also can track flights prices for certain travel periods and send them to your email. The alexa is okay but compared to the google home mini it just doesnt stand a chance. Also I got two light bulbs for the same price as alexa from kholes hence Alexa went back and google home mini rules my house.

Title: it does wonders!
Body: I live alone and I didn't realize the many benefits Alexa can bring, including the fact that I can get something done with just my voice! I can be vaccuming and ask Alexa to turn the music on or ask the weather. It is like having someone else to talk to.... and we shouldn't underestimate the value of having company. There are so many of us living alone and needing someone to talk to. Besides, it can integrate with other devices, which is great. I'm happy. About the data possibly open to others? don't kid yourself, the government has access to everything...

Title: Reasonably good for music only. Voice quality insufficient.
Body: With this 3rd generation Echo Amazon is trying to compete with other whole house music systems (think Sonos), and it's definitely better than the prior generation in this regard. That said, I never bought these for music, which in no universe can they come close to my dedicated 2-channel  stereo system. For voice only I find the 3rd gen Echo to be unacceptably boomy and near unintelligible for every day use like voicing instructions, news, weather, etc. Glad I kept my other four 2nd gen devices. Can totally understand them, even being of slightly bad hearing.

Title: BEST PRODUCT FOR THE PRICE IVE EVER BOUGHT
Body: I'm a paraplegic and I'm in love with this device cuz it helps me so much for literally everything- remembering my appointments, taking my meds, listing to music, setting alarms, syncs to google calander and other appps on your phone-too planning my day, reminders to drink enough water, turning on and off my lights, and SO much more. You can even technically start your coffee, adjust your thermostat, unlock doors, preheat oven, and even vacuume your house, all without having to lift a finger...just by using your voice. Some features require smart home devices. Super customizable. Even has a sort of app store with it, where it can learn or you can get blueprints: to create new skills for the device to use. Such as headspace, meditation, listen to your favorite podcasts, even soothing sounds for the dog while your away. I expecially love the black model, really nice and super sleek. Makes the changing colored lights look really dope on the black because it stands out and seems to be even brighter then the white model. Anyways, if you set it up right and dont belive that its listening to you 24/7 (which its not)...then it's one of the best products for that price I've ever owned. You will get annoyed with saying the name Alexa all the time, I wish you could change her name or make her have different accents but that's besides my point lol

Title: Great Replacement for Alarm Clock!
Body: My wife and I have been thrilled with this echo, that recently replaced our 15 year old alarm clock. The display dims enough, when the lights are out, that it isn't bothersome to us. The only complaint I have, is it is very difficult to turn the alarm off, by pressing the button, without snoozing. I don't want to wake my wife up, buy saying "Alexa turn off the alarm". If this could be improved, it would be perfect! I usually log into the Alexa app, and turn my alarm off, to keep from disturbing my wife. Multiple alarms work great! You can have as many as you want. I just tell Alexa to set the alarms, before we go to bed. If you have the same schedule each day, you can tell it to set the same, for whatever days you want. Very nice!

Title: Love the 3rd Gen echo dot
Body: I had a 2nd gen echo dot and loved it, even though the sound wasn't that good.  Got this 3rd gen dot and WOW what a difference!  The sound is awesome for something so small.  Loved it so much, I bought 3 more as gifts for family.  It seems the voice recognition isn't quite as good as the 2nd gen.  I find myself having to repeat "Alexa" to get it to react where, on the 2nd gen, I never really had that problem.  Overall, though, I am very happy with Echo Dot 3rd Gen.

Title: Set up can be fast, easy but.....
Body: Set up can be quick and easy but if you really want the best results take time to make time.  Alexa can save you time, but she doesn't come all knowing. You must take time to download apps for smart products and then discover. Alexa has a great feature to ask her to discover but you have to do the leg work first. Smart Plugs, switches, light bulbs ect. need their own app on your device (phone, tablet, pc) prior and set up in that app before you can add into alexa.  Our Philips Hue lights skipped the app and Alexa did all the work.  Learn about Alexa, set it up correctly by making groups aka rooms in your home to use full features. Add skills, create routines, but remember the name of the routine isn't what you say or ask Alexa unless they are the same name.  This is one of the most helpful pieces of technology I have bought, I bought two and will be adding another if not two more soon.  Smart home integration takes time to set up but save energy and time and can increase your well being, save time and brighten your life. You only get out of it what you put into it!

Title: i love it
Body: I love it.. great gift for my husband. He uses it every day.Only reason I gave 4 stars is because I ordered anther one i the past, $15 more, same seller.Literally the day it arrived, the price went down$15. I asked i they could do anything, to avoid me having to return and repurchase.They did nothing. I had to return 2 of these (got one for my best friend too) which is $30 savings, and repurchase 2. I thought that was silly

Title: Great technology for those with physical limitations
Body: I bought this for my adult child with physical disabilities primarily for her to be able to use her voice to play music and turn on lights hands-free.  I wasn_ sure Alexa would be able to understand her voice, but she was immediately able to use it.  The biggest benefit, however, was the _rop in feature that allows me to call her and her to call out, just by using her voice.  This has opened a whole new world for her.  I also consider a safety feature, knowing I am an easy _all away in an emergency.  I consider the Echo to be one of the most significant technologies available for those with physical limitations.  We now plan on setting up one for another relative in a nursing home.

Title: Setup is a pain, after that all is good.
Body: Unit came with useless setup instructions. The sites it tells you to go were not working. After several hours I got it working. Huge tip, if you are using a phone to set it up make sure you are on mobile data, NOT WiFi. You have to connect directly to the unit via WiFi, that tip would have saved me a lot of time.  AFTER you have it setup it works great. Voice recognition is spot on and the sound quality is excellent.

Title: Struggles with voice recognition
Body: Although I have a southern U.S. accent and my wife has an Irish accent; we both have good diction. Alexa confuses voice commands when either of us use it. We have to repeat our commands over and over.My child loves the audio functions, and as an audiophile, I was surprised at the quality of its sound - I mean for a unit the size of a hockey puck. Hi-Fi? Of course not. But, its the size of a small hamburger!

Title: Amazing sound quality, not a huge fan of charging cord/wall plug
Body: Amazing sound, voice recognition, and usefulness! I wanted a speaker to use around the house and the Echo Dot has not disappointed! Love it so far. I never owned an Echo Dot before now so I can't speak to how it compares to older gens. Recommend if you are looking for an easy, great sounding speaker! I was disappointed by the bulky cord and wall plug. The sound quality is definitely worth the hassle though.

Title: Female voice unintelligible
Body: While the Echo dot has excelllent design and attractive optical features, it has poor sound quality for such an imaginative device.  We wound the woman's voice (1) was muffled (unclear) and (2) her enunciation lacking at times, espedially when offering a lenthy response to a simple query  Her reply simply could not be understood---- even with intense efforts to decipher her words.  Four of us sat around the kithen table and had trouble with her explanations or informative replies.We asked our son to send Echo back because of this deficiencies.  Why not use aman's voice, with more treble tones.  Despite many efforts using our computer to adjust Alexa's response "quality" - - -it was impoisble to improve it

Title: Good basic capabilities
Body: Love the ease of set up, size, etc.  This is in our bathroom, vanity area.Alexa still has a good many issues understanding the questions she is asked, but in terms of playing music, reading the news, and giving me a morning update, this is perfect for the location we choose.FWIW, this part of our house has a fairly week wireless WIFI signal but the dot connected and we've had no issues with connectivity, streaming, or similar issues.

Title: Much better than an alarm clock!
Body: The sounds is amazing, but the problem we have with the two echos we have is that my rather loud housemates often influence Alexa to start playing in my room.  it's confusing.  Also, Alexa is so efficient you begin to believe you can have a discussion, but it's an illusion, obviously.  I can't get her to repeat things, for example,  I'm sure with future generations it will be even better, though.

Title: Fun for the family, excellent value
Body: My only complaint is the sound could be louder, but overall it_ pretty awesome especially for the value! It_ fun to send your family messages from your phone for Alexa to read to them using the communicate and announce tabs in the app Amazon Alexa app. We have had a lot of laughs already. Our six year old has made Alexa _art at the most opportune times. I didn_ know AI would pass gas. _

Title: Amazing!
Body: Bought this as a Christmas gift for my elderly parents to help them remember the day of the week. They are so excited that they can do all sorts of things with it. I think it's so cute that mom calls it Alexie and it still answers! I wish you could use it without wifi because I would have several. I reside in an area where internet is not available but I have LTE thru my cell phone carrier.

Title: Odd speaker
Body: The Echo dot 3 performs the duties of the Echo (2nd generation) with no problem whatever.  However, the speaker sound seems to fluctuate.  When answering a question, the Alexa voice has a deep bass quality.  Music playback, on the other hand, sounds "tinny".  I've been spoiled by the excellent sound quality of the larger Echo I guess.  The Echo dot does the job well since its position in my home is not a place I listen to music.

Title: It's not the bottom line...yet
Body: I don't like the heavy level of muffled voice of Alexa.  I think Alexa is an interesting toy.  I don't think there are enough critical "devices" that Alexa can/should control.  Alexa was a gift...I've had it on the kitchen table since Christmas.  But so far, Alexa can only update me with weather and news...that I get from television.  So...what's the big deal with Alexa?

Title: This thing is amazing
Body: I never knew that I needed an Echo Dot, but I did. It has brought me into 2020 with a bang. It was not difficult to set up, and it is intuitive to use. It will actually give you its own tutorial. Since installing my Echo Dot, I have installed two smart outlets and a smart thermostat. I can turn down the heat before going to bed with a simple command. Everyone should own one. By the way, if you think the world is listening in, there is a mute button, so that Alexa cannot hear you. It is a fun and helpful gadget, and quickly becomes more than just a gimmicky toy.

Title: One of our very best purchases
Body: Love our echo..sound quality much better than my dot. Easy to set up  and so many ways to use. My son is an insulin dependent diabetic and it is amazing the accuracy counting carbs and adding them up. It has been so beneficial to his health and well being. I love accessing my Audible books, listening to music, setting a timer for cooking and kids homework. It has made our lives easier and more fun

Title: Love my echo dot! So helpful and the GGMM D3battery base makes it portable!
Body: I love my echo dot. I have four of them and they really help make my life easier. They can control almost everything, lights, locks TV, music, thermostat. It hears you almost all of the time and I've run into very few issues with it overall. I really couldn't ask for a more helpful device. It's even more handy when I found that I could get a battery base for it. The GGMM D3 base that I found lets me carry the alexa dot around pretty much anywhere. I love that I can take it into the bathroom with me and listen to music while I shower or take it outside and listen to music. That's really the only thing I think it was missing.

Title: Amazon provides great support for Alexa
Body: First of all, please know that I am technologically challenged.  You want me to rate voice recognition.  Alexa seems to recognize it with no problem.  I haven't a clue as to what you mean/want for integration.  For a very small device, the sound is excellent.  It is in my bedroom and I hear it clearly in my bathroom, and actually in my living room.  And with my Amazon Prime, I have commercial free music which is a treat.However, Alexa does not know how to answer some of my questions.  Some are technically related to what she does.  For example she didn't know what the flashing green light was.  I had to continue to revise my questions to get the answer.  And to other questions she says, "Hmmm, I'm not sure about that" or something to that effect.  My Google device looks it up immediately and gives me some sort of an answer.  Unfortunately, I don't remember a question for  an example to give you. And, when I ask what the temperature is, all I get if the temperature.  My Google device (in the kitchen) not only gives me the temperature, it states my city and gives the forecast for the rest of the day.  When I ask Alexa who the singer is, I get just the singer.  When I ask Google I get the name of the song AND the singer.I hope this helps.

Title: Static if turned up, no Jesus but my kid enjoys using it
Body: I purchased this for my son as a gift because he begged me for one! I really like that he can set his alarms for the week now that he's old enough to take on the responsibility to wake himself up in the mornings to get ready for school. I also like that he can ask educational questions or questions out of curiosity. Although I do not like that it really doesn't tell you much about Jesus if you ask about Him. That's really sad because I would love for my son to be able to ask questions pertaining to Jesus and the Bible and get an accurate answer based on the Bible. Another thing I dislike is if he turns the volume up high, you can hear static in the speakers. This device should not be made to go louder than it can handle for the price you pay. I purchased my other son a Bluetooth speaker that was around the same price and his gets really loud without any static issues.My son seems to really enjoy having this in his bedroom though so I'll still give it 3 stars.

Title: Uh Oh...but she's still fun
Body: My son got me this for Christmas since I'm always "asking Google" something on my phone. Getting Alexa to work wasn't the piece of cake it should have been. She kept telling me she couldn't connect to the internet. I finally got her to connect, but along the way, when adding the Alexa app to my phone, it picked up information for another person, including the person's address (1,600+ miles away from where I live). Not only that but Alexa gave me a notification that this person's order had been delivered!Now, I will say I know this person. She is an online friend who shares some of the same hobbies and we have met in person and spent time together. But what if she wasn't!? Neither of us can figure out how her info got on my Alexa app on my phone since I had not added the app before I got my Echo Dot. She had moved this past year and it had her current information. Quite unsettling when you think about it!Still, Alexa has been fun. She gets things wrong sometimes, but who else will sing Auld Lang Syne on New Year's Eve, or tell me "nighty-night" and "sleep tight" when I go to bed. "We" are still learning how to interact, but the Echo Dot works well.

Title: Like it, when it works.
Body: Received this is a Christmas gift from my husband and overall it's neat and I enjoy listening to music and NPR while making dinner. HOWEVER....it tends to cut out halfway through songs and move on to the next one without prompting. It also gets "stuck" on the blue light with no response to a request from time to time. I've dealt with flashing lights of red, yellow and green, with no messages or calls waiting, and no reason for the lights (when red is flashing, all our other wifi using devices are doing just fine). It's a little frustrating, especially with no recourse to fix the issue, since I'm not sure where it's stemming from. The Alexa app hasn't been very helpful in these instances either. But when it works, it's fun.

Title: Love making announcements, but drop in needs some work.
Body: Alexa (via the dot) is a member of the household at this point, we have 4 of them. We probably use them for less than most A music, jeopardy on occasion, and the announcement/intercom feature. The intercom _rop in, however often has a lot of _hat? _uh? _hat_ you say when conversing with my teens through it. The goal in having them in their rooms was to eliminate the screaming in the house - and yes they have phones, but they are often on vibrate and don_ see them, etc. This allows for a streamline right into their rooms - but as I said the reception is shoddy most times unless you are RIGHT on top of the device.  Regardless, it_ still managed to minimize the shouting to an extent.

Title: Much better
Body: Our version 1 Dot died a couple of years ago and we didn't replace it. A relative got us one for Christmas this year. I've found the sound quality is better but the voice recognition seems to be as bad if not a bit worse. That could just be that I haven't trained it well enough yet. I really do wish there was a way to interrupt sometimes. When I'm saying "cancel" and she goes on and on listing options, I really would like to stop it. Especially when I'm taking a call and don't need another voice in the room. All in all, I'm glad we have one again. We're not really into integrating it too much right now because our house is old, but we appreciate just asking for weather information, etc.

Title: Love this little guy!
Body: Love this little guy! Bought another for myself abs one for a friend! I use it to save writing ideas, reminders, like not to eat cookies & muffins... or that i have an appointmwnt coningnul, for timers (no need to type into my iphone!) to wake me, play music i havent heard i years, even ti read my kindle book to me. (Not being human there are sone weird aspects to this, like always rising in intonation if there is a question mark, so but narration if u really want good listening). And then there are the endless supply of cat jokes. And other types. Lots of fun and useful! I do wish i could change the name or something, Alexa as an on switch gets tedious but, nature of the technology i guess.

Title: Having a ball with this!
Body: Fantastic value for what you get.  Feels like a heavy hockey puck that can talk to you.  The sound quality is way better than gen 1 and 2 Echo dots.  I've just mostly used this one for Amazon Music, and it is by far the cheapest speaker you will ever find for how good the sound is.  This thing can hear you from many rooms away....that is how good the microphones are.  Privacy is not a concern for me, since I can simply unplug her.  Only downside is the lack of an internal battery to not have to have it go "wireless"....it always has to be plugged into the wall.  But other than that, fantastic job, Amazon on this item.  Btw, yall need to offer this in burlap.  :)  lol

Title: Very nice little device
Body: I didn't know that I needed one of these until my wife purchased it for me. I have two now that are connected together and the sound quality is amazing. Together with my Amazon music subscription, I am able to listen to music either by making a verbal request to Alexa or selecting a particular album or playlist from my phone. We have also taken advantage of many of the features ranging from having Alexa make a grocery list that appears on my phone, to weather forecasts, sports scores and even playing music to "Comfort my dog". We are amazed at the sound quality of this little device. We have two connected as a group and they sound amazing.

Title: This is still a beta products and a work in progress
Body: This system takes a tremendous amount of time to set up and integrate with other systems such as ADT and ring and Phillips hue. The integration with ADT security is only I would say at about 80% and still has some bugs that need to be worked out. I would consider the entire Alexa system to be still in the somewhat beta/development stage and I think will someday be a great product but it is still a work in progress especially with its interaction with other peoples applications. The support that you get from Amazon through their device support division is not really that good and the management oversight on it really truly is of poor quality.

Title: Privacy. Enough said.
Body: Amazon keeps these recordings forever or until you choose to delete them. "When you use an Alexa device, we keep the voice recordings associated with your account to improve the accuracy of the results provided to you and to improve our services," notes Amazon. "If you delete these recordings, it may degrade your experience using the voice features."From your web browser, you can only choose to delete all of your recordings. You can't listen to them from the web. To delete all of your recordings:  Go to Manage Your Content and Devices, then select the Your Devices tab.  Select your Alexa device from those that are registered to your Amazon account.  Select Manage voice recordings.  Select Delete.There's no automated way to delete recordings, so you'll have to remember to delete them manually on a regular basis.

Title: Fairly cheap, simple, and makes life just that much simpler
Body: My first Echo device was the 3rd Gen Dot and my house now has three different echoes. I think it_ good for replacing an alarm clock that also does a little bit more. The fact is has Bluetooth capability is cool, usually just stream Spotify straight too it instead though. These speakers have pretty okay quality, better than most speakers that cost the same price. If you stream music your sound quality won_ be amazing anyway so you don_ really lose much. I_e been using it to wake me up and then do a nice simple routine to start my day. The audio detection is usually really good but sometimes the audio from the speaker might be too loud and the microphone can_ hear you (I_e been having that issue with my alarms). Otherwise, this has been amazing and even got one for my mother for Christmas, she seems to enjoy it.

Title: Love our Alexa, great for list making and music!
Body: I really love our echo dot so far! Have had about a month and I_ sure I_ not an expert on all of its functions but I am slowly getting there. As a mom I love making lists using Alexa and it_ a breeze to add stuff to it, check items off, and if it_ a grocery list and buy the same items you can easily move checked off items back to your current list. This is by far my favorite use so far. I also have it hooked up to my Roomba which is nice too. Also great to play music and ask Alexa endless questions for fun. Just that little extra thing to keep your life organized I_ a fan!

Title: Excellent device for the price
Body: Bought this during Christmas promotion to try the technology out. It is a very well build device that is easy to setup and use. I am still discovering new capabilities. The sound quality is pretty good considering it's small size and I have been using it like a radio. You can set it to come on in the morning and play music or any radio station that is available on the internet. Ask it to come on at any time and it responds. It is timing a couple of lights i have on smart plugs. Questions? Alexa has answers. Reminders, timers etc. all useful.

Title: What a Waste
Body: I received this as a "prize" for winning this years Christmas Decorations at our apartment complex.  First of all and most important, Amazon wants you to download an app for this hunk of junk.  I guess another way to invade my privacy.  Second, set up then has to be done on line.  Third, did I say this is a hunk of junk?  Well it's only application that is worthy of this crap is an alarm clock, because you can tell "Alexa the Slu*" to turn off the alarm without rolling over.  I am here to tell you this is one product I would never purchase for myself.  It might be fun to watch someone use it has a hockey puck and see how long it lasts.

Title: a welcome little addition
Body: i already have three google homes, but i bought this because i liked alexa on my tablet and figured the upgrade to a dot would be worth it. it was - i like this thing! i won't be replacing my main smart device - a full-size google home - because the google home's speaker is much better for music, which is my primary use in my bedroom. but i've put this in the kitchen where myself and my housemates will use it hands-free while cooking, and it is perfect and simple enough for that. alexa responds a lot faster than my google does!

Title: We love it!
Body: I bought this for my 9 y.o. son and he has become entranced with it, since it'll play any song he can think of. (Side note: we are subscribed to Amazon Music.) And since it's his, he got to do the Voice Recognition and thinks it's so cool that Alexa can even hear him from a different room. It's really easy to use, you can adjust the volume by voice or by the two huge +/- buttons on top. He literally uses this every day and every night. This is, hands down, one of the best purchases I've bought for my music-loving son.

Title: It's so handy and convenient
Body: It is so handy and convenient. I can use the app to turn on and off the lights. It was a challenge to connect other smart plugs to Alexa but once it was a success, it is so worth the wait. The customer service for Alexa and the smart plug app were wonderful and helpful. I got the GoSund smart plugs cause they were smaller and less expensive than the bigger looking smart plugs. They work just as well as the bigger and more expensive smart plugs like WeMo, unfortunately I had to set them up with a few more steps because GoSund was not one of the more popular listed smart plugs on Amazon Alexa app.

Title: The only Alexa product you need to buy
Body: For starting a smart home the echo dot can_ be beat. It can be connected to Bluetooth speakers or a high end audio system to improve sound quality, and does a fine job at controlling smart switches, outlets, and lights.Larger models may have a few fancier features and screens, however their price is way higher. To start your smart home and to see if it works for you, the echo dot is a great way to get started.My issues with the dot come from it sometimes activating without being spoken to, and it telling me features that are only supported on more expensive Alexa devices.

Title: Much improved sound quality over earlier "dot" generations.
Body: Purchased on behalf of a friend. I helped them add this to their existing first generation Echo device.  I was amazed at the difference in sound over the original "dot" devices which I use in my home, though with bluetooth pairing to external speakers, it's never been an issue with me. if I were to order one of these, I'd probably not need to pair it for casual long (background) listening as the sound is very nice. Responded well to it's new owner, and was a breeze to add using the phone app.

Title: Set up was easy
Body: Before Thanksgiving we picked up a Ring doorbell as well as the Alexa Echo Show 5, putting the Echo Show 5 in the kitchen with plans on using it for recipes and watching cooking videos. It worked great but wanted to upgrade the 5 to a 8 for the bigger screen, while shopping for a 8 we saw a package deal for the 8 and then the dot and quickly purchased it. We now have the dot in our tv room, set up on this was really easy since we already had the echo 5. Love having the dot in our tv room.

Title: I love them
Body: My son got me 2, for my kitchen and sewing room.  I didn't think I would use them but I use it constantly.  I love using the audible reading.  My free audible book was the Listening Bible.  I have since created a music playlist from Amazon Prime free music.  While cooking I have multiple timers set with Alexa telling me "your 10 minute timer is done - take the rolls out of the oven"...And I really like asking her to tell me jokes.  There are tons of things and I use it every day.  Get one, or two.

Title: I Love Alexa!
Body: This is the third Alexa I've bought for my apartment. Did I need it, no. But do I love having one, especially a pink one, next to my bed, yes. Like so many forms of technology now, I could certainly get along without Alexa but in so many little ways it makes my life easier plus everyday I learn new tips of how to use Alexa. The latest tip I learned is how to use Alexa as an intercom instead of yelling at the top of my lungs to my husband in the next room. Just for that alone, I love it.

Title: Was a skeptic, now an echo advocate
Body: A Friend recommended one to me years ago and continued to politely decline as I didn_ see the purpose of it. After a Cheap Bluetooth speaker of mine died I decided to invest in an echo dot for that purpose only and after receiving it I later realized how helpful and efficient it really is. My favorite feature has to be the Sleep sounds and the recommendations Alexa provides.. during the holidays I was given the option to Hide the description details of my packages that were soon to arrive as not to spoil it. What a great idea! I_e recommended it to everyone and even purchased a few for friends as gift!

Title: Think about how you would want to automate your place
Body: We have 2 Echo Dot (3rd Gen) which mainly operate our plug-in lamps.  We had never named the rooms in our house so that was a bit of a brain scratch.  One of the dots is in the "Master Bedroom" and the other is in the "Family Room".  One upstairs and one downstairs.  Our old house has a lot of built-in lights and at this time they are not controlled with Alexa.  At first, we did not know how to set up the system, or what words to use, when we got the dots.  After a few youtube videos, and chatting with friends, we feel as though we are doing okay in using the system.  To control the outlets we purchased some 3rd party (tp-link) outlet (3 per pack) which required a different app to be installed that allows Alexa to operate them.  So far no issues with the apps and we have good control of the of these plugs.  My Samsung TV is one generation back and cannot connect to Alexa.  I should have looked that up before we got them but that knowledge would not have changed my decision.  Implementation and use is very easy.  I need to learn more about other products and connections before I can say I am more than a beginner.

Title: Integration with Alexa is so versitile
Body: The features that keep getting added are amazing!  I just wish some more flexibility with routines and being able to put a song on repeat from amazon music in a routine.  My family including my 4 year old all use Alexa through these devices to control our lights, fans, flood lights, garages, timers for food, rgb back lighting throughout the house, it really is a lot of fun and has made us more efficient with our time.

Sound quality is great on this little thing. I honestly never go above 20% and I'm a-okay with that. It's great though if I ever wanted to have a gathering that I can blast it if I wanted to and I'm pretty sure it'd light up my entire apartment. The one thing I find frustrating is the voice recognition fails every so often or Alexa bugs out. I think there's still progress to be made, but we're getting there!

Title: I_e arrived!
Body: I_ new to Alexa. I_e had one and didn_ use it. Received another for Christmas along with smart light bulbs. I_ finding I like this set up. Now, I_ looking to get a smart thermostat, along with more lightbulbs. I_e had an alarm system. I find being able to manage it remotely provides me with peace of mind. I appreciate having the extra devices; which provides extra security with operating my house while I_ gone.

Title: Updated Review
Body: I had previously written a very poor review of this product. When I got it, I hooked it up to my car just following directions. It worked as expected but one day it just all on its own disconnected itself.Today, I finally spent some time on the phone with someone in the Alexa tech support department and she walked me through setting it back up. So for the time being I_ giving it 3 stars because Alexa knows my voice and everything worked as advertised.I_ cautiously optimistic; I don_ know why it disconnected itself in the first place so that gives me the expectation that it will happen again. If it does, I believe I can set it up again, but it won_ ever use to the level of 5 stars, which is usually the experiences I have with Amazon and it_ products.

Title: It's Not NCC-1701-D But It Will Do For Now!
Body: My first Echo was a gift but after having it a few months I grew accustomed to its ease of operation and ordered a second one. Setting alarms and timers, playing music, checking on my commute traffic, adding items to grocery and shopping lists, and all with just some voice commands. I also like its functionality with my Smart Plugs so I can turn my lights off (and on) with my voice or with the Alexa app on any of my devices, even when I'm away from home.

Title: AMAZING!!
Body: This was a gift from my partner. What an amazing gift. Alexa does so much more than what is advertised. Alexa is amazing. She understands everything I say. This was bought for me to have a speaker in my room, so while I_ on the phone I could hear my music. It does that and so much more! Alexa is my timer, my interactive story, my trivia, my clock and so much more in one! The bass is okay but it_ not extremely loud so the purpose it was intended for (my bedroom), it is spot on and has great sound and bass for my bedroom. Very happy I was given this!

Title: Curious? Read review.
Body: TLDR at the end of review. Scroll down to skip my two cents.Cons: Could be louder, but it's more than enough. Setup could be more streamlined. Alexa sometimes doesn't hear you when it's at Max volume. An easy fix with noise cancelation programming. The LEDs could be brighter. Mine is in the kitchen and it's pretty bright in there.Pro's: Crisp, clear, audio. Alexa understands words well (eastern American common English). Notification lights which are very underestimated. You can send messages to other Alexa users, fun. Genuinely fantastic concept. Small, and pretty.Conclusion: There is progress to be made but I use it every day. It's just plain fun. It's relatively inexpensive. If you're on the fence, just get one. Also get off the fence, that's dangerous.

Title: Very handy
Body: When I first purchased this my concept was that it would be used for music. I have found we use it often not only for music but also for our calendar the weather as well as good news. My only frustration is when when I first purchase this my concept was that it would be used 4 music. I have found we use it often not only for music but also for our calendar, the weather as well as good news. My only frustration is when it continually tries to sell me Amazon prime music which is not included with Amazon Prime. I've tried to stop it offering to sell me Amazon Prime music on the echo Dot as well as the app that you download to your phone no such luck. Overall it's been a very handy useful tool

Title: Alexa freezes up
Body: Worst worst worst! I couldn_ believe it. I order one it froze up all the time and it had a bunch of issues, Amazon had me return it and they send me a refurnished one that had a stain! I was mad and I told them and they didn_ care. I used it for two weeks and same problems freezing up all the time. Stoping Music randomly. I told them and they were so rude and basically said just return it and go buy a new one. Worst customer service!!! And this Alexa sucks!

Title: Great for music, weather, etc
Body: This is my first time using such a device. Unfortunately I don't feel it will integrate with my Google calender, but outside of that, I really enjoy it. It was a bit of a challenge setting up multiple Dots to work together, however with experimentation, was able to do so. Makes me wish i had more automation in my house. In time that can be accomplished with various attachments.

Title: It's OK
Body: This item was supposed to be a gift, but it didn't work out the way my parents thought it would, so it was returned. That said, if you're looking for something small in the Alexa/Amazon family, it works well enough. You do have to be rather precise with Alexa in asking for things for it/her to do like play a certain type of music, and even then she may or may not  play what was requested exactly.

Title: Just getting started...love our  new Dot
Body: I was able to sync the Dot up to my new plugs so we can turn lights and other items on and off.  Haven't tried the TV or Cable yet but we're pleased to see that it takes directions from both my husband and I.  Hubbie is not a techie but loves the idea of asking Alexa to perform (he does use Siri on his IPhone).  Lots more to get Alexa to do -- just getting started!

Title: What's Not to Love?  Hint: Put a Bluetooth Adapter On Old Stereo and Have a Party!
Body: I bought two.  The second was only .99 cents on special promotion.  I took a $10 Bluetooth adapter and plugged it into an AUX input on an old 70s Akai receiver.  It now reads me audiobooks, plays news all day via TuneIn, and music & comedy all night free on real speakers.  Its own speakers are nice, too.  Changing volume levels is as easy as, "Alexa, level 6" (1through 8).  I also use it to remind me of important matters.  I put one in the kitchen area and the second in a distant bathroom.  I am covered wherever I go.  The dog and cat wonder whom I am talking to.  Bluetooth light bulbs just plug in and work from any lamp you have.  No additional adapter or plug neede.  Two for $15.  "Alexa, turn on frontroom."  Tell the bulbs to change colors, too.  Awesome!

Title: Well priced. Quality little smart speaker.
Body: Easily integrated with various brands of smart items, even connectable by Bluetooth to my phone or laptop for Netflix binging when I don_ wanna stare up at my TV, extremely versatile. I do have some issues with voice recognition when I have repeating rhymes. For example, I_l ask her to _urn light two blue and she_l turn all of them blue because two and blue rhyme. You_e just gotta annunciate your words. No big deal. Can_ beat the price honestly. Amazon has not failed.

Title: Fun Product!
Body: Great for all kinds of things that I am sure I don_ know 1/100th of. If you say Elexa Good Morning, she will tell you something interesting about the day. If you ask her to play certain music, she does. Or if you want to know about the weather for the day, or about your morning commute, she can tell you.  Etc. etc.

Title: fun little device to have
Body: I bought this because it was on sale over Christmas break and I thought it would be fun for my kids to play music, they already do with their tablets. I didn't expect to like it so much. Being able to tell Alexa to add milk to shopping list while I am standing in the kitchen is awesome. I can't tell you how many times I forget to write things down, so I like being able to tell her while I am thinking about it. Same with reminders and adding to my google calendar. I recently got my daughter into reading... took forever to find books she liked. Anyway, she will ask what a word means or how to say it, I asked her to ask Alexa and she can spell the words and Alexa will tell her how to say them.So, I had so much fun with this device, that I bought a firestick, got a newer kindle fire, and now I bought a show 10.1 and have an alexa enabled watch on the way and a second dot. We're going full Alexa... she can do so much it's like having a personal assistant.

Title: Best intercom system ever!
Body: Initially, I purchase 3 echo dots on black friday to use as an intercom system between my house & my mom's in-law suite in my backyard. One in her place, one in my bedroom, and one in my kitchen. Not only have the dots worked out fantastically as an intercom system, but they have become integral parts of both of our daily lives! Don't let the size fool you, these little gems have stellar sound quality that will fill an entire room (or in my mom's case, suite).The only reason I'm giving it 4/5 is due to some technical issues. After a few weeks in, the one is my bedroom began not dropping-in (the intercom feature) into the others, and wouldn't allow the other dots to drop into it, resulting in me constantly having to unplug it & plug it back in. I contacted Amazon customer support & they sent me a replacement. Now however, the one in my Mom's suite is starting to encounter the same issue.... If it wasn't for those issues, this would be a 5/5

Title: Whats not to love_
Body: What's not to like, a small but mighty Echo Dot, love it! I put this little Dot on my night stand and ditched my alarm clock with the annoying glowing clock numbers staring at me all the time, making me count the hours and minutes until I had to get out of bed. Now I let Dot worry about times, alarms, reminders and the like. If I wake up in the night I have my Dot soothe me back to sleep with any number of choices, meditation relaxation music, the ocean waves or even a crackling camp fire with Crickets. I can add to my "to do list" or shopping list in the moment, no more running for a pen and paper. My bedroom Dot links up with my dining room Echo Plus and I have music again, when, where and how I like it. Mozart to 70's soft rock, or the holiday stuff, add a little local or national news it's just awesome. I feel like I have two little assistants standing by anytime I need them, whats the weather outside, how are the roads, add dog food to my shopping list....Love, love, LOVE_

Title: Even I can use this!!
Body: I_ awful at learning and installing new technologies. I had issues logging in. I had to call support, twice! The first guy wasn_ too helpful. The second time he figured out I put in the wrong email, I felt stupid. But he walked he through the whole process and it_ worked perfect since then. I_e connected my Amazon music and my new thermostat to Alexa. My granddaughter loves hearing jokes from her.I wish I could figure out how to get jokes for a kid though. A lot of the jokes go over her head. But we do love asking silly questions. The sound is amazing!! The music I listen to has a lot of bass and the sound from the small speaker is beyond what I had hoped. Might need to buy a couple more for the house

Title: Best version yet
Body: First off, I have like 12 of the earlier generations, so I wasn't expecting a big difference. I ordered this as a bundle because it was cheaper than buying the other item by itself. That said, I'm so impressed with the difference. The main differences - it's heavier, better sound, can actually hear you when it's playing music (even when the music is loud), generally more responsive than older generations. If I could afford to replace all the older ones I have, I probably wouldn't because that would be dumb and a waste of money. Haha. But if any of the old ones stop working, I'll def replace with this one. I would say if you have to choose between the 3 generations (as of this writing), spend a little more and go with the 3rd Gen. It'll be worth it.

Title: The damn thing understands me
Body: I'll admit that I tried to go all in with google's home mini. At the time, the echo first gen, was good but not great. Voice commands worked well enough. Sound quality was on par with an AM radio. Nothing that was not unheard of at the time.Voice activated speaker should do just that. Activate on your voice. The google product, despite the voice training setting, could never understand me."ok google""ok google""OK GOOGLE""O K GOO GLE"and other premutations of wake word.Flip a coin. Maybe, maybe not. The only certainty was the urge to toss it in the trash.Unfortunately when it did activate it could not help me when i asked it why it was such junk.The 3rd gen echo understands the wake word every time.Nest support aside (skill in echo vs native in google home), this is definitely on par with integration into various services, like sengled and tplink.Routines seem better too, however I have not dusted off my old goggle home mini in months after getting this product.

Title: Smokes Gen 1 dot
Body: I've had the first dot for a while. Kids use it off and on. Didn't think there'd be much different, but this Gen 3 blows the other one out the water.
