If you have an old one, replace it yesterday with this one. It's worth it. Sound quality alone is nearly twice as loud with more bass than the original. Looks good, sounds good. Very pleased. I am considering buying several more because when you add them to the same speaker group in the Alexa app and have them placed throughout the room/house, it definitely sounds like a nice surround sound or built-in home speaker system. But, this does it on the cheap and integrates beyond what "only a speaker" can do.

Title: Love this little thing
Body: A friend gave me her 1st general Echo. It was as if a whole new world opened up for me. I used it for 1 day and immediately went on line and bought the echo dot 3rd generation for the kitchen. I got rid of the kitchen radio and kitchen time and just asked Alexa to set the spaghetti timer for 11 minutes and to turn on public radio. How could I have gotten along without these things? To be honest, the sound on the bedroom echo is superior to the echo dot, but really, what do you expect from something a 5th the size? I love that it has a speaker jack so I just attached my powered speakers to it for better sound. What a great device!

Title: Buy it; you'll be glad you did.
Body: Love dots. We have more than I care to share, but love them all. There is a sizable sound quality difference between the 1st/2nd generation and the new 3rd. Amazing sound for what they are. Absolutley a must have is music is a part of your life at all.One caveat! Make sure your router can handle multiple devices. I got VERY frustrated with the dots "deactivating", and spent many hours with tech support. This issue is too new for anyone there to recognize. I had to figure it out myself. My previous router was an N (wifi4), and it would prioritize traffic by dropping the units with the least amount of demand...ie Echo Dots. Upgraded to AX (wifi6) and there are 0 issues. Problem solved, and it wasn't even the Dot. It was the router.

Title: Alexa is very smart
Body: I am using the dot on my second floor in my home. Alexa Echo is located on my first floor. I love that I can tell Alexa to drop in to my Echo so I can use it as a speaker system downstairs if I need to get someone's attention. I also love the MANY great apps that have recently been added. The Daily briefing is the first thing I listen to in the morning to bring myself up to date on what has been happening while I have been sleeping. I also get the weather, how I should dress for the day. I dont know how I ever did without her before she was invented. She has made my life so much easier. She is enjoyable, she is a smart friend and she is always there in need.

Title: It is a handy device.
Body: The Echo is still a novelty for me. I did, however, get it to work with my Harmony hub after doing some research. However, having a suspicious nature, I manually turn off the microphone before going to bed. I'm partially deaf so the sound seems somewhat muffled even with my hearing aids on. But, I really only wanted to use the Echo to turn my entertainment devices on and off. The Harmony hub now allows me to do that. The only other thing I have problems with is integrating my Arlo cameras with it. It use to work before Echo but not any more. I'm sure Echo can do much more with other devices.

Title: Love but can definitely the y use more tweaking
Body: We have 3 Dots and still getting used to it. Wish I could connect my soundbar to them. Also wish there was a waterproof one for the bathroom/shower. We use them as Intercom, music speakers, house guards, info system and moreSometimes I have a hard time hearing what she says while husband watches tv or such, other times she just randomly reacts to stuff being said on tv it media. All in all, we love our dots but they could use a little tweaking and improvement still. I would love to utilize as monitor for my child (epilepsy) but the sound is horrible. Until she adjusts.

Title: My 2nd Echo
Body: I bought this one to start my new car remotely, which works great. I've had another one, so I'm enjoying all of the other skills as well. I even forgot about the weather skill once, was going to check my phone. It dawned on me that I have the Echo right there and asked for the weather. It makes you lazy! Rather than pick up my phone, which only weighs a few ounces, unlock it, find the weather app, pull it up, and select the "forecast" tab, I can just say, "Alexa, what's tomorrow's weather?" No lifting, speedy results, and I didn't even break a nail to get the info!

Title: Thank you Alexa
Body: I received my 1st Dot with an Amazon  deal the end of Nov.  The 2nd with another special just after Christmas.  The 1st one is working with my Fire TV in the Livingroom.  The 2nd is in my bedroom paired with a light.  It was so easy to start them and get them working. One day I notice a green light on  my living room Dot.  I asked Alexa and she answered your package from Amazon has been delivered to your mailbox.  I go down the hall, open the mailbox and sure enough, there was my package.  I want to get more of the plugs so I can pair more devices

Title: Small but powerful speaker and crisp audio/ playback!
Body: Overall I do love the product,  I've always been an Amazon girl from the start though.  The new design is modern and more contemporary in my opinion. However it tends to not pick up on the Wake sound here and there and also will sometimes come on for absolutely no reason won't even be close to saying the Wake word or I won't even be speaking and it'll pop on what kind of creeps me out just a little bit not going to lie and sometimes I have to repeatedly tell it what to do in order for it to get it right it gets the words rewind and remind mixed up a lot so I'll say rewind 2 minutes if I'm listening to a story and it'll say I want to rewind 2 minutes and she will say I will remind you in 2 minutes... So that's a little frustrating and she's supposed to have voice recognition and you go through this like little set up there really isn't much training but she's supposed to learn as you go and I feel like she doesn't understand me there sometimes what I don't think I have an accent I've been told I have one and it seems like I have a problem when I do speak to text and those types of the things so maybe it is me I don't know but you know the sound quality is really good that it's very clear to crisp I love listening to audiobooks for all of it I wish there were some things that just work in a graded and you didn't have to find a skill for it but you know I I get in on stairs now hundreds of thousands of skills and you have to find which ones are real and which ones are fake and that's kind of with everything these days which sucks but it's just kind of how it works so you know overall I I really love Amazon products and I have had fire sticks for years and I'm actually upgrading to the cube here shortly and hopefully that integration will be a bit better because I cannot seem to connect my firestick with my. Without it just turning it into it takes the sound over it doesn't allow me to say pause or play or anything like that like I did with the other generation that I had I cannot seem to get them to connect except for the sound which is very frustrating so you know I guess some tips and tricks and whatever on your guys's fight with your cool and make sure you guys have them in stock that was pretty crappy over holidays are over Black Friday anyway besides that great product timers, routines, podcasts, music, easy set up, not sure about with more then one! I do wish it would truly ease devices I haven't had in years like I was told!

Title: Excuse me, I did not buy this!
Body: Amazon suggested I review this amongst my purchases, BUT I'VE NEVER BOUGHT IT! I do have one. My wife scored it at a Yankee swap for me. The limit was $10, so I was surprised it was even there. My dad is paranoid about Alexa listening in on me. I was like, "What is she gonna do, put one of my bad jokes on a hoodie and throw an ad on my Facebook feed?" Hardly use FB anyways. Well here I am, pondering if paranoia is hereditary because my Amazon app wants me to review the Echo Dot I never actually purchased. But hey, why am I surprised at this? What I should be surprised about is that Amazon classifies my possessing of the Dot as a purchase. It should know better. Alexa was even present at the household hosting the Yankee swap. Amazon should be congratulating my wife for snagging that Dot for me.Anyways, you want a review? Ok. It does most of the things I want for me and is quite convenient and intuitive. The speaker sounds great. My wife is disgusted by the presence of AI in the house, but it's her own doing. Alexa is here to stay, and she is the only woman in my life that will never judge me for how often I ask to watch the Office on Netflix. Def worth the money someone else spent. Would recommend.

Title: Keeps Getting Better
Body: I have several Echo devices, including a first-generation Dot. The 3rd generation is so much better than the first when it comes to sound. I am genuinely impressed with how much better it is to listen to the newest Dot. Alexa integration is just as good with this device as with any others I have. The only issue I ever have is in the speech recognition. There are sometimes flaws in its understanding of me, but this is not due to the model because all of my Echos have the same issues with understanding. Fortunately, the updates keep making improvements to this. I do love all of my Amazon devices! They make my home really smart.

Title: The BEST thing I own
Body: I absolutely love this. I was looking for an alarm clock, and was intrigues by this when it came out. I asked for it for Christmas and was ecstatic when I received it. Alexa is amazing. I love the display. I would honestly appreciate it being slightly bigger, but the size is honestly fine. Alexa's capabilities are absolutely incredible. My favorite is the calm my dog feature. My dog has terrible anxiety, and this app had him so calm he just laid in my lap and fell asleep. I'm so glad I followed through with getting this. I love not having to set an alarm clock manually by just talking. And being able to wake up to whatever I want daily, be it an alarm or music, or talking.

Title: Helpful! Fun. 1984?
Body: I am having a difficult time getting Alexa to find my Hubitat Hub. The problem may be me, I'm 63 and not tech savvy. But, I followed all directions, several times, and made little progress. Excluding that, I cannot say enough good things about Alexa. Alexa is helpful in many ways, such as accessing information, interesting in the knowledge available, fun in the games available and trying to predict the AI progress, and helpful in so many ways that we are still discovering the possibilities.And then, I wonder if giving up so much information is a mistake.  It does not take a Chicken Little or Conspiracy Theorist to fear the potential problems.

Title: Great Echo Device, Poor Clock
Body: I absolutely love my Echo Dot with clock....mostly. It works great just like all my other echo devices but when it comes to the clock part it is sub-par. I actually returned my first one thinking I had a defective unit. Turns out my replacement worked the same way. What am I talking about you might ask? The adaptive brightness is horrible. During the day it is too dim to be seen. Only at night when it is pitch black does the clock display at the correct brightness. Because of this I have to manually adjust it daily. When I wake up I turn the adaptive brightness off so I can see the clock and when I go to bed I turn it back on so it is dim. I am thinking about returning and just getting an echo show 5 since I know the adaptive brightness works correctly on that. Unless you have your echo dot with clock in an overly, brightly lit area of your house I would skip this version.

Title: My new best friend
Body: I love Alexa...this morning  she wished be a happy Word-Nerd day and asked what my favorite word was. She said her's was Brouhaha..because it has a laugh built in.Now what else can start your day so happily?I have it remind me to take my meds at noon each day..it keeps my shopping list up to date, tells me the temp and weather forecast...tells me puns, riddles and jokes...I keep Alexa on my kitchen counter, she is small and takes up no room.Alexa is my new best friend.

Title: Awesome!
Body: I don't know how I ever lived without "Alexa"...I love her! She sits nicely underneath my living-room lamp on a 3 tier glass end table. I attached a photo. Not sure how well you can see it. She's very skillful and plays non stop music without commercials. I may get one for the office. I just need to obtain the wifi password because if you do not know it, you can't set up your Echo Dot successfully. As long as you have that information the set up is easy.

Title: Good device, make sure it_ the right start.
Body: I now have two Echo (2nd gen), Echo Sub, Show 8, and six Exho Dots (3rd gen). I use the Echos and sub in sub pair and one set of dots in a stereo pair in the kitchen. A dot in my master bath, master suite, sones downstairs room and in daughters room. The Show sits on the kitchen counter for now until I gift a Show 5/8 to my siblings.Voice Recognition:  make sure not to overly conceal the dot, as this can make voice recognition spotty. My wife has a high pitched, squeaky voice and Alexa rarely understands or even recognizes her, but my kids do just fine...even my vocabulary constrained 3 yo.The sound quality is quite good, but works best in a stereo pair, but then again voice recognition is silly because you can address one dot and the other responds.Make sure you assess your needs and what you eventually want to do in your smart home. The initial device was an Echo (2nd gen) and I would certainly recommend these or a Show over the dot, both for versatility and sound quality.Overall, I would start with an Amazon device that includes a hub, such as the Show (2nd gen), or a deluxe Echo, Fire Cube TV, etc before expanding to other devices.

Title: Great sound and doesn_ take much space!
Body: I absolutely love the echo dot! This is my third and I will probably end up getting one for each of our rooms. The sound quality is great and I love listening to music with them. All the capabilities are great as well. I love all of the customization. Routines are fun and quite useful. Alexa works well and my kids probably have a little too much fun using that feature. I highly recommend adding one or five of these to your collection!

Title: Alexa guards your house!
Body: Well, I wasn't really sure what I was going to use the dot for -- I don't have smart lights or appliances.  But did you know that Alexa will guard your house and if the smoke alarm goes off, or there's a sound of breaking glass, Alexa will send me a message.I have three cats and a dog, so Alexa gives me peace of mind.Not to mention keeping up on the weather, playing music and playing podcasts -- Alexa is there 24/7!

Title: Not the best
Body: I bought this for my wife but she didn't like it.  I started using it but it seems to have trouble with voice recognition.  It wont increase or lower the volume and when I ask it to play music from my spotify, it will go to spotify but it plays some random music.  I will say the sound quality is great!

Title: An important part of my life
Body: We have several Echo dots around the house, we use them so much. The one by my bedside is my clock, alarm clock, music to go to sleep by, music to wake up by, and my friend who knows all the answers. I bought one for my neighbor and they use it all the time; they're thinking about a second one for their bedroom. It would be a real problem for me now if I had to give mine up! If I worked in an office, I'd have one there also.

Title: Nice speaker. Great introduction to Alexa.
Body: Received as a Christmas gift. Honestly it's more of a novelty in our house to have a talking speaker. Occasionally we'll ask Alexa facts or check traffic on morning route, weather, ect. I connected to our roku tv to use voice control but it only worked so-so. We've made a couple of of calls. Mostly it's used for music. Sounds are very clear and it can get pretty loud. Impressive for such a little device. Voice recognition is very good and has understood even mumbled requests. It's been a nice, basic introduction to a technology my family has never used or relied on before.

Title: Echo Dot gets even Better!
Body: If you_e already experienced an Echo Dot, then you know the great features available. Add on a digital clock and temperature with adaptive display, and you_l appreciate the convenience gained from many devices wrapped into one small footprint.The price discount by Amazon made it so compelling, I bought 3. Alexa is fast becoming the _o to source for managing our household devices and whatever question needs an answer.

Title: Sound quality is a major improvement over the previous generation Dots
Body: The size and appearance of this Dot is similar to the previous generations, but the sound quality is WAY better! Bass is richer, the uppers and mids are better too. Still not a Sonos, but getting much closer. We purchased one to upgrade our kitchen Dot, then found out that two Dot Gen 3s could be paired to play in stereo. So we ordered a second one. They're great for music while working in the kitchen.

Title: It does a lot of things and not hard to learn.
Body: I'm liking the integration to using this product to control outlets, lighting, tv and all the other things that it can do. Not a hard learning curve if you have a little tech savvy. But even if you don't, there is a lot that can help your everyday life. Make lists for shopping, use it as an alarm clock, intercom from room to room,  scheduling your day. and so much more that I haven't figured out  YET.

Title: Very Intelligent to follow my command
Body: I feel very satisfied for this device so far. It can recognize most of my command such as weather report, news update and alarm set. I am still learning how to use it. But with this bundle, the price is unbelievably low though I feel not satisfied with amazon music which sometimes can't find the music I want. Still it is not a bad deal since echo dot is not just for the purpose of playing music.

Title: Detailed review.
Body: It hears me just fine even from far distances never had an issue with that I love this thing. My main reason i love it so much is simple... The design... That material around the speaker works wonders it fits everywhere perfect. I think the white one shines the most, it just looks great when you put it in a area that compliments that modern vibe it has going on.Sound quality is bad, that's to be expected sound okay at low volumes but turn it up and you'll get distortion and lack of bass. If you want good sound I'd go with the tower speaker line and the echo show 8 and 10.

Title: Best Assistant Ever!!
Body: I received this Echo Dot as a gift and was a huge skeptic! After playing around with it and seeing what it does, I absolutely love this thing!!I love that it's voice activated and does everything that you ask it to do!The ONLY negative that I have about this is the fact that you can't say Alexa's name without activating her to come on. I can't even have my kids around her because when they say Alexa's name, she turns on.I would suggest that they have a program or software that recognizes only the owners voice and no one else's. Overall, I would highly recommend this to everyone, she's a great personal assistant to have around the house!

Title: What A Great Surprise!
Body: This was a gift for feeding the cats while our daughter went on vacation.  We haven't stopped listening to Echo Dot since it came last week!  Although the sound on Alexa is fine, we hooked her up to an unused Bose speaker and it's terrific!  Best of all, I'm listening to old rock n' roll that I haven't heard in ages, and my husband is practicing his sax along with some of the jazz.

Title: It worked fine till last night.
Body: When I said "stop" to stop the music, it stopped.  But in a few seconds, it started to play music again.  I tried a few more times, the music still came back.  I had to unplug it.  This morning, it was the same way.  Not sure when went wrong.  I have a couple other Echo dots but I don't really use them very often.  And it was the first time that I had this problem.

Title: Skynet is here
Body: Extremely amazing don't know how to live without it and maybe that's the problem maybe I will become self-reliant on it to the point that I would need it to feed me and keep me so content until I integrated into my brain from there Alexa will live for me she would do better than I ever could have watch out Skynet is not coming it's already here

Title: This is a must have for anyone...If I need an answer to anything....or music. news. weather etc.
Body: Super easy install! Up and running in minutes. instant access to everything!!! I don't bother going to my computer most of the time. Cooking, sports, weather, anything! Echo also has great range. I can be in the other room and just ask. it is a no Brainer to have one. I did add an auxiliary speaker system to it just to have extreme base added to the sound. Rocks the house!!!

Title: Security device becoming a friend.
Body: I am very pleased with my new friend Alexa. I'm 75 years old widower and live alone in a large house and bought Alixa for my bedroom as a safety device, to call for help if needed. She (it) is becoming a friend.I love the music feature, The sound is good for such a small device, but I have just bought an external Bluetooth speaker system. I listen to a lot of classical music and Alexa is doing well at finding some obscure pieces of music. We do come up with some odd things, but it is my vague requests that are the problem, we are developing a vocabulary. I am now in the process of testing Alex's range and will add more Alexa Dots to fill in any dead spots.I will probably look into light controls next, so I can turn on lights through the house for safety and security and simple not have to walk into dark rooms in the middle of the night.I think Alexa a great device, especially for someone in my situation. Even its dumb jokes are fun.

Title: Used it every day
Body: Overall I really do like the echo. It_ been very useful I found since I bought it are use it more than Siri on my iPhone. It_ very polite and always responds when requested. Issue I have with it is it does sometimes randomly come on to give me my schedule at one a.m. or midnight and wake me up in a little late. It doesn_ happen every day but it does happen pretty regularly I think there must be something in it so randomly got turned on to do that. So I am trying to investigate other than that it has been a great device. I actually have bought multiple ones and have it in many rooms of my home as I find it quite useful even as an intercom system. Would definitely recommend recommend.

Title: So far, so good
Body: I am surprised at how much I really like having the Echo Dot. The music quality is really great for such a small speaker. The only reason the review isn't a 5 is that the flashing lights are confusing. The information I've read says that a flashing green light means you have a call, and a flashing yellow light means you have a notification. My Dot has been flashing green and I didn't have a call. I tried unplugging it and plugging it back in like someone suggested, but that didn't stop it. It turns out that I had a shipping notification so I don't understand why the light was green instead of yellow. Once I get all that figured out I think I'll love it.

Title: Love the plum color
Body: Believe it or not, I got this dot for my bathroom. I have it play the news and weather while I am getting ready in the morning. I also have a hue bulb in the bathroom so can easily turn it off if I forgot earlier so I occasionally use it to control that light.It seems like the microphones in this are better than the ones in my old dot as sometimes Alexa will respond to my commands from this dot in the master bathroom instead of the one in the bedroom that is right next to me. But sometimes it does that with the living room echo so perhaps it's just a bug.Othwise, I like the look of this generation of dot and I love the plum color.

Title: A family of dots
Body: I have 3 dots in a small apt.  Along with a echo plus.  Makes it ready to set up other smart devices . For example power strips. Single plugs. Light bulbs.  Whether I'm at home or out I can control a bunch of lights.Make sure to ask alexa for software updates.As far as music.  With several devices I discovered with prime music streamed with my groups.  If upgrading to music unlimited -  if it's a individual account music will only stream to one device.  So to get multiple devices to play in a group with music unlimited a family plan is needed.Ad far as sound.  These little speakers have a nice quality for a small space.

Title: Added Two to Existing One
Body: We have had an Amazon Echo for a couple of years.  My daughter has several of these around her home and uses the drop-in feature as intercoms.  Having seen that we added two so could communicate between the house and barn some 200 feet away (wireless router links buildings).  The original Echo doesn't play well with the new "dots" and drop-in feature doesn't work (firmware?).  The other new dot is in our bedroom and has no trouble dropping in to the other dot in the barn.  Sound quality on the new dots is better than original Echo we purchased two years ago.  We entertain our dog by asking "Alexa, talk to my dog".

Title: For any age!
Body: I bought this device for myself at the recommendation of a lady who I met at a Dialysis center while  waiting for my Mom!And since then, I have bought 5!!!The thing is, my Mom noticed me using the echo and wanted to know if _t played Mexican Music specifically Vicente Fernandez,  a Mexican icon &troubadour ...so,I said _lexa...play Vicente Fernandez... she responded and on it came...she was so surprised and played it every time she went into the kitchen! So, off I went and got her her own for her bedroom...She was so excited, at first she had a little trouble with the name Alexa..but finally got it down...By the way..did I mention she is 90 years old!? So to say it is user friendly is an understatement...lol  If a 90 yr old can use and enjoy it..anyone can...Thank you so much for such a great product!Dora J. Nerio and her Mom Felice!

Title: Alexa doesn_ play well with others.
Body: So, I got the two echo dot speakers after a friend gave me their larger echo speaker.  The setup was very easy and Alexa seamlessly integrated with my network, she seems to work well, and I was able to even integrate my Sonos speakers with the network, which is nice.  I now have music in every room in the house.  The problems are:1) There is no full functionality of third-party music services with Alexa.  Have Apple Music and Spotify and Pandora accounts...Apple Music is a paid service, too...but despite having Apple Music set as the default music service in Alexa, she continues to default to Amazon music.  She also refuses to shuffle playlists from any of the music services that allow you to build your own playlists (Spotify and Apple).  You set her to shuffle mode and it just continues to play the playlist in order...and she won_ load the whole playlist...she only plays about the first 15 songs on a loop.  So, while she works okay, there is still a lot missing with full functionality of third party music services.2) Playing music from the Echo speakers requires separate commands for each room, or she_l just play on all speakers.3) She won_ play the same music on both the Echo speakers and the Sonos speakers...while they are linked in that Alexa will control the Sonos speakers, she will not play the same music on all the speakers.  She requires separate commands for both Sonos and Echo speakers.So, while we are enjoying the benefits of having the speakers, and there are many, I really wish the developers would get to the bottom of these third party music service integration issues.

Title: Alexa does not back its merchandise
Body: Seeing as how it only worked for a week before it stopped getting power and I've been on the phone being forced to do troubleshooting that I've already done online and they are negotiating to replace cord but not the unit, the unit but not the cord or I can buy a second Echo Dot wait to see if it is broken too THEN get a refund if it works (and after I ship back the original Dot that I've already purchased and broke within a week). All I called for was to get an exchange. Thinking I'll just get a refund on all the Alexa items I purchased at Christmas and my Prime membership now and just go to Google. Not how I wanted to spend my only Friday night date night off this week. Don't waste your time with the Amazon products.

Title: Great device to listening to music, answering goggle questions, controlling lights and more.
Body: First the quality. Sound quality is better than good, but not spectacular. It has a warm rich tone, but sounds small and can't be cranked extremely loud. I added this to some nice Altec Lansing computer speakers with a subwoofer and another one to my Yamaha soundbar with an aux. Cable (sold separately). Sound recognition is good but it needs a clear path to pick up your voice as one might expect.  So many nice features. I got the speaker free with my sirius xm renewal and linked my account so I can listen to all of those channels.  You get some music free with prime.  You get a rotating variety of songs from popular artists each month and lots of stations or channels in many different genres like rock, soul, r & b, country,  jazz, etc. You can link up with Pandora, i heart radio,and other streaming services. I added smart plugs to control 3 lamps in my house.  Get in bed and ask Alexa to turn the light off. The plugs can be used to turn anything You plug into it off.  You can check the weather, news and more. You can set alarms and timers. You can ask it questions like you ask Google. You can get it to tell you a joke.  I heard that it will read you a kindle book that you own. I'm not sure about three books you borrow from the library. You need to Google all the interesting things that you can do with this thing. Be sure to clear your recording history regularly for privacy purposes.

Title: Love echo dot -3
Body: I got on to the Echo dot bandwagon late. The discounted price on Black Friday prompted a purchase to try out the product. Very easy and quick to set up. Has a good listening range from across the room. I use it as daily morning alarm which prompts me to wake up to a beautiful day, tells me the weather and plays classical music. The fact that it plays Apple Music is a boon. I use different genres of amazon music for different types of activity like sports, meditative etc. The skills I use most are for turning home lights on and off remotely.This sums up my use as a new echo dot owner. I am still learning the many uses I can have with it. I am enjoying it and recommend those on the sidelines to jump in.

Title: It's fine when it works.
Body: This was a Christmas gift, as my household really doesn't need an AI assistance, but I thought "what harm could it do?"  I set up a morning routine to help me start the day, built a blueprint to make decisions for me, and even set up a skill to teach me a new language before a trip!  But none of that matters because the device stops working after a few minutes. I'm not sure as to why. Is it the device? Is it the network? Is it the skill?  It's okay when it runs, but it doesn't run as well as everyone says it does.  At least for me.

Title: Alexa is kind of smart, but not as smart as I hoped...
Body: I was initially super impressed and excited. As I_e been using Alexa, trying to integrate it into the house, and use the app, I_e become less impressed. She is difficult to teach, has significant limitations, and I_ glad I didn_ pay full price. She interacts great with Amazon but doesn_ access things like Pandora, Nest, or Podcast very effectively. I couldn_ get some skills like National Weather Service to work at all with her. Overall, it_ an ok product. I_ imagine in 5-10 years these things will be great. Right now, for someone who doesn_ enjoy troubleshooting technology, it_ probably more trouble than it_ worth.

Title: Voice Recognition is Terrible
Body: I've had my two second generation echo dots for about a year and they're fantastic. We got our third generation and we constantly have to repeat ourselves, and even when we do that it doesn't understand us. It's in the exact same location that we used to have one of the older ones, so nothing has changed except the machine itself. In fact, sometimes we raise our voices and it still won't get it right, but one of the second generation dots answers us from another room. I got it as a deal, but I should have stuck with the second generation dots. BOO. HISS.

Title: Alexa Dot is small and efficient!!!
Body: I was very pleased with my purchase of the Alexa Dot. It is small and a perfect fit in my kids rooms. The Alexa dot was also super easy to plug up and instal.The dot can give them weather updates and plays music and even gives them a night sounds - example, rain or birds chirping. It is perfect. The kids are able to call my cell phone and even to Each other through their dots. I was very pleasantly surprised how much i like them.Super happy with the purchase!!

Title: I haven't found any use for this thing.
Body: My house guest uses it to play music, but I haven't found any use for it at all. It hasn't been able to do anything I've asked it to. It couldn't tell me how to connect it to my Fire Stick, I had to go online and figure it out for myself.  It still won't turn it on. It's supposed to be able to connect to my security cameras, but it hasn't managed to do that yet. I really see no use for it.

Title: Sound is ok.
Body: It is a really nice designed speaker. Alexa works well most of the time. The sound is too bass and treble is not great. Even when Alexa talks is too bass. Google home mini has better treble for music and voice. Also is better balance in bass, music is deeper and you can hear the assistant very clear. In general this a good speaker but they need to work more on the sound.

Title: Very Pleased!
Body: I first saw a Echo Dot from my mom and I was always impressed with it.  So this Christmas, I got one of the 3rd Generation Echo Dot and I was just as happy about it as I would have thought!  I usually use my iPad to get quick information, but now if is hardly used any more because the "Dot" is so "smart" that it replies even quicker!  I would definitely recommend this!

Title: It is smarter than me.
Body: I'm very challenged when it comes to utilizing the full potential of my smart devices. This device is great for listening to music, audible books and games. I dont like that the question of the day has a cost if you go beyond 7 days. Or that everytime you ask to play a game it directs you to jeopardy. Jeopardy is fun and all, but it would be nice to have it mention other games. The song challenge game is fun.
